Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Check the circuit.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: All operating, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: It can't be the screen then. Definitely something out there, Captain, headed this way.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It could be these meteorites.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: No, it's something else. There's still something out there.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It's coming at the speed of light, collision course. The meteorite beam has not deflected it, Captain.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Evasive manoeuvres, sir?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Steady as we go.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: It's a radio wave, sir. We're passing through an old-style distress signal.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: They were keyed to cause interference and attract attention this way.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: A ship in trouble making a forced landing, sir. That's it. No other message.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: I have a fix. It comes from the Talos star group.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: We've no ships or Earth colonies that far out.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their call letters check with a survey expedition. SS Columbia. It disappeared in that region approximately eighteen years ago.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It would take that long for a radio beam to travel from there to here.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Records show the Talos group has never been explored. Solar system similar to Earth, eleven planets. Number four seems to be Class M, oxygen atmosphere.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Then they could still be alive, even after eighteen years.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: If they survived the crash.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: We aren't going to go, to be certain?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Not without any indication of survivors, no. Continue to the Vega Colony and take care of our own sick and injured first. You have the helm. Maintain present course.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Narrator
Text: BOYCE [OC}: Boyce here.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Drop by my cabin, Doctor. (Boyce enters with bag) What's that? I didn't say there's anything wrong with me.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: I understand we picked up a distress signal.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: That's right. Unless we get anything more positive on it, it seems to me the condition of our own crew takes precedent. I'd like to log the ship's doctor's opinion, too.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Oh, I concur with yours, definitely.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Good. I'm glad you do, because we're going to stop first at the Vega Colony and replace anybody who needs hospitalisation and also. What the devil are you putting in there, ice?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Who wants a warm martini?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: What makes you think I need one?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Sometimes a man'll tell his bartender things he'll never tell his doctor. What's been on your mind, Chris, the fight on Rigel Seven?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Shouldn't it be? My own yeoman and two others dead, seven injured.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Was there anything you personally could have done to prevent it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh, I should have smelled trouble when I saw the swords and the armour. Instead of that, I let myself get trapped in that deserted fortress and attacked by one of their warriors.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Chris, you set standards for yourself no one could meet. You treat everyone on board like a human being except yourself, and now you're tired and you

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You bet I'm tired. You bet. I'm tired of being responsible for two hundred and three lives. I'm tired of deciding which mission is too risky and which isn't, and who's going on the landing party and who doesn't, and who lives and who dies. Boy, I've had it, Phil.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: To the point of finally taking my advice, a rest leave?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: To the point of considering resigning.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: And do what?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Well, for one thing, go home. Nice little town with fifty miles of parkland around it. Remember I told you I had two horses, and we used to take some food and ride out all day.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Ah, that sounds exciting. Ride out with a picnic lunch every day.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I said that's one place I might go. I might go into business on Regulus or on the Orion colony.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: You, an Orion trader, dealing in green animal women, slaves?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: The point is this isn't the only life available. There's a whole galaxy of things to choose from.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Not for you. A man either lives life as it happens to him, meets it head-on, and licks it, or he turns his back on it and starts to wither away.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Now you're beginning to talk like a doctor, bartender.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Take your choice. We both get the same two kinds of customers. The living and the dying.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock here. We're intercepting a follow-up message, sir. There are crash survivors on Talos.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Context: reads
Text: Eleven survivors from crash. Gravity and oxygen within limits. Food and water obtainable, but unless. The message faded at that point, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Address intercraft.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: System open.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: This is the captain. Our destination is the Talos star group. Our time warp, factor seven.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Course computed and on the screen.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: All decks have acknowledged, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Engage.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: On course, sir.

Title: The Cage
Context: Colt enters. Pike turns around and bumps into her

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Yeoman.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I thought I told you that when I'm on the bridge

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: But you wanted the reports by oh five hundred. It's oh five hundred now, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh, I see. Thank you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: She's replacing your former yeoman, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: She does a good job, all right. It's just that I can't get used to having a woman on the bridge. No offence, Lieutenant. You're different, of course.

Title: The Cage
Context: The Enterprise arrives at a planet

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: We've settled into orbit, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Geological lab report complete, Captain.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Preliminary lab survey ready, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Spectography?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Our reading shows an oxygen nitrogen atmosphere, sir, heavy with inert elements but well within safety limits.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Gravity?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Zero point nine of Earth.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Captain? Reflections, sir, from the planet's surface. As I read it, they polarise out as rounded metal bits. Could be parts of a spaceship hull.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Prep a landing party of six. You feel up to it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Sorry, Number One. With little information on this planet, we'll have to leave the ship's most experienced officer here covering us.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Of course, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: There's no indication of problems down there, but let's not take chances.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pitcairn
Text: Yes, sir. There's a canyon to the left. We can set you there completely unobserved.

Title: The Cage
Context: the group explores until they find a rough settlement

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: Sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Old Man
Text: They're men. They're humans.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Captain Christopher Pike, United Space Ship Enterprise.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Haskins
Text: Doctor Theodore Haskins, American Continent lnstitute.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Survivor
Text: Is Earth all right?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: The same old Earth, and you'll see it very soon.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: And you won't believe how fast you can get back. Well the time barrier's been broken. Our new ships can

Title: The Cage
Context: He's struck dumb by the sight of a lovely young woman

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Haskins
Text: This is Vina. Her parents are dead. She was born almost as we crashed.

Title: The Cage
Context: The reunion is being watched on another screen, by three people with big bald heads

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Context: as the survivors pack up the settlement
Text: Enterprise.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Landing party, come in.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: We'll begin transporting the survivors and their effects up to you very shortly.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Quarters are being prepared, sir. Have I permission to send out scouting and scientific parties now?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: That's affirmative on the

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You appear to be healthy and intelligent, Captain. A prime specimen.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: I didn't get that last message, Captain.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Er, affirmative on request. Landing party out.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Haskins
Text: You must forgive her choice of words, Captain. She's lived her whole life with a collection of aging scientists.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: If they can spare you a moment, I'd like to make my medical report.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I think it's time to show the Captain our secret.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Their health is excellent. Almost too good.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Haskins
Text: There's a reason for our condition, but we've had some doubt if Earth is ready to learn the secret. Let the girl show you. We'll accept your judgment.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike follows Vina up a slope to a ledge by a rock face

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You're tired, but don't worry. You'll feel much better soon. Don't you see it? Here and here.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I don't understand.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You will. You're a perfect choice.

Title: The Cage
Context: Vina vanishes, and so do all the survivors and their encampment. A door opens in the rock face, Pike is knocked out and taken inside. At the settlement -

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Captain!

Title: The Cage
Context: Everyone rushes over in time to see the door closing in the rock. They fire their phasers at it but it just blasts away the rock covering to show the metal underneath.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Landing party, come in.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no survivors' encampment, Number One. This is all some sort of trap. We've lost the Captain. Do you read?

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike wakes to find himself in a cell with a transparent wall blocking his escape. He tests it's strength, and notices other similar occupied cells. There's a fanged ape, a giant bird and other scary shadows. The three aliens arrive

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Can you hear me? My name is Christopher Pike, commander of the space vehicle Enterprise from a stellar group at the other end of this galaxy. Our intentions are peaceful. Can you understand me?

Title: The Cage
Context: the aliens communicate with their minds, not voices

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Talosian
Text: It appears, Magistrate, that the intelligence of the specimen is shockingly limited.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: This is no surprise since his vessel was baited here so easily with a simulated message. As you can read in its thoughts, it is only now beginning to suspect that the survivors and encampment were a simple illusion we placed in their minds.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You're not speaking, yet I can hear you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: You will note the confusion as it reads our thought transmissions.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: All right then, telepathy. You can read my mind. I can read yours. Now, unless you want my ship to consider capturing me an unfriendly act

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: You now see the primitive fear threat reaction. The specimen is about to boast of his strength, the weaponry of his vessel, and so on. Next, frustrated into a need to display physical prowess, the creature will throw himself against the transparency.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: If you were in here, wouldn't you test the strength of these walls, too? There's a way out of any cage, and I'll find it.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Despite its frustration, the creature appears more adaptable than our specimens from other planets. We can soon begin the experiment.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: The inhabitants of this planet must live deep underground, and probably manufacture food and other needs down there. Our tests indicate the planet surface, without considerably more vegetation or some animals, simply too barren to support life.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: So we just thought we saw survivors there, Mister Spock.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. An illusion placed in our minds by this planet's inhabitants.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: It was a perfect illusion. They had us seeing just what we wanted to see, human beings who'd survived with dignity and bravery, everything entirely logical, right down to the building of the camp, the tattered clothing, everything. Now let's be sure we understand the danger of this. The inhabitants of this planet can read our minds. They can create illusions out of a person's own thoughts, memories, and experiences, even out of a person's own desires. Illusions just as real and solid as this table top and just as impossible to ignore.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Any estimate what they might want one of us for?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: They may simply be studying the Captain, to find out how Earth people are put together. Or it could be something more.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Then why aren't we doing anything? That entry may have stood up against hand lasers, but we can transmit the ship's power against it. Enough to blast half a continent.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Look. Brains three times the size of ours. If we start buzzing about down there, we're liable to find their mental power is so great they could reach out and swat this ship as though it were a fly.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It's Captain Pike they've got. He needs help, and he probably needs it fast.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Engineering deck will rig to transmit ship's power. We'll try blasting through that metal.

Title: The Cage
Context: As Pike continues to explore his cell

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Talosian
Text: Thousands of us are already probing the creature's thoughts, Magistrate. We find excellent memory capacity.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: I read most strongly a recent death struggle in which it fought to protect its life. We will begin with this, giving the specimen something more interesting to protect.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Come on, we must hide ourselves. Come, come. Hurry. It's deserted. There'll be weapons and perhaps food.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: This is Rigel Seven.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Please, we must hide ourselves.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I was in a cage, a cell, in some kind of a zoo. I must still be there.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Come on.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: They've reached into my mind and taken the memory of somewhere I've been.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: The killer!

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: It's starting just as it happened two weeks ago. Except for you.

Title: The Cage
Context: The courtyard is scattered with lances and spears

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Longer hair, different dress, but it is you, the one the survivors called Vina. Or rather the image of Vina. But why you again? Why didn't they create a different girl?

Title: The Cage
Context: The killer enters - a big humanoid with shield and axe

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Quick. If you attack while it's not looking.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: But it's only a dream.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You have to kill him as you did here before.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You can tell my jailers I won't go along with it. I'm not an animal performing for its supper.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: It doesn't matter what you call this, you'll feel it. That's what matters. You'll feel every moment of whatever happens to you. Please, don't you know what he'll do to us?

Title: The Cage
Context: so Pike fights the killer with mace and shield

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Why would an illusion be frightened?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Because that's the way you imagined me.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Who are you? You act as if this were really you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Careful.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike and Vina retreat up some stairs. The killer breaks Pike's spear and they throw objects at it. Pike gets knocked down into the courtyard. The killer grabs Vina and Pike throws a spear into it's back. Then it jumps down and spears itself on a wicked harpoon that Pike grabs just in time

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: It's over.

Title: The Cage
Context: Vina hugs her hero, then sees the Talosians watching them. The Talosians leave.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Why are you here?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: To please you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Are you real?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: As real as you wish.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: No, no. No, that's not an answer. I've never met you before, never even imagined you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Perhaps they made me out of dreams you've forgotten.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: What, and dress you in the same metal fabric they wear?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I have to wear something, don't I? I can wear whatever you wish, be anything you wish.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: So they can see how their specimen performs? They want to see how I react, is that it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Don't you have a dream, something you've always wanted very badly?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Or do they do more than just watch me? Do they feel with me, too?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You can have whatever dream you want. I can become anything, any woman you've ever imagined. You can have anything you want in the whole universe. Let me please you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Yes. Yes, you can please me. You can tell me about them. Is there any way I can keep them from probing my mind, from using my thoughts against me? Does that frighten you? Does that mean there is a way?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You're a fool.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Since you're not real, there's not much point in continuing this conversation, is there.

Title: The Cage
Context: A big laser cannon is aimed at the door in the rock

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: All circuits engaged, Mister Spock.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standing by, Number One.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Take cover.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: The Cage
Context: The laser cannon blasts away

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Increase to full power! Can you give us any more?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our circuits are beginning to heat. We'll have to cease power.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Disengage. The top of that knoll should have been sheared off the first second.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Maybe it was. It's what I tried to explain in the briefing room. Their power of illusion is so great, we can't be sure of anything we do, anything we see.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Perhaps if you asked me some questions, I could answer.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: How far can they control my mind?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: If I tell you, then will you pick some dream you've had and let me live it with you?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Perhaps.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: They can't actually make you do anything you don't want to do.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: But they try to trick me with their illusions.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: And, they can punish you when you're not co-operative. You'll find out about that.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Did they ever live on the surface of this planet? Why did they go underground?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: War, thousands of centuries ago.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: That's why it's so barren up there?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Narrator
Text: VINA; The planet's only now becoming able to support life again.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: So the Talosians who came underground found life limited here and they concentrated on developing their mental power.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: But they found it's a trap. Like a narcotic. Because when dreams become more important than reality, you give up travel, building, creating. You even forget how to repair the machines left behind by your ancestors. You just sit, living and reliving other lives left behind in the thought record.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Or sit probing minds of zoo specimens like me.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You're better than a theatre to them. They create the illusion for you, they watch you react, feel your emotions. They have a whole collection of specimens, descendants of life brought back long ago from all over this part of the galaxy.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Which means they had to have more than one of each animal.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Please.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: They'll need a pair of humans too. Where do they get intend to get the Earth woman?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You said that if I answered questions

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: But that was a bargain with something that didn't exist. You said you weren't real, remember?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I'm a woman as real and as human as you are. We're like Adam and Eve. If we. Don't. Please don't punish me! (disappears)

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike sees the Magistrate walk away

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike continues to search the walls for a door when a hatch opens and a glass is placed on the floor

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: The vial contains a nourishing protein complex.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Is the keeper actually communicating with one of his animals?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: If the form and the colour is not appealing, it can appear as any food you wish to visualise.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: And if I prefer

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: To starve? You overlook the unpleasant alternative of punishment.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike is surrounded by fire and brimstone, screaming in pain

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: From a fable you once heard in childhood. You will now consume the nourishment.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Why not just put irresistible hunger in my mind? Because you can't, can you? You do have limitations, don't you?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: If you continue to disobey, from deeper in your mind, there are things even more unpleasant.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike drinks the nourishment then launches himself at the glass wall. The Magistrate steps back in surprise

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: That's very interesting.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Now to the female.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You were startled. Weren't you reading my mind then?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: As you've conjectured, an Earth vessel did crash on our planet, but with only a single survivor.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: No, let's stay on the first subject. All I wanted for that moment was to get my hands around your neck.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: We repaired the survivor's injuries and found the species interesting.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Do primitive thoughts put up a block you can't read through?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: It became necessary to attract a mate.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: All right, all right, let's talk about the girl. You seem to be going out of your way to make her attractive, to make me feel protective.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: This is necessary in order to perpetuate the species.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: It seems more important to you now that I begin to accept her and like her.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: We wish our specimens to be happy in their new life.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Assuming that's a lie, why would you want me attracted to her? So I'll feel love in a husband-wife relationship? That would be necessary only if you intend to build a family group or perhaps a whole human community.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: With the female now properly conditioned.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You mean properly punished! I'm the one who's not co-operating! Why don't you punish me?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: First, an emotion of protectiveness. Now one of sympathy. Excellent.

Title: The Cage
Context: A picnic spread on a tartan rug, two horses standing by, a futuristic city in the distance

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You want some coffee, dear? I left the thermos hooked to my saddle.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Tango! You old devil, you. I'm sorry I don't have any sugar. Well, they think of everything, don't they? (feeds lumps to the horse)

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Hey, your coffee. Is it good to be home?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: They read our minds very well. Home, anything else I want, if I co-operate, is that it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Have you forgotten my headaches, darling? I get them when you talk strangely like this.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Look, I'm sorry they punish you, but we can't let them

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: My, it turned out to be a lovely day, didn't it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: It's funny. It's about twenty four hours ago I was telling the ship's doctor how much I wanted something else not very different from what we have here. An escape from reality. Life with no frustrations. No responsibilities. Now that I have it, I understand the doctor's answer.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I hope you're hungry. These little white sandwiches are your mother's recipe for chicken tuna.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You either live life, bruises, skinned knees and all, or you turn your back on it and start dying. The doctor's going to be happy about one part, at least. He said I needed a rest.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: This is a lovely place to rest.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I used to ride through here when I was a kid. It's not as pretty as some of the parkland around the big cities, but. That's Mojave. That's where I was born.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Is that supposed to be news to your wife? You're home. You can even stay if you want. Wouldn't it be nice showing your children where you once played?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: These headaches, they'll be hereditary you know. Would you wish them on a child or a whole group of children?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Foolish.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Is it? Look, first they made me protect you and then feel sympathy for you. Now we have these familiar surroundings and a comfortable husband-wife relationship. They don't need all this for just passion. What they're after is respect and mutual dependence.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: They say in the olden days all this was a desert. Blowing sand and cactus.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: But we're not here, neither of us. We're in a menagerie, a cage!

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: No.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Narrator
Text: PIKE; I can't help either one of us if you won't give me a chance. Now, you told me once they used illusions as a narcotic. They couldn't repair the machines left by their ancestors. Is that why they want us, to build a colony of slaves?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Stop it. Don't you care what they'll do to us?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Back in my cage, it seemed for a couple of minutes that our keeper couldn't read my thoughts. Do emotions like hate, keeping hate in your mind, does that block off our mind from them?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Yes. They can't read through primitive emotions. But you can't keep it up for long enough. I've tried. They keep at you and at you year after year, tricking and punishing, and they won. They own me. I know you must hate me for that.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh, no. I don't hate you. I can guess what it was like.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: But that's not enough. Don't you see? They read my thoughts, my feelings, my dreams of what would be a perfect man. That's why they picked you. I can't help but love you and they expect you to feel the same way.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: If they can read my mind, then they know I'm attracted to you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I was from the very first moment I saw you in the survivor's camp.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Talosian
Text: A curious species. They have fantasies they hide even from themselves.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I'm beginning to see why none of this has worked for you. You've been home, and fighting as on Rigel. That's not new to you, either. A person's strongest dreams are about what he can't do. Yes, a ship's captain, always having to be so formal, so decent and honest and proper. You must wonder what it would be like to forget all that.

Title: The Cage
Context: A band plays, and a green woman dances sensuously

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Officer
Text: Nice place you have here, Mister Pike.

Title: The Cage
Context: The dancer is -

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Vina? ORION: Glistening green. Almost like secret dreams a bored ship captain might have.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Officer
Text: Funny how they are on this planet. They actually like being taken advantage of. Suppose you had all of space to choose from, and this was only one small sample.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Orion
Text: Wouldn't you say it was worth a man's soul?

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike gets up and leaves. The door he walks through turns into a rock wall. Then Vina is there, holding a blazing torch

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've located a magnetic field that seems to come from their underground generator.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: Could that be an illusion too?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Now, you all know the situation. We're hoping to transport down inside the Talosian community.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: If our measurements and readings are an illusion also, one could find oneself materialised inside solid rock.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Nothing will be said if any volunteer wants to back out.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pitcairn energises but only Number One and Yeoman Colt dematerialise

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: The women!

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Captain! Captain.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: No! Let me finish!

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: But we were a party of six.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: We were the only ones transported.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: It's not fair. You don't need them.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Context: grabbing Colt's laser pistol
Text: They don't work.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: They were fully charged when we left. It's dead. (communicator) I can't make a signal. What is it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Don't say anything. I'm filling my mind with a picture of beating their huge, misshapen heads to pulp, thoughts so primitive they black out everything else. I'm filling my mind with hate.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: How long can you block your thoughts? A few minutes, an hour? How can that help?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Leave him alone.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: He doesn't need you. He's already picked me.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Picked her? For what? I don't understand.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Now, there's a fine choice for intelligent offspring.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Offspring, as in children?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Offspring as in he's Adam. Is that it?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You're no better choice. They'd have more luck crossing him with a computer.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Well, shall we do a little time computation? There was a Vina listed on that expedition as an adult crewman. Now, adding eighteen years to your age then.

Title: The Cage
Context: The Magistrate approaches the cell

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: It's not fair. I did what you asked.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Since you resist the present specimen, you now have a selection.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I'll break out of this zoo somehow and get to you. Is your blood red like ours? I'm going to find out.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Each of the two new specimens has qualities in her favour. The female you call Number One has the superior mind and would produce highly intelligent children. Although she seems to lack emotion, this is largely a pretence. She has often has fantasies involving you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: All I want to do is get my hands on you. Can you read these thoughts? Images of hate, killing?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: The other new arrival has considered you unreachable but now is realising this has changed. The factors in her favour are youth and strength, plus unusually strong female drives.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You'll find my thoughts more interesting. Thoughts so primitive you can't understand. Emotions so ugly (stricken by pain)

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Wrong thinking is punishable. Right thinking will be as quickly rewarded. You will find it an effective combination.

Title: The Cage
Context: Magistrate leaves

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Captain.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: No. No, don't help me. I have to concentrate. They can't read through hate.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Address intercraft.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: Open, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the acting captain speaking. We have no choice now but to consider the safety of this vessel and the remainder of the crew. We're leaving. All decks prepare for hyperdrive. Time warp factor.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Mister Spock, the ship's controls have gone dead.

Title: The Cage
Context: The lights go out

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engine room!

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: Open.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock here. Switch to rockets. We're blasting out.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pitcairn
Text: All systems are out, bridge. We've got nothing.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: There's nothing. Every system aboard is fading out.

Title: The Cage
Context: The group are apparently dozing when the Magistrate opens the hatch to get the laser pistols Pike dropped there. He grabs him and pulls him into the cage, and starts to throttle him

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Now you hold still, or I'll break your neck.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: Don't hurt them. They don't mean to be evil.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I've had some samples of how good they are.

Title: The Cage
Context: the Talosian appears to be a vicious monster

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You stop this illusion, or I'll twist your head off. (it stops) All right, now you try one more illusion, you try anything at all, and I'll break your neck.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Your ship. Release me or we'll destroy it.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Bridge]

Title: The Cage
Context: The senior officers have taken the navigation console apart

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing. But for the batteries we'd lose gravitation and oxygen.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: The computers!

Title: The Cage
Context: The monitor shows a montage of images - space capsules, the Moon, maps of Earth

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: I can't shut it off. It's running through our library. Tapes, micro-records, everything. It doesn't make sense.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Could be we've waited too long. It's collecting all the information stored in this fly. They've decided to swat us.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: He's not bluffing, Captain. With illusion they can make your crew work the wrong controls or push any button it takes to destroy your ship.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I'm going to gamble you're too intelligent to kill for no reason at all.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike hands the Magistrate over to Number One and picks up the laser pistols, firing them at the glass wall. Then he puts one to the Magistrate's head

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: On the other hand, I've got a reason. I'm willing to bet you've created an illusion this laser is empty. I think it just blasted a hole in that window and you're keep us from seeing it. You want me to test my theory out on your head?

Title: The Cage
Context: There is a hole in the window

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Captain.

Title: The Cage
Context: They all leave through the hole and get into the elevator to the surface

Title: The Cage
Context: The top of the rocky knoll is split apart

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Make contact, Number One.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: They kept us from seeing this, too. We cut through and never knew it. Captain.

Title: The Cage
Context: The communicator isn't working

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: As you see, your attempt to escape accomplished nothing.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I want to contact our ship.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: You are now on the surface where we wished you to be. With the female of your choice, you will now begin carefully guided lives.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: And start by burying you?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: That is your choice. To help you reclaim the planet's surface, our zoological gardens will furnish a variety of plant life.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Look, I'll make a deal with you. You and your life for the lives of these two Earth women.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Since our lifespan is many times yours, we have time to evolve you into a society trained to serve as artisans, technicians

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Do you understand what I'm saying? You give me proof that our ship is all right, send these two back, and I'll stay with Vina.

Title: The Cage
Context: Number One sets her laser pistol to overload

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: It's wrong to create a whole race of humans to live as slaves.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Is this a deception? Do you intend to destroy yourselves?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: What is that?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: The weapon is building up an overload. A force chamber explosion. You still have time to get underground. Well, go on! (pushes Vina away) Just to show you how primitive humans are, Talosian, you go with her.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: If, if you all think it's this important, then I can't go either. I suppose if they have one human being, they might try again.

Title: The Cage
Context: More Talosians arrive

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Wait.

Title: The Cage
Context: Number One turns off the pistol

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Talosian
Text: Their method of storing records is crude and consumed much time. Are you prepared to assimilate it?

Title: The Cage
Context: The Magistrate nods, and the veins on his head throb

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: We had not believed this possible. The customs and history of your race show a unique hatred of captivity. Even when it's pleasant and benevolent, you prefer death. This makes you too violent and dangerous a species for our needs.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: He means that they can't use you. You're free to go back to the ship.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: And that's it? No apologies? You captured one of us, threatened all of us.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Talosian
Text: Your unsuitability has condemned the Talosian race to eventual death. Is this not sufficient?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: No other specimen has shown your adaptability. You were our last hope.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: But wouldn't some form of trade, mutual co-operation?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: Your race would learn our power of illusion and destroy itself too.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Captain, we have transporter control now.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Let's get back to the ship.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: I can't. I can't go with you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pitcairn
Text: Sir, it just came on. We can't shut the power off.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock here.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: All power has come on, Mister Spock. The helm is answering to control.

Title: The Cage
Context: The transporter platforms light up and first Colt, then Number One are beamed aboard

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Garison
Text: The captain?

Title: The Cage
Context: Vina changes into a scarred, misshapen older woman

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: You see why I can't go with you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: This is the female's true appearance.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Vina
Text: They found me in the wreckage, dying. A lump of flesh. They rebuilt me. Everything works. But they had never seen a human. They had no guide for putting me back together.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: It was necessary to convince you her desire to stay is an honest one.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You'll give her back her illusion of beauty?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: And more.

Title: The Cage
Context: Beautiful Vina and happy Pike go up the slope and into the elevator

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Magistrate
Text: She has an illusion and you have reality. May you find your way as pleasant.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pitcairn
Text: Mister Spock, the system is coming on again.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike is beamed aboard

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: What's happened to Vina?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Isn't she coming with us?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: No. No, and I agreed with her reasons.

Title: The Cage
Context: Pike, Number One and Spock enter

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Hold on a minute.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh, I feel fine, just fine.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: You look a hundred percent better.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: You recommended a rest, a change of pace, didn't you? I've even been home. Does that make you happy?

Title: The Cage
Context: He bumps into Colt again

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Yeoman.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: I thought I told you that when I'm on the bridge I

Title: The Cage
Context: She hands him a clip-board stuffed with papers for his signature

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh. Oh yes. The reports. Thank you.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Sir, I was wondering. Just curious. Who would have been Eve?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: Yeoman! You've delivered your report.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Colt
Text: Yes, ma'am. Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Eve, sir? Yes, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Eve as in Adam?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: As in all ship's doctors are dirty old men. What are we running here, a cadet ship, Number One? Are we ready or not?

Title: The Cage
Speaker: One
Text: All decks show ready, sir.

Title: The Cage
Speaker: Pike
Text: Engage.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Star date 1312.4. The impossible has happened. From directly ahead, we're picking up a recorded distress signal, the call letters of a vessel which has been missing for over two centuries. Did another Earth ship once probe out of the galaxy as we intend to do? What happened to it out there? Is this some warning they've left behind?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your move, Captain.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We should have intercepted by now. The Bridge said they'd call.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll have you checkmated your next move.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have I ever mentioned you play a very irritating game of chess, Mister Spock?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Irritating? Ah, yes. One of your Earth emotions.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certain you don't know what irritation is?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: The fact one of my ancestors married a human female

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Terrible having bad blood like that.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KELSO [on monitor] Bridge to briefing lounge. Object is now within tractor beam range.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No visual contact, Mister Kelso?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: No, sir. It's too small to be a vessel. It only reads about one metre in diameter.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not large enough even for a lifeboat.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KELSO [on monitor] Small enough to bring it aboard, sir, if you want to risk it.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock onto it, Mister Kelso.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: Materialiser ready, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring it aboard. Old-style ship recorder that could be ejected when something threatened the ship.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: More like destroyed the ship in this case. Look at it. Burnt, pitted.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's hope its tapes are intact. We'll feed it through Mister Spock's computer.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, sir. It's begun transmitting, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Flash the Bridge. Put all decks on the alert.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Hold it, Jim.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Getting into shape?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yeah, well I figured you weren't on the Bridge. Kelso's voice sounded a little nervous. Well, uh, you finish the game?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: He played most illogically. His next move should have been the rook.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yore relieved, Mister Alden.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Alden
Text: Acknowledged, Mister Mitchell.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Screen on.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Screen on, sir. Approaching galaxy edge, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neutralise warp, Mister Mitchell. Hold this position.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Neutralise warp, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Address intercraft.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Intercraft open.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain speaking. The object we encountered is a ship's disaster recorder, apparently ejected from the S.S. Valiant two hundred years ago.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: The tapes are burnt out. Trying the memory banks.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We hope to learn from the recorder what the Valiant was doing here and what destroyed the vessel. We'll move out into our probe as soon as we have those answers. All decks, stand by.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Department heads, sir. You wanted everybody on the Bridge before we left the galaxy. Jones.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Smith
Text: The name's Smith, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Astro sciences standing by, Captain.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering division ready, as always.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: Life sciences ready, sir. This is Doctor Dehner, who joined the ship at the Aldebaran colony.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Psychiatry, Captain. My assignment is to study crew reaction in emergency conditions.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Getting something from the recorder now.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: lf there was an emergency, I'd be interested in how that crew reacted, too.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Improving the breed, Doctor? Is that your line?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I heard that's more your specialty, Commander, line included.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Context: to Kelso
Text: Walking freezer unit.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Decoding memory banks. I'll try to interpolate. The Valiant had encountered a magnetic space storm and was being swept in this direction.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The old impulse engines weren't strong enough.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Swept past this point, about a half light year out of the galaxy, they were thrown clear, turned, and headed back into the galaxy here. I'm not getting it all. The tapes are pretty badly burned. Sounds like the ship had encountered some unknown force. Now, orders, counter orders, repeated urgent requests for information from the ship's computer records for anything concerning ESP in human beings.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Extrasensory perception. Doctor Dehner, how are you on ESP?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: In tests I've taken, my ESP rated rather high.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm asking what you know about ESP.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: It is a fact that some people can sense future happenings, read the backs of playing cards and so on, but the esper capacity is always quite limited.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Severe damage. Seven crewmen dead. No, make that six. One crewman seemed to have recovered. That's when they became interested in extrasensory perception. More than interested, almost frantic about it. No, this must be garbled. I get something about destruct. I must have read it wrong. It sounded like the captain giving an order to destroy his own ship.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Comments?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: The only fact we have for sure is that the S.S. Valiant was destroyed.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's probably the best argument to continue the probe. Other vessels will be heading out here someday and they'll have to know what they'll be facing. We're leaving the galaxy, Mister Mitchell. Ahead, warp factor one.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Force field of some kind.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: We're coming up on it fast.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor beam on.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Sensor beam on, sir.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflectors full intensity.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Deflectors full intensity.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflectors say there's something there, sensors say there isn't. Density negative. Radiation negative. Energy negative.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Whatever it is, contact in twelve seconds.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gravitation on automatic. (consoles blow up) Emergency stations. All decks on fire alert. Neutralise controls. Kelso, put it on manual. Any radiation? Anything?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative!

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsmen, take us out of here. (Dehner gets hit by an electric charge, then Mitchell) Helmsmen! (Kirk takes controls) Lateral power! (Spock takes over, Enterprise veers away) Take damage reports.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Damage control reports, all stations!

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Gravity control switching to batteries.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Something hit me, like an electrical charge.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: He's alive. Appears to be in shock.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Engineering deck three, can you give damage report?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Crewman 2
Text: Sensor beams. Full power on the deflectors.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Main engines are out, sir. We're on emergency power cells. Casualties, nine dead.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Gravity is down to point eight.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Crewman 2
Text: All decks, this is Bridge Engineering. Due to emergency conditions.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gary. Gary, are you all right?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'm a little weak for some reason, Jim, but I feel all right now. (opens eyes, they're glowing)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Star date 1312.9. Ship's condition, heading back on impulse power only. Main engines burned out. The ship's space warp ability gone. Earth bases which were only days away are now years in the distance. Our overriding question now is what destroyed the Valiant? They lived through the barrier, just as we have. What happened to them after that?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Autopsy report, sir. Each case showed damage to the body's neural circuit. An area of the brain was burned out.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you, are you feeling all right?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Yes. Mitchell, too, except for his eyes. We're trying to find a reason for that now, and why, out of our whole crew, only certain people were affected.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think we've found that answer, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mentioned that tests show you have a high degree of extrasensory perception. So do the records of the others. Gary Mitchell has the highest esper rating of all.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: lf you're suggesting there's anything dangerous

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Before the Valiant was destroyed, its captain was frantically searching for ESP information on his crew.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Espers are simply people with flashes of insight.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are there not also those who seem to see through solid objects, cause fires to start spontaneously?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: There's nothing about it that could possibly make a person dangerous.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Dehner is speaking of normal ESP power.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Perhaps you know of another kind?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we know for sure, Doctor, that there isn't another kind?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Context: without looking
Text: Hello, Jim. Hey, you look worried.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've been worried about you ever since that night on Deneb IV.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yeah, she was nova, that one. Not nearly as many after-effects this time, except for the eyes. They kind of stare back at me when I'm shaving.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you feel any different?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Well, in a way, I feel better than I've ever felt before in my life. Actually seems to have done me some good.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Well, I'm getting a chance to read some of that longhair stuff you like. Hey man, I remember you back at the Academy. A stack of books with legs. The first thing I ever heard from an upperclassman was, watch out for Lieutenant Kirk. In his class, you either think or sink.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wasn't that bad, was I?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: If I hadn't aimed that little blonde lab technician at you

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You what? You planned that?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Well, you wanted me to think, didn't you? I outlined her whole campaign for her.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I almost married her!

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Better be good to me. I'm getting even better ideas here.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Context: looks at monitor
Text: You? Spinoza?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Once you get into him, he's rather simple though. Childish, almost. I don't agree with him at all.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Hey, I'm trying to tell you I feel fine. When do I go back on duty?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm going to ask Doctor Dehner to keep you under observation for a while.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: With almost a hundred women on board, you can do better than that, friend Captain.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Consider it a challenge.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: That doesn't seem very friendly. (weird voice) Didn't I say you'd better be (normal) good to me?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's reading even faster now than just a few moments ago. Is that Gary Mitchell, the one you used to know?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put a twenty four hour watch on the Sickbay. Fullest possible range of examinations and tests.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: Perfect, perfect. I've never had a patient like you, Gary. Even the healthiest are generally off on some reading. leaves)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I know you don't particularly like me, Mister Mitchell, but since I am assigned here, can we make the best of it?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I've got nothing against you, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Nor against the walking freezer unit?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Well, I, sorry about that.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Women professionals do tend to overcompensate. Now let's talk about you. How do you feel?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: You know, everybody, everybody seems worried that I don't have some kind of fever or something. Maybe if we could just change these dials (sends them soaring). Now back to normal, I think.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: How did you do that?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'm not sure, I, I just thought of making it happen, and it does. It's, hey, er hey watch this, Doc.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: indicators plummet, Mitchell collapses

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Stop it. Stop it! You were dead for almost twenty two seconds. There were no readings at all.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yeah. Oh, boy. You, you know, Doc, there have been other things too, like going halfway through the ship's library in hardly a day. Yeah. Oh, what's happening to me?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Do you remember everything you read that quickly?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yeah.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: On any tape?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Sure. Yeah.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Try this one.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Yeah.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Page three eighty seven.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: My love has wings. Slender, feathered things with grace in upswept curve and tapered tip. The Nightingale Woman, written by Phineas Tarbolde on the Canopius planet back in 1996. It's funny you picked that one, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Why?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: That's one of the most passionate love sonnets of the past couple of centuries. How do you feel, Doctor?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: What?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: How do you feel?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I just fell. Nothing happened.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MITCHELL No? Are you sure? Are you sure?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Er, I was on my coffee break. I thought I'd check up on

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MITCHELL Yeah, that's okay Lee, come on in. Don't let the light in my eyes bother you, pal. It's all for our, our good-looking lady doctor here.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Yeah. Sure.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: So, er, so, how go the repairs?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Well, the main engines are gone, unless we can find some way to re-energise them.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: You'd better check the starboard impulse packs. Those points have about decayed to lead.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Oh, yeah, sure, Mitch.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'm not joking, Lee! You activate those packs, and you'll blow the whole impulse deck.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: I'll, er, I'll get on it right away. I just wanted to stop by and make sure you were okay. See you later. (leaves)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: He's a fool. A fool. He'd seen those points and he hadn't noticed their condition.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: How do you know?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: The image of what he'd seen was still in his mind.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Well, it didn't make any sense that he'd know, but naturally, I checked out the circuit anyway. I don't know how, but he was right. This point is burned out exactly the way he described it.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Sorry I'm late. I became so interested in observing Gary, Mister Mitchell.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our subject is not Gary Mitchell. Our concern is, rather, what he is mutating into.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I know those from your planet aren't suppose to have feelings like we do, Mister Spock, but to talk that way about a man you've worked next to for years is worse than

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's enough, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I don't think so. I understand you least of all. Gary told me that you've been friends since he joined the service, that you asked for him aboard your first command.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is my duty, whether pleasant or unpleasant, to listen to the reports, observations, even speculations, on any subject that might affect the safety of this vessel, and it's my science officer's duty to see I'm provided with that. Go ahead, Mister Spock.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have you noted evidence of unusual powers?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: He can control certain autonomic reflexes. He reads very fast, retains more than most of us might consider usual.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, would you repeat what you just told us?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: About an hour ago, the Bridge controls started going crazy. Levers shifting by themselves, buttons being pushed, instrument readings changing.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: And on my monitor screen I could see Mitchell smiling each time it happened, as if this ship and crew were almost a toy for his amusement.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are they right, Doctor? Has he shown abilities of such magnitude?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I saw some such indications.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you didn't think it worth mentioning?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: No one's been hurt, have they? Don't you understand? A mutated superior man could also be a wonderful thing. The forerunner of a new and better kind of human being.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Sulu
Text: If you want the mathematics of this, Mitchell's ability is increasing geometrically. That is, like having a penny, doubling it every day. In a month, you'll be a millionaire.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: In less time than that, he will have attained powers we can't understand and can't cope with. Soon we'll be not only useless to him, but actually an annoyance.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There'll be no discussion of this with the crew. Thank you. (everyone else leaves)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll never reach an Earth base with him aboard, Jim. You heard the mathematics of it. In a month he'll have as much in common with us as we'd have with a ship full of white mice.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I need a recommendation, Spock, not vague warnings.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recommendation one. There's a planet a few light days away from here. Delta Vega. It has a lithium cracking station. We may be able to adapt some of its power packs to our engines.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if we can't? We'll be trapped in orbit there. We haven't enough power to blast back out.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is the only possible way to get Mitchell off this ship.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you mean strand Mitchell there, I won't do it. That station is fully automated. There's not a soul on the whole planet. Even the ore ships call only once every twenty years.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you have one other choice. Kill Mitchell while you still can.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get out of here.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is your only other choice, assuming you make it while you still have time.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you try for one moment to feel? At least act like you've got a heart. We're talking about Gary.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: The captain of the Valiant probably felt the same way, and he waited too long to make his decision. I think we've both guessed that.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set course for Delta Vega.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Star date 1313.1. We're now approaching Delta Vega. Course set for a standard orbit. This planet, completely uninhabited, is slightly smaller than Earth. Desolate, but rich in crystal and minerals. Kelso's task, transport down with a repair party, try to regenerate the main engines, save the ship. Our task, transport down a man I've known for fifteen years, and if we're successful, maroon him there.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'm thirsty. (cup slides under tap, is filled, then flies through the air to his hand) It's like a man who has been blind all of his life, suddenly being given sight. Sometimes I feel there's nothing I couldn't do, in time. Some people think that makes me a monster, don't they Jim.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you reading all our thoughts, Gary?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I can sense mainly worry in you, Jim. Safety of your ship.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would you do in my place?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Probably just what Mister Spock is thinking now. Kill me while you can.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: He zaps Kirk and Spock with electric bolts

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Stop it, Gary!

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I also know we're orbiting Delta Vega, Jim. I can't let you force me down there. I may not want to leave this ship, not yet. I may want another place. I'm not sure yet just what kind of a world I can use.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Use?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I don't understand it all yet, but if I keep growing, getting stronger, why, the things I could do, like, like maybe a god could do. (Kirk knocks him out)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want him unconscious for a while. (Dehner sedates him)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: You fools! Soon I'll squash you like insects. (Piper re-sedates him)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you do it, Lee?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Maybe, if we can bypass the fuel bins without blowing ourselves up.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take him.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: There's not a soul on this planet but us?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nobody but us chickens, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Alden
Text: I think I've got the 203-R set, Lee.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Good, Alden. Transport it up with you, will you?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Alden
Text: Okay.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The fuel bins, Lee. Could they be detonated from here?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: A destruct switch? I guess I could wire one up right there.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do it.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's regaining consciousness.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Piper. I want only one medical officer here at any one time. The other will monitor him on the dispensary screen.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I'd like to stay now, try to talk to him.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: My friend James Kirk. remember those rodent things on Dimorus? The poisoned darts they threw? I took one meant for you.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And almost died. I remember.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: So why be afraid of me now?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've been testing your ability to take over the Enterprise. In the transporter room, you said something about us seeming like insects by comparison, squashing us if we got in your way.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I was drugged then.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. In the Sickbay, you said if you were in my place, you'd kill a mutant like yourself.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Why don't you kill me then? Mister Spock is right and you're a fool if you can't see it.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: You don't mean that, Gary.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Man cannot survive if a race of true espers is born. In time you'll understand that. (tests the forcefield)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gary. Gary, don't!

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Jim.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His eyes went back to normal.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fighting the force field drained his strength, for a while at least. He could be handled now.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'll just keep getting stronger. You know that, don't you.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Context: having put new panel in a bridge station
Text: It fits like a glove, Captain.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, did Mister Spock get the phaser rifle we sent down?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't order any (Spock enters with rifle) Affirmative. Landing party out.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: He tried to get through the force field again. His eyes changed back faster. He didn't become as weak.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Dehner feels he isn't that dangerous. What makes you right and a trained psychiatrist wrong?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: Because she feels. I don't. All I know is logic. In my opinion we'll be lucky if we can repair this ship and get away in time.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Direct to the power bins. From here you could blow up this whole valley.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If Mitchell gets out, at your discretion, Lee, if sitting here, you think you're the last chance, I want you to hit that button.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Star date 1313.3. Note commendations on Lieutenant Kelso and the engineering staff. In orbit above us, the engines of the Enterprise are almost fully regenerated. Balance of the landing party is being transported back up. Mitchell, whatever he's become, keeps changing, growing stronger by the minute.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: He's been like that for hours now.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have Doctor Piper meet us in the control room with Kelso. We'll all transport up together.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: If he should try to stop us

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kelso will be on the destruct button until the last minute. I think he knows that.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I'm staying behind with him.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: Fission chamber three checks out. The station seems to be running fine.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Scott
Text: You're a talented thief, Kelso. Everything you sent up seems to be fitting in place.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kelso
Text: I'm kind of proud of the job we've done. We're going to be ready to transport up (a cable loops over his neck from behind and throttles him)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're leaving with the ship, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: He is not evil.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I gave you an order, Doctor.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: You should have killed me while you could, James. Command and compassion is a fool's mixture. (zaps Kirk and Spock then waves away the forcefield. He leads Dehner into his cell and we see in the mirror her eyes are like his now)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
