Text: It hit me, too, whatever it was. Kelso is dead, strangled. At least Spock's alive.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Dehner?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: She went with Mitchell.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't give him a pill until after I'm gone. It's my fault Mitchell got as far as he did. Did you see their direction?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: Yes, there was some morning light. They were headed across the valley, to the left of the pointed peaks. There's flatlands beyond.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When Mister Spock recovers, you'll both transport up immediately to the Enterprise.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Piper
Text: But Captain

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you have not received a signal from me within twelve hours, you'll proceed at maximum warp to the nearest Earth base with my recommendation that this entire planet be subjected to a lethal concentration of neutron radiation. No protest on this, Mark. That's an order.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: It would take almost a miracle to survive here.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Then I shall make one. Behold. (creates and oasis with flowers and a spring) You'll soon share this feeling, Elizabeth. To be like God, to have the power to make the world anything you want it to be.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: What's wrong?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: A visitor. A very foolish man. You'll enjoy being a god, Elizabeth. Blasphemy? No. Let there be food. Kaferian apples. Whenever we visited that planet, I always favoured these. Can you hear me, James? You cannot see me. I'm not there. You follow the right path, James. You'll come to me soon.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I can see him in my mind, too.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Go to him, Elizabeth, talk to him. Now that you're changing I want you to see just how unimportant they are.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Yes, it just took a little longer for it to happen to me.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must help me Before it goes too far.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: What he's doing is right for him and me.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And for humanity? You're still human

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: No, I

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At least partly, you are, or you wouldn't be here talking to me.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Earth is really unimportant. Before long, we'll be where it would have taken mankind millions of years of learning to reach.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What will Mitchell learn in getting there? Will he know what to do with his power? Will he acquire the wisdom?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Please go back while you still can.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you hear him joke about compassion? Above all else, a god needs compassion. Mitchell! Elizabeth.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: What do you know about gods?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then let's talk about humans, about our frailties. As powerful as he gets, he'll have all that inside him.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Go back.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were a psychiatrist once. You know the ugly, savage things we all keep buried, that none of us dare expose. But he'll dare. Who's to stop him? He doesn't need to care. Be a psychiatrist for one minute longer. What do you see happening to him? What's your prognosis, Doctor?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: He's coming.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then watch him. Hang on to being a human for one minute longer.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: I'm disappointed in you, Elizabeth. (phaser rifle has no effect on him) I've been contemplating the death of an old friend. He deserves a decent burial, at least. (a grave appears in the rock, with a tombstone engraved James R Kirk. A massive boulder on the cliff above is loosened)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Stop it, Gary.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Morals are for men, not gods.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A god, but still driven by human frailty. Do you like what you see?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Time to pray, Captain. Pray to me.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To you? Not to both of you?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Pray that you die easily.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There'll only be one of you in the end. One jealous god. if all this makes a god, or is it making you something else?

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: Your last chance, Kirk.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you like what you see? Absolute power corrupting absolutely. (Dehner zaps Mitchell, he returns fire, she continues and his eyes return to normal)

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: Hurry. You haven't much time.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: The two men punch and wrestle until Kirk raises a rock over his head

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gary, forgive me.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: Mitchell's eyes glow again

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Mitchell
Text: For a moment, James, but your moment is fading.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: They both fall into the grave, but Kirk leaps out first, grabs the rifle and brings the boulder down to entomb Mitchell

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Dehner
Text: I'm sorry. You can't know what it's like to be almost a god.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Context: She dies

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise from Captain Kirk, come in.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's log, Star date 1313.8. Add to official losses, Doctor Elizabeth Dehner. Be it noted she gave her life in performance of her duty. Lieutenant Commander Gary Mitchell, same notation. I want his service record to end that way. He didn't ask for what happened to him.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Spock
Text: I felt for him, too.

Title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe there's some hope for you after all, Mister Spock.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: One degree to overlap. Stand by to photograph. Now.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Three days of this now, sir. Other ships must have made star maps of some of this.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Lieutenant. We are the first to reach this far.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, contact with an object. It's moving toward us. No visual contact yet.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflectors, full intensity.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's coming at light speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Collision course.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evasive maneuvers, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Object changing direction, too, sir. Keeps coming at us.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm getting no signal from it, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Still collision course. Deflectors aren't stopping it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sound alarm.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's slowing down, Mister Spock.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Countermand alarm. All engines full stop.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Visual contact.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ahead slow. Steer a course around it, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: It's blocking the way!

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite unnecessary to raise your voice, Mister Bailey. All engines stop. Sound the alert.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to all decks. Condition alert. All decks, condition alert. Captain Kirk to the Bridge.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1512.2. On our third day of star mapping, an unexplained cubical object blocked our vessel's path. On the Bridge, Mister Spock immediately ordered general alert. My location, Sickbay. Quarterly physical check.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just a few seconds more.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Context: on back, pumping pedals
Text: Just a few seconds more.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's a boy. Keep it up. Work up a little sweat, it'll will do you good. (notices red alert)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're killing me. You're killing me.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop. Winded?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd be the last one I'd tell. (sees light, goes to desk monitor) Kirk here. What's going on?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have a look at this, Captain.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undetermined. Whatever it is, it's blocking our way. When we move, it moves as well.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A vessel of some kind?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. More some type of device.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right up. You could see the alarm lights flashing from there, McCoy. Why didn't you tell me?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Finally finished a physical on you, didn't I. (Kirk leaves) What am I, a doctor or a moon shuttle conductor? If I jumped every time a light came on around here, I'd end up talking to myself.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All decks alert. All decks alert.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge. Captain to Bridge.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any changes?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. Whatever it is, it seems to just want to hold us here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any indication of danger from it?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll change first then. Captain out.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: All decks have reported green, Mister Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: And when the Captain arrives he will expect a full report on

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: The cube's range and position. I'll have it by then. Raising my voice back there doesn't mean I was scared or couldn't do my job. It means I happen to have a human thing called an adrenaline gland.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: It does sound most inconvenient, however. Have you considered having it removed?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Very funny.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You try to cross brains with Spock, he'll cut you to pieces every time.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to Bridge.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any signs of life?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you tried all hailing frequencies?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative. No answer from the cube.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have the department heads meet me on the Bridge.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Already standing by.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reporting, sir. Sensors show it is solid, but its composition is unknown to us.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies still open, sir. I get no message from it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Navigation.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Distance from us, fifteen hundred ninety three metres, position constant.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Each of its edges measures one hundred seven metres. Mass, a little under eleven thousand metric tons.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Motive power? Beats me what makes it go.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll buy speculation.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'd sell it if I had any. That's a solid cube. How something like that can sense us coming, block us, move when we move, well it beats me. That's my report.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Life sciences.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Same report.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Sir, we going to just let it hold us here? We've got phaser weapons. I vote we blast it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll keep that in mind, Mister Bailey, when this becomes a democracy.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1513.8. Star maps reveal no indication of habitable planets nearby. Origin and purpose of the cube still unknown. We've been here, held motionless, for eighteen hours.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything further, gentlemen?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe it adds up to either one of two possibilities. First, a space buoy of some kind.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Second?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Flypaper.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you don't recommend sticking around.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. It would make us appear too weak.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's time for action, gentlemen. Mister Bailey

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Bridge to Phaser Gun Crew

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Countermand. I'll select what kind of action.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: I'm sorry, sir. I thought you meant

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you explaining Mister Bailey? I haven't requested an explanation. Now, as I was about to say, Navigator, plot us a spiral course away from the cube.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Yes, sir. We'll try pulling away from it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Helmsman to Engine Room, stand by. All decks alert. We're going to try pulling away.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Course plotted and laid in, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage, Mister Sulu. Quarter speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Point two five, sir. Still blocking us, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see if it'll give way. Ahead half speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Point five oh, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Radiation from the short end of the spectrum increasing.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All stop. Hold position.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: It's still coming toward us. Range, one hundred ninety metres.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Radiation increasing.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Power astern, half speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Half speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Radiation nearing the tolerance level.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Still coming, gaining on us.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engines astern, full speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Full speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Range one hundred twenty five metres now.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helm, give us warp speed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp one, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Radiation at the tolerance level.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp two, sir. Speed is now warp three.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Radiation passing the tolerance level, entering lethal zone.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Range fifty one metres and still closing, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser Crew stand ready.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Phaser Crew reports ready, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Growing. We can take only a few more seconds of this.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock phasers on target. Mister Bailey, lock phasers.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Phasers locked on target, sir. At point-blank range and closing.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire main phasers.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1514.0. The cube has been destroyed. Ship's damage minor but my next decision, major. Probe on ahead or turn back.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing, Captain. No contacts, no objects in any direction.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Care to speculate on what we'll find if we go on ahead?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Speculate? No. Logically, we'll discover the intelligence which sent out the cube.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Intelligence different from ours or superior?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Probably both, and if you're asking the logical decision to make

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm not. The mission of the Enterprise is to seek out and contact alien life.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Has it occurred to you that there's a certain inefficiency in constantly questioning me on things you've already made up your mind about?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It gives me emotional security. Navigator, set a course ahead.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Plotted. Laid in, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Warp one, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Bailey, phaser crews were sluggish. You were slow in locking them into your directional beam. Helmsman, engineering decks could have been faster, too. Programme a series of simulated attacks and evasion maneuvers. Keep repeating the exercise until we're proficient, gentlemen.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Your timing is lousy, Jim.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Your men are tired.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's quarters. Aren't you the one who always says a little suffering is good for the soul?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I never say that.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: This is the Bridge. Prepare for simulated attack.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm especially worried about Bailey. Navigator's position's rough enough for a seasoned man.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think he'll cut it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh? How so sure? Because you spotted something you liked in him, something familiar, like yourself say about, oh, eleven years ago?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: On the double, deck five! Give me a green light.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, Doctor, you've been reading your textbooks again?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't need textbooks to know you could've promoted him too fast. Listen to that voice.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Condition alert. Battle stations.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Engineering, deck five, report. Phaser crews, come on, let's get with it. Phaser station two, where's your green light?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's next? They're not machines, Jim?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, they're not. After what they've been through they really should

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, I've heard you say that man is ultimately superior to any mechanical device.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I never say that, either.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I could've sworn I heard you say that. Kirk here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exercise rating, Captain. Ninety four percent.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's try for one hundred, Mister Spock.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are you going to do with that six percent when they give it to you, Jim?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm going to take it, and I'm going to (door opens)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Rand
Text: Excuse me, sir. It's past time you had something to eat, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What the devil is this? Green leaves?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Rand
Text: It's dietary salad, sir. Doctor McCoy ordered your diet card changed. I thought you knew.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Your weight was up a couple of pounds, remember?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you stop hovering over me, Yeoman?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Rand
Text: Well, I'll change it if you don't like it, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring some for the doctor, too.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, no. No, I never eat until the crew eats.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Yeoman.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Rand
Text: You're welcome, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: This is the Bridge. All decks prepare to better reaction time on second simulated attack.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When I find the headquarters genius that assigned me a female yeoman

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the matter, Jim. Don't you trust yourself?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've already got a female to worry about. Her name's the Enterprise.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Engineering decks alert. Phaser crews, let's

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SULU [OC] Countermand that. All decks to battle stations. This is not a drill. Repeat, this is not a drill.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're picking up an object, sir. Much larger, coming toward us.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Coming.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exceptionally strong contact. Not visual yet. Distant spectrograph. Metallic, similar to cube. Much greater energy reading.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: There, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Half speed. Prepare for evasive action.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Reducing to warp two, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Tractor beam, Captain. Something's grabbed us, hard.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Engines overloading, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All engines stop.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All engines stopped, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser crews stand ready.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Bridge to phaser crews, stand ready.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Forward phaser, will comply. All weapons at operational ready.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's its mass, Mister Spock?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reading goes off my scale, Captain. Must be a mile in diameter.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Over five thousand metres away, and it still fills the screen.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reduce image. Let me see all of it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Magnification two five, sir. Magnification one eight point five, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies open, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the United Earth ship Enterprise. We convey greetings and await your reply. What is it, Mister Bailey?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: A message coming over my navigation beam.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pick it up.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Switching, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: And trespassed into our star systems. This is Balok, Commander of the flagship Fesarius of the First Federation. Your vessel, obviously the product of a primitive and savage civilisation, having ignored a warning buoy and having then destroyed it, has demonstrated your intention is not peaceful. We are now considering the disposition of your ship and the life aboard.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies open, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain of the Enterprise speaking. The warning nature of your space buoy was unknown to us. Our vessel was blocked. When we attempted to disengage

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we're being invaded by exceptionally strong sensor probes everywhere. Our electrical systems, our engines.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: No further communication will be accepted. If there is the slightest hostile move, your vessel will be destroyed immediately.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're shutting off some of our systems, Captain. Brilliant. Extremely sophisticated in their methods.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does the recorder marker have this on its tapes?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enough to warn other Earth ships.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Bailey, dispatch recorder marker. Mister Bailey?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Recorder marker dispatched, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Marker on course. Heading back the way we (big bang)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Your recorder marker has been destroyed. You have been examined. Your ship must be destroyed. We make assumption you have a deity or deities or some such beliefs which comfort you. We therefore grant you ten Earth time periods known as minutes to make preparations.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Might be interesting to see what they look like if I can locate where that voice is coming from. (McCoy and Scott enter)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Balok's message. It was heard all over the ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to crew. Those of you who have served for long on this vessel have encountered alien lifeforms. You know the greatest danger facing us is ourselves, an irrational fear of the unknown. But there's no such thing as the unknown, only things temporarily hidden, temporarily not understood. In most cases we have found that intelligence capable of a civilisation is capable of understanding peaceful gestures. Surely a lifeform advanced enough for space travel is advanced enough to eventually understand our motives. All decks stand by. Captain out. Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies open, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain of the USS Enterprise. We came seeking friendship but we have no wish to trespass. To demonstrate our goodwill, our vessel will now return the way it came. We (humming noise) Lay in a course ahead, Mister Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: What? A course?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Plotted and laid in, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage, warp factor one.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor. There's no response.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Switch to impulse.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All engine systems show dead, and weapon systems.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Switching to screen. I believe I can get something visual.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: You are wasting time and effort. There is no escape. You have eight Earth minutes left.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was curious to see how they appeared.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course you were.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: I don't understand this. Spock's wasting time. Everybody else just sitting around. Somebody's got to do something.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Easy, Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: What do they want from us? Let's find out what they want us to do.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They want us to lose our heads.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: We've only got eight minutes left.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Seven minutes and forty five seconds.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: He's doing a countdown!

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Practically end of watch.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: What, are you all out of your minds? End of watch? It's the end of everything. What are you, robots? Wound-up toy soldiers? Don't you know when you're dying? Watch and regulations and orders What do they mean?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bailey, you're relieved! Escort him to his quarters, Doctor.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let's go. (McCoy and Bailey leave)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies open, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain of the Enterprise speaking. It is the custom of Earth people to try and avoid misunderstanding whenever possible. We destroyed your space buoy as a simple act of self-preservation. When we attempted to move away from it, it emitted radiation harmful to our species. If you've examined our ship and its tapes, you know this to be true. (humming noise)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: You now have seven minutes left.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Four minutes, thirty seconds.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: You have an annoying fascination for timepieces, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Four minutes.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter with them out there? They must know we mean them no harm.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're certainly aware by now that we're totally incapable of it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be something to do, something I've overlooked.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: In chess, when one is outmatched, the game is over. Checkmate.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that your best recommendation?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm s, I regret that I can find no other logical alternative.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Assuming we get out of this, Captain

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nobody's given up yet.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, then about Bailey. Let me enter it in my medical records as simple fatigue.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's my decision, Doctor.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And your mistake. You overworked him, pushed him, expected too much from him.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm ordering you to drop it. I have no time for you, your theories, your quaint philosophies.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I intend to challenge your actions in my records. I'll state that I warned you about Bailey's condition. Now that's no bluff.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any time you can bluff me, Doctor.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Three minutes.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Doctor. Let's hope we have time to argue about it. Not chess, Mister Spock, poker. Do you know the game? Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies open, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain of the Enterprise. Our respect for other lifeforms requires that we give you this warning. One critical item of information that has never been incorporated into the memory banks of any Earth ship. Since the early years of space exploration, Earth vessels have had incorporated into them a substance known as corbomite. It is a material and a device which prevents attack on us. If any destructive energy touches our vessel, a reverse reaction of equal strength is created, destroying

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: You now have two minutes.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Destroying the attacker! It may interest you to know that since the initial use of corbomite more than two of our centuries ago, no attacking vessel has survived the attempt. Death has little meaning to us. If it has none to you then attack us now. We grow annoyed at your foolishness.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: However, it was well played. I regret not having learned more about this Balok. In some manner he was reminiscent of my father.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then may heaven have helped your mother.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite the contrary. She considered herself a very fortunate Earth woman.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc. Sorry.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: For having other things on your mind? My fault. I don't how the devil you keep from punching me in the face.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One minute. I knew he would. (Bailey enters) If anyone's interested, thirty seconds.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Request permission to return to post, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Permission granted.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Eleven, ten seconds, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very interesting game, this poker.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It does have advantages over chess.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Love to teach it to you.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: This is the Commander of the Fesarius.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Here it comes. Is it raise or call?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: The destruction of your vessel has been delayed. We will relent in your destruction only if we have proof of your corbomite device.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold on that. Let him sweat for a change. Ship to ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequencies, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request denied.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have visual contact, Captain.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: We will soon inform you of our decision regarding your vessel. And having permitted your primitive efforts to see my form, I trust it has pleased your curiosity. And now, another demonstration of our superiority.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought the power was off in the galley.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Rand
Text: I used a hand phaser, and zap. Hot coffee.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Something's going on, Captain. (something leaves the Fesarius)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a small ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: About two thousand metric tons.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: It has been decided that I will conduct you to a planet of the First Federation which is capable of sustaining your lifeform. There you will disembark and be interned. Your ship will be destroyed, of course.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engine systems coming on, Captain.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Do not be deceived by the size of this pilot vessel. It has an equal potential to destroy your vessel.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Tractor beam again.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: So that you may sustain your gravity and atmosphere, your systems are now open. Escape is impossible since you are being taken under our power to your destination. Any move to escape or destroy this ship will result in the instant destruction of the Enterprise and everyone aboard.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're being towed, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1514.1. The Enterprise is in tow. To this point, no resistance has been offered. My plan? A show of resignation. Balok's tractor beam has to be a heavy drain of power on his small ship. Question. Will he grow careless?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Captain, he's pulling out a little ahead of us.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's sneaked power down a bit.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Our speed is down to point six four of light.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want a right angled course. Shear away from him no matter which way he turns.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maximum acceleration when I give the word.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's a strain, Captain. Engines are overloading.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: More power.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're superheating. Intermix temperature, seven thousand four hundred degrees. Seven five, seven six, eight thousand degrees. (everything is juddering, the little ship is getting brighter and brighter)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shear away, Mister Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Two thousand degrees above maximum. Eight four, eight five, eight six. She'll blow soon!

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Mister Sulu. Impulse power two.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: We're breaking free, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All engines stop.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All engines stopped, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engines need work badly, Captain. Can you hold it here a few hours?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: That may not be wise. He got a signal through to the mother ship.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we're not home yet.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: A signal, Captain. It's very weak. It's Balok. It's a distress signal to the Fesarius. His engines are out. His life-sustaining system isn't operating. The message is repeating, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any reply?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Negative, sir. The signal is growing weak. Sir, I doubt if the mother ship could have heard it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot a course for it, Mister Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: For it, Captain?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dead ahead. This is the Captain speaking. First Federation vessel is in distress. We're preparing to board it. There are lives at stake. By our standards, alien life but lives nevertheless. Captain out.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Course plotted and laid in, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, ready the transporter room.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, bring us to within one hundred metres. Ahead slow.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ahead slow, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, don't you think

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the mission of this vessel, Doctor? To seek out and contact alien life, and an opportunity to demonstrate what our high-sounding words mean. Any questions? I'll take two men with me. Doctor McCoy to examine and treat the aliens if necessary, and you, Mister Bailey.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Sir?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The face of the unknown. I think I owe you a look at it.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, request permission to

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Denied. If I'm wrong, if it's a trap, I want you here.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter ready?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, yes, sir, but it's risky. We're locked on what appears to be a main deck.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Air sample?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Breathable. In fact, a slightly higher oxygen content than our own. Communicator, phaser weapon.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Scotty. Ready, Doctor?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, but you won't let that stop you.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bend low, gentlemen. It reads pretty cramped over there. Ready to transport.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a dummy. A puppet of some kind.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: I'm Balok. Welcome aboard. (curtain opens to reveal a small humanoid with big grin)

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: And McCoy and Bailey. Sit. Be comfortable. Go ahead, be seated. We must drink. This is tranya. I hope you relish it as much as I.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander Balok.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: I know, I know, a thousand questions. But first, the tranya. Gentlemen. (drinks) Ahh.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander, that puppet.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: My alter ego, so to speak. In your culture, he would be Mister Hyde to my Jekyll. You must admit he's effective. You would never have been frightened by me. And I thought my distress signal quite clever. It was a pleasure testing you.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Testing us?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: I had to discover your real intentions.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you probed our memory banks.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Your records could have been a deception on your part.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And your crew?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: I have no crew, Doctor. I run everything, this entire complex, from this small ship. But I miss company, conversation. Even an alien would be welcome. Perhaps one of your men for some period of time. An exchange of information, cultures.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Both our cultures would benefit. Do you know where we can find a volunteer, Mister Bailey?

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: Me, sir. I'd like to volunteer.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Text: Ah. You represent Earth's best, then.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Bailey
Text: No, sir, I'm not. I'll make plenty of mistakes.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you'd find out more about us that way, and I'd get a better officer in return.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Speaker: Balok
Context: laughs
Text: I see. We think much alike, Captain, you and I. Now, before I bring back the Fesarius, let me show you my vessel. It is not often I have this pleasure. Yes, we're very much alike, Captain. Both proud of our ships.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1329.8. The U.S.S. Enterprise in pursuit of an unidentified vessel.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: There he is, sir. Centre screen. Still trying to run away from us, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't lose him, Mister Sulu.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth ship, Mister Spock?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Difficult to say, Captain. We're getting no registration beam from it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: If it is, he'll soon overload his engines.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, he's pushing his engines too hard.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Changing course again. He knows we're after him all right.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with him, Mister Sulu. Communication?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've tried all frequencies, sir. He refuses to answer. Unless he's not receiving us.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's receiving us alright.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approaching an asteroid belt, Captain. Schiller rating three five.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflectors on, Mister Farrell.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's seen the asteroids too, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with him. He'll try to lose us in them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: If one hits him.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor reading on the vessel. I make it out as a small class J cargo ship, and his engines are super-heating.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to warn him. If he loses power now

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: There go his engines, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's drifting into the asteroid belt, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: He's had it, unless we put our deflector screen around him.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, if we try, we'll overload our own engines. He's too far away.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cover him with our deflector screen, Mister Farrell. Scotty, Spock, stand by in the transporter room.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. (they leave)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: We're protecting him, sir. We won't be able to hold it long.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're overloading, Captain. Engine temperatures climbing.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Crewman
Text: This is the Engine room. Temperatures are passing the danger line.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: FARRELL Our deflector screen's weakening, sir. We can't protect them much longer. (lights flicker)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That was one of our lithium crystal circuits, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room. If you don't start beaming that crew over soon

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're not answering our signal. There's nothing to lock onto.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SULU (lights go out again) Another circuit, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm getting a distress signal call from them, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we're getting a distress signal.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're locked onto something, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Meaning no ingratitude, gentlemen, but just where is it I find meself?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: It's really a darn beautiful ship, isn't it? Really a beautiful ship. Oh, the name, gentlemen, is Walsh, Captain Leo Walsh.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: How many more in your crew?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Just a few more.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Your vessel's breaking up, man. If we don't get them over here right now

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: We couldn't be sure you was a friendly vessel, now could we. Ah, but the three will be in position about by now.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Another lithium circuit. Now supplementing with battery power, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, how many of them did you get aboard?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Only one, sir, but we've locked onto three more.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: What's wrong?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir. With those three lithium crystals gone

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: It'll take longer on battery power.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Never trusted this.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: There she goes.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Asteroid hit him dead centre.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room. Their vessel has been hit by an asteroid. It's gone. Did you get the crew off?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not yet, sir, but we've hooked onto something. (three women beam in, the men are transfixed)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to transporter room. Report.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: It's all right, darlings. We're in good hands.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: We're clearing the asteroid belt now, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflector screen down, Mister Farrell. Save the power.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to transporter room. Are you reading me or not, Mister Scott? Bridge to transporter room. How many did we get off?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, er, four in all, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If that captain can walk, I want him in my cabin immediately. Correction,

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want him there whether he can walk or not. Kirk out.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: That fellow sounded a mite upset, didn't he?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Yes, they are.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Curious. You're certain this was everyone aboard, Mister Walsh? No other crewmen?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Oh, no, that's everyone, all right, but so far as the ladies actually being the crew

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: You can explain that to the Captain. (the group leave)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Amen to that, Scotty.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Ah, sure, these starships are really something marvellous, but men will always be men no matter where they are. Eh, mister? You'll never take that out of them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deck twelve.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You're part Vulcanian, aren't you. Ah well then, a pretty face doesn't affect you at all, does it. That is, unless you want it to. You can save it, girls. This type can turn himself off from any emotion.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I apologise for what he said, sir. He's used to buying and selling people.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I'll handle the conversation, darling.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Commander of the transport to see you, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Now, if you don't mind telling

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Hello.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the ladies? Is this your crew, Captain?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, no, Captain. This is me cargo.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1329.1. We've taken aboard from unregistered transport vessel its captain and, and three unusual females. These women have a mysterious magnetic effect on the male members of my crew, including myself. Explanation unknown at present.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, how the devil am I supposed to know this is a starship, Captain? Here I am with a cargo of young lovelies. A strange ship comes up alongside. Well. naturally I did my best to evade you. And starship Captain or no, you exceeded your authority when you drove me and mine into a shower of asteroids.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your name, please.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Walsh. Leo Walsh. You destroyed me ship, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Walsh, I'm convening a ship's hearing on your actions. Mister Spock will supply you with any legal information you may need for your defence.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You're a hard-nosed one, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you're a liar, Mister Walsh. I think we both understand each other. Security! Escort Mister Walsh to his quarters. Confine him there.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You're on duty, Johnny-o. Back to reality.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: You can feel their eyes when they look at you, like something grabbing hold of you. Did you notice that?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I noticed. How I noticed. Come on, Johnny.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've got trouble, Mister Spock.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm well aware of that, Mister Scott.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: One lithium crystal left, and that with a hairline split at the base.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Better rig a by-pass circuit.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can't. We blew the whole converter assembly.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Needed on the bridge, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Women
Text: Harry! Where were you?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Shh! Calm down now, darlings. Would you mind waiting outside?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Security
Text: Sorry, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, now, answer every question they put to you. Don't lie. Well, you've no need to, have you, and don't submit to a med. That is, being so healthy, they've no need for a medical exam, have they.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: What if they ask about

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: They won't. Have you no place to go lads?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: They'll notice we're different.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: No, no, no, they won't. Just let Leo take all the hard questions. Now don't be panicking, loves. We'll get to

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Get where? We don't have a ship and we're headed the wrong way, Harry.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Nudd
Text: Leo. Leo Walsh is me name, darling. Don't forget that. So lovely. Lovely, aren't they? If they only think lovely thoughts, if they smile, they'll come out right some which way, won't they? My personal guarantee on that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: The entire ship's power is feeding through one lithium crystal.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, switch to by-pass circuits.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: We burned them all out when we super-heated. That jackass Walsh not only wrecked his vessel, but in saving his skin

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If it makes you feel better, Engineer, that's one jackass we're going to see skinned.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: But it's frustrating. Almost a million gross tons of vessel depending on a hunk of crystal the size of my fist.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: And that crystal won't hold up, not pulling all our power through it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Spock?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a lithium mining operation on Rigel 12. High-grade ore, I've heard.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Location and distance.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Farrell has the course. Less than two day's travel.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make for Rigel 12, Mister Spock.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rigel 12, Mister Farrell. You have the course.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1329.2. On board the U.S.S. Enterprise, a ship's hearing is being convened against the transport vessel's captain. I'm becoming concerned about the almost-hypnotic effect produced by the women.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This hearing is convened. Stardate 1329.2, on board starship U.S.S. Enterprise. Formal hearings against transport captain Leo Walsh. Start computer.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: State your name for the record.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Leo Francis Walsh.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incorrect.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your correct name.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Gentlemen, surely you're not going to take the word of a soulless mechanical device over that of a real flesh and blood man.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: State your correct name for the record.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Harry Mudd.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incorrect.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Harcourt Fenton Mudd.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Any past offenses, Mister Mudd?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Of course not. Gentlemen, I'm simply an honest businessman.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incorrect.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Blast that tin-plated pot.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Full data coming on screen.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: If it can read our minds, too.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: It can't, darling. It can't. Just what's on the record.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Offense record. Smuggling. Sentence suspended. Transport of stolen goods. Purchase of space vessel with counterfeit currency. Sentences, psychiatric treatment, effectiveness disputed.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Mudd, you're charged with galaxy travel without a flight plan, without an identification beam, and failure to answer a starship's signal, thus effecting a menace to navigation.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: What? My tiny ship in this immense galaxy a menace to navigation?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're also charged with operation of a vessel without a master's license.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Untrue! I have a master's ticket.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incorrect. Master's license revoked Stardate 1116.4.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: All right. Well, very simply, Leo Walsh, who was to be my captain on this trip, passed away suddenly. Well, I had no choice but to take out me ship me own self. I assumed Leo's name out of courtesy to him. In memoriam, as it were. A fine, fine man, alas, gone to his reward.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Destination and purpose of journey?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Planet Ophiuchus 3. Wiving settlers.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come again, Mister Mudd. You do what?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I recruit wives for settlers, a difficult but satisfying task.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Data on witnesses.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: No data.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, go to sensor probe. Any unusual readings?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: No decipherable reading on females. However, unusual reading on male board members. Detecting high respiration patterns, perspiration rate up, heartbeat rapid, blood pressure higher than normal.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Er, that's sufficient. Strike that from the record.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You see, gentlemen, just as I told you. Three lovely ladies destined for frontier planets to be the companions of lonely men, to supply that warmth of a human touch that's so desperately needed. A wife, a home, a family. Gentlemen, I look upon this work as a sacred public trust. I've devoted me whole life to it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incorrect.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, I'm about to start devoting my entire life to it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did these ladies come voluntarily?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, of course! Now, for example, Ruthie here comes from a pelagic planet, sea ranchers. Magda there from the helium experimental station.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: It's the same story for all of us, Captain. No men. Mine was a farm planet with automated machines for company and two brothers to cook for, mend their clothes, canal mud a foot thick on their boots every time they walked in.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Fine, Evie. Fine.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: It's not fine! We've got men willing to be our husbands waiting for us, and you're taking us in the opposite direction! Staring at us Iike we were Saturnius harem girls or something.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: That's enough, Evie.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The only charges are against Mister Mudd. Illegal operation of a vessel. Do you have any defence to offer?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Only heaven's own truth, which I've just given you.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The hearing is closed. Mister Mudd to be handed over to the legal authorities at our earliest opportunity.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: And what about us? What happens to us? Help us, please. All of us.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miss McHuron, if you don't mind

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Our last crystal, sir. It's gone.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain Kirk, engineering section reports our entire life-support system is now on batteries.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Miss McHuron, would you mind. Mister Spock, will you contact the miners on Rigel 12? Notify them that we'll need the lithium crystals immediately upon arrival. (all officers leave)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Oh, you beautiful galaxy! Oh, that heavenly universe! Well, girls, lithium miners. Don't you understand? Lonely, isolated, overworked, rich lithium miners! Girls, do you still want husbands, hmm? Evie, you won't be satisfied with a mere ship's captain. I'll get you a man who can buy you a whole planet. Maggie, you're going to be a countess. Ruth, I'll make you a duchess. And I, I'll be running this starship. Captain James Kirk, the next orders you're taking will be given by Harcourt Fenton Mudd!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log-- Stardate 1330.1. Position, fourteen hours out of Rigel 12. We're on auxiliary impulse engines. Fuel low, barely sufficient to achieve orbit over the planet. Lithium replacements are now imperative. The effect of Mudd's women on my crew continues to grow, still totally unexplained. Harry Mudd is confined to his quarters under guard.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: May I come in?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why, yes, please do. By all means. Connors, are you finished?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: I was wondering what this place looked like. It's fascinating.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Would, Would you walk past my panel again, please?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Your what?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My medical scanner.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Oh, why? You're not giving me an examination, are you?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh no. I wouldn't trust my, my judgment, believe me. Just walk by, please. (scanner heart monitor activates) It's not supposed to do that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: I wondered, will you be examining the miners on Rigel 12?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, if they need it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: You haven't asked yet? Are they in good health and all?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What? Oh, yes, they're in excellent health, all three of them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Oh. Three.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you wearing some unusual kind of perfume or something radioactive, my dear?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: No. I'm just me.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder what makes it do that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Captain? I hope you don't mind.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As a matter of fact, Miss McHuron, I do.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I was trying to take a walk, and I just, I just had to run in someplace. You see, all your men were looking at me, following me with their eyes.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I'll have to talk to them about that. They, er, they don't do that ordinarily, Miss McHuron, but somehow, in your case, and the ladies with you, its, er

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: They're probably just lonely. I can understand loneliness.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Yes, er, now, Miss McHuron

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I, I suppose you understand it even more, having to run a huge ship like this with so much responsibility every minute and having to be so careful with all your men looking up to you.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it probably appears more difficult than it is.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Hmm! I read once that a commander has to act like a paragon of virtue. I never met a paragon.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neither have I.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Well, of course not. No one is. But some people try to pretend. Do you, Captain?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miss McHuron, I don't

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Oh, no! Oh, I just can't do it. I don't care what Harry Mudd says. I do like you, but I just can't go through with it. I hate this whole thing!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Just three? You're sure?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Yes. The miners are healthy and fairly young.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Later, dear, later. Magda, did you get to your communications man?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: The head miner is named Ben Childress. The others are Gossett and Benton.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: And they've been there?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Almost three years now, alone!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Perfect. Perfect. Three of them and three lovely ladies has Harry Mudd. And lithium crystals, my dear, are worth three hundred times their weight in diamonds, thousands of times their weight in gold.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: But they'll be down there, and we'll be up here, circling a hundred miles above them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: And there's a guard outside your door, Harry. You can't get out of your cabin.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: No, my dears. After one more job for you, it won't be Harry Mudd that's trapped. It will be a gentleman named James T

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I don't like you, and I'm not very happy with myself, either.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, I'm not really surprised. I've seen you noticing the Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: We're supposed to notice them! Oh, oh Harry, I don't feel very good. I think it must be near the time.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I asked for a preorbital course, Mister Farrell.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Preorbital course locked in, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the last time I'm giving an order twice, gentlemen. We're down to battery power, and we're low on that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: It'll get us to Rigel 12, sir, but it'll be a shaky orbit.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just hang us in long enough to get six crystals, Scotty. That's all we need.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll get you there.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ridiculous. What are we running here. Did you examine them? Did you examine Eve?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She refused.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, come on, you're the doctor. What is it? Is it that we're tired, and they're beautiful? They are incredibly beautiful.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are they, Jim? Are they actually more lovely, pound for pound, measurement for measurement, than any other women you've known? Or is it that they just, well, act beautiful. No. Strike that, strike that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are they?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean are they alien illusions? That sort of thing?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I asked you first.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, an alien smart enough to pull this could also keep my medical scanner from going beep!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't follow you.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't either.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: Top space frequency of three nine. (hands over communicator)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Rigel 12. Rigel 12.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: This is Rigel 12. Come in, Enterprise.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, this isn't exactly the Enterprise. My name is Harry Mudd. To whom have I the pleasure of speaking, sir?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Power curve still dropping, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: We'll make orbit, sir. A temporary one.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lay in. Computer?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can sustain this orbit for three days, seven hours.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: More than enough time. Communications, have a representative of the Rigel 12 miners meet us here to discuss our needs. Beam him up first pass over their camp.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Look what's happening. (hair lank, skin slightly lined) Look at my face.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: Give us the pills.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: What if someone sees us like this?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: You'll never find them, Harry, and if you do find them you know what they are. A cheat. If you care for someone, really care

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Context: ransacking drawers frantically
Text: For whom, Evie? For Kirk? You'll find out that Ship's captains are already married, girl, to their vessels. You'd find out the first time you came between him and the ship. You'll see.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: I'm going back to what I was. Ugly.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: I can't stand myself like this.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Why did you hide them, Harry? Don't you trust us?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I didn't hide them, girl. I put them in a safe place in case I was searched.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Madga
Text: Find the pill, Harry!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Mattress! Yes, here! (Ruth and Magda devour them eagerly) Go on, Eve. Take it. It's not a cheat. It's a miracle for some man who can appreciate it and who needs it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even burned and cracked, they're beautiful. Destroying them was a shame.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not at all, Mister Spock. The choice was burning this lithium crystal or the destruction of another man's ship. Come.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Security
Text: Sir. Mining Chief Childress and Mister Gossett.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Show them in. I'm James Kirk, captain of the Enterprise. This is my science officer Mister Spock.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Let's get right to business. You want lithium crystals and we've got them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fine. I'm authorised to pay an equitable price.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: We're not sure they're for sale, Captain. We might prefer a swap.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did you have in mind?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Mudd's women.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Gossett
Text: If we like them. We'd like to have a look at them first of course.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Right. Trot them out, Captain. Oh, and Harry Mudd. Either way, I've agreed to have him released. Charges dropped.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Context: laughs
Text: Is there anything else?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: You've got no choice, Kirk. You beam a landing party down, and you won't find one blessed crystal.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No deal. You're a long way out in space, gentlemen. You'll need medical help, cargo runs, starship protection. You want to consider those facts too?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Come along, ladies, come along. You must be Ben Childress. Come on now, girls, come on.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Ruth
Text: And you must be Herm Gossett.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Gossett
Text: Yes, I reckon I am.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: One thing I'll say for you, Mudd, you're not a liar. Ladies, you are welcome.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's still no deal.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Conserving batteries, sir. Half power.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I'm told they have only three days of orbit left before they start spiraling in. I do hate to see you suffering such a situation, Captain, but truth is truth, and the sad fact is you will deal. Sooner or later, you'll have to.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Transporting down to surface of planet Rigel 12 to acquire replacement lithium crystals. Expect further difficulty from miners.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Childress, you've won. Now I'll take the lithium crystals.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: When I have the time, Kirk.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Childress.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: We're busy, Mister Kirk.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: We don't have the time to spare, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You got a better idea?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Context: to Eve
Text: Blows like that all the time. You can get lost a dozen feet from your doorstep. The wind comes up sudden. Magnetic storm. That means the wind will really rip soon.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Magda
Text: Dance with me.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Would you like to dance?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: No, I (coughs) No. I'm sorry, I guess it must be the dust.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: That's the way it is on Rigel all the time. (cuts in on Ruth instead)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Gossett
Text: Hey.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Benton
Text: Go away.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Gossett
Text: I'm cutting in.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Benton
Text: Not on me. (fight starts)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: What's the matter with you?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Why don't you run a raffle and the loser gets me? (leaves)

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: You can't go out there. You'll get killed.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just have those crystals here when I get back.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Eve! Eve!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Have transported aboard the Enterprise to implement search with infrared scanners and sensing system. Magnetic storms on the planet's surface are cutting down speed and efficiency of our equipment. Search now in progress for three hours, eighteen minutes.

Title: Mudd's Women
