Speaker: Farrell
Text: Traverse parallel three and four.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Checking, but not getting much.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: The storm is ionising the atmosphere, Captain. Getting difficult to probe through it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, this is draining our batteries further. If we only had those crystals.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we don't! I didn't get any. I should have found a way. Satisfied, Mister Scott?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Losing communications with the miners, sir. Magnetic storm seems worse.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Has Childress reported in yet?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir. He and the girl are still missing.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sorry, Scotty. How much power do we have left?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Scott
Text: About five hours, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Have expended all but forty three minutes of power. Ship's condition, critical. Search now in progress seven hours, thirty one minutes. Magnetic storms are easing.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Infrared reading. Check traverse three, grid zero four zero.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: About eleven miles, bearing one two one from the mining company.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That's Ben Childress' quarters.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a heat unit operating in there. It could be a cookstove.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have Mudd meet me in the transporter room.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mudd?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The name of this game.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: I had things where I wanted them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I ate some of your food, so I paid with some chores.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: And I do my own cooking. I've not laid a hand on you. Remember that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Oh, the sound of male ego. You travel halfway across the galaxy, and it's still the same song. There. You going to eat or talk?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: I guess I'm supposed to sit, taste, and roll my eyes. Ooh, female cooking again. I've tasted better, by my own hand.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Well you're tasting some of it now. I couldn't scrape three layers of your leavings out of that pan.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: You find me a well, some decent water, then talk.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Well, why don't you hang your pan out in the wind and let the sand blast it clean, or hadn't you thought about that?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Context: after hanging out the pots
Text: It might work. That solitaire?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Double jack.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: The red eight ought to go on the black nine.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Not in double jack.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: You're not only plain as an old bucket, you're not even good company. What the devil happened to your looks, anyway?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I got tired of you. I slumped.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: You heard what I said. You're homely! I've got enough in crystals already to buy queens by the gross! (Kirk and Mudd enter) I didn't touch her.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Thank heaven you found her.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: She's been bubbling with gratitude ever since.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sit down. Tell him. Tell him, Harry.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Ah. Yes, well.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Venus drugs, Harry.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Venus drug? I've heard of it but, it's not just one of those stories?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, it exists, illegally.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, actually, you see, it's a relatively harmless drug.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Harmless!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, what it does is give you more of whatever you have. Well, with men, it makes them more muscular. Women, rounder. Men, more aggressive. Women, more feminine, and

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He gave it to the women before you met them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Does that mean the others? They really look like she does?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Mister Childress, I

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Is that what it means?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: Yes, that's what it means!

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: What happened to my partners?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They've left for their quarters during the storm, Childress. They're married. Subspace radio marriage. It was a fraud. They can get out of it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: If they want to.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Why?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You can't condemn the women.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: I can! A man goes out and fights, almost dies. We all almost die. We should have, but we didn't. And now that we've got the good life in our hands, you bring us women for wives that

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: You don't want wives, you want this. This is what you want, Mister Childress. I hope you remember it and dream about it, because you can't have it. It's not real! (takes the pills) Is this the kind of wife you want, Ben? Not someone to help you, not a wife to cook and sew and cry and need, but this kind. Selfish, vain, useless. Is this what you really want? All right, then. Here it is.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quite a woman, eh, Childress?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: A fake, pumped up by a drug.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By herself. She took no drug.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: I swallowed it.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Coloured gelatin.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Yes, they took away my drug and substituted that.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: But that can't be.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's only one kind of woman.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Or man, for that matter.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You either believe in yourself, or you don't. All right Childress, I've gone as far with you as I intend to. I want those lithium crystals and I want them now. Enterprise, this is Kirk.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by. Do I beam down a search party?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: No, the crystals are here, and you're welcome to them.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Spock. We're coming aboard with the lithium crystals.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: How many coming, Captain?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Childress
Text: Eve will stay, today at least. We, er, we want to talk.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Eve?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Eve
Text: You've got someone up there called the Enterprise.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Two of us, Mister Spock. Come on, Mister Mudd.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Don't you think you could possibly, by accident, arrange to leave me behind here? On this planet that would be punishment enough.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't do that, Harry, but I will appear as a character witness at your trial. If you think that'll help.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mudd
Text: They'll throw away the key.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That must have been quite a talk you made down there. Ever try considering the patent medicine business?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why should I work your side of the street?

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm happy the affair is over. A most annoying emotional episode.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Smack right in the old heart. Oh, I'm sorry. In your case, it would be about here.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Spock
Text: The fact that my internal arrangement differs from yours, Doctor, pleases me no end.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Course plotted and all systems in operation.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Engines engaged. Helm answering.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Out of orbit, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead full.

Title: Mudd's Women
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ahead full, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That should make a good specimen.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Context: holding pink animal with a horn
Text: Temperature's starting to drop.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah. At night it gets down to a hundred and twenty degrees below zero.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That's nippy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: Hey!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: I fell off that bank, sir. Cut my hand.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see it. Get back to the ship. Report to the Sickbay.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: Yes, sir. Geological Technician Fisher. Ready to beam up.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Right. Locked onto you. Energise. Coadjutor engagement.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: What happened?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: I took a flop.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Onto what?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: I don't know. Some kind of yellow ore.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Magnetic. Decontaminate that uniform.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: Yes, sir. (;eaves)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: That acted like a burnout.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk ready to beam up.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Just one moment, Captain. It checks out okay now. You better go get a synchronic meter so we can double-check.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Yes sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, Captain. Locked onto you. (Kirk stumbles as he leaves the platform) Are you all right, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm all right. Just a little dizzy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let me give you a hand.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't get through there. Nothing serious. Don't leave the transporter room unattended.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Wilson will be right back, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Context: both leave, and another Kirk materialises on the pad

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1672.1. Specimen-gathering mission on planet Alpha 177. Unknown to any of us during this time, a duplicate of me, some strange alter ego, had been created by the transporter malfunction.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Captain? Are you all right, sir? Can I give you a hand, sir? Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to all decks. Section duty officers, check communication lines.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: It might profit you to let Doctor McCoy give you the once-over.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Engineer, I'll have my engines looked to.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Ship's manifests, sir. I think they're in order now.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Yeoman.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: I've checked

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's all.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir. (leaves Kirk to lie down on bed)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You picked a good day, Fisher. Business has been lousy. What'd you do, take a fall on purpose so you could get a little vacation?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Saurian brandy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Back to duty status, Fisher. I have no sympathy for clumsiness.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: No, sir. The hand's much better, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What can I do for you, Jim?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Context: grabbing him by the neck
Text: I said, give me the brandy! (leaves with bottle and goes to Rand's quarters)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come in. Yes, Mister Spock, what is it?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is there something I can do for you, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like what?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, Doctor McCoy seemed to think I should check on you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's nice. Come on, Spock, I know that look. What is it?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, our good doctor said that you were acting like a wild man, demanded brandy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our good doctor's been putting you on again.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hmm. Well, in that case, if you'll excuse the intrusion Captain, I'll get back to my work.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll tell him you were properly annoyed.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Scotty?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Transporter breakdown. Continue circuit testing. We beamed up this animal and, well, look for yourself. It's in this specimen case. (opens lid to reveal angry pink animal)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: A few seconds after they sent this one up through the transporter, that duplicate appeared. Except it's not a duplicate, it's an opposite. Two of the same animal, but different. One gentle, this. One mean and fierce, that. Some kind of savage, ferocious opposite. Captain, we don't dare send Mister Sulu and the landing party up. If this should happen to a man.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, my.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Oh! Captain, you startled me. Is there something that you? Can I help you, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jim will do here, Janice.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Oh.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're too beautiful to ignore. Too much woman. We've both been pretending too long. (grabs her) Stop pretending. Let's stop pretending. Come here, Janice. Don't fight me. Don't fight me, Janice. (kisses her)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just a minute, Janice. Just a minute! (forces her onto the floor, she scratches his face and gets away to the door which opens just as Fisher is passing by)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Call Mister Spock! Call Mister Spock!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: Geological Technician Fisher. Deck twelve, section (Kirk grabs him and hits him, hard)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Me? My yeoman said that? I've been resting here since you left me. Alone, Mister Spock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy reports that you demanded this brandy in Sickbay and left with it. I found this bottle in Yeoman Rand's quarters.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not true. I haven't been to the Sickbay. Let's find out what's going on.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay. (just missing the other Kirk nursing grazed knuckles, who goes into his quarters)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Then he kissed me and he said that we, that he was the Captain and he could order me. I didn't know what to do. When you mentioned the feelings we'd been hiding, and you started talking about us.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Us?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Well, he is the captain. I couldn't just. You started hurting me. I had to fight you, and scratch your face.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman, look at me. Look at me, look at my face. Are there any scratches?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: I was sure I scratched you. I was frightened. Maybe

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman. I was in my room. It wasn't me.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Sir, Fisher saw you, too.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fisher saw?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: If it hadn't been. I can understand. I don't want to get you into trouble. I wouldn't have even mentioned it!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It wasn't me!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: It was you, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you know what you're saying?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Fisher
Text: Yes, I know what I'm saying.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Back to that bed, bucko. Come on, let's go.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: You can go now, Yeoman. (Rand leaves) There's only one logical answer. We have an impostor aboard.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1672.9. On the planet's surface, temperatures are beginning to drop, our landing party there in growing jeopardy. Due to the malfunction of the ship's transporter, an unexplained duplicate of myself definitely exists.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did all this happen?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know sir, but when Fisher came up, his suit was covered with a soft yellow ore that had highly unusual properties. It may have caused an overload. Can't tell, not yet.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does the transporter work at all?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes sir, but we don't dare bring up the landing party. It might be duplicated like this animal.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long will it take you to find the trouble?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can't say, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We just can't leave those four men down there. It's getting dark. They'll die. The surface temperature of that planet goes down to a hundred and twenty degrees below zero at night.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're doing everything we can, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know, Scotty.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: About your double, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, er, yes, we'll have to find him. Search parties, Mister Spock. Organise search parties.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can't take a chance on killing it. We have no previous experience, no way of knowing what would happen to you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's right. We don't know, but the men have to be armed. The men are to be armed, with their phasers locked, I repeat, locked, on setting number one. There can't be any chance of him being killed. He's to be taken without. If the men are forced to fire, he can't be killed.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: How shall we explain it to them, Captain? The search parties are to capture you?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell them.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: The search parties, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'll make an announcement to the entire crew, tell them what happened. It's a good crew. They deserve to know.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, no disrespect intended, but you must surely realise you can't announce the full truth to the crew. You're the Captain of this ship. You haven't the right to be vulnerable in the eyes of the crew. You can't afford the luxury of being anything less than perfect. If you do, they lose faith, and you lose command.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I do know that, Mister Spock. What I don't know is why I forgot that just now. Mister Spock, if you see me slipping again, your orders, your orders are to tell me.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1673.1. Something has happened to me. Somehow, in being duplicated, I have lost my strength of will. Decisions are becoming more and more difficult.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain speaking. There's an impostor aboard the ship, a man who looks exactly like me and is pretending to be me. This man is dangerous. Utmost caution is to be observed. All crew members are to arm themselves. The impostor may be identified by scratches on his face. Repeat, the impostor may be identified by scratches on his face.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Section chiefs, assign personnel to the search. All search parties

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: report to Mister Spock for assignment.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: About the phaser weapons to be set for stunning force and locked.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes, yes. All hand phasers must be set on base cycle, stunning force.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The impostor is not to be injured. Use minimum force. Repeat, the imposter

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is not to be injured.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk. I'm Captain Kirk! I'm Captain Kirk! I'm Captain Kirk! (goes to mirror, covers scratches with makeup, opens door) Wilson!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Sir?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wilson, give me your phaser.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How have you been?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Wilson
Text: Fine, sir. (Kirk grabs and hits him)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's it going down there, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's already twenty degrees below zero. Can't exactly

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: call it balmy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't there any way we can help them?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thermal heaters were transported down. They duplicated. They won't operate.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we've got to get those men up.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Transporter Technician Wilson found injured near the Captain's cabin. He says the impostor attacked him, called him by name, took his hand phaser.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged. Continue the search.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to find him before he, but how?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently, this double, however different in temperament, has your knowledge of the ship, its crew, its devices. This being the case, perhaps we can outguess him by determining his next move. Knowing how the ship is laid out, where would you go to elude a mass search?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The lower levels. The Engineering deck.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Set and locked on base cycle to stun, not to kill. What about your phaser, Captain? Don't you think we ought to get some help, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I don't want anyone else to see the

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you ordered me to tell you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, if I'm to be the Captain, I've got to act like one.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Context: they split up to search, and Kirk comes face to face with himself

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't hurt me. You can't kill me. You can't. Don't you understand? I'm part of you. You need me. I need you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I don't need you. (Spock neck-pinches him, and his phaser fire hits a panel instead)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll be regaining consciousness soon, and not knowing what his physical state is, I don't think I dare give him a tranquilizer of any kind. I think we'd better bind him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. yes, all right. What's the matter with me?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Judging from my observations, Captain, you're rapidly losing the power of decision.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have a point, Spock?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, always, Doctor. We have here an unusual opportunity to appraise the human mind, or to examine, in Earth terms, the roles of good and evil in a man. His negative side, which you call hostility, lust, violence, and his positive side, which Earth people express as compassion, love, tenderness.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's the Captain's guts you're analysing. Are you of that, Spock?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, and what is it that makes one man an exceptional leader? We see indications that it's his negative side which makes him strong, that his evil side, if you will, properly controlled and disciplined, is vital to his strength. Your negative side removed from you, the power of command begins to elude you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is your point, Mister Spock?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: If your power of command continues to weaken, you'll soon be unable to function as Captain. You must be prepared for that.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have your intellect, Jim. You can fight with that!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For how long?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I seem insensitive to what you're going through, Captain, understand it's the way I am.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Scott, sir, on the lower level of the Engineering deck.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've found a new trouble with the transporter. The casing has a wide gap ripped in it. (the phaser damage) The main circuits

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: have been burned through. The abort control circuit is gone altogether.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Can you give us a status report, Captain? Temperature's still dropping. Now forty one degrees below zero.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've located the trouble. It shouldn't be much longer.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Do you think you might be able to find a long rope somewhere and lower us down a pot of hot coffee?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll see what we can do.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Rice wine will do, if you're short on coffee.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering deck, Kirk here.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That unit, Scotty, status report.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: The transporter unit ioniser. Nothing much left of it, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How bad is it?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can't repair it in less than a week.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1673.5. Transporter still inoperable. My negative self is under restraint in Sickbay. My own indecisiveness growing. My force of will steadily weakening. On the planet, condition critical. Surface temperature is seventy five degrees below zero, still dropping.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Context: using phaser to heat rocks
Text: I think we ought to give room service another call. That coffee's taking too long. Enterprise, this is Sulu.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hot line direct to the Captain. Are we that far gone?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I gave everybody the afternoon off. I'm watching the store.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is it down there?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Oh, lovely, except that the frost is building up. We're using hand phasers to heat the rocks. One phaser quit on us, three still operating. Any possibility of getting us back aboard before the skiing season opens down here?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Spock, Mister Sulu. You'll have to hold on a little longer. There's no other way. Survival procedures, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Per your training programme, Mister Spock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Context: other Kirk is screaming

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Apparently the body functioning weakened during the duplication process. A fact I failed to consider.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's not dying?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, he is.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: Help me.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How can he die? Can I survive without him?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know, Jim.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't be afraid. Here's my hand. Hold on. You don't have to be afraid. I won't let go. Hold on. You won't be afraid if you use your mind and think! Think! You can do it. That's it!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, he is back! Jim, you can use that brandy now. In fact, I'll join you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have to take him back inside myself. I can't survive without him. I don't want him back. He's like an animal, a thoughtless, brutal animal, and yet it's me. Me.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you're no different than anyone else. We all have our darker side. We need it! It's half of what we are. It's not really ugly, it's human.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Human.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, human. A lot of what he is makes you the man you are. God forbid I should have to agree with Spock, but he was right. Without the negative side, you wouldn't be the Captain. You couldn't be, and you know it. Your strength of command lies mostly in him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do I have?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have the goodness.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not enough. I have a ship to command.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The intelligence, the logic. It appears your half has most of that, and perhaps that's where man's essential courage comes from. For you see, he was afraid and you weren't.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here. Would you come to the transporter room. We think we may have found an answer.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Coming.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've found a way to get the transporter working, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've attached some bypass and leader circuits to compensate for the difference. Tied directly into the impulse engines, there shouldn't be more than a five point variation in the velocity balance. I suggest we send the animal through. Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes. Go ahead.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Context: opening box with angry animal in it
Text: I'll grab him by the scruff of the neck and hold him as long as I can.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't hurt him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's painless and quick. The animal will be unconscious for only a few minutes. (sedates it)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Scott
Text: If this doesn't work, I don't know what will.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energise. Reverse.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: The shock of putting him back together seems to have been too much for him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Jim.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1673.1. Entry made by Second Officer Spock. Captain Kirk retains command of this vessel, but his force of will rapidly fading. Condition of landing party critical. Transporter unit still under repair.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Autopsy in-depth. Hurry. I don't know. Animal could have died of some kind of shock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: For once, I agree with you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I said could have, Mister Spock. We won't know until we get a full post-mortem.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: No autopsy is necessary to know that the animal was terrified, confused. It was split into two halves and suddenly thrust back together again. Thus shock induced by blind terror.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes, that sounds likely.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: It couldn't understand. You can. You have your intelligence controlling your fear.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get the transporter room ready.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could be, if, maybe. All guesswork so far. Just theory. Jim, why don't you give me a chance to do an autopsy and let Spock check the transporter circuits again.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That sounds, sounds reasonable. We should double-check everything.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Aren't you forgetting something, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't think I've for

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your men on the planet surface. How much time do they have left?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's right. The men. We have to take the chance, Bones. Their lives

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Suppose it wasn't shock, Jim. Suppose death was caused by transporter malfunction. Then you'd die. They'd die, anyway. Jim, you can't risk your life on a theory!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Being split in two halves is no theory with me, Doctor. I have a human half, you see, as well as an alien half, submerged, constantly at war with each other. Personal experience, Doctor. I survive it because my intelligence wins over both, makes them live together. Your intelligence would enable you to survive as well.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help me. Somebody make the decision.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you relinquishing your command, Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, I'm not.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well then, we can't help you, Jim. The decision is yours.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, ready the transporter room. Bones, continue the autopsy.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, I have a tie-in with Sulu now.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain K-Kirk, Sulu here. One hundred seventeen below. Can't last much longer.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Can't see clearly, Doctor, to read top indicator. Think the cold penetrating communicator. Two men unconscious. No time. No. Can't wait. No time.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu. Mister Sulu. Can't wait. Can't let them die.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: What are you going to do?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go through the transporter, both of us.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: There's nothing I can do to stop you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's what I have to do. It's what I have to do. What we have to do.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I won't fight you anymore. Oh, I feel so weak. I'll be glad when this is over. (grabs Kirk and knocks him out)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Janice, hello.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain, I

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman, I owe you an explanation.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: No.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I do. The transporter malfunctioned, divided me, created a duplicate. The animal part of me came to your cabin. He even scratched me to make us look more alike. I'd like the chance to explain it to you. You don't mind if I come to your cabin later?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Context: enters turbolift
Text: Bridge.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: No word from Mister Sulu, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: Prepare to leave orbit, Mister Farrell. Well?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Captain!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I gave you an order, Mister Farrell.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: But what about

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: They can't be saved. Prepare to leave orbit.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I thought the plan

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I've changed my mind. Man your station, Mister Spock. (McCoy enters with another Kirk, identically dressed) Grab him. He's the impostor.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: McCoy, he's fooled you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He (the one in the captain's chair) attacked him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you know who I am. You know what that is.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Mister Spock, which one? What do we do?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll let the captain handle this.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I'm the captain. Isn't that obvious? Look at his face. Remember the scratches? Look how he's tried to hide them. He wants you to think that he's Captain Kirk. You know who I am.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: You want to kill me, don't you? Farrell, James, grab him. He'll destroy the ship! I'm the Captain. Don't you understand? I'm captain of the ship! (starts attacking the crew) I'm the captain! This is my ship! My ship! It's mine! I'll kill you.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can half a man live?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: Take another step, you'll die.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we'll both die.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: Please, I don't want to. Don't make me. Don't make me. (Kirk takes phaser off him) I don't want to go back. Please! I want to live!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You will. Both of us.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Other Kirk
Text: I want to live!

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll have to hold on to him, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If this doesn't work.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready. (beams them out)

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Mister Spock? (one figure is beamed back) Jim?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get those men aboard fast.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Right away, Captain.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: as the party is wheeled away
Text: Severe exposure and frostbite, but I think they'll make it. How do you feel, Jim?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How? I've seen a part of myself no man should ever see.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Status report, green.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: All sections report ready, sir.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Thank you, Mister Spock, from both of us.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: Shall I pass that on to the crew, sir?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The impostor's back where he belongs. Let's forget him.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain? The impostor told me what happened, who he really was, and I'd just like to say that. Well, sir, what I'd like is

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Yeoman.

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Spock
Text: The, er, impostor had some interesting qualities, wouldn't you say, Yeoman?

Title: The Enemy WIthin
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain speaking. Navigator, set in course correction. Helmsman, steady as she goes.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1513.1. Our position, orbiting planet M-113. On board the Enterprise, Mister Spock temporarily in command. On the planet the ruins of an ancient and long-dead civilisation. Ship's surgeon McCoy and myself are now beaming down to the planet's surface. Our mission, routine medical examination of archaeologist Robert Crater and his wife Nancy. Routine but for the fact that Nancy Crater is that one woman in Doctor McCoy's past.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shall we pick some flowers, Doctor? When a man visits an old girlfriend she usually expects something like that.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is that how you get girls to like you, by bribing them? There doesn't seem to be anybody around, does there.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll be along. You rushed us down ten minutes early. (enter building)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Crater? Professor? Mrs. Crater? Nervous, Dr. McCoy?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah, a little bit, I guess. You see, we walked out of each other's lives ten years ago. She married Crater, and for all I know she may have forgotten me completely. Of all the bonehead ideas, Jim, how'd I let myself in for things like this?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Context: singing outside, then enters
Text: Leonard!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nancy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Hello.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's good to see you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Let me look at you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You haven't aged a day. Oh, this is Captain Jim Kirk of the Enterprise.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Context: seeing an older woman than McCoy does
Text: Mrs. Crater. I've heard a great deal about you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: All good, I hope.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And Crewman Darnell.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Darnell
Context: seeing a young blonde
Text: How do you do, ma'am?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something wrong, Darnell?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Darnell
Text: Excuse me sir but, ma'am, if I didn't know better I would swear you were someone I left behind on Wrigley's Pleasure Planet. It's funny, you're exactly like a girl that

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A little less mouth, Darnell.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Darnell
Text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to. I mean, I know it's impossible, of course.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why don't you step outside, Darnell.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Darnell
Text: Yes, sir. Thank you, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe I'll step outside, too.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: What? And let Plum examine me all alone?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plum?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Plum.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: A nickname I gave Leonard when we were very young.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll, er, I'll wait for the professor and I'll catch you both at once.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I'd better go get Bob. Every time he starts digging he forgets time, sleep, food, everything. Be back in a minute.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Blonde Nancy
Text: It's quite warm here, isn't it? (encourages Darnell to follow her)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, additional entry. Since our mission was routine, we had beamed down to the planet without suspicion. We were unaware each member of the landing party was seeing a different woman, a different Nancy Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Crater, I'm Captain Kirk. This is

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: The heroic Captain and the intrepid doctor cross interstellar space to preserve our health. Your sense of duty is overwhelming. Now will you please go back where you came from and tell whoever issues your orders to leave me and my wife alone. We need salt against the heat. Aside from that, we're doing very well, thank you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm pleased you're doing well but I'm required to confirm that fact.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Doubtless the good surgeon will enjoy prodding and poking us with his arcane machinery. Go away, we don't want you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What you want is unimportant right now. What you will get is required by the book.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quote. All research personnel on alien planets are required to have their health certified by a starship surgeon at one year intervals. Like it or not, Professor, as commander of the starship, I'm required

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: To show your gold braid to everyone. You love it, don't you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's all yours, Plum. Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sit down and breathe deeply, please.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Did I hear you call him Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You did.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: McCoy. I've heard Nancy speak of a Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's me. Didn't she mention I was here?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: You've seen Nancy?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She went out to get you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: You've seen her too? You were with the good Doctor?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Why?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Nothing. It's just that it gives me pleasure to know that she's gotten to see an old friend and has a chance for some company. It's different for me, I enjoy solitude. But for a woman. You understand, of course.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it certainly hasn't aged her. She looks exactly as I knew her twelve years ago. Amazing, Jim. Like a girl of twenty five.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Sorry. I'm sorry, Captain, sit down. I seem to have forgotten my manners.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quite all right.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not joking, Jim. She hasn't aged a day. She doesn't have a grey hair on her head.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's got some grey, Bones. Excuse me, Professor, she's a handsome woman, yes, but hardly twenty five.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: You've seen my wife with the eyes of your past attachment, Doctor. I'm sure when Nancy lets, when you see her again she'll be a believable age.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well at any rate she doesn't look a day over thirty.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Genuine affection. I'm glad you still feel it for her. Leonard, isn't it? She's a fine woman.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Open your mouth.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Why, I thought the machine

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The machine is capable of almost anything but I'll still put my trust in a healthy set of tonsils. Now, open your mouth. (a woman screams, they dash out, Kirk with his phaser drawn)

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Darnell is lying on a rock, Nancy is standing by him

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Context: removing a piece of plant from Darnell's mouth
Text: McCoy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dead, Jim. Strange. A red mottling all over his face.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: What do you suppose happened, Captain? You beam down a crewman who doesn't know better than to eat an untested plant.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've just lost a crewman, Mrs. Crater. I want to know what happened.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Well, I, I

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take it easy, Nancy. Just tell us what you know.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I was just. I couldn't find Bob, and I was coming back. I crossed to your crewman. I wanted him to know I wasn't offended by the things he'd said back there. You remember. Then I, I noticed he had a Borgia plant in his hand. Before I could say anything, he, he'd taken a bite from it. He fell, his face all twisted, and. Leonard, you're looking at me like you don't believe me.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, no, no, no, it's not that. It's something entirely different. Jim, I suppose we could complete these examinations later.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: We don't need an examination, you can see that. Perhaps you'd better take your man and

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're well aware of our next duties, Professor. We'll complete your examinations tomorrow. Transporter room.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Transporter room, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock onto us. Three beaming up.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Scott
Text: Locked onto you, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Salt. You did ask them about more salt tablets?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: I'll take care of the provisioning, Nancy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Miss Uhura, your last sub-space log contained an error in the frequencies column.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, sometimes I think if I hear that word frequency once more, I'll cry.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cry?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I was just trying to start a conversation.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, since it is illogical for a communications officer to resent the word frequency, I have no answer.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, you have an answer. I'm an illogical woman who's beginning to feel too much a part of that communications console. Why don't you tell me I'm an attractive young lady, or ask me if I've ever been in love? Tell me how your planet Vulcan looks on a lazy evening when the moon is full.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan has no moon, Miss Uhura.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm not surprised, Mister Spock.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Transporter room to Bridge. Landing party returning. They report one death.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge acknowledging.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't believe it.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Explain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: You explain. That means that somebody is dead and you just sit there. It could be Captain Kirk. He's the closest thing you have to a friend.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, my demonstration of concern will not change what happened. The transporter room is very well-manned and they will call if they need my assistance.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She called it a Borgia plant.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something new to me.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Dispensary.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Mister Spock.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Borgia plant listed in library record tapes as carbon group three vegetation similar to Earth nightshade family. Alkaloid poison. Chemical structure common to class M planets. About the strange mottling on his facial skin surface. There is no reference to this symptom.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hmm. Well then, this man wasn't poisoned.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Spock. She said she saw him eat the plant.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's mistaken. I know alkaloid poison, what to look for. There's not a trace of it in his body.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There were bits of the plant in his mouth.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, don't tell me my business. He could not have swallowed any. My instruments would have picked up any trace of it whatsoever.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then what kills a healthy man

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll tell you something else. This man shouldn't be dead. I can't find anything wrong with him. According to all the tests he should just get up and walk away from here. I don't know. I'll have the tests double-checked. My eyes may be tricking me. I swear, Jim, when I first saw her she looked just as I'd known her ten years ago. Granted, for a moment I may have been looking at her through a romantic haze.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How your lost love affects your vision, Doctor, doesn't interest me. I've lost a man. I want to know what killed him.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1513.4. In orbit around planet M-113. One crewman, member of the landing party, dead by violence. Cause unknown, but we are certain the cause of death was not poison.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message, Captain. Starship base on Caran 4 requesting explanation of our delay here, sir. Space Commander Dominguez says we have supplies he urgently needs.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Tell Jose he'll get his chili peppers when we get there. Tell him they're prime Mexican reds. I handpicked them myself, but he won't die if he goes a few more days without them. Got it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Got it, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: No mistake in our record tapes. Borgia plant. Its sole deadly property is alkaloid poison.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Professor Crater and wife?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Check out perfectly. They arrived here nearly five years ago. Visited by various vessels, made fairly heavy shipments out, of artefacts and reports. However, there has been a marked drop in shipments during the last year.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dispensary to Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We found something.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd rather not put it on the speaker.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So improbable we almost didn't check it.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sodium chloride. Not a trace of it.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This man has no salt in his body at all.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you explain that, Doctor?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't, except that what we normally carry in our bodies is gone from his.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: He would die almost instantly.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How? There isn't a mark on his body.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Except the red rings on his face.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You called that skin mottling.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought it was, sir. Another error on my part.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not counting them, Bones. Are you in the mood for an apology?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, forget it. I probably was mooning over her. I should have been thinking about my job.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps you were. Both Nancy and Crater went out of their way to mention one item they needed.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Salt tablets.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, outfit a landing party. We're beaming down with some questions.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: One might think that you had more important duties than harassing people, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have, Professor. Believe me, I have. Where is Mrs. Crater? I want to talk to her, too.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Captain, you can't just beam down here and bully us, and interfere with our work.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mrs. Crater. I won't ask again.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Possibly at the other diggings. We don't keep military logs

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Green, find her.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Green
Text: Yes, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standing by.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sturgeon, transport a sample of the plant to Mister Spock. We'll check if it's actually the Borgia plant or something we don't understand. (Sturgeon leaves) You got that, Mister Spock?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Complete analysis.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Captain, considering the inescapable fact that you are a trespasser on my planet

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your complaint is noted, sir. Look, something we don't understand killed one of my men. It could prove to be a danger to you and Mrs. Crater, too.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: We've been here for almost five years. If there were anything hostile here we would know about it, wouldn't we?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, tell the professor what the autopsy revealed.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Our crewman died of salt depletion. Sudden, total loss of it. Medically impossible by any standards.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And by coincidence, both you and Mrs. Crater requested salt tablets.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: And your esteemed physician cannot explain our need for salt tablets?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're all aware of the need for salt on a hot and arid planet like this, Professor, but it's a mystery, and I don't like mysteries. They give me a bellyache and I've got a beauty right now.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Context: opening storage box) Nancy and I started with twenty five pounds. This is what we have left. (a few tablets at the bottom of a jar
Text: Now what is so mysterious about that?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: checking tablets
Text: Salt.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of the missions of the Enterprise is to protect human life in places like this. I'm going to have to ask you and Mrs. Crater to stay aboard my ship until we find out what killed that crewman.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: But you can't do that.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I can, Professor. <br. crater="" do="" interfere="" it="" it'll="" mustn't="" our="" with="" work="" you="">

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: How? You've been here five years. Will a couple of days make a difference? Mister Spock.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Arrange quarters for Professor and Mrs. Crater. Did you get the plant analysis?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is the Borgia variety, Captain. Could not have caused Darnell's death.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, he's run off.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Crater finds Sturgeon's body

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Nancy! You! Salt! I've got salt! Smell it! Smell it, Nancy!

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Nancy is kneeling by Green's body. She stands at the call

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Crater! Professor Crater!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Professor Crater!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Crater! Professor! Professor!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim! Jim, it's Sturgeon. He's dead.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'd better locate Crewman Green. Green! Green! Crewman Green, report! Green!

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Nancy changes into Green

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Crewman Green, report! Green! Green, where are you? Could it be Crater? He came this way.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. Green! (Green arrives) Did you see this?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Green
Text: Yes, sir. Sturgeon was dead when I found him. I was circling to find whatever it was.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Same red rings on his face. Have you seen Nancy, Mrs. Crater?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Green
Text: No, sir. I checked all through the ruins.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm worried about her, Jim. She's not at the quarters, she's not at the diggings. She could be in trouble. Nancy!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Crater!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nancy, it's Leonard!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're beaming aboard the ship, Doctor.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't leave her!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't search this whole planet on foot.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could learn something from Mister Spock, Doctor. Stop thinking with your glands. We've equipment aboard the Enterprise that could pinpoint a match lit anywhere on this planet, or the heat of a body. Transporter room, Kirk speaking. Three to beam up.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Bridge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Break out the surface search equipment. I want co-ordinates on two people.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's a body down there. Sturgeon.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Transporter Operator
Text: We'll bring him home, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could use some sleep, Bones.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right, Jim.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Oh, Green, what went on down there? (he reaches for the salt cellar) Who do you think you are?

Title: The Man Trap
Context: they enter turbolift

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Something odd, Captain. You said two people.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor and Nancy Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: We get a reading on only one person, probably Crater. He's circling as if searching for something.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Expand search radius.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Green is following Rand

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Why don't you go chase an asteroid?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Redshirt
Text: Hey, Janice, is that for me?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Don't you wish it was?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Blueshirt
Text: How about that?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Redshirt
Text: Yeah, how'd you like to have her as your personal yeoman?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Where are you, Sulu?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: In here feeding the weepers, Janice.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: I've got your tray.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: May the Great Bird of the Galaxy bless your planet.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Thank you. Hello, Beauregard. How are you today, darling?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Her name's Gertrude.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: No, it's a he plant. A girl can tell.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Why do people have to call inanimate objects she, like she's a fast ship.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: He is not an inanimate object. He's so animate he makes me nervous. In fact, I keep expecting one of these plants of yours to grab me.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hello, Green.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: He's not talking today. You been nipping saurian brandy or something?

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Beauregard starts screeching and slithers down into it's stem. Green rushes out

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Context: stroking plant
Text: Take it easy. Calm down. Very sensitive.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: He's the real spook. Suppose he's going space happy or something?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: UHURA (to crewmen) The door to my quarters still rattles when it opens. Would you stop by and see if you can do something about it? Thanks, Bobby. (Green changes into African crewman) Crewman, do I know you?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crewman
Text: In a way, ma'am. You were just thinking of someone like me. I'm guessing of course, but you do look a little lonely.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I see. So naturally, when I'm lonely I think of you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Ina cuvanea mwanamke turee.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Una kafeeri Hur. You're Swahili?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura to the Bridge. (the crewman begins to reach for her face) Lieutenant Uhura to the Bridge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: I'd better get this tray back. Bye, Beauregard.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Wait a minute, I'll walk along.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, report to the Bridge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Lieutenant Uhura. On my way, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Bridge. Captain there?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Nothing to report, Doctor. We haven't located Mrs. Crater. What's the matter, can't you sleep?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nope.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try taking one of those red pills you gave me last week. You'll sleep.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: The simple fact is unless there's something seriously wrong with the ship's equipment, there's only one person within a one hundred mile circle.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. We'll triangulate on him. We'll let Professor Crater explain what happened to his wife. (to Uhura) Remember my instructions, Lieutenant. Keep a tight fix on us. If we let out a yell I want an armed party down there before the echo dies.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Uhura's crewman has found McCoy's quarters, and transforms into Nancy

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nancy. Well, come in. come in. I've been worried sick about you. I wonder why Jim didn't tell me he found you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I'm so happy to see you, Leonard. The others, they, I, I don't relate to them as much as you. You have such strong memories of me.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: You do care, don't you, Leonard? It makes me feel so, so safe.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nancy, er

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: My husband? I like your feelings better. Much stronger. But you're tired, You need to rest.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're as bad as Jim Kirk. He's been telling me to take these.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I think you should. I'll get you some water.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: a crewman lies dead, with mottles on his face

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Look at his face!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge. Sulu. Trouble on deck nine, section two. We need a medical team.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1513.8. I am now certain that the violent death of my crewmen was caused by some strange life-form.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: lying on bed
Text: I was so worried. Your husband acting strange, crewmen dying.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: You're so tired, darling. Just rest now.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Medical department alert. Doctors and medics acknowledge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: It's nothing, dear. It's nothing. You just sleep. Nancy will take care of everything.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Dr. McCoy to the Bridge. Dr. McCoy to the Bridge. (Nancy changes to McCoy) Dr. McCoy to the Bridge.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, additional. Armed and able-bodied crewmen are not attacked and slaughtered this easily. Apparently, the killer can immobilize them as it approaches perhaps with some hypnotic or paralysing power. The answer lies with Professor Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Go away! We don't want you here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We? Where's your wife, Professor? We're concerned about her.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: I'm armed. Go away.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's your wife, Professor?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: She's no concern of yours.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're worried about her safety. Aren't you? Professor, you're a reasonable man, let me (comm. beep) Kirk here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Casualty, Captain. Barnhart was found dead on deck nine. Same symptoms.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock cutting in, Captain. Something here, through the arches to your left.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Sulu. Spock has something.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Green.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He beamed up to the ship with us.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or something did.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise from Kirk.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge. Sulu.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have an intruder aboard. Could be masquerading as Crewman Green. General quarters, security condition three.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: GQ security three, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: General quarters three. Intruder alert. GQ three. Intruder alert. General quarters three. Intruder alert. GQ three. Intruder alert.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Reporting GQ three secure, Captain. Do you require assistance there?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Crater knows the creature. If we could take him alive.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative, Lieutenant, but keep locked in on us. Kirk out. Let's get him. (phaser fire)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: We don't want you here! We're happy alone! I'll kill to stay alone. You hear that, Kirk? Or you'll have to kill me. II don't care either way.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, taking him alive is going to be difficult.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set your phaser on one quarter. I'll leave mine on stun.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why risk your life for his?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's not trying to kill us, he's trying to frighten us, and he's doing a pretty good job.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: GQ three now secured except for decks five, seven, and ten. Come in, please.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: He's not in supply and maintenance.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Go to Engineering now. Run through file photos of the crewmen there.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Check.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Security
Text: Deck five reporting. Crewman Green is not in his quarters. No one has seen him

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Keep in mind if you find him, he's not Crewman Green. The Captain reports Crewman Green is dead.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: And he, or rather it, followed me. I thought there was something twitchy about him.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He, whatever, was probably your crewman, too, Lieutenant.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: He must have been it. You know, I would have remembered a crewman like him.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The creature leading you a merry chase, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The creature?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Or whatever it is that's killing the crewmen. Perhaps I can help. Fill me in.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: Spock and Kirk are circling around Crater from different directions

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged. Crater! (Kirk fires his phaser)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your wife, Professor. Where is she? Your wife, Professor. Where is she?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: She was the last of her kind.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The last of her kind?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: The last of its kind. Earth history, remember? Like the passenger pigeon or buffalo. Ooh! I feel strange.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just stunned. You'll be able to think in a minute.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Earth buffalo. What about it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Once there were millions of them prairies black with them. One herd covered three whole states, and when they moved they were like thunder.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: And now they're gone. Is that what you mean?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Like the creatures here. Once there were millions of them. Now there's one left. Nancy understood.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Always in the past tense.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's your wife? Where is she now?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Dead. Buried up on the hill. It killed her.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Oh, a year, or was it two?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to Captain. Sulu here.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's definite, Mister Sulu. The intruder can assume any shape. Crewmen, you, myself, anyone. Do you understand?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Affirmative, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to GQ four.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: General quarters four, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: The creature was trying to survive. It has that right, doesn't it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to transporter room. Three to beam up.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: They needed salt to stay alive. There was no more salt. It's the last one. The buffalo. There is no difference.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's one, Professor. Your creature is killing my people.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, continuing. The Enterprise has been invaded by a creature capable of assuming any form, and with the capacity to paralyse and draw the life from any one of us.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Deck five, section three. Deck five, section three. Report.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Security
Text: Security 3 A here. 3 B in sight.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Negative, Captain. I've checked every face on this vessel. It was not a crewman I saw.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman Rand, how long was this Green with you?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: As long as he, it thought it could get to the salt on my tray, sir.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Supplies of salt have been set out as bait at all decks and engineering levels, Captain. However, no one or nothing has approached them as yet.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dr. McCoy?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Medical department report, Doctor.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh. Well, we could offer it salt without tricks. There's no reason for it to attack us.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your attitude is laudable, Doctor, but your reasoning is reckless.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Context: eyeing McCoy carefully
Text: The creature is not dangerous when fed.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, it's simply trying to survive by using its natural ability to take other forms.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: The way the chameleon uses its protective colouring, an ability retained no doubt from its primitive state, the way we have retained our incisor teeth. They were once fangs. Certain of our muscles were designed for chase. It uses its ability the way we would use our muscles and teeth if necessary, to stay alive.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And like us, it's an intelligent animal. There's no need to hunt it down.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very interesting hypothesis, Doctor. Briefing room.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SULU [on monitor] All the halls sealed off. All weapons accounted for and locked away. Security four in effect on every level. Still no lead on intruder.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant. Continue the search. Crater, we don't know who or what we're looking for. We need your help, and now.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: I demanded, I even begged that you get off my planet.
