Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you recognise this thing When you see it? Professor, I'll forego charges up to this point but this creature's aboard my ship and I'll have it, or I'll have your skin, or both. Now where is it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: I loved Nancy very much. Few women like my Nancy. She lives in my dreams. She walks and sings in them.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And it becomes Nancy for you.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Not because of tricks. It doesn't trick me. It needs love as much as it needs salt. When it killed Nancy, I almost destroyed it but, it isn't just a beast. It is intelligent and the last of its kind.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You bleed too much, Crater. You're too pure and noble. Are you saving the last of its kind or has this become Crater's private heaven, here on this planet? This thing becomes wife, lover, best friend, wise man, fool, idol, slave. It isn't a bad life to have everyone in the universe at your beck and call, and you win all the arguments.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: You don't understand.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you learned to see this thing in whatever form it becomes?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Yes.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you going to help us find it?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crater
Text: Sorry, I can't.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recommend we use truth serum, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I resist using it, but in this case the professor will give us the truth.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take him.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll accompany you, Doctor.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, yes. Of course.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Captain Kirk to dispensary. Captain Kirk to dispensary.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Context: on biobed
Text: It wasn't McCoy. It was the creature. It hit me. Crater grabbed my phaser. I wondered about McCoy. Doubt had crossed my mind.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain. Professor Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dead. But it had you, too.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, my ancestors spawned in another ocean than yours did. My blood cells are quite different.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Leonard. Leonard, wake up. Please help me. Help me, Leonard. They're trying to kill me. Don't let them kill me!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Easy, easy. Nobodies going to

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: But you must help me!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Move aside, Bones.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's going on here, Jim?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's not Nancy, Bones.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you insane?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It killed four crewmen. Now Crater.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The creature. It kills. It needs salt to live. Bones, move aside.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My guess is she needs more. You want it, Nancy? Come and get it.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're frightening her, Jim.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not fright. Hunger. Look at her.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Leonard, if you love me, make him go away.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on. You want this, Nancy? Come on Nancy. Come and get it. Come and get it. Here it is.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Leonard, help me.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop it, Jim!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy, get out of the way!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you out of your mind?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get out of the way.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: McCoy and Kirk struggle for the phaser while Nancy grabs and eats the salt tablets. McCoy wins and is pushed away, then she transfixes Kirk and reaches for his face

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's killing the Captain. Shoot it, Doctor, quickly!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No! No!

Title: The Man Trap
Context: They struggle for the phaser. Spock gets between Nancy and Kirk.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK:It's killing the captain! Shoot, quick!

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I won't shoot Nancy.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is not Nancy. (hitting her repeatedly) If she were Nancy, could she take this?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop it! Stop it, Spock! Stop it! (Nancy sends Spock flying with one slap)

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is that Nancy, Doctor?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. (she goes to Kirk again) No!

Title: The Man Trap
Context: She transforms into her natural state.Kirk screams, McCoy fires the phaser, she changes back into Nancy

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Leonard. Leonard, no. Leonard, please.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lord, forgive me.

Title: The Man Trap
Context: He fires again and she dies

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Bones.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready to leave orbit, Captain.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Spock
Text: Something wrong, Captain?

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was thinking about the buffalo, Mister Spock. Warp one, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Man Trap
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp one, sir. Leaving orbit.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. Our position, orbiting Psi 2000, an ancient world, now a frozen wasteland, about to rip apart in its death throes. Our mission, pick up a scientific party below, observe the disintegration of the planet.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Check out the life-support systems.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Right, sir. All life systems were off, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Someone strangled this woman.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: TORMOLEN The other four are back there.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Dead?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Right, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineer at his post?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: TORMOLEN He's frozen there like he didn't care.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: The rest?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Well, better look for yourself, Mister Spock. One man was taking a shower fully clothed. (they split up, he takes off his glove to scratch his nose then puts it on the console. Something orange jumps onto his skin. Feeling the cold he puts the glove back on)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Be certain we expose ourselves to nothing. Spock here. Do you read, Enterprise?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk, affirmative.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: All station personnel are dead.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What caused it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. It's like nothing we've dealt with before.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Captain'S Log
Text: Stardate 1704.2. The science party we were to have picked up has been found dead. Life support systems had been turned off. Station personnel, frozen to death. Conditions highly unusual. Meanwhile, we remain in orbit to complete our mission, close scientific measurement of the break-up of this planet.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: You received my signal, Mister Scott.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, sir. Decontaminate.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Spock and Tormolen aboard, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're holding them in the chamber for decontamination.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Better have Medicine look them over too. Tell Mister Spock I'll meet him there in ten minutes. Kirk out.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're fine, Joe. Up and out of there. Mister Spock? Your pulse is two hundred and forty two, your blood pressure is practically nonexistent, assuming you call that green stuff in your veins blood.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: The readings are perfectly normal for me, Doctor, thank you, and as for my anatomy being different from yours, I am delighted. Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How are they?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're fine, Jim.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Terrible, Captain. It was terrible. They were just sitting, like they didn't care. Whatever was happening, they didn't care. I keep wondering

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You keep wondering if man was meant to be out here. You keep wondering, you keep signing on. Any guesses, Mister Spock? Any idea of what happened down there?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wish I could say, Captain. The circumstances were quite bizarre, however our record tapes may show us something.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Six dead. Six people dead.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd better get some rest.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set up those tapes, Mister Spock. We'll see if the answers are there. (leaves with Spock)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The lab status report, Doctor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, thank you, Christine.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Next tape, please.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: Spectro-analysis tape, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Almost as though they were irrational, drugged. An engineer sitting there, apparently oblivious to everything. A woman strangled. A crewman with a phaser pistol in his hand.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: He'd used the computer room as if it were an amusement gallery.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And a fully clothed man frozen to death in a shower. If the image wasn't so ugly, it would be laughable. Not even a theory, gentlemen?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Definitely not drugs or intoxication. The bio-analysis on the tapes prove that conclusively.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could be some form of space madness we've never heard of, but it would have to be caused by something. Our spectro-readings showed no contamination, no unusual elements present.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Or at least none your tricorders could register.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Instruments register only those things they're designed to register. Space still contains infinite unknowns.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth Science needs the closest possible measurement of the breakup of this planet. To do this, we need the Enterprise in a critically tight orbit. Question. Could what happened down there to those people create any unusual danger to this vessel and crew?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We will need top efficiency, Captain. It'll be a tricky orbit. When the planet begins to go, there may be drastic changes in gravity, mass, magnetic field.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The purpose of a briefing, gentlemen, is to get me answers based on your abilities and experience. In a critical orbit, there's no time for surprise.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Unless you people on the Bridge start taking showers with your clothes on, my engines can pull us out of anything. We'll be warping out of orbit within a half second of getting your command.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Scanners report sudden four degree shift in planet magnetic field. A change in mass also, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's beginning. Unusually rapid shifts.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On our way, Lieutenant. I'll hold you to that half second, Scotty.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Foil. It's a rapier. A thin sword.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: All right. So what do you do with it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What do you mean, what do you do with it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Self-defence? Mayhem? Shish kebab?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You practice.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: For what?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hi, Joey.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Last week it was botany he was trying to get me interested in. I was supposed to be collecting leaves, plant specimens.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Your attitude is all wrong. Fencing tones the muscle, sharpens the eye, improves the posture. You tell him, Joey. Explain to him. Hey, Joey. You feeling all right?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Get off me! You don't rank me and you don't have pointed ears, so just get off my neck!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What's with him?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Nothing!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Attention. Engine room on standby alert. All duty personnel to the Bridge. Acknowledge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You sure you're all right now, Joe? We've got to leave.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: We're all a bunch of hypocrites. Sticking our noses into something that we've got no business. What are we doing out here, anyway?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Take it easy, Joe.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: We bring pain and trouble with us, leave men and women stuck out on freezing planets until they die. What are we doing out here in space? Good? What good? We're polluting it, destroying it. We've got no business being out here. No business.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Take it easy, Joe.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Now calm down.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: If a man was supposed to fly, he'd have wings. If he was supposed to be out in space, he wouldn't need air to breathe, wouldn't need life-support systems to keep him from freezing to death.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Hey, Joey, put the knife down, huh?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You're all steamed up, Joe.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: We don't belong here. It's not ours. Not ours. Destroying and watching. We don't belong. I don't belong. Six people died down there. Why do I deserve to live?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What are you doing, Joe?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Hey, Joey, put the knife down. (grabs his arm) Don't be a fool.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Let go!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: You're just getting in a sweat about (three men struggle) Let me have the knife!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Joey, don't be a fool.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Tormolen
Text: Let me go.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Joey, give me the knife. (they fall to the floor, Tormolen gets stabbed in the stomach) Emergency! Rec room, area three nine. We need medics!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, supplemental. Our orbit tightening. Our need for efficiency, critical. But unknown to us, a totally new and unusual disease has been brought aboard.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Relative gravity increasing, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Compensate, Mister Riley.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Magnetic field continuing to shift, sir. Planet continuing to shrink in mass.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: All scanning stations manned, all recorders functioning, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Orbit steady now, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, this planet is condensing more rapidly than expected. A valuable study. We may be seeing Earth's distant future. Before its sun went dark, this planet was remarkably similar to yours.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Helm answering nicely, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Communications status, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tormolen's record?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Psychiatric file, personality quotients.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was he trying to kill himself?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's doubtful he meant to. He was confused, self-tortured.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doesn't sound like the man I know.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: His capacity for self-doubt has always been rather high. What puzzles me is what brought it to the surface with so much force.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: His breathing rate is dropping, Doctor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Compensate with the respirator. Stand by to close. Closing.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Relative gravity increase, sir. Like the planet reached out and yanked at us.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Compensate. (adjusts Riley's controls) Compensate.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Orbit steady now, sir. May be a little nervous, I guess.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This shouldn't be happening. This man should be getting stronger. You sure the respirator's functioning properly?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why is this man dying? Hypo.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: He's dead, Doctor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The wounds were not that severe.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is McCoy. Captain Kirk to Sickbay.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura, monitor communications. Tell McCoy I'll be there when I can.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Planet breakup is imminent, Captain. Shrinking in size at an increasing rate. As the planet continues to shrink in size, its surface moves away from us.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forcing us to spiral down to maintain the same distance from it.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. We must be prepared to respond instantly to any sudden change.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engine room from Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tie into the helm, Scotty. If we should call for power, we'll want it fast.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: No problem, sir. You'll have it.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rate of compaction seems constant.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I'll go see what the good doctor wants. Keep me informed of any change, Mister Spock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Don't know if it's this planet or what happened with Joe. I'm sweating like a bridegroom.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Yeah, me too.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hey, why don't you come down to the gym with me, Kevin m'lad?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Now?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Why not? Light workout will take the edge off.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Sulu, what about. Hey, Sulu, don't be a fool!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Intestinal damage wasn't that severe. I got to him in plenty of time. That man should still be alive. The only reason he died, Jim, is he didn't want to live. He gave up.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a supposition, Doctor, not a fact.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that may be. Maybe. I've lost patients before, but not like that. Not Joe's kind. That kind of man doesn't give up.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Coincidence? Maybe.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean that Joe was down on the planet surface and you're gonna ask me if it's connected.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's exactly what I was going to ask.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, he was decontaminated. He's been medically checked. We've run every test we know for everything we know.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not good enough.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, we're doing everything that's possible.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I want the impossible checked out too.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why isn't Mister Sulu at this station?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Magnetic pull compensated for, sir. Orbit steady.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Take over here, Rand. (a male, not Janice)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: You haven't answered my question. Where is Mister Sulu?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Have no fear, O'Riley's here. One Irishman is worth ten thousand of you

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're relieved, Mister Riley. Lieutenant Uhura, take over this station.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Now that's what I like. Let the women work too. Universal suffrage.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Report to Sickbay, Mister Riley.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Sickbay? Exactly where I was heading, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Security. Mister Riley is headed for Sickbay. See to it he arrives. Captain Kirk to the Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Where's Joe?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Well.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: He died, didn't he.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: You know something? You have such lovely eyes, pretty lady. (touches her face)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I know he was a friend of yours. This must be a terrible shock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: You know what Joe's mistake was? He wasn't born an Irishman.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Context: brandishing foil
Text: Richelieu, beware! Stand. No farther. No escape for you. You either leave this bois bloodied, or with my blood on your swords. Cowards!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Brent, relieve Miss Uhura.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Brent
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What were their symptoms?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nonviolent at this stage. Slightly disoriented. Riley seemed rather pleased with himself, as if he were

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Irrational, or drugged.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Both Sulu and Riley, locate and confine. I want every crewman who comes in contact with them medically checked.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, level two, corridor three reports a disturbance. Mister Sulu chasing crewmen with a sword.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put Security on it.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. A pattern is developing. First, Tormolen. Hidden personality traits being forced to the surface. Then Riley, who fancies himself a descendant of Irish kings, and now Sulu, who is at heart a swashbuckler out of your 18th century.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Present condition of Psi 2000.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gravity pull increasing. We've shifted to two percent and should stabilise our position.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsman, stabilise position.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Leslie
Text: Helm is not answering to control.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp us out of here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Leslie
Text: No response from engines, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Impulse power then. Blast us out of this orbit.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Leslie
Text: Impulse engines also dead, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engine room, we need power!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, acknowledge. Our controls are dead. Take her.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Richelieu, at last.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, put that (discovers that the point is sharp) put that thing away.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: For honour, Queen, and France! (lunges)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sulu.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ah.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sulu, give me that.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I'll protect you, fair maiden.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sorry, neither.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Foul Richelieu. (distracted by Uhura's escape, Kirk is able to grab Sulu and Spock does a neck-pinch)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like you to teach me that sometime.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Take D'Artagnon here to Sickbay.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we need power. Engine room, acknowledge!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: You rang, sir?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who's this?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: This is Captain Kevin Thomas Riley of the starship Enterprise.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: And who is this?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. Get out of the engine room, navigator. Where's Mister Scott?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: I've relieved Mister Scott of his duties. Now, attention, cooks. This is your captain speaking. I would like double portions of ice cream for the entire crew.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Clear that tube, will you?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: And now, your captain will render an ancient Irish favourite. (sings) I'll take you home again Kathleen

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. At our present rate of descent, we have less than twenty minutes before we enter planet atmosphere.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And burn up. I know, Mister Spock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Wild and wide to where your heart

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1704.4. Ship out of control, spiraling down towards planet Psi 2000. We have nineteen minutes of life left without engine power or helm control.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did Riley get in there?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: He ran in, said you wanted us on the Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's cut off both helm and power.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: And he shut the door behind us and locked off the mechanism.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't you get to the auxiliary?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't. He's hooked everything through the main panel in there. Get up to my office and pull the plans for this bulkhead. The only way to get that door open is to cut through these wall circuits here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Context: singing
Text: The roses all have left your cheeks. I've watched them fade away and die

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Status reports, all sections.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, a fight in the aft wardroom. Security reports incidents among the crewmen are increasing.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Go to Alert Baker two. Seal off main sections.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks, alert system B two. Repeat, go to alert condition Baker two. Seal off all main sections. Stand by.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're going to seal off, Captain, if we can minimise the spread of whatever this is.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue the alert, Lieutenant.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I can't, sir. He's cut off the alert channels.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Lieutenant Uhura,

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: You've interrupted my song. I'm sorry, but there'll be no ice cream for you tonight.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cut him off.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I can't, sir. There's no way to do it.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Attention, crew. This is Captain Riley. There will be a formal dance in the bowling alley at nineteen hundred hours tonight.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: No way, Captain. He controls the main power panels. He can override any channel from down there. Seventeen minutes left, sir. (ship is jolted severely)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you tie me in to the Sickbay?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm getting you, Jim. Look, can you keep this beast level? I've got Sulu tranquillized and we're running tests on him.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So far there's nothing unusual in his bloodstream. Body functions seem normal.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Riley's the immediate problem, Doctor. Is there any way, anything you can do to snap him out of it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Negative, until I can get a little farther on these tests.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: This is Captain Riley. Crew, I have some additional orders.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: In the future, all female crew members will wear their hair loosely, about their shoulders.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: And use restraint in putting on your makeup. Women, women should not look made up. And now, crew, I will render Kathleen one more time!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Please, not again.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Context: singing) I'll take you home again, Kathleen (meanwhile, Scott is working in a Jefferies tube
Text: I've watched them fade away and die.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've set the jumpers up there. Stand by 'til I give you a signal.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: And tears bedim your loving eyes. Oh,

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: I will take you home Kathleen.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering to Bridge. Try your helm. You'll have enough power to keep her stabilised. Here, let's have a look at that.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sixteen minutes left, Captain. We've stabilised, but still spiraling down.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Emergency signal, Captain. Both decks four and five. Fights and disorders.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get me Sickbay.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I have no intercom for Sickbay. He keeps switching channels on me.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: See what you can do to help Doctor McCoy. Better check Scotty first. Move him faster. He's got to get through that bulkhead.

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Moody
Context: singing
Text: I'll take you home again Janice

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Spock
Text: What's going on?

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Rand
Text: Mister Spock, I'm trying to get to the Bridge and this crewman won't let me by.

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Spock
Text: Crewman, stand aside.

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Moody
Text: Oh, yes, sir. I'll take you home again, Janice

Title: The Naked Time
Location: corridor] spock: crewman, report to the lab
Speaker: Rand
Text: Spock!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Message from the captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Tell him I'm doing my best. If I cut through the wrong circuits

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have fourteen minutes left.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Even if we were under a full-scale attack I couldn't move any faster, not and maintain a safety factor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: At the rate you're proceeding, calculations show that you'll take a minute and a half more than we have left. You can't afford a safety factor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Biopsy lab. Biopsy, where's my report? Biopsy, come in! Harrison, where's my report? I'm going to the lab.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Sir?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The tranquillizer's wearing off.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, good. I'll need him conscious now. Continue to examine him on circuits K one and three.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Of course, Doctor.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get him out of here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: I would have gotten here sooner, sir but Crewman Moody stopped me in the hallway.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take the helm.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: Sir?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take the helm!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Kathleen. And now, crew, one more time!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At least try cutting him off!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, if I could cut him off, don't you think I

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: I'll take you home again Kathleen

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. I'll keep trying.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sorry.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: Across the ocean wild and wide

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engine room.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got twelve minutes left. It'll take at least two or three of them to get the engines up to power now.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then we'll make it, sir, if all goes right.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Call me when you've cut through. I want to be there. Kirk out.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nurse? Where is Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: He's gone to the lab.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lab. Lab, respond please. Spock here. Lab!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is it, Nurse?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock, (takes his hand) the men from Vulcan treat their women strangely. At least, people say that, but you're part human too. I know you don't, you couldn't, hurt me, would you? I'm in love with you, Mister Spock. You, the human Mister Spock, the Vulcan Mister Spock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nurse, you should

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Christine, please. I see things, how honest you are. I know how you feel. You hide it, but you do have feeling. Oh, how we must hurt you, torture you.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm in control of my emotions.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The others believe that. I don't. I love you. I don't know why, but I love you. I do love you just as you are. Oh, I love you.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sorry.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain is en route to Engineering, Mister Spock. Can you take the bridge? Acknowledge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am sorry.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Christine.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Christine.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Sickbay. Is Mister Spock there?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, would you please acknowledge? (Spock is struggling to keep his control)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: I will take you home Kathleen

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Almost ready, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: To where your heart will feel no pain. When the fields are fresh and green. I'll take you to your home

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: - Ready, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Security
Text: Follow me through. Put your phasers on stun. Don't fire unless he's armed. Go.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Riley
Text: I'll take. No dance tonight.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get him out of here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Context: close to tears
Text: I'm in control of my emotions. Control of my emotions. I am an officer. An officer. My duty. My duty is, is. My duty is to, to. Too late. I'm sorry. To. Two, four, six. Six. Six times six.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we haven't got much time left.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Entering planet's outer atmosphere, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: He's turned the engines off. Completely cold. It will take thirty minutes to regenerate them.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Ship's outer skin is beginning to heat, Captain. Orbit plot shows we have about eight minutes left.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't change the laws of physics. I've got to have thirty minutes.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, supplemental. The Enterprise, spiraling down out of control. Ship's outer skin heating rapidly due to friction with planet atmosphere.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Maybe twenty two, twenty three minutes.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we've got six.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, you can't mix matter and antimatter cold. We'd go up in the biggest explosion since

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can balance our engines into a controlled implosion.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's only a theory. It's never been done.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge, have you found Mister Spock yet?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: If you wanted to chance odds of ten thousand to one, maybe, assuming we had a row of computers working weeks on the right formula.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock is not on the Bridge, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Context: waking up screaming
Text: I was on the Bridge. Hey Doc, what am I doing here?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Bio. We've isolated it. Start preparing serum.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Harrison
Text: What, Doctor?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's water. Somehow on this planet, water's changed to a complex chain of molecules.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Harrison
Text: What's that, Doctor?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's how we missed it. It passed from man to man through perspiration. Once in the bloodstream, it acts like alcohol, depresses the centres of judgment, self-control. Now get someone to the lab. Tell them the serum works, and start preparing more.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Doc, will you let me out of here? I'm all right.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Release him.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineers, man your stations. Engine rooms, report. Cycling station, report. This will be an emergency restart of engines.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where have you been? What happened?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: My mother. I could never tell her I loved her.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got four minutes, maybe five.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: An Earth woman, living on a planet where love, emotion, is bad taste.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to risk a full-power start. The engines were shut off. No time to regenerate them. Do you hear me? We've got to risk a full-power start!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: I respected my father, our customs. I was ashamed of my Earth blood. (Kirk slaps him) Jim, when I feel friendship for you, I'm ashamed.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Context: hitting him repeatedly
Text: You've got to hear me! We need a formula. We've got to risk implosion!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: t's never been done! Understand, Jim. I've spent a whole lifetime learning to hide my feelings. (finally hits Kirk back)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to risk implosion. It's our only chance.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's never been done.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't tell me that again, Science Officer! It's a theory. It's possible. We may go up into the biggest ball of fire since the last sun in these parts exploded, but we've got to take that one in ten thousand chance!

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain. Engineer asked, did you find

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I found Mister Spock! I'm talking to Mister Spock, do you understand?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. Three and a half minutes left, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got it, the disease. Love. You're better off without it, and I'm better off without mine. This vessel, I give, she takes. She won't permit me my life. I've got to live hers.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have a beautiful yeoman. Have you noticed her, Mister Spock? You're allowed to notice her. The Captain's not permitted

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, there is an intermix formula.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now I know why it's called she.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's never been tested. It's a theoretical relationship between time and antimatter.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Flesh woman to touch, to hold. A beach to walk on. A few days, no braid on my shoulder.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, help.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stand by to intermix. I'll call the formulae in from the Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Entering upper stratosphere, Captain. Skin temperature now twenty one hundred seventy degrees.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got to hang on. Tell them. Clear the corridors, the turbo lift. Hurry. (Scott and Spock leave) Never lose you. Never.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: The Naked Time
Context: McCoy gives Kirk a hypo as he leaves the turbolift

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engine room. We're set. Hyperbolic course.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Brent
Text: Direction, sir?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Direction. Direction. It doesn't matter. The way we came.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course laid in, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fuel temperature.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Scott
Text: Level.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Context: gazing at Janice
Text: No beach to walk on.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Rand
Text: Sir?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Raise antimatter eight and forty degrees.

Title: The Naked Time

Text: That'll take four minutes.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We haven't the time. We'll have to risk it. Bridge, we're ready.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you all right, Jim?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you? (Spock nods)

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We found a cure. We're over that part of it.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, we were successful. The engines imploded.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, my velocity gauge is off the scale.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engine power went off the scale as well. We're now travelling faster than is possible for normal space.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Checked elapsed time, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: My chronometer's running backwards, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time warp. We're going backward in time. Helm, begin reversing power. Slowly.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Helm answering, sir. Power reversing.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're back to normal time, Captain.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engines ahead. Warp one.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp one, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The time warp. What did it do to us?

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've regressed in time seventy one hours. It is now three days ago, Captain. We have three days to live over again.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not those last three days.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Spock
Text: This does open some intriguing prospects, Captain. Since the formula worked, we can go back in time, to any planet, any era.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We may risk it someday, Mister Spock. Resume course to our next destination, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course laid in, sir.

Title: The Naked Time
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Steady as she goes.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1533.6. Now manoeuvring to come alongside cargo vessel Antares. Its Captain and First officer are beaming over to us with an unusual passenger.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Chief, begin materialisation. Captain Ramart, I'm Captain Kirk.

Speaker: Ramart

Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you do?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Nellis
Text: How do you do?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Evans. We've heard a great deal about you. Welcome aboard.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart

Speaker: Nellis

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie

Speaker: Ramart

Speaker: Kirk

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Hundreds. All human, like me. That's exciting. Is that the right word?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Nellis
Text: That's perfect. It's the exact word.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart
Text: You see. We'd like to keep Charlie with us, but with his closest living relatives on Colony Five and your vessel going that way, why

Speaker: Charlie
Text: I'd like to see your ship now. All of it. The people and everything.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You keep interrupting, Mister Evans. That's considered wrong.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I'm sorry.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have a large supply of entertainment tapes, gentlemen.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart
Text: No, we've a tight schedule to make, Captain. Just twenty of us, we're making out fine.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This must be a space first. A transport ship that doesn't need anything?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart
Text: Nothing.

Speaker: Kirk

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Ramart

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. (the pair are beamed off)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman Rand, this is Charles Evans. Show him to his quarters and drop his records off at Doctor McCoy's office, if you will.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Are you a girl? Is that a girl?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a girl.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, star date 1533.7. We have taken aboard an unusual passenger for transport to Colony Alpha Five. Charles Evans, the sole survivor of a transport crash fourteen years ago. The child, alone from age three, has not only survived, but has grown to intelligent, healthy adolescence.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tell me. The ship's supply of food concentrates couldn't have lasted fourteen years.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: After that I found other things to eat, just growing around.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And you learned to talk by just listening to the ship's tapes?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: The memory banks still worked. They talked to me, and I talked back.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're four-oh.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Four?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Four-oh. One hundred percent. Sound of wind and limb.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: That, that Captain. Kirk?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: Why does he call me Mister Evans?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy

Speaker: Charlie
Text: He's not, well, he isn't like Captain Ramart.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, no. Captain Kirk is one of a kind, Charlie.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: Do you like me?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why not?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Some, the other ship, they didn't like me. I tried. I'm trying to make people like me. I want them to like me.

Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Most seventeen year olds do. Come on, let's go. I'll show you to your quarters.

Text: I brought you a present.

Context: A bottle of perfume.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Do you like that kind?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, I, it's my favourite. Where did you get it? They don't have any in the ship's stores.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: It's a present.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: I know, but where did? Gee, I'm late, Charlie. I really have to go.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Can't you stay and talk a little while?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: Look, I'm off duty at fourteen hundred. Why don't you join me in recreation room six, deck three.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: You got a deal, friend. (slaps her bottom)

Speaker: Rand
Text: Charlie!

Speaker: Charlie
Text: I thought. Don't be angry. I didn't, I wanted.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't be angry.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: I will.

Text: Okay.

Text: But tell me, what reason would he have to lie if there are Thasians?

Text: Good. Doctor McCoy, Mister Spock is working out

Text: Excuse me, Captain. Status report.

Text: Thank you. He's working out a training programme for Charlie Evans. Earth history, his own background, that sort of thing. I'd like you to give him the necessary medical orientation on the problems of, um, er, adolescence.

Text: Well, don't you think it'd be better for a strong father image like you? He already looks up to you.

We know not what he'll do.

Text: Now from a planet out in space, there comes a lad, not commonplace. A-seeking out his first embrace. He's saving it for you. Oh, Charlie's our new darling, our darling, our darling. Charlie's our new darling. We know not what he'll do.

Speaker: Kirk
Text: Me. I see. Well, um, er, there are things you can do with a lady, er, Charlie, that you er. There's no right way to hit a woman. I mean, man to man is one thing, but, er, man and woman, er, it's, er, it's, er. Well it's, er, another thing. Do you understand?

Text: Captain's Log, star date 1535.8. UESPA headquarters notified of the mysterious loss of science probe vessel Antares.

Context: Kirk and Spock are playing 3D chess

Speaker: Spock
Text: Your mind is not on the game, Captain. Check. The Antares?

Title: Charlie X

Speaker: Spock

Speaker: Kirk

Speaker: Spock
Text: And again, check.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Checkmate.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I prefer to call it inspired.

Speaker: Spock
Text: As you wish. At any rate, the game is yours.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: Oh, I, I watched them play on the Antares. Can I try?

Speaker: Kirk
Text: I place you in the hands of our chess master.

Text: The principles of three-dimensional chess are basically mathematic, Charlie. You put the white here and the black on the secondary level.

Text: Very well. (just three moves later) That was a mistake, Charlie.

Text: Checkmate.

Speaker: Rand
Text: Charlie, Tina's

Text: But she's not as. She doesn't. She's not the same. Not like you. She's, she's just a girl. You're, you smell like a girl. All the other girls on the ship they, they look just like Tina. You're the only one who looks like you. You can understand, can't you? You know about being with somebody? Wanting to be? If I had the whole universe I'd give it to you. When I see you, I feel like I'm hungry all over. Hungry. Do you know how that feels?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Er, no. No, no. Sit down. Charlie, being seventeen is more than how many years you've lived. It's a whole other thing. Doctor McCoy could probably explain the biological conditions. Well, let's, let's use a specific. Yeoman Rand is a woman.

Text: Oh, I won't hit her like that anymore.

Text: No, there's more to it than that.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: Everything I do or say is wrong. I'm in the way, I don't know the rules, and when I learn something and try to do it, suddenly I'm wrong!

Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now wait, wait.

Speaker: Charlie
Text: I don't know what I am or what I'm supposed to be, or even who. I don't know why I hurt so much inside all the time.

Text: You'll live, believe me. There's nothing wrong with you that hasn't gone wrong with every other human male since the model first came up.

Text: You go slow. You be gentle. I mean, it's not a one-way street, you know, how you feel and that's all. It's how the girl feels, too. Don't press, Charlie. If the girl feels anything for you at all, you'll know it. Do you understand?

Text: You don't think Janice. You. She could love me!

Speaker: Charlie
Text: She can.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: She is.

Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Text: Charlie, there are a million things in this universe you can have and there are a million things you can't have. It's no fun facing that, but that's the way things are.
