Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got to slap the floor to absorb the energy when you fall. Go ahead, try it. Like everything else, it takes practice, Charlie. Try again. Good. That's much better. Here, now I'll show you a shoulder roll. Try that.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I don't want to do that.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it makes it hard to teach you

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I don't want to do that.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Charlie. Lesson's over for today.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: You were going to teach me how to fight.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have to learn to protect yourself in a fall before I do that. It's more than teaching you to defend yourself. Charlie, I want you to learn. Charlie? Hey, Sam, let me borrow you for a couple easy throws, all right?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Sam
Text: Right.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Watch this, Charlie. That wasn't so bad, was it? Now I'll throw him. Here we go, Sam.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: That looks hard.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Charlie. Try it. Attaboy. Let's go.

Title: Charlie X
Context: Charlie can't make Kirk lose his balance. He gets dumped instead.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Oh!

Title: Charlie X
Context: Sam laughs.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That wasn't so bad, was it?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't laugh at me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cool off.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't laugh at me!

Title: Charlie X
Context: Sam disappears.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: He shouldn't have done that. It's not nice to laugh at people.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to him, Charlie?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: He's gone.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's no answer.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: He's gone! I didn't mean to do that. He made me do it! He laughed at me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Bridge.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Two men from security, on the double.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: What are you going to do to me?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm confining you to quarters. I want you to stay there.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I won't let them hurt me. I'll make them go away, too.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They won't hurt you, Charlie. (security arrive) They'll take you to your quarters, Charlie. Go with them.

Title: Charlie X
Context: Charlie knocks them down, one draws his phaser

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: No! (phaser disappears)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to your quarters.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: He was going to hurt me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to your quarters or I'll pick you up and carry you there.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I won't let you.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's your choice, Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I won't let them hurt me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They won't hurt you.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security reports that all phaser weapons have disappeared. Shall I repeat, Captain?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I heard you. Have Doctor McCoy and Mister Spock meet me in the Briefing room.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thasians have been referred to in our records as having the power to transmute objects or render substances invisible. It has generally been regarded as legend, but Charlie does seems to possess this same power.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are chances that Charlie's not an Earthling, that he's a Thasian?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I don't think so, not unless they're exactly like Earthlings. The development of his fingers and toes exactly matches the present development of mans on Earth.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, whatever he is, we have some idea of the power he has. I know what I saw him do in the gymnasium.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Considering the effect a normal adolescent has on a home, Charlie with the power he has

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Short-tempered, because he doesn't understand. He needs, he wants. Nothing happens fast enough.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: The probability is he's responsible for the destruction of the Antares, which would indicate a total disregard for human life.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He doesn't understand what life is. He's a boy.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, what do we do with this boy, Jim? How do we keep him caged up?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It goes even further than that, Doctor. We can't take him with us to Earth Colony Five. Can you imagine what he'd do in an open, normal environment. I've talked with him, listened. He's a boy in a man's body, trying to be an adult with the adolescence in him getting in the way.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: And with a weapon in him which could destroy you or anyone, anywhere on this ship.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, for the moment he's stopped. You're an authority he respects, Jim.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed. The struggle must remain between you and him. Should any of us interfere

Title: Charlie X
Context: Charlie enters under guard

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: You wanted to ask me something, he said.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you responsible for what happened to the Antares, Charlie?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Why?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Answer me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Yes. There was a warped baffle-plate on the shield of their energy pile. I made it go away. It would've blown up anyway. Well they weren't nice to me! They wanted to get rid of me. They don't now.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about us, Charlie?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I don't know.

Title: Charlie X
Context: Charlie leaves

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're in the hands of an adolescent.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, raise Colony Five. I want to speak directly to the governor.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Navigator, lay a course away from Colony Five. Buy me some time.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Navigator
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Charlie X
Context: Uhura's console short-circuits and she is thrown to the floor

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, get the doctor up here on the double. How bad is it?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I think it's all right, sir. Sir, there's no reason for that panel to cross-circuit like that. I checked it over myself not fifteen minutes ago.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Navigator
Text: Captain! I can't feed any course co-ordinates into the panel, sir. It rejects the course change.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Pilot
Text: Helm doesn't respond either, sir. (Charlie enters)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you getting any readings on your instruments?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir. There's a Tyger, tyger, burning bright in the forest of the night.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm trying to Saturn rings around my head, down a road that's Martian red.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: You're trying to change course, Captain. You can't do that. I want to get to Colony Five as soon as we can.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Release the transmitter.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: You don't need all that subspace chatter.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's going on here? Spock calls me to the Bridge and goes into some kind of poetry.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: See to her, Doctor.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Once upon a midnight dreary while I pondered, weak and weary.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Very nice, Mister Ears. Oh, I can make him do anything, whirl around, laugh, anything.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's enough, Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't you think he's funny? I think he's funny.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Leave my crew alone. (Charlie leaves)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, he'll soon reach a point where he won't back down.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Tina
Text: Charlie, what's wrong? (he turns her into an iguana)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I have something for you. (a rose) Pink is your favourite, isn't it?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: You don't walk into a room without knocking.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't ever lock your door on me again, Janice. I love you.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: I'll lock it when I please. What is it you want, anyway?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: You. I only want to be nice to you. I can give you anything. Just, just tell me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Context: switching on comm.
Text: I want you to get out.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: But I only want to be nice to you.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: Get out, Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: I can't make it any plainer than that.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I love you.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: You don't know what the word means.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Then show me.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: No!

Title: Charlie X
Context: Kirk and Spock rush in, Charlie knocks them down.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: Charlie!

Title: Charlie X
Context: She slaps him, so he makes her disappear.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Why did she do that? I loved her, but she wasn't nice at all. What you did wasn't nice either, but I still need you, Captain. The Enterprise isn't quite like the Antares. Running the Antares was easy. You have to be nice. All right? (gives pain)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: My legs. They're broken.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let him go, too, Charlie.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Why?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because I'm telling you to. Because you need me to run the ship, and I need him.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: If you try to hurt me again, I'll make a lot of people go away.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what about Yeoman Janice? Is she dead? Gone? Destroyed?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I won't tell you. Growing up isn't so much. I'm not a man, and I can do anything! You can't.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll activate the force field myself. You can return to your section.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: He had a mean look. I had to freeze him. I like happy looks. (enters room) Aren't you coming in?

Title: Charlie X
Context: A forcefield activates in the doorway so Charlie makes the wall go away and freezes Kirk and Spock.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: That wasn't nice. You'll be sorry. You wait, you'll see, you'll be sorry you did that. (unfreezes them) You will.

Title: Charlie X
Context: He turns a young woman into an old one. Some crew are laughing in a room.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: No. No laughing!

Title: Charlie X
Context: The shadows freeze, then a woman with no face feels her way around the corner

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, my instruments show we're receiving a message on subspace frequency three, ship-to-ship. I can't hear it, sir.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you creating that message, Charlie, or you're blocking one that's coming in.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: It's my game, Captain. You have to find out. Like you said, that's how the game's played. You can have it now. I've locked on course for Colony Five again. (leaves)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've waited long enough. I'm going to take him on.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't have any special immunity. Not anymore. Pushed far enough, he'd send you off to oblivion, too.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Out of the question.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wait a minute. Does Charlie? Now, wait, Spock, has he done away with anybody since he took over?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not so far as we know.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe he can't. Could be he's overreached himself. It's a big ship. He's taken full control. If we could tax his power, turn on every device on the ship, every circuit, every light, all of it, and while he's fighting that, if I could distract him, maybe you could tranquilize him, keep him under until we reach Colony Five.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Risky, Jim.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we don't try, Doctor, he'll get rid of us anyway. There's no choice, gentlemen, none at all.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I can make you all go away anytime I want to.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get out of my chair, Charlie, and get out of it now.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I've got your ship, Captain.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe, Charlie, but I don't think you can handle any more. I think you've reached your limit and can't take on one more thing, but you're going to have to.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I could've sent you away before, but I didn't.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're going to have to take me on.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't make me do it now.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got my ship, and I want it back. I want my crew back, whole, if I have to break your neck to do it! (throws him out of command chair)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Don't push me. (gives Kirk pain) Sorry. I'm sorry but. Stop it. I said stop it!

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the navigation console is clear now. The ship is answering the helm.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, something off our starboard bow. The message says they're from Thasus.

Title: Charlie X
Context: Rand reappears

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Oh.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain, how did I?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right, Yeoman.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors show there something's there, Captain. Deflectors indicate no solid substance.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: No! Oh, no, please, don't let them take me. I can't live with them anymore. You're my friends. You said you were my friends, remember? When I came aboard! Please, I want to go home. Take me home.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Thasian
Text: I have taken my form from centuries ago, so that I may communicate with you. We did not realise until too late that the boy had gone, and we are saddened that his escape cost the lives of the first ship. We could not help them, but we have returned your people and your ship to you. Everything is as it was.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: I won't do it again. Please, I'll be good. I won't ever do it again. I'm sorry about the Antares. I'm sorry! When I came aboard! Please, I want to go with you. Help me!

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The boy belongs with his own kind.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Thasian
Text: That would be impossible.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With training, we can teach him to live in our society. If he can be taught not to use his power

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Thasian
Text: We gave him the power so he could live. He will use it, always, and he would destroy you and your kind, or you would be forced to destroy him to save yourselves.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there nothing you can do?

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Thasian
Text: We offer him life, and we will take care of him. Come, Charles.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Charlie
Text: Oh, please, don't let them take me. I can't even touch them! Janice, they can't feel. Not like you! They don't love! Please, I want to stay. (fades away)

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Charlie's back on board the Thasian ship, sir. They signal they're leaving.

Title: Charlie X
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right, Yeoman. It's all over now.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Scott
Text: The ceremony will be carried on all viewing screens, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There was a call for you from the Bridge.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Still no answer from Earth Outpost number two, Captain, and now number three's gone silent.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain course to outpost four. Keep me informed. Kirk out.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: At the door, a young lady in gold uniform and a pretty head-dress takes Scott's arm and is escorted into the room, to the strains of 'Here Comes The Bride'. Kirk goes to the rostrum.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Since the days of the first wooden vessels, all shipmasters have had one happy privilege. That of uniting two people in the bonds of matrimony. We are gathered here today with you, Angela Martine, and you, Robert Tomlinson, in the sight of your fellows, in accordance with our laws and our many beliefs so that you may pledge your

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Alert! Alert! All decks alert! Alert! Alert! Captain to the Bridge. All decks alert.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Earth Outpost four reports they're under attack. A space vessel, identity unknown.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full ahead. All decks, condition red.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All decks, condition red. All decks, condition red.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 1709.2. Patrolling outposts guarding the neutral zone between planets Romulus and Remus and the rest of the galaxy, received emergency call from outpost 4. The U.S.S. Enterprise is moving to investigate and assist.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Outpost 4 reported under attack, sir. Then message terminates.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Verified, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Our speed is now maximum, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Position, eight minutes from Outpost four at this velocity, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've talked to my engine room, sir. We'll get more speed out of her.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did Outpost 4 give anything at all on the attacking vessel, Lieutenant?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No identification, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: There can't be much doubt who's attacking, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, put this star sector on our screen. Now show our position. Signal this to all decks, Lieutenant.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks standing by, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain speaking. In our next action, we can risk neither miscalculation nor error

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By any man aboard. Listen carefully. Science Officer.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Referring to the map on your screens, you will note beyond the moving position of our vessel, a line of Earth outpost stations. Constructed on asteroids, they monitor the Neutral Zone established by treaty after the Earth-Romulan conflict a century ago.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: As you may recall from your histories, this conflict was fought,

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: By our standards today, with primitive atomic weapons and in primitive space vessels

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which allowed no quarter, no captives. Nor was there even ship-to-ship visual communication. Therefore, no human, Romulan, or ally has ever seen the other. Earth believes the Romulans to be warlike, cruel, treacherous, and only the Romulans know what they think of Earth. The treaty, set by sub-space radio, established this Neutral Zone, entry into which by either side, would constitute an act of war. The treaty has been unbroken since that time. Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What you do not know and must be told is that my command orders on this subject are precise and inviolable. No act, no provocation

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will be considered sufficient reason to violate the zone. We may defend ourselves,

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But if necessary to avoid interspace war,

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Both these outposts and this vessel will be considered expendable. Captain out.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: We know Outpost four has been attacked, sir, so if we intercept Romulans now

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: After a whole century, what will a Romulan ship look like, Mister Stiles? I doubt they'll radio and identify themselves.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: You'll know, sir. They're painted like a giant bird-of-prey.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had no idea that history was your specialty.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Family history. There was a Captain Stiles was in the space service then. Two Commanders and several junior officers. All lost in that war, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Their war, Mister Stiles. Not yours. Don't forget it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Outpost two coming into sensor range, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Outpost 2 was the first to go silent, Lieutenant?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain, then Outpost three an hour later.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sweeping the area of Outpost two. Sensor reading indefinite. Double-checking Outpost three. I read dust and debris. Both Earth outposts gone, and the asteroids they were constructed on, pulverised.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open a channel to our nearest command base. Quarter hour reports on our position and status.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Call battle stations, Mister Sulu.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Battle stations. All hands to battle stations. Battle stations. Battle stations. All decks acknowledge. All decks acknowledge, sir. All stations show green.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise main phasers, Mister Styles. All weapons to full power.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: All weapons to full power. Phaser control room.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Energise. Acknowledge.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Angela
Context: the bride
Text: Phaser control acknowledging. All weapons energising to full.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Robert
Context: the groom
Text: Happy wedding day, almost.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Angela
Text: You won't get off my hook this easily. I'm going to marry you, Mister, battle or phaser weapons notwithstanding.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Robert
Text: Well, meanwhile, temporarily at least, I am still your superior officer. So get with it, Mister.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Tec 1
Text: Port weapons show ready.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Tec 2
Text: Starboard and midship weapons show ready.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Angela
Text: Acknowledge. All weapons batteries ready.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Outpost four now five minutes away, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: And showing on my sensors, Captain. At least it's still there.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, regaining contact with Outpost four. Switching to speakers.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Outpost four. Do you read me, Enterprise? This is Commander Hansen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. We're minutes away, Hansen. What's your status?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Outposts two, three, and eight are gone. Unknown weapon. Completely destroyed, even though we were alerted. Had our deflector shield on maximum. Hit by enormous power. First attack blew our deflector shield. If they hit us again with our deflector shield gone. Do you read me, Enterprise?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Confirm what hit you, Hansen. What vessel? Identity?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Space vessel, only glimpse of.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you locate the intruder for us?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Negative. It seems to have disappeared somehow. I have you on my screen now. Switching to visual.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tie us in.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Tied in, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The viewscreen shows a man in a wrecked room, surrounded by fires

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Enterprise, can you see it? My command post here. We're a mile deep on an asteroid. Almost solid iron. And even through our deflectors, it did this. Can you see?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Affirmative. You're visual, Hansen. What do you have on the intruder?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: No identification. No answer to our challenge. Only a glimpse of it. Then they fired something at us, some form of high-energy plasma. Fantastic power. And then the whole vessel disappeared. But it's out there somewhere. Our sensors show that much. Enterprise, something coming on our viewing screen, coming at us fast.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock us onto your screen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Switching. Can you see it, Enterprise? Can you see it? It's becoming visible in the centre of my screen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: A ship appears from nowhere on the screen

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have phaser capacity? We're still out of range.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Negative. Phasers gone. Weapons crew dead.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make a challenge. Warn that ship off.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Trying to, sir. They don't acknowledge.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The alien ship fires a big red plasma ball, and the viewscreen switches to Hansen as the outpost is hit, then just bright light. Back to the attacking ship, which then vanishes.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Outpost four disintegrated, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Position of the intruder, Mister Spock.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Disappeared. Interesting how they became visible for just a moment.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When they opened fire. Perhaps necessary when they use their weapon. SPOCK: I have a blip on the motion sensor. Could be the intruder.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to full magnification.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Screen is on full mag, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't see anything. I can't understand it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Invisibility is theoretically possible, Captain, with selective bending of light. But the power cost is enormous.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: They may have solved that problem.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Continuing to challenge, sir. Still no response.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Discontinue. Contact remaining outposts. Have them signal us any sightings or sensor readings in their area.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Blip has changed its heading. And in a very leisurely manoeuvre. They may not be aware of us.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Their invisibility screen may work both ways. With that kind of power consumption, they may not be able to see us.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: His heading is now one eleven mark fourteen. The exact heading a Romulan would take, Jim, for the Neutral Zone and home.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Parallel course.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Don't you mean interception course, sir?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative. You and Mister Sulu will match its course and speed with the object on our sensors exactly, move for move. If he has sensors, I want him to think we're a reflection, an echo. Under no circumstances are you to cross into the Neutral Zone without my direct orders.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Acknowledged, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel battle stations. All decks, standby alert.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Cancel battle stations.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Captain, may I respectfully remind the Captain what has happened? The Romulans have crossed the Neutral Zone, attacked our outposts, killed our men.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Stiles.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Add to that the fact it was a sneak attack.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Stiles, are you questioning my orders?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Negative, sir. I'm pointing our that we could have Romulan spies aboard this ship.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I agree, sir. Respectfully recommend all decks maintain security alert.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. All decks, security alert.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Security alert, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Picking up communication. It's from their ship.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pipe it in.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sounds like code, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a fix on it, Captain. I believe I can lock on it, get a picture of their Bridge.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on the screen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Up shimmers an image of a group of four humanoids around a console. One leaves his post and salutes the figure with his back to us. That figure then turns, and we see someone who looks just like - a Vulcan. Both Spock's eyebrows hit the ceiling. There's a long silence and a lot of stares.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Decoding?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Cryptography is working on it, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Give it to Spock.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't quite get that, Mister Stiles.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Nothing, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: I was suggesting that Mister Spock could probably translate it for you, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I assume you're complimenting Mister Spock on his ability to decode.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: I'm not sure, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, here's one thing you can be sure of, Mister. Leave any bigotry in your quarters. There's no room for it on the Bridge. Do I make myself clear?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: You do, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transmission has been cut off. (to Spock) I made a tape of it, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Runs the tape through his computer

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Something visual ahead, Captain, at extreme range. He's changing course, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with him, helm.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Turning, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: We're given a lovely shot of the bird painted on its belly

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: We grow visible. Attend the cloaking system.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: It consumes much power, Commander. With no enemy to concern us.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: That Earth outpost called to an Earth vessel. Now it follows us.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Which neither retreats nor grows nearer. It turns as we turn. Commander, it is our judgment we run from a reflection.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Perhaps so, but my judgment prevails.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Cloaking system on, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: It is good we approach the Neutral Zone. Not too soon for me to see the stars of home. I know they are following.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Context: an older man
Text: If an Earth ship, why does he not attack?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: First study the enemy, seek weakness. If I were their commander, that is what I would do.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: My Commander sent for Decius.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: A message was dispatched. You've broken the rule of silence.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: Only in code, Commander. To inform our Praetor of this glorious mission.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Your carelessness might have ended this glorious mission. You're reduced two steps in rank. Return to post.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Text: Take care, Commander. He has friends, and friends of his kind mean power. And power is danger.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Danger and I are old companions.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Text: We've seen a hundred campaigns together, and still I do not understand you.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: I think you do. No need to tell you what happens when we reach home with proof of the Earthmen's weakness. And we will have proof. The Earth commander will follow. He must. When he attacks, we will destroy him. Our gift to the homeland, another war.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Text: If we are the strong, isn't this the signal for war?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Must it always be so? How many comrades have we lost in this way?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Text: Our portion, Commander, is obedience.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Obedience. Duty. Death and more death. Soon even enough for the Praetor's taste. Centurion, I find myself wishing for destruction before we can return. Worry not. Like you, I am too well-trained in my duty to permit it. Continue evasive manoeuvres. Now, back to the first course.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They're turning, sir. We're staying with them.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Steady on one eleven mark fourteen. Back on their original course, Captain, toward the Neutral Zone.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's our position, navigator?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: We'll enter the Neutral Zone in less than an hour, sir. Assuming, of course, that we don't turn back.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Scott
Text: We now have aboard debris from Outpost four, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring it to the briefing room. Are you ready, gentlemen?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: From the outpost's protective shield. Cast rodinium. This is the hardest substance known to our science.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: He crushes it with his hand

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lab theorises an enveloping energy plasma forcing an implosion.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Comments?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, their weaponry is superior to ours, and they have a practical invisibility screen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're discussing tactics. Do you realise what this really comes down to? Millions and millions of lives hanging on what this vessel does.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or on what this vessel fails to do, Doctor.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well gentlemen, the question still remains. Can we engage them with a reasonable possibility of victory?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Scott
Text: No question. Their power is simple impulse.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Meaning we can outrun them?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: To be used in chasing them or retreating, sir?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Mister Styles. I called this session for opinions.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: We have to attack immediately.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: They're still on our side of the Neutral Zone. There would be no doubt they broke the treaty.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Attack, without a visible target? How do we aim our phasers?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Aim with sensors. Not accurate, but if we blanket them

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: And hope for a lucky shot before they zero in on us?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: And if we don't? Once back, they'll report that we saw their weapons and ran.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: And if they could report they destroyed us?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: These are Romulans! You run away from them and you guarantee war. They'll be back. Not just one ship but with everything they've got. You know that, Mister Science Officer. You've the expert on these people, always left out that one point. Why? I'm very interested in why.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sit down, Mister.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I agree. Attack.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you suggesting we fight to prevent a fight?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Based on what? Memories of a war over a century ago? On theories about a people we've never even met face to face?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: We know what they look like.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, indeed we do, Mister Stiles. And if Romulans are an offshoot of my Vulcan blood, and I think this likely, then attack becomes even more imperative.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: War is never imperative, Mister Spock.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is for them, Doctor. Vulcan, like Earth, had its aggressive colonising period. Savage, even by Earth standards. And if Romulans retain this martial philosophy, then weakness is something we dare not show.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you want a galactic war on your conscience?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to Bridge.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: This is Uhura, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's our position?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Course unchanged, sir. Estimating treaty boundary in twenty one minutes.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you continuing to broadcast tactical reports?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Affirmative, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And at this distance?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Approximately three hours before receiving a reply to our first message.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant. Check our course ahead, Mister Spock.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: A comet, magnitude seven, dead ahead, and the intruder changing course toward it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Comet Icarus four. Composition?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite ordinary. An ionised mass, a trail of frozen vapour particles.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And when an object passes through it, even an invisible object?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: It leaves a visible trail.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our chance, gentlemen. Prepare to attack. All hands, battle stations. I hope we won't need your services, Bones.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Amen to that. We're taking a big gamble, Jim.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Battle status?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All stations manned, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Phaser weapons energised. Set for proximity blast.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Intruder now bearing directly for comet's tail.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot his exact point of entry, Mister Stiles.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Computed. On the board, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The moment he begins entering the comet's tail, he becomes visible. End run, gentlemen. We'll swing around the other side and catch him at that moment.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Acknowledged, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's maintaining that bearing, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get him, Mister Sulu.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: How pleasing to the eye it is. Behold a marvel in the darkness.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Centurion
Text: You spoke of entrapment.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Its many particles will obscure their sensing device, Centurion.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: We enter it, Commander.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Once fully obscured, we will turn suddenly back upon our adversary.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: At last the screen is clear, Commander.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Clear?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Our reflection no longer follows us.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Escape manoeuvre one, quickly!

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're losing sensor contact, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Steady as she goes. Phaser crews ready?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser crew signal ready, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He'll only be visible for a moment. Stand by.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, nothing in

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At the last moment he must have guessed our move. Hard to starboard, helm!

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hard to starboard.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He did exactly what I would have done. I won't underestimate him again. Now, fire blind. Lay down a pattern.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Traverse pattern. All phasers fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Robert
Text: Phaser one, fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Phaser one, fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Pulse phaser shots go into the darkness, rocking the Romulan ship

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Robert
Text: Phaser two, fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Phaser two, fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The Centurion pushes his Commander out of the way of a falling beam

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Divert all power to weapons.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser overload. Control circuit burnout.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Spock goes under his station to put out the flames

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: It'll take time to correct, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, are they surrendering?

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The Romulan ship has become visible

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full astern! Emergency warp speed!

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: A red plasma blast is heading towards them

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we have emergency warp?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Full power, sir. It's still overtaking us. If we can get one phaser working, sir, one shot might detonate it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Navigation?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Estimate it'll overtake us in two minutes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers, Mister Spock?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Feed this to the space recorder and jettison immediately.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Rand
Text: Captain, should I continue log entry?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman. Affirmative. Continue log entries.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ten seconds to impact. Captain, It's dissipating, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: It must have a range limit.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Rand stands as close as humanly possible to Kirk

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Five, four, three, two, one. Impact!

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Everyone gets thrown about a bit

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Limited range.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Phasers operational, Captain. Intruder bearing one eleven mark fourteen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Back to his old course.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: He may think we're destroyed, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't make that assumption. I don't think their Captain will either.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Intruder holding steady. Course one eleven mark fourteen.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Same as before, Mister Sulu. Stay with him.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The Commander tends to his injured friend

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Commander, the reflection returns.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Activate our cloak.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Commander, our fuel runs low.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Quickly!

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: The Earth vessel? Impossible.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: It moves as we move.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Its commander is not one to repeat a mistake.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: We'll enter the Neutral Zone in one minute, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do we violate the treaty, Captain?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: They did, Doctor.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Once inside, they can claim we did. A set-up. They want war, we furnish the provocation.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're still on our side, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get them while we are. Before we enter the Neutral Zone. Full ahead, Mister Sulu. Maximum warp.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ahead, sir. Maximum.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers, stand by.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Sir, at this distance?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We know their Achilles heel, Mister Stiles. Their weapon takes all their energy. They must become visible in order to launch it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: A phaser hit at this distance would be the wildest stroke of luck.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm aware of that, Mister Stiles. Are phasers ready?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Phasers show ready, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Commander!

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Evasive action. The Earth ship again.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: They are hit by phaser fire again

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: Twenty seconds to Neutral Zone, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, inform Command base, In my opinion, no option. On my responsibility, we are proceeding into the Neutral Zone. Steady as we go, Mister Sulu. Continue firing.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: Commander, they stay within range. I will tend to the centurion.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: No need. The Centurion is dead.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: Why don't we fire, Commander?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: No. No, he's shrewd, this starship commander. He tries to make us waste energy. He has estimated we have only enough. It is time. All debris into disposal tubes.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: Yes, Commander.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: The body of the Centurion, too. Forgive me, my old friend, but I must use all my experience now to get home.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Motion sensor signal stopped.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cease fire.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Debris scatter ahead, sir. We've hit him.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vessel wreckage. Metal moulds, conduit, plastoform and a body, Captain. However.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: However?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Insufficient mass, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Simple debris. Not a vessel, a trick.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to sensor probes.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing, sir. No motion out there at all. We've lost them, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 1709.6. We are at the Neutral Zone. Have lost contact with the intruder. No reaction on our motion sensors but believe the Romulan vessel to be somewhere close by. With all engines and systems shut down, the Enterprise is also playing the silent waiting game in hope of regaining contact.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: The lights are being dimmed and systems shut down as they rig for silent running

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I must make further repairs on the transfer coil. It's giving out again.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Spock, work quietly.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Decius
Text: Now twenty full cycles, Commander. Still no sign. I say he's been fooled. He must have gone on.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Commander
Text: Shh. He is there, somewhere. I feel it.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Now motionless for nine hours, forty seven minutes.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Yeoman Rand walks in without knocking, to find the Captain lying on his bed.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Rand
Text: Can I get you something from the galley, sir? Coffee, at least?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Yeoman. Bring it to the Bridge. I'll be there in a moment.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: McCoy walks in unannounced, and Rand leaves.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wish I were on a long sea voyage somewhere. Not too much deck tennis, no frantic dancing, and no responsibility. Why me? I look around that Bridge, and I see the men waiting for me to make the next move. And Bones, what if I'm wrong?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't really expect an answer.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But I've got one. Something I seldom say to a customer, Jim. In this galaxy, there's a mathematical probability of three million Earth-type planets. And in all of the universe, three million million galaxies like this. And in all of that, and perhaps more, only one of each of us. Don't destroy the one named Kirk.

Title: Balance of Terror
Context: Spock carefully closes the cover on his repairs, and is reaching up to his station to help himself up when he accidentally touches a button, turning on a system

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Stiles
Text: What?

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right. It's all right.

Title: Balance of Terror
Speaker: Romulan
Text: A signal, Commander.

Title: Balance of Terror

When they moved from light to darkness, they replaced freedom with a mechanistic culture. Doctor Korby has been able to uncover elements of this culture which will revolutionise the universe when freed from this cavernous environment.

There's no emotion in it, no emotional involvement. She simply responds to orders. She's a totally logical computer. A thing is not a woman. Now do you understand?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If these mechanical things have no feelings and perform only as you programme them, then why did Brown try to shoot me? Why did he kill two of my men? There are many things I don't understand, Doctor.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I will answer all of your questions now.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: This is how you make an android. (Kirk is naked on one side of circular table, a human-shaped blob on the other) Andrea. (the table starts turning) He's not being harmed, I promise.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Roger, what's happened to you? When I sat in your class, you wouldn't even dream of harming an insect or an animal. Their life was sacred to you then.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Christine, if I'd simply beamed up to their vessel with Brown and the others, I'd have given them objects of curiosity, beginnings of wild stories, foolish theories. Ruk! Watch carefully. (the blob turns into Kirk, and the table is stopped) Choose, Christine. Which is your captain?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I don't know. They're exact. I honestly don't know.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Synthetic organs are in place. We merely synchronise them with Kirk's autonomic nervous system, duplicating the rhythms of his body. At the same time, we duplicate the mental pattern. Now, physical pattern complete, we now make a mental pattern. Ready for final synaptic fusion. Andrea, stand by for cortex circuits. The android will be so perfect It could even replace the captain. The same memories, the same attitudes, the same abilities. Activate circuits.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mind your own business, Mister Spock. I'm sick of your half-breed interference, do you hear? Mind your own business, Mister Spock. I'm sick of your half-breed (passes out, the other one wakes up)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Complete.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Are you all right?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As far as I know.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Now, meet an android.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: How do you do, Miss Chapel?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: I am now programmed to please you also. Is the food appealing?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, thank you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: Please sit, Captain.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Thank you. I'm more or less on parole, I understand.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: Doctor Korby suggested that you have lunch. He thought you might have a few things to talk about.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Captain.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: I know, I know. I'd hate to be torn between commander and fiance myself.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: No, I'm not torn. I'm puzzled. I'm worried.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Has he confided in you?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Nothing he hasn't told you. I know it doesn't make sense. What he's done may seem wrong, but he is Roger Korby, whatever he seems to be doing.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Unless something's gone wrong with his mind.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: No. You're forgetting how well I know him. He's as sane as you or I.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Nurse, if I gave you a direct order to betray him

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Please, don't ask me to make that choice. I'd much rather you push me off the same precipice where Matthews died. Oh, I can't. (pushes plate away) Please, go ahead and eat.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Androids don't eat, Miss Chapel.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: He even has your sense of humour.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, there's one difference between us. I'm hungry.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: The difference is your weakness, Captain, not mine.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: One at a time, gentlemen. Captain?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Eating is a pleasure, sir. Unfortunately, one you will never know.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Perhaps, but I will never starve, sir.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's an exact duplicate?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: In every detail.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about memory? Tell me about Sam.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: George Samuel Kirk, your brother. Only you call him Sam.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He saw me off on this mission.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Yes, with his wife and three sons.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He said he was being transferred to Earth colony two research station.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: No, Captain. He said he was continuing his research and that he wanted to be transferred to Earth colony two.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: You might as well try to outthink a calculating machine.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obviously, I can't, but we do have some interesting differences.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Totally unimportant ones. You may leave now. (Kirk2 leaves) You haven't guessed the rest? Not even you, Christine? What you saw was only a machine, Only half of what I could've accomplished, Do you understand? By continuing the process I could've transferred you, your very consciousness into that android. Your soul, if you wish. All of you. In android form, a human being can have practical immortality. Can you understand what I'm offering mankind?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Programming. Different word, but the same old promises made by Genghis Khan, Julius Caesar, Hitler, Ferris, Maltuvis.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Can you understand that a human converted to an android can be programmed for the better? Can you imagine how life could be improved if we could do away with jealousy, greed, hate?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It can also be improved by eliminating love, tenderness, sentiment. The other side of the coin, Doctor.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: No one need ever die again. No disease, no deformities. why even fear can be programmed away, replaced with joy. I'm offering you a pracical heaven, a new paradise, and all I need is your help.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All you wanted before was my understanding.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I need transportation to a planet colony with proper raw materials. I'm sure there are several good possibilities among your next stops. No diversion from your route. I want no suspicions aroused. I'll begin producing androids carefully, selectively.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes. No one need know, only to frighten uninformed minds.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: They must be strongly infiltrated into society before the android existence is revealed. I want no wave of hysteria to destroy what is good and right. You with me, Captain?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've created your own Kirk. Why do you need me?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I created him to impress you, not to replace you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm impressed, Doctor, but not the way you think! (leaps up with cord he's untied from the chair leg and loops it around Korby's throat) Stand back, Ruk! I'll kill him! Stay back. (goes through door, releasing Korby into Ruk's arms)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Ruk, protect!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Roger, I. Ruk, no! (runs after him)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Ruk, stop! Doctor Korby said you are to obey me! Ruk! Ruk! Ruk, I order you not to harm him!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Context: Kirk breaks off a stalactite to use as a club. RUk hears the sound

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: Captain Kirk, where are you? Captain Kirk! I can help you!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Christine, is that you?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Context: Ruk sneaks up and they struggle, ending up with Kirk dangling from the edge of the pit. After thinking about it, Ruk pulls him up to safety

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, We finished ahead of schedule.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Doctor Korby has considerable cargo to beam aboard. I'll have to go over our destination schedule with him.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're going back down with the command pack?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Mind your own business, Mister Spock. I'm sick of your half-breed interference, do you hear?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. very well, Captain.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: You look upset, Mister Spock. Is everything all right up here?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: No problems here, sir.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Good. I'll beam up shortly with Doctor Korby and party. (leaves)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Security, Spock here. Status of your landing party?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Security
Text: Ready and standing by, sir,

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have them meet me in the transporter room after the Captain has beamed down.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: I looked it over. I think you'll find planet Midas Five an excellent choice.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: A small colony. Abundant raw materials. You made a good beginning, Captain.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Thank you. I felt quite at home on the Enterprise.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Andrea, kiss me. (she does, then raises her arm to slap him. He stops her and pulls her in for a passionate embrace)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: No. Not programmed for you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter, Andrea? Confused?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: No. (leaves. Ruk blocks Kirk's attempt to leave)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Emotion, Ruk? You disapprove of Miss Chapel's orders to save my life?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: To maintain your existence would be illogical.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Can't your memory banks solve a simple equation like that? What happened to the old ones, Ruk?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: So long ago.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it possible they built their machines too well, gave them pride and a desire to survive? Machines that wanted logic and order and found that frustrated by the illogical emotional creatures that built them?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: Yes, the old ones. The ones who made us. They grew fearful of us. They began to turn us off.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And isn't it Korby who's creating the same danger to you all over again? Unlike you, we humans are full of unpredictable emotions that logic cannot solve.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: Yes. Yes, it had been so long ago, I had forgotten. The old ones here. The ones who made us, yes. Yes, it is still in my memory banks. It became necessary to destroy them. You are inconsistent. You cannot be programmed. You are inferior.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Korby?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: You came from the outside. You bring disorder here.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The danger to you is Korby.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: I was programmed by Korby. I cannot harm him.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The old ones programmed you, too, but it became possible to destroy them.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: That was the equation! (seizes Kirk) Existence! Survival must cancel out programming.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's it, Ruk! Logic! You can't protect someone who's trying to destroy you!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Ruk, I would like

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Ruk
Text: You brought him among us. You brought the inferior ones. We had cleansed ourselves of them. Now you bring the evil back!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Ruk, stop! Your programming. (fires phaser, Ruk vanishes) I had no choice.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were a man with respect for all things alive. How can I explain the change in you? If I was to tell Earth I was in your hands, to tell them what has become (jumps Korby and traps his arm in a door. The skin tears to reveal electronics)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: It's still me, Christine. Roger. I'm in here. You can't imagine how it was. I was frozen, dying. My legs were gone. I was, I had only my brain between life and death. This can be repaired easier than another man can set a broken finger. I'm still the same as I was before, Christine, perhaps even better.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Are you, Roger?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Context: into comm. unit
Text: Andrea.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: There's someone in the outer junction.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. He must've got my message.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: I will find Ruk.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: But he'll never find us in this maze.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Ruk has been shut off.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: Get a weapon. Deal with it. Protect.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: I will kiss you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: No.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: You, you will not?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: It is illogical. (she disintegrates him)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I'm the same! A direct transfer. All of me, human, rational, and without a flaw.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: He freed himself, and I destroyed, (sees Kirk there) destroyed him. I am not programmed for alarms. I listened to your instructions. They were mis-stated.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She killed the android, Korby, the same way you killed Ruk. Is this your perfect world, your flawless beings killing off one another? Aren't you doing exactly what you hate most in humans, killing with no more concern than when you turn off a light?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I'm not a computer. Test me. Ask me to solve any, equate, transmit. Christine, Christine, let me prove myself. Does this make such a difference?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Don't you see, Roger? Everything you've done has proved it isn't you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: I am Roger Korby!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then prove it. Give me that phaser gun. If there's any human left in you, give it to me.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: No. You will never understand. I constructed a perfect being, tested it, proved it. Proved it. Proved it? (hands phaser to Kirk)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Andrea, give me the weapon.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: No. Protect. Protect. (to Korby) To love you. To, to kiss you.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Korby
Text: No. You cannot love. You're not human.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Andrea
Text: Love you. Kiss. (Korby reaches for trigger and disintegrates them both)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In here, Spock.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, are you all right? Nurse? Where's Doctor Korby?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Korby was never here.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Thank you for letting me make the decision, Captain. I'm quite certain I'm doing the right thing. (leaves)

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's staying with the ship. Something bothering you, Mister Spock?

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Frankly, I was rather dismayed by your use of the term half-breed, Captain. You must admit it is an unsophisticated expression.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll remember that Mister Spock, the next time I find myself in a similar situation. Steady as we go, helm.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Ready to beam down. Energise. Energise.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Having trouble, gentlemen?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: I just don't understand the problem, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're beaming cargo down to a penal colony, Mister Berkeley.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Their security force field, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: U.S.S. Enterprise to Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Rehab colony. Come in.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request opening in your force field for beaming down of cargo.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Enterprise, affirmative. Our security cover is now open.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise. Any incoming cargo?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Just one item, sir. Some research material bound for the Central Bureau of Penology at Stockholm.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Tantalus cargo ready to beam up.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Mister Berkeley, you might refamiliarise yourself with the manual on penal colony procedures.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Immediately, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think you can take the time to lock this up first.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: I'll get a vault assignment. (leaves. The box opens, a man climbs out and attacks the technician)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 2715.1. Exchanged cargo with penal colony on Tantalus V. I've departed without going ashore.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I would like to have met Doctor Adams. Have you ever been to a penal colony since they started following his theories?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A cage is a cage, Jim.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're behind the times, Bones. They're more like resort colonies now.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message, Captain. Switching to speaker.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Tantalus colony to Enterprise. We are unable to locate one of our inmates. This is a potentially violent case. Possibly hidden in the box we beamed up to you. Repeat, unable to locate one of our inmates. This is a potentially violent case.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise acknowledging. Stand by. Security alert three.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security alert, condition three. All sections go to alert condition three. We may have an intruder aboard.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Repeat, all sections to alert condition three. Intruder aboard.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Security
Context: to intruder who has swapped overall with technician) Hey, you from Engineering! (runs
Text: Bridge. Section C, deck fourteen.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, section C deck fourteen, reporting trouble. Someone in Engineering uniform.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security control, this is the Bridge. Come in.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have them, Captain. Closing off deck fourteen, search in progress.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security alert, condition three. (intruder jumps one of the security men) Approximately six foot four male, early forties. Approach with caution. This man's extremely dangerous.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Repeat, approach with extreme caution. Bridge out.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative in the deck area, Captain. He may have gotten out. Expanding search to adjoining sections.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise to Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Tantalus colony. Adams here.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Adams? This is Captain Kirk. It appears we may have an inmate of yours aboard the ship.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transporter crewman found unconscious, Captain. Cargo case open and empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make that definite, Doctor. He's aboard.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Terribly sorry, Captain. I take all the blame. Let me repeat, he's clever as well as extremely violent. Take all possible precautions.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll keep you posted, Doctor. Kirk out.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. Your Earth people glorify organised violence for forty centuries, but you imprison those who employ it privately.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And, of course, your people found an answer.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: We disposed of emotion, Doctor. Where there is no emotion there is no motive for violence.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Where's the captain? Which one of you is the captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: My name is Van Gelder. I want asylum.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At gunpoint?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: I want your promise first, your word that you won't take me back there, to Tantalus.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No promises. Give me the weapon.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: No! No. No, I'm not going back! I'll disable your vessel first. You choose, Captain. I'll destroy your control panel.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Context: Gelder is distracted and Spock neck-pinches him

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take him to Sickbay. Reverse course. Head back for Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Abnormal, of course, but it's not schizophrenia, tissue damage, or any condition I'm acquainted with, Jim. And you know after getting him here, it took almost a triple dose of sedative to put him under.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your report said he was quite talkative.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
