Text: But not very informative. He claimed one thing, then he seemed to forget, and then he'd start to claim something else, but always with just the ring of truth in it. I'd sure like to study this one, Jim.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not our problem, Bones.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: You smart, button-pushing brass hat. Wash your hands of it. Is that your system? You're both quite sure of yourselves, aren't you? Quite expert. Take him back. Let someone else worry about him.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did you say your name was?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: My name? My name is Simon Van Gelder. (in great pain) I was the director of, director at the Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You see what I mean?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: I was a graduate of, of. I was assistant to Doctor. I knew. I knew, but they've erased it.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Erased?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Edited, adjusted, subverted me, but I won't forget! I won't forget! You, you're so blind ignorant. You believe I belong back there, don't you? Dead or alive. Well, I won't let you take me back. I'm not going! I'll die first! Do you hear? I'm not going! No! No! No.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Estimated arrival at Tantalus?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fifty seven minutes, thirty seconds, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's so fascinating?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: An identification tape from our ship's library on Doctor Simon Van Gelder.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Van Gelder?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Van Gelder, Captain. No mistake. There's a full ID tape on him.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Committed to Tantalus colony when?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Assigned there six months ago as Doctor Adams' associate.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship to surface, Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequency's open, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: U.S.S. Enterprise to Tantalus colony.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Tantalus.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. I'd like to speak to Doctor Adams.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Woman
Text: Stand by, Enterprise.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Captain Kirk, Doctor Adams here.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Adams, regarding your escaped man

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Is Doctor Van Gelder all right? And your people, no injuries?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No casualties, sir. This man is Doctor Simon Van Gelder?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Yes, of course. You're certain he's all right? We've been very concerned. In the violent state he's in

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No harm to him, sir. We thought you might enlighten us as to his condition.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: He'd been doing some experimental work, Captain, an experimental beam we'd hoped might rehabilitate incorrigibles. Van Gelder felt he hadn't the moral right to expose another man to something he hadn't tried on his own person.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tragedy, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, that doesn't quite ring true.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Er, Doctor Adams, please stand by. Explain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't believe him. I can't explain it, but the more I study that patient

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't believe him, and you can't explain it. Bones, are you aware that in the last twenty years Doctor Adams has done more to revolutionise, to humanise prisons and the treatment of prisoners than all the rest of humanity had done in forty centuries? I've been to those penal colonies since they've begun following his methods, and they're not cages anymore.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're clean, decent hospitals for sick minds.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, listen!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, I suggest you ask Doctor Adams if he wants Van Gelder returned.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Adams, regarding Van Gelder.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Yes, Captain. May I inquire about your patrol destinations? Are you passing near any hospital facilities superior to ours? I'd like Van Gelder to have the best possible treatment, of course.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Doctor. I'll take it up with the ship's surgeon. Stand by. Well, Bones, you've got the ball. You care to recommend a better place?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There are no superior facilities, he knows that. But that's not the question. If something unusual is going on down there

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An assumption, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm required to enter any reasonable doubts into my medical log. That requires you to answer in your log. Sorry, Jim.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Adams, this is rather embarrassing. By strict interpretation of our starship regulation, I'm required to initiate an investigation of this so that a proper report

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: No need to apologise, Captain Kirk. In fact, I'd take it as a personal favour if you'd beam down and look into it yourself. I'm sure you realise we don't get too many visitors here. Oh, I, er, Captain, I would appreciate it if you could come down with a minimum staff. We're forced to limit outside contact as much as possible.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Affirmative, Doctor. I've visited rehab colonies before. Enterprise out. Find me someone in your department with psychiatric and penology experience, if possible.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 2715.2. Standard orbit, planet Tantalus V.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mission, routine investigation and report as per ship surgeon's medical log. As for my last entry, it seems I will get to meet Doctor Adams at last. However, I would have preferred other circumstances. Sickbay. Report, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Van Gelder's still violently agitated, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you'd prefer to keep him here until I complete my investigation anyway.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe we should, Jim.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, I'm assigning your technical aide, Captain. One of our psychiatrists does have a background in rehabilitative therapy. Doctor Noel, standing by in the transporter room now.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Doctor. Bridge out. Mister Spock.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Co-ordinates?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Locked in, sir. Ready to beam down.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Doctor Helen Noel, Captain. We've met. Don't you remember the science lab Christmas party?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I remember.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: You dropped in

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes, I remember.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Problem, Captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you tell McCoy that she had better check out as the best assistant I ever had. Energise.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Energise.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In here, I presume, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Perhaps it would be simpler if you called me Helen, Captain, since

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is another time, another place, and another situation.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Of course, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Elevator, and going down quite a ways.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Context: in his arms
Text: I wouldn't recommend it for weak hearts.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Hello Captain Kirk, and er

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Helen Noel. It's a pleasure to finally meet you, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Thank you. Thank you, Captain. Welcome to Devil's Island, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Perhaps you'll call me Helen, Doctor. With so many titles around, we're not going to be sure who's talking to who.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: I shall indeed. Won't you?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Thank you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe regulations call for me to check my weapon.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: No, no. That won't be necessary in your case, Captain. Just keep it out of sight, hmm? I know you people feel as naked without a weapon as we do without a medikit. A small toast. Do you mind? It's such a great day for us here on Tantalus when we have visitors, no matter what the excuse.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Oh, now, Captain, you made your apology from upstairs. Now forget it. I don't think you'll be able to get through the security screen, Captain. Just a second, hmm? There. Now try it.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise. Spock here.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your landing co-ordinates were right on the nose, Mister Spock. We arrived safely, and we're here with Doctor Adams right now. Kirk out.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative, Captain. Enterprise out.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Ah, Lethe, come in. Lethe, this is Captain Kirk and Doctor Helen Noel. Lethe came to us for rehabilitation and stayed on as a therapist, and a very good one too, I might add.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Lethe
Text: I love my work.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Go right ahead, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Before you came here

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Lethe
Text: I was another person, malignant, hateful.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: May I ask what crime you committed?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Lethe
Text: Does it matter? That person no longer exists.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Um, part of our cure, if you will, Captain, is to bury the past. Why should a person go on living with unbearable memories if there's no necess. Oh, I feel quite sure that you'd concur with me in that, Doctor. Helen.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: A shifting of memory patterns is basic to psychotherapy.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Yes. And now to the toast, hmm? You'll forgive us, Lethe. There you are, Captain. To all mankind. May we never find space so vast, planets so cold, heart and mind so empty that, that we cannot fill them with love and warmth.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quite a tour, Doctor. Very impressive.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Thank you. Hi, Carl.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Yes?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hmm?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Ah. I was afraid you would ask about this, Captain. One doesn't like to talk about their personal failures, you know? It was just an experiment that went wrong, I'm afraid.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: May I see it?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Captain, if something hasn't worked out and therefore has no scientific fact

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shall we leave it up to the doctor?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Since you brought me down here for advice, Captain

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of the advantages of being a Captain, Doctor, is being able to ask for advice without necessarily having to take it.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: I think I'll have to award that round to the Captain, Helen. You're fighting over your weight. All right, let's take a look.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: I'm not a criminal! I do not require neural neutraliser.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Neural neutraliser. Can you explain that, Doctor Van Gelder?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: A room. A device. Door. Control panel. I see it. A device. A light! The light!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: This room. What happens there?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: (screams)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: A neural neutraliser. Experimental. Actually, we don't expect to get much use out of it at all. That beam from above neutralises brain waves, relaxes the patient's mind. Does them no harm, of course, and the effects are only temporary.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One question, Doctor. If it doesn't do any good

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Why do we go on using it, hmm, Captain? Hope. Yes, yes, there's always that slight chance that it might do some good in the more violent cases.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Tranquillisers are fine, Captain, but to continually pump chemicals into a person's bloodstream

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Exactly my point, Helen. Yes. Shall we? (he and Noel leave)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to therapist
Text: How does it work?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Therapist
Text: Quite simple. Off on switches, and the large control here changes the strength of the brain neutralising beam.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Captain, you remind me of the ancient sceptic who demanded of the wise old sage to be taught all the world's wisdom while standing on one foot.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Beam neutralising has been experimented with on Earth, Captain. I'm not acquainted with this particular style of equipment, but I can assure you that Doctor Adams has not created a chamber of horrors here.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't mean to suggest that he had. The reason I asked, sir, was you haven't mentioned where Doctor Van Gelder's injury occurred.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Right here, Captain. Yes, Simon was a very stubborn man. He could've sat in that room for years with the beam at that volume or even higher. Or if he simply had someone standing by to snap it off in case he got into trouble, but, but no. He tried it alone and on full volume. It's a pity.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to therapist
Text: Thank you. (leaves)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Therapist
Context: to man in treatment chair
Text: You will forget all you have heard. To remember any portion of it, any word, will cause you pain, terrible pain, growing more terrible as you fight to remember.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can you give us your present location, Captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In Doctor Adams' study, Mister Spock. Why?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you're with Doctor Adams now.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Van Gelder has made reference to a particular treatment room. The term was neural neutraliser.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. He was injured there. I've seen the room. Doctor Adams explained

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: the mistake Van Gelder made.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Mister Spock. Anything further?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Your Mister Spock sounds like a very excellent second in command, Captain Kirk. Please tell him to go ahead and speak freely. I have to check in with a member of my staff anyway.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Doctor Adams.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Excuse me.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Spock. Doctor Adams has left with some things to attend to. What is it, Mister Spock?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Van Gelder is extremely agitated, Captain, and warns that you are in danger.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Oh, that's foolish.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please repeat, Captain. I didn't receive that.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell McCoy the technical expert he sent along with me insists that any concern is unjustified. According to Adams, Van Gelder created his own problem.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: He's suffering from

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: neuro-synapse damage, as if his brain were short-circuited. It's no wonder he's having delusions.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here. Received and understood.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But we still have some doubts up here, Captain. Can you tell us any more?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not really.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: When do you plan to beam back up, Captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think we'll spend the night here, Mister Spock.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: No! No, no, no.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: And you will continue to check in every four hours?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: No! No. No, don't let them! You must warn your captain. No! No! Don't let him stay! Don't let him stay! Don't! No. No. Don't hypo me. Please, don't hypo me. I'll try not to fight. I'll try. But you must listen. Warn your Captain. Doctor Adams. Doc, Doctor Adams will destroy.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Destroy how? What?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Right death.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise log. First officer Spock, acting captain. I must now use an ancient Vulcan technique to probe into Van Gelder's tortured mind.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, if there's the slightest possibility it might help.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've never used it on a human, Doctor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If there's any way we can look into this man's mind to see if what he's seeing is real or delusion

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's a hidden, personal thing to the Vulcan people, part of our private lives.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now look, Spock, Jim Kirk could be in real trouble. Will it work or not?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could be dangerous. Do you understand? It requires I make pressure changes in your nerves, your blood vessels.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: You must open my mind. Let me warn you and explain to you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: This will not affect you, Doctor McCoy, only the person I touch. It is not hypnosis.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I understand. (Spock puts his hands on Gelder's face) Good, the reading's levelling.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: You begin to feel a strange euphoria. Your body floats.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Yes, I begin to feel it.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Open your mind. We move together. Our minds sharing the same thoughts.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good evening.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Good evening.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did you think of the inmates we saw here this afternoon?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: You could've waited until tomorrow morning to ask me that, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: I thought they were happy, well-adjusted.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But a bit blank.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Captain, if you're questioning the methods of a man like Tristan Adams

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to see that treatment room again. You say you're somewhat familiar with the theory behind it?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Yes, somewhat, but if you'd simply state any doubts you have to Doctor Adams

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if he's lying, he'll continue to lie, and I won't find out a thing. The only way I can be sure is to see that machine at work, or is that too impractical and unscientific of me, Doctor? Well?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Coming.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is our name? Who are we?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: We are Simon Van Gelder.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Adams. The neural neutraliser. What did he do to us?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: He can reshape any mind he chooses. He used it to erase our memories, put his own thoughts there. He was surprised it took so much power. We fought him, remember? But we grew so tired, our minds so blank, so open, that any thought he placed there became our thoughts. Our minds so empty like a sponge, needing thoughts, begging. Empty. Loneliness. So lonely to be sitting there empty, wanting any word from him. Love.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Hate.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Live.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Die.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Such agony to be empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: Lonely.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lonely.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: So empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Gelder
Text: So empty.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have no desire to damage my brain. Can this be handled with reasonable safety? Yes or no?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Yes.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And will you be able to determine if that beam is harming me in the slightest?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Yes, Captain. I know my profession. (Kirk sits in treatment chair) Ready?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mm-hmm.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: We'll try minimum intensity, a second or two. (light turns)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anytime you're ready, Doctor, just for a second or two.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: We already tried it for that long, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing happened.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Something happened. Your face went completely blank.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try a harmless suggestion.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Context: light turns
Text: You're hungry.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know, when we finally get through this I'd like to locate and raid a kitchen somewhere.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: I put that suggestion in your mind, Captain. I said simply that you were hungry.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Remarkably effective for a device that Doctor Adams was going to abandon.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: I think we should try this again.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Pick something unusual, an unusual suggestion, something we can both be sure of.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Context: light turns
Text: At the Christmas party, we met, we danced, you talked about the stars. I suggest now that it happened in a different way. You swept me off my feet and carried me to your cabin.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Merry Christmas.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Captain, if your crew saw you carry me here.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My crew is sworn to secrecy.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: But my reputation. I mean, just having met like this. Of course, it would be different if you cared for me.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You want me to manufacture a lie, wrap it up as a Christmas present for you?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: No, I prefer honesty. (they kiss)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Now Captain Kirk is going to have a complete demonstration. I want there to be no doubts whatsoever in his mind. Mmm. You're madly in love with Helen, Captain. You'd lie, cheat, steal for her, sacrifice your career, your reputation.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: No, Doctor! No!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: The pain. Do you feel it, Captain? You must have her, or the pain grows worse, the pain, the longing for her.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helen.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: No.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: For years, you've loved her, Captain, for years.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For years, I've loved you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: You must continue to remember that, Captain. And now, she's gone. (machine to maximum)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helen! Helen, don't go! I need you, Helen!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Context: reduces intensity
Text: Now Captain, you must take your phaser weapon and drop it on the floor. Captain, the pain increases unless you obey me.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must drop it.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Very good, Captain. Very good indeed. And now your communicator. Drop it on the floor.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Argh! (machine to maximum) Kirk to Enterprise. Argh!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: No!

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: They've taken you from the room, Captain. You're in your own quarters now.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helen. Helen, for years I've loved you. Helen.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Try to remember.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've loved you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: He placed all that in your mind.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For years.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Remember. Doctor Adams took the controls away from me. Do you remember the pain and then his voice? Remember?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Yes, I remember. I remember. Helen. Look. The duct. The duct. Give me a hand here. Pull. (cover comes open) Air conditioning. It has to connect with other ducts and tunnels. You can get through this. It might lead to the power supply. Short-circuited, it would cut off the security force field. Have you had any training in hyper-power circuits?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: No.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Megavoltage. Touch the wrong line, and you're dead.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Anything's better than Adams' treatment room. (he closes the cover behind her and the door opens) Time for another treatment?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Please don't fight me, Captain. The pain only gets worse when you doubt me. You believe in me completely.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe in you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: You trust me completely.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I trust you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Excellent, Captain. I compliment you. Do you know Doctor Van Gelder was down on his hands and knees sobbing at this point? It was so gratifying. I'm so fortunate to have had a couple of excellent specimens to, to work with. I've learned a great deal.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Lethe
Text: The woman doctor. She's gone, Doctor Adams.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Notify security at once, Lethe. Where is she, Captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I, argh, I don't know.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Where is Helen And with what instructions?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. (collapses)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Context: Noel makes it to the power control room and finds an off switch but it won't move

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Emergency channel D.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: It's no good, Mister Spock. I can't break through their force field.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Keep trying.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Context: Noel hides as guards search for her, and when they go she pulls down the master high voltage switch. A guard grabs her

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Adams
Text: Put him back in the chair, Eli, and find that girl. (Kirk knocks them both out and leaves)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Context: the guard turns the power back on again, but when he reaches for Noel she pushes him against the high volt grid and he fries, cutting the power again

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Berkeley
Text: Mister Spock, the force field is gone. I can send you right to the source of the interruption.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Context: to McCoy
Text: Get some security people and follow me down. Energise.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Context: Noel dashes back into the aircon tunnels

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Context: pushes a load of buttons
Text: Enterprise, this is Spock. Force field has been eliminated. (turns main power back on again)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Captain. Captain?

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Context: helps her out of vent
Text: Helen, are you all right? (kisses her)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: Yes. This isn't right, Captain. (Spock enters) Doctor Adams did this to you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Adams? Doctor A. The treatment room. Follow me.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim! (Kirk turns machine off)

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The power came on.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Captain.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: The machine wasn't on high enough to kill.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But he was alone. Can you imagine the mind emptied by that thing? Without even a tormentor for company.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Noel
Text: I understand.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, Captain, there was a message from Tantalus colony, sir.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was from Van Gelder. He thought you'd like to know the treatment room had been dismantled and the equipment destroyed.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's hard to believe that a man could die of loneliness.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not when you've sat in that room. Take us out of orbit, Mister Spock. Ahead warp factor one.

Title: Dagger Of The Mind
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged, Captain. Warp factor one.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Bridge]

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth-style distress signal. SOS.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: I've answered it on all frequencies, sir. They don't reply.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not a vessel, a ground source. The third planet in this solar system, according to my instruments.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Directly ahead. Definitely an Earth-style signal.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're hundreds of light years from Earth, Mister Spock. No colonies or vessels out this far.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Measuring the planet now, Captain. It's spheroid-shaped, circumference twenty four thousand eight hundred seventy four miles. Mass six times ten to the twenty first power tons. Mean density five point five one seven. Atmosphere oxygen, nitrogen.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Earth!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not the Earth, another Earth. Another Earth?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2713.5. In the distant reaches of our galaxy, we have made an astonishing discovery. Earth type radio signals coming from a planet which apparently is an exact duplicate of the Earth. It seems impossible, but there it is.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold us in a fixed orbit, Mister Spock.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Still no response, communications?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: None, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll beam down. Alert security. Prepare to transport landing party to surface. We'll land in the vicinity of the distress signals now being received.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Identical. Earth, as it was in the early 1900s.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: More the, er, mid-1900s I would say, Captain, approximately 1960.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: But where is everybody?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings indicate that natural deterioration has been taking place on this planet for at least several centuries.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: You mean there's no one alive?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not conclusive, Yeoman. The evidence would suggest that the distress signal is automated.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, this is marvellous. the most horrible conglomeration of antique architecture I've ever seen.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. (comes upon child's tricycle)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Teenager
Text: Mine! Mine! (attacks McCoy) Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! (Kirk drags him off and hits him several times) It's, it's broke. Somebody broke it. Fix. Somebody, please fix.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course somebody will fix it.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Definitely humanoid, in spite of the distortion.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But with the mind of a child. Bones, what is it?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A seizure of some type.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We want to help you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Teenager
Text: Liar! Fibber, fibber, fibber, fibber, fibber, fibber, fibber!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's dead. It's incredible.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Its metabolic rate. It's impossibly high as if it's burning itself up, almost as if it aged a century in just the past few minutes.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: sound of running
Text: Come on!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How old is this thing?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: About three hundred years.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: sound in the closet
Text: Come out. We mean you no harm. (opens door)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Don't hurt me, please.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not going to hurt you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No, please, don't. I didn't do anything.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I won't hurt you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No, please don't.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I only want to talk to you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No, don't. Don't hurt.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Don't, please.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I won't hurt you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Don't hurt me.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on. It's all right. Come on.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: We won't hurt you, sweetheart. We're your friends. No, shh!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take the guards, have a look outside. Radioactive readings, chemical pollutions, any further sign of life.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Right, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder what happened to her, that she should be so terrified of us.

Title: Miri
Context: Someone clears a patch of grime from a window, Spock goes over and peers in

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: But I remember the things you Grups did, burning, yelling, hurting people.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We didn't do anything like that.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: You're not going to hurt?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, of course not. We're here to help.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Grups don't help.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: But we will.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened here? Where is everybody?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: You know.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't. Won't you tell me?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: You got a foolie, is that it, and you want me to play, but I can't. I don't know the rules. I've got to know the rules.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Foolie?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: A game, you know. You can't play a game without rules. Even Grups ought to know that.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are Grups?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: You are. They will, when Onlies get old.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Grownups.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said something about the Grups doing bad things, yelling, hurting, burning.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: That was when they started to get sick in the before time. We hid, then they were gone. Am I doing all right?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're doing fine.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You said the Grups got sick. Is that why there aren't any of them around?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Yes. They died, but that was after the awful things.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A plague, Captain. That could explain a lot of it.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what about the children, the Onlies? Didn't the awful things affect them?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Of course not. We're here, aren't we?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: More of you? How many?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: All there are.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's your name?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Miri.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miri. A pretty name for a pretty young woman.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Pretty?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very pretty.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Guards! Cover me.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Nyah na nyah. (stones are dropped from above) Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Children, Captain. Lots of them. We couldn't begin to get close to them. They just seemed to scurry away, like animals. Only children.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miri said all the adults died.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That creature which attacked us was certainly no child. Perhaps it died of the disease the girl's talking about.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be records somewhere and answers to some of our questions. Miri, do you know any buildings where the doctors used to work?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Yes, I know that. Them and their pills and things.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you take me there?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: That's a bad place.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's important. Please.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: All right. Do you have a name, too?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. It's Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I like that name.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I like yours, too. I like you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Do you really?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't lie to you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I wouldn't lie to you, either, Jim. I remember the Grups, but you're nice. You're different.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, thank you. (sees a mark on his hand)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: It's already starting. I knew it would. Just like it did with the Grups. It'll spread all over you, and you'll yell, and you'll try to hurt everybody and then you'll die. I knew it would! I knew it would!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2713.6. The building Miri led us to also housed an automatic transmission station, which sent out the signal that drew us to this planet. We also discovered something else. That the blues blotches, characteristic of the unknown disease had appeared on each of us, with the exception of Mister Spock. There was a well-equipped laboratory in the building. Doctor McCoy took tissue samples of each of us in an attempt to isolate the organism responsible.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A veritable zoo of bacteria. Beam down a biocomputer and a portable electronic microscope. If I'm dealing with viruses, I'll need better equipment than I have here.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Captain Kirk?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Lieutenant?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: I've got volunteers standing by ready to help you, sir.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Under no circumstances do I want anyone to beam down from the ship. We can't take any chances with further contamination.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: But Captain, if you become too ill to

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My orders still stand, Lieutenant. You can help us best by clearing the computer banks and standing by. Kirk out. Bones, why do you think the symptoms haven't appeared in Mister Spock?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know. Probably the little bugs or whatever they are have no appetite for green blood.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Being a red-blooded human obviously has its disadvantages. Now there you have a museum piece, Doctor. (referring to microscope) Lens type, manually operated, light-activated.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spare me the analysis, Mister Spock, please. It is enough that it works.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: It spreads real fast. I know. When you're old, it covers you like anything.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: reading
Text: Intermediate experimentation report project on life prolongation.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Progress report, genetics section, Life Prolongation Project.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: So that's what it was.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Life prolongation. Didn't have much luck, did they?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. Doctor McCoy's biocomputer and a portable electronic microscope have been beamed down from the Enterprise. They will be used in conjunction with computer banks on-board ship.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tubular with extreme multiplicability. Appear to have affinity for nucleic acids. Give me what you have.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: This was three hundred years ago, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All the adults are dead. Only the children are left alive.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: But children become adults.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At least they have up to now.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, there are certain glandular changes which take place upon entering puberty, are there not?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. It changes the entire body system. You know that. Of course you know that. Why?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is it not possible that these children here, as they enter puberty, contract the disease?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That would explain why there are no adults.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Glandular, post-pubescent. Could be.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's illogical. It does not follow. All the adults on this planet died three hundred years ago, but there are children in the streets.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who die when they enter adolescence.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But how do they keep the line going?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: One thing, Captain. If she were a wild animal ever since she's been a little girl, how do you explain that she wants to stay with us?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Loneliness? I don't know, curiosity? I think children have an instinctive need for adults. They want to be told right and wrong.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: There may be other emotions at work in this case, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She likes you, Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: She's becoming a woman.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Here are those figures you asked for. Twelve to the tenth power. Metabolic rate seventy two percent. Production of nucleic acids reduced to thirty three percent of normal. Conventional chronological progression one hundred by three point six.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged, Lieutenant. I have their calculations now.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to redshirts) Try again. See if you can find anything outside. (to Miri
Text: Hey, clean up that desk for me, will you?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: All right, Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: According to their life prolongation plan, what they thought they were accomplishing, a person would age only one month for every one hundred years of real time.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: One hundred years and only one month?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly, Yeoman. Evidently through some miscalculation, this virus annihilated the entire adult population in a very short period, leaving only the children.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: But that means these children

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Could very well be immensely old.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That would certainly answer the question of what happened to their parents.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Answers it very well.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Children who never age. Eternal childhood, filled with play, no responsibilities. It's almost like a dream.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't examine that dream too closely, Yeoman. It might not turn out to be very pretty.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A few days ago or a week ago that creature that attacked us could have been just like Miri. A child entering puberty on this planet means a death sentence.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Do you suppose she knows?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think so.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: If they're as old as Spock claims, they must have some idea of what's happening.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no adult interpretation. I think we're dealing with children. Immensely old perhaps, but nonetheless children. We've got to do something about the others.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Difficult, if we can't even get a glimpse of them.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You couldn't get close to the other kids?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible. They know the area too well, like mice.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm going to try. Miri? Come here. You want to go someplace with me?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Sure. (leave, holding hands)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: That little girl

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is at least three hundred years older than you are, Yeoman. Think about it.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: Miri is with them! Why? Why?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: What's she going to do, Jahn?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: I don't, I don't know. I know what we've got to do. There are more of them than we see. Somewhere, up in the sky, maybe, somewhere. They talk to each other all the time. You know Grups. You know what they do, the hurting, the killing.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: I remember, Jahn, the way it was.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: That's right, the way it was in the before time. They talk to the other Grups with these little boxes. Now, if they didn't have those little boxes, they'd be all alone, huh?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: But they don't see us. We hide. Olly olly oxen free!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Olly olly oxen free! Olly olly oxen free! Olly olly oxen free!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: No! It's not a game, it's real. They're dangerous, they're Grups. Don't you understand?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Masked Boy
Text: Jahn!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Context: sees Kirk and Miri approach the building
Text: All right, let's hide!

Title: Miri
Context: Kirk and Miri come in, then a changing girl appears. The children flee, screaming. The girl jumps Kirk, and he eventually stuns her

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dead. I don't understand it. My phaser wasn't set to kill.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Her name was Louise. She was just a little bit older than I am when it happened. Oh, Jim. (she hugs him)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Data has been fed into the computers, Mister Spock. Stand by.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Context: sharpening pencils
Text: Are these enough, Jim?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We could use some more, if you don't mind.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No, I don't mind.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There couldn't be any doubt about what you found here?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: This fellow made these notes in the last weeks after the disaster began. I disregard these last entries. He said himself he was too sick, too far gone to be sure he wasn't already mad, and I agree, but based on the entries he made before that, I know how much time we have. The ship's computers will verify my figures.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Only a matter of time before we all go mad, destroy each other, till the last of us finally destroys himself.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about Miri?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our guess was correct. They contract the disease as they enter puberty and their metabolism changes. The notes would indicate it doesn't become acute for a month or so. I estimate she has perhaps five or six weeks left.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What about us?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: The older the victim, the more rapid the progress of the disease.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you? The disease doesn't seem to be interested in you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am a carrier. Whatever happens, I can't go back to the ship, and I do want to go back to the ship, Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course, Mister Spock. We still don't know what we're fighting.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, but we know what it is and how fast it does it. It's progressing. We'll begin to feel it inside soon. Intense fever, great pain in the extremities, fuzziness of vision. Of course, those are the early symptoms. There'll be more.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are You certain about the time we have left?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: I presume my calculations are correct.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there any possibility

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Landing party, this is the Enterprise.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Computer indicates one hundred seventy hours, Mister Spock.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Verified, Captain. We have seven days.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, supplement. This is the second day of the seven left to us. We've found nothing. Enterprise is standing by with labs and computers ready to assist us.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no data, no starting point.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think I've found it.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Janice, take Miri for a walk.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Only one half intact.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But do you know what they were up to?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: More or less. The idea was to create a new series of diseases, a chain reaction of viruses meant essentially to extend the life of the human cell immeasurably.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, they weren't successful. We've seen the results.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You two will have to recreate their thinking. If you can isolate that virus, we'll be able to develop a vaccine.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is that all, Captain? We have five days, you know.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Nyah na nyah. Nyah na nyah.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The children! (all dash out, while Jahn sneaks in and collects the communicators from the desks)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, nothing.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you? (clunk as grate closes)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Communicators, Captain, they're gone.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, We've absolutely got to have those communicators. Without them, we don't have the computers, and without the computers, we don't have a chance.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2717.3. Three days, seven hours left to us. Investigation proves that the supply of food in the area is running dangerously low. Unless something is done, the children will starve in a few months. The disease is working on each of us according to Doctor McCoy's prediction. Our tempers are growing short, and We're no further along than we were two days ago.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Haven't you found a thing yet?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Would you like to take a crack at it?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Context: as Kirk pushes past and makes her drop flasks
Text: No! No! No! (runs out, Kirk follows, then Miri)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: I'm upset, so upset. Back on the ship, I used to try to get you to look at my legs. Captain, look at my legs. (covered in blotches)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: holds her
Text: We're all frightened. (Miri leaves)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I found something!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The last slide I examined, I failed to make the necessary adjustment. The slowing down of my own responses

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind that, what did you find?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The disease, Captain, the one they created three hundred years ago.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: There's a chance!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A chance. At least it's a race now, and we've just wasted a minute.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: That would be some foolie, Miri, but do you think it would work?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I know. I know. Don't you think I've heard them talk? They have such little time to do this dumb thing of theirs, this buttinsky thing. If we get her away. that Yeoman, that's one person less to start off with.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Masked Boy
Text: But how, Miri? If they're so busy, if they're going to have the big emergency, how are you going to get her away?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: It's easy. She's always asking me about the youngest little Onlies, little ones. What if they get sick, who takes care of them? Do they have enough to eat? Where do they sleep? I'll just tell her one of you fell down and got hurt.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Me. Say it's me.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: All right, you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: But Grups, they know things and all that. You know, I bet they'll be able to do it with one person less.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Not one, two. Because he'll try to find her.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Who? Who will, Miri?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: The Captain. He'll try to find her, but he won't. Mister Lovey-dovey.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Lovey-dovey. Bonk bonk on the head. Bonk bonk! bonk bonk!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Bonk bonk! Bonk bonk!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It looks right.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: The nitrogen cycle, it has to be.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But the question is, what's the dosage?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is a very good question.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is she, Miri? Where is she, Miri? Where's Janice?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: What's the matter with you? How should I know?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is she? Has something happened to her?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Don't you feel all right?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't feel all right! None of us feel all right! Can't you see what's going on?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Jim, I don't want anything to happen to you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got to find Janice.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's not all, Captain. We've got to find those communicators.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're trying, Mister Spock. We're trying very hard.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's not good enough! This could be it, but we can't test it without the ship's computers.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've got to have those communicators, Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the vaccine?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's what the computers will tell us.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Without them, it could be a beaker full of death.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you hear them? We only have a few hours left.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I don't care.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got to care. Miri, I'm going to tell you something. You, your friends, all the Onlies are going to get the disease unless we succeed in what we're doing. You've seen your friends get it.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Sometimes it happens.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not sometimes. All the times, Miri! As soon as you start growing up the way you are. Don't you know why you don't like to play games anymore, why you don't see your friends the way you used to? It's because you're becoming a young woman, and the moment you become a young woman, you get the disease. All of you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: That's not true. It just happens sometimes.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All the time, Miri! It's happening to you right now! Look at it. Look at it, Miri, it's in you!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No! No! No!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Blah, blah, blah!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: No, you got the wrong game. A teacher, I told you. Now, what does a teacher say, huh?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Yeah. Study, study, study, or bonk bonk, bad kid. (children all applaud)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: It's not funny.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: It's a foolie.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: What are you going to do with me?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: You think I'd tell you? Miri, you're not supposed to be here.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I know.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: What's the matter, something go wrong?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: Okay, then. Don't just stand there in the doorway, come on in.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Listen to him.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: You listen, Miri.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: I did. Why do you think I brought him here? Tell them, Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: Tell'em, Jim. Tell'em, Jim.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Tell'em, Jim! Tell'em, Jim! Tell'em, Jim! Tell'em, Jim!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Listen to me. Listen to me!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: No yelling in the classroom! Look at him, a very bad citizen.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This isn't a game. It never was a game.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Blonde Girl
Text: Call the police!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: I'm the police. Bonk bonk unless you're good.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: You're the teacher.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: I got two jobs. Bonk bonk!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Blah blah blah! Blah blah blah! Blah blah blah! Blah blah blah!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Listen to me! You've got our communicators, the boxes we talk into. We need them to talk to the ship.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Blah blah blah!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No blah blah blah! Because if we don't talk to the ship, if you don't help us, there won't be any games anymore. There won't be anything. Nothing, no Grups, no Onlies, nobody left forever and ever.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Context: sees boy with club coming up behind him
Text: Captain.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now listen to me. You've got to help us before it's too late. Let Janice go. Give me those communicators before it's too late.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Context: approaching menacingly
Text: Nyah na nyah, nyah na nyah, nyah na nyah, nyah na nyah.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've seen your friends change one by one as they grew up. Did you ever see one of them not change? One by one, they got the disease, and they became like, Iike those creatures you're afraid of, like Louise. One by one they changed and got the disease. The disease like I've got, like Miri has. You understand what I'm talking about. You're not babies. We can help you!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Naughty Grup. (starts hitting Kirk) Bonk bonk! Bonk bonk!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: No, please. No! (the other children join in as the little blonde girl watches, smiling)

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: bleeding
Text: It's waiting for you. It may only be a matter of months.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Listen to him. He's telling the truth.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: He's funny. He thinks he's funny.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Bonk bonk! Get him!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look at my arms! That's what's going to happen to you unless you let me help you.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Red Head Boy
Text: Bonk bonk! Hit him!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the little ones. What's going to happen to them after you've gone, after you've turned into creatures like Louise? Oh, they'll still be here, but not for long, because the food's all gone. You've eaten it. Maybe six months left, that's all, and then nothing left to eat, nobody left to take care of them. They'll die, too.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Look at my arm, Jahn. It's happening to me. He's telling the truth.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: They're Grups!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Children
Text: Bonk bonk! Bonk bonk! Bonk bonk! Bonk bonk!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, you want a foolie? All right. I dare you, I double-dare you. Look at the blood on my face. Now look at your hands. Blood on your hands. Now who's doing the hurting? Not the Grups, it's you hurting, yelling, maybe killing, just like the Grups you remember and creatures you're afraid of. You're acting like them, and you're going to be just like them unless you let me help you. I'm a Grup, and I want to help you. I'm begging you, let me help you or there won't be anything left at all. Please.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We can't wait for those communicators any longer.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: We must. The vaccine could be fatal.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The disease certainly is. How long do we have left? Hours, minutes? How much longer do you want to wait?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bickering is pointless. I'll check on the Captain's progress.

Title: Miri
Context: Spock leaves. McCoy picks up the hypospray and injects himself, then collapses in agony

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock!

Title: Miri
Speaker: Galloway
Text: Is he dead, Mister Spock?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not yet.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Context: with children and communicators
Text: Three hours, eleven minutes left. Thank you, Lieutenant. Keep this channel open. Clear your computers. What happened to him?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: He injected himself with the vaccine. He was unconscious when I found him.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look at his face.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: The blemishes are fading. They're fading. Who will understand the medical mind?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Jahn
Text: Is this supposed to be a good thing, Miri?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Miri
Text: Of course it is.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: They were just children. Simply to leave them there with a medical team

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just children, three hundred years old and more. I've already contacted Space Central. They'll send teachers, advisers.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And truant officers, I presume.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll be all right.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Rand
Text: Miri. She really loved you, you know.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I never get involved with older women, Yeoman. Mister Spock?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: Miri
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full ahead. Warp factor one.

Title: Miri
Speaker: Spock
Text: Warp factor one, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: On stage, a velvet-clad arm raises a bloody knife, then plunges it again into his sleeping victim. The audience are rapt.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting. An Arcturian Macbeth.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Context: a man with an eyepatch
Text: Watch him. Watch Macbeth.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Context: as Lady M
Text: Is he dead? Speak. Is King Duncan dead?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Will all great Neptune's ocean wash this blood clean from my hands.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: That voice. He's back. That man on the stage. I'm certain of it. That's Kodos the Executioner.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Pluck out mine eyes!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, star date 2817.6. Starship Enterprise diverted from scheduled course. Purpose, to confirm discover by Doctor Thomas Leighton of an extraordinary new synthetic food which would totally end the threat of famine on Cygnia Minor, a nearby Earth colony.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean to tell me you've called me three light years off my course just to accuse an actor of being Kodos?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: He is Kodos. I'm sure of it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said you discovered a new food concentrate. What am I supposed to put in my log, that you lied? That you diverted a starship with false information? You're not only in trouble, you've put me in trouble, too.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: I did it to trap Kodos!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kodos is dead.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: Is he? Is anyone sure? A body burned beyond recognition?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tom, the authorities closed the book on that case years ago.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: Then let's reopen it. Jim, four thousand people were butchered.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Martha, you tell him.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Martha
Text: I can't tell him anything, Jim. He's been like this since the company of actors arrived.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kodos is dead. I'm satisfied of that.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: Well, I'm not. I remember him. That voice. The bloody thing he did.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: He turns his head to reveal it's not just an eyepatch, but a covering over half his face

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: Jim, Jim, I need your help. There were only eight or nine of us who actually saw Kodos. I was one, you were another. If he's to be exposed,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's dead.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leighton
Text: Then it will be a ghost Martha and I receive in our home tonight. I invited the entire company to a cocktail party. I have to be sure.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And I have to get back to my ship and figure out how I'm going to enter all this in my log. Tom. Martha.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Library computer.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: History files. Subject, former Governor Kodos of Tarsus Four, also known as Kodos the Executioner. After that, background on actor Anton Karidian.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Kodos the Executioner, summary. Governor of Tarsus Four twenty Earth years ago. Invoked martial law. Slaughtered fifty percent of population Earth colony, that planet. Burned body found when Earth forces arrived. No positive identification. Case closed. Detailed information follows. On stardate 2794.7,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop. Information on Anton Karidian.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Director and star of travelling company of actors sponsored by galactic cultural exchange project, touring official installations last nine years. Has daughter, Lenore, nineteen years old,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop. Give comparative identification between actor Karidian and Governor Kodos.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: No identification records available on actor Anton Karidian.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give information on actor Karidian prior to Kodos' death.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: No information available, Anton Karidian, prior to twenty years ago

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Photograph Kodos. (an image of a red-haired man with a beard comes on the monitor) Photograph Karidian. (the grey-haired man with a small moustache) Now photograph both.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Door opens

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. You know Doctor Leighton, don't you? Would you say he's given to fantasy?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: A good empirical research scientist. Steady, reputable, occasionally brilliant.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With a very long memory.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have no information on that, Captain. We are ready to leave orbit.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll delay departure for a time. I'm beaming back down to the planet.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: The cocktail party is in full swing in the main room, and Martha is bringing another tray of drinks for her guests.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Tom?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Martha
Text: He went to town. He called. He's on his way back.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: The lovely young blonde Lenore Karidian enters, and Kirk beams

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The others are on the patio.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I take it you're the welcoming committee. (referring to his glass) Is that for me?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not? I saw your performance today. May I extend my appreciation?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: My father will be delighted, Mister. Mister?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain James Kirk, Starship Enterprise.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: We are honoured.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had hoped to meet your father, here, tonight, personally.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I'm sorry, Captain Kirk. He has a rigid rule about that. He never sees anyone personally, and he never attends parties.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An actor turning away his admirers? Very unusual.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Karidian is a most unusual man. You saw Macbeth. That was my father.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I'll talk to Lady Macbeth.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: They sit

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: So. Captain of the Enterprise. Interesting.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So, Lady Macbeth. Interesting. What's your next move?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: We play two performances at Benecia, if the AstraI Queen can get us there.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's a good ship. (takes a glass from a passing tray) Thank you. You were very impressive as Lady Macbeth.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Thank you. And as Lenore Karidian?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very impressive. Lenore. I'd like to see you again.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: You mean professionally?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not necessarily.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I think I'd like that. Unfortunately, we must keep a schedule.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't have a schedule now, do you?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: You mean leave? But I've only just arrived.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; So have I.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: And you hate to overstay a welcome.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Why not?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I'll make our apologies to our hostess. I'll meet you outside.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Meandering between rocks and scrubby trees, arm in arm

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Tired of walking?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: No. Just thinking.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: About what?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: At the party, you were such a brash young man.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; And now?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Now somehow different. Not a ship's Captain with all those people to be strong and confident in front of. You know, you're really very dear, aren't you? In some ways, very lonely.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: But just as their lips are about to meet, Kirk spots a body among the rocks and goes to investigate

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's Tom Leighton. He's dead.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Tom's body is laid out on the couch, and Martha covers it

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Martha
Text: At least he has peace now. He never really had that before. Oh, why was Tom killed if what he suspected wasn't true?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. I'll try and find out.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Martha
Text: Oh, Jim. How I'll miss him. (bursts into tears and leaves)

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge here, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put me through to Captain Jon Daily of the AstraI Queen on orbit station, and put it on scramble.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Daily's on, sir.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Jon? Jim Kirk.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Daily
Text: Hi, Jim.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you do me a favour?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Daily
Text: I owe you a dozen. Just ask.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't make your pick-up here.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Daily
Text: You mean strand all those actors?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll pick them up. And if there's any trouble, it'll be my responsibility.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Daily
Text: Will do. Anything else?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just keep this between the two of us and accept my thanks. Over and out. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge here, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter room, ready to beam up.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready to resume course, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think we're due for a pick-up.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: What kind? Personnel? Cargo?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain? A Miss Karidian has been transported aboard ship. She requests permission to see you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell her to come up to the Bridge, Lieutenant.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Escort Miss Karidian to the Bridge.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: How did you know this lady was coming aboard?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm the Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Captain Kirk, I didn't think we'd be meeting again so soon.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You probably wouldn't believe me if I told you I arranged it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: No, but it's a delightful thought. Captain, I'm afraid we need your help. We've been stranded. It seems that our transportation has cancelled out on us.

Title: The Conscience of the King
