Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't you make other arrangements?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Yes, but not in time. You see, our schedule is like a chain. One break and it all collapses.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It'd be a shame if that happened.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: If ever we needed a Good Samaritan.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I appeal to you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Spock's eyebrow hits the ceiling

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The regulations are very clear about taking on passengers.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I'll make a bargain with you, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you got to trade?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Special performance for the crew in exchange for a lift.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You make it sound very interesting. The crew has been on patrol for a long time. They could use a break in the monotony.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Then you'll do it?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got me backed into a corner. The men would never forgive me if I deprived them of your performance, and your presence.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Thank you, Captain. I'm eternally grateful. I'll get the company ready. This means so much to them.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, prepare to leave orbit as soon as the Karidian company is aboard the ship.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Lenore and her escort enter the turbolift

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I inquire as to our course, Captain?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Benecia Colony.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Benecia Colony is eight light years off our course.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If my memory needs refreshing, Mister Spock, I'll ask you for it. In the meantime, follow my orders.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 2818.9. There are many questions in my mind, too many, perhaps, about the actor Karidian and his daughter. For personal reasons, I'm almost afraid to learn the answers.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, ETA the Benecia Colony.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll arrive stardate 2825.3, Captain, approximately fifteen hundred Benecia time.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Kirk goes over to Spock's station and throws a few switches

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Library computer.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Data on question submitted to personnel files.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Data being received. Kodos file of all survivors. There are nine actual eye witnesses who can identify Kodos.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop. Give list.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Kirk, J., presently Enterprise Captain, Leighton, T., Moulton, E., Riley, K., Eames, D.,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop. Is that star service Lieutenant Kevin Riley?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative. Riley, Kevin. Presently assigned U.S.S. Enterprise communications section.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop. Mister Spock.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Kevin Riley in communications, I wish to have him transferred down to the engineering decks.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: He came up from engineering, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sending him back.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Any explanation? He's a fine young officer. He's bound to consider this transfer a disciplinary action.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't wish to discuss it, Mister Spock. Please follow my orders.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, the man on top walks a lonely street. The chain of command is often a noose.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spare me your philosophical metaphors, Doctor. The Captain is acting strangely. I'm asking if you've noticed.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Negative. Did you know this is the first time in a week I've had time for a drop of the true? Would you care for a drink, Mister Spock?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: My father's race was spared the dubious benefits of alcohol.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now I know why they were conquered. What are you so worried about, anyway? I find Jim generally knows what he's doing.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was illogical for him to bring those players aboard.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Illogical? Did you get a look at that Juliet? That's a pretty exciting creature. Of course your, personal chemistry would prevent you from seeing that. Did it ever occur to you that he simply might like the girl?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: It occurred. I dismissed it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You would.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did you know that he suddenly transferred Lieutenant Riley to engineering?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lots of things go on around here that I don't know, Mister Spock. Now, he's the Captain. He can transfer whoever he pleases. You can look that up in a hundred volumes of space regulations somewhere. All right? Come on, have a drink.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, thank you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're welcome. But I will. And please, Mister Spock, if you won't join me, don't disapprove of me. At least not until you've tried it, huh?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Lenore is getting a personal tour of the ship

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the observation deck. That's the flight deck down there with the shuttle craft.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Interesting.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't it?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Tell me, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Did you order the soft lights especially for the occasion?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I had ordered soft lights, I'd also have arranged for music and flowers. Unfortunately, it isn't so. On the Enterprise, we try to duplicate earth conditions of night and day as closely as possible.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Star light, star bright. I wish I may, I wish I might. Do you remember that, Captain?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's very old.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Almost as old as the stars themselves. And this ship. All this power, surging and throbbing, yet under control. Are you like that, Captain? All this power at your command, yet the decisions that you have to make

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come from a very human source.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Are you, Captain? Human?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can count on it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Tell me about the women in your world, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd rather talk about you. You must have wanted to perform since you first saw your father act. When was that?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: In the beginning.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me about it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: That's not fair. You haven't answered my question about the women.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would you like to know?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Has the machine changed them? Made them just people instead of women?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Worlds may change, galaxies disintegrate, but a woman always remains a woman.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: All this and power too. The Caesar of the stars and the Cleopatra to worship him.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Finally, a passionate embrace

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Spock is on duty, and thinking

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Library computer.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Full personal dossiers on the following names. Doctor Thomas Leighton, Anton Karidian, Lieutenant Kevin Riley, and Captain James T. Kirk.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Accomplished. Standing by.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correlate. Check their past histories. Report any item, any past episode or experience they all have in common.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I appreciate whatever concern you may have for the ship's company, Mister Spock,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: I will continue, Doctor. According to our library banks, it started on the Earth colony of Tarsus Four, when the food supply was attacked by an exotic fungus and largely destroyed. There were over eight thousand colonists and virtually no food. And that was when Governor Kodos seized full power and declared emergency martial law.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've heard of it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: You may not have heard it all. Kodos began to separate the colonists. Some would live, be rationed whatever food was left. The remainder would be immediately put to death. Apparently he had his own theories of eugenics.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unfortunately, he wasn't the first.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps not. But he was certainly among the most ruthless, to decide arbitrarily who would survive and who would not, using his own personal standards, and then to implement his decision without mercy. Children watching their parents die. Whole families destroyed. Over four thousand people. They died quickly, without pain, but they died. Relief arrived, but too late to prevent the executions. And Kodos? There never was a positive identification of his body.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What has Karidian to do with it?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: His history begins almost to the day where Kodos disappeared.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You think Jim suspects he's Kodos?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: He'd better. There were nine eye witnesses who survived the massacre, who'd actually seen Kodos with their own eyes. Jim Kirk was one of them. With the exception of Riley and Captain Kirk, every other eye witness is dead. And my library computer shows that wherever they were, on Earth, on a colony, or aboard ship, the Karidian Company of Players was somewhere near when they died.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's unbelievable.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: There's just one officer on duty, and he hasn't touched the meal lying on a plate nearby

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Hey. Rec room. Somebody.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Talk to me.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Matson
Text: Larry Matson here. Is that you, Riley?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Matson
Text: What's up?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Not me. I am down. In the engineering room.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Matson
Text: You've been a bad boy.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Maybe so. Whatever I've done, they're sure keeping it a secret from me.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Hey. Is that Uhura playing? Let me talk to her.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Matson
Text: I think his heart is sore.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What can I do for you, Riley?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: A song. Make it a love song. Just something to reassure me I'm not the only living thing left in the universe, huh?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Well, you're not, and I'll prove it to you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: sings) The skies are green and glowin

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Where my heart is

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Where my heart is

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Where the scented lunar flower is growing

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Somewhere beyond the stars

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Beyond Antares.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: As Riley listens, we see a shadow moving

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'll be back, though it takes forever

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Forever is just a day

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Forever is just another journey

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Engineering]

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Tomorrow a stop along the way

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Something gets squirted into Riley's milk

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Then let the years go fading

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Where my heart is

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Riley reaches for his tray

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Where my heart is

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Where my love eternal is waiting'

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Somewhere beyond the stars

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Beyond Antares.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: He drinks

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: How'd you like that, Riley?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: But Riley is sweating and choking

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: Help me, please.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: He collapses

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've got to pull him through.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not sure I can.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: If he dies, the only one who'll be able to identify Kodos is the Captain. And he'll be the next target.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 2819.1. Ship's officer Riley's condition worsening. Doctor McCoy making lab analysis to determine cause and antidote. Entire crew deeply concerned.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As of this date, lab report indicates presence of appreciable amount of tetralubisol, a highly volatile lubricant in use aboard ship.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Someone tried to poison him.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tetralubisol us a milky substance. Someone could have gotten careless, made a mistake.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't believe that and neither do you. I want the Captain to see that report.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: When I've finished logging it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My report on Lieutenant Riley.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will he make it?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's got a good chance.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can we predict the same for you, Captain?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Spock. Let's have it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Riley was a witness. So were you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Someone tried to kill him.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could have been an accident.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: You should be told the difference between empiricism and stubbornness, Doctor. I checked with the library computer, just as you did. I got the same information.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't you getting a little out of line, Mister Spock? My personal business,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is my personal business when it might interfere with the smooth operation of this ship.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You think that happened?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could happen.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't like anyone meddling in my private affairs. Not even my second in command.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, Spock's simply trying,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know what he's doing, and I don't like it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's his job, and you know it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you also know that nothing is proven.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even in this corner of the galaxy, Captain, two plus two equals four. Almost certainly an attempt will be made to kill you. Why do you invite death?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not. I'm interested in justice.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you? Are you sure it's not vengeance?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm not sure. I wish I was. I've done things I've never done before. I've placed my command in jeopardy. From here on I've got to determine whether or not Karidian is Kodos.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: He is.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You sound certain. I wish I could be. Before I accuse a man of that, I've got to be. I saw him once, twenty years ago. Men change. Memory changes. Look at him now, he's an actor. He can change his appearance. No. Logic is not enough. I've got to feel my way, make absolutely sure.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What if you decide he is Kodos? What then? Do you play God, carry his head through the corridors in triumph? That won't bring back the dead, Jim.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but they may rest easier.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: A scene break, during which McCoy apparently leaves

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logic, Captain. Doctor Leighton was murdered while the Karidian Company was on Planet Q. Now an attempt has been made against Riley while the company is on board the Enterprise.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc isn't sure it was a murder attempt. Besides, I have an idea may prove

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Shh. Listen. Do you hear it? That low hum.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A phaser.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: On overload. (starts searching)

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. There's a phaser on overload in my quarters. If it blows, it'll take out the entire deck. Evacuate all personnel in this quadrant. Double Red Alert. (now starts searching himself) You get out of here.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: You can't stay.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on. Block off this section. Hurry. I'll find it.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evacuate this section. Seal it off. Clear section C4 and C5.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: In Kirk's quarters the noise gets louder, and finally he sees the phaser silhouetted against the Red Alert light high in a bulkhead. He gets it, dashes into the corridor and drops it into a convenient pressure waste disposal unit directly opposite. Spock returns in time for the bang that throws them against the opposite wall

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Context: barging in without knocking
Text: We're overdue for our talk, aren't we?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I hoped you would have respected my privacy, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A moment ago, we narrowly averted an explosion which would have destroyed several decks of this ship. Before that, someone tried to poison one of my crewmen.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I am sorry to hear that.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sure you are. Are you Kodos? I asked you a question.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Do you believe that I am?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I do.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Then I am Kodos, if it pleases you to believe so. I am an actor. I play many parts.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're an actor now. What were you twenty years ago?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Younger, Captain. Much younger.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So was I. But I remember. Let's see if you do. Read this into that communicator on the wall. It will be recorded and compared to a piece of Kodos' voice film we have in our files. The test is virtually infallible. It will tell us whether you're Karidian, or Kodos the Executioner. (switches on comm.) Ready for voice test. Disguising your voice will make no difference.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Context: reading) The revolution is successful, but survival depends on drastic measures. Your continued existence represents a threat to the well-being of society. (stops looking at the paper
Text: Your lives means slow death to the more valued members of the colony. Therefore I have no alternative but to sentence you to death. Your execution is so ordered. Signed, Kodos, governor of Tarsus Four.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I remember the words. I wrote them down. You said them like you knew them. You hardly glanced at the paper.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I learn my parts very quickly.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure? Are you sure you didn't act this role out in front of a captive audience whom you blasted out of existence without mercy?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I find your use of the word mercy strangely inappropriate, Captain. Here you stand, the perfect symbol of our technical society. Mechanised, electronicised, and not very human. You've done away with humanity, the striving of man to achieve greatness through his own resources.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've armed man with tools. The striving for greatness continues. But Kodos

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Kodos, whoever he was

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or is.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Or is. Kodos made a decision of life and death. Some had to die that others might live. You're a man of decision, Captain. You ought to understand that.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All I understand is that four thousand people were needlessly butchered.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: In order to save four thousand others. And if the supply ships hadn't come earlier than expected, this Kodos of yours might have gone down in history as a great hero.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But he didn't. And history has made its judgment.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: If you're so sure that I'm Kodos, why not kill me now? Let bloody vengeance take its final course! And see what difference it makes to this universe of yours.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those beautiful words, well acted, change nothing.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I suppose not. They're merely tools, like this ship of yours.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are no previous records to Anton Karidian prior to twenty years ago.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Blood thins. The body fails. One is finally grateful for a failing memory. I no longer treasure life, not even my own. I am tired! And the past is a blank. Did you get everything you, wanted, Captain Kirk?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I had gotten everything I wanted, you might not walk out of this room alive.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: She enters from the next room

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Context: to Karidian
Text: You'd better rest now. There's a stain of cruelty on your shining armour, Captain. You could have spared him, and me. You talked of using tools. I was a tool, wasn't l? A tool to use against my father.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In the beginning perhaps. But later, I wanted it to be more than that.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Later. Everything's always later. Later. Latest. Too late. Too late, Captain. You are like your ship, powerful, and not human. There is no mercy in you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If he is Kodos, then I've shown him more mercy than he deserves. And if he isn't, then we'll let you off at Benecia, and no harm done.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Captain Kirk. Who are you to say what harm was done?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who do I have to be?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Kevin is pacing up and down in the background, overhearing what is being dictated

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Medical log. Lieutenant Riley's sufficiently recovered to be discharged, but the Captain's ordered him restricted to Sickbay to prevent contact with the passenger who calls himself Karidian and who's suspected of being Kodos the Executioner and of murdering the Lieutenant's family.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 2819.8. Suspect under surveillance. Strategic areas under double guard. Performance of the Karidian Players taking place as scheduled.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Context: on stage
Text: Tonight, the Karidian Players present Hamlet, another in a series of living plays presented in space, dedicated to the tradition of classic theatre. Hamlet is a violent play about violent times when life was cheap and ambition was God.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Two pieces of paper are lined up on his desk

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe we have a match, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not an exact match, Mister Spock. We're dealing with a man's life. No machine can make that decision.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In the long history of medicine, no doctor has ever caught the first few minutes of a play. Riley, don't forget to

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: but he's not there

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Riley? Captain Kirk, McCoy here.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Riley's gone. I was recording my log about Karidian and Kodos. If he overheard

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've made your point, Doctor.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Security
Text: Captain? Security, H deck, The weapons locker has been broken into. One phaser is missing.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. Security two alert. Find and restrain Lieutenant Kevin Riley. He's armed and possibly headed towards the ship's theatre.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: The Ghost summons Hamlet

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Hamlet
Text: Whither wilt thou lead me? Speak, I'll go no further.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KARIDIAN Mark me.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Hamlet
Text: I will.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Kirk comes creeping around backstage

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: My hour is almost come, when I to sulphurous and tormenting fires must render up myself.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Hamlet
Text: Speak. I am bound to hear.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: So art thou to revenge, when thou shalt hear. I am thy father's spirit, doomed for a certain term to walk the night,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Kirk spots Kevin with the phaser

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Riley, get back to the Sickbay.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: He murdered my father, and my mother.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could be wrong. Don't throw away your life on a mistake.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: I'm not wrong.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: But that I am forbid to tell the secrets of my prison house,

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Riley
Text: I know that voice, that face, I know it. I saw it. He murdered them.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Thy soul, freeze thy young blood.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's an order. Give me the weapon.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Takes it from Riley

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now get back to Sickbay. Go on.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Riley leaves, and there is polite applause at the end of the scene on stage. Karidian comes backstage.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: It's going beautifully. What is it? What's wrong?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: There was a voice out of the past haunting me, torturing me. There was another part I once played long ago. I never told you about it. Now that same curtain rises again. The time has come.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: No, Father. The time will never come. Tonight, after my performance, the last two who can harm you will be gone.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: What are you saying?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: There were nine. Now there are only two, and they will be gone as soon as I. Don't look at me like that.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: What have you done?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: What had to be done. They had to be silenced.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: All of them? All seven? More blood on my hands?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: No Father, not anymore. I'm strong, Father. It's nothing.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Stagehand
Text: Second act, three minutes.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: We'll be ready. Don't you see? All the ghosts are dead. I've buried them. There's no more blood on your hands.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Oh, my child, my child. You've left me nothing! You were the one thing in my life untouched by what I'd done.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: But you're safe now, Father. I've saved you. Now, no one can touch you. Not even Captain Kirk. See Caesar come? He's awed by your greatness, your shining brightness. Bright as a blade before it is stained with blood.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bright as a blade. Come with me, both of you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Of course. After the play.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The play is over. It's been over for twenty years.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: I was a soldier in a cause. There were things to be done, terrible things.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Stop it, Father! You have nothing to justify.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Murder, flight, suicide, madness. I never wanted the blood on my hands ever to stain you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: I did it for you. I've saved you.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By killing seven innocent men.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: They weren't innocent! They were dangerous! I would have killed a world to save him!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Stagehand
Text: Curtain going up, one minute.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: Kirk takes Karidian's arm

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: The play, Captain. He must go on. This is the great Karidian.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Guard.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: You cannot deny him his last performance!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: She grabs the security guard's phaser and runs out onto the stage

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: Lenore, don't!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll never get off the ship.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: It will become a floating tomb, drifting through space with the soul of the great Karidian giving performances at every star he touches. (Kirk moves towards her) I know how to use this, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: No.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Caesar, beware the ides of March.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Karidian
Text: No, child! Don't!

Title: The Conscience of the King
Context: As she squeezes the trigger, her father steps in front of Kirk, and takes the shot himself. Lenore screams at what she has done. and Kirk takes the phaser from her as she kneels over Karidian's body

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Lenore
Text: Father. Father! O, proud, death! What feast is toward in thine eternal cell, that thou, such a prince at a shot so bloodily hast struck? The curtain, the curtain rises. It rises. There's no time to sleep. The play. The play. The play's the thing, wherein we'll catch the conscience of the king.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Medical report. (hands it over) She'll receive the best of care, Jim. She remembers nothing. She even thinks her father's still alive giving performances before cheering crowds. You really cared for her, didn't you?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready to leave Benecia orbit, Captain.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Leslie. All channels cleared, Uhura?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All channels clear, sir.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whenever you're ready, Mister Leslie.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Leslie
Text: Leaving orbit, sir.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're not going to answer my question, are you?

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead warp factor one, Mister Leslie.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's an answer.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2821.5. On route to Makus Three with a cargo of medical supplies. Our course leads us past Murasaki 312, a quasar-like formation, vague, undefined. A priceless opportunity for scientific investigation. On board is Galactic High Commissioner Ferris, overseeing the deliver of the medicines to Makus Three.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to shuttlecraft Galileo. Stand by, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I remind you, Captain, I'm entirely opposed to this delay. Your mission is to get those emergency medical supplies to Makus Three in time for their transfer to the New Paris colonies.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No problem, Commissioner. And may I remind you that I have standing orders to investigate all quasars and quasar-like phenomena wherever they may be encountered. Besides, it's three days to Makus. And the rendezvous doesn't take place for five.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I don't like to take chances. The plague is out of control on New Paris. We must get those drugs there on time.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No problem. Captain to Galileo. All systems cleared for take off.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The NCC1701/7 is in the hangar bay preparing to launch.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Power up. All instruments activated. All readings normal. All go.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch shuttlecraft.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The curved doors at the stern of the engineering deck open, and the little vessel heads out into space

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Readings normal. Acceleration normal. Phase one separation normal.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Position?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: Three point seven. Sir, I

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Make up your mind please, Mister Latimer.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: Sir, this indicator's gone crazy.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: That's to be expected, Mister Spock. Quasars are extremely disruptive. Just how much, we don't know.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Considerably, Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Mister Spock, radiation is increasing.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stop forward momentum, Mister Latimer.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: I can't, sir. Nothing happens.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Galileo to Enterprise. Galileo to Enterprise. Come in, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Ionic interference, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're being drawn right into it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Galileo to Enterprise. Galileo to Enterprise. We are out of control, being pulled directly into the heart of Murasaki three one two. Being hit by violent radiation on outer hull. Course three point two five

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything at all?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing clear, Captain. Just a few words about being pulled off course.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try and get me a fix on the Galileo.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Scanners are blank, Captain. We're getting a mass of readings I've never seen. Nothing makes sense.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Kirk switches on Spock's science computer

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Computer
Text: Negative ionic concentration one point six four times ten to the ninth power metres, Radiation wave length three hundred seventy angstroms. Harmonics upward along entire spectrum.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: What is it, Captain?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That thing out there has ionized this complete sector. None of our instruments work. At least four complete solar systems in the immediate vicinity. And out there somewhere, a twenty four foot shuttlecraft, off course, out of control. Finding a needle in a haystack would be child's play.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2821.7. The electromagnetic phenomenon known as Murasaki Three Twelve whirls like some angry blight in space, a depressive reminder that seven shipmates still have not been heard from. Equally bad, the effect has rendered our normal searching systems useless. Without them, we are blind and almost helpless.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: A Yeoman is delivering cups of coffee

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I was opposed to this from the very beginning. Our flight to Makus Three is of the very highest priority.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm aware of that, Commissioner. At the same time I have certain scientific duties I must perform, and investigating the Murasaki effect is one.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Yes, but you've lost your crew.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have two days to find them.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Two days? ln all that? Two days?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would you have me do, turn around and leave them there?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You shouldn't have sent them out in the first place. (Do you know what you've done? You've concerned yourself with only seven people.)

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, there's one planet in this solar system capable of sustaining human life. It's type M, oxygen, nitrogen, and it's listed as Taurus Two. It's unexplored. As far as we can determine with our equipment malfunction, it's just about dead-centre of the Murasaki effect.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant. Mister Sulu.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set course for Taurus Two.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: FERRIS: You said something about a needle in a haystack. It's useless

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If they're not there, Commissioner, then they're dead by now.)

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Shuttlecraft Galileo appears to have landed in one piece in a rocky landscape. It's contents have been rather shaken about and many are holding their heads.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You all right?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Context: Holding his right wrist
Text: Yes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty? Boma?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Now that's what I call a ride.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeoman?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Yes. I just got a little bump on the head.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: helping her back into her seat
Text: Upsy-daisy.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: I can't be sure, but I'd say that, the magnetic potential of the effect was (McCoy gives him a tissue for his nose bleed) Thank you. Was such that, as we gathered speed, it was multiplied geometrically. And we were simply shot into the centre of the effect. Like a projectile.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'd say your evaluation is reasonable, Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: What a mess.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Picturesque descriptions will not mend broken circuits, Mister Scott. I think you'll find your work is cut out for you. Galileo to Enterprise. Galileo to Enterprise. Come in, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: You don't really expect to get an answer, do you?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I expect nothing, Mister Scott. It is merely logical to try all the alternatives. Doctor McCoy, a reading on the atmosphere, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Partial pressure of oxygen, seventy millimetres of mercury. Nitrogen one forty. Breathable, if you're not running in competition.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just the facts, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Traces of argon, neon, krypton, all in acceptable quantities. However, I wouldn't recommend this place as a summer resort.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you for your opinion. It will be duly noted. You're recording this, Yeoman?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Of course, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, if you'll make a survey of the damage, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Logical.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, I think we should move outside, make room for Mister Scott to do his work. Mister Latimer, Mister Gaetano, you'll arm yourselves and scout out the area, keeping in visual contact with the ship.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The two men go outside, and the doors close behind them

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you think our chances are of contacting the Enterprise?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Under present conditions, extremely poor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But they'll be looking for us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: If the ionisation effect is as widespread as I believe it is, Doctor, they'll be searching for us without instrumentation, by visual contact only. On those terms, this is a very large planet.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then you don't think they'll find us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not as long as we're grounded. We may be here for a very long time, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Enterprise is orbiting a sickly green swirled planet, and Commissioner Ferris is lounging by the door, watching Uhura working.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything on your scanners?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Totally inoperative, sir. No readings at all.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you tried tying in to the auxiliary power?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. No change.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transport room, this is the captain speaking. Are the transporters beaming up yet?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Chief
Text: Not one hundred percent, Captain. We beamed down some inert material, but it came back in a disassociated condition. We wouldn't dare try with people.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. This is the captain speaking. Flight deck, prepare Columbus for immediate exit, for a search of the planet surface. Correlate co-ordinates with Mister Sulu. Thank you. Anything, Uhura?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All wavelengths dominated by ionisation effects, sir. Transmission is blocked, reception impossible.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Well, Captain?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have until 2823.8 to continue the search, Commissioner.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You don't really think you'll have any luck, do you?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look, these people are my friends and my shipmates. I intend to continue the ship's search for them until the last possible moment.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Very well, Captain, but not one second beyond that moment. Is that clear? If it isn't, I suggest you look at book nineteen, section four thirty three, paragraph twelve.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm familiar with the regulations, Commissioner. I know all about your authority. Launch shuttlecraft Columbus.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Spock is scanning one of it's small nacelles when McCoy comes out to join him.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I can't say much for the circumstances, but at least it's your big chance.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: My big chance? For what, Doctor?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Command. Oh, I know you, Mister Spock. You've never voiced it, but you've always thought that logic was the best basis on which to build command. Am I right?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am a logical man, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It'll take more than logic to get us out of this.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps, Doctor, but I know of no better way to begin. I realise command does have its fascinations, even under circumstances such as these. But I neither enjoy the idea of command, nor am I frightened of it. It simply exists. And I will do whatever logically needs to be done. Excuse me.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: he heads back inside

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Very bad, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: In what way?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've lost a great deal of fuel. We have no chance at all to reach escape velocity. And if we ever hope to make orbit, we'll have to lighten our load by at least five hundred pounds.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: The weight of three grown men.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, you could put it that way.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Or the equivalent weight in equipment.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy, with very few exceptions we use virtually every piece of equipment aboard this craft in attaining orbit. There's very little excess weight, except among the passengers.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: You mean three of us must stay behind.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unless the situation changes radically, yes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: And who's to choose?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: As commanding officer, the choice will be mine.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: You wouldn't be interested in drawing lots?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very quaint idea, Mister Boma, but I do believe I'm better qualified to make the selection than any random drawing of lots.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: All right, Mister Spock. Who?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: My choice will be a logical one, arrived at through logical means.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, life and death are seldom logical.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: But attaining a desired goal always is, Doctor. Now gentlemen, I suggest we move outside to make a further examination of the hull in the event we've overlooked any minor damage.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Spock leaves

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: If any minor damage was overlooked, it was when they put his head together.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not his head, Mister Boma, his heart. His heart.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Latimer and Gaetano are investigating a strange scraping sound, but the mist is obscuring their vision.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: What is it?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: II don't know. It's from up there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: No, it's from back there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: It's everywhere. It's all around us!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Latimer
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: They go to the top of the ridge, and Latimer stands up. Someone throws a large flint-tipped spear into his back, and he falls. The scream is heard back at the shuttlecraft

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come on, Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Gaetano fires his phaser at several different enemies. The spear in Latimer's back is taller than a man

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: What was it?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: It was something huge, terrible. Up there. I think I hit it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Did you see what it was?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Vaguely. It was like a giant ape.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Poor Latimer.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: At least it was quick for him.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: We'll get off all right.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Context: returns from investigating
Text: Nothing there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: I tell you there was.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't doubt your word.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: But there must be something. I swear I hit it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Context: pulling the bloody spear from Latimer's body and examining it
Text: Folsom Point.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Sir?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a remarkable resemblance to the Folsom Point discovered in 1925, old world calendar, New Mexico, North America. A bit more crude about the shaft, I believe. Not very efficient.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Not very efficient? Is that all you have to say?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Am I in error, Mister Boma?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: You? Error? Impossible.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then what, Mister Boma?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: There's a man lying there dead, and you talk about stone spears. What about Latimer?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: My concern for the dead will not bring him back to life, Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Mister Spock. In the interest of efficiency, I don't think we should leave his body here.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bringing him back to the ship should not interfere with our repair efforts. If you need assistance, I

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: We'll do it. Give me a hand with Latimer, will you?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2822.3. We continue to search, but I find it more difficult each moment to ward off a sense of utter futility and great loss.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the Columbus has returned from searching quadrant seven seven nine X by five three four M. Results negative.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have them proceed to the next quadrant. Any word from engineering on our sensors?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They're working on them, sir. Still inoperable.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the transporters?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They're still reported unsafe.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Commissioner?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I don't relish the thought of abandoning your crewmen out there, however I must remind you

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I haven't forgotten, Commissioner.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You're running out of time.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I haven't forgotten that, Commissioner. This is the captain. Try using overload power on the transporters. We've got to get them working.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Chief
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura, order the Columbus to open its course two degrees on every lap from now on.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But Captain, two degrees means they'll be overlooking more than a dozen terrestrial miles on each search loop.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It also means we have a fighting chance to cover the majority of the planet's surface. Mind your helm, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Context: stepping into the turbolift
Text: Twenty four more hours, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps if you were to channel the second auxiliary tank through the primary intake valve.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's too delicate. It may not be able to take the pressure as it is.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: coming in from rear compartment
Text: This should save us at least fifty pounds, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Excellent, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: We should be able to scrape up another hundred pounds.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which would still leave us at least one hundred and fifty pounds overweight.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't believe you're serious about leaving someone behind. Now whatever it is that's out there

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is more rational to sacrifice one life than six, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not talking about rationality.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: You might be wise to start.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Context: looking in from outside
Text: Mister Spock. we're ready.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: For what?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: The services for Latimer.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Boma, we're working against time.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: The man's dead. He deserves a decent burial. You're the captain. A few words.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, perhaps you know the correct words for such an occasion.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, that's your place.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: My place is here. If you please, Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now look. We may all die here. At least let us die like men, not machines.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: By dealing with first things first, I hope to increase our chances of staying alive. Well, Mister Scott.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: If you'll give me a hand with this conduit.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Boma closes the door and leaves them to it

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: later

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Pressure's dropping. We're losing everything.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: What happened?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: One of the lines gave. The strain of coming through the atmosphere and the added load when we tried to bypass. Yes, that's done it. We have no fuel.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would seem to solve the problem of who to leave behind. Consider the alternatives, Mister Scott.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: We have no fuel! What alternatives?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, there are always alternatives.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock! Something's happening outside.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: They crouch down behind a rock while Spock stands and listens to that scraping sound

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do those supersensitive ears make of that, Mister Spock?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Wood rubbing on some kind of leather.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: They're getting ready. They'll attack.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Not necessarily. It could be a simple tribal rite, assuming a tribal culture.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not a tribal culture. Their artefacts are too primitive. More likely a loose association of some sort.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: If we knew more about them

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: We know enough. If they're tribal, they'll have a sense of unity. We can use that.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: How, Mister Boma?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: By hitting them hard. Give them a bloody nose. Make them think twice about attacking us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Yes, I agree. If we stand by and do nothing, we're just giving them an invitation to come down and slaughter us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm frequently appalled by the low regard you Earthmen have for life.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Well, we're practical about it. I say we hit them before they hit us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Boma?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Absolutely.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Seems logical to me.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It does, indeed. It seems logical to me, also. But to take life indiscriminately,

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: The majority.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not interested in the opinion of the majority, Mister Gaetano. Components must be weighed. Our danger to ourselves as well as our duties to other life forms, friendly or not. There's a third course.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: That could get us killed.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think not. Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: You and Yeoman Mears return to the ship. Assist Mister Scott in any way possible. We'll be back shortly.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Mears and McCoy leave

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, you'll follow my orders to the letter, firing only when so instructed, and at my designated targets.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Now you're talking.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll fire to frighten, Mister Gaetano, not to kill.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: Oh, for the. You saw what they did to Latimer!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am in command, Mister Gaetano. The orders and the responsibility will be mine. Follow me.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The trio are paddling through dry ice when a giant spear is thrown across their path. Spock fires at one assailant, who throws his shield at them too. They move on a little way.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: The mists. I can't see them.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I hear them. They're directly ahead of us. Several, I believe. Direct your phasers to two o'clock and to ten o'clock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: I say we hit them dead on.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I know. But fortunately, I'm giving the orders. Take aim please, and fire when I give a signal.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: He climbs partway up a rock, for a better view.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fire. (several seconds of sustained phaser beam) Cease fire. (It's gone quiet) They should think twice before bothering us again.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Gaetano
Text: I still say we should have killed them.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was not necessary. Fear will do for us what needs to be done. Mister Boma, you will return with me to the Galileo. Mister Gaetano, you remain on guard here. Keep in contact with the ship.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Boma says a silent goodbye to his colleague, and the noise starts up again

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Did you find them?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, we found them. They won't bother us again.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I hope not. Scotty has an idea.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's dangerous, but it might work.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Go, Mister Scott.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can adjust the main reactor to function with a substitute fuel supply.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's all very well, but we don't have a substitute supply.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, we do. Our phasers. I can adapt them and use their energy. It'll take time, but it's possible.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Trouble is, they happen to be our only defence.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: They would also seem to be our only hope.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Context: after brief thought
Text: Yeoman, your phaser.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: But what if the creatures attack again?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: They won't attack for at least several hours. By then, with luck, we'll be gone.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: If I can get a full load, we should be able to achieve orbit with all hands. Not that we can maintain it long.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: We don't have to maintain it very long, Mister Scott. In less than twenty four hours, the Enterprise will be forced to abandon its search in order to make a rendezvous. If we can't maintain orbit after that time, it won't make any difference. If we burn up in a decaying orbit or die here on the planet's surface, we shall surely die. Doctor, your phaser. Go to work, Mister Scott.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: A bunch of boxes is beamed aboard

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Chief
Text: They came back all right, sir. In my opinion, the transporters are now safe for human transport.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. This is the captain. Landing parties one, two, and three, report to transporter room for immediate beaming down to surface of the planet. Ordinance condition One A.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Chief
Text: Captain, it's a big planet. It'll be sheer luck if our landing parties find anything.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm depending on luck, Lieutenant. It's almost the only tool we have that'll work.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Gaetano has worked himself up into a panic when a rock knocks his phaser out of his hand. Then a spear is thrown, and finally the giant creature comes for the helpless man

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Spock, Boma and McCoy arrive on the scene a little later, and examine the marks in the ground. Spock picks up the dropped phaser

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Take this back to Mister Scott for conversion, please Doctor.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Nobody knows what's happened to Gaetano, and you hand over his phaser like nothing's happened at all.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Context: handing over his own phaser
Text: And give this to Mister Scott in the event I don't return.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just where are you going?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a certain scientific curiosity about what's become of Mister Gaetano. Return to the ship, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Spock leaves

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know. He'll risk his neck locating Gaetano and if he finds him, he's just as liable to order him to stay behind. You tell me.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Do you really think the ship will ever leave?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it won't unless we get these phasers back.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Further on, Spock finds Gaetano's body draped over a rock. He picks him up in a fireman's lift and heads back to the shuttlecraft with him. Spears are thrown. McCoy and Boma help him get the body inside.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Scott is still lying in the middle of the floor, working

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Mister Spock, they didn't stay frightened very long, did they?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most illogical reaction. We demonstrated our superior weapons. They should have fled.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean they should have respected us?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Of course.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, respect is a rational process. Did it ever occur to you they might react emotionally, with anger?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I am not responsible for their unpredictability.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They were perfectly predictable to anyone with feeling. You might as well admit it, Mister Spock, your precious logic brought them down on us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Why haven't they done anything?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're studying us, for the moment.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Another prediction, Mister Spock?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: My opinion, Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The shuttlecraft shakes as one of the locals starts battering it with a rock

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Seal the windows!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Studying us, Mister Spock? They seem to learn rather quickly.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: All right, Spock, you have all the answers. What now?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Boma, your tone is increasingly hostile.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: My tone isn't the only thing that's hostile, Mister Spock!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Curious. Most illogical.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: I'm sick and tired of your logic!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: We could use a little inspiration.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strange. Step by step, I have made the correct and logical decisions. And yet two men have died.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And you've brought our furry friends down on us.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do seem to have miscalculated regarding them, and inculcated resentment on your parts. The sum of the parts cannot be greater than the whole.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MCCOY A little less analysis and more action. That's what we need, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: How much longer, Mister Scott?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Another hour, maybe two.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That won't be long enough.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor, a phaser can only drain so fast.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: How long do you think those plates will hold out under this? We've got to do something!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: You've got your hands full.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2823.1. Our landing parties are on the surface of Taurus Two. We continue to hope. Instruments are slowly returning to an operable condition as the ion storm slowly disperses. On the ship, we can only wait helplessly.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What word from the sensor section?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: At last report they were getting some readings

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not interested in the last report. I want to know now.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You have two hours and forty three minutes, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm perfectly aware of how much time I have left.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I'm delighted. However I shall continue to remind you.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do that.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, sensor section reporting. Static interference still creating false images. Estimates eighty percent undependable.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about radio communication?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Clearing slowly. Still incapable of transmission or reception.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: What do you intend to do?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do? I intend to continue the search. Foot by foot, inch by inch, by candlelight if necessary, until the last possible moment. And if you'd keep your nose off my bridge, I'd be thankful.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: I'm sure the authorities will be pleased by your diligence, Captain. I'm not sure they'll appreciate the way you address a High Commissioner.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm in command here, Mister Ferris.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You are, Captain. For another two hours and forty two minutes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, how much power do we have left in the ship's batteries?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're in good shape, but they won't lift us off, if that's what you're getting at.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Will they electrify the exterior of this ship?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: That they will, Mister Spock!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: He dashes to the rear compartment and puts on big rubber gloves

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Get to the centre of the ship. Don't touch the plates. Be sure you're insulated. Stand by. Are you ready, Scott?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: All right. Go. (Scott uses a spanner or something to short out the battery connections) Again! Again!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: It goes quiet and still outside

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: I daren't use any more. Not and be sure of ignition.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe we've used enough. Mister Scott. I suggest you continue draining the phasers.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It must've worked.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: For the moment.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: For the moment?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: The moment they discover they're not seriously hurt, they'll be back. Meanwhile, please check the aft compartment. See if there's anything you can unload to lighten the ship.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Mister Gaetano's body's back there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will of course have to be left behind.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Not without a burial.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wouldn't recommend it. The creatures won't be far away.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: Not without a burial, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would expose members of this crew to unnecessary peril.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: I'll take that chance. You see, Mister Spock, I would insist upon a decent burial even if your body was back there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: I'm sick and tired of this machine!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's enough!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen. All right, Mister Boma, you'll have your burial, provided the creatures will permit it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, landing party number two has been beamed back aboard ship. They have casualties. One dead, two injured.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Context: going to Spock's station
Text: Put Lieutenant Kelowitz on visual.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: Kelowitz, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: His uniform is dirty and he sounds tired

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: We were attacked, Captain. Huge, furry creatures. I checked with astral anthropology, and they're order 480G, anthropoid. Similar to life forms discovered on Hansen's Planet, but much larger. Ten, twelve feet in height.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are casualties?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: Ensign O'Neal got a spear through the body before we even knew they were around. Lieutenant lmmamura has a dislocated shoulder and severe lacerations, but he'll make it all right. Captain, the creatures are all over the place. If the Galileo is down on that planet, I

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant. You'd better report to Sickbay yourself.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Commissioner Ferris enters

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: Captain Kirk, check your chronometer. You'll see that it is 2823.8. Your time is up.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But they're still out there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: So are the plague victims on New Paris. I'm sorry, Captain. I now assume authority granted me under Title fifteen, Galactic Emergency Procedures, and I order you to abandon search.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
