Text: The Columbus hasn't returned yet. I still have two search parties out.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Ferris
Text: You're procrastinating, Captain. You have your orders. Recall your search parties and proceed to Makus Three immediately.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Order the transporter room to immediately beam up the two search parties from the surface. Attempt to contact the Columbus.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm in partial contact with them now, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then have them return immediately. Mister Sulu, prepare to abandon search. Set course for Makus Three.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplement. The search parties have returned to the ship, and the Columbus is on its way back. I have been compelled to abandon the search.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the sensor section says the beams are working again.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the other systems?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir. Too much interference.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, course set for Makus Three.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand ready, Mister Sulu. How long before the Columbus comes on board?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Twenty three minutes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Twenty three minutes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: Enterprise, this is Galileo. Come in, please. Enterprise. Nothing, sir. Just ionic interference.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: How about weight?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: If we shed every ounce, we might be able to achieve orbit.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: And how long can we hold it?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: A few hours, no longer. But if we time it right, we can cut out of orbit and save enough fuel for a controlled re=entry.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: To land here again? Not a very attractive possibility.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: We have very few alternatives, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy. Mister Boma. When can we lift off, Scott?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Maybe eight minutes if the weight's right.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: McCoy appears from the aft compartment

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, The ship will lift off in exactly ten minutes. You have that long to bury Mister Gaetano. Now, it appears to be clear outside, at least for the moment. I'll assist you. Hurry.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The Columbus is aboard, sir. The flight hatch is closed. Transporter room reports last of the landing parties have beamed safely up. All systems report secured for warp factors.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, proceed on course for Makus Three, at space normal speed.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Space normal, sir?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those are my orders. Lieutenant Uhura, order all sensor sections to direct beams aft. Full function, continuous operation until further orders.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Shuttlecraft]

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: From our viewpoint inside, we see the three men standing by two mounds of soil when giant spears start landing near them

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Get into the ship! Immediate lift off!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: He throws a spear back, then gets pinned against a rock outcrop by a thrown boulder

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: No! Go back! Lift off! Go back! No!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: But Boma and McCoy ignore his orders and free him

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: All right, All right! Go! Go! Go! Go!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: They all get safely into the shuttlecraft

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Go, Scott!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: I told you to lift off!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't be a fool, Mister Spock. We couldn't leave you out there.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Get us off, Scott!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: We should be moving, but we're not.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite right, Mister Scott. There's somebody holding us down. All systems are go, but we're not moving.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Throws switches on the pilot's panel

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: What are you doing?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our boosters.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll never be able to hold orbit.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Would you rather stay here?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: They swap seats

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: We're moving!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: They let go!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We got off!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I remind you we have yet to achieve orbit, nor can we maintain it long. An hour from now we may be right back where we started from.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The Galileo leaves the sickly yellow and green atmosphere of the planet

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, by coming after me, you may well have destroyed what slim chance you had for survival. The logical thing for you to have done was to have left me behind.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, remind me to tell you that I'm sick and tired of your logic.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is a most illogical attitude. Orbit in one minute, Mister Scott. Fuel status?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Fifteen pounds psi. Approximately enough for one orbit, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: After that?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Tapping our boosters ended our last chance for a soft landing.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: You mean a burn-up?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is the usual end of a decaying orbit.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: I don't want to die up here.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Infinitely preferable to the kind of death we'd be granted on the planet's surface, I should think.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: I admire your ability to make so measured a choice.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, you said a while ago that there were always alternatives.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did l? I may have been mistaken.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, at least I lived long enough to hear that. Is there anything we can do?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Enterprise is surely on course for Makus Three by now. I for one do not believe in angels.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Mister Spock, so ends your first command.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. My first command.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Orbit attitude, Mister Spock. With our present fuel, that gives us about forty five minutes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Galileo to Enterprise. Galileo to Enterprise, come in, please. Galileo to Enterprise. Come in, please.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: He ponders for a moment, then flicks the Fuel Jettison button

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock!

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: There's a jolt as two long plumes of flame streak out from the nacelles

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: What happened?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: He jettisoned the fuel and ignited it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Boma
Text: We need that fuel to maintain orbit. Are you out of your mind?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps, Mister Boma.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How long have we got now, Scotty?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: The orbit'll start decaying as soon as the fuel's exhausted. Say six minutes.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The air is full of pointless status reports over the comm. when suddenly

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, there's something there on screen, at Taurus Two.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: On the viewscreen, a long trail of yellow crosses the green of the planet

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sensors, a meteorite?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No. It's holding a lateral line. There it is again. Holding steady, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A hundred and eighty degrees about, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant Uhura, contact transporter room. All beams ready. Full normal speed.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: A distress signal? It's like sending up a flare. Mister Spock, that was a good gamble. Perhaps it was worth it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: No one out there to see it.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The plume of flame fades out

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Scott
Text: Orbit decaying, Mister Spock. Ten seconds to atmosphere.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It may be the last action you'll ever take, Mister Spock, but it was all human.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Totally illogical. There was no chance.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's exactly what I mean.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: The front of the little craft starts to glow red, and instrumentation begins to smoke and crackle.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Mears
Text: It's getting hot.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transporters locked in, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate beams.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: Our last view inside Galileo is of lots of smoke, then transporter beams

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Whatever it was, Captain, it just burned up in the atmosphere.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, transporter room just beamed up five persons. Alive and well.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, proceed on course to Makus Three. Ahead warp factor one.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Warp factor one.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Context: later, everyone is back on duty

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's really something I don't understand about all of this. Maybe you can explain it to me. Logically, of course. When you jettisoned the fuel and ignited it, you knew there was virtually no chance of it being seen, yet you did it anyhow. That would seem to me to be an act of desperation.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite correct, Captain.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now we all know, and I'm sure the doctor will agree with me, that desperation is a highly emotional state of mind. How does your well-known logic explain that?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite simply, Captain. I examined the problem from all angles, and it was plainly hopeless. Logic informed me that under the circumstances, the only possible action would have to be one of desperation. Logical decision, logically arrived at.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. You mean you reasoned that it was time for an emotional outburst.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, I wouldn't put it in exactly those terms, Captain, but those are essentially the facts.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're not going to admit that for the first time in your life, you committed a purely human emotional act?

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you're a stubborn man.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2947.3. We have been through a severe ion storm. One crewman is dead. Ship's damage is considerable. I have ordered a non-scheduled layover on Starbase Eleven for repairs. A full report of damages was made to the commanding officer of Starbase Eleven, Commodore Stone.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Kirk is not in his usual gold shirt, but a green one with gold braiding.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Maintenance Section Eighteen. The section is working on the Intrepid. Reschedule. The Enterprise is on priority one. That makes three times you've read it, Jim. Is there an error?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. But the death of the crewman.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Regulations, Captain. And the extract from your ship's computer log confirming this sworn deposition?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge here. Go ahead, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Mister Spock with that computer log extract?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: He should have been there ten minutes ago, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: It's a great pity. The service can't afford to lose men like Lieutenant Commander Finney.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree. I waited until the last possible moment. We were on Red Alert. The storm got worse. I had to jettison the pod.

Title: Court Martial
Context: The two man transporter alcove in the corner activates.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What took you so long, Mister Spock?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I believe I

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: I'll take that.

Title: Court Martial
Context: As he puts the data card into his computer, the door opens and a teenage girl dressed in blue enters.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jamie.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: There you are. I just wanted one more look at you. The man who killed my father.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not so. He was my friend.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: Your friend? You hated him all your life! That's why you killed him, you murderer! You murderer! You murderer!

Title: Court Martial
Context: She dissolves into tears.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Mister Spock, would you please?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Miss Finney, come with me, please.

Title: Court Martial
Context: They leave.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Captain Kirk, you say you jettisoned the pod after the Red Alert?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have my sworn deposition.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Then, Captain, I must presume you've committed willful perjury. This extract from your computer log says you jettisoned the pod before going to Red Alert. Consider yourself confined to the base. Official inquiry will determine whether a general court martial is in order.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2948.5. Starship Enterprise remains in orbit around Starbase Eleven. Full repairs in progress. I've been ordered to stand by on Starbase Eleven until the inquiry into the death of Lieutenant Commander Finney can be conducted. I'm confident of the outcome.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Kirk and McCoy enter, and go to the bar.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Timothy, I haven't seen you since the Vulcanian expedition. (no reply) Well, I see our graduating class from the Academy is well represented. Corrigan. Teller. How you doing, Mike?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mike
Context: An older man in a gold shirt
Text: I'll get by, Jim.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Timothy
Context: Dark hair, red shirt
Text: I understand you're laying over for repairs. Big job?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Couple of days.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Timothy
Text: You moving out then?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In a hurry to see me go?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Timothy
Text: Oh, I just wondered how long it'd take to get a new records officer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can talk plainer than that.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Timothy
Text: I can, but I think the point's been made. Ben was a friend of ours.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Jim. Let's go.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on. Finish. Ben was a friend of yours, and

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on. I'm waiting to hear the rest.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mike
Text: Why don't you tell us?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would be the point? You've already made up your minds. Excuse me, Bones.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Leaves, just as a lady in a floaty green dress enters.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you have any doubt, that was indeed Captain James Kirk of the Enterprise.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Yes, I know. Are you a friend of his?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In these trying times, one of the few. Doctor Leonard McCoy. And you?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Areel Shaw. And I'm a friend, too. An old one.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All of my old friends look like doctors. All of his look like you. Well, you might as well join me for a drink. With this inquiry coming up, he's going to need all the friends he can get.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Recording inquiry. Matter. Captain Kirk, James T. Subject. Circumstances of death, Lieutenant Commander Finney, Benjamin.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: This inquiry, to determine whether a general court-martial should be convened against Captain Kirk on charges of perjury and culpable negligence.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Let us begin with your relationship with Commander Finney. You knew him for a long time, didn't you?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. He was an instructor at the Academy when I was a midshipman, but that didn't stand in the way of our beginning a close friendship. His daughter Jamie, who was here last night, was named after me.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: It's common knowledge that something happened to your friendship.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's no secret. We were assigned to the same ship some years later. I relieved him on watch once and found a circuit open to the atomic matter piles that should've been closed. Another five minutes, it could have blown up the ship.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Ship nomenclature. Specify.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: United Starship Republic, number 1371.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Continue.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I closed the switch and logged the incident. He drew a reprimand and was sent to the bottom of the promotion list.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: And he blamed you for that?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. He had been at the Academy for an unusually long time as an instructor. As a result, he was late in being assigned to a starship. The delay, he felt, looked bad on his record. My action, he believed, made things worse.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Comment. Service record of Lieutenant Commander Finney to be appended this inquiry.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Noted.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Now let's get into the specifics of the storm, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Weather scan indicated an ion storm dead ahead. I sent Finney into the pod.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Why Finney?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His name was at the top of the duty roster.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: If he blamed you

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He may have blamed me that he never rose to command a ship, but I don't assign jobs on the basis of who blames me. It was Finney's turn, and I assigned him. He had just checked in with me from the pod when we hit the leading edge of the storm. Not too bad at first. I signalled a Yellow Alert. Then we began encountering pressure, variant stress, force seven, the works. I finally signaled a Red Alert. Finney knew he had a matter of seconds. I gave him those seconds and more. But apparently it wasn't enough.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Then why, Captain, does the computer log from your ship, made automatically at the time, indicate that you were still on Yellow Alert when you jettisoned and not on Red?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. There's been a mistake.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: It would seem so. Could the computer be wrong?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock is running a survey right now, but the odds are next to impossible.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Stop recording. Now, look, Jim. Not one man in a million could do what you and I have done. Command a starship. A hundred decisions a day, hundreds of lives staked on you making every one of them right. You're played out, Jim. Exhausted.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that the way you see it?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: That's the way my report'll read if you co-operate.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A physical breakdown. Possibly even mental collapse.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Possibly.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd be admitting a man died because

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Admit nothing. Say nothing. Let me bury the matter here and now. No starship captain has ever stood trial before, and I don't want you to be the first. KIRK: But if what you suspect is true, then I'm guilty. I should be punished.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: I'm thinking of the service. I won't have it smeared.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By what, Commodore Stone?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: All right. By an evident perjurer who's either covering his bad judgment, his cowardice, or

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's as far as you go, sir. I'm telling you I was there on the Bridge. I know what happened. I know what I did.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: It's in the transcript, and computer transcripts don't lie. I'm telling you, Captain, either you accept a permanent ground assignment, or the whole disciplinary weight of Starfleet command is going to light right on your neck.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So that's the way we do it now? Sweep it under the rug, and me along with it? Not on your life. I intend to fight.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Then you draw a general court.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Draw it? I demand it. And right now, Commodore Stone. Right now.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2948.9. The officers who will comprise my court-martial board are proceeding to Starbase Eleven. Meanwhile, repairs on the Enterprise are almost complete.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Kirk goes to the table of the lady in green, and kisses her hands.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Areel. Doctor McCoy said you were here. I should have felt it in the air, like static electricity.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Flattery will get you everywhere.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; It's been, how long has it been?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Four years, seven months, and an odd number of days. Not that I'm counting.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You look marvellous. You haven't changed a bit.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: But things have changed for you, haven't they?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, you've heard about that, have you?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I'm a lawyer in the Judge Advocate's office, remember?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I remember. Let's forget it. We have a lot of lost time to make up for.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: You're taking it very lightly.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The confidence of an innocent man.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Are you? That's not what the rumours indicate.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look, Let's not talk shop.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Jim, this could ruin you. Will you take some advice?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I never could talk you into anything. All right. Fire away.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: The prosecution will build its case on the basis of Kirk versus the computer. Now if your attorney tries to defend on that basis, you won't have a chance.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What other choice is there?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: That's up to your attorney, and that's why he's got to be a good one.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You, perhaps?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: No, I'm busy.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, a girl with your ability should be able to handle two cases at once.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Jim, be serious. You're not an ordinary human. You're a Starship Captain, and you've stepped into scandal. If there's any way they can do it, they'll slap you down hard and permanently for the good of the service.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You still haven't made any recommendation.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Samuel T. Cogley, attorney at law. If anyone can save you, he can. He'll be paying you a visit. Jim, I've got to go.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Areel, you still haven't told me how you know so much about what the prosecution's going to do.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Because, Jim Kirk, my dear old love, I am the prosecution, and I have to do my very best to have you slapped down hard. Broken out of the service, in disgrace.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Kirk is about to pour himself a drink.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: You Kirk?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. (Notices the piles of books everywhere) What is all this?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I figure we'll be spending some time together, so I moved in.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope I'm not crowding you.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: What's the matter? Don't you like books?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, I like them fine, but a computer takes less space.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: A computer, huh? I got one of these in my office. Contains all the precedents. The synthesis of all the great legal decisions written throughout time. I never use it.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I've got my own system. Books, young man, books. Thousands of them. If time wasn't so important, I'd show you something. My library. Thousands of books.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what would be the point?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: This is where the law is. Not in that homogenised, pasteurised, synthesiser. Do you want to know the law, the ancient concepts in their own language, Learn the intent of the men who wrote them, from Moses to the tribunal of Alpha 3? Books.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have to be either an obsessive crackpot who's escaped from his keeper or Samuel T. Cogley, attorney at law.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Right on both counts. Need a lawyer?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm afraid so.

Title: Court Martial
Context: There are four officers in dress uniform on the bench, including Stone.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: This court is now in session. I have appointed as members of this court Space Command Representative Lindstrom, Starship Captains Krasnovsky and Chandra. Captain Kirk, I direct your attention to the fact that you have a right to ask for substitute officers if you feel that any of these named harbour any prejudiced attitudes to your case.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have no objections, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Do you consent to the service Lieutenant Shaw as prosecuting officer and to myself as president of the court?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I do, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: All right, clerk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Charge, culpable negligence. Specification in that on Stardate 2945.7, by such negligence, Captain Kirk, James T., did cause loss of life, to wit, the life of Records Officer Lieutenant Commander Finney, Benjamin. To all recorded charges and specifications, what is the plea?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not guilty.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Proceed, Lieutenant.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I call Mister Spock.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Spock hands over his data chip, sits down and puts his hand on the lie detector.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Spock, serial number S179-276SP. Service rank, Lieutenant Commander. Position, First officer, science officer. Current assignment, USS Enterprise. Commendations, Vulcanian Scientific Legion of Honour. Awards of valour. Twice decorated by Starfleet command.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Mister Spock, as a First officer, you know a great deal about computers, don't you?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: I know all about them.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: It is possible for a computer to malfunction, is it not?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Do you know of any malfunction which has caused an inaccuracy in the Enterprise computer?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: That answer is based on your mechanical survey of the Enterprise computer ordered by the defendant prior to this trial, is it not?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Now the stardate

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: But the computer is inaccurate, never the less.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Why do you say that?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: It reports that the jettison button was pressed before the Red Alert.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: In other words, it reports that Captain Kirk was reacting to an extreme emergency that did not then exist.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: And that is impossible.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Is it? Were you watching him the exact moment he pressed the jettison button?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, I was occupied. The ship was already on Yellow Alert.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Then how can you dispute the finding of the log?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not dispute it. I merely state that it is wrong.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Oh? On what do you base that statement?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: I know the Captain. He is in

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Please instruct the witness not to speculate.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, I am half Vulcanian. Vulcanians do not speculate. I speak from pure logic. If I let go of a hammer on a planet that has a positive gravity, I need not see it fall to know that it has in fact fallen.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I do not see what that has to

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, human beings have characteristics just as inanimate objects do. It is impossible for Captain Kirk to act out of panic or malice. It is not his nature.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: In your opinion.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. In my opinion.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Thank you. Your witness, Mister Cogley.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: No questions.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: You may step down.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I now call the personnel officer for the Enterprise.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Service rank, Ensign. Position, personnel officer. Current assignment, USS Enterprise.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: In the course of your duties as personnel officer of the Enterprise, you would be familiar with the service records of all aboard?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Context: A young Asian woman
Text: Yes, ma'am.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: With reference to Records Officer Finney, was there in his service record a reported disciplinary action for failure to close a circuit?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Text: Yes, ma'am.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Was the charge in that instance based upon a log entry by the officer who relieved him?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Text: Yes, ma'am.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: And who was that officer?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Text: Ensign James T. Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Louder, please, for the court.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Text: Ensign James T. Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Now the Captain Kirk who sits in this courtroom?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Ensign
Text: Yes, ma'am.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Thank you. Do you wish to cross-examine, Mister Cogley?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: No questions.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: You may step down.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I now call Doctor McCoy to the stand.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Service rank, Lieutenant Commander. Position, Ship's Surgeon. Current assignment, USS Enterprise. Commendations, Legion of Honour. Awards of valour. Decorated by Starfleet surgeons.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Doctor, you are, on the record, an expert in psychology, especially space psychology. Patterns which develop in the close quarters of a ship during long voyages in deep space.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know something about it.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: You have just heard the testimony of your own personnel officer, that it was an action of the then Ensign Kirk, which placed an unerasable blot on the record of the then Lieutenant Finney. Psychologically, Doctor, is it possible that Lieutenant Finney blamed Kirk for the incident?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's possible.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: He could have hated Kirk down through the years, blamed him for being passed over for promotion, blamed him for never being given a command of his own, correct?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He could have.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Now, let us hypothesise, Doctor. Is it normal for a person to return affection for hatred?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Do we not tend to at first resent and then actively dislike the person who hates us?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Wait a minute. I don't quite follow you.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Hypothetically. Would not Captain Smith begin to hate Lieutenant Commander Jones once he learned that Lieutenant Commander Jones hated and detested him?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, yes, I suppose it could happen.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Then I ask you, is it not possible that Captain Kirk became aware of Lieutenant Commander Finney's hatred toward him and perhaps, even involuntarily, began to reciprocate?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not Captain Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Any normal human, Doctor. Is it possible?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But he's not that kind of a man.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Is it theoretically possible, Doctor?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. It's possible.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Thank you. Your witness, Mister Cogley.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: No questions.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: You may step down. Mister Cogley. You've listened to testimony from three witnesses, and in neither instance have you availed yourself of your right to cross-examine. Have you abrogated that right?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Well, sir, the truth is, I've been holding back till we get this preliminary business out of the way. I'd like to call Captain Kirk to the stand.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: James T. Kirk, serial number SC937-0176CEC. Service rank, Captain. Position, Starship command. Current assignment, USS Enterprise. Commendations, Palm Leaf Of Axanar Peace Mission, Grankite Order of Tactics, Class of Excellence, Prantares Ribbon of Commendation, Classes first and second

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: May it please the court.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Court recognises counsel for the prosecution.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: The prosecution concedes the inestimable record of Captain Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Mister Cogley?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I wouldn't want to slow the wheels of progress. But then on the other hand, I wouldn't want those wheels to run over my client in their unbridled haste.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Continue.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Awards of valour, Medal of Honour, Silver Palm with Cluster, Starfleet citation for Conspicuous Gallantry, Karagite Order of Heroism

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Stop. I think that's enough. I wouldn't want to slow things up too much.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Thank you.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Now, Captain, despite what these machines indicate, was there indeed a Red Alert before you jettisoned the pod?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, sir, there was.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Please tell us about it.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Firstly, I am at a loss to explain the errors in the extract from the computer log. We were in an ion storm. Everyone here in this court knows the dangers involved. I was in command. The decisions were mine, no one else's. Charges of malice have been raised. There was no malice. Lieutenant Commander Finney was a member of my crew, and that's exactly the way he was treated. It has been suggested that I panicked on the bridge and jettisoned the ion pod prematurely. That is not so. You've heard some of the details of my record. This was not my first crisis. It was one of many. During it, I did what my experience and training required me to do. I took the proper steps in the proper order. I did exactly what had to be done, exactly when it should have been done.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: You did the right thing, but would you do it again?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Given the same circumstances I would do the same thing without hesitation, because the steps I took in the order I took them were absolutely necessary if I were to save my ship. And nothing is more important than my ship.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Your witness, Miss Shaw.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: The prosecution does not wish to dishonour this man, but facts are facts. I must invite the attention of the court and Captain Kirk to this visual extract from the Enterprise computer log. Play back. What you are about to see is precisely what took place on the Enterprise bridge during the ion storm.

Title: Court Martial
Context: On the courtroom viewscreen

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Meteorology reports ion storm upcoming, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll need somebody in the pod for readings.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Finney is top of duty roster, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Post him.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attention, Commander Finney, report to pod for reading on ion plates.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Message Received.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Officer posted, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Context: The ship suddenly judders

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by on alert status, Mister Spock.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Approaching ion storm, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp factor one, Mister Hanson.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Warp one, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Context: There's another sharp jerk, and Kirk presses a button on his chair panel.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Reverse. Stop. Go forward with magnification on the panel. Freeze that. Captain Kirk is now signalling a Yellow Alert. Go forward, normal view.

Title: Court Martial
Context: On courtroom viewscreen.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Call from the pod, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tie in.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Finney here, Captain. Ion readings in progress.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make it fast, Ben. I may have to go to Red Alert.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold our course, Mister Hanson.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Natural vibrations, force two, Captain. Force three.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering, then ion pod.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Engineering.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One third more thrust.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Working.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Ion pod.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by to get out of there, Ben.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Force five, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Steady as she goes, Mister Hanson.

Title: Court Martial
Context: And the close up on the Captain's panel shows...

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Freeze that! If the court will notice, the log plainly shows the defendant's finger pressing the jettison button. The condition signal reads Yellow Alert. Not red alert, but simply Yellow Alert. When the pod containing Lieutenant Commander Finney was jettisoned, the emergency did not as yet exist.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But that's not the way it happened.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2949.9. The evidence presented by the visual playback to my general court-martial was damning. I suspect even my attorney has begun to doubt me.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Computers don't lie.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you suggesting that I did?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I'm suggesting that maybe you did have a lapse. It was possible, you know, with the strain you were under. There's still time to change our plea. I could get you off.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Two days ago, I would've staked anything on my judgment.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: You did. Your professional career.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I spent my whole life training for decisions just like that one. My whole life. Is it possible that when the moment came? No. I know what I did. You can pull out if you want to.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: There's no place to go, except back to court and hear the verdict.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Communicator beeps

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've run a complete megalyte survey on the computer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll tell you what you found. Nothing, right?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: You sound bitter, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not bitter enough to forget to thank you for your efforts.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Further instructions?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. It's not all bad, Mister Spock. Who knows. You may be able to beat your next captain at chess. Kirk out.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chess.

Title: Court Martial
Context: The door opens

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jamie. This is Lieutenant Commander Finney's daughter.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: Mister Cogley, we've got to stop this. Make him take a ground assignment. I realise it wasn't his fault. I won't make any trouble. Make him change his plea.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's too late for that, Jamie, but I'm glad you don't blame me anymore for what happened.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: I was just so upset that night. I'm sorry.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't say any more.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: But I have to. I never realised how close you and Dad had been until I read through some papers he wrote, letters to Mother and me. I don't know how I ever could've thought that you. Mister Cogley, ruining Jim won't change what's happened.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: That's very commendable, Miss Finney, but most unusual. After all, Captain Kirk is accused of causing your father's death, and the evidence would indicate his guilt.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Jamie
Text: I was just thinking of Jim.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know, and I thank you. I have to go and change. You ready?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: No, but I may be getting ready.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Bishop, half level right.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I had to see it to believe it.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Explain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're about to lop off the captain's professional head, and you're sitting here playing chess with the computer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is true.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, you're the most cold-blooded man I've ever known.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why, thank you, Doctor. I've just won my fourth game.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's impossible.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Observe for yourself. Rook to king's pawn four.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Computer
Text: Bishop, half level right.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now, this is the computer's move. And now mine. (takes the bishop) Checkmate. Mechanically, the computer's flawless. Therefore, logically, its report of the captain's guilt is infallible. I could not accept that, however.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So you tested the programme bank.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. I programmed it myself for chess some months ago. The best I should have been able to attain was a draw.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, why are you just sitting there?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter room, stand by. We're beaming down.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Court is now in session. The board will entertain motions before delivering its verdict. Counsel for the prosecution?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Sir, the prosecution rests.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Counsel for the defence?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Sir, the defence rests.

Title: Court Martial
Context: McCoy and Spock run in and whisper to Kirk and Cogley

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Mister Cogley. Mister Cogley!

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Sir, some new evidence has just been brought to my attention. I'd like to ask the court to

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Objection! Counsel for the defence has rested his case.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Of what nature is this evidence?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I can't tell you, I'll have to show you.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Mister Cogley is well-known for his theatrics.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Is saving an innocent man's career a theatric? i

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Counsels will kindly direct their remarks to the bench.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I'd be delighted to, sir, now that I've got something human to talk about. Rights, sir, human rights. The Bible, the Code of Hammurabi and of Justinian, Magna Carta, the Constitution of the United States, Fundamental Declarations of the Martian colonies, the Statutes of Alpha Three. Gentlemen, these documents all speak of rights. Rights of the accused to a trial by his peers, to be represented by counsel, the rights of cross-examination, but most importantly, the right to be confronted by the witnesses against him, a right to which my client has been denied.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Your Honour, that is ridiculous. We produced the witnesses in court. My learned opponent had the opportunity to see them, cross-examine them.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: All but one. The most devastating witness against my client is not a human being. It's a machine, an information system. The computer log of the Enterprise. Can ask this court adjourn and reconvene aboard that vessel.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I protest, Your Honour.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: And I repeat, I speak of rights. A machine has none. A man must. My client has the right to face his accuser, and if you do not grant him that right, you have brought us down to the level of the machine. Indeed, you have elevated that machine above us. I ask that my motion be granted, and more than that, gentlemen. In the name of humanity, fading in the shadow of the machine, I demand it. I demand it!

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2950.1. After due consideration, the general court-martial has reconvened on board the Enterprise.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: How many games of chess did you win from the computer, Mister Spock?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Five in all.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: May that be considered unusual?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Why?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: I personally programmed the computer for chess months ago. I gave the machine an understanding of the game equal to my own. The computer cannot make an error and assuming that I do not either, the best that could normally be hoped for would be stalemate after stalemate, and yet I beat the machine five times. Someone, either accidentally or deliberately, adjusted the programming and therefore the memory banks of that computer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Could that have had an effect on the visual playback we saw?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Object! The witness would be making a conclusion.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Sustained.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Hypothetically, Mister Spock. Hypothetically, Miss Shaw. If what you suggest had been done, it would be beyond the capabilities of most men. Is that true?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: What man aboard ship would it not be beyond?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Captain, myself, and the records officer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: And at the moment, you have no records officer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative. Until he was lost, our records officer was Lieutenant Commander Finney.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Captain Kirk, will you tell the steps you took to find Mister Finney after the storm?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I instituted a phase one search.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Describe a phase one search.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a painstaking, thorough attempt in and around the ship to find a man who's presumably injured and unable to respond.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: It presupposes, does it not, that a man wishes to be found?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I beg your pardon?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: If you start a search for a man, you assume, don't you, that he wants to be found? He's not hiding?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: On a ship of this size, could a man evade such a search?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Possibly.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Gentlemen, I submit to you that Lieutenant Commander Ben Finney is not dead.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Mister Cogley, we are waiting for proof of the extraordinary statement you made in the briefing room.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: You shall have it, but first I need the co-operation of this court in conducting an experiment. Captain Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, for the purposes of this experiment, it'll be necessary for all personnel, except for members of the court and the command crew, to leave the ship. I am ordering all others to report to the transporter room.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Including myself, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: This court is by no means adjourned, Mister Cogley.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: I have an errand ashore of vital importance to the purpose of this court, and I will return.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Very well.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Cogley
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Leaves with the spare crew members.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Captain, are you maintaining an engine crew aboard?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our impulse engines have been shut down. We'll maintain orbit by momentum.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Krasnovsky
Text: And when the orbit decays?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We hope to be finished long before that.

Title: Court Martial
Context: A little later

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready, Mister Spock?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, this computer has an auditory sensor. It can, in effect, hear sounds. By installing a booster, we can increase that capability on the order of one to the fourth power. The computer should bring us every sound occurring on the ship.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Crewman
Text: All personnel have left the ship as ordered, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy? All right, Mister Spock.

Title: Court Martial
Context: A cacophony of heartbeats comes over the bridge speakers.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Turn it down a little. Gentlemen, that sound is caused by the heartbeats of all the people on board the ship. Doctor McCoy will use this white sound device to mask out each person's heartbeat so that it will be eliminated from the sounds we are hearing.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: First, the Captain. Mister Spock.

Title: Court Martial
Context: He goes around the assembled group one at a time

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And lastly, myself.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's all of us, except for crewman in the transporter room. Mister Spock, eliminate his heartbeat. That accounts for everyone.

Title: Court Martial
Context: But still one heart beats over the speakers.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Finney.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Localise that.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: B deck, in or near Engineering.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Seal off B deck, sections 18Y through 23D.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: So Finney is alive.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It would seem so. Commodore, this is my problem. I'd appreciate it if no one left the bridge.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Armed with a phaser, Kirk makes his way alone.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sam Cogley had gone a shore to bring Jamie Finney on board. We felt Jamie's presence would make Finney easier to handle in the event Finney really were alive.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ben.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ben Finney.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Mister Spock, encountering variants.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Compensate.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: What does that mean?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: The orbit is beginning to decay.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ben, where are you?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Hello, Captain!

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Nothing to say

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Captain?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm glad you're alive.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: You mean you're relieved because you think your career is saved. Well, you're wrong.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ben! Ben, it's not too late. We can help you.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Like you helped me all along? Kept me down

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Robbed me of my own command?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: I'm a good officer, as good as you. I've watched you for years. The great Captain Kirk.

Title: Court Martial
Context: We finally see the man, as he jabs a phaser into Kirk's back

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: They told you to do it to me. You all conspired against me. You ruined me, but you won't do it anymore.

Title: Court Martial
Context: He disarms Kirk and throws the weapon away. Kirk turns to face him.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put the phaser down, Ben.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Oh, I wouldn't kill you, Captain. Your own death would mean too little to you, But your ship

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about my ship?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: It's dead. I've killed it. I tapped out your primary energy circuits.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, what's our orbit status?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Decaying, Captain.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Variants at second level

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Depreciating unusually fast.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: You're out of power. I know the ship, too. The Enterprise should've been mine. You kept me from it.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ben. Why kill innocent people?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Innocent? Officers and gentlemen, Captains all. Except for Finney and his one mistake. A long time ago, but they don't forget.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I logged the mistake, Ben. Blame me, not them.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: But they are to blame. All of them.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: I was a good officer. I really was. I loved the service more than any man ever dared.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Mister Spock, we're running out of time.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, if you'll please hurry to the transporter room

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Mister Spock, the court has not yet reached a verdict. We will hear this witness out.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not too late. You can be helped. But if you kill those people

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: Why shouldn't I? They killed me, didn't they? It's a fair trade.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is Jamie included in that deal?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: What do you mean?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's on board by now. Yes. She's on board.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Finney
Text: What? Why did you do that? Why did you bring her here? I'll kill you!

Title: Court Martial
Context: Kirk takes his opportunity to grapple with the bigger man. There's a fight in which Kirk's shirt gets torn. Finney swings at Kirk with a wrench, but finally has his lights punched out.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beaten and sobbing, Finney told me where he had sabotaged the prime energy circuits.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The damage he'd caused was considerable, but not irreparable. With luck, I would be able to effect repairs before our orbit decayed completely.

Title: Court Martial
Context: For repairs, read pulling cables out of junction boxes.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Power returning, Mister Spock. Up fourteen points and rising.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Activate port impulse engines. One third power.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Uhura takes navigation

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: One third power.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Variants fading.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Hanson
Text: Orbit stabilising.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All secure, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Stone
Text: Unless the prosecution has an objection, I rule this court to be dismissed.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Absolutely no objection, sir.

Title: Court Martial
Context: Later, Kirk is in a fresh new shirt, and talking quietly to Areel in front of the turbolift doors. Around them it is business as usual.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: How long will it be this time before I see you again?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At the risk of sounding like a mystic, that depends on the stars.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Sam Cogley asked me to give you something special. It's not a first edition, just a book. Sam says that makes it special.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't have much of a chance to thank him.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: He's busy on a case. He's defending Ben Finney. He says he'll win.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't be a bit surprised.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: Do you think it would cause a complete breakdown of discipline if a lowly lieutenant kissed a Starship Captain on the bridge of his ship?

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's try. (a gentle but lingering kiss) See? No change. Discipline goes on.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: And so must the Enterprise. Goodbye, Jim.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Goodbye, Areel. Better luck next time.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Shaw
Text: I had pretty good luck this time. I lost, didn't l?

Title: Court Martial
Context: She leaves, blowing him a final kiss. He pulls himself together, goes to his chair and sits between two stony-faced officers.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's a very good lawyer.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously.

Title: Court Martial
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Indeed she is.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: Welcome to Starbase Eleven, Captain. The Commodore's waiting to see you. He's curious why you suddenly changed course and came here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We received a subspace message asking us to divert here immediately.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: This base sent no message, Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Oh, Jim, I just can't understand this.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock received a starbase transmission, a message from the former commander of the Enterprise, Fleet Captain Pike, urgently requesting that we divert here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Impossible.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If my first officer states he received a transmission from

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Jim, I'm not doubting anyone's word. I'm simply telling you it's impossible.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You don't know? You actually don't know what's happened to Captain Pike? There's been subspace chatter about it for months. I'm sorry to have to be the one to show you. He's upstairs in the medical section.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You ever met Chris Pike?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When he was promoted to Fleet Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: About your age. Big, handsome man, vital, active.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I took over the Enterprise from him. Spock served with him for several years.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eleven years, four months, five days.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's his problem, Commodore?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Inspection tour of a cadet vessel. Old Class J starship. One of the baffle plates ruptured.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The delta rays?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: He went in bringing out all those kids that were still alive. Just wanted you gentlemen to be prepared.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Captain Pike. (a scarred head and shoulders sticking out of wheelchair device) Captain, you remember these gentlemen. They wanted to visit you. Two flashes mean no. I thought you might make an exception for them. (flash, flash) I'm sorry, gentlemen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chris, if there's anything I can do for you. (flash, flash)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Pike, may I remain for a moment? (flash, the others leave) You know why I've come, Captain. It's only six days away at maximum warp and I have it well-planned. (flash, flash) I have never disobeyed your orders before, Captain, but this time I must. (flash, flash) I know. I know it is treachery and it's mutiny. but I must do this. (flash, flash) I have no choice. (flash, flash)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Once more, Jose. Spock stated he received a message for us to come here. He entered same in his log. That's all the proof I require.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: And what do those record tapes show? No message sent from here. No message received by your vessel.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I suggest the record tapes have been deliberately changed. A computer expert can change record tapes, duplicate voices, say anything, say nothing.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: The fact remains that your first officer's former captain is hospitalised, horribly injured, at this base, and that same first officer seems to be the only one who heard that message.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If he had wanted to see Captain Pike he could have requested a leave. I would have granted it.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Well, that's true of course.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who would want to divert us here? There's no trouble in the space sector we're patrolling now. No alien problems.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Computer Centre.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Humboldt
Text: Chief Humboldt here, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Have you rechecked all the record tapes on the date in question?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Humboldt
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Is there any way at all a message could have been sent from here without us knowing it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Humboldt
Text: Negative, Commodore. We've checked and double-checked everything possible.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: All right. Start checking the impossible. Mendez out.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: Spock creeps up behind Humboldt and neck-pinches him, then does something to the innards of a computer bank

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Oh, have I introduced Miss Piper, Jim? This is Captain Kirk, Miss Piper.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: I recognized the Captain immediately. A mutual friend described you, sir. Lieutenant Helen Johansson.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helen described

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: She merely mentioned she knew you, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You have something to report, Miss Piper?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: Oh, yes, sir. I'm afraid our investigation turned up very little, Commodore. There is, of course, Mister Spock's years of service with Captain Pike. Indications of his extreme loyalty to this former commander.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miss Piper, a Vulcan can no sooner be disloyal than he can exist without breathing. That goes for his present commander as well as his past.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: We're forced to consider every possibility, sir. We can be certain Captain Pike cannot have sent a message. In his condition he's under observation every minute of every day.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: And totally unable to move, Jim. His wheel chair is constructed to respond to his brain waves. Oh, he can turn it, move it forwards, or backwards slightly.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: With the flashing light, he can say yes or no.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: But that's it, Jim. That's as much as that poor devil can do. His mind is as active as yours and mine, but it's trapped inside a useless vegetating body. He's kept alive mechanically, a battery-driven heart.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no way he could even have asked for that message to be sent?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Context: slow) Starbase Operations. (fast) Starbase Operations. (Spock adjusts it to sound normal
Text: Starbase Operations. Starbase Operations, Enterprise. Standby to receive new orders, Enterprise.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Starbase Operation, Mister Hansen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Text: Starbase Operations to Enterprise. Standby to receive new orders. They're to be fed directly into the ship's computers. This is top secret and scrambled.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Enterprise standing by. Request confirmation.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise to Starbase. Request confirmation.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Chief
Text: Sir, this is a security area. What are you doing here?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have security clearance, Chief.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Chief
Text: Who gave you clearance? I haven't been notified. You're cross-circuiting the. (struggle) Whose tapes are these?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Repeat, Enterprise to Starbase. Orders received. We need operating confirmation from the ship's Captain. (Spock pinches the Chief unconscious)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Come in, Starbase. Come in, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: Spock inserts data chip

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. You have confirmation, Miss Uhura.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Hansen here, Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Our destination has been scramble-fed into ship's computers. Er, how can I handle the helm if I don't know where we're going?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Context: another chip
Text: Mister Spock is with me here. He'll answer all questions. Kirk out.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Mister Spock.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ship's computers will handle the helm on this voyage, Mister Hansen. Course will be computed and set automatically.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: You will not discuss this with ship's crew or starbase personnel. Do you read?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Acknowledged, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stand by. We'll warp out of orbit in one hour.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Context: watching Pike on monitor
Text: He keeps blinking no. No to what?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They've tried questioning him. He's almost agitated himself into a coma.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long will he live?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As long as any of us. Blast medicine anyway. We've learned to tie into every human organ in the body except one. The brain. The brain is what life is all about. Now, that man can think any thought that we can, and love, hope, dream as much as we can, but he can't reach out, and no one can reach in.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He keeps blinking no.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No to what? They could question him for days, weeks, before they stumble on the right thing.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, could this have anything to do with Spock?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't read you at all, Jim.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What I mean is either a message was received. It was one of two things. Either someone sent a message diverting us here, or someone on board the ship lied about receiving it. Could that someone be Mister Spock?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, forgetting how well we both know Spock, the simple fact that he's a Vulcan means he's incapable of telling a lie.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's also half human.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And that half is completely submerged. To be caught acting like us or even thinking like us would completely embarrass him.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Someone's interfering with my command and my ship. I don't know who it is, but I mean to find out. Even you. If I thought you had the technical know-how I'd suspect you, but you don't. Spock does.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He would not make a false entry.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's a false entry in the log right now which doesn't jibe with the established facts. How do you explain that.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't, but to question Spock of all people? Me, yes. I could run off half-cocked given a good reason. So could you, but not Spock. It's impossible.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Text: Doctor McCoy, report to Transporter Control. Doctor McCoy to Transporter Control.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Text: You're needed aboard the Enterprise, Doctor. Medical emergency.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, what is it? Sickness? Injury? How bad is it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Text: That's all we have on it, Doctor. Just needed aboard.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Probably somebody discovered a hangnail. I'll beam up and let you know, Jim.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Context: reading
Text: For eyes of Starfleet Command only.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Oh, I'm certifying I ordered you to read it. Know anything at all about this planet?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What every ship Captain knows. General Order 7, no vessel under any condition, emergency or otherwise, is to visit Talos Four.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: And to do so is the only death penalty left on our books. Only Fleet Command knows why. Not even this file explains that. (unlocks the magnetic strip) But it does name the only Earth ship that ever visited the planet.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Enterprise, commanded by Captain Christopher Pike.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: With a half Vulcan science officer named Spock.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Piper
Text: Commodore! Captain Pike, he's gone!

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Mendez here. What is it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Voice
Text: Starship Enterprise, Commodore. It's warping out of orbit. Refuses to acknowledge our signal.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Out of orbit, Mister Spock. Seems strange with no navigator on duty.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Enterprise knows where she's going, Mister Hansen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Someone's trying to hail us, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Maintain radio silence, Lieutenant. This is First Officer Spock. Per Starfleet orders this date, I have been placed in temporary command of the Enterprise. While our destination is secret, our mission is relatively simple. Starbase Command has assigned Captain Kirk medical rest leave until our return. His instructions are that you will obey my orders as you would his. First Officer out.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's going on around here? Who said Jim needed a medical rest leave? And this call about me being needed aboard the ship. I've checked everywhere.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: And no one from the ship made such a call.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's right.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
