Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I regret they elected to keep certain things from you. Will you come with me, please.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is this, Spock? Captain, are you all right? (flash, flash) I see that you're still signaling

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, one moment, please.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Doctor McCoy. I'm recording you this message, Bones, so there will be no misunderstanding. I'm sorry to have to make it an order. You're not to disturb Captain Pike with any questions. Simply take good care of him. Follow Spock's instructions to the letter. Kirk out. (flash, flash)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Sir, scanners report an object following us, about the size of a starbase shuttlecraft. Shall we reverse helm?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Take no action, Mister Hansen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: But at our speed, they'll never catch us. In case they want to reach us

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have your orders, Mister Hansen. We'll make no contact.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Starbase Shuttlecraft one to Enterprise. Come in, please. Enterprise, Commodore Mendez and Captain Kirk. If you read me, you are ordered to reply. Repeating it on all emergency frequencies, Jim.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock is headed for Talos Four, all right.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Pulling ahead of us fast. Fuel is down to sixty three point three. If we turn back now, we've just got barely enough to get us back to the base.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Enterprise, come in!

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Library computer.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lock on to sensors. Measure object now following the Enterprise.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computed. Object is a Class F shuttlecraft. Duranium metal shell, ion engine power

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stop. How long before shuttlecraft's fuel supply forces return to starbase?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computed. Shuttlecraft is already past point of safe return.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: We coast.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Blast you any way. You had no right to come along.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: RHIP, Captain. Rank hath its privileges.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Two hours of oxygen left.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Wonderful.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Part of me is hoping the Enterprise won't come back for us. We step on that deck, Spock is finished. Court-martialed, disgraced.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: He's dead if he makes it to Talos Four. Why would he want to get Pike there? The command reports stated Talos contained absolutely no practical benefits to mankind.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock would have some logical reason for going there.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Maybe. Maybe he's just gone mad.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I keep wondering who might be after us in a shuttlecraft and I keep coming up with the same answers, but I can't be right, can l, Mister Spock.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer control. Lock on to shuttlecraft following us.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Locked on. Tractor beam ready.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Go to tape Abel Seven Baker. Execute instructions.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is it the captain, Mister Spock?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Sir, the engines are reversing. She's brought herself to a dead stop.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the First Officer speaking. Security, send an armed team to the Bridge. Transporter Room, stand by to beam Captain Kirk aboard. Effective until then, Lieutenant Hansen is in operational command.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Sir?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: First Officer out. Doctor, as senior officer present, I present myself to you for arrest.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You what?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: The charge is mutiny, Doctor. I never received orders to take command.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Security
Text: Security reporting, Mister Spock.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock is, er, under arrest. Is confinement to quarters enough?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Adequate, Doctor. I'll make no trouble.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, confine him.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Security
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Store our shuttlecraft on the hangar deck, Mister Scott. Beam us directly aboard.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, Captain. Locked on to you.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Transferring command to you, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Accepting command. Where's Mister Spock?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: In his quarters, under arrest.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: His quarters, after what he's done, Lieutenant?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain from Bridge. The engines are coming on.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse power. Hold this position. Tell whoever gave those orders to report

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Hansen
Text: Sir, there's nobody up there giving orders. Mister Spock has the computers running the ship.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Disengage computer control, Uhura.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: We can't disengage, Captain. The helm does not respond. (Scott leaves, muttering in Gaelic)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer control, come in.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computer.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Disengage from helm.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Unable to comply.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. On voice command, you will override all contrary instructions. Voice command, disengage from helm.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Computer
Text: Unable to comply. Any such attempt will cross-circuit vessel's life-supporting system. Computer control cannot be disengaged until vessel reaches planet Talos Four.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3012.4. Despite our best efforts to disengage computers, the Enterprise is still locked on a heading for the mysterious planet Talos Four. Meanwhile, as required by Starfleet General Orders, a preliminary hearing on Lieutenant Commander Spock is being convened. And in all the years of my service, this is the most painful moment I've ever faced.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This hearing is convened. Mister Spock, you're aware of your right to counsel of your choice?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, I waive counsel. Further, I waive rights to this hearing and request immediate court-martial.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request denied.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I inquire on what grounds, Captain?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A mutiny requires a trial board of no less than three command officers. Since there are only two of that rank available

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, I must point out that there are three officers of command rank available. Yourself, Commodore Mendez, and Captain Christopher Pike.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Denied. Captain Pike is a complete invalid.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe you'll find he's still on the active duty list.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: We didn't have the heart to retire him, Jim. He's got you. Whatever he's up to, he's planned it well.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3012.6. General Court-Martial convened. Mister Spock has again waived counsel and has entered a plea of guilty.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Mister Spock, are you aware in pleading guilty that a further charge involving the death penalty must be held against you should this vessel enter the Talos star group?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Why? What does it accomplish to go there or to take Captain Pike there? I want to know why.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are your comments a part of the record, sir?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Yes, it's on the record.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you. Request monitor screen be engaged.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: For what purpose?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: To comply with the request you just made, sir, that I explain the importance of going to Talos Four.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By asking why, you've opened the door to any evidence he may wish to present. Apparently what he had in mind.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Present your evidence. Screen on.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is thirteen years ago. The Enterprise and its commander, Captain Christopher Pike.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Definitely something out there, Captain, headed this way.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Screen off. Chris, was that really you on the screen? (flash) That's impossible. Mister Spock, no vessel makes record tapes in that detail, that perfect. What were we watching?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot tell you at this time, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Captain Pike, were any record tapes of this nature made during your voyage? (flash, flash) The court is not obliged to view evidence without knowing its source.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unless the court asks a prisoner why, Commodore. You did ask that question.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You mean I was maneuvered into asking. Your evidence is out of order.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am forced to contest that, Commodore. I want to see more.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You have that right, Captain, but just because the prisoner is your First Officer and your personal friend

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That has nothing to do with it.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Very well, continue.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Screen on, Mister Scott.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: No. It's something else. There's still something out there.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: As I stated, gentlemen, this was thirteen years ago. We were on routine patrol when the ship's sensors detected something ahead. At first we were not certain what it was.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It's coming at the speed of light. Collision course.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: The meteorite beam has not deflected it, Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Evasive manoeuvres, sir?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Steady as we go.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Comm Officer
Text: It's a radio wave, sir. We're passing through an old-style distress signal.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: They were keyed to cause interference and attract attention this way.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Comm Officer
Text: A ship in trouble making a forced landing, sir. That's it. No other message.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: I have a fix. It comes from the Talos star group.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: We've no ships or Earth colonies that far out.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their call letters check with a survey expedition. S.S. Columbia disappeared in that region approximately eighteen years ago.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: It would take that long for a radio beam to travel from there to here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Records show the Talos group has never been explored. Solar system similar to Earth, eleven planets. Number four seems to be Class M, oxygen atmosphere.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Then they could still be alive, even after eighteen years.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: If they survived the crash.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: We aren't going to go, to be certain?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Not without any indication of survivors, no. Continue to the Vega Colony and take care of our own sick and injured first. You have the helm. Maintain present course.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Boyce here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Drop by my cabin, Doctor. (Boyce enters with bag) What's that? I didn't say there's anything wrong with me.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: I understand we picked up a distress signal.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: That's right. Unless we get anything more positive on it, it seems to me the condition of our own crew takes precedent. I'd like to log the ship's doctor's opinion, too.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Oh, I concur with yours, definitely.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Good. I'm glad you do, because we're going to stop first at the Vega Colony and replace anybody who needs hospitalisation and also. What the devil are you putting in there, ice?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Who wants a warm martini?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: What makes you think I need one?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Sometimes a man will tell his bartender things he'll never tell his doctor. What's been on your mind, Chris, the fight on Rigel seven?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Shouldn't it be? My own yeoman and two others dead, seven injured.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Was there anything you personally could have done to prevent it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Oh, I should have smelled trouble when I saw the swords and the armour. Instead of that, I let myself get trapped in that deserted fortress and attacked by one of their warriors.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Chris, you set standards for yourself no one could meet. You treat everyone on board like a human being except yourself, and now you're tired and you

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: You bet I'm tired. You bet. I'm tired of being responsible for two hundred and three lives. I'm tired of deciding which mission is too risky and which isn't, and who's going on the landing party and who doesn't, and who lives and who dies. Boy, I've had it, Phil.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: To the point of finally taking my advice, a rest leave?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: To the point of considering resigning.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: And do what?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Well, for one thing, go home. Nice little town with fifty miles of park land around it. Remember I told you I had two horses, and we used to take some food and ride out all day.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Ah, that sounds exciting. Ride out with a picnic lunch every day.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: I said that's one place I might go. I might go into business on Regulus or on the Orion colony.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: You, an Orion trader, dealing in green animal women, slaves?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: The point is this isn't the only life available. There's a whole galaxy of things to choose from.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Not for you. A man either lives life as it happens to him, meets it head-on, and licks it, or he turns his back on it and starts to wither away.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Now you're beginning to talk like a doctor, bartender.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Take your choice. We both get the same two kinds of customers. The living and the dying.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock here. We're intercepting a follow-up message, sir. There are crash survivors on Talos.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Officer
Context: reads
Text: Eleven survivors from crash. Gravity and oxygen within limits. Food and water obtainable, but unless. The message faded at that point, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Address intercraft.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: System open.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: This is the captain. Our destination is the Talos star group.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Our time warp, factor seven.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Course computed and on the screen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: All decks have acknowledged, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Engage.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Screen off. Mister Spock, I'm truly amazed at your technical prowess in somehow manufacturing all this. I congratulate you on your imagination. But this is a court of space law, not a theatre.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, please tell the court this is not imagination, nor some clever photographic record. Are we seeing the actual events of thirteen years ago? (flash) Yes, gentlemen. On that screen as it happened, the incredible experience of Captain Christopher Pike on Talos Four. If, after witnessing this, the court wishes to turn this vessel back, I will release this ship to manual control.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: You're in no position to bargain. This is ridiculous. This man mutinied, stole your ship, abducted Captain Pike. Well, for me this has gone far enough.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We still haven't heard the full story. I vote to continue.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: And I vote we do not. Deadlock, and since I'm

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not a deadlock. There's still one member of the trial board to be heard from.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Very well. Captain Pike, it's up to you. Do we continue under these conditions? (flash)

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log supplemental. Mister Spock, on trial for mutiny, has forced the court to accept unusual evidence. On our monitor screen, the voyage of Captain Pike and the Enterprise to the one forbidden world in all the galaxy.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Screen on.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: We've settled into orbit, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Geological lab report complete, Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Preliminary lab survey ready, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Spectography?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Our reading shows an oxygen nitrogen atmosphere, sir, heavy with inert elements but well within safety limits.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Gravity?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Geologist
Text: Zero point nine of Earth.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Captain? Reflections, sir, from the planet's surface. As I read it, they polarise out as rounded metal bits. Could be parts of a spaceship hull.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Prep a landing party of six. You feel up to it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Sorry, Number One. With little information on this planet, we'll have to leave the ship's most experienced officer here covering us.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Of course, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: There's no indication of problems down there, but let's not take chances.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pitcairn
Text: Yes, sir. There's a canyon to the left. We can set you there completely unobserved.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Right.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: the group explores until they find a rough settlement

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Old Man
Text: They're men. They're humans.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Captain Christopher Pike, United Space Ship Enterprise.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Haskins
Text: Doctor Theodore Haskins, American Continent lnstitute.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Survivor
Text: Is Earth all right?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: The same old Earth, and you'll see it very soon.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: And you won't believe how fast you can get back. Well the time barrier's been broken. Our new ships can

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Haskins
Text: This is Vina. Her parents are dead. She was born almost as we crashed.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: The reunion is being watched on another screen, by people with big bald heads

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Context: as the survivors pack up the settlement
Text: Enterprise.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Landing party, come in.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: We'll begin transporting the survivors and their effects up to you very shortly.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Quarters are being prepared, sir. Have I permission to send out scouting and scientific parties now?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Yes, affirmative on the

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Vina
Text: You appear to be healthy and intelligent, Captain. A prime specimen.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: I didn't get that last message, Captain.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: Er, affirmative on request. Landing party out.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Haskins
Text: You must forgive her choice of words, Captain. She's lived her whole life with a collection of aging scientists.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: If they can, er, spare you a moment, I'd like to make my medical report.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Vina
Text: I think it's time to show the Captain our secret.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Boyce
Text: Their health is excellent, almost too good.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Haskins
Text: There's a reason for our condition, but we've had some doubt if Earth is ready to learn the secret. Let the girl show you. We'll accept your judgment.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: Pike follows Vina up a slope to a ledge by a rock face

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Vina
Text: You're tired, but don't worry. You'll feel much better soon. Don't you see it? Here and here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Pike
Text: I, I don't understand.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Vina
Text: You will. You're a perfect choice.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: she vanishes, and so do all the survivors and their encampment. A door opens in the rock face, Pike is knocked out and taken inside. At the settlement -

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Tyler
Text: Captain! (everyone rushes over in time to see the door closing in the rock. They fire their phasers at it to no avail.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Number One
Text: Landing party, come in.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no survivors' encampment, Number One. This is all some sort of trap. We've lost the Captain. Do you read?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's for Commodore Mendez.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plead signal for you, sir. Go ahead, Uhura.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Commodore Mendez, urgent. Subspace monitors show Enterprise receiving transmissions from planet Talos Four in violation of Starfleet General Orders.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Receiving transmissions from Talos Four? Then the images we've been seeing are

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are coming from Talos Four, sir.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk is here by relieved. You are ordered to assume command of the Enterprise. Disable vessel if necessary to prevent further contact. Message signed ComSol, Starfleet Command.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Mister Spock, you're aware of the orders regarding any contact with Talos Four. You have deliberately invited the death penalty. You've not only finished yourself, Spock, but you've finished your Captain as well.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Commodore must be aware that Captain Kirk knew nothing of this.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: And you're aware a Captain is responsible for everything that occurs on his ship. I order you to return this vessel back to manual control.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, I respectfully decline.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Mendez
Text: Very well. You've earned the consequences. This court is in recess.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: Mendez and yeoman leave, Scott and McCoy wheel Pike out after him

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you know what you're doing? Have you lost your mind?

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Jim, please don't stop me. Don't let him stop me. It's your career and Captain Pike's life. You must see the rest of the transmission.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock him up.

Title: The Menagerie, part 1
Context: To be concluded next week...

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Enterprise is orbiting a very green planet, and a young female Yeoman is getting a signature from the Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything from the landing party?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: They should be sending up a report momentarily, Captain. (Kirk stretches and groans) Something wrong?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A kink in my back. (behind his back the Yeoman starts to massage it) That's it. A little higher, please. Push. Push hard. Dig it in there, Mister

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Spock steps forward and Kirk realises who is massaging his lower back

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Yeoman. That's sufficient.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: You need sleep, Captain. If it's not out of line

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have enough of that from Doctor McCoy, Yeoman. Thank you.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy is correct, Captain. After what this ship has been through in the last three months, there is not a crewman aboard who is not in need of rest. Myself excepted, of course.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have Doctor McCoy's report channeled to my quarters, Lieutenant.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Beautiful, beautiful. No animals, no people, no worries. Just what the doctor ordered. Right, Doctor?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I couldn't have prescribed better. We are one weary ship.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Do you think the Captain will authorise shore leave here?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Depending upon my report and that of the other scouting parties. You know, you have to see this place to believe it. It's like something out of Alice in Wonderland. The Captain has to come down.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He'd like it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He needs it. You've got your problems, I've got mine. He's got ours, plus his, plus four hundred and thirty other people's. Where are you going?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: To get some cell-structure records. A blade of grass, a bush, a tree, a flower petal. With these, we can tell the whole planet's biology.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: As Sulu crouches down behind some pampas grass, McCoy turns and looks straight at a white rabbit in a check jacket, yellow waistcoat, and looking at a gold pocket-watch.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rabbit
Text: Oh, my paws and whiskers! I'll be late.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: It heads off down a hole. Then a young girl comes running up, wearing a blue dress with a white apron.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Alice
Text: Excuse me, sir. Have you seen a rather large white rabbit with a yellow waistcoat and white gloves here about?

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Wordlessly, McCoy points in the direction the rabbit went. The girl curtseys nicely

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Alice
Text: Thank you very much.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: She runs off after the rabbit

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sulu!

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What is it? What's the matter?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you see them?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: See what? I don't see anything. What is it, Doc?

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The Captain is dictating his log in the presence of Yeoman Tonia Barrows

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's log. Stardate 3025 er, point 3. We are orbiting an uninhabited planet in the Omicron Delta region. A planet remarkably like Earth, or how we remember Earth to be. Park-like, beautiful, green, flowers, trees, green lawn, quiet and restful. Almost too good to be true.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Sir, I don't see your name in any of the shore parties.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I may be tired, Yeoman, but I'm not falling apart. Dismissed.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: She leaves, and Spock enters

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, we're beaming down the starboard section first. Which section would you like to go with?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not necessary in my case, Captain. On my planet, to rest is to rest, to cease using energy. To me, it is quite illogical to run up and down on green grass using energy instead of saving it.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Intercom whistles

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor McCoy calling from the planet, Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Open a channel, Uhura.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, are you beaming down?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hadn't planned to, Bones. Why?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, either our scouting probes and detectors are malfunctioning, and all us scouts careless and beauty-intoxicated, or I must report myself unfit for duty.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: On this supposedly uninhabited planet, I just saw a large rabbit

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Pull a gold watch from his vest and claim that he was late.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's pretty good. I got one for you. The rabbit was followed by a little blonde girl, right?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As a matter of fact, yes.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And they disappeared through a hole in a hedge.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Doctor, I'll take your report under consideration. Captain out. That's a McCoy pill, with a little mystery sugar-coating. He wants to get me down there. I'm afraid I won't swallow it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, Captain. Something I did come to discuss.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock, what is it?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: I picked this up from Doctor McCoy's log. We have a crewmember aboard who's showing signs of stress and fatigue. Reaction time down nine to twelve percent, associational reading norm minus three.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's much too low a rating.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's becoming irritable and quarrelsome, yet he refuses to take rest and rehabilitation. Now, He has that right, but we've found

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A crewman's right ends where the safety of the ship begins. That man will go a shore on my orders. What's his name?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: James Kirk. Enjoy yourself, Captain. It's an interesting planet. You'll find it quite pleasant. Very much like your Earth.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: An establishing shot of a landscape

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Scouts have detected no animals, artefacts, or force fields of any kind. Only peace, sunshine, and good air. You'll have no problems.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: But as these words are spoken, a rock raises itself to reveal a classic western-style six shooter gun.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Elsewhere, a man and a woman are taking scans of the vegetation

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Teller
Context: the woman
Text: Does it always have to be work with you? There's so much loveliness.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: You won't find all this so lovely if our report for the Captain isn't ready when he asks for it, which shouldn't be long.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Kirk and Barrows beam down

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rodriguez, Teller, everything all right?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Yes, sir. We've completed the specimen survey.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. That should be sufficient. Beam it up to Mister Spock when you're ready, and start enjoying yourselves.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Thank you, sir. And sir, I think you'll find Doctor McCoy and Mister Sulu that way.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Walking along

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Restful. After what we've been through, it's hard to believe a place this beautiful exists.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: It is beautiful. So lovely, and restful. I mean, affirmative, Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy! McCoy!

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Over here. Over here.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They meet up by the lake

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, know any good rabbit jokes lately?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As a matter of fact, I do, but this is not one of them. Look at this. (a pair of large tracks in the soil) I saw what I saw, or maybe I hallucinated it, but I want you to take a look and tell me what you think about it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Footprints. Could be a rabbit. It would have to be an unusual creature to make this size tracks. What about Mister Sulu? Will he confirm what you saw?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Negative. He was examining the flora at the time.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge, this is the Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Where is Mister Sulu?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Collecting specimens.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Has the first shore party beamed down yet?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Negative, Captain. They're just about to start.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get this message to all shore parties. Stand by. No one is to leave the ship.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're cancelling the shore leave on account of this, Jim?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the doctor, Doctor. Can you explain this?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, no.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neither can I. I admit it looks harmless. It probably is harmless. But before I bring my people down here, I want proof it's harmless.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They hear a gunshot. Kirk draws his phaser and they head off in the direction of the shot. More are fired.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They find Sulu target practising

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you think you're doing?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Target shooting, Captain. Isn't it a beauty? Haven't got anything like this in my collection.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where did you get it, Mister Sulu?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I found it. I know it's a crazy coincidence, but I've always wanted one like this. Found it lying right over there. An old-time police special, and in beautiful condition. Hasn't been one like this made in a couple of centuries.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Context: holding out his hand for the offending weapon
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Context: handing it over
Text: It fires lead pellets propelled by expanding gases from a chemical explosion.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll hang on to it. The fresh air seems to have made you trigger-happy.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Doctor McCoy's rabbit, sir. He must have gone through here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure our instruments didn't show any animal life on this planet?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Absolutely. No birds, no mammals, no insects, nothing. I'm certain our readings weren't off.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to believe this is an elaborate gag, but. Yeoman Barrows, you accompany Mister Sulu. Find out where those tracks came from. Doctor, you come with me back to the glade. I'd like another look at that area.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: As they head back, an aerial comes up in front of our point of view and follows them.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is turning out to be one very unusual shore leave.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it could have been worse.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You could have seen the rabbit.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter, Bones, you getting a persecution complex?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, yeah, I'm beginning to feel a little bit picked on, if that's what you mean.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know the feeling very well. I had it at the Academy. An upper classman there. One practical joke after another, and always on me. My own personal devil. A guy by the name of Finnegan.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And you being the very serious young

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Serious? I'll make a confession, Bones. I was absolutely grim, which delighted Finnegan no end. He's the kind of guy to put a bowl of cold soup in your bed or a bucket of water propped on a half-open door. You never knew where he'd strike next. More tracks. Looks like your rabbit came from over there.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A girl's footprints. The young blonde girl I saw chasing it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. You follow the rabbit. I'll backtrack the girl. I'll meet you around the other side of the hill.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Good. I've got a personal grudge against that rabbit, Jim.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They split up, and then suddenly there's a young man leaning against a tree trunk

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Context: in a dreadful cod-Irish accent
Text: Jim.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Finnegan? I can't believe it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: You never know when I'm going to strike, huh, Jim? (hits him on the jaw) How's this? Come on, come on. It's me, Finnegan. All right, Jimmy boy. (maniacal laughter) Go ahead, lay one on me. That's what you always wanted, isn't it? Come on. Come on.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, let's try that one again. Go!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He just lays hands on Finnegan for a good fight, when they hear screams. Kirk runs off to investigate

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Go! Any excuse, Jim baby. Run away! Run away! Run away!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Along the path, he meets McCoy

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What was it?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman Barrows.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They arrive on the scene to find Tonia disheveled, her uniform torn, hugging a tree

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: I don't know. I mean I do know. I was following the tracks, and there he was.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who was?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Him.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Barrows, give me a report.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: He had a cloak, sir, and a dagger with jewels on it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure you're not imagining all this?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Captain, I know it sounds incredible, but I did not imagine it any more than I imagined he did this.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sounds like Don Juan.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Yes. Yes. It was so sort of story book walking around here, and I was thinking, all a girl needs is Don Juan. Just day dreaming, the way you would about someone you'd like to meet.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu was with you. Where is he now?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: He ran after him.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with her, Doctor.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He heads off in the direction she indicates

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu! Sulu!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: An aerial comes up from a rock and monitors him as he runs along the path

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu! Sulu!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The Captain runs across a barren piece of ground towards a rocky outcrop, which suddenly gains palms and banana plants when he gets there.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He picks an orange flower, and becomes wistful. And there she is, blonde and lovely, her dress half white, half black and roses.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ruth? Ruth.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Jim, darling, it is me. It is Ruth.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: She kisses him

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Stardate 3025.8. Investigation of this increasingly unusual planet continues, and we are seeing things that cannot possibly exist, yet they are undeniably real.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Context: into communicator
Text: McCoy, do you read me? Ruth. Ruth, how can it be you? How could you possibly be here? You haven't aged. It's been fifteen years.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Ruth
Text: It doesn't matter. None of that matters.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: His communicator beeps

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you find Mister Sulu, Captain?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you find Mister Sulu?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but I'm sure he's all right.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sir? Are you all right?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm fine.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: Rodriguez to Captain Kirk.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Rodriguez.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: Captain, a while ago, I saw well, birds, a whole flock of them.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you like birds, Mister Rodriguez?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: I like them fine, sir, but all our surveys showed

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Then offhand I'd say our instruments are defective. There are indeed life-forms on this planet.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: Sir, our surveys couldn't have been that wrong.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Rodriguez, have the search parties rendezvous at the glade. I'd like some answers to all this.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Ruth
Text: You have to go?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't want to.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Ruth
Text: You'll see me again if you want to.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You haven't told me. You haven't told me

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Ruth
Text: Do what you have to do, and I'll be waiting.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ruth.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: communicator beeps

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm getting strange readings from the planet surface, Captain. Some sort of power field down there.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Specify.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: A highly sophisticated type of energy draining our power and increasing, beginning to affect our communications.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you pinpoint the source?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Could be coming from beneath the planet's surface. Patterns indicate some sort of industrial activity.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep me posted, Mister Spock. We'll continue our investigation down here. Captain out.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He walks off

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Meanwhile, back at the tree where Tonia met Don Juan, something is monitoring them. The couple go walking arm in arm through the tropical plants.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Feeling better?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: A little, but I wouldn't want to be alone here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a beautiful place. A little strange, I'll admit.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: That's just it. It's almost too beautiful. I was thinking, even before my tunic was torn, that in a place like this a girl should be, oh let's see now, a girl should be dressed like a fairy-tale princess, with lots of floaty stuff and a tall hat with a veil.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I see what you mean, but then you'd have whole armies of Don Juans to fight off. And me, too.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Is that a promise, Doctor?

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He takes her hands in his, and they gaze into each others eyes for a long second. Then she spots her dream clothing hanging on some shrubs

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Oh, Doctor, they're lovely. Look at me, Doctor. A lady to be protected and fought for. A princess of the blood royale.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You are all of those things and many more. They'll look even lovelier with you wearing them.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Doctor, I'm afraid.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, look, I don't know how or why, but the dress is here. I'd like to see you in it. Why don't you put it on?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: All right, but you stay right there. Don't peek.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My dear girl, I am a doctor. When I peek, it's in the line of duty.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: he turns his back on her, and his communicator beeps

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Calling Doctor McCoy.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here. I can't read you very well. Is this Rodriguez?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: This is all the volume I can get on this thing. Can't read you well, either. Captain's orders. Rendezvous at that glade where he first found you.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right. What the devil's wrong with communications? Esteban. Esteban.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: But Esteban and Teller have problems of their own - a tiger has them trapped

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriquez
Text: Doctor. Doctor. Doctor McCoy!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The tiger gets bored and leaves. Tonia emerges from her changing room looking lovely, and happy in her Disney fantasy creation.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the science officer, Mister Spock. I want some answers.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: First there was McCoy's Alice in Wonderland where there was supposedly no animal life. And Sulu's gun where there's no refined metal detected. Rodriguez' birds. And then my, well, the two people I saw.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Any chance these could be hallucinations?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One hallucination flattened me with a clout on the jaw.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The other.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: That sounds like a painful reality.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: There must be some logical explanation.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your signal is very weak. Can you turn up your gain?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm already on maximum.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, shall I beam down an armed party?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative. Our people here are armed with phasers. Besides, there's yet to be any real danger. (he sees geese flying overhead) Captain out.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Sulu walks along by a cliff face, a hatch opens in the ground and out comes a Samurai to attack him. Sulu's phaser doesn't work and he is forced to dodge the long, sharp sword

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy. McCoy, do you read me? Kirk to McCoy. Come in.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Sulu comes running over the rocks towards him

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, take cover! There's a Samurai after me.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A what?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I mean, there was. (no one is chasing him now) Captain, you've got to believe me.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I do. I've met some interesting personalities myself. Have you seen any of the others while I've been gone?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Got a call a few minutes ago. Rodriguez. Said you were rendezvousing back at the glade.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope he got through to everybody. Communications are almost out.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That's not all. So's my phaser.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Kirk checks his own weapon - nothing) KIRK: Yeah. We'd better get to the glade

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. (sound of a transporter beam) Look. Someone beaming down from the bridge.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trying to. Something's obstructing it. (finally the familiar shape fully materialises) Mister Spock, my orders were no one was to leave the ship.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Necessary, Captain. Unable to contact you by communicator, and the transporter is useless to us now. As I told you before, there's an unusual power field down here. It's soaking up all the energy at the source. I calculated the rate of its growth, and reasoned that I just might be able to transport one more person.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. We can use your help.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're stranded down here, Captain?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Until we can find out what this is all about.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: There's no one here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is where the Captain said to rendezvous. (makes Tonia stand with her back to a tree) I swear I heard someone moving around.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Don't talk like that.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A princess shouldn't be afraid, not with a brave knight to protect her.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The trio hear the snarl of a big cat

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That way. Spread out. Let's find it.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: A knight in armour on a black horse has appeared, and is coming towards them.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: These things cannot be real. Hallucinations can't harm us. Go back to where you were.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Kirk and Spock arrive on the scene. The knight lowers his lance, charges, and runs McCoy through. Tonia screams. Spock draws his phaser, and Kirk the gun he confiscated from Sulu. He shoots the knight from his horse, then they run to McCoy.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: He's dead.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. All contact with the Enterprise has been lost. We're trapped here. Our ship's surgeon, my personal friend, is dead. We're certain now that whatever we're facing is terribly real.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: It's my fault. It never would have happened. It's my fault.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: It is, it is. I'm to blame.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman! We're in trouble. I need every crewman alert and thinking.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Context: at the knight's body
Text: Captain! Captain!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Kirk goes over

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You'd better have a look at this, sir. (the knight is a plastic dummy) I don't understand.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neither do I, Mister Sulu, but before we leave this planet, I will.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's like a dummy, Captain. It couldn't be alive.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tricorder?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Still operating, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. (Spock and Sulu swap places, handing over the tricorder) What do you make of that?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is not human skin tissue, Captain. It more closely resembles the cellular casting we use for wound repairs. Much finer, of course.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want an exact judgment, Mister Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is definitely a mechanical contrivance. It has the same basic cell structure as the plants here, even the trees, the grass.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you saying this is a plant, Mister Spock?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm saying that these are all multicellular castings. The plants, the animals, the people. They're all being manufactured.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By who? And why? And why these particular things?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: All we know for certain is that they act exactly like the real thing. Just as pleasant or just as deadly.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: There's a buzzing sound in the air, and a plane flies overhead

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Teller
Text: What is it?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Of all the crazy things. Remember what I was telling you a while ago, about the early wars and funny air vehicles they used? That's one of them.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Teller
Text: Can it hurt us?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Not unless it makes a strafing run.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Teller
Text: A what?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: The way they used to attack people on the ground. (the plane descends) Come on.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They run along the path, as a second plane joins the first, straight into a clump of trees. Angela falls to the ground having hit the tree.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Rodriguez
Text: Angela.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Everyone has been watching the air show, then Sulu notices...

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain!

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy's body?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's gone. Dragged off.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: The black knight, too.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: At this point, Captain, my analysis may not sound very scientific.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy's death is a scientific fact.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is one slight possibility, very slim, but nevertheless. Captain, what were your thoughts just before you encountered the people you described?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was, I was thinking about the Academy. My days

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Hey, Jim baby! I see you brought out reinforcements. Ha! Well, I'm waiting for you, Jimmy boy.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Finnegan. Finnegan! What's been happening to my people?

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Finnegan laughs and runs off

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take Sulu. Find McCoy's body. This man is my problem.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, wait.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's an order, Mister Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He runs off after Finnegan

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Here I am! Run!

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Jim! Find me! Can't you see me? Come and get me! Here I am! Come on. You never could find your head with both hands! Like it used to be, Jimmy. Remember? (finally Kirk catches up to him, because he's lounging on a ledge) Hey, Jim

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want some answers.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Coming up.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He jumps on Kirk and they have a fight. Finnegan knocks Kirk down

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Get up. Get up. Get up. Always fight fair, don't you? True officer and gentleman, you. You stupid underclassman. I've got the edge. I'm still twenty years old. Look at you. You're an old man.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The fight resumes, and Kirk punches Finnegan till he falls down a rocky slope and ends up writhing in pain

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: I can't move me leg. I can't feel me leg. My back is broken. You've broken me back.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you feel that?

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He gets kicked to the ground

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Can you feel that, now? (Kirk passes out) Sleep sweet, Jimmy boy. Sleep as long as you like. Sleep forever, Jim boy. Forever and forever.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: A little later, Kirk regains consciousness

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Won't you ever learn, Jim boy? You never could take me, you know.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Finnegan. One thing

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Sure. Name it.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Answers.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Earn them!

Title: Shore Leave
Context: He throws dirt in Kirk's face and the exchange of punches resumes until they're both too tired to continue.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: Not bad. Kind of makes up for things, huh, Jim?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A lot of things. What's been happening to my people?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: I never answer questions from plebes, Jimmy boy.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not a plebe. This is today, fifteen years later. What are you doing here?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Finnegan
Text: I'm being exactly what you expect me to be, Jimmy boy.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Kirk lands the final haymaker that knocks Finnegan out cold

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did you enjoy it, Captain?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I enjoyed it. After all these years. (realisation dawns) I did enjoy it. The one thing I wanted to do after all these years was to beat the tar out of Finnegan.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which supports a theory I've been formulating.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That we're all meeting people and things that we happen to be thinking about at the moment.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Somehow our thoughts are read, these things are quickly manufactured and provided for us.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dangerous if we happen to be thinking about

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. We must all control our thoughts.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Difficult.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: The force field we encountered is obviously underground, manufacturing these things. Passages lead to the surface. Just for example, when Rodriguez thought of a tiger

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The tiger is behind them, the chain around it's neck tethering it to the spot clearly visible

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to get back to the landing party and warn them.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: They start to run back to the glade. The aircraft strafe them, Kirk elbows the Samurai out of his way

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Tonia has changed back into her uniform when Don Juan sneaks up behind her and grabs her, warding off Sulu and Rodriquez with his sword

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, Rodriguez, Barrows. Front and centre.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: Don Juan runs off

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't ask any questions, Sulu. Face front, everyone. Don't talk. Don't breathe. Don't think. You're at attention. Concentrate on that and only that. Concentrate.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: A smiling grey-haired man in a long green robe walks up to Kirk

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: I'm the caretaker of this place, Captain Kirk.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know my name?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: But of course. Lieutenant Rodriguez, Lieutenant Sulu, Yeoman Barrows and Mister Spock. We've just discovered you don't understand all this. These experiences were intended to amuse you.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Amuse? That's your word for what we've been through?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: But none of this is permanent. Here you have to only imagine your fondest wishes, either old ones you wish to relive or new ones, anything at all. Battle, fear, love, triumph. Anything that pleases you can be made to happen.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: The term is amusement park.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: Of course.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: An old Earth name for a place where people could go to see and do all sorts of fascinating things.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: This entire planet was constructed for our race of people to come and play.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Play? As advanced as you obviously are, and you still play?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, play, Mister Sulu. The more complex the mind, the greater the need for the simplicity of play.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: Exactly, Captain. How very perceptive of you.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But that still doesn't explain the death of my ship's surgeon.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Possibly because no one has died, Jim. (Strolls in with a lovely girl on each arm) I was taken below the surface for some rather remarkable repairs. It's amazing. They've got a factory complex down there you wouldn't believe. They can build or do anything immediately.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Context: not amused
Text: And how do you explain them?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh. Them. Well I, er, I was thinking about a little cabaret I know on Rigel Two, and, er, there were these two girls in the chorus line. And well, here they are. Well after all, I am on shore leave.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Tonia
Text: And so am l.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, yes. So you are. Well, girls, I suppose you can turn something up.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: The cabaret girls go to Sulu and Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: We regret that some of you've been made uncomfortable.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say your people built all this. Who are you? What planet are you from?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: My impression is that your race is not yet ready to understand us, Captain.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: I tend to agree.

Title: Shore Leave
Context: a communicator beeps

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: This is the bridge, Captain. Our power systems have just come back in. Do you require assistance?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, everything is in order, Lieutenant. Stand by.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: However.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Caretaker
Text: If you would use the proper caution, this amusement planet of ours could be an ideal place for your people to enjoy themselves, if you wish.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's what the doctor ordered, Jim.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commence transporting shore leave parties. Tell them to prepare for the best shore leave they've ever had. Kirk out.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Context: handing the girl over to Sulu
Text: Captain, I'll go back aboard ship and take over. With all due respect to the young lady, I've already had as much shore leave as I care for.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Mister Spock. I'll go. You. (then he sees Ruth walking towards the group) On the other hand, I'll stay for a day or two.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did you enjoy your rest, gentlemen?

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we did, Mister Spock. I think we did.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Indeed we did, Mister Spock.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most illogical.

Title: Shore Leave
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead warp factor one, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: A Yeoman is distributing coffees when McCoy enters

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: All clear ahead, Captain. The sensors indicate zero register.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forward readings, Mister Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gravimetric readings, no significant change, zero space density.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead warp factor three, Mister Sulu. Colony Beta Six wants their supplies. Let's get across this void in a hurry.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Void, star desert. The word conjures up pictures of dunes, oases, mirages.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sunlight, palm trees. We're nine hundred light years from that kind of desert, Bones.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: The precise meaning of the word desert is a waterless, barren wasteland. I fail to understand your romantic nostalgia for such a place.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That doesn't surprise me, Mister Spock. I can't imagine a mirage ever disturbing those mathematically perfect brain waves of yours.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Doctor McCoy. Moving on schedule into quadrant nine oh four. Beta Six is eight days distant.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something, Mister Spock?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unusual, Captain. I'm now getting a sizable space-displacement reading.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you verify that, Navigator?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: No, sir. Forward sweeps are negative. Wait. Verified, sir. We must be in some sort of light warp or we'd have picked it up earlier.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on visual.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: A purple globe appears on the viewscreen

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Iron-silica body, planet sized, magnitude one E. We'll be passing close.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Inconceivable this body has gone unnoted on all our records.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And yet, here it is. No time to investigate. Science stations, gather data for computer banks. Uhura, notify the discovery on subspace radio.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Strong interference on subspace, Captain. The planet must be a natural radio source.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of its range. Veer forty degrees to starboard, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Forty degrees.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He reaches for the switch, and sways as if dizzy, then stands up and vanishes

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He dashes to Sulu's station, then suddenly stops and disappears too

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Mister Spock, they're gone!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Emergency! Full reverse power!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log Stardate 2124.5. First Officer Spock reporting for Captain James Kirk. We are orbiting the lone unrecorded planet in the star desert. For four hours, we have made every possible instrument sweep, but Captain Kirk and Helmsman Sulu remain unaccounted for. I have placed the ship on red alert.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Enterprise is now orbiting a red planet with white whispy clouds

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've searched again from stem to stern. If they're not down on that planet, they're nowhere.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: No sign of human life on the surface, sir. Unless the instruments aren't functioning.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Function is normal. Continuous sensor sweeps. Lieutenant Uhura, have you checked all wave bands?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All of them, Mister Spock. No response.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: With due respect, sir. Request permission to transport to the surface immediately and carry out a search.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I second DeSalle's request. What are we waiting for?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: The decision will be mine, Doctor. I have the responsibility for your safety. (to Sulu's replacement) Mister Jaeger, describe your geophysical findings for the surface below.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: No detectable soil or vegetation. Extremely hot, toxic atmosphere swept by tornadic storm. Continuous volcanic eruptions. Deadly to any lifeforms such as we know it without oxygen and life-support systems.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Estimate survival time of two unprotected individuals down there.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: Not very long.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock. Look.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Words are appearing on the monitor above her head, in gothic script. Spock reads them out loud

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Greetings and felicitations. Hmm. Send this, Lieutenant. USS Enterprise to signaler on planet surface. Identify self.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The reply comes up on the monitor

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hip hip hoorah? And I believe it's pronounced tally ho.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Some kind of a joke, sir?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll entertain any theories, Mister DeSalle. Any at all.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: One thing is certain. Obviously there's life on that planet.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're quite correct, Doctor. Prepare transporter room.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Request assignment to the search party, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Mister Scott. Neither you nor I can be spared here. Mister DeSalle, equip the landing party with full communications, armament, and life-support gear. Mister Jaeger, your geophysical knowledge may be crucial down there. Doctor McCoy will accompany. If those peculiar signals are coming from Captain Kirk or Lieutenant Sulu, their rationality is in question. Dismissed.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No more messages from below, sir, but I've locked onto their original source.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very good. Transmit coordinates to Mister Scott. Once on the planet's surface, you'll establish contact with us immediately. Use the laser beacon if necessary. Ready, Scott?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready, Mister Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Activate.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The landing party arrive on grass, amidst trees and shrubs. Jaeger starts scanning immediately.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where are your storms, Jaeger?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: Atmosphere exactly the same as ours.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He takes of his oxygen mask, sniffs, and signals that the other two can do the same.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: DeSalle to Enterprise. DeSalle to Enterprise. It doesn't function. We're cut off.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: trying his own communicator
Text: No response.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Context: to Jaeger
Text: Keep trying with yours. Something's blocking the beacon. I've got to find open ground.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He wanders off through the shrubs

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Mister Jaeger! McCoy!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: They join him to see a stone building in the gothic style, with an iron-bound oak door. They approach cautiously, and enter

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The place is stuffed full of things. A bust of Napoleon on a stand, a suit of armour, a globe, tapestry and swords and shields on the walls, an open fire, a harpsichord and a large mirror

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In the name of heaven, where are we?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: They head down steps into the room, past the Salt Monster in an alcove

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Look.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Sulu and Kirk are displayed in a mini-minstrel's gallery. McCoy scans them.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's no reading. They're like waxworks figures.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The main door slams shut, and there's a man in an embroidered coat playing the harpsichord

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I must say, they make a perfectly exquisite display pair, but I suppose you want them back now.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He waves his hand and the two men come back to life

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Where are we?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Welcome to an island of peace on my stormy little planet of Gothos.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened? Fill me in.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You disappeared from the bridge after Sulu. We've been looking for you for four hours.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You must excuse my whimsical way of fetching you here, but when I saw you passing by I simply could not resist.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James Kirk of the United Starship Enterprise.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, so you're the Captain of these brave lads. My greetings and felicitations, Captain. So good of you and your officers to drop in. Absolutely smashing.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? Where do you come from?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: General Trelane, retired. At your service, sirs. My home is your home.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He goes back to his playing

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: We've lost contact with the ship, Captain. We're trapped here.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I can't tell you how delighted I am to have visitors from the very planet that I've made my hobby. Yes, but according to my observations, I didn't think you capable of such voyages.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: Notice the period, Captain. Nine hundred light years from Earth. It's what might be seen through a viewing scope if it were powerful enough.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, yes. I've been looking in on the doings on your lively little Earth.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you've been looking in on the doings nine hundred years past.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, really? Have I made an error in time? How fallible of me. Oh, I did so want to make you feel at home. I'm quite proud of the detail.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: General Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Retired, sir. Just Squire Trelane now. And you may call me Squire. Yes, I rather fancy that.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For what purpose have you imprisoned us here?
