Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Imprisoned? Nonsense. You're my guests. You see, I just finished my studies of your curious and fascinating society. You came by at the most propitious moment. I want to know all about your campaigns, your battles, your missions of conquest.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our missions are peaceful, not for conquest. When we do battle, it is only because we have no choice.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, but that's the official story, eh?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must ask you to let us go back to our ship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I wouldn't hear of it. You shall join me in a repast. I want to learn all about your feelings on war and killing and conquest. That sort of thing. Do you know that you're one of the few predator species that preys even on itself?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk returns to the main group, where DeSalle has his hand on his phaser

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not yet. Put it on stun, not to kill, DeSalle.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: DeSalle, did you say? Un vrai Francais?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: My ancestry is French, yes.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, monsieur. Vive la gloire. Vive Napoleon. You know, I admire your Napoleon very much.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Mister DeSalle, our navigator. Doctor McCoy, our medical officer. Mister Sulu, our helmsman, and Carl Jaeger, meteorologist.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Welcome, good physicianer and honourable sir. (bows low)

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Is he kidding?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Und Offizier Jaeger, und der deutsche Soldat, nein? (gives a little Prussian salute then marches around) Eins, zwei, drei, vier. Gehen vir mit dem Schiessgewehr.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: I'm a scientist, not a military man.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh come now. We're all military men under the skin. And how we do love our uniforms.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane is admiring himself in his mirror when he spots DeSalle raising his weapon, and with a wave of the hand, stops him

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: What an interesting weapon you've got there. Do let me see it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He takes it out of DeSalle's hand, and he can move again

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: TRELANE:: Yes. Now let me see. How does this work? Ah, yes. This won't kill, and this will.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He fires it at the Salt Monster, who is disintegrated

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, how marvellous! (destroys another exhibit) Devastating! Why, this could kill millions.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk takes it off him

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who will you start with, my crew? Are we your next targets?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, how absolutely typical of your species. You don't understand something, so you become fearful. Now, do let me anticipate your next question. You want to know how I've managed all of this.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's correct.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: We, meaning I and others, have, to state the matter briefly, perfected a system by which matter can be transferred to energy and back to matter again.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like the transporter system aboard the Enterprise.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, a crude example of an infinitely more sophisticated process. You see, we not only transport matter from place to place, but we can alter its shape at will.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This drawing room, did you create it by rearranging matter on this planet?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Quite.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. How did you manage

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Dear Captain, your inquiries are becoming tiresome. I want you to be happy. Free yourself of care. Let's enjoy ourselves in the spirit of martial good fellowship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, let's go. We're getting out of here.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Tut, tut, tut. You're being quite rude. You can't go. Apparently, you need another demonstration of my authority. Yes, quite.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk vanishes from the room and is in the natural atmosphere of the planet, choking on the fumes. Everyone in the room can hear him. Trelane brings him back) Now, that's a sample of the atmosphere of this planet outside my kindly influence. Now, you will behave yourself hereafter, won't you? Or I shall be very, very angry

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log Stardate 2125.7. Science Officer Spock reporting for Captain Kirk. We have completed fourteenth orbit of this planet without establishing contact with our missing officers or the parties sent to find them. Subspace communications remain blocked. However, by diverting impulse power to our sensors, we have made them operable, and we have detected one small area on the surface which seems relatively stable.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, it's there, Mister Spock. Peaceful as Earth, but how do you explain it?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't, Mister Scott. It simply exists. Artificial perhaps, or a freak of nature. The fact remains that life can exist in that area.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, it could, but it couldn't move around much.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apply a fine tuning on our sensors. Locate any life forms in that stable area.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: If we find any, it doesn't follow that it would be our people.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative. But if the Captain is down there and alive, that's where he'll have to be. We'll attempt to transport up any living beings our sensors detect.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Shooting in the dark, Mister Spock?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or stand by and do nothing, Mister Scott.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane is showing off his decor

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: And this, of course, is an array of your battle flags and pennants dating back to the Crusades, to Hannibal's invaders, the Grecian war galleys, and the hordes of Persia. Can't you imagine it, Captain? The thousands of men marching off to their deaths, singing beneath these banners. Doesn't it make your blood run swiftly?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Then he goes back to his music

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, where could he possibly come from? Who is this maniac?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Better say, what is he? I monitored him, and what I found was unbelievable.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not alive?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not in the way we define life. No trace. Zero.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You mean, it shows he's dead?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It doesn't even show that he exists at all, alive or dead.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Jaeger
Text: Notice the wood fire, Captain? Burning steadily, ember bed glowing, and it doesn't give off any heat at all.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire without heat, mistaking all this for present day Earth without taking into account the time differential. Whatever we're dealing with, he certainly isn't all knowledgeable. He makes mistakes.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Discussing deep laid plans, I'll wager. I cannot wait to see them evolve.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane, we haven't planned

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Tut tut. Do not think that I deplore your martial virtue of deception and stratagem. Quite the contrary. I have nothing but admiration for your whole species.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If your admiration is genuine, you must have respect for our sense of duty too. Our ship has need of us. We have tasks to perform.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, I can't let you go now. I was getting a bit bored until you came. You must stay. I insist.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For how long?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Until this is over, of course.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Until what is over?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Dear Captain, so many questions. Make the most of an uncertain future. Enjoy yourself today. Tomorrow may never come at all.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane, even if we wanted to stay, our companions are missing us.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Yes, I must experience your sense of concern, your grief at the separation.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are four hundred men and women aboard that ship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Women? Do you mean that you actually have members of the fairer sex among your crew? Oh, how charming. And they must be all very beautiful. And I shall be so very gallant to them. Here, let me fetch them down at once.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Context: grabbing his arm
Text: No.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: No?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This game has gone on long enough. Those are crucial operating personnel. You can't

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I can do anything I want. I should think you would have realised that by now.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, receiving a transporter signal.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Transporter signal? What does he mean? You must tell me!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It means, Trelane, the party's over, thanks to Mister Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Context: as the group is beamed away
Text: Wait! I won't have this! I haven't dismissed you yet. Stop! I won't have this!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everyone to stations. Report, Mister Spock. How were our scanners able to penetrate that radiation field?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: They didn't, Captain. Not clearly. We merely beamed up all life forms in a given area.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Which means Trelane is not a life form as we know it, or he'd be beaming through now.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to warp out of here at once. Maximum speed.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Ross
Context: a blonde yeoman
Text: Oh, Captain, I was so worried.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we're going to need every ounce of your engines. We're going to put a hundred million miles between us and that madman.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye aye, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm quaking, but I don't know if it's from laughter or terror.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor, what was it? What was down there?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it was a. Oh, forget it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Ross
Text: Look.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane has appeared on the Bridge

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Where are all your weapons, Captain? Don't you display your weapons?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Don't fret, Captain. I'm only a bit upset with you, but this Mister Spock you mentioned, the one responsible for that unseemly, impudent act of taking you from me, which is he?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Surely not an officer. He isn't quite human, is he?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: My father is from the planet Vulcan.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: And are its natives predatory?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not generally. But there have been exceptions.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Really? You will see to his punishment?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On the contrary. I commend his action.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: But I don't like him.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get off my ship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, rot! You're all going back with me.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not going anywhere.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Nonsense. I have an absolutely enchanting sojourn on Gothos planned for all of you, and you shan't spoil it for me. Anyway, the decor of my drawing room is much more appropriate

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: A lot of the clutter in the middle of the room has been replaced by a fully furnished dining table and six high-backed chairs. Sulu and DeSalle are already seated

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: And tasteful. Don't you agree?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: But so much more fitting, honourable sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Context: getting up
Text: You

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: DeSalle.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane 'stops' him

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, what primitive fury. Why, he's the very soul of sublime savagery.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane, let him go.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: he does, and Sulu grabs DeSalle

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We haven't even got our phasers.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Yes, of course. I forget that I shouldn't frighten you too much. But I warn you, you can't provoke me again. Come, everyone. Let's forget your bad manners. Let's be full of merry talk and sallies of wit. We have victuals to delight the palate and brave company to delight the mind. Come, Doctor, do partake. Ah, you've been quite derelict in your social duties, Captain. You haven't introduced me to the charming contingent of your crew.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is General Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Retired. But if you prefer, you may address me as the lonely Squire of Gothos, dear ladies.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura of communications.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah a Nubian prize. (he kisses her hand) Taken on one of your raids of conquest, no doubt, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No doubt.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: She has the melting eyes of the queen of Sheba. The same lovely colouring. And this. Is this the face that launched a thousand ships and burnt the topless towers of Ilium? Fair Helen, make me immortal with a kiss.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Context: holding Trelane back
Text: Yeoman Teresa Ross. I believe you have met our science officer Mister Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You do realise, don't you, that it's in deference to the Captain that I brought you here?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I don't know if I like your tone. It's most challenging. That's what you're doing, challenging me?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I object to you. I object to intellect without discipline. I object to power without constructive purpose.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, Mister Spock, you do have one saving grace after all. You're ill-mannered. The human half of you, no doubt. (to Ross) Ah, come, my little wood nymph. Won't you dance with your swain? (to Uhura) Give us some sprightly music, my dear girl.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't know how to play this.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Of course you do.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: And she does, as Trelane dances with Ross

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, how far do we go along with this charade?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Until we can think our way out. Meanwhile, we accept his hospitality.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You should taste his food. Straw would taste better than his meat, and water a hundred times better than his brandy. Nothing has any taste at all.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: It may be unappetizing, Doctor, but it is very logical.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's that magic word again. Does your logic find this fascinating, Mister Spock?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating is a word I use for the unexpected. In this case, I should think interesting would suffice.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't find this unexpected, Mister Spock?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: That his food has no taste, his wine no flavour? No. It simply means that Trelane knows all of the Earth forms, but none of the substance.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if he's fallible, he can't be all powerful. Which means he has something helping him.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A machine? A device? Something which does these things for him.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, my dear, don't we make a graceful pair? Except for one small detail. That dress hardly matches this charming scene.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Suddenly she's wearing an empire line dress with feathers in her hair. Idealised Jane Austen

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah, yes, that's more what we want. The dashing warrior and his elegant lady.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That mirror. It's part of his audience, his ego. He never wanders from it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is it ego, or something else?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: The mirror.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about it?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: You noted yourself he never gets very far from it. I suppose it could be vanity.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, Mister Spock, that's not the reason. What kind of a machine could do these things?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: A machine with the ability to turn energy into matter guided by thought waves. It would have a very complex memory bank, and would be extremely sophisticated.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Like a computer, only much more. Could the machine that maintains the environment in this immediate area be kept in this house?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think not. A device capable of keeping out this planet's natural atmosphere would be immense.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I agree. That leaves me free

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: . Spock
Text: Free, Captain?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I'm not mistaken, Mister Spock, I think I can turn his lights off at the source. (raises his voice) Don't be too upset by what you see, gentlemen. After all, his actions are those of an immature, unbalanced mind.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I overheard that remark, Captain. I'm afraid I'll have to dispense with you.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You only heard part of it. I just started.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I want you to leave my crewmen alone. I want you to leave my crewwomen alone too. (to Ross) You're not to dance with him. I don't like it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Does it actually make you angry, Captain?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Context: removing one of her long gloves
Text: I don't want you accepting his gifts, either.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Ross
Text: Captain, please don't do this.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Well, I do believe the dear Captain is jealous of me.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't care what you believe, just keep your hands off her!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, how curiously human. How wonderfully barbaric.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've had enough of your insulting attentions to her.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Of course you have. After all, that's the root of the matter, isn't it? You fight for the attention, the admiration, the possession of women.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If it's fighting that you want, (slaps Trelane) you may have it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Are you challenging me to a duel?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you have the courage.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, this is better than I'd planned. I shall not shirk an affair of honour.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He gets a box from the mantle-shelf. It contains a pair of duelling pistols

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: A matched set. Just like the pair that slew your heroic Alexander Hamilton. And Captain, I never miss.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 2126.1. Delayed report. The whole bridge crew are the unwilling guests of the creature who calls himself Trelane. We are weaponless, powerless, and our only hope of escape with the Enterprise lies in playing his games. I've decided to make my move with the field of honour game, and everything depends on my one chance with the ancient duelling pistol.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, how fascinating. I'm party to an actual human duel.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you ready?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Quite ready, sir. We shall test each other's courage and then, and then we shall see.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enough talk. Let's get on with it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: As you will, sir. Honour will be served, eh? Oh, wait! As the one challenged, I claim the first shot.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We shoot together.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: It's my game and my rules, but if you need to be persuaded. (aims at Spock)

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane takes aim, then fires his pistol at the ceiling instead

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: And now, Captain, how do you have the expression? My fate is in your hands.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: So Kirk shoots the mirror and everything goes hay-wire in the room

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You've ruined everything!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: The machine.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Captain, subspace interference is clearing.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to contact the ship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, the remarkable treachery of the species.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on, Trelane. Look at it. It's over. Your power is blanked out. You're finished.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You've earned my wrath. Go back. Go back to your ship, all of you, and prepare. You're all dead men. You especially, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He goes to his mirror, and vanishes

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane! Everyone, we're getting out of here. Now. This is the Captain. Commence beaming up. Maximum speed.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The men are already at their posts when the women arrive, and Yeoman Ross hasn't even got changed yet

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set course for Colony Beta Six.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Laid in, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full power acceleration from orbit, Mister Scott.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Scott
Text: Full power, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Emergency warp at the earliest possible moment, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standing by to warp, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Shall I make a full report to Spacefleet Command, sir?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not yet. They may trace our beam. Wait until we're well out of range.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can we know his range is, Captain?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can take an educated guess. At the point we entered their solar system.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Still no sign of pursuit. Instruments clear, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Ross
Text: May I take a moment to change?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think you might. Turn in your glass slippers. The ball is over.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Ross
Text: Gladly, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard to believe it ever happened.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we're about to warp.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Large body ahead.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The planet swims back onto the viewscreen

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Collision course.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard to port, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: That was the planet Gothos, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gothos? Mister Sulu, have we been going in circles?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir. All instruments show on course.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gothos again, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard over, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cat and mouse game.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With us as the mouse.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: There it is again. Dead ahead.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ninety degrees to starboard, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Turning, Captain. Nut not veering off from it.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ninety degrees sub-port, Mister Sulu. Adjust.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Turn completed, and still accelerating toward the planet.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or it toward us.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Decelerate into orbit. Prepare transporter room.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, you're not beaming down.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I am, Doctor McCoy. I am going to see our playful Mister Trelane and whatever it takes to make him give up our ship. Stand by communications. Mister Spock. If you don't receive a message from me within the hour, leave the vicinity at once. No turning back.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The bright drawing-room is now an austere courtroom, with Trelane as the gowned and be-wigged judge

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: The prisoner may approach the bench.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Any attempt at demonstrations will weigh against you with the court, and this time my instrumentality is unbreakable.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: A silhouette of a noose appears on the wall behind Kirk

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've had enough of your games.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, the absurdity of these inferior beings. (reading from the charge sheet) And now, Captain James Kirk, you stand accused of the high crime of treason against a superior authority, conspiracy, and the attempt to foment insurrection. How do you plead?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I haven't come to plead in your court, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I warn you. Anything you might say has already been taken down in evidence against you.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've come for one purpose. To get back my ship.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Irrelevant.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've made you angry with our will to survive, haven't we?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Uncalled for.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then vent your anger on me alone. I was the one who led the others. I was the one who shot out your mirror machine.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: And did you really think that was the only medium of instrumentality at my command?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I took that chance. I'm willing to pay the price for chancing wrong.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, then you do admit to the charge?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, anything! Just allow the Enterprise to continue its journey. You pompous

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Immaterial!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk leaves the dock and goes nose to nose with Trelane

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those people have done you no harm.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Inadmissible!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're living beings, not playthings for your amusement.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Silence! This trial is over. You are guilty. On all counts, you are guilty. And according to your own laws, this court has no choice in fixing punishment. You will hang by the neck, Captain, until you are dead, dead, dead!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 2126.3. First Officer Spock reporting. Still no word from Captain Kirk on the surface below us. Waiting time is almost up. I will soon be forced to attempt departure as per instructions.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Until a moment ago, I didn't think it possible, but it was. (takes off his robes and wig) I did it. I was angry. I actually experienced genuine rage. This experiment has been successful.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm glad you weren't disappointed.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Why, Captain, you're still angry. Would that I could have sustained that moment. Ah, no matter. Do you have a last request?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trelane, if you think I'm going to cheerfully and obediently stick my head in that noose

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You still haven't learned. You have no choice. Oh, this is becoming quite tiresome. It's all so very easy.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's your problem, Trelane. Everything is easy. It's given you a bad habit. You're not aware of it, but you have it. You don't think, Trelane. That's your problem. You miss opportunities, like your anger before and mine right now. Oh, you enjoy it, but you couldn't have accomplished it without me, and you know why? Because you're a bumbling, inept fool.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Take care, now.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Here you have an opportunity to experience something really unique, and you're wasting it. You want to commit murder? Go ahead, but where's the sport in a simple hanging?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: The sport?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. The terror of murder. The suspense. The fun.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, I'm intrigued. Go ahead, Captain. What do you suggest?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A personal conflict between us. Not like the duel before, but the real thing. The stakes, a human life. Mine.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Context: waving a sword around
Text: Yes! Yes!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the idea.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, then you approve?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but you can do better than that. There's still not enough sport in just killing me with a sword.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I know. That will be dull. We'll have to have something more fanciful. Let me see. A hunt. A royal hunt. Predator against predator. Now, you may go hide in the forest anywhere you like and I shall seek. How does that strike you, Captain?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It strikes me very well. But you'll have to make it worth my while, Trelane. Why not up the stakes?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: The stakes?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. While we're playing our game, free my ship. Let it continue on its way. In return, I'll give you a contest you'll remember.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Always back to your ship. Oh well. If it will add spice to the pursuit, I accept your terms, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk is outside the building

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Remember, you must try not to let me find you too quickly.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me notify the Enterprise that it can go.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: At your convenience.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Enterprise. Enterprise, this is Kirk. Can you hear me? (static) Get the ship away as fast as you can. I'll try and give you the time you need. Can you hear me?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Trelane appears out of thin air

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah-ha!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk dodges him and runs into the shrubs

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Enterprise.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah ha! Captain Kirk. You must try harder, Captain. This is too easy.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: They keep dodging amongst the shrubs

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise. Enterprise, can you hear me?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk takes an opportunity to get Trelane's sword off him, but when he takes a swing at his foe he just disappears and reappears again

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Touche, Captain. Touche. I must confess you scored first. But after all, I never played this game before.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: A sword appears in his hand

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: And now let's have at it again!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk fences Trelane with a branch, but it breaks and he has to run off, leaving Trelane laughing

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The door will not open

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise. Enterprise.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Ah-ha! Tallyho! (iron grids pen Kirk in) You made a noble fight of it, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Remember, Trelane. You promised to let my ship go.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Yes, but this is such sport. I must fetch all the others back to play. So this is victory. It has a sweet taste. Down, Captain. On your knees!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You haven't won, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I have. I could run you through!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you haven't won anything.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: On your knees, Captain!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No! Does it still taste as sweet?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I order you. You've been beaten.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I'm not defeated.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I order you! I order you! (Kirk disarms him and snaps the sword across his knee) You broke it! You broke my sword!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got a lot to learn about winning, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You dare to defy me!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In fact, you've got a lot to learn about everything, haven't you?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Kirk slaps his face

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I'll fix you for that! You cheated! You haven't played the game right. I'll show you!

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: Two green flashing lights appear, and Trelane steps into their spotlight

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: No! No. You said I could have this planet.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: This has gone far enough.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: You always stop me when I'm having fun.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: You're disobedient and cruel. We've told you before.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: Time to come in now, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: But I don't want to come in, and I won't. I'm a general, and I won't listen to you.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: Enough, Trelane. Come along.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: But why? I didn't do anything wrong. I was just playing.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: We said, come along.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: But I haven't finished studying my predators yet.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: This is not studying them.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: If you cannot take proper care of your pets, you cannot have them at all.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, but I was winning. I was winning.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: They're beings, Trelane. They have spirit. They're superior.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: No, no. You saw.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: You'll grow up, Trelane. You'll understand. Now come along.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, but you said I could. You promised. I never have any fun.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: Stop that nonsense at once, or you'll not be permitted to make any more planets.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: Oh, but you saw. I was winning. I would have won. Honest.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: No, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: No, Trelane.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The spotlight contracts, and Trelane gradually vanishes

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Trelane
Text: I would have. I would have. I would have. I would. I would. I would. I would.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: Captain, we regret that the life paths of yourself and your companions have been disturbed.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? Who is Trelane?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: You must forgive our child. The fault is ours for indulging him too much. He will be punished.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Father
Text: We would not have let him intercept you had we realised your vulnerability.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Mother
Text: Forgive us, Captain. We will maintain your life-support conditions while you return to your ship. Please accept our apologies.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: The lights disappear

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to Enterprise. Captain to Enterprise.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we're receiving you.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam me up, Mister Spock. We're free to go.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warping down, Captain. Our warp factor four.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Approach channels clear, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Colony Beta Six clears us for normal approach, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Normal orbit approach procedures, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Still thinking about Trelane, is that it?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: For the record, how do we describe him? Pure mentality? Force of intellect? Embodied energy? Superbeing? He must be classified, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: God of war, Mister Spock.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I hardly find that fitting.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then a small boy, and a very naughty one at that.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will make a strange entry in the library banks.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then he was a very strange small boy. One the other hand, he was probably doing things comparable to the same mischievous pranks you played when you were a boy.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mischievous pranks, Captain?

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Dipping little girls' curls in inkwells. Stealing apples from the neighbours' trees. Tying cans on

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Context: He's stopped by the look of horrified incredulity on Spock's face.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forgive me, Mister Spock. I should have known better.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall be delighted, Captain.

Title: Arena
Context: Enterprise is in orbit of a planet

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll enjoy Commodore Travers. He sets a good table.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder if he brought his personal chef along with him to Cestus Three.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Probably. Rank hath its privileges.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How well we both know that.

Title: Arena
Context: Intercom whistles

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. Kirk here.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Travers
Text: Travers, Jim. We're waiting.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, Commodore. We're on our way.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Travers
Text: Be sure to bring along your tactical people. I've got an interesting problem for them.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll beam down immediately, Commodore. Kirk out.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. I wonder why he's insistent that our tactical aides come down.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This colony is isolated, exposed, out on the edge of now here. He probably wants additional advice.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps, Captain, but nevertheless

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, isn't it enough the commodore is famous for his hospitality? I, for one, could use a good non-reconstituted meal.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, you are a sensualist.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You bet your pointed ears I am. Ready whenever you are, Captain.

Title: Arena
Context: Six men, including one red shirt, get on the transporter platform

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Arena
Context: There is no one waiting to meet them. Instead, just razed ground and the smoke of a few fires

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Red alert.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What is it, Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cestus Three has been destroyed.

Title: Arena
Context: They take cover

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full alert. Tricorder readings, Mister Spock. Life detection.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Those messages we got, Captain, the one directing us here yesterday.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Faked. All this happened several days ago. (to a man in a yellow shirt) Lang, over there. Look for survivors. Kelowitz, (blue shirt) that way. (to the red shirt) O'Herlihy, stick with me.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, impulses that direction. Very weak, possibly a survivor.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Bones.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 3045.6 The Enterprise has responded to a call from Earth observation outpost on Cestus Three. On landing, we have discovered that the outpost has been destroyed.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, over there.

Title: Arena
Context: They run to a lone survivor amongst a tangle of wreckage

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Careful, careful. Shock, radiation burns, internal injuries for certain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Careful, careful. Shock, radiation burns, internal injuries for certain. He's in a bad way, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep him alive, Bones. I want to know what's been happening here.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Getting another life reading, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Survivors?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not survivors. Not warm-blooded. Living creatures, but not human.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Azimuth ninety three degrees, range one five seven zero yards.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: O'Herlihy.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk sends his security guard off to look, but he hasn't gone far before he stands up and says

Title: Arena
Speaker: O'Herlihy
Text: Captain, I see something.

Title: Arena
Context: And promptly gets hit by a beam and vanishes. There's also an incoming whistle and an explosion.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cover! Kirk to Enterprise, lock on transporters. Beam us up.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we're coming under attack. Unidentified ship quartering in.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We can't beam you up. I've just rigged up defensive screens.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep those screens up. Fire all phasers.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Firing phasers, Captain. The alien has screens up, too.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take all action necessary to protect the ship. We'll hold out here.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Are you under attack, Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We could drop screens.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep those screens up. Worry about us when the ship is safe.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: Arena
Context: More bombs rain down around them

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If they lower those screens to beam us up, they'll be open to phaser attack.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're hopelessly outnumbered here, Captain. It's those disruptors versus our hand phasers.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're stuck with it, Mister Spock. We'll have to make do with what we've got.

Title: Arena
Context: Carrying the survivor, the away team heads into better shelter - Life Support Ramp 3 Level K according to the sign

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kelowitz, Lang, flank out. Lay down fire on co-ordinates Mister Spock gave you. Even if you don't see them. Keep your heads down.

Title: Arena
Context: Lang and Kelowitz leave

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're helpless down here. And the Enterprise

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sulu is an experienced combat officer.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's my ship, Mister Spock. I should be there. We can't even get at them.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor can they at us at the moment. Not unless they moved their original position. That intervening high ground.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you remember the layout of this place? The arsenal?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: About one hundred yards in that direction. But after an attack as thorough as this one

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll risk it.

Title: Arena
Context: He does an heroic zigzag run amongst the incoming explosions, takes shelter behind an oil drum and calls Enterprise

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Report.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, are you all right?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind about me. What about the ship?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We returned fire with all phaser banks. Negative against its deflector screen.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Arm your photon torpedoes.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Arm photon torpedoes. Stand by.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any identification on the attacking vessel?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir. Doesn't correspond with any configuration we're familiar with.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We can't get visual contact. She's too far away.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Mister Sulu, photon torpedoes locked on.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Photon torpedoes locked on, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Fire all banks.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All banks fired, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu. Sulu, our communications are being interfered with. (An explosion makes him run further on into an old bomb crater) Now get this straight.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do anything you think necessary to protect the ship. Leave orbit, maximum warp, anything. Clear?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Clear, Captain, but you

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind about me. Protect my ship!

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Photon torpedoes negative, Captain. I'm warping out of orbit.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Contact me when you can. Kirk out.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk ducks into a building. Meanwhile, back over at Ramp 3

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: How is he, Doctor?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll be dead in half an hour if we don't get him some decent care.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're moving. I've got to get to the Captain.

Title: Arena
Context: He joins Kirk in the bomb crater, where a grenade launcher is being set up

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Locked on to the enemy, Captain. They're moving toward the high ground. (fizzing sound and smoke) They've locked on to my tricorder.

Title: Arena
Context: He throws it away and it goes bang

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very ingenious. They fed back my own impulses and built up an overload.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll see how ingenious they are. Here, give me a hand with this grenade launcher. Lang!

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Any word from the Enterprise?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu's taken her out of orbit.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: They got Lang, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you see them?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: No, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An evaluation, Mister Kelowitz. Where do you think they are?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: If I were them, I'd go to the high ground on the right. I make it twelve hundred yards, azimuth eighty seven. It's pretty close for one of these little jewels, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It'll be a lot closer to them. Stand clear.

Title: Arena
Context: He drops a blue ball into the launcher, it zooms off and there is a blinding flash and bang. Silence reigns until Kirk's communicator beeps.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the alien's withdrawing. She's at extreme range, but our sensors indicate she just activated her transporters.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock on to the alien, Mister Sulu. I don't want to lose her.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Our screens are down. We can beam you up now, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want a search party of thirty medical personnel beamed down immediately to search for survivors. Notify the transporter room. Lock onto us. We're beaming up.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplement. We have beamed back to the Enterprise and immediately set out in pursuit of the alien vessel. It appears to be headed toward a largely unexplored section of the galaxy.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you tell me what happened?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Man
Text: Scanners reported a ship approaching. We get them now and then. They're all welcome to use our facilities. You know that.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Man
Text: They came in space normal speed, using our regular approach route, but they knocked out our phaser batteries with their first salvo. From then on we were helpless. We weren't expecting anything! Why should we? We didn't have anything anyone would want.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Easy. Easy.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Man
Text: They poured it on, like, like phasers, only worse, whatever they were using. I tried to signal them. We called up. Tried to surrender. We had women and children. I told them that! I begged them! They wouldn't listen. They didn't let up for a moment.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, the Enterprise received two messages, ostensibly from Cestus Three. One for the Enterprise to go there, and the other for myself and my tactical crew to beam down to the surface.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Man
Text: They hit us a full day before you got there, Captain. No messages came from us, Captain. Why did they do it? Why? Why did they do it? There has to be a reason. There has to be a reason!

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was a trap. Getting the Enterprise to come to Cestus Three, getting us and our whole crew to come ashore.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very clever. As to the reason?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The reason is crystal clear. The Enterprise is the only protection in this section of the Federation. Destroy the Enterprise, and everything is wide open.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: You allude to invasion, Captain, yet positive proof

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have all the proof I need on Cestus Three.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not necessarily, sir. Several possible explanations

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How can you explain a massacre like that? No, Mister Spock. The threat is clear and immediate. Invasion.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, then. If that's the case, you must make certain that the alien vessel never reaches its home base.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I intend to. If we can keep them in the dark as to our strength, they'll never dare move against us. Captain to helmsman.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu here, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is the alien still making warp five?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Affirmative, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Initiate warp six.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Affirmative, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Overtake. Phaser banks, lock on to the enemy vessel. Stand by for firing orders. All hands, this is the Captain. We are going into battle. All hands, battle stations. Red alert. I repeat, red alert. This is no drill. This is no drill.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 3046.2. We are in hot pursuit of the alien vessel which destroyed the Earth outpost on Cestus Three.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister DePaul.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Position.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Twenty two point three parsecs beyond latest chart limit, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All scanners lock into computer banks. I want a complete record of this. Mister Spock, what do we have on this general area?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Virtually nothing, Captain. No records of any explorations. There are rumours of certain strange signals on subspace channels. However, none has ever been recorded.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything on intelligent life forms?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing specific, Captain. Unscientific rumours only. More like space legends.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, status, alien vessel.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They must be aware we're after them, sir. They've gone to warp six also.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp factor seven.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something the matter, Mister Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: A sustained warp seven speed will be dangerous, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. I mean to catch them.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll either catch them or blow up, Captain. They may be faster than we are.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll have to prove it. Yes, Mister Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: You mean to destroy the alien ship, Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: I thought perhaps the hot pursuit alone might be sufficient. Destruction might be unnecessary.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Colony Cestus Three has been obliterated, Mister Spock.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: The destruction of the alien vessel will not help that colony, Jim.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If the aliens go unpunished, they'll be back, attacking other Federation installations.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: I merely suggested that a regard for sentient life

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no time for that. It's a matter of policy. Out here, we're the only policemen around. And a crime has been committed. Do I make myself clear?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very clear, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm delighted, Mister Spock. Report, Mister Sulu.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Alien ship maintaining interval, Captain. Now at warp seven.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp factor eight.

Title: Arena
Context: Everyone looks surprised. Scotty is aghast.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to phaser banks. All components at battle ready. All banks primed.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Aft phaser to Bridge. Alert status. All weapons at operational ready.

Title: Arena
Context: Later, the ship has not blown up, and Sulu has a grin on his face

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Sulu.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Closing on target, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Mister DePaul.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our position.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Two two seven nine pl, sir. Uncharted solar system at two four six six pm.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it on the alien's course?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Depaul
Text: No, sir. He's headed away from it.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, sensors report we're being scanned.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By the alien ship?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir. It's from that solar system ahead.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any interference? Resistance?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir, Just scanning beams. It's on an unusual wave length.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would appear someone is curious about us.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, is the alien still heading away from that solar system?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. We're closing, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, anything further on those scanning beams?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There's no hostility, sir. They're not tractors or weapons of any sort, Just increasing in intensity. Steady. Regular. It's growing stronger, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain!

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, what is it?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The alien. It's slowing down. Warp five, four, two. It's going sublight, sir. Sir? It's stopped dead in space.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He may be turning to fight.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir. They're just dead out there.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Unmoving.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we've got them. Go to Red Alert. Prepare to fire phaser banks. Sensors, lock on. Mister Sulu, continue closing. Mister Spock, lock phasers into computer. Computers will control attack.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer lock ready, Captain. All systems standing by.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Range is one eight one zero. One seven six zero. Range is one seven zero zero. One six four zero. Range is one five nine zero. One five five zero and closing, sir.

Title: Arena
Context: Suddenly, the ship decelerates, and everyone hangs on to something as the lights dim.) SULU: Warp six, warp five, four, warp three, warp one. Sublight, Captain. We're stuck, Captain. It's impossible, but. It's impossible

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From warp eight? Have you lost your mind?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Same as the alien, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, report.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're dead, Captain. Locked up. Frozen tight. All propulsion systems read zero.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Life systems?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're all normal, sir. Atmosphere, heat, light. No variance.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser banks. Report.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Crewman
Text: We're all inoperative here, Captain. No power at all. No faulty circuits I can find. Just no power.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damage Control, report.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: All systems report normal, Captain. No ascertainable damage.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Then what is it?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir, but whatever it is, we canna move.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're being held in place, Captain, apparently from that solar system.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; This far out? That's impossible.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are being held.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tractor beam?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. An unidentifiable power.

Title: Arena
Context: The lights flicker and the viewscreen goes psychedelic.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: We are the Metrons. You are one of two crafts which have come into our space on a mission of violence. This is not permissible. Yet we have analysed you and have learned that your violent tendencies are inherent. So be it. We will control them. We will resolve your conflict in the way most suited to your limited mentalities. Captain James Kirk.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Kirk.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: We have prepared a planet with a suitable atmosphere. You will be taken there, as will the Captain of the Gorn ship which you have been pursuing. There you will settle your dispute.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: METRON [OC]:You will be provided with a recording-translating device, in hopes that a chronicle of this contest will serve to dissuade others of your kind from entering our system, but you will not be permitted to communicate with your ship. You will each be totally alone.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What makes you think you can interfere with

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: It is you who are interfering. We are simply putting a stop to it. The place we have prepared for you contains sufficient elements for either of you to construct weapons lethal enough to destroy the other, which seems to be your intention. The winner of the contest will be permitted to go his way unharmed. The loser, along with his ship, shall be destroyed in the interests of peace. The contest will be one of ingenuity against ingenuity, brute strength against brute strength. The results will be final.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just a minute

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: There will be no discussion. It is done.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk vanishes, and Uhura screams

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's gone.

Title: Arena
Context: A dinosaur- like being with multifaceted eyes and a multicoloured tunic greets us with a roar. Kirk is now wearing a belt with the recorder/translator on it

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Enterprise is dead in space, stopped cold during her pursuit of an alien raider by mysterious forces, and I have been somehow whisked off the bridge and placed on the surface of an asteroid, facing the Captain of the alien ship. Weaponless, I face the creature the Metrons called a Gorn. Large, reptilian. Like most humans, I seem to have an instinctive revulsion to reptiles. I must fight to remember that this is an intelligent, highly advanced individual, the Captain of a starship, like myself, undoubtedly a dangerously clever opponent.

Title: Arena
Context: The Gorn breaks a branch of a tree with great ease. Kirk struggles to break off a twig. Their first physical engagement is uneven. Kirk is more agile than the reptile but nowhere near as strong. He boxes the Gorn's ears to get out of a bear-hug and runs up into the rocks looking for weapons. He throws a heavy rock at the Gorn, but it just bounces off his chest. When a boulder gets flung at him in return, Kirk retreats. Quickly.

Title: Arena
Context: Spock goes over to the Engineering Station

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have you tried overload?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. It does no good.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: How about bypassing the transformer banks? Feed the impulse engines directly.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Scott
Text: I tried that, sir. Nothing.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, have sensors learned anything about the nature of the force which holds us here?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir. They report they definitely emanate from that solar system ahead.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: No indication of its composition? Gravimetric? Magnetic? Electronic?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing, sir.

Title: Arena
Context: Standing on rocks, silhouetted against a clear blue sky, Kirk makes an entry on his recorder for posterity.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James Kirk of the Starship Enterprise. Who ever finds this please get it to Starfleet Command. I'm engaged in personal combat with a creature apparently called a Gorn.

Title: Arena
Context: We see that the recording is also being transmitted and translated by the Gorn's device too

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's immensely strong. Already he has withstood attacks from me that would have killed a human being. Fortunately, though strong, he is not agile. The agility and, I hope, the cleverness, is mine.

Title: Arena
Context: Back on the rock

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Metrons, the creatures that sent us both here, said that the surface of the planet provides the raw material to construct weapons. There's very little here. Scrub brush, rocks, an abundance of mineral deposits, but no weapons in the conventional sense. Still, I need to find one. Bare-handed against the Gorn, I have no chance.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Leave channel one open, Lieutenant, just in case.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are you going to do, Mister Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm going to wait, Doctor. There's little else I can do.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What about the Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I could help him, I would. I cannot.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, you're the one that's always talking about logic. What about some logic now? Where's the Captain, Mister Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's out there, Doctor. Out there somewhere in a thousand cubic parsecs of space, and there's absolutely nothing we can do to help him.

Title: Arena
Context: Running up a slope, Kirk comes across a clump of mature bamboo. Good, solid, hollow stems, but he doesn't regard them as suitable clubs. He carries on gaining height. Meanwhile, the Gorn is using trailing vines to construct something. Kirk comes across an outcrop of minerals, and decides to tell us what they are.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A large deposit of diamonds on the surface. Perhaps the hardest substance known in the universe. Beautifully crystallized and pointed, but too small to be useful as a weapon. An incredible fortune in stones yet I would trade them all for a hand phaser, or a good solid club. Yet the Metrons said there would be weapons, if I could find them. Where? What kind?

Title: Arena
Context: From his vantage point on the ridge, Kirk watches the Gorn at work, then spots a lone rock neatly balanced on a pinnacle above his adversary. He pushes it over, the Gorn looks up, then we get the cloud of dust and a view of the reptile under the rock, lying still. Confident, Kirk comes down to check on his kill, just in time to see the Gorn move, grasp his stone dagger, and get up again. The rock continues on its way down the slope. The mammal runs away, straight into reptiles trap of vines and rocks. Now Kirk is pinned under a boulder, and at his enemy's mercy

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: But the Gorn has to move the boulder to be able to stab him, so once again Kirk is able to dodge away, albeit with a limp.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the U.S.S. Enterprise calling the Metrons. Our channels are open. Come in, please. We urgently desire a conference. Please answer.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk hobbles up to a rock face with bright yellow powder spread across it, and takes a rest. We keep cutting to the Gorn, who can hear everything he says, remember.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This may be my last entry. I am almost exhausted. Unless I find the weapon the Metron mentioned I have very little time left. Native sulphur, diamonds. This place is a mineralogist's dream. Yet there is something about sulphur. Something very old. Something? If only I could remember.

Title: Arena
Context: The Gorn's roar comes closer, and he moves on

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The ship, our engines, our weapons. It's just inconceivable that we are immobilised.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: But it has happened, Doctor.

Title: Arena
Context: Dimmed lights and swirly viewscreen again

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: We are the Metrons. Your Captain is losing his battle. We would suggest you make whatever memorial arrangements, if any, which are customary in your culture. We believe you have very little time left.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We appeal to you in the name of civilisation. Put a stop to this.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: Your violent intent and actions demonstrate that you are not civilised. However, we are not without compassion. It is possible you may have feelings toward your Captain. So that you will be able to prepare yourself, we will allow you to see and hear what is now transpiring.

Title: Arena
Context: There on the viewscreen is their first sight of a Gorn, then Kirk and yet another mineral deposit.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If there were only some way we could contact him.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, indeed, Doctor, if only there were. Notice the substance encrusting that rock. Yes. Unless I'm mistaken, it's potassium nitrate.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps nothing, Doctor. (Kirk tastes the mineral and spits it out) Perhaps everything.

Title: Arena
Context: The bridge crew watch as enlightenment dawns and Kirk goes off in search of his other mineral discoveries.) GORN [OC]: Earthling! Captain

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who is this, the Metron?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: This is your opponent, Earthling. I have heard every word you have said.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. What do you want?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: I'm weary of the chase. Wait for me. I shall be merciful and quick.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like you were at Cestus Three?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: You were intruding! You established an outpost in our space.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You butchered helpless human beings

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: We destroyed invaders, as I shall destroy you!

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can that be true? Was Cestus Three an intrusion on their space?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: It may well be possible, Doctor. We know very little about that section of the galaxy.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then we could be in the wrong.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps. That is something best decided by diplomats.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Gorn simply might have been trying to protect themselves.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Arena
Context: They watch as Kirk returns to the bamboo clump and picks out a short, wide stem.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. Good. Good. (Kirk cuts vines to length against a rock) He knows, Doctor. He has reasoned it out.

Title: Arena
Context: Potassium nitrate gets shoveled into the bamboo

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Yes.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is it, Spock?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; An invention, Doctor. First potassium nitrate, and now if he can find some sulphur and a charcoal deposit or ordinary coal.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk is at the outcrop of sharp diamonds, and putting them into the bamboo too.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's he doing?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Diamonds. The hardest known substance. Impelled by sufficient force, they would make formidable projectiles.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What force?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recall your basic chemistry, Doctor. Gunpowder.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: Captain, let us be reasonable.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Gorn
Text: You have lost. Admit it to yourself. Stop running.

Title: Arena
Context: Now the sulphur goes into the cannon, and finally he finds a vein on coal.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Coal.

Title: Arena
Context: Now Kirk settles down to empty the bamboo, crush the coal, make a hole in the bamboo for a fuse and then mix his ingredients a little more precisely.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can he do it?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: If he has the time, Doctor. If he has the time.

Title: Arena
Context: The cannon is strengthened with the vine tied around it, and the gunpowder gets rammed home with a small branch. Finally the diamonds go in, and a piece of torn trouser will serve as a fuse, once he can raise a spark from a stone and the translating device. Fire is created as the Gorn approaches him from behind. Seeing the danger, he braces the cannon and fires it. The explosion blows the bamboo apart, and also incapacitates his opponent. Kirk picks up his fallen stone dagger and puts the point to the Gorn's windpipe, but cannot administer the coup de grace.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, I won't kill you. Maybe you thought you were protecting yourself when you attacked the outpost.

Title: Arena
Context: He throws the dagger away, stands up and shouts to the sky

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I won't kill him! Do you hear? You'll have to get your entertainment someplace else!

Title: Arena
Context: The Gorn disappears, and a young blond boy in a white shift appears instead.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a Metron?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: Does my appearance surprise you, Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem more like a boy.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: I am approximately fifteen hundred of your Earth years old. You surprise me, Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: By sparing your helpless enemy who surely would have destroyed you, you demonstrated the advanced trait of mercy, something we hardly expected. We feel there may be hope for your kind. Therefore, you will not be destroyed. It would not be civilised.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to the Gorn?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: I sent him back to his ship. If you like, I shall destroy him for you.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. That won't be necessary. We can talk. Maybe reach an agreement.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Metron
Text: Very good, Captain. There is hope for you. Perhaps in several thousand years, your people and mine shall meet to reach an agreement. You are still half savage, but there is hope. We will contact you when we are ready.

Title: Arena
Context: Kirk suddenly appears in front of the crew, who all leap to their feet.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain! Are you all right?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. I don't know. All right, everybody. Back to your posts. Let's get out of here.

Title: Arena
Context: He takes his seat.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's impossible, but there's Sirius over there when it should be here. And Canopus. And Arcanis. We're. All of a sudden, we're clear across the galaxy, five hundred parsecs from where we are I mean, were. I mean

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't try and figure it out, Mister Sulu. Just plot a course for us back to Cestus Three.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Arena
Context: McCoy leaves

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: After you touched off your primitive cannon, Captain, we lost the picture the Metron was sending us.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; You saw what happened down there?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
