Text: Most of it. I would be interested in knowing what finally happened.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're a most promising species, Mister Spock, as predators go. Did you know that?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've frequently had my doubts.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't. Not anymore. And maybe in a thousand years or so, we'll be able to prove it. Never mind, Mister Spock. It doesn't make much sense to me either. Take us back to where we're supposed to be, Mister Sulu. Warp factor one.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor one.

Title: Arena
Speaker: Spock
Text: A thousand years, Captain?

Title: Arena
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Well, that gives us a little time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Enterprise is orbiting a red and white planet.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Spock?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very typical, Captain. Iron-silicon base, oxygen-hydrogen atmosphere, largely arid, no discernible life. No surprises.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Photographic section, begin scanning. Tie in to visual section 988-TG, computer bank 22. Kirk out. About four more orbits ought to do it, Mister Lesley. That'll wrap it up. Lay in a course for Starbase 200.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lesley
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Something suddenly rocks the ship. We see a shot of a nebula along with the crew.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Incredible, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: And again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was that?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: What my instruments read is totally unbelievable, Captain. Twice, for a split second each time, everything within range of our instruments seemed on the verge of winking out.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want facts, not poetry.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have given you the facts, Captain. The entire magnetic field in this solar system simply blinked. The planet below, the mass of which we're measuring, attained zero gravity.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible. What you're describing

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is non-existence.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Standard General Alert signal from Starfleet Command, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All stations to immediate alert status. Stand by.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, scanners now report a life object on the planet surface below.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You just did a complete life survey five minutes ago. How are you just picking it up now?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Inexplicable, Captain. This reading began at approximately the moment that the pulsation phenomenon began to subside.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, what is it, this object? Its physical makeup?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: A living being. Body temperature 98.5 Fahrenheit. Mass, electrical impulses, movement. It is apparently human, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And its appearance coincided with this cosmic winking-out?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Almost to the second.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explanation.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: None.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speculation. Could this being present any danger to the ship?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possible. Very possible.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, notify Security to have an armed detachment of men ready to beam down with us. Let's go. Any word comes through from Starfleet Command, pipe it down immediately. Communications, priority one.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3087.6. While investigating an uncharted planet, the Enterprise and at least this entire quadrant of space, has been subjected to violent, unexplained stress and force. Sensors have reported the presence of a human being on the planet below who might be connected with the phenomenon. With my first officer and a security team, I have set out in search of him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk, Spock and four armed red-shirts arrive on a rocky terrain with a few scrubby bushes. They walk on a little way until they spot a strange craft on the ground. A one-man flying saucer with a perspex dome cockpit. As they reach it, a man calls out from a ridge.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: You came! Thank the heavens. There's still time. It's not too late. We can still stop him. But I, but I, need, need your help.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: He falls.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing yet, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Context: A woman in a blue uniform
Text: Report on the dilithium crystals, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Whatever that phenomenon was, it drained almost all of our crystals completely. It could mean trouble.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a talent for understatement, Lieutenant. Without full crystal power, our orbit will begin to decay in ten hours. Re-amplify immediately.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Aye aye, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any further magnetic disturbance?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Scanners indicate situation normal.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing. Illogical. An effect of such proportions, unexplainable by any established physical laws that I'm aware of. I have been able to ascertain one fact. Though the effect, whatever it was, was unquestioningly widespread, it was strongest here on the planet beneath us.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep checking.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Red Two message in one minute, Captain. Starfleet Command. Code Factor one, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Code Factor one.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Invasion status. All hands, this is the Captain. Battle stations. I repeat, battle stations. This is no drill.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: About our patient.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Doctor, quickly.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll make it. He'll be stiff and sore for a while, but he'll be all right.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll talk to him later. Thank you. Kirk out.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message ready, Captain. Main screen, coming up.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Enterprise standing by, Commodore.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Barstow
Text: You're aware of the effect an hour ago?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Barstow
Text: You may not be aware of its scope. It occurred in every quadrant of the galaxy and far beyond. Complete disruption of normal magnetic and gravimetric fields, timewarp distortion, possible radiation variations. And all of them centring on the general area which you are now patrolling. The question is, are these natural phenomena or are they mechanically created, and if they are, by whom? For what purpose? Your guess, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, sir. I have considered all the alternatives. My best guess is it could be a prelude to invasion.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Barstow
Text: Exactly our consensus. I'm giving you the job of finding out specifically.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Aye, aye, sir. Can you assign me other starships as a reserve?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Barstow
Text: Negative. I'm evacuating all Starfleet units and personnel within a hundred parsecs of your position. It's going to be tough on you and the Enterprise, but that's the job you've drawn. You're on your own.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. You mean, we're the bait.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Barstow
Text: Good luck.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, sir. (transmission ends) Maintain alert status at all battle stations.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye aye, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From the top, Mister Spock. First, the phenomenon came from the planet below. Secondly, the danger is apparently real and imminent.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Third, a closer examination of the planet's surface would be in order. My job, sir?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Meanwhile, I'll talk to our unexpected guest. Maybe he can provide some answers.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: That's how I came to be down there, Captain, pursuing the devil's own spawn, a thing I've chased across the universe. He's humanoid outside, but inside, he's a hideous, murdering monster. I'll get him, Captain. I swear it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say this one man

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Not man! Thing.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thing destroyed your entire civilisation.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: To the last man, woman and child.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did you escape?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I was inspecting magnetic communications satellites. You believe me, don't you?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Before we picked you up, our ship sustained a number of incredible effects.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: That was he! He's death, anti-life, he lives to destroy.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is he the thing that attacked you?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes. I give you my word. I swear it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't have any other facts, any information.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Then you'll join me in my holy cause? Help me in visiting justice and vengeance upon him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My only cause is the safety of my ship and the mission we're on. You'll beam down with me and I'll check your story out.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: The flying saucer is being minutely examined

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, find anything?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Anything from our guest?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: According to him, there's a creature of some sort down here, a humanoid.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura communicated that information. I ordered re-confirmation on our sensors. They indicate no living creature on this planet. I suggest, Captain, that you've been lied to.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Captain, you yourself said there were no other explanations. Why do you give credence to this man?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to comprehend your indignation, sir. I've simply made the logical deduction that you are a liar.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's have it. The truth this time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Another one of those 'nebula overlay' events happens, and Lazarus starts shouting then runs off.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: No! You've come back in, is it? Well, don't stop. Here I am. Come at me again. We'll finish it!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you identify that?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm trying, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lazarus! You stay here. All personnel, security red.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Come! Come! It'll do you no good. I'll chase you to the very fires of hell!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: We're treated to a negative image of Lazarus suddenly being pounced on by another person. They fight as the picture keeps being rotated to make you dizzy. Then it all ends and Lazarus staggers back on the planet surface again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lazarus, what happened?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I saw it again. The thing. It attacked me.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, readings of the effect indicate it centred here on this planet, almost on this very spot.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I told you it was a thing. All white, black and empty. A terrible emptiness.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get back to the ship.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: He'll kill us all if we don't kill him first! Kill! Kill! Kill! Kill! Kill!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3088.3. We continue to orbit the dead planet, which seems to be the source of the phenomenon which has struck the Enterprise and all sections of the galaxy once again. As for Lazarus, the story he tells me about the humanoid continues to trouble me.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any luck?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. I can no more explain the occurrence of the second phenomenon than I can the first.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If there's a shred of truth to what Lazarus said

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: That a single creature, a humanoid could be responsible for an effect of such magnitude?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard to believe.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But the rest of his story seems to fit. His wounds testify to an apparent confrontation with something.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Assuming there is a humanoid, a something, how does he do it? He has no weapons, no power.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I only know for certain that the occurrence of the phenomenon coincides exactly with the moments that Lazarus has his alleged confrontations.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor McCoy asking to see you in sickbay, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know, Jim. Maybe I'm imagining things, and maybe I'm not. You tell me.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You tell me. That's why you brought me down here, isn't it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, as you know, we both brought Lazarus in here and I treated a deep abrasion on his forehead, right?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then I bandaged it, I stepped into this room for just a moment

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I've got a lot of things to do. Get to the point.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, say he's got the constitution of a dinosaur, recuperative powers ditto. As we both know, I'm a bright young medic with a miraculous touch. Why then, when I returned, there wasn't a trace of that wound on his forehead. Not even a bruise. It was like he had never been injured.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is he?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know, Jim. This is a big ship. I'm just a country doctor.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus is sitting nearby when the following conversation takes place.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Hi.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Hi. Coffee?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Is that an order, Lieutenant?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: I know what you mean. Re-amplification finished on the dilithium crystals?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Yes. Ready and waiting.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: They leave, then Lazarus follows.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus has some sort of seizure and we get the nebula effect, the fight, and then... he has a plaster on his forehead again. Kirk and McCoy exit the turbolift and spot him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lazarus, are you all right?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes. But impatient. Have you decided to help me yet?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: McCoy removes the plaster to show the cut.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Is something wrong?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I have a ship's physician with a strange sense of humour.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is no joke, Jim. I know what I saw.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge calling the captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Request you come to the Bridge, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Find something?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Something quite extraordinary.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way. Lazarus, you're with me. Bones, if I had time, I'd laugh.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Main screen on, Lieutenant.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Screen on, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk and Lazarus enter.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Source of radiation, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: A bright flashing light on the planet.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is it the scanners didn't pick it up before?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Because it is not there.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Another riddle? First Doctor McCoy, then you?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: What I mean, Captain, is that according to our usual scanning procedures, there is nothing there that could be causing that effect.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it is there.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative. I confess I am somewhat at a loss for words. It may be described, though loosely and inaccurately, as a rip in our universe.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A what?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: A kind of physical warp, Captain, in which none of our established physical laws apply with any regularity. However, with the dilithium crystals, I was able to localise it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes! That's it! The dilithium crystals. With their power we could do it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: You refer to the humanoid?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes. We've got him, Captain, we've got him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do the crystals have to do with it? All they show us the point of radiation.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: That's just it, that's the key. That's the way to trap him. That's the solution. Captain, I beg of you. I plead, I demand. Give me the crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out of the question. Those crystals are the very heart of the power of my ship.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: You fool! There won't be any ship if we don't kill him. He'll destroy all of you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How? Now you tell me how. All I've heard is double-talk, lies, threats, accusations that don't hold water. Now you tell me, how it presents a danger to my ship?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I warn you, Captain. You'll give me the crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't threaten me, Lazarus.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: No threat intended. Captain, I'll have my vengeance.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: He leaves the Bridge by the turbolift, and the guard follows a moment later. Lazarus is walking along a corridor when he has another seizure and loses the head injury. Lazarus heads for...

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Lieutenant Masters, Captain's calling.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Masters here.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, can you prepare an experimentation chamber in ten minutes? All dilithium crystals, full power.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: We see Lazarus jump the engineer, out of her sight.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: I'll check, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: She goes into the room where Lazarus is hiding, checks a panel and leaves again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Captain. The chamber will be ready in ten minutes, sir. My assistant and I will

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus injects her neck with something.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Captain! Captain!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, what is it? What's wrong? Lieutenant?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, Security reports Lazarus missing.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3088.7. We are no closer to finding an answer to the strange phenomenon than we were at the beginning. Not only have two of my crewmen been attacked, two of our dilithium crystals are missing, and without them the Enterprise cannot operate at full power. They must be found.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: This Lazarus has his head injury back again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fact. You said you needed the crystals. Fact. An hour after you said you must have them, they were missing. Fact. Two of my crewmen were attacked.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: And fact, Captain. I didn't take the crystals. I'm not the one. Find my enemy, find the beast, and you'll find the crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How'd this beast get aboard my ship?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: He did. Isn't that enough?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. He didn't transport up. A report would've been made.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I tell you we're dealing with a creature capable of destroying worlds.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why does he need the crystals? For what reason?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: For the same reason that I do. Listen to me. He's humanoid. Why, he he can pilot a spaceship. He can compute formulas to destroy races. He can steal an energy source for his vehicle so he can escape from me. Are you deaf as well as blind?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sit down. The crystals certainly aren't here. There's an unexplained radiation source on the planet. Obviously some connection. We'll check it out. Organise a search party immediately. Mister Lazarus will beam down with us.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may not have reason to thank me, depending on what we find.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: What do you believe now, Captain?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe the missing crystals aren't in your ship. Mister Spock?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unable to locate the source of radiation.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not? You had it spotted on the Enterprise.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has simply disappeared, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want every inch of this terrain checked. Look for footprints, movement, anything. Call out if you spot anything. Don't be afraid to use your weapons.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: The entire party leave the little spaceship. The Starfleet group splits into two and take different lines along a rocky outcrop. Lazarus heads off on his own and has one of his nebula moments. There's a fight in negative space and then it's over again. Kirk sends his two security men on ahead, and for some reason Lazarus decides to climb down a cliff face. He dislodges a rock and it goes tumbling. Lazarus calls out, then follows it.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Captain, look out!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's coming out of it now.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: The thing, the thing.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's all right. You're on board the Enterprise.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: The rock, I

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How's your head?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Aches.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You saved my life down there. I want to thank you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Why shouldn't I?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have some questions I want to ask you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not now, Jim.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's necessary.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Go ahead. It's all right.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is a computer report of the evidence you gave at your first screening. It calls you a liar, Lazarus. For one thing, there's no planet at the location you said you came from. There never has been. If you want help from us, you'd better start telling the truth.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: You wouldn't believe me if I told you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try us.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: All right. I distorted a fact in the interest of self-preservation, for my holy cause. I needed help, not censure. Freedom, not captivity for being a madman. I was afraid that's what you'd call me if I told you the truth.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll have the truth now.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: My planet, my Earth, or what's left of it, is down there beneath us.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you saying?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: My spaceship is more than just that. It's a time chamber, a time-ship, and I. I am a time traveller.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And this thing you search for is a time traveler, too?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Oh, yes. He's fled me across all the years, all the empty years to a dead future on a murdered planet he destroyed. Help me! Give me the tools I need to kill him! The crystals! Don't let him get away! Don't let him get away.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lazarus, you're hurt. I know. I sympathise, but I've got four hundred and thirty other men to worry about. Now where are those crystals?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I told you, he's got them. He took them. The thing! The thing!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's got to get some rest, Jim. And would you get that muscleman out of my Sickbay. (gestures at the security guard)

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dismissed.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: The guard leaves.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's in a lot of pain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sometimes pain can drive a man harder than pleasure. I'm sure you know that, Doctor.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, don't worry, he's not going anywhere. Not this time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: But once the medical bay is empty, Lazarus gets out of bed and has a quick seizure.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have we got, Mister Spock? A magnetic effect which produces a winking-out phenomenon. A mysterious, unidentified source of radiation on the planet. Lazarus, a walking powder keg. Your rip in the universe. A so-called murdering humanoid.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: True, Captain, but more significant to me is the fact that our ship's instruments are specifically designed to locate and identify any object in our universe, be it energy or matter.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But by using those instruments you were unable to identify the source of the radiation on the planet.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct. Which would seem to be impossible.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are the instruments in order?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perfect working condition.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then what you say leads obviously to one alternative. The source of radiation is not from our universe.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor in our universe, Captain. It came from outside.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Outside? Yes, that would explain a lot. Another universe, perhaps in another dimension, occupying the same space at the same time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: The possible existence of a parallel universe has been scientifically conceded, Captain.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. What would happen if another universe, say a minus universe, came into contact with a positive universe such as ours?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unquestionably a warp. A distortion of physical laws on an immense scale.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which is what we've been experiencing. The point where they come into contact, couldn't that be described as a hole?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. I point out that a hole in the universe or in a simple container can either allow the contents to escape

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or what is outside to enter. The invasion that Commodore Barstow suspected.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: There has been no evidence of a large-scale invasion.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But a small scale invasion, Mister Spock. What is your analysis of the mental state of Lazarus?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Difficult, Captain. One moment, paranoid, the next, calm, mild, rational. Almost as if he were two men.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, two men. Different, but identical. And a hole in the universe. No, not a hole, A door.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Through which these two beings are somehow enabled to pass.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take a look at Lazarus. One minute he's at the point of death, the next he's alive, well, strong as a bull.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: The cut on his forehead. First he has it, then it's gone, then he has it again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which is physically impossible for one man.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite right. Unquestionably, there are two of him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's going on? This leaping from universe to universe. This wild talk about a murdering creature who destroys civilisations What's the purpose?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, madness has no purpose or reason, but it may have a goal. He must be stopped, held. Destroyed if necessary.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't follow you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Two parallel universes project this. One positive, the other negative. Or, more specifically, one matter, the other antimatter.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you know what you're saying? Matter and antimatter have a tendency to cancel each other out. violently.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. Under certain conditions, when two identical particles of matter and antimatter meet

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like Lazarus. Identical. Like both Lazarus', only one is matter and the other antimatter. If they meet.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Annihilation, Jim. Total, complete, absolute annihilation.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of everything that exists, everywhere.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus is prowling when he spots a High Voltage access panel. He opens it, removes a couple of transistors then puts one back to short it out. He leaves the area as smoke billows forth.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Smoke starts to come from the main control panels.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: The energiser has shorted. Get out of here. Sound the alarm.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Come on. You, too, Lieutenant.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: No, I've got to stay

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: We've got to get out of here. The whole thing might blow!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: He bustles her out into the corridor.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Masters
Text: Engineering calling Bridge. Fire! Fire in the energising circuit.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Hidden by the smoke, Lazarus enters Engineering.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Fire, Captain. Engineering. Situation critical.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All available personnel, on the double. Spock, with me.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Two firefighters in protective gear are entering Engineering

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Under control, sir, but it couldn't have started by itself.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lazarus. A trick to get the crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Chief
Text: Sir, you shouldn't be in here.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Oh, I didn't know.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: He knocks the poor lad out, then sets co-ordinates and is beamed to the planet carrying a bundle.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk and Spock exit Engineering.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's probably beaming down with the crystals right now. I'm going after him. You organise a security detail. Follow me as soon as you can.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Bridge.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus climbs into his saucer and unwraps the crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: I'll get you now. I have a threshold. Run, run. I'll get you now.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: It's done, it's done! Finished, finished. It's done. It's done. It's done, it's done.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lazarus.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Done. No! Don't! Not you!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk leans into the saucer - and vanishes.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: No!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk goes into that negative space and finds that there is nowhere to run to. Then suddenly he's on the ground on the planet again. Or is he? He walks over to the saucer and is greeted by uninjured Lazarus.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Welcome, Captain. I wasn't expecting you.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes, him. You understand.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not completely. This is a parallel universe?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Of course.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Antimatter?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Here, yes.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if identical particles meet

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: The end of everything. Civilisation, existence, all gone. I tried to stop him, Captain. That's why I took your dilithium crystals.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He has two more.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: That's very bad, Captain. If he comes through at a time of his own choosing. But I think if we hurry and you will help me, he can yet still be stopped. There's little time left. He meant to come through. When you accidentally passed through, it drained his crystals. It'll take him about ten minutes to re-energise with the equipment aboard his ship. That should give us enough time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly what did I pass through?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: That's hard to explain, Captain. I call it an alternative warp. It's sort of a negative magnetic corridor where the two parallel universes meet. It's sort of a safety valve. It keeps eternity from blowing up.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This corridor, is it what caused the magnetic effect, the winking out phenomenon?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Precisely, Captain, but not because of its existence. Because, because my foe entered. The corridor is like a prison, with explosives at the door. Open the door, and the explosives might go off. Stay inside

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the universe is safe.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Both universes, Captain. Yours and mine.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Surely Lazarus must realise what would happen if you should meet face to face outside the corridor.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Of course he knows, Captain, but he's mad. You heard him. He's lost his mind. When our people found a way to slip through the warp and prove another universe, an identical one, existed, it was too much for him. He could not live knowing that I lived. He became obsessed with the idea of destroying me. The fact that it meant his own destruction, and everything else, meant nothing to him.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So you're the terrible thing, the murdering monster. The creature.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes, Captain. Or he is. It depends on your point of view, doesn't it? It's ready, Captain. If we can force him into the corridor while I'm waiting for him, we can put an end to this. But if he comes through at a time of his own choosing and breaks into this universe to find me

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand. What do you want me to do?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Find him. Force him through his threshold, while I'm waiting for him, into the corridor, and I'll hold him there.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't hold him forever.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Can't I, Captain? You destroy his ship.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I destroy his ship, won't yours also be destroyed?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: It will.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And your door will be closed.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Yes, and so will his.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll be trapped inside that corridor with him forever. At each other's throats throughout time.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Is it such a large price to pay for the safety of two universes?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm ready.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: Send him to me. I'll be waiting.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Lazarus activates his crystals manually, and Kirk vanishes, then reappears on 'our' planet and gestures to Spock who has come down with two guards.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lazarus.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk jumps him while he is distracted and knocks him down.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand back.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: But Lazarus has him in a bear hug, and they struggle together for a while until Kirk finally gets the upper-hand again.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lazarus
Text: No! No! No, I'm not ready! I'm not ready!

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: Kirk throws him through the threshold.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Take these crystals to the Enterprise.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must destroy that ship completely.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: What of Lazarus?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what of Lazarus?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate phaser banks.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lesley
Text: Phaser banks activated.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by to fire.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: The bright dot appears on the planet surface.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lesley
Text: Phasers standing by, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire phasers.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Context: A sustained burst hits the little saucer, while the two Lazarus' wrestle in non-space. Finally it disappears.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Lesley, let's get out of here. Ahead warp factor one.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Lesley
Text: Warp one, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything's all right, Mister Spock, for us.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is, of course, no escape for them, sir.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is, of course, no escape. How would it be? Trapped forever with a raging madman at your throat until time itself came to a stop? For eternity. How would it be?

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the universe is safe.

Title: The Alternative Factor
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For you and me. But what of Lazarus? What of Lazarus?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Webb
Context: the radar operator
Text: Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Captain
Text: What is it, Webb?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Webb
Text: A blip, sir. Just came on the screen.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Captain
Text: How do you read it?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Webb
Text: Aircraft of some sort. By the size of it and the speed, it's not one of ours, sir. It doesn't even read like anything I've ever seen.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Captain
Text: What was the approach?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Webb
Text: None, sir. It was just there, like it fell out of the sky or something.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Captain
Context: suddenly interested
Text: Current position?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Webb
Text: Directly over the Omaha installation, sir. Holding there.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Captain
Text: Watch the scope, Webb. Air Defence will want to send somebody up for a closer look. We may have a real UFO on our hands.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Context: The alert sounds, a fighter is scrambled, and we get a shot of the USS Enterprise flying across the blue sky.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Location: us air force base - radar room
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain 's log Stardate 3113.2. We were en-route to Starbase 9 for resupply when a black star of high gravitational attraction began to drag us toward it. It required all warp power in reverse to pull us away from the star. But, like snapping a rubber band, the breakaway sent us plunging through space, out of control, to stop here, wherever we are.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The crew are picking themselves and their chairs up off the floor

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Except for secondary systems, everything is out, sir. We're on impulse power only.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliaries?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: If Mister Scott is still with us, auxiliaries should be on momentarily. (Uhura is just stirring on the floor) Are you all right, Lieutenant?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: He helps her back to her seat, and the lights come on.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott is still with us.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. Damage control parties on all decks, check in. All departments tie in with the record computer. Report casualties and operational readiness to the First Officer. Kirk out. Lieutenant Uhura, contact Starfleet Control. I want them alerted to the position of that black star that's in the area of Starbase 9.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain? Casualty reports indicate only minor injuries. Engineering reports warp engines non-operational. Mister Scott overrode the automatic helm setting and is holding us in orbit on impulse power.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Orbit where?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Earth, Captain. We were on a general course in this direction when we were pulled in by the star. Apparently the breakaway threw us on in the same direction.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Screen on.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: A full view of north America is on screen, with not a cloud in sight.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are too low in the atmosphere to retain this orbit, Captain. Engineering reports we have sufficient impulse power to achieve escape velocity.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give us some altitude, Mister Sulu.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Helm answering. She's sluggish, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, normal Starfleet channel has nothing but static. I'm getting something on another frequency, but it's not Starfleet.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on audio.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Man
Text: This is the five thirty news summary. Cape Kennedy. The first manned Moon shot is scheduled for Wednesday, six am Eastern Standard Time. All three astronauts who are to make this historic

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Kirk signals it cut off

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Manned Moon shot? That was in the late 1960s.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently, Captain, so are we.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whiplash propelled us into a time warp, Captain. Backward. Exact chronometer readings in a few moments.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm getting ground to air transmission.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Verified. Scanners report some type of craft approaching from below us. Under cloud cover and closing.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: Bluejay 4, this is Blackjack. We're tracking you and the UFO.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I have him on my screen. Following.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, can you gain altitude faster? I want to outdistance him.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Picking up, sir, but she's still slow in responding.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Blackjack, this is Bluejay 4. UFO is picking up speed and climbing. I'm going in closer.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: Bluejay 4, you should be close enough for visual contact.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I can see it now. Whatever this is, it's big. Two cylindrical projections on top, one below. Purpose undetermined.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: We have two flights scrambled and on the way. They should rendezvous in your sector in two minutes.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I won't be here. The UFO's climbing away fast.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: Bluejay 4, you are ordered to close on the UFO. and attempt to force him to land. We want it brought down or at least disabled until the other planes arrive.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Acknowledged. Closing on target.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Positive identification, Captain. Aircraft is an interceptor, equipped with missiles, possibly armed with nuclear warheads. If he hits us with one, he might damage us severely, perhaps beyond our capacity to repair under current circumstances.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, activate tractor beam. Lock onto that aircraft and hold it out there.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, this type of aircraft might be too fragile to take our tractor beam.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Tractor beam on, sir. We have the target.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The bright light of the tractor beam forces Captain Christopher to lower his visor

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Aircraft is breaking up, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Transporter room. Can you lock onto the cockpit of that aircraft?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Scanning area, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try and beam that pilot aboard. Take over, Mister Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: From his seated position strapped into his fighter, Captain Christopher is beamed aboard standing up.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Welcome aboard the Enterprise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: You speak English.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's right. You can step off the transporter

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Captain John Christopher, United States Air Force. Serial number 4857932.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Relax, Captain, you're among friends. I'm Captain James T. Kirk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: What's going on here? Where am I? What happened? You people, who are you?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All in good time, Captain. Meanwhile, let me apologise for bringing you aboard the ship so abruptly, but it couldn't be helped. I didn't know that your craft couldn't stand up to our tractor beam.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Don't give me any double-talk. Just tell me who you are.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll tell you what we decide to tell you in a few moments. In the meantime, relax. You're our guest. I have a feeling you'll find it interesting.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it, Mister Spock?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: The aircraft has completely broken up, Captain. Shall we turn off the tractor beam?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Affirmative. We have the pilot aboard. I'll be right up. Kirk out. Follow me.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Crewwoman
Text: Good morning, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Morning. (drags Christopher along) Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: A woman?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Crewman.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Must have taken quite a lot to build a ship like this.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are only twelve like it in the fleet.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I see. Did the Navy

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're a combined service, Captain. Our authority is the United Earth Space Probe Agency.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: United Earth?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is very difficult to explain. We're from your future. A time warp placed us here. It was an accident.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: You seem to have a lot of them. However, I can't deny the fact that you're here. With this ship.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I never have believed in little green men.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Neither have I.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Christopher, this is my First Officer, Lieutenant Commander Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Feel free to look around, Captain. Don't touch anything, but I think you'll find it interesting.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Interesting is a word and a half for it, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've achieved a stable orbit out of Earth's atmosphere. Our deflectors are operative, enough to prevent our being picked up again as a UFO. And Mister Scott wishes to speak to you about the engines.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well, Mister Spock. Anything else on your mind?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Christopher.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about him?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We cannot return him to Earth, Captain. He already knows too much about us and is learning more. I do not specifically refer to Captain Christopher, but suppose an unscrupulous man were to gain certain knowledge of man's future? Such a man could manipulate key industries, stocks, and even nations. and in so doing, change what must be. And if it is changed, Captain, you and I and all that we know might not even exist.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your logic can be most annoying.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Goes over to Christopher, who is talking to Uhura.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That flight suit must be uncomfortable. (to Spock) Why don't you have the quartermaster issue him something more suitable? Then I want to meet you and him in my quarters.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Captain's quarters]

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer on. Record.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Context: in a low, breathy voice
Text: Recording.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Spock enters with Christopher, who is now dressed in Command gold

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Engineering Officer Scott informs warp engines damaged, but can be made operational and reenergised.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computed and recorded, dear.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, you will not address me in that manner. Compute.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computed, dear.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I ordered this computer and its interlinking systems repaired.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have investigated it, Captain. To correct the fault will require an overhaul of the entire computer system and a minimum of three weeks at a Starbase.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't mind so much if it didn't get so affectionate.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: It also has an unfortunate tendency to giggle.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I take it that a lady computer is not routine.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We put in at Cygnet Fourteen for general repair and maintenance. Cygnet Fourteen is a planet dominated by women. They seemed to feel the ship's computer system lacked a personality. They gave it one. Female, of course.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Well, you people certainly have interesting problems. I'd love to stay around to see how your girlfriend works out, but

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm afraid you'll have to. We can't send you back.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Can't? Spock here told me that your transporter can beam down an object even from an orbit this high.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not the transporter. It's you. You know what the future looks like. If anybody else finds out, they could change the course of it, destroy it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Well then my disappearance would change something, too.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have run a computer check on all historical tapes. They show no record of any relevant contribution by John Christopher.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Look, Captain, I don't buy all your time accident story. The experts can figure out who you are and what you are. It's my duty to report what I've seen. Well, what would you do?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd report, If I could. We can't take the risk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I don't want to know about risks. I have a wife, two children. What about them?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engine room to Captain Kirk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Scotty?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Progress report, sir. Everything's jury-rigged, but we're coming along with the repairs. We could re-energise in about four hours, but

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what, Scotty?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well sir, as I say, the engines are being repaired, but we've no place to go in this time. If you, if you see what I mean?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Scotty. Carry on.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Too bad, Captain. Maybe I can't go home, but neither can you. You're as much a prisoner in time as I am.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log Stardate 3113.7. Our engines are being repaired, but we are still locked in time, and we have aboard a passenger whom we do not want, and we cannot return.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Text: Recommendation for his disposition, dear?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintenance note. My recording computer has a serious malfunction. Recommend it either be corrected or scrapped. Compute.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Context: petulant
Text: Computed.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have some new information regarding Captain Christopher. Important I see you both immediately.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. Report to my quarters. I'll contact Captain Christopher.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir. Bridge out.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Christopher. Captain Christopher? Security, this is the Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Chief
Text: Security Chief here, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Kirk; All decks alert. Captain Christopher is not in his assigned quarters. He may be trying to escape the ship. I want a man outside the transporter room immediately. I'm heading there myself.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Christopher gets the jump on a hapless red-shirt and takes his phaser, then steps into

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: All right. Nice and easy. Now I'm going to step into that thing, and you're going to transport me back to Earth.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: He hears a noise behind him, and turns to have Kirk disarm him and knock him out

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Jim, with the exception of a slight bruise or two, our Captain is as healthy as a proverbial horse. He'll be coming out of it in a minute or two.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He tried to escape. I know how he feels, but I can't send him back with what he knows.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what if we can't go back? What do we do, sit up here and wait for our supplies to run out, our power to die? It has to eventually, you know. We certainly can't go back to Earth. It would be worse than the Captain being returned. There are four hundred and thirty of us, and that means four hundred and thirty chances of altering the future.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. But we're not in that position yet.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm glad to hear it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if we do get back to where we belong, then he won't belong. We're roughly about the same age, but in our society he'd be useless. Archaic.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe he could be retrained, reeducated.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now you're sounding like Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you're going to get nasty, I'm going to leave.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could he be retrained to forget his family? His children?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: The answer to that is no.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You all right?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Yeah. I see physical training is required in your service, too.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Crude methods, but effective.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: What does he mean by that?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's just a joke, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said you had some additional information, Mister Spock?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I made an error in my computations.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh? This could be an historic occasion.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I find that we must return Captain Christopher to Earth after all.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Why? You said I made no relative contribution.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Poor choice of words on my part. I neglected, in my initial run-through, to correlate the possible contributions by offspring. I find, after running a crosscheck on that factor, that your son Colonel Shaun Geoffrey Christopher headed, or will head, the first successful Earth-Saturn probe, which is a rather significant

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Wait a minute. I don't have a son.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean yet.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: The doctor is correct. Unless we return Captain Christopher to Earth, There will be no Colonel Shaun Geoffrey Christopher to go to Saturn.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that's it, isn't it? We'll have to find some way of

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: A boy. I'm going to have a son.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledging that we must return Captain Christopher, there are several problems, prime of which is the explanation of his return. We tracked his plane wreckage down after our tractor beam crushed it. It crashed in an open section of southern Nebraska.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That means those search parties will be crawling all over that wreckage.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: And Captain Christopher himself complicated the matter.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: When I made visual contact, I turned on my wing cameras. I got close enough to take some pretty clear pictures of you. Air Defence Command will be processing that film fast. And ADC Control was probably recording my radio transmissions.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I remember my history, these things were being dismissed as weather balloons, sun dogs, explainable things. At least publicly.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, our tractor beam caught and crushed an Air Force plane. It'll be impossible to explain this as anything other than a genuine UFO. Possibly alien, definitely destructive.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about our problem, Mister Spock? Any ideas on how to get us back to our own time?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: A theory. A reverse application of what happened to us. Logically, it could work. Also, logically, there are a hundred variables, any one of which could put us in a worse position than we're in now.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're going to have to go back and get those reports and photos. If the Captain feels duty bound to report what he saw, there won't be any evidence to support him.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: That makes me out to be either a liar or a fool.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at all. You'll simply be one of the thousands who thought he saw a UFO.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Captain, I know that base. I was stationed there a year ago. I'd like to

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Captain. Thank you, but if anything should go wrong, you might get hurt. We couldn't risk that. Neither could you or your son.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Well, I'd like to help. I could sketch a layout of the place for you. Show you where the record section and the photo lab are.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Kirk hands him a PADD

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: It's nighttime, and a guard is patrolling the corridors when Kirk and Sulu beam in. They smile at the quaint notice board and trophy cupboard before breaking into the Statistical Services Division by means of a sort of sonic screwdriver. Kirk's torch lights up a bank of magnetic tapes

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Primitive computer. I've seen them demonstrated in museums.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Me, too. If this one's like those, it'll make the devil's noise if you start it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't intend to start it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How long have they been down there now?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fifteen minutes, twenty eight seconds.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, shouldn't they be coming up?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is a fact, Doctor, that prowling by stealth is more time-consuming than a direct approach. In our case

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Shouldn't you be working on your time warp calculations, Mister Spock?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: They've just taken the magnetic tape when the lights go on and an armed guard confronts them

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Hold it. Get your hands up. Now, one at a time, hand me those belts.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: They hand over the belts with the phasers attached to them

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: And the bag.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's been too long. Jim should have at least signaled by now.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: You may be correct, Doctor. Open communicator channel.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: There's a beeping sound

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: What was that?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was what?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: That noise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I didn't hear anything.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: That noise. It's coming from one of these things.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: He has a communicator in his hand, so he puts down the bag and belts and opens it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The emergency signal.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Stay right where you are.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kyle
Text: One emergency signal, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Beam up immediately.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Only one signal. What happened?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll know in a moment, Doctor.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The Sergeant is beamed aboard.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here. Are you all right, Captain?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm all right, but as you can see, we have another problem.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain 's Log, Stardate 3113.9. First Officer Spock recording. Due to an unfortunate accident, we have taken aboard another unwanted passenger.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your surprise package is an Air Police sergeant from the base.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want you to keep him in the transporter room. No sense in letting him see more of the ship than is necessary.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't believe there'll be trouble in that respect, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The Sergeant still hasn't hardly moved a muscle when McCoy gently takes the gun and communicator out of his hands.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our guest seems quite satisfied to remain where he is.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. (returns to the magnetic tapes) What was the chronometer reading when we first sighted Christopher's jet?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Five thirty in that time zone, maybe a little after.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it at the end of these tapes, will you? Get them all.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: They leave the room and head off down the corridor to the photo section

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll try the darkroom.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: On the monitor board, a light flashes on the board, indicating someone has entered the Photo Section

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Photo lab.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Kirk is checking reels of film

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's it. That's all of them. Signal Mister Spock that we're almost ready to beam up. I'll make a check of the files just in case.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Kirk walks out into the main lab just as security walk in. He shuts the door behind him and fights the three men, making lots of noise so Sulu can hear what is going on. He's eventually restrained, and the Colonel takes a look in the dark room. It's empty.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: All right. Where's the other one?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What other one?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Your partner. I saw you looking that was and I saw somebody move in there.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, no. Just me. Besides, could anyone get out of here without your seeing them?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: No. Nobody should have been able to.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your decision to beam up was quite correct, Mister Sulu.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engine room to Mister Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've completed re-energising the warp engines, sir. We can re-fire them anytime.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do so now, engineer. We'll need all power to test our theory.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Engine room out.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Context: examining a roll of film
Text: Poor photography.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Blast your theories and observations, Mister Spock. What about Jim? He's down there alone, probably under arrest. He doesn't have a communicator, and we can't locate him or beam him back aboard without one.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am aware of that, Doctor. This is the first officer. Captain Christopher to the briefing room.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Now, look, Mister. You and I had better start communicating. I want to know how you got in here. That's a simple question. Give me a simple answer. Nobody saw you. You got all the way inside without tripping any alarm. How did you do it?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Believe me, Colonel, you wouldn't believe me.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Don't try to be funny. How did you get in?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I popped in out of thin air.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: You seem to think this is some kind of a game.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Colonel. I know it's no game.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: All right. What did you say your name was?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For the fourth time, my name is James T. Kirk.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: And how did you get inside a top security installation, James T. Kirk?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I told you, you wouldn't believe me.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The Colonel picks up the communicator

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Colonel, would you mind being careful with that?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: That worries you a little bit, huh? What is that, a radio? Transmitter of some kind?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of some kind.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: You can be more specific than that, Kirk. I don't like mysteries.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't stop being careless with that, you'll have one. A big one.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: I'll have it disassembled and examined. We are not dummies, mister. We know how to find out things we want to know. (tosses it to the guard standing nearby) What is that? Is that a uniform of some kind?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This little thing? Just something I slipped on.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Kirk, maybe you don't realise how serious this is. Sabotage of a government installation

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did I sabotage something?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: No. We stopped you in time. But what would you have done if we hadn't found you?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Believe me, Colonel, nothing at all.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: Is that what you're here for? Nothing at all?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what would have happened if you hadn't interfered.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: All right, Kirk. Maybe this will make you laugh. Sabotage, espionage, unauthorised entry, burglary. How are those for starters? And I can think up lots more if you don't start talking.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Colonel. The truth is, I'm a little green man from Alpha Centauri. A beautiful place. You ought to see it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: I am going to lock you up for two hundred years.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
