Text: That ought to be just about right.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: He's probably being held in security section. Even if they've notified the authorities, it'll take a little time for someone to get there.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite logical, Captain. Can you give us the co-ordinates to beam down a landing party near those interrogation rooms?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Yes, but you're not going to get them unless you take me with you.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can't do that, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If something went wrong

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Something's already gone wrong. Of course, you could beam down anywhere inside that base, but it would take time to find him.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, you and Captain Christopher will beam down with me. The captain will provide the co-ordinates for the transporter chief.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shall I issue phasers?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: One for you, one for me. Set them on heavy stun force.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. (leaves)

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: You don't trust me, Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: In fact, I do. But only to a certain point.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The party are beamed down

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Do they do that all the time?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Are you hungry?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Uh-huh.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kyle
Text: What would you like?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Maybe some chicken soup.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Kyle puts a card in the slot and the hatch slides up to reveal a bowl on a tray. The Sergeant dips his finger in to taste it.) SERGEANT: It is

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Captain Christopher walks past the guard on duty

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Guard
Text: Just a minute, sir. Hold it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Sulu karate-chops him into unconsciousness

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: There's a knock at the door

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Fellini
Text: See what that is, airman.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: It's Spock, who neck-pinches the hapless airman. Kirk punches Lt. Colonel Fellini's lights out.) SPOCK: Don't you find that painful, Captain

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I do. What's he doing here?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: He knew the exact beam down co-ordinates for this section of the base. It was necessary to bring him along.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. No harm done. Mister Sulu, did you check out those tapes?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock ran them through. They were the right ones. We got them all.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Spock goes into the Colonel's office

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: They know you've been here.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All they have is a mystery and no answers. Mister Sulu, signal the Transporter Chief. Four to beam up.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Context: holding the security guard's gun
Text: Uh-uh. Not me.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't be a fool. You know what's at stake.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: You bet I do. My family. A son that isn't born yet. You don't have to return me now, Captain. Spock, come out of there.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't explain your presence on the base.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I told you it's my duty to report everything I've seen. That's explanation enough. Spock!

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll go home, Christopher but you'll do it our way.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Spock appears in the doorway behind Christopher

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Over my dead body.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: So he gets neck-pinched into unconsciousness

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suspected he might not wish to return with us.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Four to beam up, Mister Sulu.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, Stardate 3114.1. We must make an attempt to break free of this time, or we and our reluctant passengers will remain its prisoners. All we have is a theory and a few facts.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott and I both agree that the only possible solution is the slingshot effect, like the one that put us here. My computations indicate that if we fly toward the sun, seek out its magnetic attraction, then pull away at full power, the whiplash will propel us into another time warp.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Slingshot effects are fine for you people. How do you propose to return the Sergeant and me?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logically, as we move faster and faster toward the sun, we'll begin to move backward in time. We'll actually go back beyond yesterday, beyond the point when we first appeared in the sky. Then, breaking free will shoot us forward in time, and we'll transport you back before any of this happened.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You won't have anything to remember, because it never would have happened.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: What if you can't pull free of the sun?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, we'll do that all right, Captain. We'll not be getting so close that my engines couldn't pull us out. What I am worried about, sir, that we may not have much control when we're thrown forward again.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helm control?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Braking control, sir. If I can't stop us soon enough, we may overshoot our time, and if I stop the engines suddenly the strain may tear us apart. Anyway we do it, it's a mighty rough ride.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, gentlemen, we all have to take a chance. Especially if one is all you have. Assume your stations.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Enterprise leaves orbit, and we watch the pretty blue and white globe receding on the viewscreen.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead warp factor three, Mister Sulu.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor three, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: I never thought I'd make it into space. I was in line to be chosen for the space programme but I didn't qualify.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take a good look around, Captain. You made it here ahead of all of them.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, our speed is increasing. We're travelling at over warp eight.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since we've passed Mercury, the sun's pull on us has increased greatly. From here, we'll move even faster. And Captain, notice the chronometers. They've started backward. Minute by minute, the speed of time passage will now increase.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get your gear. Report to the transporter room. And Captain Christopher, you only have about fifteen years, so you'd better hurry.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Christopher leaves, and time passes.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approaching breakaway point. On the countdown. Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Mister Sulu. (the ship lurches sideways) More power, Mister Sulu.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's maximum now, sir. She's fighting it.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Then everyone's thrown forward

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've broken free and heading back.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Gaining speed now, Captain. We're now at warp four, warp seven. Eight. Off the dial, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chronometers moving forward again, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have the chronometer reading and the co-ordinates to return Captain Christopher and the guard?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computed.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room. Captain Christopher.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Transporter room]

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: This is Christopher.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're coming up on Earth fast, Captain. Are you ready?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Everything A-OK.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Captain, thanks for the look ahead.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our pleasure, Captain. Bridge out.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The blue planet grows larger on the viewscreen

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Twenty minutes, sir. It'll be close.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room. Prepare to energise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ten minutes. Nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: You should be close enough for a visual contact.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Captain Christopher is beamed into himself. He has a look around, but Enterprise has vanished.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: Bluejay Four. Can you see it? What is it? Bluejay 4. Come in. We've lost the image.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Blackjack, this is Bluejay Four. I could have sworn there was some kind of ship, but nothing could have moved that fast.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Flight
Text: We don't track mirages.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Christopher
Text: Mark it down as another UFO. Bluejay Four returning to base. Out.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approaching second beaming, Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to transporter room, prepare to energise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: The sergeant is beamed into himself as he is about to look through the glass door of the Statistical Services Division. There's no one there, so he continues on his round.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Past Pluto, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's our reading, Mister Spock?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approaching our century, Captain. Braking should begin now.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to engineering. Begin full braking power.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Pulling away from the sun weakened them, sir. They may blow apart if I reverse.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No choice, Mister Scott.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fifty years to go.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Engines cutting back, sir. No decrease in speed.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Spock
Text: Forty, thirty.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind, Mister Spock.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Once again, everyone gets thrown around

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The engines!

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engine room to Bridge. Engines are on full reverse. They're buckling! Bridge!

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Context: Things return to normal

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott is still with us.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Starfleet
Text: Starfleet Control calling Enterprise. Come in, Enterprise.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open a channel, Uhura.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Frequency open, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Starfleet Control, this is the Enterprise. Captain Kirk speaking.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Computer
Text: Record ship arrival, dear.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Starfleet
Text: Enterprise, this is Starfleet Control. Come in, please.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Starfleet Control, repeating message. The Enterprise is home. Kirk out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Two men in colonial style clothing, complete with tri-corn hats, are running for their lives. One falls.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: O'Neil, we've got to keep going. Come on, get up.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: It's no use. They're everywhere.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The Captain gave us an order. We've got to find some clue.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: It's no use, Mister Sulu. Look, there's one of them. There's another one.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Ominous figures in long red gowns and hoods are slowly advancing on them, carrying staves.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Scouting party to Enterprise.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Come in.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, beam us up quick. Emergency.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter room, lock onto Sulu and O'Neil. Beam up immediately.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: We've got to make a run for it. We can't just stand here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister O'Neil, stand tight. They'll beam us up any minute.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: Run, I tell you. We've got to get out of here. You know what they're capable of.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: He makes a dash for it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: O'Neil!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: One of the robed figures reaches Sulu and points his hollow stave at him. Sulu stiffens, then relaxes with a smile on his face. The transporter takes him away.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, what is it? Where's Lieutenant O'Neil?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What? Who?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant O'Neil. Where is he?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You. You're not of the Body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor McCoy, transporter room. Quickly.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You, you did it. They knew we were Archons. These are the clothes they wear, not these.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Throws a bundle at a man, and takes his jacket off.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, take it easy.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Landru. Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sit down. (McCoy enters) What happened?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They're wonderful. They're the sweetest, friendliest people in the universe. It's paradise, my friend. Paradise.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant O'Neil. Where is he?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Paradise. Paradise.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. Stardate 3156.2. While orbiting planet Beta Three trying to find some trace of the starship Archon that disappeared here a hundred years ago, a search party consisting of two Enterprise officers were sent to the planet below. Mister Sulu has returned, but in a highly agitated mental state. His condition requires I beam down with an additional search detail.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The extensive landing party is now in more late 19th Century American style clothes, with bootlace ties and long jackets. Spock has a cape with the hood raised to cover his ears.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Materialisation completed. Kirk out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: A man walks slowly past them, hand on his heart and smile on his face. He bows politely and carries on his way.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Odd. The expression on that man's face. The mindlessness. Vacant contentment.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like Sulu. If everybody on this planet is like him. Let's go.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: Joy to you, friends.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Joy to you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: You be strangers. Come for the Festival, are ya?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: Got a place to sleep it off yet? Go round to Reger's house. He's got rooms. But you'll have to hurry. It's almost the Red Hour.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The town hall clock shows a few minutes to six o'clock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This Festival, it starts at six o'clock?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: Tula, these folks come for the Festival. Your daddy can put them up, can't he?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tula
Text: You're from the Valley?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: We've just arrived.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tula
Text: My father will be glad to put you up, though. It's right over there.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The clock strikes the hour, and everybody shouts and goes wild. Clothing gets loosened, women are carries away by men, there are shouts and screams everywhere.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: Tula, come!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Windows are broken, fights break out, a woman jumps on Kirk and kisses him.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They run to Reger's house and get in.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Three older men turn in surprise.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; I'm sorry to break in on you like this. We didn't expect that kind of a welcome.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: Welcome? You are strangers?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's right. We're from the valley.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: You came for the Festival?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: Then how come you here?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Are you Reger?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Yes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: You have a daughter named Tula.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Yes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Well, you'd better do something. She's outside.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: I know. It's Festival. It's the will of Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: Reger, these are young men. They are not old enough to be excused.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: They're visitors.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: Well, have they no Lawgivers in the Valley? Why be they not at the Festival?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We heard that you might have rooms for us.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: There. You see, Hacom? They've merely come looking for a place to rest afterwards.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: The Red Hour has already struck.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: Hacom, these be strangers. The Valley has different ways.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: Do you say that Landru is not everywhere?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: No, of course not. It's simply they may have different ways.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: They've come looking for shelter. Can I turn them away? Come, please.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: But the girl, out there.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: She is in festival, as you should be.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Come, please. Hurry.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: He leads the way upstairs.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: The Lawgivers should know.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: Surely, Hacom, they already know. Are they not infallible?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: You mock them! You mock the Lawgivers. And the strangers are not of the Body. You will see.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: But, Hacom

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Hacom leaves the house

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Reger shows them into a sparsely furnished room with bunk beds, and turns up the gas light.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: You can return here at the close of the Festival. It's quiet. You'll have need of rest.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have no plans to attend the Festival, sir.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: The hour is struck. You can hear.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to hear more about this Festival, and Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Context: alarmed
Text: Landru? You ask? You're strange. You scorn Festival? Are you? Are you?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about Landru?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Outside are scenes of rioting, willful destruction of property, random violence and lust. Reger leaves the group, unseen to us.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Rioter
Text: Festival! Festival!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru. My guess is we have until morning. Let's put the time to good use. Doctor, do atmospheric readings to determine whether there's anything in the air to account for all this. Mister Lindstrom, correlate all that you've seen with any other sociological parallels, if any.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Mister Spock, you and I have some serious thinking to do. When we leave here tomorrow morning, I want to have a plan of action.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk, as sixth man in the group, didn't get a bunk bed or chair to sleep on. When the town clock strikes 6 am, everybody outside stops and then goes on their placid way as if nothing had happened.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock, Lindstrom. Doc.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They hear crying outside, and go to investigate.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: No, no it's all over now. It's all over now, child. That's all right. Quiet.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Excuse me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Leads the distressed Tula away

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: It's all right. It's all over.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He'll give her a shot. It'll calm her down. Trust us.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: You didn't even try to bring her back. What kind of father are you?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: It's Landru's will.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about Landru? Who is he?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: It is true then. You did not attend the Festival last night.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Then you're not of the Body. You couldn't be.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's asleep.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Are you, are you Archons?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What if we are?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: It was said more would follow. If you are indeed

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: We must hide them. Quickly. The Lawgivers.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can take care of ourselves.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: Landru will know. He will come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Hacom storms in with two robed figures.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: He is the one. He mocked the Lawgivers. I heard him.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: No, Hacom. It was a jest.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: The others, they were here, but they scorned the Festival. I saw it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Tamar, stand clear.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Tamar
Text: I hear and obey the voice of Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The Lawgiver kills him with his hollow stave

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: You attacked the Body. You have heard the Word and disobeyed. You will be absorbed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean, absorbed?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: There, you see? Not of the body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: You will be absorbed. The Good is all. Landru is gentle. You will come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not going anywhere.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: It is the law. You must come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said we're not going anywhere.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The two lawgivers turn and face each other.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently they're not prepared to deal with out right disobedience. How did you know?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything we've seen here so far seems to indicate some sort of compulsive involuntary stimulus to action.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your analysis seems logical.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: It is clear that you simply did not understand. I will re-phrase. You are ordered to accompany us to the absorption chambers.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why did you kill that man?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Out of order. You will obey. It is the word of Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You tell Landru that we'll come in our own time and that we'll speak to him.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk takes the stave from the lawgiver, and hands it to Spock for inspection.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: You cannot. It is Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Hacom
Text: Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Hacom leaves quickly

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. This is merely a hollow tube, Captain. No mechanism.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: They're communing. We have time. Come with me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where to?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: To a place I know. You'll be safe there, but we must hurry. Landru will come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They hurry slowly, smiling and bowing to passers by.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quite a festival they had.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Peace.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you make of all this?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Totally illogical. Yesterday, without apparent cause or reason, they wrought total havoc. Yet today, now

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now they're back to normal.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Bilar
Text: Morning, friends.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: All
Text: Good morning, Bilar.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Your daughter. That's the man.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: No, it wasn't Bilar. It was Landru. Let's hurry, we haven't much time.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: But a few paces further on, the passers by all stop.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: It's too late. Look.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Landru. He's summoning the body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Telepathy, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The people pick up weapons from the debris in the street.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun. Which way, Reger?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Perhaps through there, but Landru

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll handle Landru, Just get us out of this.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They get trapped in an alley

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't want to hurt them. Warn them back.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: They're in the Body. It's Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun, wide field. Fire.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They drop the first wave, but more come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They get down the alley

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant O'Neil. He's one of our men.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Not anymore. He's been absorbed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring him along.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: The Lieutenant is one of them. When he wakes, Landru will find us through him. Leave him there. He's our enemy. He's been absorbed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Captain, now that we've got Lieutenant O'Neil, let's beam up out of here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We still don't know what's happened to the Archons. Which way? Bring him along.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Reger leads them into a building made of massive stones. He goes over to a corner and unwraps a flat panel, which gives off light.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Put him over there.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A lighting panel.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Amazing in this culture.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Comes from a time before Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Before Landru? How long ago was that?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Nobody knows positively. Some say as long ago as six thousand years.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: It took a very advanced technology to construct a device like this. Inconsistent with this environment

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not inconsistent with what we've seen. Security.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The two spare members of the group go to stand guard.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those staffs. Hollow tubes. Antennae for some sort of broadcast power. What is it, Mister Spock?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strong power generations, Captain. Near here, but radiating in all directions.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll be coming around soon, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: He must not. He's been absorbed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Absorbed?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: The Body absorbs its enemies. It only kills when it has to. When the first Archons came, they were free, out of control, opposing the will of Landru. Many were killed, many more were absorbed. When he regains consciousness, Landru will find us through him. And if the others come

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What others?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Those like you and me, who resist Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: An underground? How are you organised?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: In threes. Myself, Tamar, who's dead now, and one other.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: I don't know. Tamar was my contact.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Give me a decision, Captain. He's coming out of it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: He must not regain consciousness. He'll destroy us all. He's of the Body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give him a shot. Keep him asleep. Reger, I want some answers. This underground. If Landru is so powerful, how do you survive?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: I don't know, Captain. Some of us escape the directives. Not many, but a few. It was that way when the first Archons came.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Archons. Tell me about them.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: They had invaded the Body, but they resisted the will of Landru. You see, Landru had pulled them down from the skies.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pulled them down from the skies? A starship? Mister Spock, those power readings you took, are they?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Powerful enough to destroy a starship? Affirmative.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise, come in.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we're under attack. There are heat beams of some kind coming up from the planet surface.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Status report.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Our shields are holding, but they're taking all our power.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: If we try to warp out or move on impulse, we'll lose our shields and burn up like a cinder.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Orbit condition.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Checking. We're going down, Captain. Unless we can get those beams off us so we can use our engines, we're due to hit atmosphere in less than twelve hours.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep your shield up. Do everything you can to maintain orbit. We'll try and locate the source of the beam and stop it here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Impossible to break away. I've tried the emergency bypass circuits but they haven't been effective.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The conversation ends in a crackle of static.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor beams, very strong. We're being probed. In this direction.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Block them out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Too strong, Captain. Can't be blocked.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Context: adopting a prayerful posture
Text: Oh.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The image of a tall, elegant man draped in robes appears against a wall.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: I am Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Projection, Captain. Unreal.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But beautiful, Mister Spock, with no apparatus at this end.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: You have come as destroyers. You bring an infection.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are holding my ship. I demand that you release it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: You have come to a world without hate, without fear, without conflict. No war, no disease, no crime. None of the ancient evils. Landru seeks tranquillity. Peace for all. The universal good.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We mean you no harm. Ours is a mission of peace and good will.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: The good must transcend the evil. It shall be done. So it has been since the beginning.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: He doesn't hear you, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Context: drawing his phaser
Text: Maybe he'll hear this.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put that away. Landru, listen to me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: You will be absorbed. Your individuality will merge into the unity of the good, and in your submergence into the common being of the Body, you will find contentment and fulfillment. You will experience the absolute good.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: Oh.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: A sound permeates the room, and knocks everyone out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3157.4. The Enterprise, still under attack by some sort of heat rays from the surface of Beta Three, is now being commanded by Engineering Officer Scott. The shore party has been taken by the creature called Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk wakes up in a chamber very like the previous one, constructed of large stone blocks, but without the furniture. A stone door has no handle on the inside. His communicator and phaser are gone.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Wake up. Mister Lesley.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Where's Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was gone when I woke up, along with the other guard and Mister O'Neil.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: I should say they've been here and been removed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is here?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently a maximum security establishment. Are you armed?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. All our phasers are gone. I checked. That's locked.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Oh, does my head ache.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: The natural result of being subjected to a hypersonic.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Oh, is that what it was?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sound waves. Stronger, they might have killed us. As it was, they merely rendered us unconscious.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enough analysis. Let's think of a way to get out of here. What about the Lawgivers' inability to cope with the unexpected?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: We shouldn't depend on that happening again, Captain. In a society as well organised as this one seems to be, I cannot conceive of such an oversight going uncorrected. Interesting, however. Their reaction to your defiance was remarkably similar to the reaction of a computer when fed insufficient or contradictory data.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you suggesting the Lawgivers are mere computers, that they aren't human?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite human, Captain. It's simply that all the facts are not yet in. There are gaps.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The door opens, and a Lawgiver escorts McCoy and O'Neil in, then leaves them again.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc. How?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hello, friend. We were told to wait here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can I help you, friend?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you know me?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We all know one another and Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Like Sulu.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Think, man. The Enterprise. The ship. Remember?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You speak very strangely, friend. Are you from away?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do remember!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ask Landru. He remembers. He knows and he watches. You are strange. Are you not of the Body?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The door opens again, and a Lawgiver points his hollow stave at Kirk.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Then you will die.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've been corrected, Captain. You'd better go.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Work on Bones. See if you can't

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk leaves with the Lawgivers.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy, what will happen to him?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He goes to joy, peace, and tranquillity. He goes to meet Landru. Happiness is to all of us, blessed by Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk is secured to the wall by his wrists. A stout bald man comes in and relieves the Lawgiver on duty.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: I am Marplon. It is your hour. Happy communing.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: With thanks. Happy communing.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Marplon steps into the control booth.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Spock is attempting a mind meld on McCoy.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Well?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible. He's under extremely powerful control.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Are we just going to stand here?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Little else we can do, unless you can think of a way to get through that door.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Well, this is simply ridiculous. A bunch of stone age characters running around in robes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: And apparently commanding powers far beyond our comprehension. Not simple, not ridiculous. Very, very dangerous.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The door opens and this time the stave is pointed at Spock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: You. Come.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk is released and greets Spock with an inane smile on his face.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Joy to you, friend. Peace and contentment will fill you. You will know the peace of Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk leaves, and Spock is fastened to the wall for his treatment. The lights waver as the Lawgivers leave Marplon to his work.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Have no fear, friend. The effect is harmless. My name is Marplon. I was too late to save your first two friends. They have been absorbed. Beware of them.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Spock is released.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: What about the Captain?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: He is unharmed, unchanged. I am the third man in Reger's triad. We have been awaiting your return.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are not Archons, Marplon.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Whatever you may call yourselves, you are in fulfillment of prophecy. We ask your help.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Where is Reger?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: He will join us. He is immune to absorption. Hurry. We have not much time.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Who is Landru?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: I cannot answer your questions now. Landru, he will hear. Here are your weapons. You may need them.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Lawgivers enter

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Behave as you saw your Captain behave. It is done.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Joy be with you. Peace and contentment.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Peace and tranquillity to you. (in a whisper) Are you all right?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite all right. Be careful of Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand. Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am formulating a theory, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not here. The doctor.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You speak in strange whispers. This is not the way of Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Joy be yours, and tranquillity, my friend.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And peace and harmony. Are you of the Body?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Body is one.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Blessed be the Body, and health to all of its parts.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My friends. (guiding Red and Spock away to a quiet corner) What is your theory, Mister Spock?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is a soulless society, Captain. It has no spirit, no spark. All is indeed peace and tranquillity. The peace of the factory, the tranquillity of the machine. All parts working in unison.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And when something unexplained happens, their routine is disrupted.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Until new orders are received. The question is, who gives those orders?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no Landru, Captain, not in the human sense.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're thinking the same thing I am. Mister Spock, the plug must be pulled.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru must die.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, our Prime Directive of non-interference.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That refers to a living, growing culture. Do you think this one is?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Marplon and Reger enter.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Joy to you all, friends.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: It is the gift of Landru. (goes over to Kirk) I've brought your signalling devices. You may need them.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What we need is more information about Landru. (Reger shakes his head) You said you wanted us to help you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: The prophecy says

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind what the prophecy says. If you want to be liberated from Landru, we'll need your help.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're not of the Body!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Peace

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're not!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: to you, friend. Joy and tranquillity.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lawgivers!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Peace.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lawgivers! (trying to strangle Kirk) Traitor! Traitors! Traitors!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Spock deals with O'Neil

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc, I don't want to hurt you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Traitors!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk manages to get a sleeper hold on McCoy, and he passes out

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: More lawgivers enter, and are overpowered. Spock uses a punch to knock his one out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't that somewhat old-fashioned? Robes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They undress the lawgivers and put on their robes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is Landru?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: No, no.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where do we find him?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: We do not see him. We hear him, in the Hall of Audiences.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In this building?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Context: reluctantly
Text: Yes.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're going to take us there. (the two men are terrified at the prospect) Spock, call the Enterprise.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: No.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Snap out of it! Start acting like men.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise. status report.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, I've been trying to reach you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Report, Scott.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: The orbit's still decaying. I give it six hours, more or less.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Those heat beams are still on us. You've got to cut them off, Mister Spock, or we'll cook.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, stand by. We're doing the best we can. How's Mister Sulu?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: He's peaceful enough, but he worries me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put a guard on him.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: On Sulu?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's an order. Watch him. Captain out.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. (gives him a phaser)

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; All right. About Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: There was war. Convulsions. The world was destroying itself. Landru was our leader. He saw the truth. He changed the world. He took us back, back to a simple time. A time of peace and tranquillity.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to him?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: He's still alive. He is here now. He sees. He hears. We have destroyed ourselves. Please, no more.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said you wanted freedom. It's time you learned that freedom is never a gift. It has to be earned. Come on. We're going to find Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: No, no, I was wrong! I submit, I bear myself to the will of Landru!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's too late for that.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Reger
Text: No! Lawgivers! Help! Help me!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Spock neck-pinches him.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, it's up to you. Take us to Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: outside the door

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: This is the Hall of Audiences.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: But this is Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Marplon makes a deep bow, and the door opens outwards. They enter the empty room.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Landru speaks here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk and Spock remove the robes and leave the staves propped by the open door.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru! Landru. We are the Archons. We are the Archons. We've come to speak. We are the Archons. We want to talk to you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: The projection appears on the far wall.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Landru! He comes!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Despite my efforts to save you, you have invaded the Body and you are causing great harm.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have no intention of causing harm.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Obliteration is necessary. The infection is strong. For the good of the Body, you must die. It is a great sorrow.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We do not intend to die.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: All who saw you, all who know of your presence here must be excised. The memory of the Body will be cleansed.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Listen to me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Useless, Captain. A projection.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. Let's have a look at the projector.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: They both use their phasers to blast a hole in the wall. As expected, there are nice clean big computer boxes in a room beyond. Lights are flashing and blinking, blinking and flashing.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course. It had to be. Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: A machine. This whole society is a machine's concept of perfection. Peace, harmony.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But no soul.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: I am Landru. You have intruded.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pull out its plug, Mister Spock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Before they can press the buttons on their phasers, there is a high-pitched sound

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Your devices have been neutralised. So it shall be with you. I am Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru died six thousand years ago.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: I am Landru. I am he. All that he was, I am. His experience, his knowledge.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not his wisdom. He may have programmed you, but he could not have given you a soul. You are a machine.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Your statement is irrelevant. You will be obliterated. The good of the Body is the Prime Directive.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: The good of the Body, Captain. That's the key.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. What is the good?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: I am Landru.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru is dead. You are a machine. A question has been put to you. Answer it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: The good is the harmonious continuation of the Body. The good is peace, tranquillity. The good of the Body is the directive.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I put it to you that you have disobeyed the Prime Directive. You are harmful to the Body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: The body is. It exists. It is healthy.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The body is dying. You are destroying it.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Do you ask a question?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done to do justice to the full potential of every individual of the Body?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Insufficient data.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Without freedom of choice, there is no creativity. Without creativity, there is no life. The body dies. The fault is yours.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you aiding the body, or are you destroying it?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Context: sounding very machine-like, Davros-like
Text: I am not programmed to answer that question.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lawgiver
Text: Landru! Guide us, Landru!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Kirk draws his phaser.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not necessary, Captain. They have no guidance. Possibly for the first time in their lives.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Landru, answer the question.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Peace, order, and tranquillity are maintained. The body lives, but I reserve creativity to me.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then the body dies. Creativity is necessary for the health of the Body.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: This is impossible.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Marplon
Text: Is this truly Landru?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: What's left of him, after he built and programmed this machine six thousand years ago.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must create the good. That is the will of Landru, nothing else.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: But there is evil.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then the evil must be destroyed. That is the Prime Directive. And you are the evil.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: I think. I live.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are the evil. The evil must be destroyed. Fulfill the Prime Directive.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Smoke starts to rise from the base of the main computer bank.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Landru, help me!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: are the evil. Fulfill the Prime Directive.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Landru
Text: Help me! Help me! Help me! Help me!

Title: The Return of The Archons
Context: Fire breaks out and things go bang. The machine dies. Now Kirk and Spock step briefly into the computer room.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Marplon, you're on your own now. I hope you're up to it. (to Lawgivers) And you can get rid of those robes. If I were you, I'd start look for another job. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, are you all right?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the ship?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Scott
Text: The heat rays are gone, Captain, and Mister Sulu's back to normal.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Relieving you.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excellent, Scotty. Stand by to beam up landing party. Let's go and see how the others are doing. Marplon can finish up here.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3158.7 The Enterprise is preparing to leave Beta Three in Star system C One Eleven. Sociologist Lindstrom is remaining behind with a party of experts who will help restore the planet's culture to a human form.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Marvellous.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: The late Landru, Captain. A marvellous feat of engineering. A computer capable of directing the lives of millions of human beings.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But only a machine, Mister Spock. The original Landru programmed it with all his knowledge but he couldn't give it his wisdom, his compassion, his understanding, his soul, Mister Spock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: Predictably metaphysical. I prefer the concrete, the graspable, the provable.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd make a splendid computer, Mister Spock.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is very kind of you, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, Mister Lindstrom from the surface.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Lindstrom.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: I just wanted to say goodbye, Captain.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's it going?

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Lindstrom
Text: Couldn't be better. Already this morning, we've had half a dozen domestic quarrels and two genuine knock-down drag-outs. It may not be paradise, but it's certainly human.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sounds most promising. Good luck.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Spock
Text: How often mankind has wished for a world as peaceful and secure as the one Landru provided.

Title: The Return of The Archons
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. And we never got it. Just lucky, I guess.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3192.1. The Enterprise is en route to star cluster NGC 321. Objective, to open diplomatic relations with the civilisations known to be there. We have sent a message to Eminiar Seven, principal planet of the star cluster, informing them of our friendly intentions. We are awaiting an answer.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing yet, Lieutenant?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing, Captain. Hailing frequencies are open.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Ambassador Fox enters the Bridge from the turbolift.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Have you received an answer to your message yet, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing yet, Ambassador. We're awaiting a reply. Today's the first time we've had any evidence they've picked up our signal.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, message coming in from Eminiar Seven. Sir, it's code seven-ten.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Positive. It repeats over and over.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Is that supposed to mean something?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Code seven-ten means under no circumstances are we to approach that planet. No circumstances what so ever.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: You will disregard that signal, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Fox, it is their planet.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Captain, in the past twenty years, thousands of lives have been lost in this quadrant. Lives that could have been saved if the Federation had a treaty port here. We mean to have that port and I'm here to get it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By disregarding code seven-ten, you might well involve us in an interplanetary war.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I'm quite prepared to take that risk.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are. I'm thinking about this ship, my crew.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I have my orders, Captain, and now you have yours. You will proceed on course. Achieve orbit status and just leave the rest to me. You're well aware that my mission gives me the power of command. I now exercise it. You will proceed on course. That's a direct order.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: He leaves.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: In view of code seven-ten, Captain, may I suggest

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. This is the Captain. Condition Yellow Alert. Phaser crews stand by. Deflector shields up. We're going in. Peacefully, I hope. But peacefully or not, we're going in.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3192.5. Now in standard orbit around planet Eminiar Seven. My orders are clear. We must establish diplomatic relations at all cost. Preparing to beam down to planet surface.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We know very little about them. Their civilisation is advanced. They've had space flight for several centuries, but they've never ventured beyond their own solar system. When first contacted more than fifty years ago, Eminiar Seven was at war with its nearest neighbour.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything else?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Earth expedition making the report failed to return from its mission. The USS Valiant. Listed as missing in space.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Kirk, what's this about you going down alone?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not alone. I'm taking some security people with me.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: It is my prerogative.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't risk beaming you down there until I know what kind of reception you're going to receive. Your safety is my responsibility. Those are my orders, sir. Mister Spock.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter room standing by, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What co-ordinates?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've selected a site which from the traffic seems to be near an official establishment.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Final sensor readings?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: No hostility directed toward us. No apparent notice taken of us at all, which seems strange. They did scan us when we assumed orbit. Obviously, they know we're here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship's defences?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Screens down, but all defensive details on general alert status, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Landing party will pick up phaser number one's from the arsenal. Keep them inconspicuous. Mister Scott.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The ship is yours. Take care of her until I come back.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir. And have a bonny trip.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll do our best. Let's go.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: A young woman in black tights and a skillfully draped scarf is accompanied by two guards. She uses a scanning device.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: They will materialise there. Remember your instructions; They are to be treated correctly, nothing more.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk, Spock, a yeoman and two guards materialise next to a sculpture

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the United Federation of Planets.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: I know. I'm Mea 3. I congratulate you on your instrumentation. You've come directly to the Division of Control. If you'll follow me, please.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Captain, I wish

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: You were warned not to come here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had orders to come here. Why did your people tell us to stay away?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: It was for your own safety, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see no danger here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: The danger exists. Nevertheless, you are here. It would be morally incorrect to do less than extend our hospitality. Anan 7 and members of the High Council await you. If you will come this way, please.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Five stern looking men sit along a table facing the door.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk. This is my first officer, Mister Spock, Lieutenants Galloway, Osborne, Yeoman Tamula.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Welcome to Eminiar Seven. Well, Captain, what can we do for you?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My mission is to establish diplomatic relations between your people and mine.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: That is impossible.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would you mind telling me why?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Because of the war.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're still at war?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: We have been at war for five hundred years.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You conceal it very well. Mister Spock?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, we have completely scanned your planet. We find it highly advanced, prosperous in a material sense, comfortable for your people, and peaceful in the extreme. Yet you say you are at war. There is no evidence of this.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Casualties among our civilian population total from one to three million dead each year from direct enemy attack. That is one reason, Captain, why we told you to stay away. As long as your ship is orbiting our planet, it is in severe danger.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: With whom are you at war?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: The third planet in our system, called Vendikar. Originally settled by our people and now a ruthless enemy. Highly advanced technologically.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: An alarm sounds.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Please excuse me. Vendikar is attacking. Mea, care for our guests.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: The Council adjourn into an adjacent room filled with computer equipment.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strange.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To say the least.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: It will not last long.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you take shelter?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: There is no shelter, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are these attacks frequent?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Oh yes, and we will retaliate immediately.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: She sees an area flare on a map

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Oh!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: A hit right here in the city.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you hear any explosions, Mister Spock?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: None, Captain. Yeoman Tamula.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: Sir?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Tricorder readings. Radiation. Disturbances of any kind.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: She scans the area

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: Working, sir. No evidence.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mea, if this is an attack, may I ask what weapons the enemy is using?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Fusion bombs, materialised by the enemy over their targets.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Bridge. Scotty?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scanners operative on the planet's surface?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Of course, sir. As per orders.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything unusual?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Nothing, sir. All quiet.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Kirk out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Look, Anan. (another flare on another screen)

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Yes, I see it. They were warned.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Just as it happened fifty years ago.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Alert a security detachment. They may be needed.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Anan rejoins the group

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: It's a vicious attack, extremely destructive. Fortunately, our defences are firming, but our casualties are high. Very high.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sir, I have been in contact with my ship, which has had this entire planet under surveillance. All during this so-called attack of yours, we have been monitoring you. There's been no attack, no explosions, no radiations, no disturbances whatsoever. If this is some sort of game you're playing

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: This is no game, Captain. Half a million people have just been killed. Activate the attack units, Sar.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Yes, Councilman.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Launch immediate counter attack.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computers, Captain. They fight their war with computers. Totally.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Yes, of course.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer don't kill a half million people.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Deaths have been registered. Of course they have twenty four hours to report.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To report?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: To our disintegration machines. You must understand, Captain, we have been at war for five hundred years. Under ordinary conditions, no civilisation could withstand that. But we have reached a solution.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then the attack by Vendikar was theoretical.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Oh, no, quite real. An attack is mathematically launched. I lost my wife in the last attack. Our civilisation lives. The people die, but our culture goes on.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean to tell me your people just walk into a disintegration machine when they're told to?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: We have a high consciousness of duty, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is a certain scientific logic about it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I'm glad you approve.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not approve. I understand.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Good. Then you will recall I warned you not to come here. You chose to ignore my warning. I'm sorry, but it's happened.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What has happened?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Once your ship was in orbit about our planet, it became a legitimate target. It has been classified destroyed by a tricobalt satellite explosion. All persons aboard your ship have twenty four hours to report to our disintegration machines. In order to ensure their co-operation, I have ordered you, Captain, and your party held in custody until they surrender. If possible, we shall spare your ship, Captain, but its passengers and crew are already dead.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, delayed. The Enterprise, in orbit about Eminiar Seven, has been declared a casualty of an incredible war fought by computers. I and my landing party, though apparently not included as casualties aboard the Enterprise, are confined on the planet's surface, awaiting what?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: I have been sent to ask if you require anything.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We require a great deal. I wish to speak to Anan Seven.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: He's busy co-ordinating casualty lists.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
