Text: He'll have more casualty lists than he knows what to do with if he doesn't get in here and talk to me.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Don't you understand? Our duty

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your duty doesn't include stepping into a disintegrator and disappearing.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: I'm afraid mine does, Captain. I too have been declared a casualty. I must report to a disintegrator by noon tomorrow.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that all it means to you? To report and die?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: My life is as dear to me as yours is to you, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then how can you stand

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Don't you see? If I refuse to report, and others refuse, then Vendikar would have no choice but to launch real weapons. We would have to do the same to defend ourselves. More than people would die then. A whole civilisation would be destroyed. Surely you can see that ours is a better way.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't see that at all.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: It's been our way for almost five hundred years. Is there anything I can bring you?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Anan Seven.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I tell you, we should have heard something by now.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Doctor, that we should, but we haven't, and we cannot raise them. You know, if there'd been trouble, they should have at least managed to get word back to us.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We can't just sit here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: What would you suggest?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Me? I'm a doctor. If I were an officer of the line, I'd

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Would you have me open fire?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course not.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, message coming in from the Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good news, Mister Scott. The Eminians have agreed to the establishment of full normal diplomatic relations.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Fox'll be glad to hear about that.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They've also extended an invitation to all personnel to come ashore, for shore leave. They've assured me that our people will have a wonderful time.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Er, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: It sounds like Kirk but it isn't.) ANAN: Yes, Mister Scott

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: All personnel?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: All personnel. We'll transport up trained Eminians to assume support positions. Those are my orders, Mister Scott.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, Captain. We'll start forming shore parties immediately. Scott out. Well now, what do you think of that?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, I do. Computer, last message received and recorded from Captain Kirk.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Computer
Text: In place.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Run it through analyser. Question. Is it or is it not the Captain's voice?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Computer
Text: Negative. A close copy.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: A voice duplicator?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Computer
Text: Ninety eight percent probability.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, they've got them, Doctor, and now they're trying to get us.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure you can do it, Mister Spock?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Limited telepathic abilities are inherent in Vulcanians, Captain. It may work. It may not.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do your best.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Spock goes to the door and begins to slowly work his way across it. Outside, the guard starts to blink and shake his head. Spock reaches the place directly behind the guard and looks as if he is doing a mind meld through the wall. Slowly, the guard opens the door and enters. He is swiftly disarmed and knocked out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: My pleasure, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: What do we do now, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We get our communicators back and try and contact the ship. Mister Spock, we'll need more weapons.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll try to take it easy, but if we're forced to kill

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: As holder of the only gun, Kirk leads the way into the corridors of the city.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: At a junction, they watch as first a young woman, then a security guard go into a booth.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: An entrance, Captain, but no exit. They go in, but they do not come out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A disintegration machine.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: So I would assume.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: They move forward carefully and meet -

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mea. What do you think you're doing?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: I'm going

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're not going in there.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: But I must.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No you're not.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Please. All right, don't worry about me.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, that guard. I'll cover you.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Spock walks nonchalantly up to the guard in charge of disintegrating the waiting queue of people.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, there's a multi-legged creature crawling on your shoulder.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: He neck-pinches him, as the rest just stare. They now have two weapons. Spock rejoins Kirk.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, you people, clear out of the way.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk fires at the booth.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: What are you doing?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Throwing a monkey wrench into the machinery.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: You can't do this.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've done it. (The booth finally blows up.) Come on, let's get out of here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Security
Text: The Federation prisoners have attacked their guard and escaped. They are armed. Disintegration station number twelve destroyed, Councilman, apparently by disruptor fire.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: All security personnel, Federation prisoners have escaped. They are to be found. They are armed. If they resist, do what is necessary. Planetary disruptor banks, calculate orbit of star cruiser now circling. Stand by to fire. Full power.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Security
Text: Councilman, planetary disruptor banks locked onto target. Standing by.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: In ten seconds, open fire. Destroy the star cruiser. Those are the orders of the Council.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log, stardate 3193.0. Chief Engineer Scott recording. The Captain and First Officer are overdue and missing on the surface of Eminiar Seven. I have taken standard precautionary measures while we continue our attempts to locate them.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Depaul
Text: All stations reporting. Deflector screens rigged at full power. Phaser crews ready. Sensors reading zero. Correction. Mister Scott.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, Mister DePaul?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Sensor readings just shot off the scale.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, now. They're taking pot shots at us. Holding, Mister DePaul?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Screens firm, sir. Extremely powerful sonic vibrations. Decibels eighteen to the twelfth power. If those screens weren't up, we'd be totally disrupted by now.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I guess that answers our questions, Mister Scott. They're not very friendly, are they?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, but what about our Captain and the landing party down there somewhere?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We get them out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: If they're alive, and if we can find them. That's a big planet.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not too big for the Enterprise to handle if it has to.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can't fire full phasers with our screens up, and We can't lower our screens with their disruptors on us. Of course I could treat them to a few dozen photon torpedoes.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Context: entering the Bridge
Text: You'll do no such thing, Mister Scott.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Fox, we're under attack. They're trying to knock us down.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: You have taken defensive measures.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Of course, but

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: There are no buts. Obviously it's a misunderstanding, and one of my jobs is to clear up misunderstandings.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're holding our Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: We have no proof of that.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm responsible for the safety of this ship.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: And I'm responsible for the success of this mission, and that's more important than this ship. Is that clear? We came here to establish diplomatic relations with these people.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: But they're the ones who're looking for a fight, Mister Fox.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: This is a diplomatic matter. If you check your regulations, you'll find that my orders get priority. I'll try to make contact with the planetary officials. Lieutenant, open up a channel and keep it open. Tell them to expect a priority one message from me. There will be no punitive measures, gentlemen. Those are my orders.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: He leaves the Bridge.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Diplomats. The best diplomat I know is a fully activated phaser bank.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: Why did we come back here, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The last place they'll look for us is the place we escaped from. (gives her a gun) Cover the door.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: Captain, you've got to let me go. My time is almost up.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you that anxious to die?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: You don't understand.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, how did that little raid work out?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We captured four of their disrupter-type weapons, two complete outfits of male clothing, and perhaps most important of all, one of their communication devices.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will it reach the ship?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at this time. Its range is restricted in comparison with ours. I may be able to alter its components, but it will take time.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Work on it. We've got to contact the ship. Mea, I want you to give me a complete layout of this building complex. How do I get to the War Room?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: No!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now listen to me. I'm trying to help you. To save your life and the lives of millions like you. If you help me, maybe I can do it. If you don't, you'll die, we'll die, and the killing will go on. Or are you that fond of the war?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: What are you going to do?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're going to try and stop the killing. We're trying to help. Believe me.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mea
Text: I believe you, but

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me what I want to know. Please.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Time is running out. We have been unable to destroy the Earth ship. One of our disintegration chambers has been eliminated and we have already fallen far behind in our quota. This is a grave crisis and I am at a loss to know how to proceed.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: The central channel, Anan. The Earth ambassador's calling with an urgent message.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: What is the great immorality, open honesty or a deception which may save our lives? Put me through to the Earth Ambassador.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: A channel is open, Mister Ambassador. You will be speaking to Anan Seven, head of the High Council of the Eminian Union.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Mister Anan, this is Robert Fox

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Special Ambassador for the United Federation of Planets.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: A great honour, Mister Ambassador.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: We have approached you openly

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: With the intent of establishing formal and friendly relations between our peoples, but now,

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: For some reason, you have attacked us, and apparently you're holding several special representatives of our Federation.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: A mistake, Mister Ambassador. We are at war.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: An error in our sensors indicated that your ship was about to attack us.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I'm giving orders that our attack be stopped.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Now, as to your representatives, you have my sacred word as an Eminian that they are alive and well.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Thank you. I thought perhaps it was all a mistake.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Depaul
Text: Mister Scott, disruptor beams are no longer hitting us.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Maintain status, Mister DePaul.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: We are most anxious to establish relations with you, Mister Fox.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: We will make arrangements to receive you. (to Sar, closing the channel) The minute their screens are down, open fire.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Yes, Councilman.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Context: reopening the channel
Text: I apologise deeply for the misunderstanding. These are trying times for us, you understand.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I understand. Mister Anan, I presume that you have our ship's Captain on hand when I beam down.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: He will be there, sir.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I give you my word.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I'm sure that from this day forward, your planet and our Federation will attain the deepest friendship. I look forward to seeing you.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: He gestures to Uhura to end transmission.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Diplomacy, gentlemen, should be a job left to diplomats. You will, of course, immediately resume a peaceful status.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir, I will not.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: What did you say?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll not lower the screens, not until the Captain tells me to.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: You are taking orders from me. You will lower the screens as a sign of good faith. My authority.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I know about your authority, but the screens stay up.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Fox, they faked a message from the Captain, they've launched an attack against our ship. Now you want us to trust them openly?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I want you and expect you to obey my lawful orders.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. I won't lower the screens.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Your refusal to comply with my orders has endangered the entire success of this mission. I can have you sent to a penal colony for this.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: That you can, sir, but I won't lower the screens.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Your name will figure prominently in my report to the Federation Central.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Fox leaves the Bridge

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Scotty, now you've done it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. The haggis is in the fire for sure, but I'll not lower my defences on the word of that mealy-mouthed gentleman down below. Not until I know what happened to the Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk enters, quietly, but Anan knows he is there without turning around.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Won't you join me in a drink, Captain? You'll find our trova most interesting.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't come to drink.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I assume that is what you used to destroy disintegration chamber number twelve.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A very efficient weapon. I'm not afraid of using it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: My first impression was correct. You are a barbarian.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Don't sound so incredulous, Captain. Of course you are. We all are. A killer first, a builder second. A hunter, a warrior, and let's be honest, a murderer. That is our joint heritage, is it not?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're less cold-blooded about it than you are.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: What do you want, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want to contact my ship. Where are my communicators?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: In a safe place.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You take a lot of chances, Councilman.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You're worried about your ship, Captain. I'm trying to save a world.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I were you, I'd think about saving my life.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Won't you have a drink, Captain?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk pours himself a slug of trova, and as he turns his back, Anan presses concealed buttons.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: And then we can discuss our differences.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not interested in discussing our differences. You don't seem to realise the risk you're taking. We don't make war with computers and herd the casualties into suicide stations. We make the real thing, Councilman. I could destroy this planet.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Why do you think I don't let you talk to your ship ?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't need the ship for that.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You mean, all by yourself with a disruptor, you can destroy this planet?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's exactly what I mean.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I had no idea you were so formidable.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to think I'm joking. Where are the communicators?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: If I told you, Captain, would you walk right out and get them?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something like that.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Very well, Captain. They're in the War Room. Go left down the corridor, left again. They are unguarded.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk gestures Anan to leave in front of him, and pushes him into the first guard outside the door. Then Kirk tackles the second guard, but finally the pair knock him out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Is he alive? Pity. Man like that would have preferred to die fighting. Take him to the Council Room.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk is half-dragged away

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Fox and his aide beam down to exactly the same place as the original landing party.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Ambassador Fox?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I am Robert Fox. Have I the honour of addressing Anan Seven?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Welcome to Eminiar, Mister Ambassador.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Mister Ambassador, I am truly sorry for what must happen.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I beg your pardon?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You and your party have been declared war casualties. You will be taken immediately to one of our casualty stations so that your deaths may be recorded.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: You mean we are to be killed?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: That is correct, Mister Ambassador. I regret it very much, but there is nothing I can do about it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: The two security guards are in Eminian uniform and look like something out of Thunderbirds - the puppet show, that is.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise, come in.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, it's Mister Spock.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty here, Mister Spock. Go ahead.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is the ship all right?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've been through a bit, but we're all right now. How about the Captain and you?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Captain is overdue. We've suffered no casualties among us. This is important. Under no circumstances shall any one beam down from the Enterprise. They'd be killed the moment they arrived.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: That ties it. That popinjay Fox went down a couple minutes ago.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Ambassador?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I knew it had a rotten ring to it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Orbit out to maximum phaser range and stand by for further orders. Spock out.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: What are you going to do, Mister Spock?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Find the Ambassador and the Captain. Yeoman Tamula, you stay here and prevent this young lady from immolating herself. Knock her down if necessary. This is a killing situation. Do what you must to protect yourself. Clear?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Tamula
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: A guard is trying to force Fox inside when Spock and the two guards arrive.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: What are you doing? I'm a representative of the United Federation of Planets! A special representative!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Guard
Text: Get in line.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: They disarm and disable the Eminian guards

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Spock!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please, Mister Fox. Ladies and gentlemen, please move quickly away from the chamber or you may be injured.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: What are you doing, Mister Spock?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Practicing a peculiar variety of diplomacy, sir.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: He uses the disrupter to destroy the disintegration chamber

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll take you to a place of comparative safety, then I must find the Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: They have him. The guards told us. They took him to the Council Room under heavy guard.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: By now, Mister Ambassador, I'm sure you realise that normal diplomatic procedures are ineffective here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: I've never been a soldier, Mister Spock, but I learn very quickly.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, sir. We need all the help we can get.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Captain, surely you can see the position we are in. If your people do not report to our disintegration chambers, it is a violation of an agreement that dates back five hundred years.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My people are not responsible for your agreements.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You will be responsible for an escalation that will destroy everything. Millions of people horribly killed. Complete destruction of our culture here and yes, the culture on Vendikar. Disaster, disease, starvation, horrible, lingering death, pain and anguish!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That seems to frighten you.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: It would frighten any sane man.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. You're quite right.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Don't you understand, Captain? We have done away with all that. Now you are threatening to bring it down on us again. Are those five hundred people of yours more important than the hundreds of millions of innocent people on Eminiar and Vendikar? What kind of monster are you?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm a barbarian. You said it yourself.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: I had hoped I'd spoken only figuratively.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, no. You were quite accurate. I plan to prove it to you.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Open a channel to the Enterprise. You give me no choice, Captain. We are not bandits, but you force us to act as bandits.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is the USS Enterprise.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, General Order Twenty Four. Two hours! In two hours!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Enterprise, this is Anan Seven, First Councilman of the High Council of Eminiar.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: We hold your Captain, his party, your Ambassador and his party prisoners.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Unless you immediately start transportation of all personnel aboard your ship to the surface, the hostages will be killed. You have thirty minutes. I mean it, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All that it means is that I won't be around for the destruction. You heard me give General Order Twenty Four. That means in two hours the Enterprise will destroy Eminiar Seven.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: Planetary defence System, open fire on the Enterprise!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Security
Text: I'm sorry, Councilman. The target has moved out of range.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You wouldn't do this. Hundreds of millions of people.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't start it, Councilman, but I'm liable to finish it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Meanwhile Spock and his group are moving through the corridors. Fox's aide gets injured in one weapons exchange so they leave him behind.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Councilman, I received a message from Vendikar. Our time is nearly up. Our quota is short by several thousand. They accuse us of reneging on the treaty.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You see? It's started.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're wrong. It hasn't begun.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Security
Text: Councilman, Disintegrator station eleven has been destroyed. Guard positions in tunnels eight and ten fail to answer. Earth party reported seen in corridor 4A.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have less than two hours, Councilman.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: What I want or don't want has nothing to do with it. Escalation is automatic. You can stop it!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop it? I'm counting on it.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Open a channel, Lieutenant. This is the commander of the USS Enterprise.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: All cities and installations on Eminiar Seven have been located, identified, and fed into our fire-control system. In one hour and forty five minutes

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: The entire inhabited surface of your planet will be destroyed.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: You have that long to surrender your hostages.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: What can I do? Somebody, please tell me.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk lures a guard to him, knocks him down, gets his weapon and holds off the others.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold it! Over there. You, over there. Move, move, move.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Everyone goes over against a wall, while Kirk gets a second weapon and stands by the council table.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now we'll talk.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Spock and Fox enter.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I had assumed you needed help. I see I'm in error.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I need the help. In there, Mister Spock.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Spock enters the War Room

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in, Scotty.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain, are you all right?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything's secure here. Maintain position. If everything goes according to plan, you can beam us up in ten minutes. If you don't hear from us, carry out General Order Twenty Four on schedule.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, Captain. Is there anything else we can do?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cross your fingers. Kirk out. Death, destruction, disease, horror. That's what war is all about, Anan. That's what makes it a thing to be avoided. You've made it neat and painless. So neat and painless, you've had no reason to stop it. And you've had it for five hundred years. Since it seems to be the only way I can save my crew and my ship, I'm going to end it for you, one way or another. Mister Ambassador.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would you mind taking these people out into the corridor and holding them there.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Gentlemen, if you please.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Sar
Text: You. Come with me. Mister Osborne.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our communicators, weapons.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Sar opens a cupboard and Osborne gets them.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Spock.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: These are the attack computers, Captain. That one's defence, that one computes the casualties. They're all tied in with a subspace transmission unit, which keeps them in constant contact with their Vendikan counterparts.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, go on.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: At the moment contact is broken, it abrogates the agreement between the two warring parties.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: What are you going to do?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: This one's the key. The circuit is now locked. Destroy this one, and they'll all go.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Get him out of here.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Sar
Text: Now wait a minute. Please, please!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Kirk uses his phaser to destroy the computer.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Against the wall!

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: There is a very satisfying series of explosions.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: You realise what you have done?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I do. I've given you back the horrors of war. The Vendikans now assume that you've broken your agreement and that you're preparing to wage real war with real weapons. They'll want do the same. Only the next attack they launch will do a lot more than count up numbers in a computer. They'll destroy cities, devastate your planet. You of course will want to retaliate. If I were you, I'd start making bombs. Yes, Councilman, you have a real war on your hands. You can either wage it with real weapons, or you might consider an alternative. Put an end to it. Make peace.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: There can be no peace. Don't you see? We've admitted it to ourselves. We're a killer species. It's instinctive. It's the same with you. Your General Order Twenty Four.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. It's instinctive. But the instinct can be fought. We're human beings with the blood of a million savage years on our hands, but we can stop it. We can admit that we're killers, but we're not going to kill today. That's all it takes. Knowing that we won't kill today. Contact Vendikar. I think you'll find that they're just as terrified, appalled, horrified as you are, that they'll do anything to avoid the alternative I've given you. Peace or utter destruction. It's up to you.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: As a third party interested only in peace and the establishment of normal relations, I should be glad to offer my services as negotiator between you and Vendikar. I've had some small experiences in such matters.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Anan
Text: There may be a chance. We have a direct channel with Vendikar's High Council. It hasn't been used in centuries.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Fox
Text: Then it's long overdue. Shall we go?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Context: Anan and Fox leave.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a chance it may work, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty?

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel implementation of General Order Twenty Four. Alert transporter room. We're ready to beam up.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lay in a course for Argona Two, Navigator. Mister Scott.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Space details set, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message from Eminiar Seven, Captain. Ambassador Fox reports negotiations underway with Vendikar. Outlook hopeful.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you took a big chance.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did I, Mister Spock? They've been killing three million people a year. It had been going on for five hundred years. An actual attack wouldn't have killed any more people than one of their computer attacks, but it would have ended their ability to make war. The fighting would have been over permanently.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But you didn't know that it would work.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. It was a calculated risk. Still, the Eminians keep a very orderly society, and actual war is a very messy business. A very, very messy business. I had a feeling that they would do anything to avoid it, even talk peace.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: A feeling is not much to go on.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sometimes a feeling, Mister Spock, is all we humans have to go on.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you almost make me believe in luck.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, Mister Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spinelli
Text: Coming up on it fast, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you certain of your sensor readings?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Definitely a space vessel of some type.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Origin?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown. It could hardly be an Earth ship. There have been no flights into this sector for years.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm picking up a signal, sir. (a series of beeps comes over the speakers) Captain, that's the old Morse code call signal.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: CQ. CQ.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're reading it, Lieutenant. I thought you said it couldn't possibly be an Earth vessel.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to understand why it always gives you pleasure to see me proven wrong.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An emotional Earth weakness of mine. There it is.

Title: Space Seed
Context: The ship appears on the viewscreen.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An old Earth vessel, similar to the DY=500 class.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Much older. DY-100 class, to be exact. Captain, the last such vessel was built centuries ago, back in the 1990s.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then it's a derelict, its signal left on automatic.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or an old Earth ship being used by aliens.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Weapons status.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Weapons
Text: Deflector shields on maximum. Phasers manned, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bioscanners report.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Life science bioscanners are picking up heart beats from over there. Can't be human, though. They're too faint, and average only four beats per minute.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor reading, Captain. Some sort of equipment functioning on that vessel.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All decks go to full alert.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Enterprise comes alongside the smaller ship, which is still as big as the engineering hull

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3141.9. A full hour has elapsed since interception of the strange vessel. Our presence alongside is still being completely ignored. Although our sensors continue to show signs of equipment and life aboard, there has been no indication of danger to us.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Weapons department, maintain battle stations. All other decks standby alert.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks acknowledging, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're continuing to pick up some form of heart action over there. Very faint, very slow. Seems to be coming from about sixty or seventy bodies, as near as I can tell.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alien bodies, Bones?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could be. There's no sign of breathing or other form of respiration.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hull surface is pitted with meteor scars. However, scanners make out a name. SS Botany Bay.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you can check the registry.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: No such vessel listed. Records of that period are fragmentary, however. The mid=1990s was the era of your last so-called World War.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Eugenics Wars.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Of course. Your attempt to improve the race through selective breeding.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, wait a minute. Not our attempt, Mister Spock. A group of ambitious scientists. I'm sure you know the type. Devoted to logic, completely unemotional

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, all right, gentlemen. As you were. Rig for tractor beam, Helm. Lock onto that vessel.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spinelli
Text: Rigging for tractor beam, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Bridge is yours, Mister Spock. Care to join the landing party, Doctor?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, if you're actually giving me a choice

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not. Oh, I'll need somebody familiar with the late 20th-Century Earth. Here's a chance for that historian to do something for a change. What's her name? McIvers?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant McGivers.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Lt McGivers is just about to settle down to some painting, when

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attention. The following personnel report to transporter room. Engineering Officer Scott, Lieutenant McGivers. Acknowledge.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: McGivers. On my way.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, it looks like that ship was expecting us. We read heat coming on, complete oxygen atmosphere.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very interesting. You ready, Bones?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. I signed aboard this ship to practice medicine, not to have my atoms scattered back and forth across space by this gadget.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're an old-fashioned boy, McCoy. Where's that historian? (McGivers enters) Come on, Lieutenant

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: McGivers, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Men and women are lying in clear-sided compartments, seemingly asleep.) KIRK: Scotty

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Definitely Earth-type mechanism, sir. Twentieth century vessel. Old type atomic power. Bulky, solid. I think they used to call them transistor units. I'd love to tear this baby apart.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Captain, it's a sleeper ship.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Suspended animation.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I've seen old photographs of this. Necessary because of the time involved in space travel until about the year 2018. It took years just to travel from one planet to another.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it possible they're still alive after centuries of travel?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's theoretically possible. I've never heard of it being tested for this long a period.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: What a handsome group of people.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I have a new reading. The lights must have triggered some mechanism.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Captain, look here.

Title: Space Seed
Context: They go to the compartment holding a dark-haired man.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Beats me what's happening.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We've triggered something, all right. His heart beat's increasing. Now passing eight beats per minute. There are some signs of respiration beginning.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: This one was probably programmed to be triggered first.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could he be the leader? The leader. Lieutenant?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Context: dragging herself back from just gazing at the man
Text: Yes, sir. The leader was often set to revive first. This would allow him to decide whether the conditions warranted revival of the others.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Heart beat now approaching forty per minute. The respiration pattern is firming up.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: From the northern India area, I'd guess. Probably a Sikh. They were the most fantastic warriors.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Heart beat now fifty two and increasing.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The others?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's no change, and they're mixed types. Western, mid-European, Latin, Oriental.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: A man from the twentieth century coming alive.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe. Heart beat dropping.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Circuit shorting.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Probably some dust.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Heartbeat now thirty, dropping fast. It's a heart flutter. He's dying.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Do something, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can we?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: It'd take an hour to figure it out.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happens if we get him out of there?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll die in seconds if we don't.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Kirk uses something metal in his hand to break the glass and open the compartment. The man is slid out on a trolley, gasping and awake. He tries to speak.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: How long?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long have you been sleeping? Two centuries we estimate. Landing party to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Go ahead, boarding party. We read you.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock in on McCoy's beam. He's transporting back with a casualty we discovered here.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Magnificent.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Alongside the SS Botany Bay for ten hours now. A boarding party of engineering and medical specialists are now completing their examination of the mysterious vessel. Attempts to revive other sleepers await our success or failure with the casualty already beamed over. Doctor McCoy is frankly amazed at his physical and recuperative power.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to boarding party.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, any records, log books of any kind?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Negative, Captain. It appears they were in suspended animation when the ship took off.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How many alive?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Twelve units have malfunctioned, leaving seventy two still operating. Thirty of those are women.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. Seventy two alive. A group of people dating back to the 1990s. A discovery of some importance, Mister Spock. There are a great many unanswered questions about those years.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: A strange, violent period in your history. I find no record what so ever of an SS Botany Bay. Captain, the DY-100 class vessel was designed for interplanetary travel only. With simple nuclear-powered engines, star travel was considered impractical at that time. It was ten thousand to one against their making it to another star system. And why no record of the trip?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Botany Bay. That was the name of a penal colony on shores of Australia, wasn't it? If they took that name for their vessel

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you're suggesting this was a penal deportation vessel, you've arrived at a totally illogical conclusion.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Earth was on the verge of a dark ages. Whole populations were being bombed out of existence. A group of criminals could have been dealt with far more efficiently than wasting one of their most advanced spaceships.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. So much for my theory. I'm still waiting to hear yours.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even a theory requires some facts, Captain. So far I have none.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And that irritates you, Mister Spock.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Irritation?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not capable of that emotion.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My apologies, Mister Spock. You suspect some danger in them?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Insufficient facts always invites danger, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we'd better get some facts. Rig for towing.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spinelli
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make course for Starbase Twelve.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Context: At Khan's bedside

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: to nurse
Text: That'll be all. (she leaves)

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll live.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My compliments.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I'm good, but not that good. There's something inside this man that refuses to accept death. Look at that. Even as he is now, his heart valve action has twice the power of yours and mine. Lung efficiency is fifty percent better.

Title: Space Seed
Context: McGivers enters

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An improved breed of human. That's what the Eugenics War was all about.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd estimate he could lift us both with one arm. It will be interesting to see if his brain matches his body.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Doctor, will he live?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It appears he will, Lieutenant. (leaves)

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to talk to you.

Title: Space Seed
Context: They go out into the main area, where McCoy is at his desk

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I were to rate your performance as a member of the landing party today I

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I know, sir. I'm sorry.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, at any one time, the safety of this entire vessel might depend upon the performance of a single crewman, and the fact that you find a man strangely compelling to you personally

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Not personally, Captain. Professionally. My profession is historian, and when I find a specimen from the past alive, I'm in the sheer delight of examining his mind.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And men were more adventuresome then. Bolder, more colourful.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Yes, sir, I think they were.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. If I can have honesty, it's easier to overlook mistakes. That's all.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Context: She leaves

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A pity you wasted your life on command, Jim. You'd have made a fair psychologist.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fair? (leaves)

Title: Space Seed
Context: In the ward, Khan wakes, gets out of bed and does some stretches. He hears McCoy's voice.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to lab. Anything new on those bios?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Lab Tech
Text: They all came out fine, Doctor.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Good. McCoy out.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan sees a display of old medical instruments on the wall, takes a scalpel, and is back in bed when McCoy walks in to check on him. As the good doctor leans over, Khan grabs him by the throat and holds the blade to his neck.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, either choke me or cut my throat. Make up your mind.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: English. I thought I dreamed hearing it. Where am I?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're in (a squeeze makes him lower his voice) You're in bed, holding a knife at your doctor's throat.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Answer my question.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It would be most effective if you would cut the carotid artery, just under the left ear.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan releases him.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I like a brave man.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I was simply trying to avoid an argument. (takes the scalpel) You're aboard the United Spaceship Enterprise. Your vessel is in tow.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I remember a voice. Did I hear it say I had been sleeping for two centuries?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That is correct.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Where is your Captain? I have many questions.

Title: Space Seed
Context: McCoy goes to the intercom

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I have a patient here with many questions, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way.

Title: Space Seed
Context: A little later, and Khan is sitting up more

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: James Kirk, commanding the starship Enterprise.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I see.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And your name?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I have a few questions first. What is your heading?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our heading is Starbase Twelve, a planet in the Gamma 400 star system. Our command base in this sector. Is that of any use to you?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: And my people?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Seventy two of your life-support canisters are still functioning.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: You will revive them.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As soon as we reach Starbase Twelve.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I see.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And now

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Khan is my name.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Khan. Nothing else?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Khan.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was the exact date of your lift off? We know it was sometime in the early 1990s, but

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I find myself growing fatigued, Doctor. May we continue this questioning at some other time?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The facts I need, Mister Khan, will take very little time. For example, the nature of your expedition.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. A little later might be better.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Captain, I wonder if I could have something to read during my convalescence. I was once an engineer of sorts. I would be most interested in studying the technical manuals on your vessel.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I understand. You have two hundred years of catching up to do.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Precisely.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're available to any patient on the viewing screen. Doctor McCoy will show you how to tie into the library tapes.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Thank you, Captain. You are very co-operative.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This Khan is not what I expected of a twentieth century man.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: I note he's making considerable use of our technical library.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Common courtesy, Mister Spock. He'll spend the rest of his days in our time. It's only decent to help him catch up. Would you estimate him to be a product of selective breeding?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is that possibility, Captain. His age would be correct. In 1993, a group of these young supermen did seize power simultaneously in over forty nations.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, they were hardly supermen. They were aggressive, arrogant. They began to battle among themselves.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Because the scientists overlooked one fact. Superior ability breeds superior ambition.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting, if true. They created a group of Alexanders, Napoleons.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have collected some names and made some counts. By my estimate, there were some eighty or ninety of these young supermen unaccounted for when they were finally defeated.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That fact isn't in the history texts.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Would you reveal to war-weary populations that some eighty Napoleons might still be alive?

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan is lounging, showing off his chest and calves.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Ship's historian, Lieutenant

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Marla McGivers.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Yes.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I am told you participated in my rebirth.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: In a small way.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I've been reading up on starships, but they have one luxury not mentioned in the manuals.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: A beautiful woman. My name is Khan. Please sit and entertain me.

Title: Space Seed
Context: She perches on another bed

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I'd like some historical information about your ship, its purpose and

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: And why do you wear your hair in such an uncomplimentary fashion?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: It's comfortable.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: But it's not attractive. (He takes her to a mirror and loosens a couple of strands at the back.) There. Soft. Natural. Simple.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Mister Khan, I'm here on business.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: You find no pleasure here?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: My interest is scientific. Men of. That is, the world of the past. I'm sure you understand to actually talk to a man of your century

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: There. Simple, soft. Please remember.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Perhaps some other time, when you feel more like talking about the past.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I'm glad you came. Please do it again.

Title: Space Seed
Context: The dining table is laid out, and the senior staff are in dress uniform.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Very impressive. Are we expecting a fleet admiral for dinner?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant McGivers' idea to welcome Khan to our century. Just how strongly is she attracted to him?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, there aren't any regulations against romance, Jim.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My curiosity's official, not personal, Bones.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, he has a magnetism. Almost electric. You felt it. And it could over power McGivers with her preoccupation with the past.

Title: Space Seed
Context: A crewwoman shows Khan in.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Thank you. I hoped you might guide me to our dinner engagement. (sees a picture on the wall) Very good. Fine technique.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: It's a gladiator named Flavius. He once

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: And you've rearranged your hair for me. Excellent.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: All bold men from the past. Richard, Leif Ericson, Napoleon. A hobby of yours, such men?

Title: Space Seed
Context: He uncovers a work in progress - a man in a turban

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I am honoured. Thank you. But I caution you. Such men dare take what they want.

Title: Space Seed
Context: He kisses her, and she responds.

Title: Space Seed
Context: After dinner, as liqueurs are being served.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forgive my curiosity, Mister Khan, but my officers are anxious to know more about your extraordinary journey.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: And how you managed to keep it out of the history books.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Adventure, Captain. Adventure. There was little else left on Earth.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: There was the war to end tyranny. Many considered that a noble effort.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Tyranny, sir? Or an attempt to unify humanity?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unify, sir? Like a team of animals under one whip?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I know something of those years. Remember, it was a time of great dreams, of great aspiration.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Under dozens of petty dictatorships.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: One man would have ruled eventually. As Rome under Caesar. Think of its accomplishments.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then your sympathies were with

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: You are an excellent tactician, Captain. You let your second in command attack while you sit and watch for weakness.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a tendency to express ideas in military terms, Mister Khan. This is a social occasion.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: It has been said that social occasions are only warfare concealed. Many prefer it more honest, more open.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You fled. Why? Were you afraid?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I've never been afraid.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you left at the very time mankind needed courage.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: We offered the world order!

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Excellent. Excellent. But if you will excuse me, gentlemen and ladies, I grow fatigued again. With your permission, Captain, I will return to my quarters.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Kirk stands, and Khan leaves.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan is pacing when Marla enters.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I wanted to apologise. They had no right to treat you that way.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Quite understandable, since I'm something of a mystery to them.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: You're no mystery to me. I know exactly who you are.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Do you?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Leif Ericson, Richard the Lion Heart, Napoleon. I don't know if you're going to like living in our time.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Then I'll have to remold it to my liking.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Embraces her

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Please don't.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Pushes her away.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Go. Or stay. But do it because it is what you wish to do. Well?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I'll stay a little longer.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: How many minutes do you graciously offer?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I only meant

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: This grows tiresome. You must now ask to stay.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I'd like to stay. Please.

Title: Space Seed
Context: He takes her hand, then forces her down onto her knees.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Open your heart. Will you open your heart?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Yes.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I intend to take this ship. Do you agree?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Oh, please don't ask me

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I need your help.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: You won't harm anyone?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Now you question me?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: No.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Will you assist me?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Oh, please, Khan, don't ask me

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Leave me then. Go, I say.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: No. I promise. I'll do anything you ask.

Title: Space Seed
Context: A large picture of their guest in on a screen

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Name, Khan, as we know him today. (Spock changes the picture) Name, Khan Noonien Singh.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: From 1992 through 1996, absolute ruler of more than a quarter of your world. From Asia through the Middle East.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The last of the tyrants to be overthrown.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: I must confess, gentlemen. I've always held a sneaking admiration for this one.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was the best of the tyrants and the most dangerous. They were supermen, in a sense. Stronger, braver, certainly more ambitious, more daring.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, this romanticism about a ruthless dictator is

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, we humans have a streak of barbarism in us. Appalling, but there, nevertheless.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: There were no massacres under his rule.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: And as little freedom.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No wars until he was attacked.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you misunderstand us. We can be against him and admire him all at the same time.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Illogical.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Totally. This is the Captain. Put a twenty four hour security on Mister Khan's quarters, effective immediately.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan is seated at a plain table, dressed in a red Enterprise uniform shirt, when Kirk bursts in and sits opposite him.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I'm sorry, Captain. I was lost in thought. My door. Locked from outside, a guard posted.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Unusual treatment for Khan Noonien Singh.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Excellent. You identified me with your computer system, I imagine.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like those answers now. First, the purpose of your star flight.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: A new life, a chance to build a world. Other things I doubt you would understand.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Because I'm not a product of controlled genetics?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Captain, although your abilities intrigue me, you are quite honestly inferior. Mentally, physically. In fact, I am surprised how little improvement there has been in human evolution. Oh, there has been technical advancement, but, how little man himself has changed. Yes, it appears we will do well in your century, Captain. Do you have any other questions?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. They've all been answered.

Title: Space Seed
Context: He leaves, and the guard resumes his post. Khan summons his strength, wrenches the locked door open and knocks out his guard with a single blow.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Marla is holding a phaser on the transporter chief.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Move away.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan comes in and incapacitates him with pressure at the base of the skull. She beams him to the Botany Bay.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Freshly revived supermen and women are stretching their muscles when Khan greets them.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Otto. Joaquin. The trip is over. The battle begins again. Only this time it's not a world we win. It's a universe. Kati.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spinelli
Text: On course, sir. Warp factor two.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain. (he answers the intercom) Bridge.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Security
Text: Captain, Security here. Khan's escaped.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sound security alert.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security alert, Captain. Communication channels are down, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Kirk heads to the lift, but the doors do not open

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Turbo elevators inoperative. Jammed, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Kirk rushes to a panel on the far bulkhead and pushes buttons.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Atmospheric controls cut off.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Useless. They're on override in Engineering.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering. Scotty. This is the Bridge.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain!

Title: Space Seed
Context: He gets knocked out

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's going on down there?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: He's not able to answer you at the moment, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Your ship is mine. I have shut off the life-support system to your Bridge, and jammed up your exit routes. I am willing to negotiate.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Flood all decks with neural gas.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible. Intruder control systems inoperative. Mister Khan was very thorough in his study of our tech manuals.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Contact Starbase Twelve.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All channels are totally jammed, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Brilliant. Every contingency anticipated.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Your air should be getting quite thin by now.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Do you surrender the Bridge?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Academic, Captain. Refuse,

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: And every person on the Bridge will suffocate.

Title: Space Seed
Context: A little later, with everyone else unconscious, Kirk makes his last log entry.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Stardate 3142.8. They have my ship, discarding their own worthless vessel. Only moments of air left on the Bridge now. Commendations recommended for Lieutenant Uhura, Technicians First Class Thule and Harrison, Lieutenant Spinelli and, of course, Mister Spock. I take full responsibility. I take full (He passes out)

Title: Space Seed
Context: The senior staff are awake again, and listening to a speech at gunpoint.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Nothing ever changes, except man. Your technical accomplishments? Improve a mechanical device and you may double productivity. But improve man and you gain a thousand fold. I am such a man. Join me. I'll treat you well. I need your training to operate a vessel this complex.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: Where is Captain Kirk?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I see now I made one serious error. You are the Communications Officer? Engage the viewing screen, please.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Uhura doesn't move, so Joaquin drags her to the table, then hits her. As he raises his hand again, Marla intervenes.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: No!

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I should have realised that suffocating together on the Bridge would create heroic camaraderie among you. But it is quite a different thing to watch it happening to someone else. Engage the viewing screen. I'm sure you recognise your medical decompression chamber here, Doctor. And the meaning of that indicator. (It is dropping to 10Hg) Your Captain will die. If you join me, Mister Spock, I will save his life. My vessel was useless. I need you and yours to select a colony planet. One with a population willing to be led by us.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To be conquered by you. A starship would make that most simple, wouldn't it?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Each of you in turn will go in there. Die while the others watch.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Khan. There's no reason I must watch this, is there?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Context: Shakes his head) But I hoped you would be stronger. (She leaves
Text: If any one of you joins me, anyone! I'll let him live. It's so useless!

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Joachim
Text: We've lost the channel. How do I regain picture?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: It does not matter. The Captain is dead. Take Mister Spock next.

Title: Space Seed
Context: There is one young man standing guard by the chamber door.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Khan said to watch him very closely. He may decide to co-operate.

Title: Space Seed
Context: As he turns to look in the porthole, she injects him. He passes out and she repressurises the chamber, freeing Kirk.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: Captain, I saved your life. Now please don't kill him.

Title: Space Seed
Context: The outer Sickbay door opens, Kirk waits and then tackles Spock's guard. Spock neck-pinches him.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Surprised to see you, Captain, though pleased.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm a little pleased myself. Situation?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Khan is holding our staff in the briefing room. His men have control of the ship.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our only chance is the intruder control circuit. Although he's cut it off at the Bridge.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a relay junction down the corridor.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gas all decks but this one.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Armoury, this is Khan. Report. Rodriguez. Ling. McPherson. Anyone. Report status.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Gas starts coming out of the ventilation grill. Khan flees, Scott hits a guard and gives chase. Everyone else coughs.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Khan?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know. He got out just as the gas

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Anesthesia gas in all sections except Engineering. Someone just closed that line.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan is working controls and listening to the intercom messages.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, acknowledge. Unable to flood Engineering section. I suspect

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is Scott. Captain's headed for the Engineering section. I'll follow in case

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. We must retake the vessel while the anesthesia lasts. Meet me in the Armoury. I'm blowing it clear first. Spock out.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Kirk dashes into Engineering and straight into Khan, who easily disarms him then crushes the phaser. Then an alarm beeps.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: If I understood your manuals, that's an overload in progress. Your ship flares up like an exploding sun within minutes.

Title: Space Seed
Context: The two fight. Khan can throw Kirk around with little effort.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: I have five times your strength. You're no match for me.

Title: Space Seed
Context: But Kirk gets himself a weapon and clubs Khan into unconsciousness before stopping the overload and saving his ship.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. Stardate 3143.3. Control of the Enterprise has been regained. I wish my next decisions were no more difficult. Khan and his people. What a waste to put them in a reorientation centre. And what do I do about McGivers?

Title: Space Seed
Context: The senior staff are in dress uniform again.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Record tapes engaged and ready, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This hearing is now in session. Under the authority vested in me by Starfleet Command, I declare all charges and specifications in this matter have been dropped.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. Agreed you have the authority

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, our heading takes us near the Ceti Alpha star system.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite correct, Captain. Planet number five there is habitable, although a bit savage, somewhat inhospitable.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But no more than Australia's Botany Bay colony was at the beginning. Those men went on to tame a continent, Mister Khan. Can you tame a world?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: Have you ever read Milton, Captain?

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I understand. Lieutenant Marla McGivers. Given a choice of court martial or accompanying them there.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Context: gazing into her eyes
Text: It will be difficult. A struggle at first even to stay alive, to find food.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Marla
Text: I'll go with him, sir.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Khan
Text: A superior woman. I will take her. And I've gotten something else I wanted. A world to win, an empire to build.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This hearing is closed.

Title: Space Seed
Context: Khan and McGivers are escorted out.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's a shame for a good Scotsman to admit it, but I'm not up on Milton.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The statement Lucifer made when he fell into the pit. 'It is better to rule in hell than serve in heaven.'

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be interesting, Captain, to return to that world in a hundred years and to learn what crop has sprung from the seed you planted today.

Title: Space Seed
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock, it would indeed.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Painter
Text: Approaching Omicron Ceti Three, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standard orbit, Mister Painter.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Painter
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Lieutenant.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've been transmitting a contact signal every five minutes. All I get is dead air. Shall I continue?
