Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain transmission pattern until we've established orbit.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, there were one hundred and fifty men, women, and children in that colony. What are the chances of survivors?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Absolutely none, Captain. Berthold rays are such a recent discovery. We do not yet have full knowledge of their nature. It is known, however, that living animal tissue disintegrates under exposure. Sandoval's group could not have survived after three years.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you saying that those people built a future in a place knowing they might not survive?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am saying they knew there was a risk.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what about us? Can we afford to send people to the planet's surface?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: The breakdown of tissue does not develop immediately. We can risk a limited exposure.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Painter
Text: We've established orbit, sir, and I've pinpointed a settlement.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Painter. Mister Spock, equip a landing party of five to accompany me to the planet's surface. Include Doctor McCoy and a biologist. I'll want them in ten minutes.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: The group beam down into a farm, complete with wooden fence and a tarmacadamed paths. There are clap-board buildings and even a stable block.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Another dream that failed. There's nothing sadder. It took these people a year to make the trip from Earth. They came all that way and died.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Hardly that, sir. Welcome to Omicron Ceti Three. I'm Elias Sandoval.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3417.3. We thought our mission to Omicron Ceti Three would be an unhappy one. We had expected to find no survivors of the agricultural colony there. Apparently, our information was incorrect.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We haven't seen anyone outside our group for four years since we left Earth. We've been expecting someone for some time. Our subspace radio didn't work properly, and I'm afraid we didn't have anyone who could master its intricacies.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Actually, Mister Sandoval, we didn't come here because of your silent radio.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: It makes little difference, Captain. You're here. We're happy to see you. Come, let me show you our settlement.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: On pure speculation, just an educated guess, I'd say that man is alive.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, this planet is being bombarded by Berthold rays, as our reports indicated. At this intensity, we'll be safe for a week if necessary. But

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But these people shouldn't be alive.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Is it possible that they're not?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You shook hands with him, Jim. His flesh was warm. He's alive. There's no doubt about that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's also no question of the fact that Berthold rays are incontrovertibly deadly. There's no miracle connected with it, Doctor, you know that. No cures, no serums, no antidotes. If a man is exposed long enough, he dies.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, we're debating in a vacuum. Let's go get some answers.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Elias leads the way into a comfortable room with wooden furniture and gingham curtains.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: There are two other settlements, but we have forty five colonists here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was the reason for the dispersal?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We felt three groups would have better potential. If disease were to strike one group, the others would be less likely to be affected. You see, Omicron is an ideal agricultural planet. We determined not to suffer the fate of expeditions that went before us.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Elias.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Leila, come meet our guests. This is Leila Kalomi, our botanist. This is Captain Kirk, Doctor McCoy, Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Mister Spock and I have met before. It's been a long time.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sandoval, we do have a mission here. Examinations, tests.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: By all means, make them. I think you'll find our settlement an interesting one. Our philosophy is a simple one, that men should return to a less complicated life. We have few mechanical things here. No vehicles, no weapons. We have harmony here. Complete peace.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll try not to interfere with your work.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Make yourselves at home, gentlemen.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: What exactly are we looking for anyway, sir?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Whatever doesn't look right, whatever that is. When it comes to farms, I wouldn't know what looked right or wrong if it were two feet from me.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: You mean like that weird alien plant right next to you?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kelowitz
Context: opening up the barn door
Text: Hey.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What is it?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: No cows. This barn isn't even built for them, Just for storage.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Come to think of it, we haven't seen any animals. No horses, no pigs, not even a dog. Nothing.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: You've known the Vulcanian?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: On Earth, six years ago.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Did you love him?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: If I did, it was important only to myself.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: How did he feel?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Mister Spock's feelings were never expressed to me. It is said he has none to give.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Would you like him to stay with us now, to be as one of us?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: There is no choice, Elias. He will stay.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: In another part of the farmhouse, McCoy is conducting medical examinations.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That'll be all. Thank you very much.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: The man leaves, Kirk enters.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've examined nine men so far, varying in ages from twenty three to fifty nine. They're all in perfect condition. Text book responses. Heart, lungs, excellent. Co-ordination, excellent. Reflexes, excellent. If there are many more of them, I could throw away my shingle.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Communicator beeps

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain. There seems to be a total absence of life on the planet, with the exception of the colonists and various types of flora.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu had the same observation. Any explanations?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at the moment, sir. I am conducting various tests with the tricorder, but results are inconclusive.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. Continue investigations. Kirk out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No animals. That's peculiar.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, especially in view of the fact that the records for this expedition indicate that they did have some for breeding and food purposes. Apparently, none of them survived.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd like to see the medical records on the expedition.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I thought you might.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Hands over a computer disc

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Captain, I've been looking for you. You haven't seen our fields and crops. I'd like to show you and the Doctor what we've accomplished here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm afraid I'll have to bow out. I have to continue with these medical examinations. However, if I find everyone else's health to be as perfect as yours, I

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He promised to throw away his shingle.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: You'll find no weaklings here. Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: This is the reason, Captain. This soil will grow anything we plant in it. It's a perfect world. We have a moderate climate, moderate rains all year round. It gives us all we need. It is perfect.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Pardon me, Captain. Biology report ready, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: I have work to attend to myself, Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: He leaves them.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Lieutenant.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: I heard Sandoval saying they could grow anything here. That's true, sir. They've got a variety of crops in. Grains, potatoes, beans.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make your point.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Well, sir, for an agricultural colony, they have actually very little acreage planted. There's enough to sustain the colony, but very little more.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's like a jigsaw puzzle all one colour. No key to where the pieces fit in. Why?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Communicator beeps

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is McCoy, Jim. I think you'd better get back here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trouble?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, but I'd like you to see this for yourself.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sandoval's medical record, four years ago when the expedition left Earth. He registered scar tissue on his lungs from lobar pneumonia suffered when he was a child. No major operations, but there was an appendectomy. Received all required inoculations, et cetera.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's so strange about that?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing, but I examined that man no more than two hours ago. You know what his readings were? Perfect, perfect, and perfect. Just like everyone else I've examined here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Instrument malfunction?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. I thought of that and tested it on myself. It accurately recorded my lack of tonsils and those two broken ribs I had once. It did not record the scar tissue on Sandoval's lungs, but it did record a healthy appendix where one was supposedly removed.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock is scanning amongst the rows of dry-looking somethings.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing. Not even insects. Yet your plants grow, and you've survived exposure to Berthold rays.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: That can be explained.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please do.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Later.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have never understood the female capacity to avoid a direct answer to any question.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: And I never understood you. Until now. There was always a place in here where no one could come. There was only the face you allow people to see. Only one side you'd allow them to know.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would like to know how your people have managed to survive here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I missed you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logically, you should all be dead.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: If I tell you how we survived, will you try to understand how we feel about our life here? About each other?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Emotions are alien to me. I'm a scientist.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Someone else might believe that. Your shipmates, your Captain, but not me. Come.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sandoval, within the hour I've received orders from Starfleet Command to evacuate all personnel from this colony. Naturally, you'll inform your people to begin preparations. We will have accommodations for you aboard the Enterprise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: No.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not an arbitrary decision on my part. I have my orders.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Captain, it's entirely unnecessary. We're in no danger here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We've explained the Berthold rays to you and their effect. Can't you understand?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Doctor, how can I make you understand? Your own instruments have shown that we're all in perfect health. We've had no deaths here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about your animals?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We're vegetarians.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That doesn't answer my question, sir. Why did all your animals die?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Captain, you stress very unimportant matters. We will not leave.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: The grass is brown and dry, but the pink flowers are growing.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: It's not much further.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've not yet explained the nature of this thing.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Its basic properties and elements are not important. What is important is it gives life, peace, love.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: What you're describing was once known in the vernacular as a happiness pill. And you, as a scientist, should know that that's not possible.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Come. I was one of the first to find them. The spores.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spores?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: One of the pink flowers shoots things at him. Spock clutches his head and falls to the ground in pain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: No.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: It shouldn't hurt.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, I can't. Please, don't!

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Not like this. It didn't hurt us.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not like you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Suddenly the pain is gone.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Now. Now, you belong to all of us and we to you. There's no need to hide your inner face any longer. We understand.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I love you. I can love you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: They kiss.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. We have been ordered by Starfleet Command to evacuate the colony on Omicron Three. However, the colony leader, Elias Sandoval, has refused all co-operation and will not listen to any arguments.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sandoval.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Captain, your arguments are very valid, but they do not apply to us.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're being unreasonable.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Well, nevertheless. Excuse me.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse me. My orders are to remove all the colonists. That's exactly what I intend to do, with or without your help.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Narrator
Text: ELIAS; Without, I should think.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Would you like to use a butterfly net on him, Captain?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I think we'll use a

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we've checked out everything. It all seems normal, except for the absence of any animals.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have orders to evacuate all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Narrator
Text: I want landing parties to co-ordinate the colonists and prepare them for transport up to the ship. We'll need extra accommodations aboard. Where's Mister Spock and Mister DeSalle?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We haven't seen them since we began our check.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: DeSalle said he was going to examine some native plants he found. Did Spock call in at all?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, he didn't. (gets out communicator) Spock? See to the landing parties, would you, Mister Sulu.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock's communicator is beeping to itself while he is lying in Leila's lap, looking at the clouds. He has changed out of his uniform into an overall.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: That one looks like a dragon. You see the tail and the dorsal spines?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I've never seen a dragon.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have. On Berengaria Seven. But I've never stopped to look at clouds before. Or rainbows. You know, I can tell you exactly why one appears in the sky, but considering its beauty has always been out of the question.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Not here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: She picks up the communicator and it opens.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock!

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, what did you want?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, is that you?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain. What did you want?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are you?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't believe I want to tell you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I don't know what you think you're doing, but this is an order. Report back to me at the settlement in ten minutes. We're evacuating all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, I don't think so.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't think so, what?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't think so, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, report to me immediately.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: But the communicator drops to the ground during another kiss

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock? Acknowledge.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. The frequency is open, but he doesn't answer.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That didn't sound at all like Spock, Jim.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I thought you said you might like him if he mellowed a little.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I didn't say that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not exactly. He might be in trouble.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, take over the landing party detail and start getting those colonists aboard.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How will you find Spock?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The frequency is open. It'll act as a homing device. Contact DeSalle. Have him meet you here. Make sure the landing party work in teams of two. I don't want anybody left alone down here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: They find the communicator, and hear laughter. Spock is hanging upside down from a branch of a nearby tree.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. (clears throat) Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Items are being collected to be taken up to the ship. DeSalle has brought some of the pink plants.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are you doing with those things, DeSalle?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: I want you to take a close look at these, Doc. They're very interesting.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Are you out of your mind? You were told to report to me at once.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I didn't want to, Jim.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You? Yes, I can see that. Miss Kalomi, you'll have to come back to the settlement and prepare to transport up to the ship.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: There'll be no evacuation, Jim, but perhaps we should go back and get you straightened out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, Mister Spock is under arrest, and he's in your custody until we get back to the Enterprise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well. Come with me.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: He takes Leila's hand and leads the group to a clump of the plants, where they all get sprayed with spores.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu understands, don't you, Mister Sulu?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, I see now. Of course we can't remove the colony. It'd be wrong.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know what these plants are or how they work, but you're all going back to the settlement with me, and those colonists are going aboard the ship.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Kirk leaves them.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can see the Captain is going to be difficult.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: No equipment or colonists now, just plants going up to the ship.) MCCOY: (with an extreme southern drawl) Ready to beam up. Hiya, Jimmy boy! Hey, I've taken care of everything. All y'all gotta do is relax. Doctor's orders

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How many of those did you beam up?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, must be nigh onto a hundred by now.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Chief
Text: Hey, Doc, I'm ready to energise. Everything okay with those plants?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. Beam me up.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Chief
Text: Well, sure, if you want.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I most certainly do. Energise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, put me through to Admiral Komack at Starfleet.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, I'm sorry, Captain. I can't do that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean, you can't do that. Follow standard procedure. That's an order.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, I know it is, Captain, but you see, all communications are out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I short-circuited them, except ship to surface. We'll need that for a while. It's really for the best, Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: She leaves the Bridge. Kirk finds a plant and throws it angrily across the helm console before storming out himself.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: There's a long queue of crewmembers lounging against the wall outside the transporter room.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get back to your stations. Get back to your stations.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leslie
Text: I'm sorry, sir. We're all transporting down to join the colony.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said get back to your station.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leslie
Text: No, sir.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is mutiny, mister.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leslie
Text: Yes, sir. It is.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3417.5. The pod plants have spread spores throughout the ship, carried by the ventilation system. Under their influence, my crew is deserting to join the Omicron colony, and I can't stop them. I don't know why I have not been infected, nor can I get Doctor McCoy to explain the physical-psychological aspects of the infection.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not interested in any physical-psychological aspects, Jim boy. We all perfectly healthy down here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've heard that word a lot lately. Perfect. Everything's perfect.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah. That's right. That's just what it is.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll bet you've even grown your tonsils back.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sho'nuf. Hey, Jim boy, y'all ever have a real cold Georgia-style mint julep, huh?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look, Bones, I need your help. Can you run tests, blood samples, anything at all to give us a lead on what these things are, how to counteract them?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who wants to counteract paradise, Jim boy?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Bones.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock is pouring tea.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Almost the entire ship's complement has beamed down.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: I'm very pleased. The entire landing operation is proceeding quite well.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Kirk enters

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's McCoy?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: He went off to create something called a mint julep. That's a drink, Jim.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Captain, why don't you join us?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In your own private paradise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: The spores have made it that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where did they originate?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's impossible to say. They drifted through space until they finally landed here. You see, they actually thrive on Berthold rays. The plants act as a repository for thousands of microscopic spores until they find a human body to inhabit.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: In return, they give you complete health and peace of mind.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's paradise?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We have no need or want, Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's a true Eden, Jim. There's belonging and love.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No wants. No needs. We weren't meant for that. None of us. Man stagnates if he has no ambition, no desire to be more than he is.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We have what we need.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Except a challenge.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: You don't understand, Jim, but you'll come around sooner or later. Join us. Please.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm going back to the ship.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: All the panels are lit, the lights are on, but nobody is home except one.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering? Scotty? Biochemistry lab? Security? Is there anyone on board? This is the Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: He sits in his chair.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3417.7. Except for myself, all crew personnel have transported to the surface of the planet. Mutinied. Lieutenant Uhura has effectively sabotaged the communications station. I can only contact the surface of the planet. The ship can be maintained in orbit for several months, but even with automatic controls, I cannot pilot her alone. In effect, I am marooned here. I'm beginning to realise just how big this ship really is, how quiet. I don't know how to get my crew back, how to counteract the effect of the spores. I don't know what I can offer against paradise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: The plant that he had thrown earlier, now sprays him with spores.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise to Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Jim. What is it now?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've joined you. I understand now.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Wonderful, Jim. When will you beam down?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are some things in my quarters I want to pack.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good. Leila and I will meet you at the beam down point.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: He packs a suitcase with a smile on his face, then goes to the safe and gets out his medals. He loses the smile.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Kirk puts his suitcase on the transporter pad and goes over to the controls.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No! I can't leave! (he's very relieved) Emotions. Violent emotions. Needs. Anger. Captain's log, supplemental. I think I've discovered the answer, but to carry out my plan entails considerable risk. Mister Spock is much stronger than the ordinary human being. Aroused, his great physical strength could kill. But it's a risk I'll have to take.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise to Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's Jim.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: What's keeping you, Jim? We've been waiting.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've been packing some things, and I realise there's some equipment here that we should have down at the settlement.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know we can't come back on board once the last of us has left.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you want me to beam up a party?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I think you and I can handle it. Why don't you beam up now?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just a moment. It won't take long. Do you mind?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I'll wait.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready to beam up, Jim.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Context: with a large metal bar in his hand
Text: Energising.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock materialises.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, you mutinous, disloyal, computerised, half-breed, we'll see about you deserting my ship.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: The term half-breed is somewhat applicable, but computerised is inaccurate. A machine can be computerised, not a man.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What makes you think you're a man? You're an overgrown jackrabbit, an elf with a hyperactive thyroid.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, I don't understand.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course you don't understand. You don't have the brains to understand. All you have is printed circuits.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, if you'll excuse me.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What can you expect from a simpering, devil-eared freak whose father was a computer and his mother an encyclopedia?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: My mother was a teacher. My father an ambassador.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your father was a computer, like his son. An ambassador from a planet of traitors. A Vulcan never lived who had an ounce of integrity.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, please don't

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a traitor from a race of traitors. Disloyal to the core, rotten like the rest of your subhuman race, and you've got the gall to make love to that girl.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's enough.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does she know what she's getting, Spock? A carcass full of memory banks who should be squatting in a mushroom, instead of passing himself off as a man? You belong in a circus, Spock, not a starship. Right next to the dog-faced boy.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock bends the metal bar with one blow, and throws Kirk around the transporter room with ease. Fortunately, Kirk is able to dodge the blows that damage the walls and equipment until finally...

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Had enough? I didn't realise what it took to get under that thick hide of yours. Anyhow, I don't know what you're so mad about. It isn't every first officer who gets to belt his Captain several times.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: You did that to me deliberately.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Believe me, Mister Spock, it was painful in more ways than one.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: The spores. They're gone. I don't belong anymore.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said they were benevolent and peaceful. Violent emotions overwhelm them, destroy them. I had to make you angry enough to shake off their influence. That's the answer, Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: That may be correct, Captain, but trying to initiate a brawl with over five hundred crewmen and colonists is hardly logical.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had something else in mind. Can you put together a subsonic transmitter. Something we can hook into the communications station and broadcast over the communicator?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: It can be done.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Let's get to work.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Striking a fellow officer is a court martial offence.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if we're both in the Brig, who's going to build the subsonic transmitter?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is quite logical, Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well now, it's a little early to be counting stars, Miss Leila.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I'm waiting for Mister Spock and the Captain to transport down. They had some equipment to be moved. But it's been so long. I wish he'd come back.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, now, I think I can fix that for you. Enterprise?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Spock is back in uniform and under the console when it beeps.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise. Spock here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: This is Leila. I borrowed the doctor's communicator. I was worried something might have happened to you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: You are all right, aren't you?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Yes. I'm quite well.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Can I come aboard? I've never seen a starship before

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: and I want to talk to you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you still at the beam down point, and is the doctor there?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Yes to both questions.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Give your communicator back to Doctor McCoy. You won't need it to beam up. It'll take a few moments. Just wait there. Out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, Miss Kalomi is strictly your concern, but should you talk to her while she's still under the influence of the spores?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll be back shortly, Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Once she's materialised she rushes to put her arms around him, but he doesn't respond.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: You're no longer with us, are you? I felt something was wrong.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was necessary.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: Come back to the planet with me. You can belong again. Come back with me, please.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can't.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I love you. I said that six years ago, and I can't seem to stop repeating myself. On Earth, you couldn't give anything of yourself. You couldn't even put your arms around me. We couldn't have anything together there. We couldn't have anything together anyplace else. We're happy here. (crying) I can't lose you now, Mister Spock. I can't.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a responsibility to this ship, to that man on the Bridge. I am what I am, Leila, and if there are self-made purgatories, then we all have to live in them. Mine can be no worse than someone else's.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: I have lost you, haven't I? And not only you, I've lost all of it. The spores. I've lost them, too.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Captain discovered that strong emotions and needs destroy the spore influence.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Leila
Text: And this is for my good? Do you mind if I say I still love you? You never told me if you had another name, Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Context: wiping away her tears
Text: You couldn't pronounce it.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: They'll not hear this, of course. It'll be more a sensation of feeling it.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As though somebody had put itching powder on their skin.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. It should begin to work on their nerves in a few minutes.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: What do you think you're doing?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I said I was sorry.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Desalle
Text: More like you're clumsy.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Sulu
Text: If you hadn't gotten in my way

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: They fight with their spades.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Elsewhere around the settlement, fights are breaking out.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kelowitz
Text: Come on. Break it up. Break it up.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: McCoy is resting under a tree, with a tall glass of mint julep in his hand.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Well, Doctor, I've been thinking about what sort of work I could assign you to.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean, what sort of work? I'm a doctor.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Not any more, of course. We don't need you. Not as a doctor.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, no? Would you like to see how fast I can put you in a hospital?

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: I am the leader of this colony. I'll assign you whatever work I think suitable.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just a minute. You'd better make me a mechanic. Then I can treat little tin gods like you. (He punches Elias) Sorry, Sandoval. I don't know what made me do that.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: We've done nothing here. No accomplishments, no progress. Three years wasted. We wanted to make this planet a garden.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't stay here. You can't survive without the spores. After you've cleared at the Starbase, you could be relocated. It depends upon what you want.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: I think I'd, I think we'd like to get some work done. The work we started out to do.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Enterprise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise. Spock here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is McCoy. Sandoval would like to talk to the Captain.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just a moment. They're all beginning to call in, Captain. Rather contritely, I should say. Sandoval wishes to speak to you.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put him on the speaker. Kirk here.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Elias
Text: Oh, Captain, as I understood it, you were to transport us to Starbase Twenty Seven. We'll give you every co-operation.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Start making preparations, Mister Sandoval. We'll begin transporting your people aboard as soon as more of our crew checks in.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Context: Later, when everyone is back on duty.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Jim, I've just examined the last of the colonists, and they're all in absolutely perfect, perfect health. A fringe benefit left over by the spores.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's the second time man's been thrown out of paradise.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, Bones. This time we walked out on our own. Maybe we weren't meant for paradise. Maybe we were meant to fight our way through. Struggle, claw our way up, scratch for every inch of the way. Maybe we can't stroll to the music of the lute. We must march to the sound of drums.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: Poetry, Captain. Non-regulation.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We haven't heard much from you about Omicron Ceti Three, Mister Spock.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have little to say about it, Captain, except that for the first time in my life I was happy.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: A nervous man has his weapon drawn

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Sam
Text: Who's there?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Context: enters with a lot of men
Text: It's your relief, Sam. All quiet?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Sam
Text: Didn't see a thing, Chief.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Schmitter
Text: Nobody ever does. Whatever the thing is, it's already killed fifty people. I never realised before how dark it is down here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Stay on your toes, Schmitter. Keep your phaser in your hand at all times.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Schmitter
Text: What good will that do? You saw what happened to Ed Appel when he shot at it. How about those other people before the monster got them?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: I'm sorry, Schmitter. I know how you feel, but we've got to have guards.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Schmitter
Text: Okay, Chief. I'll do what I can.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Keep alert. If you hear anything or see anything, call in. Somebody can arrive in three minutes.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Schmitter
Text: A lot can happen in three minutes. Chief, is it true the Enterprise is on its way?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: It's coming.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Schmitter
Text: You think it could get here in the next four hours?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: You'll be all right.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The group leaves, and nervous Schmitter paces. Then we hear a scraping sound. He turns, looks and screams. Vanderberg and the others run back.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Come on.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: It's mere moments, but they're already too late.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Schmitter. Like the rest of them. Burned to a crisp.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3196.1. A distress call from the pergium production station on Janus Six has brought the Enterprise to that long-established colony. Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy, and I have beamed down to meet with Chief Engineer Vanderberg, administrative head of Janus Six.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, let's assume there is a monster. What has it done? When did it start?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: About three months ago, we opened up a new level. Sensors gave us an unusually rich pergium reading. Not only pergium, whatever you want. Uranium, sirium, platinum. The whole planet's like that. It's a treasure house.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we're aware of that. If mining conditions weren't so difficult, Janus Six could supply the mineral needs of a thousand planets. But what happened?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: First, the automatic machinery, piece by piece, started to almost disintegrate. Metal began dissolving away. There was no reason for it, and our chemists were unable to analyse the corrosive agent.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sure there is an answer. It simply has not yet been discovered.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Yes, it has. I don't know what this butchering monster is, but I know what it's doing. Our maintenance engineers sent down to the drifts to repair the corroded machinery. We found them seared to a crisp.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Volcanic activity?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no current volcanic activity on this planet, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: He's right. None. At first the deaths were down deep, but they've been moving up toward our levels. The last man died two days ago three levels below this.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Same way? Burned?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd like to examine the body.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: We kept it for you. There isn't much left. Roberts will show you. (McCoy and the guard leave) It isn't pretty.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you post sentries? Guards?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Of course. Five of them have died.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who else has seen this?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Context: entering
Text: I have.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: This is Ed Appel, chief processing engineer.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Describe it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: I can't. I only got a glimpse of it, but it's big and shaggy.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Ed shot it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh. You mean shot at it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: No. I mean shot it. With this. (a hand phaser)

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: A good, clean shot. Didn't even slow it down. Well, I've made my report to you. Production has stopped, nobody will go into the lower levels, and I don't blame them. If the Federation wants pergium, then you're going to have to do something about it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's why we're here, Mister Vanderberg.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: You're all pretty tough, aren't you? Starship, phaser banks. You can't get your starship down in the tunnels.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think we'll need to, Mister Appel. Mister Vanderberg, we'll need a complete subsurface chart of all the drifts, galleries and tunnels.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Mister Vanderberg, I'll need a complete subsurface chart of all the drifts, galleries, tunnels.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: You'll get it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Context: examining a large globe from Vanderberg's desk
Text: Mister Vanderberg, what is this?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: It's a silicon nodule. There are a millions of them are down there. No commercial value.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: But a geological oddity, to say the least. Pure silicon?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: A few trace elements. Look, we didn't call you here so you could collect rocks.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Vanderberg. We'll need your complete co-operation.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: You'll have it. Just find that creature, whatever it is. I've got a quota to meet. Come on, Appel.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: They leave, and McCoy comes back.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The vast number of tunnels won't make our hunting any easier. Doc?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Schmitter didn't burn to death, not in the usual sense, anyway.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, there are only fragments of bone and teeth left, but the plant's physician agrees with me. A chemical corrosion. Almost as if he'd been thrown into a vat of extremely corrosive acid.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Strong enough to eat machinery?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Strong enough to eat anything else that you can think of.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Context: at the mine map
Text: I've charted the positions of the deaths and acts of sabotage. Here, here, and here. If the times of these incidents are to be accepted as accurate, the creature would have to have moved at an incredible rate of speed.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Vanderberg, how recent are these charts?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Context: reentering
Text: They were made last year.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Before the appearance of whatever it is?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: That's right.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Mister Spock give us a report on life beneath the surface.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Within range of our sensors, there is no life, other than the accountable human residents of this colony beneath the surface. At least, no life as we know it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't cover tunnel by tunnel on foot. We must get production going again. We must have that pergium.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we could force another appearance of this creature

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: When that creature appears, men die.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: And as if to prove his point, the guard outside the power plant is killed. There's just a vaguely man-shaped stain on the ground and wisps of smoke lead us to a neat circular hole in the door he was guarding.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Too many tunnels. We couldn't possibly. Mister Spock, our sensors can pick up normal life functions at a considerable distance, but what about abnormal life functions?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Just then the lights flicker and an alarm sounds.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Something's happening in the reactor room!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Back to your stations. Look at that.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: He goes through the hole cut in the door.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wouldn't touch it, Captain. An extremely active corrosive. Traces may linger.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Kirk, quickly!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: They step through carefully.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: The main circulating pump for the entire reactor is gone.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: The same indication as shown at the door, Captain. A very strong corrosive.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there a replacement for that?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: No, none. It's outdated, but we never had any trouble with it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, on board?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing for a device this antiquated, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Without the pump mechanism, the reactor will go supercritical. It could poison half the planet. We can't shut it down. It provides heat and air and life support for the whole colony.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, we seem to have been given a choice. Death by asphyxiation or death by radiation poisoning.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: A PXK pergium reactor? No, sir. We don't have any spare circulating pump for a thing like that. I haven't seen a PXK in twenty years.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you rig one up? It's vital.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well sir, I can put together some odds and ends, but it won't hold for long.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Forty eight hours maybe, with a bit of luck.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forty eight hours is better than nothing. Gather what you need and beam down here with it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Bridge]

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Top priority.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll be right down. Scott out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: What happens when it breaks down?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hopefully we'll have found the missing part by then.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Hopefully. Small chance.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll have to, Chief. The alternative is to evacuate all you people up to the Enterprise. A dozen planets depend on you for pergium for their reactor. They're already screaming. Reactors closing down, life support systems

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: I'm concerned with my people right here, Kirk. They're being murdered. You find that monster and kill it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: The missing pump wasn't taken by accident. It was the one piece of equipment absolutely essential for the operation of the reactor.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you think the creature is trying to push the colonists off the planet?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem so.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But why now, Mister Spock? These production facilities have been in operation for over fifty years.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't know. But there is a possibility.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: He goes over to the silicon nodule on the desk.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Life as we know it is universally based on some combination of carbon compounds, but what if life exists based on another element? For instance, silicon.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're creating fantasies, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not necessarily, Bones. I've heard of the theoretical possibility of life based on silicon. A silicon-based life would be of an entirely different order. It's possible that our phasers might not affect it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Certainly not phaser one, which is far less powerful than phaser two.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, how about this? A creature that lives deep in the planet below us, at home in solid rock. It seems to me that in order to survive, it would have to have some form of natural armour plating.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could explain much, especially since the colonists are armed only with phaser one.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But our people have phaser number two.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which I could adjust to be more effective against silicon.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Silicon-based life is physiologically impossible, especially in an oxygen atmosphere.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It may be, Doctor, that the creature can exist for brief periods in such an atmosphere before returning to its own environment.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I still think you're imagining things.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may be right, Doctor, but at least it's something to go on. Mister Spock, have Lieutenant Commander Giotto assemble the security troops and arm them with phaser number two. You make the proper adjustments. You seem fascinated by this rock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain. You recall that Vanderberg commented there were thousands of these at a lower level, the level which the machinery opened just prior to the first appearance of the creature.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do they tie in?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speculate.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have already given Doctor McCoy sufficient cause for amusement. I'd prefer to cogitate the possibilities for a time.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A short time, Mister Spock. We have very little.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's it going, Scotty?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well sir, it's a plumber's nightmare, but it'll hold for a bit.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It has to hold longer than a bit.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sorry, sir. That's about the best I can do, but I guarantee it's not good enough.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Context: answers comm. beep
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the security officers have gathered in Chief Vanderberg's office.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right there. Kirk out. Scotty, ride herd on it. Kind words. Tender, loving care. Kiss it. Baby it. Flatter it if you have to, but keep it going.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll do what I can, sir.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Six red-shirted men are lined up.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You will proceed from level to level, checking out every foot, every opening. You are searching for some sort of creature which is highly resistant to phaser fire. Phasers will be set on maximum, and remember this. Fifty people have died. I want no more deaths.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Except the bloody thing.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The creature may or may not attack on sight. However, you must. It is vitally important we get this installation back into production.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Vanderberg, may I ask at which level you discovered the nodules of silicon?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: The twenty-third. Why?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Commander Giotto, take your detail. Go directly to the twenty-third level. Start your search there.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Aye, aye, sir. May I ask if you have reason to suspect this creature may be on that level?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's one of the possibilities we've discussed. (to Vanderberg) I want your people to stay on the top level, together at a safe place.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: I don't know any safe place, Captain, the way that thing comes and goes.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, gentlemen, you have your instructions. Let's get at it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The Starfleet people walk carefully along wonderfully smooth floors with just the occasional piece of equipment strewn around. Spock stops to use his tricorder on a section of the tunnel wall.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock? Find something?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Adjusting my tricorder to register for silicon, Captain. Interesting.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Traces?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: A life form, Captain. Bearing one hundred eleven degrees, elevation four degrees.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of our people?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. Silicon.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The security team have gradually split up to cover all the different tunnels. A young blond lad manages a scream before meeting his fate.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: He never even had a chance to fire, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's only been seconds since we heard him scream. The creature must still be around.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK What is it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: This tunnel. My readings indicate it was made within the hour. Moments ago, in fact.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you certain?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Positive.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This tunnel goes back as far as the eye can see. Our best machinery couldn't cut a tunnel like this, not even with phasers.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain. I'm quite at a loss.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Then they turn to see their adversary, and both fire their phasers at it. The shaggy creature shuffles off back into another of its nice circular tunnels and vanishes.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gone.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Disappeared. Astonishing that anything of that bulk could move so rapidly.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These walls are hot.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. This tunnel was cut within the last two minutes.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Giotto and another security man arrive.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: GIOTTO Are you all right, Captain?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, perfectly.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Did you see it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we saw it. Where does the tunnel go?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings indicate a maze of tunnels of this general category in that direction.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Did you shoot at it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. We took a bite out of it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Spock picks up the piece of 'armour' they had cut off the creature

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not animal tissue. What is it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: The closest approximation I could come to would be fibrous asbestos. A mineral, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then your guess was right.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem so. Silicon-based.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Summation.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are dealing with a silicon creature of the deep rocks, capable of moving through solid rock as easily as we move through the air.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That would account for the tunnels.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct. This creature's body secretes an extremely powerful corrosive.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Powerful enough to dissolve the door of the reactor chamber.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: And it explains the murdered men.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's definitely phaser resistant. We had our weapons set for silicon and on full power, yet we only damaged it. It still lives.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Narrator
Text: GIOTTO You mean it's impossible to kill?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, it might require amassed phasers.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or a single phaser with much longer contact.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander, pass this on to your men We knew it was a killer. Now it's wounded, probably in pain somewhere back there. There's nothing more dangerous than a wounded animal. Commander Giotto, instruct your men to concentrate the search in this sector. Remind them the creature is wounded.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: leaves

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Mister Spock?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've run a complete spherical check on all life forms, radius one hundred miles. I've located our men, all of them, and I've located one creature moving rapidly through native rock, bearing two hundred and one. And that is all.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One creature in a hundred miles?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. Captain, there are literally thousands of these tunnels in this general area alone, far too many to be cut by the one creature in an ordinary lifetime.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we're dealing with more than one creature, despite your tricorder readings, or we have a creature with an extremely long life span.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or it is the last of a race of creatures which made these tunnels. If so, if it is the only survivor of a dead race, to kill it would be a crime against science.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, our mission is to protect this colony, to get the pergium moving again. This is not a zoological expedition. Maintain a constant reading on the creature. If we have to, we'll use phasers to cut our own tunnels. We'll try to surround it. I'm sorry, Mister Spock, but I'm afraid the creature must die.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see no alternative myself, Captain. It merely seems a pity. The search team is gathering in the main tunnel.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Giotto now has seven red-shirts with him.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So it is wounded, and therefore twice as dangerous. Stay in pairs. If you see it, concentrate your phaser fire at what appears to be its head. Concentrate it. Maintain it. It is definitely resistant, but it can be hurt. And if it can be hurt, it can be killed. Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, if you'll examine your charts, please. I last located the creature in the area marked adit26 moving in bearing two zero one. This particular group will move out beyond that area in all directions in an effort to surround it, and possibly capture it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your orders are shoot to kill. Protect yourself at all times. Commander Giotto, disperse your search parties.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Louis, Vinci, take your men out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The red-shirts leave.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Capture it? I don't recall giving any such order.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: You did not, sir. I merely thought that if the opportunity arose

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will lose no more men. The creature will be killed on sight and that's the end of it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, sir.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. I want you to assist Scotty in maintaining that makeshift circulating pump.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: II beg your pardon, sir?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You heard me. It's vital that we keep that reactor in operation. Your scientific knowledge

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is not needed there, sir. Mister Scott has far more knowledge of nuclear reactors than I do. You're aware of that.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you are second in command. This will be a dangerous hunt. Either one of us by himself is expendable. Both of us are not.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there are approximately one hundred of us engaged in this search, against one creature. The odds against you and I both being killed are 2,228.7 to 1.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: 2,228.7 to 1? Those are pretty good odds, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: And they are of course accurate, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course. Well, I hate to use the word, but logically, with those kind of odds, you might as well stay. But please stay out of trouble, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is always my intention, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: A communicator beeps

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty here, Captain. My brilliant improvisation Just gave up the ghost. It couldn't stand the strain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you fix it again?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: Negative, Captain. It's gone for good.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Start immediate evacuation of all colonists to the Enterprise.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Not all of them, Captain. I and some of my key personnel are staying.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: We'll be down to join you.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We haven't enough phasers for you.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Then we'll use clubs. We're not being chased away from here. We're staying.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Get everybody else aboard the Enterprise. The fewer people we have breathing the air down here, the longer the rest of us will be able to hold out. How much longer, Scotty?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Scott
Text: The reactor will go super-critical in about ten hours, Sir. You have that long to find the mechanism.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll do our best. Start feeding us constant status reports, Scotty. Vanderberg, you and your crew assemble at level twenty three, checkpoint Tiger. Kirk out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Vanderberg, Appel and three others are there.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Team up with the Enterprise security personnel. They're better armed than you. Keep someone in sight at all times. Vanderberg, take two men. Go through that tunnel there. Rendezvous with Commander Giotto. Appel and the rest of the men, go through there and tie up with Lieutenant Osborne's detail. Mister Spock and I will control the operation from a central point. That's all.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The miners leave.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are being watched.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure? Intuition?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. We're being watched.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: They start to move through the tunnels

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Fresh readings within the hour in each of these tunnels.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The chart says both of these tunnels converge a few thousand yards further. You take the left. I'll take the right.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Should we separate?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Two tunnels, two of us. We separate.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Kirk walks off down a real tunnel, while Spock has to hunch down to move through one of the new circular tunnels. Further on, Kirk's tunnel becomes circular too, then it opens into an area with flat floor, equipment and silicon nodules.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've found a whole layer of these silicon nodules of yours, hundreds of them.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed? I find that most illuminating, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Be absolutely certain you do not damage any of them.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Only a theory I have.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: We see something move a roof support, and rocks fall near Kirk.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain? Are you all right? Jim? Jim!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock, I'm all right. We seem to have had a cave-in.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I could phaser you out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, no, you'd better not. Any disturbance might bring down the rest of the wall.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Besides, it isn't necessary. The chart said the tunnels meet further on.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, but I find it extremely disquieting that your roof chose that particular moment to collapse. Please proceed with extreme caution. I shall quicken my pace.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well, Mister Spock. I'll meet you at the other end.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Just then a part of the wall vanishes, and their strange adversary emerges. The pair have a stand off, with the creature approaching when Kirk lowers his phaser, and backing off when he raises it. The communicator beeps.) KIRK: Kirk here

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I just read some fresh signs.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: The creature is in this area. I'll take a lifeform reading.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not necessary, Mister Spock. I know exactly where the creature is.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Where, Captain?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ten feet away from me.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Kill it, Captain, quickly.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not making any threatening moves, Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: You don't dare take the chance, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Kill it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thought you were the one who wanted it kept alive, captured if possible.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, your life is in danger. You can't take the risk.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It seems to be waiting.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I remind you it's a proven killer. I'm on my way. Spock out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Context: sitting down
Text: Well, what do we do, just talk it over?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The creature turns to show it's wound from their last encounter.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, you can be hurt, can't you? We just sit here? It's your move.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Spock comes running in and takes aim

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no! Don't shoot. Come on over, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: He does so, and squats by the Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. It's made no moves against you?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. It seems to be waiting. I tried talking to it, but it didn't do any good.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
