Context: Spock points at a pile of silicon nodules.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, they're all through here, all over the place. Thousands of them.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I see.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does it means something to you?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly the answer, Captain, but I'm not certain. Captain, you are aware of the Vulcan technique of the joining of two minds.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You think you can get through to that thing?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's possible.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I know it's a terrible personal lowering of mental barriers but if there's a chance

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll try.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: He fastens his phaser to his belt and carefully approaches the worried creature. Without touching, he concentrates for a moment and then cries out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Pain! Pain! Pain! (he staggers back) That's all I got, Captain. Waves and waves of searing pain. It's in agony.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The creature climbs onto a rock ledge and etches letters into it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No kill I. What is that, a plea for us not to kill it, or a promise that it won't kill us?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't know, Captain. Evidently, it gained an immediate knowledge of us from its empathy with me. In my brief contact with the creature's mind, I discovered it is a highly intelligent, extremely sophisticated animal. In great pain, of course, because of its wound, but not reacting at all like a wounded creature. It calls itself a Horta.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A Horta. A Horta! Mister Spock, we need that retardation mechanism. You must re-establish communications with it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it has no reason to give us the device, and apparently every reason for wishing us off this planet.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm aware of that. If we could only win its confidence. Doctor McCoy, this is Captain Kirk.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Grab your medical kit and come down here on the double. I've got a patient for you.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is somebody injured? What happened?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind. Just come down to the twenty third level. You'll be led to us by tricorder readings. Kirk out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, I remind you that this is a silicon-based form of life. Doctor McCoy's medical knowledge will be totally useless.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's a healer, let him heal. Mister Spock, you must re-establish communications. I want to know why it suddenly took to murder.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: To obtain that kind of communication, Captain, it will be necessary to touch it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've seen how the creature destroys.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Kirk stands ready with his phaser as Spock carefully places his hands on the quivering Horta.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Commander Giotto.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Giotto here, Captain. Are you all right?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perfectly all right. Where are you?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: We're at the end of the tunnel. Mister Vanderberg and his men are here, and they're pretty ugly. Shall I let them through?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Under no circumstances allow them in here yet. The minute Doc McCoy gets there, send him through.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Murder. Of thousands. Devils! Eternity ends. The chamber of the ages. The altar of tomorrow! Murderers! Stop them. Kill! Strike back! Monsters!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: McCoy runs in

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What in the name of? What is Spock doing?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's wounded. Badly. You've got to help it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Help that?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go take a look.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: McCoy kneels by the wound and gets out his tricorder.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: The end of life. Murderers.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't be serious. That thing is virtually made out of stone!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help it. Treat it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm a doctor, not a bricklayer.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a healer. There's a patient. That's an order. Mister Spock. Tell it we're trying to help. The mechanism.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood. It is the end of life. Eternity stops. Go out into the tunnel. To the chamber of the ages. Cry for the children. Walk carefully in the vault of tomorrow. Sorrow for the murdered children. The thing you search for is there. Go. Go. Sadness. Sadness for the end of things. Go into the tunnel. There is a passageway. Quickly, quickly.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Kirk heads off down the tunnel the Horta came out of.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: The Captain said for you to wait here, and here is where you'll wait.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: That murdering monster's in there and we're going to kill it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Giotto
Text: You're going to stay here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: Kirk emerges into an area filled with silicon nodules, both whole and broken.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: into communicator
Text: That's right, Lieutenant. Just beam it down to me immediately, and never mind what I want it for. I just want it! Now move!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Context: channeling the Horta
Text: It is time to sleep. It is over. Failure. The murderers have won. Death is welcome. Let it end here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Mister Spock. Spock. Spock! Come out of it. I found the unit in there. It's in pretty good shape. I also found about a million of these silicon nodules. They're eggs, aren't they?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain, eggs and about to hatch.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The miners must have broken into the hatchery. Their operations destroyed thousands of them. No wonder.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: There. They're coming.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: He knocks out Giotto and the miners overpower the rest of the red-shirts, clubbing them viciously.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: All right! All right, let's go!

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Come on.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How are you doing, Doc?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll let you know.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Context: The miners come round the corner.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't fire. First man that fires is dead.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: That thing has killed fifty of my men.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've killed thousands of her children.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: What?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those round silicon nodules that you've been collecting and destroying? They're her eggs. Tell them, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: There have been many generations of Horta on this planet. Every fifty thousand years, the entire race dies, all but one, like this one, but the eggs live. She cares for them, protects them. And when they hatch, she is the mother to them, thousands of them. This creature here is the mother of her race.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Horta is intelligent, peaceful, mild. She had no objection to sharing this planet with you, till you broke into her nursery and started destroying her eggs. Then she fought back in the only way she knew how, as any mother would fight when her children are in danger.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: We didn't know. How could we? You mean if these eggs hatch, there'll be thousands of those things crawling around down here?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is where they live. They digest rock, they tunnel for nourishment.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: And they are the most inoffensive of creatures. They harbour ill will towards no one.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Appel
Text: Now look, we have pergium to deliver.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. Here's your circulating pump. You've complained this planet is a mineralogical treasure house if you had the equipment to get at it. Gentlemen, the Horta moves through rock the way we move through air, and it leaves tunnels. The greatest natural miners in the universe. It seems to me we could make an agreement, reach a modus vivendi. They tunnel. You collect and process, and your process operation would be a thousand times more profitable.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Sounds all right, if it will work.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Except for one thing. The Horta is badly wounded. It may die.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It won't die. By golly, Jim, I'm beginning to think I can cure a rainy day.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you help it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Help it? I cured it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I had the ship beam down a hundred pounds of that thermoconcrete. You know, the kind we use to build emergency shelters out of. It's mostly silicone. So I just trowelled it into the wound, and it'll act like a bandage until it heals. Take a look. It's as good as new.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Spock, I'm going to have to ask you to get in touch with the Horta again. Tell her our proposition. She and her children can do all the tunnelling they want. Our people will remove the minerals, and each side will leave the other alone. Think she'll go for it?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: It seems logical, Captain. The Horta has a very logical mind. And after close association with humans, I find that curiously refreshing.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ship ready to leave orbit, Captain. Course laid in.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good, Mister Spock.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chief Engineer Vanderberg standing by on channel one.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fine. Yes, Chief. Kirk here.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Just wanted to tell you the eggs have started to hatch, Captain.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: First thing the little devils do is start to tunnel.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: We've already hit huge new pergium deposits. I'm afraid to tell you how much gold and platinum and rare earths we've uncovered.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm delighted to hear that, Chief. Once Mother Horta tells her kids what to look for, you people are going to be embarrassingly rich.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: You know, the Horta aren't so bad once you're used to their appearance.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Vanderberg
Text: Well. that's about it, Kirk. Thanks for everything.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our pleasure, Chief. Kirk out.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Curious. What Chief Vanderberg said about the Horta is exactly what the Mother Horta said to me. She found humanoid appearance revolting, but she thought she could get used to it.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, she did, did she? Now tell me, did she happen to make any comment about those ears?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not specifically, but I did get the distinct impression she found them the most attractive human characteristic of all. I didn't have the heart to tell her that only I have

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She really liked those ears?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Horta is a remarkably intelligent and sensitive creature, with impeccable taste.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because she approved of you?

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Really, Captain, my modesty

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does not bear close examination, Mister Spock. I suspect you're becoming more and more human all the time.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I see no reason to stand here and be insulted.

Title: The Devil In The Dark
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead, warp factor two.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we've reached the designated position for scanning the coded directive tape.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. (puts it into a decoder) We both guessed right. Negotiations with the Klingon Empire are on the verge of breaking down. Starfleet Command anticipates a surprise attack. We are to proceed to Organia and take whatever steps are necessary to prevent the Klingons from using it as a base.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strategically sound. Organia is the only Class M planet in the disputed area, ideally located for use by either side.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Organia's description, Mister Spock.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Inhabited by humanoids. A very peaceful, friendly people living on a primitive level. Little of intrinsic value. Approximately Class D minus on Richter's scale of cultures.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Another Armenia, Belgium.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The weak innocents who always seem to be located on the natural invasion routes.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the automatic deflector screen just popped on. Body approaching.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Configuration, Mister Sulu.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Everyone is thrown about as the Enterprise is hit by multiple weapons fire.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser banks, lock on. Return fire. Maintain firing rate. One hundred percent dispersal pattern.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've hit him, Captain. He's hurt.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damage control, report to the first officer.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the other ship doesn't register. Only drifting debris. We got him.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands, maintain general alert. Hold battle stations. Damage report, Mister Spock.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Minor, Captain. We were most fortunate. Blast damage in decks ten and eleven, minor buckling in the antimatter pods, casualties very light.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain surveillance, Mister Sulu.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No contact, Captain. He blew up all right.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we've been anticipating an attack. I'd say what we've just experienced very nearly qualifies.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. It would seem to be an unfriendly act.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Automatic all-points relay from Starfleet Command, Captain, code one.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, there it is. War. We didn't want it, but we've got it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Curious how often you humans manage to obtain that which you do not want.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: War or not, we've still got a job to do. Denying Organia to the Klingons.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: With the outbreak of hostilities, that might not be easy.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lay in a course for Organia, Mister Sulu.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negotiating with the Organians will be time-consuming, Captain, and time is one thing we'll have the least of.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We won't get it by talking about it. The trigger's been pulled. We have to get there before the hammer falls. Ahead warp factor seven.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3198.4. We have reached Organia and established standard orbit. No signs of hostile activities in this area.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. Unit XY-75847 report a fleet of Klingon ships in their sector, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What bearing?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Unable to ascertain, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, have the phaser crews stand by their positions. Full power deflector screens.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock and I are going to the planet's surface. You will be in command. Your responsibility is to the Enterprise, not to us. Is that clear?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Perfectly, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Klingon fleet is in this quadrant. We know that Organia will be a target. If they should emerge

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We'll handle them, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You will evaluate the situation. If there is a fleet of them, you'll get out of here, Mister Sulu.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But, Captain

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No buts. You'll get to safety and alert the fleet. You will not attack alone. Mister Spock and I will be all right. Mister Spock, let's you and I pay the Organians a visit.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: They beam down in front of a vaguely castle-styled wall which is completely smooth. The locals are dressed in romanticised rural mediaeval-style clothing, and take no notice of them at all.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd think they had people beaming down every day.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Curious lack of interest. Notice the ruins in the distance, Captain. Quite large.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. A fortress, perhaps. A castle.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whatever it is, it would seem to be inconsistent with the reports we've been given on this culture.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: A man in a loose purple robe opens his arms wide.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Welcome.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reception committee?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem so.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: You are our visitors. Welcome, welcome. I am Ayelborne.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the United Federation of Planets. This is my first officer Mister Spock.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: You are most welcome, my friend.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I would like to speak to someone in authority.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We don't have anybody in authority, but I am the chairman of the Council of Elders. Perhaps I would do.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You people are in great danger. Is there someplace we can go and talk?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Oh, yes. Our council chambers are nearby. Please.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, if you don't mind, I should like to wander about the village and make some studies.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Of course, my friend. Our village is yours. Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Ayelborne and four other older men seat themselves at a simple wooden table. Beautifully polished, though.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, my government has informed me that the Klingons are expected to move against your planet with the objective of making it a base of operation against the Federation. My mission, frankly, is to keep them from doing it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: What you're saying, Captain, is that we seem to have a choice between dealing with you or your enemies.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, sir. With the Federation, you have a choice. You have none with the Klingons. The Klingons are a military dictatorship. War is their way of life. Life under the Klingon rule would be very unpleasant. We offer you protection.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: We thank you for your altruistic offer, Captain, but we really do not need your protection.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We are a simple people, Captain. We have nothing that anybody could want.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have this planet and its strategic location. I assure you that if you don't take action to prevent it, the Klingons will move against you as surely as your sun rises. We will help you build defences, build facilities.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We have no defences, Captain, nor are any needed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I have seen what the Klingons do to planets like yours. They are organised into vast slave labour camps. No freedoms whatsoever. Your goods will be confiscated. Hostages taken and killed, your leaders confined. You'd be far better off on a penal planet. Infinitely better off.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Captain, we see that your concern is genuine. We are moved. But again we assure you we are in absolutely no danger. If anybody is in danger, you are, and that concerns us greatly. It would be better if you returned to your ship as soon as possible.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You keep insisting there's no danger. I keep assuring you there is. Would you mind telling me

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: It is our way of life, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the first thing that would be lost! Excuse me, gentlemen. I'm a soldier, not a diplomat. I can only tell you the truth.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: If you will excuse us, Captain, we will discuss your kind offer.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certainly.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The doors open on their own and Spock enters. He and Kirk whisper in a corner.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, our information on these people and their culture was not correct. This is not a primitive society making progress toward mechanisation. They are totally stagnant. There is no evidence of any progress as far back as my tricorder can register.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That doesn't seem likely.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nevertheless, it is true. For tens of thousands of years, there has been absolutely no advancement, no significant change in their physical environment. This is a laboratory specimen of an arrested culture.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. That might be useful.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We have discussed your offer, Captain. Our opinion is unchanged. We are in no danger. We thank you for your kind offer of assistance, although we must decline it, and we strongly recommend that you leave Organia before you yourselves are endangered.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I must get you to reconsider. We can be of immense help to you. In addition to military aid, we can send you specialists, technicians. We can show you how to feed a thousand people where one was fed before. We can help you build schools, educate the young in the latest technological and scientific skills. Your public facilities are almost non-existent. We can help you remake your world, end disease, hunger, hardship. All we ask in return is that you let us help you. Now.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Captain, I can see that you do not understand us. Perhaps

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Context: answering communicator
Text: Excuse me, sir. Kirk here.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, a large number of Klingon vessels have just arrived.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They're opening fire.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Positive identification?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. My screens are up. I can't drop them to beam you aboard.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, follow your orders. Get out of here. Contact the fleet. Return if the odds are more equal. Kirk out. Gentlemen, you kept insisting that there was no danger

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: That is correct, Captain. There is no danger.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: Ayelborne, eight space vehicles have assumed orbit around our planet. They are activating their material transmission units.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Thank you, Trefayne.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you verify that?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain, but it seems a logical development.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Captain, since it is too late for you to escape, perhaps we should do something about protecting you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you had listened to me

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: We must be sure you are not harmed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: Ayelborne, several hundred men have appeared near the citadel. They bring many weapons.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does he know that?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Oh, our friend Trefayne is really quite intuitive. You can rest assured that what he says is absolutely correct.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So we're stranded here, in the middle of a Klingon occupation army.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: So it would seem. Not a very pleasant prospect.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a gift for understatement, Mister Spock. It's not a very pleasant prospect at all.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. stardate 3201.7. Mister Spock and I are trapped on the planet Organia, which is in the process of being occupied by the forces of the Klingon Empire. The Organians have provided us with native clothing in the hopes we may be taken for Organians.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, our phasers are gone.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you take them?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Yes, Captain. I took them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must ask you to return them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: I'm sorry, Captain. I cannot do that. Were you armed, you might be tempted to use violence, and that we cannot permit. You, Captain, will pass as an Organian, and Mister Spock. Mister Spock presents a problem. He doesn't look like an Organian.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: A Vulcan trader, perhaps. A dealer in kevas and trillium. Harmless to the Klingons.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They know that Vulcan is a member of the Federation.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan merchants are not uncommon, Captain. It is a practical approach.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the rest of you?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We shall continue as before. We have nothing to fear.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a lot to learn, sir. And if I know the Klingons, you'll be learning it the hard way.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The doors open on their own, and two Klingons march in, followed by their leader.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: This is the ruling council?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: I am Ayelborne, temporary head of the council. I bid you welcome.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: No doubt you do. I am Kor, military governor of Organia. (looking at Kirk) Who are you?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: He is Baroner, one of our leading citizens.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: And he has no tongue?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have a tongue.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Good. You will be taught how to use it. Where is your smile?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My what?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: The stupid, idiotic smile everyone else seems to be wearing. A Vulcan. Do you also have a tongue?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am Spock, a dealer in kevas and trillium.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kos
Text: You do not look like a storekeeper. Take this man. Vulcans are members of the Federation. He may be a spy.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's no spy.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Well, have we a ram among the sheep? Do you object to us taking him?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's done nothing. Nothing at all.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Coming from an Organian, yours is practically an act of rebellion. Very good. (to the Council) So you welcome me. (to Kirk) Do you also welcome me?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're here. There's nothing I can do about it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Good honest hatred. Very refreshing. However, it makes no difference whether you welcome me or not. I am here and will stay. You are now subjects of the Klingon Empire. You'll find there are many rules and regulations. They will be posted. Violation of the smallest of them will be punished by death.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We shall obey your regulations, Commander.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You disapprove, Baroner.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You need my approval?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: I need your obedience. Nothing more. Will I have it?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to be in command.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Yes. I am. I shall need a representative from among you. Liaison between the forces of the occupation and the civil population. Smile and smile. I don't trust men who smile too much. You, Baroner, you're the man.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Me? I don't want the job.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Have I asked whether or not you want it? We Klingons have a reputation for ruthlessness. You will find that it is deserved. Should one Klingon soldier be killed, a thousand Organians will die. I will have order. Is that clear?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Commander, I assure you our people want nothing but peace. We shall cause you no trouble.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: I'm sure you will not. Take the Vulcan to the examination room. (to Kirk) You, come with me. I will familiarise you with your new duties.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Mister Spock?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You are concerned?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He is my friend.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You have a poor choice of friends. He will be examined. If he is lying, he will die. If he is telling the truth, he will find that business has taken a turn for the worse. Take him. You do not like to be pushed. Very good. You may be a man I can deal with, Baroner. Come with me.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Probably up in the old castle.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: From this day on, no public assemblages of more than three people. All publications to be cleared through this office. Neighbourhood controls will be established, hostages selected. A somewhat lengthy list of crimes against the state.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Kor hands the proclamation to Kirk, who puts it down on the desk.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You do not like them? (Spock is brought in.) Well?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: He is what he claims to be, Commander, a Vulcanian merchant named Spock. His main concern seems to be how he would carry out his business under our occupation.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Nothing else?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: The usual. A certain amount of apprehension regarding us. The mind is remarkably disciplined.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You are sure?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: I used force four, which is sufficient to break down any pretence.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Very well, Lieutenant. Would you like to try our little truth finder?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: It's a mind-sifter or mind-ripper, depending on how much force is used. We can record every thought, every bit of knowledge in a man's mind. Of course, when that much force is used, the mind is emptied. Permanently, I'm afraid. What's left is more vegetable than human.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you're proud of it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: It is a tool, a weapon. Somewhat drastic, but very efficient.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure you're all right?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perfectly, Baroner. But it was an interesting experience.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: All right, Vulcan, you may go. But you are an enemy alien. You will be under our scrutiny at all times. If I have to warn you

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not necessary, Commander. I understand you very well.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: He leaves, followed by the guard.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Return to your council, Baroner. You will receive our official notifications as soon as they are published. In the meantime keep the people in order. It is your responsibility.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or I will be killed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: That is exactly right. You will be killed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That mindsifter can't be all the terror they think it is.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: It should not be underestimated, Captain. It reaches directly into the mind. We Vulcans have certain mental (a Klingon walks past) certain disciplines which enable me to maintain a shield. Without those disciplines, there would be no protection.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll try and avoid it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon 2
Text: Out of the way, Organian.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sorry, sir. We did not notice you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon 2
Text: Next time, keep your eyes open, or I'll shut them permanently.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I strongly suggest we direct our energies toward the immediate problem. Accomplishing our mission here.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You didn't really think I was going to beat his head in, did you?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I thought you might.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're right. But as you say, we still have a job to do.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll receive no help from the Organians.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe, but sooner or later they'll start resenting how the Klingons run things. If we could prove to them they could do something to strike back, to keep the Klingons off balance.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Verbal persuasion seems to be ineffective. Perhaps a more direct approach?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's exactly what I had in mind. Mister Spock Did I or did I not see something that looked like a munitions dump outside of Kor's headquarters?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: You did.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think it's time we did a little simple and plain communicating. Tonight.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very meritorious idea, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're short of tools.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm certain the Klingons will provide whatever is necessary. It's a pleasure doing business with you, Mister Spock.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Kirk jumps one Klingon and hauls his unconscious body away. Spock primes a grenade, presumably from the munitions dump.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Okay so far. Sonic grenade?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: With a delayed action fuse.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Good.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: These crates contain chemical explosives. They should make a most satisfactory display.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: He casually drops the grenade into a box, and they run.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Six, five, four three.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: There's a short but bright fireworks show.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were right, Mister Spock. A most satisfactory display.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course we blew it up. Deliberately.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: But that was violence.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We did it to show you that you can fight back. You don't have to be sheep, you can be wolves.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: Terrible to destroy.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: History is full of examples of civil populations fighting back successfully against a military dictatorship. We may not be able to destroy the Klingons, but we can tie them up. Blow up their installations, disrupt their communications, make Organia useless to them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our fleet will eventually arrive. In the meantime, the battle is ours. It can be a successful one.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Captain, I implore you never to do such a thing again.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Are you afraid of retribution? Does your personal freedom mean so little to you?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: How little you understand us, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All I understand is that you apparently don't have the backbone to fight and protect your loved ones.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Of course he had the Council Chamber bugged.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I speak of courage, gentlemen. Does courage mean so little to you?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Kor and his troops enter.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You speak of courage. Obviously you do not know the difference between courage and foolhardiness. Always it is the brave ones who die. The soldiers. I hope you will continue to savour the sweetness of your life. You disgust me.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: What are you going to do with him, Commander?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: What is always done with spies and saboteurs. He will be killed, after he has had first-hand experience of our mind scanner.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: There's no need to use your machine on him, commander. I can tell you his name. It is Captain James T. Kirk.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ayelborne!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: What? (A big grin spreads across his face) Captain of the USS Enterprise. A starship commander. And his first officer? I had hoped to meet you in battle, but

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: For some reason, he feels that he must destroy you, Commander, just as you feel you must destroy him.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: That's going to be rather difficult now. Isn't it, Captain? What an admirable people. Do you always betray your friends?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: I didn't want you to harm him. I'm sorry, Captain. It was for the best. No harm would come of it.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm used to the idea of dying, but I have no desire to die for the likes of you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: I don't blame you, Captain. Lock up the Vulcan. Take the Captain to my office. We'll have a talk before I do what must be done.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You'll have a drink with me, Captain?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, thank you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: I assure you it isn't drugged. With our mind-scanner, we have no need for such crude methods.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want from me?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Oh, a very great deal, but first I want to talk. Just talk.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You think I'm going to sit here and just talk with the enemy?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You'll talk. Either here, now, voluntarily, or under our mind-scanner. The fact is, Captain, I have a great admiration for your Starfleet. A remarkable instrument. and I must confess to a certain admiration for you. I know, of course, that it was you who destroyed our supplies last night.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something was destroyed? Nothing inconsequential, I hope.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Hardly. They were quite important to us, but they can be replaced. You of the Federation, you are much like us.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're nothing like you. We're a democratic body.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Come now. I'm not referring to minor ideological differences. I mean that we are similar as a species. Here we are on a planet of sheep. Two tigers, predators, hunters, killers, and it is precisely that which makes us great. And there is a universe to be taken.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a very large universe, Commander, full of people who don't like the Klingons.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Excellent. Then it shall be a matter of testing each other's wills. Of power. Survival must be earned, Captain. Tell me about the dispersal of your Starfleet.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: . Kirk
Text: Go climb a tree.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: I can get what I want through our mind-scanner, but there would be very little of your mind left, Captain. I have no desire to see you become a vegetable. This friend of yours, the Vulcan. He seems to have the ability to block our scanner. I think perhaps I will find out why. I will have him dissected. Your friend killed. You, a mental vegetable. Not a pleasant prospect, Captain, but it lies ahead for you unless you tell me everything I want to know. Twelve hours, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It will take a lot longer than that, Commander.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Longer than that I will not wait. I respect you, Captain, but this is war, a game we Klingons play to win. Take him to the cell with his friend. And watch him closely.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: It's a traditional mediaeval castle cell, big iron grills, straw on the floor, lit by ever-burning torches in sconces on the walls.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's no use, Jim. There's no way out.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Later.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much of the twelve hours do we have left?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Six hours, forty three minutes, if the Klingons are punctual.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think we can count on them being punctual. Blowing that munitions dump wasn't enough. If we get out of here, we've got to carry the attack directly to Kor. These Organians

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: They do not seem to understand. Most peculiar.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nevertheless, our orders still stand. We've got to make some attempt to neutralise the Klingon occupation.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: We may not get the chance, Captain. These walls are very thick.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And there are guards every few feet down the hall.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: There are sounds outside, then the door swings silently open on it's own. Spock and Kirk are ready to pounce on whoever enters.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Oh, there you are, gentlemen. I trust you are in good health? Shall we go?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Yes. Your captors plan to do violence to you. That we cannot permit. I came to take you away.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You turned us over to them. You expect us to trust you now?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Is there really a choice, Captain? I offer you safety.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't stay here. This is the first place they'll look.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: They will not come here, Captain. You may believe me.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: First you turn us in, then get us out. What are you doing now, waiting for the Klingons to post a reward so you can turn us in again and collect it?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: How little you understand us, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor do we understand what happened to the guard at the citadel.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Please do not concern yourself about them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to them?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Why, nothing happened to them, Captain. Nothing at all.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Commander!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Don't you see I'm busy?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: The two Federation prisoners. They're gone.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You mean they've escaped?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: I swear. No one was at fault. The guards, ten of them were constantly on duty watching the cell. Then when they opened it to give them food, they simply weren't there, and there was no way out.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: If you're lying to me.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: I swear!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: All right, Lieutenant. Implement Special Occupation Order Number Four. Immediately!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Sir!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that's all you can do, smile?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: You are free, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want to know how I'm free, and why.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, there are several questions I would like to ask as well.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This idiotic placidity of yours, your refusal to do anything to protect yourselves

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We have already answered that question. To us, violence is unthinkable.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Attention. Attention all Organians. Attention. This is Commander Kor. The two Federation prisoners have escaped, obviously with outside aid.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: They will be returned immediately. So that you will know we mean what we say, listen.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those are Klingon phasers. Take the door. Get down, gentlemen.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: In the courtyard of my headquarters,

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Two hundred Organians have just been killed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Two hundred of them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: In two hours, two hundred more will die, and two hundred more after that until the two Federation spies are turned over to us. This is the order of Kor.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you hear them?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Yes, of course, Captain. But nothing has changed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Spock. It seems it's up to you and me.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would appear so, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Federation has invested a great deal of money in our training. They're about due for a small return. We have two hours with which to do it in.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: But only two. More Organians will die.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No more will die on account of us, Mister Spock. Where are those phasers?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: I cannot tell you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've told us a great deal about how you hate violence. Unless you tell me where those phasers are, you're going to have more violence than you know what to do with.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: You mean you would actually use force?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's entirely up to you.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: Ayelborne, this is of no matter. Perhaps you'd better let him have what he wants. He

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Very well, but it will do you no good. They're in that cabinet.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Spock gets them, but leaves the tricorder.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I have no great love for you, your planet, your culture. Despite that, Mister Spock and I are going to go out there and quite probably die, in an attempt to show you that there are some things worth dying for.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: There are only two of you against an army. Don't you realise that what you intend to do will be hopeless?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Mister Spock, let's get out of here.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The doors open politely to let them leave, then close again behind them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: Brave men.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Yes, but so foolish.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: Interesting, however.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Of course, we cannot allow it. To stop them is very bad.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: It is necessary. They may harm one another.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Trefayne.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: They will wait until darkness.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: And then?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: Terrible. Inconceivable. Savage.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We will wait.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Outside, under cover of darkness and bushes.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, can we get those two guards? What would you say the odds on our getting out of here?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Difficult to be precise, Captain. I should say approximately 7,824.7 to 1.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Difficult to be precise? 7,824 to 1?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a pretty close approximation.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I endeavour to be accurate.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do quite well. Set your phaser on stun. We're after the top dog, not the members of the pack.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very good.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But if the situation calls for it, we kill, is that clear?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Clear, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll take the one on the left. Fire.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Two stunned Klingons fall, and Kirk and Spock run into the building.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Trefayne
Text: It has begun.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Very well.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: It will be hard.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Prepare yourselves.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: They close their eyes and concentrate.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: No results, Commander.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Nothing?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: I cannot understand these people.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: They know what death is, don't they?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: They do not seem to be worried about anything.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Bad enough to be a military governor, but to govern a population of sheep! Very well, Lieutenant, round up two hundred more.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Context: going into his office
Text: Fools! Will I have to kill them all?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The Klingons march off, and Kirk jumps one of them from a side corridor, getting his belt around the Lieutenant's neck.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't tell me what I want to know, I'll kill you here and now. Is that clear?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Yes.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is Kor's office down there?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Yes.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the hostages? Talk. Talk.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Klingon
Text: I am to gather two hundred more.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To be killed?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The Klingon nods.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Spock knocks the Klingon out with a neck pinch.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, what are the odds now?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Less than seven thousand to one, Captain. It's remarkable we've got this far.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Less than seven thousand to one. Well, getting better. Getting better.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just stay where you are, Commander.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You have done well to get this far through my guards.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Context: taking his weapon
Text: I believe you'll find that several of them are no longer in perfect operating condition.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: So, you are here. You will be interested in knowing that a Federation fleet is on its way here at the moment. Our fleet is preparing to meet them.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Checkmate, Commander.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Shall we wait and see the results before you kill me?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't intend to kill you unless I have to.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Sentimentality, mercy. The emotions of peace. Your weakness, Captain Kirk. The Klingon Empire shall win. Think of it, as we sit here, in space above us the destiny of the galaxy will be decided for the next ten thousand years. Can I offer you a drink? We can toast the victory of the Klingon fleet.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: You may be premature. There are many possibilities.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Today we conquer. If some day we are defeated, well, war has its fortunes good and bad. Do you know why we are so strong? Because we are a unit. Each of us is part of the greater whole, always under surveillance. Even a commander like myself, always under surveillance, Captain. If you will note.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cover, Spock! Back!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: The Klingons burst it, then suddenly everyone drops their weapons. Everyone.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Shoot! Shoot!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: They try hand to hand, but are unable to touch each other without extreme pain. Up on the Enterprise, the crew suddenly leap out of their seats and away from their consoles.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Spock?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Inexplicable, Captain. Extreme heat. Not only the weapons but the bodies as well.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Ayelborne and Claymare come in.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: We are terribly sorry to be forced to interfere, gentlemen, but we cannot permit you to harm yourselves.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: What are you talking about?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: We have put a stop to your violence.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are stopping this? You?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: All instruments of violence on this planet now radiate a temperature of three hundred and fifty degrees. They are inoperative.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: My fleet!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: The same conditions exist on both the star-fleets. There will be no battle.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Ridiculous!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: I suggest you contact them. You too, Captain. Your ship is now within range of your communications device.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't explain it. We were just closing in on the Klingon fleet when

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Every control on our ship became too hot to handle.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Then it all goes dark, and he can touch the consoles again

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Our power's gone. Our phaser banks are dead.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Sulu.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: My fleet, it's helpless.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: As I stand here, I also stand upon the home planet of the Klingon Empire, and the home planet of your Federation, Captain. I'm going to put a stop to this insane war.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You're what?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're talking nonsense.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: It is being done.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't just stop the fleet. What gives you the right?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You can't interfere. What happens in space is not your business.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Unless both sides agree to an immediate cessation of hostilities, all your armed forces, wherever they may be, will be immediately immobilised.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have legitimate grievances against the Klingons. They've invaded our territory, killed our citizens. They're openly aggressive. They've boasted that they'll take over half the galaxy.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Why not? We're the stronger! You've tried to hem us in, cut off vital supplies, strangle our trade! You've been asking for war!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the ones who issued the ultimatum to withdraw from the disputed areas!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: They are not disputed! They're clearly ours. And now you step in with some kind of trick.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: It is no trick, Commander. We have simply put an end to your war. All your military forces, wherever they are, are now completely paralysed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: We find interference in other people's affairs most disgusting, but you gentlemen have given us no choice.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You should be the first to be on our side. Two hundred hostages killed.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: No one has been killed, Captain.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: No one has died here in uncounted thousands of years.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: You are liars. You are meddling in things that are none of your business.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Even if you have some power that we don't understand, you have no right to dictate to our Federation

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Or our Empire!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How to handle their interstellar relations! We have the right

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: To wage war, Captain? To kill millions of innocent people? To destroy life on a planetary scale? Is that what you're defending?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, no one wants war. But there are proper channels. People have a right to handle their own affairs. Eventually, we will have

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Oh, eventually you will have peace, but only after millions of people have died. It is true that in the future, you and the Klingons will become fast friends. You will work together.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Never!

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Claymare
Text: Your emotions are most discordant. We do not wish to seem inhospitable, but gentlemen, you must leave.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Yes, please leave us. The mere presence of beings like yourselves is intensely painful to us.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean, beings like yourselves?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Ayelborne
Text: Millions of years ago, Captain, we were humanoid like yourselves, but we have developed beyond the need of physical bodies. That of us which you see is mere appearance for your sake.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: Captain, it's a trick. We can handle them. I have an army.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Context: Kirk holds him back as Ayelborne and Claymare transform into pulsating lights, too bright to look at. Then they disappear.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. Pure energy. Pure thought. Totally incorporeal. Not life as we know it at all.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what about this planet? The fields, the buildings, this citadel?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Conventionalisations, I should say. Useless to the Organians. Created so that visitors such as ourselves, could have conventional points of reference.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: But is all of this possible?

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have seen it with our own eyes. I should say the Organians are as far above us on the evolutionary scale as we are above the amoeba.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Commander, I guess that takes care of the war. Obviously, the Organians aren't going to let us fight.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kor
Text: A shame, Captain. It would have been glorious.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've been most restrained since we left Organia.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm embarrassed. I was furious with the Organians for stopping a war I didn't want. We think of ourselves as the most powerful beings in the universe. It's unsettling to discover that we're wrong.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it took millions of years for the Organians to evolve into what they are. Even the gods did not spring into being overnight. You and I have no reason to be embarrassed. We did, after all, beat the odds.

Title: Errand of Mercy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, no, no, no, Mister Spock, We didn't beat the odds. We didn't have a chance. The Organians raided the game.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Enterprise is at Red Alert as she orbits a muddy looking planet. Every so often the ship shakes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay on top of it, Mister Sulu.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're holding orbit, sir. The helm is sluggish.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Control circuits threatening to overload, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Understood, Engineer. Mister Spock? We can't avoid these areas of turbulence.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe we'll have them plotted in a few more orbits, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Sulu's console explodes and he is thrown to the floor, unconscious.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay. To the Bridge.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Switching to manual, Captain. Do we maintain this orbit?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is of great scientific importance, Captain. We're actually passing through ripples in time.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain orbit. Open the channel to Starfleet Command. Precautionary measure, Lieutenant. Broadcast to Starfleet Command my past week's log entries, starting with the unusual readings we had on the instruments and how they led us here. Inform Starfleet Command that apparently something or someone down on this planet

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy enters

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Context: pointing to Sulu
Text: Bones. Can effect changes in time, causing turbulent waves of space displacement.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Some heart flutter. Better risk a few drops of cordrazine.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tricky stuff. Are you sure you want to risk

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: The hypo is administered and Sulu opens his eyes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You were about to make a medical comment, Jim?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who, me, Doctor?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Context: at the helm
Text: We're guiding around most of the time ripples now.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: All plotted but one, Captain. Coming up on it now. Seems to be fairly heavy displacement.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: And they hit it just as McCoy still has the hypo in his hand, and the jolt results in him injecting it into his own stomach.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones! Get back to your positions.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: The hypo, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was set for cordrazine.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Empty.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Communications, emergency medical team.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: screams
Text: Killers! Assassins! I won't let you! I'll kill you first! I won't let you! You won't get me! Murderers! Killers!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: He dashes into the turbolift.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security alert.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental entry. Two drops of cordrazine can save a man's life. A hundred times that amount has just accidentally been pumped into Doctor McCoy's body. In a strange, wild frenzy, he has fled the ship's Bridge. All connecting decks have been placed on alert. We have no way of knowing if the madness is permanent or temporary, or in what direction it will drive McCoy.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy enters, knocks out the Chief very quickly and scientifically, then beams himself away.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue alert, decks four through eleven. The medical department knows as little as we do. In dosages approaching this, there's some record of wild paranoia.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Confirmed by the library record tapes, Captain. Subjects failed to recognise acquaintances, became hysterically convinced that they were in mortal danger, and were seeking escape at any cost. Extremely dangerous to himself or to anyone else who might

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Galloway
Text: Bridge, Security. Alert, alert!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge here. Go ahead.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Galloway
Text: Security 054, sir. We just found the transport chief injured.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Chief
Text: Captain, Doctor McCoy has beamed himself down to the planet.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: And the transporter at that time, Captain, was focused on the centre of the time disturbance.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So whatever's down there, McCoy is in the heart of it. Set up a landing party. Let's go get him. Kirk out.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: The landing party is Kirk, Spock, Scott, Uhura and two security guards. Among remains of fluted columns and fragments of Greek-style buildings is an irregular dough-nut shaped object with lights in it.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These ruins extend to the horizon. Begin recording.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Recording, sir.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: And of considerable age. On the order of ten thousand centuries old.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Detail, fan out. What is this thing, Mister Spock? It seems to be pulsating with power of some kind. Analysis, please.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unbelievable, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's funny.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: This single object is the source of all the time displacement.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can't. For this to do what it does is impossible by any science I understand. It is operating even now. Putting out waves and waves of time displacement, which we picked up millions of miles away.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Landing party to Enterprise. No sign of Doctor McCoy. Search progressing.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: And he pops up from behind a rock after she and her security guard have passed by.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Incredible power. It can't be a machine as we understand mechanics.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then what is it?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Context: The doughnut pulses bright in time with the words
Text: A question. Since before your sun burned hot in space and before your race was born, I have awaited a question.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: I am the Guardian of Forever.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you machine or being?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: I am both and neither. I am my own beginning, my own ending.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see no reason for answers to be couched in riddles.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: I answer as simply as your level of understanding makes possible.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: A time portal, Captain. A gateway to other times and dimensions, if I'm correct.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: As correct as possible for you. Your science knowledge is obviously primitive.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Really.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Annoyed, Spock?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: Behold. A gateway to your own past, if you wish.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: A camel train passing a pyramid, ancient Rome - images appear inside the doughnut.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Killers! Killers! I won't let you get me! I'll kill you first! I won't let you get me! Assassins! Murderers! Killers!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Scott and a guard manage to grab McCoy, and Spock neck-pinches him. An army of lancers charge across the doughnut.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock! If that is a doorway back through time, could we somehow take Bones back a day in time, then

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Relive the accident. This time be certain that the hypo accident is avoided. Look at the speed with which the centuries are passing, Captain. To step through on precisely the day we wish

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Guardian. Can you change the speed at which yesterday passes?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: I was made to offer the past in this manner. I cannot change.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: The US cavalry charges.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Strangely compelling, isn't it? To step through there and lose oneself in another world.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am a fool. My tricorder is capable of recording even at this speed. I've missed taping centuries of living history which no man before has ever

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: But McCoy has woken up, and dashes towards the Guardian.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor McCoy!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, no!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy leaps through the doughnut and the pictures stop. He's gone.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is he?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: He has passed into what was.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I've lost contact with the ship. I was talking to them. Suddenly, it went dead. No static, just nothing.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Nothing wrong with the communicator, sir.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: Your vessel, your beginning, all that you knew is gone.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy has somehow changed history.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: You mean we're stranded down here?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: With no past, no future.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm frightened.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth's not there. At least, not the Earth we know. We're totally alone.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, no stardate. For us, time does not exist. McCoy, back somewhere in the past, has effected a change in the course of time. All Earth history has been changed. There is no starship Enterprise. We have only one chance. We have asked the Guardian to show us Earth's history again. Spock and I will go back into time ourselves and attempt to set right what ever it was that McCoy changed.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was recording images at the time McCoy left. A rather barbaric period in your American history. I believe I can approximate just when to jump. Perhaps within a month of the correct time. A week, if we're fortunate.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make sure we arrive before McCoy got there. It's vital we stop him before he does whatever it was that changed all history. Guardian, if we are successful

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: Then you will be returned. It will be as though none of you had gone.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, it seems impossible. Even if you were able to find the right date

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then even finding McCoy would be a miracle.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no alternative.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, when you think you've waited long enough. Each of you will have to try it. Even if you fail, at least you'll be alive in some past world somewhere.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Seconds now, sir. Stand by.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: Good luck, gentlemen.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Happiness at least, sir.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: First World War images.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: And now.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They leap through a wall with a poster for boxing at Madison Square Gardens. Welcome to the Depression.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've seen old photographs of this period. An economic upheaval had occurred.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was called Depression, circa 1930. Quite barbaric.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
