Context: Two women give then curious looks, and Spock hides his ears with his hands.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We seem to be costumed a little out of step with the time.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm afraid I'm going to be difficult to explain in any case, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Spock, if we can't disguise you, we'll find some way of explaining you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: That should prove interesting.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They are nearly run down crossing the street.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Driver
Text: Look out, will you? Why don't you watch where you're going?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They head into an alley with washing hanging out on the fire escape.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Theft, Captain?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we'll steal from the rich and give back to the poor later. I think I'm going to like this century. Simple, easier to manage. We're not going to have any difficulty explaining

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Then he sees the policeman.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Policeman
Text: Well?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a police officer. I recognise the traditional accoutrements.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were saying you'll have no trouble explaining it.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My friend is obviously Chinese. I see you've noticed the ears. They're actually easy to explain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: A crowd is gathering.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps the unfortunate accident I had as a child.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The unfortunate accident he had as a child. He caught his head in a mechanical rice picker. But fortunately, there was an American missionary living close by who was actually a skilled plastic surgeon in civilian life.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Policeman
Text: All right, all right. Drop those bundles and put your hands on that wall there! Come on!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, how careless of your wife to let you go out that way.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Policeman
Text: What? Where?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh, yes, it's quite untidy. Here, let me help you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: And a quick neck pinch in front of witnesses, then they grab the clothes and run off. With whistles blowing, they duck down the alley beside the 21st Street Mission and down the stairs to the cellar.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were actually enjoying my predicament back there. At times, you seem quite human.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I hardly believe that insults are within your prerogative as my commanding officer.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sorry.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They get changed into jeans and shirts.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time we faced the unpleasant facts.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: First, I believe we have about a week before McCoy arrives, but we can't be certain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Arrives where? Honolulu, Boise, San Diego? Why not Outer Mongolia, for that matter?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is a theory. There could be some logic to the belief that time is fluid, like a river, with currents, eddies, backwash.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the same currents that swept McCoy to a certain time and place might sweep us there, too.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unless that is true, Captain, we have no hope. Frustrating. Locked in here is the place and moment of his arrival, even the images of what he did. If only I could tie this tricorder in with the ship's computers for just a few moments.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Couldn't you build some form of computer aid here?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: In this zinc-plated vacuum-tubed culture?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well, it would pose an extremely complex problem in logic, Mister Spock. Excuse me. I sometimes expect too much of you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: The lights come on.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Who's there?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Spock puts on a woolen hat that was conveniently amongst the clothes Kirk stole. A young woman wearing an apron comes down the stairs.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse us, miss. We didn't mean to trespass. It's cold outside.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: A lie is a poor way to say hello. It isn't that cold.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We were being chased by a policeman.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Why?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These clothes. We stole them. We didn't have any money.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Well, I could do with some help around here. Doing dishes, sweeping, general cleaning.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: At what rate of payment? I need radio tubes and so forth. My hobby.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Fifteen cents an hour for ten hours a day. What are your names?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mine is Jim Kirk. His is Spock.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I'm Edith Keeler. You can start by cleaning up down here.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse me, Miss. Where are we?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: You're in the 21st Street Mission.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you run this place?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Indeed I do, Mister Kirk.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: She leaves them.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Radio tubes and so on. I approve of hobbies, Mister Spock.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Kirk and Spock collect their bowls of soup and pieces of bread, and sit at one of the long tables.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Good evening.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: She steps up onto a small stage with a piano.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: You'll be sorry.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: You expect to eat for free or something? You got to listen to Goody Two-shoes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Now, as I'm sure somebody out there has said, it's time to pay for the soup.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: Not that she's a bad-looking broad, but if she really wanted to help out a fella in need

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shut up. Shut up. I want to hear what she has to say.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, of course, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Now, let's start by getting one thing straight. I'm not a do-gooder. If you're a bum, if you can't break off of the booze or whatever it is that makes you a bad risk, then get out. Now I don't pretend to tell you how to find happiness and love when every day is just a struggle to survive, but I do insist that you do survive because the days and the years ahead are worth living for. One day soon man is going to be able to harness incredible energies, maybe even the atom. Energies that could ultimately hurl us to other worlds in some sort of spaceship. And the men that reach out into space will be able to find ways to feed the hungry millions of the world and to cure their diseases. They will be able to find a way to give each man hope and a common future, and those are the days worth living for. Our deserts will bloom. (She continues under the dialogue.)

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Development of atomic power is years away, and space flight years after that.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Speculation. Gifted insight.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I find her most uncommon, Mister Spock.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Prepare for tomorrow. Get ready. Don't give up.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Later, when the bowls are being handed in, Edith calls after Kirk.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Mister Kirk. You are uncommon workmen. That basement looks like it's been scrubbed and polished.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we can report back for other work?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Yes. Seven o'clock in the morning. Do you have a flop for the night?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A what?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: You really are new at this, aren't you? A flop is a place to sleep.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: There's a vacant room at the place where I live for two dollars a week. If you want to I'll take you there.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Good.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: She goes to get her coat.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have a flop.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have a what, Captain?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A place to sleep.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: One might have said so in the first place.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: It must be some days later, because Spock has already built a 50's horror movie contraption, complete with static electricity running between two vertical wires. Kirk enters with groceries and turns the whining thing off.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I must have some platinum. A small block would be sufficient, five or six pounds. By passing certain circuits through there to be used as a duodynetic field core...

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I've brought you some assorted vegetables, baloney in a hard roll for myself, and I've spent the other nine tenths of our combined salaries for the last three days on filling this order for you. Mister Spock, this bag does not contain platinum, silver or gold, nor is it likely to in the near future.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you're asking me to work with equipment which hardly very far ahead of stone knives and bearskins.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy'll be along in a few days, perhaps sooner. There's no guarantee that these currents in time will bring us together. This has to work.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Captain, in three weeks at this rate, possibly a month, I might reach the first mnemonic memory circuits.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: There's a knock at the door.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your hat.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: If you can leave immediately, I can get you five hours work at twenty two cents an hour. What? What on Earth is that?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am endeavouring, ma'am, to construct a mnemonic memory circuit using stone knives and bearskins.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Kirk and Spock are sweeping the floor, with the chairs stacked on the tables, and two men repairing clocks.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Tools for finely detailed work.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Later, a combination padlock is being opened by someone with very sensitive ears.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Spock is stoking the boiler when Edith comes in to confront them.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: That toolbox was locked with a combination lock and you opened it like a real pro. Why did you do it?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I needed the fine tools for my radio work. They'd have been returned in the morning.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I'm sorry, I can't

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If Mister Spock says that he needs the tools and that they'll be returned tomorrow morning, you can bet your reputation on that, Miss Keeler.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: On one condition. Walk me home? I still have a few questions I'd like to ask about you two. Oh, and don't give me that questions about little old us? look. You know as well as I do how out of place you two are around here.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. Where would you estimate we belong, Miss Keeler?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: You? At his side, as if you've always been there and always will. And you? You belong in another place. I don't know where or how. I'll figure it out eventually.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll finish with the furnace.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Captain. Even when he doesn't say it, he does.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They are strolling along, hand in hand, as 'Goodnight, Sweetheart' carries in the air from a radio repair shop.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Why does Spock call you Captain? Were you in the war together?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We served together.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: And you don't want to talk about it? Why? Did you do something wrong? Are you afraid of something? Whatever it is, let me help.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me help. A hundred years or so from now, I believe, a famous novelist will write a classic using that theme. He'll recommend those three words even over I love you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Centuries from now? Who is he? Where does he come from er, where will he come from?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Silly question. Want to hear a silly answer?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Yes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A planet circling that far left star in Orion's belt. See?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Not that you can actually see any stars in the night sky above the Brooklyn Bridge.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Using the clock-mender's tools, Spock gets an image on his tricorder screen of a newspaper report. Edith Keeler, social worker from 21st Street Mission was killed today, it says. Kirk enters.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How are the stone knives and bearskins?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I may have found our focal point in time.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think you may also find you have a connection burning someplace.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I'm overloading those lines. I believe we'll have our answer on this screen, Captain.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: And, Captain, you may find this a bit distressing.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see what you have.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've slowed down the recording we made from the time vortex.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: February 23rd, 1936. Six years from now. (reading below the headline FDR confers with slum area 'angel') The President and Edith Keeler conferred for some time today

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Then the whole thing goes up in flames.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How bad?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bad enough.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The President and Edith Keeler.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem unlikely, Jim. A few moments ago, I read a 1930 newspaper article.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We know her future. Within six years from now, she'll become very important. Nationally famous.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or Captain, Edith Keeler will die this year. I saw her obituary. Some sort of traffic accident.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must be mistaken. They both can't be true.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Edith Keeler is the focal point in time we've been looking for, the point that both we and Doctor McCoy have been drawn to.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She has two possible futures then, and depending on whether she lives or dies, all of history will be changed. And McCoy

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is the random element.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In his condition, what does he do? Does he kill her?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Or perhaps he prevents her from being killed. We don't know which.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get this thing fixed. We must find out before McCoy arrives.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, suppose we discover that in order to set things straight again, Edith Keeler must die?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: The man from the canteen steals a milk bottle from a doorstep when McCoy leaps in through Singers Book Store window and starts shouting.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Assassins! Murderers! Murderers! Assassins! You! What planet is this? (he drops the bottle) No! Don't run! I won't kill you! It's they who do the killing! Don't run! I won't kill you!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Jim and Edith are climbing the stairs together.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Why? What is so funny about man reaching for the moon?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you know?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I just know, that's all. I feel it. And more, I think that one day they'll take all the money they spend now on war and death

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And make them spend it on life?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Yes. You see the same things that I do. We speak the same language.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The very same.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: They are outside room 33 when he leans in for the kiss.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy catches the down-and-out.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: No!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm glad you got away, too. Why do you think they want to kill us?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: Look, fella, you take a sip too much of that old wood alky, and, and almost anything seems like it

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where? Where are we? Earth? The constellations seem right, but. Explain! Explain this trick.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Man
Text: I, I,

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Biped. Small. Good cranial development. No doubt considerable human ancestry. Is that how you're able to fake all of this? Very good. Modern museum perfection. Right down to the cement beams. Very, very good. Oh, I'd give a lot to see the hospital. Probably needles and sutures. All the pain. They used to hand-cut and sew people like garments. Needles and sutures. Oh, the terrible pain!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: He passes out on the ground and his colour starts to improve. The man frisks him, finds his phaser and runs off a little way. Then he fiddles with the phaser, and disintegrates himself.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long before we get a full answer?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll need at least two more days before I dare make another attempt.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy could have been in the city a week now for all we know, and whatever he does that affects her and changes history could happen tonight or tomorrow morning.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, our last bit of information was obtained at the expense of thirty hours work in fused and burned circuits.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must know whether she lives or dies, Spock. I must know what to do.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: It's morning, apparently. Bums are still sleeping in shop doorways.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Crier
Text: Extra! Extra! Get your morning paper! Get your paper. Read all about it!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy spots men going into the Mission and follows them.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Edith is pouring cups of brown liquid.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, Miss. That coffee, it just smells wonderful.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: You look terrible! You'd better sit down. Come on.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't. I got to keep moving. I can't let them find me.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: There's a cot in the back room. They won't find you there. Come on.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: She helps him out just as Spock comes in and starts serving the drinks

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is how history went after McCoy changed it. Here, in the late 1930s. A growing pacifist movement whose influence delayed the United States' entry into the Second World War. While peace negotiations dragged on, Germany had time to complete its heavy-water experiments.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Germany. Fascism. Hitler. They won the Second World War.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Because all this lets them develop the A-bomb first. There's no mistake, Captain. Let me run it again. Edith Keeler. Founder of the peace movement.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But she was right. Peace was the way.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: She was right, but at the wrong time. With the A-bomb, and with their V2 rockets to carry them, Germany captured the world.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: And all this because McCoy came back and somehow kept her from dying in a street accident as she was meant to. We must stop him, Jim.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did she die? What day?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can estimate general happenings from these images, but I can't trace down precise actions at exact moments, Captain. I'm sorry.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I believe I'm in love with Edith Keeler.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, Edith Keeler must die.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy stirs, dislodging the moist towel from his forehead.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Hey, now, come on. You're not ready to take on any tigers just yet. Lie down.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The most common question to ask would be, where am I? I don't think I'll ask it.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Why not?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The only possible answer would conclusively prove that I'm either unconscious or demented. This looks like old Earth around 1920 or 25.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Would you care to try for 30?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I am unconscious, or demented.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I have a friend that talks about Earth the same way that you do. Would you like to meet him?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm a surgeon, not a psychiatrist. I am Leonard McCoy, Senior Medical Officer aboard the USS Enterprise.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I don't mean to disbelieve you, but that's hardly a Navy uniform.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's quite all right. It's quite all right dear, because I don't believe in you, either.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Get some rest.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Edith has just gone up a flight of stairs.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Edith.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Are you following me, sir?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With ulterior motives. Does that please you?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I hope it means (she stumbles on the step and Kirk catches her, while Spock watches.) Oh! How stupid! I've been up and down those stairs a thousand times. I could have broken my neck.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Spock goes back into room 21 as she kisses Jim, and re-emerges when Kirk comes down the stairs again.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I did not plan to eavesdrop.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, of course you didn't.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: I must point out that when she stumbled, she might have died right there, had you not caught her.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not yet time. McCoy isn't here.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're not that sure of our facts. Who's to say when the exact time will come? Save her, do as your heart tells you to do, and millions will die who did not die before.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy is out of bed.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come in.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Well, you look just fine, Doctor.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I thought you might like to see the evening paper.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, not particularly. You know, I've convinced myself that this is all in a cordrazine hallucination, but I've decided you're not.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: That's reassuring.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But if you're not, what are you?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: A friend. When you showed up here, you looked like you could use one.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't doubt it. What about this place? Do you run it?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: I try to.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: It's necessary.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it was for me, at least. You may have saved my life.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Lots of people drink from the wrong bottle sometimes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not as wrong as the bottle I drank from. Allow me to show my gratitude. Perhaps there's something I can do around here to thank you.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: We can talk about that later. I have to go. My young man is taking me to a Clark Gable movie.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A who movie?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: A Clark Gable. Don't you know?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I know what a movie is, but.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: That's very strange. You get some rest. I'll see you later.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Edith, Kirk and Spock leave the Mission together, then Spock heads off alone. Kirk and Edith dodge traffic to cross the street.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: If we hurry, maybe we can catch the Clark Gable movie at the Orpheum.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: You know, Doctor McCoy said the same thing.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy! Leonard McCoy?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Edith
Text: Yes. He's in the Mission. He's

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay right here. Spock! Stay right there!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is it?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy! He's in

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy comes out and they greet each other enthusiastically. A truck is coming down the street as Edith starts to cross, not looking.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Jim!

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Edith.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy dashes forward but Kirk grabs him and pulls him back onto the pavement just as Edith and the truck meet in in a squeal of brakes.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You deliberately stopped me, Jim. I could have saved her. Do you know what you just did?

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: He knows, Doctor. He knows.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: Kirk and Spock leap back out of the Guardian.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Scott
Text: What happened, sir? You only left a moment ago.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Context: McCoy returns.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Spock
Text: We were successful.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Guardian
Text: Time has resumed its shape. All is as it was before. Many such journeys are possible. Let me be your gateway.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the Enterprise is up there. They're asking if we want to beam up.

Title: The City on the Edge of Forever
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get the hell out of here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything, Lieutenant?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir. I've tried every major transmitting station on Deneva. None of them have acknowledged my contact signal.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try GSK-783, sub-space frequency 3.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: But sir, that's a call sign for a private transmitter.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm very well aware of that, Lieutenant. Try it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Evaluation, Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: As I speculated, Captain, the overall pattern of mass insanity destroying civilisations follows an almost straight line through this section of the galaxy. Over here the Beta Portilin system the ancient civilisations. Archaeologists have given us information indicating that they were the beginning. Two hundred years ago, Levinius Five was swept by mass insanity, then Theta Cygni Twelve. The last was Ingraham B, two years ago.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And next in line, Deneva. Bones, what's your theory about the cause of all this?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's no medical or scientific cause for what happened on those planets. Jim.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it follows a definite pattern, a systematic progression from planet to planet.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we're picking up a ship on our sensors, heading directly into the Denevan sun. He'll burn up.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot an interception course, Mister Sulu. Warp factor eight. Lieutenant Uhura, try to contact that ship.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ship is a one-man vessel of Denevan configuration, Captain. He does not seem to be out of control. His course is straight for the sun.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, tractor beams?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Out of range, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Making contact, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Denevan ship, this is the USS Enterprise. Can you reverse your course? Acknowledge.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we'll get too close to the sun.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep closing. Denevan ship, reverse your course. Do you hear me? Reverse your course. Acknowledge.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Outer hull temperature now four hundred and eighty degrees and rising.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's too close, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: So are we. Hull temperature one thousand degrees and rising. The sun's gravimetric pull increasing.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Pilot
Text: I did it. It's finally gone. I'm free. I'm

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He burned up, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse course. One hundred and eighty degrees about.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: All clear, Captain. Hull temperature falling, gravimetric pull approaching tolerance level.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. Reduce to sub-warp speed. Take us to Deneva.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That Denevan ship headed deliberately into the sun. Why?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's one possibility. The mass insanity may have reached this planet, too.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm having difficulty on that transmitter call to Deneva.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep trying.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, your brother Sam and his family, aren't they stationed on this planet?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log stardate 3287.2. The mass insanity we have tracked across this section of the galaxy seems to have already touched Deneva. That planet, colonised over a century ago, is one of the most beautiful in the galaxy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Planet development is normal, Captain. Originally colonised as a freighting-line base in this area.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, they make regular trips from here carrying supplies to the asteroid belt for the miners and bringing cargo out. I've made the run a couple of times myself as an engineering advisor.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: No Federation contacts for over a year.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. I've made contact with your private transmitter, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on audio.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: Please hurry. Help us. I don't have much time. They'll know. Please! Please help us

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aurelan, this is Jim on the Enterprise. Repeat your message.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Contact broken, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Re-establish.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sorry, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not interested in your excuses, Lieutenant. Re-establish contact with that transmitter.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm afraid that's impossible at the moment, Captain. They stopped broadcasting immediately. They do not acknowledge my contact signal.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep trying to raise them.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, did you know who that woman was?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. You were right a while back. My brother Sam lives on Deneva. He's a research biologist. That woman sounded like his wife Aurelan.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set your phasers on stun. We're going to beam directly into the capital city. Alert status. Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura has had no further response to our signals. Sensors report the expected number of humans on the planet surface. However, they are strangely quiet. Very little activity.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll want a complete transcript of everything that happens down there, Yeoman.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Zahra
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go. Energise.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Kirk, Spock, McCoy, Scott, the Yeoman and two security guards beam into an open area with grass, formal ponds and sculpture in front of a concrete and glass-fronted building.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are almost a million inhabitants of Deneva. There's more than one hundred thousand in this city alone. Where is everyone?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're here, Captain. In the buildings. Strangely quiescent.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My brother's lab is over there. They signalled us once. There should be someone there. Let's find out what's happening.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, several people approaching.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Men
Text: Go back! Get away! We don't want to hurt you! Go back! Get out of here. Go on, get away! Go away! Get out of here! We don't want to hurt you.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by to fire. Fire.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: The four attacking men are stunned.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you hear what they said, Mister Spock?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. They seemed most concerned for our safety.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They tried to brain us with these clubs. Check them out, Bones.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their attitude was inconsistent with their actions.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To say the least.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's something wrong, Jim. Their nervous systems. Unconscious like this, there should be just routine autonomic activity, but I'm getting a very high reading, as though even in their unconscious state, they're being violently stimulated.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: A woman's scream cuts the air.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fan out. Follow me. Security.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: A woman is trying to cover the air vents. A man and a boy are lying on the floor.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: They're here! They're here! Please keep them away!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Context: bearhugging her
Text: Aurelan.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: They're here! They're here!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. (McCoy sedates her) Aurelan, you're safe now.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is this your brother, Jim?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sam. It is my brother. Was my brother.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Jim. The boy's unconscious, but he's still alive.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Peter?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd better get the boy and his mother back to the ship. I can't do much for them down here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get ready to beam up.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Enterprise. Prepare to beam up party of four.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I understand how you must

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Yes, Mister Spock. You heard my sister-in-law say something about they being here. Your guess.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Notice the ventilator, Captain. Apparently they were trying to keep something outside from getting in. Obviously they were not entirely successful.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It doesn't make sense. There are no harmful life forms reported. Our sensors didn't pick up anything that didn't belong here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is correct. I am at a loss to understand it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ready to beam up, Captain. I'd like you to be onboard when your sister-in-law regains consciousness.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take charge of the landing party, Mister Spock. I want some answers to all this.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I won't be able to give you the exact cause until I get the plates back from the lab. They're both in extreme pain. I sedated them heavily. But your sister-in-law seems to have a high tolerance. The tranquilliser hasn't affected her much.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can she talk?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aurelan? Aurelan, it's Jim.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: Jim? Sam, he's

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's dead. But your son's still alive. You've got to help us.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: You are here. It is you, Jim.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm here. You have to tell us what happened, Aurelan, to you and the others.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: They came eight months ago.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: Things. Horrible things! Visitors brought them in their vessel from a planet. Ingraham B.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What kind of things?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: Not the ship's crew's fault. The things made them bring their ship here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aurelan, it's important that you tell us. What kind of things?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: Not their fault.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: She starts screaming and crying again, so McCoy gives her another shot.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: When she answers questions, any questions, it's as if she's fighting to get the answers out. As though something is exerting pain to stop her.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Aurelan
Text: They use it to control us. They're spreading, Jim. They need us to be their arms and legs. They're forcing us to build ships for them. Don't let them! Don't let them go any further!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: One last scream and convulsion, then all her readings plummet to zero. KIRK: My brother's son

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll do everything I can, Jim, to save him.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: The streets are extraordinarily quiet, Captain. We've seen no other Denevans, and the ones we stunned earlier were gone when we came out.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've seen some kind of creature? Any alien form?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: None, sir. Just that noise we heard.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: A peculiar buzzing sound. We were about to investigate it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Let's go find out what it is. Set your phasers on force three, to kill. We're looking for some kind of creature, and we already know it will kill.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They go down some steps into a shady courtyard where the noise is coming from. There are gelatinous-looking creatures attached to the shady side of a lintel.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: One detaches and flies around them.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Form a ring. Fire!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: After a prolonged burst, one falls to the ground and the others fly off.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Incredible. Not only should it have been destroyed by our phasers, it does not even register on my tricorder.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Zahra
Text: Captain, it doesn't even look real.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not life as we know or understand it. Yet t is obviously alive, it exists.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And it can bear up under full phaser power.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I suggest we risk taking it aboard.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's too close in here. It may be a trap in here. Let's move out.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: As they head up the stairs, the felled creature revives and lands on Spock's back. He falls back in pain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock! Spock! (He pulls it off) It's gone. Can you stand? Spock, are you all right?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log supplemental. Whatever the creatures are, they have apparently taken over all the inhabitants of Deneva. Meanwhile, ship's surgeon Doctor McCoy is examining a strange puncture wound left by one of the creatures on Mister Spock's back.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse. That's the second time he's come out of it. Either he's fighting us, or something inside of him is fighting us.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, the readings have never looked like that before, not even on Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let's prepare to close. Nurse!

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, that's not all you're going to do?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Miss Chapel.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, there is more of it in him, entwined all through his body.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Miss Chapel, if you cannot assist me as required, call another nurse in here. But do one or the other now.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: McCoy enters in his surgical scrubs, carrying a jar.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is he?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To be very frank, Jim, I don't know that I can do anything for Spock or your nephew. (hold up the jar) They're pieces of some form of living tissue. I removed one from Spock's spinal cord, the other from your sister-in-law's body. They're both the same. The boy's too weak to touch. Besides, removal of the tissue wouldn't stop the pain anyhow as far as I can tell.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you operate on Spock in time?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. I just removed these for examination. His body's full of these tentacles, entwining and growing all about his nervous system.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My nephew?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The same. Evidently, when the creature attacks, it leaves a stinger much like a bee or wasp, leaving one of these in the victim's body. It takes over the victim very rapidly, and the entwining is far, far too involved for conventional surgery to remove.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Recommendations?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Jim. The lab, the science departments, we're all stumped.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: No! No! (he sits up)

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Context: hoarsely
Text: No, I won't.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock leaves

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Bridge, this is Sickbay. Tell Doctor McCoy Mister Spock just left here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: He's delirious and possibly dangerous.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All decks, security alert. Locate and restrain Mister Spock. He may be dangerous. Use phasers on stun if necessary.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock enters the Bridge and throws Sulu out of his seat.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I must take the ship.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Three of them wrestle him to the floor as Chapel enters and hands a hypo to McCoy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Down! I must take it down.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: McCoy sedates him.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get him back to the Sickbay. Use security restraints.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The K3 indicator registers the level of pain. Watch as I turn it on. That's what he's been going through. I've never seen anything like it. No wonder the poor devils go mad.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy. Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: These restraints will no longer be necessary. Nor will your sedatives, Doctor. I'll be able to return to duty. I apologise for my weakness earlier when I tried to take control of the ship. I simply did not understand.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Narrator
Text: What is there to understand, Mister Spock?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am a Vulcan, Doctor. Pain is a thing of the mind. The mind can be controlled.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're only half-Vulcan. What about the human half of you?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is proving to be an inconvenience, but it is manageable. And the creature, with all of its thousands of parts, even now is pressuring me. (the pain indicator hits the top of the monitor) It wants this ship, but I am resisting.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can he control it the way he says, Bones?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who knows, Jim? I know the amount of pain the creature can inflict upon him, but whether he can control it hour to hour

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have my own will, Captain. Let me help.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I need you, Spock, but we can't take any chances. We'll keep you confined for a while longer. If you can maintain control, we'll see. My nephew. If he regains consciousness, will he go through that?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help them. I don't care what it takes or costs. You've got to help them.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, aren't you forgetting something? There are over a million colonists on that planet down there, just as much your responsibility. They need your help, too.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They leave.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am a Vulcan. I am a Vulcan. There is no pain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Then he breaks his restraints.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, I thought you were still confined to Sickbay.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Here, now. Where do you think you're going?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have an errand on the planet's surface. You will beam me down to the same co-ordinates as before.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not likely, Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is an order, Mister Scott.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir, and I'm sorry I have to disobey it. The Captain said no one was to transport down. Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock pushes Scott aside and neck-pinches his assistant. But Scott has a phaser in his hand when he gets up again.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Freeze right there, Mister Spock, or I'll put you to sleep for sure. This is Mister Scott in the transporter room. Get me the Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Soon after, Kirk enters with an entourage, and the other man is rubbing his shoulder.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I gave you an order to stay in the Sickbay.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Until the pain was gone, Captain. It has been discontinued by me.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: He said he was transporting down to the surface, sir. Your orders were that no one was to beam down unless you authorised it. And knowing Mister Spock's determination on some things, I thought I'd better hold him here until I got your orders.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: One of the creatures will have to be captured and analysed, Captain. We did not have a clear opportunity to do so earlier when I was attacked. Since my nervous system is already affected, as you pointed out, Doctor, I don't believe they can do much more to me.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, this is ridiculous. I don't want my patients running around. He should be in bed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am in complete control of myself, Doctor. The fact that I am here proves that I do not belong in bed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, your logic, as usual, is inescapable. Beam him down. Stay in constant touch with us. Give him your phaser. He'll need that, too.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, that man is sick. Don't give me any damnable logic about him being the only man for the job.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't have to, Bones. We both know he is.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: A man tries to attack Spock, but is neck-pinched. After struggling to regain his self-control, Spock returns to the courtyard of the gel-creatures. He phasers one off the lintel and puts it into a metal box.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Kirk and McCoy enter.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come in, gentlemen. I believe you'll find this interesting. (McCoy scans Spock.) Doctor, your medical skill and curiosity are quite admirable, but I assure you I'm all right.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You may be controlling the pain, Mister Spock, but you're far from all right.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unimportant at the moment, Doctor. Please observe. Interesting, gentlemen. A one-celled creature resembling, more than anything else, a huge, individual brain cell.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. That would answer a lot of questions.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you understand what I'm suggesting, Captain?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think so. This may be one cell in a larger organism. An incredibly huge organism, in fact.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: And although it is not physically connected to the other cells, it is nevertheless part of the whole creature, guided by the whole, drawing its strength from the whole, which probably accounts for its unusual resistance to our phaser weapons.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Existing so differently from any living matter or energy as we know it, that it may have come here, planet by planet, from an entirely different galaxy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: From a place where our physical laws do not apply. We may therefore find it difficult to destroy, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not impossible, Mister Spock. The Denevan that flew into the sun cried out that he was free, that he'd won. That's the angle to work on, gentlemen. I want an analysis of all this from Medical and Life Science departments within the hour.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Kirk leaves, then McCoy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Later, Chapel is working with McCoy when Kirk enters.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Captain. I've tried everything I can. Variant radiation, intense heat, even as great as nine thousand degrees.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you're wasting your time. There has to be something that'll kill the creature without destroying the human host.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Which happens to be my point. The thing won't die, even at temperatures and radiation which would burn Spock and your nephew to ashes.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't accept that, Bones. We've got fourteen science labs aboard this ship. The finest equipment and computers in the galaxy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I understand your concern. Your affection for Spock, the fact that your nephew is the last survivor of your brother's family.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, Bones. There's more than two lives at stake here. I cannot let it spread beyond this colony, even if it means destroying a million people down there.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3289.8. I am faced with the most difficult decision of my life. Unless we find a way to destroy the creatures without killing their human hosts, my command responsibilities will force me to kill over a million people.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I regret I see no other choice for you, Captain. We already know this thing has destroyed three civilisations. Perhaps more.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Gentlemen, I want it stopped, too, but not at the cost of destroying over a million people.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Including myself, Doctor, and Captain Kirk's young nephew. Understandably upsetting, but once it spreads past here, there are dozens of colonies beyond and billions of people.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If killing five people saves ten, it's a bargain. Is that your simple logic, Mister Spock?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will accept neither of those alternatives, gentlemen. I cannot let this thing expand beyond this planet, nor do I intend to kill a million or more people to stop it. I want another answer. I'm putting you gentlemen on the hot seat with me. I want that third alternative.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Jim. We've been over and over it, made every conceivable test.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: I therefore request permission to beam down to the planet's surface. I also suggest that your nephew accompany me.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request denied.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I do not make this request lightly. I do not know how much longer I can hold out against the pain. But I do know what the boy will go through should he regain consciousness.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request denied. There must be another answer. Something in the sun killed that thing before the Denevan died. All right. All right. We've tried heat, radiation. What other qualities or properties does the sun have?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: It exists physically. It occupies space. It has mass, therefore gravity. It converts matter to energy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, we've been through it and through it. Radiation, heat

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But one other thing you haven't mentioned. It's bright. It radiates a blinding light if you're close enough.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing lethal about light.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not to us. But down on the surface, the creatures stayed in the shadows for the most part. Suppose they weren't simply hiding. Suppose they're sensitive to light. Light, like in a sun, close up.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: A possibility.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't move Deneva closer to the sun, Jim.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but you can move the equivalent of the sun to Deneva. Mister Spock?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. In essence, it can be done. A string of satellites around the planet with burning tri-magnesite and trevium.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I can rig a test cubicle in the bio-lab, put our specimen in it. But I don't

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Let's get on it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Chapel puts the creature's jar into a large chamber.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your figures are, of course, accurate.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Of course. The light of the sun at the proximity where the Denevan declared himself free was one million candles per square inch. If this works, the satellites we orbit will produce light of such intensity that even someone in a closed, darkened area will be affected by it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Ready, Doctor.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Put on your masks.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They cover their eyes with goggles while the light is shone in the chamber.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Completed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They open the chamber. The thing is still.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It worked! We can do it. What's the matter, Jim? We can do it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It worked in a lab. With the creature exposed to everything we can give it. But what about the people who are infected?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I don't know. Maybe trial

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe. There's no time for maybes, Bones. We need to know now.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But I'd have to put a

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we'd have to put someone who's infected under that light.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you have any idea of the risk?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have to duplicate the conditions on the planet, and Spock

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you'll need a host for the next step in the test to determine whether the creature can be driven from the body. I am the logical choice.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you know what one million candlelight per square inch can do to your optic nerves?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no other way, Bones. We have to duplicate the brilliance that existed at the moment the Denevan declared himself freed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right. I'll rig up a protective pair of goggles.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: There'll be none on the planet's surface, Doctor.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree completely.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unfortunately, you're both right. It's the only thing we can do. All right, Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock enters the experimental chamber.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock's the best first officer in the fleet.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Proceed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock sits facing the light source and gets the full blast.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Completed.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They open the chamber, and Spock stands.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, are you all right?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: The creature within me is gone. I am free of it and the pain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: He walks forward, straight into a table.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: And I'm also quite blind. An equitable trade, Doctor. Thank you.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: They help him into a chair, and Chapel rushes in.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, the results of the first tests on the creature's remains.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: She leaves.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: reading
Text: Oh, no.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I threw the total spectrum of light at the creature. It wasn't necessary. I didn't stop to think that only one kind of light might've killed it.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. Just as dogs are sensitive to certain sounds which humans cannot hear, these creatures evidently are sensitive to light which we cannot see.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you telling me that Spock need not have been blinded?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I didn't need to throw the blinding white light at all, Jim. Spock, I

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor it was my selection as well. It is done.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, take care of him.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Completing the seeding orbit, Captain. Two hundred and ten ultraviolet satellites now in position. Seventy two miles altitude, permanent orbit about the planet.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Scanners?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scanners ready, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Very well. Ready, Helm?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Satellite control, this is the Captain. Energise all satellites.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Man
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Scott
Text: All satellites operative, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Down on the planet, gel-creatures are dropping to the ground and dissolving.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, receiving messages from a ground station.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The things are dying, sir. It's working.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell Spock it worked.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain. He'll be happy to hear that.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, it wasn't your fault.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Later.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman, record this for Starfleet Command.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Zahra
Text: Ready, sir.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The alien creatures on Deneva have been destroyed

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Zahra
Text: Captain, look. Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Context: Spock walks onto the Bridge, followed by McCoy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. You can see.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The blindness was temporary, Jim. There's something about his optical nerves which aren't the same as a human's.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: An hereditary trait, Captain. The brightness of the Vulcan sun has caused the development of an inner eyelid, which acts as a shield against high-intensity light. Totally instinctive, Doctor. We tend to ignore it, as you ignore your own appendix.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Regaining eyesight would be an emotional experience for most. You, I presume, felt nothing?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite the contrary, Captain. I had a very strong reaction. My first sight was the face of Doctor McCoy bending over me.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: 'Tis a pity your brief blindness did not increase your appreciation for beauty, Mister Spock.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you gentlemen are finished, would you mind laying in a course for Starbase Ten, Mister Spock?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: My pleasure, Captain.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unusual eye arrangement. I might've known he'd turn up with something like that.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that, Doctor?

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I said, please don't tell Spock I said he was the best first officer in the fleet.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why, thank you, Doctor McCoy.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've been so concerned about his Vulcan eyes, Doctor, you forgot about his Vulcan ears. Ahead warp factor one, Mister Sulu.

Title: Operation: Annihilate!
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor one, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Still no response, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, keep it open. I don't like this. Nothing since the first check in. Scott and Sulu should've contacted us again a half an hour ago.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: They may have nothing to report. Our sensors indicate no life forms except our landing party.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Both those men are well aware of landing party procedure. They should've checked in with us by now.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Contact established, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Jackson
Text: Jackson to Enterprise.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise. Kirk here.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Jackson
Text: One to beam up, Enterprise.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One? Jackson, where are Scott and Sulu?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Jackson
Text: I'm ready to beam up, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jackson!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm sorry. I can't clear it, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Notify Transporter room to prepare to beam up one member of the landing party. Then have Doctor McCoy report to me in the Transporter room on the double.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Ready, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's on, Jim?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trouble. (one man materialises) Jackson, where are the others?

Title: Catspaw
Context: The man falls over and off the transporter platform.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The man is dead.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Context: from the mouth of Jackson
Text: Captain Kirk, can you hear me? There is a curse on your ship. Leave this place or you will all die.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 3018.2. Crewman Jackson is dead and there are no apparent physical causes. Mister Scott and Mister Sulu are still out of touch on the planet below. Leaving Assistant Chief Engineer DeSalle in command of the Enterprise, I'm beaming down to the planet's surface to find my two missing crewmen and discover what killed Jackson.

Title: Catspaw
Context: It's rocky, and misty. Very spooky.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Odd. Our probe data didn't indicate fog.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: No cloud formations, no bodies of water, no changes in surface temperature. Under these conditions, fog is highly unlikely, Captain. According to our transporter co-ordinates this is the exact location from which Jackson was beamed up to the ship.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They step down carefully into the mist swirling along the path.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Readings, Mister Spock.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: No indications of. A moment, Captain. Picking up life form readings. Twenty four degrees mark seven. Range one thirty seven point one six metres. Multiple readings, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scott and Sulu?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise. Lieutenant Uhura here.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are the ship's sensors reading now, Lieutenant?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Report, Mister.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I am only picking up physical impulses from the three of them. As far as instruments can make out, there is nothing else down there that's alive.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Relay, Lieutenant.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, we are only registering on you. (static) Captain? Captain Kirk?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, can you hear me?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Whatever this stuff is, it's getting thicker. Suppose that has anything to do with the interference?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. There has to be some explanation for the fact that the ship's sensors can't register anything but us, while we're picking up readings of multiple life forms. Are they still there, Spock?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: No change, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand-by alert.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They check their phasers.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Listen. Now, what do you think that

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quiet.

Title: Catspaw
Context: There's an eerie wailing, then the images of, well, the Three Witches from Macbeth, appear.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 1
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 2
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 3
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 1
Text: Go back!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 2
Text: Go back!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 3
Text: Go back! Remember the curse!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 1
Text: Wind shall rise.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 2
Text: And fog descend.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Witch 3
Text: So leave here, all, or meet your end.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Maniacal cackling as they vanish.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Comment?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very bad poetry, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A more useful comment, Mister Spock.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: What we've just seen is not real.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's useful.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: However, on azimuth twenty four, at just over one hundred metres, there are definitely life forms. Erratic, confused, but definitely registering.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's where we're going.

Title: Catspaw
Context: A strong gust of wind blows them back.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That was a pretty real illusion, Mister Spock.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They walk on again.
