Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Catspaw
Context: There is a castle hewn from the local rock, and a door is opening.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the source of the life form readings, Captain. They're inside, somewhere.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise, come in.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is this how we lost contact with the first landing party?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about it, Spock? Does this structure have anything to do with communicator interference?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say not, Captain. There's no indication of anything that would cause such interference.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And it doesn't pick up on our ship's sensors.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor do our sensors register the life forms inside.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could it be exerting a force field of some kind that cuts into our sensor scan.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then it would affect Spock's tricorder too, wouldn't it?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Would it? I wonder.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They approach the edifice cautiously, then enter.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They are greeted by an angry, spitting black cat, wearing a large gem on its collar. It runs off, tail bristling.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Three witches, what appears to be a castle and a black cat.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we weren't missing two officers and a third one dead I'd say someone was playing an elaborate trick or treat on us.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Trick or treat, Captain?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. You'd be a natural. I'll explain it to you one day. Shall we have a look around?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would seem to be in order.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Context: sending them off in different directions
Text: Bones. Spock.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: They're gone, Mister DeSalle. The captain and the others simply stopped registering.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Check for malfunctions.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I did, sir, as soon as it happened.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister DeSalle, that's exactly what happened to Mister Scott and his party. They, they just disappeared.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Nobody just disappears. They may have encountered a magnetic field or some other obstruction. Mister Chekov, recalibrate your sensors. If you need help

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I can do it, sir. I'm not that green.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, continue in your efforts to break through that static interference.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: We know they're down there. I want them found.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The main door slams shut behind them.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Straight ahead, Mister Spock?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: The readings would so indicate.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Unlike a real castle, this one is all corridors at present.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dust, cobwebs. Halloween is right.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The black cat is ahead of them when the stone floor gives way and dumps the trio into

Title: Catspaw
Context: Reasonably well equipped out of Edgar Allen Poe - rack, skeleton in iron cage - and our heroes chained to the wall.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Are you all right?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I am undamaged, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? (sees another skeleton chained to the wall) Doc?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You were saying something about trick or treat.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dungeons, curses, skeletons and iron maidens. They're all Earth manifestations. Why?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know, Captain, but these things do exist. They are real.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could this be an Earth parallel development of some sort?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: None of this parallels any human development. It's more like a human nightmare.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: As if someone knew what it was that terrifies man most on an instinctive level.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ghost stories, ogres, demons. The whole

Title: Catspaw
Context: Footsteps, then the dungeon door opens. Down the steps walk - Scott and Sulu! as if in a trance.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, Sulu. Scotty. Put down the phaser. Scotty!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They appear to be drugged, Jim. Look at their eyes. Hardly blink at all.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Neither did Jackson just before he collapsed.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These two are alive. Scotty, do you hear me? Sulu, do you know who I am? What's happened to you?

Title: Catspaw
Context: Sulu holds up a very big key ring

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're going to release us.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Sulu undoes their shackles and they start to leave. They begin to fight, but suddenly

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Stop!

Title: Catspaw
Context: Red plush furnishings and a bald man with a little beard, wearing a golden gown, is sitting on what is effectively a throne on a raised dais.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whoever you are, you've proven your skill at creating illusion. Now I want to know why and what you've done to my men.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Where did your race get this ridiculous predilection for resistance? You examine any object, you question everything. Is it not enough to accept what is?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not when one of my men is dead because of it and two others turned into mindless

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: NO, not mindless. These two are merely controlled, Captain Kirk. Oh, yes, we know who you are. All of you. (to the cat) Don't we, my precious?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? Why did you bring us here?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: My name is Korob. And as for bringing you here, it was you who quite contrarily insisted upon coming. You were warned to stay away.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? For what reason? Why all the mumbo-jumbo?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Mumbo-jumbo? (the cat meows as if explaining) Oh! Oh, no, I assure you it was not that, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mapping expeditions have charted this solar system before. There never have been any life forms on Pyris Seven.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: It is of no importance that we are not native to this planet. (meow) Oh! I'm told that I've been an inattentive host, gentlemen. You will join me for something to refresh yourselves.

Title: Catspaw
Context: He leaves his throne and the cat follows.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That cat.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That cat.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: There are ancient Earth legends about wizards and their familiars.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Familiars?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Demons in animal forms sent by Satan to serve the wizard.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Superstition.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not create the legend, Captain. I merely report it.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You are the different one, Mister Spock. You do not think like the others. There are no colours to your patterns of logic. There's only black and white. You see all this around you, yet you do not believe.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He doesn't know about trick or treat.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: I do not understand that reference, therefore it also is of no importance. Gentlemen, I can be most hospitable.

Title: Catspaw
Context: He waves his wand and the table is loaded with food.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ingenious.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Do be seated.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're not hungry.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: But I insist.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They seat themselves.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Korob. What do you want from us?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: For the moment, merely that you eat and enjoy. Oh, Doctor, do try the wine. You'll find it excellent.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll find us most unco-operative unless you start explaining yourself.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Hopefully I can change that attitude.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The food vanishes and their plates are now filled with cut gemstones.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: These look real.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: They are, I assure you. Diamonds, rubies, emeralds, sapphires. All the crystalline forms that you cherish above all things. A fortune of them for each of you if you leave here without further inquiry.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We could manufacture a ton of these on our ship. They mean nothing to us.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Valueless? I don't understand. I read

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever it is you read, you read it wrong. As for leaving, we'll leave when we're ready.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You are most unpredictable. Perhaps I have made a small mistake. Nevertheless, you have passed the tests.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tests?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Yes. Our analysis of you may have been in some small way in error, but you were warned to stay away and yet you came to save your comrades. That proves loyalty. Your bravery was tested and you did not frighten. And despite my failure with these bright baubles, I perceive that you cannot be bribed. In many ways you are quite admirable. (meow) Quite right. Go at once, yes.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The cat leaves, and a few moments later a dark haired woman in a loose black dress enters the room. She is wearing a pendant like the cat's collar.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Gentlemen, my colleague. Sylvia.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Doctor McCoy, Mister Spock and Captain Kirk. You wanted to know what we did to your men. Actually it's a simple matter for us to probe the minds of creatures like yourself.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mind probing? Hypnosis?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You like to think of yourselves as complex creatures, but you're flawed. One gains admittance to your minds through many levels. You have too many to keep track of yourselves. There are unguarded entrances to any human mind.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Telepathy?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not entirely, no. Telepathy doesn't imply control and I assure you that I have full control over your friends.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Kirk gets the phaser off Scott by throwing gems in his face.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't move! (hands it to Spock) Cover them. Now, I want the rest of our weapons and our equipment. I want some answers.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Put that weapon down! Captain, it seems so foolish of you to insist on demonstrations. (She holds up a model Enterprise on a chain) In the mythology of your race this is called sympathetic magic. Jackson, the crew member who returned to the ship. You wondered what killed him. I made an image of him. In the essence of my thoughts the image was Jackson. And when I killed the image and knew that it was dead, he died.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't think a man to death.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Your communicator. (it appears on the table) Now, signal your ship.

Title: Catspaw
Context: She moves the model into a candle flame.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Don't. Sylvia, don't.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in. Come in.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The ship is at Red Alert.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise. From Captain Kirk. Come in.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, are you all right? Where are you? Are the others all right, sir?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind about us. What's happening up there?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: The temperature, sir. It keeps rising. Reading, Mister.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's up sixty degrees in the past thirty seconds. We're burning up, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: DeSalle, channel bypass power into your heat dissipation units.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: We've already done it, Captain. It had no effect. We're cooking up here.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. I'll handle it down here. Kirk out. (taking the model from Sylvia and the phaser from Spock) You've won.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You can relax now, Captain. Your ship is safe.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Temperature is almost back to normal, dropping down fast.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Lieutenant, try to raise the captain again.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, please. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Acknowledge. We've lost him again, Mister DeSalle.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Captain, you've seen something of our science. Now tell us about yours.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to be singing a different tune. I'd rather know more about yours. You call it magic, you call it science. It seems unrelated to both of them.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: What would you name it, Captain?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't attempt to name it, but you seem to do with your mind what we do with tools. You alter matter, move it about by telekinesis.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Yes, we can change the molecular structure

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Korob, you talk too much.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You kept Scott and Sulu as catspaws to lure us down here. How'd you know we'd come?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Oh, we didn't have to know. They knew.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Enough of this! You will tell us what we want to know.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's too late for threats. You let me contact the ship. How long do you think it will it be before a search party arrives?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Some time, Captain. Quite some time.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The model Enterprise is encased in a block of perspex.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: There will be no search party, Captain Kirk. An impenetrable force field around your ship, Captain. It will not hinder orbit, but your people are prisoners within it.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's some kind of a force field, sir, but not like any other I've ever heard of before. It's not coming from anywhere. It's simply all around us.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: I would advise you to co-operate, Captain. Forcible extraction of the information we wish from you is not complicated, but it is extremely painful and it has a certain draining effect.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have nothing to discuss.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Take them to their cell. (gives the phaser to Scott)

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Wait. The doctor will stay. Your turn will be next, Captain. It makes little difference. Take them out of here.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Wave length analysis, Mister Chekov?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It will not analyse, sir.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: All right, but it's there and it's real. If it's real, it can be affected. Engineering, stand by to divert all power systems to the outer hull. Prepare impulse engines for generation of maximum heat directed as ordered. Maybe we can't break it, but I'll bet you credits to navy beans we can put a dent in it.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Kirk and Spock are shackled to the wall again.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long has it been?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Twenty two minutes, seventeen seconds.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thanks. I wonder what they're doing to Doc.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sure we'll find out shortly. Jim, all of these things that we've seen. To an Earthman like yourself, they must seem quite familiar.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Familiar. Startling. Not rational.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. I refer you to the psychological theory of the racial subconscious. The universal myths, symbols.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ghosts, witches.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: And dungeons and castles and black cats. They all belong to the twilight world of consciousness.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They tried to tap our conscious mind.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: And they missed. They reached basically only the subconscious. Korob seemed puzzled by your reaction to the environment he'd provided.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He expected me to react as though it were all normal. Well, he admitted that they weren't native to this planet.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: And not to have a knowledge of our scientific methods is most unlikely for any life form we've met in this galaxy.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They refer to us as creatures, as though we were some species that they were unfamiliar with. If we're creatures, I wonder what they're really like.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently something totally alien in all respects.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Agreed. Totally alien. And I don't like hostile strangers showing such an acute interest in our galaxy, our world, Spock. Not at all like friendly visitors. We're going to have to stop them, cold. But at the moment

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: I, too, am at a loss at this time to suggest a course of action.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The door opens and McCoy enters with Scott and Sulu. He has been zombified. Sulu unchains Kirk.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Bones. Doc.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You forget what we were sent here for.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: I forget nothing. I'm not a puppet, Korob, like you.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You're a traitor.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You are a fool. We have nothing like this and I like it. To touch, to feel to understand the idea of luxury I like it. And I don't intend to leave it.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: We have a duty to the old ones.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: What do they know of sensations? This is a new world.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You're cruel. You torture our specimens.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: And that, too, is a new sensation. I find it stimulating.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: You're wrong! You're discarding everything we live by.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: I live by my own decisions. You're a weak fool, Korob.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: I have the power.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: But you're afraid to use it. Don't threaten me. I can squash you and that would be an interesting sensation, yes. I find I like these new sensations. Don't try to push me.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The door opens and the group enters.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Captain. It's time for our talk. Korob, leave us alone and take these men with you.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Korob picks up the communicator and Enterprise from the table.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: This is not ended, Sylvia.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: But it may end soon, old man.

Title: Catspaw
Context: He leaves, followed by McCoy, Scott and Sulu.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What now? You wave your magic wand and destroy my mind, too?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: There's no real damage to the mind, Captain, simply a drain of knowledge and will.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't call that damage?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Why should I?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd know if you had compassion. A woman should have compassion, but I forget you're not a woman.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: But you're mistaken, Captain. I am a woman now. I come from a world without sensation as you and I now know it. It excites me. I want more.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to need us. Why?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Because you have knowledge which I lack. but were our abilities put together. Tell me about power, Captain. How does it feel?

Title: Catspaw
Context: As Korob watches from behind a screen, Kirk puts his hand on her shoulder. He strokes her neck and face.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about Korob?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: He is a fool. I'll do without him. But you? Why do I find you different? Why would it be so difficult to dispose of you?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why don't you simply probe my mind and get what you want?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: No, not that, not for you. What I want is a joining. My mind to yours willingly. Think of the secrets you could learn. Think of the power that would be yours. Anything you can imagine, I can give you.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're very persuasive. What happens if I go along?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Then everything would be ours together. I've never conceived of the idea of togetherness before. It excites me. You excite me. Why?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For the same reasons you excite me. You're a very beautiful woman.

Title: Catspaw
Context: He kisses her.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You find me beautiful? But I can be many women. (now she's blonde teen jail-bait) You like what you see. (a platinum blonde in a loose cat-suit) or do you prefer me as I was?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a knack for giving me difficult choices. (kisses her again) You have nothing like that where you come from?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Nothing.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your people, when they come here

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: They're like, like feathers in the wind without the transmuter.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Context: nuzzling her neck
Text: Transmuter?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: The source. You will learn. I will teach you later. Later.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then it's a device. You do use tools.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: It gives only form. You're teaching me substance.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You haven't changed your mind? You won't return home?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: My home is here with you. A billion worlds of sensation to pick and choose.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Another kiss, then he lets her go and she realises

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You are using me. You hold me in your arms and there is no fire in your mind. You're trying to deceive me! It's here, (the crystal) like words on a page. You are using me.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And why not? You've been using me and my crew.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Enter Sulu, Scott and McCoy.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You will be swept away. You, your men, your ship, your worlds!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't see any change.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: It's there, Lieutenant.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It was that electrical field we set up, Mister DeSalle, that dent you wanted. It's not much, but it is a start.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Desalle
Text: Keep it up, Mister Chekov. Channel the entire output of reactors one, two, and three into the relay stations. Whatever it is, it's starting to weaken.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Korob rushes in and releases the prisoners.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: I've released the model of your ship from the crystal, although they would have freed themselves soon. It's difficult to control so many things in so little time. (hands over phaser and communicator) Here. You must go before she finds the weapon is missing.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not leaving without my men.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: They're not your men anymore. They belong to Sylvia. I can no longer control them or her. She's irrational. The strain of adopting to your form, the insatiable desire for sensation and experience. She's a great danger and it was not necessary. We could have entered your galaxy in peace.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: You came in a ship?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: We used the transmuter.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transmuter. Yes, she mentioned that.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: There's no time to explain now. She means to destroy us all. There might still be a chance. Quickly. Come.

Title: Catspaw
Context: They go cautiously along the corridors, and a cat's snarl is heard. There on a wall is the shadow of a very large feline.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why a cat?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Racial memories. The cat is the most ruthless, most terrifying of animals, as far back as the sabre-toothed tiger.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: I think I can stop her.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd better let us. (draws the phaser) It's out of energy. She must have drained it. We could have jumped Scott and Sulu at any time. We didn't know. No way out.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: It's my problem. She's one of my kind. Come quickly.

Title: Catspaw
Context: The giant cat pads down the corridor as they retreat back into the dungeon.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Spock goes to the hole in the ceiling that they originally fell through.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you think you can make it?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready when you are, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Korob
Text: Get ready.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Spock gets out into the corridor above.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: No! Get back. Get back. Get back! Get back!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Korob, that door won't last.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Get back!

Title: Catspaw
Context: The door is pushed in and he is crushed underneath it. Kirk runs to his aid.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Korob
Text: Go. Go! (He dies, and Kirk picks up his wand.)

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quickly, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Korob seemed to think this was important. Said something about a transmuter.

Title: Catspaw
Context: He throws the wand up to Spock.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, a bit more alacrity, if you please.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Kirk uses a bed frame as a trampoline to help him reach the hole, and Spock pulls him the rest of the way.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Context: McCoy arrives to take a swing at them with a morning-star. Kirk fights with him as Spock takes on Scott. Kirk knocks McCoy out.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doc.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Then Sulu arrives. Spock neck-pinches Scott. Kirk parries Sulu's martial arts attack until he can throw him against a door, when he is knocked out.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim!

Title: Catspaw
Context: McCoy has awakened only to get knocked out again.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, at least we found them.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortuitous, Captain. And now that we have them all together? (the cat arrives) A most unpleasant situation, Captain. If only your phaser had some power.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe we do. (he gets the wand) Sylvia, I have the transmuter. It's mine now.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You're very clever, Captain. More so than I'd imagined. Clever, resourceful and handsome.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Don't let her touch the wand, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Context: She strokes her pendant, and she and Kirk vanish.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim!

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you get tired of these games?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: I've never played games. Give it to me.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wasn't sure before, but I am now. This is the source of your power, isn't it. The transmuter.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: No, not the source. It's merely an amplifier. The mind is the source. Mine is simple, but yours has the key but you don't know how to use it.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I catch on quickly.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: It is not too late, Captain James Kirk. Come with me. I'll teach you. You'll teach me.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Because your people have nothing of your own? Is that why you need us?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: We need your dreams, your ambition. With them, I can build. Give me the transmuter.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You fool. Don't you know what you're giving up? Everything that your species finds desirable. Look at me. I am a woman. I am all women.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know what you are but you're not a woman. You've tortured my men and taken their minds from them. You ask for love and return pain instead.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Sylvia
Context: holding a phaser
Text: Korob was wrong. I didn't destroy all your weapons. Give me the transmuter. Give it to me!

Title: Catspaw
Context: Kirk smashes the wand against the table, and there is a blinding blue light.

Title: Catspaw
Context: Kirk is standing on the rocks holding a phaser. Spock approaches wearing his tricorder. McCoy, Scott and Sulu follow him.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened, Jim?

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That'll take some explaining, Bones.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Scott
Text: Everything's vanished.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not everything.

Title: Catspaw
Context: By his feet are two tiny blue fluffy creatures with stick-thin arms and legs, and squid's tentacles for faces.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Korob and Sylvia as they really are. Their forms were an illusion, just like the castle and everything else. Only the power pack gave them reality.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. A life form totally alien to our galaxy. If we could preserve and study this

Title: Catspaw
Context: But the little puppets collapse and die. Smoke rises from the bodies.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Too late. All of this, just an illusion.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No illusion. Jackson is dead. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Standing by, Captain.

Title: Catspaw
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Five to beam up.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Enterprise shuttlecraft NCC1701/7 is being piloted by Kirk, assisted by Spock. McCoy is tending to a lady in a green dress and headscarf.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have reached projected point three, Captain. Adjust to new course two oh one mark one five.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: offering a drink
Text: Jim.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is she, Doc?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No change.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Small thanks to the Starfleet.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now really, Commissioner, you can't blame the Starfleet.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I should've received the proper inoculations ahead of time.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sakuro's disease is extremely rare. The chances of anyone contracting it are literally billions to one.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I was sent to Epsilon Canaris Three to prevent a war, Doctor. Thanks to the inefficiency of the medical branch of the Starfleet, I've been forced to leave before my job was done.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commissioner, I can assure you that once we reach the Enterprise, with its medical facilities, we'll have you back to your job in time for you to prevent that war.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: How soon will we rendezvous with that ship of yours, Captain?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In exactly four hours, twenty one minutes, Commissioner.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Will you check your automatic scanner, please?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's odd. I've never seen anything like that before.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor have I.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: They lower the central shutter to view the approaching swirly flashing thing.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Heading directly toward us at warp speed.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Staying right with us. Sensor readings, Mister Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vaguely like a cloud of ionised hydrogen, but with strong erratic electrical impulses.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Sounds of electrical shorts. The lights flicker.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Helm does not answer, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neither do the pods. Communications are dead. Building overload. Cut all power relays.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cut, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: What's happening? I demand to know.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You already know as much as we do, Miss Hedford. Whatever that thing is outside, it's yanked us off course from the Enterprise.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now on course nine eight mark one two, heading directly toward Gamma Canaris region.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, we've got to get Miss Hedford to the Enterprise. Her condition.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know, Bones, but there's nothing I can do about it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I insist you make your scheduled rendezvous with the Enterprise.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miss Hedford, we'll do what we can, when we can. At the moment, we're helpless. You might as well sit back and enjoy the ride.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: The shuttlecraft has landed on a blue and purple planet. It is surrounded by lots of very high cliffs.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise, this is the Galileo. Come in, please, come in. Enterprise, this is the Galileo. Come in, please. It's no good. We're not transmitting. Bones?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oxygen-nitrogen atmosphere. Some krypton, argon, neon. Temperature seventy five degrees Fahrenheit. Practically identical to Earth atmosphere.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gravity is similar to Earth. Most unusual in view of its size. The bulk of the body seems to be iron and nickel. More than an asteroid. Like a small planetoid, I should say. Possibly a remnant of a planet breakup. Totally suitable for human life.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, we get out and get up. Issue phasers. Bones, maintain full alert. Commissioner, you'll stay inside.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Just how long am I supposed to stay inside, Captain?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a very good question. I wish I could answer it. All right. Let's go.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take a look around, Bones.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock checks the shuttlecraft for damage.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most unusual. Unlikely. In fact, Captain, I would say quite impossible.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing wrong and nothing works.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be a reason.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's look a little further.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Nancy comes out of the shuttlecraft.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I just took a tricording sweep, and I got the same readings almost as Spock got when we were pulled off course.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ionised cloud.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think so, only it reads here on the surface with us. It's in that direction, and it doesn't read solid. It's more unstable, tenuous, like a collection of gases.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Hello! Hello!

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: A figure in an orange jumpsuit waves and runs towards them.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, get a physiological reading on that, whatever it is.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Hello! Are you real? I mean, I'm not imagining you, am I?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're real enough.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You speak English. Earth people?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From the Federation.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: The F? Well, it doesn't matter. I'm Cochrane. I've been marooned here who knows how long. If you only knew how good it is to see you. And a woman. A beautiful one at that.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James T. Kirk, commanding the starship Enterprise. (they shake hands) This is my first officer Mister Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're a Vulcan, aren't you?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chief Surgeon Leonard McCoy.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Doctor.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Pleasure.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, and excuse me, Assistant Federation Commissioner Hedford.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Ma'am. You're food to a starving man. All of you. Hey, that's a nice ship. Simple and clean. Been trying to get her to go again? Well, forget it. It won't work.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's human, Jim. Everything checks out perfectly.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Cochrane. We were forced off our course and taken here by some force we couldn't identify.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which seems to be on the surface of this body at the moment.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Well, I wouldn't know anything about that.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: You say we'll be unable to get the ship to function again?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Not a chance. There's some sort of dampening field down here. Power systems don't work. Take my word for it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: You don't mind if we continue to try?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Go right ahead. You've got plenty of time.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about you, Cochrane? How did you get here?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Marooned, I told you. Look, we'll have lots of time to learn about each other. I have a small place over that way. All the comforts of home. I can even offer you a hot bath.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: How perceptive of you to notice I needed one.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't mind, Mister Cochrane, I'd like more than just a statement that you were marooned here. It's a long way off the beaten path.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: That's right. That's why I'm so glad to see you. Look, I'll tell you everything you want to know, but not here. Your ship is sure a beauty.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, she is. And you've been out of circulation quite a while. The principles may be new to you. Mister Spock, why don't you explain our methods of propulsion to Mister Cochrane?

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock and Cochrane go to the other side of the shuttlecraft.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Talks a lot, but he doesn't say much.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've noticed something else.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's that?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He looks familiar.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Familiar? Now that you mention it, he does.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't quite place him, but. What about Miss Hedford?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No temperature yet, but we've got to get under way soon, Jim. I guarantee you, it will develop. What are we going to do?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take Cochrane up on his offer.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Not a true vertical in the building, and palms in the garden. It looks quite nice and avant-garde.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: You built this, Mister Cochrane?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Yes. I had tools and supplies left over from my crash.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not bad.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Not Earth, but it's livable. I grow vegetables in the fields over that next ridge. Come on in.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All the comforts of home indeed, Mister Cochrane. Where'd you get the antiques?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You mean my instruments? I imagine things have changed a lot since I crashed.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not that much.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Hands a piece over to Spock to examine.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Must you keep it so terribly hot in here?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: The temperature's a constant seventy two degrees. Let me get you something cool to drink.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you feel hot?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I feel infuriated, deeply put upon, and absolutely outraged.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It was quite a hike here. You're tired. Just take it easy for a while.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I'll rest later, Doctor.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Temperature, Captain. First sign.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. It means we're running out of time.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Doctor.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: From the doorway, the three see a swirly thing which then disappears. Cochrane comes in with a tray of drinks.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was that?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Well, sometimes the light plays tricks on you. You'd be surprised what I've imagined I've seen around here sometimes.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: We imagined nothing, Mister Cochrane. There was an entity out there and I suspect it was the same entity which brought us here. Please explain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: There's nothing to explain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: He hands a drink to Nancy.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Thank you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll find I have a very low tolerance level where the safety of my people are concerned. We find you out here, where no human has any business being. We were virtually hijacked in space and brought here. Now I'm not just requesting an explanation, Mister. I'm demanding one.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: All right. It was the Companion.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The what?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: That's what I call it. As a matter of fact, Captain, I didn't crash here. I was brought here in my disabled ship. I was almost dead. The Companion saved my life.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were injured?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I was dying, Mister Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem perfectly all right now. What was the matter?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I was an old man.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were what?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Well, I don't know how it did it, but the Companion rejuvenated me, made me young again, like I am now.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: I prefer to reserve judgment on that part of your story, sir. Meanwhile, would you please explain exactly what this Companion of yours is?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I told you, I don't know what it is. It exists, it lives, and I can communicate with it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's a pretty far out story.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Cochrane, do you have a first name?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Zefram.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Zefram Cochrane of Alpha Centuri, the discoverer of the space warp?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: That's right, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But that's impossible. Zefram Cochrane died a hundred and fifty years ago.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: The name of Zefram Cochrane is revered throughout the known galaxy. Planets were named after him. Great universities, cities.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't your story a little improbable, Mister Cochrane?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: No, it's true. I was eighty seven years old when I came here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say this Companion found you and rejuvenated you? What were you doing in space at the age of eighty seven?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I was tired, Captain. I was going to die, and I wanted to die in space. That's all.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: True, his body was never found.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're looking at it, Mister Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: If so, you wear your age very well.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you feel?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Terrible. How should I feel?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're running a little temperature. Perhaps you should lie down.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Doctor, will you please just leave me alone. It's the heat.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right. Try to relax. Jim, it's started, the fever. It's over a hundred, and it's climbing.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long do we have?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A matter of hours, that's all.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Cochrane, you say you were brought here a hundred and fifty years ago? You don't look over thirty five.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I haven't aged. The Companion sees to that.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. These instruments, they date from the time indicated. From your ship, Mister Cochrane?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I cannibalised it. The food, water, gardens, everything else I need the Companion gives me. Apparently, it creates it out of the native elements.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say you can communicate with it. Perhaps you can find out what we're doing here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I already know.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You wouldn't mind telling us?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You won't like it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I already don't like it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're here to keep me company.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean you brought us here?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: No, the Companion did. I told it I'd die of loneliness. I thought it would release me. Instead, it brought you here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: No! No! No! That's disgusting! We're not animals! No! Oh, no! It's inhuman! No! No!

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Kirk and McCoy take her to a bed and lie her down. McCoy gives her an injection.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, run additional tricorder readings. Learn anything you can. Find me a weapon to use against this thing.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: You ask me to find a weapon. Do you intend to destroy it?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I intend to do whatever's necessary to get us off this planet and Commissioner Hedford to the hospital. If the Companion stands in the way, then we push it out of the way. Clear, Spock?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite clear, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. You have your orders. (Spock leaves) Mister Cochrane, if you left here, what would happen to you?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I'd begin to age again, normally.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you want to leave here?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Believe me, Captain, immortality consists largely of boredom. What's it like out there in the galaxy?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're on a thousand planets and spreading out. We cross fantastic distances and everything's alive, Cochrane. Life everywhere. We estimate there are millions of planets with intelligent life. We haven't begun to map them. Interesting?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: How would you like to sleep for a hundred and fifty years and wake up in a new world?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all out there waiting for you, but we'll need your help to get away.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You've got it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock is working when the Companion appears next to him. He reaches to touch it, and then is flung away. The electrics in the shuttlecraft all burn out.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to think this Companion of yours can do almost anything.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I said it was very powerful.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could it cure her?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I don't know.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you communicate with it?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: It's on a non-verbal level, but I usually get my message across.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to try. We're helpless. See if it can do something.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you do it?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I just sort of clear my mind and it comes.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: He walks to the edge of the garden then stands with his eyes closed. The Companion appears, then moves to envelope him.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what do you make of that?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Almost a symbiosis of some kind, a sort of joining.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly what I think. Not exactly like a pet owner speaking to a beloved animal, would you say?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, it's more than that.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Agreed. More like love.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: The Companion vanishes, so Kirk and McCoy go over to Cochrane.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you all right?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Yes. It kind of drains me a little, but I'm all right.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: The Companion can't do anything to help Miss Hedford.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then she'll die.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: If there's anything I could do to help, I would, and I will, but we can expect nothing from the Companion.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock! Are you all right?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Quite all right, Doctor. A most fascinating thing happened. Apparently, the Companion imparted to me a rather quaint, old-fashioned electric shock of respectable voltage.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It attacked you?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently. Unquestionably, a large part of its substance is simple electricity.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, yes. I'm not a scientist or a physicist, Mister Spock, but am I correct in assuming that anything that generates electricity can be shorted out?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite correct, Doctor.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock is demonstrating the device he has put on the table.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Put this in the proximity of the Companion, throw this switch, and it will scramble every electrical impulse the creature can produce. It cannot fail.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It troubles you, Cochrane?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: The Companion saved my life. It's taken care of me all these years. We've been very close in a way that's hard to explain. I suppose I even have an affection for it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's also keeping you prisoner.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I don't want it killed.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: We may simply render it powerless.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: But you don't know. You could kill it. I won't stand for that.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're getting out of here, Cochrane. Face up to it. I'll do anything I have to to save all of our lives.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I suppose from your point of view, you're right.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We understand how you feel, Mister Cochrane, but it has to be done.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: All right. You want me to contact it?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Please. Outside.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: What was it they used to call it? The Judas goat? (leaves)

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is some risk, Captain. We do not know the extent of its powers.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nor it ours.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Cochrane 'calls' and the Companion comes just as before. When it has enveloped him, Kirk gives the word.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: The jolt knocks Cochrane out and the Companion comes towards the dwelling, apparently angry.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: It enters, blows up Spock's contraption then attacks Kirk and Spock. They are rolling around on the floor inside the sparkly thing, clutching their throats.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop it! You're killing them! Stop it, please! Stop it! You're choking them! Let them go. You're choking them! Stop it!

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Outside, Cochrane hears McCoy's shouts, and somehow calms the Companion. It vanishes.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You all right, Jim?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: All right.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: They go to the doorway and see the Companion with Cochrane again.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cochrane got it off of us, but I don't know whether he did us a favour or not.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What kind of talk is that?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you fight a thing like that? I've got a ship up there somewhere, responsibility for four lives here, one of them dying because of me.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It isn't your fault.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm in command, Bones. It makes it my fault. How do you fight a thing like that?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe you're a soldier so often that you forget you're also trained to be a diplomat. Why not try a carrot instead of a stick?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The universal translator on the shuttlecraft. We can try that, talk to that thing.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: The translator is for use with more congruent life forms.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Adjust it, change it. The trouble with immortality is it's boring. Adjusting the translator will give you something to do.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is possible. If I could widen its pattern of reception

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right down your alley, Spock. Get it here and get to work. That thing is still out there. Better go that way.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock leaves, passing Nancy's bed

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any change?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, for the worse.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's Log. Stardate 3219.8. Lieutenant Commander Scott recording in the absence of Captain Kirk. A shuttlecraft bearing the Captain, the first officer, Chief Surgeon McCoy, and Assistant Federation Commissioner Hedford is now definitely overdue for a rendezvous with the Enterprise. We are attempting to backtrack it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott. Computer central reports that we're coming up on the co-ordinates of the last established position of the shuttlecraft.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Steady. No, Mister Scott, bearing three ten mark thirty five just cleared. No antimatter residue.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: All scanners, spherical sweep. Range, maximum. They'll have to pick it up.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: If the shuttlecraft powered away, Mister Scott, but if it were just towed?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: There'd still be traces of residual matter floating around, Lieutenant.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bearing two ten mark forty. Strong particle concentration. We're on it, Mister Scott.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lay on that course. Maintain scanning.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course laid in, sir. Particle density decreasing. Gone, sir. No readings.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Steady as she goes, Mister Sulu.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What do you think it means, Mister Scott?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: The shuttlecraft was on schedule until it was shy five hours of rendezvous. Then something happened.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Well, I'd feel a lot better if it were a little more definite.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: It didn't wreck. There was no debris. There's no trace of expelled internal atmosphere, no residual radioactivity. Ah, it's. Something took over. Tractor beams maybe. Something. They dragged it away on the heading we're now on.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: If there are no further traces, how are we going to follow them?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: We stay on this course, see what comes up.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's a big galaxy, Mister Scott.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Spock is working on the Universal Translator. It is basically a metal tube nearly a foot long, that can be held in the hand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: What's the theory behind this device?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are certain universal ideas and concepts common to all intelligent life. This device instantaneously compares the frequency of brainwave patterns, selects those ideas and concepts it recognises, and then provides the necessary grammar.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then it translates its findings into English.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You mean it speaks?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With a voice or the approximation of whatever the creature is on the sending end. Not one hundred percent efficient, but nothing ever is. Ready, Mister Spock?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite ready, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Cochrane, call the Companion.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Cochrane summons the Companion.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Companion. (It leaves Cochrane) We wish to talk to you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: How can we communicate? My thoughts, you are hearing them. This is interesting.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Feminine. No doubt about it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. The matter of gender could change the entire situation.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm way ahead of you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then it is not a zookeeper.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. A lover. Companion. It is wrong to keep us here against our will.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: A man needs the company of his own kind, or he will cease to exist. He felt it to me.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of us will cease to exist if we don't get her to a place where we can care for her.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: The man needs others of his species. That is why you are here. The man must continue.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Companion, try to understand. It is the nature of our species to be free, just as it is your nature to stay here. We will cease to exist in captivity.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: Your bodies have stopped their peculiar degeneration. There will be nothing to harm you. You will continue, and the man will continue. This is necessary.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is a marvellous opportunity to add to our knowledge. Ask it about its nature, its history.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This isn't a classroom. I'm trying to get us out of here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: A chance like this may never come again. It could tell us so much.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This isn't the time. Companion, what you offer us is not continuation. It is non=existence. We will cease to exist. Even the man will cease to exist.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: Your impulses are illogical. This communication is useless. The man must continue. Therefore, you will continue. It is necessary.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: She vanishes, and they all head back indoors.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Captain, why did you build that translator with a feminine voice?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We didn't.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: But I heard

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The idea of male and female are universal constants, Cochrane. There's no doubt about it. The Companion is female.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't? A blind man could see it with a cane. You're not a pet. You're not a specimen kept in a cage. You're a lover.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I'm a what?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Her attitude when she approaches you is profoundly different than when she contacts us. Her appearance is soft, gentle. Her voice is melodic, pleasing. I do not totally understand the emotion, but it obviously exists. The Companion loves you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Do you know what you're saying? For all these years, I've let something as alien as that crawl around inside me, into my mind, my feelings.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you complaining about? It kept you alive.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: That thing fed on me. It used me. It's disgusting.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's nothing disgusting about it. It's just another life form, that's all. You get used to those things.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're as bad as it is.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your highly emotional reaction is most illogical. Your relationship with the Companion has for one hundred and fifty years been emotionally satisfying, eminently practical, and totally harmless. It may indeed have been quite beneficial.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Is this what the future holds? Men who have no notion of decency or morality? Maybe I'm a hundred and fifty years out of style, but I'm not going to be fodder for any inhuman monster. (leaves)

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. A totally parochial attitude.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Doctor. Doctor.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right here, Miss Hedford.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I heard him. He was loved and he resents it.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You just rest.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: No. I don't want to die. I've been good at my job, but I've never been loved. Never. What kind of life is that? Not to be loved, never to have shown love? And he runs away from love. (cries)

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log, stardate 3220.3. Lieutenant Commander Scott reporting in lieu of the Captain and the first officer. We are continuing our search for the missing shuttlecraft.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Approaching what seems to be an asteroid belt, sir. Scanners report approximately seven thousand bodies of sizes running from types A to N.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Atmosphere count?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Approximately thirty four percent of the bodies of atmospherian types H to M.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, then. We'll do it the hard way. All sensors set for life form registration. Automatic selection.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, there are thousands of them out there they could be on, if they're on any of them at all.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's right, Lieutenant. Thousands. And we'll look them over one by one.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Another contact session is in progress.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Companion, do you love the man?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: I do not understand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is he important to you, more important than anything? Is he as though he were a part of you?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: He is part of me. The man must continue.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He will not continue. He will cease to exist. By your feeling for him, you are condemning him to an existence he will find unbearable. He will cease to exist.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: He does not age. He remains forever.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You speak of his body. I speak of his spirit. Companion, inside the shelter, a female of our species is dying. She will not continue. That is what will happen to the man unless you release all of us.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: I do not understand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our species can only survive if we have obstacles to overcome. You take away all obstacles. Without them to strengthen us, we will weaken and die. You regard the man only as a toy. You amuse yourself with him.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: You are wrong. The man is the centre of all things. I care for him.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you can't really love him. You haven't the slightest knowledge of love, the total union of two people. You are the Companion. He is the man. You are two different things. You can't join. You can't love. You may keep him here forever, but you will always be separate, apart from him.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Companion
Text: If I were human there can be love? (vanishes)

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What did you hope to gain by that, Jim?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to convince her of the hopelessness of it. Love sometimes expresses itself in sacrifice. I thought maybe if she loved him, she'd let him go.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: But she or it is inhuman, Captain. You cannot expect her to react like a human.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I tried.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: It's useless. I know.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Context: standing in the doorway
Text: Zefram Cochrane.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't understand it. She's not sick at all.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: We understand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: It's her.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Don't you understand? It's the Companion.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's perfectly healthy. Heart like a hammer, respiration normal, blood pressure normal. This is medically impossible.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: We are here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Both of us. Those you knew as the Commissioner and the Companion. We are both here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Companion, you do not have the power to create life.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: That is for the Maker of all things.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commissioner Hedford was dying.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: That part of us was too weak to hold on. In a moment, there would have been no continuing. Now we're together.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you are both here, in the one body?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: We are one.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: She goes to Cochrane, who takes a step back.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Zefram, we frighten you. We've never frightened you before. Loneliness. This is loneliness. Oh, what a bitter thing. Oh, Zefram, it's so sad. How do you bear it, this loneliness?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, check out the shuttlecraft. Engine, communications, everything.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: That will not be necessary, Captain. Your vehicle will operate as before, so will the communications device.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're letting us go?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: We could do nothing now to stop you. You said we would not know love because we were not human. Now we are human. We'll know the change of days. We will know death. But to touch the hand of man, nothing is as important.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You're very beautiful.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Part of me understands. Part does not. But it pleases me.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I could explain many things.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: Oh, let me walk, Zefram. Let me feel the earth against my feet. Let me feel the warmth of the sun on my face. You beside me. Let me feel these things.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Cochrane We have a few things to do.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Cochrane and Nancy walk off hand in hand.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, it's the Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: Put him on. Lock on to his co-ordinates. Captain, this is Scotty. Are you all right?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perfectly all right. Can you get a fix on us.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: The helm is computing your position now, Captain.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course two twenty four mark twelve. ETA fifty seven minutes.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll be there in 57 minutes, sir.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. I'll continue transmitting. Assume standard orbit when you arrive. We'll transport up in the shuttlecraft.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: What happened, Captain?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting story, Scotty. I can't tell you now because, quite frankly, I don't know how it's going to end. Kirk out.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Somewhere in the vicinity, Nancy is holding up her scarf to mimic how she saw Cochrane when she was a swirly thing.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Everything will be an eye-opener to you. There's a thousand planets out there, a thousand races, and I'll show everything to you, soon as I learn my way around again. Maybe I can make up a little for everything you've done for me.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: I can't go with you, Zefram.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Of course you can. You have to.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: My life emanates from this place. If I should leave it for more than a tiny march of days, I'll cease to exist. I must return, even as you must consume matter to maintain your life.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You gave up everything to be human? But even if you stay here, you'll eventually die.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: The joy of this hour. I am pleased.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Well, I can't just fly away and leave you here.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Nancy
Text: You must be free, Zefram Cochrane.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: You saved my life, took care of me. You loved me. I never understood. I do now.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: He kisses her.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're locked in, Captain. Standard orbit established. Shuttlecraft bay standing by to receive you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Scotty.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: Cochrane and Nancy return.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Enterprise is waiting, Mister Cochrane.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I can't take her away from here. If I do, she'll die. If I leave her, she'll die of loneliness. I owe everything to her. I can't leave her. I love her. Is that surprising?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not coming from a human being. You are, after all, essentially irrational.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Think it over, Mister Cochrane. There's a whole galaxy out there waiting to honour you.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: I have honours enough.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Spock
Text: But you will age, both of you. There will be no immortality. You'll both grow old here and finally die.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: That's been happening to men and women for a long time. I've got the feeling it's one of the pleasanter things about being human, as long as you grow old together.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: There's plenty of water here. The climate's good for growing things. I might try to plant a fig tree. A man's entitled to that, isn't he? It isn't gratitude, Captain. Now that I see her, touch her, I know that I love her. We'll have a lot of years together. They'll be happy ones.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All the best.

Title: Metamorphosis
Context: They shake hands, and Kirk walks away.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Cochrane
Text: Captain, don't tell them about me.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not a word, Mister Cochrane.

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what about that war on Epsilon Canaris Three?

Title: Metamorphosis
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm sure the Federation can find another woman somewhere who'll stop that war.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're quite large. Seven feet tall is not unusual. They're extremely fast and strong. Lieutenant?

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Uhura turns on a monitor) Make no mistake. They can be highly dangerous. The Capellans' basic weapon, the kligat. At any distance up to a hundred yards, they can make it almost as effective against a man as a phaser

Title: Friday's Child
Context: On the monitor, we see McCoy being given a demonstration in which a small sapling is cut in half by one of these hand-thrown objects.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In addition, an assortment of swords and knives.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Call from the bridge, Captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge, Helm, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Sulu. Report.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Now in standard orbit, sir. I've pinpointed their encampment below.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. Have the transporter room stand by.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: How long were you stationed on the planet, Doctor?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Only a few months. We found them totally uninterested in medical aid or hospitals. They believe only the strong should survive.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis, gentlemen.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ordinarily, under these circumstances, I would recommend a large, well-armed landing party.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but in this case, with the more people we take down, the greater chance we have of violating one of their taboos.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Agreed. Once they've got it into their heads we're showing force, you can forget them signing any mining treaty.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. Scotty, you're in command. Bear in mind that the Klingons have been sighted in this sector. While we're negotiating down there, we don't want the Enterprise to become an incident up here.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. We'll keep on our toes.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Kirk, Spock, McCoy and one security guard beam down.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Halt! You are of the Earth vessel?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We come with open hearts and hands.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Grant
Text: A Klingon!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Grant, no!

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Too late. A Capellan kills him with a kligat.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't move a muscle.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3497.2. Planet Capella Four. The rare mineral topaline, vital to the life-support systems of planetoid colonies, has been discovered in abundance here. Our mission, obtain a mining agreement. But we've discovered a Klingon agent has preceded us to the planet. A discovery which has cost the life of one of my crewmen.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: I am unaware of any state of war between our peoples, Captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: Or is it your policy to kill Klingons on sight?
