Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was young, and inexperienced.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Does Maab know that the Klingons are our sworn enemies by their own words?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: We understand only that he also offers things of value for our rocks, and he has freely handed us his weapons and other devices. Will you do the same?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me call my ship and inform them

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: To bring down an attack upon their village? It is as I told you, Maab. Earthmen fear to bargain honestly.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Will you hand us your weapons?

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Phasers and communicators are thrown down at Maab's feet.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Traces of bedouin-style, with low furniture, plenty of furs and a metal brazier providing warmth and light. There are two guards outside.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So they keep their word scrupulously. They're unusually honest. Is that what I heard you say, Doctor?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I mentioned that.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: He also mentioned that they can be highly dangerous.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dangerous if lied to, if their customs are violated. We lied to no one, Doctor. We violated no customs. Perhaps you'll explain to me why one of my men is dead.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Because he was drawing a weapon on another of their guests.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Grant looked up, saw a Klingon, made a purely instinctive defensive move. What's a Klingon doing down here among your scrupulously honest friends anyway?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look, Jim. I know what it means to you to lose a crewman.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's only one down, Doctor. There's over four hundred more up there in orbit. And if there's a Klingon down here, there might be a Klingon ship up there somewhere.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Scott. I'm picking up something on the sensors, sir. Seems to be another ship.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, let's put it on the screen.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A small dot on the monitor above the science station.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's just at the edge of our sensor range, sir. Hard to get an exact reading.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You think it's a Klingon ship?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Who else would be playing cat and mouse with a starship? Well, they can't hurt us much out there, bobbing about like that. No need to call the captain yet.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I shouldn't have chewed you out. I'm sorry.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I understand.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Inefficient, however. Emotion, Captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you're quite right, Mister Spock. Inefficient and illogical.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A woman enters with a large bowl of fruit.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You've shown friendship by handing over our weapons. She's making a gesture in return.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: She offers Kirk a piece.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim! You touch it, her nearest male relative will have to try to kill you. They're offering you a chance for combat. They consider it more pleasurable than love.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Man
Text: Chur-ah.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would appear, Captain, that he finds you a disappointment.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A middle-aged man sits on a throne, surrounded by his guards.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: I am the teer Akaar. I lead the Ten Tribes of Capella.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A heavily pregnant woman enters and sits.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: And this is Eleen, a young wife to give an old man a son to rule these tribes.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk. First of all, I must protest the killing of my crewman.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: If it was your man, wasn't it his privilege to die for you? I do not understand.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Their customs are different, Teer.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: And different from those of my people, too, Teer. The sight of death frightens them.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let me take this, Jim. What Maab has said is true. Our customs are different. What the Klingon has said is unimportant, and we do not hear his words. I just called the Klingon a liar.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Laughter, Teer? Is not the Klingon an honoured guest also?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: It was the Earth people who first bargained for our rocks.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Is it not best to have two who bargain for the same goods?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: It is I who speak for the tribe, Maab.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: I speak for many, Teer. Hear the words of the Klingon.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: What do Earth men offer you? What have you obtained from them in the past? Powders and liquids for the sick? We Klingons believe as you do. The sick should die. Only the strong should live. Earthmen have promised to teach the youth of your tribes many things. What? What things? Cleverness against enemies? The use of weapons?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: The Klingon speaks the truth, Akaar.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Earth Federation offers one other thing, Akaar. Our laws. And the highest of all our laws states that your world is yours and will always remain yours. This differs us from the Klingons. Their empire is made up of conquered worlds. They take what they want by arms and force.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Good, good. Let the Klingons and the Earthmen offer us amusement. Capellans welcome this.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: The Earth men have different customs, but never have they lied to our people.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: There are those of us who won't bargain with Earthmen, Akaar.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: Do you say you will fight me, Maab?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Let that be your choice, Teer.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Maab, Kras and the Orange man leave.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We need our communicators, those devices on our belts. If there's a Klingon ship somewhere

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Akaar
Text: The sky does not interest me. I must consider the words I have heard.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Leave him.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The ship's disappeared, sir. Gone out of range.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, I'm getting a call from a vessel. It's so faint I can't make it out.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Put a booster on it, Lieutenant. Try to pull it in.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've lost it. It sounded like a distress signal from an Earth vessel.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: There is a big fight going on, and Kirk joins in when a Capellan comes to their tent. Maab and Akaar's factions are fighting each other. Kras takes the opportunity to search the landing party's tent.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Klingon! Communicators, weapons.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: I have no quarrel with you, Captain. I wish merely to return to my vessel.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: He grabs a knife and lunges at Kirk, who throws him easily and turns the weapon on the Klingon.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Type of vessel. Location.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: A small scout ship, Captain. We need the mineral, too. I was sent to negotiate.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Release him. (Kirk does so.) Akaar is dead. I am the teer.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: Kill them now.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wait. If you lead these people now, be certain you make the right decisions.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: Is the new leader of the Ten Tribes afraid? Let me kill him for you.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or let the Klingon and me fight. It might amuse you.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Perhaps to be a teer is to see in new ways. I begin to like you, Earthman, and I saw fear in the Klingon's eye.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: We had an agreement.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: That too may change, Klingon.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I have the signal clear now, Mister Scott. It is a distress call. It's from the SS Dierdre.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Dierdre? That's a freighter.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Reporting they're under attack. They're running, trying to manoeuvre. It's a Klingon vessel attacking.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Helm?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Picking it up, sir. Taking a fix.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Try the captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, Captain. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, Captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Eleen is brought in. One of Maab's guards trips her with his sword, and she burns her hand the brazier. Kirk moves to help, but

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, careful.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: You carry a child who would be teer.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: I must die.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Maab raises his knife, and Kirk pulls her away

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No!

Title: Friday's Child
Context: There's a fight. Starfleet loses.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: No man may touch the wife of a teer.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: She was prepared to die, Earthman.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: I was proud to obey the laws. Kill him first. He laid hands upon me. It is my right to see him die.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise to Mister Spock. Doctor McCoy, come in please.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I have it on the sensors, sir. Tie into my channel, Lieutenant.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Voice
Text: Commanding. We are under heavy attack by Klingon vessels. Two convoy ships are already damaged. We must have help. Enterprise, acknowledge. Please acknowledge. Repeat

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Interception course computed and laid in, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Prepare to take us out of orbit, Mister Sulu.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Scotty, the captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: We have a distress call from a Federation ship under attack. That's where our duty lies. Take us out of orbit, Mister Sulu. Ahead warp five.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3498.9. Lieutenant Commander Scott in temporary command.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: We were forced to leave Capella to aid a Federation vessel under attack by a Klingon vessel. We were unable to contact our landing party before we were forced to answer the distress signal. Our inability to reach the landing party is strange and I am concerned.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Eleen is with the three men, and the guards are now inside the doorway.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our check-in signal is one hour, twelve minutes overdue. Since no reconnaissance party has appeared, and since Mister Scott is notably efficient in such matters

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must assume that something's keeping them busy up there. The Klingon ship.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would seem a logical conclusion.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I'm going to fix that woman's arm. They can only kill me once for touching her.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a very good idea, Bones.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain, an excellent idea.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let me see that arm.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: You will not touch me.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: The guards are distracted by McCoy and Eleen, so Kirk and Spock overpower them while McCoy keeps her quiet.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Context: knife at her throat
Text: You said you're prepared to die. Does that mean you'd prefer to die? I think we can get you safely to the ship. Your choice. Bones.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: To live is always desirable.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Let's go.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Maab is sitting on his throne out in the fresh air as Kras paces near him.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Klingon. There's nothing to concern you there.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: We made an agreement, Maab. I have a right to my weapons.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Context: taking a disrupter from under his cloak
Text: We have them well cared for, Klingon. Your weapon will be returned when our business is completed. That was our agreement.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Approaching the freighter's last reported position, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sensor report, Mister Chekov.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Negative, sir. No debris, no residual particles, no traces.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu, begin a standard search pattern. All scanners full intensity, Mister Chekov. (to Uhura) No signal at all?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Negative, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It should be on our screens by now.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: At best, a freighter might travel warp two.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm well aware of a freighter's maximum speed, Mister Sulu.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3499.1. Before leaving the Capellan encampment, we managed to retrieve our communicators. Our phasers were not to be found. We've fled into the hills, yet we know the Capellans will eventually find us by scent alone, if necessary. And we've learned one thing more. The girl, Eleen, hates the unborn child she is carrying.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: It is, of course, a place with plenty of rocks and cliff faces.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with her, Bones. Nice place to get trapped in.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: But a defensible entrance, Captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I see. Scout up the trail that way. See what we have in the way of an exit. I'll take a look around.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now listen, you may be a Capellan woman and the widow of a high teer, but I'm a doctor, and it's my tradition to care for the sick and injured. Now, let me see that arm.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: She does, and he treats the burn. Meanwhile, Kirk spots the posse coming after them.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: McCoy scans Eleen's belly, then puts his hand on it.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: You will not touch me in that manner.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You listen to me, young woman. I'll touch you in any way or manner that my professional judgment indicates.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: She slaps his face, twice, so he slaps her in return.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just as I thought. It can come anytime now.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: How do you know?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Because I'm a doctor, that's how I know.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Even the women of our village cannot tell so much with a touch. Strange hand. Very soft.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Spock and Kirk meet up.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The walls get higher and narrower, but there is a way out.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. If we could block off that entrance, hold them off, it'd give us more time. They'd have to go around these hills.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is enough loose rock and shale.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you think we could create a sonic disruption with two of our communicators?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Only a very slight chance it would work.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if you don't think we can, maybe we shouldn't try.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I didn't say that exactly.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: The Capellans are getting close to the canyon entrance.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The sound beams should produce a sympathetic vibration on the weak area of that slide.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: The party is led by Maab, who senses something is wrong but keeps coming forward until the rock face explodes. Kras hides but other Capellans are crushed by the falling boulders. When the dust starts to clear, Kras takes the Federation phasers from a wounded Capellan then kills him with his own knife. The remaining members of the posse move on.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Worried about the delivery?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Capellans aren't human, Jim. They're humanoid. There's certain internal differences. I don't have equipment to handle an emergency.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if you don't think you can handle it

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Forget it. I can do it. The last thing I want around is a ham-handed ship's captain.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: They continue their climb up the canyon. It is steep and Eleen is struggling. Kirk goes to help.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No! Only McCoy.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's a cave in there. Probably the only shelter around here.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll need help getting her in there.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look, I'm a doctor, not an escalator! Spock, give me a hand!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No! I will allow only your touch.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: A vessel doesn't just disappear.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There's nothing, Mister Scott. All channels and frequencies are clear.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Chekov?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Nothing, sir. If it were destroyed, I'd pick up debris readings of some sort.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It couldn't have run away from us, sir. Not a freighter.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Chekov, pull the microtape on that distress call. I want it replayed.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Voice
Text: Commanding. We are under heavy attack by Klingon vessels. Two convoy ships are already damaged. We must have help.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Enterprise, acknowledge. Please acknowledge.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Did you hear it? They called us by name. Not a general distress signal, but one aimed right at us.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Wouldn't they normally call for the nearest starship?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: How would a freighter know we were ordered into this sector?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: A trap. We were diverted from the planet.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Or it could be an authentic distress call.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll stay long enough to make certain. Continue search pattern.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Continuing.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Dark, with convenient flat-topped rocks studding the smooth floor.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, you've got one of those magnesite-nitron tablets in your kit. Give me one.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just a minute. Let me get her on the rock. There you go.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Kirk puts the tablet on a rock and hits it with his knife. It bursts into flame and the whole cave is illuminated. Eleen is in pain.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No, no. Pain is here.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did you arrange to touch her, Bones, give her a happy pill?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No a right cross.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never seen that in a medical book.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's in mine from now on.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No, no. It's there. The The pain is there.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vegetation, Captain. Evidently there's water nearby.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, but we need weapons just as much as we need water, Spock.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: There would seem to be little weapon potential at hand.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Follow me.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No! McCoy!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Easy, easy. I'm here. Now you must want the child!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: No. Here, child belongs to husband.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So they take all the credit here. Poppycock! Answer me. Do you want my help? Answer me. Do you want my help? (she nods) All right. Say to yourself, The child is mine. The child is mine. It is mine!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Yes, it's yours.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, no. You've got it all wrong.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Yes, McCoy. It's yours.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. Say to yourself, The child is mine. It is mine. It is

Title: Friday's Child
Context: But she has made up her mind, and the child is coming anyway.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: He gives up and tests a bow they have made.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, this bark has suitable tensile cohesion.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean it makes a good bowstring.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe I said that.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A baby cries offscreen.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's more like it. Since the Capellans never developed the bow, this may come as big a surprise as gunpowder was on Earth.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: A beaming McCoy comes to summon the men back indoors.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: The new-born is proudly shown off by the Doctor, then handed to Spock, who has no idea how to cradle it.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, no, Mister Spock. You place this arm under here to support its back, and this hand here to support its head.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would rather, I would rather not. Thank you.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: McCoy. Bring our child.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our child?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll explain later.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: That should prove very interesting.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Still negative, Mister Scott. All sweeps.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Chekov?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Nothing.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're turning back. Warp five, Helm.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp five, sir. On course for Capella Four.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Warp 6 as soon as she'll take it, Mister Sulu. The captain could be in trouble back there.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, another distress call from the USS Carolina.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ignore it.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The Carolina is registered in this sector.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ignore it, Lieutenant. Log it as my order, my responsibility.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Scotty, if it should turn out to be real

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's an old, old saying on Earth, Mister Sulu. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I know this saying. It was invented in Russia. (he smirks to himself)

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Eleen knocks out the sleeping McCoy and leaves.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Atop the rocks, Kirk and Spock are keeping lookout for the Capellans when McCoy wakes.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim! Spock! Jim! Spock!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened, Bones?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My patient spattered me with a rock. She's gone.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The child?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's all right. It's in there. I guess I'll forget psychiatry, stick with surgery. I really thought she'd learned to want it.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Virtue is a relative term, Doctor. She'll head straight to the warriors.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll go with you.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, you took a medical oath long before you signed aboard my ship. That small patient in there needs you.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Estimating to planet?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Thirty one minutes, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Scott? Sensors picking up a vessel ahead, cutting across our path.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sub-light one half.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Reversing to sub-light, one half.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's an alien, sir. By configuration a Klingon warship. Taking position directly in our path.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu, sound battle stations.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: This is the USS Enterprise calling unidentified Klingon vessel. Come in. USS Enterprise calling Klingon vessel. Acknowledge, please.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I have it on the viewscreen now, sir. Still distant. Holding a position dead ahead, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Drawing a line, daring us to step over it.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Still closing. The alien's directly in our line of flight.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is the commander of the USS Enterprise. Identify yourself and your intention. Acknowledge. Close out the frequency, Lieutenant.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser banks are ready, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: And we'll go right down their throat, if necessary. Let's see if they have the belly for it.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Kirk and Spock are lying in wait for the Capellans, who are travelling single file. Maab stops the column and sends a scout ahead.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Keel
Text: Behind the rocks up there.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: The Earthmen make excellent game. Their cleverness has surprised me.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Context: slightly out of breath
Text: They must die. That is your law.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: We will honour our law, and our word to you, Klingon.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Keel
Text: Maab.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: The child is dead, Maab. Do as you will with me.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Keel
Text: The Earthmen?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Dead. I killed them as they slept.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: If true, take us to them.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Do you doubt my word, Klingon? I'm the wife of a teer. I will die in my own tent.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: It is in order. She is the wife of a teer. (Kras runs off.) No!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: First, we'll verify her story.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Is this what your sworn word means, Klingon?

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Kirk shoots an arrow into Kras' knee. A kligat is thrown, and Spock shoots the thrower. Kirk downs another. Eleen runs for the Klingon's phaser but he picks it up first and uses it to blast at Spock's hiding place.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Here, Captain. Over here, Captain. (into communicator as Kirk joins him.) Spock to Enterprise.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The cavalry doesn't come over the hill in the nick of time anymore.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: If by that you mean we can't expect help from the Enterprise, I must agree.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Naam.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: But Kras disintegrates him before he can throw his kligat

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's just one thing I want.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Klingon?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of us must get him.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Revenge, Captain?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kras
Text: The next man who raises a weapon destroys all of you. You and your primitive knives and your weapons, I'll teach you what killing really means.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Klingon!

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Eleen
Text: Fight! Are you warriors or children? Maab, I will flee. When the Klingon turns to fire, I'll

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Context: drawing his knife
Text: As teer of the Ten Tribes, I give you back your life. Mine is now forfeit. Keel, stand ready.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Maab walks forward, arms out to the side.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Maab
Text: Klingon!

Title: Friday's Child
Context: Kras disintegrates him, and Keel throws his kligat, killing Kras. The two factions gather at the body. Then a bunch of red-shirts run around the corner.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Hold it there. Drop your weapons.

Title: Friday's Child
Context: McCoy arrives carrying the baby, and Eleen goes to him.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We missed you, Mister Scott.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well sir, we had a wee bit of a run-in with a Klingon vessel, but he had no stomach for fighting. We checked the encampment, found out you were here, and had no trouble at all in tracking you down. I could

Title: Friday's Child
Context: He is interrupted by the baby crying.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, that's not the way to handle it. Here, like this. Here, take his little head like that. There, arm in a. That's it. See how easy? Oochy-woochy coochy-coo. Oochy-woochy coochy-coo.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oochy-woochy coochy-coo, Captain?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An obscure Earth dialect, Mister Spock. Oochy-woochy coochy-coo. If you're curious, consult linguistics.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, at any rate, this should prove interesting.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: When the woman starts explaining how the new high teer is actually Doctor McCoy's child.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's that again, Mister Spock?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't actually understand it ourselves, Mister Scott.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor does Doctor McCoy.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Oochy-woochy coochy-coo. Oochy-woochy coochy-coo.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Contact Starfleet. Inform them the Federation mining rights on Capella have been secured by treaty, documents signed by the young high chief's regent. Report follows.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The child's regent?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Eleen. Remarkable young lady.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Representing the high teer, Leonard James Akaar.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: The child was named Leonard James Akaar?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Has a kind of a ring to it, don't you think, James?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I think it's a name destined to go down in galactic history, Leonard. What do you think, Spock?

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think you're both going to be insufferably pleased with yourselves for at least a month, sir.

Title: Friday's Child
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take us out of orbit, Mister Sulu. Ahead warp factor one.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Here's the report on Pollux Five, Captain. This entire system has been almost the same. A strange lack of intelligent life on the planets. It bugs the percentages.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bugs the? Well, carry out the standard procedures on Pollux Four.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant, you look a bit tired this morning.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Well, I was up all night working on this report, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well in that case, there's nothing like a wee bit of coffee to get you back in shape. Join me, Carolyn?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: All right, Scotty. Just let me give this to Mister Spock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, could you get that excited over a cup of coffee?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Even from here I can tell his pulse rate's up.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Gentlemen. Come along, my dear.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not sure I like that, Jim.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, Bones? Scotty's a good man.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And he thinks he's the right man for her, but I'm not sure she thinks he's the right man. On the other hand, she's a woman. All woman. One day she'll find the right man and off she'll go, out of the service.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I like to think of it not so much losing an officer as gaining

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come along.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: He and Carolyn enter the turbolift.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Actually, I'm losing an officer.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Entering standard orbit around Pollux Four, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cartographic Detail, stand by.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Preliminary reports, Mister Spock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Pollux Four. Class M type planet, oxygen and nitrogen atmosphere. Sensors indicate no life forms. Approximate age four billion years. Judged no reason for contact. In all respects, quite ordinary, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cartographic Sections, implement standard orders.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All cartographic standards full automatic.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What in the name of?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Where there was originally an image of a nice blue and white planet there is now a .... hand?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis, Mister Spock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Momentarily.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Am I seeing things?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Not unless I am, too. Captain, that thing's a giant hand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Mister Spock? Is it a hand?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Not living tissue.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A trick, then? A projection?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not a projection, sir. A field of energy.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard about.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hard about. We can't seem to get away from it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's almost as if it means to grab us.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse all engines.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All engines reverse.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Everyone is thrown forward as the ship is grabbed by the hand and stopped in its tracks.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're dead still, Captain. Helm doesn't answer. We can't move.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3468.1. While approaching Pollux Four, a planet in the Beta Geminorum system, the Enterprise has been stopped in space by an unknown force of some kind.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, relay our position and circumstances to Starbase Twelve immediately.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu try rocking the ship. Full impulse power forward and back.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Damage report coming in, Captain. Situation under control. Minor damage, stations three, seven, and nineteen.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay reports five minor injuries, all being treated.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Mister Sulu?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Applying thrust, sir. No results, Captain. We're stuck tight.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Status.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ship is almost completely encircled by the field. It resembles a conventional force field but on unusual wavelengths. Despite its appearance, that of a human appendage, it is definitely not living tissue. It is energy.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Mister Sulu. Our forward tractor beams, adjust to repel.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Standing by.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ineffective, Captain. There doesn't seem to be anything to push against.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, a most curious development on scanner five seven.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's all take a look at it, Mister Spock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Screen on, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Now a face appears in space, a male human wearing a laurel wreath.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Activity on hailing channel three, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Put it on audio, Lieutenant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: The eons have passed and what has been written has come about. You are most welcome, my beloved children. Your places await you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Response frequencies, Lieutenant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Calculated. Channel open, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You have left your plains and valleys and made this bold venture. So it was in the beginning. You have made me proud. Now you can rest.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James T. Kirk, commanding the USS Enterprise. Please identify yourself.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: We shall remember together. We shall drink the sacramental wine. There shall be the music of the pipes. The long wait has ended.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you responsible for stopping the ship?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Yes. I caused the wind to withdraw from your sails.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give it back, then we'll talk.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: It has been five thousand years. Have you learned no patience in that time?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know who or what you are, but I must warn you we have the power to defend ourselves. If you value your safety, release this ship.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You have the same fire. How like your fathers you are. Agamemnon, Hector, Odysseus.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind the history lesson. Release the ship!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will obey me, lest I close my hand thus.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: External pressure building up, Captain. Eight hundred GSC and climbing.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Compensate.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: One thousand GSC and climbing. (The crew react to increasing air pressure) Becoming critical, Captain. We can't handle it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right! Whatever you're doing, turn it off! You win!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Pressure is gone, Captain. Space normal on hull.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: hat was your first lesson. Remember it. Captain Kirk, I invite you and your officers to join me. But do not bring that one, the one with the pointed ears. He is much like Pan, and Pan always bored me. No sad faces. This is a time to rejoice, not to fear. You are returning home. Let your hearts prepare to sing.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go, Bones. You in good voice?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sure it's wise, Jim?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we don't accept his invitation, we'll have a crushed eggshell where this ship used to be.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Verbose, isn't he?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Insulted, Spock?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Insults are effective only where emotion is present.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. We'll tackle him together. We already know the questions. You're the best man to find the answers.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Kirk, Scott, Chekov, McCoy and Lt Carolyn Palamas beam down into a lightly wooded area in front of a Greek temple.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tricorders.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: What am I doing down here, Doctor?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you're the A and A officer, aren't you? Archaeology, anthropology, ancient civilisations.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Correct.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're going to need help in all those areas.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Apollo is sitting on a throne, lyre by his feet

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: My children, long have I waited for this moment. The memories you bring of your lush and beautiful Earth, the green fields and blue skies, the simple shepherds and their flocks.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know of Earth? You've been there?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Once I stretched out my hand, and Earth trembled. And I breathed upon it, and spring returned.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mentioned Agamemnon, Hector, Odysseus. How do you know about them?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Search your most distant memories, those of the thousands of years past, and I am there. Your fathers knew me, and your father's fathers. I am Apollo.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And I am the tsar of all the Russias.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I'm sorry, Captain. I never met a god before.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you haven't yet. Readings, Doctor.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Simple humanoid, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Evidently not so simple.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Earth, mother of the most beautiful of women in the universe. That at least has not changed. I am pleased. Yes, my children. Zeus, Athena, Aphrodite, Artemis. A gallant band of travellers. We knew your Earth well, five thousand of your years ago.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. We're here at your invitation. Would you mind telling us what you want without all the Olympian generalities?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will not leave this place.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter room.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Your transportation device no longer functions.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise, come in.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I will not permit that device to work, either, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it you want?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will worship me, as your fathers did before you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you want to play god and call yourself Apollo, that's your business, but you're no god to us, Mister.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I said you would worship me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you've got a lot to learn!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: And so have you! Let the lesson begin! (Apollo grows as tall as his temple.) Welcome to Olympus, Captain Kirk.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Enterprise is still held by the hand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, I can't contact the landing party. All frequencies are jammed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Try to break through it, Lieutenant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Transporter and communications?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very efficient. Mister Sulu, rig all transmission circuits for maximum power generation. Compute for reversal of polarity of the field around the ship.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Working, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Kyle, I want a complete sensor scan of the planet.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Aye sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Locate all the lifeforms. I want to know what's going on down there.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: The giant Apollo suddenly looks weary, and vanishes.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To coin a phrase, fascinating.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis. Lieutenant Palamas, what do you know about Apollo?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Apollo, twin brother of Artemis, son of the god Zeus and Leto, a mortal. He was the god of light and purity. He was skilled in the bow and lyre.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And this thing? (the temple)

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Obviously he has some knowledge of Earth. His classical references and the appearance of all this.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think the appearance of this is for our benefit. Bones?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't say much till I check our these readings. He looks human, but of course that doesn't mean a thing.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Whatever he is, he seems to control a remarkable technology.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Power is what he controls. You can't do tricks like that without energy.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fine, but what power, and where is it? Scout around with your tricorders. Find the source of that power. Bones.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Scott, Chekov and Carolyn wander off.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I wonder if five thousand years ago

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have a theory?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have an idea. What if he is really Apollo?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Apollo is back on his throne.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I want from you that which is rightfully mine. Your loyalty, your tribute, and your worship.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: May I ask what you offer in exchange for this worship?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Life in paradise. As simple and as pleasureful as it was those thousands of years ago on that beautiful planet so far away.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apollo, we're willing to talk, but you'll find we don't bow to every creature who happens to have a bag of tricks.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Agamemnon was one such as you, and Hercules. Pride and arrogance. They defied me until they felt my wrath.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: I would like to point out that we are quite capable of some wrath ourselves.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have four hundred and thirty people on that ship up there.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: No, you do not, Captain. They are mine. To save, to cherish, or to destroy at my will.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: But why? What you've said so far makes no sense at all.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: How like Aphrodite and Athena. The beauty, grace. And you seem wise for a woman. What is your name?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Lieutenant Palamas.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I mean your name.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Carolyn.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Carolyn. Yes. You are beautiful. You would do Aphrodite credit. I will tell you a thousand tales, stories of courage and love. You will know what it is to be a goddess.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Leave her alone.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You protest? You risk much.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: And so do you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Scott draws his phaser and Apollo blasts it out of his hand with a point of his finger. Chekov finds his phaser doesn't work.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. (picks up the twisted and melted weapon) Very impressive. How'd you do it?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I've grown weary of discussion and argument.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the phasers. All the working parts are fused.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: None of your toys will function. Yes. You are a beauty. But like Artemis, the bow arm should be bare.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: He waves his hand and her clothes turn into Greek-style draperies, with her hair piled very tall.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Oh, it's beautiful.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Yes. Come. (he takes her hand and leads her away)

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: She's not going with you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Scott gets thrown over a table with a flick of the wrist.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: He shall learn the discipline of the temple. So shall you all. Come.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: It's all right, Captain. I'll go.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Without fear. She is fit indeed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: They both vanish as they walk away.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, how is he?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stunned but coming around. I'm not sure it's wise to let her go off like that.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He would have been rather difficult to stop.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You saw how capricious he is. Benevolent one minute, angry the next. One more wrong move from her and he could kill her.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, I think you'd better continue your investigation.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: leaves

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you feel, Scotty?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: I am tingling all over. Did he take her with him?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It would seem so.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've got to stop him. He wants her. The way he looks at her.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, I understand your concern over her, but she volunteered to go with him, hopefully to find out more about him. She's doing her job. I think it's about time you started doing yours. We've got to find out the source of his power. You've got a tricorder. Use it if you're able to.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm able, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And one more thing. I want no more unauthorised action against Apollo or whatever he is. That's an order!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Besides, you stiff-necked thistle head, you could have gotten yourself killed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: leaves

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty doesn't believe in gods.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apollo's no god. But he could have been taken for one, though, once. Say five thousand years ago, a highly sophisticated group of space travellers landed on Earth around the Mediterranean.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. To the simple shepherds and tribesmen of early Greece, creatures like that would have been gods.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Especially if they had the power to alter their form at will and command great energy. In fact, they couldn't have been taken for anything else.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready to reverse polarity, Mister Sulu?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Computed and standing by to generate, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Activate all units.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: The ship jolts several times, but

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No good, Mister Spock. We didn't even faze it. We're still locked tight.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cut power, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant, we must restore communications with the landing party.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm working, sir, but I can't do anything with this.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I might be able to rig up a subspace bypass circuit.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good. Do so. Sensor report, Mister Kyle.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: I've located the landing party, but one of them seems separated from the other four.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: And Apollo?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've just picked up readings for our own people, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock, here's something. There seems to be a radiated energy pulsation coming from the planet. I don't know what it is, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Origin?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't seem to pinpoint it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would suggest, Mister Sulu, if you cannot find out where the power source is, you should find out where it is not. A simple process of elimination.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The whole planet, sir? Yes, sir. The whole planet.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: At a marble bench by a tranquil water scene.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Oh, it's lovely.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I've known other women. Daphne, Cassandra, but none more beautiful than you. Are you frightened of me?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Frightened? No, I don't think so. Of course, a girl doesn't go walking with a

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: A god?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: All right, a god every day. What happened to the others? Artemis, Hera?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: They returned to the cosmos on the wings of the wind.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: You mean they died?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: No, not as you understand it. We're immortal, we gods. But the Earth changed. Your fathers changed. They turned away until we were only memories. A god cannot survive as a memory. We need love, admiration, worship, as you need food.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: You really think you're a god?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: In a real sense, we were gods. We had the power of life and death. We could have struck out from Olympus and destroyed. We have no wish to destroy, so we came home again. It was an empty place without worshippers, but we had no strength to leave, so we waited, all of us, through the long years.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: But you said the others didn't die.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Even for a god, there's a point of no return. Hera was first. She stood in front of the temple and spread herself upon the wind, thinner and thinner, until only the wind remained. But I knew you would come. You striving, bickering, foolishly brave humans. I knew you would come to the stars one day. Of all the gods, I knew and I waited, waited for you to come and sit by my side.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Even five thousand years ago, the gods took mortals to them to love, to care for, like Zeus took Leto, my mother. We were gods of passion, of love.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: They kiss.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: There is a repeated occurrence of registrations, a regular pulsating pattern of radiated energy.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Unquestionably, an immensely powerful field of energy is being generated around here somewhere. We're just having difficulty focusing on it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apollo has no difficulty focusing. He taps that energy, Mister Scott.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, some creatures can generate and control energy with no harm to themselves. The electric eel on Earth, the giant dry worm of Antos Four, the fluffy

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not the whole encyclopaedia, Chekov.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The captain requires complete information.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock's contaminating this boy, Jim.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you suggesting that he, Apollo, taps a flow of energy and channels it through his body?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That would seem most likely, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, I think you've earned your pay for the week. But where is the source of that power?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Number one on our list of things to do.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that all you have to offer?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, except my estimation for his physical condition. In spite of Apollo's bag of tricks, he comes up essentially normal with just a few variations. However, there's an extra organ in his chest that I can't even make a guess about.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, is it possible

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Apollo walks back in out of thin air.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Lieutenant Palamas?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: She is no longer of any concern to you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: You bloodthirsty Saracen, what have you done with her?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Scott picks up a statuette and rushes at Apollo. He gets another finger blast of electricity for his effort.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not good. Severe shock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, mister. You wanted worshippers? You've got enemies. You want us to bow down, you'll have to

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Kirk clutches his throat and falls to the ground, choking.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will learn discipline. You will learn

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Again, he suddenly becomes tired and vanishes.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Chekov, give me a hand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take care of Scotty.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Are you all right, Captain?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Apollo?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: He disappeared again like the cat in that Russian story.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you mean the English story, the Cheshire Cat?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Cheshire? No, sir. Minsk perhaps, but

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, all right, all right.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, there is something I noticed. Apollo looked very strange when he disappeared, tired or in pain. I don't know if it means anything.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good, Mister Chekov. That might very well mean something.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you feel?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't get my arm to move.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Some neural damage.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to get out of here.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: How?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, let's assume that five thousand years ago creatures like our friend Apollo did indeed visit Earth and form the basis of the Greek classic myths.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Makes sense.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Most mythology has its basis in fact. If I remember my ancient legends, the gods, after expending energy, required rest, even as we humans.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And Apollo's gone, after attacking you and Mister Scott. You think maybe he's off somewhere recharging his energy cells?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something like that. Remember, he's keeping a force field on the ship and he's expending energy down here. You said he looked pained and tired when he disappeared. If we can wear him out, overwork him, that might do it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The trouble with overworking him is that it can get us killed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we can provoke him so that he strikes one of us again, there's a chance that he'll be drained enough so the rest of us can jump him.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I still say it can get us killed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not all of us, Bones. When he comes back, it's a chance we'll have to take.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Uhura is underneath the communications station, doing some soldering.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Progress report.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm connecting the bypass circuit now, sir. It should take another half hour.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Speed is essential, Lieutenant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, I haven't done anything like this in years. If it isn't done just right, I could blow the entire communications system. It's very delicate work, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can think no one better equipped to handle it, Miss Uhura. Please proceed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. Right away.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Progress, Mister Sulu?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sectors one through twenty five charted and examined. No chance at all of power originating in those areas.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Continue the search.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir. Fourteen B by twenty six index.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Kyle.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're unable to break completely loose from this force field, but we might be able to punch some holes through it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: What for, sir?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: To shoot through. It might also relieve Lieutenant Uhura's communications problem. Take these equations to the nuclear electronics lab. I want them to work on the problem of negating the force field in selected areas. That might be done by generating a strong pinpoint charge of M-rays on some of these selected wave lengths and tying them in with the combined output of all our engines.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Right away, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Apollo reappears on his throne, Carolyn standing by his side.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Come here! I know you're trying to escape me. It's useless. I know everything you do. I tried to be compassionate toward your kind.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know nothing about our kind. You know only our remote ancestors who trembled before your tricks. Your tricks don't frighten us, neither do you. We've come a long way in five thousand years.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: But you're of the same nature. I could sweep you out of existence with a wave of my hand and bring you back again. I can give life or death. What else does mankind demand of its gods?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mankind has no need for gods. We find the one quite adequate.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: We shall not debate, mortal. I offer you eternal rest and happiness according to the ancient ways. I ask little in return, but what I ask for I insist upon. Approach me. (the four men turn their backs on him) I said approach me!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're busy. (quietly) Look after the girl.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will gather laurel leaves, light the ancient fires, kill a deer, make your sacrifices to me. Apollo has spoken!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go! Gather laurel leaves? You must be joking!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: All
Text: Ha ha ha ha.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Kill a deer. That's the funniest thing I ever heard.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, get back.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You shall reap the rewards of your insolence!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're tired of your phony fireworks!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Mortal, you have earned this!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: No, don't!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: A father doesn't destroy his children. You said you were gentle and understanding.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: How can they worship you if you hurt them?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Apollo, please. (taking his hand) You know so much of love. Please don't hurt them. Please.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I shall be lenient with you, for her sake. You will make plans to bring the rest of your people down. Be sure your artisans bring tools. You will need homes.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you will supply the herds of sheep, and the pipes we'll play, and the simple skins we'll wear for clothes.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: You will dismantle your ship for the supplies you need, and I'll crush its empty hull. I have been too patient. I shall be patient no longer.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: He disappears with Carolyn still holding his hand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've got to do something!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We were doing something until our brave lady stepped in and saved us.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Any more good ideas, Jim?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I have. One more. And it depends on the lieutenant's loyalty. If she fails us, we'd better get used to herding goats.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Fools. I offer them more than they could know. Not just a world, but all that makes it up. Man thinks he's progressed. They're wrong. He's merely forgotten those things which gave life meaning. You'll all be provided for, cared for, happy. There is an order of things in this universe. Your species has denied it. I come to restore it. And for you, because you have the sensitivity to understand, I offer you more than your wildest dreams have ever imagined. You'll become the mother of a new race of gods. You'll inspire the universe. All men will revere you almost as a god yourself. And I shall love you for time without end, worlds without end. You shall complete me, and I you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: She embraces him happily.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise, come in. Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Enterprise, come in. Kirk to

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Carolyn. What's happened to her?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, I'll find out.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Perhaps if I assisted.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How old are you?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Twenty two, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I'd better handle it. (goes over to a very satisfied looking woman) You all right?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Oh, yes, I'm all right. I have a message for you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come over there. Well?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: He wants us to live in peace. He wants to provide for us. He'll give us everything we ever wanted, and he can do it, too.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Lieutenant, you can come down from Mount Olympus now. You've got work to do.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He thrives on love, worship, attention.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Yes?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't give him that worship, none of us can. Especially you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: What?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spurn him. Reject him. You must. You're special to him.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Yes. I love him.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. All our lives, here and on the ship, depend on you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: No, not on me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On you, Lieutenant! Reject him, and we have a chance to save ourselves. Accept him, and you condemn all of us to slavery, nothing less than slavery. We might never get help this far out. Or perhaps the thought of spending an eternity bending knee and tending sheep appeals to you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Oh, but you don't understand. He's kind, and he wants the best for us. And he's so lonely. What you ask would break his heart. How can I?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give me your hand. Your hand. (she does) Now feel that. Human flesh against human flesh. We're the same. We share the same history, the same heritage, the same lives. We're tied together beyond any untying. Man or woman, it makes no difference. We're human. We couldn't escape from each other even if we wanted to. That's how you do it, Lieutenant. By remembering who and what you are. A bit of flesh and blood afloat in a universe without end. The only thing that's truly yours is the rest of humanity. That's where our duty lies. Do you understand me?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Yes. Yes, I understand. He's calling me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. You have your orders and your duty.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Yes, sir. My orders and my duty.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: She walks away slowly, looking back.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I think we can try it now, sir. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: The rest of the men gather to listen

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've pinpointed a power source on the planet's surface which seems to have something to do with the force field.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is there a structure of some sort near you?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is indeed, Mister Spock.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: The power emanates from there.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. How are you doing on the force field?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can negate sections of it, creating openings through which we can fire our phaser banks.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that ought to do it. Have Sulu lock all phaser banks onto the structure. Fire on my order only. Cut it fine. We'll be standing nearby.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: ]Bridge]

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. I would recommend a discreet distance.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd love to oblige you, Mister Spock, but we're not all together. Besides, we have Apollo to deal with.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If that structure is the source of his power, I want to know where he is when we attack it.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, do you think that mysterious organ in Apollo's chest could have something to do with the transmission of energy?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it doesn't serve any other purpose I know of.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've got to wait until Carolyn comes back before we fire on the temple. We don't know what would happen to her if he was suddenly attacked. She might get killed.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. I know. Scotty. We'll wait.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: There's some very passionate kissing going on.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I must say, Apollo, the way you ape human behaviour is remarkable, but there are some other things I must know. Your evolutionary patterns and your social development.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: My what?
