Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I'm sure they're unique. I've never encountered a specimen like you before.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I am Apollo. I've chosen you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I'm sure that's very flattering, but I must get on with my work now.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Your work?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: I'm a scientist. My particular specialty is ancient civilisations, relics, and myths. Surely you know I've only been studying you.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I don't believe it. You love me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Love you? Be logical. I'm not some simple shepherdess you can awe. Why, I could no more love you than I could love a new species of bacteria.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Carolyn! I forbid you to go. I order you to stay.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Carolyn
Text: Is that the secret of your power over women, the thunderbolts you throw?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: She walks away, and a strong wind begins to blow. Thunder rumbles.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What the devil is that?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Context: answers communicator
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors are picking up an atmospheric disturbance in your area.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by your phasers, Mister Spock. Prepare to fire on my signal. Kirk out.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've got to go and find her!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to be here when he comes back.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: But what if he doesn't. What if he

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, just hold on!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Carolyn falls to the ground in the strong winds, and a giant image of Apollo looms over her amid the lightning flashes.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. The temple is his power source. Let's bring him back to it. Get to cover. Mister Spock, fire those phasers.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you're too close.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire those phasers! That's an order, Mister Spock!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All phaser banks, fire!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: The white marble starts to glow pink under the phaser beams, and Apollo runs back.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: No! Stop! Stop, I say!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Enterprise shudders under his anger. There is no longer a hand holding the ship.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All phaser banks, maintain firing rate!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: More power to the shields.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Stop!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: Carolyn totters into view, and Scotty dashes to her.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Stop, I say! (the temple is now yellow) I command it!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Spock
Text: All banks maintain firing rate.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maintaining, sir.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Stop! Stop! Stop!

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: His lightning bolts end, and the temple dissolves into rubble. Scott helps Carolyn to her feet as Apollo walks around, surveying the ruins.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: I would have cherished you, cared for you. I would have loved you as a father loves his children. Did I ask so much?

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've out grown you. You asked for something we could no longer give.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Carolyn, I loved you. I would have made a goddess of you. I've shown you my open heart. See what you've done to me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: He becomes a giant.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Apollo
Text: Zeus, Hermes, Hera, Aphrodite. You were right. Athena, you were right. The time has passed. There is no room for gods. Forgive me, my old friends. Take me. Take me.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Context: And he disappears one last time. Carolyn cries.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wish we hadn't had to do this.

Title: Who Mourns For Adonais?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So do I. They gave us so much. The Greek civilisation, much of our culture and philosophy came from a worship of those beings. In a way, they began the Golden Age. Would it have hurt us, I wonder, just to have gathered a few laurel leaves?

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Kirk has just climbed up a ladder to this deck when McCoy exits the turbolift.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, Captain. Got a minute?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A minute.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's Spock. Have you noticed anything strange about him?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, nothing in particular. Why ?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it's nothing I can pinpoint without an examination, but he's become increasingly restive. If he were not a Vulcan, I'd almost say nervous. And for another thing, he's avoiding food. I checked and he hasn't eaten at all in three days.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That just sounds like Mister Spock in one of his contemplative phases.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Miss Chapel.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Context: carrying a tray and sounding embarrassed
Text: Doctor McCoy.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's this?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Oh.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh! Vulcan plomeek soup, and I'll bet you made it too. You never give up hoping, do you?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Well, Mister Spock hasn't been eating, Doctor, and I, I just happened to notice.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's all right. Carry on, Miss Chapel.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: She turns and rings the bell on Spock's quarters. The door opens and she enters.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I'm a busy man.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, when I suggested to Spock that it was time for his routine check-up, your logical, unemotional first officer turned to me and said, you will cease to pry into my personal matters, Doctor, or I shall certainly break your neck.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock said that?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is this?

Title: [Corridor]
Context: The door to his quarters opens and Chapel rushes out with a scream, just before the soup bowl hits the opposite wall.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Poking and prying! If I want anything from you, I'll ask for it!

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Everyone stops and stares as he come to his door.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I should like to request a leave of absence on my home planet. On our present course you can divert to Vulcan with a loss of but two point eight light days.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, what the devil is this all about?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have made my request, Captain. All I require from you is that you answer it. Yes or no.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Spock, let's have it.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is undignified for a woman to play servant to a man who is not hers.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm more interested in your request for shore leave. In all the years

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have my request, Captain. Will you grant it or not?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In all the years that I've known you, you've never asked for a leave of any sort. In fact, you've refused them. Why now?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, surely I have enough leave time accumulated.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Agreed, but that isn't the question, is it? If there's a problem of some sort, illness in the family

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. Nothing of that nature, Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then since we're headed for Altair Six, and since the shore facilities there are excellent

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No! I must. I wish to take my leave on Vulcan.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I'm asking you. What's wrong?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I need rest. I'm asking you to accept that answer.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge. Helm.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alter course to Vulcan. Increase speed to warp four.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I suppose most of us overlook the fact that even Vulcans aren't indestructible.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: He leaves.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. (looking at his shaking hand) We're not.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3372.7. On course, on schedule, bound for Altair Six via Vulcan. First Officer Spock seems to be under stress. He has requested and been granted shore leave. Ship surgeon McCoy has him under medical surveillance.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, something's coming in on the Starfleet channel. Priority and urgent, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on audio over here, Lieutenant.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message complete, sir. Switching over.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Starfleet
Text: To Captain, USS Enterprise from Starfleet Sector Nine. Inauguration ceremonies, Altair Six, have been advanced seven solar days. You are ordered to alter your flight plan to accommodate, by order of Komack, Admiral, Starfleet Command. Acknowledge.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, acknowledge that message.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, compute course and speed necessary for compliance.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Context: a bit of a Russian accent
Text: We'll have to head directly there at warp six, sir. Insufficient time to stop off at Vulcan.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Head directly for Altair Six. Sailor's luck, Mister Spock. Or, as one of Finagle's Laws puts it, 'Any home port the ship makes will be somebody else's, not mine'. The new president of Altair Six wants to get himself launched a week early, so we have to be there a week early. Don't worry. I'll see that you get your leave as soon as we're finished.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I quite understand, Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Kirk is resting in the dark when he has an idea.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge. Navigation.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Navigation. Chekov here.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, how late will we arrive for the ceremonies if we increase speed to maximum and divert to Vulcan just long enough to drop off Mister Spock?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't understand, Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How far behind schedule will diverting to Vulcan put us?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We're on course for Vulcan, Captain, as Mister Spock ordered.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Chekov. Kirk, out.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Come with me, please.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deck five. You've changed course for Vulcan, Mister Spock. Why?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Changed the course?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you deny it?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. No, by no means, Captain. It is quite possible.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why'd you do it?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I accept on your word that I did it, but I do not know why, nor do I remember doing it. Captain, lock me away. I do not wish to be seen. I cannot. No Vulcan could explain further.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm trying to help you, Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ask me no further questions. I will not answer.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I order you to report to the Sickbay.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sickbay?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Complete examination. McCoy's waiting.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock wanders in like a man in a dream.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come in, Spock. I'm all ready for you.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: My orders were to report to Sickbay, Doctor. I have done so. And now I'll go to my quarters.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My orders were to give you a thorough physical. In case you hadn't noticed, I have to answer to the same commanding officer that you do. Come on, Spock. Yield to the logic of the situation.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Examine me, for all the good it'll do either of us.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Sulu
Text: How do you figure it, Chekov? First we're going to Vulcan, then we're going to Altair, then we're headed to Vulcan again, and now we're headed back to Altair.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I think I'm going to get space sick.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you've got to get Spock to Vulcan.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I will, I will. As soon as this mission is

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No! Now. Right away. If you don't get him to Vulcan within a week eight days at the outside, he'll die. He'll die, Jim.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why must he die? Why within eight days? Explain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You keep saying that. Are you a doctor, or aren't you?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's a growing imbalance of body functions, as if in our bodies huge amounts of adrenalin were constantly being pumped into our bloodstreams. Now, I can't trace it down in my biocomps. Spock won't tell me what it is. But if it isn't stopped somehow, the physical and emotional pressures will simply kill him.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say you're convinced he knows what it is?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He does, and he's as tightlipped about it as an Aldebaran Shellmouth. No use to ask him, Jim. He won't talk.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock is staring at the picture of a young girl on his monitor, but switches it off when the doorbell buzzes.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay. McCoy has given me his medical evaluation of your condition. He says you're going to die unless something is done. What? Is it something only your planet can do for you? Spock! You've been called the best first officer in the fleet. That's an enormous asset to me. If I have to lose that first officer, I want to know why.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is a thing no out-worlder may know except those very few who have been involved. A Vulcan understands, but even we do not speak of it among ourselves. It is a deeply personal thing. Can you see that, Captain, and understand?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I do not understand. Explain. Consider that an order.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there are some things which transcend even the discipline of the service.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would it help if I told you that I'll treat this as totally confidential?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has to do with biology.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Biology.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What kind of biology?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan biology.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean the biology of Vulcans? Biology as in reproduction? Well, there's no need to be embarrassed about it, Mister Spock. It happens to the birds and the bees.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: The birds and the bees are not Vulcans, Captain. If they were, if any creature as proudly logical as us were to have their logic ripped from them as this time does to us. How do Vulcans choose their mates? Haven't you wondered?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I guess the rest of us assume that it's done quite logically.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. No. It is not. We shield it with ritual and customs shrouded in antiquity. You humans have no conception. It strips our minds from us. It brings a madness which rips away our veneer of civilisation. It is the pon farr. The time of mating. There are precedents in nature, Captain. The giant eelbirds of Regulus Five, once each eleven years they must return to the caverns where they hatched. On your Earth, the salmon. They must return to that one stream where they were born, to spawn or die in trying.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you're not a fish, Mister Spock. You're

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. Nor am I a man. I'm a Vulcan. I'd hoped I would be spared this, but the ancient drives are too strong. Eventually, they catch up with us, and we are driven by forces we cannot control to return home and take a wife. Or die.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I haven't heard a word you've said, and I'll get you to Vulcan somehow.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, get me Admiral Komack at Starfleet Command, Sector Nine. Pipe it down to McCoy's office.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Starfleet Command. Yes, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Sulu, you don't think

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maybe you ought to plot a course back for Vulcan, just in case.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock is playing his lyre when the intercom whistles.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Communication to Mister Spock. Lieutenant Uhura here. The captain asked me to

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Let me alone. Let me alone!

Title: [Corridor]
Context: He pounds his desk monitor into a pulp.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Komack
Text: Captain, you're making a most unusual request.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm aware of that, sir, but it's of the utmost importance. You must give me permission to divert to Vulcan.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Komack
Text: But you refuse to explain why it is so important.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't, sir, but believe me, I wouldn't make such a request

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Komack
Text: Altair Six is no ordinary matter. That area is just putting itself together after a long interplanetary conflict. This inauguration will stabilise the entire Altair system. Our appearance there is a demonstration of friendship and strength which will cause ripples clear to the Klingon Empire.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sir, the delay would be, at most, a day. I can hardly believe that

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Komack
Text: You will proceed to Altair Six as ordered. You have your orders. Starfleet out.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's that.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, it's not. I know the Altair situation. We would be one of three starships. Very impressive, very diplomatic, but it's simply not that vital.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't go off to Vulcan against Starfleet orders. You'll be busted

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't let Spock die, can I, Bones? And he will if we go to Altair. I owe him my life a dozen times over. Isn't that worth a career? He's my friend. Bridge. Navigation.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge. Navigation.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, lay in a course for Vulcan. Tell Engineering I want warp eight or better. Push her for all she'll take.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Nurse Chapel leaves Sickbay, beaming.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Course already plotted. Laying it in, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Very well. Carry on, Mister Chekov. Kirk, out.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock is lying on his bed, apparently asleep. Christine thinks about touching him and then goes to leave.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Miss Chapel.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, Mister Spock?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I had a most startling dream. You were trying to tell me something, but I couldn't hear you. It would be illogical for us to protest against our natures. Don't you think?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I don't understand.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your face is wet.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I came to tell you that we are bound for Vulcan. We'll be there in just a few days.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan. Miss Chapel.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: My name is Christine.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I know, Christine. Would you make me some of that plomeek soup?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Oh, I'd be very glad to do that, Mister Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is obvious that you have surmised my problem, Doctor. My compliments on your insight. Captain, there is a thing that happens to Vulcans at this time. Almost an insanity, which you would no doubt find distasteful.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will I? You've been most patient with my kinds of madness.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then would you beam down to the planet's surface and stand with me? There is a brief ceremony.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it permitted?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is my right. By tradition, the male is accompanied by his closest friends.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I also request McCoy accompany me.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I shall be honoured, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. We're standing by on Vulcan hailing frequencies, sir.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open the channel, Lieutenant. Vulcan Space Central, this is the USS Enterprise requesting permission to assume standard orbit.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Vulcan
Text: USS Enterprise from Vulcan Space Central. Permission granted. And from all of Vulcan, welcome. Is Commander Spock with you?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Vulcan
Text: Standby to activate your central viewer, please.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Nurse Chapel enters.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, what's going on?

Title: [Corridor]
Context: The viewscreen lights up with the image of a very beautiful woman.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: Spock, it is I.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: T'Pring, parted from me and never parted, never and always touching and touched. We meet at the appointed place.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: Spock, parted from me and never parted, never and always touching and touched. I await you.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: She's lovely, Mister Spock. Who is she?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: She is T'Pring. My wife.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: The trio have beamed down onto a very red planet. Sky, ground, all shades of hot orange-red. Spock leads them into an area marked out by stone structures.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the land of my family. It has been held by us for more than two thousand Earth years. This is our place of Koon-ut-kal-if-fee,

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He called it Koon-ut what?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He described it to me as meaning marriage or challenge. In the distant past, Vulcans killed to win their mates.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And they still go mad at this time. Perhaps the price they pay for having no emotions the rest of the time.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's lovely. I wish the breeze were cooler.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah. Hot as Vulcan. Now I understand what that phrase means.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The atmosphere is thinner than Earth.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock strikes a gong.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder when his T'Pring arrives.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: The marriage party approaches. I hear them.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Marriage party? You said T'Pring was your wife.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: By our parents' arrangement. A ceremony while we were but seven years of age. Less than a marriage but more than a betrothal. One touches the other in order to feel each other's thoughts. In this way our minds were locked together, so that at the proper time, we would both be drawn to Koon-ut-kal-if-fee.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: A jingling sound gets louder, and Spock strikes the gong again. Two men enter shaking contraptions with lots of bells, followed by a woman carried on a chair. T'Pring and others come behind her.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, you know who that is? T'Pau. The only person to ever turn down a seat on the Federation Council.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: T'Pau. Officiating at Spock's wedding?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He never mentioned that his family was this important.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: T'Pau's chair is placed on a dais, and Spock greets her. She gives him a quick mind-meld.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Spock, are our ceremonies for outworlders?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are not outworlders. They are my friends. I am permitted this.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: She gestures for them to approach.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Kirk.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ma'am.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: And thee are called?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Leonard McCoy, ma'am.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Thee names these out worlders friends. How does thee pledge their behaviour?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: With my life, T'Pau.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: What they are about to see comes down from the time of the beginning, without change. This is the Vulcan heart. This is the Vulcan soul. This is our way. Kah-if-farr.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Spock is about to strike the gong again, when T'Pring intervenes.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: Kal-if-fee!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it? What happened?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: She chooses the challenge.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: pointing at T'Pau's bodyguard
Text: With him?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: He acts only if cowardice is seen. She will choose her champion.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Do not attempt to speak with him, Kirk. He is deep in the plak-tow, the blood fever. He will not speak with thee again until he has passed through what is to come. If thee wishes to depart, thee may leave now.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll stay.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Spock chose his friends well.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ma'am, I don't understand. Are you trying to say that she rejected him? That she doesn't want him?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: He will have to fight for her. It is her right. T'Pring, thee has chosen the kal-if-fee, the challenge. Thee are prepared to become the property of the victor?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: I am prepared.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Spock, does thee accept the challenge according to our laws and customs?

Title: [Corridor]
Context: A single nod. T'Pring looks at the young man who followed her in.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Think Spock can take him?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I doubt it. Not in his present condition.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: T'Pring, thee will choose thy champion.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: As it was in the dawn of our days, as it is today, as it will be for all tomorrows, I make my choice. This one.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: She steps past the expectant Stonn and points at Kirk.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Stonn
Text: No! I am to be the one. It was agreed.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Be silent.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Stonn
Text: Hear me. I have made the ancient claim. I claim the right. The woman is

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Kroykah!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Stonn
Text: I ask forgiveness.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Kirk? T'Pring is within her rights, but our laws and customs are not binding on thee. Thee are free to decline with no harm on thyself.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: T'Pau.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Thee speaks?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: My friend does not understand.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: The choice has been made, Spock. It is up to him now.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: He does not know. I will do what I must, T'Pau, but not with him! His blood does not burn. He is my friend!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: It is said thy Vulcan blood is thin. Are thee Vulcan or are thee human?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I burn, T'Pau. My eyes are flame. My heart is flame. Thee has the power, T'Pau. In the name of my fathers, forbid. Forbid! T'Pau. I plead with thee! I beg!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Thee has prided thyself on thy Vulcan heritage. It is decided.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happens to Spock if I decline?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Another champion will be selected. Do not interfere, Kirk. Keep thy place.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't do it, Jim.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. She said their laws and customs were not binding on you.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you said Spock might not be able to handle him. If I can knock Spock out without really hurting him

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In this climate? If the heat doesn't get you, the thin air will. You can't do it!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I get into any trouble, I'll quit. And Spock wins, and honour is satisfied.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, listen, if you

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. He's my first officer and my friend. I disregarded Starfleet orders to bring him here. Another thing, that's T'Pau of Vulcan. All of Vulcan in one package. How can I back out in front of her?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: It is done. Kirk, decide.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I accept the challenge.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Here begins the act of combat for possession of the woman, T'Pring. As it was at the time of the beginning, so it is now. Bring forth the lirpa.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: They are presented with wicked-looking half moon blades set in a wooden shaft, with a counterweight at the other end.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: If both survive the lirpa, combat will continue with the ahn woon.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean, if both survive?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: This combat is to the death.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now wait a minute, ma'am. Who said anything about a fight to the death?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: These men are friends. To force them to fight until one of them is killed

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: I can forgive such a display only once. Challenge was given and lawfully accepted. It has begun. Let no one interfere.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: And so the fight begins, first with a trial of brute strength, then a good swing by Spock slices open Kirk's tunic and cuts his chest. It is clear that the first officer will kill his captain, given the chance. When Kirk is down and unarmed, Spock goes in for the final blow.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock! No!

Title: [Corridor]
Context: And Kirk rolls away just in time, then disarms Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Kroykah!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is this Vulcan chivalry? The air's too hot and thin for Kirk. He's not used to it.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: The air is the air. What can be done?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: holding up a hypo
Text: I can compensate for the atmosphere and the temperature with this. At least it'll give Kirk a fighting chance.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Thee may proceed.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're going to have to kill him, Jim.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kill Spock? That's not what I came to Vulcan for, is it? What's that?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a tri-ox compound. It'll help you breathe. Now be careful!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sound medical advice.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: The ahn woon.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: The bells sound, and both men are given long straps with weights and tassels on the ends. Spock demonstrates it use by lassoing Kirk's legs and knocking him down with it before holding it in the middle to use first as a flail, and finally to strangle his opponent.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Kroykah!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MCCOY; Get your hands off of him, Spock! He's finished. He's dead.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: I grieve with thee.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Enterprise.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise. Lieutenant Uhura here.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Have the transporter room stand by to beam up the landing party. (ends communication) As strange as it may seem, Mister Spock, you're in command now. Any orders?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I'll follow you up in a few minutes. You will instruct Mister Chekov to plot a course for the nearest Starbase where I must surrender myself to the authorities. (the sound of a transporter off screen) T'Pring. Explain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: Specify.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why the challenge, and why you chose my captain as your champion.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: Stonn wanted me, I wanted him.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see no logic in preferring Stonn over me.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: You have become much known among our people, Spock. Almost a legend. And as the years went by, I came to know that I did not want to be the consort of a legend. But by the laws of our people, I could only divorce you by the kal-if-fee. There was also Stonn, who wanted very much to be my consort, and I wanted him. If your Captain were victor, he would not want me, and so I would have Stonn. If you were victor you would free me because I had dared to challenge, and again I would have Stonn. But if you did not free me, it would be the same. For you would be gone, and I would have your name and your property, and Stonn would still be there.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logical. Flawlessly logical.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pring
Text: I am honoured.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stonn. She is yours. After a time, you may find that having is not so pleasing a thing after all as wanting. It is not logical, but it is often true. Spock here. Stand by to beam up. Live long, T'Pau, and prosper.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: T'Pau
Text: Live long and prosper, Spock.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall do neither. I have killed my captain and my friend. Energize.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I shall be resigning my commission immediately, of course.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: So I would appreciate your making the final arrangements.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, please, let me finish. There can be no excuse for the crime of which I'm guilty. I intend to offer no defence. Furthermore, I shall order Mister Scott to take immediate command of this vessel.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you think you better check with me first?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain! Jim!

Title: [Corridor]
Context: There's a big, big grin across his face, which fades when McCoy and Chapel's own smiles are noticed

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm pleased to see you, Captain. You seem uninjured. I am at something of a loss to understand it, however.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Blame McCoy. That was no tri-ox compound he shot me with. He slipped in a neural paralyser. Knocked me out, simulated death.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse, would you mind, please?

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Chapel leaves in a slight huff.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, what happened down there? The girl? The wedding?

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ah, yes, the girl. Most interesting. It must have been the combat. When I thought I had killed the captain, I found I had lost all interest in T'Pring. The madness was gone.

Title: [Corridor]
Context: Intercom whistle

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk. Message from Starfleet Command, top priority.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Relay it, Lieutenant.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Response to T'Pau's request for diversion of Enterprise to planet Vulcan

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hereby approved. Any reasonable delay granted. Komack, Admiral, Starfleet Command.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, a little late, but I'm glad they're seeing it our way. How about that T'Pau? They couldn't turn her down. Mister Chekov, lay in a course for Altair Six. Leave orbit when ready. Kirk out.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's just one thing, Mister Spock. You can't tell me that when you first saw Jim alive that you weren't on the verge of giving us an emotional scene that would have brought the house down. .

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Merely my quite logical relief that Starfleet had not lost a highly proficient captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. I understand.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course, Mister Spock, your reaction was quite logical.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Doctor.

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In a pig's eye!

Title: [Corridor]
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Spock. Let's go mind the store.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Plenty of security around, and a blonde woman instead of Uhura at communications.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: The distress call definitely came from one of the solar systems in this sector.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you pinpoint it any closer, Lieutenant?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Negative. It was so badly garbled all we got was the name Constellation, then we lost it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, we're now within the limits of System L-370, but I can't seem to locate

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, sensors show this entire solar system has been destroyed. Nothing left but rubble and asteroids.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But that's incredible. The star in this system is still intact. Only a nova could destroy like that.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nonetheless, Captain, sensors show nothing but debris where we charted seven planets last year.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue a search pattern.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Later.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Entering limits of System L-374, sir. Scanners show the same evidence of destruction.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Every solar system in this sector blasted to rubble and still no sign of the Constellation. Matt Decker's in command. What could have happened to him?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the two inner most planets of this system appear to be intact.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Sir, I'm picking up a ship's disaster beacon.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to raise it, Lieutenant.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have it on the sensors, Captain. By configuration, a starship stopped in space. She appears to be drifting.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: No answer, Captain. All I get is the automatic beacon.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors not recording normal energy output.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Approach course, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: They arrive at a ship hanging crookedly in space. It looks identical to Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's the Constellation. Look at that.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: She may have been wrecked by whatever destroyed these solar systems.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She was attacked. Red alert! Red alert! Man your battle stations!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Red alert. Red alert. Man your battle stations.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All phaser banks manned and ready, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. Initiate a full sensor scan of the immediate area for any other vessel.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Palmer.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: I can't raise the Constellation, sir. I'm still getting the distress beacon, but there's heavy subspace interference. It's almost blocking the signal.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep trying. Mister Spock, full evaluation of the damage to the Constellation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: All power plants dead, reserve energy banks operative at a very low power level.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Life support systems?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Also operative at a low power level. The entire Bridge is damaged and uninhabitable. The rest of the ship seems able to sustain life.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Radiation levels?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Normal, but subspace interference makes readings difficult.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No other vessels in the area, Captain. All scanners show clear.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands, go to Yellow Alert. Stand by battle stations. Lieutenant, have Doctor McCoy, Mister Scott, and a damage control party report to me in the transporter room.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're going to board her. Mister Spock, you're in command.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The name ship for the Constellation-class is a mess, with chunks blown out of her nacelles and saucer. Inside, pipes are hanging down, twisted.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: Radiation level normal. Atmospheric pressure eleven pounds per square inch.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Filtration systems are out, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: The whole communication system looks to be shorted out, too, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, check the phaser banks. See if they've been fired. Bones, you come with me.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come along, lads.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: They head down a ladder while McCoy and Kirk walk off.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: What a mess.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No clutter, no half-empty cups of coffee. Whatever happened didn't happen without a warning.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: What do you think did it, sir?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, lad. But I want a full structural and control damage check, and I'm going to have a look at those engines.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The crew wasn't abducted, they just left. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise, Spock here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No survivors, no bodies either.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it possible they could have beamed down to one of the two planets?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Improbable, Captain. The surface temperature of the inner planet is that of molten lead. The other has an atmosphere poisonous to human life.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll continue our search. Kirk out.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Scott returns to the beam-in point.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I've checked the engines. The warp drive is a hopeless pile of junk. The impulse engines are not too badly off. We ought to be able to do something with them.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser banks?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Exhausted. They didn't give up without a battle.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But where are they? I can't imagine a man like Matt Decker abandoning ship while his life support systems were still operative.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Computer system is still intact. We can playback the duplicate Captain's Log from the auxiliary control room.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: They head off, then Kirk spots a man at a desk in a room.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The man is conscious but dazed, stunned.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt. Matt, it's Jim Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Commodore? Commodore Decker? (he injects him)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt? Matt.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Kirk. It's Jim Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to your ship, Matt?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: A ship. Attacked. That, that thing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What thing? What was it?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: That

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Answer me! What was it? What happened, Matt?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, give him a minute. He's in a state of shock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready with the duplicate log, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4202.1. Exceptionally heavy subspace interference still prevents our contacting Starfleet to inform them of the destroyed solar systems we have encountered. We are now entering system L-374. Science Officer Masada reports the fourth planet seems to be breaking up. We are going to investigate.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The fourth planet. Only two left now. Scotty, pull the microtapes from the sensor memory banks and beam them aboard to Spock. I want a full analysis, a complete report of what happened when they went in on that planet.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: We tried to contact Starfleet. No one heard. No one! We couldn't run.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to your crew?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Oh, I had to beam them down. We were dead. No power, our phasers useless. I stayed behind, the last man. The Captain, the last man aboard the ship. That's what you're supposed to do, isn't it? And then it hit again and the transporter went out. They were down there, and I'm up here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What hit? What attacked you?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: They say there's no devil, Jim, but there is. Right out of hell, I saw it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt, where's your crew?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: On the third planet.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is no third planet.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Don't you think I know that? There was, but not anymore. They called me. They begged me for help, four hundred of them. I couldn't. I couldn't. (breaks down in tears)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, Washburn has our report.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: We made a complete check on structural and control damage, sir. As far as we can tell, something crashed through the deflectors and knocked out the generators. Somehow the antimatter in the warp drive pods has been deactivated.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deactivated? Scotty, could some kind of general energy dampening field do that, and would the same type of thing account for the heavy subspace interference?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, that all adds up. But what sort of a thing could do all that?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: If you'd seen it, you'd know. The whole thing's a weapon. It must be.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What does it look like?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Well, it's miles long, with a maw that could swallow a dozen starships. It destroys planets, chops them into rubble.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, an alien ship? Or is it alive, or is it

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Both or neither. I don't know.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt, your log stated that the fourth planet was breaking up. You went in to investigate.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: We saw this thing hovering over the planet, slicing out chunks of it with a force beam.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you run a scanner check on it? What kind of a beam?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Pure antiproton. Absolutely pure.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Context: answers communicator
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unable to raise Starfleet Command due to heavy subspace interference.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attempting to remedy.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the Constellation's tapes?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: She was attacked by what appears to be essentially a robot, an automated weapon of immense size and power. Its apparent function is to smash planets to rubble and then digest the debris for fuel. It is, therefore, self-sustaining as long as there are planetary bodies for it to feed on.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A robot weapon that purposely destroys entire solar systems. Why?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. However, Mister Sulu has computed the path of the machine, using the destroyed solar systems as a base course. Projecting back on our star charts, we find that it came from outside, from another galaxy.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is the projected course of this thing?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: If it follows its present path, it will go through the most densely populated section of our galaxy.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Stand by, Mister Spock. Kirk out.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This whole thing's incredible. A robot? A machine like that, who would build it?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't know. An alien race, apparently from another galaxy.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But why?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, did you ever hear of a doomsday machine?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. I'm a doctor, not a mechanic.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a weapon built primarily as a bluff. It's never meant to be used. So strong, it could destroy both sides in a war. Something like the old H-Bomb was supposed to be. That's what I think this is. A doomsday machine that somebody used in a war uncounted years ago. They don't exist anymore, but the machine is still destroying.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Oh, forget about your theories! That thing is on the way to the heart of our galaxy. What are you going to do about it?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take it easy.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The first thing we're going to do is get you back to the Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Oh, no, I stay here. I'm not leaving my ship!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no ship to leave. It's a dead hulk! We'll take her in tow. I'll stay onboard and get her ready. You go back to the Enterprise with the doctor and let him help you.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: It's just that I, I, I never lost a command before.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Have the transporter room beam Doctor McCoy and Commodore Decker on board immediately.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: As Kyle beams them aboard, Spock's impassionate voice can be heard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Red alert! Red alert!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: It came up on us fast, Captain, but we seem able to maintain our distance.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're blind here. What's it look like?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Decker and McCoy enter. The viewscreen shows a thing with a big yellow maw, that tapers down along it's body to a pointed tail.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: It looks very much like Commodore Decker's planet killer. And it is pursuing us. (The viewscreen now shows it head-on. A round opening with a small sun partway down the gullet.)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are more manoeuvrable, but it is gaining on us. Sensors indicate some kind of total conversion drive.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: No evidence of life, subspace interference level incredibly high.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever it is, we can't let it go beyond us to the next solar system. We have to stop it. If it's a robot, what are the chances of deactivating it?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say none, Captain. The energy generated by our power nacelles seems to attracts it. I doubt we could manoeuvre close enough without drawing a direct attack upon ourselves.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: I also believe the nature of this machine precludes the possibility of easy access to its control mechanisms.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's closing on us, Mister Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Closing, Captain.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Lower your deflector screens Long enough to beam us aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter Room, stand by to beam landing party aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Ready to beam, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: But the monster fires a ray at them, everyone goes flying and smoke comes out of a transporter pad.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evasive action, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Damage report, all stations.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Mister Spock, the transporter's out.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affect repairs. Captain Kirk, come in please.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we've been attacked. The transporter is damaged. We're taking evasive action.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Mister Spock, communication's damaged. We're unable to override interference.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Damage in communications, Captain. Interference will (static)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock? Spock? Come in, Spock. Spock? We're stuck, blind, and deaf.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: And paralysed. No power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we just can't stand around while our ship is being attacked. Scotty, you've got to get me some manoeuvering power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't repair warp drive without a spacedock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then get me impulse power. Half-speed, quarter-speed, anything. If we get this hulk moving, maybe we can do something.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, the impulse engines are still in fair shape. I might coax them.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then get moving.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come on, lad.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Washburn, you get in there. Let's see what we can do about this viewing screen. I've got to find out what's happening out there.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No casualties, Mister Spock. How are we doing?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have outrun it, Doctor.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Status report.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impulse and warp engines operative, transporter and communications under repair. Random chance seems to have operated in our favour.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In plain, non-Vulcan English, we've been lucky.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe I said that, Doctor.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's veering off, back on course for the next solar system. The Rigel colony, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently programmed to ignore anything as small as a ship beyond a certain radius. We'll maintain a discreet distance and circle back to pick up the Captain.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You can't let that reach Rigel. Why, millions of innocent people would die.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am aware of the Rigel system's population, Commodore, but we are only one ship. Our deflector shields are strained, our subspace transmitter is useless. Logically, our primary duty is to survive in order to warn Starfleet Command.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Our primary duty is to maintain life and safety of Federation planets. Do you deny that?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, you will lay in an evasive course back to the Constellation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Belay that last order, helmsman. One hundred and eighty degree turn, hard about. We're going to attack.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The whole Bridge holds its breath.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You will carry out my last order, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Mister Spock, I'm officially notifying you that I'm exercising my option under regulations as a Starfleet Commodore, and that I am assuming command of the Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have the right to do so, but I would advise against it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: That thing must be destroyed.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You tried to destroy it once before, Commodore. The result was a wrecked ship and a dead crew.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I made a mistake then. We were too far away. This time I'm going to hit it with full phasers at point-blank range.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors show the object's hull is solid neutronium. A single ship cannot combat it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Mister Spock, that will be all. You have been relieved of command. Don't force me to relieve you of duty as well.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't let him do this, Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Doctor, you are out of line.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So are you, sir. Well, Spock?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, Starfleet Order 104, Section B, leaves me no alternative. Paragraph 1A clearly states

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To blazes with regulations! You can't let him take command when you know he's wrong!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you can certify Commodore Decker medically or psychologically unfit for command, I can relieve him under Section C.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll certify that right now.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll also be asked to produce your medical records to prove it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, you know I haven't had time to run an examination on him.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then your statement would not be considered valid.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You may leave the Bridge, Doctor.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What about the Captain? We can't leave

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Doctor, you may leave the Bridge.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, do something!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Mister Spock knows his duty under regulations, Doctor. Do you? (McCoy leaves) Hard about, helmsman. Course thirty two degrees, mark ten. Deflectors at full power. Ready on main phaser banks.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Spock stands completely still, like a statue, as Enterprise arrives back at the planet-killer.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Kirk is trying to mend the viewscreen, but just making smoke and spluttering noises.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, the impulse engines' control circuits are fused solid.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the warp drive control circuits?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, we can cross-connect the controls, but it'll make the ship almost impossible for one man to handle.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You worry about your miracles, Scotty, I'll worry about mine. Get to work.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Washburn, try the 2G6 circuit.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Closing fast.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflector shields at full power. They can't take much more of this.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Helmsman, hold your course. Stand by all phaser banks.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The planet killer fires at them.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflectors holding, but weakening. We must retreat, Commodore. The energy drain

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I'm in command here, Mister Spock. Maintain your course, helmsman. Get us in closer.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready to give it a try?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: Just one minute, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, how you doing?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Controls are all hooked up, sir. We should have some power for you soon.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: Try it now, Captain.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think (an image of tiny Enterprise and the giant planet killer comes on screen) What the devil's going on?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Fire!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Two phaser beams strafe the machine's body.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Direct hit. It just bounced off.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore, I urgently recommend immediate withdrawal.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Recommendation noted. Maintain course. Fire!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in. Enterprise, come in. Mister Spock, come in. Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty, where's that power?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Coming, sir. If I push these impulse engines too hard in the condition they're in, they'll blow apart.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Washburn, get down to Engineering. Assist Mister Scott.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Washburn
Text: Aye, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, push it right to the edge. This ship has got to manoeuver.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Another blast from the machine.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Sir, deflector shields are gone.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Context: to Spock) Sir, Deck seven reports power failure in main energisers. Implementing emergency procedures. (another hit
Text: Severe casualties reported on decks three and four. Damage control party sealing off inner hull rupture.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has ceased fire. We're being held in a tractor beam. We're being pulled inside, Commodore. You must veer off.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Maintain phaser fire, helmsman.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have lost warp power. If we don't break the tractor beam within sixty seconds, we never will.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: But don't you understand? We've got to destroy it!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: That, sir, is illogical. It is suicide. Attempted suicide would be proof that you are psychologically unfit for command. If you don't veer off, I shall relieve you on that basis.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Veer off.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Emergency impulse power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We can't break loose!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; We need more power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We haven't got it. We're being pulled inside.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Kirk sees Enterprise approach the planet-killer's 'mouth'.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, give me that power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: You've got it, Captain. Just enough to move us. I can't do better.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That'll do. Full ahead, Mister Scott.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: A sudden jolt as Constellation overcomes inertia.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's it, Mister Scott. Keep that power coming.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Full power astern.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir. We still can't move.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep pouring it on, Scotty.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I still don't know what we're doing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're moving, the Enterprise isn't. Maybe that thing will see us and let the Enterprise go. If I only had some phasers.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Phasers? You've got 'em. I have one bank recharged.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you've just earned your pay for the week. Stand by. Fire phasers.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: One beam lances out, and the monster turns.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're loose, Commodore.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Good boy, Jim. Between the two of us, we'll kill that thing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, it worked. Great. (sees that maw turning towards them) I think it's great. Scotty, get us out of here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's closing fast on the Constellation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore, I suggest

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Kirk pulled us out of there by distracting it. Now it's our turn. Fire phasers. (they do) We did it! Hard about. Give me some distance.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're moving away, Commodore.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: This machine seems to have a programmed defensive sphere. Any energy source entering that field is subject to attack.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Mister Spock, status report.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Warp drive and deflectors will be out for a solar day. Repairs proceeding on transporter and communications.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's closing with us again, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Maintain speed and distance.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's sucking in space rubble from those destroyed planets. Refueling itself.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can maintain this speed for only seven hours before we exhaust our fuel, but it can refuel itself indefinitely.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Then we'll have to fight it now before it gets any stronger.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Illogical. We cannot destroy it. Therefore, we cannot save Rigel. We must transport the Captain and the others from the Constellation and escape this thing's subspace interference in order to warn Starfleet Command.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Mister Spock, we've pierced the interference locally.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can you raise Starfleet?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: No, sir, but I've got ship-to-ship communications back. Picking up Captain Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: On audio, Lieutenant.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise. Enterprise, come in.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Mister Spock, I am still in command. I will speak for this ship. Enterprise to Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Commodore Decker speaking.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt. What's going on? Give me Mister Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I'm in command here, Jim.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to Spock?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Nothing. I assumed command according to regulations

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Since your first officer was reluctant to take aggressive action against the

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK You mean you're the lunatic who's responsible for almost destroying my ship?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You are speaking to a senior officer, Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give me Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I told you, I am in command here, according to every rule in the book, Captain. Anything you have to say at all, you will say to me.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's only one thing I want to say to you, Commodore. Get my ship out of there.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, ship status.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Down here. (the arm of the Captain's chair)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Warp drive out. Deflector shields down. Transporter under repair. We are on emergency impulse power.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long to repair warp drive?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: At least one solar day.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: At our present rate of consumption, we'll exhaust our impulse power long before then.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's gaining on us, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take evasive action, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I told you, I am in command here and I will give the orders, Captain. We're going to turn and attack.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not with my ship, you don't.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, relieve Commodore Decker immediately. That's a direct order.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You can't relieve me and you know it. According to regulations

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Blast regulations! Mister Spock, I order you to assume command on my personal authority as Captain of the Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore Decker, you are relieved of command.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I don't recognise your authority to relieve me.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You may file a formal protest with Starfleet Command, assuming we survive to reach a Starbase. But you are relieved. Commodore. I do not wish to place you under arrest.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You wouldn't dare. (Spock signals the guards forward) You're bluffing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcans never bluff.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: No. No, I don't suppose that they do. Very well, Mister Spock. The Bridge is yours.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I have assumed command.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Now, Mister Spock

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: One moment, sir. Commodore. I believe you are scheduled for medical examination. Mister Montgomery.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Montgomery
Text: Sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You will accompany the commodore to Sickbay.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Montgomery
Text: Aye, sir. Commodore?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: They leave.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, change course. Seven zero mark two one.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mark twenty one, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are taking an evasive course back to you. We will try to stay ahead of the object until we can transport you aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fine. Just make sure you stay ahead of it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Back on the Enterprise, Decker fights Montgomery when they exit turbolift two. It takes a while, but eventually the red-shirt is knocked out and dragged into a side room. Decker then makes his way to the shuttlecraft hangar deck.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Scotty.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've hooked in ship's communication. The best I can give you on impulse is one third power. The shields are up but they won't last long.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep it going, Scotty, keep it going. Mister Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm plotting an intercept course. Will rendezvous with you at fourteen thirteen point seven hours.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock, someone's opening the shuttlecraft bay doors.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Shut them, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's too late, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Why are you launching a shuttlecraft?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whoever it is, Captain, has no authorisation. Lieutenant, raise the shuttlecraft.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Enterprise to shuttlecraft. Come in, shuttlecraft.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Enterprise to shuttlecraft. Come in, shuttlecraft. Come in, shuttlecraft.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: Shuttlecraft to Enterprise. Decker here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore, I must insist that you return to the ship.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: You said it yourself, Spock. There is no way to blast through the hull of that machine, so I'm going to take this thing right down its throat.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Kirk. Matt, you'll be killed.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: I've been prepared for death ever since I, ever since I killed my crew.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No one expects you to die for an error in judgment.
