Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Decker
Text: The commander is responsible for the lives of his crew, and for their deaths. Well, I should have died with mine.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: You cannot succeed, Commodore. Your only logical alternative is to return to the ship.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Matt. Matt, listen to me. You can't throw your life away like this. Matt, you're a starship commander. That makes you a valuable commodity.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We need you, your experience, your judgment. Matt! (Decker turns off the intercom)

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're stronger with you than without you!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The shuttlecraft enters the planet killer, and Decker dies in agony from the radiation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's gone. Constellation, come in, please.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk, come in please.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, may I offer my condolences on the death of your friend. It is most regrettable.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's regrettable that he died for nothing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock, sensors indicate a minute drop in the machine's power emanations. Do you think the shuttlecraft explosion might have done some damage?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about that, Spock? Is it possible?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: The drop in power is definite, Captain but negligible. The object is still pursing us, thereby causing us to drain our power reserve at a much greater rate.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Mister Spock, the transporter is now operational.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter operational, Captain. Shall we beam you aboard?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott and I will stay here, but beam the damage control party aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's little to be gained by staying aboard the Constellation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Except possibly the destruction of that thing out there. Carry out your orders, Mister Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged. Transporter Room. Beam damage control party aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, listen. Maybe Matt Decker didn't die for nothing. He had the right idea but not enough power to do it. Am I correct in assuming that a fusion explosion of ninety seven megatons will result if a starship impulse engine is overloaded?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. Ninety seven point eight three five megatons.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ninety seven point eight three five. Will it be powerful enough to destroy that thing out there?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Its hull is pure neutronium. There is no known way of blasting through it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not through it, Spock, from inside it. Will it be enough?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Insufficient data. I shall try to take further sensor readings.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do the best you can and make it fast. Kirk to Scott.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Here, sir. The damage control party just beamed back to the Enterprise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Scotty, can you set the ship's impulse engines to overload?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. The shape the thing's in, it's hard to keep her from blowing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK I want you to rig a thirty second delay detonation device, and rig it so that it can be blown from up here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set it and get up here as fast as you can.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Right away.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: The object's neutronium hull makes sensor readings of the inner mechanism impossible.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you don't know?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you're getting dangerously close to the planet killer.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I intend to get a lot closer. I'm going to ram her right down that thing's throat.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, you'll be killed, just like Decker.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, I don't intend to die, Mister Spock. We've rigged a delay detonation device. You'll have thirty seconds to beam me aboard the Enterprise before the Constellation's impulse engines blow.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your chances of survival are not promising. We don't even know if the explosion will be powerful enough.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A calculated risk, Mister Spock.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's another factor, Captain. The transporter is not working at one hundred percent efficiency.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thirty seconds is very slim timing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A chance I'll have to take. Kirk out.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: A cranky transporter's a mighty finicky piece of machinery to be gambling your life on, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the detonator?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've linked it in with the impulse control system. (flips a switch) It's armed now. Press this one. Thirty seconds later, poof! Once it's activated, there's no way to stop it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Understood. Mister Spock. Prepare to beam Scotty on board.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter, stand by.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Good luck, Captain.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: It takes longer than usual to materialise Mister Scott.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's the matter with that thing?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: It's a power drain somewhere, sir. I almost lost you.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: It'll never work like this. It's the main junction circuitry. I'll get it.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Bridge. Transporter malfunction.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter is out, Captain. You'll have to stand by.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't. Power level's dropping too fast. You'd better hurry.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Amid spluttering cables

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, speed is of the essence.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's two thousand miles from the planet killer and closing fast.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The cables stop spluttering.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge, transporter operational, but this jury-rigging won't last for long. He's got to come off now.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll stand by here.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Fifteen hundred miles and closing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, transporter operational, but just barely.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to beam me aboard on my signal.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One thousand miles and closing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter, stand by.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Five hundred miles and closing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: The throat of the machine fills the screen when he flips the final red switch.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam me aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energise.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Energising. Bridge, it's shorted out again.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Och, what's wrong with it?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, beam me aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can't, Captain. Transporter is out again.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, twenty seconds to detonation.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Try inverse phasing.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sixty, fifty, forty

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Thirty.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I suggest you beam me aboard.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ten

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Nine, eight

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Seven.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott?

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Scott
Text: Try her now, Mister Kyle.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Six.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Five, four

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: We see the Constellation enter the planet-killer. We see Kyle frantically to beam something in. We see a cloud coming out of the planet-killer before there's a bang.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Bridge, we got him through!

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energy output zero. Radiation level normal.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Context: Kirk runs in.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Welcome aboard, Captain. Sensors show all energy sources deactivated. It's quite dead.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, ease us back to minimum headway. Conserve power as much as possible. Lieutenant Palmer, tell Mister Scott to expedite repairs on the warp drive. Poor Matt. He gave his life in an attempt to save others. Not the worst way to go.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain. I presume your log will show that Commodore Decker died in the line of duty.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Indeed it shall, Mister Spock. Ironic, isn't it? Way back in the 20th century, the H-Bomb was the ultimate weapon, their doomsday machine, and we used something like it to destroy another doomsday machine. Probably the first time such a weapon has ever been used for constructive purposes.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Spock
Text: Appropriate, Captain. However, I can't help wondering if there are any more of those weapons wandering around the universe.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I certainly hope not. I found one quite sufficient.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: A woman is doing a belly-dance, complete with finger-cymbals, while the patrons lounge on cushions. The audience are appreciating the show.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I think I'm going to like Argelius.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obviously a man of good taste.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: You mean to tell me all these women, that all this is

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes, yes. The Argelians think very highly of their pleasure.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's an understatement if I ever heard one. This is a completely hedonistic society.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you like her, Scotty?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. Why shouldn't I?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I've invited her to join us at the table. I thought you might like to meet her.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now that's what I call a real Captain. Always thinking of his men.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The dancer comes over, bends over backwards then does a shimmy before returning to the small stage to finish. Scotty bangs on the table in applause.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, Scotty. In Argelius they use the lights.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now no one has to tell an old Aberdeen pub-crawler how to applaud, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: She comes over, but the man at the next table doesn't look too pleased with the situation.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have one of our pillows?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The man leaves as she sits.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: 'Tis a fine foggy night tonight, and I doubt if anyone's ever told you of the marvellous fogs we have in Aberdeen.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kara
Text: Never a word, but I'm dying to learn.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well then, why don't I show you? There's nothing like a walk in the fog with a bonny lass.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kara
Text: Or a handsome gentleman. Why don't we?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: You don't mind, do you? I might even get back to the ship on time.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We won't leave without you, Scotty. Relax and enjoy yourself. (Scott and Kara leave) My work is never done.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My work, Jim. This is prescription stuff. Don't forget, the explosion that threw Scotty against a bulkhead was caused by a woman.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Physically he's all right. Am I right in assuming that?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, yes, yes. As a matter of fact, considerable psychological damage could have been caused. For example, his total resentment toward women.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He seems he's overcoming his resentment.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course, in my professional opinion, when he gets back to the ship, he's going to hate you for making him leave Argelius. But then he will have lost total resentment toward women.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mission accomplished as far as Scotty is concerned. Bones, I know a little place across town where the women

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh yes. I know the place. Let's go.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The fog hangs very low on Argelius - somewhere just below knee level. Couples are meandering along lost in each other. Kirk works out which way to go, then suddenly - a scream splits the night. They run towards it and find the dancer on the ground.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's dead, Jim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stabbed, a dozen times.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: And standing by a wall, groaning, with a bloody knife in his hand, is Montgomery Scott

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3614.9. Planet Argelius Two. While on therapeutic shore leave, Mister Scott has fallen under suspicion of having brutally murdered an Argelian woman. The chief city administrator, Mister Hengist, has taken charge of the investigation, but has learned little of value.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Context: a neat man in a suit
Text: I don't know what to say, gentlemen. Argelius is the last planet in the galaxy I'd expect a thing like this to happen.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're just as shocked as you are, Mister Hengist.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: If this was my home planet, Rigel Four, I'd have a dozen investigators working on the matter, but they don't exist here.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're not a native of Argelius, sir?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Oh, no. Argelius hires its administrative officers from other planets. The Argelians aren't very efficient, you know. Gentle, harmless people. Mister Scott. Mister Scott? Now, are you sure you've never seen this before? (the knife)

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I, I don't remember.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Really, sir. That is hardly helpful.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you left the cafe with the girl. Do you remember that? What happened next?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: We were walking in the fog. I was up ahead trying to lead the way. I heard the girl scream. I remember starting to turn. I don't remember another thing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you've got to remember.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. (they move off a little way) If he says he can't remember, he probably doesn't. You know Scotty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know a murder's been committed.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't think by any chance that Scotty

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It doesn't make any difference what I think.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But you don't just throw him to the wolves.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I have a diplomatic responsibility. This happened under Argelian jurisdiction. If they want to arrest him, try him, even convict him, I have to go along with it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But he's suffering from a severe concussion.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll do what we can.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: It's not promising, Captain. Mister Scott insists he remembers nothing, but my detector readings indicates that only his fingerprints are on the murder weapon.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Mister Hengist, there were other people in the cafe about the time of the murder. Several of them left just before Mister Scott and the girl did.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: So I've been informed by the staff. They're being located and we will question them. But the outlook for your friend is quite grim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the law in these cases?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: The law of Argelius is love.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: An elegant grey-haired man enters, with a woman.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Gentlemen, our prefect, Jaris. Sir, Captain Kirk, Doctor McCoy.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: And this is my wife, Sybo.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: And this man is Scott, the one I sent you the message about.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: He does not look like a man capable of such an act. Still, it's been so long. Gentlemen, before our great awakening two hundred years ago, we had ways of learning the truth in such matters. We shall return to them.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Argelian empathic contact?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: You know of this?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we've heard of it. I assumed it was a lost art.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: My wife is a descendent of the ancient priestesses of our land. She has the ancestral gift. Gentlemen, I have come to invite you to my home.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Prefect, don't you think this should be handled in an official manner through my office?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: It shall be handled in an official manner, Mister Hengist, since I am the highest official. Gentlemen, let us proceed to my home where, with the aid of my wife, we shall learn the truth. Please.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The middle eastern theme continues with spiral columns, onion-dome arches, latticed windows and plenty of cushions.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Depending on your wife's empathic abilities is all very well, Prefect, but there's only one way we can find out what it is Mister Scott cannot remember. Since you find it impossible to let us go back up to our ship, I can beam down a technician with a psycho-tricorder.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Prefect, it will give us a detailed account of everything that's happened to Mister Scott in the last twenty four hours.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Oh, I'd advise against it, Prefect. This is purely an Argelian matter.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: My wife must meditate for a time before she's ready. I see no reason why we should not use that time to good advantage. Very well, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise. Spock here.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, beam down a technician with a psycho-tricorder, please. Use these co-ordinates.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged. Co-ordinates received.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Prefect, the psycho-tricorder will require privacy to be effective.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: There is a small chamber below this room. Perhaps that will suffice. Captain, news of this frightful murder is spreading among my people. They're greatly disturbed. I have already heard talk of closing Argelius to space vehicles.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that would be most unfortunate. Argelian hospitality is well-known, as well as its strategic importance as a space port.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Yes. I believe it's the only one in the quadrant. (hands out drinks) Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: There are other people we should question. Perhaps I should go expedite their arrival here?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Yes, please do so, Mister Hengist. Anyone with any connection with this murder should be present at the ceremony.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: A woman beams down as Hengist leaves.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Karen
Text: Lieutenant Karen Tracy reporting as ordered, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, I want a twenty four hour regressive memory check made on Mister Scott.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Karen
Text: Yes, Captain. Where shall I set up?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: If you'll Just follow me, Lieutenant.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Jaris and Karen leave.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, co-operate completely with Lieutenant Tracy. Maybe we'll clear this thing up.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I certainly hope so, sir. I can't stand this not knowing. (leaves)

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, under normal conditions, Scotty would have never done such a thing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But that blow on the head. It could put all his previous behaviour patterns into the junk heap.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course, there's another possibility.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hysterical amnesia. When a man feels guilty about something, something too terrible to remember, he blots it out of his conscious memory.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Jaris returns and crosses to another doorway.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Are you ready, Sybo?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sybo
Text: I am ready. May I have the knife, please?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Certainly. Among other gifts, Sybo has the ability to receive impressions from inanimate objects. Do you have it, Captain?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The knife? No.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: But I put it here when we arrived. It's gone.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: A woman's scream fills the air.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Karen Tracy is lying face down on the floor, and Scott is slumped unconscious in a chair.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's dead, Jim. Just like the other one.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stabbed over and over again.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Context: to Scott
Text: Drink this. An Argelian stimulant, Doctor. Quite effective and quite harmless.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Go ahead, Scotty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lieutenant? Captain? Where's

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Tracy is dead, Scott. You were found alone in the room.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Dead? But I

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened down there?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I was sitting there. She was taking her readings, and now I'm sitting here.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is that all that happened?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I tell you, I don't remember. I must have passed out.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It could be, Jim. That head injury.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That head injury. Think, Scotty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I've been trying. I can't even believe this is really happening.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no way into that place from up here. Prefect, is there another entrance to that chamber?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Yes, there's a door that leads into the garden, but it's been locked for years.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Locks can be picked, Jim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: McCoy leaves and Hengist enters. He is accompanied by the man from the next table and one of the musicians.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Prefect, both of these men were at the cafe the night of the murder.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where've they been during the past few minutes?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Captain, if you don't mind please.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's been another murder, Hengist. One of my crew.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: The same as Kara.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Why, that's terrible. (to the man from the next table) You, my men picked you up near there. What were you doing?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: Please, I know nothing about it. I didn't kill anyone.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Well, how was the girl killed?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stabbed. And there's no sign of the weapon.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: If only I had facilities.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You. You were a musician at the cafe. You played for the murdered girl.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tark
Text: Since she was a little girl, she danced for me. She was my daughter. Prefect, how could this thing have happened here? The man who did it must be found. He must be punished.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you. You left the cafe before Scott and Kara.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Is this true? Who are you?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: Morla of Cantaba Street, Prefect. I was there. I have nothing to hide.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you know Kara?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tark
Text: Of course he knew her. They were to be married, but he behaved disgracefully. Unheard of. He was jealous of her.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: That is very disquieting.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: I know it was wrong, but I just couldn't help myself. I loved her, and when she went over to the table with these men, I could not stand to watch, so I left and went home.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jealousy has often been a motive for murder.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Yes, I know. That is why the emotion is so strongly disapproved of here.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: Prefect, I didn't kill anyone. I couldn't.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: We shall see, Morla.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sorry, Jim. The lock may or may not have been picked. It would be hard to tell even with the tricorder.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you prove you went directly home?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Captain, may I continue with the questions please?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well get on with it, man. Just don't stand there.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Captain, Captain. You're behaving very much like a man who is desperately trying anything to save his friend. Would you be as desperate to save Argelius as a space port for your Starfleet?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well of course I'm trying to save my friend, if he's innocent. And he hasn't been proven guilty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Need I remind you of the circumstances, Captain? In both cases, your friend Scott was discovered over the body and later claimed to remember nothing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sybo
Text: I am ready, Jaris.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Gentlemen, sit down please.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Everyone sits around the central brazier.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On one condition, Prefect. That the room be sealed so that no one can leave or enter while the ceremony is going on.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Context: he flicks a row of switches and the doorways are closed
Text: The room is sealed.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, you mean my neck is going to have to depend on some spooky mumbo jumbo?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Kirk's communicator beeps.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain. May I have a word with you?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Excuse me, gentlemen. (moves away from the group) Yes, Mister Spock?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Concerning the situation you related to us. In my opinion, the Argelian empathic contact is an interesting phenomenon, but the technique is not sound enough to risk a man's life.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you suggest, Mister Spock?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Simply that we beam Mister Scott on board the Enterprise and employ our computers to learn the truth.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These are a proud people. They have their own customs, their own laws, and while we're here we're subject to them. It is absolutely imperative that this matter be resolved according to Argelian law. Is that clear?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite clear, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't like it any more than you do, Spock, but there's nothing we can do about it. Kirk out,

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Everyone is holding hands around the brazier.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sybo
Text: Let us begin. Let the circle not be broken. Concentrate upon the flame which burns upon the altar of truth.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Yes, there is something here. Something terrible. I feel its presence. Fear, anger, hatred. Anger feeds the flame. Oh! Oh! There is evil here. Monstrous, terrible evil. Consuming hunger. Hatred of all that lives. Hatred of women. A hunger that never dies. It is strong, overpowering. An ancient terror. It has a name. Beratis, Kesla, Redjac! Devouring all life, all light. A hunger that will never die! Redjac! Redjac!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The lights go out, and she screams. When the lights come on again, the flame has gone out. Scott is standing holding Sybo in his arms, then he lets her go and she falls forward across McCoy's lap. There is a knife in her back

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Later...)

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Three murders, and Scotty the only possible answer each time.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't care what the circumstances indicate, Jim. Scotty simply could not have done it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Normally, no, but that blow on his head could

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK Scotty, I'm sorry. You don't even remember whether you did it or not.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: I agree with you, Captain. I'm perfectly satisfied Mister Scott is guilty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not responsible.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: That is unproven, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can prove it, if he's insane.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Gentlemen, please. How could any man do such monstrous things?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what we hope to find out, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Mister Scott?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir, I swear to you I did not kill your wife or the other ladies.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: By your own admission, you don't know whether you did or didn't. Your so-called failing memory

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Hengist. On the Enterprise, we can make a recording of the registrations of Mister Scott's conscious and subconscious mind. They will tell us what happened to him in the recent past.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There would be no room for doubt. We would know. And after all, that's what we're after, isn't it, Prefect? To know?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: You, sir, claim to remember nothing about the murders.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: If this is so, you may have killed without knowing it. Will your machines tell us this?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No doubt will remain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Very well. We will go to your ship, and he who is guilty will face the ancient penalties, barbaric and horrible though they may be. The ancient penalty for murder was death by slow torture. That law has never been changed. Do you understand that, Mister Scott?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. I understand.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3615.4. With Mister Scott in a technical state of arrest, we have beamed aboard the Enterprise to continue the investigation.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Each testifier will sit here, place his hand on this plate. Any deviation from factual truth will be immediately detected and relayed to this computer which will in turn notify us. Doctor McCoy has already fed the computer his medical reports. Our laboratory experts are examining the murder weapon and will give their data to the computers for analysis. Shall we begin?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Jaris nods.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, will you take the stand?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Scott sits on the raised chair and puts his right hand on the sensor plate. Yet at no time does the camera let us see all his finger.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, identify verification.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Lieutenant Commander Montgomery Scott. Serial number SE-19754-T. Verified.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Subject's present physical condition.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Subject recently received severe blow on skull. Damage healing. Some peripheral abnormalities.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sufficient abnormalities to account for periods of functional amnesia?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Negative.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I don't see how that can be.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Unless Scotty's lying about his loss of memory.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm not lying, Captain. I don't remember a thing about the first two murders.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, accuracy scan.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Subject relaying accurate account. No physiological changes.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain? I didn't black out when Mister Jaris' wife was killed.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty, let's have it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: We were holding hands. When the lights went out, the circle was broken. I heard the poor lady scream, and as I was near the head of the table anyway I went toward her. But there was something in my way.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something? You mean someone.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, Captain, some thing. Cold, it was, like a stinking draught out of a slaughterhouse, but it wasn't really there. Like it. (lost for words) If you know what I mean.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Subject relaying accurate account. No physiological changes.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Let's hit it on the head. Scotty, did you kill Sybo?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, Captain. That I'm sure of.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: He's been saying that right along. It means no more now than it did before.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, lie to me. How old are you?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Twenty two sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Inaccurate. Inaccurate. Data in error.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: After the lights went out, Mister Scott, who was holding your hand?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Morla on the one side and you on the other, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: But that doesn't mean anything, Captain, with a room that small. The lights were out. Anyone would've had time to kill the lady.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: But I remind you we found Mister Scott holding her in his arms, the knife still (to Jaris) I'm sorry, sir, but I must. The knife still in her back and blood on his hands.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The verifier showed that he was telling the truth when he said he didn't kill her.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: There were two other women murdered.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott. Did you kill Kara?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't remember.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you kill Lieutenant Tracy?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't remember.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, accuracy scan.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Subject relaying accurate account. No physiological changes.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: All that proves is that he's telling the truth when he says he doesn't remember.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: This is a waste of time.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: After we take the testimony here, we'll run a psycho-tricorder analysis of Mister Scott's memory, which is what we wanted to do on the surface. That will give us a complete record. Will that satisfy you, Mister Hengist?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Well, if you can convince me that the machine is incapable of error, and if it shows he did not kill the women.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There will be no error. As for the rest of it, the readings will show. You can step down, Mister Scott, if there are no objections.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: I object to the entire procedure.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Mister Hengist, we are here on my authority. We will co-operate.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Prefect, I know you mean well, but I've had experience

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: For the time being, we will accept Captain Kirk's explanation of the machine's accuracy as factual. I do, however, reserve to myself the right to make the final determination.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can ask no more. Mister Morla, will you take the stand?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: He does so.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where were you at the time that Kara was murdered?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: I'm not sure. Walking home, I assume. I was angry.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Anger is a relative state, sir. Were you angry enough to do violence?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: I've never done violence in my life. I don't think I could. You've got to believe me. I wouldn't kill her. I couldn't. I loved her, and she loved me.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tark
Text: That's not true! He might think she loved him, but she didn't. She told me. He was jealous. All the time. They fought constantly.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you kill Lieutenant Tracy?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: No.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you kill Sybo?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: No.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, verification scan.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Subject relaying accurate account, though some statements subjective. No physiological changes.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Morla, I think you can step down now. Sybo spoke of a hunger that never dies. Something that thrives on fear, terror, death. Mister Spock, maybe we're going about it in the wrong way. Let's assume that Sybo was a sensitive. That she did sense something, something evil.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensitivity of certain Argelian women is a documented fact, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: My poor Sybo's talent was genuine, gentlemen. What she told you was true.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, then, what was it she said, exactly? A monstrous evil, ancient terror.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That devours all life and light.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She said something else, words that didn't make sense.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Redjac, Beratis and, er, Kesla.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obscure, meaningless words.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: To us, perhaps, but to the computer?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah. Mister Spock, check them out.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, linguistic bank. Definition of following word. Redjac.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Negative finding.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no such word in the linguistics bank?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Scan all other banks.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Affirmative. A proper name.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Define.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Redjac. Source Earth, nineteenth century. Language, English. Nickname for mass murderer of women. Other Earth synonym, Jack the Ripper.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jack the Ripper?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: That's ridiculous. He lived hundreds of years ago.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tark
Text: A man couldn't survive all these centuries.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Just before she died, my wife said, it is a hunger that never dies.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tark
Text: But all men die.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, all men die. And Jack the Ripper couldn't be alive if he were a man. But everything we've uncovered points to Jack the Ripper, which is an impossibility, isn't it? Or is it?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Humans and humanoids make up only a small percentage of the life forms we know of. There are entities possessed of extremely long life spans, virtually immortal.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We know that someone or something killed three women. If it's impossible for it to be human, it has to be something else. Something driven to kill.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sybo said it feeds on death.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: In the strict scientific sense, Doctor, we all feed on death. Even vegetarians.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, but she said more than that. Not just death, but fear. She said it also feeds on fear.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which would tend to support the proposition that the murderer was not human. Deriving sustenance from emotion is not unknown in the galaxy, and fear is among the strongest and most violent of the emotions.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Surely, Prefect, this has gone far enough. Someone, some man has killed three women. We have the prime suspect in our hands. Are we going to let him go and start chasing ghosts?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Mister Hengist, not ghosts. Possibly not human, but not ghosts. Mister Spock, check out the possibilities.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, digest log recordings for past five solar minutes. Correlate hypotheses. Compare with life forms register. Question. Could such an entity within discussed limits exist in this galaxy?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: The Drella of Alpha Carinae Five derives nourishment from the emotion of love. There is sufficient precedent for existence of creature, nature unknown, which could exist on emotion of fear.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, extrapolate most likely composition of such entity.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Working. To meet with specified requirements, entity would exist without form in conventional sense. Most probable mass of energy of highly cohesive electromagnetic field.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, could the described entity assume physical form?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative. Precedent, mellitus, cloud creature of Alpha Majoris One.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Fairy tales. Ghosts and goblins.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I've seen the mellitus myself. In its natural state, it's gaseous. When it's at rest, it's solid. Mister Spock, let's assume the existence of this creature.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: I point out that Jack the Ripper slew at will in the heart of the most populous city of old Earth and was never identified.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doesn't seem likely, does it?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suggest the possibility of a hypnotic screen, which blinds all but the victim to the presence of the killer.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Is that possible?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Extremely possible There are many such examples that exist in nature.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: This is fantasy! We all know the murderer is sitting right here. You're trying to cloud the issue. I've got a mind to

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: I am satisfied the course of this investigation is valid enough. Please be seated, Mister Hengist.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Spock, what do we have? A creature without form, that feeds on horror and fear, that must assume a physical shape to kill.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: And I suspect preys on women because women are more easily and more deeply terrified, generating more sheer horror than the male of the species.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer. Criminological files. Cases of unsolved mass murders of women since Jack the Ripper.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. 1932. Shanghai, China, Earth. Seven women knifed to death. 1974, Kiev, USSR, Earth. Five women knifed to death. 2105. Martian colonies. Eight women knifed to death. 2156. Heliopolis, Alpha Eridani Two. Ten women knifed to death. There are additional examples.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, those places are aligned directly between Argelius and Earth.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. When man moved out into the galaxy, that thing must've moved with him. Computer, identify the proper names Kesla and Beratis.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Kesla. Name given to unidentified mass murderer of women on planet Deneb Two. Beratis. Name given to unidentified mass murderer of women on planet Rigel Four. Additional data. Murders on Rigel Four occurred one solar year ago.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: All heads turn towards Mister Hengist

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You come from Rigel Four.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Well, many people do. It's not a crime.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but what we're investigating is. Would you mind taking the stand, Mister Hengist?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: I will not.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: Mister Hengist.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Prefect, this has gone far enough. I will not take the stand.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can appreciate your position, sir. You are in charge of civil disturbances locally. If you are the entity for which we search, what better position from which to kill with impunity?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just after you left Jaris' house, we discovered the murder knife was missing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you were unaccounted for when Lieutenant Tracy was murdered.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: An entity which feeds on fear and terror would find a perfect hunting ground on Argelius, a planet without violence, where the inhabitants are as peaceful as sheep. The entity would be as a hungry wolf in that fold.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Gentlemen, I know something of the law. You're engaging in sheer speculation.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps. Mister Spock. The murder weapon.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer. Report on analysis of Exhibit A.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Exhibit A on visual. Composition of blade, boridium. Composition of handle, murinite. Details of carving on handle conform to folk art forms, indicating place of origin.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Specify. Point of origin.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Computer
Text: Artefact produced by hill people of Argus River region, planet Rigel Four.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now then, Mister Hengist

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: But Hengist tries to make a break for it, even landing a very good kick on Kirk, who repays him with an even better right cross. Hengist falls to the floor.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Jim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But that's impossible.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The lights dim eerily.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: Redjac! Redjac! Redjac! Redjac! Redjac! (maniacal laughter)

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The lights come back.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: The computer will not respond to these controls. The entity is unquestionably controlling it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the computer controls the ship.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: Redjac! Redjac! Redjac! Redjac!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty, give me a hand. (They prop Hengist up on a chair, leaning against the table.)

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's no use, Captain. The bypass circuits are blocked.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Audio cut off, Spock.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The viewscreen has an image of hot swirling flames or lava. Anyway, it is fear-inducing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Tankris
Context: a lady yeoman
Text: What's happening, Captain?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Text: What does it mean?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It means that thing can control the entire operation of the ship, including the life support systems.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Morla
Text: You mean it could kill us all?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, it will try, but not immediately. We know it feeds on fear and terror. There are nearly four hundred and forty humans aboard this ship. Surely it will try to breed fear and terror before it kills.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands, this is the captain. Stay at your posts. Remain calm. Captain out. Bones. What's the sedative situation?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've got some stuff that would tranquillise an active volcano.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Start distribution immediately. The longer we can hold back that fear, the more time we'll have to get that thing out of the computer. Prefect, you'll all be safer here. Spock, come with me.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, don't you have a compulsory scan unit built into the computer banks?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes we do, Captain, but with the entity in control

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't there certain mathematical problems which simply cannot be solved?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. If we could focus the attention of the computer on one of them.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That ought to do it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: The door nearly closes before he is inside.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently our friends learned very quickly.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Too quickly. Bridge.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: But the lights indicate they are going down quickly, not up.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Freefall!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out of control. Put it on manual. Bridge.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: They start going up, then an alarm goes off.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That was due to be next. Life-support malfunction.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: We don't have much time, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said it yourself, Spock. It wants terror, not just death.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the life-support system override jammed.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Man your station, Mister Sulu.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: Captain, you're wasting your time.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cut that thing off.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: You and all aboard your ship are about to die!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try and cut that thing off.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: This is the first time I heard a malfunction threaten us.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Man your post, Mister Sulu. (to all the crew) Prepare your manual overrides. You may need them.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Kirk crouches down by Spock under the life-support station.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Normal environmental levels have been restored, Captain, but it will not last long. A few hours at best.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That should be enough time. Let's get at it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What's going on, Captain?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind, Mister Sulu.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: A nurse enters.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tranquilliser?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Nurse
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everyone, including yourself.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Nurse
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: You cannot stop me now, Captain. It will do you no good. I control all circuits. You cannot silence me. You cannot reach me. Your manual overrides are extremely limited in life.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Proceeding, Captain, but I will need some time.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: Soon all control will be restored to me! There is nothing you can do to prevent it!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you destroy this ship, you destroy yourself.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: I am without ending. I have existed from the dawn of time, and I shall I live beyond its end! In the meantime, I shall feed, and this time I do not need a knife. You will all die horribly in searing pain!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is attempting to generate terror, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: I can cut off your oxygen and suffocate you!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain? (gets his injection, and grins) Who ever he is, he sure talks gloomy.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Man your post, Mister. If any of the other systems go out, switch to manual override, and above all, don't be afraid.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: With an armful of this stuff, I wouldn't be afraid of a supernova.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Implement.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, this is a Class A compulsory directive. Compute to the last digit the value of pi.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Voice
Text: No, no, no, no! No, no!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: As we know, the value of pi is a transcendental figure without resolution. The computer banks will work on this problem to the exclusion of all else until we order it to stop.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that should keep that thing busy for a while. The Argelians will be the first to panic. Let's get back to the briefing room.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I wonder who it is we're not supposed to be afraid of.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: McCoy is in the process of inoculating the group. Scott feels no pain, that's for sure.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, sir?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I doubt very much whether the computers will be inhabited by more than a group of figures for a while.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is resistance, Captain, but the directive is succeeding. Bank after bank is turning to the problem.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you drive it out of the computers, it'll have to go somewhere else.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How are you doing?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm almost finished. Just Jaris and me.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Maniacal laughter over the intercom.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Complete computer control, Captain. The entity has fled.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but where to? Bones, what would happen if that thing entered a tranquillised body?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, it might take up knitting, but nothing more violent than that.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say everyone's had a shot but you and Jaris?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And you and Mister Spock, Captain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm willing to take a chance on Mister Spock. Better give yourself a shot, Doc.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I don't think so. I think I ought to stay clear.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do as I say.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: McCoy injects himself.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Extend your arm, Mister Jaris.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Jaris
Context: grabs Kirk's throat
Text: No, no, kill you all! Die! Make you suffer!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Spock administers a neck-pinch. Hengist comes back to life, snatches up the knife and grabs Yeoman Tankris.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Everybody keep back or I'll kill her! I'll kill her! Keep back!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You'd better be careful. You're going to hurt somebody with that thing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Hengist pushes his hostage at McCoy then tries to attack Kirk. He's easily defeated.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: You'll suffer! You'll suffer. (Spock injects him) I'll kill all of you.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get him to the Transporter Room, quick!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: You'll die, die, die. Everybody will die.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Kirk carries the giggling Hengist in a fireman's lift, while Spock follows.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Kill, kill, kill you all.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deep space. Full power. Widest angle of dispersion. Maintain.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kyle
Text: No need to get excited, Captain. I'll do it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: They lay Hengist on the pad.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do it, Spock.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Hengist
Text: Everybody die. You'll all suffer.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: He is beamed out.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kyle
Text: You didn't have to shove me, Mister Spock. I'd have gotten round to it.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: McCoy and Scott enter, with big grins.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Jaris is all right.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: What did you do with that thing, Captain? Did you send it back to the planet?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We beamed it out into open space, Scotty. Widest possible dispersion.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That thing can't die.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly, Doctor. Its consciousness may continue for some time, consisting of billions of separate bits of energy, floating forever in space, powerless.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it will die finally. You seem very happy about the whole thing.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Why not? For a while there I didn't know whether I was innocent or guilty.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, how long will it take for this tranquilliser to wear off?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know. Five or six hours. I gave them a pretty big shot, Jim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I can see that. Well Mister Spock, for the next five or six hours, we're going to have the happiest crew in space. Of course, we won't get much work done.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, since you came to Argelius to rest, I suggest you take advantage of the opportunity.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a splendid idea, Mister Spock. I know a cafe where the women are so

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know the place, Jim.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let's go see!

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You, gentlemen? In your condition? Don't be ridiculous. Mister Spock, this cafe has women that are so. (met with a Look) No, I guess not. Alone?

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Context: Kirk goes to the door and gestures for everyone to leave.

Title: Wolf In The Fold
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any response from the Malurians, Lieutenant?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing since their original distress call, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the Federation science team working there? Doctor Manway had a special transmitter.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There's nothing, sir. I'm scanning all frequencies.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They have to answer.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. They will not answer. The long-range sensor sweep of this system reveals no sign of life.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That can't be. The last census reported a total inhabitation of more than four billion people.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I register no life readings at all, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible. What could have happened?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: We would have known in advance of any system-wide catastrophe, and in the event of an interplanetary war, there would be considerable radioactive residue. Our instruments show only normal background radiation.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any other possibilities?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, sir. Sensor readings would have revealed the presence of any disease organisms. They do not. In addition, we received the routine report from this system only a week ago. Even the Symbalene blood burn does not act that swiftly.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, shields just snapped on. Something heading in at multiwarp speeds.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Evasive manoeuvres, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: An extremely powerful bolt of energy, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full power to the shields, Mister Scott.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Giving them all we got.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands, Red Alert. Phaser banks stand by. Photon torpedoes to Condition Red, Condition Red.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The viewscreen fills with a ball of bright light.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's going to hit.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Everyone gets thrown around a lot, and the lights go out for a short while.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Shields still holding, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Temporarily, Captain. Our shields absorbed energy equivalent to ninety of our photon torpedoes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ninety?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I may add, the energy used repulsing this first attack reduced our shielding power twenty percent.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: First attack, sir?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think we can expect others, Lieutenant.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can resist three more such attacks. The fourth will shatter our shields completely.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, pinpoint the source. Mister Sulu, evasive manoeuvres.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, contact Starfleet Command. Patch in my log. Tell them what has happened. Tell them the entire Malurian race seems to have been destroyed by an unknown agency, and that we are under attack by an unidentified force.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Another ball of light is on the viewscreen

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsmen, I said evasive manoeuvres.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're losing power, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm having to divert the warp engine power into the shields, sir, if you want the protection.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, speed of those bolts.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approximately warp fifteen, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we can't out run them. Good, Scotty. You're doing the right thing. (another hit) Source, Spock.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. Nothing within sensor range. (a third bolt approaching) Something now, Captain. Very small. Bearing one two three degrees, mark one eight. Range ninety thousand kilometres.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's our target, Mister Sulu. Prepare photon torpedo.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The third bolt hits

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Shields still holding, sir, but the drain on the engines is reaching the critical point. Ach, we lost warp manoeuvreing power. Switching to impulse.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Photon torpedoes armed, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Has the target changed location, Mister Spock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. Holding steady.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready photon torpedo number two, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Torpedo away. (a pause, then a flash) Direct hit.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: No effect. Target absorbed full energy of our torpedo.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Absorbed it? There must be damage to your instruments, Spock .

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are in good working order, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what could have absorbed that much energy and survived? Lieutenant, try to make contact.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, they've fired another.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can we take it, Mister Scott?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's problematical, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Context: It hits.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, shields are down. We cannot survive another hit.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything, Lieutenant?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm trying, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Translator computer. All hailing frequencies open.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. All hailing frequencies open.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To unidentified vessel. This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or any lifeforms. Please communicate with us. Any further readings, Mister Spock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computing now, Captain. Weight, five hundred kilograms. Shape, roughly cylindrical. Length, a fraction over one metre.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Five hundred kilos and only one metre long?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: What kind of intelligent creatures can exist in a thing that small?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Intelligence does not necessarily require bulk, Mister Scott.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, we're getting a signal from the spacecraft.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on audio, Lieutenant.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. It's impossible to get it any clearer, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis sector. Have them study and decode it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Analysis sector, channel one, main computer. Decode.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, this message is a sort of binary. Extremely sophisticated, compressed, carrying several channels at once.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you decode it?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: No clue as yet, Captain. A moment. Transmission speed has stepped down. Much slower. Seems to be a single binary.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's mathematical. Yes, one symbol. The symbol repeat. Sir, that isn't in the Starfleet code. It's an old-style interplanetary code.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat what? The message I sent?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem so, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission in this part of the galaxy. We have no hostile intentions. We request identity.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's another signal now, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's a formula, Captain. They're sending us a mathematical message and requesting language equivalence. They're trying to communicate.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tie in the ship's translator to the communication channel. Let them take it at their own speed.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Suddenly one of Spock's console monitor's burns out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cut power, Lieutenant. Overloaded and burned out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I guess they can take it faster than we give it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the message is coming in now.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: USS Enterprise, this is Nomad. My mission is non-hostile.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apparently they got what they needed before the computers burned out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nomad?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Require communication. Can you leave your ship?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is impossible to come aboard your ship because of the size differential.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Non sequitur. Your facts are uncoordinated.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are prepared to beam you aboard our ship.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: That will be satisfactory.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you require any special conditions, any particular atmosphere or environment?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Negative. I will come aboard.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Hold your position. We're locked onto your co-ordinates. We'll beam you aboard.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, you're not really bringing that thing in here?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we have any choice, Scotty? Besides, once it's aboard, it won't be taking any more shots at us. Lieutenant, get a repair crew on that computer. Get Doctor McCoy down to the transporter room. Spock, you come with me. Scotty, you too.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor McCoy to the transporter room. Maintenance crew C5.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They've got the co-ordinates, Jim. It's locked in.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Energising.

Title: The Changeling
Context: What looks like a satellite - antenna at the top, engine at the bottom and flashing lights on the side - is hanging in mid air over the transporter pad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sensor readings, Mister Spock.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. It has a protective screen. I cannot get through.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do we do now, go up and knock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Relate your point of origin.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are from the United Federation of Planets.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Insufficient response. All things have a point of origin. I will scan your star charts.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we show it a close-up view of our system, it has no point of reference. It won't know more than it does now.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: A reasonable course.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you care to leave your ship, we'll provide the necessary life support systems.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Non sequitur. Your facts are uncoordinated.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I don't think anybody's in there.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I contain no parasitical beings. I am Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: . Scott
Text: In my opinion, that's a machine.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is reacting much like a highly sophisticated computer.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I am Nomad. What is opinion?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: An opinion is a belief, a view, a judgment.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Insufficient response.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's your source of power?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: It has changed since the point of origin. There was much taken from the other. I am perpetual now. I am Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wasn't there a probe called Nomad launched in the early 2000s?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. It was reported destroyed. There were no more in the series. But if this is that probe

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I will scan your star charts.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will bring them.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I have the capability of movement within your ship.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This way.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad glides along slowly, in mid-air

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Scotty, get our warp power up to full capacity.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, Bones, come with us.

Title: The Changeling
Context: A bemused young Indian officer watches the performance.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chart 14A, sir?
