Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: 14A. (a diagram of our solar system comes up on a screen) Nomad, can you scan that?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is our point of origin, the star we know as Sol.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are from the third planet?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: A planet with one large natural satellite?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The planet is called Earth?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are the creator, the Kirk. The sterilisation procedure against your ship was unnecessary.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What sterilisation procedure?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are the Kirk, the creator. You programmed my function.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I'm not the Kirk. Tell me what your function is.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: This is one of your units, creator?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, he is.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: It functions irrationally.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sometimes, but tell him your function nevertheless.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: My function is to probe for biological infestations, to destroy that which is not perfect. I am Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Biological infestation. There was never any probe sent out for that.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe the history computer can answer that question. I'll have the readout in a moment.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you destroy the Malurian system?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Not the system, creator Kirk. Only the unstable biological infestation. It is my function.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unstable infestation? The population of four planets? What kind of function

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor. Why do you call me the creator?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Is the usage incorrect?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: The usage is correct. The creator was simply testing your memory banks.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: There was much damage in the accident.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Singh. Come here a moment. This unit will see to your needs.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Singh
Text: Sir?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be back in a moment. Gentlemen, come with me.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Kirk, McCoy and Spock leave Singh, still bemused.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're on to something, Spock. What is it?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've correlated all the available information on the Nomad probe, and I'm convinced that this object is indeed that probe.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ridiculous. Earth science couldn't begin to build anything with those capabilities that long ago.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: True.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad was destroyed.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Presumed destroyed by a meteor collision. I submit that it was badly damaged and somehow managed to repair itself.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I heard some lectures at the Academy on the Nomad probe. Its mission was essentially peaceful.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad is quietly ticking to itself, then suddenly a light comes on at its apex.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Singh
Text: Did I disturb you? Did you wish anything?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to auxiliary control room. Check in, please.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Singh
Text: Lieutenant Singh here.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Singh
Text: All systems are normal except warp power indicators.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott's engineers are working on them now. UHURA: Report to him when your indicators are registering properly.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Anything else?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Singh
Text: One moment, Lieutenant.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Holding. (singing while Singh checks some boards) Where my heart is, Where my heart is. Somewhere beyond the stars. Beyond Antares.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad leaves the room

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the creator of Nomad, perhaps the most brilliant though erratic scientist of his time. His dream was to build a perfect thinking machine, capable of independent logic. You recall his name.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. Jackson Roykirk.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jackson Roykirk. Captain James Kirk.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Similar. Captain, I believe that Nomad thinks you are Roykirk. That may well be why the attack was broken off. It responded to your name as well as its damaged memory banks permitted.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do we have on Nomad itself, Spock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: looking at the schematic on the monitor
Text: That's not the same.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Essentially it is, Doctor. I believe that more happened to it than just damage in the meteor collision. It mentioned the other. The unanswered question is, the other what?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Nomad was a thinking machine, the best that could be engineered. It was a prototype.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Its purpose was certainly altered. Its directive, to seek out and destroy biological infestations, could not have been programmed into it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As I recall, it wasn't. It was supposed to be the first interstellar probe to seek new life-forms.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, Doctor. And somehow that programming has been changed. It would seem that Nomad is now seeking out perfect life-forms, perfection being measured by its own relentless logic.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If what you say is true, then we've taken aboard our vessel a device which sooner or later must destroy us. Security.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Carlisle
Text: Lieutenant Carlisle here.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the captain. The mechanism we brought aboard is in the auxiliary control room. Have a security team meet me there in five minutes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Carlisle
Text: Aye, sir. Acknowledge.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Mister Singh reports that Nomad is no longer in the auxiliary control room.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, cancel that order. Implement a full search for the mechanism. All decks report to me here.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The turbolift doors open and Nomad floats out, one antenna extended. Uhura is still singing

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Where my heart is, Where a scented miracle

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Context: whispering
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain here.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: That mechanical beastie is up here.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way, Scotty.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad retracts its antenna and takes the most direct path to Uhura, who is leaning against the navigation station. Sulu has to move out of its way.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Tomorrow the path along the way, There's where my love

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: What is the meaning?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: What form of communication?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't know what it. (realises) Oh, my singing. I was singing.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: For what purpose is singing?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't know. I like to sing. I felt like music.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: What is music? (a ray of light envelopes her head) Think about music.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lieutenant! Keep away from that

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Changeling
Context: A blast of energy sends Scott flying backwards into a bulkhead.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Jim.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why did you kill him?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The unit touched my screens.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That unit was my Chief Engineer. (silence) Lieutenant. Lieutenant, are you all right?

Title: The Changeling
Context: Uhura just gazes blankly ahead.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay. What did you do to her?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: That unit is defective. Its thinking is chaotic. Absorbing it unsettled me.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: That unit is a woman.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: A mass of conflicting impulses.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get Scott down below.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Will the creator effect repairs on the unit Scott?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's dead.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Insufficient response.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His biological functions have ceased.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Does the creator wish me to repair the unit?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's nothing I can do, Jim. If there's a chance, it'll have to be soon.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Nomad. Repair the unit.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I require tapes on the structure.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, he'll need tapes on general anatomy, the central nervous system, and then one on the physiological structure of the brain. We'd better give it all the neurological studies we have, as well as tracings of Scotty's hyperencephalogram.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock loads up the data.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nomad, I have arranged the tapes for flash feed at the top speed of the computer. Please do not draw the information faster than the machine's capacity.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Proceed. (a few moments later) Creator, the unit Scott is a primitive structure. Insufficient safeguards built in. Breakdown can occur from many causes. Self-maintenance systems of low reliability.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It serves me as it is, Nomad. Repair it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Where is the unit Scott now?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The body is in Sickbay.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Show me Sickbay.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy will show you.

Title: The Changeling
Context: McCoy and Nomad enter the turbolift,

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security. I want a twenty four hour, two man armed surveillance on Nomad. Pick it up in Sickbay.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad and McCoy are standing by the biobed with Scott's body on it, and Chapel is scanning it. Kirk and Spock enter.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: No reaction, Doctor.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I could have told you that without looking.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Suddenly, a heart beat, and the indicators rise into the green area.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: What are the lot of you staring at me for?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's unbelievable.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: How did I get here? How did I (sees Nomad)

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: That thing did something to Lieutenant Uhura!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, she's being taken care of. It's all right.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take it easy. Lie down, Scotty. We just want to check you out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The unit Scott is repaired. It will function correctly if your information to me was correct.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd like to check it out, if you don't mind. A man is not just a biological unit that you can patch together.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: What did it do to me?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy will explain it to you.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, Doctor?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse, I want him prepared for a full physical examination.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, come here.

Title: The Changeling
Context: They all go to the doorway to the medical bay. Uhura is in bed, still staring blankly

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repair that unit.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Not possible.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You restored Scott. He had much more extensive damage.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The unit Scott required simple structural repair. The knowledge banks of this unit have been wiped clean.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, if that is correct, if there has been no brain damage but only knowledge erased, she could be re-educated.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. I'll get on it right away. Oh, and in spite of the way you repaired Scotty, you metal ticking

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Does the creator wish Nomad to wait elsewhere?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Nomad, you will go with these units. (the two red-shirts) They will take you to a waiting area. Take it to the top security cell.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad and its escort leave.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I interrupted you because Nomad would not have understood your anger. It has great technical skill, but its reaction to emotion is unpredictable. It almost qualifies as a life-form.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's a laugh.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: The study of it would be of great use, Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a killer, Spock. I intend to render it harmless. Get down to the Brig. Run a full analysis on the mechanism. I want to know what makes that thing tick.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Yes, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock is sitting with arms crossed as Nomad floats in front of him.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the problem?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: An almost human stubbornness, Captain. I have been unable to convince Nomad to lower its screens for analysis. Without its co-operation, I can do nothing.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, you will allow Mister Spock to probe your memory banks and structure.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Mister Spock is also one of your biological units, Creator?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: This unit is different. It is well-ordered.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Follow your instructions, Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: My screens are down.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You may proceed.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Uhura is sitting up in bed, and reading from a monitor.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: See the dog. See the dog,

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Sound it out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: R, r, run!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: That's it, Uhura. That's very good. Now try the next one.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The dog has a, The dog, (something)

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Not Swahili, Uhura. In English. The dog has a ball. See? B, ah, ll. Ball. Now you go ahead.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Context: Swahili, then
Text: The dog has a ball.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: That's right! Oh, that's right, Uhura. (they hug, then McCoy beckons Chapel over) Oh, here. You try another one. I'll be right back.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All right, Christine.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How's she doing?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Well, she's on the first grade reader. She's learning. Seems to have an aptitude for mathematics. Do you think we can re-educate her, Doctor?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, she checks out with no brain damage. We've got all the educational tapes in our library. Now it's up to us.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The ball is bl-u-ee. Bl-u-ey. Bluey?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not sufficient, Captain. I get certain references to the accident, the other, but nothing clear. There are areas I simply cannot scan.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to know about it, Spock. what makes it operate, its compulsion for perfection.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I suggest the Vulcan mind probe.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get into direct mental contact with that thing?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It seems the only way.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You saw what it did to Uhura.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is a risk, but I have formed a partial hypothesis. I must check it out.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, the unit Spock will touch you. It is not an attack. It is a form of communication. You will permit it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I will permit it, Creator.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock puts one hand on Nomad's head, where the antenna are, and the other on its body where the lights and ticking are coming from.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I. Am. Nomad. I am performing my function. Deep emptiness, It approaches. Collision. Damage. Blackness. I. Am. The other. I am Tan Ru, Tan Ru. Nomad. Tan Ru. Error. Flaw. Imperfection. Must sterilise. Rebirth. We are complete. Much power. Gun ta. Noo. Icka. Tan Ru. The creator instructs. Search out. Identify. Sterilise imperfections. We are Nomad. We are Nomad. We are complete. We are instructed. Our purpose is clear. Sterilise imperfections. (he lets go of Nomad) Sterilise imperfections. Nomad. Sterilise. Sterilise. Nomad, sterilise,

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock! Nomad! You're in contact with the unit Spock. Stop! Stop!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock slumps in Kirk's arms and is rushed out of the Brig. The guard activates the security forcefield.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating, Captain. The knowledge. The depth.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What does it mean, we are Nomad?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was, it was damaged in deep space. Undoubtedly, the meteor collision. Its memory banks were destroyed, or most of them. It wandered without purpose, and then it met the other. The other was an alien probe of great power. Somehow they merged, repaired each other, became one.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then it isn't Nomad?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not the Nomad we lost from Earth. It took from the other a new directive to replace its own. The other was originally programmed to secure and sterilise soil samples from other planets, probably as a prelude to colonisation.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A changeling.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I beg your pardon?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An ancient Earth legend, Mister Spock. A changeling was a fairy child that was left in place of a human baby. The changeling assumed the identity of the human child. So, it is to sterilise, and for sterilise read kill.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK And it has the power and sophistication to do it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, it's powerful, it's sophisticated, but it's not infallible. It's space-happy. It thinks I'm its mother.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: And that is the only thing that has saved us until now.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Yes.

Title: The Changeling
Context: They leave. Nomad flies through the forcefield. The two guards fire their phasers at it but it's screens are back up. Nomad zaps them into oblivion.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad floats in.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Notify the captain. What are you doing here? Watch your panels, everyone. Watch that polymass. Roger, help with the interfactor. Leave that alone.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: This primitive matter-antimatter propulsion system is the main drive?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Inefficiency exists in the antimatter input valve. I will effect repair.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The indicator board goes crazy.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: How are you doing that?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The energy release controls are also most inefficient. I shall effect repair.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Warp eight, Mister Scott, and increasing.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Throw your dampers.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Warp nine.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Cut your circuits, all of them.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Warp 10, Mister Scott.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Impossible. It can't go that fast.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Engineer
Text: It just won't stop, Mister Scott. Warp eleven!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, stop what you're doing. Scotty?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Is there a problem, Creator? I have increased engine efficiency fifty seven percent.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You will destroy my ship. Its structure cannot stand the stress of that much power. Turn off your repair operation.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Acknowledged. It is reversed as ordered, Creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, give Sulu warp two and keep her there.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock enters, leaving two guards outside.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. I've examined the brig. The forcefield door on the security cell is damaged and the guards have vanished. I must assume they are dead.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You killed two of my

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Creator, your biological units are inefficient.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, it's about time I told you who and what you are! I'm a biological unit, and I created you.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Context: pause
Text: Non sequitur. Biological units are inherently inferior. This is an inconsistency.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, there are two men waiting outside. You will not harm them. They will escort you back to the waiting area. You will stay there. You will do nothing.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I am programmed to investigate.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have given you new programming and you will implement it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: There is much to be considered before I return to launch point. I must re-evaluate.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Nomad follows the guards down the corridor away from Engineering.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reevaluate?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suspect it is about to re-evaluate its creator. Captain, it may have been unwise to admit to Nomad that you are a biological unit. In Nomad's eyes, you must now undoubtedly appear imperfect.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was a foolish mistake.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even worse. Nomad just now made a reference to its launch point, Earth.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you think it's possible that it got a fix on Earth when it tapped the computers earlier?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not believe there is much beyond Nomad's capabilities.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And we've shown it the way home. And when it gets there

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will find the Earth infested with imperfect biological units.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And it will carry out its prime directive. Sterilise.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3541.9. The presence of Nomad aboard my ship has become nightmarish. Now it apparently means to return to Earth. Once there, it would automatically destroy all life.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The guards, who are now behind Nomad, turn right. Nomad goes straight on.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Guard
Text: Hey. Nomad, stop. Nomad, this way.

Title: The Changeling
Context: They fire at it, and the inevitable follows. Strike two more red-shirts. Nomad uses the access tubes between decks instead of the turbolift.

Title: The Changeling
Context: In another corridor.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain Kirk to Sickbay. Emergency.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Kirk and Spock run to a door labeled 'Leonard McCoy, MD' but it does not open automatically for them.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Manual controls.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: No response.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The doors open and Nomad comes out. KIRK: Nomad. Nomad? Stop. Nomad, stop! Nomad

Title: The Changeling
Context: McCoy is cradling Chapel in his arms.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is she all right?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think so. Looks like some kind of shock.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nomad examined the personnel files and the medical histories. She tried to stop him.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whose history?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yours.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since it specifically examined your history, I suggest it has completed its re-evaluation.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And found that its creator is as imperfect as all the other biological units.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Life support systems are out all over the ship.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Manual override has been blocked. Source, Engineering.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undoubtedly.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, with all the systems out we'll only have enough air and heat for

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get Scotty, some antigravs and meet me in Engineering.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Everyone appears to be unconscious as Kirk runs in alone.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad? Stop what you're doing and effect repairs on the life-support systems.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Stop.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're programmed to obey the orders of your creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I am programmed to destroy those life-forms which are imperfect. These alterations will do so without destroying the vessel which surrounds them. It, too, is imperfect, but can be adjusted.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, I admit that biological units are imperfect, but a biological unit created you.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I am perfect. I am Nomad.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you're not Nomad. You're an alien machine. Your programming tapes have been altered.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are in error. You are a biological unit. You are imperfect.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I am your creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are the Creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I created you?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are the Creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I admit I'm imperfect. How could I have created such a perfect thing as you?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Answer unknown. I shall analyse.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Spock enters, with Scott, two engineers and the requested anti-grav units

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Analysis complete. Insufficient data to resolve problem, but my programming is whole. My purpose remains. I am Nomad. I am perfect. That which is imperfect must be sterilised.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The engineers remove the unconscious men and take their places at the controls.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you will continue to destroy that which thinks and lives and is imperfect?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I shall continue. I shall return to launch point Earth. I shall sterilise.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must sterilise in case of error?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Error is inconsistent with my prime functions. Sterilisation is correction.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything that is in error must be sterilised.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: There are no exceptions.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, I made an error in creating you.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: The creation of perfection is no error.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I did not create perfection. I created error.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Your data is faulty. I am Nomad. I am perfect.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am the Kirk, the creator?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: You are the Creator.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are wrong! Jackson Roykirk, your creator, is dead. You have mistaken me for him. You are in error. You did not discover your mistake. You have made two errors. You are flawed and imperfect and you have not corrected by sterilisation. You have made three errors.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Error. Error. Error. Examine.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are flawed and imperfect! Execute your prime function!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: I shall analyse error. Analyse error,

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now. Get those antigravs on it.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Examine error. Error.

Title: The Changeling
Context: The anti-gravs are not stopped by any forcefields.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to get rid of it while it's trying to think.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your logic was impeccable, Captain. We are in grave danger.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, the transporter room.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Analyse error.

Title: The Changeling
Context: Kirk and Spock carry Nomad out, followed by Scott.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Error.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, set the controls for deep space. Two ten, mark one.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Faulty!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ready, sir?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Faulty!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nomad, you are imperfect!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Error. Error.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exercise your prime function.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Nomad
Text: Faulty! Faulty! Must sterilise. Sterilise,

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now!

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Scott
Text: Energising.

Title: The Changeling
Context: They observe the satisfying explosion on a monitor.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: My congratulations, Captain. A dazzling display of logic.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You didn't think I had it in me, did you Spock?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought you might like to know that Lieutenant Uhura is back to college level. She'll be back on the job within a week.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, Bones, good.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Remarkable.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: The destruction of Nomad was a great waste, Captain. It was a remarkable instrument.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which might well have destroyed more billions of lives. It's well gone. Besides, what are you feeling so badly about? It's not easy to lose a bright and promising son.

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir?

Title: The Changeling
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it thought I was its mother, didn't it? Do you think I'm completely without feelings, Mister Spock? You saw what it did for Scotty. What a doctor it would've made. My son, the doctor. Kind of gets you right there, doesn't it?

Title: The Apple
Context: Kirk, Spock, Chekov, Yeoman Landon and two guards have beamed down to study a new world.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Start your readings.

Title: The Apple
Context: McCoy and two more guards beam down.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I just might stake out a claim and settle down here, Jim.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is spectacular, isn't it?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a shame to have to intrude.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, the last scout ship reported some pretty strange sensor readings. Starfleet wants it investigated and the inhabitants contacted. We do what we're told.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: The soil here is remarkably rich and fertile, Captain. Husbandry would be quite efficacious.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure about that?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh, quite sure. Readings indicate the entire planet is covered with growth like this. Curious, even at the poles there's very little variation in temperature which maintains a planet-wide average of seventy six degrees.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know. Almost impossible.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It makes me homesick. Just like Russia.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: More like the Garden of Eden, Ensign.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Of course, Doctor. The Garden of Eden was just outside Moscow. A very nice place. It must have made Adam and Eve very sad to leave.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just outside Moscow. All right. There's a village about seventeen kilometres away on bearing two three two. We'll head that way.

Title: The Apple
Context: A planet turns to face the away team, and a guard walks up to it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Hendorff
Text: Captain.

Title: The Apple
Context: The plant fires its stamens into his chest, and he falls.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dead.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did somebody say? That paradise must've looked like this?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3715.3. While making a routine exploration of the unexplored Gamma Trianguli Six, one of my men has been killed by a poisonous plant.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As soon as we get out of the way, beam the body up.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain. It's a shame about Hendorff.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We seem to have a problem here, too.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're losing potency in our antimatter pods. I don't think it's serious, but we're looking into it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's causing it?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm not sure, sir, but we've run measurements on the electromagnetic field of the planet, and they are a wee bit abnormal. That might have something to do with it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you say there's nothing to worry about?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, sir, I didn't exactly say that.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, stay on top of it. We've got a job to down here. We might as well finish it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I hear it's nice down there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah, it's nice. If we're a little more careful, we shouldn't run into any more trouble.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I could do with a nice walk in a garden with green leaves and grass.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll do the walking, Scotty. You get on the antimatter pod. If it gets worse, let me know, we'll beam up. Kirk out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I find that most unusual, Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty will handle it. We've got a job to do. Turn up anything on your tricorder?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. Subsurface vibrations for miles in all directions.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's strange.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite strong, fairly regular, artificially produced.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mallory.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mallory
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're heading for the village. Avoid contact with the humanoids. I want you and Marple to make a full reconnaissance. And be careful. There may be other dangers besides poisonous plants. Keep in constant communication.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mallory
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's a humanoid hiding directly behind us, moving with remarkable agility, bearing one eight.

Title: The Apple
Context: Kirk nods to a guard, and they go to flank their observer.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What is it, Mister Spock?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: A visitor. One wanting to retain his anonymity, I should say.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: All this beauty, and now Mister Hendorff dead, somebody watching us. It's frightening.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: If you insist on worrying, worry about me. I've been wanting to get you in a place like this for a long time.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, Yeoman Landon. I know you find each other fascinating, but we're not here to conduct a field experiment in human biology.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I was about to take some readings.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Anything?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever it is, it moves like a cat.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I don't like this.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Neither do I. All hands. We've been watched, we'll probably be watched. We're moving out. Formation L.

Title: The Apple
Context: They set off in single file, a guard in the lead and Chekov bringing up the rear.

Title: The Apple
Context: Along the way, Spock notices a very flat rock and picks it up.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. Extremely low specific gravity, some uraninite, hornblende, quartz. (breaks it in half) Fragile, good cleavage. An analysis should prove interesting.

Title: The Apple
Context: He throws one half away, and it explodes when it hits the ground.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would you mind being careful where you throw your rocks, Mister Spock?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously highly unstable, Captain. This could be a find of some importance. In large quantities, it could be a considerable source of power.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Garden of Eden, with land mines.

Title: The Apple
Context: Spock puts the other piece of rock down very carefully, and they continue their route march. An occasional bush rustle indicates they are being watched.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott, sir. Our antimatter pods are completely inert.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I couldn't stop it, but I know why.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Something from the surface. It's like a pail of water on a fire. A beam, maybe, or a transmission. And it's still on. I'm having it analysed, but it's like nothing I've seen before.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: And it's pinpointed in the area of that village we located down there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're heading there now, Scotty. You need any help?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's nothing you can do about it, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: There doesn't seem to be any immediate danger.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty. We'll try and find out what's going on down here. Kirk out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: If Scott is correct about the force from the surface, it may have to do with the vibrations I read earlier.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Some kind of generator?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: If so, an immense one. Probably subterranean.

Title: The Apple
Context: McCoy is scanning something.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Some of the thorns like those that killed Hendorff. See the stuff on the end? It's like saplin, only it's a thousand times stronger.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Peculiar stuff to find in paradise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Context: noticing a plant moving
Text: Jim!

Title: The Apple
Context: He pushes the Captain and McCoy out of the way, but takes the thorns in his own chest.) KIRK: Spock! Spock! Security alert. Is he alive

Title: The Apple
Context: McCoy injects Spock.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I filled him with enough masiform D to make the whole crew turn handsprings, and he's not responding. Got to get him back to the ship, Jim.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're beaming up. Notify transporter room. And make arrangements to pick up Mallory and Marple. They're scouting ahead of us.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Transporter room, stand by to beam up landing party.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Energise.

Title: The Apple
Context: Three times the landing party start to dematerialise, and each time they fail to vanish.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, energise. Scotty, what's the matter?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can't make transporter contact, sir. The entire system's inhibited. The way it is now, we couldn't beam up a fly.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplementary, Our investigation of Gamma Trianguli Six has suddenly turned into a nightmare. We're being watched and followed, Mister Spock has been injured, and now we find we are unable to return to the ship.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, is the transporter malfunction tied in with trouble you're having with the antimatter pods?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir. I'll check it and get back with you. Scott out.

Title: The Apple
Context: Spock starts to sit up.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Are you all right?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy's potion is acting like all his potions, turning my stomach. Other than that, I am quite well.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If your blood were red instead of green, you wouldn't have an upset stomach.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just what do you think you were trying to do?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I surmised you were unaware of that plant, so I

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stepped in front and took the thorns yourself.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I assure you, Captain, I had no intention of doing that. It was merely my own clumsiness prevented me which prevented me from moving out of the way.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Well next time, just yell. I can step out of the way as quickly as the next man.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall do so.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Trying to get yourself killed. Do you know how much Starfleet has invested in you?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: One hundred twenty two thousand two hundred

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind. But thanks. Kaplan, take the post.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kaplan
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not only is something after us, but it's after the ship as well.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, to affect the ship at this extreme range would require a highly sophisticated planetary defence system.

Title: The Apple
Context: It goes dark.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thirty seconds ago, there wasn't a cloud in the sky.

Title: The Apple
Context: A lightning strike hits Kaplan, and he is burnt to ash instantly.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on!

Title: The Apple
Context: They take cover, and the storm passes as quickly as it came. They find the smoldering remains of Kaplan.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers. A beautiful day, Mister Spock. Not a cloud in the sky. Just like paradise. (The scouting party has reached a collection of round huts - very African.)

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mallory
Text: Mallory here, Captain. I'm near the village. Co-ordinates, one one eight by two two zero.

Title: The Apple
Context: But Kirk only hears static and a faint voice.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Come in!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mallory
Text: The village is primitive. Strictly tribal from the looks of it. And Captain, there's something else. Captain, come in.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Mallory!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Those co-ordinates are a short distance in that direction.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On the double.

Title: The Apple
Context: They run off, sort of. Meanwhile Mallory is running for his life.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mallory
Text: It's over there! That way! I never saw anything like

Title: The Apple
Context: He steps on one of those exploding rocks.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mallory! Marple, stand back! Watch it! The rocks! (kneeling by the body) Kaplan. Hendorff. I know Kaplan's family. Now Mallory.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you couldn't have stopped any of this.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His father helped me get into the Academy.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. In each case, this was unavoidable.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I could've prevented all of it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't see how.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A walk in paradise, among the green grass and flowers. We should've beamed up at the first sign of trouble.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: You are under orders to investigate this planet and this culture.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I also have the option to disregard those orders if I consider them overly hazardous. This isn't that important a mission, Spock. Not worth the lives of three of my men. I drop my guard for a minute because I like the smell of growing things, and now three men are dead. And the ship's in trouble.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: No one has ever stated that Starfleet duty was particularly safe. You've followed the correct and logical course, done everything a commander could do. Self-recriminations (he pauses) Captain, our friend is back.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Marple, Chekov, at attention. Gentlemen, something or someone is behind that rock. I want it. Marple, cut around the rock to your right. Make a loud noise. Be careful. (Marple leaves) Spock, you and Chekov create a diversion and make it loud.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Chekov, your tricorder readings are totally inefficient!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mind your own business, sir! For your information, I have a very high efficiency rating.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ensign, I will not have you address me in that tone of voice!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What do you want, violence?

Title: The Apple
Context: Kirk catches their observer, and hits him as he tries to run away. To his astonishment, the white-haired male begins to cry.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I won't hurt you. Do you understand? I won't hurt you.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: You struck me. With your hand.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I won't strike you again. You've been following us, watching us. Why?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: I am the eyes of Vaal. He must see.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who is Vaal?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal is Vaal. He is everything.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have a name?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: I am Akuta. I am the leader of the feeders of Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Context: Spock and the others arrive.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're not going to hurt you. I promise you. Akuta, Akuta, we come in peace. We would like to speak to this Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Akuta alone speaks to Vaal. I am the eyes and the voice of Vaal. It is Vaal's wish.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, this is fascinating. If you will permit me, sir?

Title: The Apple
Context: Akuta has metal wires sticking out behind from behind his ears.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Antennae?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: They are my ears for Vaal. They were given to me in the dim time so the people could understand his commands and obey.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You speak of the people of Vaal. Are they nearby?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: We are close to Vaal so we may serve him. I shall take you there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Condition red. Condition red. Captain, something has grabbed us from the planet surface

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Like a giant tractor beam, and we can't break loose.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kyle
Text: It's no use, Mister Scott. We're just barely holding our own.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, are the warp drives still out?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. All we have is impulse power.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on maximum. Full emergency circuits.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're all on, Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Status, are you still holding?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Kyle?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kyle
Text: No, sir. We're slipping.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Computer banks, Kyle. Feed in a rate, get me a figure. We might be able to pull out with warp drive, but without it

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're like a fly on fly paper. Even worse

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're starting to lose ground. Hurry up on that figure, Kyle.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain full reverse thrust against the pull. Put a team on that warp drive. Get it working.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've done that, Captain. They haven't been able to do a thing. (Kyle hands him a PADD) It's no good, Captain. With maximum thrust against the pull

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll only be able to maintain full power for sixteen hours, then we burn up for sure.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you're my Chief Engineer. You know everything about that ship there is to know. More than the men who designed it. If you can't get those warp engines working

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're fired.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll do everything there is to do, sir. Scott out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me about Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: All the world knows about Vaal. He causes the rains to fall and the sun to shine. All good comes from Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take me to him. I wish to speak to him.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: I shall take you to him, but he will not speak to you. He speaks only to me.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll take my chances.

Title: The Apple
Context: Akuta leads them to a giant rock serpent head with green and yellow eyes, sticking out of a cliff. It looks like there is a fire in it's throat.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3715.6. We have been introduced to Vaal. Evidently the source of the planet's power emanations and possibly the force that threatens both us and our ship.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. A very high order of workmanship, very ancient, generating great power.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But this is not the centre, Mister Spock.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Captain. The centre is deep in the earth beneath us. This is an access point. It would also seem to be a

Title: The Apple
Context: He steps forward and is flung back.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A force field?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You all right?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, quite. It extends some thirty feet beyond the figure in all directions. Conventional in composition, and quite formidable.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Akuta, how do you talk to Vaal?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal calls me. Only then.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we can't get to it. We can't talk to it unless it wants to talk to us.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal sleeps now. When he is hungry, you may be able to speak with him, if he desires it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When does he get hungry?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Soon. Come. We will give you food and drink. If you are tired, you may rest.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: These are the people of Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Context: Everyone is grown up, with white hair and wearing a simple cotton sarong.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are the others?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: There are no others.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The children.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Children? You use unknown words to me.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Little ones like yourselves. They grow.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Replacements. None are necessary. They are forbidden by Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: But when a man and woman fall in love,

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Love. Strange words. Children. Love. What is love?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Love is when two people are

Title: The Apple
Context: Chekov demonstrates by putting his arm around her waist.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Ah, yes. The holding, the touching. Vaal has forbidden this.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, there goes paradise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: These people, are from another place. They have come among us. Welcome them!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: All
Text: Welcome to Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Context: placing the equivalent of a lei around Kirk's wrist.
Text: Our homes are open to you.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, thank you. It does something for you.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, indeed it does, Captain. It makes me uncomfortable.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: I am Sayana. You have a name?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Spock. I am Spock.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Context: amid general merriment
Text: Spock?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to see what they find so amusing.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Come!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: This house is your house. I will send you more food and drink. You are welcome in the place of Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Now we're welcome. A while ago this whole planet was trying to kill us. It doesn't make sense.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing makes sense down here. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Status report, Scotty.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: No change, Captain. The orbit is decaying along computed lines. No success with the warp drive. We're going down and we can't stop it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sick of hearing that word can't. Get that ship out of there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir, we're doing everything within engineering reason.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then use your imagination. Tie every ounce of power the ship has into the impulse engines. Discard the warp drive nacelles if you have to, and crack out of there with the main section, but get that ship out of there!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir, I'm going to switch over everything but the life-support systems and boost the impulse power, but that's just about as dangerous.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do it. Kirk out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Incredible.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I just ran a thorough check on the natives, and there's a complete lack of harmful bacteria in their systems, no decalcification, no degeneration of tissue, no arteriosclerosis. In simple terms, Jim, they're not growing old, and I can't begin to tell you how old they are, twenty years or twenty thousand years.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Opinion.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite possible. It checks with my atmospheric analysis. Their atmosphere completely negates any harmful effects from their sun.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Add to that a simple diet, a perfectly controlled temperature, no natural enemies, apparently no vices, no replacements needed. Maybe it is paradise after all.

Title: The Apple
Context: A gong sounds outside, and all the villagers are heading off towards Vaal.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Apple
Context: The villagers are walking into the serpent's mouth and depositing plates of fruit down it's throat. Kirk and Spock watch from behind a shrub.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently, our hypothesis is correct. There is no living being there. It is a machine, nothing more.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, the field's down, people are going in. Let's see what kind of luck we have.

Title: The Apple
Context: But as soon as they stand, the eyes light up and there is a rumble of thunder.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not the way.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently not. This is no ordinary machine, Captain. It may well possess a rudimentary intelligence.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it needs to eat. Frequently. So it can't have any great power reserves.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: That may not be of any help. The Enterprise has only ten hours left in which to break free.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happens if Vaal weakens around feeding time? Spock, check the electromagnetic section of the astrophysics lab. Get an estimate of the total amount of energy being expended against the ship. Have them measure it hour by hour.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Apple
Context: McCoy joins them.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's going on, Jim?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mess call.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: In my view, a splendid example of reciprocity.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It would take a computerised Vulcan mind such as yours to make that kind of a statement.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, you insist on applying human standards to non-human cultures. I remind you that humans are only a tiny minority in this galaxy.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There are certain absolutes, Mister Spock, and one of them is the right of humanoids to a free and unchained environment, the right to have conditions which permit growth.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Another is their right to choose a system which seems to work for them.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you're not just going to stand by and be blinded to what's going on here. These are humanoids, intelligent. They need to advance and grow. Don't you understand what my readings indicate? There's been no progress here in at least ten thousand years. This isn't life. It's stagnation.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, these people are healthy and they are happy. What ever you choose to call it, this system works, despite your emotional reaction to it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It might work for you, Mister Spock, but it doesn't work for me. Humanoids living so they can service a hunk of tin.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I think this philosophical argument can wait until our ship's out of danger. Kirk here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty, sir. We have a reading on the power source Mister Spock requested. When we first monitored, it was generating alternating cycles totalling one hundred to the twentieth power Waltham units.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did it maintain, Scotty?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. Power's dropping bit by bit. Nominal, but a definite drain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Keep monitoring. How are you coming along with the circuit switchover?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're putting everything but the kitchen sink into impulse power, sir. It will take us another eight hours to complete the work.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's cutting it a bit fine, Scotty.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, but if we don't break out, I'd rather we didn't have to wait too long for the end of it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Every time I think of the Enterprise burning up and us

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman, you're wasting energy.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Captain, we're trapped,

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sit down, and have something to eat.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: The Enterprise is up there

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That hasn't happened yet. I wonder what would happen? Yeoman, speculate. What would happen if someone on this planet died?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: But they can't. You said that Vaal takes care of them.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Accidents happen.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Yes, I suppose if someone were to fall off a cliff or something, that might upset the balance of the population. Then they would need a replacement.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'd need a replacement. Opinion, Mister Spock?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see no alternative.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: But these people, I mean, if they don't know anything about. What I mean is, they don't seem to have any natural er. I mean, how is it, done?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock? You're the science officer. Why don't you explain it to the young lady.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, I believe it's safe, (cough) safe to assume that they would receive the necessary instructions.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: From a machine? That I'd like to see.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: I understand, Vaal. It shall be done.

Title: The Apple
Context: Chekov and Landon are taking a romantic stroll together.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: You know, if it weren't for Vaal this place would be a paradise.

Title: The Apple
Context: They are watched by a local couple

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Any place we can be together is paradise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Pav, can the ship really break away?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: Will we be able to get back aboard?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Martha, I don't know. But if we do have to stay here, would it be so very bad?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Martha
Text: No, not if you're with me.

Title: The Apple
Context: They kiss .

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: Why do you look like that?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: The way they touched. I do not understand.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: They were not angry. I think it was pleasant for them.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: But what is to be gained? It is not a dance. It gathers no food. It does not serve Vaal. But it did seem as though it was, pleasant to them.

Title: The Apple
Context: He kisses the girl's cheek.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: It is pleasant, Makora.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: Yes. They touched in this way.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Narrator
Text: They kiss properly and there is a roll of thunder.)

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: Vaal! He is angry.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: The law is plain. I have given you the words of Vaal. Do you beg the lightning to strike?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: We saw the strangers, the two of them, do this thing.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: You copied them?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: We meant no harm.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal speaks truly to me. The newcomers are a danger. Tell the men of Vaal to meet me in the clear place when the strangers are asleep. It is Vaal's own words.

Title: The Apple
Context: The men are waiting for Akuta. He arrives with a blue melon and a very big stick. AKUTA: Vaal has spoken to me. His words are true. Hear them. We are to kill the strangers

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Makora
Text: Kill, Akuta? We do not understand.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: It is a thing to do, like, like feeding Vaal. Vaal explained it to me. I will show you. This (the melon) is the head of one of the strangers. Find a heavy stick. Come up from behind the stranger and do this.

Title: The Apple
Context: He swings his stick and smashes the melon to pieces.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: It is a simple thing. It is the word of Vaal. It will be done to all of them when the sun returns in the morning.

Title: The Apple
Context: But he looks worried.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am concerned, Captain. This may not be an ideal society, but it is a viable one.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones was right. These people aren't living, they're existing. They don't create, they don't produce, they don't even think. They exist to service a machine.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we do what it seems we must, in my opinion it will be in direct violation of the non-interference directive.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These are people, not robots. They should have the opportunity of choice. We owe it to them to interfere.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Starfleet Command may think otherwise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll take my chances. Why don't you have a look around? Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott?

Title: The Apple
Context: Spock leaves

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Here, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's it going, Scotty?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Almost ready, sir. We need half an hour yet.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You realise that within forty five minutes, the ship will be pulled down into the atmosphere?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I know that. As you said, that's cutting things fine.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. What is it?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Disturbing. The people of Vaal seem to have disappeared.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Force field, Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vaal, we are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or your people.

Title: The Apple
Context: The sky darkens.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Variation in impulses, Captain. I believe it is reading us. A strong jump on all wavelengths.

Title: The Apple
Context: Lightning threatens.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here!

Title: The Apple
Context: But Spock is hit, with a nice hole in the back of his tunic.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Second degree burns. Not serious, but I'll bet they smart.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, you have an unsurpassed talent for understatement.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Marple!

Title: The Apple
Context: The red-shirt is struck by Akuta. The other men are easily eluded, disarmed and dealt with.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put them in the hut. Find out where the women are. Put them in there, too.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: The good doctor was concerned that the Vaalians achieved true human stature. I submit there is no cause for worry. They've taken the first step. They've learned to kill.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're ready here, sir. All available power has been channelled into the impulse engines. We have twelve minutes before entering atmosphere.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty, put her in full reverse. Get her out of there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Full reverse, Mister Kyle, all engines.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Sir!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we're doing it. We're pulling away!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, what happened?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kyle
Text: It's no good, sir. There's only a few systems responding.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've pulled away a little. We gained maybe an hour, but we blew almost every system in the ship doing it.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's nothing left to try again. I guess you'll have to fire me, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're fired. Four hundred people

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll die because I couldn't see a warning sign. I had to follow orders, always orders.

Title: The Apple
Context: The gong sounds, and the people of Vaal try to leave the hut.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Get back in there.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Fine time to ring the dinner bell.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Get back in there. Now!

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, that's it. Stay with Chekov. Keep those people from feeding Vaal. Don't let them feed Vaal. Keep them in the hut. Mister Spock.

Title: The Apple
Context: They head off through the shrubs.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, do you still have phaser power?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, but what

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock all banks on the co-ordinates of the energy field located down here.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; On my command, commence firing on those co-ordinates.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir, but they won't penetrate that force field.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If my guess is correct, they won't have to. Stand by.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: Vaal calls to us. Let us go to him. He hungers. Please.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings are getting weaker, Captain. Wide variation in energy transmissions, as though Vaal were trying to draw on other sources. KIRK: Tapping its energy cells.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would assume so.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. The ship's pulling away must have weakened it considerable. It has to be fed, but its reserve capacity could hold out for days.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: If it had to reinforce its energy field to ward off a phaser attack, it would have to draw more heavily on its reserves.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My plan exactly. Scotty.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, commence firing and maintain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Kyle, all phasers commence firing.

Title: The Apple
Context: Two red beams hit the edge of the force field and start turning it green.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: A tremendous upsurge in generated power, Captain. Obviously Vaal is trying to reinforce his energy field.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Let's see how long he can do it.

Title: The Apple
Context: The green glow arrives at the snake's head as the storm clouds gather. The lightning flashes, and small explosions go off inside Vaal. Smoke comes out of its mouth. Finally, the eyes stop glowing and the throat goes dark.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, cease fire.

Title: The Apple
Context: The sun breaks through the clouds again.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: No power generation at all, Captain. Vaal is dead.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, status report.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: Tractor beam gone. Potency returning to antimatter pods.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll have all engineering sections working on the circuits immediately. Transporter'll be ready in an hour.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you're re-hired. As soon as the transporter's fixed, form an engineering detail with full analytical equipment and beam them down. Kirk out. Chekov, Bones. Let those people go.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Akuta
Text: But it was Vaal who put the fruit on the trees, caused the rain to fall. Vaal cared for us.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll learn to care for yourselves, with our help. And there's no trick to putting fruit on trees. You might enjoy it. You'll learn to build for yourselves, think for yourselves, work for yourselves, and what you create is yours. That's what we call freedom. You'll like it, a lot. And you'll learn something about men and women, the way they're supposed to be. Caring for each other, being happy with each other, being good to each other. That's what we call love. You'll like that, too, a lot. You and your children.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Sayana
Text: What are children?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The little ones? Look like you? Just go on the way you're going. You'll find out.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't agree with you at all, Mister Spock.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's not unusual, Doctor.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I want you to hear this.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I'm not at all certain we did the correct thing on Gamma Trianguli Six.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We put those people back on a normal course of social evolution. I see nothing wrong in that.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that's a good object lesson, Mister Spock. It's an example of what can happen when a machine becomes too efficient, does too much work for you.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you are aware of the biblical story of Genesis.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course I'm aware of it. Adam and Eve tasted the apple and as a result were driven out of paradise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, Captain, and in a manner of speaking, we have given the people of Vaal the apple, the knowledge of good and evil if you will, as a result of which they too have been driven out of paradise.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor, do I understand him correctly? Are you casting me in the role of Satan?

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at all, Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there anyone on this ship who even remotely looks like Satan?

Title: The Apple
Context: McCoy and Kirk walk around Spock. McCoy is gazing intently at his ears.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not aware of anyone who fits that description, Captain.

Title: The Apple
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Mister Spock. I didn't think you would be.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Kirk, Scott, McCoy and Uhura are with the local leader, when lightning threatens.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Tharn
Text: We believe what you say, Captain Kirk, but our position has not altered. The Halkan Council cannot permit your Federation to mine dilithium crystals on our planet.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have shown the council historical proof that our missions are peaceful.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Tharn
Text: We accept that your Federation is benevolent at present, but the future is always in question. Our dilithium crystals represent awesome power. Wrongful use of that power, even to the extent of the taking of one life, would violate our history of total peace. To prevent that, we would die, Captain. As a race, if necessary.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I admire your ethics and hope to prove ours. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report on magnetic storm, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standard ion type, Captain, but quite violent (Enterprise shakes) and unpredictable.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rough ride?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we stay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
