Text: Stand by to beam up landing party.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot an extended orbit to clear disturbance. Kirk out.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Comply, Mister Sulu.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When may we resume discussion?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Tharn
Text: The council will meditate further, but do not be hopeful of any change. Captain, you do have the might to force the crystals from us, of course.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we won't. Consider that. Enterprise. Transporter room, energise.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Trouble, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Four figures start to materialise, then disappear again. The image of Enterprise in orbit reverses itself. Finally, four figures solidify, wearing strange uniforms with gold sashes. Uhura's midriff is bare.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock was right. It was a rough trip.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Spock and Kyle greet their Captain with a semi-Nazi salute. Their uniforms have changes, and Spock has grown a very fetching goatee beard.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: At norm, Mister Kyle. Controls at neutral.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Status of mission, Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No change.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standard procedure, Captain? (Kirk nods) Mister Sulu, you will programme phaser barrage on Halkan cities.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their military capability, Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: None.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Regrettable that this society has chosen suicide. Mister Kyle, you were instructed to compensate during the ion storm.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: But I tried, Mister Spock, I tried.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Carelessness with the equipment cannot be tolerated.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: But Mister Spock, I

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your agoniser.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: No, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your agoniser, please.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: A guard restrains Kyle and takes a device from his belt.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: No, Mister Spock! I tried. I really tried.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Spock places the device on Kyle's collar bone, and he writhes in agony. When it is removed, he collapses.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate unknown. During an ion storm, my landing party has beamed back to the Enterprise and found it and the personnel aboard changed. The ship is subtly altered physically. Behaviour and discipline has become brutal, savage.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, the storm has caused some minor damage in your section. There are also injuries requiring your attention, Doctor. Well, gentlemen?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: The power beam jumped for a moment, sir, as the landing party was about to materialise. I never saw it happen before.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Due to your error, Mister Kyle?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kyle
Text: No, Mister Spock. Before.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly a result of the severe storm. Captain, do you feel any abnormal effects?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Doctor McCoy, you'd better look us over. That was a rough beam-up.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, have those transporter circuits checked.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, what is all this?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: How did we get in these

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not now. Not now.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is this? Everything's all messed up and changed around, out of place.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, what's happened?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, not everything. That spot, I spilt acid there a year ago. Jim, What in blazes is this?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. It's our Enterprise but it isn't. Maybe

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Maybe what, Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any of you feel dizzy when we were in the transporter beam?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When we first materialised.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I did.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It happened twice. First we were in our own transporter chamber, then we faded, and then when we finally materialised, we were here. Wherever this is.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, the transporter chief mentioned a surge of power. The transporter lock might have been affected by the ion storm and we just materialised somewhere else.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, here. Not our universe, not our ship. Something parallel. A parallel universe co-existing with ours on another dimensional plane. Everything's duplicated, almost. Another Enterprise. Spock with a beard.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Another Captain Kirk, another Doctor McCoy, another

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: An exchange. If we're here

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then our counterparts must have been transporting up at the exact same time. Similar storms on both universes disrupted the circuits. We're here, and they're on our Enterprise. Probably asking the same questions. Are we in another universe, and if so, how do we get back to our own? They'll use the computer, and we have to.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What about the Halkans? We can't let them be destroyed.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, can you buy me some time. Get below and short out the main phaser couplings. They'll think the storm blew the stand-by circuits.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then get on this technology. It's all we have to work with if we want to get back home. The intercom may be monitored. Use your communicators for private messages. Subfrequency and scramble.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Scott leaves

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get to your post. Run today's communication from Starfleet Command. I want to know my exact orders and options, if any.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura, you're the only one who can do it. I'll be right there.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She leaves.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Let's take a look at the library. We have a lot to learn.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Chekov, phaser setting for planetary target A.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Co-ordinates seven one two stroke four, Mister Sulu.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Port batteries locked.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Uhura enters, and goes to her station. Sulu goes over to her. He has a very nasty scar down his face.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Still no interest, Uhura? Hmm? I could change your mind.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: You are away from your post, Mister.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Is the captain here? Is Spock here? When the cat's away

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She slaps his hand away, then Kirk enters. Everyone salutes him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Communications status.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No storm damage, sir. All stations report normal. (quietly) You're ordered to annihilate the Halkans unless they comply. No alternative.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers Locked on target A, Captain. Approaching optimum range. Commence fire, Captain? Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Mister Sulu.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: The door opens and a burly guard blocks Scott's entrance.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've been ordered to check phaser couplings for possible damage by the storm.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Guard
Text: Do you have authorisation from security, sir?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain's orders.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Guard
Text: I'll have to check with Security Chief Sulu, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Never mind. I'll attend to it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: He goes to an intercom.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Phaser report, sir. No damage.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. Thank you, Mister Scott. Kirk out.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Spock enters the Bridge.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Planet's rotation is carrying primary target beyond arc of phaser lock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shall I correct orbit to new firing position?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lock on to secondary city.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, contact the Halkan council. I wish to talk to them again.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is a new race. They offer other things of value besides dilithium crystals.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: But we cannot expect their co-operation. They have refused the Empire. Command procedure dictates that we provide the customary example.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Secondary target now moving beyond our phaser lock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put phasers on standby, Mister Sulu.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: A serious breach of orders, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have my reasons, and I'll make them clear to you in my own good time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have the leader on the Halkan Council waiting on channel B.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is useless to resist us.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: THARN [on viewscreen: We do not resist you.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have twelve hours to consider your position.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: THARN [on viewscreen: Twelve years, Captain Kirk, or twelve thousand. We are ethically compelled to deny your demand for our dilithium crystals, for you would use their power to destroy.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will level your planet and take what we want. That is destruction. You will die as a race.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: THARN [on viewscreen: To preserve what we are.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will not argue. Twelve hours. No more. Close communications. Turn phasers off.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Twelve hours, Captain? That is unprecedented.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I shall be in my quarters. Lieutenant Uhura, have Doctor McCoy and Mister Scott meet me there.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Chekov presses a couple of buttons on his console, then leaves his post.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you've placed yourself in a most grave position. This conduct must be reported.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're at liberty to do so, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Deck five, sir?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: As Kirk leaves the lift, someone punches him in the face and he is grabbed.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Chekov
Context: holding a phaser on Kirk
Text: So you die, Captain, and we all move up in rank. No one will question the assassination of a captain who has disobeyed prime orders of the Empire.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. I command an Enterprise where officers apparently employ private henchmen among the crew, where assassination of superiors is a common means of advancing in rank.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Suddenly, one of Chekov's men turns against him, taking his weapon and shooting another. Kirk throws his final assailant and he gets zapped into molecules too. The turbolift opens and two armed men come out.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Man
Text: Your men, Captain. Easy, Farrell. I did your job. Ask the captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Sir?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, he did your job.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Smart boy, switching to the top dog.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get him out of here.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Man
Text: Mister Chekov was going to make me a chief. You could make me an officer.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. You're working for me.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Man
Text: A commission?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're in line. You might even make captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Man
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Kirk punches him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not on my ship.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Farrell
Text: The booth for this one, sir?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the booth. Carry on.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Chekov is taken away.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: The three men enter warily.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Here. Here. What's this?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's called blood. Watch your step. The officers move up by assassination. Chekov tried it on me.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu is Security Chief, like the ancient Gestapo.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And my Sickbay is a chamber of horrors. My assistants were betting on the tolerance of an injured man. How long it would take him to pass out from the pain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report on technology.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mostly variations in instrumentation. Nothing I can't handle.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Star readings?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Everything's exactly where it should be, except us.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find out where we stand. Computer.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Context: a male voice
Text: Ready.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. Record security research, to be classified under my voice print or Mister Scott's.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Recorded.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Produce all data relevant to the recent ion storm. Correlate following hypothesis. Could a storm of such magnitude cause a power surge in the transporter circuits creating a momentary interdimensional contact with a parallel universe?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At such a moment, could persons in each universe, in the act of beaming, transpose with their counterparts in the other universe?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could conditions necessary to such an event be created artificially using the ship's power?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Record procedure. Scotty, can you do it?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not by myself. I'll need help. And you'd be too conspicuous.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm a doctor, not an engineer.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now you're an engineer. I'll have to tap the power we need from the warp engines and balance it for the four of us.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, the way this ship is run, what kind of people are we in this universe?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find out. Computer.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Ready.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Read out official record of current command.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Captain James T. Kirk succeeded to command ISS Enterprise through assassination of Captain Christopher Pike. First action, suppression of Gorlan uprising through destruction of rebel home planet. Second action, execution of five thousand colonists on Vega Nine.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel. Now we know.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain? We can do it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: We have to lay in the automatic transporter setting, but when we interrupt engine circuits to tie the power increase into the transporter, it'll show up on Sulu's security board. Of course, we'll only need a second.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll tell Uhura to create a diversion to distract Sulu, at your signal. Let's get back to our posts. Keep me advised.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, if we're here, what do you suppose our counterparts doing back in our universe?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On our Enterprise.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: A furious duplicate Captain is being manhandled along the corridor by two security guards and thrown into the Brig. Uhura, Scott and McCoy are already there.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: I order you, Let me go! Traitors! Spock, get these men off me! What is this?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy2
Text: What are you doing, Spock?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: You traitorous pig. I'll hang you up by your Vulcan ears. I'll have you all executed!

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think not. Your authority on this ship is extremely limited, Captain. The four of you will remain her in the Brig and in custody until I discover how to return you to wherever it is you belong.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Has the whole galaxy gone crazy? What kind of a uniform is this? Where's your beard? What's going on? Where's my personal guard?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can answer none of your questions at this time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: All right, Spock. Whatever your game is, I'll play it. You want credits, I'll give them to you. You'll be a rich man. A command of your own? I can swing that, too.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently some kind of transposition has taken place. I find it extremely interesting.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Spock. What is it that will buy you? Power?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk2
Text: Power, Spock? I can get that for you!

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I am pleased that you frustrated Mister Chekov's plan. I should regret your death.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not desire the captaincy. I much prefer my scientific duties. I am frankly content to be a lesser target.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Logical, as always, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: They arrive at a cylinder containing Chekov, who is writhing in agony.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: The agony booth is a most effective means of discipline. I presume you've ordered full duration.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I haven't decided.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. His act warrants death.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said I haven't decided.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is, of course, your affair. Captain, may I inquire if you intend to persist in your unusual course of action regarding the Halkans?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: They continue walking. Farrell joins Spock's personal guard walking behind his master.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You heard my orders.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are, of course, in contradiction to standard Empire procedure. You cannot ignore the consequences.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that a threat?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not threaten, Captain. I merely state facts. I have found you to be an excellent officer. Our missions together have been both successful and profitable. However, I shall not permit your aberrations to jeopardise my position.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you think we should destroy the Halkans?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Terror must be maintained or the Empire is doomed. It is the logic of history.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Conquest is easy, control is not. We may have bitten off more than we can chew.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I do not wish to find myself opposing you, but if you continue on your present course, this confusing, inexplicable behaviour,

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is my concern, not yours. You would find me a formidable enemy.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm aware of that, Captain. I trust that you are aware of the reverse.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Spock and his bodyguard leave.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Orders, sir?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Release Chekov. Confine him to quarters.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Farrell
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Scott distracts the guard outside the door so McCoy can give him a hypo.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That ought to hold him for about six hours.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: They go to the upper level, and Scott begins his work

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: The room is dark, and a woman is lying on his bed.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: I fell asleep. We had quite a time in the chem lab picking up after the storm. Nothing compared to your day, I gather. I heard about Chekov.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He gambled, I won.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: You got lucky. I'm surprised you could be caught off-guard that way.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was preoccupied.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: . Marlena
Text: You're still in trouble with Starfleet Command. What you've got in mind this time is beyond me. You're scheming, of course. The Halkans have something you want, or, is it all some clever means to advance you to the Admiralty? Kirk. The Cabinet itself?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Further than that, if I'm successful.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Really? Well, you must know what you're doing. You always do. If I'm to be the woman of a Caesar, can't I know what you're up to?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Their kiss is interrupted by the intercom.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Spock, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have received a private communication from Starfleet Command. I am committing a breach of regulations by informing you of its contents.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am instructed to wait until planet dawn over principal target to permit you to carry out our mission.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if I don't?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: In that event, I am ordered to kill you and to proceed against the Halkans as the new captain of the Enterprise.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate unknown. We are trapped in a savage, parallel universe from which we must escape within four hours, or I will face a death sentence at Mister Spock's hands.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Let's drink a toast to Spock, The only man aboard with the decency to warn you, and he'll die for it. They'll never find another man like him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't intend to kill him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Are you going to act against the Halkans before the deadline?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but I'll avoid killing Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Just get him out of the way, he and his men.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll get out of his way.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Shall I activate the Tantalus field? You'll at least want to monitor him, won't you?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She touches a wall panel and it rises to reveal a screen and a collection of buttons.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: I hate this thing.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not that bad.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Of course not. It made you captain. How many enemies have you simply wiped out of existence by the touch of a button? Fifty? A hundred? Now, I always thought that was funny, The great, powerful Captain Kirk who owes everything to some unknown alien scientist and a plundered laboratory.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if you don't take advantage of your opportunities

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: You don't rise to the command of a starship or even higher.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She switches it on, and Spock is seen sitting at his table.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: That magnificent mind of his. But it can't protect him from this. I press it and he dies. Now?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Kirk switches it off.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: You really mean it. It doesn't matter. If Spock fails his order, he'll be killed anyway.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll see to it that the circumstances of his failure will clear him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: You're not even afraid of Starfleet Command. Can your scheme bring you that much power so quickly? And what about me? How does Marlena fit in?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does Marlena want to fit in?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She goes into the other room.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty here, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have to get out of here within three hours. Spock has orders to kill me unless I complete the mission.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've got another deadline, too, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: The two-way matter transmission affected the local field density between the universes, and it's increasing. We've got to move fast.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How fast?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Half hour at the most.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we miss?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: We couldn't get out of here in a century. We're ready to bridge power from the engines to the transporter.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: You've got to get down there and free the board so we can lock in. Give me about ten minutes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've got to complete a few more computations.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. I'll be in the transporter room in ten minutes. I'll meet you in Sickbay afterward.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: ready.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Explain computer activity in the engineering section.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: A security research is in progress.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Who is conducting the research?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: The Captain and Mister Scott.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is the nature of the research?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Computer
Text: Programme is classified under voice index log.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: A big red light starts flashing.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why are you monitoring my communications, Mister Sulu?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: My security board has detected extensive use of computer, Mister Spock. I was about to inform you.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's not hard to guess the nature of your order from Starfleet Command. I suggest a connection. The captain suspects.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's working on escape or defence.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is my concern.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Correct. It's your play. I hope you succeed, because the order would fall on me next and you know how Captain Kirk's enemies have a habit of disappearing.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I am successful, you see yourself a step nearer to the captaincy. I do not want to command the Enterprise, but if it should befall me, I suggest you remember that my operatives would avenge my death and some of them are Vulcans.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Marlena has changed into something more comfortable.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Oiling my traps, darling. I'm afraid I'm a little out of practice. Maybe that's what happened to us? It's very hard for a working officer to shine as a woman every minute, and you demand perfection.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've never seen perfection, but no woman could come closer to it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: I remember when you used to talk that way.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I still do.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Prove it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got to go.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Ship's business? An important task on the crew deck? Well, I guess it's over. Commander Kenno will take me temporarily. He's made that quite clear. I'll call a yeoman to help me with my things.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't have to do that.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Are you feeling sorry for me? Do I see hesitation in your eyes about anything? I want one thing, Captain. Transfer me. On the Enterprise, I am humiliated! On another ship, I can hunt fresh game. I've got my rank, and. Don't I? I've been a captain's woman, and I like it. I'll be one again if I have to go through every officer in the fleet.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could. (She turns to slap him.) I simply meant that you could be anything you want to be.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: They kiss, long and passionate.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: It's been a long time since you've kissed me like that. You're a stranger. Mercy to the Halkans, mercy to Spock, to me. Am I your woman?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the Captain's woman until he says you're not.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She turns on the Tantalus machine and watches him go into a turbolift.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty's signal should be coming through any moment. You know what to do.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've got a pretty good idea, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep Sulu's attention off that board.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'll do my best, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good luck. Kirk out.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Scott is up a Jefferies tube. He signals Uhura.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: You aren't very persistent, Mister Sulu. The game has rules. You're ignoring them. I protest and you come back. You didn't come back.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Context: wrapping his arms around her naked waist
Text: Now you're making sense.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I was getting bored. Of course this isn't the time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: The board beeps.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Any time's a good time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She slaps him, hard.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm afraid I changed my mind. Again.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You take a lot of chances, Lieutenant.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Context: drawing her dagger
Text: So do you, Mister. So do you. Take over for me.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She goes into the turbolift, and guards block Sulu's way.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, all clear. On my way to Sickbay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now it's up to the captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please restrict your movements, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing? Are you going to shoot me now, Spock? I thought I had until dawn.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall make that decision. Since your return from the planet, you've behaved in a most atypical and illogical manner. I want to know why.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shoot. You're wasting time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall not waste time with you. You're too inflexible, too disciplined once you've made up your mind. But Doctor McCoy has a plenitude of human weaknesses, sentimental, soft. You may not tell me what I want to know, but he will.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're running a big risk, Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have the phaser, Captain, and I do not intend to simply disappear as so many of your opponents have in the past. If you please. Sickbay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, of course. The entire landing party. Captain, stand over there. Doctor, it is time for answers.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Kirk knocks the phaser out of Spock's hand, and he and Scott try to fight him. Even Uhura gets pushed around. Finally, she hands Kirk a skull and he smashes it over Spock's head. He falls, unconscious.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much time, Scotty?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Hardly fifteen minutes, sir. The field density between the two universes is starting to close very fast.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Help me get him on the table. Well, come on. Help me get him on the table. He'll die without immediate treatment.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything laid in, Scotty? The time lag so the operator can get into the transporter chamber?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: All laid in, sir. Come on, McCoy! We're taking a chance of not getting back home.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We'll get home. This won't take long.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Marlena is still watching on the Tantalus screen.)

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Fourteen minutes. We've got to go!

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Shut up? I can save his life.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you want me to stop, Jim? It'll only take a minute.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He is very much like our own Mister Spock, isn't he? You've got that minute.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A little time, he'll live.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Sulu and three henchmen march in.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is this, Mister Sulu?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock has orders to kill you, Captain. He will succeed, apparently. You will also appear to have killed him after a fierce battle. Regrettable, but it will leave me in command.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Then one of the henchmen disappears, and another. Marlena presses the button again and Sulu is alone. Kirk disarms and knocks him out easily.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've barely got ten minutes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go, Bones.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't let him die, Jim. You get on to the transporter room. I'll be there in five minutes.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No longer.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I guarantee it. Now, go on, please.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Kirk, Scott and Uhura leave. McCoy gives Spock an injection.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Context: sitting up and grabbing McCoy's arm
Text: Why did the captain let me live?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: He pushes him against the wall and does a mind meld.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our minds are merging, Doctor. Our minds are one. I feel what you feel. I know what you know.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Marlena is waiting for them.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A friend. Activate the transporter. You saved us back at Sickbay with the Tantalus field.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Take me with you.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't. I'm sorry. Our power is balanced for four. There's no guarantee that we'll make it with five. All could die. Scotty?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's working, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: But there are only three of you.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One is coming. I'd help you if I could, Marlena. Believe that.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: She raises her phaser.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you kill us, you'll still stay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Uhura disarms Marlena.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's McCoy? Time, Scotty.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Five minutes, sir.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Do you know what they'll do to me?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: The power's cut, sir. They're on to us.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliary.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, it's available.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you bridge to your setup?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can get us the power, but the automatic setting is linked to the transporter main. If we bypass, that means that someone has got to operate the controls manually.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of us will have to stay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll stay, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get to the transporter chamber. You, too, Uhura.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Jim.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's an order, Scotty.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: What about me?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Spock enters with McCoy.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cut the transporter power. It was necessary to delay your beam-out until I could arrive. Take him.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Scott guides McCoy to the transporter pad.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineering, re-activate main transporter circuits.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a man of integrity in both universes, Mister Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: You must return to your universe. I must have my captain back. I shall operate the transporter. You have two minutes and ten seconds.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In that time I have something to say. How long before the Halkan prediction of galactic revolt is realised?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approximately two hundred and forty years.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The inevitable outcome?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Empire shall be overthrown, of course.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The illogic of waste, Mister Spock. The waste of lives, potential, resources, time. I submit to you that your Empire is illogical because it cannot endure. I submit that you are illogical to be a willing part of it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have one minute and twenty three seconds.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If change is inevitable, predictable, beneficial, doesn't logic demand that you be a part of it?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: One man cannot summon the future.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But one man can change the present. Be the captain of this Enterprise, Mister Spock. Find a logical reason for sparing the Halkans and make it stick. Push till it gives. You can defend yourself better than any man in the fleet.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, get in the chamber!

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about it, Spock?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: A man must also have the power.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In my cabin is a device that will make you invincible.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What will it be? Past or future? Tyranny or freedom? It's up to you.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is time.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In every revolution, there's one man with a vision.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk, I shall consider it.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: He beams them away.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: Back on the 'proper' Enterprise, in the right uniforms.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Welcome home, Captain.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What I don't understand is how were you able to identify our counterparts so quickly?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was far easier for you as civilised men to behave like barbarians, than it was for them as barbarians to behave like civilised men. I assume they returned to their Enterprise at the same time you appeared here.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Probably. However, that Jim Kirk will find a few changes, if I read my Spocks correctly.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I think I liked him with a beard better. It gave him character. Of course almost any change would be a distinct improvement.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What worries me is the easy way his counterpart fitted into that other universe. I always thought Spock was a bit of a pirate at heart.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, gentlemen. May I point out that I had an opportunity to observe your counterparts here quite closely. They were brutal, savage, unprincipled, uncivilised, treacherous, In every way, splendid examples of homo sapiens, the very flower of humanity. I found them quite refreshing.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not sure, but I think we've been insulted.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sure.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: A women steps out of the turbolift.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, er, Lieutenant?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Marlena
Text: Marlena Moreau. I was just assigned last week.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Lieutenant. Carry on.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've met her before, Captain?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uh, why do you ask?

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your reaction, One of recognition.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, no. No, no. We haven't met before, exactly. She just seemed a nice, likable girl. I think we could become friends. It's possible.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Context: And to prove it, he leaves his chair and goes over to stand next to her.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Kirk, Spock, McCoy, Scott, Chekov and Galway beam down to a group of pre-fabricated buildings. The sky is orange.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is everyone?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Perhaps they weren't expecting us.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our arrival was scheduled well in advance, Doctor. The annual check of every scientific expedition is routine.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had a subspace contact with a Robert Johnson, the leader of this expedition, an hour ago.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did he report anything wrong?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, yet there was something wrong. I can't pin it down. His conversation was disjointed, his thoughts a little foggy, unrelated. Chekov, check that building. Mister Spock and I will check this one. The rest of you, take a look around. See if you can find anyone.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Chekov goes into the dark building - it has no windows - and the light comes on as he bumps up against a table bearing the body of a very old man. He panics and runs out again.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain! Captain! Captain! Captain!

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A man, sir. In there. A dead man.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Again, the lights only come on when the party reaches the table in the middle of the room.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Exactly what it looks like. Death by natural causes. Old age.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite impossible, Doctor. I ran a personnel check on this expedition before we beamed down. I assure you that none of them were

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: He is interrupted by the entrance of an old man and woman. ROBERT: (to the woman) They've come to pay their respects to Alvin

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk of

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: You'll have to speak louder.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I say I'm Captain Kirk of the USS Enterprise. Who are you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: I'm Robert Johnson. This is my wife, Elaine.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How old are you? How old are you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: I'm, er, let me see. I am twenty nine, and Elaine is

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Elaine
Text: I'm twenty seven.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3478.2. On a routine mission to re-supply the experimental colony at Gamma Hydra Four, we discovered a most unusual phenomenon. Of the six members of the colony, none of whom were over thirty, we found four had died and two were dying of old age.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Johnson, can you hear me?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: I can hear you. Not deaf yet, you know. Not yet.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you tell me what happened?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: What happened?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did your instruments show anything?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Robert
Text: Elaine was so beautiful. So beautiful. So beautiful.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He can hear you, Jim, but he doesn't understand. Let's let him rest.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to nurse
Text: If they seem lucid, I'll be in the briefing room.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay seated. Commodore Stocker, I've asked you to be part of this briefing because Gamma Hydra Four falls in your administrative area.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: I appreciate that, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Wallace, as an expert in endocrinology, I'd appreciate you working very closely Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Context: a young blonde woman in a pink dress
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, would you fill them in?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The expedition is suffering from extreme old age, and they're growing older by the minute. Much older. My examinations have turned up absolutely nothing. In fact, I don't have a clue.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the atmosphere and environment, Mister Spock?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors reveal nothing which is inimical to human life. The atmosphere screens out the usual amount of harmful cosmic rays.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're close to the neutral Zone between our Federation and the Romulan empire. It's possible the Romulans have a new weapon and are using this colony as guinea pigs.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have already begun investigation into that possibility, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I want you all to check out everything in your own departments. No matter how remote, how far-fetched the notion, I want it run down. We'll stay in orbit until we have the answer.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: I'm sure you understand that I'm anxious to get to Starbase Ten to assume my new post.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Commodore. We'll do everything we can to make sure you make your duty.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Everyone leaves, but Doctor Wallace remains seated.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor, is there something I can do for you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Well, be a little less the cool, efficient Captain and a little more the old friend.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long has it been?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Six years, four months, and an odd number of days. You mean you don't know?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it's been a long time. Things wouldn't change if it started all over again, would it? You have your job, I have my ship, and neither one of us will change.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: You said it. I didn't. In all those years, I only heard from you once. A stargram when my husband died. You know, you never asked me why I got married after we called it off.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I supposed that you met someone you loved.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: I met a man I admired. A great man.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And in your field as you. You didn't give up a thing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: No. Just you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, Mister Spock would like to see you on the Bridge.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm on my way.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standard orbit, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've rechecked the sensors, Captain. Gamma Hydra Four checks out as a Class M planet with a conventional oxygen-nitrogen atmosphere and normal mass. I can find nothing at all out of the ordinary.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the comet that astrophysics reported?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're checking it on it. I've reached no conclusions as yet. The comet was a rogue and has never been investigated.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Captain Kirk?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Commodore.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Facilities at Starbase Ten are much more complete than those on board ship. It seems to me that your investigations would be facilitated if we proceeded there. I assure you all co-operation.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. You're anxious to get to the base, but we have a few facilities of our own here. I think the Enterprise will do quite nicely. I'll be in engineering, Mister Spock. Maintain standard orbit, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You already gave that command, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh? Well, follow it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant Galway.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Context: a petite woman
Text: Doctor, may I speak to you for a moment, please?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. Go right ahead.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: I know this is going to sound foolish, but I seem to be having a little trouble hearing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's probably nothing important.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: I never had trouble before.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, don't worry about it. Perhaps a little hypersonic treatment might clear it up.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Progress report, Mister Spock.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: All research lines negative, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Astronomical section reports that a comet recently passed by. Check into that.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm doing that, Captain, as per your previous order. We discussed that earlier.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes. Let me know what you come up with. I'll be in the Sickbay.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Kirk turns to put on a clean shirt and jerks, putting a hand to his back.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: McCoy and Chapel are putting a sheet over the face of a patient.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The last one. Robert Johnson. Cause of death, old age.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You did what you could.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Which adds up to absolutely nothing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor McCoy, this is Scott. May I come see you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All you need are vitamins, but you can come up anyhow.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I believe you're getting grey.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You take over my job and see what happens to you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see what you mean.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's your problem, Jim?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shoulder. Just a twinge. Probably muscular strain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're probably right, Doctor. By the way, I don't like how you've been running this ship lately.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Reprimand received. Go ahead.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: McCoy scans his arm, then takes hold of a finger. Kirk pulls back in pain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I think we better'd run a complete physical on you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Just muscular strain, isn't it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, Jim. It's advanced arthritis, and it's spreading.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can run it through again, but I'll come up with the same thing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Scott enters, his hair light grey and his face deeply lined.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3579.4. The Enterprise personnel who beamed down to the planet's surface, Doctor McCoy, Engineer Scott, Mister Spock, Lieutenant Galway, and myself are all showing definite signs of aging. Only Ensign Chekov appears to be normal.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Chekov is on the stamina machine, Spock is on a bio-bed, Kirk and McCoy are definitely looking older. Chapel and Wallace are also present.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Bones.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All of us who went down to the surface, with the exception of Chekov, are aging at various rates. Approximately thirty years for each day. I don't know what's causing it. A virus, a bacteria, or evil spirits, but I'm trying to find out.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, could I ask for some figures?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Context: looking about the same as usual
Text: Based on what Doctor McCoy gave me, I estimate that physically we each have less than a week to live. Also, since our mental faculties are aging faster than our bodies, we will be little better than mental vegetables in considerably lesser time.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Total senility?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain. In a very short time.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What a way to die. All right. I want all the research facilities, all the scientific technicians, to start round-the-clock research immediately. I want the answers, and I want the remedy. Let's start by finding out why Chekov hasn't been affected.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm doing what I can. (to Spock) You're perfectly healthy.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Context: sitting up
Text: I must differ with you, Doctor. I'm having difficulty concentrating, which is most disturbing, my eye sight appears to be failing, and the normal temperature of the ship seems to me to be increasingly cold.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I did not say you weren't affected, Mister Spock. You are perfectly healthy, that is, for any normal Vulcan on the high side of a hundred.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, can I go back to my station?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You feel up to it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Scott
Text: Of course I do. I just need a wee bit of rest, that's all.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: He leaves, with Spock giving him a hand.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can leave, too, Lieutenant Galway. Lieutenant Galway?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: What? You spoke to me, Doctor?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I spoke to you. I said that you could leave, too. Now why don't you go down to your quarters and get some sleep.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: No. I don't want to sleep. Can't you understand? If I sleep, what will I find when I wake up?

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Camera finally pans over to show us an old woman with a dowagers hump.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Galway, assume your position. Start your duties.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: Thank you, sir. (on her way out) What a stupid place to hang a mirror.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's ten years younger than I am, and she looks,

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: People age normally at different speeds, Jim.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why hasn't he aged?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well I want to know! Is it his youth, his blood type, his heritage, his glands, his genes?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His genes. All right, nurse. Prepare Chekov for another complete physical.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Come along, Ensign. This won't hurt. Much.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Promises.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: A few years ago on Aldebaran Three, my husband and I tried various carbohydrate compounds to slow down the degeneration of plant life.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then try that, Doctor Wallace. Try anything, but do it quickly.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Yes, sir. (leaves)

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be on the Bridge. Keep me posted as to Chekov.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Doctor Wallace is waiting for Kirk.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thought you were on your way to the biochemistry lab, Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: We both go in the same direction.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So we do.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Look, we know the problem. We know the progress of the affliction. Therefore, once we find the proper line of research, it's only logical we find the solution.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You sound like my first officer.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: No problem is insoluble. Not even ours.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That didn't spring from logic.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Our situation doesn't have its roots in logic. The heart is not a logical organ. When I married Theodore Wallace, I thought I was over you. I was wrong.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When did you realise that? Today?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: What?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much older was your husband than you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: What difference does that make?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Answer me.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Twenty six years.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's quite a difference.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Jim, he was a brilliant man. We were stationed on a lonely outpost. We were working together. I don't want to talk about him. I want to talk about us.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look at me. Look at me. What do you see?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: I see Captain James Kirk, a man of morality, decency, handsome, and strong.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And old. And rapidly growing older.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Jim, please.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you offering me, Jan? Love, or a going away present?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Give us some more blood, Chekov. The needle won't hurt, Chekov. Take off your shirt, Chekov. Roll over, Chekov. Breathe deeply, Chekov. Blood sample, Chekov. Marrow sample, Chekov. Skin sample, Chekov. If I live long enough, I'm going to run out of samples.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You'll live.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, yes. I'll live, but I won't enjoy it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maintaining standard orbit, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Kirk enters.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Increase orbit to twenty thousand perigee, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Context: a blonde yeoman
Text: Will you sign this, sir?

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: He drops the pen, she starts to stoop to pick it up.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman. (picks the pen up) You have a reason for being on the Bridge, Commodore Stocker?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: I'd hoped for a few words with you at your convenience.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have very little time.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: If I may say so sir, we have a due date at Starbase Ten.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're going to be late. I don't intend to leave this area until we've found the solution for this problem.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Captain, I'm watching four very valuable and one almost irreplaceable members of the Starfleet failing before my eyes. I want to do something to help.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes. If you're so concerned, I'll send a message to Starbase Ten.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you sent such a message this morning.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman? Where's that

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: Sir?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fuel consumption report?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: I gave it to you. You signed it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I'd signed it, I wouldn't have asked for it, now would l?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: Your signature, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Later, everyone is tip-toeing around an obviously sleeping Captain in his comfy chair. Spock enters, unaware.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I believe (notices, and wakes him gently) Captain. Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. I was just thinking.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir. Quite understandable.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have something to report?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir. We have the cause of the affliction.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: The orbit of Gamma Hydra Four carried the planet directly through the comet's trail. On conventional radiation settings, we discovered nothing. On resetting our sensors to the extreme lower range of the scale, undetected radiation appeared. Below normal radiation levels but definitely present, and undoubtedly residue from the comet.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, Spock. Well done. Let's get this to Doctor McCoy immediately. Oh. Lieutenant, take a message to Starfleet Command. Due to the proximity of the Romulans, you'd better use Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: But, Captain, the Romulans have broken Code two. If you remember the last bulletin

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then use Code three.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. Code three.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Message. Key to affliction may be comet which passed by Gamma Hydra Four. Said comet is now,

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Context: consulting PADD
Text: Quadrant four four eight, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quadrant. All units are to be alerted for complete analysis of radiation and means found to neutralise it. Comet is highly dangerous. Kirk, commanding Enterprise. Immediately, Lieutenant. Let's go.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Mister Sulu. Increase orbit to twenty thousand mile perigee.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You mean another twenty thousand, Captain?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I fail to understand why each one of my commands is being questioned. Now do as you're told, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, what is our present position?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Orbiting at twenty thousand, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maintaining, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Radiation? That's as good an answer as any, but why didn't we know about it earlier?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly, Doctor, because my thinking processes are not as efficient as before.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: to Wallace
Text: Run this through, Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Bones, I'm going up to the Bridge. Keep me posted. Spock?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a question for the doctor. (Kirk leaves) Doctor, the ship's temperature is increasingly uncomfortable for me. I've adjusted the environment in my quarters to one hundred twenty five degrees, which is at least tolerable. However, I

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I see I'm not going to be making any house calls on you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wondered if perhaps there was something which could lower my sensitivity to cold.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not a magician, Spock, just an old country doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. As I always suspected. (leaves)

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Doctor McCoy, none of our usual radiation therapies will have any effect on this radiation sickness.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, then we just start over, that's all. We work harder, faster, and we start completely from scratch if we have to. But we find something.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Spock, can I have a word with you?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Mister Spock, a starship can function with a Chief Engineer, a Chief Medical Officer, even a First Officer under physical par. But it's disastrous to have a commanding officer whose condition is any less than perfection.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am aware of that.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Please understand me. My admiration for Captain Kirk is unbounded. He is a great officer. But Mister Spock, I need your help and your co-operation.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: For what, sir?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: I would like you to take over command of the Enterprise.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: On what grounds, Commodore?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: On the grounds that the captain, because of his affliction, is unable to perform his duties.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Need I remind you, sir, that I too have contracted the same affliction?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Yes, but you're a Vulcan. You have a much greater life span. You show the affects to a much smaller degree.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm half human, sir. My physical reflexes are down, my mental capacity is reduced. I tire easily. No, sir. I am not fit for command.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Well, if you are not, with your Vulcan physique, then obviously Captain Kirk cannot be.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, I do have duties to perform.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Mister Spock. I do not like what I'm about to say but regulations demand it. And as a Starfleet flag officer, I must follow regulations. As second in command of the Enterprise, you must convene an extraordinary competency hearing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I resist that suggestion, Commodore.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: It's not a matter of choice. When a captain is unfit, physically or mentally, a competency hearing is mandatory. Please don't make me quote a regulation which you know as well as I do.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, sir. The hearing shall convene at fourteen hundred hours.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Chekov is back on the biobed.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now this isn't going to hurt a bit.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That's what you said the last time.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did it hurt?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Galway
Text: Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: She collapses in Kirk's arms.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's dead. Her metabolism caused her to age more rapidly than the rest of us, but the same thing's going to happen to us unless

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long have we got, Bones?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, a matter of days. Perhaps hours.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Let it read that this competency hearing was ordered by Commodore Stocker and reluctantly called by myself.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let it also read that I consider it invalid.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Mister Spock, may I make a statement? I have had to resort to these legal grounds in order to save the lives of some very valuable members of the Starfleet. I have tried to convince Captain Kirk of the necessity of proceeding to Starbase Ten, but I've been overruled in each case. The responsibility of this hearing is mine.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: On the contrary, Commodore. As presiding officer and as second in command of the Enterprise, the responsibility is mine. Captain Kirk, would you like to make a statement?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I would like to make a statement. I am the captain of this ship and am totally capable of commanding her. Let's call this whole thing off and get back to work.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is quite impossible, Captain. The regulations are quite specific. You are entitled to direct examination of all witnesses immediately after the board has questioned them.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very kind of you, Spock.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, how long have you served with Captain Kirk?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Two years, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: To your knowledge, has he ever had any difficulty making decisions?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did he order you to maintain standard orbit around Gamma Hydra Four?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did he not, several minutes later, repeat that order?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did he order you to increase orbit?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did he not several minutes later repeat that order?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He did not. When I give an order, I expect it to be obeyed. I don't have to repeat myself.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, please answer the question.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Captain Kirk repeated his order.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Mister Sulu. Yeoman Atkins, you handed Captain Kirk a fuel consumption report in the presence of witnesses, which he read and signed. Is that correct?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: Sir, he had more important things on his mind.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yeoman, you will simply answer the question.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: I, I guess he forgot he'd signed it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: You guess?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Atkins
Text: He'd forgot he'd signed it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Yeoman. You may leave. Lieutenant Uhura. I have here a bulletin from Starfleet Command which states that the Romulans have broken Code two. Are these your initials which appear at the bottom?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They are.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: And whose initials are those which appear directly below yours?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Those of Captain Kirk.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did Captain Kirk ask you to send a message about the comet which passed Gamma Hydra Four?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: He did.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Using Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, yes, but he changed it to Code three.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: After you reminded him that the Romulans had broken Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Lieutenant. Doctor McCoy, Doctor McCoy!

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: waking up
Text: Yes, Spock? What is it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Several hours ago, at the request of this board, you ran a complete physical examination of Captain Kirk.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I did.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Medical banks, compute described subject's physical age, using established norms as comparative base.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working. Subject's physical age based on physiological profile, between sixty and seventy two. Aging rapidly.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm thirty four. I'm thirty four years old.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: The computer differs with you, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Will you give us your professional evaluation of Captain Kirk's present physical condition.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain Kirk is suffering from a, a peculiar physical degeneration which strongly resembles aging.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is not his mental capacity degenerating even more rapidly?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, yes, but he's a better man right now

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, you heard the computer's analysis of Captain Kirk's physical age. Do you agree with it?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a blasted machine, Spock! You can't argue with a machine.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you agree with it, Doctor?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Yes, I do, agree. And I am sorry, Jim.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: This board has no further questions. Unless you, Commodore Stocker, have something that you would like to add.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: No. I am quite satisfied, Mister Spock.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you wish to call any witnesses, Captain Kirk?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
