Text: I am perfectly capable of speaking in my own defence, Mister Spock.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I would suggest

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, no. It's all right, Spock. It's all right. There's only one reason, and one reason alone, for having this, hearing. I refused to leave Gamma Hydra Two

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gamma Hydra Four, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. A slip of the tongue.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're inability to remember having given commands, reading and signing important orders and then forgetting them, your physical analysis as compiled by our own chief surgeon. All these things would appear to be irrefutable proof of failing physical and mental conditions.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So I'm a little confused. Who wouldn't be at a time like this? My ship's in trouble, my senior officers are ill. And this nonsense about a competency hearing is enough to mix up any man. Trying to relieve a captain of his command is, well, that's, that's. Spock, I wouldn't have believed it of you. Go ahead. Ask me questions. I'll show you what I'm capable of. There's nothing wrong with my memory. Go ahead! Ask me anything! We're in orbit around Gamma Hydra Two, right? Anyhow, it doesn't matter. There's a lot more to running a starship than answering a lot of fool questions. A lot more. Go ahead. Ask me questions.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have no more questions, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ask me anything. Anything.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: There'll be no more questions, Captain. If you would leave the room so the board can vote

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good idea. Get this stupid voting over with so I can get back to running the ship. The most fool thing I ever heard of. Competency hearing when there's work to be done. I'll be in my quarters, awaiting your decision. (leaves)

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Well, since the senior officers are incapable and I am of flag rank, I am forced by regulations to assume command.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, you have never commanded a starship.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: What would you have, a junior officer with far less experience than I have?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: The danger from the Romulans

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Mister Spock, we have to save these people. Mister Sulu, set a direct course for Starbase Ten. Warp five.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Across the Neutral Zone?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Immediately, Mister Sulu. All officers are to return to their posts.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Wallace and Spock enter.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So, I've been relieved.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sorry, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. You should've been a prosecuting attorney.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Regulations require

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Regulations. Don't give me regulations. You've wanted command all along. First little excuse you get

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I have not assumed command.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope you're proud of. What do you mean, you've not assumed command?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suffer the same affliction as you, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you're not in command, who is?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore Stocker.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stocker? Are you crazy? He's never had a field command.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott was unfit for command. Commodore Stocker is ranking officer

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No! Don't talk to me about rank! The man's a chair-bound paper-pusher. I order you to take command.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you refusing a direct order?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir. Only Commodore Stocker can give a command order onboard this ship.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You traitorous, disloyal, you stab me in the back the first chance you get? Spock. Get out. I never want to have to look at you again.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Spock leaves.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jan, Jan.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Oh, Jim. I'm sorry. Truly I am.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I made a fool of myself in there. I shouldn't have let them confuse me, rattle me.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Everybody understood.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I'm not old, Jan. I'm not. A few muscular aches doesn't make a man old. And you don't run a starship with your arms. You run it with your head. My brain's as sharp as it ever was. A simple case of radiation poisoning, and they relieve me of my command. I admit I'm getting a little grey, but radiation will do that to you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Oh, Jim, will you forgive me? I have work to do.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jan, you know me. Look at me closely. Tell me. Am I getting old?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing here?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem to be the place where I can be of the most use.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe you'd like to relieve Doctor McCoy. What about Chekov?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing. Absolutely nothing.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, there has to be. There has to be. We beamed down together. We were on the surface together. The same spot. We were together all the time.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, not all the time. Captain, he left us for a few moments.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He left us? He left us. He went into the building. Spock, something happened.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Yes, indeed, Captain. Doctor, you remember

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was scared! He saw the dead body and he ran out of the building and he was scared to death.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, yes. Now that could be. Right. Scared. Heart beats faster, breathe gets short, and there's cold sweats and adrenaline flows. Adrenal activity. Now hold on Just a minute. There was something that I read once. It was ancient history, just after the atomic age. Used for radiation sickness. Adrenaline.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Doctor, hyronalin is the specific accepted for all radiation sickness.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, yes. Now. But before, adrenaline. Highly promising. Early research, but they abandoned it when hyronalin was discovered.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite possible, Doctor. Perhaps a sufficiently efficacious compound could be developed.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't just stand there jawing, Spock. You and Doctor Wallace get cracking.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Entering Romulan Neutral Zone, sir. All sensors on maximum.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Thank you, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant Uhura, let me know if we contact any Romulan.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: The ship is shaken by an impact.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I think we just made contact, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Romulans approaching from both sides. We're bracketed, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Engineering wants instructions, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Commodore Stocker, what are your orders? Commodore! (But he is transfixed by the sight of another weapon blast heading for them on the viewscreen.)

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm going up to the bridge.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, Jim. You can't do it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have to go to the bridge. We're under attack.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse? Doctor Wallace!

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me go.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Jim.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Easy, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're under attack. I have to go to the Bridge. I've got to go to the bridge.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: But they bustle him into the ward instead.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Keep trying to raise the Romulans.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm trying, Commodore.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: If I could talk to them, explain to them why we violated the Neutral Zone.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The Romulans are notorious for not listening to explanations.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Lieutenant Uhura is right, sir. We've tangled with them before.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Greenhorn, up there ruining my ship.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Jim, if I have to give you a shot

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim-boy, you just lay quiet. You can't do no good. We're both through.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No. My ship. My ship.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Spock totters in carrying a small beaker.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I made the necessary computations and produced this serum. It is crude and dangerous, but we have no time for refinements.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right. Let's, let's go.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could cure or kill, Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't give me any Vulcan details. Just give me the shot.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I'll take the first shot.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long do you think this ship can take the pounding? I've got to get up there.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: Jim, it could kill you.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll die anyway. Do it.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Wallace, give him the shot.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quickly. Quickly.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: She does, and he goes into convulsions. Fortunately he is already strapped down.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, they've fired another.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: As the Enterprise continues to be battered, Kirk is writhing and groaning.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, well, what's happening?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Wallace
Text: The ageing process has stopped. His bodily functions are getting stronger.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, I've tried all known hailing frequencies. They simply ignore us.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Opinion, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They know they have us. They know our shields will give out.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Well then, we have no alternative but to surrender.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, the Romulans do not take captives.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're losing power, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: What am I going to do? I've got to do something.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're surrounded by Romulan vessels. Maximum of ten. Range fifty to a hundred thousand kilometres.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering, this is the captain. I want full emergency power. I want everything within about two minutes. I want the warp drive engines on full standby. Kirk out. Open up a special channel to Starfleet Command. Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: But, Captain, Code

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's an order, Lieutenant. Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain. Code two.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Message. From Enterprise to Starfleet Command this sector. Have inadvertently encroached upon Romulan Neutral Zone. Surrounded and under heavy Romulan attack. Escape impossible, shields failing. Will implement destruct order using corbomite device recently installed. Since this will result in the destruction of the Enterprise and all matter in a two hundred thousand kilometre diameter and establish a corresponding dead zone, all Federation ships will avoid this area for the next four solar years. Explosion will take place in one minute. Kirk, commanding Enterprise, out. Mister Sulu, course one eight eight degrees, mark fourteen. Speed, warp factor eight. Stand by.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Romulans giving ground, Captain. Obviously, they tapped in as you expected them to.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A logical assumption, Mister Spock. Are they still retreating?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. All hands, stand by. Warp factor eight, now.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Romulans were caught off guard, Captain. They're falling behind.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are we out of range, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. And out of the Neutral Zone.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from Red Alert. Adjust a new course, two five seven degrees, mark three. Heading for Starbase Ten.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Two five seven degrees, mark three.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: Captain, I just wanted to assure you that I did what I thought best to save you and the men.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Noted. You should know, however, that there's very little a Starbase can do that a starship can't.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Stocker
Text: If I may say so, Captain, I am now quite aware of what a starship can do with the right man at the helm.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: McCoy enters

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're looking good, Doc.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Feeling fine. So is Scotty. The serum worked. He pulled a muscle during the reaction, but otherwise he's feeling fine.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And yourself?

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, very well. A few bruises here and there. Oh. Anytime you're ready, Mister Spock.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am quite ready now, Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Because of your Vulcan physique, I have prepared an extremely potent shot for you. However, you might like to know I've removed all the breakables from Sickbay.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is very considerate of you, Doctor.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought you'd be pleased to hear that.

Title: The Deadly Years
Context: Spock, McCoy and Stocker leave as Wallace enters.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, gentlemen, all and all, an experience we'll remember in our old age. Which won't be for some while, I hope. Take over, Mister Sulu. Steady as she goes.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Steady as she goes, Captain.

Title: The Deadly Years
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thought I said that.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Spock and McCoy are greeted by a crewman in blue as he walks along.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Good morning, sir, Doctor.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Something wrong?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. There's something odd about that man, and I can't quite pinpoint it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps you're making a rather hasty judgment. Mister Norman has only been aboard seventy two hours.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know when something doesn't strike me right, and he doesn't.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Specifics, Doctor. Labels do not make arguments.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right. There's something wrong about a man who never smiles, whose conversation never varies from the routine of the job, and who won't talk about his background.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I mean that it's odd for a non-Vulcan. The ears make all the difference.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I find your argument strewn with gaping defects in logic.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe, but you can't evaluate a man by logic alone. Besides, he has avoided two appointments that I've made for his physical exam without reason.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's not at all surprising, Doctor. He's probably terrified of your beads and rattles.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman enters.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Jordan
Text: Command personnel only.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman knocks him out and makes changes to the various control panels. A 'Danger, Overload' light comes on.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Sulu?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: There's an unplanned course change being fed into the instruments, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Correct it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliary control, this is the captain. Auxiliary control, what's going on down there?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, auxiliary control is on total override.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Security.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: Security. Lieutenant Rowe here, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Intruder alert, deck eight, auxiliary control.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, have Mister Spock report to the bridge.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the imposed course, Mister Sulu?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Turning on three oh seven degrees, mark eight. Being executed now, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The three burly security men arrive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: Take care of him.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The other two leave with the unconscious crewman.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: Security to Captain Kirk.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: Lieutenant Rowe, sir. I'm in auxiliary control. Ensign Jordan's been knocked out.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: The directional master controls have been jammed. They're totally unworkable.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any sign of the intruder?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Rowe
Text: No, sir. He's gone. I've put out a full security alert on all decks.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Find him. Kirk out. Mister Spock, we seem to be taking an unscheduled ride.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, cut in emergency manual monitor. I want the override broken.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, the instruments won't respond.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Emergency manual monitor, report.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: In the upper gallery, Norman has been busy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. Acknowledge.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Emergency manual monitor, this is the captain. Report.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman enters the main area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Here, you're not allowed

Title: I, Mudd
Context: He is pushed against the wall and knocked out briefly. Norman fights everyone that comes at him.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Acknowledge. This is the captain. Scotty, acknowledge. Scotty, what's going on down there?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Engineering.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The fights continue.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the captain. Scotty, report.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, the intruder is in your area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's going on down there? Scotty!

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman has triumphed and is adjusting controls.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, he's here.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty? Security, the intruder is in the engineering section. Have all units converge on that point.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, we're picking up speed. Warp five, six. Warp seven, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cut power.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't, sir. All the controls are jammed.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, take over.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: It will not be necessary, Captain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell Security we've found the intruder. Do you mind telling me what this is all about, mister?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: I am in total control of your ship. I have connected the matter-antimatter pods to the main navigational bank. A trigger relay is now in operation. Any attempts to alter course will result in immediate destruction of this vessel.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Confirmed, Captain. He's taken out all the override controls. If we tamper without knowing where the trigger relay is, we could extinguish ourselves.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: I assure you we are no threat to humanity or humanoid life. We mean you no harm, but we require your ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You require? Who and what are we?

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman lifts his tunic and opens a panel in his abdomen. There are circuit boards, wires and the obligatory flashing lights in there.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An android.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: And most sophisticated.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: I control the trigger relay, sir. I cannot be overcome by physical means, and if you attempt to use your phasers, the trigger relay will be activated. We shall continue on our present course for approximately four solar days, at which time we shall arrive at our destination.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who sent you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: I am not programmed to respond in that area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Context: attempting a mind meld
Text: He simply appears to have turned himself off, Captain. And since we cannot repair the damage he has done without destroying the ship

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It seems we're going to take a little trip.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Stardate 4513.3. After having been taken over by an android, the Enterprise has been under way at warp seven for four days. Now we are entering orbit around a planet which has never been charted.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Captain Kirk. The following individuals will be transported down to our planet. Yourself, science officer, medical officer, communications officer and navigator.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any meetings or discussions can be held aboard the Enterprise.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: If you do not come with me, your engines will be destroyed and you will remain in orbit here forever.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must say that's a gracious invitation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: There is a word. Among us there is no corresponding meaning, but it seems to mean something to you humans.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what is that word?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Please.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The required landing party materialise.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Our planet's surface is what you classify as K-type, adaptable for humans by use of pressure domes and life-support systems. (to one of two identical women standing by a doorway.) I have brought them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: He is waiting.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: If you will follow us, please?

Title: I, Mudd
Context: There are several other women, all identical to the first two. And seated on the throne -

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't believe it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Welcome aboard, Kirk. It's been a long time, eh?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Harry Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, to be absolutely accurate, laddybuck, you should refer to me as Mudd the First, ruler of this entire sovereign planet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ruler? Harry, I want control of my ship returned immediately. We have no intention of staying as your guests.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, I'm afraid there's a bit of a problem there.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Alice.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Alice reaches out and crushes the communicator.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Now, now, now, now, Jamie boy, let's have no unauthorised communications.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You know this man, Captain?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, do I know him. Harcourt Fenton Mudd, thief

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Come now.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Swindler and con man

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Entrepreneur.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Liar and rogue.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Did I leave you with that impression?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He belongs in jail, which is where I thought I left you, Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: And thereby hangs a tale, yes. But look around you, Kirk. Quite a place, isn't it? I hope you're all going to enjoy it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mudd, I want that trained machine of yours, Norman, to deactivate the trigger mechanism and free my ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I shall do that, Kirk, when I'm ready.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm telling you now.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: And I do the telling on this planet, Kirk, old boy. You do the listening.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, I'll listen. What are you telling?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Merely that you might as well start enjoying yourselves. It's really a very, very nice place, and you're all going to be here quite probably for the rest of your lives. (laughs)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Harry Mudd, you're a liar and an outlaw and in deep trouble. I want navigational control restored, my ship released.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Sorry. That'd be against the law. My law. Decreed by Mudd the First. Voted in by the resident population. Lovely, aren't they? You must admit, Kirk, that I still retain my eye for beauty. I decreed that I should always be surrounded by it, and my decrees always come to pass. I've had five hundred of them made up to attend me. All of them identical, beautiful, compliant, obedient.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Five hundred of the same model? That seems rather redundant.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I have a fondness for this particular model, Mister Spock, which you, unfortunately, are ill-equipped to appreciate.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Harry, explain. How did you get here? We left you in custody after that affair on the Rigel mining planet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Yes, well, I organised a technical information service bringing modern industrial techniques to backward planets, making available certain valuable patents to struggling young civilisations throughout the galaxy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you pay royalties to the owners of those patents?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, actually, Kirk, as a defender of the free enterprise system, I found myself in a rather ambiguous conflict as a matter of principle.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: He did not pay royalties.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Knowledge, sir, should be free to all.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who caught you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: That, sir, is an outrageous assumption.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Who caught you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I sold the Denebians all the rights to a Vulcan fuel synthesiser.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the Denebians contacted the Vulcans.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: How'd you know?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what I would have done.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: It's typical police mentality. They've got no sense of humour. They arrested me.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, I find that shocking.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Worse than that. Do know what the penalty for fraud is on Deneb Five?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: The guilty party has his choice. Death by electrocution, death by gas, death by phaser, death by hanging.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: The key word in your entire peroration, Mister Spock, was, death. Barbarians. Well, of course, I left.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He broke jail.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I borrowed transportation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He stole a spaceship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: The patrol reacted in a hostile manner.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They fired at him.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: They've no respect for private property. They damaged the bloody spaceship. Well, I got away, but I couldn't navigate, so I wandered out through unmapped space, and here I found Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: You went to substantial risk and effort to bring a starship here. Logically, you must have a compelling motive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Spock, you're going to love it here. They all talk just the way you do.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on, get on with it, Harry.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Yes, well, right, laddybuck. So here I am in a planet with over two hundred thousand hard-working, happy androids, all of whom exist merely to serve my every whim. It's absolute paradise.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then I'm unable to discern your problem.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: They won't let me go. They want to study me. They want to learn more about human beings.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They picked a fine representative.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Watch your tongue, lad. You're talking about Mudd the First. Well, anyway, I ran out of ideas. I simply ran out of things for them to do, and they insisted that I bring them more human beings. They need human beings to serve, to study. So I had to promise them a prime sample. A starship captain. Bright, loyal, fearless and imaginative. Any captain would have done. I was lucky to get you. So you are going to take over for me here, and I can get off this rock and back to civilisation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think not, Harry.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You misunderstand me, lad. I'm not asking you. I'm telling you. You've no choice. Show them to their quarters.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman And Alices
Text: Yes, my Lord Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice
Text: This way, please.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: noticing a curtained alcove
Text: Harry, what's this?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Ah. That, gentlemen, is a shrine to the memory of my beloved Stella.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Stella, my wife.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Revealing a woman of sour features.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dead?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Oh, no, no, no. Merely deserted. You see, gentlemen, behind every great man there is a woman urging him on. And so it was with my Stella. She urged me on into outer space. Not that she meant to, but with her continual, eternal, confounded nagging. Well, I think of her constantly, and every time I do, I go further out into space.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's very interesting. You leave your wife and then bring her along.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I had the androids construct a perfect replica of Stella so that I could gaze upon her and rejoice in her absence. Gentlemen, attend. Stella, dear.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella
Text: Harcourt. Harcourt Fenton Mudd, what have you been up to? Nothing good, I'm sure. Well, let me tell you, you lazy, good-for-nothing

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Shut up.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella
Text: Nothing, thing, thing,

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Marvellous, isn't it? I finally have the last word with her, and with you.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman and the Alices lead the landing party to a place with couches and plants.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You'll find this quite comfortable. Your quarters are down the hall.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: If there is anything you need

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. My ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: We are not programmed to respond in that area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Norman, who created you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: The makers designed us. They came from the galaxy of Andromeda.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then your makers weren't humanoid?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: They were, as you say, quite humanoid, but, unlike your civilisation, robots were common. We performed the necessary service functions and freed our makers to evolve a perfect social order.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What became of them?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Our home planet's sun became a nova. Only a few exploratory outposts survived. This unit, myself, was part of one such outpost in your galaxy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then some of your makers survive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: No, Captain. They died over the stretch of time.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whom do you serve now?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: All
Text: We serve Harry Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: He has given us purpose again.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: It is necessary to have purpose.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We lacked it for a long time. (he leaves)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: We have a very extensive library section for your amusement.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: Our research laboratories and workshops are extremely well equipped.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Both
Text: You are free to visit them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. We might later. In the meantime, would you mind leaving us?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Both
Text: Why should we leave you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because we don't like you. Now. (shooing away gesture)

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The Alices leave

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, opinions?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I think we're in a lot of trouble.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a great help, Mister Chekov. Bones?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think Mister Chekov's right. We are in a lot of trouble.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. And if you say we're in a lot of trouble.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are, and we must direct our attack to the heart of the matter. Obviously this many androids cannot operate independently. There must be a central control system which guides the entire android population.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try and find it. The rest of you, look around, learn everything you can. I'll see what else I can find out from Mister Mudd. Let's go.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Norman is behind a console whilst two Hermans stand by.)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: I trust you are enjoying yourself, Mister Spock.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very interesting. Very interesting. This is a most unusual device.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: It is our central control complex.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did I understand there are more than two hundred thousand of you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Two hundred and seven thousand, eight hundred and nine.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: This would seem to be a simple relay centre. Are all of you controlled through this device?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Context: his number 1 collar flashes
Text: I am not programmed to respond in this area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh, that's quite understandable.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Two brunettes in pink are being shown to Kirk and Uhura.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 263
Text: These are our Barbara series. The body is covered with a self-renewing plastic over a skeleton of beryllium-titanium alloy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very impressive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I should say so.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must say, I like the styling.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: They were, of course, made to my personal specifications, as indeed were the Maisie series, the Trudie series, and particularly the Annabel series.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you believe in male androids, Harry?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Male? Well, I suppose they have their uses.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: How long does a body like that last?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 19
Text: None of our android bodies has ever worn out. However, the estimated duration of this model is five hundred thousand years.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Five hundred thousand years?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 263
Text: Our medi-robots are able to place a human brain within a structurally compatible android body.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Immortality and eternal beauty.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I've just had a most fascinating meeting with Norman, and I'm convinced I've discovered a very important inconsistency.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: McCoy enters with Mudd

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I'm so glad you enjoyed it, Doctor.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you should see the research facilities. They've got a lab down there that. Well, I could spend the rest of my life studying it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I do so admire a man who devotes himself to knowledge.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't lose your head, Bones. Nobody's staying anywhere.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Stubborn, Kirk. Stubborn.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wouldn't be bored, I can tell you that.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let go of me! Now what are you doing? What kind of a woman

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice
Text: The last one, lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: She throws Scott into the group.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Splendid. Splendid. Welcome to Mudd, Mister Scott.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Harry Mudd! Oh, you bogus frat, you. You're the cause of all this, are you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, you were ordered to stay aboard.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. And I stayed until that female gargantua threw me into the transporter beams.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What does she mean, the last one?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Didn't I tell you, Kirk? I beamed a few dozen androids up to your ship. They've been sending your crew to the surface for the past couple of hours. They're all down now.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you out of your mind? (grabs Mudd by the throat) You can't beam down an entire crew of a spaceship. Somebody has to be on board.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: There is an entire crew aboard. An entire crew of androids. They learn very quickly, Captain. The fact is, I've taken over your whole ship. There's nothing you can do about it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Harry, Harry, you'll never get away with it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Well, who's to stop me?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Starfleet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: But now, Captain, now I have a ship of my own as fast as any in the fleet, so how will they catch me, eh? Just think of it, laddybuck. Harry Mudd with his own crew of lovelies aboard your vessel. Think about that.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm trying not to.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Alice.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Mudd and Alice leave.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: He could successfully accomplish it, Captain. I've questioned a number of the androids, and they're totally loyal to Mudd. Perhaps of more concern is the fact that this android population can literally provide anything a human being could ask for in unlimited quantity.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. That's what worries me. How will my crew react in a world where they can have everything they want simply by asking for it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alices
Text: You desire something, lord?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, yes, thank you. (they pour him a cup of wine) You're Alice

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: One eighteen.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And you're Alice

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 322
Text: Three twenty two.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, well, it doesn't make much difference. You're both lovely.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alices
Text: Thank you, my lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: You desire something else, lord?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What a shame you're not real.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 322
Text: We are real, my lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, I mean real girls.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: We are programmed to function as human females, lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You are?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alices
Text: Yes, my lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Harry Mudd programmed you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alices
Text: Yes, my lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That unprincipled, evil-minded, lecherous kulak Harry Mudd programmed you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alices
Text: Yes, my lord.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: This place is even better than Leningrad.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: A device has lights running up it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Absolutely fantastic. Hand-worked to the finest tolerances, microvision, and a nanopulse laser. I've never seen the like before.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You may command us to make anything for you, or do the work yourself for pleasure. You may have the services of any number of craftsmen, exclusive use of the computer facilities. Anything.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Mudd and Kirk enter.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, you should see this shop! Why, they have facilities we've never even thought of.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that the way you're going to do it, Mudd? Hit my people at their weakest point?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We only wish to make you happy and comfortable, Captain. If we are to serve your kind, we must understand you. Our Lord, Harry Mudd was only one example for us. Now we are learning a great deal from all of you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, here we are, birds in a gilded cage. The question is, how do we get out of here?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't know, sir, but it's a very nice gilded cage.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: And it is a very pleasant place, Captain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: What did they offer you, Uhura?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, nothing really important. Just immortality.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. We're getting back to the ship, and don't you forget it. Straighten up! This may be a gilded cage filled with everything you always wanted, but it's still a cage. We don't belong here. We belong on that ship up there.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: Do you require something, lord?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Yes. My ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: I am not programmed

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice And Kirk
Text: To respond in that area.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: Is there anything any of you require to please you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alice, give us back our ship to please us. Return us to our ship because we desire it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: We are programmed to serve. We shall serve you to your best interests to make you happy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we're unhappy here.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: Please explain unhappy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unhappiness is the state which occurs in the human when wants and desires are not fulfilled.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: Which wants and desires of yours are not fulfilled?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We want the Enterprise.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Alice's label flashes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: The Enterprise is not a want or a desire. It is a mechanical device.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, it's a beautiful lady, and we love her.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 471
Text: Illogical. Illogical. All units relate. All units. Norman, co-ordinate. Unhappiness does not relate. We must study this.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: She leaves.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, have you had time to take any psychological readings of the androids?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I did. And you can forget it. They're perfect, flawless, mentally and physically. No weaknesses, perfectly disciplined. No vices, no fears, no faults. Just a sense of purpose. Believe me, there's nothing tougher to overcome, even among humans.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. That's what this crew needs, a little sense of purpose.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mudd, a few questions I want to ask you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Afraid I won't have time to answer them. My bags are all packed. The androids will take the Enterprise out of orbit in less than twenty four hours. But it's been a real pleasure having you here, Kirk. Is there anything I can get for you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. My ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You're a stubborn fellow, aren't you? But I don't mind. I don't mind that at all. Because I'll be leaving here quickly enough, and then you can be stubborn at your own leisure. One last time. Stella, dear.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella
Text: Harcourt Fenton Mudd, where have you been? What have you been up to? Have you been drinking again, you miserable sot! You good-for-nothing

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Shut up!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella
Text: Thing, thing, thing.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Alice Number 2, my little love. Will you have my bags transported up to the ship?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Androids
Text: No, my Lord Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: What?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We can no longer take your orders, Harry Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Why not?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Our makers were wise. They programmed us to serve.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Yes, but that's what I'm saying. Put my bags on the ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Harry, I think they have something else in mind.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You are correct, Captain. Harry Mudd is flawed, even for a human being. We recognised this from the beginning but used his knowledge to obtain more specimens. Your species is self-destructive. You need our help.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We prefer to help ourselves. We make mistakes, but we're human. And maybe that's the word that best explains us.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We will not harm you, but we will take the starship, and you will remain on this planet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Now, look here. You can't do that! Now, listen. To serve us, you must obey us.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Androids
Text: No, my Lord Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Alice number One, obey me. Put my bags on that ship!

Title: I, Mudd
Context: She gives him a gentle push and he goes reeling backwards until he falls.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We cannot allow any race as greedy and corruptible as yours to have free run of the galaxy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm curious, Norman. Just how do you intend to stop them?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We shall serve them. Their kind will be eager to accept our service. Soon they will become completely dependent upon us.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 99
Text: Their aggressive and acquisitive instincts will be under our control.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: We shall take care of them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eminently practical.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The whole galaxy controlled by your kind?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: Yes, Captain. And we shall serve them and you will be happy, and controlled.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So far this thing has had its amusing aspects, but that threat the androids made about taking over all the humans in the galaxy is not very funny.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, it is not. They may quite possibly be able to accomplish it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Take my word for it, they can.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whatever method we use to stop them, we must make haste. They have only to install some cybernetic devices aboard the Enterprise and they'll be able to leave orbit.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you know so much?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I asked them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why shouldn't they answer our questions? They don't think we can do anything to stop them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: You're so smart, Kirk, you and this pointy-eared thinking machine of yours. Well, you'd better do something because I'm as anxious to get off this ruddy rock as you are.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You wanted to leave us on this ruddy rock and leave by yourself.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, what have we got to work with?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, Captain, androids and robots, they're just not capable of independent, creative thought.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yet the device that Norman claims to be their central control is totally inadequate to the task of directing more than two hundred thousand of them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree. What in your opinion does direct them?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: There are a large number of Alices and Trudies, Maisies, Annabels, and according to my research, a Herman series, an Oscar series, a whole plethora of series in fact. But only one Norman.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Norman. When I told one of the Alices that the Enterprise was a lovely lady and we loved her, she said, Norman, co-ordinate. Why Norman? Unless

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: To function as they do, each android mind must be one component of a mass brain linked through a central locus.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Named Norman. Forming one gigantic, highly intelligent mind. And the glowing badges, they indicate the mind in operation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would seem logical.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, logical. That's what it is. And that in turn gives us a weapon that we can use against them. We must use wild, insane, irrational illogic aimed right at Norman!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Captain, you sing and dance as well as anyone I've ever seen, but what the devil are you talking about?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: What would seem to be a sound, and perhaps our only, opportunity.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Opportunity? Now, listen, Spock, you may be a wonderful science officer, but believe me, you couldn't sell fake patents to your mother.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to understand why I should care to induce my mother to purchase falsified patents.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Forget it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get to the point. Harry, you said you wanted to help. Do you?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Captain, the kind of a wholesome, antiseptic galaxy that these androids would run would be purgatory for a man like me.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's fine, Harry. The androids will be expecting us to make a break for it, and that's where you come in.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: What can I do?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing, Harry. Just go to sleep.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: What do you mean? (McCoy produces a hypo) Oh, now, now wait a minute, gentlemen. No, what I, I, (gets injected) had in mind was actually more in the line of a few words of sage counsel as it were. Advice (passes out in Kirk and Scott's arms)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Harry. I do believe you're putting on weight.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: Yes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have a medical problem. Your ex-Lord, Harry Mudd.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: He is human. You will have to care for him.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are caring for him, but our doctor needs his medical equipment aboard the Enterprise.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: The starship is forbidden to humans.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are programmed to serve. If we're not allowed access to our medical equipment, Harry Mudd will die. He will cease to function. You will have failed to serve.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: I am directed to observe the situation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: He is malfunctioning?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He is dying.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: If you take him to your Sickbay, will he be repaired?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, they're lying. It's a trick. Doctor McCoy injected something into Harry Mudd to make him look sick. It's a trick to get back on board and sabotage the ship.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: Your request is refused.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura, why did you tell her?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Because I want an android body. I want immortality. I'll live forever, Captain. I'll be young and beautiful.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: You have been of assistance. We shall fulfill our obligation.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Thank you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 1
Text: The programming for your body will be completed before we leave.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Alice leaves

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura. Beautiful!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I half believed it myself.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SCOTT; Well, the androids were expecting an attempt, and now we've made it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What's next, Captain?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Next, we take the Alices on a trip through Wonderland.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118+2
Text: Do you require something?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Your attention.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Scott and McCoy enter, bow to each other and then start playing imaginary flute and fiddle while Chekov and Uhura waltz.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: What are they doing?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're celebrating.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: What are they celebrating?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Their captivity. Do you enjoy the music?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: Music?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: Music?

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Their badges start flashing.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Thank you, gentlemen. Thank you, lovely lady. You dance divinely.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Thank you, kind sir. (her slap knocks him off his feet.)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 2
Text: Why does she strike him?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She likes him. Mister Chekov. The floor is no place for an officer. Attention! Now stand absolutely still.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, Captain. (and goes into an energetic Cossack dance)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's better, Mister Chekov.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 118
Text: It is illogical.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your statement is illogical.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: The flashes become a continual light.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: How does it look?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Completely inner directed. Oblivious to everything.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I wonder how Spock's doing.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Of course. Your computations would inevitably lead to a total description of the parabolic intersection of dimension with dimension.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 27
Text: Mister Spock, you have a remarkably logical and analytical mind.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: He attempts a neck pinch on Alice 210.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 210
Text: Is there some significance to this action?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I love you. However, I hate you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Alice 210
Text: But I'm identical in every way with Alice Twenty Seven.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, of course. That is exactly why I hate you. Because you are identical.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: They go out of action.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right, it's worked so far, but we're not out yet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Success, Captain. We've been pruning the leaves and branches of the tree. Now it is time to get to work on the root.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If Norman is the control centre, he should be in a bind by what we've done. If we can overload him further, we should be able to immobilise all of them. Does everybody remember what to do?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: All
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: What are you doing here?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want you to surrender.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: That is illogical. We can move more quickly than you. We are invulnerable to attack. We are much stronger.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, we are stronger. I'll prove it to you. Can you harm a man that you're programmed to serve?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: No.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: But you already have, Norman, laddy. Human beings do not survive on bread alone, you poor soulless creature, but on the nourishments of liberty, for what indeed is a man without freedom? Naught but a mechanism trapped in the cogwheels of eternity.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: in a monotone
Text: You offer us only well-being.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Context: in a monotone
Text: Food and drink and happiness mean nothing to us. We must be about our job.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Suffering, in torment and pain. Labouring without end.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Dying and crying and lamenting over our burdens.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Both
Text: Only this way can we be happy.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Then they curtsey.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: That is contradictory. It is not logical. Mister Spock. Explain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logic is a little tweeting bird chirping in a meadow. Logic is a wreath of pretty flowers which smell bad. Are you sure your circuits are registering correctly? Your ears are green.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Context: clutching at his heart and crying out in anguish
Text: I canna go on! I'm tired of happiness. I'm tired of comfort and pleasure. I'm ready! Kill me! Kill me!

Title: I, Mudd
Context: They point their fingers at him and whistle. Scott slumps to his knees.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Goodbye, cruel universe.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You cannot have killed him. You have no weapons.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. Scotty's dead. He had too much happiness. But now he's happier he's dead, and we'll miss him. Let us hear it for our poor, dead friend.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: They laugh.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is a man but that lofty spirit, that sense of enterprise, that devotion to something that cannot be sensed, cannot be realised but only dreamed! The highest reality.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Brilliant! Bravo, bravo, Captain!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did you like it?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: That is irrational. Illogical. Dreams are not real.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our logic is to be illogical. That is our advantage. Mister Spock, it is time. The explosive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, Captain.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: He removes an invisible package from under his tunic.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Scott
Text: Explosive! (gets up again)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Don't panic. Women and children first.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Mister Spock, isn't that too much for our purposes?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe that is the correct amount, Captain. Mister Mudd, are you ready?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Aye, aye! (adopts a catchers pose)

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Be careful. I would not want you to drop it.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Mimes an underarm throw, and Mudd juggles before 'catching' it.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Easy now. Oh, he's caught it!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Watch it! Watch it!

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Mudd puts 'it' on the floor.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Context: to McCoy
Text: Detonator. Fuse. Primer. Mashie.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Adopts a golfing stance.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: There is no explosive.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No? Observe. Fore! (Mudd swings.) Boom!

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Everyone except Spock staggers around with hands over their ears.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you all right?

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Spock quietly exits.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: But there was no explosion.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I lied.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: What?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He lied. Everything Harry tells you is a lie. Remember that. Everything Harry tells you is a lie.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Listen to this carefully, Norman. I am lying.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You say you are lying, but if everything you say is a lie then you are telling the truth, but you cannot tell the truth because everything you say is a lie. You lie. You tell the truth. But you cannot for. Illogical! Illogical! Please explain.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Smoke comes out of Norman's head.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Norman
Text: You are human. Only humans can explain their behaviour. Please explain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am not programmed to respond in that area.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Norman goes blank.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe they are all immobilised, Captain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Kirk, old man, I'm beginning to develop considerable respect for you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, thank you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Would you consider entering a partnership arrangement with me? I've got some ideas.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A partnership arrangement? You and me?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Yes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got something else in mind. Let's go.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Different androids are standing around the walls. Two pairs are wearing costumes from 'Mudd's Women'.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you must be very unhappy, Mister Spock.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is a human emotion, Doctor, with which I am totally unfamiliar. How could I be unhappy?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, we found a whole world of minds that work just like yours. Logical, unemotional, completely pragmatic. And we poor, irrational humans whipped them in a fair fight. Now you'll find yourself back among us illogical humans again.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which I find eminently satisfactory, Doctor, for nowhere am I so desperately needed as among a shipload of illogical humans.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Touch, Bones.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I've never heard of anything so revolting. We'll soon get to the bottom of this.

Title: I, Mudd
Context: Enters escorted by two Alices.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Kirk, now what's this I hear about my having to stay here?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mudd, you've been paroled to the android population of this planet.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Spock
Text: The androids are being reprogrammed. Their original purpose was to adapt this planet for productive use. They'll begin that work again.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: But what do I do? Kirk, I'm no scientist.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you're an irritant. You'll stay here and provide a first-class example to the androids of a human failure. They'll learn by close observation how to avoid ones like you in the future.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: How long?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As long as you continue to be an irritant, Harry. It's up to you.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I suppose that taking everything into consideration, as it were, and noting all the different possibilities, I could manage. And as detention sentences go, this one isn't too uncomfortable. And I'm back in the galaxy again!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you are. Oh, there's one more thing, Harry. We've programmed a special android attendant to take care of your every need. She'll help you find an incentive to work with the androids and not exploit them.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I call that unexpectedly civil of you, Captain.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 1
Text: Harcourt! Harcourt Fenton Mudd, what have you been up to? Have you been drinking again? You answer me!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Shut up!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella
Text: You miserable, conniving toad!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: I order you. Shut up, Stella!

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 1
Text: Staying out all night then giving me some silly story.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 2
Text: Harcourt! Harcourt Fenton Mudd, you've been overeating again and drinking.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: Kirk, you can't do this.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 2
Text: You need constant supervision.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: It's inhuman.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 2
Text: I can see I've got my work cut out for me.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 500
Text: Harcourt.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Text: No. Number five hundred? No, no, no.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Stella 500
Text: What have you been up to?

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Mudd
Context: barely heard over the cacophony
Text: Kirk. It's inhuman. Mercy.

Title: I, Mudd
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Goodbye, Harry. Have fun.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deep Space Station K7 now within sensor range, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Mister Chekov, this flight is supposed to provide both experience and knowledge. How close will we come to the Klingon outpost if we continue on our present course?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: One parsec, sir. Close enough to smell them.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is illogical, Ensign. Odours cannot travel through the vacuum of space.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I was making a little joke, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Extremely little, Ensign.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, immediate past history of the quadrant?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Under dispute between the two parties since initial contact. The battle of Donatu Five was fought near here twenty three solar years ago. Inconclusive.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis of disputed area?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undeveloped. Sherman's Planet is claimed by both sides, our Federation and the Klingon Empire. We do have the better claim.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The area was first mapped by the famous Russian astronomer Ivan Borkoff almost two hundred

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: John Burke.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Burke, sir? I don't think so. I'm sure it was

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: John Burke was the Chief Astronomer at the Royal Academy in old Britain at the time.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, Royal Academy. Well

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: is the rest of your history that faulty, Ensign? Key points of dispute?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Under terms of the Organian Peace Treaty, one side or the other must prove it can develop the planet most efficiently.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And unfortunately, though the Klingons are brutal and aggressive, they are most efficient.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I remember once Peter the Great had that problem like that. The

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm picking up a subspace distress call. Priority channel. It's from Space Station K7.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to warp factor six.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Code One emergency. That's a disaster call.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: This is a Red Alert. Man your battle stations. All hands.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 4523.3. Deep Space Station K7 has issued a priority one call. More than an emergency, it signals near or total disaster. We can only assume the Klingons have attacked the station. We're going in armed for battle.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: ]Bridge]

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Main phasers armed and ready, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The space station is on the main viewer, looking intact.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: But there's nothing there. Just the station.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Priority One distress call, and it's just absolutely peaceful. Lieutenant Uhura, break subspace silence.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. The channel's open, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Space Station K7, this is Captain Kirk of the Enterprise. What is your emergency?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: This is Mister Lurry, manager of K7. I must apologise for the distress call.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Lurry, you issued a Priority One distress call. State the nature of your emergency.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Well, perhaps you better beam over. I'll try to explain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll try to explain. You'd better be prepared to do more than that. Kirk out. Mister Spock, I'll need your help. Mister Chekov, maintain battle readiness. Lieutenant Uhura, see that the transporter room is standing by.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. Transporter room, stand by.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Kirk and Spock arrive in the two man transporter alcove

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Lurry, if there's no emergency, why did you issue a priority one distress call?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: That was my order, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Captain Kirk, this is Nilz Baris. He's out from Earth to take charge of the development project on Sherman's Planet.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And that gives you the authority to put an entire quadrant on defence alert?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: Mister Baris is the Federation Undersecretary in Charge of Agricultural Affairs in this quadrant.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; That gives him the authority.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: This is my assistant Arne Darvin.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And this is my first officer Mister Spock.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: And now Captain, I want all available security guards. I want them posted around the storage compartments.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Storage compartments? Storage compartments?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: The storage compartments containing the quadrotriticale.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What? What? What's quadrotriticale? (Lurry hands him a small packet) Wheat. So what?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Quadrotriticale is not wheat, Captain. Of course, I wouldn't expect you or Mister Spock to know about such things, but quadrotriticale is a rather

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quadrotriticale is a high-yield grain, a four-lobed hybrid of wheat and rye. A perennial, also, I believe. Its root grain, triticale, can trace its ancestry all the way back to twentieth century Canada

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you've made your point.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Quadrotriticale is the only earth grain that grows on Sherman's Planet. We have several tons of it here on the station. It's very important that grain gets to Sherman's Planet safely. Mister Baris thinks that Klingon agents may try to sabotage it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You issued a priority one distress call for a couple of tons of wheat?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: Quadrotriticale!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Of course, Captain, I realise that

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Baris, you summoned the Enterprise without an emergency. You'll take full responsibility for it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: What do you mean?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Misuse of the Priority One channels is a Federation offence.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: I did not misuse the Priority One channel. I want that grain protected.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Captain, couldn't you at least post a couple of guards? We do have a large number of ships passing through.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem a logical precaution, Captain. The Sherman's Planet affair is of extreme importance to the Federation.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from general quarters. And beam down two, and only two, security guards. Have them report to Mister Lurry. Authorise shore leave for all off-duty personnel.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Captain Kirk, how dare you authorise a mere two men for a project of this importance? Starfleet Command

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have never questioned the orders or the intelligence of any representative of the Federation. Until now.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: storms out of the office

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {K7 Bar]

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Wherever humanoids may travel, someone will set up a bar to have pretty females serve intoxicating beverages. K7 is no exception.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Summoning a starship on a priority A-1 channel to guard some storage compartments. Storage compartments of wheat.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nevertheless Captain, the Klingons would not enjoy seeing us successfully develop Sherman's Planet.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I guess not.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: downs his drink in one and heads for the door, where they meet Chekov and Uhura coming in.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see you didn't waste time taking your shore leave.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Context: coldly
Text: How often do I get shore leave?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: She wants to shop, and I thought I would help her.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Context: entering
Text: Oh, excuse me. Excuse me.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Context: shows Chekov the packet of wheat
Text: Mister Chekov, what do you make of this?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, quadrotriticale. I've read about this, but I've never seen any before.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does everybody know about this wheat but me?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
