Speaker: Chekov
Text: Not everyone, Captain. It's a Russian invention.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Kirk and Spock leave.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: I don't want any. I told you before, and I'm telling you again I don't want any more Spican flame gems. Thanks to you, I have enough Spican flame gems to last me a lifetime.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: How sad for you, my friend. You won't find a finer stone anywhere. But I have something better. Surely you want some Antarian glow water.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: I use that to polish the flame gems.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: You're a difficult man to reach, but I have something from the far reaches of the galaxy. Surely you want

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: from yet another pocket, the trader pulls a what looks like a ball of fluff.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: Not at your price.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What is it? Is it alive? May I hold it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Jones puts it in her hand and it starts purring

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, it's adorable. What is it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: What is it? Why, lovely lady, it's a tribble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: A tribble?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Only the sweetest creature known to man, excepting, of course, your lovely self.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, it's purring. Listen, it's purring.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: It's only saying that it likes you.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Are you selling them?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: That's what we're trying to decide right now.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: My friend, 10 credits apiece is a very reasonable price. Now you can see for yourself how much the lovely little lady appreciates the finer things.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: One credit apiece.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: He won't bite, will he?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Sir, transporting harmful animals from one planet to another is against regulations, or weren't you aware of that? Besides, tribbles have no teeth.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: All right. I'll double my offer 2 credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Twice nothing is still nothing.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: If you're not going to take him, I'm going to take him. I think he's cute.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: Four credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Is that an offer or a joke?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: That's my offer.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: That's a joke.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: Five?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: You're an honest man. I'll tell you what I'm going to do I'm going to lessen my price to eight and a half credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: You're talking yourself out of a deal, friend. Six credits. Not a credit more.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Seven and a half. Seven? All right, you robber, six credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: Done. When can I have them?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Right away.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All right, what are you selling them for?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: Well, let me see, little lady. Six credits. Figure a reasonable mark-up for a reasonable profit, say ten percent mark-up. Ten credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Thief.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: In fact, I'll sell you this one.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: the tribble is eating grain spilt from the packet Kirk gave Chekov

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Hey! He's eating my grain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: That'll be ten credits.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: That happens to be my sample, and I'll do with it as I please. And I please to give it to the lovely lady.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, I couldn't. Could I?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: I insist.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: What are you trying to do, ruin the market?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Once this lovely little lady starts to show this precious little darling around, you won't be able to keep up with them.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, what is it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message from Starfleet, Captain. Priority channel. Admiral Fitzpatrick speaking.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on visual, Lieutenant.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Admiral
Text: Captain Kirk?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Admiral
Text: Captain, it is not necessary to remind you of the importance to the Federation of Sherman's Planet. The key to our winning of this planet is the grain quadrotriticale. The shipment of it must be protected. Effective immediately, you will render any aid and assistance which Undersecretary Baris may require. The safety of the grain and the project is your responsibility. Starfleet out.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, that's just lovely.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: But not totally unexpected.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk! Captain Kirk!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Lieutenant, what is it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sensors are picking up a Klingon battle cruiser rapidly closing on the station.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to Red Alert. Notify Mister Lurry. We'll be right up.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is the position of the Klingon ship?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A hundred kilometres off K7. It's just sitting there.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have Mister Lurry.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put him on visual.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Lurry, there's a Klingon warship hanging one hundred kilometres off your station.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: I don't think the Klingons are planning to attack us.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Because at this moment the captain of the Klingon ship is sitting right here in my office.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel Red Alert. We'll beam right down.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security, cancel Red Alert.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4524.2. A Klingon warship is hovering only a hundred kilometres from Deep Space Station K7 while its captain waits in the station manager's office. Their intentions are unknown.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: False smiles all round as Kirk and Spock are greeted by a Klingon who very closely resembles the Squire of Gothos...

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Ah, my dear Captain Kirk.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My dear Captain Koloth.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Let me assure you that my intentions are peaceful. As I've already told Mister Lurry, the purpose of my presence is to invoke shore leave rights.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shore leave?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Captain, we Klingons are not as luxury-minded as you Earthers. We do not equip our ships with, how shall I say it, non-essentials. (makes an hour-glass gesture with his hands)

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: We have been in space for five months. What we choose as recreation is our own business.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: I might also add that under terms of the Organian Peace Treaty, you cannot refuse us.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well, I don't make those decisions. Mister Lurry is in charge of those matters.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: Captain, may I speak to you a minute? (takes him aside) Look, I don't want them here, but I don't have the authority to refuse.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I have the authority to act, and I'm going to use it. My dear Captain Koloth, you may indeed bring your men down on shore leave, but only twelve at a time. And I assure you, for every man you bring down here, I shall have one security guard. There will be no trouble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Captain Kirk, there's been no formal declaration of hostilities between our two respective governments. So, naturally, our relationship will be a peaceful one.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let us both take steps to keep it that way.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Of course.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Scott is at a monitor, reading, when Spock and Kirk enter.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Another technical journal, Scotty?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you ever relax?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I am relaxing.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: There is a crowd at a long table, and there are purring sounds.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How long have you had that thing, Lieutenant?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Since yesterday, Doctor. This morning, I found out that he, I mean she, had had babies.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, in that case, you got a bargain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You running a nursery, Lieutenant?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, Captain. Well, I hadn't intended to, sir, but the tribble had other plans.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you get this at the space station?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Context: stroking a tribble
Text: A most curious creature, Captain. Its trilling seems to have a tranquillising effect on the human nervous system. Fortunately, of course, I am immune to its effect.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Everyone stares, he suddenly realises what he is doing, and puts it down. Spock and Kirk leave.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant, do you mind if I take one of these down to the lab to see what makes it tick?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Well, all right, Doctor, but if you're going to dissect it, I don't want to know about it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I won't harm a hair on its head, wherever that is.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Freeman
Text: Say, Lieutenant. Seeing as you're giving them away, can I have one?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sure, why not? I think they're old enough. (to all) Go ahead.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Baris waiting is on channel E to speak to you, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pipe it down here will you, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Mister Baris is coming on.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Baris. What can I do for you?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Kirk, this station is swarming with Klingons.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was not aware, Mister Baris, that twelve Klingons constitutes a swarm.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Captain Kirk, there are Klingon soldiers on this station. Now, I want you to keep that grain safe.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Baris, I have guards around the grain. I have guards around the Klingons. The only reason those guards are there is because Starfleet wants them there. As for what you want (pauses at a look from Spock) It has been noted and logged. Kirk out.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, may I ask where you'll be?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay with a headache.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: There are eleven fluffy tribbles of various sizes and colour in a large container.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hi, Jim.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what have you got for a headache?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let me guess. Klingons? Baris?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Both. How many of these did Uhura give you?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just one.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you've got, er, eleven.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You noticed that, huh? Here. This ought to take care of it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do they? How do they?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I haven't figured that out yet, but I can tell you this much. Almost fifty percent of the creature's metabolism is geared for reproduction. Do you know what you get if you feed a tribble too much?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A fat tribble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. You get a bunch of hungry little tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Bones, all I can suggest is you open up a maternity ward.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All you men going on shore leave to stay in groups. Avoid trouble with the Klingons.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll tell them before they go, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't you going on shore leave, Scotty?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Why, no, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want you to go on shore leave. Make sure that everybody stays out of trouble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: But, Captain. Aye, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, enjoy yourself.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Business is good. Scott, Chekov and Freeman take the last vacant table. Two security men leave and Jones enters, whistling.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Ah, friend. Can I offer you a charming little tribble?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Uh, no, thanks.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Oh. Perhaps one of you other gents?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: No reply

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Ah, friend Klingon. Can I interest you in a harmless tribble?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The tribble screeches.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: Get it away from me.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: I'm sorry. I can't understand it. I've never seen them act this way before.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: Get out of here with that parasite.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: He's only a harmless little

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: Take it away!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Yes. Ah, my good friend. How would you like to enter another little transaction? This time, a tribble for a spot

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Text: A tribble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Indeed.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Barman
Context: starts producing tribbles from all over the place and putting them on the bar
Text: A tribble?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The pretty lady in yellow brings our group their drinks.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: When are you going to get off that milk diet, lad?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: This is vodka.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Where I come from, that's soda pop. This is a drink for a man.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Scotch?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It was invented by a little old lady from Leningrad.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Korax goes over to the bar and shares his drink with Jones.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: The Earthers like those fuzzy things, don't they?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Frankly, I never liked Earthers. They remind me of Regulan blood worms.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That Cossack.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Easy, lad. You ought to be more forgiving.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: No. I just remembered. There is one Earthman who doesn't remind me of a Regulan blood worm. That's Kirk. A Regulan blood worm is soft and shapeless, but Kirk isn't soft. Kirk may be a swaggering, overbearing, tin-plated dictator with delusions of godhood, but he's not soft.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Chekov leaps to his feet

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Take it easy, lad. Everybody's entitled to an opinion.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: That's right, and if I think that Kirk is a Denebian slime devil, well that's my opinion too.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Don't do it, mister, and that's an order.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You heard what he called the captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Forget it. It's not worth fighting for. We're big enough to take a few insults. Now, drink your drink.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: swaps Chekov's vodka for Freeman's red wine.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: Of course, I'd say that Captain Kirk deserves his ship. We like the Enterprise. We, we really do. That sagging old rust bucket is designed like a garbage scow. Half the quadrant knows it. That's why they're learning to speak Klingonese.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Scott!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Laddie, don't you think you should rephrase that?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Korax
Text: You're right, I should. I didn't mean to say that the Enterprise should be hauling garbage. I meant to say that it should be hauled away as garbage.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: There's a fight, of course. Scott's first right cross sends Korax flying over a table. After that, it's the Klingons versus Starfleet, with the barman beating a retreat and Jones taking the opportunity to help himself to drinks from the dispensing machine. Finally he decides to leave with his spoils and is about to enjoy his last glass when the Security guards rush in followed by the Barman, who takes the glass just before it reaches Jones' lips. So he takes another out of his pocket instead.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 4525.6. A small disturbance between the Klingon crew and members of the Enterprise crew has broken out aboard Space Station K7. I am forced to cancel shore leave for both ships.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Ten men are lined up. Chekov has a nice bruise on his cheek.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want to know who started it. I'm waiting. Freeman, who started the fight?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Freeman
Text: I don't know, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Chekov. I know you. You started it, didn't you?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No, sir, I didn't.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who did?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't know, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know, sir. I want to know who threw the first punch. All right. You're all confined to quarters until I find out who started it. Dismissed. (the men file out) Scotty, not you. You were supposed to prevent trouble, Mister Scott.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who threw the first punch, Scotty?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Um.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I did, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You did, Mister Scott? What caused it, Scotty?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: They insulted us, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Must have been some insult.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, it was.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You threw the first punch.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. Chekov wanted to, but I held him back.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You held? Why did Chekov want to start a fight?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, the Klingon, sir. Is this off the record?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, this is not off the record.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, Captain, the Klingons called you, uh a tin-plated, overbearing, swaggering dictator with delusions of godhood.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that all?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. They also compared you with a Denebian slime devil.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: And then they said you

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I get the picture, Scotty.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: After they said all this, that's when you hit the Klingons?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, I didn't. You told us to avoid trouble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: And I didn't see that it was worth fighting about. After all, we're big enough to take a few insults. Aren't we?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it they said that started the fight?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: They called the Enterprise a garbage scow, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. And that's when you hit the Klingons?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You hit the Klingons because they insulted the Enterprise, not because they

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, sir, this was a matter of pride.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty. Dismissed. Scotty, you're restricted to quarters until further notice.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Context: big grin
Text: Yes, sir. Thank you, sir. That'll give me a chance to catch up on my technical journals.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: There are a lot more than eleven tribbles now.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the matter, Spock?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's something disquieting about these creatures.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't tell me you've got a feeling.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Don't be insulting, Doctor. They remind me of the lilies of the field. They toil not, neither do they spin. But they seem to eat a great deal. I see no practical use for them.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Does everything have to have a practical use for you? They're nice, soft, and furry, and they make a pleasant sound.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: So would an ermine violin, but I see no advantage in having one.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a human characteristic to love little animals, especially if they're attractive in some way.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I am well aware of human characteristics. I am frequently inundated by them, but I've trained myself to put up with practically anything.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I don't know too much about these little tribbles yet, but there's one thing that I have discovered.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is that, Doctor?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I like them better than I like you.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: They do have one redeeming characteristic.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's that?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: They do not talk too much. If you'll excuse me, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Kirk walks to his chair, preoccupied by his last conversation. When he sits, there is a squeak. He has sat on a large tribble. Then he notices that there are fluffy balls everywhere.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, would you mind coming up to the bridge? (he takes a walk around then) Lieutenant Uhura, how did all these tribbles get on the bridge?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't know, sir. They do seem to be all over the ship.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: McCoy enters, stroking a tribble.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes? Did you want to see me, Jim? Don't look at me. It's the tribbles who are breeding. If we don't get them off this ship, we're going to be hip deep in them.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain that.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The nearest thing I can figure out is they're born pregnant, which seems to be quite a time saver.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know, but really

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And from my observations, it seems they're bisexual, reproducing at will. And, brother, have they got a lot of will.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I am forced to agree with the doctor. I've been running computations on their rate of reproduction. The figures are taking an alarming direction. They're consuming our supplies and returning nothing.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: But they do give us something, Mister Spock. They give us love. Well, Cyrano Jones says a tribble is the only love that money can buy.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Too much of anything, Lieutenant, even love, isn't necessarily a good thing.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get the maintenance crew to clean up the entire ship, and then contact Mister Lurry and tell him I'm beaming down.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have him find Cyrano Jones and hold him.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And get these tribbles off the bridge.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Captain Kirk, I'm mystified at your tone of voice. I've done nothing to warrant such severe treatment.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, really?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Surely you must have realised what would happen if you removed the tribbles from their predator-filled environment into an environment where their natural multiplicative proclivities would have no restraining factors.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Of course. What did you say?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: By removing the tribbles from their natural habitat, you have, so to speak, removed the cork from the bottle and allowed the genie to escape.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: If by that, you mean do they breed quickly? Of course, that's how I maintain my stock. Breeding animals is not against regulations, only breeding dangerous ones. And tribbles are not dangerous.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just incredibly prolific.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Precisely, and at six credits a head, well, that is, a body, it mounts up. Now if you'll excuse me.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You should sell an instruction and maintenance manual for this thing.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: If I did, what would happen to man's search for knowledge? Well, I must be tending my ship. Au revoir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: He meets Baris and Darvin at the door.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: Go ahead, sir. Tell him.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Captain Kirk, I consider your security measures a disgrace. In my opinion, you have taken this important project far too lightly.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On the contrary, sir. I think of this project as very important. It is you I take lightly.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: I am going to report fully to the proper authorities that you have given free and complete access to this station to a man who is quite probably a Klingon agent.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a serious charge. To whom are you referring?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: To that man who just walked out of here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cyrano Jones, a Klingon agent?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: You heard me.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I heard you.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: He simply could not believe his ears.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What evidence do you have against Mister Jones?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: My assistant here has kept Mister Jones under close surveillance for quite some time, and his actions have been most suspicious. I believe he was involved in that little altercation between your men and the men from

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, yes. Go on. What else do you have?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: Well Captain, I've checked his ship's log, and it seems that he was within the Klingon's sphere of influence less than four months ago.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: The man is an independent scout, Captain. It is quite possible he is also a Klingon spy.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have already checked on the background of Mister Cyrano Jones. He is a licensed asteroid locator and prospector. He's never broken the law, at least not severely. For the past seven years, with his one-man spaceship, he's obtained a marginal living by engaging in the buying and selling of rare merchandise, including, unfortunately, tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: But he is after my grain!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have any proof of that?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: You can't deny he's disrupted this station.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: People have disrupted stations before without being Klingon agents. Sometimes, all they need is a title, Mister Baris. Unfortunately, disrupting a space station is not an offence. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a ship to tend to. Au revoir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: There are tribbles on the walls, the floor, the tables, even as chess pieces. Kirk gets a tray from the food dispenser. It has tribbles on it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My chicken sandwich and coffee. This is my chicken sandwich and coffee.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want these off the ship. I don't care if it takes every man we've got, I want them off the ship.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Scott enters, carrying an armful of fluff.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're into the machinery, all right, and they're probably in all the other food processors too.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Probably through one of the air vents.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there are vents of that type on the space station.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And in the storage compartments. (goes to a table monitor) This is Kirk. Contact Manager Lurry and Nilz Baris. Have them meet us near the storage compartments. We're beaming down. Come on, Spock.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The tribbles are all over the pads too. Kirk picks one up but there's nowhere else to put it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Lurry
Text: What's wrong?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plenty, if what I think's happened has happened.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that door secure?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Guard
Text: Yes, sir. Nothing could get in.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Open it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Guard
Text: It's not working, sir. It seems to be stuck.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Here. Let me try it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: But he can't open it either, so he tried one of the overhead doors instead. That does open, and a whole load of tribbles fall out, burying the gallant Captain up to his shoulders. Spock examines one.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: They seem to be gorged.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Gorged? On my grain? Kirk, I am going to hold you responsible. There must be thousands of them.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hundreds of thousands.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: One million seven hundred seventy one thousand five hundred sixty one. That's assuming one tribble, multiplying with an average litter of ten, producing a new generation every twelve hours over a period of three days.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's assuming they got here three days ago.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: And allowing for the amount of grain consumed and the volume of the storage compartment.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Kirk, you should have known. You are responsible for turning the development project into a total disaster.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Baris

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: And I'm through being intimidated, Kirk. You have insulted me, you have ignored me, you've walked all over me. You have abused your authority, and you've rejected my requests. And this, this is the result. I'm going to hold you responsible.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Baris, I'll hold you in irons if you don't shut up.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I think I've got it. All we have to do is quit feeding them. We quit feeding them, they stop breeding.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now he tells me.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain this tribble is dead. And so are these.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A lot of them are dead. A lot of them are alive, but they won't be for long.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: The logical assumption is that there is something in the grain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Bones, I want the tribbles, the grain, everything analysed. I want to know what killed these tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I haven't figured out what keeps them alive yet. All right, if I find out anything, I'll let you know. (leaves)

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: That isn't going to do you any good, Kirk. This project is ruined, and Starfleet is going to hear about it. And when they do, they will have a board of inquiry and they will roast you alive. And I am going to be there, Kirk, to enjoy every minute of it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Until that inquiry, I'm still the captain. And as Captain, I want two things done. First, find Cyrano Jones, and second (as another tribble hits him on the head) close that door.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: A security guard is picking up tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Really, Captain Kirk, I must protest this treatment.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah, Mister Jones, with an armful. A few questions.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: An official apology addressed to the Klingon High Command. I expect you to assume full responsibility for the persecution of Klingon nationals in this quadrant.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An apology?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Yes. You've harassed my men. You've treated them like criminals. You've been most uncourteous, Captain Kirk. If you wish to avoid a diplomatic incident

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: No, Kirk. You can't let him. That will give them the wedge they need to claim Sherman's Planet.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe that more than the word of an aggrieved Klingon commander would be necessary for that, Mister Baris.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Mister Spock, as far as Sherman's Planet is concerned, Captain Kirk has already given it to us.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we'll see about that, but before I take any official action, I'd like to know Just what happened. Who put the tribbles in the quadrotriticale? What was in the grain that killed them?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Captain Kirk, before you go on, may I make a request?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Can you get those things out of here?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The guards take Jones' tribbles from him. They get to the door as Darvin enters, and the tribbles shriek.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Remarkable.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold on a minute. I thought you said tribbles liked everybody.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: They do. I can't understand it. The last time I saw one act this way was at the bar.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was in the bar?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Klingons. Him, for one. (points at Korax)

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Kirk takes two tribbles from the guards and brings them near Korax. They shriek.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're right, Mister Jones. They don't like Klingons. (McCoy enters) But they do like Vulcans. I didn't know you had it in you.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously tribbles are very perceptive creatures, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obviously. Mister Baris, they like you. Well, there's no accounting for taste. (and back to Darvin) They don't like you, Mister Darvin. I wonder why. Bones?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: scanning him
Text: Heartbeat is all wrong. His body temperature is. Jim, this man is a Klingon.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: A Klingon?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wonder what Starfleet Command will say about that. What about the grain, Bones?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, yes. It was poisoned.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: Poisoned?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. It's been impregnated with a virus. The virus turns into an inert material in the bloodstream. The more the organism eats, the more inert matter is built up. So after two or three days, they reached a point where they couldn't take in enough nourishment to survive.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They starved to death. In a storage compartment full of grain, they starved to death.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That is essentially it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Darvin, are you going to talk?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: I have nothing to say. (Kirk thrusts the tribbles into his face) All right, I poisoned the grain! Take them away.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the tribbles had nothing to do with it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Darvin
Text: I don't know. I never saw one before in my life, and I hope I never see one of those fuzzy miserable things again.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Baris
Text: I'm certain that can be arranged, Darvin. Guards? If you'll excuse me, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: Baris leaves with the security guards and Darvin.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Koloth. About that apology.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Koloth
Text: Yes?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have six hours to get your ship out of Federation territory.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The tribbles shriek, Koloth makes a hasty bow and practically runs out of the room with Korax.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know, I think I could learn to like tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: The face of an unhappy barman peers out from a pile of tribbles.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Well, Captain, I suppose I'm free to go now.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you're not. There's something I want to show you. You know what the penalty is for transporting an animal proven harmful to human life?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Captain, one little tribble isn't harmful. Captain, you wouldn't do a thing like that to me, now would you? Would you?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: The penalty is twenty years in a rehabilitation colony.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Captain Kirk. Friend. Friend Kirk. Surely we can come to some sort of mutual understanding. After all, my tribbles did put you wise to the poisoned grain, and they did help you to find the Klingon agent. You saved a lot of lives that way.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is one thing you can do.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Yes?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pick up every tribble on the space station. If you do that, I'll speak to Mister Lurry about returning your spaceship.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: It would take years.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Seventeen point nine, to be exact.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Seventeen point nine years.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Consider it Job security.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: Captain, you're a hard man. All right! All right!

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll do it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: He'll do it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Jones
Text: I'll do it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Context: He starts stuffing tribbles into his many pockets.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Starfleet was able to divert that freighter.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. That means Sherman's Planet will get its quadrotriticale only a few weeks late. I don't see any tribbles around here.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And you won't find a tribble on this entire ship.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, how did you do it?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I cannot take credit for another man's work. Scotty did it.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty! Where are the tribbles?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, er, Captain, it was really Mister Spock's recommendation.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course. Spock.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Based on computer analysis, of course, taking into account the possibilities of

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I don't want to interrupt this mutual admiration society, but I'd like to know where the tribbles are.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tell him, Spock.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, it was Mister Scott who performed the actual engineering.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott. Where are the tribbles?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I used the transporter, Captain.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You used the transporter?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where did you transport them? Scott, you didn't transport them into space, did you?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain Kirk, that'd be inhuman.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are they?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I gave them a good home, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Context: shouting
Text: Where?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: I gave them to the Klingons, sir.

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Kirk
Context: a whisper
Text: You gave them to the Klingons?

Title: The Trouble With Tribbles
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Before they went into warp, I transported the whole kit and caboodle into their engine room, where they'll be no tribble at all.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Everyone on the Bridge is staring at Spock's back, as he analyses some sensor data.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: No doubt about it, Captain. The space debris comes from the survey vessel SS Beagle.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Missing for six years, and now this junk in space.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Portions of the antimatter nacelles, personal belongings. Captain, no signs of bodies whatsoever.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then whatever destroyed the ship, the crew was able to get off safely. Navigator, compute the present drift of the wreckage.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Computed and on the board, sir.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, assuming that the wreckage drifted at the same speed and direction for the past six years?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would have come from planet four, star system eight nine two, directly ahead.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Only one sixteenth parsec away, Captain. We should be there in seconds.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standard orbit around the planet. There may be survivors there.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: SS Beagle. Small class four stardrive vessel. Crew of forty seven, commanded by. Jim, I believe you knew him. Captain R M Merik.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, at the academy. He was dropped in his fifth year. He went into the merchant service.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Coming up on the planet, captain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: A planet with lots of water, some land masses and just s few wispy white clouds.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on the screen.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Definitely class M, somewhat similar to Earth.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, similar. But the land masses and oceans are quite different, however.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Different in shape only, Captain. The proportion of land to water is exactly as on your Earth. Density five point five, diameter seven nine one seven at the equator, atmosphere seventy eight percent nitrogen, twenty one percent oxygen. Again, exactly like Earth.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly in some ways, different in others.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I also picked up indications of large cities.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What era?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: No sign of atomic power as yet, but far enough along for radio communications, power transportation, an excellent road system.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, both amplitude and frequency modulation being used. I think I can pick up something visual. It's a news broadcast using a system I think they once called video.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Television was the colloquial term.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on the screen.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: A black and white image of people watching as police in crash helmets arrest someone. There is a car in the foreground. Very 1950s or 60s.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Voice
Text: Today police rounded up still another group of dissidents. Authorities are as yet unable to explain these fresh outbreaks of treasonable disobedience by well-treated, well-protected, intelligent slaves. Now turning to the world of sports and bringing you the taped results of the arena games last night. (a sword fight) The first heat involved amateurs. They're petty thieves from City Prison. Conducted, however, with traditional weapons, it provided some amusement for a few moments. In the second heat, a slightly more professional display in the spirit of our splendid past, when gladiator Claudius Marcus killed the last of the barbarians, William B. Harrison, in an excellent example of

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The picture of an old Roman fight with net and short sword is lost.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transmission lost, sir. Shall I try to get it back?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Slaves and gladiators. What are we seeing, a twentieth-century Rome?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the one described as the barbarian is also listed here. Flight officer William B. Harrison of the SS Beagle. At least there were some survivors down there.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready the transporter room, Mister Spock. We're beaming down.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The landing party of three is beamed onto a ridge, nicely silhouetted against the clear blue sky.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could have selected a more convenient place, Mister Spock.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: But hardly more practical, captain. Close to the city we located, but not populated. We should not be observed.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: They head down the steep slope. Spock takes some tricorder scans.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. This atmosphere is remarkably similar to your twentieth century. Moderately industrialised pollution containing substantial amounts of carbon monoxide and partially consumed hydrocarbons.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The word was smog.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I believe that was the term. I had no idea you were that much of a historian, Doctor.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I am not, Mister Spock. I was simply trying to stop you from giving us a whole lecture on the subject. Jim, is there anything at all we know about this planet?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The SS Beagle was the first ship to make a survey of this star sector when it disappeared.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then the Prime Directive is in full force, Captain?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No identification of self or mission. No interference with the social development of said planet.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No references to space, or the fact that there are other worlds, or more advanced civilisations.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: One, just once, I'd like to be able to land someplace and say, Behold, I am the Archangel Gabriel.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to see the humour in that situation, Doctor.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Naturally. You could hardly claim to be an angel with those pointed ears, Mister Spock. But say you landed someplace with a pitchfork.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: A gunshot rings out.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Don't move! Hands in the air!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Complete Earth parallel. The language here is English.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Kirk tries to go for his phaser, and another shot hits the ground near his feet.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: I said, don't move!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think he means it, Spock.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: There would seem to be evidence to that effect.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Four men appear from behind rocks. They are wearing t-shirts with a short chain motif at the neck. The leader is barefoot and wearing shorts.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Who are you?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We come from another province.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Context: to Spock
Text: Where are you from? What do you call those?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I call them ears.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Are you trying to be funny?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Never. Colloquial twentieth-century English. An amazing parallel.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We come from a place that's quite some journey from here. I doubt if you've heard

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Uniforms. Probably some new Praetorian guard unit. I should kill you here, but Septimus would probably be displeased. Move. Move!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: As they are lead along, a guard whistles the signal that they are approaching, and two men come out of a hidden cave

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: I didn't harm them, Septimus, as much as I wanted to.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Context: a very old man with a gentle way of speaking
Text: Keep always in your mind, Flavius, that our way is peace.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: For which we are grateful, for we are men of peace ourselves.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Oh? Are you Children of the Sun?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, if you're speaking of worships of sorts, we represent many beliefs.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: There is only one true belief! Roman butchers, sent here by the first citizen.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we look like any Romans you ever saw ?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Then are you slaves like ourselves?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our people don't believe in slavery.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: A Roman lie. We must kill them.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, we came here looking for some friends, forty seven of them who were stranded here some six years ago. They wore clothing similar to ours. Have you heard of such men?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Septimus, I know killing is evil, but sometimes it's necessary.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: No.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: But they've located us, our hiding place. It's better to kill a few of them than all of us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wait. I can prove we're telling the truth. A small device. I'll take it out slowly. (his communicator) Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, lock in on my transmission beam. Scan us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scanning, sir.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Including ourselves, how many of us are there?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Twelve, Captain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, Scotty. Continue scanning. We'll maintain transmission. Kirk out. The Enterprise is our ship, somewhere at sea. That's all I can tell you. If it isn't sufficient, you will have to kill us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Tell me the empire has a device like that, Flavius, and you may kill them. Otherwise, accept them as friends.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Septimus leads the way into the caves.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4040.7. On the surface of planet four, system eight nine two, the landing party has won the confidence of what obviously is a group of runaway slaves. They dwell in caves not far from a large city, wear rags, live under primitive conditions. But they are creatures of a heavily industrialised twentieth-century type planet very much like Earth. An amazing example of Hodgkins's law of Parallel Planet Development. But on this Earth, Rome never fell. A world ruled by emperors who can trace their line back two thousand years to their own Julius and Augustus Caesars.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The landing party are given water, and Spock leafs through some magazines.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: No, Captain. I'm sure I would have heard of the arrival of other men like you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps you've heard, let's say, an impossible story or a rumour of men who came from the sky or from other worlds.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: There are no other worlds.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The stars.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Lights shining through from heaven. It is where the sun is. Blessed be the sun.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Context: brings over a magazine
Text: Captain, I thought you might find this interesting.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Context: looking at a car advert
Text: The Jupiter Eight. Conventional internal combustion engine. You were right about the smog. But the Jupiter Eight? Mars toothpaste. Neptune bath salts.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Taken from the names of false gods. When I was a senator, I worshiped them too, but I heard the words of the sun. I became a Brother. For that, they made me a slave.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Septimus, we need your help. We must go into the city. We know that one of our missing friends was seen there recently.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: My advice to you is to leave. Go back where you came from.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't do that. Perhaps you know his name. Merik. Captain Merik.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: General consternation and animosity from the other slaves

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Merikus?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. He's the leader of our friends.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Merikus is first citizen. Butcher.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That doesn't sound like the same man.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, a logical question, if I may. Septimus, how many years ago did Merikus become your first citizen?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: Perhaps five years.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Almost six. I was there when he became lord of the games. If he is your friend, you are no friends of ours.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Septimus, wherever we may be from, you must believe that it is one of our most important laws that none of us interfere with the affairs of others. If Captain Merik is Merikus, then he has violated that law, and he must be taken away and punished. Will you help us get to the truth of all this?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: First I must discuss it with the others.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The men leave.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Curious, Captain, the similarity in names. Were you told why Merik was dropped from the Space Academy?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He failed a psycho-simulator test. All it takes is a split second of indecision. Hardly the type to become a political strongman.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Odd that these people should worship the sun.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why, Doctor?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Because, my dear Mister Spock, it is illogical. Rome had no sun worshipers. Why should they parallel Rome in every way except one?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The men return.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Septimus
Text: We have decided. Flavius will guide you. We will provide you with suitable clothing. I caution you, take great care. The police are everywhere. May the blessings of the sun be upon you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Dressed as slaves in jeans and t-shirts, the landing party are lead towards the city. Spock wears his obligatory woollen hat. They stop by a small thicket of trees.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: We'll wait here until dark.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you a slave, Flavius?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: You are barbarians indeed not to know of Flavius Maximus. For seven years, I was the most successful gladiator in this province.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you heard the word of the sun?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Yes. The words of peace and freedom. It wasn't easy for me to believe. I was trained to fight. But the words, the words are true.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are many things I'd like to know

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: he's interrupted by rapid gunfire.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: Hold! Don't move! Hands in the air!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Armed police round them up.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Four fleeing fish. A fine haul. Flavius Maximus.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Flavius attacks him and gets knocked down.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: You have been too long absent from the games, Flavius. The first citizen will be pleased. Runaway slaves are always welcome. (removes Spock's hat) No, not slaves. Barbarians. It's been a long time since I've watched barbarians die in the arena.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4040.9. Uniformed police like those of Earth, a great city like Rome with automobiles. Astonishing similarities to twentieth-century Earth, down to the fine carbon steel in the bars.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Spock and McCoy carry Flavius into a cell.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell Merikus I'd like to see him.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: The first citizen? Why would he bother with arena bait like you?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell him it's Jim Kirk. Perhaps a friend.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: Perhaps?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if I am a friend and you don't tell him, do you really want to risk that?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: They are locked in and left alone. McCoy tends to Flavius's head wound.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But if there have been slaves for over 2,000 years, hasn't there always been discontent, runaways?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Long ago there were rebellions, but they were suppressed. And with each century, the slaves acquired more rights under the law. They received rights to medicine, the right to government payments in their old age, and they slowly learned to be content.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even more fascinating. Slavery evolving into an institution with guaranteed medical payments, old-age pensions.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Quite logical, I'd say, Mister Spock. Just as it's logical that twentieth-century Rome would use television to show its gladiator contests or name a new car the Jupiter Eight.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, if I were able to show emotion, your new infatuation with that term would begin to annoy me.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What term? Logic? Medical men are trained in logic, Mister Spock.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Really, Doctor, I had no idea they were trained. Watching you, I assumed it was trial and error.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Are they enemies, Captain?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not sure they're sure. When the slaves began to worship the sun, they became discontent again. When did all this happen?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Long ago. Perhaps as long ago as the beginning of the empire. The message of the sun, that all men are brothers, was kept from us. Perhaps I'm a fool to believe it. It does often seem that man must fight to live.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You go on believing it, Flavius. All men are brothers.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The guards return.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: Flavius. Your friends are waiting for you. You've already been matched for the morning games. Come.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: I will not fight. I'm a Brother of the Sun.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: Put a sword in your hand, and you'll fight. I know you, Flavius, you're as peaceful as a bull.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Two guards take Flavius away.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: You three come with us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Three against three. We may never get a better chance.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: No talking. Outside.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Context: looking at McCoy
Text: I doubt if he'll get very far. He feels ill.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I do?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Maximus
Text: Outside!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, but he'll double over before we get very far. (Spock and Kirk take McCoy's arms.)

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I think I can walk. I'll try.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: McCoy suddenly doubles over in pain and two guards are sent in to help. One gets neck-pinched, the Roman is karate-chopped and the last guard is punched by the invalid.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Context: blue eyed, red haired) Well done, Jim. (Armed guards appear.
Text: I'm afraid it isn't that easy. They've been handling slaves here for two thousand years.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: But it was exciting. They'd do well in the arena.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Merik, isn't it ?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Yes, it's me. This is our Proconsul, Claudius Marcus.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: But this is no place for a reunion.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: This way. Your friends, too. There's lots to talk about, lots to explain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Don't judge me before you know the facts. Come on, we can talk freely here. The Proconsul knows who and what we are.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Some small animal skins on the floor, a brass brazier, an urn and busts on plinths, and a girl preparing drinks.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: You can leave us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The guards leave.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Well, a celebration. A meeting of old friends.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Prepare food for our friends. They've come from a great distance. A great distance indeed. So, this is a Vulcan. Interesting. From what I've heard, I wish I had fifty of you for the arena.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: This other is your ship's surgeon?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: It's a pity we can't let him loose in our hospitals. Our level of medicine would improve immeasurably, I'm sure.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Come. You must be hungry. Gentlemen?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: They sit at a table, and the girl brings over a plate.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Oh, try the sparrow broiled in garum. Delicious. Or perhaps some of this roast kid. Lovely thing, isn't she?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, what happened?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: We had meteor damage, Jim. I went ashore with a landing party to look for iridium ore for repairs, and I met this gentleman.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: He convinced me it would be unfair to this world to carry word of their existence elsewhere.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Contamination. Can't risk that. Oh, you'll understand as you learn more about us.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: So I made the decision to stay.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to your crew? Did they voluntarily beam, come ashore?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: This is an ordered world, Jim, a conservative world based on time-honoured Roman strengths and virtues.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to your crew?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: There's been no war here for over four hundred years, Jim. Could, let's say, your land of that same era make that same boast? I think you can see why they don't want to have their stability contaminated by dangerous ideas of other ways and other places.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting, and given a conservative empire, quite understandable.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you out of your head?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I said I understood it, Doctor. I find the checks and balances of this civilisation quite illuminating.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Next he'll be telling us he prefers it over Earth history.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: They do seem to have escaped the carnage of your first three world wars, Doctor.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They have slavery, gladiatorial games, despotism.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Situations quite familiar to the six million who died in your first world war, the eleven million who died in your second, the thirty seven million who died in your third. Shall I go on?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Interesting. And you, Captain, which world do you prefer?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My world, proconsul, is my vessel, my oath, my crew. What happened to your vessel you've explained. What happened to your oath is obvious.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: And as for my men, those that were able to adapt to this world are still alive. Those who couldn't adapt are dead. That's the way it is with life everywhere, isn't it?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You sent your own men into the arena?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Just as I did, Jim, you're going to order your own people ashore.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You must know that's impossible. Starfleet regulations

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Are designed to circumvent any such order. There may be over four hundred men on your ship, Captain, but they can be brought down if it's handled properly. Say, a few at a time. You see, I have the advantage of a trained ship captain to tell me what is and what is not possible. Your communicator, Captain Kirk. Now do save us all a lot of unnecessary trouble and issue the appropriate orders.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: They're going to be arriving soon, anyway, Jim. A recon party, then a rescue party, then another rescue party. I had less men. It added up the same.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you really believe I could be made to order my own people down?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: I believe this, Captain. That you would do almost anything rather than see these two dear friends put slowly to death.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Kirk takes the communicator.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge. Scott here.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Armed guards enter.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, if you have a fix. (guns are pointed at his head) Stand by, Scotty.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Very wise of you, Captain. No point in sending up bullet-ridden corpses.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yet on the other hand, my chief engineer's standing by for a message.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: I do hope so, for your sake. Now, Captain, what are you going to order your men to do?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I brought down a hundred of them armed with phasers

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: you could probably defeat the combined armies of our entire empire, and violate your oath regarding noninterference with other societies. I believe you all swear you'll die before you'd violate that directive. Am I right?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite correct.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Must you always be so blasted honest?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: But on the other hand, why even bother to send your men down? From what I understand, your vessel could lay waste to the entire surface of the world. Oh, but there's that Prime Directive in the way again. Can't interfere.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Jim, you've already started a message. Your engineer's waiting. What are you going to do?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. Sorry to keep you waiting.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: We were becoming concerned, Captain. You were a bit overdue.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Order your officers to come down.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Condition Green, all's well. Kirk out.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Guards, take them. Prepare them for the games.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Ah, that was stupid, Jim. This is not an Academy training test. This is for real. They're taking you to die.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
