Text: Ship's log, stardate 4041.2. Chief Engineer Scott recording. Captain Kirk and his landing party have checked in

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: But they have used the code term Condition Green, which means they're in trouble. But it also prohibits my taking any action. (ends log entry) Mister Chekov, pinpoint power source locations. Type, power, load factors, and how much our beams will have to pull to overload them.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That may take some time.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let it take time, lad. They're in trouble, and I'm under orders not to interfere. However, no order can stop me from frightening them. It may do no good, but it may suggest to someone just what a starship can really do. Aye.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Actually, a painted backdrop in the Empire TV television studio. The commentator sits on scaffolding next to a camera operator.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Announcer
Text: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. Live and direct from City Arena, and in colour, we bring you Name the Winner, brought to you tonight by your Jupiter Eight dealers from coast to coast. In just a moment, tonight's first heat. We're in a taped commercial, Proconsul. Forty seconds, then we'll be back live.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Claudius, Merik and Kirk take seats on a raised platform. Kirk is manacled, and there are two armed guards behind him. Spock and McCoy are brought out by two guards in full traditional dress.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Announcer
Text: Stand by. Ten seconds. And first tonight, ladies and gentlemen, a surprise extra. In the far corner, a pair of highly aggressive barbarians. Strong, intelligent, with strange ways, and I'm sure full of a lot of surprises. And facing them, two favorites here from previous encounters, Achilles and Flavius. (The canned applause is turned up by a bored sound effects man) Victory or death? And for which of them? Well, ladies and gentlemen, you know as much about that at this moment as I do because this is your programme. You name the winner.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: I don't mind fighting, but why you?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Voice
Text: Begin!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Achilles takes on Spock. They are well matched. McCoy is against Flavius, and doesn't know what to do with a short sword.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Announcer
Text: Flavius may be getting off to a slow start, but he's never disappointed this crowd. A close one. The barbarian with the pointed ears seems to be in trouble.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I tell you I'm well able to defeat you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Achilles
Text: Fight, barbarian!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Most of my men went the same way. I hoped I would feel it less with yours.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not want to injure you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The cat-calls and hisses are amplified. Flavius gets a taste of the whip.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Master
Text: Fight, you two. You bring this network's ratings down, Flavius, and we'll do a special on you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: McCoy puts more effort into it.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Question, Captain?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The rules. If Spock should finish his man off first, would he be able to help

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: We believe men should fight their own battles. Only the weak will die. My word as a Roman. Ready to order your men down, Captain?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: Maybe now you understand why I gave in. The Romans have always been the strongest, and they've had practice for over two thousand years in enslaving men, using them, killing them.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Quite true, Captain Kirk. The games have always strengthened us. Death becomes a familiar pattern. We don't fear it as you do.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Flavius gets whipped again

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: At least defend yourself.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I am defending myself!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Text: Not like that, you fool. Hold your weapon higher.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The cat-calls are replaced by cheers

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Admit it. You find these games frightening, revolting.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Proconsul, in some parts of the galaxy I have seen forms of entertainment that makes this look like a folk dance.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Certain this isn't different, Captain? Those are your men dying, not strangers.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've had to select men to die before so that others could be saved.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: You're a clever liar, Captain Kirk. Merikus was a spaceship captain. I've observed him thoroughly. Your species has no such strength.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: He commands not just a spaceship, Proconsul, but a starship. A very special vessel and crew. I tried for such a command.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: I see no evidence of superiority. They fight no better than your men did, Merikus. Perhaps not as well.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Achilles
Text: Stop running. Fight.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Need any help, Doctor?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Whatever gave you that idea?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Achilles
Text: Fight, you pointed-ear freak!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You tell him, buster. Of all the completely ridiculous, illogical questions I ever heard in my life!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: McCoy falls, and is vulnerable. Achilles is distracted so Spock punches him out then goes and neck-pinches Flavius.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Master
Text: A clear foul, Proconsul. Your decision?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Your opinion, Merikus? After all, they're like yourself.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: It's your decision, Proconsul.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Your opinion, Captain Kirk? Would you like me to kill them now? An easy death? Then you'd gladly accept whatever happens to you. Take them back to their cage. Well, it won't go that easily for them, Captain, nor for you. Take him to my quarters.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Kirk is alone in the room, and is startled when a curtain is pulled back and the blonde girl appears, wearing very little.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Drusilla
Text: I was told to wait for you and provide wine, food, whatever you wish. I am Proconsul's slave Drusilla. Although for this evening. (pause) For this evening I was told I am your slave. Command me.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It won't work.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Drusilla
Text: What will not work?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever he has in mind, whatever tricks. You hear that, Proconsul? It won't work. I'm not co-operating. I may die, but you won't get any entertainment out of it.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Drusilla
Text: We're alone. Please believe me. I've never lied to one who owns me.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Spock is checking the iron bars of their prison.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Angry, Mister Spock, or frustrated, perhaps?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Such emotions are foreign to me, Doctor. I'm merely testing the strength of the door.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: For the fifteenth time. Spock. Spock, I know we've had our disagreements. Maybe they're jokes. I don't know. As Jim says, we're not often sure ourselves sometimes, but what I'm trying to say is

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I am seeking a means of escape. Will you please be brief?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, what I'm trying to say is you saved my life in the arena.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, that's quite true.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm trying to thank you, you pointed-eared hobgoblin!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Oh, yes. You humans have that emotional need to express gratitude. You're welcome, I believe, is the correct response. However, Doctor, you must remember I am entirely motivated by logic. The loss of our ship's surgeon, whatever I think of his skill, would mean a reduction in the efficiency of the Enterprise and therefore

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you know why you're not afraid to die, Spock? You're more afraid of living. Each day you stay alive is just one more day you might slip and let your human half peek out. That's it, isn't it? Insecurity. Why, you wouldn't know what to do with a genuine, warm, decent feeling.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: Really, Doctor?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know. I'm worried about Jim, too.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: The wine is being poured.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. (he tries a grape) Excellent.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Drusilla
Text: I was concerned. I am ordered to please you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've been in some strange worlds with strange customs. Perhaps this is considered torture here.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Drusilla
Text: Torture? I do not understand. I do not wish to see you tortured in any way. (she kisses him) At the first sign of pain, you will tell me?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll be the first to know.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Later, when the oil lamp has burnt out, and Kirk is asleep

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Captain. (Kirk wakes with a start) I'm sorry I was detained. Should we have our little talk now? So far on this planet we've kept you rather busy. I don't wonder you slept through the afternoon. By the way, one of the communicators we took from you is missing. Was it my pretty Drusilla by any chance?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Merik enters. There are guards in the room now too.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: See if he has it. Not that I would have punished her. I would have blamed you. You're a Roman, Kirk, or you should have been. It's not on his person?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Text: No, Proconsul.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: I am sorry I was detained. I trust there was nothing further you required?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing except perhaps an explanation.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Because you're a man, I owe you that. You must die shortly, and because you are a man (pauses) Would you leave us, Merik? The thoughts of one man to another cannot possibly interest you.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Merik leaves.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Because you are a man, I gave you some last hours as a man.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I appreciate that.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Unfortunately, we must demonstrate that defiance is intolerable.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: But I've learned to respect you. I promise you, you will die easily, quickly.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thank you. And my friends?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: When their time comes, the same of course. Guards. Take him to the arena. Oh, we've pre-empted fifteen minutes on the early show for you. In full colour. We guarantee you a splendid audience. You may not understand because you're centuries beyond anything as crude as television.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've heard it was similar.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Enterprise log, Engineer Scott reporting. All banks in readiness for disruption of power sources on the planet's surface.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Announcer
Text: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. Before tonight's first heat, a simple execution. Stay tuned to this channel. There's a lot of excitement coming your way.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Make it a quick, single thrust.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Master
Text: Don't move. You'll only die harder.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Flavius
Context: rushing into the arena
Text: Murderers! If you want death, fight me!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Claudius signals a guard, who fires his machine gun. The Roman is killed along with Flavius. Kirk grabs the sword and deals with another Roman.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now, Mister Chekov. Activate.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: As the lights go out, Kirk gets himself a gun and runs.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Guards, don't let him escape! Guards!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: When the lights come on again, he's by McCoy and Spock's cell.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand back.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: He shoots the lock out.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obsolete, but effective.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened, Jim?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: What did they do to you?

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They threw me a few curves. No time to explain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Claudius and guards come in from two different entrances.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Claudius
Text: Hold! We're in each other's line of fire. I pity you, Captain Merik, but at least watch and see how men die. Swords only!

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: So the fight starts, and Spock acquires a sword very quickly. The cell door is a defensible position.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Merik
Context: into communicator
Text: Starship, lock in on this. Three to beam

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Claudius stabs him, but Merik manages to throw the communicator into the cell with the landing party.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Ready to beam up three.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: They disappear in a hail of bullets.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4041.7. Note commendation, Engineering Officer Scott. Despite enormous temptation

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Narrator
Text: > [Bridge]

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And strong personal feelings, he obeyed the Prime Directive. His temporary blackout of the city below resulted in no interference with the society and yet saved the lives of myself and the landing party.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Scott
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Context: Scott leaves as McCoy and Spock enter the Bridge.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I see on your report Flavius was killed. I am sorry. I liked that huge sun worshiper.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wish we could have examined that belief of his more closely. It seems illogical for a sun worshiper to develop a philosophy of total brotherhood. Sun worship is usually a primitive superstition religion.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm afraid you have it all wrong, Mister Spock, all of you. I've been monitoring some of their old-style radio waves, the empire spokesman trying to ridicule their religion. But he couldn't. Don't you understand? It's not the sun up in the sky. It's the Son of God.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Caesar and Christ. They had them both. And the word is spreading only now.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A philosophy of total love and total brotherhood.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will replace their imperial Rome, but it will happen in their twentieth century.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wouldn't it be something to watch, to be a part of? To see it happen all over again? Mister Chekov, take us out of orbit. Ahead warp factor one.

Title: Bread And Circuses
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Enterprise is orbiting a very red planet, and Kirk is checking his appearance in a mirror.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dress uniforms, spit and polish. I don't know how much longer I'm going to be able to stand this. I feel like my neck's in a sling.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Vulcans are the last delegates we have to pick up. As soon as we get them aboard, we'll be able to relax.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: They leave.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sure. A formal reception tonight, a hundred and fourteen delegates aboard for two weeks, thirty two of them ambassadors, (Spock joins them) half of them mad at the other half, and the whole lot touchier than a raw antimatter pile over this Coridan question.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Intercom whistles

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Shuttlecraft approaching with Ambassador Sarek's party. Estimate arrival one minute.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring them aboard, Mister Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Standby to recover shuttlecraft. Honour guard to the hangar deck.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: As the NCC1701/7 arrives, the honour guard smarted themselves up outside.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Voice
Text: Clear hangar deck. Clear hangar deck. Depressurising. Recovering shuttlecraft. Hangar deck pressurising.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The guard line up, holding phasers with arms crossed.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How does that Vulcan salute go?

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Spock demonstrates - right hand with the fingers separated into a V-sign.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That hurts worse than the uniform.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: A couple are escorted from the shuttlecraft.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain James Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My First Officer, Commander Spock.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan honours us with your presence. We come to serve.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Your service honours us, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Chief Medical Officer Doctor McCoy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ambassador.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Doctor. My aides and she who is my wife.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: He holds out his right hand with two fingers extended, and a human woman steps forward to touch them.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our pleasure, madam. As soon as you're settled I'll arrange a tour of the ship. Mister Spock will conduct you.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: I'd prefer another guide, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As you wish, Ambassador. Mister Spock, we'll leave orbit in two hours. Would you care to beam down and visit your parents?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Ambassador Sarek and his wife are my parents.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 3842.3. We have departed Vulcan for the neutral planetoid code-named Babel. Since it is in our sector, the Enterprise has been assigned to transport ambassadors of Federation planets to this vitally important council. The issues of the council are politically complex, the passengers explosive.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Kirk is conducting Sarek and Amanda's tour himself. Spock is doing something in Engineering when they enter.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the engineering section. There are a number of emergency back-up systems for the main controls. Over here are a number of control computers.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Amanda lags behind to talk with her son.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: After all these years among humans, you still haven't learned to smile.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Humans smile with so little provocation.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: And you haven't come to see us in four years, either.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: The situation between my father and myself has not changed.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: My wife, attend.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. A moment, if you please.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain the computer components.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: I gave Spock his first instruction in computers, Captain. He chose to devote his knowledge to Starfleet instead of the Vulcan Science Academy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you will excuse me, Captain. (leaves)

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Ambassador. I did not mean to offend. I thought that

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Offence is a human emotion. I'm returning to my quarters. Continue, my wife. (leaves)

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mrs. Sarek, I just don't understand.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Amanda. I'm afraid you couldn't pronounce the Vulcan name.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: After a fashion, and after many years of practice. Shall we continue the tour? My husband did request it.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It sounded more like a command.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Of course. He's a Vulcan. I'm his wife.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Spock is his son.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: You don't understand the Vulcan way, Captain. It's logical. It's a better way than ours. But it's not easy. It has kept Spock and Sarek from speaking as father and son for eighteen years.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock is my best officer, and my friend.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: I'm glad he has such a friend. It hasn't been easy on Spock. Neither human nor Vulcan. At home nowhere except Starfleet.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I take it that Spock disagreed with his father on a choice of career.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: My husband has nothing against Starfleet. But Vulcans believe that peace should not depend on force.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Starfleet force is used only as a last resort. We're an instrument of civilisation. And it's a better opportunity for a scientist to study the universe than he can get at the Vulcan Science Academy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Perhaps. But Sarek wanted Spock to follow his teachings, as Sarek followed the teachings of his own father.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They are both stubborn.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: A human trait, Captain?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse me. Kirk here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I've picked up some sort of signal. Just a few symbols. Nothing intelligible.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Source?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: That's what bothers me, sir. Impossible to locate. There wasn't enough of it. Sensors show nothing in the area, but it was a strong signal, as though it was very close.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to alert status four. Begin long-range scanning. Kirk out.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 3842.4. The interplanetary conference will consider the petition of the Coridan planets to be admitted to the Federation. The Coridan system has been claimed by some of the races now aboard our ship as delegates, races who have strong personal reasons for keeping Coridan out of the Federation. The most pressing problem aboard the Enterprise is to make sure open warfare doesn't break out among the delegates before the conference begins.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: People of all shapes, sizes and colours are helping themselves to drinks and nibbles from buffet tables.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Ambassador, I understand you had retired before this conference was called. Forgive my curiosity, but as a doctor, I'm interested in Vulcan physiology. Isn't it unusual for a Vulcan to retire at your age? After all, you're only a hundred and two.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: One hundred two point four three seven precisely, Doctor, measured in your years. I had other concerns.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Context: a stout chap with a porcine nose
Text: Sarek of Vulcan, do you vote to admit Coridan to the Federation?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: The vote will not be taken here, Ambassador Gav. My government's instructions will be heard in the council chambers on Babel.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: No! You! How do you vote, Sarek of Vulcan?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Context: thin and blue, with two antennae
Text: Why must you know, Tellarite?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: In council, his vote carries others. I will know where he stands and why.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Tellarites do not argue for reasons. They simply argue.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: No. You

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen. Ambassador Sarek is quite correct when he points out this is not the council chamber of Babel. I'm fully aware that the admission of Coridan is a highly debatable issue, but you won't solve it here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: You are correct, Captain. Quite logical.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: My apologies, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: You will excuse me. (stalks away)

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: Have you met Gav before, Ambassador?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: We debated during my last council session. Ambassador.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Ambassador Gav lost.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I've always suspected that you were a little more human than you let on. Mrs. Sarek, I know about the rigorous training of the Vulcan youth, but tell me, did he ever run and play like the human children, even in secret?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Well, he, he did have a pet sehlat he was very fond of.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sehlat?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: It's sort of a fat teddy bear.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A teddy bear?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Excuse me, Doctor. It has been a rather long day for my wife. Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Sarek leads Amanda away.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A teddy bear.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not precisely, Doctor. On Vulcan, the teddy bears are alive, and they have six-inch fangs.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, sensors are registering an unidentified vessel pacing us.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way. All duty personnel on Yellow Alert. Don't alarm the passengers. Kirk out.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A small ship, Captain. It's been there five minutes, remaining outside phaser range at extreme limit of sensors.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Identification, Spock?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors indicate the size of a scout ship, but the configuration is unfamiliar. Most unusual.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does she answer a hail?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've tried all frequencies and hooked in the universal translator. No response, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Maintain translator broadcast. Check records for authorised ships.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Starfleet records no authorised vessel in this quadrant except ours.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Care to guess what she is?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Guess, Captain? I shall need more data for my estimate.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, plot course to intercept that vessel. I want to see what she looks like close up.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: You embarrassed Spock this evening. Not even a mother may do that. He is a Vulcan.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: He's also human.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: He's a Starfleet officer.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: I thought you didn't approve of Starfleet.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: It is not a question of approval. The fact exists. He is in Starfleet. He must command respect if he is to function.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Sarek, you're proud of him, aren't you? You're showing almost human pride in your son.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: It does not require pride to ask that Spock be given the respect which is his due. Not as my son, but as Spock. Do you understand?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Not really, but it doesn't matter. I love you anyway. I know. It isn't logical.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vessel changing course, heading toward us at high warp speed.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready main phasers.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Phasers armed and ready, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The bright dot on the viewscreen whizzes past them.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. They were travelling at approximately warp ten.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Back on original course, Mister Chekov. Report on intruder's movements.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, Starfleet acknowledges report on our situation and confirms no authorised Federation vessel in this quadrant.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Back on original heading, Captain. The intruder changed course immediately after we did. It's paralleling us again.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we have a shadow. Faster, more manoeuvrable and unidentified. Mister Spock, full analysis of sensor readings. I want to know who that intruder is.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Sarek enters, and surreptitiously takes a tablet with a drink.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: Vulcan, I would speak to you.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: It does seem unavoidable.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: How do you vote on the Coridan admission?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: You seem unwilling to wait for the council meeting, Ambassador. No matter. We favour admission.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: You favour? Why?

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The room goes silent.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Under Federation law, Coridan can be protected and its wealth administered for the benefit of its people.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: That's well for you. Vulcan has no mining interest.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Coridan has nearly unlimited wealth of dilithium crystals, but it is under-populated and unprotected. This invites illegal mining operations.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: Illegal? You accuse us?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Some of your ships have been carrying Coridan dilithium crystals.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: You call us thieves?

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Gav attacks Sarek, who shrugs him off easily.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen. Gentlemen. Whatever arguments you have between yourselves is your business. My business is running the ship. As long as I command, there will be order.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Of course, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Gav
Text: Understood. There will be payment for your slander, Sarek.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Threats are illogical. And payment is usually expensive.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Gav leaves.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The Tellarite is hanging upside down from a Jefferies tube. He is not doing spine stretching exercises.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Joseph
Text: Security to Captain Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Joseph
Text: Lieutenant Joseph, sir. I'm on deck eleven, section A3. I've just found one of the Tellarites murdered. I think it's the ambassador himself, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How was he killed?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His neck was broken. By an expert.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, from the nature and location of the break, I'd say the killer knew exactly where to apply pressure to snap the neck instantly.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who aboard would have that knowledge?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcans. On Vulcan, the method is called tal-shaya. It was considered a merciful form of execution in ancient times.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. A short time ago, I broke up an argument between Gav and your father.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain? Interesting.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Interesting? Spock, do you realise that makes your father the most likely suspect?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcans do not approve of violence.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're saying he couldn't have done it?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Captain. I'm merely saying it would be illogical to kill without reason.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But if he had a reason, could he have done it?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: If there were a reason, my father is quite capable of killing. Logically and efficiently.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mrs. Sarek, I'm sorry to disturb you. I must speak to your husband.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: He's been gone for some time. It's his habit to meditate in private before retiring. What's wrong? Spock?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: You want something of me, Captain?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador, the Tellarite. Gav has been murdered.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His neck was broken, Mister Ambassador, by what Spock describes as tal-shaya.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Indeed? Interesting.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Ambassador, where were you during the past hour?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Captain, you're not accusing him?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mother. If only on circumstantial evidence, he is a logical suspect.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: I quite agree.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then where were you during the hour?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: In private meditation, Captain. Spock will tell you that such meditation is a personal experience, not to be discussed. especially not with Earthmen.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a very convenient excuse, Ambassador.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Sarek suddenly collapses.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Sarek. Sarek. What's wrong?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's difficult to say with Vulcan physiology, but I believe it's something to do with his cardiovascular system.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you help him?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know that yet either.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain. I get sensor readings of tri-tritanium from the alien ship's hull.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry about your father.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, it could adversely affect our mission.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't you worried about him?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Worry is a human emotion, Captain. I accept what has happened. The ship's hull seems to have a high density level or is cloaked against sensor probes. It is manned, but sensors cannot make out specifics.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Well, the Romulans have nothing like it. Certainly not the Federation or the neutral planets. What about the Klingons?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think it unlikely it is one of theirs.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who, then?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain? I picked up the last part of a transmission. Just like that other one. I put the recorder and the directional locator on it immediately.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, directional locator indicates source bearing twenty seven, mark eight.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's the intruder ship, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Switch recorder to Mister Spock's station for decode, Lieutenant.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, the directional locator indicates reception point somewhere within the body of this ship.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A personal receiver? Somebody on board is in contact with that vessel?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly, Captain. But I cannot decode this transmission.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is in no known code. There's no detectable pattern. No standard references apply.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are any conclusions possible from the information?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Only negative. It fits none of our computer records, and it is alien.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Murder? Someone out there playing tag? Lieutenant, you've got your sensor locator on a wide beam. You've established a receiver on board this vessel. Tighten your field to the interior of the ship.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If that alien vessel starts transmitting again, I want to know who on board the Enterprise is receiving.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, how is he?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As far as I can tell from instrument readings, our prime suspect has a malfunction in one of the heart valve. It's similar to a heart attack in a human. But with Vulcan physiology, it's impossible to tell without an operation. Mrs. Sarek, has he had any previous attacks?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: No.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Yes. There were three others. My physician prescribed Benjisidrine for the condition.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Why didn't you tell me?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: There was nothing you could have done.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador, when did you have these attacks?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Two before we left Vulcan, the third a few hours ago. I was on the observation deck. When the Tellarite was murdered, I was quite incapacitated.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There were no witnesses?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: None.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, do you propose surgery for the heart defect?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not sure. It's tough enough on a human. On a Vulcan, an ordinary operation's out of the question.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Because of the construction of the Vulcan heart.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suggest that a cryogenic open-heart procedure would be the logical approach.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Yes, unquestionably.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what about it?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I'm glad somebody's asking me something around here. Well, the procedure they're discussing would require tremendous amounts of blood for the patient.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I've checked the blood bank. There isn't enough Vulcan blood and plasma to even begin such an operation of this type.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are other Vulcans aboard.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: My blood type is T-negative. Somewhat rare, even for a Vulcan.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I'd say that's rare.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: My blood is T-negative, Doctor.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: We've run a number of blood tests on Mister Spock. It isn't true Vulcan blood either. It has human blood elements in it.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: It should be possible to filter out the human factors.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Even you couldn't give that much blood, Spock. It would kill you.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mrs. Sarek, you must understand the chances are extremely small to find a way to produce sufficient T-negative blood.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. I would estimate the odds

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Please don't.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I see it, Spock, but that was a Rigelian.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rigelian physiology is very similar to Vulcan.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Similar is not good enough. It's still experimental.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: But it does look promising.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, we would need such great amounts of blood that, even if the drug worked on the Vulcans as well as a Rigelian, which I'm doubtful, it would still drain Sarek to a critical level.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I consider the safety factor low, but acceptable.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Plus the fact I've never operated on a Vulcan before. Oh, I've studied the anatomical types. I know where all the organs are. But that's a lot different from actual surgical experience. So if I don't kill him with the operation, the drug probably will.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: What drug, Doctor? My husband is asleep. What drug?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A chemical stimulant to speed up reproduction and replacement of blood in the body. It's only experimental.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has been used successfully on test subjects on Rigel Five.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It places a tremendous strain on the spleen and the liver. In Sarek's condition, the stimulant would kill him.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Miss Chapel? I underwent a physical examination last week. Would you pull those records, please?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Already pulled. You're perfectly healthy, Mister Spock.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What has that got

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: You're going to use it on yourself. A transfusion from you to your father.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem the only answer.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It could damage you internally. It could kill you. I'm sorry, Spock. I can't sanction it.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: And I refuse to permit it. I won't risk both of you.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you automatically condemn Sarek to death. And you, Doctor, have no logical alternative either. If you do not operate, Sarek will die. You now have the means to perform the operation. I am volunteering myself as the blood donor. I'll be at my station until you require me.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Kirk is in the middle of a vigorous fight with an Andorian (the blue people with antennae). The Andorian pulls a knife and stabs Kirk before getting kicked unconscious.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge. Spock.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm on deck five, near my quarters. I've been attacked by an Andorian. Security. Security team.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: He passes out.) SPOCK [OC]: Captain? Captain? Captain

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3843.4. First Officer Spock in temporary command. The captain has been critically wounded by one of the delegates to the Babel conference. The ship is on alert status. We are still being followed by the intruder vessel.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a bad wound. Punctured left lung. A centimetre or so lower, it'd have gone through the heart.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll be in the brig questioning the Andorian prisoner.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Context: monitoring Sarek
Text: Doctor, the K2 factor is dropping.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, your father is much worse. There's no longer a choice. I have to operate immediately. We can begin as soon as you're prepared.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Doctor.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: My first responsibility is to the ship. Our passengers' safety is by Starfleet order of first importance. We are being followed by an alien, possibly hostile, vessel. I cannot relinquish command under these circumstances.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can turn command over to Scotty.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: On what grounds, Doctor? Command requirements do not recognise personal privilege. I'll be in the brig interrogating the Andorian.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: He is Thelev, a minor member of my staff. I know nothing of him except that he has served adequately.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: He has been subjected to questioning under verifier scan and truth drug. He reveals nothing. I suggest his mind has been so conditioned as part of a preconceived plan.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: My people are a violent race, but we've no quarrel with Captain Kirk.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently Thelev did.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: You suggest a plot. How could it profit us to harm the captain?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know. There is no logic in Thelev's attack upon the captain. There is no logic in Gav's murder.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Shras
Text: Perhaps you should forget logic and devote yourself to motivations of passion or gain. Those are reasons for murder.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The doorbell rings impatiently.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come in.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Spock, you must turn command over to somebody else.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mother, when I was commissioned, I took an oath to carry out responsibilities which were clearly and exactly specified.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Any competent officer can command this ship. Only you can give your father the blood transfusions that he needs to live.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Any competent officer can command this ship under normal circumstances. The circumstances are not normal. We're carrying over one hundred valuable Federation passengers. We're being pursued by an alien ship. We're subject to possible attack. There has been murder and attempted murder on board. I cannot dismiss my duties.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Duty? Your duty is to your father.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I know, but this must take precedence. If I could give the transfusion without loss of time or efficiency, I would. Sarek understands my reason.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Well, I don't. It's not human. That's not a dirty word. You're human, too. Let that part of you come through. Your father's dying.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mother, how can you have lived on Vulcan so long, married a Vulcan, raised a son on Vulcan, without understanding what it means to be a Vulcan?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: If this is what it means, I don't want to know.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: It means to adopt a philosophy, a way of life, which is logical and beneficial. We cannot disregard that philosophy merely for personal gain, no matter how important that gain might be.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Nothing is as important as your father's life.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can you imagine what my father would say if I were to agree, if I were to give up command of this vessel, jeopardise hundreds of lives, risk interplanetary war, all for the life of one person?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: When you were five years old and came home stiff-lipped, anguished, because the other boys tormented you saying that you weren't really Vulcan. I watched you, knowing that inside that the human part of you was crying and I cried, too. There must be some part of me in you, some part that I still can reach. If being Vulcan is more important to you, then you'll stand there speaking rules and regulations from Starfleet and Vulcan philosophy, and let your father die. And I'll hate you for the rest of my life.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mother

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Oh, go to him. Now. Please.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: She slaps his face and storms out.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor McCoy?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to get my hands on the guy with the sledgehammer.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The one who hit you?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, the one inside my head. How long have I

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Tries to sit up and fails.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now let that be a lesson to you. Just lie there and be happy you're still alive.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's Sarek?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not good. If I could only operate.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's stopping you? I thought you were all ready.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I was. When you became injured, Spock assumed command. He's going to stay there until you're back on your feet, even if it costs Sarek his life. Regulations.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't damn him for his loyalty, for doing his duty, but I'm not going to let him commit patricide.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, if you stand, you could start to bleed again.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, Sarek will die without that operation, and you can't operate without transfusions from Spock. I'll convince Spock I'm all right and order him to report here. As soon as he leaves the bridge, I'll turn command over to Scotty and report to my quarters. Will that fill your prescription?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll take over, Mister Spock. You report to Sickbay with Doctor McCoy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, are you quite all right?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've certified him physically fit, Mister Spock. Now since I have an operation to perform and both of us are required

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get out, Spock. Chekov, what's the status of the intruder?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No change, sir. Maintaining its distance.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any further transmissions, Lieutenant?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: None, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The turbolift doors close on Spock and McCoy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Call Mister Scott to the bridge.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the alien vessel is moving closer.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Belay that order. I'll stay here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm picking up the alien signal again, but it's coming from inside the Enterprise.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Specific origin?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: From the brig, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security? Security to the brig. Search the prisoner immediately.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Readings, Nurse.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock's blood reproduction rate is up over two hundred percent. Sarek's heartbeat has risen to three hundred and twenty four. Blood pressure ninety over forty, dropping.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wish I knew whether that was good or bad. Initiate sterile field.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Spock is starting to get up.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where do you think you're going?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I must see the captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My patients don't walk out in the middle of an operation.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: The alien ship. I've just realised that if their power utilisation curve is not the norm, it should be possible to identify them this way. Very important.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Chapel gives him a hypo to put him to sleep.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So is your father's life.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Joseph
Text: Security here. We had to stun the Andorian. He had some sort of transceiver. It was hidden in his antenna.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the alien ship has changed course and speed. Moving directly toward us at warp eight.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring the prisoner to the bridge. Deflectors on. Red Alert. Phasers stand by to fire on my order.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Shields on. Phasers manned and ready, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, take over Spock's scanners.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: The little light flashes past and the Enterprise rocks.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Target, Mister Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Moving away. Turning now. He's coming around again.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire as he passes, Ensign.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A clean miss, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report on his weaponry, Mister Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sensors record standard phasers, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standard phasers. Good. They may have more speed, but they're not giants.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the intercoms are jammed. All the ambassadors are asking what's going on.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell them to take a good guess, but clear that board, Lieutenant.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: He's coming around again.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Another hit and jolt.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: One more like that, and I'm going to lose both these men.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Spock is awake again.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Another attack.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Fire control locked into the computers, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my order, fire photon torpedoes two, four and six. Widest possible scatter.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Full spread missed, sir. They're moving too fast for us.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, his heart's stopped.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Cardio-stimulate.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Another jolt.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The systems are off.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then get me that old portable cardio-stimulator.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: She fetches a hand-sized device from a trolley.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Call engineering and have sickbay systems put on priority.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Number four shield has buckled, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliary power.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Switching over. Shields firming up. Number four is still weak, sir. If they hit us there again, it'll go altogether.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Sickbay gets its power back.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: Thelev is brought to the Bridge.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your friends out there are good. They'll have to destroy this ship to win.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: That was intended from the beginning, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're not Andorian. Who are you?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Damage reports coming in, Captain. Every deck.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damage control procedures, all decks. That ship out there has phasers. At least our weapons are alike.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Number two shield is gone.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering, this is the Captain. Cut power on port side except for phaser banks. At my signal, cut starboard power. Kirk out. Who are you?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: Find your own answers, Captain. You haven't long to live.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a spy, surgically altered to pass as an Andorian. Planted in the ambassador's party to use terror and murder to disrupt us and prepare for this attack.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: Speculation, Captain.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering, cut power on starboard side. Maintain until further orders. Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: In the darkened ship, Chekov takes back his usual station.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: What are you doing?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You speculate.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We're starting to drift, sir. Shall I hold her on course?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Stand by your phasers, Mister Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Phasers standing by. He's just hovering out there, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Looking us over. We're dead as far as he knows.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: You're baiting him. You're trying to lure him in.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Here he comes. Range decreasing. Speed dropping close to sublight.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold your fire, Mister Chekov.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Phasers locked on target. Range closing. Seventy five thousand kilometres.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: There's a satisfying flare on the viewscreen.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Got him!

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from general quarters. Lieutenant, open the hailing frequency. If they wish to surrender

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: A very big flare makes everyone shield their eyes.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: They could not surrender, Captain. They had orders to self-destruct.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: While in Sickbay, Sarek's vital signs are strengthening.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, relay to Starfleet command. Tell them we have a prisoner.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: Only temporarily, Captain. You see, I had orders to self-destruct, too. Slow poison. Quite painless, actually, but there's no known antidote. I anticipate another ten minutes of life.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take him to Sickbay.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Thelev
Text: I seem to have miscalculated.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: He dies with the security guards holding his arms.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So did they. Mister Chekov, take over.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you quite through shaking the ship around?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, Sarek how are they?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't mind telling you, you sure make it difficult for a surgeon trying

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones!

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Captain, come in.

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: They go through to the ward.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That pig-headed Vulcan stamina. I couldn't have pulled them through without it.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Some doctors have all the luck.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I believe you'll find the alien

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We damaged their ship. They destroyed themselves to avoid capture. Bones, Thelev's body will be brought to your lab. I want an autopsy performed as soon as possible.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: I think you'll find he's an Orion, Doctor.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Orion?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Intelligence reports that Orion smugglers have been raiding the Coridan system.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what would they gain by an attack on Starfleet?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Mutual suspicion and interplanetary war.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course. With Orion carefully neutral, they'd clean up supplying dilithium to both sides and continue to raid Coridan.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: The thing that confused me was the power utilisation curve. It made them seem more powerful than a starship or anything known to us. That ship was constructed for a suicide mission. Since they never intended to return to their home base, they could use one hundred percent power on their attacks. The thing I don't understand is why I didn't think of it earlier.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You might have had something else on your mind.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: That hardly seems likely.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but thank you anyway.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: And you, Sarek. Would you also say thank you to your son?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: For saving your life.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: Spock acted in the only logical manner open to him. One does not thank logic, Amanda.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Amanda
Text: Logic, logic! I'm sick to death of logic. Do you want to know how I feel about your logic?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Emotional, isn't she?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: She has always been that way.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed? Why did you marry her?

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Sarek
Text: At the time, it seemed the logical thing to do.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. (starts to collapse.) No, no, I'm all right

Title: Journey to Babel
Context: McCoy helps him onto a bed.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you keep arguing with your kindly family doctor, you're going to spend your next ten days right here. If you co-operate, you'll be out in two.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I'll return to my station now.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You are at your station, Mister Spock.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, I believe you're enjoying all this.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain. I've never seen him look so happy.

Title: Journey to Babel
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Shut up. (to Kirk) Shh. Shh! (to camera) Well, what do you know? I finally got the last word.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Doctor McCoy is sampling the local vegetation when his communicator beeps.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Jim.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much longer, McCoy?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, about another thirty minutes. I've come across some most interesting organic compounds. Hey, Starfleet was right.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk is also on the planet.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: These roots and soil cultures can be a medical treasure house. Any problems there?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No sign of the inhabitants so far. Kirk out.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Large prints. The ape-like carnivore in the reports?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the mugato. No problem, though. Those prints are several days old. They seldom stay in one place.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Aside from that, you say it's a Garden of Eden?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or so it seemed to the brash young Lieutenant Kirk on his first planet survey.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Class M in all respects. Quite Earth-like.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Except these people stayed in their Garden of Eden. Bows and arrows for hunting, but absolutely no fighting among themselves. Remarkably peaceful and tranquil.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Voice
Text: Ho! Take cover here!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk and Spock dash off to investigate, and see three dark-haired locals laying an ambush, armed with long-barreled guns.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bows and arrows, Captain?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Villagers with flintlocks? That's impossible. They hadn't progressed nearly that far.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, look.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: A group of blond hunters is approaching. They do have bows and arrows.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of those men walking into ambush is Tyree. The friend I lived with here. (He draws his phaser.)

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, use of our phasers is expressly forbidden.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: So instead Kirk throws a rock which startles a villager into firing his weapon early.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Villagers!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: There's a chase, hunters after the villagers, and the villagers pursuing Kirk and Spock. A shot is fired, which McCoy hears.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Enterprise, alert! Stand by to beam up landing party.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk and Spock come running, then Spock gets shot in the back.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock? Your phaser. (it is missing, so Kirk prepares to use his to defend his friend.)

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Captain. I can travel.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: They join McCoy.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam us up, quickly.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, Scotty. Have medics stand by.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: They beam out just before the villagers arrive.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: What happened, Captain?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lead projectile. Primitive firearm.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Context: an African doctor, to Nurse Chapel
Text: Vitalizer B.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Pressure packet. Lucky his heart's where his liver should be, or he'd be dead now.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Not good, sir.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Coranalin.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, can you save him?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks, Red Alert! Battle stations, battle stations! Go to Red Alert!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Uhura, sir. We have a Klingon vessel on our screen.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way. Scotty. Bones?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know yet, Jim.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, we're holding the planet between us and the Klingons. I don't think they've spotted us.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Make that definite, sir. They're sending a routine message to their home base with no mention of us.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Go to Yellow Alert.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yellow Alert. All stations go to Yellow Alert.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you think you can keep us out of their sight, Chekov?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I can try, Captain.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Message to Starbase, sir?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No point in giving ourselves away, Lieutenant. Not until we find out what's going on.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can hide for a while, sir, but we may have to go out of orbit to keep it up for long.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Sickbay.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here. I'll call you soon as I know anything. Sickbay out.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So, they've broken the treaty.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not necessarily, Captain. They have as much right to scientific missions here as we have.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Research is not the Klingon way.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: True, but since this is a hands-off planet, how are you going to prove they're doing otherwise?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When I left there thirteen years ago, those villagers had barely learned to forge iron. Spock was shot with a flintlock. How many centuries between those two developments?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: On Earth, about twelve, sir.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: On the other hand, a flintlock would be the first firearm the inhabitants would normally develop.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm aware of that, Mister Scott.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And, sir, the fact Earth took twelve centuries doesn't mean they had to.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: We've seen different development at rates on different planets.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: And were the Klingons behind it, why didn't they give them breechloaders?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Or machine guns?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Or old-style hand lasers?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I did not invite a debate. I'm sorry. I'm worried about Spock and concerned about what's happened to something I once knew down there. You have the conn, Scotty. I'll be in Sickbay.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: We've no replacements for the damaged organs, sir. If he's going to live, his Vulcan physiology will have to do it for him.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Agreed. Sterilite off.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll live or die now, Jim. I don't know which. Doctor M'Benga interned on a Vulcan ward. He couldn't be in better hands.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you and I are transporting down.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't leave Spock at this time.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You just indicated you could. There are Klingons here. If their mission is a legitimate research interest in the planet's organic potential, then you're the one man who can tell me.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And if that's not it?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I need help. Advice I can trust as much as Spock's.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I appreciate the compliment, Jim, but

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I'm as worried about Spock as you are, but if the Klingons are breaking the treaty it could be interstellar war. Kirk to Bridge.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge, Scott here.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy and I are transporting back down. Inform ship's stores that we'll need native costumes.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we may have to break out of orbit any minute to keep out of their sight. We'd be out of communicator range with you.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand. We'll arrange a rendezvous schedule. Kirk out.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4211.4. Keeping our presence here secret is an enormous tactical advantage, therefore I cannot risk contact with Starfleet Command. I must take action on my own judgment. I've elected to violate orders and make contact with planet inhabitants.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy and Kirk are dressed in the leathers of hill people.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perfect. Tyree's camp's a quarter of a mile away.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Want to think about it again, Jim? Starfleet's orders about this planet state no interference with

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No interference with normal social development. I'm not only aware of it, it was my survey thirteen years ago that recommended it.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I read it. Inhabitants superior in many ways to humans. Left alone, they undoubtedly someday will develop a remarkably advanced and peaceful culture.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Indeed. And I intend to see that they have that chance. You coming with me?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do I have a choice?

Title: A Private Little War
Context: So they make their way down the slope, and Kirk gets pounced on by a big white ape with a large horn on it's head and spines down it's back. It easily throws off McCoy as it concentrates on it's first victim, biting him, Throwing rocks makes it stand up, then McCoy vaporizes it with his phaser.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Context: shaking
Text: Contact ship. Took full poison. Fangs.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Enterprise, McCoy. Emergency. Come in. Enterprise, come in. McCoy! Emergency!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They left. Out of orbit.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: giving an injection
Text: Jim, there is no antitoxin for this poison. I can only keep you alive a few hours with this.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tyree. Some of his men. Cure.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Three men are standing in front of them.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you hill people? Do you know a hunter named Tyree? A mugato attacked him. He's James Kirk. He's a friend of Tyree's. Blast it! Do something! He's dying!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk passes out.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Tyree's camp]

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Yutan
Text: Take him to the cave. I bring Tyree.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Medical log, stardate 4211.8. Kirk is right about the people here. Despite their fear and our strangeness, they're compassionate and gentle. I've learned the hunter Tyree is now their leader. He is expected to return shortly with his wife, who they say knows how to cure this poison. My problem. The captain is in deep shock. I must keep him warm and alive until then.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy wraps plenty of furs around Kirk.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You and your Garden of Eden.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: A man and a dark-haired woman come out of hiding after two armed villagers pass.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
