Text: We must obtain the same firesticks, husband. You could be killing them instead. We could take their houses, their goods.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Nona, enough. In time the villagers will return to their ways of friendship.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: In time? They kill your people! I am a Kahn-ut-tu woman. In all this land, how many are there? Men seek us because through us they become great leaders.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I took you because you cast a spell upon me.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: And I have spells that help me keep you. Remember this leaf? The night we camped by the water?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: The night of madness.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Oh, Tyree, did you really hate that madness?

Title: A Private Little War
Context: She rubs the leaf down his arm, scratching him and leaving pieces attached to his skin.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: No, Nona. No! It brought up evil beasts from my soul.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Only one lovely beast, Tyree, my huge, angry man.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: They kiss passionately.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Yutan
Text: Forgive me.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: What is it?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Yutan
Text: There are strangers in our camp. One has taken the mugato bite. He dies.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Strangers?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Yutan
Text: It is said the dying one is a friend of Tyree, from long ago.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: That one. Bring him when his head clears.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk is shivering under his furs, so McCoy uses his phaser to heat a rock.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: The stranger, where is he?

Title: A Private Little War
Context: She is pointed to the cave.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy is heating another couple of rocks when she arrives. The sight of such a powerful weapon stops her from going in.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree arrives, running.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Nona, where's Kirk? The cave?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Tyree, you wish me to save him?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: You must. He is the one I told you of. The friend of my younger days.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: My remedies require I know what kind of man he is. All that is known of him.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I gave him my promise of silence. He was made my brother.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: And I am your wife, his sister. I promise silence also.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Nona

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Quickly! Or he dies.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: The indicators over Spock's bed are very low. Chapel is holding his hand, but puts it down quickly when the door opens.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Don't let these low panel readings bother you. I've seen this before in Vulcans. It's their way of concentrating all their strength, blood, and antibodies onto the injured organs. A form of self-induced hypnosis.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: You mean he's conscious?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Well, in a sense. He knows we're here and what we're saying, but he can't afford to take his mind from the tissue he's fighting to heal. I suppose he even knows you were holding his hand. (leaves)

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: A good nurse always treats her patients that way. It proves she's interested.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I am Tyree.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: And I'm Tyree's woman.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: It is Kirk. She will cure him.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Nona takes a strange object out of her bag. It is moving slightly.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's that?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: A mahko root.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A plant? It moves.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: For those who know where to find it, how to use it, how to pick it.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: She holds out her hand, and Tyree cuts it with his knife. Then she starts writhing for a few moments before putting the mahko root onto Kirk's wound and holding it there with her bleeding hand.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Take this of my soul. This of my soul. Thine own. Into thine. Deeply. Together. Your pain is mine. All mine. Your soul and mine, together! Return. It is past. Return. Return!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree beats a drum then she collapses, exhausted, across Kirk's bare chest. The root is shriveled. Kirk wakes up.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. I had the strangest dream.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you feel, Jim?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tired. Very tired. You did a fine job, Bones. I think I'll sleep.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy removes the root. The would has healed completely.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I want to thank you for saving his life. (Nona's hand is healed too) I would like to learn more about this.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Our blood has passed through the mahko root together. Our souls have been together. He is mine now.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: She must sleep also.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He is hers?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: When a man and woman are joined in this manner, he can refuse her no wish. But it is only legend.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Later, McCoy wakes to find Jim is out of bed. He finds him by Nona's bed.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. What are you doing here? (their voices wake Tyree) Tyree. My old friend.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Yes, James! James, it's good to see you.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What am I doing here? A mugato bite! I remember. I told him to take me to Tyree's camp. I knew you'd find a kahn-ut-tu to cure me. The kahn-ut-tu is the local witch people here. They've studied (Nona gets up and stands in front of him) They've studied the roots and the herbs.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: I am a kahn-ut-tu, Captain. I cured you.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: My wife, Nona.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course. I should've guessed. Congratulations. Tyree, we must talk now. The villagers, their new weapons. I want to hear all about that. We must make plans.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Good. It is past time to plan.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Much has happened since you left, James. Come, we'll speak of it.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: And of things to be done.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Come. (the men leave, but he stops Nona from following.) We will speak of it.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: The markers on the indicator board above Spock's head are going up and down like crazy.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: The readings are beginning to fluctuate.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Just as they should. This is Doctor M'Benga. There will be someone with you constantly now. When the time comes, I'll be called. (to Chapel) As soon as he shows any signs of consciousness, call me immediately.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: After you've called me, if he speaks, do whatever he says.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Do whatever he says?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Yes. That's clear enough, isn't it?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: The firesticks first appeared nearly a year ago. Since that time, many of my people have died.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say they make the firesticks themselves? How can you be sure?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I've looked into their village. I have seen it being done.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Have you seen any strangers among the villagers?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Strangers? No.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you take us to their village while it's still dark?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Yes, but the mugatos travel at night also. You killed one. Its mate will not be far.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Context: showing his phaser
Text: You've seen how these work.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: I've seen them also, and I know you have many ways to make your friend Tyree a man of great importance.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Many ways? What else does she know about us?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Tyree has told me much of you. Do not blame him. It was the price for saving your life.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're simply strangers from

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: From one of the lights in the sky, and you have ways as far above firesticks as the sky above our world.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: You will not speak of this to others.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: I will not if I am made to understand. Teach me. There's an old custom among my people. When a woman saves a man's life, he is grateful.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am grateful.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A splendid custom if not carried to extremes.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We once were as you are, Spears, arrows. There came a time when our weapons grew faster than our wisdom, and we almost destroyed ourselves. We learned from this to make a rule during all our travels, Never to cause the same to happen to other worlds. Just as a man must grow in his own way and in his own time.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Some men never grow.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps not as fast or in the way another thinks he should. But we're wise enough to know that we are wise enough not to interfere with the way of a man or another world.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: You must let the villagers destroy us? You will not help your friend and brother kill them instead?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: No! I said I will not kill!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: We must fight or die! Is dying better? You would let him die when you have weapons to make him powerful and safe? Then he has the wrong friends. And I have the wrong husband. (leaves)

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: You will help in ways she does not understand. I have faith in our friendship, James. Come, before we lose the darkness. (leaves)

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's bothering you, Jim? If we find the Klingons have helped the villagers, there's certainly something we can do.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what's bothering me. The something we may have to do.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Smooth walled buildings with tiled roofs, shrubs in terracotta jars. An armed guard patrols in front of one with a verandah.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: The guard. We must wait.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tyree, supposing you had to fight? What then?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, this man believes in the same thing we believe in. That killing is stupid and useless.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tyree?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Now. Come.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk sneaks around behind the guard and puts a sleeper hold on him.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The gun. Ammunition. Doctor.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy and Kirk run off while Tyree picks up the flintlock.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: A Klingon is sitting behind a simple wooden table.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: You are late, my friend Apella.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Apella
Text: A quarrel by my people. A division of some skins and a hill woman taken this morning. It's hard to divide one woman.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: Give her to the man who killed the most of her people. The others will see the profit in bravery. I'll make a Klingon of you yet.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: He hands over another flintlock.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Your next improvement. Notice what we've done to the striker. See how it holds the priming powder more securely? Fewer misfires. When I return, we will give you other improvements. A rifled barrel.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Apella
Text: What?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: A way to shoot further and straighter.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. Coal for forge, sulphur for gun powder.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's take a look inside.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: A big bellows runs straight into the base of the fire.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, here's your forge. People's exhibit number one. A chrome steel drill point.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: scanning
Text: This pig iron is almost carbon-free. That village furnace certainly didn't produce it. People's exhibit number two. Cold-rolled gun barrel rod fashioned to look homemade. You were right about the Klingons, Jim. KIRK: Make recorder and scanner tapes of everything.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right. It's a pity we can't include a live Klingon. That'd just about wrap it

Title: A Private Little War
Context: He is interrupted by voices from outside. They hide.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Apella
Text: Is it difficult to cut grooves into the barrels?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: It's quite simple. I'll show you.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Apella and Krell enter the forge.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Apella
Text: I thought my people would grow tired of killing. But you were right. They see that it is easier than trading and it has pleasures. I feel it myself. Like the hunt, but with richer rewards.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: You will be rich one day, Apella, beyond your dreams. The leader of a whole world. A governor in the Klingon Empire.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Then McCoy's scanner whistles. So Kirk jumps the Klingon while McCoy hits Apella with the steel rod he took.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: They open the door, but there are two more armed villagers outside. Nevertheless, they knock them out and get away.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Krell
Text: Guards! Intruders!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Tyree
Text: Move! Fast!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Shots are fired as the three run for their lives out of the village.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Spock starts gasping for air.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nurse.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hit me. The pain will help me to consciousness. Hit me.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Hit you? No! I can't

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Blast you, strike me! If I don't regain consciousness soon, it may be too late. Hit me. (she slaps his face) Harder!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: She does, with tears in her eyes.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Again. Continue. The pain will help me to consciousness.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Context: running in and dragging her away
Text: What are you doing, woman?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Leave me alone!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: Have you gone daft?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Mister Spock needs me! Let go!

Title: A Private Little War
Context: M'Benga rushes in and helps Spock to sit up before giving him some pretty vicious hits across the face. Scott stares, astonished. Finally Spock grabs M'Benga's arm.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: That will be quite enough. Thank you, doctor.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Please, release her.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's this all about?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: She was doing as I requested, Mister Scott. A Vulcan form of self-healing.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: As you saw, they must wait until the last possible moment then fight their way back to consciousness.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Here, let me help you, Mister Spock.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, nurse. I'm quite fully recovered.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, I see you are.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Just slightly away from the tents, Kirk is giving a rifle shooting lesson.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Men, this is the pan. This is the hammer. The hammer striking the pan causes a spark, ignites the powder, and fires the flintlock. Now aim it as I showed you. Hold your breath and squeeze the trigger gently. (Tyree shoots the clay pot target) Well done. Very, very, very good.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I want to talk to you.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not here, Bones. In the cave. Yutan, your turn.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do I have to say it? It's not bad enough there's one serpent in Eden teaching one side about gun powder. You want to make sure they all know about it!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly. Each side receives the same knowledge and the same type of firearm.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Have you gone out of your mind? Yes, maybe you have. Tyree's wife, she said there was something in that root. She said now you can refuse her nothing.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Superstition.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is it a coincidence this is exactly what she wants?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it? She wants superior weapons. That's the one thing neither side can have. Bones. Bones, the normal development of this planet was the status quo between the hill people and the villagers. The Klingons changed that with the flintlocks. If this planet is to develop the way it should, we must equalize both sides again.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, that means you're condemning this whole planet to a war that may never end. It could go on for year after year, massacre after massacre.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Doctor! All right. Say I'm wrong. Say I'm drugged. Say the woman drugged me. What is your sober, sensible solution to all this?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't have a solution. But furnishing them firearms is certainly not the answer.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, do you remember the twentieth century brush wars on the Asian continent? Two giant powers involved, much like the Klingons and ourselves. Neither side felt could pull out.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I remember. It went on bloody year after bloody year.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would you have suggested, that one side arm its friends with an overpowering weapon? Mankind would never have lived to travel space if they had. No. The only solution is what happened back then. Balance of power.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And if the Klingons give their side even more?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we arm our side with exactly that much more. A balance of power. The trickiest, most difficult, dirtiest game of them all, but the only one that preserves both sides.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And what about your friend Tyree? Will he understand this balance of power?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Probably not. But I'm going to have to try and make him understand. I never had a more difficult task.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Jim, here's another morsel of agony for you. Since Tyree won't fight, he will be one of the first to die.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, war isn't a good life, but it's life. His wife is the only way to reach him. If I tell her we're going to supply guns, maybe she'll convince him.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Position, Mister Scott?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Text: Entering distant orbit, sir. Approaching rendezvous time.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Klingons?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Chekov
Text: They haven't spotted us yet, sir. Looks like they're beaming someone aboard.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stand by to signal the captain.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk finds Nona near a stream which is running over a rock. She has been bathing. KIRK: Nona. Pardon me

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: You are here because I wished you here.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh? I thought it was my idea.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Yes. They always believe they come of free will. Tyree thought the same when I cast my first spell on him.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nona

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Can you smell this fragrance? Some find it pleasing.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: It is the same planet that she used on Tyree.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to talk to you.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Again. Some find it soothing. Yes.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I would like

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Happy. Yes. You feel good.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree overhears her, and he is carrying a gun.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I feel dizzy. Yes, you are lovely. You're beautiful.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree takes aim.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Kiss me.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Kirk gives in, but Tyree cannot bring himself to squeeze the trigger. He throws the gun down in disgust and runs. Nona and Kirk are interrupted by the shriek of a mugato. Kirk is so besotted that Nona has difficulty getting out of his embrace and trying to escape. Eventually Kirk thinks to draw his phaser and kill the attacking creature. She decides to hit him over the head to get the phaser for herself.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree returns.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where's Captain Kirk? Tyree, the firestick. Where is it?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: There! I left it there.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's a fine thing to leave lying around. Show us where it is.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Nona has just left when McCoy, Tyree and Yutan arrive. Yutan picks up the rifle.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I do not want it.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim? Jim. Who hit you?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nona.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Nona greets a band of villagers.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: I bring you victory for Apella!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: ) Man 1
Text: Tyree's woman.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Man 2
Text: She's a Kahn-ut-tu.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Man 1
Text: We won't trust this division to Apella.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Take me to him. He will have the strength to use this new weapon.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Villager number one grabs Nona, and she slaps him off.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: Touch me again, and this small box will kill you.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: They don't believe her, and all four men struggle with her

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy is about to give Kirk an injection to go with the headache pills.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no. I'm all right. My phaser. She took it.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Nona
Text: This weapon I bring you is far greater than your firesticks.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Still, all the men want is to have their wicked way with her, and she screams. Kirk, Tyree and McCoy come running over the brow.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: Nona!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Man 4
Text: Hill people!

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Man 1
Text: It's a trap. The woman's tricked us.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: He stabs her. Another man shoots McCoy in the arm. Yutan fires back, then there is a good old-fashioned hand-to-hand struggle. Tyree smashes one man's head repeatedly with a large rock, until Kirk stops him. He goes to his wife.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's dead.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: Tyree picks up a rifle.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Tyree
Text: I want more of these, Kirk. Many more! Yutan, two of those who killed my wife have escaped. Track them down. I will kill them.

Title: A Private Little War
Context: McCoy finds the phaser in the dirt nearby.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Here.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tomorrow in the palm of her hands.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you got what you wanted.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not what I wanted, Bones. What had to be. (McCoy hands him a communicator from his bag) Kirk here.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK [OC] Spock, Captain. I trust all has gone well.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, are you alive?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Spock
Text: An illogical question, Doctor, since obviously you are hearing my voice.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I don't know why I was worried. You can't kill a computer.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, ask Scotty how long it would take him to reproduce a hundred flintlocks.

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Scott
Context: losing his grin
Text: I didn't get that exactly, Captain. A hundred what?

Title: A Private Little War
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A hundred serpents. Serpents for the Garden of Eden. We're very tired, Mister Spock. Beam us up home.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3211.7. We are entering standard orbit about Gamma Two, an uninhabited planetoid with an automatic communications and astrogation station.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign Chekov, Lieutenant Uhura, and I will beam down and make a routine check of its facilities.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Standard orbit, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Mind the store, Mister Spock.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, let's go.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise, Scotty.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: But before he can touch the controls, the landing party vanish abruptly.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The three appear lying on the ground, on a decorated surface. There are iron railings around a vaguely triangular area, and three benches, one on each side.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain. what happened?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It must be a transporter malfunction.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That was a rough trip.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This isn't Gamma Two. Look at the colour of that sky. (it's green)

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: This is the craziest landing pad I've ever seen.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a trinary sun.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Bridge.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Chekov. they vanished. They got onto the transporter platform and they just vanished.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I presume you mean they vanished in a manner not consistent with the usual workings of the transporter, Mister Scott.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, of course I mean that. You think I'd call if they just beamed down?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Have you reversed controls?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've made all the proper checks. There was nothing. There was no flash of light, nothing. They were gone.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Power surge?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not down here. All the dials were right and the transporter was functioning perfectly.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recheck your equipment, Mister Scott. I'll scan for them on the planet's surface. Spock out.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: But Captain, if we're not on Gamma Two, then where are we?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what I'd like to know. Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise. Dead.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mine, too.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. Look.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: People are approaching them. One big guy in a fur, with teeth that hold his mouth open, another male with a knife, a female in pink carrying a lance-like weapon, and another in silver with green hair.) KIRK: Phasers on stun. Fire. (nothing happens) Hand-to-hand

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The men go one-on-one while Uhura has to deal with both women simultaneously. They are not fairly matched. Chekov cannot handle the giant and Uhura quickly gives up. Only Kirk acquits himself well against the normal male, until green-hair intervenes with her weapon.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3211.8. While beaming down from the Enterprise to inspect facilities on Gamma Two, the normal transporter sequence has been interrupted, and we find ourselves on a strange and hostile planet, surrounded by creatures belonging to races scattered all through the galaxy.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: A thin bald male in a long black cloak pops into the scene.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Excellent, Captain Kirk. Although we expected strength and competitive spirit, we are greatly pleased.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Either of you hurt?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't think so, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Nobody's hurt, Captain. Yet.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Admirable, Chekov. Admirable. You also, Uhura. Your spirit is as great as the captain's. I can see you all will prove invaluable here. I am Galt, Master Thrall of the planet Triskelion. I have been sent to welcome you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: All three are fastened securely to the wall, and have collars around their necks.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: There, Captain. Now you are prepared for your training.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you know our names?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: The Providers were expecting you, Captain. They arranged your transportation.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These Providers of yours, are they

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Correction, Captain. The Providers are not ours. We are theirs.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do they want from us?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: You are to be trained, of course. What other use is there for thralls?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thralls? You must be mistaken. We're officers of a United spaceship on Federation business.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: There has been no mistake. Your old titles mean nothing here, Captain. You are thralls now. You are to be taken to the training enclosure. (the restraints are released) Come. Places have been prepared for you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not going anywhere until we have some information. Who are you? What is this place? What do you think you're going to do with us?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: I am Galt, the Master Thrall. This place is the planet Triskelion. You are to be trained and spend the rest of your lives here.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, I've checked that transporter from one end to the other. Every circuit works perfectly. Whatever that power surge was, it had nothing to do with the transporter or any other system aboard this ship.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm beginning to believe that, Mister Scott. I've conducted two sweeps of the planet's surface. There is no sign of life.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then what the devil is happening? Does that mean their atoms are just floating around out there?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Doctor. Even that would show up on our sensors.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Where are they then?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: The only answers are negative. No magnetic storms, no ionic interference, no breakdown in your equipment.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A negative attitude is no good to us. We can't just leave them out there, wherever they are.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: We shall continue sensor scans, Doctor. At the moment, that is all we can do, except hope for a rational explanation.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hope? I always thought that was a human failing, Mister Spock.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: True, Doctor. Constant exposure does result in a certain degree of contamination.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: A curved corridor, with doors off on either side. The doors have iron bars in the upper half.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: These are your quarters. Open, thralls.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: As the doors slide open, Chekov and Kirk hit their minders and they all run. Galt's eyes glow, the collars glow and the Starfleet escapees collapse, choking.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: That was foolish, Captain. Escape is quite impossible, as demonstrated by your collars of obedience. Return to your quarters.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: They do, and they are left alone.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are not within the confines of this solar system.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's been nearly an hour. Can people live that long as disassembled atoms in a transporter beam?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have never heard of a study being done, but it would be a fascinating project.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Fascinating? Those people are friends of ours out there, if they're still alive.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The odds are not good.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. I would say approximately four hundred

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't quote odds and don't give me anymore dispassionate logic, Mister Spock. Just keep looking for them.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would welcome a suggestion, Doctor, even an emotional one, as to where to look.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: First time you've ever asked me for anything, and it has to be an occasion like this.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the Enterprise. They will be trying to find us, won't they?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They'll try, but where do they look? We're here, and we don't know where it is.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This system's star is a trinary. Limits it a bit, but we're a long way from the Enterprise, if we're in the same dimension.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The male goes to Uhura's cell with a tray.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Lars
Text: I am your drill thrall. I am called Lars.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want from her?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Lars
Text: That is not your concern. Your drill thralls will attend you presently. (he opens Uhura's door and goes in) There is little time.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What are you doing? Get out!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Lars
Text: I have been selected for you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The shadow play tells all we need to know. And the screams.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, are you all right? Uhura! Lieutenant! Lieutenant, are you all right? Lieutenant, answer me! Lieutenant! What's happening to Lieutenant Uhura? Lieutenant, are you all right?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Lars
Text: It is not allowed to refuse selection.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: He leaves. Uhura's clothes are intact.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Context: to Kirk): Step away from the door. (she enters with a tray
Text: Come. It is the nourishment interval.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3259.2. First Officer Spock in command. The Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov have been missing for nearly two hours. Computer probability projections are useless due to insufficient data.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Haines
Context: a woman in gold uniform at Spock's station
Text: Mister Spock, I'm getting a fluctuating energy reading on this hydrogen cloud. It's faint, sir, but it consistently reads an excess of predictable energy level.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. It seems to be an ionisation trail.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What would account for that, Spock?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly the question I have just fed to the computers, Doctor. And the answer is, nothing known to us would account for it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, the transporter has neither the power nor the range to account for that.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Plot a follow course, Ensign Haines.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Haines
Context: now in Chekov's seat
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're going to leave here without them and run off on some wild goose chase halfway across the galaxy just because you found a discrepancy in a hydrogen cloud?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I am chasing the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov, not some wild aquatic fowl. This is the only lead we've had.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Haines
Text: Course plotted and laid in, Mister Spock. Three ten mark two four one.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Initiate. Warp factor two.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The robust woman in pink brings him his tray. She smiles at him.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You, you have been selected for me?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Tamoon
Context: with a deep voice
Text: No. I am only your drill thrall. I have brought you nourishment. It is a nice name, Chee-koo.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Chekov.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Tamoon
Text: Chee-koof! It is a very nice name. I am called Tamoon.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Context: nervous of her intentions
Text: Oh, pleased, Pleased to know you, miss.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Tamoon
Text: You are a fine specimen. I like you better than the others. I will instruct you well, so my Provider will take you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That's very kind of you, miss, but

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Tamoon
Text: If my Provider is pleased, we may even be selected for each other.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't realise I was so hungry. Whatever you call this, it is very good.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is nourishment. We call it that.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nourishment. That's very practical. What do you call this collar?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is a sign of our Provider. By the colour of the lights it can be known who holds us. When you are vended, you will also have a colour.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vended? You mean bought, sold.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: When you are developed. The Provider who offers the most quatloos puts his colour on us.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our race has another name for it. Slavery. This collar of obedience, is Galt the only one who can operate it?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is only to warn and punish.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does he work it?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is not permitted to talk of that.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you provide all my nourishment?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Of course. I am your drill thrall. I will train you well.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm sure you will. I must say, I've never seen a top sergeant who looked like you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: What does that mean?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It means you're a very beautiful woman.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: What is beautiful?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean nobody's ever told you that before? well, er, beautiful is, Beautiful. (he holds up the tray so she can see her reflection) That's beautiful. Shahna, where were you born?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Born? I have been here always.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your parents. Where are they? Your mother and father.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: She who bore me was killed in a freestyle match.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Freestyle?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: You will learn all these things.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lars and Chekov's drill thrall. They weren't born here. Where do they come from?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is not permitted. (a gong sounds and a red light flashes) The exercise interval. This is your training harness. Put it on.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is ridiculous. There's nothing out there. Nothing at all.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: We certainly seem to be heading into an empty sector.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Projecting back along the path of ionisation, the nearest system is M two four alpha.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: That must be two dozen light years away.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eleven point six three zero.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you suggesting that they could have transported over a distance of? You're out of your Vulcan mind, Spock.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm suggesting nothing, Doctor. I am merely pursuing the only logical course available to us.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The three are learning how to fight with the long poles with the curved hook on one end and grapple on the other. Galt enters with another thrall, his hands tied behind him.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Hold. This thrall was slow in obeying a command. For his punishment, he will be practice target. As you charge, you will strike the practice target when you pass. You begin, Uhura.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: It is not allowed to refuse a training exercise.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't care whether it's allowed or not. I will not do it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: None of us will do it, Galt.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: It is part of your training. The Providers wish it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The devil with the Providers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Cossacks.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Galt gives them a reminder of what their collars do.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: We have been tolerant because you are newcomers, but I see you must be given a lesson. Lars. (Lars unties the thrall) Kloog. Kloog will administer correction. Uhura, take your place on the triad. (Lars starts to tie Uhura's hands behind her back.) Tie her.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No! I am responsible for the actions of my people. I demand to see the Providers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: It is not permitted. But, Captain, since you assume responsibility for your people, you will take the punishment. It is less painful than the collar. Turn around. {Lars ties Kirk's hands.) Captain, you will be practice target. It is a shame to lose you, Captain, but it is worth it as an example to the others.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Stardate, unknown. Our strange captivity continues. This planet is called Triskelion. We do not know its location. We do not know who controls it. Its dangers are abundantly clear.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Kloog (the big, silent one) has a whip and net, which Kirk is trying to dodge. His back is bloody and his shirt is torn, but he manages to land a good kick on Kloog.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Hold. Rest interval. Fifteen trisecs.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: The two combatants join their comrades on the benches.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's pretty fast with that whip.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: This will strengthen you. Drink it. Kloog's left eye is weak. Approach him from that side.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Resume places.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Kirk carries on dodging the whip, whilst loosening his bonds. Finally he manages to get his hands in front of him, jump on Kloog's back and try to strangle him. Kloog falls to the ground.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Hold.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: We hold, Provider One.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Provider One bids three hundred quatloos for the newcomers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Provider Two, three hundred and fifty quatloos.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: Provider Three, four hundred.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: One thousand quatloos.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: One thousand fifty quatloos.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Two thousand.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Context: after a pause
Text: Two thousand quatloos are bid. Is there a challenge? The newcomers have been vended to Provider One.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're free people. We belong to no one.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Such spirit. I wager fifteen quatloos that he is untrainable.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: Twenty quatloos that all three are untrainable.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Five thousand quatloos that the newcomers will have to be destroyed.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Accepted. Mark them, Galt.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Galt's eyes go bright, and the badges on the collars turn red.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: You now bear the mark of a fine herd. But I must warn you, any further disobedience now that you are full-fledged thralls will be punishable by death.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, it just doesn't make sense they could have come this far. If there's any chance at all it is to continue to search in the area they were lost.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: We searched the area.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's always possible to miss something.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Such as a failure in the transporter mechanism?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. There was no sign of failure.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: There was no sign of them in the area of Gamma Two.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If they weren't there it's ridiculous to think they could still be alive. Not after all this time.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: In that case, Doctor, we have nothing to lose by pursuing our present course.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Shahna has taken Kirk for a run.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Slow down. Slow down. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. We've covered over two miles. Can we take a breather? A rest?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Context: not at all out of breath
Text: Oh. Very well. You are tired.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh. well, it's good to get away from that development area, even for a while. Shahna, why do the Providers, why do they like to watch others being hurt, killed?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: That is the way.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Their voices sound mechanical. Are they computers?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Computers?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've seen them. Do they have bodies?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Not such as ours.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is this place?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: It is not used.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's very old. Does it have a name? Shahna, could it have been a city for the Providers?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I do not think it is well to ask such things.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They do have bodies, or did have.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: One does not talk of such things.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very pretty country. Very much like my home planet, Earth.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Planet?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Stands close to her back, hands on her shoulders, so he can whisper in her ear.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where I was born. Shahna, don't you ever look at the night sky? The lights up there?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I have looked at them.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, those are stars. And around them are planets. And there are people that live on them, Just like us.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: How can one live on a flicker of light?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From Earth, Triskelion's three suns are just a flicker of light. Actually, this is the darkest planet I've ever seen.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Dark? But all is lighted. Here, the chambers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The thralls have no freedom, Shahna. You don't think or do anything but what the Providers tell you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: What else would one do?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Love, for one thing.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: What is love?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Love is the most important thing on Earth. Especially to a man and a woman.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: We, too, have mates. When it is time to increase the herd, my Provider will select one for me.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On Earth, we select our own mate. Someone we care for. On Earth, men and women live together, help each other, make each other happy.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I do not think your words are allowed.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. All right. Tell me about the Providers. What do they look like? Where do they live?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I have never seen them, but they are said not to be like us. They stay in

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Her collar lights up, and Kirk holds her tight while she writhes in pain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop it. Stop it! I'm responsible! I made her talk! Stop it! You're killing her! She did nothing wrong! It was my fault. If you want to punish someone, punish me! Please.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Is that what you humans call compassion? It is interesting, but it has no value here. You present many interesting aspects, Captain, but you must learn obedience. Then you will be an excellent thrall.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Shahna's collar stops glowing.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right. It's all right. You can stop crying now, Shahna. It's all right.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: You risked bringing their anger on yourself. Why did you do it?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's the custom of my people to help one another when we're in trouble.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: He kisses her.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: And this. Is this also helping?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could call it that.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Please, help me once again. (another kiss) I did not know it could be like this between people. Is it always so in the place you come from?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Context: popping out of thin air
Text: Captain, you do indeed present many surprises. Because you have amused the Providers, there will be no punishment. Return to your quarters.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, can we manage anything faster than warp six?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's my opinion that we've gone too far as it is, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's right, Spock. We've lost Jim and the others on Gamma Two. Now you've dragged us a dozen light years on some wild hunch that

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I do not respond to hunches. No transporter malfunction was responsible for the disappearance. They were not within the Gamma system. A focused beam of extremely high-intensity light was directed into the Gamma system from the trinary system we are now approaching. No known natural phenomena could have caused that beam. Does that clarify the situation?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, it doesn't. It's still a fancy way of saying that you're playing a hunch. well, my hunch is that they're back on Gamma Two dead or alive and I still want another search.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor McCoy speaks for me, too, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see. (pause) Gentlemen, I am in command of this vessel, and we shall continue on our present course. (conspiratorial whisper) Unless it is your intention to declare a mutiny.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who said anything about a mutiny, you stubborn, pointed-eared. All right. If we don't find them here, do we still have another search on Gamma Two?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed. Mister Scott, could you manage warp seven?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: I would be more than content to do so, sir, and maybe a wee bit more.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ensign, warp seven.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Shahna brings a nourishment tray.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're disturbed about what happened today.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Yes. You have made me feel strangely. If it were allowed, I would ask that you have another drill thrall.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't like that, Shahna. I wouldn't like that at all.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: He kisses her, then punches her to knock her out.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Shahna. (takes the magnetic key and unlocks his door)

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Kirk opens Chekov's cell. Tamoon is bound and gagged.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Text: This is going to kill our romance.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: They let Uhura out.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about Lars?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Uhura
Text: He's gone to report me. I said I didn't like the food.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think Galt is the only one who controls these collars. If we can find the phaser that I threw at Lars, we can use the circuits to short out these collars.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Chekov
Context: pointing to an exit
Text: Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Galt appears, and punishment is administered.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Only a reminder. You Earth people are most unusual, most stimulating.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Haines
Text: Standard orbit.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors indicate only one concentration of life forms on the planet, on the lower hemisphere. Humanoid readings.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, at least that gives our landing force a starting point.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: There will be no landing force, Doctor. Assuming the captain and the others are still alive, it would be unwise to endanger them by beaming down a large contingent.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well we're not going to leave them there while we just sit and wait.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. No power source. It may be shielded.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And it may be just a wild goose chase like we've been telling you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall beam down, Doctor. If I am unable to communicate, a landing party may be necessary.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Mister Spock, if you're going into the lion's den, you'll need a medical officer.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Daniel, as I recall, had only his faith. But I welcome your company, Doctor. Mister Scott, you'll be in command.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: But the turbolift doors shut before Spock and McCoy can leave the bridge, and the lights start flashing.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: No, Mister Spock, you will not leave the ship.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: None of your control systems will operate.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What the devil's going on?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock? Spock!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Welcome to Triskelion, gentlemen.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By now it must be obvious to you that you have been expected.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: What the voice said was true, sir. Nothing is functioning.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Commendations, gentlemen. Your ingenuity in discovering the whereabouts of your companions is noteworthy.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What you're hearing, gentlemen, is a Provider.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: We are known to the thralls as Providers because we provide for all their needs. The term is easier for their limited mental abilities to comprehend.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Providing for all their needs means using thralls, people stolen from other parts of the galaxy

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To fight each other, and the Providers gamble on the winner.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But these Providers haven't the courage to show themselves.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Your species has great curiosity.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: We knew that. You are interesting in many ways.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you are afraid.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: You present no danger while you wear the collar

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: And you wear it as long as you live.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then show yourselves.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: There is no objection.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: It is vast, obviously constructed with ceiling lights and a power plant in the background. In the foreground is a transparent dome with three yellow brains in it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The power source. Shielded by solid rock.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Context: a brain pulsates red
Text: We are one thousand of your metres beneath the surface.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Primary mental evolution. Incredible.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Context: pulsing green
Text: That is not true, Captain. Once we had humanoid form, but we evolved beyond it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Context: yellow
Text: Through eons of devoting ourselves exclusively to intellectual pursuits, we became the physically simple, mentally superior creatures you see before you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A species that enslaves other beings is hardly superior, mentally or otherwise.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: The thralls are necessary to the games. We have found athletic competitions our only challenge, the only thing which furnishes us with purpose.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's an unproductive purpose, unworthy of your intellect.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: We use only inferior beings.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have found that all life forms in the galaxy are capable of superior development. Perhaps you're not as evolved as you believe.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: An interesting speculation, Captain. You and your people are most challenging.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Yes, most challenging. It was hoped that such new blood would stimulate our stock of thralls. How unfortunate that you must be destroyed.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our destruction will result only in your own. You may control the Enterprise, but you cannot match the force of the entire Federation.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Your ship will be destroyed by a magnetic storm. No communications with your base will be possible. Your fate will remain a mystery to your people.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you call yourselves superior! You're murderers without the spirit to really wager for the lives you take.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Wager? Explain yourself, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My people pride themselves on being the greatest, most successful gamblers in the universe. We compete for everything. Power, fame, women, everything we desire, and it is our nature to win. And for proof, I offer you our exploration of this galaxy.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: We are aware of your competitive abilities, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, then, I wager that with weapons of your own choice, right here and now, my people can overcome an equal number of thralls set against us.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: A hundred quatloos on the newcomers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Four hundred quatloos against the newcomers.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Two hundred quatloos against!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: Five hundred for the newcomers. Contest by multiple elimination.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wait! Wait! Hear me! We can't wager for trifles like quatloos. The stakes must be higher.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Name your stakes, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we win, the Enterprise and its crew leaves here in safety. Further more, all the thralls on the planet must be freed.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Anarchy. They would starve.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You will educate and train them to establish a normal self-governing culture.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: Thralls govern themselves? Ridiculous!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have done the same with cultures throughout the galaxy. Are you willing to admit that we can do something you can't?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: There is nothing we cannot do!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: And if you lose, Captain?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we lose? We will remain here, the entire crew of the Enterprise. The most stubborn, determined competitors in the universe. We'll become thralls, enter your games, obey your orders without rebellion. You'll be assured of generations of the most exciting wagering you've ever had.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Your stakes are indeed high, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not for true gamesters.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Three
Text: We will accept your stakes on one condition.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Name it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: As leader of your people, your spirit seems most indomitable. We suggest you alone, pitted against three contestants of our choosing.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Three against one? Those are pretty high odds.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Two
Text: Not for true gamesters, Captain.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your, your terms are unfair.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: On the contrary, they're extremely fair, since your alternative is death.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, in that case, I'll accept your terms.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Galt will prepare you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Lars has a net, Kloog has his whip, and an Andorian has the pole weapon, same as Kirk.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Because you wager your skill for all your people, they will be permitted to watch the outcome of the game on the ship's viewscreen.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, look!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: Captain, you will defend. Thralls must stay in the blue area. You will take the yellow. Touching an opposing colour deprives a contestant of one weapon. An opponent must be killed to be removed from the game. If only wounded, he is replaced by a fresh thrall. Is that clear, Captain?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's clear.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What in the name of heaven is this?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Heaven's got very little to do with this.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: So the fight begins, and everyone puts their feet outside their allotted colours from time to time. Kirk manages to trip up or push over each of his three opponents several times. Eventually he throws his pole into Kloog's belly then picks up a dagger to defend himself with. Lars traps his hand in the net, but Kirk ducks as the Andorian throws his pole. Now the two fight with just the daggers, until Kirk throws the Andorian. Galt sees that he is only injured, and orders in his replacement.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Galt
Text: Shahna.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: She enters the area with a pole.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: You lied. Everything you said.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: She trips him, but he grabs the pole and pulls her down to the point of his dagger. They both hesitate, break free, and she gets him at her mercy. Again there is hesitation, so Kirk uses his legs to grab her and this time puts the blade firmly to her throat.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: The thralls surrender!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: Kirk lets her go.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: You have won, Captain Kirk, unfortunately. However, the terms of the wager will be honoured. You are free. Remove your collars.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: They come off easily.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The thralls will be trained?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: One
Text: They will be trained. We have said it.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think you'll find it a much more exciting game than the one you've been playing. I'm sorry, Shahna. I didn't lie. I did what was necessary. Someday, I hope you'll understand.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I understand, a little. You will leave us now?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: To go back to the lights in the sky?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: I would like to go to those lights with you. Take me?

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Then teach me how, and I will follow you.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's so much you must learn here first. The Providers will teach you. Learn it, Shahna. all your people must learn before you can reach for the stars. Shahna. (he gives her a farewell kiss) Scotty!

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam us up.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Context: They disappear in a twinkle.

Title: The Gamesters Of Triskelion
Speaker: Shahna
Text: Goodbye, Jim Kirk. I will learn, and watch the lights in the sky, and remember.

Title: Obsession
Context: Kirk and Spock are standing by a large purple boulder.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our scanner survey was correct, Captain. There it is. Pure tritanium.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fantastic. 20 times as hard as diamond.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Twenty one point four times as hard, to be exact.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. (into communicator) Scotty, you can mark this vein as confirmed. Inform Starfleet I recommend that they dispatch a survey vessel immediately.

Title: Obsession
Context: Unseen by the landing party, a cloud of smoke is coming out of another rock and heading for them.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Acknowledged, Captain. They'll send one fast enough for this rich a find.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: We won't be able to break it, Captain. I'll phaser off a specimen.

Title: Obsession
Context: He does so, and the smoke retreats.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lesley.

Title: Obsession
Context: He is handed a pair of tongs to pick up the sample with.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you smell that? A sweet odour like honey. It was years ago, on another planet. A thing with a an odour like that.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're in the growing season in this hemisphere of this planet. There are doubtless many pollen aromas.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rizzo.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Yes, sir?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take your men. Make a swing around our perimeter. Scan for dikironium in the atmosphere. Set your phasers on disrupter-B. If you see any gaseous cloud, fire immediately. You're on Red Alert. Make a sweep.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready to beam back aboard, Captain?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative, Scotty. We're checking something out.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: The USS Yorktown is expecting to rendezvous with us in less than eight hours, Captain. That doesn't give us much time.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Acknowledged. Continue standing by. Kirk out.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, dikironium exists only in laboratory experiments.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's gone. I could have been wrong. The last time I caught an odour like that was eleven years ago.

Title: Obsession
Context: The three red-shirts have run into a clearing.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Seemed to read dikironium for a minute, and then I lost it. It's almost like something out there knows I'm scanning it. It kind of keeps changing itself into something different. That isn't possible. Nothing can do that.

Title: Obsession
Context: All together now - It's Behind You! The other two security men fall to the ground, choking in the cloud. Rizzo can't get a clear shot.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Captain?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: There's a strange cloud, sir.

Title: Obsession
Context: It reaches him and he starts choking too

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Cloud, cloud.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire into it immediately!

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Help me. Help!

Title: Obsession
Context: But by the time they get there, the cloud has gone.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Dead. And you'll find every red corpuscle gone from their body.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rizzo's alive, barely.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty, lock in on us. Medical emergency.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: You think you know what it was, Captain?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something that can't possibly exist, but it does.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Narrator
