Text: Captain's log, stardate 3619.2. With the mysterious death of two crewmen, all personnel on the planet have been evacuated back to the ship.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Autopsy report, Doctor.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's Ensign Rizzo?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Still unconscious, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Transfusions?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Continuing as rapidly as possible. His blood count is still sixty percent less than normal. (leaves)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to bridge.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here. Ready to leave orbit, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold your position.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Cutting in if I may, Captain. The USS Yorktown is expecting to rendezvous with us in less than seven hours.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you'll inform them that we might be a little late.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, the Yorktown's ship surgeon will want to know how late. Those vaccines he's transferring to us are highly perishable.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock again, Captain. Those medical supplies are badly needed on planet Theta Seven. They are expecting us to get them there on time.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, we are remaining in orbit until I find out more about those deaths, on my responsibility. I am perfectly aware that it might cost lives on Theta Seven. Kirk out. Autopsy report.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You saw their colour. There wasn't a red corpuscle left in their bodies.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Marks, cuts, incisions of any kind?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not a one. What happened is medically impossible.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I suggest you look at the record tapes of past similar occurrences. You'll find the USS Farragut lists casualties eleven years ago from exactly the same impossible causes.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you, Captain. I'll check those tapes immediately.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: First, can you bring Ensign Rizzo to consciousness for a moment?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, but it

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will it hurt him if you do so?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In his present condition, I don't think it would make much difference.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then do so.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Transfusion completed, sir. His pulse and respiration are still far below normal.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Give him one cc of cordazine, nurse.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rizzo. This is the captain. Can you hear me? Do you remember what happened to you?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Remember. I'm cold. I'm so cold.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were attacked by something. When it happened, did you notice an odour of any kind? Rizzo. Rizzo! Do you remember a sickly sweet odour? Did you smell it?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: Yes. Yes. A smell. A strange smell. It was like being smothered in honey.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you feel a presence, an intelligence?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Rizzo
Text: It was trying to draw strength from us. I felt it. It was, it was, it was there.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's beginning to sleep again. I can't risk another shot.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's already told me what I wanted to know.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wouldn't depend too much what he says in that half-conscious state. He could be dreaming, saying what he thought you wanted to hear.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You check those record tapes. I want your medical analysis as quickly as possible. (leaves)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: What's with the captain? I've never seen him like that before.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I intend to find out. I'll be in the medical record library.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, Captain. Subspace message from Starfleet. They're inquiring

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not now. Have the security duty officer report to me immediately.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Continuing scanning. Still no readings of life forms on the planet.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's assume that it's something so completely different that our sensors wouldn't identify it as a life form.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: You mentioned dikironium, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Suppose it was composed of that rare element. A strange, gaseous creature.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've scanned for that element, Captain. There's no trace of dikironium on the planet surface or in the atmosphere.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Suppose it camouflaged itself. Let's assume that it's intelligent, that it knows we're looking for it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: To hide from a sensor scan, it would have to be able to change its molecular structure, like gold changing itself to lead or wood changing itself to ivory.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've just suggested something that never occurred to me. It may provide some answers to a tape record which I think you'll find Doctor McCoy is looking at this very moment.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chekov, take over on scanner.

Title: Obsession
Context: As Spock steps into the turbolift, Garrovick steps out onto the bridge.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Ensign Garrovick reporting, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you the new security officer?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was your father

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir, but I don't expect any special treatment on that account.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll get none aboard this ship, Mister.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have a report on Ensign Rizzo. He's dead, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You knew Rizzo?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir. We were good friends, graduated the Academy together.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll get a crack at what killed him. Interested?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, I am, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want four men armed with phaser two set for disrupter effect. Join me in the transporter room in five minutes. You'll accompany me to the planet surface.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Reading is changing, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock was right. Notice the molecular shift?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Dikironium reading now, sir. Bearing ninety four mark seven, angle of elevation six degrees. Holding steady.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Over that rise. Take two men, circle around to the left. I'll take the other two and go the other way. That creature is dangerous. If you see it, fire full phasers.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Swensen, Bardoli come with me.

Title: Obsession
Context: Garrovick and his group go into a clearing, and the cloud emerges. Garrovick fires at it after a slight hesitation.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A phaser! Come on! (arriving at the scene) Garrovick, did you?

Title: Obsession
Context: But then he sees the other two security men, lying on the ground, skin pale as snow.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 3619.6. One of the men in critical condition, the other is dead. And I, I am now even more convinced that this is not only an intelligent creature, but the same which decimated the crew of the USS Farragut eleven years ago in another part of the galaxy. Both Spock and McCoy are doubtful of this, and I sense they also doubt my decision to stay and fight the thing. Why am I keeping the ship here?

Title: Obsession
Context: Kirk is already there when Spock, McCoy and Garrovick enter.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Garrovick, we've studied your report. Mister Spock, begin.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: What was the size of the thing you saw, Ensign?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I'd say it measured from ten to sixty cubic metres, sir. It varied in size, fluctuated as it moved.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Composition?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: It was like a, a gaseous cloud. Parts of it I could see through. Other parts were more dense.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ensign, did you sense any intelligence in this gaseous cloud?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Did I what, sir?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you get any subconscious impressions that this was a creature. A living, thinking thing, rather than just a strange cloud of chemical elements?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: No, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you didn't come to actual contact with it, did you?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: No, sir. I was furthest away from it. It seemed to come out of nowhere, hovered for a moment, then moved toward my men. It was fast, incredibly fast.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you say it hovered?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You did fire at it, didn't you?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir, I did.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What distance were you from the creature?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: About twenty yards, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You fired at a large, hovering target at that distance and missed?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes. I, er, well, I didn't fire while it was hovering, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean you froze?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: No, sir. I didn't exactly freeze.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What exactly were you doing?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Well, I was startled for a second. And then by the time I fired, the thing was already moving.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have any further information?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: No, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you gentlemen have any further questions?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I only hesitated for a moment, sir. I'm sorry.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign, you're relieved of all duties and confined to quarters until further notice.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir. (leaves)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You were a little hard on the boy, Jim.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He froze. One man was killed. Another may die.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, scientifically

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll both be filing reports. Make your comments and recommendations then.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, while we're waiting I've taken the liberty of cleaning the radioactive disposal vent on number two impulse engine, but we'll be ready to leave orbit in under half an hour.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not leaving orbit, Mister Scott. Not that quickly.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the Yorktown requesting information on how soon we expect to rendezvous with them.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: The medicine for Theta Seven colony is not only needed desperately and has limited

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm aware of the situation, Engineer, and I'm getting a little tired of my senior officers conspiring against me. Forgive me. Perhaps I shouldn't have used the word conspire.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Agreed, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scanner readings?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Nothing, sir. Continuing to scan.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you aware it can change its molecular structure?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you scanning for any unusual movement?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any type of gaseous cloud?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We've run a full scanner probe twice.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then run it twenty times if that's what it takes!

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I hope I'm not disturbing you, Doctor.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Interrupting another autopsy report is no disturbance, Mister Spock. It's a relief.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I need your advice.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then I need a drink.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not understand your reasoning.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You need advice from me? You must be kidding.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not joke, Doctor. Perhaps I should rephrase my statement. I require an opinion. There are many aspects of human irrationality I do not yet comprehend. obsession, for one. The persistent, single-minded fixation on one idea.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim and his creature?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. Have you studied the incident involving the USS Farragut?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. With all these deaths and injuries, I've only had a chance to scan the tapes. There are eight or ten hours of record tape there.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, I read somewhat faster. In brief, Doctor, nearly half the crew and the captain were annihilated. The captain's name was Garrovick.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The same as our Ensign.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: His father. Among the survivors was a young officer on his first deep-space assignment, James T. Kirk. And there is still more. I suggest you study this.

Title: Obsession
Context: Spock hands over a record tape.

Title: Obsession
Context: The Captain is lying on his bed, staring at the ceiling

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Personal log, stardate 3620.7. Have I the right to jeopardise my crew, my ship for a feeling I can't even put into words? No man achieves Starfleet command without relying on intuition, but have I made a rational decision? Am I letting the horrors of the past distort my judgment of the present?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mind if I come in?

Title: Obsession
Context: Kirk gets up and goes to his desk.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to bridge. Scanning report.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Continued scanning, sir. No unusual readings.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain search. Kirk out. It can't have just vanished.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sometimes they do, if we're lucky. Monsters come in many forms. You know the greatest monster of them all, Jim? Guilt.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get to the point.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, When a young officer is exposed to unknown dangers for the first time, he's under tremendous emotional stress. Now we all know that.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign Garrovick is a ship-command decision. You're straying out of your field, Doctor.

Title: Obsession
Context: He returns to his bed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Am I? I was speaking of Lieutenant James T. Kirk of the starship Farragut. Eleven years ago, you were the young officer at the phaser station when something attacked. According to the tapes, this young Lieutenant Kirk insisted upon blaming himself.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because I delayed in firing at it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You had a normal emotion. You were startled. You delayed firing for a grand total of perhaps two seconds.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I hadn't delayed, it would have been killed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The ship's exec didn't seem to think so. His log entry was quite clear on the subject. Lieutenant Kirk is a fine young officer who performed with uncommon bravery.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you understand? It killed two hundred crewmen.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain Garrovick was very important to you, wasn't he, Jim?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. He was my commanding officer from the day I left the Academy. One of the finest men I ever knew. I could have killed that thing if I'd fired soon enough the first time.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't know that, Jim. You don't know that any more than you know that Garrovick could have destroyed it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't help how I feel. There's an intelligence about it, Bones. A malevolence. It's evil. It must be destroyed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To be so obsessed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Obsessed?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That you could destroy yourself, your career, a young boy who reminds you of yourself eleven years ago.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't push our friendship past the point where I have to take official

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not, Jim. This is professional, Captain. I am preparing a medical log entry on my estimation of the physical and emotional condition of a starship captain. Which requires a witness of command grade.

Title: Obsession
Context: McCoy goes to the door and opens it to admit Spock.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do I take it, Doctor, Commander, that both of you or either of you consider me unfit or incapacitated?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correctly phrased, Captain. As recommended in the manual. Our reply, also as recommended, is, sir, we have noted in your recent behaviour certain items, which, on the surface, seem unusual. We respectfully ask permission to inquire further

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Blast it! Forget the manual! Ask your questions.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, the USS Yorktown is waiting now at the rendezvous point. It carries perishable drugs

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Skip the recitation, Spock. I know the facts.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They need those vaccines on Theta Seven, Captain. Now why are we delaying here?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because I'm convinced that this is the same creature that attacked the Farragut eleven years ago.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Creature, Captain?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My report is on the tapes. As it attacked us eleven years ago, as I lost consciousness, I could feel the intelligence of the thing. I could sense it thinking, planning.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: You say you could sense its intelligence, Captain? How did it communicate with you?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You state that it happened just as you lost consciousness. A semiconscious mind is a very tricky thing. A man never knows how much is real or how much is imagination.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever it is, Doctor, whatever it is, wouldn't you call it deadly?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, there's no doubt about that.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what if it is the same creature that attacked eleven years ago from a planet over a thousand light years from here?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, Captain, if it is an intelligent creature, if it is the same one, if it therefore is capable of space travel, it could pose a great threat to inhabited planets.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A lot of ifs, I agree, but in my command judgment, they out weigh other factors. Intuition, however illogical, Mister Spock, is recognized as a command prerogative.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, we're not trying to gang up on you.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you haven't, Doctor. You've expressed the proper concern, you've asked the proper questions. You've both done your duty. Now may I ask what medical log entry you intend to make?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: At this point, my medical log remains open.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In that case, gentlemen

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge to Captain. Come in.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I have a reading on the whatever it is, Captain. Leaving the planet surface, heading into space.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All decks, Red Alert. Red alert. Prepare to leave orbit.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we can't maintain warp eight speed much longer. Pressures are approaching the critical point.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Range, Mister Chekov?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Point zero four light years ahead. Our phasers won't reach it, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are barely closing in on it, Captain. We could be pursuing it for days.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If necessary. Do what you can to increase our speed, Scott.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Extreme magnification, Mister Chekov.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Magnification twelve. There, sir. Got it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, how do you read that?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Conflicting data, Captain. It seems to be in a borderline state between matter and energy. Elements of both. It could possibly use gravitational fields for propulsion.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you don't find that sophisticated, Mister Spock?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Extremely efficient, Captain. Whether that indicates intelligence is another matter.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Open hatch on impulse engine number two. Mister Scott was doing an AID clean-up on it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We won't be using the impulse engines. Turn the alarm off.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we can't do it. If we keep this speed, we'll blow up any minute now.

Title: Obsession
Context: Scott looks frantic, Spock almost concerned, everyone else is worried. Kirk looks as if he might burst into tears of frustration.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to warp six.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Hi. Everyone else is at alert station, so I brought you some dinner.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I'm not hungry.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor's orders.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: What's happening?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Are we still chasing that thing half way across the galaxy? Yes. Has the captain lost his sense of balance? Maybe. Is the entire crew about ready to explode? Positively. You're lucky you're out of it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: What do you mean, out of it? I caused it. You know that, too, don't you? If I'd fired my phaser quickly enough on Argus Ten, this wouldn't have happened.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: You know, self-pity's a terrible first course. Why don't you try the soup instead?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I told you, Christine, I'm not hungry.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor McCoy thought you might say something like that. This is his officially logged prescription for you. It has one word on it. Eat. Now if you don't follow his orders, Doctor McCoy could and possibly would have you hauled down to Sickbay and fed intravenously.

Title: Obsession
Context: She leaves, carrying the record tape.

Title: Obsession
Context: Chapel puts the record tape in McCoy's in-tray.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's that?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Hmm? (picks up the tape again) This?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: reading
Text: A survey on Cygnian Respiratory Diseases? I thought you took Garrovick some food. What were you doing with this?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Applying psychology.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The creature is slowing. It's down to warp two.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reduce speed. Approach slowly.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't understand. It was outrunning us.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe it's decided to fight. Phasers ready?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Phasers show ready, sir.

Title: Obsession
Context: Garrovick takes the lid off his meal and throws it across the room. It knocks the switch on his ventilation filter to 'bypass'.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Battle stations. All decks to battle stations. This is not a drill. All decks to battle stations.

Title: Obsession
Context: Garrovick dashes out into the corridor.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's coming to a full halt, sir. Magnification one.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Move in closely, Mister Chekov. Sublight one quarter speed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Captain, request permission to return to my post.

Title: Obsession
Context: He is totally ignored.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Within phaser range, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock all phasers on target.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Locked on target.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire phasers, Mister Chekov.

Title: Obsession
Context: The beams of deadly light go straight through the cloud.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Phasers ineffectual, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Photon torpedoes. Minimum spread pattern.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Minimum pattern ready, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire photon torpedoes.

Title: Obsession
Context: The ship is rocked by the blasts at such close quarters.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There. It's coming, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflectors up.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Deflectors up, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: The deflectors will not stop it, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's impossible.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I should have surmised this. For the creature to be able to use gravity as a propulsive force, it would have to have this capacity.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Five seconds to contact. All hatches and vents secure. All lights on the board show green. Sir! The number two impulse vent! we have a red light!

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Context: over Chekov's speech
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, all decks (rest of speech lost under Chekov's increasing volume)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, something's entered through the number two impulse vent.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative pressure in all ship's vents. Alert all decks.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: When it entered impulse engine number two's vent, it attacked two crewmen. It then got into the ventilating system, and now we have air for only two hours.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: One man has a chance for survival. The other is dead. You can add that little price tag to your monster hunt.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's enough, Bones.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's not enough! You didn't care as long as you could hang your trophy on the wall. Well, it's not on it, Captain, it's in it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I suggest that we no longer belabour the question of whether or not we should have gone after the creature. The matter has now been rendered academic. The creature is now after us.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Creature, Mister Spock?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: It turned and attacked, Doctor. Its method was well-considered and intelligent.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well, it could have been many light years away from us. Instead it chose to turn and attack here. Why?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible to tell, Captain, until I can make a closer survey of the creature.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, try flushing the radioactive waste into the ventilation system. See what effect that has.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. (leaves)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Jim. I was wrong. (leaves)

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the creature's ability to throw itself out of time sync makes it possible for it to be elsewhere in the instant the phaser hits. There is therefore no basis for your self-recrimination. If you had fired on time and on target eleven years ago, it would have made no more difference than it did an hour ago. Captain Garrovick would still be dead. The fault was not yours, Jim. In fact, there was no fault.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you want to play analyst, Spock, use someone else, not me. My concern is with the ship and the crew.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Come in.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ensign, am I correct in my assumption that you've been disturbed by what you consider to be a failure on your part? (a nod) I would like you to consider that the hesitation for which you are blaming yourself is an hereditary trait of your species. When suddenly faced by the unknown or imminent danger, the human will experience a split second of indecision. He hesitates. Do I have your attention, Ensign?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I know you would prefer to wallow in emotion rather than

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Mister Spock, it's very kind of you to come here

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Kindness, Mr. Garrovick, is another human emotion, and I believe we have enough of that. I simply would like you to accept the fact that your reaction has its basis in physio. (suddenly stops and sniffs) Do you smell something?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Sir, it's coming through the vent.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Get out of here! I'll attempt to seal it off.

Title: Obsession
Context: Spock literally throws Garrovick out into the corridor. He then goes to the vent, but the damaged switch breaks off in his hand.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Context: into intercom
Text: Sir, the creature's in my cabin. It's got Mister Spock.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way, Garrovick. Security to three four one. Medical alert. Scotty, reverse cabin pressure three four one.

Title: Obsession
Context: He does so, and the gas is sucked back into the vent.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, hold it. Tricorder.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, Spock may be dying.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we let that thing into the ship, he'll have a lot of company.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I must have jammed the vent control when I hit it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: See if the reverse pressure has pulled it back into the ventilation system.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: He saved my life, Captain. I should be lying dead in there, not him.

Title: Obsession
Context: The cabin door opens.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, neither of us is dead, Ensign. The reverse pressure worked. The vent is closed.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't misunderstand my next question. Mister Spock, why aren't you dead?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's that green blood of his.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: My haemoglobin is based on copper, not iron.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll bet he left a bad taste in the creature's mouth, too.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Colloquially expressed, but essentially correct.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. The scent is different. I think I understand something now.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you believe you're in communication with the creature?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know what it is, Mister Spock, but you remember I said the thing was alive. It may not be communication as we understand it, but I did know it was alive and intelligent, and I think I know something else now.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering to Captain Kirk. Engineering to Captain Kirk.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott, Captain. The creature's moving back toward the number two impulse vent. The radioactive flushing may be affecting it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open the vent. On my way to the bridge. Kirk out. Ensign Garrovick.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were on the bridge when we were attacked.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, I'm sorry, sir. I know I was confined to quarters, but when the alert sounded

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very commendable, Ensign. What was your impression of the battle?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I don't understand, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm asking for your military appraisal of the techniques used against the creature.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Ineffective, Captain. I realise, Captain, you did everything you could do. I know that. It's just that nothing works against a monster that can do the things that thing does.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Ensign, what is your appraisal of your conduct on the planet?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I delayed firing.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you hadn't delayed firing? No difference, Ensign. No weapon known would have made any difference. Then or eleven years ago. Report for duty, Ensign.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, Captain. Thank you, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Chekov.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Results positive, Captain. The creature has left the ship at high warp speed and is already nearly out of scanner range. The way that thing can move, Captain, I wouldn't believe it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Direction, Mister Spock.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was bearing one two seven mark nine, but I've lost it now.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Context: into intercom
Text: Mister Scott, I'll need all the speed you can deliver. Keep at it until we begin to shake apart. Kirk out. I believe I know where it's going.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has changed course before to mislead us, Captain. Logic would dictate that

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm playing intuition. Mister Chekov, compute a course for Tychos star system.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Computed and on the board.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead full.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Ahead full, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, contact Starfleet and the USS Yorktown.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Frequency open and clear, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Inform them that we are pursuing the creature to planet four of that system. That's the location of its attack on the USS Farragut eleven years ago.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not understand, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In Garrovick's quarters, I said the scent of the creature was somehow different. Something in my mind said home.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: And you know where home is, Captain?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think I do. I don't know how I know, but home is where it fought a starship once before. Ito Uhura) Inform them of our tactical situation and inform them I'm committing this vessel to the destruction of the creature. We will rendezvous. Round-trip time, Mister Chekov.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: One point seven days, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will rendezvous with the USS Yorktown in forty eight hours.

Title: Obsession
Context: later

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I assume that you now believe we should pursue the creature and destroy it.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't agree with Mister Spock?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's the time factor that bothers me. Those drugs are perishable.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, evidence indicates the creature is here to spawn. If so, it will reproduce by fission, not just into two parts, but thousands.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Antimatter seems our only possibility.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: An ounce should be sufficient. We can drain it from the ship's engines and transport it to the planet surface in a magnetic vacuum field.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Contact medical stores. I want as much haemoplasm as they can spare in the transporter room in fifteen minutes.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I presume you intend to use that haemoplasm to attract the creature?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must get it to the antimatter. It seems attracted to red blood cells. What better bait could we have?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is still one problem, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The blast, yes.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. A matter-antimatter blast will rip away half the planet's atmosphere. If our vessel is in orbit and encounters those shock waves

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A chance we'll have to take, Mister Spock.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Also, we cannot be certain the transporter will operate under those conditions. If a man is beaming up when that hits, we may lose him.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's exactly why I've decided to set the trap myself.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there is so little hemoglobin in my green blood, the creature could not harm me extensively. It therefore seems logical for me to be the one

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative, Mister Spock. In case this plan fails, I'll need you aboard the ship. In that event, we'll need another plan.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will require two men to transport the antimatter unit.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I'd like permission to go with you, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I had you in mind, Mister Garrovick.

Title: Obsession
Context: Kirk, Garrovick and a blue ball under a floating carrying device beam down.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Proceed immediately to maximum orbit.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Just think, Captain, less than one ounce of antimatter here is more powerful than ten thousand cobalt bombs.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's hope it's as powerful as man will ever get. Detonator.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Obsession
Context: He primes and sets it on the anti-grav unit.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain. Holding at thirty thousand kilometres.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Antimatter container positioned and armed. I'll call you back when it's baited. Kirk out.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Captain, look!

Title: Obsession
Context: The cloud is already over the bottle of blood. Within moments it is empty.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: The haemoplasm. The bait's already taken.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll need something else for bait.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Sir, that thing only feeds on blood.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Garrovick, get back to the ship. Tell them to prepare to detonate.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Captain, you're not going to be the bait.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said, get back to the ship. Ensign, I gave you an order.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Obsession
Context: A quick karate chop knocks Kirk down but not out. He lands a couple of punches on Garrovick.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Consider yourself on report. This is no time for heroics. I have no intention of sacrificing myself, at least not yet. (into communicator) Spock? Spock?

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scan us and lock on to us. It's going to be close. Very, very close. Stand by. Stand by, Enterprise.

Title: Obsession
Context: The cloud approaches.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: I can smell it, Captain. It's sickening. Honey sweet.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Enterprise. (The cloud reaches them) Now! Energise and detonate!

Title: Obsession
Context: BANG!

Title: Obsession
Context: Spock and Scott are at the controls with McCoy watching.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reset. Energise.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Chekov
Text: All decks, stand by. Shock waves.

Title: Obsession
Context: The ship is shaken, and still nothing appears on the transporter pad.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do something.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are, Doctor. Cross-circuiting to A.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Got them. A piece of them, anyway.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Cross-circuiting to B.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Crazy way to travel, spreading a man's molecules all over the universe.

Title: Obsession
Context: Finally the swirly bits solidify into two men.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, thank heaven.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, there was no deity involved. It was my cross-circuiting to B that recovered them.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well then, thank pitchforks and pointed ears. As long as it worked, Jim.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a fair statement, Bones. Now that the creature is dead, let's save some lives. We'll deliver your medicine. Bridge, this is Kirk.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Uhura here.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have Mister Chekov lay in a course for a rendezvous with the Yorktown, maximum warp.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Ensign, meet me in my quarters when you've cleaned up. I'd like to talk to you about your father. Several tall stories I think you'd like to hear.

Title: Obsession
Speaker: Garrovick
Text: Thank you, sir. I would.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4307.1. Approaching Starbase Six for a much needed period of rest and recreation.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The crew has performed excellently, but is exhausted. And I, too, am looking forward to a nice period of rest on some lovely planet.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. There was a message from Starbase Six. Heavy interference. All I get is Intrepid and what sounded like a sector co-ordinate.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. No indications of magnetic storms in this sector.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try another channel, Lieutenant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Intrepid is manned by Vulcans, isn't it?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's right, Bones.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise calling Starbase Six. Enterprise calling Starbase Six. Come in. Come in.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Spock suddenly jerks upright, his face a picture of horror.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is it, Spock? Are you in pain?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Intrepid. It just died. And the four hundred Vulcans aboard, all dead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Spock, let's go down to Sickbay.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I know what I know.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get to the Sickbay.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, no. That's an order.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: McCoy leads him away.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have Starbase Six readable now. Switching to audio, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Go ahead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Starbase
Text: You will divert immediately to sector three nine J.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sir, the Enterprise just completed an exhausting mission. We're on our way in for R and R. There must be another starship in that sector.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Starbase
Text: Negative. This is a rescue priority. We've lost all contact with solar system Gamma Seven-A, which the Intrepid was investigating. And we've just lost contact with the Intrepid. Report progress.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Order acknowledged. Kirk out. Mister Kyle, you heard the order. Set course for Gamma Seven-A, warp five.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain I have just completed a full long-range scan of Gamma Seven-A system. It is dead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dead? It's a fourth magnitude sun. There are billions of inhabitants there.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It is dead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Spock is on a biobed, being scanned.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I assure you, Doctor, I am quite all right. The pain was momentary. It passed quickly.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All of my instruments seem to agree with you if I can trust these crazy Vulcan readings. Spock, how can you be so sure the lntrepid was destroyed?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Spock gets off the bed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I sensed it die.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But I thought you had to be in physical contact with a subject before

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, even I, a half-Vulcan, could hear the death scream of four hundred Vulcan minds crying out over the distance between us.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not even a Vulcan could feel a starship die.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Call it a deep understanding of the way things happen to Vulcans, but I know not a person, not even the computers on board the Intrepid, knew what was killing them or would have understood it had they known.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But four hundred Vulcans?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've noticed that about your people, Doctor. You find it easier to understand the death of one than the death of a million. You speak about the objective hardness of the Vulcan heart, yet how little room there seems to be in yours.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Suffer the death of thy neighbour, eh, Spock? You wouldn't wish that on us, would you?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It might have rendered your history a bit less bloody.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you may have been right. We've lost contact with the Intrepid and we're out of communication with an entire solar system. Any update from Starfleet?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I cannot filter out the distortion, sir. It's getting worse.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Captain, deflector shields just snapped on.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Slow to warp three.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Warp three, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indications of energy turbulence ahead. Unable to analyse. I've never encountered readings like this before.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scanners on. Magnification three on the screen.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Magnification factor three, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Exactly what are we looking for, Mister Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would assume that.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: In the middle of the viewscreen is a black blob.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is that?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Perhaps an interstellar dust cloud.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not very likely, Ensign.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. You'd be able to see stars through a dust cloud. Looks like a hole in space. Readings, Mister Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Still not able to analyse, Captain. Sensors are feeding data to the computers now. Whatever this dark zone is, it lies directly in line with the course I calculate for the Intrepid and the Gamma Seven-A system.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold present course. Slow to warp one.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Warp factor one, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, prepare to launch a telemetry probe into that zone. Direct computer feed to Mister Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Probe ready. Switching data feed to library computer.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch probe.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Probe launched, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: A high pitched sound comes over the speakers.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was that?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The telemetry probe, sir. There's no signal from it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speculation, Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have none, Captain. Insufficient data.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Chekov is still groaning and Uhura looses her balance.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm just dizzy. I'll be all right. I'm fine, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to Captain Kirk. McCoy here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm getting reports from every deck. Half the people on this ship just fainted.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura almost did. She says she's all right. Do you want to see her?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not unless she's feeling ill. I've got an emergency here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's wrong?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Crew are queued out of the door, getting shots from Chapel.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's nothing organic. They all seem to be nervous, weak, and irritable. They say it happened suddenly, like a balloon popping.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you handle it, Bones?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm giving them stimulants to keep them on their feet.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah, we can handle it, Jim.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Kirk out. Hold our position, Mister Kyle.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, give me an update on the dark area ahead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: No analysis due to insufficient information.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No speculation, no information, nothing. I've asked you three times for information on that, and you've been unable to supply it. Insufficient data is not sufficient, Mister Spock. You're the science officer. You're supposed to have sufficient data all the time.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am well aware of that, Captain, but the computers contain nothing on this phenomenon. It is beyond our experience, and the new information is not yet significant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know about you but I'm tired. If you can't tell me what it is, let's use reverse logic. Perhaps it'll help if you tell me what it isn't.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not liquid, gaseous, or solid, despite the fact we cannot see through it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So far that's not much help.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not a galactic nebula such as the Coal Sack, and since our deflectors were activated by it, it would seem to be some form of energy, but nothing our sensors can identify.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it possible that this is what killed that solar system and the Intrepid?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very possible.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Notify the Starfleet that we're going to attempt to probe the area of darkness to gain further information.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Kirk pauses, exhausted on his way back to his chair.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm all right. Distance from zone of darkness, Mister Kyle?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: One hundred thousand kilometres, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead slow. Impulse power only.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transmission to Starfleet complete, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. Time, Mister Chekov?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Penetration of the zone in one minute, seven seconds, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Red Alert. Deflectors full power. Phaser banks ready.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Phasers standing by. Deflectors at full power, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: That eardrum splitting sound comes again.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's not coming from communications, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock!

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Analysing now, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The sound goes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the stars are gone!

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The viewscreen is completely blank.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Malfunction, Mister Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. All systems functioning properly.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then kindly tell me what happened to the stars.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to McCoy.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Things any better down there?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Worse. They're backed up into the corridor.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you got anything that will help up here? I don't want anybody folding on the bridge at a critical moment.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: On my way. McCoy out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Engineering. Scotty, there was a power loss. How come?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: We lost five percent of our energy reserve, sir. Our deflector shields are weakened.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you compensate for the loss?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, if we don't lose any more. Don't ask me how it happened.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am asking how, mister. I want answers. Kirk out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: McCoy enters with a nurse, and starts injecting the crew.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A stimulant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, how bad is it?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Two thirds of the personnel are affected.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? How? Do you have any answers?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. You know you'll get everything I can tell you. But when there is nothing, what should I say?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The man at the engineering station collapses.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This ship is in trouble. We'd better start solving problems faster than we pick up new ones. We seem to be in the middle of a creeping paralysis. Mister Spock, analysis of that last burst of noise before we started losing power.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: That sound was turbulence caused by the penetration of a boundary layer, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What boundary layer?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Boundary layer between what and what?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Between where we were and where we are.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you trying to be funny, Mister Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would never occur to me, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have any ideas, Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: We still have no specifics, but we seem to have entered a zone of energy which is incompatible with our living and mechanical processes. As we draw closer to the source, it grows stronger and we grow weaker.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Recommendations.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I have one. I recommend survival. Let's get out of here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. We're on a difficult mission, but it's not the first time. Our orders do not say stay alive or retreat.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our mission is to investigate.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're sick, and we're getting sicker.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have no guarantees, but we have a good ship and the best crew in Starfleet. So do your jobs. Carry on. Kirk out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. Go ahead, Bones.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, according to the life indicators, the energy levels

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, say it, Bones.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: According to the life monitors, we're dying.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're all dying.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4308.8. It is now ten minutes since we entered the zone of darkness. We have stopped engines while we seek a defence against the energy drain which seems to pervade the zone.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Kirk enters and is promptly thrown sideways by a massive jolt to the ship.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you all right?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Yes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was that?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm sorry, sir. I'm not sure. I was trying to recalibrate, and we went into reverse.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse? But that was a forward lurch. How could that happen in reverse thrust?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir. All I know is that the power levels are down twelve percent and steadily decreasing. I've never experienced anything like it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, we are accelerating. We are being pulled toward the centre of the zone of darkness.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By what, Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. I suggest you order Mister Scott to give us reverse power.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He just gave us reverse power. We lurched forward.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: In that case, Captain, I would suggest we apply forward thrust.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor. Life function indicators. They've started a sharp drop again.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stimulants. I don't know how long we can keep this up.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you think, Scotty? Forward thrust?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir. It goes against the rules of logic.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, doesn't it? Well, if it doesn't work, I'll never let Spock live it down. Notch it into forward.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: But

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's doing it, sir. We're slowing down. But we're not stopping. We're still being dragged forward.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have one of your engineers monitor the instruments. Keep applying thrust against the pull.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, they seem to be stabilising.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But at a dangerously low level. Well, we're still alive. I suppose that's something.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All I can contribute is the further we travel into this zone of darkness, the weaker our life functions become, and I have no idea why. I'm all right. It's those stimulants. They catch up with you.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: As to the power levels are concerned, everything is acting backwards, but the drain is continuing. On the static test, I could only get sixty percent power. We're still being dragged forward.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's logical to assume that something within this zone absorbs all forms of energy whether mechanically or biologically produced. Whatever it is, it would seem to be the same thing which drew all the energy out of an entire solar system and the Intrepid.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The same thing, not the zone itself?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say not, Captain. The analysis of the zone indicates it is a negative energy field, however illogical that may sound, but it is not the source of the power drain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe it's a shield of some kind. Some form of protection for something else.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: But what?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll find out what it is, but we'd better get out of here ourselves. Scotty, channel all the impulse and warp power into one massive thrust forward. That might snap us out of the zone.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain, but I'll reserve some for the shields in case we don't get out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I submit, Mister Scott, if we do not get out, the shields would be extraneous. It would only prolong our wait for death by a short period of time.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Use whatever power is necessary to get us out of here, Scotty. Report to your stations, continue your research. Dismissed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The department heads leave Kirk and Spock alone.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Intrepid would have done all these things too, and yet they were destroyed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, they may not have done all of these things. You just pointed out how illogical this situation is.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: True. It is also true they never knew what was killing them. Their logic would not have permitted them to believe they were being killed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan has not been conquered within its collective memory. The memory goes back so far that no Vulcan can conceive of a conqueror. I knew the ship was lost because I sensed it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it you sensed?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: The touch of death.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what do you think they felt?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Astonishment.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Scott is working on the upper level

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: That ought to do it. Engineering to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it, Scotty?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready to try it when you are, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we have the power to pull it off, Scotty?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I hope so, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by. All hands, this is the captain. We are slowly being pulled deeper into the zone of darkness by an unknown force. We're going to apply

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All available power

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Into one giant forward thrust

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In the hope that it will yank us out of the zone. Prepare yourselves. All right, Scotty. Let's get on with it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Everybody braces themselves against the g-forces that are created by the acceleration. What happened to the inertial dampers? Then there's a sudden jolt and people get thrown around. Chapel is flung into McCoy's arms for example.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's no good, sir. The best we can do is to maintain thrust against the pull and hold our position.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are we still losing power?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long will the power hold out?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: At this rate, plus the drain on all systems, two hours.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain thrust, Scotty. While we're maintaining our distance, Mister Spock, have you ascertained yet what we're maintaining our distance from?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot say what it is, Captain, but I would say it has found us.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The viewscreen is no longer black. It contains a multicoloured image rather like an abalone.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to launch a probe, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Probe ready for launch, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Getting very confused readings, Captain, but this is definitely the source of the energy drain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch probe.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Probe launched, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Probe will impact in seven point three seconds.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The ship shudders.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are we still in contact with the probe?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir. Data being relayed to Mister Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings coming in now, Captain. Length, approximately eleven thousand miles. Width varying from two thousand to three thousand miles. Outer layer studded with space debris and waste. Interior consists of protoplasm, varying from a firmer gelatinous layer to a semi-fluid central mass. Condition, living.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Magnification four.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Magnification four, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is what is drawing us toward it, Captain. The same way it drew the Intrepid to her death.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: There is an image of a single-celled organism on a screen.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That is an amoeba.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I remember my basic biology, Doctor. You mean to tell me that that thing is a giant single-celled animal?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, for lack of a better term. It's a very simple form of life. In fact it's a much simpler form of life than what you're looking at now. But that thing can apparently perform all the functions that qualify it as a living organism. It can reproduce, it can breathe, it can eat, although I don't know what.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energy itself, perhaps, drained from us. I would speculate that this unknown life form is invading our galaxy like a virus.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Intrepid died of that particular virus. How is it we survived?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Intrepid must have come across the organism while it was still low in energy, still hungry. We are not safe, Captain. We merely have a little more time than the Intrepid did.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about this zone of darkness? Does the organism generate it itself as a form of protection?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's one of the things we've got to find out. We've got to take a closer look at it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The closer we get, the faster our energy drains out. We're barely surviving at this distance.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Perhaps we could risk the shuttlecraft. Perhaps with a protective shield

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not sending anyone anywhere. Unmanned probes can give us the information we need to destroy this thing, if it can be destroyed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I must differ with you, Captain. We have sent unmanned probes into it. They have given us some information but they have not told us what we need to know, and we cannot afford the power to take blind shots at it, hoping to kill it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We could send one man in, pinpoint its vulnerable spots.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: DO you know what the odds are in coming back? I can't order a man to do that.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who said anything about an order, Jim? You've got a volunteer. I've done the preliminary work.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a suicide mission.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: The thing evidently has reflexes. The unmanned probe we sent in must have stung it when it entered. The lurch we felt was the turbulence of its reaction.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right, so I'd know enough to go slow when we penetrated its vulnerable spots.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have a martyr complex, Doctor. I submit that it disqualifies you.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you think I intend to pass up the greatest living laboratory since

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Vulcans saw it first and died.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just because the Vulcans failed

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am more capable.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I am not taking volunteers.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't think you're going?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm better qualified as a command pilot than you are.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which makes you indispensable, Captain. Further, you are not a science specialist.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, that organism contains chemical processes we've never seen before and may never see again. We could learn more in one day

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: We don't have one day, Doctor. We have precisely one hour and thirty five minutes of power left.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I'll decide.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain's personal log, stardate 4309.2. We have established that the thing which destroyed the USS Intrepid and the Gamma Seven=A system is an incredibly huge but simple cellular being whose energies are totally destructive to all known life. Both Mister Spock and Doctor McCoy have volunteered to go in a specially equipped shuttlecraft to penetrate the cell, find a way to destroy it, and free the ship. Doctor McCoy has the medical-biological knowledge. Mister Spock is better suited physically and emotionally to stand the stress. Both are right, both are capable, and which of my friends do I condemn to death? This is the captain. Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy, report to my quarters immediately. Kirk out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: You asked me to keep you informed on the power drain. All levels are down fifty percent now

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: And still draining. We can maintain thrust for another hour and fifteen minutes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Spock and McCoy enter.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. Prepare the shuttlecraft for launching.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy will tell you what special equipment to put in. Kirk out. I'm sorry, Mister Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right. I'll get a few things I need, Jim.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not you, Bones. I'm sorry, Mister Spock. You're best qualified to go.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do not suffer so, Doctor. This is not the first time superior capability has proven more valuable than professional credentials.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing has been proven yet, Spock. The DNA code analyser will give you the fundamental structure of the thing. You'll need readings on three light wavelengths from the enzyme recorder.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am familiar with the equipment, Doctor. We're wasting time. The shuttlecraft is ready.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're determined not to let me share in this, aren't you?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is not a competition, Doctor. Whether you understand it or not, grant me my own kind of dignity.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Vulcan dignity? How can I grant you what I don't understand?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then employ one of your own superstitions. Wish me luck.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Silence and stares, then McCoy opens the hangar deck door. Spock walks across and into the Galileo. The doors shut.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Good luck, Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: All systems clear for shuttlecraft launch. sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch shuttlecraft.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Shuttlecraft away, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, channel automatic telemetry directly to the computers.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Shuttlecraft to Enterprise.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come in, Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Power drain is enormous and growing worse.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Chekov goes to the science station.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Diverting all secondary power to the shields. (McCoy enters) I'll continue communications as long as there is power to transmit.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, h e won't have enough power to get back out if he diverts it to his shields.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I heard, Captain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: We discussed that possibility earlier. But you will need this information.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When do you estimate penetration?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
