Text: Slowing now. Contact in eighteen point three seconds. Brace yourselves. The area of penetration will no doubt be sensitive. Contact

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: In six seconds.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Spock is thrown around in the shuttlecraft, everyone on the ship just feels a jolt.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Spock. Spock, report.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am undamaged, Captain. Relay to Mister Scott I had three percent power reserve before the shields stabilised.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: There was nothing to spare. I shall continue my tests. Oh, and Doctor McCoy. You would have not survived it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You want to bet?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am moving slowly now, establishing course toward what appears to be the nucleus.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, Mister Spock has reduced life-support systems to bare minimum.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, save your power for the shields.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Calculations indicate the shields will last only forty seven minutes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: However, I am able to identify the chromosome structure.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Changes indicate the organism has stored sufficient energy for reproductive process to commence.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean there'll be two of those things?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm having difficulty maintaining ship control.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you read me? Spock, do you read me?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm losing voice contact I will transmit internal co-ordinates of chromosome bodies.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, come in. Come in.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Contact lost, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The ship shakes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's alive! He's kicked it in the side to let us know.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm getting telemetry.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, telemetry analysis as it comes in.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: According to Spock's telemetry information, there are over forty chromosomes in the nucleus that are ready to come together, ready to reproduce.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If the energy of that organism only doubles, we're dead, and everything within a light year will be defenceless.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, all I know is, that soon there'll be two, four, eight, and more. The entire anti-life matter that that thing puts out could someday encompass the entire galaxy.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock understood when he transmitted the co-ordinates of the chromosomes. We must destroy that organism.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, the pull from that organism is increasing, and the power drain from our shields is getting critical.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much time do we have?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: No more than an hour now, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put all secondary systems on standby. Shield power has unconditional priority.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm receiving a message from Mister Spock on a low-energy channel. It's faint, but it is readable.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on, Lieutenant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: On audio, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Spock.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am slowly losing life support and minimal shield energies. According to my calculations

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Context: Barely audible over static) The nervous energy of the organism is maximal just within its outer protective membrane. Relatively insensitive to interior irritation. I believe sufficient charge of (inaudible
Text: could destroy the organism. Tell Doctor McCoy he should have wished me luck.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log stardate 4309.4. We have determined we can destroy the creature, provided we can do it from inside the organism. Spock clearly knew how to destroy it but was unable to transmit that information.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you feel?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's on your mind?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock. Is it me, Jim? Am I so sentimental that I just have to keep believing that he's still alive in that mass of protoplasm?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He knew the odds when he went out there, just as you did when you volunteered to go. What is that thing out there, Bones? It's not intelligent. Not yet.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a disease, like a virus invading the body of our galaxy.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, it is, isn't it? How many cells does the human body have?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Millions.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This thing, this cell, this virus. It's eleven thousand miles long, and it's one cell. When it grows into millions, we'll be the virus invading its body.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, isn't that a thought? Here we are, antibodies of our own galaxy, attacking an invading germ. It would be ironic indeed if that were our sole destiny, wouldn't it?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Antibodies. Antibodies. (goes to desk monitor) Bridge.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, how much power do we have left?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're down to forty three percent, sir. We're slipping a bit against the pull that beastie's putting on us.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can't last more than forty five minutes at this rate of decline. Less, if I have to apply more thrust.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would happen if you diverted all remaining power to the shields, except for impulse power, keep that in reserve?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Cut the engine thrust? We'd be sucked into that thing like being caught in a wind tunnel, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly. Prepare to divert power on my signal. Kirk out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: Kirk leans against the monitor, tired. McCoy scans him.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you got something to say?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Technically, no. Medically, yes. Between the stimulants and the pressure, I would suggest you try to stay off your feet for a few minutes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't have a few minutes, Bones. Maybe none of us do. Let's go.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All hands, this is the captain. We're going to enter the body of the organism rather abruptly, I would think. Damage control parties stand by. All decks secure for collision. Kirk out.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready, Scotty.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Switching power to shields. Impulse in reserve. Cutting thrust to zero, now!

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Impact five seconds.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: There's a big bump and people are thrown all over the place. Then there is calm.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We're through, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe everybody is aware of that, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Damage control parties report minimal damage, sir. Repairs are being initiated.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good, Lieutenant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've only twenty six percent power reserves after entry.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we have impulse power, Scotty?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I saved all I could, sir, but I don't know whether we have enough to get back out again. Or time either.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are committed.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, we are, but we're committed to what? We have no power for the phasers.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We couldn't use it. We'd cook ourselves along with that mess of protoplasm out there

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That thing would probably like phasers. It eats power.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then what the devil, begging your pardon sir, are we doing?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock was trying to tell us what to do when we lost voice contact.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can't use the power to destroy it.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anti-power.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This thing has a negative energy charge. Everything seems to work in reverse. We'll use anti-matter.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, it couldn't swallow that.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, prepare a probe. Scotty, we'll need a magnetic bottle for the charge. How soon?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's on its way, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, we'll use a timing detonator for the probe. Work out a setting.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsman, when do you estimate arrival at nucleus?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Seven minutes, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How close are you going to it?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Point blank range. We'll implant it then back away.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why? The probe has a range of

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With the eddies and currents in that protoplasm, the probe could drift thousands of kilometres. We must be exactly on target, because we won't have a second chance. Bones, time for another stimulant.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How long do you think you can keep taking that stuff? It'll blow you apart.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep me together for another seven minutes. That's all I need.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Personal log, Commander Spock, USS Enterprise. I have noted the passage of the Enterprise on its way to whatever awaits it. If this record should survive me, I wish it known that I bequeath my highest commendation and testimonial to the captain, officers, and crew of the Enterprise. The finest starship in the fleet.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Context: also making a log entry
Text: We have arrived at the chromosome body in the nucleus of the organism. If we should fail in our attempt to destroy it, or be unable to free ourselves, I wish to record my recommendations for the following personnel, that they receive special citation. Lieutenant Commander Leonard McCoy, Lieutenant Commander Montgomery Scott, officers Chekov, Kyle, Uhura, and my highest commendation for Commander Spock, Science Officer, who gave his life in the performance of his duty.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Target co-ordinates programmed, sir. Probe ready for launch.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, how much time do we have left at one hundred percent impulse power?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Six, maybe seven minutes, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Kyle, programme fuse for seven minute delay. All non-essential systems on standby. Communications, scanning, conserve every bit of power. We must make it through the membrane before that thing explodes. Make it work, Scotty.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Programming complete. Ready for launch.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch probe at zero acceleration. Forward thrust off, one tenth of a second.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Forward thrust off, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Probe launched, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: There's a little jolt.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Despite what Spock said, it's still plenty sensitive.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Probe confirmed. It is lodged in the nucleus, near the chromosome bodies.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Kyle, back us out the way we came in. Mister Chekov, a nice, straight line. Don't waste any time.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Backing out, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Estimate we'll be out in six point thirty seven minutes.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, metallic substance outside the ship.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, get me Spock's voice channel. Highest possible gain.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Go ahead, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you read me? Do you read me, Spock, do you read me? Come in, Spock. Spock! Scotty, get a tractor beam.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we don't have enough time to do it. We only have a fifty three second escape margin.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm well aware of that, Mister Scott. Get two tractor beams on that shuttlecraft.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Tractor beams on.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I recommend you abandon the attempt.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do not risk the ship further on my behalf.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Shut up, Spock! We're rescuing you.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why, thank you, Captain McCoy.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Almost out. We're approaching the membrane, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time until explosion?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Fifty seven seconds, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintaining tractor beams on shuttlecraft, Mister Scott?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. I can't guarantee it'll hold when the warhead explodes. The power levels are (looks at readout) The power levels are dead, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may have just written our epitaph, Mister Scott.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Context: The warhead must have exploded, because everyone goes flying around the bridge again.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate main viewing screen. (they see stars.) Mister Chekov, report.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The organism is destroyed, sir. The explosion must have ruptured the membrane and thrown us clear.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Power's coming back, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shuttlecraft?

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know how, sir, but it's still with us.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Shuttlecraft to Enterprise. Shuttlecraft to Enterprise. Request permission to come aboard.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you're alive!

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, Captain. And I have some fascinating data on the organism.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't be so smart, Spock. You botched the acetylcholine test.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Later, later, later. Bring the shuttlecraft aboard, Mister Scott.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Prepare to receive shuttlecraft. Received shuttlecraft. Hangar doors closed. Hangar deck pressurising.

Title: The Immunity Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, lay in a course for Starbase Six. Ahead warp factor five. I'm still looking forward to a nice period of rest and relaxation on some lovely (gazes at yeoman) planet.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Approaching Sigma Iotia Two, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standard orbit, Mister Chekov.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have received vocal contact from an official station. They relayed us to a man named Oxmyx. His title is Boss.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Boss? All right, Lieutenant, put him on. Oxmyx. This is Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the Federation of Planets.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hello, Captain. You're from the same outfit as the Horizon?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Unfortunately, the Horizon was lost with all hands shortly after leaving your planet. We only received her radio report last month.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Last month? What are you talking about? The Horizon left here a hundred years ago.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Difficult to explain. We received a report a hundred years late because it was sent by conventional radio. Your system is on the outer reaches of the galaxy. They didn't have subspace communication in those days.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Toward the edge of what?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll explain it in more detail when I see him. The ship won't land, but we'll transport several people down. Well, that's a little difficult for you to understand, too. I'll explain it in more detail when I see you. Where will be convenient?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Well, there's an intersection just at the end of the block, near a yellow fire plug. Think you can find it?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk goes over to the engineering station.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, do you have the co-ordinates?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Located, sir.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Good. Mister Oxmyx, we have your intersection located. Will five minutes be all right?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Fine. Fine. I'll have a reception committee there to meet you.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I'll be looking forward to it. Kirk out. Scotty, you have the conn.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: McCoy and Spock enter from the turbolift.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, McCoy, we're beaming down. Standard equipment.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Horizon's contact came before the Non-Interference Directive went into effect.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They must have interfered with the normal evolution of the planet.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will be interesting to see the results of the contamination.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't know there is contamination. The evidence is only circumstantial.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What was the state of the Iotian culture before the Horizon came?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The beginnings of industrialisation.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Horizon reports indicate the Iotians are extremely intelligent and somewhat imitative.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So we're going down to recontaminate them.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: The damage has been done, Doctor. We are here to repair it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's not argue about it. Let's go study it. Energise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: There's a yellow fire hydrant, litter, a girl in a 1930's dress, motor cars, shops, and men standing around carrying machine guns. Welcome to Chicago.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is like coming home.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Home was never like this. I've seen pictures of the old days that look like this.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting, Captain. Passers-by are carrying, I believe, firearms.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They are approached by two men in neat suits with machine guns.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Context: in a brown suit
Text: Okay, you three, let's see you petrify.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, would you mind explaining that statement, please?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I want to see you turn to stone. Put your hands over your head, or you ain't going to have no head to put your hands over.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They are deprived of their phasers and communicators.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: What's this?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a weapon. Be careful with that.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: A heater, huh? Hey, the boss will love that. (puts it in his pocket)

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look, we were asked to come down here by Mister Oxmyx. He said

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I know what he said, bud. He said some of the boys would meet you. Okay, we're meeting you.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, those firearms are not necessary.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: You trying to make trouble?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who, me?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Don't give me those baby blue eyes.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I don't go for that innocent routine.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, does everyone here carry firearms?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I never heard such stupid questions in my life.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, since this Oxmyx asked us down here, don't you think we should see him?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: All right. Get moving. Down the street.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Just then a car comes hurtling around the corner. Everyone dives for cover, and gunfire rings out. The silent man in the blue suit gets shot. Kalo returns fire as the car speeds away.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Krako's getting more gall all the time .

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this how you greet all your guests?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: It happens, pal.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That man's dead back there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Yeah? We ain't playing for peanuts. What's the matter, you guys never saw a hit before?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, there are several questions I would like to ask.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Ask the boss. I don't know nothing. Get moving.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They leave the crowd to deal with the deceased.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is the contamination you're looking for, Jim.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but the Horizon crew wasn't composed of cold-blooded killers. They didn't report this culture in this state, either. What happened?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Woman
Text: Hey, Kalo. Hey, when's the boss going to do something about the crummy street lights around here, eh? A girl ain't safe.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Woman 2
Text: And how about the laundry pickup? We ain't had a truck by in three weeks.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Write him a letter.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Woman 2
Text: I did. He sent it back with postage due.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Woman
Text: Listen, we pay our percentages. We're entitled to a little service for our money.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Get lost, will ya? Some people got nothing to do but complain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this the way your citizens do business, their right of petition?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: They pay their percentages and the boss takes care of them.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: It's a lovely high-ceilinged room with wood paneling, tiled floor with a carpet and substantial furniture. A buzzer sounds.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Context: a silver haired man in a suit) Hit that button. (the girl sitting on his desk obeys
Text: Yeah?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Got them, Boss. No sweat.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: All right. Bring them in. (he goes to the pool table and picks up a cue) Which one of you is the captain?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Depends.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Make yourself a drink, Captain. It's good stuff. I distill it myself.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, thank you. You're Mister Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: That's me, pal.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is my first officer, Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Doctor, huh? Put that chopper down, Kalo. These guys are our guests. Pick up a cue, Captain. Go ahead. You can't be too careful around here these days.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Judging from what we've seen so far, I agree.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They call you The Boss, Mister Oxmyx. The boss of what?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: The boss of my territory. I got the biggest in the world. You know, there's one thing wrong with having the biggest. There's always some punk trying to cut you out. That's why you can't be too careful.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the government here?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: What government? Look, I told you. I got the territory and I run it. That's all.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But there are other bosses, other territories?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Yeah, sure. Maybe a dozen or so, not counting the small fry, but then they get burned anyway soon as I get around to it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Does that include, if I may ask, a gentleman called Krako?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: How do you know about Krako?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: He hit us, Boss.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Okay. You hit him back, you hear? Hard.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I'll take care of it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Spock has discovered a book on a lectern.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain? Gangsters. Chicago. Mobs. Published in 1992. Where'd you get this?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, wait a minute. That's the Book.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know it's a book.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: The Book. They left it, the other ship. The Horizon.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the contamination, Captain. Astonishing. An entire culture based on this.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You said they were imitative, and the book

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: I don't want any more cracks about the Book.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did they leave any other books?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Sure. Some text books on how to make radio sets and stuff like that, but, look, I brought you here so you could help me, not for you to ask me questions. After that, I'll answer anything you want to know.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it you want?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Well, I was thinking. You Feds must have made a lot of improvements since that other ship came here. You probably got all kinds of fancy heaters up there. So here's the deal. You give me all the heaters I need. Enough tools so I can knock off those punks all at once. Then I'll take over, and all you'll have to do is deal with me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now let me get this straight. You want us to supply you with arms and assistance so you can carry out an aggression against your neighbours?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: What aggression? I got to make hits. I want you to help me hit them. That's all.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating, but quite impossible.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Oxmyx, my orders are quite explicit. Under no circum

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: I ain't interested in your orders. From now on, you're gonna take orders from me. I'm gonna give you just eight hours to give me the things I want. If I don't have those tools by then, I'm gonna call up your ship and have them pick you up in a box. Is that understood, pal?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kalo and another henchman put their guns to Kirk's head.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Hey, Boss, this here's a heater, and I don't know what this is. (tosses them to his leader)

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Let's see how this thing works.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't do that. You could knock out the side of the building.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: That good, huh? All you have to do is give me about a hundred of these fancy heaters and we'll have no more trouble.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out of the question.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Captain Kirk, I usually get what I want. What's this thing? (silence) All right. Burn him.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold it. It's a communication device.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: How does it work?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's locked onto my ship's systems.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Kalo, take them to the warehouse and put them in a bag. Keep a sharp eye on them, you hear.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: In the bag, Boss. Come on.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The landing party and the gunmen leave

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Context: into communicator
Text: Hey, you. In the ship up there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, you in the ship.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here. Who's this?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: This is Bela Oxmyx. I got your captain and his friends down here. You want to see them alive

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Again you'll send me down a hundred of these fancy heaters you've got, and some troops to show me how to use them.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Am I to understand that you're holding the captain and his party?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: You heard right, pal. I'm going to give you just eight hours to get me the goods I want, or I put the hit on your friends.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: You understand?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know. (Oxmyx ends the transmission, laughing) Lieutenant Hadley, check the language banks and find out what a heater is.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The guards are sitting at a makeshift table playing cards whilst the landing party sit on various barrels and crates.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: One book on the gangs of Chicago did all this. It's amazing.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: They evidently seized upon that one book as the blueprint for an entire society.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's the Bible.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In old Chicago, conventional government almost broke down. The gangs nearly took over.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah, well, Oxmyx is the worst gangster of all.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: We may quarrel with Mister Oxmyx' methods, but his goal is essentially the correct one. This society must become united or it will degenerate into total anarchy.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If this society broke down as the result of the Horizon's influence, then the Federation's responsible, and we've got to do something to straighten this mess out. Spock, if you could get to the sociological computer, do you think you could find a solution?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, I do not have access to my computers, nor are these gentlemen likely to permit it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I've got an idea about that. (goes over to the card table and gets guns pointed at him) Gentlemen. Gentlemen. This, card game is a kid's game.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: You think so, huh?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes, yes. I wouldn't waste my time.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Who's asking you?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On Beta Antares Four, they play a real game. It's a man's game, but of course it's probably a little beyond you. It requires intelligence.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Listen, Kirk, I can play anything you can figure out. Take the cards, big man. Show us how it's played.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm familiar with the culture on Beta Antares. There aren't games

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock. (sits) Of course, the cards on Beta Antares Four are different, but not too different. The name of the game is called fizzbin.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Fizzbin?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fizzbin. It's not too difficult. (begins dealing) Each player gets six cards, except for the player on the dealer's right, who gets seven.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: On the right.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. The second card is turned up, except on Tuesdays.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: On Tuesday.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, look what you got, two jacks. You got a half fizzbin already.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I need another jack.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no. If you got another jack, why, you'd have a sralk.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: A sralk?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. You'd be disqualified. You need a king and a deuce, except at night of course, when you'd need a queen and a four.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Except at night.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right. Oh, look at that. You've got another jack. How lucky you are! How wonderful for you. If you didn't get another jack, if you'd gotten a king, why then you'd get another card, except when it's dark, you'd give it back.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: If it were dark on Tuesday.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but what you're after is a royal fizzbin, but the odds in getting a royal fizzbin are astron. Spock, what are the odds in getting a royal fizzbin?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have never computed them, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, they're astronomical, believe me. Now, for the last card. We'll call it a kronk. You got that?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: What?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk 'accidentally' drops the card on the floor

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: I'll get it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: As he bends down, Spock nock-pinches him while McCoy and Kirk punch out the other two men. McCoy is quicker than Kirk.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, find the radio station. Uhura's monitoring the broadcasts. Cut in and have yourselves beamed up to the ship.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Surely, you're coming, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will, but I'm bringing Bela Oxmyx with me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you can't

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, this mess is our responsibility. You have your orders. Let's go.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk is running along, carrying a machine gun, when a voice rings out. A man in a light grey suit and straw boater accosts him.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Text: Hold it! Okay, pally, we're going for a ride.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't mind, I'd rather walk.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Text: Listen, pally, this could either be a taxi or a hearse. You know what I mean?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm beginning to get the idea.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They climb into the back of a very nice car.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: A woman is about to put the needle onto a record when Spock neck-pinches her.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You do that very well. Now, how are you with primitive radio equipment?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very simple. Amplitude modulation transmission. I simply adjust the frequency, throw this switch, and the Enterprise should answer.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Voice
Text: That was the Jailbreakers with their latest recording on Request Time, brought to you by Bang-Bang, the makers of the sweetest little automatic in the world

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And very simple.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Let me see. (throws a few more switches and picks up the microphone.) Enterprise, this is Mister Spock.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Lieutenant Uhura here, Mister Spock.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, what are you doing on this frequency?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very long and complicated story, Lieutenant. Notify the transporter room, Two to beam up, these co-ordinates.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The brass plaque by the front door of the building proclaims 'JoJo Krako, Boss, Southside Territory'. The straw boaters are the badge of his organisation. JoJo is practising throwing darts over his shoulder at a poster of Oxmyx. Kirk is brought in. There's a copy of the Book on a lectern here too.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: So you're the Fed, huh? Well, well, well, well, well.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Krako. JoJo Krako. I'm the head of the whole Southside Territory. Hey, glad to see you.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would you mind telling me how you even know who I am?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Sit down, Kirk. I've got all of Bela's communications bugged. He can't make a date with a broad unless I know about it. Well, I guess you want to know why I brought you here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You want to make a deal.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Hey, I like that. That is sharp. That's sharp, eh, Zabo?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Text: Sharp, Boss.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: That's right, a deal. I want you to help me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: He snaps his fingers, and the girl walks over to Kirk and starts massaging his shoulders.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me guess. You want, you'll want heaters, and then you'll want troops to teach them how to use them. And then you'll attack the other bosses and take over the whole planet. Then we'll sit down and talk, right?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Wrong! I know Bela. He didn't offer you beans. Now, me, I'm a reasonable man. You give me what I want and I'll cut you in for, say, a third. Skimmed right off the top. Well, what do you think?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I got a better idea. This planet has to be united. You know that. Bela knows that. Let's sit down. You, me, Bela. Discuss this whole matter, contact the other bosses, and talk about it like reasonable men.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: You watch it, Kirk. The Book tells us how to handle things. (snaps his fingers to recall the girl) You make hits. Somebody argues, you lean on 'em. What do you think, we're stupid or something?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't think you're stupid. I just think your behaviour is arrested.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I haven't been arrested in my whole life! Listen, pally, I know how to get what I want. You want to live, don't you, Kirk? You bet you do. But after I get through with you, you're liable to be sorry unless you come across. Hold him here. Tell Cirl the Knife to sharpen up his blade. I just might have a job for him. Unless you come across with the heaters.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Krako. No deal.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: That's too bad. Put him on ice!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They put him in a proper working office, with letter opener, desk with blotting paper, a cot-bed and a nice old radio with nice old valves and stuff inside. Kirk starts taking it apart.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Futile, Doctor. No specifics. There is no record of such a culture based on a moral inversion.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean you're giving up?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Doctor. I'm merely saying the computers can offer us no logical, rational, factual way out of our current dilemma.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, Mister Oxmyx is making contact from the surface.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: On audio, Lieutenant. Mister Oxmyx, this is Mister Spock.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Huh? Hey, how'd you get back up there?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Irrelevant, since we are here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Oh, yeah. I tell you, you'd better come on back down.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Krako's put the bag on your captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why would he put a bag on our captain?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Kidnapped him, you dope.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: He'll scrag him, too.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I understand you correctly, that would seem to be a problem.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Look, you guys got something I want. I can help you get your captain back.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Then we can talk about the deal I want.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm afraid I find it difficult to trust you, Mister Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: What's to trust? Business is business. We'll call a truce. You come on down.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: My boys'll spring Kirk, and then we'll talk about giving me a hand.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll show no further hostility?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: I'm a businessman, pally. What do ya say?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since we must have our captain back, I accept.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: We shall arrive in your office within ten minutes. Spock out.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean you're going to trust him?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we are to save the captain without blatant, forceful interference on this planet, Doctor, we must have the assistance of someone indigenous. We are therefore forced to trust Mister Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk has used copper wire to create a trip-wire, and starts throwing the waste paper bin around to make a noise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help me! Help! Help me!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: A henchman dashes in and goes flying over the wire. Kirk kicks him unconscious, then uses a blanket to disorient Zabo when he comes in before knocking him out too, taking a weapon and making his escape.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, though we hope to avoid interference, I suggest you set one of our phaser banks on a strong stun position.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now you're beginning to make sense.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I trust we shall not have to use them, but it is best to be prepared. Energise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: You know what to do.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Don't worry, Boss. They can't do nothing till they're through sparkling.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Just the same, you be careful. They'll have heaters on them. (to his girl) Now you watch this.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Spock and McCoy arrive, and are promptly taken prisoner.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log. Mister Spock reporting. Incredible as it seems, Doctor McCoy and I are once again prisoners of the chief criminal boss of a society patterned after old Earth gangsters.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Context: taking the phasers
Text: Pick up many more of these, I won't need your co-operation.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Oxmyx, I understood we had an arrangement, a truce.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: I was hoping you'd think that, dummy.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're trying to help you, Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Nobody helps nobody but himself.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, you are employing a double negative.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Huh?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I fail to see why you do not understand us. You yourself have stated the need for unity of authority on this planet. We agree.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Yeah, but I got to be the unity.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Co-operation, sir, would inevitably result

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: The most co-operative man in this world is a dead man. And if you don't keep your mouth shut, you're going to be co-operatin'.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The door opens and Kirk enters with his machine gun.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Drop the guns. Drop 'em. (McCoy and Spock take back their phasers) Move down there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, Captain, you got away from Krako. You know, that ain't easy.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thought you were supposed to report to the ship, Mister Spock.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: We did, Captain. The situation required our return.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It may be just as well. Did you find out anything from the computer?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing useful. Logic and practical information do not seem to apply here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You admit that?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: To deny the facts would be illogical, Doctor.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you don't mind if I play a hunch?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm not sanguine about hunches, Captain, but I have no practical alternative.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are we going to do now, Jim?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, now that we have Bela, I'm going to put the bag on Krako. (grabs the guy in a blue suit) Listen, you. Say, that's nice material.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Man
Text: It ought to be. It cost a bundle.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Get out of 'em.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Man
Text: Hey!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kalo
Text: Now just a minute.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You too! Get out of the clothes. Nobody's going to put the bag on me any more.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk is in the blue suit, and Spock in Kalo's brown one, when they leave Bela's headquarters and go over to the cream sedan parked by the kerb.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wheels, Mister Spock.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: A fliwer, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Key in the ignition. Turn the ignition on. And nothing happens. Where's the starter? There's the starter. Yes!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Context: pushing the gear lever and making grinding noises
Text: Oops! Gears.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Oh. I believe they had a device known as a clutch. Clutch, Captain. Perhaps one of those pedals on the floor.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Context: puts it quietly into gear
Text: I kind of like this. I'm going to get one myself.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: He lets up the clutch, and they go backwards. The car kangaroos elegantly down the street and somehow makes it to JoJo's place.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you are an excellent starship commander, but as a taxi driver you leave much to be desired.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was that bad?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They get out and note the guards at the main entrance

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, that could be a bit of a problem. If they were inside, where they couldn't be seen, we could stun them with our phasers, but not out here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we can get close enough to them, we should be able to render them harmless with reasonable rapidity.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: A guard checks the contents of a passing perambulator.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They don't look like the trusting type.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Context: runs over to them
Text: It's a hit, ain't it?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I beg your pardon?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: You're going to hit somebody. Can I watch?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Young man, run along and play.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Where'd you get them ears?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Young man

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: You going to hit Krako out here? You open up and you'll be scragged from every window in the street. I can fix it for ya.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Young man, this is likely to be quite hazardous.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold on, Spock. Out of the mouths of babes

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Who you callin' a babe?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm calling you a babe.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: You calling me a babe? (brandishes his little knife.)

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah I'm calling you a babe, but there's nothing personal in it. Sit down. (on the car bumper) You know a way we can get close to them?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Sure.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: What's in it for me?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: A piece of the action.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: You do not even know what the action is going to be.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: I figure it's got to be a thick percentage or you wouldn't be trying to hit Krako.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logical.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, young man. We'll guarantee you a piece of the action if we can pull this thing off.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Is that a contract?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Done. (they shake on it) What do we do?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: You'll know what to do.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: He skips across the street, fighting imaginary enemies with his very real knife.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: And that! And how do you like that? Think you can gang up on me, huh? What are you, chicken?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The guards grin as he runs over to them.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Come on, why don't you gang up on me? I'll cut off your head and throw it in your face! Take that, and that, and falls over) Daddy, Daddy, I hurt myself!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's it. Let's go.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Guard
Text: What's the matter? Did you hurt yourself, kid?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: I want my daddy!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Guard
Text: Cute kid, ain't he?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: Daddy! I want my daddy!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sonny!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Boy
Text: I want my daddy.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sonny! Wait a moment. What have they done? What have they done to you? What have you done?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk hits one while Spock neck-pinches the other. There's a bit of argy-bargy just inside the door before it's over.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A piece of the action.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No one can see. Put your phaser on stun.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They stun two guards in the corridor in front of them. Krako is coming down the stairs with his girl.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Well, ain't this nice? I was wondering how I was going to get you back, and here you deliver yourself! Who's your friend with the ears, Kirk?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think you've got it reversed, Mister Krako.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I ain't, pally. Put down your heaters.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I believe that perhaps it would be wise to do as he says. I just heard the sound of

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The sound of a machine gun bolt being pulled back. (there are two more guards behind them.) (JoJo is shaking a phaser to make it work.)

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Krako, I don't, er

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: So this is the fancy heater, huh? How does it work?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm trying to tell you, Mister Krako, that this is bigger than you, Oxmyx or anyone.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: The only thing I want you to tell me is how it works.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you trust all your men?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Of course I can!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, one of these can make a man a pretty big boss, you know.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I either trust 'em, or they're dead. Let's go in here and talk about it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Now we got no busy little eyes to worry about. How does this thing work?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Krako, we don't have time to show you how to play with toys! (takes the phaser back)

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Toys?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you think we're here for, to get a cut of your deal? Forget it. That's peanuts to an outfit like the Federation. Right?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unquestionably.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Right.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now look, Krako, we're taking over the whole ball of wax. You co-operate with us and maybe we'll cut you in for a piece of the action.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: A miniscule. A very small piece.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: How much is that?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's, er. We'll figure it out later.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I thought you guys had laws. No interference.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who's interfering? We're taking over. Check?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Right.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The planet is being taken over by the Federation, but we don't want to come in here and use our muscle, you know what I mean? That ain't subtle. So what we do is we help one guy take over the planet. He pulls the strings, and then we pull his. (to Spock) Hey, you, sit down.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They settle them selves with their feet up on Krako's desk.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: What's your cut?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you care as long as you're being cut in? Course, there's always Bela Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: All right, it's a deal. Call your ship. Bring down your boys and whatever else you need.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise. Scott here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty. We made a deal with Krako.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: We did, sir?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah. We're ready to make the hit. We're taking over the whole planet as soon as you get ready.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Do you think that's wise, sir?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sure. We can trust Krako, but we don't have any choice. You know what I mean? He's standing about twelve feet in front of me, all ready to be our pal.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course, Scotty, I'd like to show him the ship, just to show him that we're, er, we're on the level. But you know how it is.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. I know indeed.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we'll need phasers to equip every one of Krako's men. We'll need advisors and troops to back him up on the hit. You got all that, Scotty?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain. We're preparing everything. It'll be ready when you give the word.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may begin, Mister Scott.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Acknowledged, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: You mean you're going to start sending down your boys now?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not exactly.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Krako is beamed away, and the astonished guards are easily overpowered again.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Check.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: They leave.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Two armed security men have met Krako.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: How the hell'd I get here? What? What happened? (Scott enters) You. You must be that Scott fellow Kirk was talking to. I want to know what happened.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: It looks like we put the bag on you, doesn't it.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I got rights.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: You've got nothing. You mind your place, mister, or you'll be wearing concrete galoshes.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: You mean cement overshoes?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Er. Aye.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Kirk runs towards the car.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Must we?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's faster than walking.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: But not as safe.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you afraid of cars?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at all, Captain. It's your driving that alarms me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I've got the hang of it. Now go on.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The machine guns are still where Spock left them in the open top car, and Kirk still puts it into reverse first.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Context: waking up) Oh, not again. (rouses the other man) Hey, wake up. You all right? (opens the door
Text: Hey, you guys. Come in here. The Feds snatched Krako. I never seen anything like it. They're going to move in unless we stop 'em now.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Guard
Text: Yeah? How?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Text: Well, Bela's mixed up in this somehow. I've got a sneaking hunch they're going to high-tail it back to his territory. You know what we're going to do? We're going to hit his place.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where are they?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Knowing Krako, he'll probably send them back on a blotter.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wrong again, Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Knock it off, Sawbones. I want to talk to this creep. Now listen, I'm getting tired of playing pattycake with you penny-ante operators.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: What do you mean, penny-ante operator?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a penny-ante operator. Sit down. All right, Spocko, cover him. Now listen, sweetheart. The Federation's moving in, taking over. You play ball, we'll cut you in. You don't, you're out. All the way out. You know what I mean?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Yeah, sure. Why didn't you say so in the first place? All you had to do was explain it to me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise. Scott here, sir.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You got Krako on ice?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, he's here. Mad enough

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: To chew neutronium, but behaving himself.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Okay, baby. Cool him till I flag you.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Flag me?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep him until I send for him. We're going to make some old-style phone calls from this locale. So you locate the man on the other end of the blower and give him a ride to this flop.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: What?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Find the man at the other end of the phone

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And transport him to these co-ordinates.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can do, sweetheart?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can do, Captain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Standing by.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now you. Get on the blower and call the other bosses.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: I sure don't know what you think you're talking about.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get with it. I'm giving the orders here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hello. Hello?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Guess who?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock in and energise.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Yeah, you bet your life I've got a lot of nerve. What are you going to do about it?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: Coming over with my boys and we (realises he's not where he was a second earlier) Mother.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, Captain, that ain't bad.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would advise you to keep dialing, Oxmyx.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Zabo
Text: All right. You know what to do. We hit Bela's place and nobody comes out alive. All right. Let's go.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: It's getting crowded and noisy. The minor bosses are all sporting bowler hats. Krako is there too. Kirk is standing on the pool table.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right! All right! All right! All right! Now the Federation's taking over whether you like it or not. You people, you've been running this planet like a piecework factory. From now on, it's going to be under one roof. You're going to run it like a business. That means you're going to make a profit.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: And what's your percentage?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm cutting the Federation in for forty percent. You got any objections?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: Yeah! I hear a lot of talk, but all I see here is you and a couple of your boys. I don't see no Federation.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Listen. They got a ship. I know. I was there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Tepo's got a point. All we ever seen is them.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: What, a couple of boys?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I'm not going to believe my eyes.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: general bedlam

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hang on a minute. Hang on a minute. Quiet! Just a moment!

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Let me say something. I only saw three guys in that ship. Maybe there ain't no more.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are over four hundred guys there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: That's your story, buster.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: There's a gunfight outside in the street.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Hey, it's my boys. They're making a hit at this place.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Everyone dashes to the windows to watch.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: My boys will put you down.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Want to bet? (gets the gun off McCoy) Keep moving. One move out of you two, I'll drill them. Give me the hardware.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, that's great, Krako. Now we got hostages again. We can make a deal with the Feds up there.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Are you kidding? This one's all mine. From now on, nobody's going no place. I'm going to be the big boss in this here territory.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, wait a minute. Wait a minute. Get that heater down. Don't you want to take a look at what you're going to fight?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: I already seen it. You're nothing, Fed.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, but at least let me call my ship one last time and say goodbye.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Well, all right. Go ahead. Don't get smart.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hello, Scotty. This is Kirk.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise. Scott here, sir.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, put the ship's phasers on stun. Fire a burst in a one-block radius around these co-ordinates.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Scott
Text: Right away, sir. Scott out.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: The street outside is filled with green light, and everyone falls down. The watching bosses are stunned into silence for a moment.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Krako
Text: Gee, that's some trick.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Hey, did you see that?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're not dead, just knocked out for a while. But they might just as well have been that way if we wanted them to.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Okay, okay, Kirk, so we get the message. Now, what was this syndicate deal you were talking about?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: He was talking about a percentage.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was talking about both.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: Okay. A syndicate makes sense to me. I'm a peaceful man at heart, but I'm sick and tired of all these hits. I hit Krako, Krako hits Tepo, Tepo hits me. There's too many bosses. We can't get anything done.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Narrator
Text: I was thinking if there was just one, maybe somebody like you, as the top boss, then we can get things done.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hey, Bela, no, no, no. The Federation can't get connected with a small-time operation like this. No, I was thinking, Bela, you would be the top boss. Krako, you'd be his lieutenant. The rest of you, I don't want any trouble from the rest of you because you'll have to answer to the Federation. We'll be back every year to collect our cut.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Tepo
Text: Look, you figure maybe forty percent's enough?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah, I think forty percent's sufficient.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Oxmyx
Text: It's reasonable. It sounds reasonable. That sound reasonable to you?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Context: Chorus of approval.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's reasonable, Mister Oxmyx. Let's break out some of your drinking stuff and celebrate the syndicate.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, you two have been brooding ever since we returned to the ship.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Brooding, Captain?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Brooding, Mister Spock. A sombre, emotional state. Now, do you wish to continue it or are you going to discuss it?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I'm neither brooding nor sombre. But I do have reservations about your solution to the problem of the Iotians.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah, yes. I understand that. You don't think it's logical to leave a criminal organisation in charge.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Highly irregular, to say the least, Captain. I'm also curious as to how you propose to explain to Starfleet Command that a starship will be sent each year to collect our cut.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's a very good question, Mister Spock. I propose our cut be put into the planetary treasury and used to guide the Iotians into a more ethical system. Despite themselves, they'll be forced to accept conventional responsibilities. Isn't that logical? All right, Bones, in the language of the planet, what's your beef?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know how serious this is, Jim, and I don't quite know how to tell you

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But in all the confusion I

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think I left it in Bela's office.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You left it?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Somewhere. I'm not certain.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're not certain of what?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I left my communicator.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In Bela's office?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. If the Iotians, who are very bright and imitative people, should take that communicator apart

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They will, they will. And they'll find out how the transtator works.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Spock
Text: The transtator is the basis for every important piece of equipment that we have.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Everything.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You really think it's that serious?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Serious? Serious, Bones? It upsets the whole percentage.

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do you mean?

Title: A Piece Of The Action
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, in a few years, the Iotians may demand a piece of our action.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: A landing party of Kirk, Spock, McCoy, Yeoman Thompson and a security guard have just beamed down.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: No life form readings, Captain. Continuing scan.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, somebody sent a distress call.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No sign of the spaceship. No sign of debris.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am getting readings on small metallic objects, Captain. It is possible the ship was destroyed in space and the survivors proceeded here in a shuttle craft.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But where are they?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Thompson
Text: Captain, I'm getting a reading now. Two human forms at bearing three hundred mark seven.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Confirmed.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: A male in an orange suit and a female in a blue outfit approach the party.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James T. Kirk, of the starship Enterprise. We came in answer to your distress call.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: It was very kind of you to respond so quickly, captain. Now you will surrender your ship to me.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a very strange sense of humour, Mister

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The man presses a button on his belt, and Kirk, Spock and McCoy are immobilised. The woman does the same to the Yeoman and guard.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I am Rojan of Kelva. I am your commander from this moment on. Any efforts to resist us or to escape will be severely punished. Soon we, and you, will leave this galaxy forever. You humans must face the end of your existence as you have known it. You are all paralyzed by a selective field that neutralises nerve impulses to the voluntary muscles. We can control you at will. I will now release you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay there.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Thompson
Text: Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. A neural field?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Yes. Radiating from a central projector.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Your ship, Captain Kirk. It will serve us well in the long voyage that is to come.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Voyage? Where?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: To your neighbouring galaxy, which you call Andromeda.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Andromeda? Why?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: It is our home.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: What brings you here?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Within ten millennia, high radiation levels in our galaxy will make life there impossible. So the Kelvan Empire sent forth ships to explore other galaxies, to search for one which our race could conquer and occupy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, sorry. This galaxy is already occupied.

Title: By Any Other Name
