Speaker: Rojan
Text: Captain, you think you are unconquerable and your ship impregnable, but while we've talked, the capture has already begun.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Something penetrating from the planet.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Increase power to shields.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Another male in a purple jumpsuit appears in Engineering and immobilises the crew there.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's dead, sir. All major power disabled.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sound Red Alert.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Red Alert. All personnel, man your battle stations. Go to Red Alert.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: A woman in a mustard coloured outfit takes over Life Support.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering, come in.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Life support, come in.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Then a man in brown immobilises the bridge crew.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Drea, Tomar, report.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Drea
Text: Life support control, secure.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: Engineering is secure.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Rojan, Hanar here.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Report, Hanar.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: The ship is ours. We control the bridge, engineering, and life support systems.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Proceed with your orders.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the point of capturing my ship? Even at maximum warp, the Enterprise couldn't get to Andromeda galaxy for thousands of years.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Captain, we will modify its engines, in order to produce velocities far beyond the reach of your science. The journey between galaxies will take less than three hundred of your years.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Spock Fascinating. Intergalactic travel requiring only three hundred years. That is a leap far beyond anything man has yet accomplished.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Thompson
Text: You made a voyage of three hundred years?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Our ships were of multigeneration design. We were born in the intergalactic void. We shall die there during our return journey.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: And our mission will be completed by a commander who is my descendant.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to your ship?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: There is an energy barrier at the rim of your galaxy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. We've been there.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: We managed to break through it with great difficulty. Our ship was destroyed. We barely managed to escape in a lifecraft. And now we have the means to begin our journey back to Andromeda.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why use our vessel? Why not transmit a message to your galaxy?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: No form of transmission can penetrate the barrier.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rojan, there's no reason to do this by force. Let's take your problem to the Federation. Research expeditions have catalogued hundreds of uninhabited planets in this galaxy suitable for colonization.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: We do not colonize. We conquer. We rule. There's no other way for us.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In other words, the galaxy isn't big enough for both of us.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Federation has handled foreign invasions before.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Captain, we can control the Federation as easily as we can control you. The fate of the inferior in any galaxy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Hanar suddenly appears on the planet.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: All is proceeding according to plan, Rojan.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Kelinda, take them to the holding area. We'll keep you and your party here, Captain. Your crew will undoubtedly wish to co-operate with us if they understand that you are hostages.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Move there.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Tomar has examined the ship. The modifications are underway.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Space again, Hanar. I do not think we could have kept our sanity living too long on this accursed planet.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: It is an undisciplined environment. One cannot control it. Yet there are things of interest.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Yes, but disturbing. These shells in which we've encased ourselves, they have such heightened senses. To feel. To hear. To smell. How do humans manage to exist in these fragile cases?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Since the ship was designed to sustain these forms, we have little choice.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: At least we'll be away from all of this openness. This is too strange for us, Hanar. We are creatures of outer space, and soon we will be safe in the comforting closeness of walls.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Rock walls with metal bars across the 'door'.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating material. Similar to diburnium, but considerably more dense. I doubt even phaser fire could disturb its molecular structure.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. We can't break out. There must be another way.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Thompson
Text: Captain, what do they want from us. What kind of people are they?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a very good question.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They registered as human.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Doctor. More than that. They registered as perfect human life forms. I recall noting the readings were almost classic textbook responses. Most curious.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, what are the odds in such absolute duplication of life forms in another galaxy?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: The chances are very much against it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Guard
Text: Captain. (Kalinda has appeared so they move away from the door) Captain. However perfect they are, there don't seem to be very many of them. Why...

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They have the paralysis field. Rojan mentioned something about a central projector.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. If we could put that out of operation, we might have a chance.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, I'm constrained to point out we do not even know what this projector looks like.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those devices on their belts might indicate the source of the force field.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possible. I would have to have one to examine.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Guard
Text: You'll have one, sir, if I have to rip one of the Kelvans apart to get it for you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll get your chance, but you'll do it under orders.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Guard
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On Eminiar Seven, you were able to trick the guard by a Vulcan mind probe.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I recall, Captain. I led him to believe we had escaped.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you think you can do it again?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall attempt it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kelinda seems to be getting nervous as Spock makes his attempt, then he is suddenly thrown across the cell. They go to his aid, Kelinda enters and Kirk grabs her and knocks her out. He takes the belt device.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you all right?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I will be all right, Captain. We must hurry.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: But as they come running out of their cell, Rojan and Hanar immobilise them. Kelinda walks over and is given her device back.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Context: releasing Kirk) This cannot go unpunished. Hanar. That one. (the guard
Text: Take him aside. Kelinda, the female.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Thompson
Text: Captain?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Go. As a leader, you realize the importance of discipline. I need you and these other specialists, but those two are unnecessary.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm responsible. Let them go.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I think we're somewhat alike, Captain. Each of us cares less for his own safety than for the lives of his command. We feel pain when others suffer for our mistakes. Your punishment shall be to watch them die. Captain. Proceed, Hanar.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The guard and the yeoman are reduced to blocks of solid matter.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Bring them to me. This is the essence of what they were. The flesh and brain and what you call the personality, distilled down into these compact shapes. And once crushed (he demonstrates) this person is dead. However, that one can be restored. (throws it on the ground) Hanar?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The security guard reappears.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4657.5. Work is proceeding on the Enterprise as my crew is forced to make the required changes in the ship for intergalactic travel. I can't forget the picture of Yeoman Thompson crushed to a handful of dust.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, are you sure you're all right?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, quite all right, Doctor.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You didn't look very well when you broke that mind touch.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I did not break it, Doctor. I was thrown away by something I've never experienced before.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: A series of bizarre and exotic images bursting on my mind and consciousness. Colours, shapes, mathematical equations fused and blurred. I've been attempting to isolate them, but so far I've been able to recall clearly only one. Immense beings, a hundred limbs which resemble tentacles. Minds of such control and capacity that each limb is capable of performing a different function.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you mean that's what the Kelvans really are?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undoubtedly.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, if they look that way normally, why did they adapt themselves to our bodies?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps practicality. They chose the Enterprise as the best vessel for the trip. Immense beings with a hundred tentacles would have difficulty with the turbolift. We've got to stop them. We outnumber them. Their only hold on us is the paralysis field.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's enough. One wrong move, and they jam all our neural circuits.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jam. Spock, if you reverse the circuits on McCoy's neuro-analyser, can you set up a counter field to jam the paralysis projector?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm dubious of the possibilities of success, Captain. The medical equipment is not designed to put out a great deal of power. The polarized elements would burn out quickly.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there a chance at all?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: A small one.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll take it. You and Bones have to get to the ship.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Mister Spock, you're sick.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I assure you, Captain, I am in perfect health.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you're not. Doctor McCoy has given you an thorough examination, and you're ill. In fact, if you don't get to the sickbay, you're going to die.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a good idea, Jim, but anyone looking at him can tell he's healthy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vulcans have the ability to place themselves in a kind of trance, complete relaxation of every part of the mind and body.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: We find it more restful to the body than your so-called vacation.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you do it now and come out of it in the sickbay, say in half an hour?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will take me a moment to prepare.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Spock touches his forehead, straightens up, then falls gently into McCoy and Kirk's arms.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, his heartbeat really is slow. His pulse is practically non-existent.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Context: goes to the door
Text: Hanar? Hanar.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: What do you want, human?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock is ill. The doctor thinks he may be dying.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: This illness came on him rather suddenly. Is it not unusual?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's a Vulcan. They don't react like humans.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He may die. If I can get him up to sickbay, there's a chance he'll live.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Stand away from the door. (enters the cell for a closer look) I will have you beamed aboard.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do what you can with him, Bones.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: McCoy and Tomar wheel Spock in on a trolley.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor, what happened?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Prepare two ccs of stokaline.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Stokaline? But, doctor, that's

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't argue, nurse. Just get it. (injects Spock) This may be the turning point. Prepare another shot.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chapel
Text: But, Doctor

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Please, nurse, just follow orders, will you?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Spock opens his eyes then shuts them again before she returns with the hypo. McCoy gives another injection as Tomar watches from a little distance.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There, that should do it. Just let him rest now. (to Tomar) You see, it's a flare-up of Rigelian Kassaba Fever. He suffered from it about ten years ago, and it recurs every now and then. There's no danger if he gets medication in time. He'll be all right in a couple of hours.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: Very well. I will inform Rojan. You will stay here.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want from me now?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: We will beam aboard the vessel shortly. I wish you to understand your duties.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My duty is to stop you in any way I can.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You will obey.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or you will kill more of my people?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Captain Kirk, I cannot believe that you do not understand the importance of my mission. We Kelvans have a code of honour. Harsh, demanding. It calls for much from us and much from those whom we conquer. You have been conquered. I respect your devotion to your duty, but I cannot permit it to interfere with mine.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Context: picking a flower and smelling it
Text: These are lovely. Captain Kirk, what is it you call them?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Flowers. I don't know the variety.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Our memory tapes tell us of such things on Kelvan. Crystals that form with such rapidity, they seem to grow. They look like this fragile thing somewhat. We call them Sahsheer.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A rose by any other name.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Captain?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A quote from a great human poet, Shakespeare. That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Drea has computed and laid a course for Kelva, Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We've jumped to warp eight.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: And we'll go faster yet. Increase speed to warp eleven.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Increase speed to warp eleven, Mister Chekov.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Drea
Text: On course and proceeding as planned. We will approach the barrier within an hour.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Very well.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rojan, I'm going to sickbay. My first officer was taken ill.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Yes, I was informed. You may go.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've located their power source, captain. It's installed in Engineering.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're just going to jam it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've tied in all the lab computers. That will give it a bit more power to push with.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Scott and Spock are in the upper gallery, while Kirk is apparently talking to Tomar below in main engineering. There is a rounded metal object on the console.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is it. Now all we have to do

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whatever it is we must do, it is impossible.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Why?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: This material surrounding the projector is the same as I discovered on the planet. Readings indicate it is impervious to any of our weapons. We cannot penetrate the casing to get to the machine.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's it, then.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is one other possibility, Mister Scott. The final decision, of course, must be the captain's, but I believe we must have it ready for him. The Enterprise is propelled by matter-anti-matter reactors. The barrier we must traverse is negative energy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I see what you're getting at. I can't say I like it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor I. But it must be made available to the captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Spock and Scott meet up with Kirk.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Drea
Text: Captain Kirk to the bridge, please.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible, Captain. The power source is protected by a material we cannot breach even with our phasers. Mister Scott and I have prepared the means for the only logical alternative available to us.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What alternative?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: The barrier we must penetrate is composed of negative energy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I have opened the control valves to the matter-anti-matter nacelles. On your signal, I will flood them with positive energy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: When we engage the barrier, the ship will explode. The Kelvans will be stopped here.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: And so will we.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you mad? I can't just

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The turbolift arrives.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Take your places, gentlemen. We're approaching the barrier.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kirk takes the Captain's chair, Spock and Scott their consoles. As the barrier approaches, Scott's finger is poised over a flashing button.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4658.9. With The Enterprise under control of the Kelvans, we are approaching the energy barrier at the edge of our galaxy. Spock and Scotty have devised a suicide plan to stop the Kelvans. They have rigged the ship to explode on my signal.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reading, Spock.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors indicate density negative, radiation negative, energy negative. (Kirk starts chewing his nails with indecision) All instruments off the dials, Captain. We are in contact with the barrier.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Outside hull temperatures rising, sir. It's over two thousand degrees now. Sir?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold your position.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Scott throws switches to stop the button flashing. The ship starts shaking as it passes through the barrier into intergalactic space.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We made it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Instruments returning to normal, Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks report. Damage and casualties.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Several systems out, sir. Operating on emergency backup. None affect flight procedure.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Life support systems sustaining on emergency.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'll have a full report on ship's status for you in a moment, sir.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Your people are most efficient, Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. So are yours.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Hanar, start the neutralising operation.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Hanar leaves.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What neutralising operation?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You humans are troublesome for us. We needed you to get us through the barrier. But there aren't enough of us to efficiently guard all of you of the time. Further, the food synthesisers cannot manufacture enough food for the entire journey. We are therefore neutralising all nonessential personnel.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: The procedure is already underway. Now, as to bridge personnel. Drea? We have no need for communication.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Uhura is reduced to a block of salts.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: And since Drea is capable of handling the ship from here on.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Bye, Chekov and other crew.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kirk is walking along when he comes across a cluster of blocks and some instruments on the floor.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Do you not agree that this is better thing for them than exploding the ship as your engineer had thought to do? We detected it, of course. Tomar has devised a mechanism to prevent any further tampering. Please accept your situation, Captain. It will make things much less painful.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this all?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have reviewed ship's personnel, Captain. It appears we four are the only ones the Kelvans consider essential.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty tells me you could've destroyed the ship in the barrier. Why didn't you?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I couldn't.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But that was our only chance to stop them

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't think it was.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, that's enough!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I saw them reduce four of my doctors and nurses into those little

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They've reduced the whole crew! (thumps table in anger)

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: I do not understand why you take the trouble to consume this bulk material to sustain yourselves. (holds up a pill box) We have ascertained that these contain all the nutritional elements.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Before you condemn it, why not try it?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: I believe I will. Assist me.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's your idea, Doctor. Go ahead.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All right, I'll show you how to work the selector.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He gets a tray of food for Tomar and sits him down at another table. Tomar takes a cautious mouthful.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Context: whispering
Text: Sir, why don't we try again to knock out the paralysis projector? I know the casing looks impenetrable, but I may be able to do something.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Even if we could, it's out of the question. We need that projector to bring our people back to human form.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then how will we stop the Kelvans?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: They look over at Tomar, who is enjoying his meal.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: It's quite good.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm delighted.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most curious.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: The isolated glimpses of things I saw when I touched Kelinda's mind are beginning to coalesce in my consciousness. The Kelvans have superior intellectual capacity. To achieve it, they have apparently sacrificed anything which would tend to distract them. Perceptive senses such as taste, touch, smell, and, of course, emotions.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But then Tomar shouldn't be enjoying the taste of his food.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Quite correct, Captain. But they have taken human form and are therefore having human reaction.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If he keeps reacting like that, he's going to need a diet.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If they all respond to stimulation of the senses, then maybe we can distract them. They can't have been able to handle the senses yet. If we can confuse them enough, we can get those devices from their belts.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: That seems reasonable.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. It may be our only chance. Look for any way to stimulate the senses.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can think of one way right off. (goes over to Tomar) Lad, you're going to need something to wash that down with. Have you ever tried any Saurian brandy?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: McCoy is examining Hanar.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know about that.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Please articulate.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that body of yours is a bit anaemic. Comes from taking food in pills instead of solid sustenance.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: What are you doing?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm going to give you a shot. High-potency vitamin concentrate. You'll need three a day for a few days. And eat some solid food, will you?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The brandy bottle is empty, and the two men are full of alcohol.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: No more.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kelinda is at a desk, apparently working.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Am I disturbing you?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: What is it you wish?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wish to apologise.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I don't understand, Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For hitting you. I'm sorry.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: That is not necessary. You attempted to escape as we would have.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well, I don't usually go around beating up beautiful women.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Why not?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, there are better things for men and women to do.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Like what?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He strokes her collar bone.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this where I hit you?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: No, the other side.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh. I'm sorry. (he kisses it) Is that better?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Better? Was it intended as a remedy?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: And gives her a full-on kiss with embrace.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Is there some significance to this action?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, among humans, it's meant to express warmth and love.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Oh. You are trying to seduce me. I have been studying you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Me?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: All humans. This business of love. You have devoted much literature to it. Why do you build such a mystique around a simple biological function?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We enjoy it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: The literature?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kelinda, I'm sorry I brought up the whole subject.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Do you really regard this touching of the lips as pleasurable?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I did.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Curious. Let me try.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: She kisses him, and Rojan enters.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Is there some problem, Captain?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not when I came in.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kirk leaves

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: What did he want here?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: He came to apologise for hitting me. Apparently it involves some peculiar touching contact.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: In what manner? (she kisses him) Very odd creatures, these humans.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Another bottle has been emptied.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: Do you have more?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not of this.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: Anything.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Spock and Rojan are playing 3D chess.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Humans are very peculiar. I often find them unfathomable, but an interesting psychological study.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Well, I do not understand this business of pressing with the lips to apologise.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe you're referring to a kiss. But it is my understanding that such apologies are usually exchanged between people who have some affection for each other.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Kelinda has no affection for Captain Kirk.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your game is off. Are you disturbed by the incident?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Why should I be disturbed?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: You've known Kelinda for some time. She's a Kelvan as you are. Among humans, I've found the symptoms you're displaying usually indicate jealousy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I have no reason for such a reaction. Kelinda's a female, nothing more.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk seems to find her quite attractive.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Well, of course she is!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: You are not jealous?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: No!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor upset?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Certainly not.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Checkmate.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I found this on Ganymood, er, Ganymede.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: What is it?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, it's, er. (peers at it, sniffs it) It's green.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kelinda is preening herself in front of a mirror when Rojan walks in.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Kelinda, I've been thinking.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Yes?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I do not wish you to fraternise with any of the humans.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Why not?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Well, they, they offer such strange ideas. They're not meant for us. Not for Kelvans.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Have you given this order to the others?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: No. And I wish you to particularly avoid Captain Kirk.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I will not. You have told me over and over again, humans are no threat to us. We are superior. I will do as I please.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You will do as I say, or I will neutralise your Captain Kirk and all the other humans as well.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He has taken a rather firm hold of her arm.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Hanar is having another vitamin shot.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: How many more of these?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, now, let's see. You've had three shots. I think you better stay on them for a few days, and then we'll see how you're responding.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: I see no reason for you to refer to yourself in the plural.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: You have more?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: All I have is a bottle of very, very, very old Scotch. Whisky!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: I will try it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll get it! (takes the helmet off a breastplate and reaches in, removing a very dusty bottle.) I was saving you for

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: What?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: Never mind. Gie us your glass.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The thing is, I can't tell if we're getting anywhere. And I haven't seen Scotty in hours.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We haven't seen Tomar either. But my man Hanar is getting more irritable by the minute. I'm giving him shots of formazine. That should have him climbing the walls.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rojan has exhibited symptoms of jealousy.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kelinda enters.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I would like to speak with you, Captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I'm due for another injection of stokaline.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hmm?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stokaline.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh. You will pardon us.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Spock and McCoy leave.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You had something to say?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Yes. This cultural mystique surrounding the biological function.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: You realise humans are overly preoccupied with the subject.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. We do think a great deal about it.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I've done some supplemental reading on it, and, er

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a question?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: Yes. I was wondering, would you please apologise to me again?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Kirk smiles broadly.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: Rojan, I want to talk to you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Very well.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: First, I do not like the way responsibility and duty has been portioned out to us.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: It's the way your duties have always been assigned.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: That is my second quarrel with you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Hanar!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Hanar
Text: And further, I do not care much for the way you run this ship.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Hanar, confine yourself to your quarters!

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Hanar storms off the bridge, and Rojan hits the arm of the Captain's chair. Drea stares.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: There's a whole lot of smooching going on.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Context: coming up for air
Text: Rojan has forbidden me to see you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's too bad. Why do you defy him?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: It's not a question of defiance. We were told to find out everything we could about you.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Huh. And how's the research going?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I need some more experiments.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: She's getting the hang of kissing.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Mister Spock, you were not ordered to the bridge. What is your purpose here?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Automatic sensors and various other recording devices require monitoring and periodic adjustments.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Very well. Proceed. Have you seen Captain Kirk?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you wish, I shall call him to the bridge.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: No. I was wondering where he was.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: I left him in the recreation room.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: He was alone then.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Kelinda was with him. She seemed anxious to speak to him.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I told her to stay away from him.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would appear, sir, that you have little control over her. Or perhaps Captain Kirk has more.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Rojan leaves the bridge.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: The last drops of Scotch go into Tomar's glass.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Tomar
Text: Very interesting. But I feel rather strange.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He makes some jerking motions then falls off his chair onto the floor.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Scott
Text: We did it, you and me. Put him right under the table. (takes the paralyser off Tomar's belt) I'll take this to the captain.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He gets to the door, then stops and gently falls back against the wall. He slides to the floor, as out of it as Tomar is.

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Rojan breaks up the kissing session.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Kelinda, I told you to avoid this human.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: I did not wish to.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I am your commander.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not enough, Rojan.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You did this to her, corrupted her, turned her away from me!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you can't keep her, that's not my problem.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You will release her!

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: Rojan drags Kirk away from Kalinda. Kirk slaps him across the face, twice. Finally he has goaded him into a fight.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why don't you use your paralyser? You thought I was taking your woman away from you. You're jealous! You tried to kill me with your bare hands. Would a Kelvan do that? Would he have to? You're reacting with the emotions of a human. You are a human.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: No, I cannot be!

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: He throws off Kirk, into the arms of Spock and McCoy who are entering the room.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm stimulating him. (McCoy pushes him back into the fight.) You have no choice. To use this ship, you have to use our form and now you're stuck with it, you and your descendants, for the next three hundred years.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You fool. These bodies are tools. We remain Kelvans!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look what's happened in the short time you've been exposed to us. What do you think will happen in three centuries? When this ship gets to Kelva, the people on it will be human. They'll be aliens. Enemies!

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: We have a duty, our mission. We've got to accomplish any way we can.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your mission is to find new worlds for your people to live in. You can still do that. We can bring this problem to the Federation. There are many planets in this galaxy that can be inhabited.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: You would really do that? You would extend welcome to invaders?

Title: By Any Other Name
Context: They finally stop fighting.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. But we would welcome friends.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rojan, you are only a link in a chain, following an order given three hundred years ago. This is an opportunity for you to establish a destiny of your own.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Perhaps. Perhaps it could be done.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Spock
Text: A robot ship could be sent to Kelva with the Federation proposal.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: But if we retain this form, where could we find a place?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Seems to me that little planet you were on is kind of nice.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: And you. You would wish to remain with him?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kelinda
Text: He's most interesting, but I wish to go with you. I believe I owe you an apology. (she kisses Rojan) It's most pleasurable.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Yes. Very curious.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You see, Rojan, being human does have certain advantages. Being able to appreciate the beauty of a flower or a woman.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: Bridge, this is Rojan.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Drea
Text: Yes, Commander.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Rojan
Text: I'm returning command of the ship to Captain Kirk. You will follow his orders.

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Drea
Text: Sir?

Title: By Any Other Name
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Turn the ship around. We're going home.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The reading's growing stronger, Captain. Coming from a star system directly ahead.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It's not a signal, sir. It does not seem to even exist, and yet it's affecting all my channels.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Someone or something is attempting to attract our attention.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Someone or something has succeeded. Our distress signal relays have been activated. We've been given a direction to follow, but how? What's causing it?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know. Not even a Vulcan can know the unknown, Captain. We are hundreds of light years past where any Earth ship has ever explored.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Planet dead ahead, Captain. Becoming visual.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: There's a yellow and gold planet on the viewscreen.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Class M planet, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Close to Earth conditions.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: With two very important exceptions. It's much older than Earth, and about a half million years ago, its atmosphere was totally ripped away by some sort of cataclysm. The planet has evidently been dead since then. Sensors detect no life of any kind.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: All of your questions will be answered in time, Captain Kirk.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Are your hailing frequencies open?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I am Sargon. It is the energy of my thoughts which has touched your instruments and directed you here. Now with this closer distance I can speak to you at last.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you, Sargon?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Please assume a standard orbit about our planet, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that a request or demand?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: The choice is yours. I read what is in your mind. Words are unnecessary.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The planet is dead. There's no possibility of life there as we understand life.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: And I am as dead as my planet. Does that frighten you, James Kirk? For if it does, if you let what is left of me perish, then all of you, my children, all of mankind must perish, too.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log. Stardate 4768.3. The Enterprise is in orbit above a planet whose surface, our sensors tell us, is devoid of all life, a world destroyed and dead for at least a half million years. Yet from it comes a voice, the energy of pure thought, telling us something has survived here for those thousands of centuries.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Context: dictating log
Text: Since exploration and contact with alien intelligences is our primary mission, I've decided to risk the potential dangers and resume contact. Log entry out. How long before Starfleet receives that?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Over three weeks at this distance, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Got something?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors registering some form of energy deep inside the planet.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Your probes have touched me, Mister Spock.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reading energy only, Captain. No life forms.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I have locked your transporter device on my co-ordinates. Please come to us. Rescue us from oblivion.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Coming from deep under the planet's surface, Captain. Under at least one hundred miles of solid rock.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I will make it possible for your transporter to beam you that deep beneath the surface. Have no fear.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reading a chamber now. Oxygen-nitrogen atmosphere, suitable for human life support.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, have Doctor McCoy report to the transporter room in ten minutes with standard landing party equipment.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I do wish to inspect whatever this is that lived that long ago.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And I would like to have my science officer with me on something as unusual as this, but it is full of unknowns and we can't risk both of us being off the ship.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The lights go out.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All power gone, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On the other hand, perhaps this Sargon would like you to come with us.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Power is restored.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All normal. No damage at all.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Will you transport down with us, Mister Spock?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, you have the conn.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, why no briefing on this? I'd at least like to know what we're getting into.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Easy, Bones. As long as you know there's something down there, you know as much as we do. The rest is only guesses.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't like it, sir. The transporter co-ordinates preset by an alien of some sort. You could materialise inside solid rock.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Inside solid rock?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unlikely. These co-ordinates correspond with the location of the subterranean chamber.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have a feeling that they or it could destroy us just standing here if they or it wanted to.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: They or it?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Doctor Ann Mulhall, Astro-biology. Well, I was ordered to report here for landing party duty.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By whom?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Strange, I'm not sure. Well, I'm not a liar, Captain. I did receive an order to report here for duty.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sure she did, Captain, Just as you received an order to bring me along.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let's get back to this solid rock business. Just how much rock are we going to go through?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approximately one hundred twelve point three seven miles, Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Miles? Are you joking?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, we're not. Let's go.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Please stand ready. I will operate your controls.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor, if you prefer to stay behind?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. No, if I'd be useful, as long as you're going down, I might as well take a medical look at whatever this is.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The landing party and two guards gather on the pads, Scotty stands sulking with arms crossed as the transporter activates, and just sends the four officers somewhere.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the security guards.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can you read me, Captain?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Scotty, and I shouldn't be able to this deep inside the planet, but perhaps this has been arranged for us, too. Is the security guard up there?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're fine. They Just didn't dematerialise.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't like it, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No problem yet. Maintain alert. Kirk out.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Atmosphere report, Captain. A fraction richer in oxygen than usual for us, but otherwise normal.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: This vault was constructed about a half a million years ago. About the same time the planet surface was destroyed, if our sensor readings are accurate.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Composition of walls?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're an alloy or substance completely unknown to me. Much stronger and harder than anything I've measured before.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: All readings are off the scale, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The air seems fresh. It must be re-circulated somehow.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that for us, or does it need fresh air?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: A panel slides back to reveal a much larger area, with rock walls, and a glowing sphere elegantly poised on an angled support.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Context: the glowing sphere
Text: Welcome. I am Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sargon, would it harm you if I

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: You may use your tricorder, Mister Spock. Your readings will show energy but no substance. Sealed in this receptacle is the essence of my mind.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Pure energy. Matter without form.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Impossible.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But you once had a body of some type?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: A body much as yours, my children, although our minds were infinitely greater.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's twice you've referred to us as my children.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Because it is possible you are our descendants, Captain Kirk. Six thousand centuries ago, our vessels were colonising this galaxy, just as your own starships have now begun to explore that vastness. As you now leave your own seed on distant planets, so we left our seed behind us. Perhaps your own legends of an Adam and an Eve were two of our travellers.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Our beliefs and our studies indicate that life on our planet, Earth, evolved independently.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would tend, however, to explain certain elements of Vulcan prehistory.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: In either case, I do not know. It was so long ago, and the records of our travels were lost in the cataclysm which we loosened upon ourselves.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A war?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: A struggle for such goals and the unleashing of such power that you could not comprehend.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then perhaps your intelligence wasn't so great, Sargon. We faced a similar crisis in our early nuclear age. We found the wisdom not to destroy ourselves.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: And we survived our primitive nuclear era, my son. But there comes to all races an ultimate crisis which you have yet to face.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: One day our minds became so powerful, we dared think of ourselves as gods.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said you wanted our help. What is it you wish?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Kirk staggers back slightly, then there is a high-pitched sound as his head is flung back.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just a moment, Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where's our captain? Where's Jim Kirk?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He is unharmed. I have taken his body to demonstrate

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: drawing his phaser
Text: I won't go along with this. Back to where you were, Sargon, or whatever you are.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: And if he refuses, Doctor, what do you propose to do with your phaser? That is still Jim's body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Kirk convulses briefly, and the sphere has dimmed a lot.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lungs filled with air again. To see again. Heart pumping, arteries surging with blood again. A half a million years. To be again. Your captain has an excellent body, Doctor McCoy. I compliment you both on the condition in which you maintained it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: What are your plans for it? Can you exchange places again when you wish?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have no fear. Your captain is quite unharmed, although his mind generates insufficient energy for him to speak from there as I do.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Yes, I have the same readings.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you aware of what's happening to his body? Heart action doubled, temperature a hundred and four degrees?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: He'll die if you don't leave his body. Soon!

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is it you want of us?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In the next room, there are other receptacles. The other two of us that survived. You, Doctor Ann Mulhall, and you, Mister Spock, we require your bodies also. We must have Captain Kirk and you so that we may live again.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: There are a group of boxes on the wall, containing spheres. Only two are alight.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Even for us, a half million years is almost too long to wait. Two others still survive. Henoch and Thalassa. Thalassa, my Thalassa. I am pleased you survived with me. Forgive me. It has been so very long.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: When the struggle came which devastated your planet

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Only the best minds were chosen to survive. Thalassa, my wife, as you may have guessed. Henoch, from the other side. Realising our mistake, we attempted to perpetuate both sides. We built this chamber here in order to preserve our essence in this fashion.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We knew the seed that we had planted on other planets would take root, that one day you would build vessels as we did, and one day you would come here.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: These others, they were stored differently than you, but it was your task to remain in the receptacle out there KIRK: and search the heavens with my mind, probing, waiting, probing. And then one day my mind touched your vessel and brought you here.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: So you could steal our bodies from us?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To steal? To take them from you? No, no, my children, you misunderstand. We mean only that you should lend us your bodies for a short time.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And destroy them, just as you're burning that one up now. Heartbeat's two hundred and sixty two, Spock. Entire metabolic rate correspondingly high.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will return your captain to you before the body limit has been reached.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our bodies, Sargon, for what purpose?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To build. To build humanoid robots. We must borrow your bodies long enough to have the use of your hands, your fingers.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you intend to construct mechanical bodies, move your minds into them, and then return our bodies to us.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: We have engineers, technicians. Why can't they build your robots for you?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Our methods, our skills are far beyond your abilities. It is time.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: They help him back to Sargon's sphere.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Kirk briefly convulses with pain, then the sphere glows bright again, and he falls to his knees.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is it you, Jim? (a nod) Good, his metabolic rate is back to normal.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, do you know what happened? Do you remember any part of it?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Sargon borrowed my body. I was floating in time and space.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He doesn't appear to be harmed. Physically, anyway.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I remember. When Sargon and I exchanged, as we passed each other, for an instant we were one. I know him now. I know what he is and what he wants, and I don't fear him.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's the most ridiculous statement I've ever heard. An alien practically hijacks your body and then corks you into a bottle and

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: I'm afraid that I must agree with Doctor McCoy. You could be suffering from a form of false euphoria.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I understand, my son. Go to your vessel. All who are involved must agree to this. After all these centuries, we can wait a few more hours.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And what if we should decide against you?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Then you may go as freely as you came.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: You're going to what? Are they all right in the head, Doctor?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No comment.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A simple transference. Their minds and ours.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Quite simple. Happens every day.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, I need your approval, too. Since you'll work with them, furnishing them all they need to make the android robots.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Narrator
Text: You won't be working with them, you'll be working with us, our bodies. They'll be inside us, and we'll be

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It all seems rather indecent to me.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: I'm not so certain of that, Doctor. It is scientifically fascinating.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Once inside their mechanical bodies, engineer, they can leave this planet, travel back with us. With their knowledge, mankind could leap ahead ten thousand years.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, they'll show us medical advances, miracles you never dreamed possible. Scotty, engineering advances. Vessels this size with engines the size of walnuts.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ach! You're joking.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, he's not.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're giants, and we're insects beside them. They could destroy us without meaning to. And all he wants is the body of our captain and our second in command, too. Coincidence?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They selected us as the most compatible bodies.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's your attitude on that, Doctor?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Well, if we all agree, I'm willing to host Thalassa's mind. I'm a scientist. The opportunity is an extraordinary one for experimentation, observation.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: A starship engine the size of a walnut? That's impossible. But I don't suppose there'd be any harm in looking over diagrams on it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? You could stop all this by saying no. That's why I called you all here together. We'll all be deeply involved. It must be unanimous.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then I'll still want one question answered to my satisfaction. Why? Not a list of possible miracles, but a simple basic understandable why that overrides all danger. And let's not kid ourselves that there is no potential danger in this.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They used to say if man could fly, he'd have wings. But he did fly. He discovered he had to. Do you wish that the first Apollo mission hadn't reached the moon, or that we hadn't gone on to Mars and then to the nearest star? That's like saying you wish that you still operated with scalpels and sewed your patients up with catgut like your great-great-great-great-grandfather used to. I'm in command. I could order this. But I'm not because, Doctor McCoy is right in pointing out the enormous danger potential in any contact with life and intelligence as fantastically advanced as this. But I must point out that the possibilities, the potential for knowledge and advancement is equally great. Risk. Risk is our business. That's what the starship is all about. That's why we're aboard her. You may dissent without prejudice. Do I hear a negative vote? (silence around the table) Engineer, stand by to beam aboard three receptacles.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The three volunteers are lying on beds, with the spheres on tables beside them.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The extreme power of the alien mind will drive the heart action dangerously high, and The body functions will race many times their normal metabolism, so we're going to have to monitor this very carefully.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I guess we're as ready as we'll ever be, Jim.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready, Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The spheres emit a brilliant light, the patients twitch, then the spheres dim.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Context: with echoy Sargon voice
Text: The transference is complete.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Metabolic rate is double and rising, Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Context: with a grin and echoy voice
Text: Hello. Oh, you are a lovely female. A pleasant sight to wake up to after half a million years.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Thank you.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're welcome.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Context: echoy
Text: I'd forgotten what it felt like even to breathe again. Sargon?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Here. In this body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: I am not displeased, my husband. Your body is not unlike that which was your own.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And I too am pleased, beloved.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: After so long. So very long.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kiss.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: So they do.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is an excellent body, Doctor. I seem to have received the best of the three. Strength, hearing, eyesight, all far above your human norms. I'm surprised the Vulcans never conquered your race.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Vulcans worship peace above all, Henoch.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, of course, Just as we do, Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Mulhall/Thalassa collapses and they help her back onto the bed.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse!

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Then Kirk/Sargon gets dizzy.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Henoch, you'd better get back to bed too.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will be unnecessary, Doctor. This Vulcan body is accustomed to the higher metabolism.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sargon, it won't work. You've got to get out before you kill them.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will vacate at once until you can administer a metabolic reduction injection.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A what?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll prepare the formula, Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Henoch, your condition?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can continue in this body for several hours.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fortunate. We will vacate at once.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: And they are as good as their word.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: This woman will assist me. (to Chapel) You will take me to your pharmacology laboratory.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: They leave.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It was close, Jim. You both barely got back alive. Unless the formula works, we can't risk it again.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now. this formula will reduce the heart action and the bodily functions to normal. While the bodies are occupied, you will administer one injection of ten cc's each hour.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I understand.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: This hypo you will code mark for Thalassa. And this one you will code mark for me.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: This one you will administer to Captain Kirk while Sargon is in his body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: This hypo does not contain the same formula.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, that's correct. But since I will arrange for you to administer each of the injections, no one else will notice.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Without the same formula, Captain Kirk will die.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: He touches her forehead.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: What were you saying?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I. I was. I wanted to say something. I've forgotten what it was.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Well, you were about to say that you watched me prepare the formula and fill each of the hypos.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, that, that was it. I will inform Doctor McCoy that each is properly filled for each patient.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very good. You see, Sargon would not permit me to keep this body. It is therefore necessary for you to kill your captain so that Sargon will die with him.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Enterprise Medical Log. Stardate 4769.1. Three alien minds now inhabit the bodies of Captain Kirk, Science Officer Spock, and Doctor Ann Mulhall.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As planned, the construction of android robots is underway. All is proceeding as expected and as promised. I can find no reason for concern, but yet I am filled with foreboding.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Sargon and Thalassa are working, when their hands touch.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Sargon, I remember a day long ago. We sat beside a silver lake. The air was scented with the flowers of our planet.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I remember. You held my hand like this.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: He kisses it, as Spock comes in.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think it best not to remember so well.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: In two days, you'll have your own hands, Thalassa. Mechanically efficient and quite human-looking. Android robot hands, of course. Hands without feeling. Enjoy the taste of life while you can.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our minds will have survived. And as androids, we can move among the people who do live, teaching them, helping them not to make the errors we did.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: What is it, Sargon?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing. Our next injection will renovate me. Do not be concerned.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Chapel is holding the hypos and trying to remember something very important.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse, how are the last metabolic readings on our patients?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: You'll find them excellent, Doctor. Well within normal.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is something wrong, Miss Chapel?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Er, yes. I, er, I had something to say. I can't seem to remember.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Regarding our patients?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes. That must be it. I am so pleased the way they are responding, Doctor. The formula's working perfectly.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You look tired, Miss Chapel. Perhaps you'd care for me to administer the last few injections.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Tired? Well, not at all, Doctor. Thank you for asking.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Leaves a puzzled McCoy.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Mulhall/Thalassa is looking at her reflection in a metallic surface when Scott comes in with a small doo-dad.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Thank you. Have you prepared the negaton hydracoils for the drawing Sargon supplied?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: For all the good it'll do you. It's a fancy name, but how will something that looks like a drop of jelly make this thing work? You'll need microgears and a pulley that does what a muscle does.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: That would be highly inefficient.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Scott
Text: I tell you, lady, this thing won't work.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will have twice the strength and agility of your body, engineer, and will last a thousand years. That is, assuming you'll stop wasting your time and allow us to complete it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Scott leaves as 'Spock' laughs.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: A thousand-year prison, Thalassa. And when it wears out we'll build another one, and we'll lock ourselves into it for another thousand years. And another, and another. Sargon has closed his mind to a better way. With these bodies.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: They're not ours, Henoch.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: When you awoke in this body, Thalassa, you said how good it was to breathe again, to have eyes and to see again. To feel. To live and feel again, Thalassa. Just think how much we can do for mankind. Are these bodies too much to ask for in return? Would you prefer this?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: No. I'm beginning to hate it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: She rushes out, and 'Spock' smirks.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay. McCoy.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sargon here, McCoy. I'm in your deck six briefing room.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Mulhall enters.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You sound terrible. Wait there for me.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Sargon, what is it?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing of importance. Fatigue perhaps.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: She sees what is on the monitor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Henoch's formula.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I wanted to be certain there was no error. Formula is correct. Don't be concerned. It is an excellent body. There. You see? I feel better already.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: In time, a host body will become accustomed to us, husband. Injections will no longer be necessary.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That will take months, perhaps years. We haven't that choice, Thalassa.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Husband. Feel the touch of my hand, husband.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, beloved. If we torment ourselves

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Beloved. What will that word mean to a machine?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our thoughts will intertwine.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Will they, husband? Will they intertwine like this? Can two minds press close like this? Can robot lips do this? (they kiss, then Kirk falls gently to the floor) Sargon, what is it?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: McCoy and Chapel enter.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hypo.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Doctor, help him!

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Medical Log. Stardate 4770.3. Do I list one death or two? When Kirk's body died, Sargon was too far distant from his receptacle to transfer back. Sargon is dead. But is Captain Kirk dead? His body is, but his consciousness is still in the receptacle into which it was transferred earlier.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The medical team hook Kirk's body up to a life support machine.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Nurse
Text: All his vital organs are now working, Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, we can keep them going for a few weeks, or a month. For all the good it'll do.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: There is a shiny plastic person on the table now.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Why pretend to work on that thing, Henoch? You know you never intended to leave Spock's body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
