Text: This is your new home, Thalassa. Once occupied, I'll add female features and some texturing. You no doubt want the mechanism to at least appear to be a woman. (he tests its hand movement.) It is ready, Thalassa.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: No!

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have no excuse to keep the real body any longer. Sargon would've required that you enter the mechanism immediately.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: I cannot live in that thing.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Would you like to save your Captain Kirk?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But you said that was impossible.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: We have many powers Sargon did not permit us to use. He thought them too tempting to us. This body pleases me. I intend to keep it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I see. And Henoch intends to keep Spock's body, of course.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Henoch's plans are his own affair. I wish only to exist in peace as a living woman.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you're asking my approval

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: I require only your silence. Only you and I will know that Doctor Mulhall has not returned to her body. Isn't that worth your captain's life? Doctor, we can take what we wish. Neither you, this ship, nor worlds have the power to stop us.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Neither Jim nor I can trade a body we don't own. It happens to belong to a young woman.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Who you hardly know. Almost a stranger to you.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I will not peddle flesh. I'm a physician.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: A physician? In contrast to what we are, you are a prancing, savage medicine man. You dare defy one you should be on your knees worshipping? I could destroy you with a single thought.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: McCoy is suddenly writhing in pain as he is surrounded by flames.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Stop! (the flames are gone) Sargon was right. The temptations within a living body are too great. Forgive me.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I am pleased, my beloved. It is good you have found the truth yourself.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Sargon? Where are you? I thought you destroyed by Henoch.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I have power even Henoch does not suspect, beloved.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Yes. Yes, I see. I understand. Just as we would have placed our consciousness within robots, Sargon has placed his into your vessel.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Doctor, leave us. Sargon has a plan. We have much work to do.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: McCoy leaves the room, and the door shuts and locks behind him. The ship shakes as he activates his desk monitor.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is Sickbay. Get me

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: The door opens, and Chapel walks out, staring blankly ahead.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse Chapel, what in the devil?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: He goes back into the ward.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim? Are you all right?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm fine, Bones.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thalassa?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: She is now with Sargon, Doctor. I'm Ann Mulhall, back in my own body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Then we see the three blackened and broken spheres.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, the receptacles. Spock's consciousness was in one of them.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was necessary.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are you talking about? There is no Spock to return to his body. You've killed a loyal officer, your best friend.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, prepare a hypo. The fastest, deadliest poison to Vulcans. Spock's consciousness is gone. We must kill his body, the thing in it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Uhura is screaming in terror before collapsing across her console. Chapel is standing rigid by the Captain's chair.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Must I make an example of you, too, Helm?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Kirk, Mulhall and McCoy enter.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Pain, Captain. And you, my dear?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: As Kirk and Mulhall double over, McCoy dashes to Spock's side, ready to inject him.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, Doctor, I know every thought of every mind around me. See? (to Chapel) Take the hypo from him. And inject him with it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: But she injects Spock/Henoch instead! He leaps from his seat.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fools. I'll simply transfer to another place, another body.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: He whirls around.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sargon! No, Sargon, please. Let me. Let me transfer.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: He falls to the floor and his victims are freed from their pain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. My friend Spock. If there'd only been another way.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: I could not allow your sacrifice of one so close to you.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Lights dim and glow, then Chapel wobbles.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Spock stands up.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're alive.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There was enough poison in that hypo to kill ten Vulcans.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: No, Doctor. I allowed you to believe that to be true so that Henoch would read your thoughts and believe it also.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sargon.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: It seems, Doctor, the injection was only enough to cause unconsciousness.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: But Henoch believed and fled the body. He is destroyed.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But your vessel was destroyed, too. Where was your consciousness kept?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Spock
Text: The place Henoch would least suspect, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: That is why I was summoned into Sickbay, Doctor. Mister Spock's consciousness was placed in me. We shared consciousness together.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: We now know we cannot permit ourselves to exist in your world, my children. Thalassa and I must now also depart into oblivion.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is there any way we can help you, Sargon?

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Sargon
Text: Yes, my son. You can allow Thalassa and me to share your bodies again. A last moment together.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: Mulhall nods, and they go over to the science station for the light trick and voice change.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Oblivion together does not frighten me, beloved. Promise we'll be together.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I promise, beloved.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Together forever.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forever beloved. Forever.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Context: They embrace and kiss, and the light thing happens again during it.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm sure that Sargon appreciated your co-operation, Doctor Mulhall.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Mulhall
Text: Yes. I was happy to co-operate, Captain.

Title: Return To Tomorrow
Speaker: Chapel
Text: It was beautiful.

Speaker: Isak
Text: For so long I've prayed for this. Now I'm sorry.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So is he.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Isak
Text: You've given us all a new chance.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Eneg
Text: Thank you, but go now. We must do the rest.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Daras
Text: Eneg and I will go on the air, offer a new way for our people. For all our people, both Zeons and Ekosians.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Eneg
Text: It is time to stop the bloodshed, to bury our dead.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I think the planet is in good hands.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain. With the union of two cultures, this system would make a fine addition to the Federation.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise here, Captain.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam us aboard.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I never will understand humans. How could a man as brilliant, a mind as logical as John Gill's, have made such a fatal error?

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He drew the wrong conclusion from history. The problem with the Nazis wasn't simply that their leaders were evil, psychotic men. They were, but the main problem, I think, was the leader principle.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What he's saying, Spock, is that a man who holds that much power, even with the best intentions, just can't resist the urge to play God.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Doctor. I was able to gather the meaning.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It also proves another Earth saying. Absolute power corrupts absolutely. Darn clever, these Earthmen, wouldn't you say?

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Earthmen like Ramses, Alexander, Caesar, Napoleon, Hitler, Lee Kuan. Your whole Earth history is made up of men seeking absolute power.

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, you obviously don't understand

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, Doctor, you fail to accept

Title: Patterns Of Force
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen. Gentlemen, we've just been through one civil war. Let's not start another. Mister Chekov, take us out of orbit. Warp factor two, and hurry.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Enterprise approaches a space station.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standard orbit, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not now, Leslie. Lieutenant, contact the space station.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the station is calling us.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Put them on.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Enwright
Text: Captain Kirk, this is Commodore Enwright.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Commodore, I'd like an explanation

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Enwright
Text: The explanation is beaming aboard now, Captain. He may already be in your transporter room.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: A silver-haired man in command gold has beamed in.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bob.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Are you surprised?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll say. Spock, this is

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore Wesley. How do you do, sir?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Ensign. You can go. Thank you very much. Would you mind telling me what this is all about?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Narrator
Text: I receive orders to proceed here. No reason given. I'm informed that my men will be removed to the space station, to a security holding area. I think I'm entitled to an explanation.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: You've had a singular honour conferred on you, Jim. You're going to be the fox in the hunt.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: War games. I'll be commanding the attack force against you.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An entire attack force against my ship?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Have you heard of the M-5 multitronic unit?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's Doctor Richard Daystrom's device, isn't it? Tell me about that.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The most ambitious computer complex ever created. Its purpose is to correlate all computer activity aboard a starship, to provide the ultimate in vessel operation and control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: How do you know so much about it, Commander?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I hold an A-7 computer expert classification, Commodore. I'm well acquainted with Doctor Daystrom's theories and discoveries. The basic design of all our ship's computers are Doctor Daystrom's.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What has all this got to do with the Enterprise?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: You've been chosen to test the M-5, Jim. There'll be a series of routine research and contact problems for the M-5 to solve, plus navigational manoeuvres and the war games problem. If the M-5 works under actual conditions as well as it has under simulated tests, it will mean a revolution in space technology as great as warp drive. When your crew has been removed, the ship's engineering section will be modified to contain the computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why remove my crew?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: They're not needed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much security does this gadget require?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: None. Doctor Daystrom will see to the installation himself and he'll supervise the tests. When he's ready, you'll receive your orders and proceed on the mission with a crew of twenty.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Twenty? I can't run a starship with twenty crew.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: The M-5 can.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what am I supposed to do?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: You've got a great job, Jim. All you have to do is sit back and let the machine do the work.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 4729.4. The M-5 computer has been installed on board ship, and we have left the space station for test manoeuvres.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't like it, Jim. A vessel this size cannot be run by one computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are attempting to prove it can run this ship more efficiently than man.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe you're trying to prove that, Spock, but don't count me in on it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The most unfortunate lack in current computer programming is that there is nothing available to immediately replace the starship surgeon.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Very funny. If it could, they wouldn't have to replace me. I'd resign because everybody else aboard would be nothing but circuits and memory banks. You know the type, Spock. Jim, you haven't had much to say about this.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want me to say? M-5 is an honour, they tell me. Well, I'm honoured.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is he? Scotty, where's Doctor Daystrom?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: He was here. (spots him behind a console) Doctor.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Context: an imposing black man
Text: Yes? Ah, you'd be Captain Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Daystrom, this is my first officer, Mister Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am honoured, Doctor.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Thank you. Thank you very much. Captain, I've finished my tests on the M-5, and it must be hooked into your main power plants in order to be operative.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, by all means, do so.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Your engineer there wouldn't allow us the power necessary without your orders.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, hook in the multitronic unit to the ship's main power banks.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Context: sullenly
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Mister Harper.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating, Doctor. This computer has a potential beyond anything you've ever done. Even your breakthrough in duotronics did not have the promise of this.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The M-5 has been perfected, Commander. Its potential is a fact.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Frankly, the only fact that I'm concerned about is if this thing doesn't work, there are not enough men aboard to run the ship. That's begging for trouble.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Now, who is this?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Doctor Leonard McCoy, senior medical officer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Well, I'm sorry, but this is a security area.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wouldn't worry, Doctor. Doctor McCoy has clearance throughout the ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Harper and Scott connect the unit, and the warp drives fluctuate.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is it supposed to do that?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I can be of assistance, Doctor.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: No, no, no. Thank you. I can manage. There's nothing wrong, Captain. Just a few minor settling-in adjustments to make. As you can see, all is in order now.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm curious, Doctor. Why is it called M-5 and not M-1?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Well, you see, the multitronic units one through four were not entirely successful. This one is. M-5 is ready to take control of the ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Total control?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: That is what it was designed for, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are certain things men must do to remain men. Your computer would take that away.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: There are other things a man like you might do. Or perhaps you object to the possible loss of prestige and ceremony accorded a starship captain. A computer can do your job and without all that.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll have to prove that to me, Doctor.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: That is what we're here for, isn't it, Captain?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Kirk's eyes narrow, and he leaves, followed by McCoy.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you see the love light in Spock's eyes? The right computer finally came along. What's the matter, Jim?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think that thing is wrong, and I don't know why.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think it's wrong, too, replacing men with mindless machines.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't mean that. I'm getting a Red Alert right here. (the back of his head) That thing is dangerous. I feel. (hesitates) Only a fool would stand in the way of progress, if this is progress. You have my psychological profiles. Am I afraid of losing my job to that computer?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, we've all seen the advances of mechanisation. After all, Daystrom did design the computers that run this ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Under human control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're all sorry for the other guy when he loses his job to a machine. When it comes to your job, that's different. And it always will be different.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Am I afraid of losing command to a computer? Daystrom's right. I can do a lot of other things. Am I afraid of losing the prestige and the power that goes with being a starship captain? Is that why I'm fighting it? Am I that petty?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, if you have the awareness to ask yourself that question, you don't need me to answer it for you. Why don't you ask James T. Kirk? He's a pretty honest guy.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: The Captain's Chair has a new box with two switches and two lights on it. Kirk flips the switches.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The M-5 computer is now disengaged.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're coming back on our original course, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: M-5 has performed admirably so far.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All it's done is make the required course changes and some simple turns. Mister Sulu and Mister Chekov could've done that with their eyes closed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Yes, but you see, the idea is they didn't have to do it. And you'll find it won't be necessary for you to regain control of the unit after it's completed each manoeuvre.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My orders are subject to my interpretation of how long the M-5 is in control. I'll run the ship in my own way, if you don't mind, Doctor Daystrom.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I am forced to agree with Doctor Daystrom. With the course information plotted into it, his computer could have brought us here as easily as the navigator. In fact, it might have been a further demonstration of M-5's capability.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You seem to enjoy trusting yourself to the computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enjoy, Captain? No. I'm merely gratified to see Doctor Daystrom's new unit execute everything required of it in such a highly efficient manner. M-5 is another distinguished triumph for his career.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Approaching Alpha Carinae Two. ETA five minutes.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Captain, your orders at this point are not open to interpretation. You must commit the M-5 to handle its approach, the orbit, and then to analyse data regarding landing party recommendations.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't mind, I'll make my own recommendations.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Well, if you feel you need the exercise, go on, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: M-5 is committed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Enterprise approaches the planet

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standard orbit, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the M-5 has calculated that. The orbit is already plotted.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standard orbit achieved, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The planet is class M, Captain. Oxygen-nitrogen atmosphere suitable for human life support. Two major land masses, a number of islands, life form readings.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, power shutdowns on deck four. Lights, environmental control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check it out, Scotty.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Context: handing over a computer disc
Text: M-5's readout, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, my recommendations are as follows. We send down general survey party, avoiding contact of all intelligent life on the planet's surface. The survey party will consist of myself, Doctor McCoy, Astrobiologist Phillips, Geologist Rawlins and Science Officer Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Play M-5's recommendations, won't you, Mister Spock?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Context: a male computer voice
Text: M-5 readout, planet Alpha Carinae Two. Class M, atmosphere, oxygen-nitrogen.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: The power's gone off on deck five.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Categorisation of life form readings recorded. Recommendations for general survey party. Science officer Spock, Astrobiologist Phillips, Geologist Carstairs.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, the only difference in reports and recommendations is the landing party personnel. That's only a matter of judgment.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Judgment, Captain?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the computer does not judge. It makes logical selections.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why pick Carstairs instead of Rawlins? Carstairs is an ensign, no experience. This is his first tour of duty. Rawlins is chief geologist.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Aren't you really more interested in why M-5 did not select you and Doctor McCoy? Well, let's find out anyway. M-5 tie-in.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Explanation for landing party recommendation.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: General survey party requires direction of science officer. Astrobiologist Phillips has surveyed twenty nine biologically similar planets. Geologist Carstairs served on merchant marine freighters in this area. Once visited planet on geology survey for mining company.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Why were the Captain and the Chief Medical Officer not included in recommendation?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Non-essential personnel.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I've located the source of the power shutdowns. It's the M-5 unit, sir. That thing's turning off systems all over the ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you located the malfunction, Doctor?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: As I suspected, it is not a malfunction. M-5 was merely shutting down power to areas of the ship that do not require it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Decks four and six are living quarters, are they not?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's correct.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: And currently unoccupied.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not familiar with these instruments, Doctor. You are using an entirely new type of control mechanism. However, it appears to me this unit is drawing more power than before.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Quite right. As the unit is called upon to do more work, it pulls more power to enable it to do what is required of it, just as the human body draws more energy to run than to stand still.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, this unit is not a human body. The computer can process information, but only the information which is put into it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Granted, it can work a thousand, a million times faster than the human brain, but it can't make a value judgment. It hasn't intuition. It can't think.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Can't you understand? The multitronic unit is a revolution in computer science. I designed the duotronic elements used in your ship right now, and I know they are as archaic as dinosaurs compared to the M-5. A whole new approach.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sensors are picking up a vessel paralleling our course, as yet unidentified.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right up.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing here, Bones?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All the Sickbay systems are shut down until such time as the M-5 is informed there are patients to be cared for.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, sensors report two contacts now. One on the port bow, one on the stern. Distance, two hundred thousand kilometres and closing.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Identification.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the M-5 unit has already identified the vessels as Federation starships Excalibur and Lexington.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are not scheduled for war games in this area. This may be a surprise attack as a problem for the M-5.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Priority message coming in, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on audio.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Enterprise from Commodore Wesley aboard the USS Lexington. (Daystrom enters the Bridge) This is an unscheduled M-5 drill. Repeat, this is an M-5 drill. Enterprise, acknowledge on this frequency.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Acknowledge, Lieutenant.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: M-5 has acknowledged for us, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then go to Red Alert.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. Captain, M-5 has

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Already sounded the Red Alert. All right, Mister Sulu, phasers one one hundredth power. No damage potential, just enough to nudge them.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers one one hundredth power, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Phaser hit on port deflector four, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Speed increasing to warp three. Turning now to one one two mark five. Phasers locking on target, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Enemy vessel closing with us.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Main phasers firing. A hit, sir. Two more.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Changing course to two eight mark four two.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Pavel feels as fed up and useless as Kirk as the machine does his job for him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers firing again.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Turning to one one three mark five. Warp four speed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Firing again.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attacking vessels are moving off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Moving back to original course and speed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report on damage sustained in mock attack.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Minor hit on deflector screen four. No appreciable damage.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Rather impressive display for a machine, wouldn't you say, Captain?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Evaluation of M-5 performance. It'll be necessary for the log.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ship reacted more rapidly than human control could have manoeuvred her. Tactics, deployment of weapons, all indicate an immense sophistication in computer control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Machine over man, Spock? It was impressive. It might even be practical.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Practical, Captain? Perhaps. But not desirable. Computers make excellent and efficient servants, but I have no wish to serve under them. Captain the starship also runs on loyalty to one man, and nothing can replace it, or him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, message now coming in from Commodore Wesley.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on visual.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: USS Enterprise from starships Lexington and Excalibur. Both ships report simulated hits in sufficient quantity and location to justify awarding the surprise engagement to Enterprise.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from general quarters.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Our compliments to the M-5 unit, and regards to Captain Dunsel. Wesley out.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Dunsel? Who the blazes is Captain Dunsel? (everyone else knows) What does it mean, Jim? (Kirk leaves the bridge) Spock? What does it mean?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Dunsel, Doctor, is a term used by midshipmen at Starfleet Academy. It refers to a part which serves no useful purpose.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Kirk is working on a device when McCoy comes in with a covered tray.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not interested in eating, Bones.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This isn't chicken soup. I may be just a ship's doctor, but I make a Finagle's Folly that's known from here to Orion. I strongly prescribe it, Jim.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: They each take a liqueur glass with dark green liquid.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've, I've never felt this way before. At odds with the ship. I sat there and watched my ship perform for a mass of circuits and relays, and felt useless. Unneeded. To Captain Dunsel.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To James T. Kirk, Captain of the Enterprise.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Doctor. (drinks) That's one of your better prescriptions.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Simple but effective.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you know the one, 'All I ask is a tall ship'?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's a line from a poem. A very old poem, isn't it?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: 20th century Earth. 'All I ask is a tall ship, and a star to steer by'. You could feel the wind at your back in those days. The sounds of the sea beneath you. And even if you take away the wind and the water, it's still the same. The ship is yours. You can feel her. And the stars are still there, Bones.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk to the bridge, please. Captain Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Another contact, Captain. A large, slow-moving vessel.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unidentified. This is not a drill.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, there's no response to any of our signals, but M-5 has given us an autorelay.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: M-5 has identified her, Captain. The Woden. Listed in Starfleet Registry as an old-style ore freighter converted to automation. No crew. Coming into visual range.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, deflector shields just came on.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Speed increasing to warp three, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, get Daystrom up here. Disengaging M-5 unit. Cut speed to warp one. Navigator, go to course one one three mark seven. I want that ship given a wide berth.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: She won't respond, sir. She's maintaining course.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Going to warp four, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, reverse engines. Slow us down.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Reverse thrusts will not engage, sir. Manual override isn't working either.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: No effect on any of the M-5 controls, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Fantastic machine, the M-5. No off switch.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Context: enters
Text: Captain, what is it?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These controls are locked. We can't disengage the computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, photon torpedoes locking on target. Full power.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Kirk leaps to Sulu's console and starts flicking switches.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I already tried, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Daystrom, release that computer control!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Photon torpedoes are fired, destroying the Woden.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Returning to original course and speed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: All systems report normal, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Normal? That thing's trying to tell us nothing has happened.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Disengage this computer now.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: There appears to be some defect in the control panel.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There certainly does. Your brilliant young computer just destroyed an ore freighter. In fact it went out of its way to destroy an ore freighter!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Fortunately it was only a robot ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it shouldn't have destroyed anything. There might just as easily have been a crew aboard that ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In which case you'd be guilty of murder.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Disengage the computer. Lieutenant, contact Starfleet Command. Tell them we are breaking off M-5 tests and returning to the space station. Come along, Doctor Daystrom, M-5 is out of a job.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Daystrom, let's turn this thing off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: But as he approaches the unit, he is thrown sideways by a green forcefield.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Force field?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: It's not my doing, Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say, Captain, that M-5 is not only capable of taking care of this ship, it is also capable of taking care of itself.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean it's not going to let any of us turn it off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain 's Log, stardate 4731.3. The M-5 multitronic unit has taken over total control of the Enterprise.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Doctor, you built this thing. How do you propose to turn it off?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: This exercise is a trial for M-5. A shakedown. We must expect minor difficulties, but I assure you they can be corrected.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Correct it after you release control of my ship.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: I can't.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I suggest we disconnect it at the source.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Give me a few moments with it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No! Stay here. All right, Scotty. Turn it off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Scott and an engineer get the device they use to attach M-5's power supply to the ship, and head over to the junction box. But as soon as the engineer steps in between M-5 and it's power, he is disintegrated.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That wasn't a minor difficulty. That wasn't a robot. That thing murdered one of my crewman and you tell me you can't turn it off?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: It wasn't a deliberate act. M-5's analysis told it it needed a new power source. The ensign simply got in the way.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And how long will it be before all of us simply get in the way?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: M-5 appears drawing power directly from the warp engines, tapping the matter-antimatter reserves.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: So now it has virtually unlimited power. Captain, what'll we do?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, Scotty, come with me.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The multitronic unit is drawing more and more power directly from the warp engines. The computer now controls all helm, navigation, and engineering functions.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And communications and fire control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll reach the rendezvous point for the war games within an hour. We must regain control of the ship by then.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is one possibility. The automatic helm navigation circuit relays might be disrupted from engineering level three.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. I can take them out and cut in the manual override from there.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: If Mister Spock helps me, maybe an hour.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make it less.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll get the man responsible in the first place. Where is Daystrom?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's with the M-5 unit, watching it. I think it surprised even him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most illogical. Of all people, he should have known how the computer would perform. Of course, the M-5 itself has not behaved logically.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Please, Spock, do me a favour and don't say it's fascinating.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. But it is interesting.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: McCoy rolls his eyes.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, that's got it, Mister Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Have you found a solution, a way to shut that thing off?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: You don't shut a child off when it makes a mistake. M-5 is growing, learning.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Learning to kill.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: To defend itself. It's quite a different thing. When a child is taught, it's programmed with simple instructions, and at some point, if its mind develops properly, it exceeds the sum of what it was taught, thinks independently.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That thing is a danger to us all. Now find some way to shut it off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: You can't understand. You're frightened because you can't understand it. I'm going to show you. I'm going to show all of you. It takes four hundred thirty people to man a starship. With this, you don't need anyone. One machine can do all those things they send men out to do now. Men no longer need die in space or on some alien world. Men can live and go on to achieve greater things than fact-finding and dying for galactic space, which is neither ours to give or to take. They can't understand. We don't want to destroy life, we want to save it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The biographical tape of Richard Daystrom.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you find anything?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not much, aside from the fact he's a genius.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Genius is an understatement. At the age of twenty four, he made the duotronic breakthrough that won him the Nobel and Zee-Magnes prizes.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In his early twenties, Jim. That's over a quarter of a century ago.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't that enough for one lifetime?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Maybe that's the trouble. Where do you go from up? You publish articles, you give lectures, then spend your life trying to recapture past glory.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, it's difficult. What's your point?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The M-1 through M-4, remember? Not entirely successful. That's the way Daystrom put it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Genius doesn't work on an assembly line basis. Did Einstein, Kazanga, or Sitar of Vulcan produce new and revolutionary theories on a regular schedule? You can't simply say, today I will be brilliant. No matter how long it took, he came out with multitronics. The M-5.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right. The government bought it, then Daystrom had to make it work. And he did. But according to Spock, it works illogically.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And he won't let Spock near it. What are you saying, that he's tampering with it, that he's making it act that way? Why?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, if a man had a child who'd gone antisocial, killed perhaps, he'd still tend to protect that child.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now he's got you talking about that machine like a personality.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm afraid that's the way he thinks about it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are ready, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Get Daystrom. We're on our way. Let's go.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: What is it, Captain?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're going to find out, Doctor. (At the foot of the Jefferies tube)

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott is ready to apply the circuit disrupter. As he does so, I shall trip the manual override into control.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good, go ahead.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: No! No, no, no. You can't take control from the M-5.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: He tries to get into the Jefferies tube, and Kirk struggles to restrain him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Daystrom, we're going to do our best.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: You can't do it. Now let me work with it for a while, please. Please.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's it, Mister Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Please, please!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Manual override is in control, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge, this is Kirk. Sulu?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Lieutenant Sulu here, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got helm and navigational control. Turn us about. Have Mister Chekov plot a course back to the space station.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Right away, sir. You heard him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I've been updating that course for hours.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: But they flip switches in vain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Helm to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, helm doesn't respond. Navigational controls still locked in by M-5.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Chekov.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Chekov here, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to the engineering station.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Examine the H two seven nine elements, also the G nine five systems.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, G nine five system appears dead.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: All indicators are dark.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Ensign.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: It appears, Captain, we've been doing what used to be called pursuing a wild goose. M-5 has rerouted helm and navigational controls, bypassing this primary system.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: But it was active. I'd stake all that I know that it was.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe that when M-5 discovered our tampering, it rerouted the controls, leaving this one active by simply sending through an electronic impulse at regular intervals.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Decoyed. It wanted us to waste our time.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: While it was getting ready for what? Spock?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know. It is not performing in a logical manner.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Daystrom. Doctor Daystrom, I want an answer right now. I'm tired of hearing about the M-5's new approach. What is it, exactly? What is it?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not mean to offend, sir, but it behaves with an almost human pattern.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Doctor?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Yes, quite right, Mister Spock. You see, one of the arguments against computers controlling ships was that they couldn't think like men.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your new approach?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Exactly. I've developed a method of impressing human engrams upon the computer circuits. The relays are not unlike the synapse of the brain. M-5 thinks, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, Mister Spock, to the bridge, please. Report to the bridge, please.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, sensors are picking up four Federation starships. M-5 is altering course to intercept.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The main attack force. The war games.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But M-5 doesn't know it's a game.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Correction, Bones. Those four ships don't know it's M-5's game. And M-5 is going to destroy them.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Four starships just like Enterprise are in formation as Kirk, Spock and McCoy arrive on the bridge.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise to USS Lexington. Come in, Lexington. Sir, I can't raise them. M-5 is blocking all frequencies, including automatic distress. Just a minute, sir. Captain, I'm getting audio signal from the Lexington.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Enterprise from USS Lexington. This is an M-5 drill. Repeat. This is an M-5 drill. Acknowledge.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, M-5 is acknowledging.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Daystrom, does M-5 understand that this is only a drill?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Of course. It was programmed to understand, Captain. The ore ship was a miscalculation, an accident. I don't know

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, deflector shield just came on. Speed increasing to warp four.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers locking on lead ship, sir. Power levels at full strength.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full strength?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If that thing cuts loose against unshielded ships, we're in

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's no miscalculation.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attack force closing rapidly, breaking formation, attacking at will.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Our phasers are firing, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hit on the Lexington.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Full phasers. What the devil is Kirk doing? Damage report, Lieutenant. Helm, course one six four, mark three.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Turning now, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Estimate damage on Lexington, Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hit in engineering section. Possible damage to her impulse engines. She's still maneuverable on warp drive.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We're firing again, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Excalibur, a direct hit.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Closing on the Lexington again, sir. The Hood and Potemkin are moving off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers firing, Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lexington hit again.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's got to be a way of getting to the M-5. There's got to be a way!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: There isn't. It's fully protected itself.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Probably true, Captain. It works faster, thinks faster than we do. It is a human mind amplified by the instantaneous relays possible in a computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, visual contact with Lexington.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Enterprise. Jim. Have you gone mad? What are you trying to prove? Break off the attack! Jim, we have fifty three dead here, twelve on the Excalibur. If you can hear us, stop the attack!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm sorry. I can't override M-5 interference.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Jim, why don't you answer? Jim! Answer! Come in, Jim!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's your murder charge. Deliberate. Calculated. It's killing men and women. Four starships, sixteen hundred men and women!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: It misunderstood.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Jim, break off your attack!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Excalibur is maneuvering away, sir. We're increasing speed to follow.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers locked on.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Daystrom!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers firing.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: I really don't know how to get to the M-5. I really do not know.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Daystrom, you impressed human engrams on the M-5 circuits.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Coming to new course, sir. Bearing on the Potemkin.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers firing. A hit.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whose engrams?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Why, mine, of course.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then perhaps you could talk to the unit. M-5 has no reason to believe you would harm it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The computer tie-in. You spoke to it before. It knows you.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm getting the Lexington again. Tapping in on their message to Starfleet Command, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: All ships damaged in unprovoked attack. Excalibur Captain Harris and first officer dead. Many casualties. We have damage, but are still able to manoeuvre. The Enterprise refuses to answer and is continuing attack. I still have an effective battle force and believe the only way to stop the Enterprise is to destroy her. Request permission to proceed. Wesley, commanding attack force, out.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: They can't do that. They'll destroy the M-5.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can save the M-5 if you talk to it and make it stop the attack.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: I can make it stop. I created it. (goes to Spock's station) M-5 tie-in.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: This is, (calmer) this is Daystrom.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Daystrom. Acknowledged.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: M-5, do you know me?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Daystrom, Richard. Originator of comptronic, duotronic systems. Born

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Stop. M-5, your attack on the starships is wrong. You must break it off.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't like the sound of him, Jim.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd better pray that the M-5 listens to the sound of him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Programming includes protection against attack. Enemy vessels must be neutralised.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: But these are not enemy vessels. These are Federation starships. You're killing, We are killing, murdering human beings, beings of our own kind. You were not created for that purpose. You are my greatest creation. The unit to save men. You must not destroy men.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: This unit must survive.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Survive, yes. Protect yourself, but not murder. You must not die. Men must not die. To kill is a breaking of civil and moral laws we've lived by for thousands of years. You've murdered hundreds of people. We've murdered. How can we repay that?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: They attacked this unit. Programming includes full freedom to choose defensive actions in all attack situations.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Context: quietly
Text: Spock. The M-5 is not responding to him like a computer. It's talking to him.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am most impressed with the technology, Captain. Doctor Daystrom has created a mirror image of his mind.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Consideration of all programming is that we must survive.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: We will survive. Nothing can hurt you. I gave you that. You are great. I am great. Twenty years of groping to prove the things I'd done before were not accidents. Seminars and lectures to rows of fools who couldn't begin to understand my systems. Colleagues. Colleagues laughing behind my back at the boy wonder and becoming famous building on my work. Building on my work.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, he's on the edge of a nervous breakdown, if not insanity.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The M-5 must be destroyed.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Daystrom
Text: Destroyed, Kirk? No. We're invincible. Look what we've done. Your mighty starships, Four toys to be crushed as we choose.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Spock neck-pinches Daystrom.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, take him to Sickbay.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Daystrom is carried off the Bridge.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take care of him, Doctor.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: McCoy leaves

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Battle status?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The other three ships are holding station out of range. The Excalibur looks dead.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, Lexington is receiving a message from Starfleet. They

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Starfleet
Text: You are authorised to use all measures available to destroy the Enterprise. Acknowledge, Lexington.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Acknowledged. Lexington out.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They've just signed their own death warrant. M-5 will kill them to survive.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Every living thing wants to survive, Captain. Daystrom must have impressed that instinctive reaction upon the computer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Suppose it's still open to impression. Suppose it absorbed the regret Daystrom felt for the deaths it caused. The guilt.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, the ships are coming within range again.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commodore Wesley is a dedicated commander. I should regret serving aboard the instrument of his death.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The instrument of his death will not be the Enterprise if I can help it. M-5, tie-in.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. You will be under attack in a moment.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Sensors have recorded approach of ships.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have already rendered one starship either dead or hopelessly crippled. Many lives were lost.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: The ships attacked this unit. This unit must survive.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: This unit is the ultimate achievement in computer evolution. It will replace man, so man may achieve. Man must not risk death in space or other dangerous occupations. This unit must survive so man may be protected.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, attack force almost within phaser range.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There were many men aboard those ships. They were murdered. Must you survive by murder?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: This unit cannot murder.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Murder is contrary to the laws of man and God.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you have murdered. Scan the starship Excalibur, which you destroyed. Is there life aboard?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: No life.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because you murdered it. What is the penalty for murder?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: Death.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And how will you pay for your acts of murder?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: M5
Text: This unit must die.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: It disconnects itself from the power feed in Engineering and goes dark.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, deflector shields have dropped.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All phaser power gone, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: M-5 is leaving itself open to attack. The machine is committing suicide to atone for the sin of murder.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, Spock, before it changes its mind. Get down to Engineering, pull out every hook up that makes M-5 run. Pull out the plug, Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: Scott and Spock leave.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Intership communications. This is the captain speaking. In approximately one minute, we'll be attacked by Federation starships. The M-5 no longer controls the ship, but neither do we control it. The M-5 has left itself, and us, open for destruction. For whatever satisfaction we may get from the knowledge, our nineteen lives will buy the survival of over one thousand of our fellow starship crewmen.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Phasers on target.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: The force field is gone, Captain. M-5 is neutralised.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: System's coming back. I can give you power for the shields, sir.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I need communications.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: That'll take longer.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then cut power.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir!

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cut power. Keep those shields down.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: The Enterprise looks dead. I'm going to take a chance he's not just laying a trap. Wesley to attack force.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Wesley
Text: Break off attack. Do not fire. The Enterprise has dropped her shields. I repeat, hold attack. Do not fire.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll have to be committed to a total rehabilitation centre. Right now he's under sedation and heavy restraints.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say his multitronic unit is in approximately the same condition.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's exactly the situation I was hoping for when I forced the M-5 to realise it had committed murder.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: The group walk out of the medical bay to McCoy's office.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Daystrom felt such an act was against the laws of God and man. The computer that carried his engrams also believed it.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, why did you feel the attacking ships would not fire when they saw the Enterprise apparently vulnerable? Logically, that is the sort of trap M-5 should have set.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wasn't sure. Any other commander would have simply followed orders and destroyed us, but I knew Bob Wesley.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: They walk out into the

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I gambled on his humanity.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Context: and into the

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge. His logical selection was compassion.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Compassion. That's the one thing no machine ever had. Maybe it's the one thing that keeps men ahead of them. Care to debate that, Spock?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Doctor. I simply maintain that computers are more efficient than human beings, not better.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But tell me, which do you prefer to have around?

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: I presume your question is meant to offer me a choice between machines and human beings, and I believe I have already answered that question.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I was just trying to make conversation, Spock.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be most interesting to impress your memory engrams on a computer, Doctor. The resulting torrential flood of illogic would be most entertaining.

Title: The Ultimate Computer
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, take us back to the space station. Ahead, warp factor two.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Approaching planet Omega Four, sir. Object ahead. Another vessel in planet orbit, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, sound alert.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. All decks report ready, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Long range sensor scan, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's the USS Exeter, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to contact her, Lieutenant.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Exeter. she was patrolling in this area six months ago. I hadn't heard of any trouble.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Receiving no response to our signal, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The sensors indicate no damage to the vessel, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Magnification factor three, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The viewscreen shows a sister ship to the Enterprise orbiting the purple planet.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold our position out here, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant, have Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy, and Lieutenant Galloway report to the transporter room. We'll board and investigate.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're locked onto the Exeter's engineering section, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on heavy stun. Energise.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: It's dark and quiet.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: There's a red jacket draped across a console, with white crystals scattered in and around it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just their uniforms left.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: As if they were in them when

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly. When what?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: McCoy scans the white crystals.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk of the USS Enterprise. Is anyone on board? If there is, and you can hear me, please respond by intercom to the engineering section. Is there anyone on board?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Galloway and I are checking out the lower levels. There seems to be no one aboard. Only uniforms.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the shuttlecraft?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Galloway
Text: Galloway on the hangar deck, sir. All four of the craft are still here. If they left, they didn't leave that way.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy and I are going to the Bridge. Meet us there.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Aboard the USS Exeter commanded by Ron Tracey, one of the most experienced captains in the Starfleet. What could have happened to him and the over four hundred men and women who were on this ship?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Galloway
Text: The helm was left on automatic, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, play the last log tape. Maybe they had time to record what happened to them.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, the analysis of this so far is potassium thirty five percent, carbon eighteen percent, phosphorous one point zero, calcium one point five. Jim, the crew didn't leave. They're still here.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: These white crystals. That's what's left of the human body when you take the water away, which makes up ninety six percent of our bodies. Without water, we're all just three or four pounds of chemicals. Something crystallised them down to this.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have their surgeon's log, Captain. Their last log entry, Captain, on screen.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: A man in a blue shirt is struggling to try and sit up in the Captains chair and dictate the log.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Doctor
Text: If you've come aboard this ship, you're dead men. Don't go back to your own ship. You have one chance. Get down there. Get down there fast. Captain Tracey is (screams and falls out of view.)

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to beam down to the planet surface fast.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: He turns and looks down at the blue uniform lying on the floor where they saw the doctor fall.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The four beam into a place with wooden construction, fabric hangings on walls, and a beheading about to take place in the main square. It takes three villagers to try and restrain the big man they want to kill, and two to hold the woman who will follow him. Then someone sees the new arrivals.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Voice
Text: Oi! O1!

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Put the axe away, Liyang.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's Ron Tracey. Ron.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I knew someone would come looking for us. I'm just sorry it had to be you, Jim. I'm glad your arrival stopped this. No more of this, Wu. Lock up the savages.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Wu
Text: They carry fire boxes.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I said lock up the savages. The prisoners are called Yangs. Impossible even to communicate with. Hordes of them out there. They'll attack anything that moves.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting that the villagers know about phasers.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were left alone down here, Ron. What happened?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Our medi-scanners revealed this planet as perfectly harmless. The villagers, the Kohms here, were friendly enough once they got over the shock of my white skin. As you've seen, we resemble the Yangs, the savages. My landing party transported back to the ship. I stayed down here to arrange for the planet survey with the village elders. The next thing I knew, the ship was calling me. The landing party had taken an unknown disease back. My crew, Jim. My entire crew. Gone.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know. We saw it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: And I'm just as infected as they were. As you are. But I stayed alive because I stayed down here. There's some natural immunisation that protects everyone on the planet surface. I don't know what it is.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MCCOY:: Lucky we found that log. If we'd gone back to the Enterprise.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: You'd be dying by now, along with the rest of the Enterprise crew. You'll stay alive only as long as you stay here. None of us will ever leave this planet.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. The Enterprise has left the Exeter and moved into close planet orbit. Although it appears the infection may strand us here the rest of our lives, I face an even more difficult problem. A growing belief that Captain Tracey has been interfering with the evolution of life on this planet. It seems impossible. A star captain's most solemn oath is that he will give his life, even his entire crew, rather than violate the Prime Directive.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Some equipment has been beamed down to the surface for medical tests.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tell the lab the final reading on our tissue is Y three X point zero zero four. And I could use a second blood analyser unit.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: We'll beam it down shortly, Doctor.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise out.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Our tissues definitely show a massive infection, Jim, but something is immunising us down here, thank heavens, or we'd have been dead hours ago.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think we're going to have time to isolate it, Bones.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The problem is, it could be anything Some spores or pollen in the air, some chemical. Just finding it could take months, maybe even years. And I've only got one lead. The infection resembles one developed by Earth during their bacteriological warfare experiments in the 1990s. Hard to believe we were once foolish enough to play around with that.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Spock bursts in, helping an injured Galloway who is clutching his chest.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: A Yang lance, Doctor.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you all right?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bruised only. We were approximately one hundred metres from the village when five of the savages ambushed us. We managed to escape without firing.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you see any hope that these Yangs can be reasoned with? A truce, a parley, a

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Galloway
Text: No, Captain. They're too wild. They act almost insane.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Tracey is being quite factual in several statements. One, the Yangs are totally contemptuous of death. They seem incredibly vicious. Two, he is also being factual in that the Yangs are massing for an attack. There are signs of thousands of them in the foothills beyond. However, he was less than truthful in one very important matter.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser power packs.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Tracey's reserve belt packs. Empty. Found among the remains of several hundred Yang bodies.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The fool.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
