Text: A smaller attack on this village a week ago, driven off by Captain Tracey with his phaser. I have found villagers who will corroborate it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now wait a minute. He lost his ship and his crew, and he found himself the only thing standing between an entire village of peaceful people.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Regulations are quite harsh, but they're also quite clear, Captain. If you do not act, you will be considered equally guilty.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Without a serum, we're trapped here with the villagers. Now why destroy what's left of the man by arresting him?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I agree that formal charges have little meaning now. However, you must at least confiscate his phaser.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The fool. Starfleet should be made aware.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk gets out his communicator, and Tracey enters, phaser ready, and backed up by villagers.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I'll be sending the next message, Jim.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The injured Galloway tries to reach for his own phaser, and Tracey vapourises him. Then the villagers take everyones equipment.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Enterprise, come in.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise bridge. Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Captain Tracey of the Exeter.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. Captain Kirk informed us earlier you had survived.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I'm afraid I have some bad news. Your captain and landing party must have beamed down too late for full immunisation.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: They've been found unconscious, but I'm doing everything I can for them now.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, this is Lieutenant Sulu in temporary command of the Enterprise.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Our whole medical staff will volunteer to beam down

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: There's no point in risking more lives, Lieutenant. Since I've acquired some immunity perhaps the others

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu!

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Wu hits him, hard.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: At their next word, kill him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Repeat your message. Come in, landing party. Repeat your message.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I'm sorry, Lieutenant. Your captain's feverish, quite delirious.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I understand, sir. When he regains consciousness, assure him that we have no problems here.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I'll contact you later, let you know of any future needs. Landing party out.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Later, Kirk is still lying on the floor, with his hands tied behind him. He still manages to trip up the pacing guard, but then Tracey comes in.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: That's enough of that, Captain. Leave us.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The guard leaves.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Ronald Tracey, as per Starfleet Command, regulation seven, paragraph four

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I must now consider myself under arrest, unless in the presence of the most senior fellow officers presently available, I give satisfactory answer to those charges which you now bring. Et cetera, et cetera. Those were the first words duty required you to say to me, and you said them. You're covered. Now, suppose we go on to the next subject.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which is, why?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Meanwhile he is quietly loosening the leather thongs around his wrists.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Good. Direct, succinct. Answer. No native to this planet has ever had any trace of any kind of disease. How long would a man live if all disease were erased, Jim? Wu. (Wu enters) Tell Captain Kirk your age.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Wu
Text: Age? I have seen forty two years of the red bird. My eldest brother

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Their year of the red bird comes once every eleven years, which he's seen forty two times. Multiply it. Wu is four hundred and sixty two years old. His father is well over a thousand. Interested, Jim?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy could verify all that.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: He will if you order it. We must have a doctor researching this. Are you grasping all it means? This immunising agent here, once we've found it, is a fountain of youth. Virtual immortality, or as much as any man will ever want.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For sale by

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Context: to Wu) Out. (Wu leaves
Text: By those who own the serum. McCoy will eventually isolate it. Meanwhile, you inform your ship your situation's impossible. Order them away. When we're ready, we'll bargain for a whole fleet of ships to pick us up. And they'll do it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I suppose they would.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: We've got to stay alive. Let the Yangs kill us and destroy what we have to offer and we'll have committed a crime against all humanity. I'd say that's slightly more important than the Prime Directive, wouldn't you, Jim?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a very interesting proposition. Let me think it over.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: He's got his hands free, so now the two Captains get to fight. Tracey wins.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Guards.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The Yang man and woman are in one cell, Spock and McCoy in another, when Tracey brings in Kirk at gunpoint.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Take the doctor back to his workplace. The pointed-eared one stays. And Wu, tell your men we'll be leaving soon. We'll be in ambush for the Yangs. With many fire boxes this time. What do you think of that, Jim?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk moves towards the Yangs, but the male tries to attack him through the bars.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Animals who happen to look like us. You still think the Prime Directive's for this planet?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think we have the right or the wisdom to interfere, however a planet is evolving.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Well, if logic won't work, perhaps this will. Put him in there.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The guards use spears to keep the Yangs from the door while they push Kirk inside. Of course, there is a fight.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: In the storeroom, McCoy notices that his guard has fallen asleep - the snoring is a clue - and tries to reach for a possible weapon. But the guard wakes up and stops him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: In the jail cell, the two Yangs are taking it in turns to keep Kirk busy.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't they ever rest?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not that I have observed, Captain. Of course, should they wish to do so, one could always rest while the other keeps you occupied.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Spock. (grabs the woman to use her as a shield, but she bites his hand.) At least tell me why you want to kill me.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good, Captain. Try to reason with them. Keep trying, Captain. Their behaviour is highly illogical.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No point in repeating that it's illogical, Spock. I'm quite aware of it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The woman is finally within reach of Spock's neck pinch, and down she goes. The male is astonished, and goes to protect her rather than keep fighting.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pity you can't teach me that.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have tried, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Storeroom]

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: A young Kohm woman brings McCoy a plate of food.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, thank you. Thank you very much.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I have managed to loosen this grill somewhat. If the mortar on yours is as old.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't even get at it. He'd be on me in a moment. (the woman is awake again) Keep talking, Spock. Don't let me doze off.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Tracey mentioned there was once a considerable civilisation here. The only reasonable explanation would be a war. Nuclear devastation or a bacteriological holocaust.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a very interesting theory. The yellow civilisation is almost destroyed, the white civilisation is destroyed. Keep working on the window if we're ever going to regain our freedom.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Context: The male Yang, with a very deep voice.
Text: Freedom? Freedom?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I heard, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: That is a worship word. Yang worship. You will not speak it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, well, well. It is our worship word, too.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: You live with the Kohms.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Am I not now a prisoner of the Kohms as you are?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk gets to the barred window and starts working on it. Cloud William helps him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why did you not speak until now?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: You spoke to Kohms. They are only for killing.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: They get a bar free, Kirk turns around.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, we'll have you out in a minute.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Cloud William knocks Kirk out with the iron bar, them rips the others out of the window to make his escape.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain? Captain? Captain, are you able to respond?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Later, when Kirk has regained consciousness.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. How long?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Seven hours and eight minutes, Captain.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Seven hours and eight. Spock. Keys. (on a table) I'll have you out in a minute.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: There is a scraping noise outside. When the guard investigates, he is overpowered by Kirk and Spock.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Good morning, Jim.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good morning.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can contact the ship in a few moments, Captain, if I can cross-circuit this unit.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Did you find out anything?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. I'm convinced that once there was a frightening biological war that existed here. The virus still exists. Then over the years, nature built up these natural immunising agents in the food, the water, and the soil.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: War created an imbalance and nature counterbalanced it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is a disease here, something that affected the Exeter landing party and us.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's right. These immunising agents take time, and that's the real tragedy. Had the Exeter landing party stayed here just a few hours longer, they never would have died.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we can leave any time we want to. Tracey is of the opinion these immunising agents can become a fountain of youth. There are people here over a thousand years old, Bones.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Survival of the fittest, because their ancestors who survived had to have a superior resistance. Then they built up these powerful protective antibodies in the blood during the wars. Now, if you want to destroy a civilisation or a whole world, your descendants might develop a longer life, but I hardly think it's worth it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then anything you develop here as a result of all this is useless.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who knows? It might eventually cure the common cold, but lengthen lives? Poppycock. I can do more for you if you just eat right and exercise regularly.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready, Captain. Quite crude. Voice communication will not be possible, but we can signal the ship.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All that bloodshed for nothing. That'll be sufficient, Mister Spock.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Tracey appears at the door with his phaser, and shoots Spock.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: No messages. Kirk, the savage in the cell with you. Did you set him free? You sent him, Kirk. You sent him to warn the tribes! The Yangs must've been warned. They sacrificed hundreds just to draw us out in the open. And then they came, and they came. We drained four of our phasers, and they still came. We killed thousands and they still came.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll live, but I'll have to get him to better facilities than this.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Impossible! You can't carry the disease up to the ship with you.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's fully immunised now. We all are.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can beam up at any time. Any of us.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: You've isolated the serum?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no serum! There are no miracles! There's no immortality here! All this is for nothing!

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Explain it to him, Doctor.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Leave medicine to medical men, Captain. You found no fountain of youth here. People live longer here now because it's natural for them to.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Outside. Or I'll burn down both your friends now.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do what you can for him, Doctor.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is everybody?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Dead or in hiding. Now let's see how eager you are to die. Call your ship. I need your help, Kirk. They're going to attack the village. My phaser's almost drained. We need new, fresh ones. You're not just going to stand there and let them kill you, are you? If I put a weapon in your hand you'll fight, won't you?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can beam up, Tracey. All of us.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: I want five phasers. No, ten. With three extra power packs each.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. (takes the communicator) Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, are you all right now?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, quite all right. I'd like ten phasers beamed down with three extra power packs, please. Have you got that?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Say again.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise, do you read me?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, this is Sulu. We read you, but surely you know that can't be done

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Without verification.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not even if we're in danger, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we have volunteers standing by to beam down. What is your situation?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: With Tracey's phaser almost up his nose.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The situation is not immediately dangerous. Have the volunteers stand by. Kirk out.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: You have a well-trained bridge crew, Captain. My compliments.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk disarms Tracey and they have another fight. Kirk runs through the village. Tracey regains his phaser and uses up its power disintegrating a large pot before he corners Kirk. Their final fight is stopped by spear-carrying Yangs.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Cloud William sits on a chair in the place of honour. There are Romanesque statues of women around the walls, and papers scattered on a table in front of him. The prisoners have their hands tied behind them and are seated along a wall with plenty of guards.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm weak, Captain, but not in difficulty.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He must have attention soon.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: My need for attention is vital, Doctor, but our need for departure is even more immediate.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If my ancestors were forced out of the cities into the deserts, the hills

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I see, Captain. They would've learned to wear skins, adopted stoic mannerisms, learned the bow and the lance.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Living like the Indians, and finally even looking like the American Indian. American. Yangs? Yanks? Spock, Yankees!

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: Kohms? Communists? The parallel is almost too close, Captain. It would mean they fought the war your Earth avoided, and in this case, the Asiatics won and took over this planet.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But if it were true, all these generations of Yanks fighting to regain their land.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're a romantic, Jim.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: A drummer enters. Cloud William stands.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: That which is ours is ours again. It will never be taken from us again.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: A a tattered flag is brought in with great ceremony. Red and white horizontal stripes, with a corner of white stars on blue background. Kirk and the others stand.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: They can be handled, Jim. Together it'll be easy. I caution you, gentlemen, don't fight me here. I'll win. Or at worst, I'll drag you down with me.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: I am Cloud William, chief. Also son of chief. Guardian of the holies, speaker of the holy words, leader of warriors. Many have died, but this is the last of the Kohm places. What is ours is ours again.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: He goes over to the flag and puts his left hand over his heart.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Aypledgli ianectu flaggen tupep kile for stahn

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And to the republic for which it stands, one nation under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Text: He spoke the holy word.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk is brought forward to the table.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: You know many of our high-worship words. How?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In my land we have a tribe like you.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Where is your tribe?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Up there. One of those points of light that you see at night.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Text: Why are you here? Were you cast out?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're confusing the stars with heaven.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: He was cast out! Don't you recognise the Evil One? Who else would trick you with your own sacred words? Let your God strike me dead if I lie. But he won't, because I speak for him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Yet you killed many Yangs.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: You tried to kill me.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not gods! We're not evil ones. We're men, like yourselves.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: Would a man know your holy words? Would a man use them to trick you? See his servant? His face, his eyes, his ears? Do the Yang legends describe this servant of the evil one?

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Cloud William kisses a large Holy Bible then opens it at Haggai - with a picture of a devil who looks very like Spock.) KIRK: Are your faces alike? Can you tell from them which of you is good and which of you is evil

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: You command him. Everyone's seen that. You want more proof? He has no heart.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His heart is different! The internal organs of a Vulcan are

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Bring him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: He puts his ear to where a human heart would be, but a Vulcan heart is not.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: He has no heart.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Text: One of them lies.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: But which? If we should kill the good, evil would be among us.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Context: reaching for a document
Text: There is a way.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Greatest of holies. Chiefs and sons of chiefs may speak the words, but the Evil One's tongue would surely turn to fire. I will begin. You shall finish. Ee'dplebnista norkohn forkohn perfectunun.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those words are familiar. Wait a moment.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Tracey
Text: He fears to speak them, for indeed his tongue would burn with fire. Force him! Kill his servant unless he speaks, so you may see if the words burn him.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: A knife is put to Spock's throat.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, wait! There's a better way. Does not your sacred book promise that good is stronger than evil?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sirah
Context: the woman who had been captured with Cloud William
Text: Yes, it is written. Good shall always destroy evil.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Text: It is written.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The room is cleared. Tracey and Kirk have their left hands tied together. Cloud William stabs a knife into the carpet at the other end of the room.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: The fight is done when one is dead.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I've found that evil usually triumphs unless good is very, very careful.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Hoola!

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The fight begins with an exchange of punches, then Tracey tries to drag Kirk towards the knife.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, we've got to do something!

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am open to suggestions, Doctor.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk hooks his feet around a table leg to stop Tracey reaching the knife. Spock directs his attention towards the woman.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What are you doing?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm making a suggestion.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: The two protagonists have nearly reached the weapon. After a struggle, Tracey gets it. The woman picks up a communicator, walks over to Spock, then opens it. Kirk gets Tracey to drop the knife, and brings it down across his throat.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: Kill him. It is written. Good must destroy evil.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Instead, Kirk cuts their bonds just as Sulu and two security guards beam down.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, we picked up communicator signals, but

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll discuss that later, Lieutenant. Leslie, free Doctor McCoy and Mister Spock. Put Captain Tracey under arrest.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Cloud William sinks to his knees.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Cloud William.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: You are a great God servant. We are your slaves.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Get up. Face me.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: When you would not say the holy words, of the Ee'd Plebnista, I doubted you.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I did not recognise those words, you said them so badly, Without meaning.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Elder
Text: No! No! Only the eyes of a chief may see the Ee'd Plebnista.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This was not written for chiefs. (general consternation) Hear me! Hear this! Among my people, we carry many such words as this from many lands, many worlds. Many are equally good and are as well respected, but wherever we have gone, no words have said this thing of importance in quite this way. Look at these three words written larger than the rest, with a special pride never written before or since. Tall words proudly saying We the People. That which you call Ee'd Plebnista was not written for the chiefs or the kings or the warriors or the rich and powerful, but for all the people! Down the centuries, you have slurred the meaning of the words, 'We, the people of the United States, in order to form a more perfect union, establish justice, ensure domestic tranquillity, provide for the common defence, promote the general welfare, and secure the blessings of liberty to ourselves and our posterity, do ordain and establish this constitution.' These words and the words that follow were not written only for the Yangs, but for the Kohms as well!

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: The Kohms?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They must apply to everyone or they mean nothing! Do you understand?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Cloud
Text: I do not fully understand, one named Kirk. But the holy words will be obeyed. I swear it.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk leaves the Yangs to gaze at the old papers with new eyes.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's no question about his guilt, Captain, but does our involvement here also constitute a violation of the Prime Directive?

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We merely showed them the meaning of what they were fighting for. Liberty and freedom have to be more than just words.

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Spock
Text: (unintelligible. possibly Doctor... but the dialogue no longer exists.)

Title: The Omega Glory
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, the fighting is over here. I suggest we leave them to discover their history and their liberty.

Title: The Omega Glory
Context: Kirk takes one last look at the flag before leaving.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log. Using the lightspeed breakaway factor, the Enterprise has moved back through time to the twentieth century. We are now in extended orbit around Earth, using our ship's deflector shields to remain unobserved. Our mission, historical research. We are monitoring Earth communications to find out how our planet survived desperate problems in the year 1968.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The ship rocks as if being hit by something.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alert status. Force shields on maximum. Leslie, begin sensor scan.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transporter room to Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What's happening?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: It appears we have accidentally intercepted someone's transporter beam, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's incredibly powerful.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's impossible. The twentieth century had no such

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, something is beaming aboard this vessel.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right there.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: The beam is originating at least one thousand light years away.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: No transporter beam can reach that far, not even in our century.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk enters.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something is shaking us apart.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's locked, it's locked our circuits wide open.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: One of the transporter pads has activated.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're right. Something is beaming aboard.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: It's a man in a dark suit, holding a black cat. He steps down from the platform and speaks calmly.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Why have you intercepted me?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Security
Text: Security.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter room, on the double.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Security
Text: On our way, sir.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Please identify yourselves.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the United Spaceship Enterprise. I'm Captain Kirk, commanding.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Context: to the cat
Text: Yes, I heard him, Isis. We're aboard a space vessel. From what planet?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: That's impossible. In this time period, there weren't (notices Spock) Humans with a Vulcan? You're from the future, Captain. You're going to have to beam me down to Earth immediately.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Security arrive.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Careful, Isis. All right. Captain Kirk. My name is Gary Seven. I am a human being from the twentieth century. I was on my way

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Humans of the twentieth century do not go beaming around the galaxy, Mister Seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: I've been living on another planet far more advanced. I was beaming to Earth when you intercepted me.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The location of that planet?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: They wish their existence kept secret. Even in your time, it will remain unknown.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's impossible to hide a whole planet.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Impossible for you, not for them. Captain Kirk, I am of this time period. You are not. You interfere with me with what I have to do there, and you'll change history. You'll destroy the Earth and probably yourselves, too.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: If what he says is true, Captain, every second we delay him could be dangerous.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if he's lying?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: This is the most critical period in Earth's history. The planet I'm from wants to help Earth survive.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What if it turns out you're an invading alien from the future?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: A most difficult decision, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't beam you down without further proof one way or the other. Security confinement.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Security
Text: This way, please.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven attacks the security men. Spock neck-pinches him but is thrown off

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. Jim! Jim. What's going on there?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk gets a phaser and stuns Seven as he starts to work the transporter controls.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to transporter room.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what's going on down there?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, check the prisoner you'll find in security confinement. I want a medical analysis fast. Is he or isn't he human?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. A man in a twentieth century business suit. What is he? Not even Spock's Vulcan neck pinch could stop him. Without our phasers, he would have over powered all five of us. I find it difficult to believe the mysterious Mister Seven can be human, and yet, suppose he is?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Spock is stroking the cat, who is purring.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you make of the cat, Mister Spock?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite a lovely animal, Captain. I find myself strangely drawn to it.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the captain. All science, engineering, and supervisory personnel, lock into the briefing room. Our next decision can be of enormous consequence, not only to us but to Earth's entire future. You've already been given as much information as we have. Please break in at any time with analysis of that information. Navigation report.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We have analysed the direction of his beam, sir. Our star maps show no habitable planets in that area of the galaxy.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: He did say his planet was hidden, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Still unable to analyze it, sir. It was so powerful, it fused most of our recording circuits. Could have brought him back through great distances, could have brought him back through time. There's no way for us to know.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, historical report.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Current Earth crises would fill a tape bank, Captain. There will be an important assassination today, an equally dangerous government coup in Asia, and, this could be highly critical, the launching of an orbital nuclear warhead platform by the United States countering a similar launch by other powers.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Weren't orbital nuclear devices one of this era's greatest problems?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most definitely. Once the sky was full of orbiting H-bombs, the slightest mistake could have brought one down by accident, setting off a nuclear holocaust.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, hurry with that report. Join me in the briefing room with your analysis.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven tests the forcefield blocking the doorway. Then, behind the guard's back, he takes a pen from his pocket and turns it into a device that shuts the forcefield off. He also uses it to stop the guard from shooting him.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: You're tired. Go to sleep.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The guard slides down the wall with a grin on his face as Seven makes his escape.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I must admit the sensor readings seem too good. Human readings, yes, but not a single physical flaw. Totally perfect body.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If an alien needed a body.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: He might be inclined to prepare a perfect one, Captain. But then again he may be telling the truth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I need proof. All you're telling me is that on the one hand he may be lying and on the other

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The cat exits the room.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Security
Text: Security alert. All decks alert. The prisoner has escaped. All decks alert.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Captain. Inform us

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain, transporter circuits show someone preparing to beam down.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try to override. Shut it off!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The cat arrives as Seven finishes setting the controls.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: I know, Isis. But we'll be gone before they get here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: They beam away just as Kirk, McCoy and Spock dash into the room.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: A display case full of glasses splits in two, revealing a massive safe door behind it. The locking wheel turns, the safe door opens and Gary Seven carrying Isis the cat walks out of a fog into the main room. The safe door shuts itself behind him and is hidden again behind the shelves of glasses. Seven goes to the window and looks down onto a street filled with people and traffic.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: You're right, Isis. It is primitive. It's incredible that people can exist like this. At least we won't have to. Not for long. Computer on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: A bookcase swings open to reveal a black screen, circular monitor and control panel.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Context: high-pitched staccato female
Text: Computer on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Specify locations of agents two oh one and three four seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Identify self.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Simply check my voice pattern. You'll find me listed as Supervisor one nine four. Code name Gary Seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Voice pattern matches, but I have no listing of a Gary Seven assigned this planet.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, I am a class one supervisor. You are ordered to override previous instructions and answer my questions.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: I am a Beta Five computer capable of analytical decisions. Please confirm identity as supervisor by describing nature of agents and mission here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, I caution you. I have little love for Beta Five snobbery. Override. All right. Agents are male and female, descendants of human ancestors taken from Earth approximately six thousand years ago. They're the product of generations of training for this mission. Problem. Earth technology and science have progressed faster than political and social knowledge. Purpose of mission. To prevent Earth's civilisation from destroying itself before it can mature into a peaceful society.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Incomplete but sufficient. Location of agents unreported for three days.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Why didn't you say so in the first place? No, don't answer that. Simply begin search immediately. Recheck all news broadcasts, decode any government intercepted message

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: I am aware of proper search procedures, one nine four.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: There are no clouds at all over North and Central Africa, the Middle East and into the Indian subcontinent as the Enterprise orbits Earth. No green vegetation either.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can estimate only within a thousand metres or so where he beamed down, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we beam down, can you compare our position with his control setting?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Following him down is a major risk, Captain. If we ourselves do anything that changes history

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm aware of that. But I must know if he's lying, and we can't answer that sitting up here. Have ship's stores prepare the proper costumes. Stand by to beam us down.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: In response to nuclear warhead placed in suborbit by other major power, United States today launching suborbital platform with multi-warhead capacity. Purpose, to maintain balance of power.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: That's the same kind of nonsense that almost destroyed planet Omicron Four.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Analysis correct. Earth situation similar. Mission of agents two oh one and three four seven. Set malfunction on United States rocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Progress of mission Has the rocket been set to malfunction?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Negative. No progress.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: How much time before launch?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Exactly one hour, twenty seven minutes, twelve seconds.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, record the following. Unless agents are found immediately, I must undertake their mission.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk and Spock have managed to beam down in suits and overcoats (and woolly hat for Spock of course

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, lock in on our position.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lead us to him.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Locked in. Proceed one nine five degrees true.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The computer is fabricating identity papers for Seven, as a Colonel with the CIA, a Lieutenant in the NYPD and a Colonel with the NSA. It has also produced a map of McKinley Rocket Base. Then a young woman in an orange and purple mini-dress lets herself into an adjoining room.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hello? Anybody here? Looks like your lucky day, Roberta. They can't dock you if they don't know you're late.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven comes in from the main room.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Where have you been?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Oh, the subway got stalled

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Where have you been for the past three days?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Now, wait a minute. Why should I tell you? Who are you, anyway?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Where's three four seven?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: With three four eight?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Two oh one, code responses are not necessary.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Listen, friend, maybe I'd just better call the police right now.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Sit down.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Who do you think you are?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: I said sit down.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Okay, I will.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: I'll say one thing for you. You play your role well. But that is no longer necessary. I'm Supervisor one nine four, code name Gary Seven. I need a complete report

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Report.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Yes, report. Everything you have done for the past three Earth days.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: He gestures to the typewriter.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Oh. Everything I've done?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Everything you've done.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Well, okay. (puts a sheet of paper in it.) Well, let's see.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Not with your fingers.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: He flicks a switch on the side of the machine.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Well, how do you expect me to type, with my nose? Did you see that? The machine typed everything I. It's typing everything I'm saying! Stop it. Stop it! Stop it! (He turns it off.) Okay. That does it. I quit!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Wait a minute.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: I'm quitting right now!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: You're not acting, are you?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Acting? I'm leaving. Goodbye. (Seven locks the door remotely with his pen.) Hey. Hey!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven activates a green cube on the desk.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Tie in to computer.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computer on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Scan unidentified female present.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Roberta Lincoln. Human. Profession, secretary. Employed by three four seven and two oh one. Description. Age twenty, five feet seven inches, one hundred twenty pounds, hair presently tinted honey blonde. Although behaviour appears erratic, possesses high IQ. Birthmarks

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hey.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Small mole on left shoulder. Somewhat larger star-shaped mark on her

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hey, watch it! Okay, I'll bite. What is it?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Miss Lincoln. Miss Lincoln, What kind of work did your employers say they were doing here?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Research for a new encyclopaedia? No? No.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: All right. You can go. Of course, if you do, you won't be helping your country. Unless you don't care about that.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Sure, I care. What do you think I am?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: I don't know, Miss Lincoln, what you are, not yet. All I know is that my incompetence has made you aware of very secret devices that are vital to the security of this nation.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Oh. Well, what are you guys around here, anyway? FBI? Some kind of government agents, huh? (The cat enters as he hands her one of his new IDs) CIA. Very groovy.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Thank you, Isis. I'll be right in. (Isis leaves) It's a trained cat, Just like guard dogs, that kind of thing.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Yeah?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Don't let anybody in here. I'll be busy.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Okay.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Outside the apartment building.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty,

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Triangulate on this location.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Correlated. Readings indicate a greater altitude. Approximately thirty metres higher, sir.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Occurrence, automobile accident. Location Highway nine four nine, ten miles north of McKinley Rocket Base. Agents three four seven and two oh one were killed instantly.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: That just doesn't make sense. For them to die in something as useless as an automobile accident. Are the facts verified?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Verified. Descriptions of bodies are exact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk and Spock step out of the elevator by apartment 12A

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Scotty.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Proceed five metres, two four seven degrees true.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: They arrive outside 12B, and Kirk rings the doorbell.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer off.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta answers the door to the office as the computer hides behind the bookcase again.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Where's Mister Seven?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: I don't know what you're talking about. Listen, you guys can't come in here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Mister Seven?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven activates the safe-cum-transporter.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: You can't come in here. Now, get out. What do you think you're doing? This is a government office.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven picks up Isis and leaves.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Neither one of you can come in here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Mister Seven?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: This is against the rules.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: In here, Captain. (at door to main room)

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: What do you think you're doing? You want me to (picks up the telephone) Send the police. Eight Eleven East Sixty Eighth Street, apartment twelve B.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give me the phone.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven is setting the dial on the 'safe'

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: No, get your hands off of me, you big jerk! Who do you think you are? Let go!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: There's a physical tussle going on between Kirk and Roberta.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: What do you think you're doing, you big jerk? What's the big idea?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Mister Seven, help! Help!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Spock takes over from Kirk in manhandling Roberta.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Let go of me! Stop it! Don't go in there! What's the big idea? Get your hands off of me! I mean it!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: She pulls off his hat and sees his ears and eyebrows.) What are you

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk blasts open the connecting door as Seven dematerialises and the safe shuts itself.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Carrying Isis, Seven walks out of Assembly Area B-10 hangar - warning, liquid hydrogen - into the early morning sunshine. Or late afternoon. The shadows are fairly long

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. Stand by for launch area clearance. It is now sixty minutes to launch. T minus sixty and counting.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: And the big white US rocket stands gleaming on its launch gantry.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk finds the plans to the rocket base lying on the table.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Mister Seven?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: I'm warning you, I've already called the police.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plans to McKinley Rocket Base.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Police 1
Text: There it is, Charlie. Open up in there. Police.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta manages to shout before Spock can get his hand over her mouth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Police 1
Text: Open up in there! It's the police!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wide scan, Scotty. We'll be moving. Spock, in here. Spock!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: They go into the main room and Roberta dashes to open the door to the police.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: In there!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Scotty!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Police 1
Text: What's going on here?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk, Spock and the two policemen are beamed up. Kirk and Spock dash off the transporter pad leaving the flat-foots standing, slack-jawed.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse and energise.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Police 1
Text: Charlie.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: They are beamed back into the apartment, watched by Roberta.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. It is now fifty minutes to launch. T minus fifty and counting. All systems clear. All systems clear. Standing by for inspection of launch pad.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven is standing next to launch director Cromwell's car.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Context: a security guard
Text: You! Speak to you a moment?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Yeah, sure, Sarge. (hands over his NSA ID) There it is.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: I'll have to confirm this, Colonel.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: All right.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: Just put the cat down and keep your hands at your side.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: All right.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Context: into telephone
Text: Give me security. Identification check.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Be careful, lsis. Don't get stepped on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: Yes, security?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Isis yowls, distracting the guard. Seven whips out his 'pen' and zaps the guard into immobility.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Context: into telephone
Text: Security, this is Sergeant Lipton, and we're all straightened out down here. Right, thank you very much. Goodbye. All right, Sergeant. Now let's just turn right around. We're going to walk this way. You just sit right down right right there and have a little nap.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Grinning inanely, the guard sits on the ground by the building and goes to sleep.) TANNOY: Attention. It is now forty five minutes to launch. T minus forty five and counting. All systems clear. All systems clear

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Standby for inspection of launch pad.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Heading for the gantry. Sound alert.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. First alert. First alert. Begin clearing gantry area. Clear launch pad. Safety group, clear launch pad. All systems continue to green. Repeat. All systems still green. Standing by for inspection of launch pad.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Cromwell gets into his car outside launch control and drives away. Remember, we last saw Seven by this car.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's an old-style weather satellite in orbit below us. If I could bounce off it, I could get some good views. I've got it.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: An image of the rocket is on the wall monitor.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: I could get even closer. If I could spot him, I could lock on and beam him up.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chances are he's out of sight inside the rocket gantry or at one of the control centres.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Launch is in forty minutes. Stand by to beam us down. Continue visual scan.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. Stand by for launch area clearance. Range safety verified. Launch director now en route to rocket gantry to confirm launch pad clear. Ground stations three, four and eleven, stand by for confirmation. Repeat. Standby for launch area clearance.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Cromwell and a couple of military men arrive in their cars at the base of the rocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Hi, Jack.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: Mister Cromwell.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Launch director at gantry, beginning final check.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. It is now thirty five minutes to launch. T minus thirty five minutes and counting.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Cromwell's car boot opens, and Seven and Isis get out.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Canary Islands confirming they are go for the launch. All ground stations confirm go.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The three officials return to their cars.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: Lock the elevator at the top, Lieutenant. Time to get out of here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. Clear launch pad. Repeat. Clear launch pad and gantry.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The officials drive away. Seven and Isis are in the elevator heading for the top of the rocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Lipton, the guard that Seven put to sleep, wakes up as Kirk and Spock beam in.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: Freeze! One move and you've both had it.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Security
Text: Intruder alert. Intruder alert. Security to launch director. We have unidentified intruders. Males. A pair. Do you want to delay countdown?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta is talking to the green cube.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: All right, don't answer, but you can tell him I quit. You can tell him I promise not to tell anybody anything. He's safe, and you're safe, my little green friend. (the box flashes twice) Same to you.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: She sits on the desk and accidentally knocks the 'desk pen' that controls the safe door. Intrigued, she investigates.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: A crowd is gathering a few miles away to watch the launch.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Attention. Twenty minutes to launch. T minus twenty minutes and counting. All systems continue green. Repeat. All systems still green.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven is lying along one of the girders supporting the rocket, at a control panel access. Isis is meowing instructions.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Yes, thank you. I know how to open it. (with his ubiquitous pen) I know there's not much time.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: He starts fiddling with the wiring inside.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Two communicators and two phasers are on the launch controllers console. Lipton's boss is doing the interrogation.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: These are all they were carrying.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: T minus fifteen minutes and counting.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: You've got a chance, and I'll offer it only this once. The slightest possible charges will be brought against you if you identify yourselves and tell us why you're here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: To delay countdown.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: No sign of trouble on my boards. Launch director, confirm status all systems.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Control to launch director, confirming. Status board indicates all is well. Space flight conditions measure out as planned.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Continue countdown.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: No countdown delay. Repeat, no delay. All systems are green and go. All systems are go.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: T minus fourteen and counting.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Meow? You are nervous, aren't you, doll? All right. I'm going as fast as I can.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: T minus thirteen minutes and counting. Status board looks good. Stages look good. All systems go. Status board says go.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Scott is continuing his visual search for Seven, and finally spots him at the top of the rocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Security, send two men up here right away.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: T minus eight minutes and counting. All systems go. Status board go.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta's fiddling with the safe door finally makes it open.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: No!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Stand by. I'm going to beam him up.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: On the gantry, Seven feels the transporter effect and sits up, holding Isis. In the apartment, Roberta fiddles with knobs on the inside of the safe door and pulls him away from the Enterprise.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: I had him and something yanked him away.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Seven gets up from the floor of the safe.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: What are you doing? I wasn't finished.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: I'm sorry. I just touched that button right there and then wow!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: You must have intercepted the Enterprise trying to beam me on board. Computer on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The bookcase opens up.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Lock into launch site scan.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: One minute to launch.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Oh, my gosh!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Spock and I in custody. Even if we talked, they wouldn't believe us. We're powerless to stop Mister Seven or prevent the launch, or even be certain if we should. I have never felt so helpless.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Thirty seconds to launch.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Look, hey, I mean, not even the CIA could do all this.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: T minus twenty seconds. Mark. Stages reporting ready for launch. Automatic sequences on. She's completely automatic now.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Fifteen seconds to launch. Ten seconds.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one. Ignition. We have ignition.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: NASA footage of the powerful rocket lifting off and being tracked by radio telescopes.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Altitude one thousand feet. All good. All as planned. Trajectory nominal.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Rocket passing twenty mile arc and accelerating.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, adjustments at the rocket base were not completed. Can I still take over the rocket as planned?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Rocket control possible with exceiver circuits operated manually.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Exceiver on manual. Lock into flight telemetry. Visual off.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta backs away and picks up the telephone. Isis meows a warning and Seven uses his pen to sever the cord.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Roberta, please don't try to leave. You'll find all the doors locked. Are you jealous, Isis? It's most unbecoming.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Rocket altitude now one hundred miles. Standing by to begin malfunction as planned.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Begin malfunction at third stage.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Exceiver setting now nine zero point zero eight.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Nine zero point zero eight.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Second stage ready to detach.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Visual on.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Second stage detaching.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: The famous shot of a rocket stage falling away back to Earth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Third stage igniting.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Begin malfunction. Take it off course.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Malfunction setting correct. Rocket veering from planned course.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Give me the readings fast.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: What is it?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Malfunction. Rocket is deviating from programmed flight path.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Safety, standby to destruct. Continuing deviation from flight path. Repeat, deviation confirmed and increasing. Telemetry control transmitter systems tie in. All systems tie in. Report.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Arm the warhead.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Accomplished. Nuclear warhead now armed. Set exceiver nine one point two one eight.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta picks up a cigar box.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Exceiver nine one point two one eight.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Uhura is scanning broadcasts in different languages.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sensor shows that the rocket has armed itself, Mister Scott.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Computers indicate an impact somewhere in the heart of the Euro-Asian continent.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We've still time to enter close orbit and destroy it with our phaser, sir.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They're beginning to worry on Earth, Mister Scott.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm getting military alerts from the major powers.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've got to risk calling the captain. Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Warhead status confirmed. She's armed herself somehow. Repeat. This bird is armed. The warhead's alive. All boards report status. Stand by on destruct. Standby to transmit destruct signal.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: How could the warhead arm itself?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: We don't know.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Nesvig
Text: You can destroy it, of course.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: If we can't, we're going to lay an H bomb on somebody somewhere. Ready on destruct signal. Destruct.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Transmit destruct signal. Transmit destruct signal.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Kirk picks up a communicator, but Lipton hears the chirp as he opens it.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: Get back over there.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Roberta hits Seven over the head with the cigar box.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Look, I'm sorry, but like you asked me, I do care about my country, and you can't be CIA.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: She takes his pen from his pocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Orbital platform separating.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hold it!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, rocket status.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hold it, Mister Seven. I'm telling you, you're through monkeying around with my country's rocket.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Warhead still armed. Six minutes to impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Hold it! Don't move! You did enough already!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: You've got to let me finish what I started, or in six minutes World War Three begins.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Flight path continuing on target.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Destruct is fouled up somehow, flight control. She's coming down fully armed. She'll go off on impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: What? Try again! Boost the signal!

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Boosting signal. Boosting signal. Flight control, we have boosted destruct signal. Repeat. Destruct signal at maximum boost.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Context: over the open communicator
Text: Captain, can you read me? I was beaming up Mister Seven, and something yanked him away from me.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Lipton
Text: Hello? Hello, come in.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Here, let me help you, Sergeant. It's operated with this dial here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Neck pinches Lipton and Kirk gets to the communicator.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: We're getting no response.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Text: Make absolutely certain. Check everything again.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Tracking stations report no response on destruct signal.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, beam us directly to Seven's apartment.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Tannoy
Text: Auxiliary transmitters check out flight control. She hasn't destructed herself. Repeat. Destruct is not working. She's still up there. Do you read? Descending and armed. Descending and armed. She'll go off on impact. Bermuda ground station reports she's still up there. South Africa ground station reports no response on boosted destruct signal.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Cromwell
Context: picks up the red telephone
Text: Get me the president.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Rocket descending and accelerating. Do you have further instructions, one nine four?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Roberta, you've got to believe me. Look, a truly advanced planet wouldn't use force. They wouldn't come here in strange alien forms. The best of all possible methods would be to take human beings to their world, train them for generations until they're needed here.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Mister Seven, I want to believe you. I do. I know this world needs help. That's why some of my generation are kind of crazy and rebels, you know. We wonder if we're going to be alive when we're thirty.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Two minutes to impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold it right there, Mister Seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Oh, no.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you're the expert. Can you detonate the warhead from this computer?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can try, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Altitude five hundred fifty miles.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Captain, I want that warhead detonated, too. Unless I do it at least a hundred miles above ground, just barely in time to frighten them out of this arms race

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, monitors show all major powers on full missile alert. Retaliatory strike ordered on warhead impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Altitude four hundred and fifty miles.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: I can estimate some of this, Captain, but without more time

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Captain, he can only guess. Will you please let me do my job.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know what your job is! You may set those controls so we can't detonate that warhead.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Context: pointing the pen at Kirk
Text: Listen you, get away from him.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Context: grabbing the pen from her
Text: Roberta, be careful. The servo is set to kill.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: He hands the pen to Kirk.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Altitude four hundred miles.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: There are only seconds. I'll need time to set it.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Please. He's telling the truth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Fifty five seconds to impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, if you can't handle it, I'm going to have to trust him.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is difficult to know which is best, Captain.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Forty seconds to impact.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Without facts, the decision cannot be made logically. You must rely on your human intuition.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Altitude three hundred miles. Descending and accelerating.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: Thirty seconds and accelerating.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: Computer, go to visual. Count by tens.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Computer
Text: One hundred ninety miles. One hundred eighty miles. One hundred seventy miles. One hundred sixty miles. One hundred fifty, one hundred forty, one hundred thirty, one hundred twenty. (there's a bright flash) Detonation one hundred four miles.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Big sighs of relief all round.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Later, Gary Seven is dictating his report to the special typewriter. Kirk and Spock are back in uniform.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: And in spite of the accidental interference with history by the Earth ship from the future, the mission was completed.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correction, Mister Seven. It appears we did not interfere. The Enterprise was part of what was supposed to happen on this day in 1968.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: Suddenly Isis has transformed from a black cat to a dark haired woman in a black outfit.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our record tapes show, although not generally revealed, that on this date, a malfunctioning suborbital warhead was exploded exactly one hundred and four miles above the Earth.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: So everything happened the way it was supposed to.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: And you'll be pleased our records show that it resulted in a new and stronger international agreement against the use of such weapons.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Would you mind telling me who that is?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: That, Miss Lincoln, is simply my cat.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Roberta
Text: Your cat?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Context: She's a cat again, who decides to scratch behind her own ear.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Seven
Text: What else do your record tapes show?

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm afraid we can't reveal everything we know, Mister Seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we could say that Mister Seven and Miss Lincoln have some interesting experiences in store for them.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think we could say that. Two to beam up, Scotty.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Spock
Text: Live long and prosper, Mister Seven.

Title: Assignment: Earth
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the same to you, Miss Lincoln. Energise.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: On mark eight and closing.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Steady as she goes. Phaser crew, stand by.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: There's a strange object on the viewscreen.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Range, forty five thousand kilometres, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Range, forty three thousand kilometres and closing.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sensor readings?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: A mechanical device of unknown properties. I read no life forms aboard.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis, Science Officer?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously, it intends to intercept us. It has made several course changes corresponding with our own.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Thirty eight thousand and closing. Thirty five thousand and closing.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unclear whether it intends to attack or merely communicate with us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Science Officer. Come to one eight one mark seven.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The object swings back into the centre of the viewscreen.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's staying with us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full stop, Mister Chekov. Hold your position.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Melkot
Text: Aliens, you have encroached on the space of the Melkot. You will turn back immediately. This is the only warning you will receive.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: English.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It was Russian, sir. Every word.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, Captain. It was Swahili.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting. Telepathy.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unquestionably. Most impressive.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our orders are very clear. We're to establish contact with the Melkotians at all costs.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: True telepaths can be most formidable, and we have been warned.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What previous contacts have been made with the Melkotians?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: No recorded contacts. If they ever ventured into space, they evidently withdrew immediately.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, hailing frequencies.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Tied in, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the United Federation of Planets. We've contacted your buoy and understand its message. We hope that you will understand that our intent is to establish peaceful relations with you. Lieutenant, answer?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Nothing, sir. Clear on all frequencies.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try again.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Still no response, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Opinion, Mister Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I prefer being a welcomed guest, Captain, but there seems to be little choice.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: None whatsoever. Mister Chekov, deflectors at full intensity. Increase speed to achieve planet fall as scheduled.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Standard orbit in five minutes.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The buoy does not obstruct them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, advise Doctor McCoy and Engineer Scott to meet me in the transporter room. Mister Spock, Mister Chekov, let's go find out what it is they're afraid of.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 4385.3. We have transported down to the Melkotian planet and have encountered conditions which are completely contrary to what we were prepared for.
