Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The landing party are surrounded by dense fog.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, what is this?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. Sensor readings give no indication of fog like conditions in this area.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I knew it had to happen. It's a fine time for that transporter mechanism to break down.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Impossible, Doctor McCoy. My transporter was working perfectly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Then what are we doing here?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tricorder readings, Mister Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. Unlike Mister Scott's transporter, this unit is not functioning.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then let's get out of here. Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: No use, Captain. Obviously none of our devices will function. Apparently that Melkotian buoy

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Melkot
Context: a pair of red eyes in the fog
Text: Aliens. Our warning was plain. You have disregarded it. You shall be punished. You, Captain Kirk, the disobedience was on your orders. Yours is the responsibility. Yours shall be the pattern of your death.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We come in peace, but we'll defend ourselves if necessary.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Melkot
Text: You are outside. You are disease. The disease must be destroyed. Your plea has been heard, and sentence has been pronounced. It is done.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: And suddenly they are standing in a Wild West street, with six-shooters and holsters instead of phasers.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Where are we now, Captain?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The sheriff's office is just the front of the building, no sides, back or roof.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, evaluation?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously this represents the Melkotian's concept of an American frontier town, circa 1880.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's just bits and pieces. It's incomplete.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps the Melkotians have insufficient data about this era.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or perhaps this is all they require to complete the pattern of our death.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: And these, Captain? (the guns)

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beautiful specimen.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Crude but dangerous.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever the Melkotians have planned for us, it won't be pleasant. These could be useful. Just remember one thing. To individuals at close range, these could be as deadly as phasers.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In the midst of what seems so unreal, the harsh reality. This is not a dream.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Context: reading from a newspaper pinned up
Text: October 26, 1881. Tombstone, Arizona.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tombstone. Hell for leather, right out of history.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But why here? And why now?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Melkot said you were the pattern. He looked into your mind and selected what he considered the proper time and place for our punishment.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because my ancestors pioneered the American frontier.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. The violence of your own heritage is to be the pattern for our execution.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the matter with us? We're talking like we really are in Tombstone, Arizona in 1881.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, in terms of what the Melkots intend for us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's something about that date, October 26, 1881 But what was it?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The sheriff comes over, grinning.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Ike! Ike! Frank! Billy! Tom! (shakes Kirk's hand) Ike, I was afraid you weren't going to make it.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Looks like we did.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: I knew you wouldn't let them scare you away. They're a bunch of hot air if you ask me.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are they really?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Now they're going to have to fight after the way they shot off their mouths.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You know us?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Funny. That's what I like about you, lke. You always see the funny side.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm a barrel of laughs.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Nobody can say Johnny Behan doesn't have a sense of humour. (walks on)

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Johnny? He called me lke, you Frank, Bones Tom, and Billy. Ike Clanton, Tom and Frank McLowery, Billy Claiborne, Billy Clanton.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I pride myself on my knowledge of your Earth history. The names were known in the annals of the opening of the western sector of America. the United States of America, that is.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In the late nineteenth century in Arizona, two factions fought for control of the town of Tombstone. The Earps, Morgan, Virgil and Wyatt, who were the town marshals, along with Doc Holliday.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: And the Clanton gang. On October 26th, they had it out.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Who won?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Clantons lost, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And we are the Clantons?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are the Clantons. And if this is a replay of history

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: History cannot be changed.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: There's a brawl in the saloon and a window is broken. A man in black wearing a badge shoots another man. The group run over.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's impossible! Things like this can't happen.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is this a dead man, Doctor?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Very dead, Mister Spock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's one thing we can be sure of. Death is real.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Tables, chairs, bar, pianola, no roof or walls.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Ike, Frank, hiya, boys. I didn't think I'd see you again.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Billy! Oh, Billy! (kisses Chekov) Billy, baby, I knew they couldn't keep you out of town.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Oh, you knew that?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Come on.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: She takes him to a table while the man in black walks slowly past the group.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Maybe you shouldn't have.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And pass up an opportunity to see you? Don't be silly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: It's taking crazy chances with Morgan Earp right in the same room.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The man in black.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course. The man who kills on sight. Morgan Earp.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, since we have seen that death is the one reality in this situation, I seriously suggest you reseat yourself immediately. Without moving a muscle of either hand. If I remember correctly, that would involve you in what was called the fast draw. It initiated unfortunate events.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Everyone sits. Slowly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: You boys want your usual?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Absolutely. Half a gallon of scotch.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: You know we ain't got nothing but bourbon, unless you want corn whiskey.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: I wish it was all over. I saw Virgil out patrolling this morning.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good old Virgil. We can always count on him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: They've been blowing off all over town about how they chased the Clantons out. I guess you'll show them now, won't you?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Morgan walks over to Sylvia, who is massaging Chekov's shoulders.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think we're going to have any choice.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: You'll dirty yourself with this scum. Come on.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Get your hands off her.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: Now, Claiborne.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, no. All right, all right, all right. We don't want any trouble.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: If you don't want any trouble, what are you doing in my town?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just leave us alone, Mister Earp. That's all we ask.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: Five of you. You'd like me to draw, wouldn't you? All right, I will. Soon enough. Soon enough.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Morgan Earp leaves.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe he was actually trying to provoke a dispute with Mister Chekov.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Context: bringing a bottle and glasses.
Text: Close, Ike. Lucky there wasn't two of them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I guess so.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Sylvia's right. They've been bad-mouthing something fierce all over town. You boys watch it.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I assure you, sir, we shall watch it, and everything, extremely closely.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Billy, you were wonderful. (she kisses him)

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Er, Mister Chekov?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What can I do, Captain? You know we're always supposed to maintain good relations with the natives. (he kisses her)

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Young lady. Young lady.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Yes, Ike?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to talk to Mister, to Billy alone, if you don't mind.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: All right. I understand. Billy Claiborne, you be careful.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Sylvia leaves them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, you be careful. Mister Spock, except for our hand guns, we haven't changed, not even our clothing, yet these people see and hear us as the Clantons.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't think that's such a bad thing, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: The day is still young, Ensign.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, what have we got? We're here in Tombstone, Arizona, October 26, 1881. The day of the gunfight at OK Corral. And we're the Clantons, and Morgan Earp has just gone to tell his brothers we're here.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: And if this is indeed some sort of replay of history, the Earps will kill the Clantons at the OK Corral at five o'clock this afternoon.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we're not going to be at the OK Corral at five o'clock this afternoon. You, bartender. Ed. You, er, you claim you know us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: I ain't making no big claims about you to nobody. Just so happens.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take a close look at me.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Yeah?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who do you think I am?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Ike Clanton. Who do you think you are?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know this is hard to understand, but I'm Captain James T. Kirk of the spaceship Enterprise. These men are part of my crew. We're not really here, we're from the future. We haven't been born yet. Feel the material in my shirt. Now feel the material in your own shirt. Do you notice any difference?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: No.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do these clothes look like yours?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Not exactly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you seen clothes like this before?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: Sure.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: On the Clantons. You Clantons are always great with your jokes. That's why we like you.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not joking.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: The only difference between you and the Earps is that they never joke.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not joking! I'm not Ike Clanton!

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barman
Text: It's okay with me, Ike. Anything you say. Don't make no difference who I think you are. Your problem is, who does Wyatt Earp think you are?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The Marshall is Wyatt Earp, and Morgan is also there when Kirk walks in.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good morning, gentlemen. My name's James Kirk. I'm afraid there's been some sort of misunderstanding.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: Clanton, I don't know what you're trying to pull, but we warned you not to show your ugly face in town again.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course you did, and I wanted to talk to you about that.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: We're done talking, Clanton.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's been some sort of mistake, a misunderstanding.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: All right, Clanton. One more chance. Your last. You've got until five tonight to get your horse-stealing scurvy crew out of town. All the way.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. We'd be glad to. We don't want to fight.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: I always said you was yellow, Clanton.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll make one more attempt to get through to you, Mister Earp. My name is not Clanton, it's Kirk.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: Oh, yeah. We heard the talk about your jokes.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not joking.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: Sure. Well, I'm glad to meet you Mister Kirk.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Morgan punches Kirk and they fight briefly. Kirk gets Morgan in front of him as a shield from Wyatt's gun then lets him go.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: Draw, Clanton.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not me, Mister Earp.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: You draw or I will.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: No, Wyatt. Let me. When the time comes, I'll pay him for this.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't want any trouble. We'll be glad to co-operate.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: Five o'clock, Clanton. Is that clear? If you're in town at five oh one, we'll kill every one of you whether you draw or not. Is that clear?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: McCoy is tending to Kirk's lip. He flinches from whatever McCoy has put on the cloth.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the matter?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you call that stuff? Fire?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Taos Lightning straight bourbon. Try some. In small amounts, it was considered medicinal.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Label it for external use Only.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: It just takes a bit of getting used to, Captain. Actually, a man could grow quite fond of this stuff.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take it easy, Mister Scott. I hate to think what that stuff's doing to your stomach lining.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And your reflexes. We're going to need fast reflexes from now on. There's no negotiating with the Earps. We know that.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. If we only had a phaser.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Or a communicator. It'd be a pleasure to watch those Earps as we beamed back to the ship at exactly four fifty nine thirty.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could we make a communicator?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible, Captain. In this century, there are no metal alloys or power sources to make devices such as ours.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The problem is clear, Spock. We're going to have to seek contemporary solutions. Where's Chekov?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Chekov is involved, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You shouldn't have come back to town, Billy. Morgan'll kill you because he wants me.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: With his outdated weapon? If he shoots at me, I will just step out of the way.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You can joke about it. I've seen them in action. Especially Morgan.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A lot of people and things have tried to kill me. You'd be surprised.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, I mean Billy. Come along.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Billy? Please, don't even go near him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Where are we going, Captain?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To exercise the better part of valour.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: But when they get to the City Limits notice, they are stopped with a sizzle.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that settles that. A force field.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Then a clock face in mid-air strikes three.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is obvious the Melkotians are not going to permit us to leave this town.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: If we could only contact the Enterprise.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, but where is the Enterprise?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov. If you were in charge of the Enterprise, what would you be doing?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I'd be using the ship's sensors trying to locate us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. If we could find the place where we beamed down, the ship might lock in and beam us up.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well let's get there.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's no way we can know where it is, Doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It could be anywhere within a thousand mile radius.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, why don't you join us common humanoids in trying to find a way out of here, and quit explaining why we can't get out of here.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have until five o'clock to find that way. Now consider this. What materials were on hand in 1881 that could help us fight the Earps on their own terms?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Context: showing his gun
Text: We have these, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, the Melkots gave us those to execute us. We have to find a way to put the Earps out of action. Is there anything that exists here and now that could help us out of this trap?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: All those western Cossacks had were poisonous snakes and cactus plants.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, the venom, the plants. Can you make use of them?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A tranquilliser. Of course, Jim. I can make a tranquilliser!

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I could make a device to deliver it on target.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: First, Bones, the ingredients you require.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know the place to get the proper drugs. I'll need a mortar and a pestle.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, mortar and pestle.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: McCoy and Chekov leave.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you intend to deliver the tranquilliser on target?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall need some fusing and cotton wadding.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cotton wadding. Try the apothecary.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. (leaves)

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall manufacture the equivalent of an ancient generating canister, more familiarly known as a gas grenade.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The sign on the wall says Teeth Pulling By Appointment. There's a man in the chair having a shave.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barber
Text: I'll be about five minutes yet. You could come back.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, thank you. Mind if I look around a bit? (checking the bottles) Crude, but very useable.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barber
Text: I wouldn't touch that stuff if I was you.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, you don't have to worry. I know how to handle this. I have an urgent need for a small supply of this drug, too.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Barber
Text: That stuff ain't mine. It belongs to him. You'd better ask him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, so you're the dentist. Well, I'm a physician, and I have a serious emergency. I wonder if you mind if I borrow a small quantity of this.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Holliday
Text: You want it now?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My name is McCoy. I'm a doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Holliday
Text: That joke is all around town already, McLowery. But my name is still Holliday. Doc Holliday.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The emergency is real. I need these things.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Holliday
Text: Your emergency sure is real. Go on, take the stuff. Have some more fun. Take my bag. Only best you be finished before five o'clock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That is my intention, Doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Holliday
Text: Because at one minute past five, you'll find a hole in your head. Right from this gun.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: A sawn-off shotgun. McCoy leaves with the bag and bottles.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Ahem.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sylvia! Hello.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Billy Claiborne, you know how crazy I am about you.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That's very nice.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Well, aren't you going to ask me what I've got in my shopping bag?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That's just what I was preparing to inquire. Have you been shopping?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Of course, silly! What else would I be doing on a beautiful afternoon with the dance only one week away? Or have you forgotten that already?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No, no, I haven't forgotten. I am looking forward to it most eagerly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: You will be absolutely wild when you see me in the new gown I'm going to make. I found this most scrumptious material, yards and yards of it. You know what I was thinking, Billy? I was thinking what a beautiful wedding gown it would make. Why don't we just turn that dance into a wedding ball? It would be so heavenly.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Married? I'm afraid that wouldn't be possible.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: But I'm positive the gown will be ready. What else is there to stop a wedding?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: But it is absolutely impossible. I am not someone you can marry. If only I could make clear to you what I really am.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Sylvia
Text: Do you think I don't know? Billy Claiborne, you are a cattle rustler and a horse thief and I don't care what else.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: I warned you, Claiborne. Stay away.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Morgan punches Chekov, knocking him down.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Morgan
Text: You don't have to take anything from that scum, not while I'm here.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Mister Earp. Get your hands off her.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Chekov walks towards Morgan, and gets shot. Kirk and Spock hear Sylvia's scream and arrive on the scene the same time as McCoy, followed by Scott. Wyatt and Holliday also turn up.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's nothing I can do, Jim.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: Come on, Clanton. Let's do it now.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, let me.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Holliday
Text: Yeah, come on, Captain. Let him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we can't just stand here and take it.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we can.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: But they murdered Chekov! If you think I'm going to

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, they're trying to push us into something we're not ready for.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: And it is not yet our time.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Spock is working on the grenade, McCoy and Scott on the tranquilliser.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let it go, Jim. He's dead.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe he wouldn't be if I hadn't ignored the Melkot warning.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We all knew the risk when we joined the service. Now let it go.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, there is one thing which requires the immediate attention of all of us. Specifically, our future.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not this minute, Spock. It takes us a little longer.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand the feeling, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You talk about another man's feelings. What do you feel, Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: My feelings are not a subject for discussion, Doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Because there are no feelings to discuss.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, Chekov is dead! I say it now, and I can hardly believe it. But you worked closely with him. That deserves some memorial.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock will have no truck with grief, Scotty. It's human.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, Scotty.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it's quite all right. They forget I am half human.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The clock strikes four.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We don't have much time.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. I vaguely remember the historical account of the famous battle in which we are about to engage, but I am confused.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: About what?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since each of us represents members of the Clanton gang. You, Ike Clanton, I, Frank McLowery, then Mister Chekov would be the other Billy, would he not?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: William Claiborne, that's right.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: But did not William Claiborne survive the battle at the OK Corral?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Get to the point, Spock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Chekov is dead. But in the actual gunfight, William Claiborne survived.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Yes, that's right. That means it doesn't have to happen the way it happened. We can change it. Bones, how's the tranquilliser coming?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll have it ready before Spock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Another hour.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And we'll have a tranquilliser grenade?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not precisely.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forget precision. Will it work?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: It should.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Make sure it does, Spock. If we don't tranquillise them, we'll have to fight them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And if we fight them, we all die. We know that.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negotiating with them could buy us more time, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not with the Earps. I've tried that. That's out. There must be a way. History has been changed in the fact that Billy Claiborne didn't die, but Chekov is lying there dead. That means there must be a way to change this history.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be worth a try, at least until we're certain of the device. Then perhaps we could quiet things down.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not with the Earps. There is one other place I can try.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: You looking for somebody?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Sheriff. I want you to stop the fight.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Stop it? Who wants to stop it? I sure don't. You don't. You didn't yesterday.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I do now.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Since when does a Clanton run crawling to the law for help?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How else is he going to get justice?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Context: indicating gun
Text: From this. You and your boys set up this whole thing to take care of the Earps. It's a little late to decide you don't have the belly for it.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not too late. Sheriff. Sheriff. There must be plenty of decent people in town who don't like the Earps. Let's organise them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Don't talk nonsense. The people in this town are counting on you to get rid of the Earps for them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then the people had better wake up and let the law work for them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: You can talk that way after what the Earps did to Billy today? Nobody in this town will deny you your right to your revenge.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I want revenge. I want to crush the life out of the Earps. But I can't just kill them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: You listen to me. Get down to the OK Corral. Keep out of sight. When the Earps come looking, you bushwhack them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't I get it through your stupid head? I can't just kill them! I can't murder them!

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: It's the only way.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't kill them! I can't kill them!

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Behan
Text: Kill them any way you can! There'll be no questions asked. Honest. I guarantee that!

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: These crude supplies we were forced to use worked quite well.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I doubt that this combination of things was ever used for any purpose quite like this.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps they would've been if they'd had your ingenuity, Doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Kirk enters.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How soon will that be ready?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Right now.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. How long will it take the tranquilliser to have effect?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Three or four seconds.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did you manage to test it?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has not been tested.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's not necessary, Captain. It's very simple. Nothing can go wrong.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Up to now, everything has gone wrong. I want it tested now.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Would a volunteer solve the problem?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It would.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right. On one condition. That I'm wide awake and with you at five o'clock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Guaranteed.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. (has a slug of whiskey) It's to kill the pain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: But this is painless.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, you should've warned me sooner, Mister Spock. Fire away.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Spock pulls the thread on the can, and gas comes out. Scott stands close to it. Then he picks it up so the gas obscures his face.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It should have worked. Did you inhale the gas, Scotty?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. Deeply.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You still feel all right?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: I never felt better.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No dizziness? No sweating? No palpitations?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It doesn't work.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was our last chance.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you don't seem to understand. It did not function, but it must function.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing could go wrong, Captain. It should work.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: A scientific fact But if the tranquilliser does not function, which is clearly impossible, then a radical alteration of our thought patterns must be in order.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We need a weapon. An answer.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't have to worry about that now, Jim. Look at the clock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ten minutes and it's all going to end at the OK Corral. Well, we're going to wait right here until well after five o'clock. We're not going to move from this spot.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Famous last words, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: But there is a forcefield to stop them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, Bones. (and it's all the way around.) We're trapped. They got their way. We've got to stand and fight.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Scott
Text: Good. If they want a fight, let's gie'em a fight.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're experts at gunfighting. We don't have a chance.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then we'd better become experts, and fast.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: That may not be necessary.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you've got something?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: A fact, Captain. Physical laws simply cannot be ignored. Existence cannot be without them.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean, Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I mean, Doctor, that we are faced with a staggering contradiction. The tranquilliser you created should have been effective.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It would've been effective anywhere else.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. Doctor, in your opinion, what killed Mister Chekov?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: A piece of lead in his body.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Wrong. His mind killed him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Spock. If you've got the answer, tell us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Physical reality is consistent with universal laws. Where the laws do not operate, there is no reality. All of this is unreal.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean unreal? I examined Chekov. He's dead.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: But you made your examination under conditions which we cannot trust. We judge reality by the response of our senses. Once we are convinced of the reality of a given situation, we abide by its rules. We judged the bullets to be solid, the guns to be real, therefore they can kill.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov is dead because he believed the bullets would kill him.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: He may indeed be dead. We do not know.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we do know that the Melkotians created the situation. If we do not allow ourselves to believe that the bullets are real, they cannot kill us.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly. I know the bullets are unreal, therefore they cannot harm me.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must all be as certain as you are, Mister Spock, to save our lives.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But that's not possible. There'd always be some doubt.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: The smallest doubt would be enough to kill you.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're just human beings, Spock. We don't have that clockwork ticker in our head like you do. We can't turn it on and off.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must. Spock, a Vulcan mind meld.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, sir. Engineer?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The clock strikes five. Wyatt Earp puts on his gun belt.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your mind to my mind. Your thoughts to my thoughts.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The marshalls gather as the lightning flashes and the wind blows.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Context: to McCoy
Text: The bullets are unreal. Without body. They are illusions only. Shadows without substance. They will not pass through your body, for they do not exist.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They do not exist.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Holliday joins the Earps.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK (to Kirk) Unreal. Appearances only. They are shadows. Illusions. Nothing but ghosts of reality. They are lies. Falsehoods. Spectres without body. They are to be ignored.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The melds have been completed when the four killers arrive at the Corral.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Wyatt
Text: Draw.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: Kirk reaches for his gun, and the Earps fire. We see the bullets splintering the wood behind the landing party. The Earps empty their guns, then Kirk engages Wyatt in good old-fashioned fisticuffs. He beats him but chooses not to shoot him. Everything disappears.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: McCoy is examining Chekov at his station.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, I don't understand.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Neither do I. He's in perfect health.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What happened? Where have I been?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right here, it seems.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: But that girl. She was so beautiful. So real.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you remember anything else?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Perhaps that explains why he's here. Nothing was real to him except the girl.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Melkotian object.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sensor readings.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: The object is beginning to emit M-rays of a highly unstable nature, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, sound Red Alert. Mister Chekov, deflector shields on full. Phaser gun crews, lock on target.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energy output increasing beyond measurable levels, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser guns, stand by to fire.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Context: The Melkotian buoy explodes.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's, it's gone, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damage report, Lieutenant.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No damage, sir. All decks report fully operational.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Melkot
Text: Captain Kirk. You did not kill. Is this the way of your kind?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is. We fight only when there's no choice. We prefer the ways of peaceful contact. I speak for a vast alliance of fellow creatures who believe in the same thing. We have sought you out to join us. Our mission is still one of peace.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Melkot
Text: Approach our planet and be welcome. A delegation will come out to meet you. Our warning threats are over.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excellent. Lieutenant, cancel Red Alert. Mister Chekov, resume original course, warp factor two.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Warp factor two, sir.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. May I ask a question? You needn't answer if it seems too personal.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sure I'll be able to give you an answer, Mister Spock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: This afternoon, you wanted to kill, didn't you?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But he didn't kill, Mister Spock.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: But he wanted to, Doctor.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that the way it seemed to you, Mister Spock?

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you're absolutely right. That's exactly the way it was.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mankind, ready to kill.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the way it was in 1881.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Spock
Text: I wonder how humanity managed to survive.

Title: Spectre Of The Gun
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We overcame our instinct for violence.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Captain'S Log
Text: Stardate 4372.5. On a top-secret diplomatic mission, the Enterprise has entered the Tellun star system. Maintaining communications blackout, we have taken aboard Petri, Ambassador from Troyius, the outer planet, and are now approaching the inner planet Elas.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Some desk-bound Starfleet bureaucrat cut these cloak-and-dagger orders.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, but why the secrecy? This star system's under Federation control.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's in a border area, Mister Scott. The Klingons also claim jurisdiction.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: From what I've seen, it's not worth fighting about. Why are we here, Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My orders are to co-operate with Ambassador Petri in all matters pertaining to his mission here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. (Scott presses the intercom button) Kirk here. What is it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have a signal from the Elasians. They're ready to beam aboard, and they demand an explanation for the delay.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Demand? What delay? All right. Beam them aboard.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sounds typical of the Elasians. The scientists who made the initial investigation reported the men were vicious and arrogant.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's just the negative part, Mister Spock. I've been over those records. Now the women, they're supposed to be something very special. They're supposed to have a kind of subtle, mystical power that drives men wild.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The Ambassador is a skinny humanoid with orange hair and grass green skin.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador Petri, would you drop all this nonsense and tell me what this is about?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: That must wait until the Dohlman is aboard.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dohlman? What the devil is a Dohlman?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: The thing most feared and hated by my people. Our most deadly enemy.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Three burly men are beamed aboard. They draw their weapons.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Welcome. I am Petri, Ambassador of Troyius.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain Kirk. This ship is under my command.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: There's a Troyian here. I must know that all is secure before the Dohlman is brought on board.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This ship is secure and we're prepared for any hostile acts. Energise.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The Elasians get down on one knee.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: Do honour to the Dohlman of Elas.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Petri kneels

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: Glory to Elaan, Dohlman of Elas.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: A woman in little more than a high-necked bathing suit is beamed aboard. She is beautiful, but slightly sullen. The Enterprise officers kneel.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: You may stand.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Body armour, nuclear weapons.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not without precedent, Captain. Remember that

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: Permission to speak was not given.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You rule this ship?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am the first officer. This is Captain James Kirk.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Your Glory, I am Petri. In the name of my people

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Your mission is known to us. Captain Kirk, you have now permission to show us to our quarters.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, now, just a moment. There's going to have to be some kind of understanding.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Please.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My first officer Mister Spock will show you to your quarters. Ambassador, I'd like to speak to you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You have not been dismissed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: May I have your permission to go?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You are now dismissed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, thank you. Ambassador.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador, I think it's time you told me what's going on.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: That creature, Elaan, is to be the wife of our ruler to bring peace. Our two warring planets now possess the capability of mutual destruction. Some method of co-existence must be found.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. So, we go back to Troyius.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Yes. But slowly, Captain. I will need time. Before we reach there, she must be taught civilised manners. In her present condition, my people would never accept her.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you are to be her teacher?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Those are my orders. I must ask you and your crew to respect, or at least tolerate, their arrogance. Friction must be kept at a minimum.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that I can understand.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Another thing you should understand, Captain. You have as much at stake as I have. Your superiors made the statement that failure of this mission would be as catastrophic for Federation planning as it would be for our two planets. To gain peace at the price of accepting such a queen is no victory. I will take her the official gifts I bear. Perhaps that will soften her mood.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, lay in a course for Troyius. Mister Sulu, impulse drive, speed factor point zero three seven.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Impulse drive, Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's correct, Mister Sulu. Sublight factor point zero three seven.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain? You'll not be using the warp drive? All the way on impulse? That'll take a great deal of time.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You in a hurry, Mister Scott?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: No.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Spock enters.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Dohlman is dissatisfied with the quarters provided.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What's the matter with them, Mister Spock?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know, but all the Elasians seem most irrational.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I gave up my quarters because I

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I appreciate your sacrifice, Lieutenant Uhura. I'll talk to her myself.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan is throwing slippers at Petri.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Swine! Take back your gifts!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Your Glory, these are your wedding slippers.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Your ruler cannot buy the favours of the Dohlman of Elas.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: This, (a sky blue thing) this is your wedding dress, a gift from the bridegroom's mother.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I want nothing of his!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: This, This is the most prized of royal jewels for your lovely neck.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kirk enters.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I would strangle if I was to put the gift of a Troyian dog around my neck. Kryton, by whose permission did he enter?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: He came in answer to your summons.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand you're not happy with your quarters.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Quarters! (throws something that breaks)

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, not happy at all.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Am I a soft Troyian fawn to need pillows to sit on? And these ridiculous female trappings. They are an offense to my eyes.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My communications officer generously vacated the rooms hoping you would find it satisfactory.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I do not find them so, and I find him even less satisfactory. Must my bitterness be compounded with that ridiculous ambassador aboard your ship?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: I explained to Her Glory that her council of nobles and the Troyius Tribunal jointly agreed that I should instruct (pause) make her acquainted with the customs and manners of our people.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Kryton! Remove him! And take that garbage with you?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Petri picks up the wedding dress and necklace box, and leaves with Kryton.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: He dares to suggest that I adopt the servile manners of his people!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your Glory doesn't seem to be responding to instruction.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I will never forgive the council for putting me through this torture. Were you responding to my demand for better quarters?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are none better. I suggest you make do with these.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You suggest?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are no more available, but if that's the only way you can get gratification, I'll arrange to have the whole room filled from floor to ceiling with breakable objects.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I will not be humiliated!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then act in a civilised fashion.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I did not give you permission to leave!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't ask for any.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Captain, I wish to contact my government. I cannot fulfil my mission. It would be an insult to our ruler to bring this incorrigible monster as a bride!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador! This is supposed to be a peaceful mission.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: There cannot be peace between us. We have deluded ourselves. Captain, when I am near them, I do not want peace. I want to kill them.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're as bad as she is. It's not required that you like each other. Just do your job.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Job? The job is impossible. We cannot make peace with people we detest.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop trying to kill each other. Then worry about being friendly.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: But if she won't listen to me

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then make her listen, Ambassador. Use a different approach. Stop being so diplomatic. She respects strength. Go in strong.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: At first it appeared to be a sensor ghost, but I've run checks on all the instrumentation. All the equipment is functioning perfectly.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hydrogen cloud reflection?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: None in this area. Nothing that would account for it. The ghost appears intermittently.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speculation?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: None, Captain. Insufficient data.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's not an instrument malfunction. It's not a reflection from a natural phenomenon. A spaceship?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering to Captain Kirk.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I know what you said about showing respect, but must I have these persons fool around with my equipment?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hang on, Scotty. Be pleasant no matter how much it hurts. I'll be right down.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Man
Text: We're only running on impulse engines now. Ordinarily, we use the warp engines exclusively.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, I suppose, lassie, that even our impulse engines must seem fast compared to your nuclear propulsion units.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: We are interested in how the ship is used in combat, not in what drives it. Engines are for mechanics and menials.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Menials? Without engines, there'd be no fighting or

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott! I wish you had told me you wanted a tour of the engineering department.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Do we not have the freedom of this ship? We have granted your crew the permission not to kneel in our presence. What else do you want?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Courtesy. Remember?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Courtesy is not for inferiors.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Courtesy is for everyone around here, and you'll find you won't be able to exist on Troyius without it. Mister Scott, our Chief Engineer, has shown you his engineering department. That's a courtesy. You respond by saying thank you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The diminutive firecracker stalks away with her bodyguards.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: That sensor ghost is moving closer.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Lost contact now.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we had a momentary fix on the object enough to establish it was a spaceship.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whose?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: No data yet.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain! Distant bearing, sir, mark seven three point five.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Main screen. Extreme magnification.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: A Klingon ship appears in view.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our ghost has materialised.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A Klingon warship. (after a few moments) Any change, Mister Spock?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. The Klingon ship has simply moved into contact range. She is pacing us, precisely matching our sublight speed and on a parallel course.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Security
Text: Security to Captain Kirk.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Security
Text: Disturbance in the Dohlman's quarters, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Security
Text: Captain, it's Ambassador Petri. They refuse to explain what's happening, but

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: Her Glory has not summoned you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan comes out of her room

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Kryton, remove that Troyian pig.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Petri is lying on the floor, with a dagger in his back.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It was a deep wound, Jim. He lost a lot of blood, but he'll recover.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: If I recover, it will be no thanks to you, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said talk with her, not fight with her.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: I should've known better than to talk to her unarmed, but you forced me. I hold you responsible for this.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I've heard of reluctant brides, but this is ridiculous.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk. May I speak with you, sir?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Certainly.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: A message just came from Starfleet Command. It was class-A security and scrambled. I put it through the decoder.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The Federation High Commissioner is on his way to Troyius to attend the royal wedding.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Ambassador, if Elasian women are that vicious, why are men so overwhelmingly attracted to them? I mean, what magic do they possess?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: It's not magic. It's biochemical. A man whose flesh is once touched by the tears of a woman of Elas has his heart enslaved forever.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador, there's an added complication. The Federation High Commissioner will be attending the wedding.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The fat will be in the fire when he learns the bride just tried to murder the groom's ambassador.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: There will be no wedding. I would not have our ruler marry that monster if the entire galaxy depended on it, and I will have nothing further to do with you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not asking you to have anything to do with me. Do your job with her. How long before he's on his feet?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It'll be a few days. A week, at least, Jim.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Here you put me, Captain. Here I will stay. I have nothing further to say to you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: She is dining like a Tudor royal, ripping poultry apart with her hands.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: So, Ambassador Petri is going to recover? That is too bad. You have delivered your message. Now you may go.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing would please me more, Your Glory. But your impetuous nature

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Your Troyian pig was here in my quarters without any permission, so I stabbed him. Just to be Troyian is enough.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You Elasians pride yourselves on being a warrior people. You must understand discipline to be able to give and take orders. My orders are to take you to Troyius to be married and to see that you learn Troyian customs.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I despise Troyians. Any contact with them makes me feel soiled.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's been my experience that the prejudices people feel about each other disappear when they get to know each other.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: It's not in my experience.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we're still faced with the same problem.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Problem?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the problem of your indoctrination to Troyian customs and manners.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I have eliminated that problem.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have eliminated the teacher. The problem still remains.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Oh. And how do we solve the problem?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By giving you a new teacher.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Tell me, what can you teach me?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Table manners, for one thing. This is a plate. It contains food. This is a knife. It cuts the food. This is a glass.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Leave me!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like it or not, you're going to learn what you've been ordered to learn.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You will return me to Elas immediately.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Everything I order is possible.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the first problem we're going to work on. Then we'll get you ready to go to Troyius.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I will not go to Troyius, I will not be mated to a Troyian, and I will not be humiliated, and I will not be given to a green pig as a bribe to stop a war!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You enjoy the privileges and prerogatives of being a Dohlman. Then be worthy of them. If you don't want the obligations that go along with the title, then give it up.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Nobody speaks to me that way.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's another one of your problems. Nobody's told you that you're an uncivilized savage, a vicious child in a woman's body, an arrogant monster!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan slaps Kirk, so he slaps her back.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's no way to treat someone who's telling you the truth.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: He turns to leave, she takes a knife from her sleeve and throws it. It just misses him and sticks in the wall.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tomorrow's lesson will be on courtesy.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, open up the hailing frequency, identify us, and ask the Klingon his intentions.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Meanwhile, Kryton is sneaking around in Engineering, and messing with the dilithium crystals.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, no response from the Klingon vessel on any channel.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. All right, Lieutenant. Monitor all frequencies. Phaser crews stand by. Maintain Yellow Alert.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Watson
Text: What are you doing?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kryton kills the red-shirt and hides his body, then continues with his sabotage.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kirk is prevented from entering Elaan's quarters.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elasian
Text: No one may enter the Dohlman's presence.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's Kryton?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elasian
Text: On business. No one may enter the Dohlman's presence.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you tell Her Glory that Captain Kirk requests the honour of a visit.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elasian
Text: The Dohlman has promised I'll be whipped to death if I let Captain Kirk pass through that door.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: They push Kirk away, so Spock stuns them with a phaser.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. When they wake up, take them to Security holding.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, your analysis of the situation was flawless, anticipating that she would deny you admittance. However, the logic by which you arrived at your conclusion escapes me.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, the women on your planet are logical. That's the only planet in this galaxy that can make that claim.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan takes another swing at Kirk, so he forces her back down onto the bed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You dare touch a member of the royal family.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Only in self-defence. Now, are you going to behave or not?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: The penalty is death for what you are doing.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not on Elas. We're on my starship. I command here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: She bites his hand and runs into the bathroom.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You are warned, Captain, never to touch me again.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I touch you again, Your Glory, it'll be to administer an ancient Earth custom called a spanking, a form of punishment administered to spoiled brats.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You have my leave to go.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You forget, Your Glory, we haven't started your lesson in courtesy.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You can teach me nothing, Captain. If I have to stay here for ten light years, I will not be soiled by any contact with you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. I'll send in Mister Spock or Doctor McCoy. Either way, you're going to be properly prepared for Troyius. As ordered by councils, rulers, and bureaucrats.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: She comes back out.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Captain, there is one thing you can teach me.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, you were right the first time. There's nothing I can teach you. There's nothing you do not know.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I don't know how to make people like me. I don't want everybody to hate me.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it's not it's not that people hate you. It's just that people don't like to be treated as though they don't exist.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: He wipes a tear from her face.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's, er, gotten very, er. Something must've gone wrong with the ventilation system.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pardon me, Your Glory. There will be a short recess.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: They kiss.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Captain, that ancient Earth custom called spanking, what is it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's, er, It's, er. We'll talk about it later.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: He pulls her into a passionate embrace.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: In Engineering, Kryton finishes his task and opens a communicator.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: A light flashes on Uhura's panel.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk. Mister Spock, I'm getting

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have it on my sensor, Lieutenant.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk. Come in, please. Captain Kirk, please answer.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, Captain, I'm picking up a transmission from inside the Enterprise. It's on a tight beam aimed at the Klingon vessel.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Elaan's quarters]

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Inside the Enterprise? Can you pinpoint it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain. I am triangulating now. It's coming from the engineering section.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security to Engineering. Intruder alert. Security alert to all decks. Kirk out.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: He leaves Elaan on the bed with a smug smile on her face.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kryton has been caught.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Nobody saw him, but that devil sneaked back in here some way. Watson must've caught him and he was killed for it. He had this. Looks like some sort of transmitter.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's Klingon. Bones?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Neck snapped clean.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What kind of signal did you send the Klingon ship?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kryton
Text: Captain, you must know I will tell you nothing. Our interrogation techniques are more excruciating than you are even capable of.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm aware you're trained to resist any form of physical torture. Kirk to Spock.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, it was Kryton transmitting. He refuses to talk. I'll need you for the Vulcan mind meld.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kryton grabs a security guard's phaser and vapourises himself.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Security
Text: Captain, I'm sorry. He seemed

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was he trying to cover that was so important he felt he had to die for it? Scotty, he didn't come into Engineering just to use the transmitter. I want you to check every relay you've got.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, you must realise the time

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't waste the time telling me about it. Get to it.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Kryton was of a noble family. He loved me and wanted to marry me. He was furious when he heard of the announcement of the wedding plans.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He sold out to the Klingons because of jealousy?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Probably. But why speak of unimportant matters when we can speak about us?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's a Klingon warship out there. What's their involvement? Surely all of this isn't because they want to stop a marriage.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: We should welcome their help.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Elaan. Elaan, two planets, an entire star system's stability depends on it. We have a duty to forget what happened.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Could you do that? Could you give me to another man?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My orders and yours say that you belong to another man. What happened, what happened was an accident.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: It was no accident. I chose you, and you chose me. I have a plan. With this ship, you could completely obliterate Troyius. Then there will be no need for the marriage. And in gratitude, my people will give you the complete rule of this system.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What kind of a mind could think of such a thing?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: He's a Troyian.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: They kiss, and the doorbell buzzes.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You cannot resist my love, my love.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The door opens, and McCoy and Spock see the lovers in their close embrace.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: May we see you a moment?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. Jim! May we please have a word with you?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, are you all right?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did she cry, Jim?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did she cry? Did her tears touch you at any time?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kirk looks at his hand.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, we're in trouble. Now listen, Jim. Petri told Christine that the Elasian women have a sort of a biochemical substance in their tears that acts like a super love potion. And according to him, it doesn't wear off.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is true then, Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's true. Bones, you've got to find me an antidote.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll try, but I'll need tests and

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the Klingon ship has changed course. It is heading toward us at warp speed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm on my way. Battle stations.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers stand by.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers ready, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their speed is better than warp six, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, lay in a course to take us out of this star system. If they want to fight, Let's get some manoeuvering room.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Course computed, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Laid in, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Ahead warp factor two.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, the matter-antimatter

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Belay that order. What is it, Scotty?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: The anti-matter pods are rigged to blow up the moment we go into warp drive.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, that bomb he planted. Can you dismantle it?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not without being blown halfway across the galaxy.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give us every ounce of power you can from the impulse drive, and find a solution to the bomb. Kirk out. Mister Sulu, stand by to make your manoeuvres smartly. She'll be sluggish on response.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan enters the bridge. Kirk sees her during Sulu's countdown.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir. One hundred thousand kilometres. Ninety. Eighty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phaser crews, stand by to fire on command.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sixty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Fifty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold your fire.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: She's passed us without firing a shot.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't think they meant to attack us. We were very fortunate this time.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, their tactics are quite clear now, Mister Spock. They were trying to make us cut in warp drive. That way we'd have blown ourselves up and solved their problem for them without risking war with the Federation. Very neat.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very. But why do the Klingons consider the possession of this system so vital?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, a very good question, Mister Spock.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
