Text: I have another question, Captain. Is not the bridge the wrong place for the Dohlman at a time like this?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be the judge. Yes, you're quite right. Thank you, Mister Spock. (to Elaan) I want you to go to Sickbay. It's the best protected part of the ship.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I want to be by your side.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your presence here is interfering with my efficiency, my ability to protect you. Mister Spock, you have the conn.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deck five.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I love you. I have chosen you, and still I don't understand why you didn't fight the Klingon.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I can accomplish my mission by turning tail and running, I'll gladly do that.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: And that mission is to take me to Troyius.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Would you have me wearing my wedding dress for another man and never see you again?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Elaan.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Are you happy at the prospect?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've got bad news, Captain. The entire dilithium crystal converter assembly is fused. No chance of repair.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's completely unusable.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No chance of restoring warp drive?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not without dilithium crystals. We can't even generate enough power to fire our weapons.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. Elaan, I have to go back to the Bridge. Please, you must go to Sickbay.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Yes, my love.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Test number twenty four. Colladium trioxide in algobarium solution.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Results also negative.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Doctor, there is no antidote to the poison of Elasian tears. The men of Elas have tried desperately for centuries to dispel its power. You're wasting your time, Doctor.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It is my time to waste, Ambassador.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Doctor? The Captain asked me to come here for safety.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Safety? What is your estimate of our chances for survival, Doctor?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That is the captain's responsibility, Ambassador.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, message from the Klingon ship. They're ordering us to stand by for boarding or be destroyed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: They demand an immediate reply.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're trying to force a fight. Scotty, what's our energy status?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ninety three percent of impulse power, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can still manoeuvre.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Manoeuvre? Aye. We can wallow like a garbage scow against a warp-driven starship.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Our shields will hold for a few passes, but without the matter-antimatter reactor, we've no chance. Captain, can you not call Starfleet on this emergency?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And let the Klingons know they succeeded in wiping out our warp engines?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Help could not arrive before the Enterprise would be destroyed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Petri
Text: Now that we are all about to die, I ask you once again to accept this necklace, and to wear it as a token of respect for the desperate wishes of your people and mine for peace.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: That's all you men of other worlds can speak of, duty and responsibility.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll stall for time, proceed on course and hope the Klingons can be bluffed. Or that they're not prepared for a general war. Open a hailing frequency.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Frequency open, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise on Federation business. Our mission is peaceful, but we're not prepared to accept any interference.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Enterprise, prepare to be boarded or destroyed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd say our strategy wasn't totally effective.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, the Klingon ship is closing on an intercept course. Five hundred thousand kilometres. Deflector shields up.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, can you give me partial power on the phaser banks?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Elaan enters, in the blue wedding dress and wearing the necklace.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir, not a chance.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Three hundred thousand kilometres.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I told you to stay in Sickbay.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I want to die with you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not going to die. Now get off the bridge.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One hundred thousand kilometres.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Weapons fire hits the Enterprise

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's passed us. All shields held.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, bring her to one four three mark two. Keep our forward shields to him.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Here he comes again, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay with the controls. Keep our forward shields to him.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Better than warp seven.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard over, Sulu. Bring her around. He's going for our flank. (another disruptor hit) Sulu!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sorry, Captain. She won't respond fast enough on impulse.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's past us again. Damage to number four shield.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How bad?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: It will not withstand another full charge, Captain. I'm getting some very peculiar energy readings.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's paralleling us again. He seems to have broken off the attack.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What sort of readings, Mister Spock?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: She is the source.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Elaan?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: The necklace.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What kind of jewels are in this?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: They call them radans. The necklace is supposed to bring you luck. It is of little value. They are common stones.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: These are common stones? (scans them) See, Captain? Here and here.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Common stones? Now I see why the Klingons are interested in this system. May I have this?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: If I can be of any help, of course.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may have just saved our lives. Mister Spock, do you think Scotty could make use of dilithium crystals?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: No doubt, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: He's coming in again, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, prepare on my order to turn quickly to port. Try and protect the number four shield.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, Sulu. hard a-port!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Another disrupter hit

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shields holding, but weakened, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. Message coming in.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Enterprise, our readings confirm your power extremely low, your shields buckling. This is your last chance to surrender.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, number four shield just collapsed. Impulse power down to thirty one percent.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, open a hailing frequency.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Channel open, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James Kirk of the United Spaceship Enterprise. May I request your terms for surrender?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Klingon
Text: No terms. Surrender must be unconditional and immediate.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, your estimate.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're fitting it now, sir, but we'll have to run a few tests to make sure.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Test it in combat.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, these are crude crystals. There is no way to judge what the unusual shapes will do to the energy flow.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, that could blow us up just as effectively as

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me know when it's in place. Open a hailing frequency.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing frequency open, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is the Enterprise. Will you guarantee the safety of our passenger, the Dohlman from Elas?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Klingon
Text: No conditions. Surrender immediately.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, he's starting his run.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's in place, sir, but I can't answer for what happens.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You and Spock get up here. Sulu, prepare for warp manoeuvres.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, arm photon torpedoes.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Photon torpedoes ready.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp power to the shields, Captain?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative. His sensors will pick up our power increase. The more helpless he thinks we are, the closer he'll come. As he passes, I want to cut in warp drive. We'll pivot at warp two and bring all tubes to bear.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, give him a full spread of photon torpedoes.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Scott and Spock enter

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One hundred thousand kilometres.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, stand by to cut in warp drive.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: Fluctuation. It's the shape of the crystals. I was afraid of that.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Seventy five. Seventy. Sixty. Fifty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire at minimum range.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Forty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Text: She won't steady down.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Thirty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp in, Scotty. Full power to shields.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The Klingons fire.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp factor two. Bring us to course one four eight mark three.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: The Klingons fire again

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, photon torpedoes. Fire!

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Six torpedoes go, but not all hit the Klingons

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Direct hit amidships by photon torpedo.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: Damage to Klingon number three shield. Number four shield obliterated. Loss of manoeuvre power.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Chekov
Text: He's badly damaged, Captain. Continuing away at reduced speed.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from general quarters. Well done, Mister Sulu. Scotty.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: But I don't understand you. You mean you won't pursue and finish him off?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Mister Sulu, resume course for Troyius.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: Kirk is already there when Petri and Elaan enter, her bodyguards trailing behind

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: You will not beam down for the ceremony?

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: I want you to have this as a personal memento. I have learned that on Troyius, they do not wear such things. Remember me.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: She hands over her dagger.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have no choice.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Elaan
Text: Nor have I. I have only responsibilities and obligations. Goodbye.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Goodbye. Energise.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Scott
Context: to Spock
Text: It's stabilised now.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Context: McCoy enters

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I've isolated the biochemical substance of the Elasian tears. It's a kind of an infection, and I think I've found an antidote.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: You are too late, Doctor. The Captain has found his own antidote.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you out of your Vulcan mind? Do you know how long I've worked on

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: The antidote to a woman of Elas, Doctor, is a starship. The Enterprise infected the Captain long before the Dohlman did.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, prepare to take us out of orbit.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I doubt seriously if there's any kind of an antidote for the Enterprise.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Spock
Text: In this particular instance, Doctor, I agree with you.

Title: Elaan of Troyius
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ahead warp factor two.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Conifers stand on the slopes down to a lake, where three figures beam down onto a trackway.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look at those pine trees.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And that lake.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I swear that's honeysuckle I smell.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I swear that's a little orange blossom thrown in. It's unbelievable. Growth exactly like that of Earth on a planet half a galaxy away. What are the odds on such duplication?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Astronomical, Captain. The relative size, age and composition of this planet makes it highly improbable that it would evolve similarly to Earth in any way.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What in blazes is that?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: A bizarre structure on a dais, with steps leading up to it.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis, Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: An alien metal of some kind. An alloy resistant to probe. Readings can't even measure its age accurately. These incised symbols are fascinating. Evidently, some form of writing.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any theories about what it is?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Structures of this complexity require extremely sophisticated building apparatus, the kind usually found in cultures surpassing or equalling our own.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Meadows and no meteor craters. The whole place is an enigma, biologically and culturally.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the nearest concentration of life forms, Mister Spock?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bearing one one seven mark four.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And how much time did you say we have to investigate?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we are to divert the asteroid which is on a collision course with this planet, we must warp out of orbit within thirty minutes. Every second we delay arriving at the deflection point compounds the problem, perhaps past solution.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You did say thirty minutes?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then let's go. Let's find out what life forms are blessed by this environment.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Standing on the opposite side of the lake from a collection of tipis and a lodge.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why, they look like. I'd swear they're American Indians.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are, Doctor. A mixture of Navajo, Mohican, and Delaware, I believe. All among the more advanced and peaceful tribes.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's like discovering Atlantis or Shangri-la. Mister Spock, is it possible there's a more evolved civilisation somewhere else on this planet, one capable of building that obelisk or developing a deflector system?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Highly improbable, Captain. Sensor probes indicate only one type of life form here.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Shouldn't we contact them, Jim? Tell them?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell them what? That an asteroid's coming to smash their world into atoms?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Too primitive to grasp the concept of space flight, Doctor. Our appearance here would only confuse and frighten them.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got a job to do. Let's get back to the Enterprise.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Along the path.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the matter, Jim?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What? Oh, nothing. It's just so peaceful, uncomplicated. No problems, no command decisions. Just living.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Typical human reaction to an idyllic natural setting. Back in the twentieth century, we referred to it as the Tahiti Syndrome. It's particularly common to over-pressured leader types, like starship captains.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah, the Tahiti Syndrome. Let's go take care of that asteroid. But first I want another look at that obelisk.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk walks up to it as McCoy scans with the tricorder.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suggest that any further research on your part be delayed until after we have diverted the asteroid.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Context: standing next to the symbols
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. (and drops suddenly out of our sight)

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Inside the obelisk chamber, Kirk starts to stand and is hit by and electrical discharge. He collapses across a control panel.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 4842.6. First Officer Spock commanding. Numerous search parties and repeated sensor probes of the area have failed to locate Captain Kirk.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock is standing where Kirk was when he disappeared.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise. Come in, Mister Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Prepare to beam us up, Mister Scott. We're warping out of orbit.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Leaving? You can't be serious, Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, that asteroid is almost as large as your Earth's moon. Far enough away, the angle necessary to divert it enough to avoid destruction is minute, but as the asteroid approaches this planet, the angle becomes so great that even the power of a starship

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The devil with an asteroid! It won't get here for two months, Spock!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we arrive at the deflection point in time, it may not get here at all.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In the meantime, what about Jim?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Once the asteroid has been diverted, we'll return here and resume the search.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That may be hours from now. He may be injured or dying.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Context: picking up two stoned to illustrate his point
Text: Doctor, assume this is the planet we're on. This is the approaching asteroid. If we don't get to that deflection point in time, it will become physically impossible to divert this asteroid. In that case, everyone on this planet will die, including the captain.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can a few more minutes matter, Spock?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: In the time it's taken me to explain the problem, the asteroid has moved from here to here. The longer we delay, the less the likelihood of being able to divert it. Beam us up, Mister Scott.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Context: dazed and confused) Where am I? What place is this? What are these? (phaser and communicator
Text: I feel should know. They're familiar and yet unfamiliar. How did I get here? Who am I? Try to remember.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: He finds a flight of stairs and walks up, out into the sunshine

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Two young women are approaching, carrying baskets of food.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Wait.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: They kneel at the sight of Kirk. Then one gets up and walks up the steps to him, and puts his hand to her forehead.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: We are your people. We've been waiting for you to come to us.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4843.6. First Officer Spock commanding. We've been en route to the asteroid for several hours. Our delay on the planet's surface has made it imperative that we proceed at maximum warp speed for a period which exceeds the recommended safety margin.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't give you warp nine much longer, Mister Spock. These engines are beginning to show signs of stress.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stress or not, we cannot reduce speed. I do not intend to miss that

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deflection point.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, but we're moving further into the danger range all the time.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: If these circuits

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Objection noted, Mister Scott. Carry on.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Miramanee has said that you appeared to her and to her handmaiden from the walls of the temple, just as our legend foretells. We do not doubt the words of our priestess, but these are troubled times, and we must be sure.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll answer anything I can, but as I told you, many things are strange to me.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: He knows nothing of our danger. How could he save us?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: It is against custom to interrupt a tribal elder at council, even for the medicine chief.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Elder, words will not save us when the skies darken. We must be certain. I say he must prove he is a god.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Our skies have darkened three times since the harvest. The last time worst of all. Our legend predicts such danger and promises that the Wise Ones who planted us here will send a god to save us, one who can rouse the temple spirit and make the sky grow quiet. Can you do this?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I came from the temple, as Miramanee said, and it was a beginning for me here. But I came from the sky, too. Only I can't remember. I can't remember.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Salish, a terrible thing has happened. The boy was attending the fishnets, and he became entangled in them and sank to the bottom of the river. Lumo brought him up quickly, but he doesn't move.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: There is no sound in the body. There is no light in the eyes. He will move no more.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wait a moment.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk gives the kiss of life.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Wait.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk massages the boy's legs and he coughs, waking up.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He'll be all right now.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: My people are grateful.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's a simple technique. It goes way back. Way back.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Only a god can breathe life into the dead. Do you still question? Give him the medicine badge.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Miramanee takes the headband with the metal disc from Salish's head and puts it on Kirk. They all salute him.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: The Enterprise has arrived at the asteroid.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Deflection point minus seven.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Full power, Mister Scott.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: The relays will reject the overload, Mister Spock!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then bypass the relays and go to manual control.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll burn out the engines!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I want full power, Mister Scott.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, you lovelies. Hold together. Full power, Mister Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Magnification factor twelve, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Deflection point minus four.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: All engines stop. Hold position here.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: All engines stop, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Prepare to activate deflectors.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Power dropping, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: The lights dim.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineering, maintain full power. Full power.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Dilithium crystal circuit's failing, sir. We'll have to replace it.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not now.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Zero. Deflection point now, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Activate deflectors.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: A beam shoots out and pulses against the big lump of rock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Power dropping, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Degree of deflection, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Not enough, Mister Spock. It's only point zero zero one three degrees.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recircuit power to engines. Maximum speed heading three seven mark zero one zero.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That heading will put us directly in the asteroid's path, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct, Mister Chekov. I intend to retreat in front of that asteroid until we can employ all power on phaser beams.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What for?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: To destroy it. A narrow beam concentrated on a single spot will split that mass.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It might also cripple the ship, and we would be crushed by the asteroid.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Incorrect. We'll still be able to get out of its path by use of impulse power.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim won't be able to get out of its path.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: That, Doctor, is another calculated risk we must take.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Miramanee has just filled a skin with water.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Miramanee. What are you doing?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I must see to the needs of the god, as is my duty.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: You should be working on our ritual cloak.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: There will be no ritual between us now, Salish.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: What do you mean? We cannot go against tradition.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: It is because of tradition that I cannot marry you.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: But you are promised to me.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: That was before he came.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Tribal priestess and medicine chief are always joined.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: He is medicine chief now. Salish, choose another. Any maiden would be honoured to join with you.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: I wish no other.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: You have no choice.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Miramanee, if you could choose, would you choose me?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: She lowers her eyes and walks away.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk is carving a hole in a gourd.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Perhaps you would like to bathe now.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miramanee, tell me about the Wise Ones.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Tell? But a god knows everything.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not this one. Tell me.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: The Wise Ones brought us here from far away. They chose a medicine chief to keep the secret of the temple and to use it when the sky darkens.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secrets of the temple.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: There are no lacings. (his uniform top) How is this thing removed?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The secrets were passed on from father to son?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Yes. How does this open?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, why doesn't Salish use it? Why are the people in danger?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: His father did not wish to share his power too soon. He died before he told Salish the secret.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Two young women enter with trays of fruit, then the tribal elder comes in.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Our people rejoice and wish to honour your name, but I did not know what you wish to be called. What may I tell them?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ki, Kir

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Kirok?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: The women leave.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Have we displeased you?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, everything is fine.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: Then it must be ourselves, the way we live. Perhaps we have not improved as quickly as the Wise Ones wish.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your land is rich, your people happy. Who could be displeased with that?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: But there is something. Tell us. We will change it.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't tell you anything. All I can tell you is that I'm happy and peaceful here. I'm not sure, but I think I've never felt that way before.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: The elder leaves.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why are they so sure I can help them?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Well, you came from the stone metal. Did you not bring life to the child?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but I. I need time to remember.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Here there is much time. For everything.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Co-ordinates, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Tau eight point seven. Beta point zero four one.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is our target. The asteroid's weakest point.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Almost dead centre, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lock all phasers on that mark. Maximum intensity, narrow beam. I want to split that fissure wide open.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You sound like you're cutting a diamond.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very astute, Doctor.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All phasers locked, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: We'll fire in sequence and continue firing as long as Mister Scott can maintain power.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fire phasers.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser one firing.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: That Vulcan won't be satisfied till these panels are a puddle of lead.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser two firing.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Main relay's out again, Mister Scott.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser four firing. All phasers fired, sir.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Rig for simultaneous firing, Mister Sulu. Commence simultaneous bombardment.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: There are flashes and a sizzling sound from the engines, then they go dark.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: My bairns. My poor bairns.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk is dressed in decorated buckskins.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: The ritual cloak is finished. If it pleases you, I would like to name the Joining day.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Joining day?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I'm the daughter of the chief. Tribal law betroths me to our leader. If there is another, I will step aside.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Miramanee, there's no one else in my mind or my heart.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: God's wish is above tribal law.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Name the Joining day.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: The sooner our happiness together begins, the longer it will last. Tomorrow.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: They kiss.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: An image of the obelisk is on the monitor. Spock looks as if he is meditating upon it.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Don't ask for anymore warp nine speeds, Mister Spock. Our star drive is completely burned out. The only thing we have left is impulse power.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Estimated repair time?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Engineering]

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Hanging here in space? Forever.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: The only thing that'll fix these poor darlings is the nearest repair base.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've already surmised that. Thank you, Mister Scott.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, Spock, you took your calculated risk in your calculated Vulcan way, and you lost. You lost for us, you lost for that planet, and you lost for Jim.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I accept the responsibility, Doctor.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And my responsibility is the health of this crew. You've been driving yourself too hard, and I want you to get some rest.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Chekov, resume heading eight eight three mark four one.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Back to that planet? Without warp speed, it'll take months, Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly fifty nine point two two three days, Doctor, and that asteroid will be four hours behind us all the way.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well then what's the use? We might not be able to save the captain even if he still is alive. We might not be able to save anything, including this ship! You haven't heard a word I've said. All you've been doing is staring at that blasted obelisk.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Another calculated Vulcan risk, Doctor.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Miramanee is attended by three young women, preparing her for her wedding.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Woman
Text: This joining means the end of darkness.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: It's a time for joy for all my people.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk is having ritual signs painted on his face.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: You will wait until I walk the holy path to the earth lodge first, to give me time to tell the priestess that you follow and that the Joining will take place.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: He leaves Kirk to rejoice in his new life.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have found paradise. Surely no man has ever attained such happiness.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish blocks Kirk's way. He has a knife.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get out of my way, Salish.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Even though you be a god, Kirok, I cannot permit this Joining.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nobody's asking for your permission.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Then you must strike me dead.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have no intention of striking you dead.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish cuts Kirk's hand.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: You bleed. You bleed, Kirok. Behold a god who bleeds! Behold a god who bleeds!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: They fight, and Kirk gets Salish pinned to the ground.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Kill me. Kill me, Kirok, for I will not rest until I prove to my people that you are no god.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk throws down the knife and walks away.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: In the Earth Lodge, Kirk is dressed in the cloak of many coloured feathers, and he and Miramanee stand in front of the elder.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought you were reporting to Sickbay.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: There isn't time, Doctor. I must decipher those obelisk's symbols. They're a highly advanced form of cipher writing.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You've been trying to do that ever since we started back to that planet. Fifty eight days.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm aware of that, Doctor. I'm also aware when we arrive at the planet, we'll have barely four hours to effect rescue. I believe those symbols are the key.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you won't read them by killing yourself. You've hardly eaten or slept for weeks. Now if you don't let up, you're going to collapse.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not hungry, Doctor. And under stress, we Vulcans can do without sleep for weeks.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, your Vulcan metabolism is so low it can hardly be measured, and as for the pressure, that green ice water you call blood

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: My physical condition is not important, Doctor. That obelisk is.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, my diagnosis is exhaustion brought on from overwork and guilt. You're blaming yourself for crippling this ship, just as we blamed you. Well, we were wrong. So were you. You made a command decision. Jim would have done the same. My prescription is rest, now. Do I have to call the security guards to enforce it?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock goes and lies on his bed. McCoy leaves. Spock gets up again and returns to his study of the symbols.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Bare-chested Kirk is chasing laughing Miramanee through the trees.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miramanee. Come here. Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: He catches her and they kiss.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Each time your arms hold me is as joyous as the first.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm happy. I'm so happy. If it weren't for the dreams, my mind would be completely at peace.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I thought you no longer had the dreams, that you no longer saw the strange lodge which moves through the sky.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They've come back. They were gone for a while, but they've come back, and I see faces, too. Very dim. I feel I should know know them. I feel my place is with them, not here. I don't deserve this happiness.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I have a gift for you.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A gift? What?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: It may make you happy. Wait.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: These last few weeks, my love for Miramanee grows stronger with each passing day. However, the dreams return every night. Fragments of memories. I can almost get hold of them, and then

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Miramanee returns with what native american women carry their babies in.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I bear your child.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: They embrace again.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk has made a puddle in the mud floor of their home and is explaining irrigation to Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A canal. And with it we'll bring the water from the lake right to the lodge. And we can expand the system, and irrigate the fields and double the food supply.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: And with the power of the lamp. Lamp?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lamp.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Which turns night into day, we can cook twice as much food, and as you taught us, pre

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Preserve.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Preserve.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Preserve.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MIRAMANEE@ For times of famine. That is why you made the lamp, Kirok, so that I would never know when it was night, and I would be forever cooking.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, no. No, no, no, no, no. That's not why I made the lamp at all, to keep you forever cooking.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Thunder and lightning as they kiss, then a wind starts up.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's only the wind and the thunder.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I act like a stupid child. I have nothing to fear. You are here. (she looks outside) It is time.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Time?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: To go to the temple. The people will be waiting.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: To save them.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But it's only the wind. The wind can't harm them.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: The wind is only the beginning. Soon the sky will darken, the lake will go wild, and the earth will tremble. Only you can save us.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But I can't do anything about the wind or the sky.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: If we don't go now, it will be too late. You must go inside the temple and make the blue flame come out.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know how to get inside the temple.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: But you are a god.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Context: bursting in
Text: Kirok! Kirok!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Why are you not at the temple, Kirok? Soon the ground will begin to tremble. The people need your help.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll go to the caves. It'll be safe there.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: The caves? Surely a legend can do more than that for his people.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Elder
Text: When the ground trembles the caves are not safe, Kirok. If you do not rouse the temple spirit, we will all die.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: There is nothing you cannot do, my husband.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Well, what do you wait for, god? Your robes?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take care of Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish watches from a distance as Kirk beats on the obelisk's wall trying to work out how to get inside.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am Kirok! I have come! I am Kirok!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish smiles at his failure.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock is playing his lyre.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I prescribed sleep.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: You prescribed rest, Doctor. The symbols on the obelisk are not words. They are musical notes.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Musical notes? You mean it's nothing but a song?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: In a way, yes. Other cultures, among them certain Vulcan offshoots, use musical notes as words. The tones correspond roughly to an alphabet.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Were you able to make sense our of the symbols?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. The obelisk is a marker, just as I thought. It was left by a super-race known as the Preservers. They passed through the galaxy rescuing primitive cultures which were in danger of extinction and seeding them, so to speak, where they could live and grow.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've always wondered why there were so many humanoids scattered through the galaxy.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: So have I. Apparently the Preservers account for a number of them.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's probably how the planet has survived all these centuries. The Preservers put an asteroid deflector on the planet.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which has now become defective and is failing to operate.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And we have to find that deflector and put it back into working order, otherwise

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, Doctor.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish has brought a crowd armed with stones.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: There's the false one!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: They throw their stones at Kirk.) ALL: Die! Die! Die

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: No! No! Don't hurt him!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Salish holds her back.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miramanee!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Don't hurt him! He can save us!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: He's false!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I belong to him.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Salish
Text: Then go. Go die with your false god.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: All
Text: You'll be killed! Kill him! We're all doomed! Die, impostor! You lied to us! You're not a god! We'll kill you now!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock and McCoy beam down as Miramanee and Kirk fall under the hail of stones. The crowd runs away when they see them. McCoy checks Kirk first.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I need Nurse Chapel.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come in, Mister Spock.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've located the captain. Beam down Nurse Chapel with an emergency surgical kit.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My wife. Is she all right?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Wife?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hallucinations?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Chapel beams down.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock rolls Miramanee onto her back, and Chapel gives her an injection.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: The nurse has given you something to ease the pain. Why were you being stoned?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Kirok could not get back into the temple.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Naturally, since he did not come from there.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I saw him come, come.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Does he recognise us?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His brain is unimpaired. Everything else is functionally normally except his memory.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK:: Can you help him?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It'd take time.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Time, Doctor McCoy, is the one thing we do not have in abundance. (communicator beeps) Spock here.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Tracking report, sir. Sixty five minutes to end of safety margin.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Report noted. Doctor, is he strong enough for the Vulcan mind fusion?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We have no choice.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: So Spock places his hands on Kirk's face and starts the procedure.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am Spock. You are James Kirk. Our minds are moving closer. Closer, closer, closer, James Kirk. Closer.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: James Kirk.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miramanee! No! Miramanee!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our minds are one.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Both
Text: I am Kirok. I am Kirok.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am Kir

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am Kirok! I am

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock!

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: He breaks the link

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is it?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: His mind. He is an extremely dynamic individual.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It worked.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Kirk goes to Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, were you inside this structure?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. What's inside is loaded with scientific equipment.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: This obelisk is one huge deflector mechanism. It is imperative that we get inside immediately. Captain, we do not have much time.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: McCoy and Chapel start tending to Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know how to get inside.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we are not able to gain entry and activate the deflector mechanism within the next fifty minutes, this entire planet will be destroyed.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The key must be in these symbols. We've got to decipher them.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I already have to some extent, Captain. They are musical notes.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean entry can be gained by playing certain notes on a musical instrument?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would be one method. Another would be a series of tonal qualities spoken in their proper sequence.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give me your communicator. Tonal control, consonants and vowels. I must have hit it accidentally when I contacted the ship.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you could remember your exact words, Captain.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Context: flipping open the communicator
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: The hatch slides open, with Miramanee still lying on it.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, if the deflector isn't activated within twenty minutes, get out of orbit. Get the Enterprise out of the danger zone. The landing party is expendable. The Enterprise isn't. Kirk out. Miramanee. Bones, stay with her. Do what you can.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is similar to deflector panels I've seen, Captain, but far more complicated.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Careful. I must have hit something accidentally. A beam caught me and that's when I stopped remembering.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: Probably a memory beam. You must have activated it out of sequence.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: More symbols. Can you read them?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do have an excellent eye for musical notes, Captain. They would seem to indicate that this series of relays activated in their proper

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, just press the right button.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: Spock presses the middle button of a row of three, and other sections light up. A blue beam shoots out of the top of the obelisk and pushes the asteroid away.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is she?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She had bad internal injuries, Jim.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will she live?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Context: in pain
Text: Kirok. It is true. You are safe.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And so are your people, Miramanee.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: I knew you would save them, my chief. When I am better, it will be as it was, will it not?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If that's what you want.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: We will live long and happy lives. I will bear you many strong sons. I'll love you always.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And I'll love you, Miramanee. Always.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Context: He kisses her.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Speaker: Miramanee
Text: Each kiss is as the first. (she dies)

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Enterprise Medical Log, stardate 5027.3. Doctor Leonard McCoy recording. I'm concerned about Captain Kirk. He shows indications of increasing tension and emotional stress.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I have completed the assignment, Captain. A theoretical incursion into

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Chekov. I can read, and as usual your theoretical evaluations do not tally with mine. Return to your duty and I'll let you know when your work is satisfactory.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock. Full sensor scan of the region, please.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I did give a full report

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Spock, that was the past. I'm concerned with the present. Or is it becoming too much for this crew to present me current information?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; No, sir. Compliance presents no problem.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then, Mister Spock, comply.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor scan to one half parsec. Negative, Captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can find no reason for the captain's behaviour, except possibly that we've been on patrol too long without relief and diversion. He has resisted all of my attempts to run a psychological profile on him.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maintaining course and speed, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Change course. Come about to one eight five, mark three.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But, sir, that'll lead us directly into the Romulan Neutral Zone.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, very perceptive, Mister Sulu. I know where the course change takes us. Execute.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Increasing sensor scan to one parsec. All scanners report clear. Nothing in our immediate vicinity.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Better and better, Mister Spock.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, leaving Neutral Zone. Now entering Romulan space.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Scott enters the Bridge.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lieutenant, when did the order come through?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Order?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: From Starfleet. The order to enter the Neutral Zone.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There's been no order I know of, Mister Scott.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Surely the Captain couldn't be doing this on his own authority.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you two have complaints, you can bring them out into the open.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: A sinister shape appears on the viewscreen.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's a Klingon ship! But it couldn't be, not in this area.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Intelligence reports Romulans now using Klingon design.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sound Red Alert. Man battle stations. Stand by main phasers.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Battle stations. All hands, battle stations.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: A second ship has appeared. (another one decloaks) Correction, there are now three. We are surrounded.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, code a message to Starfleet Command. Advise them of our situation. Include all log entries to this point.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, your sensors read clear. What happened?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a theory, Captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, I'm receiving a class two signal from the Romulan vessel.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on the main viewing screen, Lieutenant, and complete that message to Starfleet Command.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Context: a thin male
Text: You have been identified as the star ship Enterprise, Captain James T. Kirk last known to be in command.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your information is correct. This is Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: I am Sub-commander Tal of the Romulan fleet. Your ship is surrounded, Captain. You will surrender immediately, or we will destroy you.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. (mutes sound) They want something, or they would have destroyed us by now.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: True, Captain. That would be standard Romulan procedure.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's my ship they want, and very badly.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be a great prize.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. (sound on) Save your threats. If you board this ship, I'll blow it up. You'll gain nothing.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Who is that beside you?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My first officer, Commander Spock.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Vulcan. (his communicator beeps and he answers it) Yes, Commander. Yes, Commander. No one should decide quickly to die, Captain. We give you one of your hours. If you do not surrender your ship at the end of that time, your destruction is certain. We will be open to communication should you wish it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You understand that Starfleet Command has been advised of the situation?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: The subspace message will take three weeks to reach Starfleet. The decision is yours, Captain. One hour.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The design of the ship is the same. Mister Spock, you said you had a theory on why your sensors didn't pick up the new ships until they were upon us.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe the Romulans have developed a cloaking device which renders our tracking sensors useless.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If so, Romulans could attack in Federation territory before we knew they were there, before a vessel or planet could get even begin to get their defences up.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: They caught us right enough.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, that's a brilliant observation, Mister Scott. Do you have any other helpful opinions?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've not got many choices.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have three. We can fight and be destroyed, or we can destroy the Enterprise ourselves and keep her from the Romulans. Or we can surrender. Opinions, gentlemen.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: If the Enterprise is taken by Romulans, they'll know everything there is to know about a starship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we had not crossed the Neutral Zone, on your order, you would not now need our opinions to support a decision which should never have had to be made.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you ordered us? You had no authority!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dismissed, Doctor.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said dismissed.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: McCoy leaves.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The Romulan vessel is signalling again, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put them on the screen.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: My commander wishes to speak with you, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put him on.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: The commander wishes to see you and your first officer aboard this vessel. It is felt this matter requires discussion.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why should we walk right into your hands?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Two of my officers will beam aboard your vessel as exchange hostages while you are here.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What guarantee do we have they'll beam aboard our ship once we're on yours?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Granted, we do not easily trust each other, Captain, but you are the ones who violated our territory. Should it not be we who distrust your motives? However, we agree to simultaneous exchange.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give us your transporter co-ordinates. We're beaming aboard.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One final order, Engineer Scott. If we do not return, the Enterprise must not be taken. If the Romulans attempt it, you're to fight, and if necessary, destroy yourselves. Is that clear?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Perfectly clear.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: As Kirk and Spock beam out, two Romulans beam in. Once solid, they draw their weapons. Scott scowls.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: The figure in the curved chair swivels round to reveal that the Commander is a woman in a uniform that barely covers her bottom, and thigh-length boots.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander. I'm honoured.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I don't think so, but we have an important matter to discuss. And your superficial courtesies are an overture to that discussion. You are the first officer?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I speak first with the Captain. You may wait outside.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Spock and the two guards leave

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: The matter of trespass into Romulan space is one of galactic import, a violation of treaties. Now I ask you simply, what is your mission here?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Instrument failure caused navigational error. We were across the Neutral Zone before we realised it, then we were surrounded by your ships before we could get back.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: A starship? One of the Starfleet's finest vessels? You're saying instrument failure as radical as you suggest went unnoticed until you were well past the Neutral Zone?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Accidents happen. Cut off back-up systems malfunction. We were due for overhaul two months ago.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I see. But you were able to navigate with this malfunction?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The error was corrected.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: But I doubt it'll clear you of espionage.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We were not spying, Commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Your language has always been most difficult for me, Captain. Perhaps you have another word for it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're grossly mistaken if you think we were there

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Captain, if a Romulan vessel ventured far into Federation territory without good explanation, what would a starbase commander do? You see, it works both ways. I hardly believe you are the injured party. Spock, come in.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Spock and the guards enter.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: The captain has made his statement.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I must admit some surprise on seeing you, Spock. We were not aware of Vulcans aboard the Enterprise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Starfleet is not in the habit of informing Romulans of its ships' personnel.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Quite so. Yet there are certain ships, certain officers, that are known to us. Your situation appears most interesting.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What earns Spock your special interest?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: He is a Vulcan. Our forebears had the same roots and origins. Something you wouldn't understand, Captain. We can appreciate the Vulcans, our distant brothers. I have heard of Vulcan integrity and personal honour. There's a well-known saying, or is it a myth, that Vulcans are incapable of lying?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is no myth.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Then tell me truthfully now, by your honour as a Vulcan, what was your mission?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I reserve the privilege of speaking only when it will not violate my honour as a Vulcan.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It is unworthy of a Vulcan to resort to subterfuge.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're being clever, Commander. That is unworthy of a Romulan. It is not a lie to keep the truth to oneself.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Then there is a truth here that remains unspoken.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've been told everything. There's nothing else to say.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: There is Mister Spock's unspoken truth. You knew of the cloaking device that we have developed. You deliberately violated Romulan space with a blatant spy mission, by order of the Federation.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've been all through that, Commander!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: We have not even begun! There's no force that I can use on a Vulcan that will make him speak. That is a fact. But there are Romulan methods completely effective against humans and human weaknesses.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: You would not resort to them, Commander. They would prove ineffective against the captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Then they will leave him dead, or what might be worse than dead. But I will know your unspoken truths.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let her rant. There's nothing to say.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot allow the captain to be further destroyed. The strain of command has worn heavily upon him. He's not been himself for several weeks.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a lie!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: As you can see, Captain Kirk is a highly sensitive and emotional person. I believe he has lost the capacity for rational decision.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shut up, Spock!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm betraying no secrets. The commander's suspicion that Starfleet ordered the Enterprise into the Neutral Zone is unacceptable. Our rapid capture demonstrates its foolhardiness.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You filthy liar!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am speaking the truth for the benefit of the Enterprise and the Federation. I say now and for the record, that Captain Kirk ordered the Enterprise across the Neutral Zone on his own initiative and his craving for glory.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Context: having to be held back by the guards
Text: I'll kill you, you filthy traitor! I'll kill you! I'll kill you!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: He is not sane.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Context: into comm. system
Text: Attention, Enterprise, I am speaking to you from the Romulan flagship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: The USS Enterprise, under command of Captain James T. Kirk, is formally charged with espionage. The testimony of First Officer

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Spock was highly instrumental in confirming this intrusion into Romulan space was not an accident. First Officer Spock's testimony was specific that your ship was not under orders from Starfleet Command or the Federation council to perform such a spy mission.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It was Captain Kirk who was solely responsible. Since the crew had no choice but to obey orders, the crew will not be held responsible. Therefore, I am ordering Engineer Scott, presently in command of the Enterprise, to follow the Romulan flagship

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: To our home base. You will there be processed and released to Federation Command. Until judgment is passed, Captain Kirk will be held in confinement.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Security, put our two Romulan hostages in the brig. Lieutenant Uhura, give me a channel to that ship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Channel is open, Mister Scott, and you are tied in.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is Lieutenant Commander Scott. The Enterprise takes no orders, except those of Captain

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Kirk, And we will stay right here until he returns. And if you make any attempt to board or commandeer the Enterprise, it will be blown to bits along with as many of you as we can take with us.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You humans make a brave noise. There are ways to convince you of your errors.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you hear that, you coward? You've betrayed everything of value you ever knew. Did you hear the sound of human integrity?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Take him to the security room.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk is dragged out, struggling.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: A Vulcan among humans. Living, working with them. I would think the situation would be intolerable to you.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am half Vulcan. My mother is a human.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: To whom is your allegiance then? Do you call yourself Terran or Vulcan?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Vulcan.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: How long have you been a Starfleet officer, Spock?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eighteen years.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: And you serve Captain Kirk. Do you like him? Do you like your shipmates?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: The question is irrelevant.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Possibly, but you are subordinate to Captain Kirk's orders, even to his whims.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: My duty as an officer is to obey him.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You are a superior being. Why do you not command?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not desire a ship of my own.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Or is it that no one has offered you, a Vulcan, that opportunity?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Such opportunities are extremely rare.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: For someone with your capabilities and accomplishments, opportunities are made and will be. I will see to that, if you'll stop looking on the Federation as the whole universe. It is not, you know.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: That thought has occasionally crossed my mind.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You must have your own ship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commander, shall we speak plainly? It is you who desperately need a ship. You want the Enterprise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
