Text: Of course. It would be a great achievement for me to bring home the Enterprise intact. It would broaden the scope of my powers greatly. It would be the achievement of a lifetime. And it would open equal opportunities for you.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk is finally flung into the Romulan brig, where he tests out the pain-giving properties of the force-field across the doorway.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bridge to Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor, you must beam aboard the Romulan flagship immediately. There's been an injury.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't make house calls.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor, it's Captain Kirk!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: McCoy is scanning Kirk, who is twitching slightly.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He'll recover, but he'll need further attention. Inform your superior.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She answers the comm., listening on the earpiece. They keep conversations private, these people.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Yes? I'll come there. Attend me.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Two guards walk a discreet distance behind them.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I neglected to mention, I'll expect you for dinner. We have much to discuss.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Allow me to rephrase. Will you join me for dinner?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am honoured, Commander. Are the guards also invited?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She dismisses them. They walk on, and Spock turns a corner.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Mister Spock. That corridor is forbidden to all but loyal Romulans.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Of course. I shall obey your restrictions.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I hope that one day there will be no need for you to observe any restrictions.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be illogical to assume that all conditions remain stable.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Are you the doctor?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy. Chief medical officer.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Captain Kirk's condition?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you can see for yourself, he's mentally depressed, physically weak, disoriented, displays feelings of persecution and rebellion.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Then by your own standards of normality, this man is not fully competent.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, not now.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Mister Spock has stated that he believes the captain had no authority or order to cross the Neutral Zone. Could this mental incapacity have afflicted him earlier?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, it's possible.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Mister Spock, the doctor has now confirmed your testimony as to the mental state of your captain. He was and is unfit to continue in command of the Enterprise. That duty has fallen on you. Are you ready to exercise that function?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am ready.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, I don't believe it. There's no price you could pay that would make him sell out.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: The matter is not open for discussion, Doctor.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean, the matter's not open for discussion?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: That's enough, Doctor. As a physician, your duty is to save lives. Mister Spock's duty is to lead the Enterprise and its crew to a safe haven.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no alternative, Doctor. The safety of the crew is now the paramount issue. It is misguided loyalty to resist any further.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You traitor. I'll kill you. I'll kill you. I'll kill you!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk lunges feebly at Spock, who places his hand over Kirk's face. Kirk falls back, face contorted with pain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What did you do? What did you do?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was unprepared for his attack. I instinctively used the Vulcan death grip.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Your instincts are still good, Mister Spock. The captain is dead.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: The body of Kirk lies on a bed, bathed in green light. McCoy exits through one door, and Chapel enters through the other. Kirk's eyes open.) CHAPEL: Doctor! Doctor McCoy! (Kirk's eyes shut again. The heart monitor starts thumping.) Doctor McCoy

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I left orders that no one come in here.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chapel
Text: But he's alive, alive!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well now that you know it, you might as well assist me. Hand me the physiostimulator.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chapel
Text: But he was dead. Their doctors certified he was dead.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock gave him a nerve pinch to simulate death.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Then Mister Spock isn't a traitor, and you knew that and you didn't

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I didn't know it until I beamed aboard the Romulan ship. Jim and Spock were operating under Federation orders.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: The green light goes out as Kirk wakes up properly.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh. (sitting up) My neck feels like it's been twisted off.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's the Vulcan death grip for you.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chapel
Text: There's no such thing as a Vulcan death grip.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ah, but the Romulans don't know that. Sure fooled the doctors.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You took a big chance they didn't start an autopsy.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As far as the rest of the crew's concerned, I'm still dead.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Narrator
Text: CHAPEL:: Why?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's what this whole masquerade was about. To keep the Enterprise and the Federation off the hook.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: So that if anything went wrong, you would be the one to blame.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I want you to prepare for surgery.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What for?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to Bridge.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Doctor.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Scott, will you report to Sickbay.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sickbay? I can't leave the bridge at a time like this.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have to. It's urgent.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're surrounded by enemy vessels ready to attack us. I don't know of anything more urgent than that.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I do. Mister Scott, please.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, Doctor. It better be important. Scott out.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Scott comes storming in and stutters to an astonished halt.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, Doctor, what's so urgent that... Captain? Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, you look like the devil himself, but as long as you're alive. What's it all about?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk has slanted eyebrows and pointed ears.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are those Romulan officers still aboard the ship?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're in the brig, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll need a Romulan uniform.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SCOTT; Aye. It'll be a pleasure.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I've had special Vulcan dishes prepared for you. I hope they're to your liking.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am very flattered, Commander. There's no doubt that the cuisine aboard your vessel is far superior to that of the Enterprise. It is indeed a very powerful recruiting inducement.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: We have other inducements.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She offers him a glass of blue liquid. He accepts, they silently toast each other and drink.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk is in Romulan uniform

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What the devil is Spock doing? What's delaying him?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wish I knew. Scotty, are you sure we have a clear channel to Spock?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. No doubt of it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we can't wait any longer. Prepare to beam me aboard the flagship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: But Mister Spock hasn't sent the proper co-ordinates yet.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It can't be helped, Scotty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're taking an awful chance, Jim.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just don't put me inside a bulkhead. Energise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk finishes materialising just before a Romulan comes around a corner.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Centurion. I'm sorry, no one is allowed

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've just effected an escape from the Federation vessel. I have important information for Sub-commander Tal. Where is he?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Romulan
Text: He's in control central, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I shall remember to mention your alertness to him. Return to your duty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Thank you, Centurion.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Now, orange liquid is being poured out as Spock eats.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You have nothing in Starfleet to which to return. I offer, we offer you an alternative. We will find a place for you, if you wish it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: A place?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: With me. Romulan women are not like Vulcan females. We are not dedicated to pure logic and the sterility of non-emotion. Our people are warriors. Often savage. But we are also many other pleasant things.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was not aware of that aspect of Romulan society.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: As a Vulcan, you would study it. As a human you would find ways to appreciate it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please believe me. I do appreciate it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I am so glad. Now one final step to make the occasion complete. You will lead a small party of Romulans aboard the Enterprise, and there you will take your rightful place as its commander. And you will lead the ship to a Romulan port, with my flagship at its side.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, of course, but not just this moment. An hour from now will do even better. Would it not, Commander?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Yes. Yes, it will, Mister Spock. You do know I have a first name.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was beginning to wonder.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Well, I do. Would you like to hear it?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She whispers in his ear.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: How rare, and how beautiful. But so incongruous when spoken by a soldier.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: If you will give me a moment, the soldier will transform herself into a woman.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She leaves the room.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you prepared to beam over?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm already on board, Spock. Do you have the information?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain. The cloaking device is in an area near the commander's quarters. It is closely guarded and off-limits to all but authorised personnel. What is your present location?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Officer
Text: Sub-commander Tal. I'm receiving an alien transmission from within our vessel, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Alien? Are you certain?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Officer
Text: Yes, Sub-commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: I must know the source!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Officer
Text: Triangulating now, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I'll get the cloaking device. Will you be able to get back to the Enterprise without attracting their attention?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. At present, I am rather heavily

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: He quickly shuts and hides his communicator as the door opens, and the Commander enters. She is wearing a figure hugging dress.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Is my attire now more appropriate, Mister Spock?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commander, your attire is not only more appropriate, it should actually stimulate our conversation.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: He makes the Vulcan V-sign. She does the same, and they touch hands.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Guard
Text: Centurion, have you clearance for this area? I do not recognise you.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's an intruder aboard. Has someone tried to gain entrance there?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Guard
Text: I must see your authorisation, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Over there!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: He knocks the guard out.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Now they are stroking each other's face.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It's hard to believe that I can be so moved by the touch of an alien hand.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I must confess that I too am moved emotionally. I know it is illogical.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Mister Spock, we mustn't question what we truly feel. Accept what is happening between us, even as I do.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: The doorbell buzzes

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Commander? Permission to enter.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Not now, Tal.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: It is urgent, Commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She leaves Spock and goes to the door. Tal and guards enter.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Enter.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Commander, we have intercepted an alien transmission.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Locate its source.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: We have, Commander. This room.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Spock comes out from behind the dividing curtain and shows his communicator.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: The cloaking device. Bring him.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk manages to get in and starts looking around.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Halt. Don't move. Who are you? What are you doing in here?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's an enemy spy aboard. He'll be after the cloaking device.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Romulan
Text: Drop your weapon.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Kirk does so, and as the Romulan bends to pick it up he kicks him unconscious. As Tal, Spock, the Commander and the guards make their way down the corridor, Kirk takes the globe with bits of Nomad sticking out of it, out of its control console.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, energise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: But, sir, what about Mister Spock?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll just have to hope he can buy us enough time to get this cloaking device installed.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: It'll have to hook into our deflector shield control.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you do it?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have fifteen minutes, Scotty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Commander, the cloaking device is gone.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Full alert. Search all decks.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Tal and a guard leave.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: That will be profitless, Commander. I do not believe you will find it.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You must be mad.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I assure you I am quite sane.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Why would you do this to me? What are you that you could do this?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: First officer of the Enterprise. (Broken-hearted, she slaps his face.) What is your present form of execution?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5027.4. Commander Scott has less than fifteen minutes to install the Romulan's cloaking device and get it working. I hope Mister Spock can buy us the time we need.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: As Scott struggles with the alien tech in Engineering, occasionally saying 'Drat', Kirk gets into his own uniform and walks onto the Bridge.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You're alive!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They said you'd been killed, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The report was premature.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, your ears. What happened?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll discuss it later. Mister Sulu, lay in a course for home. Mister Chekov, take the sensors. Mister Spock is still aboard the Romulan flagship. I want his body readings pinpointed and isolated. That was not a request, gentlemen.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Return to your station, Sub-commander. The boarding action on the Enterprise will begin with my command. If they resist, destroy her.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Tal leaves.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Execution of state criminals is both painful and unpleasant. I believe the details are unnecessary. The sentence will be carried out immediately after the charges have been recorded.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: I demand the Right of Statement first.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You understand Romulan tradition well. The right is granted.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you. I shall not require much time. No more than twenty minutes, I should say.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It should take less time than that to find your ally, who stole the cloaking device. You will not die alone. Recording the Romulan Right of Statement. Proceed, Commander Spock.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: My crime is sabotage. I freely admit my guilt. (Scott is continuing to work) The oath I swore as a Starfleet officer is both specific and binding. As long as I wear the uniform, my duty is to protect the security of the Federation. Clearly, your new cloaking device is a threat to that security. I carried out my duty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Everyone carries out his duty. You state the obvious, Spock.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no regulation regarding the content of my statement. May I continue?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Very well. Your twenty minutes is almost up.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, there's only one Vulcan aboard that ship. He should be easy enough to locate.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Romulans and Vulcans appear to read almost exactly alike. There is just a slight difference which. Got him, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Feed the co-ordinates to the transporter room on the double. Have them prepare to beam him aboard on my signal.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk. Mister Scott is on the intercom for you, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Scotty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've got that device installed, but bless me if I know whether it'll work.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's the biggest guess I've ever made.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, Scotty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, transporter room has the co-ordinates and is ready for beaming.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transporter room, beam Mister Spock aboard.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Beyond the historic tradition of Vulcan loyalty, there is also the combined Romulan-Vulcan history of obedience to duty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: She hears the transporter whine and runs around the desk to throw her arms around him.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Transporter room reports Mister Spock aboard, sir, and the Romulan commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The commander?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Have them report to the Bridge on the double. Mister Sulu, take us away from the Romulans. Warp factor nine.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Officer
Text: Sub-commander, the enemy vessel is moving away at extreme speed, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Alert all vessels. Weapons officer, bring main batteries to bear on the Enterprise.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Holding at warp nine, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, throw the switch on that device.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: I did, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's not working.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: I would give you credit, Captain, for getting this far. But you will be dead in a moment and the credit would be gratuitous.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, open a channel to the Romulan vessel.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. I have Sub-commander Tal, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Establish two-way visual contact.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: We have you under our weapons, Enterprise. You cannot escape.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. Hold your fire. We have your commander aboard.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Commander?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Destroy this vessel. I gave you a direct command! Tal!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Break contact!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Helmsman, flank speed. Weapons officer, stand by to fire main batteries as soon as we reach optimum range.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we're running out of time.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I'm working as fast as I can.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You see, Captain? Your effort is being wasted.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, distance from the Romulan vessel?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: One hundred and fifty thousand kilometres, Captain, and closing very rapidly.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, phasers. Commander, you'll forgive me if I put up a fight.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Of course. It's expected.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: One hundred thousand kilometres. They should commence firing at us within the next twelve point seven seconds.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's ready now, Captain, but I don't know whether our circuits can handle this alien contraption.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Throw the switch.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Scott
Text: It'll likely overload.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Throw the switch.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: Scott does, and the Enterprise gently vanishes, like a Cheshire cat

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Tal
Text: Weapons officer, commence fire. (sees Enterprise disappear) Gone. They have the cloaking device! Quickly, compute enemy course from last position and open fire!

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Officer
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, come about. Three one eight mark seven.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Three one eight mark seven, sir. Executing.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: They cut underneath the Romulan ship.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: The cloaking device is working perfectly, and the commander has informed me that even the Romulan sensors cannot track a vessel so equipped.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. Cancel Red Alert. We'll let you off at the nearest Federation outpost.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You are very generous, Captain. If I may be taken to your brig, I will take my place as your prisoner.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock will have the honour of escorting you to your quarters.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: Captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Deck two. It is regrettable that you were made an unwilling passenger. It was not intentional. All the Federation wanted was the cloaking device.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: The Federation. And what did you want?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was my only interest when I boarded your vessel.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: And that's exactly all you came away with.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: You underestimate yourself, Commander.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: You realise that very soon we will learn to penetrate the cloaking device you stole.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously. Military secrets are the most fleeting of all. I hope that you and I exchanged something more permanent.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Context: They start to step out into the corridor.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It was your choice.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was the only choice possible. You would not respect any other.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Commander
Text: It will be our secret.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Entering Neutral Zone, Captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good, Mister Chekov. Thank you, Mister Leslie.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sickbay to Bridge.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Bones?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, if all the shouting's over up there, I'd like for you to report to Sickbay.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What for?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you're due in surgery. I'm going to bob your ears.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, please go. Somehow they do not look aesthetically agreeable

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Spock
Text: On humans.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, are you coming, Jim?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Or do you want to go through life looking like your First Officer?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm on my way.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 5029.5. Responding to a distress call from our scientific colony on Triacus. We are beaming down to investigate.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: On the ground, beneath a purple sky, adults are lying motionless. Kirk, McCoy and Spock investigate. One man gets up from behind a rock.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Professor Starnes? (the man has a phaser, and looks terrified.) It's Kirk.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The man collapses without speaking.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He didn't seem to know me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk takes the dead man's tricorder, then goes over to a woman and removes a vial from her mouth.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Cyalodin.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Self-inflicted.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk replays the tricorder.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Starnes
Text: Must destroy ourselves! Alien upon us. The enemy from within. The enemy!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All this. Self-inflicted. Mass suicide.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The sound of children playing, then the kids run into the scene. There's a girl, three small boys and one older boy.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: You missed me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Text: I did not.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Hi. Who are you?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk of the starship Enterprise.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: I'm Tommy Starnes. This is Mary, Steve, Ray, and Don.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Come on. Play with us. Come on. (They make a circle and dance around Kirk.) Ring around the rosy, pocket full of posy. Ashes, ashes, we all fall down! Ring around the rosy, pocket full of posy. Ashes, ashes, we all fall down!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplementary. We have buried the members of the Starnes exploration party. Everyone has been deeply affected by what has happened here, with some important exceptions.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Grave markers with just surnames stand behind one or two mounds of soil. Kirk plants a UFP standard. The children have had enough.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Let's go and play.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: They run off to the cave entrance and play tag

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No sign of grief?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, Jim. No indication of any kind.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or of fear.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They seem completely secure and unafraid.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you insist their behaviour indicates traumatic shock?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't insist, Jim, but I can't dismiss the possibility.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A child suppresses the fact that both parents are dead? I can't believe it.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Humans do have an amazing capacity for believing what they choose and excluding that which is painful.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not these children, to this extent. It's incredible.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What those children saw is incredible, Jim. The way those deaths occurred, any reaction is possible including lacunar amnesia. That's my diagnosis. Until specific tests can be made, it remains that.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be guided by that opinion, Doctor, for the present. What about questioning them?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not until the fabric of the traumatisation weakens or you come up with another explanation for their behaviour. Forcing them to see this experience now could cause permanent damage.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Accepted, Doctor.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: One of the boys knocks over the UFP standard.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Careful.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Don
Text: I'm, I'm sorry, Captain Kirk.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Children. Children, listen to me. It's late and it's time to go up to the ship.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Don
Text: Oh, not yet.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: But we're just beginning to have fun.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Ray
Text: Not now.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. You'll go up with the doctor.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on. It's time to be going.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever happened here is locked up inside those children.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: The attack on Professor Starnes' party must surely have been unprovoked.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Attack? Mass suicide is what it seems to be.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I stand corrected, Captain. Induced would be a more precise term. Induced by an outside force.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Such as?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: The release of bacteria. Or a helpless mental depression and a state of suicidal anxiety could have been chemically induced.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What would make the children immune?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know, but it is possible.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then the children would have been exempted by conscious design.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: A valid assumption, I would say.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And their present behaviour explained by a fear of punishment. SPOCK: Or the promise of reward.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An attack by an unknown assailant on an uninhabited planet. This planet is uninhabited, Mister Spock, to the best of our information?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: At present, yes. (his tricorder beeps) Odd.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Getting a reading?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: There seems to be some disturbance coming from that cave.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Picking up any life-forms, Mister Spock?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Definitely not humanoid, Captain. Impossible to make any specific identification. The readings do not correlate with any known information.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Context: shivers
Text: Oh, that's strange. That's very strange. I'm getting a feeling of anxiety in this place. It doesn't sound very scientific, does it? But it's strongest right here.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm not aware of it, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe that's what's registering on your tricorder.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not familiar with anxiety, but I wasn't aware it could be registered on sensors.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, of course. That's, that's me. That's me. But what's causing your tricorder to react?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk dashes out of the cave.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you all right, Captain?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm fine. I'm fine. Just some sympathetic vibration with what happened here. Let's get back to the ship. I want to check out those tapes from Professor Starnes' tricorder. And I am going to question those children.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: I assume it is, although there are a lot more plants around the room than we usually see.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: All right, children. Each card is a different flavour. You take your pick, and the computer will mix your favourite combination. Now, what would you like? Call out your favourites.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Vanilla! Chocolate! Cherry! Banana!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The kids grab cards and dash to the food dispensers.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Well, would you like a surprise, Stevie?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Context: he gets his ice cream
Text: It's coconut and vanilla. They're both white.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: There, there now, Stevie. There are unpleasant surprises as well as pleasant ones. That was your unpleasant surprise. Now, what would you like for your pleasant surprise?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Text: Chocolate wobble and pistachio.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Well, coming right up.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Text: And peach.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: All right. It's going to be a wonderful surprise.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: This bowl is a lot bigger.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The tests show no evidence of tensions due to lying. They behave as though nothing had gone wrong. They check out sound physically. There are no signs of any foreign biochemical substances to account for their present state. I have no answers, Jim.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There has to be an answer.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, can't it wait till we get to a Starbase hospital so they can be checked out by child specialists?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not leaving here until we find out what went on or what's going on.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I won't prevent you questioning them, but it could harm the children if you do.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It could be far worse for them if I don't, and for us too.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Be careful.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: After this, we can all play games.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kids
Text: Yeah.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk enters.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: How do you like getting ice cream out of a computer?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: That was fun.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, well, well. You're all having such a good time, I think I'll join you. Is that all right?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Please do.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll have a dish, too.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Oh, of course.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A little one. A very small one. It's better than Triacus, isn't it?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Don
Text: That dirty old planet?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Ray
Text: What's so good about that place?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Text: Yeah?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: You weren't there very long. You don't know.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think your parents liked it very much either.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Yes, they did.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Steve
Text: Yeah. Mine sure did.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Don
Text: Parents like stupid things.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Oh, I don't know about that. Parents like children.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Ha. That's what you think.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sure your parents loved you. That's why they took you with them to Triacus. So they wouldn't be so far away from you for such a long time. That would make them very unhappy and miss you. I'm sure that you would miss them, too.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: There's a silence, then

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Busy, busy.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Busy. Busy. Busy! Busy!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The running around starts again.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Don
Text: Guess what we are.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I know. A swarm of bees.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Watch out. Watch out. I'll sting you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: She rushes at Kirk and he picks her up.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now wait a minute.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Can we have some more ice cream, please?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I don't think so. It'll spoil your dinner.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: See what I told you? They all say it.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Yeah.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, children, you've had a busy day. I think you could use some rest. Nurse Chapel will see you to your quarters.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Very good idea, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: Aw, do we have to?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Chapel ushers the little ones out.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tommy, Just a moment. I'd like to ask you a question. Come and sit down. Tommy, will you tell me what you saw?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Saw where?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In the cave, on the planet. On Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: You were there.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you see your father today?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: I saw him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did he seem upset?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Yeah, he was very upset.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: I didn't ask him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was going on that would have upset him?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: How should I know? He was always upset, just like you, Captain Kirk.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not upset with you, Tommy, or your friends. We invited you aboard the Enterprise. Why would I do that if I didn't like you?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: You have your reasons.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't you unhappy about leaving Triacus?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: That place? That's for adults.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aren't you upset about leaving your parents?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: My parents? They love it down there. Always busy. (he nearly chokes up) They're happy. Can I go now? I'm tired too, you know.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, certainly. I'll take you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: I know the way.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy leaves.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to security. Post a guard on the children. They're to be kept under constant watch.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The children are in a circle, chanting.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Hail, hail, fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. Far away, for to see, friendly Angel come to me. Hail, hail, fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. Far away, for to see, friendly Angel come to me. Hail, hail

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: a green figure of a large man shimmers into view

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgon
Context: echoy voice
Text: You have done very well, my friends. You have done what must be done. You have come aboard the Enterprise. Now our destination is a Federation settlement. Captain Kirk will undoubtedly choose a closer station. Do not let that deter you. Marcos Twelve has millions of people on it. Nearly a million will join us as our friends. The rest will be our enemies. Together with our other friends who will join us, we will defeat our enemies as we defeated them on Triacus. A million friends on Marcos will make us invincible. No one will tell us where to go, when to sleep, where to eat. The universe will be mine to command, yours to play in. To accomplish this great mission, we must first control the Enterprise. To control the ship, we first must control the crew. You know how to do that. That is your next task. And as you believe, so shall you do, so shall you do. As you believe, so shall you do, so shall you do. As you believe, so shall you do, so shall you do.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Maintaining standard orbit, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, any report from the planet security team?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Everything is quiet, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Context: enters
Text: Captain, I have extracted the salient portion of Professor Starnes' tapes.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Among the technical facts he gathered, Professor Starnes also offered some rather unscientific hypotheses.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see them.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Starnes
Text: Log date 5025.3. Ever since our arrival on Triacus, I've felt a certain growing feeling of uneasiness. At first I attributed it to the usual case of nerves associated with any new project. However, I've found that the rest of my associates are also bothered by these anxieties. The only ones not affected are the children Bless them, they find the whole thing an exciting adventure. Ah, to be young again.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see some more of these unscientific hypotheses, Mister Spock.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Starnes
Context: tense
Text: 5032.4. The feeling of anxiety we've all been experiencing is growing worse.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is another portion, Captain, which I believe you'll find particularly interesting.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Starnes
Text: 5038.3. Professor Wilkins finished his excavation today. Although whatever civilisation that might have been here was destroyed by some natural catastrophe, it would appear that one of the race took refuge in the cave. (Tommy enters the Bridge) And, for our efforts, we are becoming only more apprehensive. (Tommy clenches his fist) As if some unseen force were influencing us.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The picture on the monitor breaks up and ends.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't see you come in, Tommy.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Captain, after we leave here, can you take us to Marcos Twelve?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We'll probably take you to a Federation Starbase.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: But I have relatives on Marcos Twelve.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Tommy. Marcos Twelve is not within our patrol area. Mister Spock, we'll pursue this in my quarters.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Captain, can I stay here and watch? I'll be very quiet.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Tommy. Lieutenant, have Doctor McCoy report to my quarters for a brief conference. Mister Leslie?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk and Spock leave.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hi there.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Hi.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy does the fist clenching thing, Sulu blinks and presses some buttons and turns the navigation dial. Enterprise leaves orbit. Mary arrives with her security guard.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: What is that?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Context: blissfully unaware of reality
Text: The planet Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Will we see that all the time we stay here?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, we will. All the time we're here.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: He sees Triacus on the screen.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: He thinks he sees it.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Uhura
Context: seeing reality
Text: Mister Sulu, the screen. We're out of orbit.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy influences her too. The planet is back.) MARY: Will we reach Marcos Twelve soon

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Very soon.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Don influences the crew, then Scott walks in.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: When did we change course?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: We haven't changed course.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: What do you mean, we haven't changed course? Look at your bridge control monitor.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: We're still in orbit, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: Have you gone completely blind? That's not orbiting position.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: Don't touch the controls, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: What the devil do you think you're doing?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: We must remain in this orbit till the bridge orders a change.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: You blind fool! Can't you see in front of you? We're not in orbit.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: I will not disobey an order from the bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: You are disobeying an order from the bridge. Now step aside.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Man
Text: You're losing control of yourself.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not yet.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Scott throws the Engineer aside to get to the controls, but the other one present grabs him. Finally the first man knocks Scott out.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Starnes
Text: I'm being influenced to do things that do not make sense. I even went so far as to call Starfleet Command to request a spaceship to be used as a transport. It was only when I couldn't tell them what I wanted to transport that I began to realise that my mind was being directed. I decided to send a dispatch to Starfleet, warning them. God forgive us. Must destroy ourselves! Alien upon us. The enemy from within. The enemy!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: He never completed the entry, and the dispatch was never sent. Except for scenes of family life, games and picnics with the children, that is the complete record. Whatever overwhelmed them must have done so with incredible speed. Otherwise, the professor would have provided details of the experience. He was an excellent scientist and tireless in his pursuit of the truth.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That could be what destroyed him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possible, Captain. Evil does seek to maintain power by suppressing the truth.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Or by misleading the innocent.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Misleading the innocent? I wonder.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you mean the children may be involved?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Doctor. Spock what do we know about the race that lived here?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: According to the legend, Triacus was the seat of a band of marauders who made constant war throughout the system of Epsilon Indi. After many centuries, the destroyers were themselves destroyed by those they had preyed upon.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that the end of it?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, like so many legends, this one too has a frightening ending. It warns that the evil is awaiting a catalyst to set it again into motion and send it marauding across the galaxy.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it possible that the evil found the catalyst?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was speaking of a legend, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But most legends have their basis in fact, Spock.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think I read you, Jim, but as medical officer I must warn you that unless the normal grief is tapped and released from these children, you are treading dangerously.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand your diagnosis, Doctor, and I'll respect it. But not to the exclusion and safety of the Enterprise. Thank you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: McCoy leaves.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, what other expeditions have visited Triacus?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: According to Federation records, this is the first.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it Professor Starnes said about the unseen force?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: He said an unseen force was influencing him, that he recognised it, was beginning to fight it and cancelled his request for a ship.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A ship. Yes, a ship for Triacus. But why? By whom? (into comm.) Security detachment. Ready for relief duty on Triacus. Assemble in the transporter room immediately. I'll have some questions for that planet detachment as soon as they're beamed up. I think it's about time we found out whether Professor Starnes' enemy within is on the planet below or here onboard ship with us. Come on.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Two security men are already on the transporter pads.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your tour of duty will last one hour. Be prepared with your communicators at all times to report any alien beings. Don't wait to investigate.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Beam down the guards.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The two men disappear.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam up the security detachment from Triacus. (no one appears) Spock? What's wrong?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am unable to lock on to the proper co-ordinates.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: It appears we are no longer orbiting Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible. If we're not orbiting Triacus, then the men I beamed down are dead.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are no longer orbiting Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate the bridge monitor screen.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The starfield appears on the wall monitor.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain to Bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, we're not orbiting Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: With all respects, Captain, you're wrong. I have Triacus on my screen now.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: And all five children standing near him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're off course. I'm coming right up.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The children are doing their chant as Kirk and Spock rush onto the bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Hail, hail, fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. Far away, far to see, friendly Angel come to me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. Far away, far to see, friendly Angel come to me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgon
Text: Friends we have reached a moment of crisis. The enemy have discovered our operation, but they are too late. They no longer control the ship. We do. We shall prevail. They will take us any place we desire. Go back to your stations. Maintain your controls. If resistance mounts, call upon their beast. Their beast will serve us well. The fear in each one of them is the beast which will consume him. Remember how it was on Triacus. If they resist, so shall it be on the Enterprise. If you need me, call and I will appear. Our new goal is Marcos Twelve. It is our new beginning. We must not falter.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: The appararition vanishes.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: Go to your stations. Mary, you remain here with me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsman, disregard what you see on the screen, what you think you see on the screen. Set a course for Starbase Four.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy does the fist thing and Sulu sees swords on the viewscreen.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helmsman, did you hear me?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, contact Starbase Four. Tell them we're bringing the children there. Tell Starfleet Command I suspect them of being alien in nature, and I want a thorough investigation made upon our arrival.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: For some strange reason there is a mirror in front of her, and Tommy changes what she can see in it.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, what are you staring at?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I see my death. A long death. Disease and pain. I see my death.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, there's nothing there.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh, God. Captain, don't let it be.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you make the call to Starfleet. Mister Sulu, I ordered you to change course. Mister Sulu

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, stay away from the controls! If you touch them, we'll be destroyed.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, there's nothing there.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, why are we bothering Starfleet?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That was an order, Spock.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: This bridge is under complete control.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Complete?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no need.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take a look around you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Spock tries to reach for his controls, but Tommy intervenes.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot obey your order, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: A vain communications officer who cannot ignore a reflection, a helmsman who thinks he is flying the ship through a tunnel of swords... Kirk goes to the security guard.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take Mister Sulu to his quarters. He is relieved of duty.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: But Tommy stops the guard, and everyone else, from hearing what the captain is saying. It sounds total gibberish. Only Spock manages to clear his mind.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Confine them to quarters. Did you hear me? Did you hear me?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy summons Kirk's beast to haunt him. Loss of confidence and control. Fear of indecision.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we must get off this bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, we must. I'm losing command. I'm losing my ability to command. I'm losing the Enterprise.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm losing command. I'm losing the Enterprise. The ship is sailing on and on. I'm alone. Alone. Alone. I'm losing command.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've lost command. I've lost the Enterprise.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got command. I've got command. I've got command.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Where to, Captain?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliary control, my Vulcan friend. This ship is off course.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. I want you to override the bridge navigation system and plot a course for Starbase Four.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't do that, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Scott
Text: These are very sensitive instruments. I will not have you upset their delicate balance. We would all be lost, forever lost. (Spock sees Don) Go away now. Go away or we'll kill you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, listen to me. The Enterprise has been invaded by alien beings. Its destination is Marcos. If we take it there, millions will die the way they died at Triacus.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Kirk tries to jump the engineer at the controls, but he and Spock are forced away. They retreat.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm all right, Spock. My beast is finished. It won't return.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, so long as the children are present, there is danger. They are the carriers.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, they're not the alien beings. They're children being misled.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are followers. Without followers, evil cannot spread.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They're children.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the four hundred and thirty men and women on board the Enterprise and the ship itself are endangered by these children.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They don't understand the evil that they're doing.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps that is true, but the evil that is within them is spreading fast, and unless we can find a way to remove it

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll have to kill them.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy and Chekov arrive with two guards.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Ensign?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I have been instructed to place you and Mister Spock under arrest.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By whose order?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Starfleet Command, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where did you hear this order, Ensign? Now, listen to me. This order is false. I want you and your men to return to their stations.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I'm sorry, but I must insist you and Mister Spock come with me to the detention section.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign, listen to me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Context: drawing his phaser
Text: Do not force me to kill you, sir. I will if I have to. Will you come peacefully, Captain?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign, listen to me. This is a false order, Ensign.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I have never disobeyed an order, Captain. You know I have never

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know that, Ensign. You have never disobeyed an order, but an alien being is aboard this ship.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I will not disobey now! I cannot disobey!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ensign, listen to me. You will disobey this order!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Starfleet Command supersedes your order, sir!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Spock and Kirk jump them. Tommy's fist is working overtime to try and control the situation, but Kirk and Spock win the fight.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enough. Take these men to detention then join me on the bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Tommy is in the Captain's chair, grinning.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Enterprise will never reach Marcos Twelve. We will not be landing there.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: The crew will take us. The crew believes.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The crew does not understand. When we make them understand as I understand, they won't take you to Marcos.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: They will! They will!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: We are going to Marcos! We are going to follow our friend!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your friend? Where is your friend? Where is that stowaway? Why does he hide?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: He will come if we call him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: But we won't. We don't need him. We're not afraid of you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I'm glad you're not afraid of me. (Takes his seat) But your leader is afraid. What's he afraid of?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mary
Text: He's not afraid of anybody.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: He's not afraid of anything.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's afraid to be seen. And when the crew sees and hears him, they'll understand that he is not their friend, and they won't follow him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: He is our friend.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then let him show himself. Bring him out! Let him prove to me that he is my friend and I'll follow him to Marcos Twelve and to the ends of the universe!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Tommy
Text: No!

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Spock enters the bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, playback the chant the children sang to summon up the Gorgan.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: All
Text: Hail, hail, fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. Far away, for to see, friendly Angel come to me. Hail, hail, fire and snow. Call the angel, we will go. (The other children enter the bridge.) Far away, for to see, friendly Angel come to me.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The time has come to see the world as it is. Come on.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Gorgan appears.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: Who has summoned me?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I did, Gorgan. My beast is gone. It lost its power in the light of reality. I command again, and I ordered you here.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: No, Captain. I command here. My followers are strong and faithful and obedient. That's why we take what is ours wherever we go.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: You take from those who do not know you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And we know you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: Then you know I must win, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not if we join together to fight you.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgon
Text: Foolish. You will be destroyed. I would ask you to join me, but you are gentle, and that is a grave weakness.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're also very strong.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: Ah, but your strength is cancelled by your gentleness. You are full of goodness. Such as you cannot be changed. You are like the parents. You must be eliminated.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Children, I have pictures of some of you on Triacus. I'd like to show them to you. Would you like to see them? Mister Spock, the pictures.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: I forbid it.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why should you fear it?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: I fear nothing.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So we were told. Mister Spock, the pictures. The children are waiting.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Film of the children playing with their parents appears on Spock's overhead monitor. They smile as they watch themselves having fun. Then they see their parents lying dead, and the smiles are gone.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: They would not help transport us. They were against us. They had to be eliminated.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Spock
Text: Tommy's father would have destroyed you, but he recognised you too late.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: You are also too late. The kind ones always are.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not always, Gorgan. Not this time. You can't hide from them. They see you as we see you. They know what you are. Even the children learn.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: You are my future generals. Together we can raise armies of followers. Go to your posts! The first great victories are upon us. You will see. We have millions of friends on Marcos Twelve. We shall exterminate all who oppose us! Our purity of purpose cannot be contaminated by those who disagree, who will not co-operate, who do not understand. They must be annihilated.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: But now the children are crying.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't be afraid. Look at him. Without you children, he's nothing. The evil remains within him.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Gorgan becomes ugly.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: I command you! I command you! To your posts! Carry out your duties, or I will destroy you! You will be swept aside to make way for the strong.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look how ugly he really is. Look at him and don't be afraid.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Gorgan
Text: Death. Death to you all. Death to you all. Death to you all. Death to you all.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: Gorgon fades away. Sulu's swords vanish. McCoy enters.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They're crying, Jim. I don't know how it happened, but it's good to see.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right, Mary. It's all right. It's all right, isn't it, Doctor?

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. It's all right. We can help them now.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Marcos Twelve dead ahead, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Reverse course, Mister Sulu.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Context: McCoy leads the children off the bridge.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course reversed, Captain.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set course for Starbase Four, Mister Sulu.

Title: And The Children Shall Lead
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The Enterprise is at Red Alert as an alien vessel approaches them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phaser banks standing by, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Range forty three thousand and closing.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you read, Mister Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Configuration unidentified. Ion propulsion, high velocity, though of a unique technology.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any contact, Lieutenant?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Hailing on all frequencies, sir. All languages have been attempted. No response. Now using standard interstellar symbols.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep trying.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Magnification ten, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir. Thirty eight thousand and closing.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Scotty?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: It beats me, but isn't she a beauty?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Interesting design.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've never seen anything like her. And ion propulsion at that. They could teach us a thing or two.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Life forms, Mister Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: One. Humanoid or similar. Low level of activity. Life-support systems functioning. Interior atmosphere, conventional nitrogen-oxygen. Instruments indicate a transferal beam emanating from the area of the humanoid life form.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Directed at what?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Directed at the Bridge of the Enterprise, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security guard.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security guard to the Bridge.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: A woman materialises and smiles at them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James Kirk. This is the Starship Enterprise.

Title: Spock's Brain
