Context: The security guards rush in, she presses a button on her wrist band, the power goes off and everyone collapses. Then the same happens to the crew all over the ship. The woman walks over to Spock, and puts her hand on his head.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Later - after the opening titles - the power comes back on and everyone wakes up again.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What happened?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Helm status, Mister Sulu.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No change from last reading, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Condition reports from all decks, Lieutenant.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Where's Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim! Jim!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, what is it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You'd better come down to Sickbay

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right now.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. On my way.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Deck five. Personnel, no damage.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Spock is lying on a biobed, with a bandage around his head and life-support equipment over his torso.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Functioning.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank God.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. What happened?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I found him on the table.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like this?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, not like this.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've got him on complete life support. Was he dead?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He was worse than dead.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Bones. What's the mystery?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: His brain is gone.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His what?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's been removed surgically.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How could he survive?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's the greatest technical job I've ever seen. Every nerve ending in the brain must've been neatly sealed. Nothing ripped, nothing torn, no bleeding. It's a medical miracle.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If his brain is missing, then Spock is dying.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. That incredible Vulcan physique hung on until the life-support cycle took over. His body lives. The autonomic functions continue. But there is no mind.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That girl.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What girl?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From that ship. She took it. I don't know why, or where, but she must have taken it. Bones, how long can you keep him functioning?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't give you any guarantee.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not good enough, Doctor.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If it happened to any of us, I'd say indefinitely. But Vulcan physiology limits what I can do. Spock's body is more dependent on that tremendous brain for life support.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we'll take him with us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take him? Take him where?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In search of his brain, Doctor. From what you say, the moment we find it we must restore it to his body, or we lose him.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, where are you going to look? In this whole galaxy, where are you going to look for Spock's brain? How are you going to find it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll find it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Even if you do, I can't restore it. I don't have the medical technique.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was taken out. It can be put back in.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But I don't know how.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The thief that took it has the knowledge. I'll force it out of her.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If you don't find it in twenty four hours, you'd better forget the whole thing, Jim.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You and Scotty have Spock ready.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I've got it again. An ion trail matching when we first saw her.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where does the trail lead to?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: System Sigma Draconis.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock on, Mister Sulu. Maximum speed.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp six.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No question about the trail?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No mistake, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5431.4. for fifteen hours and twenty minutes we have been following the ion trail of the spaceship that has Spock's brain. Time left to us, eight hours and forty minutes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I've lost the trail.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All scanners, extreme sweep.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Nothing, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No signal at all, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's gone, sir. A sudden deaction shift.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've lost her trail, but she went into that system. Mister Chekov, put a schematic of Sigma Draconis on the screen.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Read out, Mister Chekov?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sun, spectral type, Gamma nine. Nine planets, three of them, Class M possessing sapient life according to reports and long-range scanning.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She was breathing our air. She must've gone to one of them. Show us the three Class-M planets. Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Chekov gets up and goes to the viewscreen to point out the relevant items.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The one on the left, number three, rates letter B on the industrial scale.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Earth equivalent approximately 1485.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir. Second planet Class M, number four, rates letter G.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The year 2030.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But that ship, Captain, either it was many years ahead of us or the most incredible design fluke in history.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Third Class M planet, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Number six. No sign of industrial development. At last report, in a Glacial Age. Sapient life plentiful, but on a most primitive level.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now. as I understand it, Mister Chekov, there are three Class-M planets,

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not one of which is capable of launching an interstellar flight,

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yet one of them accomplished it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I'm picking up high energy generation on planet six.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the primitive glaciated planet.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The source of it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It could be natural. Volcanic activity, steam, any number of causes. But it's very regular.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do your surface readings show, Mister Chekov?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No sign of organised civilisation. Primitive humanoids picked up at irregular intervals.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With regular pulsations of generated energy?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I can't explain it, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't afford to guess wrong. I've got to choose the right planet, get there, find the brain. Eight hours and thirty five minutes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Recommendations, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sigma Draconis Three. It's closest, heaviest population.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But a technological rating of only three. They couldn't possibly have put that ship we saw into space.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: None of these planets could.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I say planet four, Captain. At least planet four is ahead of three technologically.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But advanced ion propulsion is beyond even our capabilities. It'd be a miracle if they had developed it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What would they want with his brain? What would they want with Mister Spock's brain? What use is it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Why do they want it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Why would they want it? Eight hours and thirty four minutes. Planet six is glaciated, you say?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Several thousand years at least. Only the tropical zone is ice-free.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But the energy. Regular. It's there. It's real.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. It doesn't make sense, but it's there.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have the transporter room stand by. I'm taking a landing party down to planet six.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: A hunch, Captain?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A hunch, Mister Sulu.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What if you guess wrong, Captain?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I guess wrong, Mister Spock is dead. Spock will die.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 4351.5. We are beaming down to a primitive glaciated planet in the Sigma Draconis star system. Time left to us to find Spock's brain, eight hours and twenty nine minutes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Kirk, Scott, Chekov and two security guards beam onto the rocky planet.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Suit temperatures to seventy two. Life-form readings, Mister Spock? (gets a look) Mister Scott?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scattered. Widely spaced. Humanoid, all right. On the large side.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Watch out. We know their development is primitive.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Read out, Mister Chekov.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No structures, Captain. No mechanised objects that I can read. No surface consumption or generation of energy. Atmosphere is perfectly all right, of course. Temperature, a high maximum of forty. Livable.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have a thick skin.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain! There's someone, something out there in the rocks. Five of them. Humanoid, large.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun. I want them conscious.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The group of bearded, skin clad males with clubs move carefully towards the Starfleet party.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire only on my signal. Flank out.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The primitives suddenly leap up from behind rocks, throwing stones and their clubs. Kirk fires, and stuns the leader. The rest run away.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We mean you no harm. We're not your enemies, we're your friends. We only wish to talk to you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: You are not the Others?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We come from a far place. We are men.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: Men?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Like yourselves.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: You are small, like the Others.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are the Others?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: Givers of pain and delight.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do they live here with you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: No. They come. They give pain and delight.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do they come from the sky?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: They are here. You will see. The Others will come for you. They come for all like us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do they come for your women as well?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: Women?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The female of your kind.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: Your words say nothing.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you have a mate?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: Mate?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: A companion.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will you take us where we can find the Others?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Context: afraid
Text: No one wants to find them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We do. We want to find them. Take us there and we'll let you go.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, five hundred metres in that direction there's a foundation under the surface. A huge one. Registrations all over the place.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Buildings?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir. Immensely old, completely buried. But they were here once.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Somewhere down there is where the Others live. Scotty, see if you can find a way down.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Morg
Text: No! No! No, do not go there! No! No!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: He struggles briefly with the Morg, who escapes and runs off.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's all right. Let him go.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What could the Others do to cause such terror?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was it he said, pain and delight?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A peculiar mixture.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A dead and buried city on a planet in a glacial age.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And the male humanoid who doesn't know the meaning of the word female.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Over here, sir. There's food in there and a whole pile of other stuff. A storehouse for our muscular friends.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: They step inside carefully.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't think so. Scotty.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: There is a pair of photoelectric cells creating an invisible trip wire across the front of the supplies.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Metal. Forged, tempered. Our apish friends didn't make these. What do you think?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: It could be a warning device to keep those creatures away from the food.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or the food could be a lure set by the Others to bring them in here.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: In that case, the beam would be a signal.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And this cave a trap.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: If it will trap the creatures for the Others, Captain, won't it trap us, too?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Enterprise. Uhura here.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have Doctor McCoy beam down immediately.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, you and the security team will remain here at the entrance. We'll be in constant contact with you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: McCoy and Spock beam down. Spock is in a brown overall, and has a device on his head. McCoy is holding a remote control unit with coloured buttons. He presses one and Spock turns left to face us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Bones. Bring him along.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Keep him close to the right.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ready?

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: He steps across the beam and a metal shutter slams down, sealing the cave entrance. The 'elevator room' drops rapidly.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Call Chekov and tell him to send my stomach down.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It might be a long wait. We may as well be comfortable.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: He uses his phaser to heat a rock, and they warm their hands in its glow.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, that power we picked up above, we're getting closer.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A lot of it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enough to push this planet out of orbit.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What source?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Either a nuclear pile a hundred miles across or

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or what?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ion power.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're slowing down.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The door opens, and there is a woman in yellow in the corridor. She reaches to her wrist band, but Kirk stuns her first. He takes her wrist band.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is she all right?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll have her talking in a minute.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: You do not belong here. You are not Morg.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who's in charge? I wish to speak to him.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: Him? What is him?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done with Spock's brain? Where've you taken it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: You are not Morg or Eymorg. I know nothing about a brain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're lying!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's not, Jim. No change in reading. She doesn't know.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Scott
Text: See what you can pick up on your communicator.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't want to hurt you. What is this place?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: This place is here.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: I am Luma. I am Eymorg. You are not Eymorg. You are not Morg. What are you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, it's no use. You'll get nothing out of that one. Hers is the mind of a child.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I've got something, but I can't quite get a fix on it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Luma tries to get away, but McCoy grabs her.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. Activity without end, but with no volition.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, is that you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain? Captain Kirk?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Spock. Yes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there is a definite pleasurable experience connected with the hearing of your voice.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where are you, Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is that you, Doctor McCoy, and are you with the Captain?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where else would I be?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, where are you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineer Scott as well. Unfortunately, I do not know where I am.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll get you, Spock. It won't be long.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: A practical idea, Captain. It seems unlikely that I shall be able to get to you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Quickly!

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: They head off down the corridor, Scott controlling Spock's body. Then around a corner comes a woman in purple with two Morg in uniforms.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There she is. That's the one. What have you done with Spock's brain?

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The woman in purple uses her wrist band to knock out the men. Only Spock is left standing.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 5431.6. Immediately after making contact with Spock's brain, Doctor McCoy, Engineer Scott, and myself were taken prisoner inside a highly complex civilisation hundreds of metres below the surface of planet Sigma Draconis Seven. The primitive creature we encountered above warned us about the givers of pain and delight and the frightening consequences of being captured by them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Luma and other women are present, and occasionally giving pieces of food to the men standing around. Our landing party are still unconscious, and sitting on stools. The woman in purple comes in, and four women sit at the L shaped table. She presses the green button twice, and they wake up. All the men have belts with green buckles on them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: What are you? Why are you here? You have something to speak?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done with Spock's brain?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: We do not know Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Spock. You saw him on the ship. You have his brain. It must be restored to him immediately. What have you done with it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Ah, yes, brain. You spoke to Luma also of brain, but we do not understand.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I do not know about Luma, but you were on the Enterprise. I saw you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I do not know these things you speak of.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You came to my ship!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: We know only here below and here above. This is our place. You are not Morg. You are stranger.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I saw you on my ship.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, she may not remember or even really know. Disassociation could be complete. It doesn't seem possible she could have performed surgery on Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, it doesn't.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: You hurt Luma. It is not permitted again to hurt anyone.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sorry. We don't want to hurt anyone.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: If you wish to return to your home, you may go.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We'll stay here and learn about you and tell you of us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, for instance, above it's cold and harsh. And below, it's warm. The air is fresh.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. There's no sun, but there's light.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I wish to talk to those in charge.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: In charge?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the organisers, the managers. The leader of your people.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I am leader. There is no other.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's impossible. Who built the machines?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who are the doctors? Who operates?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who controls this complex?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Control? Controller?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the Controller. The Controller. Who controls? I would like to meet, to see him.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: No. It is not permitted. Never! Controller is alone, apart. We serve Controller. No other is permitted near.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We intend no harm.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: You have come to destroy us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no, no. I promise you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We just want to talk to somebody about Spock's brain. That's all.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Brain and brain! What is brain? It is Controller, is it not?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Yes, in a way it is. The human brain controls the individual's functions.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Scotty. Spock's brain controls

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's not possible.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Great leader. Great leader! (He kneels in front of Kara.) We come from a far place to learn from your Controller.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: You lie! You know me. You have said that. You came to take back the Controller.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He is our friend. You must take us to him. We beg you. Soon it will be too late.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Luma
Text: Do not take them, Kara. Do not take them to the Controller.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: They will be prevented.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must take us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: A single press of the green button and they collapse, writhing in agony.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I must learn what to do. (to Luma) Come with me. You will keep them here.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Guard
Text: Yes, mistress.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The women - sorry, Eymorg - leave.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log. Lieutenant Sulu recording. I am holding the Enterprise in orbit about planet Sigma Draconis Seven. Captain Kirk's hunch that Spock's brain is on this planet appears to be correct. Ensign Chekov remains on the surface to act as liaison between the Captain and the Enterprise.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: {Council room]

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I never felt anything like that. Every nerve in my body was on fire.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wouldn't believe the human organism could take such pain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: These are on to stay for a while. Must be a magnetic lock of some kind.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No wonder the Morgs are so obedient, and terrified.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: A Morg blocks the doorway.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How is this place kept functioning by the primitive minds we've met?

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Their equipment is laid out on a table, but another Morg stops Kirk getting to it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Those women could never have set up anything as complex as this has to be. Why, that takes engineering genius. But there's no sign of engineering genius in any of those women.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They were smart enough to invent these training devices. What a way to maintain control over a man.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Pain and delight, he said up above.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sure you noticed the delight aspect of this place.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I certainly did notice those delightful aspects. But that too was strictly under command of the women.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: How does Spock's brain fit into this?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With a communicator, we might be able to find out. This fellow is keeping us from our property.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Isn't there a way to correct that situation?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I certainly think that science might provide an answer.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It does, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Agreed, Doctor.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Kirk hits the Morg by the table while Scott and McCoy take on the one by the door. It isn't easy, but finally the Captain triumphs.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Science will triumph. Come on, Scotty. Bones, give them something to keep them out for a while. (into communicator) Spock. Spock. Come on, Spock. Spock, you were on this frequency, Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain, I am still here. Have you returned to the Enterprise?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. We might be able to locate you, if you gave us some idea of what they were using you for. Is it medical?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not certain. I seem to have a body which stretches into infinity.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Body? Why, you have none.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then what am l?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You are a disembodied brain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. It could explain much, Doctor. My medulla oblongata is hard at work apparently breathing, apparently pumping blood, apparently maintaining a normal physiologic temperature.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, we don't have time for that.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why are you endangering your lives by coming here?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We came to put you back. Where are you?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Back where?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Back into your body. We brought it along with us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thoughtful, Captain, but probably impractical. While I might trust the doctor to remove a splinter or lance a boil, I do not believe he has the knowledge to restore a brain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: No denigration intended, Doctor McCoy. That skill does not yet exist in the galaxy.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The skill to remove it exists right where we are. Restoring it must also be possible. That's why we've got to get to you as quickly as we can.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I appreciate the risks you are taking on my behalf, but I must insist they are worthwhile only if there is a reasonable chance for success. Let me ask you, how much time has elapsed since

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Eighteen hours and twelve minutes.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy must've told you that twenty four hours is the maximum my body can

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I told him.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That leaves us exactly five hours and forty eight minutes, Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It does seem all too brief a time to develop such skills, does it not?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Very brief. That's why we must get to you immediately. Beam us a signal so we can home in on you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Got it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. (Spock's body stands up and they walk out of the room)

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, Spock, one question.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got pain-giving devices attached to us. Can you tell us how to get them off.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall give it top priority.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: They walk along.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I have an answer for you. It seems your pain bands are manually controlled. The red button on a bracelet releases them. I know that does not make much sense.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes it does, Spock. (further along) Keep concentrating, Spock. Keep concentrating, Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Must be in there, Captain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Kara is in there, with her back to the door. She hears them enter, and gives them pain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.. Spock. No pain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Kirk manages to get to the control box that McCoy dropped and get Spock's body to walk over to Kara.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: No. Go away.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Spock holds her wrists, then finally presses the red button. The belts fly off.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: We will die. You must not take the Controller away. We will all die. The Controller is young and powerful. Perfect!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: How very flattering.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: You will give life to my people for ten thousand years to come.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll find another Controller.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: The old one is finished! There is no other than this and will not be another for ten thousand years.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you're in a black box tied in with light rays into a complex control panel.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say you're breathing, pumping blood, maintaining temperature? Is it possible that you're re-circulating air, running heating plants, purifying water?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain. That is unquestionably part of what I am doing.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: He must stay. He must stay!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He will not stay. (He makes Spock release her, and grabs her himself, taking off her bracelet.) Now, you took his brain. You will put it back. How did you do it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I do not know.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She couldn't, Jim. Her mind is functioning on a very simple level. Mental faculties here seem to be almost atrophied because of non-use.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She was on the Enterprise. She must have done it. How did you do it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: It was the old knowledge.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you get the old knowledge?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I put upon my head the Teacher.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is the Teacher?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: The great Teacher of all the ancient knowledge.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: There is a transparent helmet with what look like a whole lot of syringes sticking through it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I may explain, Captain. She refers to the tape storehouse of knowledge of the builders of this place. I scan it. A most impressive store.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does it work? Show us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KARA; I cannot.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must tell us.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I cannot. Only by command of the ancients may I understand.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does it work? Show us! We'll protect you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is a device with feeding circuits. They lead into the mind of the priestess leader. Its use is strictly predetermined by the builders.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Kirk forces her into the helmet.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: No! The knowledge is forbidden! I must not know the secret! I will be punished!

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: A control panel comes on and she goes quiet.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Context: confident, assured
Text: Gentlemen, the Controller's explanation of the functioning of the Teacher is essentially correct. However, he is giving no credit to me. I provide the means whereby the knowledge is used. Without me, Captain

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Without you there could be no delicate miracle that kept Spock's brain alive.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Thank you, Doctor. That was very gracious.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. From the very first, I appreciated your ability.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Good, Captain Kirk. Then you also appreciate that without the Teacher, I would not have the knowledge to use that which you have thoughtfully provided.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: She points a phaser at him.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: That phaser is set to kill.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: So it is. That is the knowledge you have brought me. Do not move. If your weapon kills, it will kill you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not the first to bring you the knowledge of killing. If you continue, you'll kill Spock.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: The Controller die? The Controller will live for ten thousand years, and we shall give him all our devotion.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But Spock will be dead. His body's dying this minute.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Why do you not understand that the need of my people for their Controller is greater than your need for your friend.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No one may kill a man. Not for any purpose. It cannot be condoned.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: He reaches for the phaser.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Do not! I do not know killing. I do not wish to kill.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Scott groans and faints, distracting her so Kirk can grab the phaser.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: The commandment must be fulfilled.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must help us. When you came to the ship, you had the knowledge. Yet, when we came here, you didn't.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Correct.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long does the knowledge last?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: Three of your hours.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It would be just enough time.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you had the knowledge, could you restore what you've taken?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I would not.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must help us. You must restore with that knowledge what you have taken.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: No!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must put back what you have taken.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: I will not betray my people. The Controller will stay.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, it worked for her. It might work for me.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: She is an alien. The configurations of her brain are different. It could cause irreparable damage to your human brain, Doctor.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm a surgeon already. If I could learn these techniques, I might be able to retain them.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, you might lose the doctor that way.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He might, but we're sure to lose you if I don't try.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot allow you to jeopardise your life for me.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, didn't you hear? I might be able to retain and bring these techniques to the world. Jim, isn't it worth that risk? Wouldn't you insist upon taking such a risk yourself?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Doctor. Put the Teacher on.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: No!

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: McCoy goes over to the device, and Kirk adjusts it onto his head. McCoy winces in pain as knowledge is fed into his brain, then falls to his knees.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. Of course. A child could do it. A child could do it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 5432.3. Doctor McCoy is proceeding to restore Spock's brain. Our problem, we do not know how long his increased surgical knowledge will stay with him. Any additional attempt to use the teaching device is impossible. It would kill my medical officer.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: The top of Spock's head is concealed by a wall, which McCoy is working behind.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've never seen anything like it. He's operating at warp speed. I'd like a try at that teacher myself.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: You will have him back and we will be destroyed.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. You won't be destroyed. You'll be without your Controller for the first time, but you'll be much better off, I think.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: We will die.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you'll live and develop as you should have. All this shouldn't have been done for you. Now the women here below and the men here above will control together.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: They will not help us without the pain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are other ways. You'll discover them. You must move to the surface, you understand.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kara
Text: We will die above in the cold.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, you won't. You'll learn to build houses, to keep warm, to work. We'll help you for a while. Humans have survived under worse conditions. It's a matter of evolution. You'll be fine.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: McCoy is starting to pause and think.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain Kirk!

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Scott
Text: He's forgetting.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't. I

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? Bones?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All the ganglia, the nerves. There are a million of them. What am I supposed to do? What am I supposed to do?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, you can't stop now.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm trying to thread a needle with a sledgehammer. What am I supposed to do? I can't remember. I don't remember.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No one can restore a brain.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You could. A while ago it was child's play.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental. Our race against time to save Spock's life may prove futile. Doctor McCoy has lost the surgical knowledge he obtained from the teacher. He has been drawing on his own skills and surgical techniques in an attempt to continue the operation, but he is faltering and uncertain. In a desperate hope that he can draw on Spock's brain for assistance, I instructed Doctor McCoy to give priority to connecting Spock's vocal chords.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dying, and I can't stop it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Context: hoarse
Text: Yes. Doctor McCoy.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you will finish reconnecting my speech centre, I might be able to help.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Speech centre.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. That's correct. One thing at a time. Ah, ah, mmm. (normal voice) That's better. Now, Doctor. Try the sonic separator.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sonic separator.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, I believe I already have some sensation of feeling. Please stimulate the nerve endings and observe the physical reactions, one by one. In each case, I shall tell you when the probe is correct. You will then seal using the tri-laser connector.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tri-laser connector. Ready?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right forefinger.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Context: twitching
Text: Correct.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right wrist.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right elbow.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct. Very good, Doctor.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll never live this down. This Vulcan is telling me how to operate.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Later

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Closed.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How do I know? I could have made a thousand mistakes. Sealing nerve endings, joining ganglia. The fluid balance is correct, but I don't know.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: Spock sits up and stretches.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Congratulations, Doctor. And thank you.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you feel, Spock?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Text: On the whole, Captain, I believe I am quite fit. Fascinating. A remarkable example of a retrograde civilisation. At the peak, advanced beyond any of our capabilities and now operating at this primitive level which you saw. And it all began thousands of years ago when a glacial age reoccurred. This underground complex was developed for the women. The men remained above, and a male-female schism took place. A fascinating cultural development of a kind which never

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I knew it was wrong. I shouldn't have done it.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that?

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I should have never reconnected his mouth.

Title: Spock's Brain
Context: A slanted eyebrow hits the ceiling.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, we took the risk, Doctor.

Title: Spock's Brain
Speaker: Spock
Context: to Kara, amid laughter
Text: As I was saying, a fascinating cultural development of the kind which hasn't been seen in ages. The last such occurrence took place on old Earth, when the Romans were warring with the ....

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5630.7. We have been assigned to convey the Medusans' ambassador to the Federation back to their home planet. While the thoughts of the Medusans are the most sublime in the galaxy, their physical appearance is exactly the opposite. They have evolved into a race of beings who are formless, so utterly hideous that the sight of a Medusan brings total madness to any human who sees one.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: A man beams aboard.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Marvick. I am James Kirk, the Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Captain, what are you doing here? You'll have to leave before the Medusan ambassador arrives.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, everything will be taken care of. This is Mister Spock, my First Officer.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MARVICK; Oh, yes, you're the Vulcan. It's all right for you to remain, but you, Captain, and this other gentleman.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Montgomery Scott, Chief Engineer. Call me Scotty.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Mister Spock, do you have the visor? You must be sure to wear it. Humans who get even a glimpse of Medusans have gone insane.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Mister Marvick. I shall be wearing the visor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We mustn't keep the ambassador waiting. If you'll go with Mister Scott, I'm sure the two of you will have a great deal in common.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, indeed. It's a rare privilege meeting one of the designers of the Enterprise.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Scott and Marvick leave.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel to transporter control centre on the planet.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. Inform the ambassador and Doctor Jones we're ready to beam them aboard. Kirk out. Are you sure this visor will work?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has proved effective for Vulcans.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's your human half I'm worried about.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall endeavour to keep it under control.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Inform me when transport is complete.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kirk leaves. Spock puts on the red filter visor and beams aboard a box and a woman. She removes her visor and gives the Vulcan salute.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Welcome aboard, Ambassador Kollos. I am First Officer Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I'm Doctor Jones. (Spock removes his visor) The ambassador is most honoured to meet you, Mister Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock fixes an anti-gravity handle to the Ambassador's box.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk, we are ready.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel to all decks.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Channel open, sir.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk to all ship's personnel. Clearance plans now in effect.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock and Jones are wearing their visors again.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Clear passageways immediately. The Ambassador will be escorted to his quarters at once.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The crew vacate the premises.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Jones, may I congratulate you on your assignment with Ambassador Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Thank you, but the assignment's not yet definite. It will depend upon my ability to achieve a true mind-link with the Ambassador.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sure you will find it a fascinating experience.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I wasn't aware that anyone had ever achieved a mind-link with the Medusans.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: No one ever has. I was referring to mind-links I had attempted with members of other species.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I've heard, Mister Spock, that you turned down the assignment with the Ambassador.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was unable to accept. My life is here.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: They place the box on a table.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Bridge. We have arrived at the Ambassador's quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. Notify all hands to return to stations. All right, let's take her out. Warp factor two.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor two, sir.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock removes the anti-gravity handle.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would appreciate an opportunity to exchange greetings with the Ambassador.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I'm sure the Ambassador would be charmed.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The box opens slightly, and a green light fills the room. There are images of a myriad of lights then the lid shuts again.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I almost envy you your assignment.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I see in your mind that you are tempted to take my place.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not correct, Doctor, although I am aware of your mind attempting to contact mine. Were you born a telepath?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Yes. That is why I had to study on Vulcan.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand. May I show you to your quarters?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I think I'll stay here a bit. Ambassador Kollos often finds the process of transport somewhat unsettling.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand. Our ship's surgeon often makes the same complaint. Do call when you are ready.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock leaves. Jones removes her visor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: What is it he sees when he looks at you? I must know!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The green light fills the room.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The senior staff are in dress uniform - Scott with more plaid than we've seen before. Mister Marvick is present too.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kirk pours a drink while Jones toys with a red rose.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't understand why they let you go with Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: They, Captain?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The male population of the Federation. Didn't someone try and talk you out of it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Now that you ask, yes.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm glad he didn't succeed. Otherwise, I wouldn't have met you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Thank you, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me, Doctor Jones. Why isn't it dangerous for you to be with Kollos? Spock I can understand. Nothing makes an impression on him.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why, thank you, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're very welcome, Mister Spock. But no human can look at Kollos, even with a visor, without going mad. How do you manage?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I spent four years on Vulcan studying their mental discipline.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You poor girl.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: On the contrary, Doctor, I would say that Doctor Jones was indeed fortunate.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Vulcan is not my idea of fun.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Joy can be many things, Doctor. On Vulcan, I learned to do things impossible to learn anywhere else.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To read minds?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: How not to read them, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't understand.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Jones was born a telepath, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Vulcan was necessary to my sanity.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: What most humans generally find impossible to understand is the need to shut out the bedlam of other people's thoughts and emotions.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Jones
Text: Or of their own thoughts and emotions. I was just noticing your Vulcan IDIC, Mister Spock. Is it a reminder that, as a Vulcan, you can mind-link with the Medusans far better than I could?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I doubt that Mister Spock would don the most revered of all Vulcan symbols merely to annoy you, Doctor Jones.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: As a matter of fact, I wear it this evening to honour you, Doctor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Indeed?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, very interesting. I might even say fascinating, but back to your mission. Doctor, do you feel any way may be found to employ Medusan navigators on starships? It would certainly solve many of our navigational problems.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: The key is the mind-link that I learned on Vulcan. Once we have learned the technique of forming a corporate intelligence with the Medusans, the designers, that's where Larry comes in, can work on adapting instruments.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't care how benevolent the Medusans are supposed to be. Isn't it suicidal to deal with something ugly enough to drive men mad? Why do you do it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see, Doctor McCoy, you still subscribe to the outmoded notion, promulgated by your ancient Greeks, that what is good must also be beautiful.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: And the reverse, of course, that what is beautiful is automatically expected to be good.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think most of us are attracted by beauty and repelled by ugliness. One of the last of our prejudices. At the risk of sounding prejudiced, gentlemen, here's to beauty. (they stand for the toast) To Miranda Jones, the loveliest human ever to grace a starship.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How can one so beautiful condemn herself to look upon ugliness the rest of her life? Will we allow it, gentlemen?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: All
Text: Certainly not.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: How can one so full of joy and the love of life as you, Doctor, condemn yourself to look upon disease and suffering for the rest of your life? Can we allow that, gentlemen?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: To whatever you want the most, Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Some more Antarean brandy? (seeing her far-away look) What is it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: There's somebody nearby thinking of murder.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In this room?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: It's gone now.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who is it? Can you tell?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: It isn't there anymore. Captain, would you mind if I said goodnight?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course. Perhaps I'll see

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'll escort you to your quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Thank you, gentlemen. You make a choice impossible. Please, stay and enjoy yourselves. It was a delightful dinner.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sleep well, Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you sure you're well enough to find your way alone?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Of course, Doctor McCoy. Please don't worry about me.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: McCoy kisses her hand, and she leaves.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now, where I come from, that's what we call a lady.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, she is something special.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Very special. I suggest you treat her accordingly. I've known Doctor Jones long enough to be aware of her remarkable gifts. Well, it's been a long day for me.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Larry, would you like to stop off at Engineering with me? I have a few things to check and a bottle of scotch says you can't handle the controls you designed.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Some other time.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Good night, gentlemen.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Marvick and Scott leave.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good night, Scotty. You dressed up for the occasion, Spock. Very impressive.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I genuinely intended to honour her, Captain. Good evening, gentlemen.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good evening. Sleep well.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock leaves.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what's troubling you with the girl?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, she's not just another girl, Captain. Don't make that mistake.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't think that for a moment. What else?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know what it is, exactly. She seems very vulnerable.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're all vulnerable in one way or another.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. But there's something so very disturbing about her.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Meaning she's quite a woman. I agree.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Good night, Jim.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good night, Bones.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The doorbell buzzes.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Miranda?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Who is it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Larry. I've got to talk to you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: It's late.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Please, Miranda, it's important.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: All right. Come in, then.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Marvick enters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: I thought the dinner was never going to end.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I rather enjoyed it.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Yes, I know you did. I didn't. You were so far away.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I'll be further away than that soon.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Please don't talk of that. There's so little time. Please, Miranda, don't go with Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Now, we've been over this time and time again.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Don't I know it. I've asked you in restaurants, in the laboratory, on one knee, on both knees. Miranda, how can you do this?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Larry, please, try to understand.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: I understand that you're a woman and that I'm a man, one of your own kind, and that Kollos will never be able to give you anything like this. (he kisses her but she doesn't respond) Why did I ever meet you?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I've been honest with you. I simply cannot love you the way you want me to.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: And I'm going away with Kollos. That's final. I think you'd better leave now.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: She turns away, then gets the same impressions she had at dinner.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: So it's you! I didn't know that it was you before. Who is it you want to kill, Larry? Is it me? You mustn't keep this to yourself. I want to help you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: So now you want to help me. Now I know what a mere human male has to do to get a reaction out of you. Make you think he's a patient. The great psychologist. Why don't you try being a woman for a change?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Marvick leaves and starts walking along the corridor. Then he stops, turns, and goes back to Kollos' quarters. The Medusan opens his box lid as Marvick draws his phaser. Larry screams and writhes about in the presence of the alien. Miranda senses something is going on. Marvick dashes out into the corridor and runs into the turbolift. Miranda comes out of her room and goes to Kollos without her visor. She picks up the phaser from the floor. Marvick assaults a crewman in another corridor. Kirk and a security detachment, followed by Spock and McCoy, arrive at Kollos' door.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Where's Mister Scott?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The green light is gone and the lid is closing.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Scott is in the upper level control area.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ah, there, Marvick. So you couldn't resist a wee wager.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Miranda comes out, holding a visor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Has the Ambassador been hurt?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: No harm has come to the Ambassador, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who could have done such a thing?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Larry Marvick.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Larry Marvick? Why?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you know whether he saw the Medusan?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Yes, he did.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then insanity will surely be the result, Captain. Dangerous insanity.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: The controls are all yours, and the bottle of scotch'll be in your room this evening if you can handle 'em.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk to all ship personnel. Red Alert. An attempt was made to murder Ambassador Kollos. The murderer is dangerously insane. He is Lawrence Marvick. Be on the watch for him. Kirk out.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Scott tries to get Larry away from the controls, but is thrown off. There is a fight between the madman and three of Starfleet's finest. Insanity wins and the Enterprise is sent careering off her course.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain, Lieutenant Sulu.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I don't believe this myself, Captain, but we're travelling at warp factor eight point five.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And accelerating.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get engineering, Uhura.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They don't answer, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock goes to the Engineering station.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor nine and accelerating.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't you disengage power from there, Mister Spock?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Trying, Captain. Mister Chekov, your assistance, please.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I have engineering now.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put them on intercom.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: We mustn't sleep! They come in your dreams! That's the worst! They suffocate in your dreams! We're making it out of here!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security to engineering.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I'll go with you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I must. I can reach his mind.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: We'll be safe at the boundaries of the universe! We'll be safe!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kirk and three security men finally drag Marvick away from the controls, just as the ship hits the galactic boundary.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, where are we?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Beyond the boundaries of the galaxy. We made it. We're safe. We're safe, Captain Kirk.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Oh, no. No! No, Captain. We mustn't sleep. No! No! No, they come in your dreams. That's the worst. They suffocate in your dreams. No!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. All right.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: No.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll take you to a place to hide.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: No.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Come on. We must stay here with the controls. Ready to speed. Speed! Speed to the next galaxy. Miranda? Miranda, you're here. With me.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Yes, Larry. I'm here.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: I didn't lose you. Oh, my beautiful love, I thought I'd lost you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I am here, Larry. No. I can see what he sees. No, don't. Don't think of it!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Marvick
Text: Liar! Liar! Deceiver! You're not alone! You brought it with you. It's here. It's here. You brought it with you! Liar! Liar! Liar! (he tries to strangle Miranda) Don't love her! Don't love her! She'll kill you if you love her! I love you, Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Marvick collapses.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's dead, Jim.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5630.8. As a result of Larry Marvick's insane fears, the Enterprise lies derelict in uncharted space. We have no way to determine our position in relation to the galaxy. We are in a completely unknown void.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are we?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are evidently far outside our own galaxy, judging from the lack of traceable reference points. When we exceeded warp speed factor nine point five, we apparently entered a space-time continuum.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I have the autopsy report on Marvick. Heart action stopped, cause unknown. Respiration stopped, cause unknown. Brain activity stopped, cause. Shall I go on?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean he just simply died.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I mean he evidently could not live with what he saw.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or what he felt. Damage report, Scotty?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Scott
Text: We need some repairs, sir, but the ship is intact.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Position report, Mister Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible to calculate. We lack data to analyse. Our instruments appear to be functioning normally, but what they tell us makes no sense. Our records are clear up to the point at which we left our galaxy.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we should be able to navigate back.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, we lack reference points on which to plot a return course. We experienced extreme sensory distortion, and we shall do so again if we attempt to use warp speed. And we cannot re-cross the barrier using sub light speed.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: A madman got us into this, and it's beginning to look as if only a madman can get us out.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: An entertaining suggestion, Mister Chekov, but not very helpful.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; There is someone else aboard who might be able to help us navigate. The Medusans have developed interstellar navigation to a fine art. Could Kollos function despite the sensory distortion?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very possibly. The Medusan sensory system is radically different from ours. Perhaps for the purpose of this emergency I might become Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: A fusion. A mind-link to create a double entity. Each of us would enjoy the knowledge and sensory capabilities of both. We will function as one being.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hazards?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: If the link is successful there will be a tendency to lose separate identity. A necessary risk. Of course, Doctor Jones will not wish to give me permission to accomplish the mind-link.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't think she'll want anyone to intrude in the kind of rapport she has with Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Jones has shown reluctance every time I've asked to converse with Kollos. In some ways, she is still most human, Captain, particularly in the depth of her jealousy.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I could confine her to quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not sufficient. Her telepathic powers are formidable. If it is at all possible, her mind must be so engaged that no thought of what I am doing shall intrude.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think that could be arranged.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: It's a room with lots of flowers in bloom.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I may be sentimental, but this is my favourite place. Earth.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I've never been to Earth. What lovely flowers. May I touch them?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certainly.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: They have no scent.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try these.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: She sniffs at a rose, and pricks her finger.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me see. It's just a thorn. I was hoping to make you forget about this today.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: It doesn't hurt anymore.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mustn't blame yourself because Marvick loved you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I didn't want his love. I couldn't return it.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But someday, you will want human love and companionship.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Shall I tell you what human companionship means to me? A struggle, a defence against the emotions of others. At times, the emotions burst in on me. Hatred, desire, envy, pity. Pity is the worst of all. I agree with the Vulcans. Violent emotion is a kind of insanity.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock, visor in hand, is making his way along a corridor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you willing to spend the rest of your life with the Medusans in order to avoid human emotion?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Perhaps.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A meeting of minds is all very well, but what about love, Miranda? You're young, attractive and human. Sooner or later, no matter how beautiful their minds are, you're going to yearn for someone who looks like yourself, someone who isn't ugly.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Ugly. What is ugly? Who is to say whether Kollos is too ugly to bear or too beautiful to bear?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda, I meant no insult. Please. Here we are among the roses. A very romantic setting. I wish there were moonlight, too. Moonlight would suit you very well.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: He moves in for the usual kiss, but gets held off.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I see you're a very complicated man.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock enters Kollos' quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Kollos, no. You mustn't let him!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda, don't.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Let me go. You have no idea what a dangerous thing Spock is planning. We must stop him! Let me go!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: They leave together.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Miranda meets Spock coming out of Kollos' quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Enterprise is at stake. It is not possible for you to be involved.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Why? I've already committed myself to mind-link when Kollos and I reach the Medusan vessel. Why put yourself in jeopardy?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
