Text: This is not a duty that you can assume. I am aware of the fact that your telepathic competence might be superior to mine, but there's a more important factor. The object is to pilot this ship. That is something you cannot do.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Then teach me to operate the ship. I can memorise instantly.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now wait a minute. I realise that you can do almost anything a sighted person can do, but you can't pilot a starship.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm sorry, Miranda, but you must be realistic. You are blind, and there are some things you simply cannot do.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock touches the decorated over-dress she always wears.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently a highly sophisticated sensor web. My compliments to you, and to your dressmaker.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course. It's the only reasonable explanation. You can't see and Kollos can't hurt you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: An elegant solution. but I fail to understand why you apparently try to conceal your blindness, Doctor Jones.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think I understand. You said it. Pity is the worst of all.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Pity, which I hate. Do you think you can gather more information with your eyes than I can with my sensors? I could play tennis with you, Captain Kirk. I might even beat you. I am standing exactly one metre, four centimetres from the door. Can you judge distance that accurately? I can even tell you how fast your heart is beating.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, that won't be necessary. Mister Spock will make the mind-link. No other decision is possible.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: No. I won't let you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Please. Do not fight us like this, Doctor Jones. I appeal to you as a colleague. Do not oppose us.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: No.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If we can't persuade you, there is someone who can. You'll have to take this up with Kollos. For your own sake.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: She goes into Kollos' quarters.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, why hadn't you told me?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She would have told you herself if she had wanted you to know. I respect her privacy.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, there's a great deal to respect about that lady.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: There's a scream, then Miranda comes out of the room, calm and composed.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: It seems I have no choice but to obey you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplementary. Our one chance to return to our own galaxy is dependent upon the navigational skills of the Medusan ambassador. With that end in view, Kollos has been brought to the bridge and placed behind a protective shield.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kollos is by Spock's station, and Spock is wearing a visor. The lid opens, then Spock comes out from behind the shield and takes off the visor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is delightful. I know you. All of you. James Kirk, Captain and friend for many years. And Leonard McCoy, also of long acquaintance. And Uhura, whose name means freedom. She walks in beauty, like the night.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's not Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you surprised to find that I've read Byron, Doctor?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's Spock!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Am I addressing the Ambassador?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: In part. That is, part of us is known to you as Kollos. Ah, Miranda. There you are. O brave new world, that has such creatures in it.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: 'Tis new to thee.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: My world is next for us. Captain Kirk, I speak for all of us you call Medusans. I am sorry for the trouble I've brought to your ship.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't hold you to blame for what happened, and thank you now for your help.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: And now to the business at hand. With your permission, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Mister Sulu, release the helm to Mister Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Co-ordination is completed.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then go ahead, Mister Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Warp one in six seconds. Five, four, three, two, one, zero.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The engines come to life, and the Enterprise glides back through the barrier.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Position report, please, Mister Chekov.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Our position? Our position is so close to the point where we entered the void, the difference isn't worth mentioning. Bull's-eye, Mister Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Mister Chekov. Manoeuvre completed, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take over, Mister Sulu. Thank you, Ambassador. Mister Chekov, plot a new course.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The new headings will be plotted in a minute, sir.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: How compact your bodies are. And what a variety of senses you have. This thing you call language though, most remarkable. You depend on it for so very much. But is any one of you really its master? But most of all, the aloneness. You are so alone. You live out your lives in this shell of flesh. Self-contained, separate. How lonely you are. How terribly lonely.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ambassador, you must dissolve the link.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: So soon?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be no delay.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're a wise Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock goes back behind the shield and the lid opens. Then Sulu notices the visor still on the helm console.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock! Don't look! Cover your eyes!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock screams.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't move!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But, Jim.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No one is to move. Spock? Are you all right?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock backs away from Kollos, anguish all over his face.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Spock? It's all right. You're safe with us now.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock then attacks everyone within reach. Kirk manages to get the phaser from a fallen security guard and stun his first officer.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's hardly breathing. Help me get him to Sickbay.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Inside, Miranda is performing a sort of mind meld on the unconscious Spock. She has removed her sensor net dress.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unless Miranda can look down into his mind and turn it outward to us, we will lose Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Context: pacing
Text: Vulcan mind techniques. They seem so untrustworthy now that Spock's life is at stake.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Her knowledge of them may be the only thing that could save Spock's sanity, perhaps even his life.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But does she want to? She's been in there so long.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's nothing else to be done.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She tried to help Marvick. Marvick is dead.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's different. Marvick loved her.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Spock is her rival. Is that any better? Even Spock felt the violence of her jealousy.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But they weren't rivals in love. Jim, you shouldn't go in there.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever happens, Bones, don't interfere.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Who is it? Doctor McCoy? Who's there?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I have no news for you, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No change?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Only that his life processes are ebbing.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing about it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Why, what I can, of course.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which doesn't seem to be much.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: No doubt you think I can wake him with a kiss.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's worth a try, isn't it? After all, he's not a machine.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: But he is a Vulcan.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Only half. The other half is human. Far more human than you, apparently.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Face reality, Captain. His mind has gone down almost too far even for me to reach!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't reach him soon, he'll die. But that's what you want, isn't it?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: That's a lie!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh yes? You want him to die. What did you do to him on the Bridge? Did you make him forget to put the visor over his eyes?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: You're insane!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you know your rival, don't you? You couldn't keep him from making a mind-link with Kollos, something you couldn't do yourself! With my words, I'll make you hear such ugliness as Spock saw when he looked at Kollos with his naked eyes! The ugliness is within you!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: That's a lie! Liar!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your desire to see Kollos is madness! You can never see him. Never. But Spock saw Kollos, and for that he must die.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Sadistic, filthy liar!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The smell of hatred, the stench of jealousy permeates you. Why don't you strangle him while he lies there?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Don't say anymore, please!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kollos knows what's in your heart. You can lie to yourself, but you can't lie to Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Please go away!

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What'd you say to her?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe too much.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's she doing in there?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You may be right, Bones. Maybe I shouldn't have gone in. She was blind, really blind. Really in the dark. And if he dies. If he dies, how do I know that I didn't kill him? How do I know that she can stand to hear the truth?

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Now, Spock, this is to the death. Or to life for both of us.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: She touches his forehead, then we get distorted images of what Spock saw while he was insane. Finally he opens his eyes and connects with Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: The door opens, and Spock staggers in from the corridor.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You look like you've paid a visit to the devil himself.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kirk steps out into the corridor, but it is empty.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Kollos is on the transporter pad in his box. Miranda is wearing her sensor net again. Spock is advertising the IDIC again.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have what you wanted most.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I am one with Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I'm truly sorry that you're leaving. Goodbye.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: McCoy leaves.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: We come to the end of an eventful trip, Captain.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't think you'd even talk to me.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Well, I have you to thank for my future. Your words enabled me to see.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Miranda, good luck, Health. I have something for you.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: A red rose.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I suppose it has thorns.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I never met a rose that didn't.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Context: to Spock
Text: I know now the great joy you felt when you joined minds with Kollos.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: I rejoice in your knowledge and in your achievement.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: I understand, Mister Spock. The glory of creation is in its infinite diversity.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: And the ways our differences combine to create meaning and beauty.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Miranda gets on the transporter pad.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Miranda
Text: Peace and long life, Spock.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Spock
Text: Live long and prosper, Miranda.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Peace.

Title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
Context: Spock puts on the visor to beam Kollos and Miranda away. Kirk just watches, then leaves.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5121.5, orbiting the second planet in the Minarian star system. This star has long given evidence of entering a nova phase, and six months ago, a research station was established to make close-up studies of the star as its end approaches. Minara is now entering a critical period, and the Enterprise has been ordered to evacuate the station before the planet becomes uninhabitable. Yet our attempts to contact the station's personnel have been, so far, unsuccessful.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Dust. Apparently these instruments have not been recently used.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Record tape. Maybe it'll tell us something about the personnel that lived here.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, please.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here. What is it, Enterprise?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Our instruments have picked up a gigantic solar flare

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: With very high levels of cosmic rays accompanying it.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How bad?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: An enormous one.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Our sensors indicate the cosmic ray concentration measures three point five one on the Ritter scale. That'll play the very devil with the crew, as well as the ship.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: At that rate, it will take exactly seventy four point one solar hours for the storm to pass.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get that ship out of here. Stay at minimum distance for absolute safety.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir. We'll beam you up in

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Negative. We're staying here. The atmosphere will protect us.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get that ship out of here, Mister Scott.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Very well, sir. Scott out.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, what about that tape?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Remember, Captain, what we see on this tape happened approximately three months ago.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Linke
Text: I don't think I can stand another week in this godforsaken place.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Ozaba
Text: In his hand are the deep places of the earth. Psalm ninety five, verse four. Looks like he was listening.

Title: The Empath
Context: A piercing noise makes them cover their ears, then Ozaba vanishes.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Linke
Text: Who's out there?

Title: The Empath
Context: He vanishes too.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened to them?

Title: The Empath
Context: The same noise comes again.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where's does that sound coming from? Spock, can you pinpoint it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. It doesn't register.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock disappears, then McCoy.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones! Spock!

Title: The Empath
Context: He tries to leave, but falls back into the floor. Then he vanishes too leaving just a body print in the dust.

Title: The Empath
Context: The three awaken lying on the floor of a big, bare room. Blue floor, red walls.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Bones. Where are we?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly one two one point three two metres beneath the planet surface, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did we get here?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Residual energy readings indicate we were beamed here by a matter-energy scrambler, similar to our own transporter mechanism.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's a nasty cut, Jim. Does it hurt?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, picking up a life-form reading bearing four two mark seven.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of the missing scientists?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. Although humanoid, it is definitely not Homo Sapiens.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Identification?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible. I can make no exact identification other than it being humanoid.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find out. Phasers on stun.

Title: The Empath
Context: They start walking.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approaching the life-form, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Still undistinguishable.

Title: The Empath
Context: A light reveals a young woman lying on what might be a bed, which is itself on a stepped platform. McCoy moves towards her.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Be careful.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She seems harmless enough.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: The sand-bats of Manark Four appear to be inanimate rock crystals, Doctor, until they attack.

Title: The Empath
Context: She wakes, using big gestures, and mimes her fear of Kirk's phaser.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not going to hurt you. Is this your home? Do you live here? What about it, Spock? Analysis.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: From what we know of the specific gravity and other environmental factors of this planet, a life-form such as hers could not evolve here.

Title: The Empath
Context: They put their phasers away.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you responsible for bringing us here? Don't be afraid. Bones, what's wrong with her?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's a mute, Jim. No vocal cords, not even vestigals. And I don't think it's a pathological condition.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She appears to be perfectly healthy. As for the other, her lack of vocal cords could be physiologically normal for her species, whatever that is.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A race of mutes, like the civilisation on Gamma Vertis Four.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's my observation, for whatever it's worth.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Without speech, how's she going to be able to understand us? Unless she's a telepath.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: An unlikely possibility, Captain, since over ninety eight percent of the known telepathic species send thoughts as well as receive them. She's made no attempt to contact our minds.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We can't keep referring to her as she, as if she weren't here.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you have any ideas?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I don't know about you, but I'm going to call her Gem.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gem, Doctor?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's better than 'Hey, you.'

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I want to know why we're here. I want to know what's going on. And she knows.

Title: The Empath
Context: Two big-headed aliens in silver robes appear. First cousins to the Talos people, by the looks of them.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: We are aware of your identity, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? Why did you bring us here?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We are Vians. Do not interfere.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you intend to do with us?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Delay us no longer.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We come (moves forward and gets pushed back by a weapon) Since you already know who we are, you must also know that we come in peace. Our prime directive specifically prohibits us from any interference.)

Title: The Empath
Context: The Vians fire their weapons several times, and the landing party is caught in some sort of enery field. The Vians go to Gem

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't seem to stand up.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't fight the force field. There's something about it that upsets the body metabolism.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Not quite, Doctor. The field draws its energy from your bodies. The more you resist, the stronger the force field becomes. Sufficient.

Title: The Empath
Context: The Vians vanish, then the forcefield.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock there must be an exit other than the one we just saw.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Correct, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock goes off, scanning with his tricorder.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you feel all right, Jim?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't worry about me. They may have hurt her.

Title: The Empath
Context: Kirk takes her hands, she takes a deep breath and turns away.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did they hurt you?

Title: The Empath
Context: Then Gem turns back and touches the cut on Kirk's head. It disappears from him and appears on her forehead instead, then vanishes.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The pain is gone. She touched my head, and the pain is gone.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The wound is completely healed. It fits, Jim. She must be an empath. Her nervous system is so sensitive, highly responsive that she can actually feel our emotional and physical reactions. They become part of her.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock returns.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, in that direction, my tricorder is now picking up a substantial collection of objects.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Details.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Electronically sophisticated devices. I fail to understand why my tricorder previously gave no indication of them being out there.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well they're there now. Let's go check them out. (to Gem) Staying here alone could be dangerous. Come with us.

Title: The Empath
Context: The group comes to a collection of computer-like items, girder structures holding up nothing, glass tubes. Herein called 'the laboratory'

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look at this stuff.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones Spock, come here.

Title: The Empath
Context: He has found the scientists, preserved in perspex tubes, in the same positions that they vanished from the research lab.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, Spock.

Title: The Empath
Context: There are three empty tubes, with the away teams names on them..

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We are on schedule. Some further simple tests are necessary.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We've seen the results of some of your tests.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I found our missing men. Dead. Another one of your experiments?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: You're wrong. Their own imperfections killed them. They were not fit subjects. Come. Time is short.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Your time is running out. This sun is about to nova. When it does, it'll destroy you, this planet, and this insane torture chamber.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock neck-pinches the alien.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get out of here.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings indicate the passage to the surface lies in this direction.

Title: The Empath
Context: As they head off, Lal wakes up and watches them go. He is joined by the other alien.

Title: The Empath
Context: A strong wind is blowing as they emerge from a cave.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise, come in. Out of range. Readings, Mister Spock?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Research station six kilometres in that direction, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get there as fast as we can. If the Enterprise has a search party, it'll be there.

Title: The Empath
Context: The group run on. Gem isn't very good at running, and McCoy falls over a stone once.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock! Much further?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just ahead.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Hey, Jim, look. Scotty and a search party.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay there! Come on!

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We're coming!

Title: The Empath
Context: When Gem stumbles again, Kirk sees the aliens watching their progress. He sends her on ahead of him.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep going.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Their will to survive is great.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: They love life greatly to struggle so.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: The prime ingredient.

Title: The Empath
Context: Scott and the rescue team vanish.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where'd they go?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I believe they were never actually present, Doctor. It was a mirage.

Title: The Empath
Context: Gem gestures to them to go back with her.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where's Kirk?

Title: The Empath
Context: They find Kirk on the ground.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing here? Where's Scotty?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it was a mirage.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Captain Kirk! We have decided that one specimen will be sufficient. You will come with us.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the others?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We've no interest in them. They may go.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't go back there. You'll end up like the other two.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I request permission to be allowed

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Denied.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But, Captain

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You have your orders.

Title: The Empath
Context: McCoy, Spock and Gem vanish.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened to my men?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: They are safe.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One specimen, you said. One specimen! What happened to my men?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Indeed, the prime ingredient.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are they? Tell me! You said you'd let them go!

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu, will you give us an estimate of how much longer we'll have until those solar flares will subside?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir. Readings now indicate two point seven two one on the Ritter scale. At the present rate of decrease, we'll have to wait at least seventeen hours more before we can even attempt to enter orbit.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. Well, as long as we're stuck out here, we might as well relax until the storm passes.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The storm's already lasted four hours longer than we've anticipated. Do you suppose our landing party could be in any danger?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's not likely. The planet's atmosphere will give them ample protection. And if I know Captain Kirk, he'll be more worried about us than we are about him.

Title: The Empath
Context: Kirk is currently stripped and dangling from a couple of chains, crucifixion-style. He is suffering, and Gem is watching.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it you want to know?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We seek no information as you mean. Your civilisation is yet too immature to have knowledge valuable to us.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't need any knowledge from us, yet you're willing to kill for it. Is that what happened to Linke and Ozaba?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: We did not kill them. Their own fears killed them.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, what did you expect from them? And what do you want from me?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We've already observed the intensity of your passions and gauged your capacity to love others. Now we want you to reveal to us your courage and strength of will.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? What is it you hope to prove? If my death is to have any meaning, at least tell me what I'm dying for.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: If you live, you will have your answer.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Spock, the passageway was there before. It's got to be there.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I'm unable to lock in on the previous readings. I can find no exit out of here.

Title: The Empath
Context: A flash, Gem and a clothed but unconscious Kirk appear, along with the forcefield to restrain McCoy and Spock.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain! (Kirk wakes) Jim, what is it? What have they done to you?

Title: The Empath
Context: Gem starts to try to heal Kirk, but recoils at the pain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Help him. Don't be afraid to help him.

Title: The Empath
Context: She does, taking the pain from his shoulders and the wounds from his wrists. Gem collapses. The forcefield is gone.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. You lie still. I'll check her out right away.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will she live?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She seems fine now.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you explain what happened?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Complete empathy. She must be a totally functional empath. Her nervous system actually connected to yours to counteract the worst of your symptoms and with her strength, she virtually sustained your body's physiological reactions.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She weakened. I could feel it. Is her life in danger?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's impossible to say yet, but supplying your body with life support did drain her.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Her withdrawal seemed to suggest the fear of death, Doctor. Only your urging her on caused her to continue.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's true. Fear would naturally be her first reaction. Perhaps she doesn't know our captain well enough yet to offer up her life for him.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could the strain really have killed her?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh yes. However, I'd assume that her instinct for self-preservation would take over to prevent it. How do you feel?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm tired.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can you recall what happened, Captain?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I remember the laboratory, and they wanted to know something. But I, I can't remember.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take it easy.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter with me?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have all the symptoms of the bends. Nitrogen bubbles in your blood caused the pain. Now how would one get the bends down here?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'll have to ask the Vians. Will I live?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, you could use some time in a decompression chamber. But otherwise, I'd say your recovery is about miraculous. I wish I could take the credit for it, but she did the work.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I noted that a light preceded you at the moment you were returned here from the Vian's laboratory.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, why do you have to get so analytical at a time like

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, he's right. Continue.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I conclude such a light is an energy transfer point linking this device to the power source.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock refers to the hand device they took off Lal.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you tap into it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I can determine the frequency at which this device operates, I might be able to cause it to function for us.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And get us out of here the same way we were brought in.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would say so.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then I would say proceed.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: You are called Captain. You are responsible for the lives of your crew. Is this correct?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It is.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: We find it necessary to have the co-operation of one of your men in our efforts.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will not co-operate.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: When we resume our interrogations, you will decide which of your men we shall use. It is essential. There is an eighty seven percent chance that the doctor will die. And while Commander Spock's life is not in danger, the possibility is ninety three percent that he will suffer brain damage, resulting in permanent insanity.

Title: The Empath
Context: Later

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How's it coming, Spock?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not know, Captain. I'm beginning to understand its operating principles, but that is all.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, It won't be long before the Vians come back. You better find out how that thing works and soon.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take it easy, Bones.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Men weren't intended to live this far underground. It's just not natural.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And space travel is?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Some men spend the majority of their lives in mines beneath the surface.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm a doctor, not a coal miner.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've recorded my principles and theories on the tricorder, Doctor. Should the Vians return, there is sufficient data for you and the captain to complete the adjustments.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not a mechanic. I couldn't get that thing to work no matter how many notes you left.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly not, but you and the captain together will be able to do so.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In any case, Spock, you're the logical one to leave with the captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The decision's mine. If there are any decisions to be made, I'll make them. If and when it becomes necessary.

Title: The Empath
Context: Kirk appears to be in discomfort. McCoy prepares a hypo, and injects him.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't need any

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm still Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise. I'll tell you what you need and when you need it. Would you rather have the bends? That's it. Just lie down and relax.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: How long will he be asleep, Doctor?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Between the emotional strain and that attack of bends, he's in pretty bad shape.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm not criticizing your action, Doctor. On the contrary, I'm quite grateful for it. The captain will be spared the strain of making so difficult a decision. You have simplified the situation considerably.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: While the captain is asleep, I am in command. When the Vians return, I shall go with them.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean, if I hadn't given him that shot

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. The choice would have been the captain's. Now it is mine.

Title: The Empath
Context: McCoy turns away. Spock sits to carry on working. Gem puts her hand on Spock's shoulder, and smiles. McCoy comes up behind him and gives him an injection.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your action is highly unethical. My decision stands.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock falls asleep next to Kirk.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not this time, Spock.

Title: The Empath
Context: The Vians return.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The choice has been made. (to Gem) You stay here with my friends. They'll take care of you. Do you understand?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Come, then.

Title: The Empath
Context: McCoy puts down his bag and tricorder, then the three vanish.

Title: The Empath
Context: Now it is McCoy who is being crucified from the chains.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Doctor, please understand that if there was any other way to accomplish our purpose

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Get on with it.

Title: The Empath
Context: So they do.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why did you let him do it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was convinced in the same way you were, Captain. By the good doctor's hypo.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Hmm. A most unusual device. It is a control unit, but not a control mechanism. In fact, it is not a mechanical device.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What exactly is it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: This control is attuned to one electrical pattern of energy, the pattern produced by the mental impulses of the person who possesses it. It is activated solely by mental commands.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you adapt it, re-attune it to fit our brain pattern?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall attempt to do so. However, it is not possible to adjust the control to fit more than one pattern at a time. I am, of course, most familiar with my own pattern. Therefore, with your permission, I

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do whatever you have to to make it work, Spock. What disturbs me is why the Vians let us keep it.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. They must have known we were capable of comprehending this control and making use of it.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And that we would use it to escape.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: The only logical assumption is that they wish to let us go.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And they keep McCoy.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is evidently their intention, Captain.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to Gem
Text: Somehow, you're the crux, the focal point of all this. Even before we got here, she was a prisoner. They didn't hurt her, they didn't even threaten her.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, the facts would indicate that she's essential to their purpose.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, there is a purpose, but what is it? Has all the pain and terror happened, or been made to happen for you?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Completed, Captain. The adjustments are delicate. They may not survive more than even one use. However, there should be sufficient energy to transfer us to the Enterprise.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will it take us to McCoy?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you so desire.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The best defence is a strong offense, and I intend to start offending right now. Aim for the lab.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock, Kirk and Gem arrive at to find McCoy alone, still suspended from the chains. Gem is horrified.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Spock. Get him down. His wrists. (they lie him on a couch) His pulse is almost gone. How is he?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Severe heart damage. Signs of congestion in both lungs. Evidence of massive circulatory collapse.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't talk. Don't speak. Take it easy until we get you back to the ship. What is it? What's the matter?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's dying, Jim. We can make him comfortable, but that is all.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't know. You're not a doctor.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Internal injuries. Bleeding in the chest and abdomen. Haemorrhage of the spleen and liver. Seventy percent kidney failure.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's right, Jim. Being a doctor has its drawbacks. I always wondered why I (coughs, so they turn him on his side) Thanks.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: It could happen anytime.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The correct medical phrase, ay, Spock? You've got a a good bedside manner, Spock.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't we do something?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm afraid not.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gem might be able to help him, the way she helped me, but could his nearness to death also kill her?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Uncertain, Captain. Dr. McCoy's analysis of her reaction assumes that her instinct for self-preservation would prevent it. However, we cannot be positive.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If she could just strengthen him and keep him from sinking further into death, we might be able to save him.

Title: The Empath
Context: A forcefield stops them from getting to where Gem is crouching in fear

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: No interference will be permitted.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She can save his life. Let us help her to go to him.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: She must not be urged or forced to take action.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: All must proceed without interference.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: The purpose that brought us together

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What purpose can all this serve, except the fulfilment of some need of yours?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: We have but one need left in life, and that is to see the completion of the final moment of our test.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Be patient.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Patient? Our friend is dying.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Perhaps.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: What purpose can be served by the death of our friend, except to bring you pleasure? Surely beings as advanced as yourselves know that your star system will soon be extinct. Your sun will nova.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: We know.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you also know that the millions of inhabitants on its planets are doomed.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: That is why we are here.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This arena of death that you have devised for your pleasure. Will it prevent this catastrophe?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: No, it will not, but it may save Gem's planet. Of all the planets of Minara, we have the power to transport the inhabitants of only one to safety.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: If Gem's planet is the one that will be saved, we must make certain beyond any doubt whatsoever they are worthy of survival.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How will the death of our friend serve this purpose?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: His death will not serve it, but her willingness to give her life for him will. You were her teachers.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We were? What could she learn from us?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Your will to survive. Your love of life. Your passion to know. They are recorded in her being.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Her planet will be fortunate.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Each of you is willing to give his life for the others. We must now find out whether that instinct has been transmitted to Gem.

Title: The Empath
Context: A small earthquake shakes the room.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Time grows short.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were correct, Captain. Everything that has occurred here has been caused to happen by them. This has all been a great laboratory, and we have been the subjects of the test.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: No. We only created the circumstances. That was necessary.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Your actions were spontaneous. Everything that is truest and best in all species of beings has been revealed by you. Those are the qualities that make a civilisation worthy to survive.

Title: The Empath
Context: Gem goes and sits by McCoy.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: Behold. That is most significant. An instinct new to the essence of her being is generating.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Compassion for another is becoming part of her functioning life system.

Title: The Empath
Context: Gem moves her hands over McCoy, not quite touching him. His bruises and cuts heal, transferring to her before disappearing. She slumps, crying silently. Then she tries for the internal injuries, but falls away in agony.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: She is afraid.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: She's saving herself. She does not yet have the instinct to save her people.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: We have failed?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: No. No, not yet.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, Dr. McCoy's life is not solely dependent on Gem. The Vians too must be capable of saving his life.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Thann
Text: True.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you cannot let him die.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: His death is not important. We must wait to see whether her instinct for self-sacrifice has become stronger than her instinct for self-preservation.

Title: The Empath
Context: McCoy starts to wake. Gem returns to him.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't touch me. Stay away. Jim. Spock. Are you here?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Bones.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't let her touch me. She'll die. Jim, I can't destroy life, even if it's to save my own. I can't. You know that. I can't let you do it.

Title: The Empath
Context: McCoy pushes Gem away.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: The intensity of emotion is draining us and building up the force field.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: It draws its energy from us, Captain. In spite of what we see, all emotion must be suppressed. That might weaken the field.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll try.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock leaves the forcefield, but Kirk remains trapped.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Empath
Context: Spock takes the device from Thann, and Kirk is free too.) KIRK: Spock

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: You cannot use our powers to change what is happening.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You must save the life of our friend.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: No. We will not. Her instinct must be developed to the fullest. The test must be complete.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is complete. Gem has earned the right of survival for her planet. She offered her life.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: To offer is not proof enough.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If death is all you understand, here are four lives for you.

Title: The Empath
Context: Kirk returns the two devices.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will not leave our friend. You've lost the capacity to feel the emotions you brought Gem here to experience. You don't understand what it is to live. Love and compassion are dead in you. You're nothing but intellect.

Title: The Empath
Context: Lal goes over to McCoy and heals him, then picks up the unconscious Gem.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Lal
Text: Farewell.

Title: The Empath
Context: They recede into the darkness.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Strange.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is puzzling you, Captain?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not puzzled, Mister Spock. I am awed.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm with you, Captain. She awed me.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no. I wasn't thinking of Gem. I was thinking of that fantastic element of chance that out in limitless space we should come together with Gem.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the element of chance can virtually be eliminated by a civilisation as advanced as the Vians.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Not to dispute your computer, Mister Spock, but from little what you've told me, I would say she was a pearl of great price.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What, Scott?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Do you not know the story of the merchant? The merchant, who when he found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, she was all that. And whether the Vians bought her or found her makes little difference. She was of great value.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, personally, I find it fascinating that with all their scientific knowledge and advances, that it was good old-fashioned human emotion that they valued the most.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Scott
Text: Perhaps the Vulcans should hear about this.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, can you be prevailed upon to bring them the news?

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Spock
Text: Possibly, Captain. I shall certainly give the thought all the consideration it is due.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, ahead warp factor two.

Title: The Empath
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir. Warp factor two.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5693.2. The Enterprise is approaching the last reported position of the star ship Defiant, which vanished without trace three weeks ago. We are in unsurveyed territory.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: You could cut the tense atmosphere with a knife.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are registering very curious readings from all sensors.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Specify.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot. According to our instruments, space itself is literally breaking up. There is no known phenomenon which would account for these readings.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about sensor failure?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. I have run a complete check on all systems.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain. We're losing power in the warp engines.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How bad is it?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can barely read it, but I don't like the looks of it. And I cannot find out the cause.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain. Visual detection of an object dead ahead.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How about it, Spock?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is virtually no sensor contact. No mass analysis. No trace of radiation. We see it, but our sensors indicate it is not there.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: As they close in, the bright fuzzy thing on the screen becomes recognizable.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Defiant! Mister Sulu, impulse engines only. Close to transporter range.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, open up a hailing frequency.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've been trying to raise them, sir. There is no response.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Just within transporter range, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Maintain position. Mister Spock, Mister Chekov, come with me. Doctor McCoy, report to the transporter room immediately. Scotty, you have the conn.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The landing party are wearing silvery space suits.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: Locked in on the Defiant Bridge, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The crew are dead. One man is in the act of strangling another.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Has there ever been a mutiny on a starship before?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Absolutely no record of such an occurrence, Ensign.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. The Captain's neck is broken.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The ship is still functioning, Captain. It is logical to assume the mutineers are somewhere aboard.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Use the ship's sensors to locate them. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to beam over a full security squad on my orders.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, Captain.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there is no sign of life aboard this vessel.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Odd, Mister Spock. Very odd. Spock, you stay here with me. Chekov, get down to Engineering and life support systems. Doctor McCoy, check out the Sickbay. Kirk to Enterprise. Cancel the security squad and stand by for further instructions.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, Captain. Standing by.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't get an accurate fix on the Defiant, Mister Scott, but I know it's drifting away from us. Shall I correct for range, sir?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, I think you're right. Keep us within beaming range, but not too close.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The crew in Engineering are dead, so is everyone in Sickbay. The patients were strapped down onto the beds.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Just like what I found in life support. All dead.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get back up here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Chekov has a dizzy spell, and totters out of Engineering.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to McCoy.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, can you tell me what they all died of?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd say these people killed each other.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They what?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You heard correctly, Jim. These people killed each other.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could mental disease have infected all of the crew?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: According to the ship's log, the medical surgeon down here didn't even know what was going on.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The best I can do is get all the readings I can get and analyse them later.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: McCoy kneels beside a slightly fuzzy crewman lying on the floor, and reaches out to touch him. His hand passes through the body.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What the devil?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what is it?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what is it? Answer me!

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: McCoy's hand passes through a PADD and a desk.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Answer me!

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, this ship is dissolving. My hand just passed through a man

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And a table.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get up here on the double.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: On the viewscreen, the fuzzy Defiant disappears and reappears several times.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Scott, the Defiant. It's starting to disappear.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge to transporter room.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: Transporter room, O'Neil here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: You got that transporter working yet, Mister?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: O'Neil
Text: No, sir. Not yet.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Take over, Mister Sulu. I'll be in the transporter room.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the Defiant's sensors correspond with an extremely high degree of correlation to those of the Enterprise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean what happened to the Defiant might be happening to the Enterprise?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, stand by to beam us back.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't, sir. At least, not all at once.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not? What's happened?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Everything. That ship you're in is fading out, and it's ripping the innards out of this one.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's jamming our transporter frequencies. I've only got three of them working, and I'm not sure of those. One of you has got to wait.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, McCoy, prepare for transportation. You, too, Spock.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Request permission to remain, Captain. I could be completing the data.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Request denied.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there is a chance

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know what the chances are. Mister Spock, don't argue. Get back with the information. I'll be right there. Scotty, energise transporter.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: It takes two goes and a lot of switch flicking to beam the three onto the Enterprise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Nothing happens. Chekov switches on the wall monitor.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's gone. The Defiant just vanished.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Scott and O'Neil start fiddling with the innards of the transporter console.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Anything?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's it. I've done all I can. There's nothing out there to grab a hold of and bring in. When that ship went, it must have taken the Captain with it.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Computer
Text: Computer working.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Compute the next period of spatial interphase.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Computer
Text: Next interphase two hours twelve minutes.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Two hours and twelve minutes? That power leak has unbalanced the ship and she's starting to drift. I can't hold her in place that long.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: We must try, Mister Scott. The fabric of space is very weak here. If we disturb it, there will be no chance of retrieving the Captain alive.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't understand what's so special about this region of space.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, picture it this way, Mister Chekov. We exist in a universe which co-exists with a multitude of others in the same physical space. At certain brief periods of time, an area of their space overlaps an area of ours. That is a time of interphase, during which we can connect with the Defiant's universe.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock? We will be able to retrieve the Captain at that time, won't we?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. However, the dimensional structure of each universe is totally dissimilar. Any use of power disturbs it. If we are not extremely careful, we shall lose the Captain and become trapped ourselves.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I see.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And die like him?

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Chekov leaps up, pushes Spock away and, screaming, attacks Sulu. Scott grabs him and McCoy arrives to help. Spock grabs his face.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Chekov! Chekov!

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Spock neck-pinches him into silence.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Security guards to the Bridge.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened, Mister Spock?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: I was attempting to explain to Mister Chekov the nature of our problems in this situation when he attacked.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did anyone notice anything peculiar in his behaviour before this?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I think he had several spasms of pain.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did he seem to be getting hysterical?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Doctor, he seemed more angry than frightened.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: He had no cause to be angry.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Security arrive.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Take Mister Chekov to Sickbay. Put him under restraint.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Scott and the security guards leave with Chekov.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura is correct. There was murderous fury in Chekov. The same fury which was evident in the Defiant.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's what I was afraid of. Whatever it was that drove the crew of the Defiant to murder each other could be communicable.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is there anything you need to isolate the cause?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Time. By the way, Mister Spock, I think it might be a wise precaution to put some distance between us and the Defiant.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: If we are to recover the Captain, we must not move.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How long will that take?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Approximately two hours before the attempt can be made.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, are you sure that Jim is still alive?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Captain was caught in our transporter beam when the Defiant phased out. It is possible he was spared the shock of transition and survived. However, if we are to recover him, we must catch him at the precise moment during the next interphase, or he will die. And there can be no margin for error. His environmental unit can provide breathable air for no more than three point six two hours.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock. A vessel approaching on an intercept vector.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Status, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Range two hundred thousand kilometres. Velocity zero point five one C.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: An arrow-head shaped ship has arrived.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, signal Red Alert.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. Red Alert. All decks, go to Red Alert.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They've stopped dead, sir. Range ninety thousand kilometres and holding.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock? I'm receiving a visual signal.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Transfer to main viewer.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: A strange, garish orange figure with triangular eyes (possibly) appears against a blue and pink tie-die background.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Loskene
Text: I am Commander Loskene. You are trespassing in a territorial annex of the Tholian Assembly. You must leave this area immediately.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock, in command of the Federation star ship Enterprise. Commander, according to the Federation, this area is free space.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Loskene
Text: We claim this territory and are prepared to use force, if necessary, to protect our property.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are not interested in your display of force. The Enterprise is responding to a distress signal from one of our ships and is currently engaged in rescue operations. Do you wish to assist us?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Loskene
Text: I find no evidence of a disabled ship. My instruments indicate ours are the only two vessels in this area.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The other ship is interspatially trapped. It should reappear in one hour and fifty three minutes. We request you stand by until then.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Loskene
Text: Very well, Enterprise. In the interest of interstellar amity, we will wait precisely one hour and fifty three minutes. But be correct. We do not tolerate deceit.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: A bench full of bottles, and red stuff dribbling through curvy pipes.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If we could only find the proper filtering agent, we might be able to solve this problem. Negative. It's the third failure.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The lab assistant is starting to go like Chekov.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse, take this sample and run an analysis on it.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to transporter room.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Transporter room here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready for interphase in twenty seconds.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Chapel turns to see the lab assistant about to strike McCoy with a metal bar.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Doctor McCoy!

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The two men struggle, while Chapel prepares a hypo and knocks the attacker out.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you, nurse. Call security. I want to have some checks run on this man.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lock on to Captain Kirk's co-ordinates

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: And prepare to bring him aboard, Mister Scott.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The transporter activates, but nothing happens.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bring him aboard, Mister Scott.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm trying. Captain Kirk is not on his designated co-ordinates, Mister Spock.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Well, keep trying, Mister Scott.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Sulu, evaluation.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sensor readings are not corresponding to those we received the last time we saw the Defiant.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: It's possible the Tholian entry into the area has disturbed the space, and if that has occurred

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Bridge.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Has the Captain been beamed aboard yet?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Doctor.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: When is that interphase going to happen?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Theoretically it already has happened, Doctor.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: However, the ship's sensors are not responding as predicted.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I thought you had the thing timed out.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: I did, Doctor. The space was disturbed by the Tholians.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean you don't know whether you're going to be able to recover the Captain or not?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not at this interphase.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall have to recalculate to determine when the next interphase will occur. They do not take place at regular intervals.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You can't wait for the next one. We've had another case like Chekov.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I had to confine my orderly to sickbay.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have confidence that you will soon isolate the cause, Doctor, and prevent further spread of the affliction.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The disease is not transmitted by the men, Mister Spock. The cause is the area of space we're in. It's affecting the whole crew.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The molecular structure of the brain tissues in the central nervous system are distorting.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And the madness that affected the Defiant's crew will soon happen to the Enterprise.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now you've got to get this ship out of here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock, we're being fired upon.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The ship shakes to the impact of the blasts of energy.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The renowned Tholian punctuality.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock, damage control report. Minor structural damage to sections A4 and C13.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineering, hold power steady and cut off all unnecessary expenditures. Mister Sulu, divert all but emergency maintenance power to the shields.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But sir, that'll reduce our phaser power by fifty percent.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock!

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Another bolt of energy is heading towards them.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Bridge!

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: I know you don't like to use the phasers, but you've got to do something about that ship out there.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: McCoy enters.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood. Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel to the Tholian ship. Mister Sulu, lock in phaser tracking controls.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Phasers locked in, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There's no response on any frequency, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's the use of this battle, Spock? You've lost Jim. Take this ship out of here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ready, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready, Mister Spock.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fire.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: A hit, Mister Spock.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Engineering, status report. Mister Scott?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: Spock, that hit from the Tholians has fused our power supply converters.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't do a thing with the Enterprise now.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: She's bound to drift, maybe right through that doorway out there.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Can you estimate minimum time required for repair?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't even know if she can be repaired.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you satisfied? Spock, why did you do it?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The decision to fight was logical. Lack of time prevented any other course of action. The Tholian ship had to be disabled.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You should've known what could've happened and done everything in your power to safeguard your crew. That is the mark of a starship Captain, like Jim.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, I hardly believe this is the time for comparisons. Please go to your laboratory and search for an antidote to the effects of this space. That is your primary task, since we must remain here.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: McCoy leaves.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Mister Spock, something has just entered sensor range. It's another Tholian, sir. Loskene must've contacted them when he tried to intercept us.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shall I lock in remaining phaser power, sir?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. Lieutenant Uhura, can you open a channel to the approaching vessel?

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: They're refusing reception. I can't

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Distance, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Just beyond phaser range, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What is that?

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: The two Tholian ships have joined stern to stern, and are now moving apart, drawing a thread of some sort out between them. Then they come back across the viewscreen creating two more lines.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, I shall run an analysis on those filaments. Tie in all sensors to the ship's library computer console. Switch scanners.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Five horizontal lines on the viewscreen.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's no analogy to this structure in Federation technology. It is, however, an energy field, and if the Tholians are successful in completing this structure before we have completed our repairs, we shall not see home again.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Now the Tholians are adding diagonal lines to the web.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: Spock stands on a raised platform, behind a lectern. Crew and officers are filing in.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, your last report on an antidote on the effects of this space was negative.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's still negative, Mister Spock. Theragen is the most promising substance tested so far. We're progressing.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: The urgency requires your personal attention in the laboratory.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My staff is working around the clock. My being there will not affect the biochemistry of any of the tests. This service requires my personal attention, Mister Spock.

Title: The Tholian Web
Context: He sits next to Scott.

Title: The Tholian Web
Speaker: Spock
Text: A few hours ago, the Captain elected to remain on board the Defiant so that three members of this crew would have the best chance of returning safely to the Enterprise. His concern was not only for them, but for all the members of the crew of this ship. You all know the sequence of events. We were fired upon by the Tholian ship.
