Context: spotting shelves of discs) Captain. Intelligence files. Their banks contain the total knowledge of the Fabrini, ready for the people to consult when they arrive at their destination. (scans them
Text: And they seem to have amassed a great deal of medical knowledge.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Context: McCoy is on the biobed. Chapel gives him an injection at Spock's signal.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Excellent, Doctor. The white corpuscle count is back to normal.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Context: McCoy groans.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your haemoglobin count is back to normal, Doctor, which indicates that the flow of oxygen to each cell of your body is back up to its abundantly energetic level.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock, for bringing back the knowledge of the Fabrini.

Title: For The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, the Fabrini descendants are scheduled to debark on their promised planet in approximately three hundred and ninety days. I think that we could manage to be in that vicinity at that time, if you wanted to thank the Fabrini personally.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kirk, McCoy, Chekov and a security guard have beamed down to a planet with a green sky and occasional outcrops of vertical rocks. Their phasers are drawn.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Full scan. Results negative. Radiation level normal. Atmosphere and terrain are undisturbed. No evidence of a colony nor any residual aftereffect of a force that might have annihilated it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Life readings, Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing. They said they were being attacked by an unidentified ship.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Which we were unable to detect upon approach.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An entire human colony, a whole settlement. One hundred men, women and children. Who did it? And why? (communicator beep) Kirk here.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors have picked up a Klingon ship, closing fast.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflectors on. Condition Red. Protect yourselves.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Total reply if attacked. So that's the answer. Klingons.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Trouble aboard the Klingon ship. Evidence of explosions, massive destruction.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Five furious Klingons beam down.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the enemy ship is drifting, totally disabled.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: And we never fired upon her.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maintain Red Alert.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The Klingons arrive, and their leader hits Kirk with his disruptor, knocking him down.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: You attacked my ship! Four hundred of my crew dead. Kirk, my ship is disabled. I claim yours. You are now prisoners of the Klingon Empire against which you have committed a wanton act of war!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: And a weird swirl of light hangs in the air a little way away. The Federation landing party are disarmed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: For three years, the Federation and the Klingon Empire have been at peace. A treaty we have honoured to the letter.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We took no action against your ship, Kang.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Were the screams of my crew imaginary? What were your orders, Kirk? To start a war? You've succeeded. To test a new weapon? We shall be happy to examine it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There was a Federation colony on this planet. It was destroyed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: By what? No bodies, no ruins. A colony of the invisible?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, a test of a new Klingon weapon, leaving no traces. Federation ships don't specialise in sneak attacks.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: We have wondered when you would begin. You lured my ship into ambush by a false Klingon distress call. You will tell us why with the proper persuasion.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You received a distress call? We received a distress call.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: I don't propose to spend the rest of my life on this ball of dust arguing your fantasies. The Enterprise is mine! Instruct your transporter room to beam us aboard.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go to the devil.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: We have no devil, Kirk. But we understand the habits of yours. I shall torture you to death one by one until your noble captain cries enough. Who will be first?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Cossacks! Filthy Klingon murderers! You killed my brother Piotre. The Archanis Four research outpost. A hundred peaceful people massacred! Just like you did here. My brother, you killed my brother.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: And you volunteer to join him. That is loyalty.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: A Klingon places an agoniser on Chekov's face, and he screams. Kirk is held back.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov! Stop the torture!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you can't hand over the Enterprise.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help Chekov.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Don't plan any tricks, Kirk. I will kill one hundred hostages at the first sign of treachery.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll beam you aboard the Enterprise. Once there, no tricks.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang gives him a communicator.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, you can't. Don't let these animals have the ship.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Move aside. (he tends to Chekov)

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Animals? Your captain crawls like one. A Klingon would never have surrendered. Order everybody in this area to be transported up. All weapons on him.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Spock.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Here, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, we have guests. Adjust transporter to wide field. Beam up everyone in the target area. (and presses a button)

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: An amber light flashes by the Captain's chair.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood, Captain. Transporter room.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The group is beamed up, and the weird light follows.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Just the four Federation people materialise on the pads.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full security, Johnson, on the double.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The security guard runs off, Spock enters.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good work, Spock.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What happened?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our landing party is intact, Doctor.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: All others suspended in transit. Who are the guests, by the way?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Klingons.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, they're right in here.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Johnson?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: Security on the way, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, leave them where they are. Non-existence. That's so many less Klingon monsters in the galaxy.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Two more security guards arrive.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring them in.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The Klingons materialise, and are quickly disarmed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: Move 'em out. Move!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Liar!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said no tricks after we reach the ship. You're a prisoner of the Federation of Planets against which you may or may not have committed an act of war.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: There are still survivors aboard my ship.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we've not been able to get through to Starfleet Command. All subspace frequencies have been blocked, and there's too much radiation coming from that Klingon ship. It's a hazard to the vicinity.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to destruct.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Completing the job you started?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You wouldn't be standing here if I had.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: First group from the Klingon vessel, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Six Klingons including two women materialise. They are hustled away except one.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: My wife, Mara, and my science officer.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Kang, what has happened?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: More Federation treachery. We are prisoners.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: What will they do to us? I've heard of their atrocities, their death camps. They will torture us for our scientific and military information.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apparently you have a few things to learn about us. Detain them in the crew lounge. Programme the food synthesiser to accommodate our guests. You'll be well-treated, Kang.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: So I have seen.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang and Mara are led away.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure from Red Alert.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light hides as Kirk and Spock leave the transporter room

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But maintain general quarters. Scan this sector for other ships. Run a full check on the colony. I want this thing nailed down fast.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We know what happened. That distress call.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: At the moment we received the distress signal from the colony on Beta Twelve A, the Klingons were too far distant to have been the attackers. Moreover, they also were apparently attracted by a distress call.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Lies. They want to start a war by pretending that we did.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Chekov may be right. The Klingons claim to have honoured the truce, but there have been incidents, raids on our outposts.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No proof that Klingons committed it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What proof do we need? We know what a Klingon is.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Leaves the turbolift.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our log tapes will indicate our innocence in the present situation.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Unfortunately, there's no guarantee that they will be believed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Still no contact with Starfleet Command, sir. Outside communications blanketed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep trying. We've got a diplomatic tiger by the tail.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Transporter room to Bridge. Klingon ship is vacated, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good, Scotty. Mister Sulu?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Forward phasers locked and ready to fire, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire phasers.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The Klingon ship is vapourised.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensor sweeps reveal no other ships within range, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No contact with Starfleet as yet, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, change course to seventeen mark four, warp factor three.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Warp factor three, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: When I take this ship, I'll have Kirk's head stuffed and hung on his cabin wall.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: They will kill us before we can act.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: No, they wish to question us, learn our strength, our plans. They never will.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: We are forty against four hundred.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Four thousand throats may be cut in one night by a running man.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Patience. Vigilance. They will make a mistake. Capture of the Enterprise will give us knowledge to end this war quickly.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light from the planet is up near the ceiling.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Context: losing her temper
Text: Captain! This doesn't make sense. Carriers are normal. Channels are open. There's still no outside contact! I don't understand it, sir. Could the Klingons be doing something?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Then the ship shudders as if from an explosion, and changes course.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Change in course. Accelerating. Helm dead. Auxiliary navigation dead.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Override.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Nothing responds, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, stop all engines.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: I would if I could, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: The controls have gone crazy. Something's taken over.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: The engines, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: They've gone to warp nine, by themselves!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: New course?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Nine oh two mark five.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That'll take us out of the galaxy.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, reports coming in from the lower decks. Emergency bulkheads have closed. Almost four hundred crewmen are trapped down there, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Most interesting. The bulk of your crew trapped, your ship racing from this galaxy at wild speeds. Delightful. How did I perform this sabotage, Kirk? All my men are here.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Johnson. Get down to Security. Search every section. Some Klingons may have beamed aboard undetected from the wrecked ship. Then get down to Engineering and help Scotty hammer things back to normal. And free those trapped crewmen. (to Kang) And before I put you in the brig, there's a little something I owe you.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: He punches Kang. A solitaire set on a table changes into a short sword which Kang picks up. A potted plant and 3D chess set become swords.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: But they turn into swords too. There's a stunned pause then a brief fight as the Starfleet group get out of the room.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Bald Klingon
Text: Stand and fight, you cowards.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Another brief skirmish and Johnson gets stabbed. They make it into the turbolift.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The security men carry their comrade out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Klingons are free. They're armed as we are. They'll try to take the ship. Scotty, how many men do we have?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Three hundred and ninety two trapped below decks.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deploy forces to protect your section and the auxiliary control centre.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check the armoury, and try and free those trapped crewmen.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: The doors and bulkheads won't budge. We'll have to cut through.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Blow out the bulkheads if you have to. We need numbers. What kind of luck have you had controlling the ship's speed?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. She's a projectile at warp nine. And don't ask me what's holding her together.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Five-minute report. Kirk out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Full sensor scan of the ship. Report on any movement by the Klingons. The Klingon Empire has maintained a duelling tradition. They think they can beat us with swords.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, neither the Klingon technology nor ours, is capable of this. The instantaneous transmutation of matter. I doubt that they are responsible.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any other logical candidate?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: None. However, if they had such power, would they not have used it to create more effective weapons and only for themselves?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu. Get below. Take command of Engineering and auxiliary control.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Sulu leaves.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain. (he has a sword too)

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain! (gets up to go with Sulu)

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, as you were. Chekov!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, let me go too. I've got a personal score to settle with the Klingons.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is no time for a vendetta. Maintain your post.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, maintain your post!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Don't try to stop me, Captain. I saw what they left of Piotre, and I swore on his grave I would avenge his murder.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Chekov dashes into the turbolift.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What's Chekov's grudge against the Klingons? Who's Piotre?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: His only brother, killed in a Klingon raid.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: His brother? He never had a brother. He's an only child.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, get down to Engineering.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Sulu leaves

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, this is the captain. Find Mister Chekov and bring him to the bridge.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, why would, why would Chekov believe he has a brother?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know, but he does. And now he wants revenge for a non-existent loss.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: McCoy finishes bandaging Johnson.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There. Those filthy butchers. There are rules, even in war. You don't keep hacking at a man after he's down. Hand me that numanol capsule.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: There's a man with a head wound in another bed, and a security guard is brought in too.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The Klingons access ship's schematics on a desk monitor

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Klingon
Text: Layout and specifications of the Enterprise, Commander.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Enemy numbers are the same as ours. We have a fighting balance.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Then we take the ship.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Klingon
Text: A ship that is headed towards the end of the galaxy?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: In time, in time. We must take these sections. First, Engineering.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir. There's no use trying to free those men down below. The phaser torches, they won't cut through the bulkheads, nor the doors, nor the decks. There's something happened to the metal.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the armoury?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm there now, sir, and you never saw such a fine collection of antiques in your life.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: We pull back to see racks of swords, billhooks, pikes.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get back to Engineering. Try to re-establish engine control, and talk to ordnance about manufacturing phaser replacements.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. (spots a special sword amongst the ordinary ones.) A Claymore. You're a beauty.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What the blazes is going on?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Scans indicate that our forces and those of the Klingons are exactly equal at thirty eight each. The Klingons control deck six and starboard deck seven, while we control all sections above.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Constant surveillance, Mister Spock.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most curious, Captain. There appear to be more life-energy units on board than can be accounted for by the presence of the Enterprise crew plus the Klingons. A considerable discrepancy.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could more Klingons have beamed aboard?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall attempt a compensatory reading of Klingon units.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Inside Engineering, the weird light seems to be bigger. Scott climbs up an access ladder to the corridor.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Any signs of those devils, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All clear, Mister Scott.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Scott is talking to some engineers when they are jumped by Klingons. He backs out into the corridor where Sulu karate chops Scott's attacker.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: They've taken Engineering. I don't know how many more of those Klingons are around, but we'll split up here and try to make it back to the bridge.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang and Mara come in to receive the praise of their crew.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: All
Text: Victory! Victory!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: No additional Klingons detected, Captain. It is an alien life force, a single entity. I cannot ascertain its location.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An alien life force. We must make contact, find out what it wants.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Readings being diverted to the library computer for analysis. Computer report.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Computer
Text: Alien life force onboard is composed of pure energy. Type unknown. Actions indicate intelligence and purpose.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: What purpose?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Computer
Text: Insufficient data for further analysis.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A brother that never existed, a phantom colony, imaginary distress calls, the creation of these weapons. Do you sense a pattern, Mister Spock?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: If the alien is creating these events, Captain, it is apparently capable of manipulating matter and mind.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And now it has control of the Enterprise and taking us out of the galaxy. But why?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I am constrained to point out that since minds are evidently being influenced, we cannot know at this moment whether our own memories are completely accurate and true.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must talk to Kang, bury the hatchet.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: An appropriate choice of terms. However, it is notoriously difficult to arrange a truce with the Klingons once blood has been drawn.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Truce? Are you serious? I've got men in Sickbay, some of them dying. Atrocities committed on their persons, and you talk about making peace with these fiends? If our backs were turned, they'd jump us in a minute. And you know what Klingons do to prisoners. Slave labour, death planets, experiments!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: While you're talking, they're planning attacks. This is a fight to the death. We'd better start trying to win it!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are attempting to end it, Doctor. By reason, preferably. There is an alien on board which may have created this situation.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who cares what started it, Mister Spock. We're in it! Murderers. We should wipe out every one of them!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The alien is the real threat. That's the enemy we have to wipe out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sickbay calling, Doctor. There are more wounded men requiring your attention.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How many more men must die before you two begin to act like military men instead of fools? (leaves)

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The intercom whistles.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: This is Kang.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kang, there's something important I must discuss with you.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: I have captured your engineering section. I now control this ship's power and life-support systems.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: I have deprived all areas except our own. You will die of suffocation in the icy cold of space.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The power has gone off.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Context: dictating into PADD
Text: The Enterprise is heading out of our galaxy, controlled by a mysterious alien somewhere aboard the ship. Engineering has been taken over by Klingons who have cut off life-support systems. Mister Sulu.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get down to emergency manual control. Try to protect our life-support circuits and auxiliary power.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Sulu leaves as Scott arrives.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sir. Chekov was right, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, I'm glad you've come.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: We should have left those fuzz-faced goons in the transporter. That's right where they belong!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Non-existence! Now they can study the Enterprise, add our technology to theirs, change the balance of power. You've jeopardised the Federation!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, take it easy.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Easy, Mister Scott.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Keep your Vulcan hands off me. Just keep away! Your feelings might be hurt, you green-blooded half-breed!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I say that I have not thoroughly enjoyed serving with humans? I find their illogic and foolish emotions a constant irritant.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then transfer out, freak!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen! (intervenes as they nearly come to blows.) Spock! Scotty. Spock. Spock! Stop it! You're half human! What are we saying? What are we doing to each other?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. The result of stress?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've been under stress before. It's never set us at each other's throats.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: But this is war.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There isn't any war! Or is there?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Have we forgotten how to defend ourselves?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty. What's happening to us? We've been trained to think in other terms than war. We've been trained to fight its causes, if necessary. Then why are we behaving like a group of savages? Look at me. Look at me. Two forces aboard this ship, each of them equally armed. Has a war been staged for us, complete with weapons and ideology and patriotic drum beating? Even, Spock, even race hatred?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Recent events would seem to be directed toward a magnification of the basic hostilities between humans and Klingons. Apparently, it is by design that we fight. We seem to be pawns.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But what's the game? And whose? And what are the rules?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is most urgent that we locate the alien entity immediately, and determine its motives and a method for halting its activities.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Without sensors? All our power down? This thing could go anywhere.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Mister Sulu, report.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No good, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Circuits are in, but systems just aren't responding.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Then the lights come back on.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're getting something.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, Captain. Power and life-support restored. Remotes on standby.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good work.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: But, Captain, I didn't do it. Everything just came on by itself.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Their life-support systems have resumed.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors may be operating.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Start scanning. Let's find that alien.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Holding steady.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Cause them to be unsteady.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: They appear to be controlled from another location. Also unable to affect ship's course for return to our empire.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: One of Kirk's tricks. Could he bypass this circuit? What power is it that supports our battle yet starves our victory? Power. Interrupt it at their main life-support couplings. Where?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Number six deck. (to Klingon) Come.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Alien detected in the engineering section, near reactor number three.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kirk and Spock, armed with swords, leave the bridge.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light hides as Chekov comes along. He hides, then kills the Klingon and takes Mara prisoner.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You don't die yet. You're not human, but you're very beautiful. Very beautiful.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: He rips her top, covers her mouth and I'll leave his intentions to your imaginations. Kirk comes along in the nick of time.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: He hauls him off Mara and slaps him twice, knocking him out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Jim, he's not responsible.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have I done? (to Mara) There's an alien entity aboard the ship. It's forcing us to fight. We don't want to. We don't know what its motive is. We're trying to find out. You must help us. Take me to Kang. A temporary truce, that's all I ask. Spock, take her.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Spock and Mara leave

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov. Chekov. (picks him up) Is this what's in store for us, from here on in? Violence, hatred.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: It's very busy. Kirk carries in Chekov, followed by Spock and Mara.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Brain waves show almost paranoid mania. What happened?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He lost control. So did I. We're becoming animal warriors. Let's go, Spock.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Orderly. Jim. Johnson's heart wound is almost healed. Same with the other casualties. Sword wounds in the vital organs, massive trauma, shock. They're all healing at a fantastic rate.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would appear that the entity wants us alive.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? So we can fight, and fight, and keep coming back for more like some bloody coliseum? What's next, the roar of crowds?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps human and Klingon psychologies and combat capabilities are being tested by an alien with designs on both powers.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Gentlemen, if we are pawns, you're looking at one who is extremely sorry.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: I understand, Doctor. I, too, felt a brief surge of racial bigotry. Most distasteful.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find the alien. (to Mara) You come with us. Maybe we can prove to you that it exists.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light is up ahead of them and glowing red.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Totally unfamiliar.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want? What are you doing here?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: Reporting for duty, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Duty? Did McCoy release you from Sickbay?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: I released myself.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then get back to Sickbay!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: Not on your life, sir. I'm fit and ready for action. The Klingons almost did me in once. I'm out to even the score.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I order you

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Johnson
Text: I've got my orders. I'm obeying orders! Kill the Klingons! It's them or us, isn't it?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Johnson!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: They cross swords, but Spock neck-pinches Johnson.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The light becomes yellow.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. During Lieutenant Johnson's emotional outburst, his expression of hatred and lust for vengeance, the alien's life energy level increased. When the Lieutenant became unconscious, the alien lost energy.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It subsists on the emotions of others.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: This one appears to be strengthened by mental irradiations of hostility, violent intentions.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It exists on the hate of others.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: To put it simply. And it has acted as a catalyst, creating this situation in order to satisfy that need. It has brought together opposing forces, provided crude instruments in an effort to promote the most violent mode of conflict.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And kept numbers and resources balanced, so that it can maintain a constant state of violence. It's got to have a vulnerable area. We've got to get rid of it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then all hostile attitudes on board must be eliminated. The fighting must end and soon.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or we're a doomed ship, travelling forever between galaxies, filled with eternal bloodlust, eternal warfare. Kang has got to listen. We've got to pool our knowledge and get rid of this thing. (goes to intercom) Kang. Kang, this is Captain Kirk.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kang, do you read me?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Commander, it's a trick!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kang. (switches off intercom) He won't answer.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: The alien is affecting his mind, Captain. Soon, it will become so powerful that none of us will be able to resist it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: The ship's dilithium crystals are deteriorating. We can't stop the process.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time factor?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: In twelve minutes, we'll be totally without engine power.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, do whatever you can. Kirk out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light floats off through a bulkhead

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And so we drift in space, with only hatred and bloodshed aboard. Now do you believe?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate Armageddon. We must find a way to defeat the alien force of hate that has taken over the Enterprise. Stop the war now, or spend eternity in futile bloody violence.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's no change, Captain. The dilithium crystals are discharging.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's nothing we can do about it.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I could talk to Kang, somehow cut through the Klingon lines, make peace before it's too late.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have nine minutes, fifty three seconds to power zero.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is, of course, a logical alternative. Kang's wife is, after all, our prisoner. Perhaps a threat.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. Now that's something the Klingons would understand.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kang! Kang, this is Captain Kirk.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know you can hear me, so don't cut me off. We have Mara, your wife. We talk truce now, or she dies. Reply.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She has five seconds to live. Reply.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: She is a victim of war, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: She understands.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He called my bluff.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: You're not going

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Federation doesn't kill or mistreat its prisoners. You've been listening to propaganda, fables. How much time?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eight minutes, forty two seconds.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: So this was no trick?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's the alien that's done this. We're in its power, our people and yours.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We only wanted to stop the fighting to save us all.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: We have always fought. We must. We are hunters, Captain, tracking and taking what we need. There are poor planets in the Klingon systems, we must push outward if we are to survive.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's another way to survive. Mutual trust and help.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: I will help you now.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: I will take you to Kang. I will add my voice to yours.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: I wouldn't trust her, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't get through the Klingon defences in time, unless. Spock. Intra-ship beaming from one section to another. It's possible?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has rarely been done because of the danger involved. Pinpoint accuracy is required. If the transportee should materialise inside a solid object, a deck or wall.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: Even if it could work, she may be leading you into a trap.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're all in a trap. This is the only way out.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: We'll go with you.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. That'd start the final battle. I believe her. Prepare the transporter. We'll wait for your signal.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kirk and Mara leave.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Scott
Text: But she can't guarantee that Kang will stop to listen, right, Mister Spock?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: No one can guarantee the actions of another.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your automatic setting is laid in, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: When transporter is energised, you will have eight seconds to get to the pads.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope your computations are correct, Mister Spock.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll know in seven point nine seconds, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: They dash to the pads, then Kirk returns to the console to leave his cutlass behind.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kirk and Mara beam in.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Mara, you're alive, and you bring us a prize.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Kang, wait. He's come alone, unarmed. He must talk to you.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Brave captain, what about?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: No! Listen to him. We are all in danger.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The weird light is glowing blood red.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mara. Before you start killing, give me one minute.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang swings his sword at Kirk's head, and Mara intervenes.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Kang, don't!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: What have they done to you, Mara? Are you out of your mind? What have they done to you? (sees the torn tunic) I see why the human beast did not kill you.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: They didn't harm me. Listen to him.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang pushes her aside, so she throws Kirk a sword. The two leaders have an old-fashioned sword fight.) Stop! Stop, please

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: With your death, we win.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nobody wins. Have any more of your men died? We can't be killed. There's an alien aboard. It wants us alive.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: No doubt you will reassemble after I have hacked you to bits!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: You fool.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: A contingent of Federation including McCoy and Spock take on the rest of the Klingons in the corridor. Spock cheats with his neck-pinch. Finally Kirk gets the point of his sword at Kang's throat.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Look! Look, Kang. For the rest of our lives. A thousand lifetimes. Senseless violence, fighting, while an alien has total control over us.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kirk throws away his sword.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. All right. In the heart. In the head. I won't stay dead. Next time I'll do the same to you. I'll kill you. And it goes on, the good old game of war, pawn against pawn! Stopping the bad guys. While somewhere, something sits back and laughs and starts it all over again.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Let's jump him.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: Those who hate and fight must stop themselves, Doctor. Otherwise, it is not stopped.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mara
Text: Kang, I am your wife. I'm a Klingon. Would I lie for them? Listen to Kirk. He is telling the truth.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Be a pawn, be a toy, be a good soldier that never questions orders.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: Kang looks at the weird light, then throws down his sword.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Klingons kill for their own purposes.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: All fighting must end, Captain, to weaken the alien before our dilithium crystals are gone.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Captain?

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put me on ship-wide intercom.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kang.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Ready, Captain.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain Kirk. A truce is ordered. The fighting is over. Lay down your weapons.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: This is Kang. Cease hostilities. Disarm.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: The fighting stops. The weird light turns orange.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Spock
Text: The cessation of violence appears to have weakened it, Captain. I suggest that good spirits might make an effective weapon.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get off my ship. You're a dead duck here. You're powerless. We know about you, and we don't want to play. Maybe there are others like you around. Maybe you've caused a lot of suffering, a lot of history, but that's all over. We'll be on guard now, ready for you. So ship out! Come on! Haul it!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yeah, out already.

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Speaker: Kang
Text: Out! We need no urging to hate humans. But for the present, only a fool fights in a burning house. Out!

Title: The Day Of The Dove
Context: To the sound of laughter, the weird light turns to white and leaves the Enterprise

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5784.2. We are responding to desperate distress calls from an unknown planet. My science officer Mister Spock is unable to account for this, since he reported no signs of life on the planet. It is rich in kironide deposits, a very rare and long-lasting source of great power.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk, Spock and McCoy have beamed down into a place of Greek columns and plenty of marble.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Context: echoy voice and a huge shadow on the wall
Text: Are you from the spaceship Enterprise?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's right.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: The huge shadow is an optical illusion. The person who walks in is a dwarf with a normal voice.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Alexander, at your service. I sing, I dance, I play all variety of games, and I'm a good loser, a very good loser. Please, sir, try to bear that in mind. Now, would you please accompany me?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are the inhabitants of this planet?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Oh, Platonians. I'm sure you've never heard of us. Our native star is Sahndara. Millennia ago, just before it went nova, we managed to escape. Our leader liked Plato's ideas Plato, Platonius. See? In fact, our present philosopher-king, Parmen, sometimes calls us Plato's children, although we sometimes think of ourselves more as Plato's stepchildren. Excuse me. Someone's waiting for you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: He stiffens, and scurries off backwards as if dragged by an invisible leash. The landing party follow.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: A man is lying on a couch.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Welcome to our republic. Whom among you is the physician?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I am. What's the problem?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: My spouse. His leg. Come this way.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, what happened to that leg?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: I suppose I scratched it.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't understand. This should have been attended to immediately.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Sheer ignorance. Is there anything you can do?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, we're certainly going to try. The infection is massive. Let me give you a hypo to ease the pain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy opens a pouch, and the hypo flies out on it's own.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Where?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In the arm.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: The injection is given without human hand.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Philana, they came to help. They deserve better than to die.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: His hand is stuffed into his mouth.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Alexander, you talk too much.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5784.3. Doctor McCoy is endeavouring to treat the leader of a strange group of people. When their planet novaed, millennia ago, they transported themselves to Earth in the time of Socrates and Plato. After the death of the Greek civilisation they idolised, they came to this planet and created for themselves a utopia patterned after it.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: What is it? What is your prognosis, Doctor?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll let you know when I have the results. And from now on, it would be better if I handled the instruments without your help.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I can't understand why a simple cut like that could become so serious.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Neither do I, but it has. How do I knock out an infection when the tricorder doesn't show any information on Platonius bacteria? All I can do, and this is going to take time, is to try to match his bugs with a known strain and hope.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander is playing a near life-size game like chess with two other men.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Your Pan is in jeopardy.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Eraclitus
Context: moving an Urn by thought
Text: It isn't now. I win.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Dioniyde
Text: Well played, Eraclitus.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Eraclitus
Text: I thank you, Dioniyde.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: They leave.) KIRK: This psychokinetic power of yours, how long have you had it

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Two and a half. Ever since our arrival here on Platonius.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: How is the power transmitted?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Brain waves.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do these waves cease while you are asleep?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: No, not if they're embedded in the unconscious.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What about medicine? Why no doctors?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: We haven't had any pressing need for the medical arts. You see, while still on Sahndara, we instituted a mass eugenics programme. We're the result. Pared down to a population of thirty eight, we're perfect for our utopia. We're bred for contemplation and self-reliance. And longevity. How old would you say I am? Don't be afraid. I'm not vain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thirty five.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: That old? I stopped aging at thirty. Well, anyway, you're off by two thousand years. I'm two thousand three hundred years old. We were married very young. I was only a hundred and seventeen, and he was a hundred and twenty eight. So you see, we scarcely have to move anymore, let alone work.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's why you have no resistance?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: That's right. A break in the skin or a cut can be fatal.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: A column falls over and breaks. The 'chess' pieces start flying around the room.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. I believe we're experiencing the psychokinetic manifestations of Parmen's delirium.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Even the Enterprise is rocking.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Captain Kirk.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we're in the midst of a storm.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: No discernible cause, and I've never seen anything like it. There's

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ten scale turbulence right now. Emergency gyros and stabilisers at maximum.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: If this keeps up, Captain, we can't last!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engines at full speed. Get her out of orbit and into space.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've tried that, sir. She's locked tight.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then there's nothing you can do but batten down and weather.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Right, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Parmen's mind is not (something flies past them very fast) Watch it! He's not only throwing around furniture, he's tearing up the Enterprise as well. Bones, knock him out fast.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy tries to give the injection, but gets flung away by Parmen's mind. Alexander gets jerked around too.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Help! Save me!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alexander. Stand behind me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk takes psychic punches.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: His mind will find me anyhow. Don't save him. Let him die. The others will kill each other trying to take his place.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hurry up with that shot!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Now, Doctor!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy is able to give the injection.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Context: apparently throttling himself
Text: I can't breathe. I'm choking.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones! Shake him. Break his concentration.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Parmen passes out, and relaxes. Alexander can breath again.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott on the Enterprise.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's all right, Captain. The turbulence has abated.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. I think you'll find the orbit lock is broken as well. Assess damage and repair whatever is necessary.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: I don't know how I can ever thank you, not only for Platonius, but for myself.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No thanks is necessary.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Alexander, show our guests to the south wing.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, thank you, we must return to the ship.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think I'd better wait until the fever breaks.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, in that case, we'll stay.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Anything you want, Just ask me. Anything.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Alexander.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Think nothing of it. You saved my life. I think I should tell you that

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me what?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Well, just that I never knew any people like you existed.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is everyone?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: They're all in chambers, meditating.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alexander, are there other Platonians like you?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: What do you mean, like me?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who don't have the psychokinetic ability.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: I thought you were talking about my size, because they make fun of me for my size. But, to answer your question, I'm the only one without it. I was brought here as the court buffoon. That's why I'm everybody's slave and I have to be ten places at once, and I never do anything right.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: How does one obtain the power?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: As far as I know it just comes to you sometime after you're born. They say I'm a throwback, and I am, and so are you. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't worry about it. We're happy without it.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: You know, I believe you are. Listen, where you come from, are there a lot of people without the power and my size?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alexander, where I come from, size, shape, or colour makes no difference, and nobody has the power.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Nobody? Somebody wants me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: And whirling round, he is dragged out of the room by that invisible leash of someone's mind.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it will be very gratifying to leave here.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That might not be easy should Parmen die.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Even if he shouldn't.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. This utopia of theirs is one of the best-kept secret in the galaxy. Screening themselves from our sensors, locking us into orbit. All this adds up to a pattern.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy enters, happy.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, my concoction actually worked. The fever's broken. And what recuperative powers. The infection's begun to drain already.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy, you may yet cure the common cold.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If ever there was a time to get out of here, it is now. Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty, come in.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to beam us up.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm afraid I can't do that, sir. Everything's frozen.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The turbulence hit you that hard?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's not the turbulence, sir. Damage to the ship is minimal.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What caused it?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know, sir, and those are the facts.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you get up into space?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: No, sir. The orbit's locked tighter than ever.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Scott
Text: And subspace communication with Starfleet, it's completely severed.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Scotty. I'll handle it down here. Stand by.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander is entertaining his master by singing whist playing a lyre.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Great Pan sounds his horn. Marking time to the rhyme with his hoof, with his hoof. Forward, forward in our plan. We proceed as we began.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk enters. Alexander sings in Greek from Aristophanes' The Frogs.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Pronounced bre-ke-ke-kex, ko-ax, ko-ax. Thanks, Larry.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your Excellency.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Parmen will do. Philosopher kings have no need of titles.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I would like to know why the ship's instrumentation and weaponry is frozen, and why the Enterprise is locked in orbit.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Captain, please. You are mistaken, I assure you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Parmen, I've talked to the engineer aboard the ship. We've showed our good faith. Now you show yours. I want this ship released immediately.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: The amenities, Captain. Allow me to remind you that I am the head of this principality. Guests do not come barging in here, making demands and issuing orders.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk's phaser flies into Parmen's hand.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Guests? You don't know the meaning of the word. Guests aren't treated like common prisoners.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Do not take that tone with me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk is forced to slap his own face repeatedly.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Acknowledge. Acknowledge. Enterprise, come in. Enterprise. I can't raise them.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Obviously Parmen does not wish any contact made with the Enterprise.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He may still need the ship's medical stores. Why prevent contact?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: To shut out any knowledge of his brutal treatment of a Starfleet captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Mister Spock. One thing for certain. Parmen is not concerned with my dignity or safety.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed, Captain. And Parmen wouldn't have treated you so brutally if he had any intention of releasing you or the Enterprise.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy suddenly stands up stiffly and moves towards the door.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where are you going?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know. I don't want to go, but I can't help myself.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk and Spock also move as if pulled along by something.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander sounds a horn as the door opens and the unwilling three stagger in.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Gentle spacemen, we are eternally in your debt. We've some trifles for you. Please accept them as tokens of our gratitude. They stem from the very source of our inspiration. To our noble captain, the shield carried by Pericles, as a symbol of gallant leadership.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: The round shield flies to Kirk's arms.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: To our silent and cerebral Mister Spock, this kithara to pluck music, to soothe his ever-active brow.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: It too flies to him.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: And lastly, to the physician Doctor McCoy, who saved Platonius and my spouse, this ancient collection of Greek cures, penned by Hippocrates himself.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: A scroll wings it's way to McCoy.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Has the Enterprise been released yet?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Captain, wait. I know what you're thinking. My humble apologies. You were badly used. In my own defence, allow me to say that my illness was more profoundly disturbing that I myself realised. I am sure that you, too, have been out of sorts and have been driven to fits of temper and rage. Unlike you, however, what I think and feel, whether for good or ill, is instantly translated into reality. So please, find it in your heart to forgive me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certainly. Has the Enterprise been released yet?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: It will be shortly.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then good day, and thank you for the presents.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Not at all. But there is one final request. After my nearly fatal infection, it has become obvious to us all that we cannot afford to be without a skilled physician. Therefore we should like you, Doctor McCoy, to remain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm very sorry, but that's impossible.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Your duties will be extraordinarily light. You'll be free to read, meditate, conduct research, whatever you like. You'll want for nothing.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The answer is no.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: We should like to keep it cordial, but we are determined to have you stay, Doctor.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy saved your life.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: I am losing patience, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you consider yourself a disciple of Plato?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: We manage to live in peace and harmony.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Whose harmony? Yours? Plato wanted truth and beauty, and above all, justice.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: My dear Mister Spock, I admit that circumstances have forced us to make a few adaptations of Plato, but ours is the most democratic society conceivable. Anyone can, at any moment, be or do anything he wishes, even to becoming ruler of Platonius if his mind is strong enough.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if his mind isn't strong enough, he gets torn apart like Alexander.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Oh, come now. We are not children. In your culture, justice is the will of the stronger. It is forced upon people by means of weapons and fleets of spaceships. Our justice is the will of the stronger mind, and I for one, consider it a vast improvement.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't use our weapons for the kind of brutality you practice.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Farewell, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come on, Doctor. McCoy.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can't move, Jim. They're going to keep me here no matter what. Leave, please.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. You're the doctor. They don't want to force you. They need your goodwill. They're trying

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Captain, go while you still can.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're not leaving until McCoy is released.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Why even discuss it? Get rid of them.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: No, my dear. That might offend the good doctor. You wish to stay? By all means. You can help us celebrate our anniversary. In the process, I hope we can persuade you to join our tiny republic.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You won't persuade me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: I think we will.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Tweedledee, he's Tweedledum.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Two spacemen marching to a drum.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk + Spock

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: On their knees again.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're not staying, McCoy. No matter what he tries to

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Prostrate on the floor.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Being your slave, what should I do but tend upon the hours and times of your desire? I have no precious time at all to spend, nor services to do, till you

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop it! Don't do this to him, Parmen!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: McCoy. No matter what he makes me say or do, the answer's no.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, Parmen! Stop it!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Well, Doctor?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I have my orders.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: As you wish, Doctor.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this your utopia, your grand vision of the future? You don't even (screams)

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: We've had enough or your moralising.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And we've had too much of yours. I'll never get me to stay here.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: You will be happy to stay. It takes a little time, Doctor, but you will be happy to stay.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Spock is forced to dance close to Kirk's head. Flamenco-style, I think, ending with a boot directly over Kirk's face. Then Spock is allowed to rest, and he starts to laugh heartily. He crawls over to Alexander, who cannot help but join in.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's a Vulcan. You can't force emotion out of him.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: You must be joking, Doctor.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You'll destroy him.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: We can't let him die laughing, can we?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I beg you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. Spock. Don't let them break you. Hold on. Don't

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Parmen, they saved your life. I'm ashamed to be a Platonian. Ashamed!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: How can you let this go on?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you do anything for him?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There is no medicine that can help him. He'll have to come through this himself.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: I trust they did not injure you too much, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My muscles are sore, that's all.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: The humiliation must have been most difficult for you to bear. I can understand.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The release of emotions, Mister Spock, is what keeps us healthy. Emotionally healthy, that is.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: That may be, Doctor. However, I have noted that the healthy release of emotion is frequently very unhealthy for those closest to you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which just goes to prove that there's no such thing as a perfect solution.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: So it would seem. Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Spock.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you still feel anger toward Parmen?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Great anger.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: And you, Doctor?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Spock. And hatred.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you must release it, gentlemen, as I must master mine. I might have seriously injured you, Captain, even killed you. They have evoked such great hatred in me, I cannot allow it to go further. I must master it. I must control.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Spock breaks a goblet with one hand.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. This is senseless. I've thought it over. I'm staying.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Parmen has promised me you'll be safe.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Promised? Parmen? He'd let us beam up to the Enterprise, and plunge the ship back into the atmosphere.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why? Why trick me?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Because, if he killed us outright in front of you, you'd retaliate. You're a doctor. You have the means. Bones, I know you're trying to do the right thing, but if any one of us escaped, Parmen knows Starfleet would never let this planet go unpunished. Sacrifice yourself by agreeing to stay, and you sign our death warrant.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: He's right. I should have warned you. They were treating you the same way they treat me. Just like me, only you fight them. All the time, I thought it was me, my mind that couldn't move a pebble. They even told I was lucky they bothered keep me around at all, and I believed them. The arms and legs of everybody's whim. Look down, don't meet their eyes. Smile. Smile. These great people, they were gods to me. But you showed me what they really are. And now I know, don't you see. It's not me, it's not my size, it's them! It's them! It's them!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander breaks an urn and takes a sharp shard of pottery.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it down.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: No. This is the best thing for them.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it down. Do what I say.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: I'm going to cut their I'm going to cut them. Parmen first, and they'll all get infected. But this time, listen, whatever they say, don't save them. Let them die.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give it to me!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: At least let me give them a taste of what they gave me. Please, they're going to kill you anyway. You know that.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In that case, what's the point in you dying too, Alexander? Give it to me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: That's the first time anybody ever thought of my life before his own. I should have told you when you first came here that they were going to kill you. Because I knew, but I was afraid. I was afraid.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's all right. It's all right, Alexander. Listen, we haven't given up, and there may be something you can do to help.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Anything I can do to help, you just tell me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Did the Platonians always have this power?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: No, not until we came to this planet.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Alexander, it is possible for you to recall how long after you arrived here that that power began to develop?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: How could I forget that? It was exactly six months and fourteen days after we got here that they started pushing me around.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: And would you know how many months' supplies you brought with you?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Well, four, I think. Or three.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's close enough, Alexander. Fascinating. Their power developed two or three months after they started eating the native foods.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: That's right.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then it is logical to assume that there is a connection between the psychokinetic power and the eating of the native foods.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then why wouldn't Alexander have the same power as the others?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps his system cannot absorb the crucial element.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, I think it'd be a good idea if you took a reading of Alexander's blood.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Not that I'm afraid or anything, but will it hurt much?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You won't even know it happened.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You still have a tricorder reading of Parmen's blood, don't you?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course. Parmen possesses the highest order of psychokinetic ability, and Alexander the lowest, in the same environmental conditions.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: The probabilities are that Alexander was born with some biochemical deficiency relative to Platonius.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll run both their blood samples through for a full comparative test on the tricorder.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
