Speaker: Kirk
Text: And if our theory works out, we've got a weapon.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The one significant difference between Parmen's blood and Alexander's is a concentration of kironide, broken down by pituitary hormone.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kironide. It's a high-energy source. That could be it.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: The pituitary hormones confirm the hypothesis. They also regulate body growth.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Oh. You mean the same thing that kept me from having the power made me a dwarf?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. It's also obvious why Parmen kept this little utopia secret. Anyone coming down here and remaining long enough would acquire the power.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly. McCoy, there must be a quick way of building up a concentration of kironide in our blood.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It'll take some doing, but it is possible.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are we waiting for?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy takes a couple of ampoules from his bag, then hesitates.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it, Bones?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Even if the kironide reaches the desired effect, it still may not help us get out of here.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. There are thirty eight of them.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: The point is well taken. However, the psychokinetic power is not additive. If it were, considering the Platonians' hostile propensities, two or three of them would have combined forces centuries ago and deposed Parmen.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: He's right. Do you know, Parmen says each has his own separate power frequency, because before when they've tried to combine their powers, and use them together, it never worked.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm ready.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's not any waste time. Give us double the concentration in Parmen's bloodstream.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: McCoy injects Kirk and Spock.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: The time factor concerns me. It may take days or even weeks before there's enough build up from the kironide to be of any benefit to us.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. What about Alexander?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Since the kironide's broken down and injected directly into his bloodstream, it should work on him as well as us. Better in fact, because he's acclimated.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Oh, no. Not after what they've done to me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not? You could conceivably take Parmen's place and run the whole planet.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: You think that's what I want? Become one of them? Become my own enemy? Just lie around like a big blob of nothing and have things done for me? I want to move around for myself. If I'm going to laugh or cry, I want do it for myself. You can keep your precious power. All I ask is one thing. If you do make it out of here, take me with you. Just drop me any place they never heard of kironide or Platonius.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alexander.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Two figures beam in.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nurse. Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: The women try to speak, but no sound comes. Then they turn and leave the room.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I guess we weren't sufficiently entertaining.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Uhura and Chapel are dressed in long robes. Kirk and Spock enter in short tunics wearing laurel wreaths.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Are we ever glad to see you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Uhura
Text: We were forced in the transporter and beamed down. It was like becoming someone's puppet.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I thought I was sleepwalking. I couldn't stop myself. Captain, what is it? What's going on?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, do you feel any effect of the kironide shot?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have experienced a slight flush, Captain.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So did l. Let's try a simple test. Concentrate on raising this plate of fruit. Nothing.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Shutters draw back to reveal their audience, the Platonians and McCoy.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Fellow academicians. Twenty five hundred years ago, a band of hearty vagabonds arrived on this barren, rough-hewn planet. There was a desperate hardship of backbreaking toil. And then a divine providence graced our genius and our dedication with the power of powers. And through it, our every need instantly materialised. We thereupon determined to form a utopian brotherhood. This night is indeed a festive occasion, for tonight, we welcome into that brotherhood its first new member.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not yet, Parmen. You have to convince the doctor first.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: They'll never do it, Jim.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Doctor, please. You have destroyed the festive mood of the ladies. We must recapture it at once. I know. What would be better than a serenade from the laughing spaceman?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Spock, Uhura and Chapel are dragged over to a couch. Alexander plucks his lyre.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Context: singing
Text: Take care, young ladies, and value your wine. Be watchful of young men in their velvet prime.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Deeply they'll swallow from your finest kegs. Then swiftly be gone leaving bitter dregs. Ah, bitter dregs.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Narrator
Text: With smiling words and tender touch. Man offers little and asks for so much"

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Narrator
Text: He loves in the breathless excitement of night, then leaves with your treasure in cold morning light. Ah, in cold morning light"

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: And now let the revels begin.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: The four toys are paired up, and the furniture moves around. Chapel and Spock on one couch, Kirk and Uhura on the other. The men swap, then return.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Dioniyde
Text: Oh, how faithless and fickle.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Eraclitus
Text: Make up your minds.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I'm so ashamed. Please make them stop.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have tried.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Please, please make them stop.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: I haven't the power. I'm deeply sorry. We've failed you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Chapel
Text: For so long I've wanted to be close to you. Now all I want to crawl away and die.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Finally they are forced to kiss.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Dioniyde
Text: Careful, Mister Spock. Too much love is dangerous.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Eraclitus
Text: Remember, Cupid's arrow kills Vulcans. (general laughter)

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Uhura
Context: in Kirk's arms
Text: I'm so frightened, Captain. I'm so very frightened.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the way they want you to feel. It makes them think that they're alive.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I know it, but I wish I could stop trembling.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try not to think of them. Try.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm thinking. I'm thinking of all the times on the Enterprise when I was scared to death and I would see you so busy at your commands. And I would hear your voice from all the parts of the ship and my fears would fade. And now they are making me tremble. But I'm not afraid. I am not afraid.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: As the camera closes in, Uhura's head is turned to obscure our view - and the lips don't quite touch.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Parmen, let's get on with it.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: You are so impatient, my wife. Observe the doctor and learn. He's quite content to wait for the piece de resistance.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: A table with a whip and other weapons slides across. Kirk and Spock approach it. Kirk takes the whip, Spock the red-hot poker. Just as they get to the women, Kirk turns.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're half dead, all of you! You've been dead for centuries. We may disappear tomorrow, but at least we're living now, and you can't stand that, can you? You're half crazy because there's nothing inside. Nothing. And you have to torture us to convince yourselves you're superior.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Kirk cracks the whip in front of Uhura's face. Alexander creeps away.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Stop it, Parmen! Stop it! I'll do whatever you want me to do. I'll stay and serve you, but stop it!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: Parmen.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander is frozen in the act of trying to stab Parmen.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Alexander again. He likes to play with knives. Very well, we shall indulge him.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander struggles not to stab himself, when suddenly he is released.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Who did that?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Context: throwing down the whip.
Text: I did.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Eraclitus
Text: Impossible!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: Quite possible and logical.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Spock throws away the poker.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Dioniyde
Text: What is this?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Philana
Text: What's going on?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Platonians, listen to me. The next one of you that tries any trick will get hurt. Not only do we have your psychokinetic abilities, but at twice your power level.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Not twice mine!

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Parmen controls Alexander and sends him to attack Kirk, but Kirk sends him back. To and fro he turns until finally the dagger is inches from Parmen's body.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Captain, no! Captain! I beg of you, I'll do anything you say. I do not wish to die. Captain, do you hear me?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Don't stop me. Let me finish him off.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you want to be like him?

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Context: Alexander puts down the knife by his own choice. Parmen is dragged out of his seat.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Alexander
Text: Parmen, listen to me. I could have had your power, but I didn't want it. I could have had your place right now, but the sight of you and your Academicians sickens me. Despite your brains, you're the most contemptible things that ever lived in this universe.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Captain, you knew that I intended to destroy both you and the Enterprise, yet you spared me.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: To us, killing is murder, even for revenge. But there will be other starships.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: There's no need for concern. They'll be safe. Of late, I have begun to think that we've become bizarre and unproductive. We are existing merely to nourish our own power. It's time for some fresh air. We shall welcome your interstellar visits.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't believe you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would be highly uncharacteristic. We must expect, Parmen, that the moment we leave here, your fear would be gone and you would again be as sadistic and as arrogant as your twenty five hundred years have made you.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just remember, we can recreate that power in a matter of hours, so don't try anything.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Parmen
Text: Understood, Captain. And you're right, none of us can be trusted. Uncontrolled, power will turn even saints into savages, and we can all be counted upon to live down to our lowest impulses.

Title: Plato's Stepchildren
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're very good at making speeches, Parmen. Just make sure that this one sinks in. Now move aside. Alexander. Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott, prepare to beam us up. I have a little surprise for you. I'm bringing a visitor aboard.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log, stardate 5710.5. Lieutenant Commander Scott reporting. While exploring an outer quadrant of the galaxy, the Enterprise received distress calls from an apparently uninhabited, incredibly beautiful city on the planet of Scalos. Captain Kirk and a landing party have beamed down to investigate.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: A blue background of extraordinary architecture, and a humanoid statue.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do your sensors read?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: They register something, sir, but I'm blessed if I can figure out what it is.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Specify.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't get a fix on it. Sensors don't pinpoint a location. We may have a malfunction. I'm about to check circuits, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You do that. Lieutenant Uhura, does the location of the distress call correspond with this area

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Exactly?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. I am still receiving visual contact. I can see them, but I can't see you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: The viewscreen has five people standing in an area with the same architecture behind them.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check co-ordinates. Is it the same area?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Co-ordinates correspond, Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, apart from the landing party, there's no one here. There are no Scalosians.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The distress call is very strong, Captain. They are pleading for immediate assistance.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check circuits for malfunctions. Kirk out.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It must be a malfunction. This is a barren world. There's hardly any vegetation, no apparent animal life.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When we've run analysis, we should have some explanation. (waves away a buzz) But there is an insect life.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My tricorder doesn't register it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It registers in my ears. Nothing, Mister Spock?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently a civilisation of high order, rating number seven on the industrial scale. Humanoid in appearance, according to the paintings. An abundance of literature, which I shall have translated and processed. Certain structures hold evidence of recent occupancy while others are apparently long abandoned.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No sign of present life?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Instrument readings indicate life-form, but of a highly unusual and intermittent nature. They have no discernible form or location. A most puzzling phenomenon, Captain. I shall have to study it further.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something was here. We saw them on the screen. Lieutenant Uhura is still getting a distress call. What happened?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown at present, Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I want you to run a survey, a complete survey of the planet using all ship's available instruments.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: McCoy turns to hear a buzz then his assistant disappears.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Compton!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MCCOY; I was looking at him. I was looking right at him, and he. And he just wasn't there!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, start a replay of the distress call. Scotty, are the transporter controls functioning now?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Is Mister Spock still down there?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, he's in Sickbay. Doctor McCoy is running a check on the landing party. What is it, Lieutenant?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Malfunction, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, I would like

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. It corrected itself.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, there's some trouble on the hangar deck. The controls are frozen.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have repair crews been assigned?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The tape is ready, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Play it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Spock enters as the viewscreen displays Scalos and that statue.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: To any and all space travellers passing within range of the planet Scalos, I send you an urgent appeal for help. My comrades and I are the last surviving members of what was once a thriving civilisation. Those of us who are left have taken shelter in this area. We have no explanation for what has been happening to us. Our number is now five. We were once a nation of nine hundred thousand.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Freeze it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is logical to assume that this distress call was pre-recorded. What we received was evidently a delayed taped message.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: That would explain our continuing to receive it while our sensors only picked up the landing party, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The fact remains, when we beamed down there we couldn't find these people. They were there, now they're not. Nor is Crewman Compton.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem that some force or agent only partially discernible to our instruments may have been responsible.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, I want the ship on standby alert while we continue the investigation.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sir, now I have readings that deflectors are inoperative. The controls are frozen.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, assist.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, ever since we beamed up from Scalos, we've had a series of malfunctions. I want an investigation and an explanation.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Captain Kirk. Captain's presence for examination is requested.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can't it wait, Bones?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Your orders, Jim. You're the last one.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you read so far?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can we discuss it here?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On my way. Mister Spock, you have the conn.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Tell the captain what you told me.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Something's going on, Captain. Somebody's opened all the medical supply cabinets.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anything missing?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Just disordered, as though someone had picked up everything and examined it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lie down, Jim.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That fits in with other disturbances. Bones, what did your readings show up on the other men?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All perfectly normal. Whatever happened to Compton down there apparently had no effect on anyone else.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any of them report any unusual experience since beaming?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No. There's no mention of it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: The buzzing sound. Kirk starts to sit up.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not finished yet.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold on. Bones, could something be making me hallucinate?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I mean that twice before something touched me, and there was nothing there. And it's just happened again. Could I be imagining it?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Physically, there's nothing wrong with you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But am I hallucinating?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'd say no.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we did beam something aboard. Something has invaded the ship. Kirk to Spock. Come in. Spock, come in.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Context: bad static
Text: Captain, I have a reading from Life Support centre

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, I can't hear you. Check your circuits. Is there a malfunction?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, intercom system is breaking down rapidly.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, ship wide order. Use communicators instead of intercom. Issue phasers to all crew members. Spock, repeat.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: I have a reading from Life Support centre. Alien substances being introduced.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Meet me there on the double.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Spock hands Kirk a phaser. The two security men running ahead hit a forcefield and fall down.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is a force field, Captain, the nature of which I'm not familiar with. I'm getting readings of an alien presence similar to those obtained on the planet's surface, but they seem to have no exact location.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun. Sweep the area.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: The corridor goes green as they fire. Then they all walk forward, but the two security men are stopped again by the force field.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem, Captain, that they intend to allow only the two of us to enter. I should advise caution.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: There is a contraption hooked up to Life Support.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unknown, Captain. But it is evidently a device of alien origin.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hooked into the life support. Designed to affect it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Life support is still operating. I would say that the installation is incomplete.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Disconnect it. (Spock gets a shock from it) Destroy it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Their phasers disappear from their hands, then they are pushed backwards.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That was no force field. Something shoved me back. They're in here. You! What are you doing on my ship? Show yourselves!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It seems that we may look at it, Captain, but that is all.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A show of strength.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. Evidently they are convinced that we can do nothing to stop them, and they wish to impress upon us what they can do to us.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have your readings been fed into the computer?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Read out.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, analyse and reply. Have we been invaded?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nature and description of enemy forces.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Data insufficient.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Number of enemy forces.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Data insufficient.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Purpose of the invasion?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Immediate purpose, seizure and control of Federation Star ship Enterprise and crew. Data insufficient for determination of end purpose.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Is there a connection between this and Compton's disappearance?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Data insufficient.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are we at present capable of resisting?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: Negative.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your recommendation?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Computer
Text: If incapable of resistance, negotiate for terms.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We will not negotiate. Do you concur?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your recommendations, Captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeoman, is that coffee available, or have those circuits been damaged as well? (takes a cup from her tray) My recommendation? Make them take the next step.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk hears that buzzing again. We see his coffee bubble briefly. He takes a drink, grimaces (it is black coffee) then everything around him slows down and finally stops.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Context: the woman from the distress call
Text: Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would you mind explaining (she kisses him) Who are you?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Deela. The enemy.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the enemy?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Yes. You beamed me aboard yourself when you came up. A ridiculously long process, but I've taken care of it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done with my men?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Nothing.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing? Mister Spock? Scotty. This is nothing?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: There's really nothing wrong with them. They are just as they have always been. It's you who are different.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. Sulu. This is nothing?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: They cannot hear you, Captain. To their ears, you sound like an insect. That's your description, Captain. Accurate, if unflattering. Really, there is nothing wrong with them.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Changed you. So you are like me now. Your crew cannot see you or any of us because of the acceleration. We move in the wink of an eye. Oh, there is a scientific explanation for it, but all that really matters is that you can see me and talk to me, and we can go on from there.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Because I like you. Didn't you guess? Or are you so accustomed to being kissed by invisible women?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: She kisses him again, but he doesn't respond.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deela. Is this why you sabotaged my ship?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Oh, but it has not been sabotaged. We we had to make some changes in it to adjust it to us.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said we?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Yes. Of course. My chief scientist and his crew. I am their queen. You are going to be their king. You'll enjoy living on Scalos.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about my ship? My crew?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Oh, in a few of their moments, they will realise that you've vanished. They will look for you, but they will not find you. You're accelerated far beyond their power to see. So they'll go on without you. Don't be so stubborn. You cannot go back to them, ever. Is it so dreadful a prospect?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Context: draws his phaser
Text: This won't kill you, but the stun effect is not very pleasant.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: But that won't work. You go ahead and try. Point it right at me.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: She sidesteps the slow phaser beam easily.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: My reactions are much too fast for such a crude weapon. And I am quite good at self-defense, too. This can be set for stun and destroy, too, like yours. (his phaser goes flying) Please, accept what has happened. There is nothing you can do to change it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I agree to go with you, will you set this ship to rights? Take out that device in the life-support system?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Don't be so silly. You'll feel better about it all in a little while. It always happens this way. They are very upset at first, then it wears off and they, they learn to like it. You will, too.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk leaves

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: He's on his way to you. Be gentle with him.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Meanwhile, in our normal time-frame

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. Captain Kirk! He's gone!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, did you see what happened?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Well, he was sitting there. He'd just drunk his coffee and set his cup down. You see it's still there. And then he vanished.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Sulu, do you verify?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That's just what happened. He was there, then all of a sudden he wasn't there.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: Captain Kirk, you've made it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Compton, did they accelerate you?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They hooked something into the life support system. They're in there. We've got to get rid of it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: I'm sorry, sir. Entry is forbidden.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By whose order?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: The commander, sir. You'll have to step back, please.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm your commander, Compton. I order you to let me in.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: I'm sorry, sir. You are no longer.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who is? Deela? Is that who you're working for?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: At first I refused, but then after a while I found I couldn't help myself. I met this girl. She's one of them. I've never known anyone like her. She brought me aboard to show them operation of the ship. Bridge controls, life support. She explained that they wanted to know. I didn't understand at first, but I do now. So will you, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Compton.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk turns away, then quickly disarms Compton and enters

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Two Scalosian males are there.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Stun.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk falls gently to the floor. Compton enters and attacks the man with the weapon. He is knocked down for his loyalty.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: You were ordered to stop him. Why did you disobey?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: I tried to stop him. You hurt him.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: He was violent. He had to be subdued.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Compton
Text: He was my captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Ekor
Text: Cell damage.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Context: to a young woman
Text: Another will be secured for you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm getting a trace reading similar to that on the planet. Mister Sulu, did you drink your coffee?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did anyone else?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: I had some.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Was it the coffee? Are we going to go too, just like the captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: I cannot give you that answer until these have been analysed.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: By that time it'll be too late.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suggest that we recall the captain's words, Make them take the next step. It would seem they have taken it. And we must determine effective countermeasures. Mister Scott, you have the conn. I shall be in the medical lab.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Deela is kneeling next to the still-unconscious Kirk.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I hate what happens to them when they're damaged. You're going to have to learn to control your temper, Rael. I do not want that to happen to this one. If they are so stubborn a species, perhaps they will last longer.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: It may be.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I hope so. They all go so soon. I want to keep this one a long time. He's pretty.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: He is inferior, Deela.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Oh? I don't think so.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: You cannot allow yourself to feel an attachment to such.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I can allow myself anything I want. Oh, Rael, don't be like that. Am I jealous of what you do?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: I do my duty.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: So do I. And sometimes I allow myself to enjoy it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk wakes up.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Hello.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is that device doing on my ship?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Deela will explain it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I will tell you anything you want to know, and you'll approve of it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Approve of it? We're your prisoners.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Hardly. You're free to go anywhere you want to.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Go ahead, Captain. It is not yet completely linked to your support system, but it is in operating order. Study it if you wish. I suggest that you do not touch it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk touches the device briefly, then clamps both hands firmly onto it in an act of defiance. Deela pulls them off.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: He told you not to touch it. Look at your hands. They're almost frozen, aren't they? It will pass.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: The unit has its own self-defence mechanism, as you see. You should've heeded me.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk sees Compton on the floor. The young man now looks very old.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: In your struggle with Compton, some of his cells were damaged. Those newly accelerated to our level are sensitive to cell damage. They age rapidly and die.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was so young.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Was.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is what you have planned for us?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: We all die, even on Scalos.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk leaves.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Why did you lie to him? He did not damage that one, you did.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Perhaps he will be less violent now.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I see no reason to make him feel any worse than he has to.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Why do you care what he feels?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Rael, he's not one of us. He's temporary. (getting a message via her collar device) He's gone to the medical laboratory. He's trying to communicate with the Vulcan. His species is capable of much affection.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: I have noted that.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I wonder if they will demonstrate it to us. Oh, Rael, stop sulking. Accept it. We've had to accept it all our lives. Don't make it worse.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Rael kisses Deela

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Go back to work.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: In fast time. Kirk is using a computer console whilst McCoy, Chapel and Spock are motionless at another bench, examining test results.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Spock, I have fed all the ascertainable facts into the computer banks.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Deela enters.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Go ahead. You won't accomplish anything, but it may be historically valuable.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hyperacceleration is the key. I have counted only five of them aboard, but they have taken over the ship, and we are under their control due to this acceleration. They are able to speed others up to their level, as they did Compton and me. Presumably, this is enslavement? Those so treated exist at this accelerated level, becoming docile eventually. But when

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Damaged.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damaged, they age incredibly fast, as though accelerated living

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Burns them out.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Burns them out. Compton was burned out. The device attached to the life-support system produces an extreme, numbing cold. It is my belief that they are turning the Enterprise into a gigantic deep-freeze for purposes only the Scalosians know.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Quite correct.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The unit has a protective shield which does not allow any physical contact. I don't know how to destroy it, but its destruction is imperative.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: The unit will be activated. By the time they hear this, it will be too late. You have remarkable reasoning powers, Captain. You were quite right in almost every assumption.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why are you doing this?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Do you really want to know? In a little while it won't matter to you at all. You'll be quite happy about it, Just as Compton was.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I really want to know.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Oh, dear. You are so stubborn. It should be obvious to you that we're doing it because we have to. A long time ago, it is in our history, we used to be like you. Then our country was almost destroyed by volcanic eruptions. The water was polluted. Radiation was released. That changed us. It accelerated us. The children died. Most of the women found they could not have more. All of our men had become sterile. So we had to mate outside our own people. Whenever a spaceship came by, we'd send our calls for help. But accelerating them to our level burned them out. Don't you see, Captain? Do I have to go into every detail? We are going to take you down with us. Perhaps one or two others of your crew. We have to. We'll be kind to you. I wouldn't hurt you, certainly. I do like you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about the rest of my crew?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: They'll remain here in suspended animation. It will do them no harm. We are saving them for when we need them in the future. You will not last forever. You know that, Captain. Captain, we have the right to survive.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not by killing others.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: You were doing exactly the same thing. You came charging into that life-support room the minute you knew there was trouble. You would have killed every one my people if you could have.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You invaded my ship. You threaten my crew.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: There is no difference.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is a difference! Your trouble is in you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: We did not ask for it. We are not to blame. We are handling it the only way we know how. The way our parents and their parents before them.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did they solve anything? Have you tried any other way? Deela, have your scientists disconnect, destroy that unit. I promise you, we'll use every skill we have to help you. We'll move you to another planet. We'll call on the most brilliant minds in our Federation to help. We'll do it

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: We have tried other ways. We've tried to make the transition to your level. Some of us, that is. Those who made the attempt died. We are trapped, Captain, Just as you are trapped now. I'm sorry for what's going to happen to you, but I cannot change it. You cannot change me.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Go to the transporter room, Deela. Signal me when you're there and beam down.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: With the captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Yes. I'll activate our unit and follow you. I'm setting it to allow all of us time to get off the ship. Please don't delay.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Meanwhile, Kirk slips his computer tape into the machine Spock is working at. Then he slips out.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Just what makes you think I would do that? The captain's gone.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Go after him, Deela.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: in real time

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's no question about it, Spock. I want you to take a look at this. The same substance is in the captain's coffee as in the Scalosian water, and there's no trace of it in any other cups.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk removed a vital component from the control console before Deela enters. She draws her weapon.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Why did you run?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I panicked.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I don't believe that.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to leave before he activates the suspended animation device.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Context: into her comm. unit
Text: We're in the transporter room. You can activate.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Beam him down at once.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk stands on the transporter pad. Deela activates the controls but nothing happens.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: What have you done to the transporter, Captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was working before. Try it again.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Context: into her comm. unit
Text: The transporter isn't working.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: What'd he do to it?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Nothing. He didn't have time.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: It must be a, what do you call it? A malfunction. You'd better not activate the unit yet. What would you say it is, Captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The technicians reported a loss of power. That must be it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: The captain says his technicians

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: I heard him. You expect me to believe him?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I expect you to check into all possible causes. If I had a suspicious nature, Captain, I would say that you sabotaged the transporter to buy time.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I'm glad we're both innocents. I despise devious people, don't you?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe in honest relationships myself.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nurse, programme the information and determine whether we can find counteragents. (there's a buzz) Doctor, did you just

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've been hearing that whine ever since we beamed down to Scalos.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: I know what it is. We brought it with us from Scalos. If you'll excuse me, I shall be on the bridge.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Your quarters are quite like you, Captain. Austere and efficient, and in their own way, handsome.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A room should reflect its occupant.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Absolutely. May I freshen up? All this rushing about has left me windblown. I'm glad to see you allow yourself some comforts. Are you married, Captain? No family? No attachments? I know. You're married to your career, and you never look at another woman.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, if she's pretty enough, I'll look.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I wondered when you'd say something nice to me. Am I more presentable now?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A bit.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: It was quite delightful kissing you when you couldn't see me. But now

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But now.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: He kisses her, then takes her hands but she dodges away. He was trying to get the weapon from her sleeve.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: No. I wouldn't allow you to take that no matter how much we trust each other. But I would've been disappointed if you hadn't tried.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was I too crude?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Just don't try it again. You're far too vulnerable to skin damage. All I have to do is scratch you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I know.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: The difference between us is that you will come around to our way of thinking sooner or later. But it's better sooner than later.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Another kiss.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, will you replay the Scalosian distress call on my viewer?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: To any and all space travellers passing within range of the planet Scalos, I send you an urgent appeal for help. My comrades and I are the last surviving members of what was once a thriving civilisation.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Compton!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I was looking at him. I was looking right at him, and then he just wasn't there

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Those of us who are left have taken shelter in this area. We have no explanation for what's happening to us. (Spock slows down the playback, then speeds it up) Those of us who are left have taken shelter in this area. We have no explanation for what's happening to us. Nation of nine hundred thousand. City alone holding one hundred thirteen thousand. On which existed several culturally enlightened Indigenous population

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Finally it is speeded up to the familiar buzz or whine the crew have been hearing.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There is an insect life.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: My tricorder doesn't register it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My ears register it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This is a barren world. Limited vegetation, no apparent animal life.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: McCoy discovers there is already a computer tape in the machine slot. He plays it and just hears that whine.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Spock.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I've found a tape in the computer down here, and when I try to read it, all I get is a whine.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bring it to the bridge at once, Doctor.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This device attached to the life-support system produces an extreme, numbing cold. It is my belief that they are turning the Enterprise into a gigantic deep-freeze. The unit has protective shield which does not allow any physical contact. I don't know how to destroy it, but its destruction is imperative.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: The unit will be activated. By the time they hear this, it will be too late.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, notify the rest of the crew.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can we use phasers to cut through that wall, bypass the force field and get at that unit?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, we cannot cope with them on our level.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Can we find some way of coping with them on theirs?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is a very logical suggestion. Stand by in the transporter room.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Scott is in the doorway of the room, as the Scalosians try to fix the transporter.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Ekor
Text: There's nothing wrong elsewhere, sir. Sufficient energy for beaming down.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: This is the only damage? Go get the others and bring them up here. (into comm.) Deela. Deela? Deela!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk is putting on his boots as Deela combs her hair. Draw your own conclusions. Rael runs in as the couple indulge in another kiss.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Rael!

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Rael takes a swing at Kirk.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Rael, stop.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk uses a chair as a shield, then Deela shoots Rael, stun level, twice.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Now, stop it. Did he damage you, Captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: How very fortunate for you, Rael. Don't you dare do anything like that again. It's contemptible.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: Then don't torment me. You know how I feel.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: I don't care what your feelings are. I don't want to know that aspect of it. What I do is necessary, and you have no right to question it. Allow me the dignity of liking the man I select. Is the transporter repaired?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: No. I have more work to do.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Don't you think you'd better do it?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Rael leaves.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: He loves me. I adored him when I was a child. I suppose I still do. I must say, you behaved better than he did.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I hope so.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: What did you say?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said I hoped I behaved correctly.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: And nothing bothers you now?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why are we here?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Our leaving was delayed. Don't you remember? You damaged the transporter.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes. That was wrong of me.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Yes, it certainly was.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we are going to Scalos?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Do you want to?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: What about your crew? Aren't you worried about them?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll be all right.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Oh.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Nothing. You've completely accepted the situation, haven't you? You even like it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Am I behaving incorrectly?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: No! I liked you better before. Stubborn and irritating and independent, like Rael.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those are undesirable qualities.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Maybe that's why I liked you so much. Because you were like him. (into comm.) Rael? You don't have to worry about the captain. He's made the adjustment.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Finished.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, it counteracts the substance most effectively.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Most effectively under laboratory conditions, but the question is will it work in the human body? And the second question is, how do we get it to the captain?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: By drinking the Scalosian water. (and does so)

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock, you don't know what that'll do to you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is somewhat stimulating. You seem to be moving very slowly, Doctor. Fascinating.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Spock leaves, and we jump back to normal time.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Chapel
Text: He's gone.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just like Compton.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: The transporter is repaired and the three other Scalosians are beamed down.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: I've beamed the others down.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Is it repaired already?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Why didn't you tell me?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: It would've been an intrusion. Come up when you wish. Signal me when you are ready.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Where will you be?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: In life support. I have to activate our unit.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Rael, wait. I'm sorry.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: I know.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk and Deela walk past Scott, still in the doorway.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Well, come, Captain. It's time to leave your pretty ship.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Rael switches on the refrigerator unit.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Rael
Text: The unit is activated, Deela. Beam down at once.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Your crew will be all right. You said so yourself.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk takes her weapon from her sleeve.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk leaves.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Context: into comm.
Text: He's broken away. He's armed.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Narrator
Text: RAEL; I'm ready for him.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Kirk meets Spock in the corridor, and they stand either side of the door. Rael fires once, turns, and Kirk fires at him. This time Rael falls slowly to the floor. Then Kirk destroys the unit. Deela arrives and all three enter the room properly.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: You are very clever, Captain. You tricked me. I should've known that you would never adjust. What shall we expect from you now?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We could put you in suspended animation until we determine what to do with you.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Your survival does not depend on that.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, it doesn't. What do you want us to do with you?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Don't make a game of it, Captain. We've lost.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If I sent you to Scalos, you'd undoubtedly play the same trick on the next spaceship that passed by.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: There won't be any others. You'll warn them. Your federation will quarantine the entire area.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I suppose it would.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: And we will die and solve your problem that way. And ours.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Scott is a little further into the room.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Now, what about your problem, Captain, and your Vulcan friend?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you will devote yourself exclusively to the concerns of Scalos, madam, we shall be pleased to remain and take care of the Enterprise.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: You could still find life on Scalos very pleasant.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And very brief.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: It'll be just as brief here. You cannot get back to your own level. No answer, Captain? Do I displease you so much?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, no. I can think of nothing I'd rather do than stay with you. Except staying alive.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Deela joins Rael on the transporter pad.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Deela
Text: Goodbye, Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: They are beamed away.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Spock, what have you got?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy and I have synthesised a possible counteragent to the Scalosian water. Regrettably, we did not have the opportunity to test it.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's test it. (drinks the contents of a small vial) Nothing's happening.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: You do seem to be moving very slowly, Captain.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain Kirk, where the blazes did you come from?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Out of the nowhere into the here.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: And Mister Spock, is he coming too?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 5710.9. Mister Spock has remained in accelerated time so that he might repair the ship more rapidly.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Somebody's repairing every console on the ship.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Scott
Text: This panel is being recircuited at incredible speed.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think we've located Mister Spock. Lieutenant, are your circuits clearing?

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel Red Alert, Mister Sulu.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Open all channels. Captain to crew. Repairs are now being effected by Mister Spock. The ship will resume normal operations almost immediately.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Context: Spock returns to normal time.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, my compliments to your repair work and yourself.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Captain. I found it an accelerating experience.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. No malfunctions anywhere? (sees the Scalosians on the viewscreen) Lieutenant.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm sorry, sir. I touched the tape button accidentally. I'll take it off.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's no malfunction.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, sir.

Title: Wink Of An Eye
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Goodbye Deela.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: The Enterprise is orbiting a blue and green world

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A ghost planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I suggest no supernatural explanation, Captain. I merely point out that the facts do not fit any known categories of planets.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's take the facts one by one. That should explain something.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undoubtedly. The age of this planet would seem to be only a few thousand years. It would be impossible for vegetation to evolve in so short a period.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Its size is approximately that of Earth's moon.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: But its mass and atmosphere are similar to Earth.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That would be difficult to explain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be impossible, Captain. An atmosphere could not evolve in so short a period of time.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And yet it has.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Evidently. But the inconsistencies are so compounded as to present a seemingly impossible phenomenon.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But a fascinating one, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, Captain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It would bear closer investigation, it would seem, if we're to provide Starfleet with an accurate report. Lieutenant, send Doctor McCoy to the transporter room for survey party. We'll also need Senior Geologist D'Amato.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Feed beam down co-ordinates to the transporter room. Mister Sulu, you'll accompany me. Mister Spock, you have the conn.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Kirk and Sulu leave.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Rahda, report to the bridge immediately.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This expedition should be a geologist's dream, Mister D'Amato.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: The opportunity to explore so young a planet is an incredible bit of luck, Captain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. If Mister Spock is correct, you'll have a report to startle the Fifth Interstellar Geophysical Conference.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why? What is it, Jim?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A planet that even Spock can't explain. Prepare to transport. Energise.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: But just as they start to disintegrate, a woman appears in the transporter room

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Wait! You must not go!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Before they have fully beamed out, the team see her touch the transporter operator, and him fall to the floor.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Blue and orange clumps of grass amongst the rocks.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, did you see what I saw?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That woman attacked Ensign Wyatt.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Captain. Captain!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: There's an earthquake which also shakes the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Spock! Are you all right?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I believe no permanent damage was done.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: What happened?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: The occipital area of my head seems to have impacted with the chair.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, Mister Spock. I meant what happened to us?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That we have yet to ascertain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Context: a woman in yellow uniform
Text: Mister Spock. The planet's gone!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What kind of earthquakes do they have in this place?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. Any more like that and they'll tear this planet apart.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Captain, this tremor we felt, if that's what it was, it's certainly like no seismic disturbance I've ever felt before. I got a reading of almost immeasurable power, but it's not there any more.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could seismic stress have accounted for it?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: The reading I got had nothing to do with a seismic force.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's very strange. And that woman. Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise, come in. The shock may have damaged it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's gone! The Enterprise, it's gone!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Sulu hands over his tricorder.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: He's right, Captain. There's nothing there.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How could it be gone? What the devil does that mean, Jim?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: For one thing it means we're stranded.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The Enterprise must have blown up. That would explain the high radiation readings, wouldn't it, Captain? If the matter - antimatter engines

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shall we stop guessing, Mister Sulu, and try and establish a pattern? I get no readings of high energy concentration. If the Enterprise had blown up, it would have left a high residual radiation.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could it be the Enterprise hit the planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Once in Siberia there was a meteor so great that it flattened whole forests and was felt as far away as

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, if I'd wanted a Russian history lesson, I'd have brought along Mister Chekov. This is a matter of survival, gentlemen. Without the Enterprise, we need food, and we need water, and we need them fast. I want a detailed analysis made of this planet, and I want it now.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Kirk hands back the tricorder.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering, no damage. All power levels normal.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Damage control report. Ship functioning normally. Many bumps and bruises. One casualty, Mister Spock. The transporter officer, he's dead.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SPOCK; Dead? Spock to Sickbay.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Sickbay, Doctor M'Benga.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Report on the death of the transporter officer.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: We're not sure. Doctor Sanchez is conducting an autopsy right now.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Give me a full report as soon as possible, please. Spock out. Mister Scott, have the transporter checked for possible malfunction.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: No debris of any kind, sir. I've made two full scans. If the planet had broken up, there'd be some sign. But what bothers me is the stars, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: The stars.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Yes, sir. They're wrong.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Wrong?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. Look. Now here's a replay of the star pattern just before the explosion.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: A positional change.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: It doesn't make any sense. But somehow I'd say that in a flash we've been knocked one thousand light years away from where we were.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nine hundred and ninety point seven light years to be exact, Lieutenant.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: But that's not possible. Nothing can do that.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, since we are here, your statement is not only illogical but also unworthy of refutation. It is also illogical to assume that any explosion, even that of a small star going supernova, could have hurled us a distance of nine hundred and ninety point seven light years.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: The point is, it shouldn't have hurled us anywhere. Why, it should have destroyed us immediately, vaporised us.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is correct, Mister Scott, by all the laws that we know. There was no period of unconsciousness. Our ship's chronometers registered a matter of only a few seconds. Therefore, we were displaced through space in some manner which I am unable to fathom.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: What you're saying is that the planet didn't blow up, and the captain and the others, they're still alive!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please, Mister Scott, restrain your leaps of illogic. I have said nothing. I was merely speculating.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Sickbay to Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: You asked for an autopsy report. It's only preliminary, but the cause of death seems to have been cellular disruption.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Explain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: It's as though every cell in the body had been individually blasted from inside.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Would any known disease organism do that?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Doctor Sanchez has ruled that possibility out, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please keep me fully advised. Spock out. He was in the transporter room. Someone may have entered after Captain Kirk and his party left. Mister Scott, since the Enterprise is obviously functional, I suggest we return to our starting place at top warp speed.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. But even at that it'll take a while to get there.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: In that case, Mister Scott, I suggest we start at once. Can you give me warp eight?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. And maybe a wee bit more. I'll sit on the warp engines myself and nurse them.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That position, Mister Scott, would not only be unavailing but also undignified. Lieutenant Rahda, plot a course.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Already plotted and laid in, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good. Then prepare to come to warp eight.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your report covers all vegetation?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, Captain. All vegetation is inedible. Poison to us.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If the Enterprise has been destroyed, you know how long we can survive.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I don't see any water, but there must be some to grow the vegetation. A source of water would stretch our survival. Did you see any evidence of rainfall?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: No, sir. And I haven't seen any evidence that there ever has been any rainfall.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But there is earth-type vegetation.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is it possible the vegetation could absorb the water directly from the air?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, that's possible. There's also the possibility of underground water.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Yes, sir. Could be.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Sulu's picked up an organism that's almost a virus, like a a plant parasite. It's the nearest biological form of life I can find.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This apparently is going to be our home for as long as we last. I suggest we find out as much as we can about it. Split up. D'Amato, see if you can find underground water.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sulu, run an atmospheric analysis.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, see if you can find out anything about the vegetation and your parasite. How do they get their moisture? If you can discover how they survive, maybe we can.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Sulu and D'Amato have headed off to do their analyses. Sulu contacts Kirk on his communicator

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu to Captain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I was making a standard magnetic sweep. From zero, I suddenly got a reading that was off the scale. Then, a reverse of polarity and now I get nothing. I've never seen anything like this reading. Like a door opened and then closed again.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Elsewhere, D'Amato is wandering amongst the purple tipped vegetation and picking up handfuls of sand. He turns around and there is the woman.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Do not be afraid.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: I'm not. Geological disturbances don't frighten me. I've come here to study them. My specialty.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I know. You are Lieutenant D'Amato, Senior Geologist.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: That's right. How did you know that?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: From the spaceship Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Yes, and we're stranded here. You been talking to my friends?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Do not be afraid.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: I'm not afraid.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am for you, Lieutenant D'Amato.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: You're, you're the woman on the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am only for D'Amato.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: D'Amato
Text: Lucky D'Amato. I want to have a conference about sharing your food and water.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Do not call the others. Please.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Somewhere else, McCoy gets out his communicator.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy to Kirk.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I just got a life form reading of tremendous intensity. Suddenly it was just there.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean just there?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just that. All levels were normal, then I get this biological surge of life form registering. No, now it's gone.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As though a door opened and closed.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What direction?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Zero eight three.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hang on. D'Amato's section. Come in. Kirk to D'Amato. Come in. Come in. Bones, Sulu, D'Amato doesn't answer.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll be right there.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Kirk arrives first. We see a pair of legs with boots lying face down behind a rock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: McCoy runs in and examines the body.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, every cell in his body's been disrupted.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Sulu arrives. Kirk adjusts his phaser.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what are you doing?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Digging a grave.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Poor D'Amato. What a terrible way to die.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are no good ways, Sulu.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Kirk phasers the ground, but it only cuts a shallow trench in the soil.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: That's the same red rock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My phaser didn't cut through it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Whatever it is, it has a mighty high melting point.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Eight thousand degrees centigrade. It looks like igneous rock, but infinitely denser.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Adjusts his phaser and tries again.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This whole planet must be made up of this substance, covered over by top soil.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, it might explain this place a little better if we knew what the substance is. I know it was D'Amato's field, but see what you can find out.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I guess a tomb of rocks is the best we can provide for D'Amato.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yeah. It might be the most suitable memorial at that.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder what killed him.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know, but something or someone did.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: We're holding warp eight point four, sir. If we can maintain it, our estimated time of arrival is eleven and one half solar hours.

Title: That Which Survives
