Speaker: Spock
Text: Eleven point three three seven hours, Lieutenant. I wish you would be more precise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Bridge. Scott to Bridge.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, the ship feels wrong.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Feels, Mister Scott?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I know it doesn't make sense. Instrumentation reads correct, but the feel is wrong.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's something I can't quite put into words.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is obvious, Mister Scott. I suggest you avoid emotionalism and simply keep your instruments correct.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock out.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: The cairn is complete, and topped off with a name-stone.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It looks so lonely there.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It would be worse if he had company.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Doctor, how can you joke about it?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not joking. Until we know what killed him, none of us are safe.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've got to figure this out and devise a defence against it. Is it possible that the rocks have life?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You remember on Janus Six, the silicon creatures

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But our instruments recorded that. They were life forms. They registered as life forms.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Unless we're dealing with beings, intelligent beings who can shield themselves.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Beings intelligent enough to have destroyed the Enterprise?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's the problem, Sulu. We have only questions. No answers.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Scott is trying to track down the source of his feeling, and a man in a red boiler suit keeps looking over his shoulder.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Watkins, check the bypass valve on the matter/antimatter reaction chamber. Make sure it's not overheating.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: But, Mister Scott, the board shows correct.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I didn't ask you to check the board, lad.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Watkins goes off into an adjoining room and checks a console and some panels in there. Then he is confronted by Losira.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: Who are you?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: My name is not important. Yours is Watkins, John B. Engineer Grade four.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: You know all about me. I've never seen you before.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Show me this unit. I wish to learn.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: This is the matter-antimatter integrator control. That's the cut off switch.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Not correct. That is the emergency overload bypass, which engages almost instantaneously. A wise precaution, considering it takes the antimatter longer to explode once the magnetic flow fails. I am for you, Mister Watkins.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Watkins
Text: Mister Scott, there's a strange woman who knows the entire plan of the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: But by the time Scott gets there, Watkins has screamed and Losira has turned sideways into a vertical line, then vanished.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, you poor lad. Scott to bridge. Scott to bridge.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: My assistant, Watkins, is dead.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do you know what he died of, Mister Scott?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I didn't see it happen, but his last words were a warning cry about some strange woman.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Security alert, all decks. Female intruder, extremely dangerous. Security alert. All decks.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Dusk is falling, the sky is a dark purple.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; Conclusions.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The basic substance of this planet is an alloy of diburnium-osmium. It couldn't have evolved naturally.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, it doesn't make sense. In fact, nothing about this planet makes sense.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Except for a momentary fluctuation on your instruments, this planet has no magnetic field. The apparent age of these rocks is only a few thousand years. No known process could evolve the plant life they have here in that short space of time.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you suggesting this might be an artificial planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But Captain, where are the people who made it? Why can't we see them?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The planet might be hollow. They might be shielding themselves from our sensor probes. It's dark. Let's get some rest. Tomorrow we have to find some food and some water or it's going to be a very unpleasant stay.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: While it lasts.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I'll take the first watch, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Take D'Amato's tricorder. Set it for automatic distress. You never can tell.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Sulu sets up the tricorder on a rock ledge, and leaves it beeping away to itself.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Sickbay. Have you completed the autopsy on Watkins, Doctor?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Yes, we have, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Was the cause of his death the same as that which killed the transporter officer?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: M'Benga
Text: Well, the pattern of cellular disruption was the same, but as to the cause, well your guess is as good as mine.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: My guess, Doctor, would be valueless. I suggest we refrain from guessing and find some facts.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock out.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: The power of this intruder to disrupt every cell in a body, combined with the almost inconceivable power required to hurl the Enterprise such a distance, speak of a very high culture and a very great danger.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: You mean that one of the people who threw us a thousand light years away from that planet is on board and killing our people?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: A reasonable assumption, Mister Scott.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then you're right, Mister Spock. Watkins must've been murdered. I sent him in to check the matter-antimatter reactor. There are no exposed circuits there. It couldn't have been anything he touched.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: If there are more of those beings on that planet, the captain and the others are in very great danger.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: While Kirk and McCoy sleep, Losira turns off the tricorder. Sulu confronts her.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am unarmed.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Who are you?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: That is not important. You are Lieutenant Sulu. You were born on the planet Earth. You're helmsman for the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: How do you know this? Where did you get this information? Are you from this planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am from here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Then the planet is hollow. Who killed Lieutenant D'Amato? All right. The captain will want to talk to you. That way. Move!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: You do not understand. I have come for you.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: What do you want?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I want to touch you.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You were on the Enterprise. Keep back! Stop or I'll shoot! I don't want to have to kill a woman.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Sulu fires his phaser at her feet, then at her. It has no effect.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain Kirk! Captain Kirk!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: As he backs away, Sulu falls over a stone. Losira manages to brush his shoulder before he gets away, screaming in pain, and Kirk steps in front of her.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold it! Who are you?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am for him. I am for Lieutenant Sulu.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Don't let her touch you, Captain! That's how D'Amato died. Phasers won't stop her.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am for Lieutenant Sulu. Please, I must touch him.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: She puts her hand on Kirk's shoulder, but it doesn't hurt him. He pushes her away.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How can you destroy others and not me?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I don't want to destroy. I don't want to.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? Why are you trying to kill us?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Only Sulu. I mean you no harm.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are there men on this planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Please, I must touch him. I am for Lieutenant Sulu.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Losira goes two-dimensional, then vanishes.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, did you see that? Maybe Spock was wrong. Perhaps this is a ghost planet.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, all I know is she almost made a ghost out of Sulu. His shoulder, where she touched it, every cell's been disrupted. Exploded from within. If she'd really gotten a good grip on him, Jim.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: How can such people be, Captain? Such evil and she's so, so beautiful.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Security sweeps of all decks are negative, Mister Spock. No evidence of intruder.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well. Cancel Red Alert but maintain increased security.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. All decks, cancel Red Alert. Maintain increased security.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please update our subspace report to Starfleet to include security search, results negative.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: How did she get off the ship, sir?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Presumably the same way she got on.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. Mister Spock what are the chances of the captain and the others being alive?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, we are not engaged in gambling. We are proceeding in the only logical way to return to the place they were last seen, and factually ascertain whether or not they still live.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Mister Spock, speed is increased to warp eight point eight.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Bridge to Engineering.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scotty here. I see it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's a power surge. I'm working on it. Reduce speed until I locate the trouble.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well. Reduce speed to warp seven.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Aye, sir. Warp seven. Mister Spock, our speed has increased to warp eight point nine and still climbing.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Bridge to Engineering. Negative effect on power reduction. Speed is still increasing.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Mister Spock, and I found out why. The emergency bypass control of the matter-antimatter integrator is fused.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's completely useless. The engines are running wild. There's no way to get at them. We should reach maximum overload in about fifteen minutes.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would calculate fourteen point eight seven minutes, Mister Scott.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Those few seconds will not make any difference, Mister Spock, because you and I and the rest of the crew will no longer be here to bandy it back and forth.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: This thing is going to blow up

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: And there's nothing in the universe can stop it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's a layer of necrotic tissue a few cells thick. A normal wound would heal quickly.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: She just touched me. How could it happen so fast?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a good question. She touched the transporter chief. He collapsed immediately. She apparently got to D'Amato. We saw what happened to him. The question is, why are you alive?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I'm happy the way it turned out.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what kind of power must she have?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The power to totally disrupt biological cell structure. Sulu's alive because I intervened. But that raises an even worse question.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes. Why didn't she kill you?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's not through yet.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Scott is working on the emergency bypass

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's useless. And there's no question it's deliberate.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sabotage.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, and a thorough job. The system's foolproof. Whoever murdered Watkins sabotaged this.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: You said it was fused. How?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: That's what worries me.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Worries, Mister Scott?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, it's fused, all right, but it would take all the power of our main phaser banks to do it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I find nothing interesting in the fact that we're about to blow up.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, but the method is fascinating.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Whatever did this is still aboard this ship. I fail to understand why you cancelled the security alert.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: A force that could hurl us nine hundred and ninety point seven light years away and at that distance still be able to sabotage our main source of energy will not be waiting around to be taken into custody.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: As I recall the pattern of our fuel flow, there is an access tube leading to the matter-antimatter reaction chamber.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's a service crawlway, but it's not meant to be used while the integrator operates.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Still, it is there, and it might be possible to shut off the fuel at that point.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: What with? Bare hands?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: A magnetic probe.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Any matter that comes in contact with antimatter triggers the explosion. And I'm not even sure a man can live in the crawlway in the energy stream of the magnetic field that bottles up the antimatter.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall try.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: You'll be killed, man!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unless a solution is found quickly, that fate awaits all of us.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. You're right. What have we got to lose? But I'll do it, Mister Spock. I know every millimetre of that system. I'll do whatever has to be done.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well, Mister Scott. You spoke of the feel of the ship being wrong.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. It was an emotional statement. I don't expect you to understand it.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I note it, Mister Scott, without necessarily understanding it. I propose to run an analysis through the ship's computers, comparing the present condition of the Enterprise with her ideal condition.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, we don't have time for that.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have twelve minutes and twenty seven seconds. I suggest you do whatever you can in the service crawlway, while I make the computer study.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Sulu, do you feel strong enough to move about?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I feel fine, Captain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is he, Bones?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He's in fair shape.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right. Whatever destructive power this woman has seems to be aimed at one specific person at one specific time. If I'm correct, when she re-appears, the other two might protect the one she's after by interposing their bodies. No weapons seem to affect her.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But Captain, how does she know about us? Does she read our minds? (there's a whining sound) Phaser on overload!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Controls are fused. Drop!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: He throws his phaser away, and it goes off with a big bang.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apparently she can destroy our weapons as well as destroy us. Come on, let's go.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, lads. Get the crawlway door open. Hand me the tools. Communicator. All right. Head first. I hope Mister Spock knows what he's doing.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Scott is slid on his back into a half-sized Jefferies tube with blue energy streaks crossing it

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Bridge.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Go ahead, Mister Scott.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've sealed off the aft end of the service crawlway, and I've positioned explosive separator charges to blast me clear of the ship if I rupture the magnetic bottle. I'm so close to the flow now it feels like ants crawling all over my body.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, I suggest you refrain from any further subjective descriptions. You now have ten minutes and nineteen seconds in which to perform your task.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Mister Spock, we're at warp eleven point two and accelerating.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I heard that. The ship's not structured to take that speed for any length of time.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: You now have ten minutes and ten seconds.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: All right, Mister Spock. I'm starting to open the access panel now.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Spock begins his computer study.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Access to the flow itself.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: If the magnetic flow jumps, you must jettison me. The safety control

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Will not hold more than two seconds if I rupture the field.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm aware of these facts. Please get on with the job. Computer.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Analysis on my comparison co-ordinates.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Computer
Text: Unable to comply. Comparison co-ordinates too complex for immediate readout. Will advise upon completion.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've removed the access plate, and I've got static electric charges dancing on the instruments. Looks like an aurora borealis in there.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, you are monitoring the magnetic force?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Oh yes, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please do not take your eyes off of it. Lieutenant Rahda, arm the pod jettison system.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Aye, sir. I'll jettison the pod at the first sign of trouble.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not until my order.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Yes, sir. Warp eleven point nine.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, what is your situation?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's hard to see. There's so much disturbance that any attempt to get at the flow would rupture the magnetic field.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: You have eight minutes, forty one seconds.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I know what time it is. I don't need a blooming' cuckoo clock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I'm getting that strange magnetic sweep again, from zero to off the scale.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Like a door opening.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: And suddenly Losira is there again.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who have you come for this time?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: For you, James T. Kirk. Commander of the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Keep behind us, Jim.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why do you want to kill us?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: For defence. You are Captain James T. Kirk, commander of the Enterprise.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why do you want to kill me?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: You are an invader.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're here on a peaceful mission. It's you who have killed our people. We mean no harm to you. We want to leave, peacefully.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Captain, I'm getting no life form register.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An android?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That would give a mechanical reading. I'm getting nothing.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am Losira, Commander.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commander of what?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Of this station.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Station? Station? Where? How do you feel about killing me?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Feel? Killing is wrong.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay between us.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: You must not penetrate this station. Please, I must touch you.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You want to kill me?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: No.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why do it if you don't want to?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am sent.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By whom?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: We defend this place.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are there others on this planet?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: They are no more.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long have you been alone? Are you lonely?

Title: That Which Survives
Context: She does her disappearing act.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: She must be somewhere.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's not registering.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And there's this power surge, right off the scale. Like a door closing. It must be near here.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: They walk on.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Is the power level still holding, Jim?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Right off the scale. It's remained at a peak ever since she disappeared. The entrance is here.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: A section of rock slides back and a door opens.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You think we're being invited in?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It certainly looks like it. And the invitation doesn't exactly relax me.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I'd rather be on the Enterprise, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We've been led here. Why?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. But whatever civilisation exists on this planet is in there. And without the Enterprise, gentlemen, the only source of food and water is in there. Let's go.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer read-out.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Computer
Text: Comparison analysis complete.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Continue.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Computer
Text: Transporter factor M7 reassembled outphase point zero zero zero nine.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Fifty seven seconds to go.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Understood.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm going to try to cut through the magnetic flow. But if the probe doesn't precisely match the magnetic flow, there'll be an explosion. Starting right now.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Magnetic force indicator jumping, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, ease off.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Magnetic force has dropped to normal, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Warp thirteen point two, sir.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Computer, for outphase condition, will reverse field achieve closure?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Computer
Text: Affirmative, if M7 factor maintained.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reverse polarity on your magnetic probe.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Reverse polarity?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is correct, Mister Scott.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: That'll take some doing. What purpose could it

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please commence. I'll explain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were correct in your feel. The Enterprise was put through a molecular transporter and reassembled slightly out of phase. Reverse polarity should seal the incision.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I have no time for theory. I just hope you're right.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Twenty seconds, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm doing the best I can! Wait! It's stuck! It's stuck! Push the button!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please continue, Mister Scott.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Don't be a fool! Push the button! It's your last chance! Don't be sentimental, push it. I'm going to die anyway.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please continue.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's loose! But there's no time. Push the button!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Nine seconds.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Scott gets his polarity reversed and puts the probe into the antimatter stream

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Eight seconds, seven seconds

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Six seconds, five seconds, four seconds, three seconds, two seconds.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: One. Mister Spock, now. Warp fourteen point one. Warp fourteen.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Magnetic forces steady.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: We hear the engines slowing down.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Rahda
Text: Warp thirteen point nine and dropping.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, you have accomplished your task.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: You might at least say thank you.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: For what purpose, Mister Scott?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is it in you humans

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Scott
Text: Never mind.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That requires an overwhelming display of emotion in a situation such as this? Two men pursue the only reasonable course of action indicated, and yet you

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Feel that something else is necessary.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Kirk, McCoy and Sulu enter a purple room with a cube hanging from the ceiling. It is glowing purple. Losira is there. Did I mention she is wearing purple?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who have you come for? Form a circle. You see? You'd better tell us. Tell us. Who have you come for? Who have you come for? You're a very determined woman. For me?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: I am for James T. Kirk.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I need your help.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: Please. I must touch you. I beg it. It is my existence.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've seen the results of your touch.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: But you are my match, James Kirk. I must touch you. Then I will live as one, even to the structure of your cells, the arrangement of chromosomes.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That is how you kill. You'll never reach me.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: A second Losira appears

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Watch out!

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira 2
Text: I am for McCoy.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That computer must be programming these replicas.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The women match our chromosome patterns after they touch us.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: A third Losira enters

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's a very painful affair. I can tell you.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira 3
Text: I am for Sulu.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Shift positions.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we can no longer protect each other.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: Spock and a security guard beam in.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, the computer! Destroy it!

Title: That Which Survives
Context: The guard phasers the cube, and the three Losiras disappear.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, I certainly am glad to see you. I thought you and the Enterprise had been destroyed.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I had the same misgivings about you. We returned and picked up your life form readings only a moment ago.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Returned from where?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: From where this brain had the power to send the Enterprise. Nine hundred and ninety point seven light years across the galaxy. What a remarkable culture this is.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was, Mister Spock. Its defences were run by computer.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: I surmised that, Captain. Its moves were immensely logical. But what people created this? Are there any representatives here?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There were replicas of one of them. But that power to recreate them has been destroyed.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is a loss, Captain.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, you wouldn't have thought so, Mister Spock, if you'd been among us.

Title: That Which Survives
Context: An image appears on a wall

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Losira
Text: My fellow Kalandans, welcome. A disease has destroyed us. Beware of it. After your long journey, I'm sorry to give you only a recorded welcome, but we who have guarded the outpost for you will be dead by the time you take possession of this planet. I am the last of our advanced force left alive. Too late the physicians discovered the cause of this sickness that kills us. In creating this planet, we have accidentally produced a deadly organism. I have awaited the regular supply ship from home for medical assistance, but I doubt now whether it will arrive in time. I will set the outpost controls on automatic. The computer will selectively defend against all life forms but our own. My fellow Kalandans, I, Losira, wish you well.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The previous ships probably spread the disease all through their people. The supply ship that she was waiting for never came. All these thousands of years, she's been waiting to greet people who were dead.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: To do the job of defence, the computer projected a replica of the only image available. Losira's.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The computer was too perfect. It projected so much of Losira's personality into the replica that it felt regret, guilt, at killing. That bought us the time we needed to destroy it. She must have been a remarkable woman.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And beautiful.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Beauty is transitory, Doctor. However, she was evidently highly intelligent.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Five to beam up. I don't agree with you, Mister Spock.

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed, Captain?

Title: That Which Survives
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beauty survives.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5730.2. The planet Ariannus is vital as a transfer point on regular space commercial lanes. It has been attacked by a bacterial invasion which threatens to render it lifeless unless checked. Our mission, to decontaminate it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, our estimated time of arrival for Ariannus?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: At present speed, our eta is three hours, four minutes, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, advise the planet's ministry of health that we'll begin decontamination procedures immediately upon locking into orbit.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, will that present any problems for you?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: None, sir. All tanks are being positioned.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, sensors indicate a space vehicle of some sort ahead.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it within visual range?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Coming into range now, sir. It's following a very erratic course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put it on the screen, extreme magnification.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: A wobbly shuttlecraft appears on the viewscreen.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I think that may be a Starfleet shuttlecraft.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is exactly what it is, Mister Chekov.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It looks like the one reported stolen from Starbase Four two weeks ago.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, try to contact them on command frequency two.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, Captain. No response, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try all frequencies.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. Hailing on all frequencies.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, there is one living creature aboard. Humanoid. He is either injured or ill. His craft shows internal atmospheric leakage. The creature may be suffocating.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Sulu, activate tractor beams.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Tractor beams activated. We have it, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to bring it aboard the hangar deck.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, send a security team to the pressure doors on the hangar deck.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, come with me. Scotty.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Scott takes the conn.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: As we watch the shuttlecraft land, we think it might say USS Enterprise across it's nose.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hangar doors open and clearing for entrance of shuttlecraft. Shuttlecraft approaching hangar deck.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Hangar doors closed, and hangar deck is pressurising.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Acknowledged.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: As the shuttlecraft turns around, NCC 1701/7 is clearly emblazoned on it. Careless special effects.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Context: to security men
Text: We'll enter as soon as the doors open. Go on my command.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: The doors open, and a man falls to the floor. He is white on the right side, and black on the left. This is important.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: McCoy gives the patient an injection.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: You are certain, Doctor, that this pigmentation is the natural condition of this individual?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's what I've recorded, Mister Spock.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do we have any knowledge of a planet that could have produced such a race of beings?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, what do you make of it?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I can't give you any specific circumstance that will explain him.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And judging by looking at him, we know at the very least he is the result of a very dramatic conflict. Spock?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no theory, Captain, from the basic work of Mendel to recent nucleotide studies, which would explain our captive. All gradations of colour from black to brown, to yellow to white are genetically predictable. We must therefore conclude that this alien is that often unaccountable rarity, a mutation, one of a kind.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I would agree. That's the case here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your prognosis, Doctor?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I can't give you one, Jim. I've never worked on anyone like him or anything like him.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yet you are pumping him full of your noxious potions as if he were a human.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: When in doubt, the book prevails, Mister Spock. I've run tests. Blood is blood, even when it's green like yours. The organs are there. They're rearranged to a degree, plus a few I've never seen before. Now, I've enriched the oxygen content of his blood and pumped in a strong stimulant. And I must say his recuperative powers appear to be excellent.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: With your permission, Captain, I shall do some further research and join you on the bridge.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Narrator
Text: )Spock leaves.)

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chapel
Text: He's coming around, Doctor.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, touch and go there for a minute, but you're out of danger now.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're aboard the starship Enterprise.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I've heard of it. It's in the United Fleet of Planets?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Federation. So was the shuttlecraft that you were flying in.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: It was?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't you usually know whose property you've stolen?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I am not a thief.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, certainly no ordinary thief, considering what it is you appropriated.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You're being very loose with your accusations and drawing conclusions without any facts.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I do know you made off with a ship that didn't belong to you.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I do not make off with things. My need gave me the right to use the ship. Mark the word, sir, the use of it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can try those technical evasions on Starfleet Command. That's where you'll be facing your charges.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I'm grateful for your rescue.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't mention it. We're pleased to have caught you. Who are you?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: My name is Lokai.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go on.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: From the planet Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's in the southernmost part of the galaxy, in an uncharted quarter. What are you doing so far from home? (no answer) You understand that when we complete our mission, we'll take you to Starbase where you'll face a very serious charge.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: The charge is trifling. I would've returned the ship as soon as I

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Had what? What were you going to do?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You monotone humans are all alike. First you condemn and then attack. I will answer no more questions.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, however we view him, Captain, he's certainly no ordinary specimen. Lokai, I don't know what's normal for you exactly, but if I had your readings, I'd be the most incredible physical specimen of all time.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've never encountered a being like you. I'd like to know more about you and your planet.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I'm very tired.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And very evasive. Or at least not fully responsive. Now, then,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I insist, I'm extremely tired. Made so by your vindictive cross-examinations. I will answer no more questions.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Kirk goes to a desk monitor.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Lieutenant Uhura here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Notify Starbase Four that we've recovered its shuttlecraft, and it will be returned along with its user as soon as we've completed our mission at Ariannus.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, if you're satisfied that the mutation theory is applicable, I'll make a note of it in my report.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Unless we get more information from him, it'll have to serve.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Intercom whistle

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, contact with alien ship, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right there. Notify Mister Spock.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put the ship on the viewing screen, Mister Sulu. Magnification. Still nothing, Mister Chekov.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I verify, sir, it's out there.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maximum magnification. I draw a blank, Mister Spock. Your response?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No malfunction, sir. The reading persists.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is a vessel out there, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Could it be a Romulan ship using their cloaking device?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. This would not be a Romulan vessel. It is totally alien in configuration. Motive power unknown. Small size of the craft indicates a rapid scout vessel, one or two-man crew.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, I've tried all hailing frequencies. Negative, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Weaponry on the vessel, Spock?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing identifiable. The craft appears to be built for speed rather than combat.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Something out there can't be seen. Explanation?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: None. Completely elusive. In fact, it's invisible.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Invisible. Malfunction?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no sensor failure. The readings persist.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It's headed straight for us!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Evasive action.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It shifts with us, sir. And we're pushing to the limit!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflector shields activated, Mister Sulu.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Automatic, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We're on collision course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's out of control or a suicide mission.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sound warning for collision. Red Alert.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Brace yourself for collision. Brace yourself.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Nothing happens.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Read out, Mister Spock.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: It just disintegrated. Fascinating.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it now?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is gone now, Captain, but it seems to have deposited an alien presence.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Right here, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: By the turbolift doors is a man, white on the left side, black on the right.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain, Spock. One of a kind?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I am Bele.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of the planet Cheron, no doubt.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Forgive my unorthodox arrival.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your mode of travel was also unorthodox. Secure from Red Alert. What happened to your vehicle?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: It served me long and durably. Unfortunately, the strain of arduous pursuit has exceeded even its advanced qualities. I was just able to complete this trip and disembark in time, or I would have disintegrated in space with it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: A most unique craft. Pity it couldn't be salvaged for our study.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Yes. It was sheathed in special materials that rendered it invisible.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What brings you to us?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You bear precious cargo, Lokai. He has taken refuge aboard this ship. I am here to claim him.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All personnel aboard this vessel are subject to my command. No one claims anyone without due process.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: My apologies, Captain. I overstepped my powers. Claim is undoubtedly an unfortunate word.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is your authorisation? From what source?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I am chief officer of the Commission on Political Traitors. Lokai was tried and convicted of treason, but had escaped. May I see him, please?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He's in Sickbay. Remember, since you're aboard the Enterprise, you're bound by its regulations.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: With your permission, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Well, Lokai, it's a pleasure to see you again. This time I'm sure our joining will be of a more permanent nature. Captain, you are to be congratulated. Never before has Lokai been rendered so quiescent.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I will not return to Cheron with him, to a land of murdering oppressors!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I told you where you were going. I allowed your fellow countryman here simply as a courtesy.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: And you see how this killer repays you, as he repays all his benefactors.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Benefactors? He's a liar. He raided our homes, tore us from our families, herded us together like cattle and then sold us as slaves!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: They were savages, Captain. We took them into our hearts, our homes. We educated them.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Yes, just education enough to serve the master race.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You were the product of our love! And you repaid us with murder.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Why should a slave show mercy to the enslaver?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Slaves? That was changed thousands of years ago. You were freed.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Freed? Were we free to be men? Free to be husbands and fathers? Free to live our lives in equality and dignity?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Yes, you were free, if you knew how to use your freedom. You were free enough to slaughter and to burn all the things that had been built!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I tried to break the chains of a hundred million people. My only crime is that I failed. To that I do plead guilty.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: There is an order in things. He asked for utopia in a day. It can't be done.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Not in a day. And not in ten times ten thousand years by your thinking. To you, we are a loathsome breed who will never be ready. Genocide for my people is the plan for your utopia.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You insane, you filthy little plotter of ruin. You vicious subverter of every decent thought. Oh, you're coming back to pay for your crimes!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I know you and all those with whom you're plotting to take power permanently. When I return to Cheron, you will understand what power is. I will have armies of followers.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's now very clear you know each other extremely well, gentlemen. The only service this ship can offer is to bring you together. It is not a battlefield.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Captain, I led revolutionaries, not criminals. I demand political asylum. This ship is a sanctuary.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll tell you once more. For you, this ship is a prison.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Captain, it is imperative that you return Lokai to Cheron for judgment.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commissioner, Cheron is not a member of the Federation. No treaties have ever been signed. Your demand for possession of this prisoner cannot be honoured. There are no extradition procedures to allow it. Is that clear, Commissioner Bele?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Captain, I hope you will be sensible.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you mean?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Co-operation.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I cannot take sides.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Since I am without a vessel to return to Cheron, I insist that you take us there immediately.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Impossible. I have a mission to accomplish. There's a planet to be decontaminated. Millions of lives are at stake. Once that has been completed, I'll return to Starbase Four and turn you both over to the authorities. You can make your case to them.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I am sorry, Captain. That will not be satisfactory, not at all satisfactory.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Commissioner, as a visiting dignitary from a far planet, I offer you every hospitality aboard this ship. Choose any other course,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You're the captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I am. I think we can consider your problem settled. At least for the present. I have ordered guest quarters for you on deck six.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele leaves with a security escort.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And I suggest you get a great deal of rest, especially your vocal chords. It seems you'll have a double opportunity to practise your oratory on Starbase Four.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Chekov to Captain Kirk. Chekov to Captain Kirk. Urgent.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, we're off course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, get back on course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: That's just it, sir. The ship's taken a new heading all by itself.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll be right there.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have you located the malfunction?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir. The ship is unresponsive. We're moving away from Ariannus.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explanation, Mister Spock?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Elusive, Captain. I am investigating.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I can't understand it. I simply have no control.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to engineering.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, we're suddenly off course. Check our manoeuvering controls.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Hold. Captain, no malfunction indicated.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Switch to auxiliary.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Out. (presses a lot of buttons.) Engineer to bridge.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: On auxiliary, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by for check. Scotty, we're still off course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll be right up.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speed, Mister Chekov.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We're moving at warp eight.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And new course?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: four oh three mark seven. Straight for the Coal Sack if there is no letup.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, put the ship on Red Alert. All hands, this is the captain. The ship is on Red Alert.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat, the ship is on Red Alert. There has been an unidentified malfunction in the ship's directional control.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat, the ship is off course and out of our control.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: As the guard heads off to his battle station, Lokai dashes out of Sickbay.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Scott enters.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Our new heading, Mister Chekov?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Four oh three mark seven.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Confirmed, Captain. Holding pattern. Co-ordinates now indicate we are charting course to (pause) Captain, Cheron lies between four oh three mark seven and mark nine.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele enters

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: We're on the way to Cheron. Captain, this ship is now under my direction. For fifty thousand of your terrestrial years, I have been pursuing Lokai through the galaxy. I have not travelled this far, this long, only to give him up. This ship goes where my will drives it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, we are now at warp ten and the speed is increasing!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Lokai enters

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, course is now clearly straight for Cheron, despite all efforts to direct us to Ariannus.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I will not return to Cheron. Captain, you must guarantee me sanctuary.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: He cannot help you now. You are lost, Lokai. You're on the way to judgment, to final punishment.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Stop him.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You evil mound of filth. Not this time.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: My cause is just. You must help me. All of you must help me.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Oh, the old cry. Pity me, pity me. Everywhere he's gone, he's been helped to escape. On every planet he's found fools who bleed for him and shed tears for the oppressed one. But there is no escape for you on this ship. This is your last sanctuary.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Kill him. Kill him!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're two of a kind.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: And we are both going to Cheron. You cannot change the course of this ship any more than you can change me. This ship goes where I want it to go.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, put them both in the brig.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: The security guards are held back by forcefields.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Phasers on stun. Fire. (no effect)

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Your phasers are ineffective against our shields. You are helpless, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: What a fool I am, expecting help from someone like you.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This ship is going to Ariannus.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: No, this ship is going to Cheron. I will let nothing interfere.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We are going to Ariannus. The lives of a billion people make no other choice possible.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You are being obtuse, Captain. I am permitting no choice. My will now controls this, and nothing can break it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bele, I am captain of this ship, and it will follow whatever course I set for it, or I will order its destruction.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You're bluffing.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I will destroy it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You can no more destroy this ship than I can change colour.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, tie in the bridge to the master computer.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, destruct sequence. Are you ready to copy?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Working.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to verify destruct sequence code one. Computer, this is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. Destruct sequence one, code one, one A.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Narrator
Text: COMPUTER Voice and code one, one A verified and correct. Sequence one complete.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Commander Spock, science officer. Destruct sequence number two, code one, one A, two B.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Voice and code verified and correct. Sequence two complete.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: This is Lieutenant Commander Scott, chief engineering officer of the USS Enterprise. Destruct sequence number three, code one B, two B, three.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Voice and code one B, two B, three verified and correct. Destruct sequence completed and engaged. Awaiting final code for thirty second countdown.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, has the ship returned to the course set for it by my orders?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. We are still headed directly for Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Destruct sequence engaged. Awaiting final code for thirty second countdown.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer, this is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. Begin thirty second countdown. Code zero, zero, zero, destruct zero.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Thirty seconds. twenty nine, twenty eight, twenty seven, (break) twenty five seconds,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see you prevent the computer from fulfilling my commands.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Twenty seconds,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: From five to zero, no command in the universe can prevent the computer from fulfilling its destruct orders.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Fifteen seconds,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can use your will to drag this ship to Cheron. But I command the computer. Mine is the final command.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Ten, nine, eight, seven, six,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I agree!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Computer. This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. Code one, two, three continuity. Abort destruct order. Repeat code one, two, three continuity. Abort destruct order.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Computer
Text: Destruct order aborted. Destruct order aborted.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, is this ship headed for Ariannus?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. The Enterprise is now moving in a circular course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: And at warp ten, we're going now here mighty fast.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: I warned you of his treachery. Kill him!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're waiting for you to fulfil your commitment, Commissioner.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Captain, I am happy to have you complete your mission of mercy to the planet Ariannus. It was madness to interfere with such a worthwhile endeavour. But, if you will, upon completion, please take me and my traitorous captive to Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I make no deals for control of this ship, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: The ship's course is now in your control.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship's course?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise is now on course to Ariannus, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Speed, Scotty?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Warp six and smoothly operating, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Lieutenant Uhura, cancel Red Alert.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me reaffirm my position, gentlemen. I could put you in the brig for what you have done, but I won't do it because you are new to this part of the galaxy, which is governed by the United Federation of Planets. We live in peace with full exercise of individual rights. The need to resort to violence and force has long since passed, and it will not be tolerated aboard this ship. You are free to move about the ship. I hope that you'll take the opportunity to know more about the Federation through its best representatives, my crew. But let me make it clear. I will stand for no interference with the function of this ship. All hands, return to normal routine. Captain out.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele leaves, with an escort.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You speak very well, Captain. Your words promise justice for all.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We try, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Yes, well, I have learned to wait for actions. After Ariannus, what is justice? I shall wait to see it dispensed.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Lokai leaves

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. Two irrevocably hostile humanoids.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Disgusting is what I call them.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: That description is not scientifically accurate.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, the word disgusting describes exactly what I feel about those two.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's enough for today. Those two are beginning to affect you.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Crew are sitting at tables, not playing chess, while Lokai expounds his case. Spock and we are listening from outside.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: And I know from my actions you must all think me a volcanic hothead, erupting lava from my nostrils at danger signals that are only figments of my imagination. But believe me, my friends, there can be no moment when I can have my guard down where such as Bele is present. So what happens? I act the madman out of the anger and frustration he forces upon me, and thereby prove his point that I am a madman.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No one knows how he'll react under pressure, Lokai.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: After all, we are only human.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Ah, Mister Chekov, therein lies my lack of ability to alert you and your captain to the real threat of someone like Bele. You see, you are from the planet Earth. There is no persecution on your planet. How can you understand my fear, my apprehension, my degradation, my suffering?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: There was persecution on Earth once. I remember reading about it in my history class.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, but it happened way back in the twentieth century. There's no such primitive thinking today.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You have read about it in history, I see. How can I make your flesh know how it feels to see all those who are like you, and only because they are like you, despised, slaughtered, and even worse, denied the simplest bit of decency that is a living being's right? Do you know what it would be like to be dragged out of your hovel into a war on another planet? A battle that will serve your oppressor and bring death to you and your brothers?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Putting the matter into the hands of your Starfleet Command is, of course, the proper procedure. How long will it be before we hear from them, Captain?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I expect the answer is already on its way.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Well, then, let us drink to their wise solution to our problem.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's do that.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commissioner, Starfleet Command may not arrive at the solution you anticipate. There is the matter of the shuttlecraft which Lokai appropriated. The interrogation of that matter may be of paramount importance to Starfleet.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Gentlemen, we are discussing a question of degree. Surely, stealing a shuttlecraft cannot be equated with the importance of murdering thousands of people.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: We do not know that Lokai has done that.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: One thing we are agreed on is that Lokai is a criminal.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Commissioner. The one thing we're agreed upon is that Lokai took a shuttlecraft.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Intercom whistle

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse me.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Uhura to Captain Kirk.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I have a communication from Starfleet Command, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, read it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Starfleet Command extends greetings to Commissioner Bele of the planet Cheron. His urgent request to be transported to his planet with the man he claims prisoner has been taken under consideration.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It is with great regret that we cannot honour that request. Intergalactic treaty clearly specifies that no being can be extradited without due process. In view of the circumstances, we have no doubt that after a hearing at Starbase, Commissioner Bele will be permitted to retain his prisoner and be provided transportation

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's enough. Thank you.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: As always, Lokai has managed to gain allies.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, wait a minute, Commissioner,

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Even if they don't recognise themselves as being such. Yes, he will evade, delay, and escape again and in the process put thousands of innocent beings at each other's throats, getting them to kill and maim for a cause which they have no stake in, but which he will force them to violently espouse by twisting their minds with his lies, his loathsome accusations and his foul threats.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can assure you, Commissioner, that our minds will not be twisted, not by Lokai, nor by you.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: It is obvious to the most simpleminded that Lokai is of an inferior breed.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: The obvious visual evidence, Commissioner, is that he is of the same breed as yourself.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Are you blind, Commander Spock? Well, look at me. Look at me!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're black on one side and white on the other.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I am black on the right side.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I fail to see the significant difference.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Lokai is white on the right side. All of his people are white on the right side.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Commissioner, perhaps the experience of my own planet Vulcan may set an example of some value to you. Vulcan was in danger of being destroyed by the same conditions and characteristics which threaten to destroy Cheron. We were once a people like yourselves, wildly emotional, often committed to irrationally opposing points of view, leading, of course, to death and destruction. Only the discipline of logic saved my planet from extinction.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
