Text: Commander Spock, I am delighted that Vulcan was saved, but you cannot expect Lokai and people like him to act with self-discipline any more than you can expect a planet to stop orbiting its sun.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let Lokai state his grievances. Hear him, listen to him. Maybe he can change. Maybe he wants to change his image.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: He cannot change.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Change is the essential process of all existence. For instance, the people of Cheron must have once been mono-coloured.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You mean like both of you?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must have been a time, long ago no doubt, when that was true.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Intercom whistle

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Excuse me. Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're orbiting Ariannus, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. Commence decontamination procedures when ready. Advise when complete.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: At once, sir. Scott out.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: I once heard that on some of your planets people believe they are descended from apes.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: The actual theory is that all life-forms evolved from the lower levels to the more advanced stages.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready for decontamination procedure.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Ready, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Ready, Mister Scott.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu, lock into co-ordinates requested by Ariannus.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Chekov, position tanks for spray release.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Tanks positioned.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, advise Ariannus the mission is to begin on signal. All ground precautions must be ready.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Ariannus says go ahead.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, let 'er rip.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: The planet they are orbiting turns orange, then white and blue

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Captain Kirk.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: First run complete, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Repeat procedure for maximum effect.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Ready to repeat decontamination procedure.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Ready, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: This time the oceans and land masses are very clearly seen. Not a cloud in the sky.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're completing the final orbit of Ariannus, sir. I'm awaiting instructions to set course for the next destination.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very good. We'll be right up.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Set directional controls for Starbase Four. Kirk out. Will you join us on the bridge?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: There is nothing I would like more.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5730.7. Having completed our mission to Ariannus, the Enterprise is now on course to Starbase Four. The crew is on normal routine, and we are proceeding without incident.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Chekov is hunched over Spock's station.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Trouble, Mister Chekov?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I don't rightly know, Mister Spock. I was trying to programme for Starbase Four as ordered. I can't get a response.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It just seemed to go dead, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, some of the memory banks of the computer are burned out.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you determine which ones?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: The directional control and the self-destruct, Captain, are both burnt out. I did it like this.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele waves his hands over the computer controls and they flash in electrical short-circuits

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5730.6. In a deliberate act of sabotage, Commissioner Bele has burned out our destruct mechanism and through the power of his will has again taken over directional control of the Enterprise.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Lokai enters

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Now can we go to Cheron without any more discussion?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At the moment, I seem to have no choice.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: So this is justice after Ariannus! You have signed my death warrant. I warned you what to expect. Will you continue to let this mockery of justice go on? If you are partisans of justice, prove it! Kill him!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We are not killers.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: What do you do, carry justice on your tongues? You will beg for it, but you won't fight or die for it.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: After so many years of leading the fight, you seem very much alive.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: I doubt that the same can be said for many of his followers.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: You're finished, Lokai! We've got your kind penned in on Cheron into little districts, and it's not going to change. You've combed the galaxy and come up with nothing but mono-coloured trash, do-gooders and bleeding hearts. You're dead, you half-white!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You useless pieces of bland flesh. I'll take you with me, you half-black.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: They lunge for each others throats, and send off electrical charges.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bele, you keep this up, and you'll never get to Cheron with your prisoner. The rest of this ship will be irreparably damaged. This will be your final battlefield. Your fifty thousand years of pursuit will have been wasted.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele and Lokai separate

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you, Lokai, will die here in space. You'll inspire no more disciples. Your cause will be ended.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Remember, Captain, political sanctuary is my right. I am your prisoner. Honour that right, or the fight will go on and your ship will burn up.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've made your point.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: If you listen to his legalistic trickery, I shall have to destroy this ship and everybody aboard.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I understand. Will you return the Enterprise to my control?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Why not?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, have repairs on directional control been completed?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Re-routed.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check controls and co-ordinates.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Controls operating. The Enterprise is responding as always. Captain, it's beautiful.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Locking onto co-ordinates.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are within scanning range of Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it within visual range?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Coming within visual range now, Captain.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Chekov, put it on the screen. Extreme magnification. What are you picking up?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Several large cities, uninhabited. Extensive traffic systems, barren of traffic. Lower animal sand vegetation encroaching on the cities. No sapient life-forms registering at all, Captain. There is no evidence of natural disaster, yet there are vast numbers of unburied corpses in all cities.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You mean, all the people are dead?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: All dead, Captain. They have annihilated each other totally.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: My people, all dead?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Commissioner, all of them.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: No one alive?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: None at all, sir.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: Your band of murderers did this.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: Your genocidal maniacs did this!

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: They attack each other again.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop it! What's the matter with you two? Didn't you hear Spock? Your planet is dead! There's nobody alive on Cheron because of hate. The cause you fought about no longer exists. Give yourselves time to breathe. Give up your hate. You're welcome to live with us. Listen to me. You both must end up dead if you don't stop hating.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Lokai
Text: You're an idealistic dreamer.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Lokai leaves

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bele. The chase is finished.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Bele
Text: He must not escape me.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Where can he go?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Bele leaves

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bele.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Shall I alert security, sir?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Lieutenant. Where can they run?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Through the ship, knocking over crewmen, whilst imagining the buildings burning on their home planet.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I have located them on ship's sensors. Bele is chasing Lokai on deck three. Bele is passing recreation room three, approaching the crewmen's lounge. Lokai is running past the crewmen's lounge. Lokai has just arrived on deck five. Passing recreation room three.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Context: Lokai beams himself away

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, someone has activated the transporter mechanism.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, anyone in the transporter room?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Transporter room is clear. However, there is a life-form materialising on the planet. It is Lokai. He is back on Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's nobody there to try him. His judges are all dead.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the transporter mechanism has been activated again.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is Bele, Captain. And another life-form has appeared on Cheron.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: It doesn't make any sense.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: To expect sense from two mentalities of such extreme viewpoints is not logical.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But their planet's dead. Does it matter now which one's right?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not to Lokai and Bele. All that matters to them is their hate.

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Do you suppose that's all they ever had, sir?

Title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, but that's all they have left. Warp factor two, Mister Sulu. Set course for Starbase Four.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's Log, stardate 5718.3. The Enterprise is orbiting Elba Two, a planet with a poisonous atmosphere where the Federation maintains an asylum for the few remaining incorrigible criminally insane of the galaxy. We are bringing a revolutionary new medicine to them, a medicine with which the Federation hopes to eliminate mental illness for all time. I am transporting down with Mister Spock, and we're delivering the medicine to Doctor Donald Cory, the governor of the colony.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Donald, good to see you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Governor.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Gentlemen, you don't know what a treat this is for me. It's been too long since I've had company. The force field's back in place now. That means you two are trapped here, and I'm not accepting any excuses for your not dining with me.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'd be delighted.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Governor, you indicated one additional inmate since our last visit, making a total of fifteen. Is that correct?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: It is. The rehabilitation programme isn't progressing too well, and I have my doubts about the effectiveness of this medicine too.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, Donald, are you becoming a pessimist?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: I'm afraid I have.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: A total of fifteen incurably insane out of billions is not what I would call an excessive figure. Who is the new inmate?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Garth. Garth of Izar, a former Starship fleet Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: He calls up a picture on a monitor

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When I was a cadet at the Academy, his exploits were required reading. He was one of my heroes. I'd like to see him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Of course.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Cory leads them down a corridor, using a hand device to deactivate and reactivate forcefields rather than locking and unlocking doors.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Context: an Orion woman
Text: Captain! You're making a mistake.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Captain Kirk is pressed for time at the moment, Marta.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: There's nothing the matter with me! Can't you see just by looking at me? Can't you tell just by listening?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: She sounds rational enough, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I am rational.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it you want to tell me?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I can't tell you in front of him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're afraid to talk in front of Governor Cory?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: He isn't really Governor Cory at all, that's just it.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: She's been saying that for days now. Our medical staff can't figure out why.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: They pass an Andorian and a Tellarite

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Here's Garth. He's been unusually disturbed, and we've had to impose additional restraint.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: The occupant of the cell is suspended in mid-air, and looks exactly like their host!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cory?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Context: in cell
Text: Yes, Jim, I'm Cory. It's true. He tricked you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: The Cory with Kirk and Spock changes into Garth. He unlocks the other cells and the occupants come out.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You said you wanted to see me, Captain. Well, here I am.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: during the opening titles, Kirk has been put in the cell with Cory, and Spock is dragged away by the Andorian and Tellarite, apparently unconscious.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Your Vulcan friend is still alive, Captain. My phaser was set to stun, not to kill. He'll be quite comfortable. Almost as comfortable as you and our esteemed governor.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Garth, do you have to make him suffer like that?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You will address me by my proper title, Kirk.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry. I should've said Captain Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I am Lord Garth, formerly of Izar, and I lead the future masters of the universe.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Lord Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You Earth people are a stiff necked lot, aren't you?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Release him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I'm afraid that subjugating you won't be enough. You must be confined. And all the people of the galaxy who will not bow to my will must be confined or destroyed.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Captain Garth, listen to me.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Oh ho! Our beloved governor has decided to address us, and we have not given him our permission to speak.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you so afraid of him that you must keep him pinned?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Context: releasing Cory
Text: I'm afraid of no one. You're all powerless against me.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Now what have you done with the medicine?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: The medicine? You mean the poison. I destroyed it.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Destroyed it? It was your only hope.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Silence! The chatter of inferior weaklings wearies me, and it's time I took command of the Enterprise. You'll help me, of course.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: My crew mutinied. The first use I will make of the Enterprise is to hunt them down and punish them for that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The crew of the Enterprise will also mutiny.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: But they won't. You see, Captain, there's a helpful technique I've mastered.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: And Garth changes into Kirk.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Good bye, darling. I'll miss you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Garth-Kirk and Marta leave

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Governor Cory, how do you feel?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: All right. There is no help for any of us if that madman is in command of the Enterprise. He boasts that he's created the most powerful explosive in the universe, and I believe him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How does he manage to change form at will?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: The people of Antos taught him the techniques of cellular metamorphosis to restore the destroyed parts of his body. By himself, he later learned to use the technique to recreate himself into any form he wished. The first time we knew about it was when a guard, seeing what he thought was me in Garth's cell, released him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He was such a genius. What a waste.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Kirk is really Garth, remember. The Andorian and Tellarite are with him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Force field is on. Good. Remain here out of sight until I give the order to join me. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam me aboard.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir. Queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said beam me aboard.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: I said, queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We have no time for chess problems. Beam me aboard!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm following your orders, Captain. Queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just testing. Be in touch with you later.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Context: throws a tantrum
Text: No! No! No! (ends up thumping the floor until he changes beck to Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: I gave him the sign. Why didn't he give me the countersign?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Something's wrong.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Using the chess problem was the Captain's own suggestion. He couldn't have forgotten it, and I can't believe he was testing me. Lieutenant, re establish communication.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir. There's no response, Mister Scott.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Send an armed detail to the transporter room immediately.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Sulu, what do your sensors show?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We can't beam anybody down, sir. The force field on the planet is in full operation, and all forms of transport into the asylum dome are blocked off.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: We could blast our way through the field, but only at the risk of destroying the Captain, Mister Spock and any other living thing on Elba Two.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How can we be powerful enough to wipe out a planet and still be so helpless?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: We are going to take the Enterprise, do you hear me? We are going to take her if I have to shatter every bone in Captain Kirk's body.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Captain? Captain Kirk? Well, I hope you haven't been too uncomfortable, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you for your concern. All in all, it's been rather restful.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Good. Still, I've been quite remiss in my duties as your host. I did invite you down to dinner, as you may recall.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd forgotten.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: But I haven't. You and Mister Spock are to be my guests.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where is Mister Spock?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Right here. Marta!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock enters with Marta, the Andorian and the Tellarite

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Why can't I blow off just one of his ears?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Stop that, Marta. Mister Spock will think we're lacking in hospitality. Won't you join us, Captain?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: He lets Kirk out of the cell

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How are you, Mister Spock?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Very well indeed, thank you, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Isn't Governor Cory joining us?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: No, the governor doesn't seem to be on the guest list.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An oversight?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: An intentional one. The governor's fasting.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In that case, we must decline with thanks.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Context: draws a weapon
Text: Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Don't be a fool, Jim. Go along with him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Good advice, Governor. Well, Captain? You'll find we set a handsome table, and the entertainment is most enjoyable.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're very persuasive.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Yes, I am. I certainly am.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Other inmates are also there. The current entertainment is the Andorian and Tellarite playing 'wheelbarrow'. When they've finished, Marta goes over to Kirk and starts fondling him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Keep your hands off Kirk! You treacherous thing!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: You're jealous!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I am above that sort of thing. The Captain is annoyed by your attentions, that's all.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Am I annoying you, dearest?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not really.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: He finds me fascinating and you're bothered by it. Admit it.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I may have you beaten to death.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: No, you won't, because I am the most beautiful woman on this planet.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You're the only woman on this planet, you stupid cow.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Well, I'm the most beautiful woman in this galaxy!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You're repulsive!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I'm beautiful! And I'm intelligent too. I write poetry, and I paint marvellous pictures. And I am a wonderful dancer.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Lies! All lies! You are the greatest liar I have ever met! Let me hear one poem you've written.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: If you like.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Context: muttering
Text: If you could create a diversion, I might be able to find the control room and open the force field.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All we need is a few seconds, if Scotty has alerted the security detail.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Gentlemen, courtesy for the performer.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Shall I compare thee to a summer's day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate. Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, and summer's lease hath all too soon

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You wrote that?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Yesterday, as a matter of fact.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: It was written by an Earth man named Shakespeare a long time ago!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Which does not alter the fact that I wrote it again yesterday! I think it's one of my best poems, don't you?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I may kill you with my bare hands! (Marta runs to the other men) Actually, Captain, she is a superb dancer. Marta, my dear, won't you dance for our guests? That was not a request.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Marta starts one of those sinuous Orion dances, although not as good as Vina.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Marvellous, isn't she, Captain?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, er, incredible.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: What is your reaction, Mister Spock?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I find it mildly interesting and somewhat nostalgic, if I understand the use of that word.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Nostalgic?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. It is somewhat reminiscent of the dances that Vulcan children do in nursery school. Of course, the children are not so well co-ordinated.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Marta's dance brings her up close and personal with both Garth and Kirk.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: She's yours if you wish, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, er, thank you. That's, er, very magnanimous of you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You'll find that I am magnanimous to my friends and merciless to my enemies, and I want you, both of you, to be my friends.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: On what, precisely, is our friendship to be based?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Upon the firmest of foundations, Mister Spock. Enlightened self interest. You, Captain, are second only to me as the finest military commander in the galaxy.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's very flattering. I am primarily an explorer now, Captain Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: And so have I been. I have charted more new worlds than any man in history.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And tried to destroy Antos Four.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Why?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Well, I could say because they were actively hostile to the Federation.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you could say, but that would be untrue.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Agreed. Actually they were quite harmless, and they made me whole when I was maimed and dying. And in my gratitude, I offered them the galaxy. They rejected me, and I condemned them to death.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: How could you, a Starship fleet Captain, believe that a Federation crew would blindly obey your order to destroy the entire Antos race, a people famous for their benevolence and peaceful pursuits?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: That was my only miscalculation. I had changed. I had risen above this decadent weakness which still has you in its command, by the way, Captain. My crew had not. I couldn't sway them, but my new crew, the men in this room, will obey my orders without question. Gentlemen, you have eyes but you cannot see. Galaxies surround us, limitless vistas. And yet the Federation would have us grub away like some ants on some somewhat larger than usual anthill. But I am not an insect. I am master of the universe, and I must claim my domain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I agree there was a time when war was necessary, and you were our greatest warrior. I studied your victory at Axanar when I was a cadet. In fact it's still required reading at the Academy.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: As well it should be.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. But my first visit to Axanar was as a new fledged cadet on a peace mission.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Peace mission! Politicians and weaklings!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They were humanitarians and statesmen, and they had a dream. A dream that became a reality and spread throughout the stars, a dream that made Mister Spock and me brothers.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Mister Spock, do you consider Captain Kirk and yourself brothers?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk speaks somewhat figuratively and with undue emotion. However, what he says is logical and I do, in fact, agree with it.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Blind! Truly blind! Captain Kirk is your commanding officer and you are his subordinate. That is all. Yet, Mister Spock, you are a worthy commander in your own right, and in my fleet, you will surely have a Starship to command.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Please forgive me, but exactly where is your fleet?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Out there waiting for me. They will flock to my cause, and for good reason. Limitless power, limitless wealth, and solar systems ruled by the elite. We, gentlemen, are that elite, and we must take what is rightfully ours from the decadent weaklings that now hold it.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Garth

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Lord Garth!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: As you wish. At any rate, you must be aware of the fact that you are attempting to recreate the disaster which resulted in your becoming an inmate in this place.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I was betrayed and treated barbarically.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: On the contrary. You were treated with justice, and with compassion which you failed to show towards any of your intended victims. Logically, therefore, one must assume

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Remove this animal!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock is hauled away, and Garth draws his phaser as Kirk stands. Then he becomes friendly again.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Try some of this wine, Captain. It has a robust, full bodied flavour which you'll find diverting.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No thank you. I prefer to join Mister Spock.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: And I prefer that you remain here. Marta, my dear. We found your little divertissement enchanting, didn't we, Captain? But there's more to come. The entertainment has merely begun. By the way, I assume you play chess.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Occasionally.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: So do I. How would you respond to queen to queen's level three?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sure you're aware that there are an infinite number of countermoves.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I'm interested in only one.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't for the life of me imagine which one.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: For the life of me is a phrase well chosen. It could literally come to that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dead I am of no use to you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: But I can make you long for death, beg for death.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: In the midnight of November, when the dead man's fare is nigh, and the danger in the valley, and the anger in the sky. I wrote that this morning. Do you like it?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I think it's very good.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Tell him what he wants to know and we'll go away together.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: But you must. I beg of you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Oh, don't beg, Marta! It's degrading. Queen to queen's level three, Captain. You'll talk freely and quite soon.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: A chunky chair is wheeled into the room.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: What you see before you, Captain, is my latest invention. Quite ordinary in appearance, almost primitive, wouldn't you say?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I recognise it. It's used for rehabilitation purposes.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: It helped many men back to health.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Appearances can be deceiving. Once it was a part of the rehabilitation process, and as such, quite painless. And I might add useless too. It made men docile and of no use to me. I've added certain refinements to the use of ultrasonic waves. The chair is no longer painless. Put the governor in it. Queen to queen's level three, Captain Kirk? It is, in fact, exquisitely painful, as you will now see.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: The lights either side of Cory's head, swirl, and he begins to pant and groan.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Interesting, isn't it? The pain is real and can be prolonged indefinitely, because there is no actual destruction of tissue.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop it!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Garth turns it off.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Of course, Captain. You have but to ask. Now, as you can see, he has not been harmed physically, yet the memory of the exquisite torment remains. Queen to queen's level three, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Too bad. Remove our distinguished governor. Put Captain Kirk in the chair.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Kirk tries to make a break for it, but fails.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: No, you mustn't do that!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You really are becoming offensive to me, my dear. Don't make it necessary for me to put you in it. Queen to queen's level three, Captain Kirk.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Please, stop it!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You want him, don't you?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Yes.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Badly enough to join him?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Listen to me, my Lord Garth. I can get him to tell me what you want to know.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: It might be interesting to have you try.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: No breakthrough?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No, Mister Scott. Still no response from the planet.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Sensor readings?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The force field is weakest on the far side of the planet. We can send down a shuttlecraft carrying a team in environmental suits.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It won't work, Scotty. They'd have to cover thousands of miles through poisonous atmosphere before they'd ever reach the asylum.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, you're right. Even if they made it, they couldn't carry anything powerful enough to break through the asylum dome. Only the ship herself could do that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Probably kill Jim and Spock.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scot
Text: Doctor, they may already be dead.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Narrator
Text: In an orange room, Marta gently gives the waking Kirk a drink of water.)

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Slowly, darling, slowly. Rest.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this more of Garth's persuasion, Marta?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I told him I'd discover your secret. I lied. I would have told him anything to save you from that torment.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I believe you mean that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I do. (kisses him) This is where I've longed to be. I think I knew I loved you from the moment I first saw you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Marta. Marta, I can help you, but I must get to the Enterprise to do that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: That's not possible.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, it is. It is if I can get to the control room and remove the force field, then Garth is finished.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: Garth is my leader.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He will lead you to destruction. He's already destroyed the medicine that could have helped you. But there's more medicine aboard the ship.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: I'll help you, but you must wait. You do see that, don't you? Soon your friend Spock will be here and then

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: At least I've arranged that much.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How did you manage that?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: A convincing lie told to a guard who finds me desirable. Darling.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: She kisses him again, then reaches under the pillow for a dagger. Kirk disarms her, she crawls after the blade and Spock arrives.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Marta
Text: No, you mustn't stop me. He's my lover and I have to kill him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock neck-pinches her.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: She seems to have worked out an infallible method for assuring permanent male fidelity. Interesting.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm very glad to see you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Captain. (draws a phaser) We're now armed. I presume we shall try to reach the control room.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you presume correctly.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: They head along the corridor, until they see a Tellarite standing guard. Spock stuns him. Kirk takes his weapon and they head into the control room.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Force field is now off, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, it's the captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: You had us worried.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, I want a fully armed security detail beamed down here on the double.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: They're already in the transporter room, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And have Doctor McCoy prepare additional medicine as quickly as possible.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I suggest you return to the ship at once. Your safety is vital to the Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Waiting for your order, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I also request permission to remain here in charge of the security team when they beam down.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well, Spock.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Still waiting, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, the Captain's life is in immediate danger. Beam him aboard at once. The security team will be entrusted to me.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Queen to queen's level three. Repeat. Queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's waiting for the proper reply, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Give the countersign as ordered.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, Mister Spock will give the countersign.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Give him the countersign, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Security detail, standby to beam down.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock reactivates the forcefield and turns into Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Blast away, Captain, if you can. Do you think I'm fool enough to give you a charged phaser?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What have you done with Spock? Where is he?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I have done nothing with him as of yet, but I do have plans for him. The Vulcan will die rather horribly, and his death will be on your conscience.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Garth

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Lord Garth!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, sir. Captain Garth, Starship fleet Captain. That's an honourable title.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: And I was the greatest of them all, wasn't I?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, you were. Yes. But you're a sick man now, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I have never been more healthy.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, think. Think back to what you were before the accident that sent you to Antos Four. Try.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I can't remember. It's almost as if I had died and was reborn.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I, I can remember. You were the finest student at the Academy, the finest Starship Captain. You were the prototype, the model for the rest of us.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Yes, I do remember that. It was a great responsibility, but one I was proud to bear.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you bore it well. And the disease that changed you, it's not your fault. And the terrible things you did since then, not truly responsible.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I don't want to hear any more. You're weak, you're trying to drain my strength.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'm not. I want you to find what you once had. I want you to go back to the greatness that you've lost, Captain Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: I am Lord Garth! Master of the universe! You doubt me only because I have not as yet had my coronation.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, sir, listen to me. I

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Stop! On your knees.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: On your knees before me! All the others before me have failed. Alexander, Caesar, Napoleon, Hitler, Lee Kuan, Krotus! All of them are dust! But I will triumph! I will make the ultimate conquest!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Kirk reaches for the forcefield control and gets stunned for his efforts.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: The tables are being rearranged.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: The throne must be higher. It must be higher than anything else in this room. Use that table as a pedestal. Ah, welcome back, Captain Kirk. I'm glad you could make it for the coronation.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Coronation?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Yes. Oh, I know that even a real throne is no more than merely a chair, but the symbolism is important, don't you agree?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I agree. You'll wear a crown too, I presume?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: But again, just as a token. Not impressive in itself, but it will serve as a standard around which our followers will rally.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Garth, you have only a handful of men.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You do refuse to enter into the spirit of the thing, don't you, Captain? Perhaps you'd like a larger role in the ceremony. You could serve as human sacrifice, for example.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I wouldn't enjoy that at all. Besides, you seem to need me alive.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: How true. All right, how about crown prince? That would make you our heir apparent. Heir apparent, I believe, is the proper role for you. Besides, we have other candidates for our human sacrifice. Who knows? Ready.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Garth goes out and comes in again with Marta on his arm. She carries a crown on a pillow. They walk between two lines of inmates, who kneel

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Well, since there is no one mighty enough to perform this ceremony, we'll perform it ourselves. Therefore, we hereby proclaim that I am Lord Garth, master of the universe. And we designate our beloved Marta to be our consort. And we further designate Captain James Kirk of the Starship Enterprise to be our heir apparent.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Garth walks up and down, then climbs up onto the table and sits on the chair.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Now remove our heir apparent that we may conclude this ceremony.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Kirk is led out into the corridor by the Andorian and the Tellarite.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Listen to me. This may be our last chance. Garth will destroy all of us unless you help me stop him. And he's using you, you know that, because he wants the power for himself. I brought something that might have cured you, but he destroyed it. If I can get a patrol down, they'd bring more of that medicine and

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Kirk tries to switch off the forcefield and gets hits for his effort. Garth enters.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Well done. Well, Captain, you continue to resist. How stupid of you. Put him in that chair right here. I've arranged a small entertainment. I wouldn't want him to miss any of it. Well, Captain, even you must admit that I'm a genius. What you see here is my latest invention. This is an explosive, the most powerful one in history. If I were to drop this flask, the resulting explosion would vaporise this planet. Now do you see why it is ridiculous to resist me? Well, perhaps you require the demonstration I've arranged. Watch closely.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Shutters open to show the planet surface on a screen.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Now, it is true that she is deadly as a poisonous serpent, but she is also a beautiful woman, and you have held her in your arms, Captain. I've ordered my men to drive her out of the protective dome. And, of course, she would choke to death on the outside in minutes.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: On the screen, Marta is struggling against two figures in environment suits.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: But I've arranged a more merciful end for her because after all, Captain, she is my consort. One tiny crystal implanted in her necklace, a portion of this explosive no bigger than a grain of sand. I propose to detonate it from here.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Marta is left alone, choking.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Poor girl. Poor, dear, suffering child. I will help her now.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Boom!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: There's been an explosion on Elba Two!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Point nine five!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It must've wiped out everything.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Immediate probe. Is the force field in place, Mister Sulu?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir. Solidly.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Uhura
Context: at Spock's station
Text: Life continues to exist on the planet.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Got to break through it somehow.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Doctor, I told you we couldn't do it without killing everyone in the asylum dome.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know it, Scotty.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, there's one last thing we might try. Perhaps the ship's phasers can cut through a section of the force field at its weakest point. Where did you say that was located, Mister Sulu?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: On the far side of the planet, Mister Scott.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Will it leave a margin of safety for the people below?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Prepare to change orbital path, Mister Sulu.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Orbital co-ordinates released, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Break synchronous orbit. Come to course one four mark six eight.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: after a few moments

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Course one four mark six eight. Synchronous orbit re-established, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ship's phasers to narrow beam.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ship's phasers ready, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let's punch a hole in it. Full power. Another blast, full power.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Force field still holding, sir.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Here.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Throws the flask of explosive to the Andorian, then snatches it back.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: How are your nerves, Kirk?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All I can say, Garth, if it happens to me, it happens to you.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: You're an extraordinary fellow, Kirk. Your stubbornness defies all logic. Logic, that is the key. Your friend Spock is a logical man. A very logical man. Go and bring the Vulcan here to me.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock is in a detention cell, calmly testing the forcefield in the doorway. When the Andorian and Tellarite arrive, he is lying on the floor. They have to pick him up and carry him between them. Once in the corridor, he neck-pinches the pair of them, takes a phaser and heads off on his own.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Spock is not only a more logical man than you, Captain, but a more intelligent one, I'm sure. I shall establish a rapport with him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: An alarm alerts him to the approach of the Vulcan.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Fascinating. Your Vulcan friend is a very ingenious fellow. This could be most amusing.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: When the control room doors open for Spock, two Captain Kirks are standing in the room.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 1
Context: to Spock's left
Text: That's Garth, stun him.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 2
Context: to Spock's right
Text: Hold it, Spock. That's Garth.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock enters the room

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 1
Text: Look at me carefully, Spock. Can't you tell I'm your Captain?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 2
Text: I won't answer that. That's exactly what he wants to know.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 1
Text: Very clever, Garth. That's exactly what I was going to say.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 2
Text: What are you doing?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Arranging to beam down a security team. Are there any objections?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 1
Text: Yes. They may walk into a trap.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 2
Text: That's right. Garth can destroy us.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. What maneuver did we use to defeat the Romulan vessel near Tau Ceti?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 1
Text: Very good, Spock. The Cochrane deceleration.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk 2
Text: Spock, you know the Cochrane deceleration's a classic battle maneuver. Every Starship Captain knows that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed, Captain. Captains. Gentlemen, whichever one of you is Captain Garth must at this moment be expending a great deal of energy to maintain the image of Captain Kirk. That energy level cannot be maintained indefinitely, and I have time.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock pulls a chair towards him to sit down, and Kirk 2 attacks him. Then the two Kirk's wrestle each other. Finally one is holding the chair over the other's head, ready to smash it down on his helpless victim.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Context: with chair
Text: I'm your Captain, Spock! Can't you tell? Shoot! Shoot!

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Context: on floor
Text: He's right, Spock. You must shoot, but shoot both of us. It's the only way to ensure the safety of the Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Spock shoots the aggressive Kirk with the chair, who then turns back into Garth. Spock switches off the force field.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain Kirk, I presume.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise here. Queen to queen's level three.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Queen to king's level one.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: The inmates are getting their jabs.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: Will intramuscular injection be satisfactory?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Intravenous is indicated unless circumstances make it impossible.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: How long before it takes effect, Doctor McCoy?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Reversal of arterial and brain damage should begin almost immediately.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Context: Garth is having a treatment in the chair.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Garth, I'm James Kirk.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am Mister Spock, science officer on a Starship.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The starship Enterprise.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Starship. Starship.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, sir, the Enterprise. I'm the captain. (Kirk and Garth shake hands) Can I help?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Cory
Text: No, Captain. The medicine seems to be taking effect. I can manage. It's very encouraging.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Garth
Text: Should I know you, sir?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Captain. No.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Tell me something. Why was it so impossible to tell the difference between us?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: It was not impossible, Captain. Our presence here is proof of that.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, and congratulations. What took you so long?

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Spock
Text: The interval of uncertainty was actually fairly brief, Captain. It only seemed long to you. I was waiting for a victor in the hand to hand struggle, which I assumed would be Captain Garth. Because of your depleted condition. Failing a resolution to the struggle, I was forced to use other means to make my determination.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. Mister Spock. Letting yourself be hit on the head, and I presume you let yourself be hit on the head, is not exactly a method King Solomon would have approved. Mister Scott, ready to beam up.

Title: Whom Gods Destroy
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5423.4. We are orbiting the planet Gideon, which is still not a member of the United Federation of Planets. The treaty negotiations have been difficult because Gideon has consistently refused the presence of a delegation from the Federation on its soil, or any surveillance by the ship's sensors. They have finally agreed to a delegation of one. They insisted it be the Captain of the Enterprise. I am, therefore, beaming down at once.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK; It's too bad Gideon isn't cleared for general visitation, Mister Spock. According to the physio-cultural reports submitted to the Federation, it's a virtual paradise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall be interested in hearing your description, Captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You won't have long to wait.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do we have final clearance from Gideon?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. They have provided us with the co-ordinates for beam down.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: May I have them, please?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Eight seven five.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Eight seven five.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Zero two zero.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Zero two zero.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Zero seven nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Zero seven nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energising.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk dematerialises, then re-appears - in an empty transporter room.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock? (goes to intercom) Mister Spock. I have not yet transported down. Why did you leave your post before confirming transport? Mister Spock? Spock?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Completely deserted

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engineering?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott? Scotty!

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, report immediately. All bridge personnel, report immediately.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to crew. Is anyone aboard?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sickbay? Doctor McCoy?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? Bones, answer me.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Still orbiting Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am alone on the Enterprise. I have searched every area of the ship and still cannot find a trace of the crew, or an indication of how its disappearance was managed. The one thing that is obvious is that I suffered a memory lapse, during which time I bruised my arm. It is causing me some irritation.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Gideon is contacting us, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Put it on the screen.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Five men sitting behind a slightly curved table. The central one speaks.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Captain Kirk, this is Ambassador Hodin. The council is still awaiting your arrival.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is Mister Spock, Ambassador Hodin. Captain Kirk was transported down minutes ago.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: That's impossible.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I transported him myself.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: He never arrived.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: He was beamed directly to your council chambers. Please verify your co-ordinates.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Eight seven five, zero two zero, zero seven nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Co-ordinates confirmed.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: We gave you the exact co-ordinates which should have brought Captain Kirk directly to this very room.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not questioning that, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: If he is not here, that is your own responsibility, Mister Spock, and that of your staff.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not deny that, sir. I am not attempting to blame your personnel.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: We are glad to hear that. We shall enter it into the records of this most unfortunate event.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, even with intricate machinery as delicately balanced as ours, there is still a margin for error which must be dealt with.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is possible that Captain Kirk materialised on some other part of Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Let us hope it was on dry land.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: McCoy enters

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency. May I cut right to the heart of the matter? I request permission to beam down to conduct a search for our captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Permission denied.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Your Federation must be aware

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Of our jealous tradition of isolation from all contaminating contacts

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: With the violent nature of planets of other star systems.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, the wars between opposing star systems no longer prevail in our galaxy. If you will grant permission

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Of course, we shall institute a thorough search. In the meantime, Mister Spock, I suggest that you look to your machinery.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Transmission ends

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We must acknowledge once and for all that the purpose of diplomacy is to prolong a crisis.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, what are we waiting for, Mister Spock? We're not diplomats.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are representatives of the Federation, Doctor.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That doesn't mean we have behave like children and listen to some fool lecture by a diplomat!

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, diplomacy is the only channel available to us at the moment. The planet is shielded from our sensors, therefore we cannot scan it. Therefore we are unable to select co-ordinates. They must be provided by Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We should never have agreed to such restrictions.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We did not, Mister Chekov. The Federation did. Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Contact Starfleet immediately. Explain our problem. Request permission to use every means at our disposal to press the search for Captain Kirk.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: At once, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Are there any other possibilities?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: There are endless, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, where do we start, Mister Spock?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Institute a sensor scan three hundred and sixty degrees, one degree at a time.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean you're going to scan space for him?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Sulu
Text: But, sir, that could take years.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then the sooner you begin, the better.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk is checking each room when he sees a young woman walking backwards from a junction, arms outstretched as she almost dances.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Odona. Yes, my name is Odona. Why did you bring me here?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you doing on my ship?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Is this entire ship yours?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not my personal property, but I'm the captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And you have it all to yourself?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It seems, at the moment, we have it all to ourselves.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: He grabs her arm.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: You're hurting me, Captain

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk. I'm sorry. James Kirk. And I didn't bring you here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: If you didn't bring me

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's right. Who has brought you here?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You? What happened before you came here? Try to remember. It's important.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It seems I was standing in a, yes. I was standing in a large auditorium crowded with people. Thousands pressed in against me. I could hardly breathe. I was fighting for oxygen, screaming to get out.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't be afraid.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I'm not, but you are troubled.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I seem to be the only one of my crew left on board the Enterprise. Four hundred and thirty, and I, apparently, am the only one left.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I'm sorry. I wish I could help.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe you can. Tell me the rest. You were fighting for oxygen, screaming to get out of there.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And then I, suddenly I was here on this, on your ship. And there was all this space. And the freedom. I just wanted to float. And then there you were.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long have you been aboard the Enterprise?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't know. Not long. Is it important?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It might be. Come with me.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, has Starfleet honoured our request with a reply?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There has been no response as yet, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did you advise them the captain's life is at stake?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. They insist that the matter must be referred to the Federation.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: What department?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Bureau of Planetary Treaties.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Contact them directly.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I did, Mister Spock. They insist that we must go through Starfleet channels.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Sulu
Text: With the captain lost, sir, that's the best they could come up with?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Diplomats and bureaucrats may function differently, but they achieve exactly the same results.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk checks the ship's chronometer on the helm/navigation console- it reads 9h 28m 29s

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nine minutes of my life has been lost.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't understand.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Between the time I tried to beam down to Gideon and the time I found myself here alone, nine minutes have disappeared just like that. Now what happened during those minutes?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: What is Gideon?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's your home. The planet that you come from.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Is it?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It must be.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Gideon? I don't know any Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible. We were in synchronous orbit over the capital city of Gideon. I tried to beam down, something happened, and you were beamed aboard from Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I do not think so.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk switches on the viewscreen, but instead of the deep orange planet, it shows a moving starfield.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're no longer over Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Where are we?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. I'm not familiar with that quadrant. Odona, you must realise that we're not here by accident. Some force, some intelligence has arranged this for a purpose.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Captain, before I said I wasn't afraid. Now I am.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The ambassador will speak, sir. They're requesting visual communication.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Good news. Very good news indeed, Mister Spock. Your captain is definitely not on Gideon. As you requested, we made a most thorough search, and you will be relieved to know that you may now investigate all the other possibilities and forget about Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: But that is not what we requested.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: You requested a most thorough search. It is in the record. And we have used every means at our disposal to accommodate you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your record on the subject is not precise, Your Excellency.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Surely, Mister Spock, you do not intend, I hope, to create a dispute between the Federation and Gideon?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, a dispute is the farthest thing from our minds, and there's no need to check your records. I merely suggest that the language of our statement may not have been understood exactly as intended.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Mister Spock, you're an officer of a spaceship. In your profession, you use many instruments, tools and weapons to achieve your objectives.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: True, Your Excellency.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: However, the only tool diplomacy has is language.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: It is of the utmost importance that the meaning be crystal clear.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, I am basically a scientist. Clarity of formulation is essential in my profession also.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: I'm glad to hear it. Perhaps you could then make greater effort to choose your words more precisely.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you going to let him get away with that?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: No matter what you say, Mister Spock, he'll twist your meaning.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, he's infuriating, sir. How can you stand it?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We do not leave without being absolutely sure ourselves that everything has been done.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Now certainly you understand our feelings about that.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Mister Spock! Mister Spock!

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Your Excellency.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Are you still there?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Your Excellency.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: There was considerable interference with your transmission. A lot of noise drowned out

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: What was said. Would you repeat, please?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I apologise for the noise, your Excellency. To summarise, I request permission to transport down to Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Forgive me, Mister Spock. No criticism of your equipment was intended. But it has sent your captain on some strange journey, a safe one we all still hope.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: But it could create for us serious incidents with your Federation, and now you propose to

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Repeat this disaster with another officer? This would be madness.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll not take that, Mister Spock. That transporter was in perfect condition. I guarantee that myself. Transport me down right this minute, and I'll prove to those gentlemen.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, you'll go to the transporter room and await my orders.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Scott leaves, muttering

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: I could not quite make that out, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Would you be so good as to repeat what you said?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Your Excellency. The ship's engineer was explaining that the malfunction, which did exist, has now been repaired. We would appreciate an opportunity to test the equipment. I, therefore, request permission

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: To beam down to your council chamber.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: But, Mister Spock, you

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, grant this one request.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: You are a very persistent fellow, Mister Spock. Very well, then, You shall test the skill of your very excitable

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Repairman.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: There is one proviso. We cannot risk further incidents. You will therefore transport a member of my staff to your ship. Let us first see if that works.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Your Excellency. Your proposal is accepted. Mister Scott.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Prepare to beam aboard a representative of the Gideon council.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: My assistant will provide you with the proper, what is the word?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Co-ordinates.
