Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Thank you. Proceed, Krodak.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Krodak
Context: standing
Text: Eight seven five.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Eight seven five.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Krodak
Text: Zero two zero.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Zero two zero.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Krodak
Text: Seven zero nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Seven zero nine. Energising.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Krodak disappears from the bridge viewscreen and appears in the transporter room

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Spock, the gentleman from Gideon is here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency, your assistant has arrived safely, and I am now ready to transport down to Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Now, now, not so fast, Mister Spock. That is quite a different matter. We agreed to allow one representative on our soil, your captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, our captain is still missing, and I now demand that I be allowed to transport to Gideon as we agreed.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Forgive me, Mister Spock, but I overstepped my authority when I made that agreement. However, your request will be taken up at the next full session of Gideon's council.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Transmission ends

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, beam down the gentleman from Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SCOTT; Yes, Mister Spock. I'm sending him straight to the same co-ordinates.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just when I was beginning to think you might find a whole new career as a diplomat, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Do not give up hope. Lieutenant Uhura, contact Starfleet Command. Demand an immediate reply to our request for permission to beam down to Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. Enterprise to Starfleet Command. Enterprise to Starfleet Command.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Enterprise to Starfleet Command. Enterprise to Starfleet Command. Captain Kirk here. Red priority. Red priority.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Isn't it in working order?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It seems to be.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Then someone should have heard you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk here. Please answer red priority. Please answer red priority. Well, if someone is listening, they're not answering.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Why should they do that?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They wouldn't.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk goes to the engineering station and swaps a couple of tapes over.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: What did you do?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Took the ship out of warp speed.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Out of what?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Space terminology. We're no longer moving faster than the speed of light. I've trimmed down to sublight speed until we find out where we are.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It feels the same.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course it does. Maybe it is the same.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Well, has the ship slowed down?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Context: referring to viewscreen
Text: If you believe that, we have.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Oh, please! Don't tell me the sky is out of order now. It's so quiet. So peaceful.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It isn't really, you know.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And it's beautiful.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Yes, it is. Very, very beautiful.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And we're alone. Can you make it last a long, long time?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long would you like it to last?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Forever.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, let's see. Power, that's no problem, it regenerates. And food. We have enough to feed a crew of four hundred and thirty for five years. So that should last us

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Forever. All my life I've dreamed of being alone.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Most people are afraid of being alone.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Where I come from, people dream of it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Why are the people of Gideon like that?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Gideon? I told you, I don't know where I come from, what my planet is.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It might be Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Does it matter so much?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. It might help me pinpoint our location.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And then you might find your crew. Being here with you, I forgot there must be others. I envy you your sense of loyalty. I want to ease your feeling of dread, your fear that all your crew no longer exists.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've got to contact whoever is manipulating us. There must be a way. Odona. Odona, can you remember why your people dream of being alone?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Because they never can be.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? What makes it so impossible to be alone?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Because there are so many of us. So many. There is no place, no street, no house, no garden, no beach, no mountain that is not filled with people. Each one of us would kill in order to find a place alone to himself. They would willingly die for it, if they could.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who sent you here?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: No one commands Odona. I was not sent here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You've come to kill. Odona, have you come to die?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't know. I don't care. I only know I'm here. I only know I'm happy.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: They kiss, and dozens of faces appear on the viewscreen. They watch as Kirk leads Odona away.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, all I have to do is find a medical kit, and I can completely cure this. (his arm)

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Cure?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, the irritation would be gone.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: What will happen if you do not find one? Will you become sick and die?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Over something as simple as this? No, it'll cure itself eventually, but. Do you know, uh I don't even remember how this happened. Do you hear that?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Yes, it sounds like an engine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, the ship's engines don't make that kind of sound.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: But there is something wrong with the equipment. Could that be it?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I know every sound that this ship might make. That's coming from outside.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: A storm might

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A storm might, but you wouldn't be able to hear it. Come on.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is a viewing port. We'll be able to see outside. If there's a storm, we'll be able to see it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk presses a button, but the steel shutter does not raise

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If it works.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: uses a manual override, and the shutters slide open to reveal faces which are then replaced by a starfield.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: People. The faces of people. And then the stars. What's happening? What's out there? The sound is gone.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was like the heartbeat of all those people, and thousands upon thousands more pressing against the ship.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: But you said we were moving through space.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I said that.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Then the people can't be out there.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, they can.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Please don't frighten me.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It could be a mirage. They could exist in our minds.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: You mean that we're going mad.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or some power is creating the illusion in our minds that we are somewhere near your planet. But why?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't know. I don't know.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think I have an idea. So that we won't keep trying to find out where we are, that we'll be content to stay here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Oh, be content!

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Be content? Be content? Not until I find out what happened to my crew. Are they dead?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you kill them so you could have the ship to yourself?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Captain, something's happening to me. I never felt like this before.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've never felt like this before either.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Is this the way one looks when one is developing a sickness?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no sickness on your planet, remember?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Now there will be. There will be sickness. There will be death.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: She passes out in his arms. The council members file out. Outside the window, a mass of people struggle to move towards their destination.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hodin.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Yes, Captain Kirk. Our experiment has passed the first stage.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me in there. I can help her.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: We have no need of any of your medicines.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But she's ill.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: And we're grateful to you for her illness. You have done well, my daughter.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk hands Odona over to Hodin

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Guard the captain well. We shall need him for a long time.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: I sympathize deeply, but Starfleet cannot override Federation directives in this matter.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Admiral, the crew will not understand it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: Has your crew suddenly become interested in provoking a war? That is not Starfleet's mission.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: We wish only to save the life of the captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: You have not proved your case to the Federation, or to Starfleet, for that matter.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am positive that I can do so to your satisfaction, Admiral. I have been convinced, since my first exchange with the ambassador, that the captain has been taken prisoner.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: Granted as fact, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I now know where the captain is being held, if he is being held at the same place to which we transported him.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: They would not dare harm him in the Gideon council chamber.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sir, the captain is not being held in the Gideon council chamber. He is being held nearby.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: You have answered what and where. I'm waiting for your explanation of why.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since the planet is shielded from our sensors, we cannot establish that without on the spot investigation.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: Do you have evidence the captain's life is threatened? Permission denied.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Admiral, I wish to state for the record that your decision is completely arbitrary.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Admiral
Text: So noted.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Will it last long?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: That depends on the strength of the one infected. You have great strength.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: How will you know when I am to die?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Your body temperature will be very great. You will see us, but you will not know who we are.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I must see him before then, Father.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Rest. Now lie still. Do you feel great pain?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Yes, in my arms and thighs.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: What is it like to feel pain?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It is like, like when you see the people have no hope for happiness, Father. You feel great despair, and your heart is heavy because you know you can do nothing. Pain is like that.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Your courage gives me great pride.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me see her.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Not yet.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't know what she may have.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: But we do. She has Vegan choriomeningitis.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's very rare, and always fatal if not treated within twenty four hours. I know, it almost killed me.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Yes. Our prime minister learned about you during our negotiations. That's why we brought you here. Your blood provided the micro-organisms which infected her.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's how my arm got hurt.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Yes. As Odona told you, we have no need for medical practitioners here. Our apologies. We were unforgivably awkward to have hurt you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Kirk has a fight with his two guards, and loses.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're mad.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: No. We are desperate.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't understand how Starfleet can deny permission to beam down to search for the captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: They did not ask for our understanding, Doctor.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't see how they expect us to sit here and wait for the captain to reappear.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unfortunately, I must violate a direct order from Starfleet.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's the best possible decision you could make, Spock. I'm with you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not make it lightly, Doctor. However, Command knows that Ambassador Hodin has not been totally honest with us. Lieutenant Uhura, repeat original Gideon co-ordinates for beam down.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Eight seven five, zero two zero, zero seven nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Scott, the co-ordinates given you?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Eight seven five, zero two zero, seven zero nine.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Co-ordinates don't match.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely. I shall beam down at once. Mister Scott, you have the conn.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll pick up my medical tricorder and meet you in the transporter room.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Doctor. I cannot accept the responsibility for ordering a fellow officer to violate a Starfleet directive. I can make such a decision only for myself.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not asking you to make the decision for me.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: The situation forces me to do so, Doctor.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: In that case, it's the worst possible decision you can make, Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: This will not take long.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Spock leaves

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Isn't that just about what Captain Kirk said before he left?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Context: into intercom
Text: Captain Kirk. Spock here. Captain Kirk?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: He goes out into the corridor, scanning with his tricorder.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your report to the Federation was a tissue of lies. You described environmental, physical, cultural conditions that would make Gideon a paradise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: And so it was! A long, long time ago what we described was true! The atmosphere on Gideon has always been germ-free. And the people flourished in their physical and spiritual perfection. Eventually, even the life span increased. Death became almost unknown to us. It occurred only when the body could no longer regenerate itself, and that happens now only to the very old.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those are conditions most people would envy.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: But Gideon did not find it enviable. The birth rate continued to rise, and the population grew, until now Gideon is encased in a living mass who can find no rest, no peace, no joy.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why haven't you introduced any of the new techniques to sterilise men and women?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Every organ renews itself. It would be impossible.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then let your people learn about the devices to safely prevent conception. The Federation will provide anything you need.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: But you see, the people of Gideon have always believed that life is sacred. That the love of life is the greatest gift. That is the one unshakable truth of Gideon. And this overwhelming love of life has developed our regenerative capacity and our great longevity.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the great misery which you now face.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: That is bitterly true, Captain. Nevertheless, we cannot deny the truth which shaped our evolution. We are incapable of destroying or interfering with the creation of that which we love so deeply. Life, in every form, from foetus to developed being. It is against our tradition, against our very nature. We simply could not do it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yet you can kill a young girl.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: We're trying to re-adjust the life cycle of an entire civilisation.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're killing your own daughter. How can you do that?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: My daughter hoped to make you feel the agony of Gideon. But it was impossible. No stranger could realize the horror that life can be here. I will not beg for your understanding of my personal grief, nor will I parade it for you to gain your co-operation. My love for my daughter is too deep for display. My pride in her runs even deeper. My daughter freely chose to do what she is doing, as the people of Gideon are free to choose.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The virus you need is very rare. Who will provide it?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: You will stay. Your blood will provide it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No sir, not me. You have many methods available. I've mentioned only a few. I do not offer my life for this purpose. I have many plans, and I have hopes other than death for Odona.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: My daughter pleaded with you to stay.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was said and what happened between us was for us alone.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: She hoped you would love her and wish to stay.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So that was your plan. That I would fall so under her spell that I would give up my freedom and become a willing sacrifice.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: Stay with us. We're desperate.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Krodak
Text: Odona's fever is rising. She's calling the name of James Kirk.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: You see, you cannot leave us now. Go to her.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: An exact duplicate of the Enterprise. But completely inoperative. (into communicator) Spock to Enterprise. Spock to Enterprise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Mister Spock.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am speaking to you from the bridge of the Enterprise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: You're where?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: On the bridge of the Enterprise, Mister Scott.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Those were the co-ordinates you insisted on.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: And they were correct. I'm on board an exact duplicate of the Enterprise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: An exact duplicate of the Enterprise? Is it in orbit, Mister Spock?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: In orbit, Doctor. In a manner of speaking, Gideon is in orbit and the ship is on Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's a beginning, but what about the captain?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sure he's on board somewhere. I'm picking up life readings. Spock out.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Ship's log, stardate 5423.8. First Officer Spock reporting. Obviously the Gideon's have transported Captain Kirk onto this replica of the Enterprise to so confuse his mind as to make him susceptible to some extraordinary experiment. It is my intention to locate the captain and warn him before the experiment reaches its conclusion, which logic indicates means the end of the captain's life as he knows it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you don't allow me to bring Doctor McCoy down here, it'll soon be too late to do anything for her.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: We have told you, it is her wish and mine that there be no interference with the natural progress of the virus.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Her death is unnecessary. Even if she lives, her blood will provide the same serum you need as mine would.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Hodin
Text: No, her death at so young an age will let the people know for certain that our lifecycle can be changed. It's the symbol that'll bring forth the dedicated young volunteers. The serum in their new blood will change Gideon, and it will once more be the paradise it was.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I'm glad that you are here. Is the time short?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very short.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: And I asked you to make our journey last forever. Oh. It began here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And it can continue. If only you'll allow me, I can cure you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I'm not afraid of what will happen, but it's just that now I wish with all my heart to stay with you forever.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: She passes out

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Outside in the corridor, Spock sneaks up on the two guards outside the 'Captain's quarters'. He neck pinches one, and throws the other along the corridor. Then he enters the room.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your Excellency. Captain, you're looking well. Evidently Starfleet's analysis was correct.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, we have a patient for Doctor McCoy. Have Scotty beam us up.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise. Spock to Enterprise.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Three to beam up, Mister Scott.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Scott
Text: Same co-ordinates?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative. Lock in on my communicator signal. Your Excellency, please do not interfere. I already have one serious problem to resolve with upper echelons.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Spock, Kirk and Odona are beamed away.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that was close, but you made it.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I am cured?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Right. Just like the captain.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: McCoy leaves

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Instead of smiling at me, you should be shouting in anger.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why, because you're well again?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: No. Because I pretended to be (pause) How can you bear to look at me after the way I deceived you?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At least you owe me the privilege of letting me look at you.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: You are a gentleman, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, ma'am.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: You are no longer needed on Gideon. I can take your place there.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that what you want to do?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: That is what I must do. I am needed there now.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're needed everywhere, Odona.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It is not like our ship.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, yes, it is. It's exactly the same. Only this one works.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It goes to many other planets?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, it goes to the whole galaxy. With another difference. This one is crowded.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: It seems crowded to you?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It does now.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Context: Crewmen pass by behind them

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: Are you going to stay on the ship?

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Odona, I have to.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: As crowded as my planet is, I could wish for it to hold one more person.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Kirk
Context: into intercom
Text: Kirk to transporter control. One to beam down to the planet Gideon.

Title: The Mark Of Gideon
Speaker: Odona
Text: I will miss you, Captain James Kirk.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5725.3. The Enterprise is en route to Memory Alpha. It is a planetoid set up by the Federation solely as a central library containing the total cultural history and scientific knowledge of all planetary Federation members. With us is specialist Lieutenant Mira Romaine. She is on board to supervise the transfer of newly designed equipment directly from the Enterprise to Memory Alpha.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: You're the sanest, the smartest, the nicest woman that has ever come aboard this ship.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Anything else?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Anything else, I'll keep to myself for the moment.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: When a man of Scotty's years falls in love, the loneliness of his life is suddenly revealed to him. His whole heart once throbbed only to the ship's engines. He could talk only to the ship. Now he can see nothing but the woman.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I didn't think Mister Scott would go for the brainy type.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I don't think he's even noticed she has a brain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott. Mister Scott?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Context: turning from Mira
Text: Hmm?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As soon as we're within viewing range of Memory Alpha, you and Lieutenant Romaine will go to the emergency manual monitor. You'll prepare for direct transfer of equipment.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: We're ready, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, may I offer my congratulations on what will be your first assignment for the Federation?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. Good luck, Lieutenant.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I'm picking up a high intensity reading.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that Memory Alpha?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: There's a bright thing in the middle of the viewscreen.) An engineer touches Scott's arm to attract his attention.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Excuse me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Magnification eight. What is that?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indications are a storm, Captain, although I've never seen one of such great intensity or strange confirmation.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Readings?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: All sensor readings are at maximum calibration.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, it's approaching at warp factor two point six and accelerating.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check that. No natural phenomena can move faster than the speed of light.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is definitely doing so, Captain. Therefore it cannot be a phenomenon of nature.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Deflectors on. Condition yellow.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Condition yellow, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shields activated, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The bright thing 'invades' the ship with sparkles. Only Mira does not shield her eyes from it. Then the sparkles withdraw.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, get us the devil out of here! Full scan on the disturbance that penetrated the Bridge. Lieutenant, all decks, damage report.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Mira gently falls to the floor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy to the Bridge. Emergency. Emergency.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira! Mira! (her eyes and mouth are open) What's that you're saying'?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: McCoy enters

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Was she hurt by the fall or the action of the disturbance?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. Did you notice, Scotty?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, after the disturbance was over, she just collapsed. How's she doing, Doctor?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I think she's coming around now.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Easy, now. Easy. You had quite a fall.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I'm, I'm fine.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You let me be the judge of that. Do you feel like walking to Sickbay?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I'm fine, Doctor. Really, I am. Is everybody else all right?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, they are. Now you just do what Doctor McCoy ordered.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Why? I feel

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get to Sickbay, Lieutenant. That's an order.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, would it be all right if I went along to Sickbay?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, Mister Scott. Stay at your post for the moment.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: But Captain

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura. Damage report.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Yes, sir. All stations are operative, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Some equipment was temporarily out of order. My sensors were inoperative.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any damage to the warp engines?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: None, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. From the action of that storm, we'll need all the speed we can get.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it was not a storm.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain. During the disturbance, Memory Alpha was hailing. I wanted to respond, but I couldn't make my hand move.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain. It was not hands that were paralysed. It was eyes. I could not force my eyes to look down and set a new course.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No, it was speech that was affected. I couldn't utter a sound.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, explanation.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Only of the result, not of the cause. In each case, a different area of the brain was affected. Our voluntary nerve functions were under some form of pressure.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Or attack.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Attack might be a more precise formulation, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And Lieutenant Romaine seems most susceptible.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are the readings corresponding, Nurse?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Everything appears normal, Doctor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Scott enters

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: What's that you're doing, Nurse?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Recording your responses in this computer.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: But why? I haven't had a single response worth noting.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chapel
Text: Lieutenant, please.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Well, have l?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant, there are four hundred and thirty people aboard this ship. You're the only one that passed out, and I want to know why.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I want to know why too. You're the doctor, you tell me. This is a new experience for me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: This whole thing is a new experience for all of us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: All of you are accustomed to new experiences. It's part of your work. I'm not.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: She might have something there, Doctor McCoy. This is her first deep space trip, and you know that affects people.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, if we can get on with this, Scotty, we might make that determination. Now then, tell me. What did you feel before you passed out?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Nothing.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nothing?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Absolutely nothing.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Doctor, there is nothing more I can tell you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lieutenant, you're being completely unco-operative!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Are you putting that into my record? It's not true.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll put the facts into your record, if I can get them.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come on now, Mira. We must help the doctor. Tell us what happened.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Perhaps you can explain to her that any career she hopes for in Starfleet requires discipline and co-operation.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm sure that's what the lieutenant wants. She just didn't understand. Did you now, lass?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: McCoy leaves

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chapel
Text: With a bedside manner like that, Scotty, you're in the wrong business.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Chapel leaves

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: When the record of this is forwarded, I'll be sent back, won't I.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Oh, you will not! That's ridiculous. This getting used to space travel, that takes some doing. And not everybody takes to it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Did you?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, me, that's different. I was practically born to it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I want to continue.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: You will. You passed your Starfleet preliminary examinations. And this is just getting used to what you might call your space legs.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I hope that's all it is.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I've plotted the storm's path.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Main screen projection.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: On its present course, it will hit Memory Alpha planetoid as it did us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, try and warn Memory Alpha of the proximity of that phenomena. Give me an ETA for its possible impact.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I cannot, sir. It has the ability to change speed.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Sir, I'm unable to establish contact with the planetoid. I'm hailing on all frequencies. No response.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is of little consequence, Captain. Memory Alpha has no protective shields.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No shields?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: None, Captain. When the library complex was assembled, shielding was considered inappropriate to its totally academic purpose. Since the information on the Memory planet is available to everyone, special protection was deemed unnecessary.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Wonderful. I hope the storm is aware of that rationale.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Completing approach to planetoid.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It is already over Memory Alpha, Captain! Its speed is incredible. It's hitting the planetoid.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are we within orbit range, Mister Chekov?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Making final approach.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, try and warn them of

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I'm sorry, sir. I can't break through this interference.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, how many people are on Memory Alpha?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: It varies with the number of scholars, researchers, and scientists from the various Federation planets who are using the computer complex.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, we are within orbit range.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock into orbit.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It is leaving Memory Alpha, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Sensors give no readings of generated energy from Memory Alpha, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any life readings?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: None.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find out what's going on down there. Kirk to Engineering. Mister Scott, report. Kirk to Engineering. Mister Scott. Where the devil is he? Scotty, report to the Bridge. Report to the Bridge. Have the transporter room stand by. I'm taking a landing party down.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, where've you been? Where are you?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: In the Sickbay.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sick?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Och, no. I was just checking on the lass. She's going to be fine now. There's nothing wrong with her.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm relieved to hear your prognosis, Mister Scott. Is the doctor there with you, or will I find him in Engineering?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here, Jim.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor, how's the girl?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I think she's in good shape.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, Mister Scott seems to agree with you. The two of you meet me in the transporter room on the double.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: McCoy and Scott leave, then we see in Mira's eye the sparkles and an image of a dead alien presumably on Memory Alpha

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental, stardate 5725.6. The storm has cleared Memory Alpha. It is heading away at incredible speed. We have been unable to make contact with the planetoid. Its silence is ominous. We are beaming down to investigate.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Somehow, I find transporting into the darkness unnerving.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, can you get us some more light?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'm afraid this light'll have to do, Captain. The generator is inoperative.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Damage report, Spock.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: A disaster for the galaxy, Captain. The central brain is damaged. The memory core is burned out. The loss to the galaxy may be irretrievable.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: They go into the next area and find the body we saw in Mira's eye, along with others.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: A very faint life reading in the immediate vicinity, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Locate him and keep him alive. We need more information about this enemy.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: McCoy finds her on the floor around a corner

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Over here, Captain!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, can you do something?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Not a thing, Jim. (the woman's mouth is moving) The same garbled sounds Lieutenant Romaine made when she fainted after the storm.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you sure?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Absolutely sure.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu here.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam down Lieutenant Romaine immediately.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The woman's face turns different vivid colours.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, have you seen anything like that before?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She's dead.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did she die of?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Severe brain haemorrhaging due to distortion of all neural systems, dissolution of autonomic nervous system. All basic personality factors, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: The attack was thorough.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did the others die of?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Each had a different centre of brain destroyed, cause unknown.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A different centre of the brain, you say?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain. I can be more detailed when we return to the ship and use the ship's computers.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Mira beams in

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira! The captain has some questions.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, when you were unconscious, you were speaking.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: What did I say?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know. The words were unfamiliar to me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: What did it sound like?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They sounded exactly like the last words spoken by the technician.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: What technician?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We found one person in there just barely alive. The rest were dead, and we

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Mira runs to see

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant. Lieutenant.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: We must get back to the ship!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why? Tell me why.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: That storm, it's returning.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How do you know?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I know. You'll be killed if we stay.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lieutenant, I assure you that unexplained phenomenon was headed away from the planet. It is probably seeking other victims.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I tell you t will kill us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Enterprise to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge, sir. The storm has reappeared on the long range scanner and is closing fast.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's its course?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Coming back in this direction.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam us up.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The four men materialise on the pads.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, this is the captain. Get the Enterprise out of here.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Wait, Captain. We've lost Mira.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Delay that order, Mister Sulu!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Stabilise her!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kyle
Text: Something's interfering with the transporter signal. I have her co-ordinates, but she's suspended in transit.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Let me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Finally Mira arrives, feeling dizzy

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Sulu, get us out of here. Mister Scott, check emergency manual monitor for transporter control.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, it's changing course.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot the new course, Mister Chekov.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Present course is one two six mark twenty.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plot it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Present course will bring it across our starboard side, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you made a statement that phenomenon is not a storm. Explain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: No known conditions in space would support that type of natural phenomenon.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm having difficulty with the ship's sensors. They seem to be under selective attack by the phenomenon as the unfortunate occupants of Memory Alpha were.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then deductive reasoning will have to be substituted.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ship's sensors are operating at the moment. Perhaps the elusive creature will now reveal something about itself.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I saw those men dead, in their exact positions!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Listen to me. I've told you what strange tricks a space trip can play on your mind. Now, that's all it is.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: No, Scotty.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Have you ever had visions of the future events before this?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Never.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, if you ask me, nobody ever has. That seeing to the future, it's pure bunk. You know that, don't you?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I've always believed it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: And you were perfectly right.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Then what is it, Scotty? What's frightening me? Ever since that storm hit, I've, I've had such strange thoughts, such feelings of terror.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Space. Space, that's all it is.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Then I don't have to report it?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, if you want to spend the rest of the trip in Sickbay. But what good would that do? Doctor McCoy can no more cure it than he can a cold.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, it's heading straight for us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Activate shields.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Shields activated.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Chekov, change course to one four three mark three.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Chekov
Text: One four three mark three.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Storm's course, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One four three mark three.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Take evasive action.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Evasive action.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard starboard, two one seven mark five.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Two one seven mark five. Still with us, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hard port, one one seven mark two.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: One one seven mark two. Still with us, sir!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is it closing?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. Maintaining its distance. However, it is matching each manoeuvre we execute, and I am receiving increasing magnitude of energy.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your analysis, Spock. What is it?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not what is it, Captain. What are they? There are ten distinct life units within it, all powerfully alive and vital.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are they? Where are they from?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Impossible to determine without programming for computer analysis.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's clear we can't outrun them. Can we shield against them?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: I do not believe the Enterprise shields would prove an effective defence.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be some defence we can use.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we are dealing with a community of life units. Their attack is in the form of brain waves directed against the brain, which is most compatible.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Maybe we can avoid another attack. Lieutenant Uhura, open all channels. Tie in the universal translator. Mister Spock says it's alive. Maybe I can talk to it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All channels open. Translator tied in.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We wish you no harm. Physical contact between us is fatal to our life forms. Please, do not come any closer to our ship.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps it did not understand.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, change in velocity recorded. They are passing our starboard side and manoeuvreing in front of us. Switching to forward scanner. Captain, change in velocity recorded. It has accelerated its approach.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Help, Scotty!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: What?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Hold me. It's happening again. No!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps it understands another kind of language. Condition Red Alert. Prepare for phaser firing.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: No, Scotty. No! No.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Scott holds her close

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock in phaser tracking controls.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Adjust phasers to fire across its course. Do not hit it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire. Reaction, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: None, sir. They're still approaching us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Apparently a shot across the bow is insufficiently convincing. Prepare to lock phasers into the heart of the community.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fire.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Mira falls to the floor, clutching her stomach in pain

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Scotty!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira! Mira.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The phasers seem to have stopped their approach. They're holding position.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lock in for another blast.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain! Captain, the phaser shots, they're killing Mira!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Killing Lieutenant Romaine?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye. When you fired the phasers, they stunned her and she crumpled.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Another shot and you'll kill her!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Get her to Sickbay at once.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Ready for firing, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cancel that order. Another attack on that alien life form will kill Lieutenant Romaine.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: It appears so.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If she is to survive, we can't attack.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Not directly.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can the computer supply a defence based on the data you've been accumulating?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. I have not been able to gather sufficient data for that. Captain, there is only one possible defence. If we can find an environment which is deadly to the alien form.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And yet isolate the girl from its deadly effects. Captain Kirk to Doctor McCoy.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is the girl well enough to be questioned?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I can have her ready in a few minutes.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Have the Lieutenant and Mister Scott in the briefing room as quickly as possible. Bring all available biographical material with you. Kirk out. Mister Spock, come with me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Go easy on her, Jim. She's in a pretty bad state.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll try.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Scott and Mira enter

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Romaine.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I didn't mean to be unco-operative, Doctor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Of course you didn't. I told the Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must get to understand what is happening.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I'll tell you everything I know.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Ship's investigative procedures are sometimes confusing to a new crewman. Don't let us upset you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I trust all of you implicitly. I want to help.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This investigation has been prompted by two events. First is the time you passed out on the Bridge, and the second is when we fired our main phasers into that force that is attacking us and seriously injured you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: You mustn't worry about hurting me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now this is how we'll proceed. Mister Spock has all the information available to us about our attackers. Doctor McCoy has access to Starfleet's exhaustive files on you. A comparison of the two may turn up some improbable connection which may protect you and ourselves. All right, gentlemen? Doctor McCoy, will you proceed?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Romaine, Mira. Lieutenant. Place of birth, Martian Colony Number Three. Parents, Lydia Romaine, deceased. Jacques Romaine, chief engineer, Starfleet, retired.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, are you prepared with the background history of the attackers?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am, Captain. I have fed all obtainable data to the main computer. It should be ready to supply whatever conclusions are possible.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Mister Sulu, what is the status of our friends?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Status unchanged. They're still with us and keeping the same distance.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue evasive manoeuvres. Keep me informed. Kirk out. Doctor, do you have a medical record of Lieutenant Romaine available?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like a few items from her psychological profile checked. Any history of psychosomatic illness?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Occasional and teenage routine incidents.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any evidence of involuntary or unconscious telepathic abilities?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: None.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any pathological or unusual empathic responses?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, Captain, not empathic. However, an extremely flexible and pliant response to new learning situations is highly marked.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead, Doctor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: After our phasers hit that thing, I gave Lieutenant Romaine a standard Steinman analysis. The results might be interesting.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go ahead.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The comparison of our Steinman with Starfleet records shows that Lieutenant Romaine's fingerprints, voice analysis, all external factors remain exactly the same as before. However, according to two hyperencephalograms, her brain wave pattern has been altered.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's what I was taught. But the BCP is just as consistent as fingerprints.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's see it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: A jagged graph comes up on the monitor. Spock raises an eyebrow

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy, according to your records, Lieutenant Romaine showed no abnormal telepathic powers.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's right, Spock. But exceptional pliancy was indicated. That might be a factor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: And you are sure that this is the correct slide?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Mister Spock. That is tape deck D, brain circuitry pattern of Lieutenant Mira Romaine.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, it also happens to be tape H, the impulse tracking obtained from the alien life units.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nurse Chapel followed this every step of the way. There can be no error.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Check it, Spock.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Spock puts his computer disc in, and the two patterns overlap and match exactly.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: As I said, Captain, this is the tracking obtained during the last shielded run. Computer, run a detailed comparison brain circuitry patterns, tape D and tape H.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Computer
Text: Comparison tape D's brain circuitry patterns of Lieutenant Mira Romaine and tape H, brain circuitry patterns of alien life unit, identical. Identical.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There has been no error.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy is correct, Captain. There is an identity of minds taking place between the alien beings and the mind of Lieutenant Romaine. Their thoughts are becoming hers.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: The alien is no longer maintaining its distance.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue evasive action. Keep me informed. Kirk out.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira has tried to tell me all along that she was seeing things in advance.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why didn't you report it?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: You don't report space sickness. That's all I thought it was.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did she see?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: The first attack on the ship, the attack on Memory Alpha and the time we nearly lost her.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Those were all acts carried out by our attacker.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: And? And?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Scotty? What else?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: I thought for a moment there was something else, but I guess I was wrong.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was he wrong, Lieutenant?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Yes, there was one other time.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did you see?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I saw Scotty.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I don't know.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What was he doing?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: He was dying. Now I understand what's been happening. I've been seeing through another mind. I've been flooded with thoughts not my own that control me. Oh, Scotty, Scotty! I'd rather die than hurt you. I'd rather die.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SCOTT@ All right, now. What's all this talk of dying? They've called the turn on us three out of four times. Now, that's a better average than anybody deserves. It's our turn now. We'll fight them. So let's not hear anything more about dying.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu, Captain. All evasion tactics carried out as ordered.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What success did you have?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: It's been useless, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: At their present force, they will get through the shields this time, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Warp eight, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll be here very soon. They may destroy you and us as they did Memory Alpha. You are especially susceptible to their will. But we have one chance to survive. Don't resist. Let them begin to function through you. If we can control that moment, we have a chance. Will you try?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Tell me what to do.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk to medical lab.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Medical lab here, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare the antigrav test units. Let's go.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Attention. All personnel, attention. Alien force has penetrated the ship.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Take defensive action. Attention, all personnel. The alien being has penetrated the ship. Take defensive action.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Security
Text: General quarters. Security condition three. Intruder alert. Repeat. General quarters. Security condition three. Intruder alert.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As soon as she has entered the gravity chamber, secure all ports.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The pretty lights enter the room

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Don't touch me, Scotty! Stay away.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Then enter Mira. She changes colour and makes the strange noise

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: We've lost her to them.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay where you are.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She could kill us all in this state.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: She will, unless we are able to complete what the captain has planned.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Stay with us, Mira. Please stay.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I'm trying. I want to be with you. They are too strong.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Don't lose yourself to them. Hold on.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: I am Mira Romaine. I will be who I choose to be. I will. Stay away, Scotty! They are with me. They will kill you.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: You won't let them.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Context: through Mira
Text: She cannot stop us. You cannot prevent it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira. Mira! Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's not Mira talking.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we must deal with them directly, now, while she still retains partial identity. We can speak to them. They will answer using her voice.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James Kirk of the spaceship Enterprise. Do you understand?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: Yes, we understand you. We have searched for a millennium for one through whom we can see and speak and hear and live out our lives.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: We are from Zetar.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is one of the planets where all humanoid life was destroyed.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't be from Zetar. All life was destroyed there long ago.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: Yes, all corporeal life was destroyed.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then what are you?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: The desires, the hopes, the mind and the will of the last hundred of Zetar. The force of our life could not be wiped out.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All things die.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: At the proper time. Our planet was dying. We were determined to live on. At the peak of our plans to go, a sudden final disaster struck us down. But the force of our lives survived. At last we have found someone through whom we can live it out.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The body of the one you inhabit has its own life to lead.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: She will accept ours.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She will not. She is fighting for her own identity.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: Her mind will accept our thoughts. Our lives will be fulfilled.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will she learn the way people on Memory Alpha learned?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: We did not wish to kill.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you did kill!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: No. Resisting us killed those people. We did not kill them.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The price of your survival is too high.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: We only want the girl.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can't have her. You're entitled to your own life, but not another's.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mira
Text: Life was given to me. It is mine. I want to live it out. I will

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The girl's life reading is becoming a match to the Zetarians. She's losing.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: Do not fight us.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: They will not accept their own deaths.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll be forced to accept it.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Zetar
Text: You will all die.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, if we cannot complete the plan, they will carry out their threat.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must get her into the pressure chamber.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, you realize the pressure needed to kill the Zetars might kill the girl too.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mira will not kill me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: Scott picks her up and gets her into the chamber before being thrown across the room

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: I told you she wouldn't kill me.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Secure the chamber. Neutralise gravity.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Zetars are growing stronger.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: The weightless state has become their natural condition.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pressurise the unit. Bring pressure to two atmospheres and then increase one atmosphere per second. Continue increasing pressure. Pressure, Spock. Pressure.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The pressure is dangerously high, Captain. It may damage her.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Continue, Spock.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The lights leave Mira

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pressure!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: The lights fizzle away

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We've done it, Jim. They're gone.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Context: intercom
Text: It's all right, Mira. They're gone. They're gone!

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Context: She looks at him and smiles

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Reduce the pressure very, very gradually, Spock.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: We may tax Mister Scott's patience, Doctor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Lie perfectly still, Lieutenant. Try not to move at all. Take deep, regular breaths. Now, don't hold it. Continue to breathe deeply. In, out. In, out. That's it. Now, you'll be in there another twenty minutes, so why don't you just try to relax?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now we have all the time in the world.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, are you able to judge the long range effects on Lieutenant Romaine?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: When the personality of a human is involved, exact predictions are hazardous.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Particularly where humans are involved, Doctor.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: However, despite Starfleet judgment of the pliancy of the Lieutenant, she put up a valiant struggle to retain her identity, and I find that encouraging.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy is correct, Captain. While the truth was difficult to accept, when it was revealed, the girl reacted well. I would say her struggle in this experience would strengthen her entire ego structure.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would either of you credit Scotty's steadfast belief in her as a factor?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: You mean, love as motivation? Humans do claim a great deal for that particular emotion. I suppose it is possible. However

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There are no howevers about it, Mister Spock. It was a factor, and it will be a factor in the girl's recovery.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do I take it both of you agree that Lieutenant Romaine need not return to Starbase for further treatment?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I should think work would be a better therapy.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Spock
Text: Logical.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk to Mister Scott.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, how's Lieutenant Romaine?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Beautiful, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Scott. Do I take it you say that she is fit for duty?

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Scott
Text: Positively, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Kirk to Bridge.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu, Captain.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu, set course for Memory Alpha. Lieutenant Romaine has a lot of work to do there.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Lights Of Zetar
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, this is an Enterprise first. Doctor McCoy, Mister Spock and Engineer Scott find themselves in complete agreement. Can I stand the strain?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5818.4. A botanical plague is devastating a planet in the quadrant of the galaxy where the Enterprise is operating at present. It threatens to destroy the vegetation on the entire planet, leaving it uninhabitable.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Context: dictating
Text: At Federation orders, we're proceeding at top warp speed to the planet Ardana, where the only source of zenite exists. It is the one substance that can halt the plague.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain, the High Advisor of Ardana is ready to receive you on Stratos, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On Stratos? That's their cloud city, isn't it, Mister Spock?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There must be some mistake. Do you have the co-ordinates to the mine entrance available?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: They've already been provided to the transport officer, Captain. Along with those of the council chamber of the High Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to transporter room.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ready to transport, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, are you locked in on the mine entrance or on their cloud city, Stratos?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: The mine entrance. That's what you ordered, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Fine. Uhura. Tell the High Advisor that we request to dispense with the welcoming ceremonies due to the emergency, and that we're beaming directly down to the mine entrance in order to ensure the fastest possible delivery of the zenite. The need is urgent.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
