Text: Mister Spock, come with me. Oh, and tell them that we appreciate the honour and that we look forward to some visit in the future.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: An area with jagged purple rocks under an orange sky. Kirk and Spock arrive on an artificial platform and gaze up at a city literally in the clouds.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stratos, Captain. A city actually floating in the sky.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Looks as tranquil as its reputation, doesn't it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is one of the most interesting metropolises in the galaxy. Have you ever visited here, Captain?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Once. I didn't have time to look around.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've never had the opportunity. However, I hear its art forms are incomparable.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, art is the population's chief occupation.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is a totally intellectual society. All forms of violence have been eliminated.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's the mine entrance. The zenite consignment should have been there. I don't understand it. Those Troglyte miners were supposed to have made delivery when we beamed down.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Perhaps there is another entrance, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem the Troglytes have changed their minds about delivery.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk and Spock are lassoed by three people in boiler suits and hard hats.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who are you? What's the meaning of this attack?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Context: a woman in blue
Text: Interference breeds attack, Captain. Come on!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're here by permission of your government council on an emergency mission.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Move on, Captain!.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: There is a fight, two against four. Then three figures beam down onto the platform.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Troglytes, halt!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The attackers make to run off.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Surrender or we'll fire!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Three escape, one gets shot

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Are you harmed, gentlemen?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, just a little shaken up.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I'm Plasus, High Advisor of the planet council.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Captain Kirk, Enterprise. My first officer, Mister Spock.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Greetings, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: My regrets for the unpleasantness of your welcome to Ardana.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was rather warm.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Unfortunately, violence is habitual with the Troglytes. But I assure you, this insult will not go unpunished.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I'm more concerned with the zenite consignment. Why wasn't it in its specified location?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Apparently the Disrupters have confiscated it, as I knew they would.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: The Disrupters? Who are they?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: A small group of Troglyte malcontents. All the other Troglytes are completely dominated by them. It's the Disrupters who are responsible for their refusal to continue mining for zenite.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They agreed to the delivery. Your council assured us of it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: They agreed obviously as a ruse to get valuable hostages.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hostages? For what purpose?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: To force the council to meet their demands. (to guards) Organise a search party immediately and find the zenite consignment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Guards leave

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Meanwhile, Captain, I would suggest that you and First Officer Spock be our guests on Stratos.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Very well. I do hope the search will be brief, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: We'll do everything possible to make it so. Come, gentlemen.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Plasus, Kirk and Spock beam onto a balcony at the edge of Stratos, with a wonderful view of a brown river and its tributaries.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Remarkable. The finest example of sustained antigravity elevation I've ever seen.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The sentinel told me of our honoured guests, my father. I came to extend greetings.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: A most gracious act. One of our planet's most incomparable works of art. My daughter, Droxine. Captain James Kirk.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Pleasure, madam.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Indeed, yes, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And First Officer Spock.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: I have never before met a Vulcan, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor I a work of art, madam.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Come, gentlemen. There is much to see in our city. This is our council gallery. It is open to all city dwellers. We have some of the finest of our various art forms assembled here for the viewing and contemplation of every

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: There is a dagger in the wall

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Disrupters again.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: How dreadful!. They're despoiling the whole city.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Despoil? For what purpose?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: By keeping us in constant turmoil, they hope to force the council to accede to their demands.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are their demands?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Completely unreasonable, Captain, but nothing you need be concerned with.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I must concern myself with it if it should interfere with the delivery of zenite to Merak Two.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Advisor, the plant life is the source of oxygen on that planet. Obviously, if all plant life is destroyed, the humanoid life will follow.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I assure you, gentlemen, you will get what you came for.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope so. Ardana is a member of the Federation, and it is your council's responsibility that nothing interferes with its obligation to another member of the Federation.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Of course, and we accept the responsibility.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: But why do they destroy art forms? That is a loss to everyone.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Art means nothing to the Disrupters. This (the dagger) is the only form they understand. The disturbances accompanying your arrival have been most wearying. No doubt you would like to rest.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: That would be most welcome, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Chambers have been prepared for you. A sentinel will guide you to them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk and Spock leave

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: I'm sorry they were so poorly treated on their first visit to our planet.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: It's fortunate that they were not seriously hurt.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Oh, yes, that would have been dreadful.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Further violence could create grave difficulties between Ardana and the Federation.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The Disrupters must be mad to attack two such charming strangers.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: They grow more daring and determined every day. Now they seek to find allies in the galaxy.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Do you think that Captain Kirk and his very attractive officer will feel that we're responsible for their injuries?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: All this time I thought you were worried about our diplomatic relations.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Two sentinels drag in a Troglyte

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Sentinel
Text: Apologies, Mister Advisor, but this Troglyte was apprehended leaving the city. He is without a transport card so we thought you would want to question him.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Remove his shields.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The sentinel takes off the troglyte's sunglasses

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: What is your business in Stratos, Troglyte? Speak! I command you!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: My business is to repair.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Repair what?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: There are damaged entrance panels.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Indeed. Then you must have a repair permit. Where is it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: It was forgotten.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Did you also forget your transport card?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: It was lost when your sentinels attacked me.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And where was your cavern implement lost? Could this perhaps be it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: I came to make repairs.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And you shall make them by giving us the names of the Disrupters.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: I know nothing.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I would advise you to increase your knowledge.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Troglyte
Text: That is not possible for a Troglyte. The Stratos city dwellers have said it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Secure him to the rostrum.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: But the troglyte breaks free of the sentinels and jumps over the balcony instead.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: How unfortunate. How unfortunate.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk is sleeping, Spock is meditating.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: This troubled planet is a place of the most violent contrasts. Those who receive the rewards are totally separated from those who shoulder the burdens. It is not a wise leadership. Here on Stratos, everything is incomparably beautiful and pleasant. The High Advisor's charming daughter Droxine, particularly so. The name Droxine seems appropriate for her. I wonder, can she retain such purity and sweetness of mind and be aware of the life of the people on the surface of the planet? There, the harsh life in the mines is instilling the people with a bitter hatred. The young girl who led the attack against us when we beamed down was filled with the violence of desperation. If the lovely Droxine knew of the young miner's misery, I wonder how the knowledge would affect her.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Spock hears a sound and goes into the next room. Droxine is preparing refreshments.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Mister Spock, I thought you had accompanied Captain Kirk to the rest chamber.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your movements awakened me.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: My apologies. I did not realise they would disturb you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Only Vulcan ears would find the noise discernible.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: It seems that Vulcans are fascinatingly different in many ways.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: The same may be said of Stratos inhabitants.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Vulcan eyes are very discerning too. I hear that, intellectually, Vulcans are as highly evolved as Stratos city dwellers.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: We do pride ourselves on our logic.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Dressed in Stratos fashion, the female miner enters the rest room, armed with her mining tool. She leans over Kirk, but he grabs her, pulls her down onto the bed and disarms her.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You again!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: You sleep lightly, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, duty is a good teacher. I see you've changed your dressmaker.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Release me.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So you can attack me again? That would be foolish.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Call the guards if you're afraid, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm not afraid. In fact, I find this rather enjoyable.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I do not!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, I'll make a deal with you. You answer some questions and I'll let you up.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: What questions?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your word first.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I will answer.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: But as soon as he lets go, she grabs for the weapon again and he has to fight her again.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Meanwhile, in the next room, the ears that heard Droxine don't hear the fighting

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: You only take a mate once every seven years?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: The seven-year cycle is biologically inherent in all Vulcan's. At that time, the mating drive outweighs all other motivations.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: And is there nothing that can disturb that cycle, Mister Spock?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Extreme feminine beauty is always disturbing, madam.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: In the rest area

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I did not come here to kill you, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why this?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: To take you hostage.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Spock and Droxine enter)

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Am I intruding, Captain?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Vanna!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Droxine.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Why have you come here?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: To welcome our honoured guests as I was taught to do when I served in your father's household.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Has she injured you, Captain?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, not at all. In fact her visit was quite enlightening.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Oh?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, it seems the Troglytes are under the impression that the Enterprise is here to intimidate them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Context: into intercom
Text: Send a sentinel to the rest chamber immediately.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: It is not impression, Captain. It is the truth.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're here to get that zenite consignment, and that's it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Starships do not transport cargo.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In times of emergency, they do anything. And believe me, this botanical plague is an emergency.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Lies will not keep the Troglytes in the caverns, and neither will your starship.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: You talk like a Disrupter, Vanna.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I speak for my people. They have as much right to the clouds as the Stratos dwellers.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: But Stratos is for advisors and studiers. What would Troglytes do here?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Live in the sunlight and warmth, as everyone should.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The caverns are warm and your eyes are not accustomed to light, just as your minds are not accustomed to logic.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: A sentinel takes Vanna away

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Unaccustomed to light and warmth? That's necessary to all humanoids. Surely, you don't deny it to the Troglytes.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The Troglytes are workers, Captain. Oh surely, you must be aware of that. They mine zenite for shipment, till the soil. Those things cannot be done here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: In other words, they perform all the physical toil necessary to maintain Stratos.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: That is their function in our society.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: But they are not allowed to share its advantages.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: How can they share what they do not understand?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They can be taught to understand, especially in a society that prides itself in enlightenment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The complete separation of toil and leisure has given Ardana this perfectly balanced social system, Captain. Why should we change it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: The surface of the planet is almost unendurable. To restrict a segment of the population to such hardship is unthinkable in an evolved culture.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: The surface is marred by violence, like the Troglytes. But here in Stratos, we have completely eliminated violence.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Vanna is shackled to a granite-looking device

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: You still refuse to disclose the names of the other Disrupters.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: There are no Disrupters!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Very well, if you prefer the rays.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The curved section of the device, facing Vanna, lights up and makes Vanna glow.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The sound of the rays can be heard in the background

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Troglyte is an abbreviation of an ancient Earth term. Its technical translation is cave dweller.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I should have realised.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: A scream rings out. Kirk and Spock go to investigate

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Advisor!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The rays are switched off, and Vanna slumps

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said you were going to question Vanna, not torture her.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: She's stubborn, and as you yourself pointed out, Captain, the search for your zenite consignment must be short.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Surely there are better methods than this.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Physical discomfort is extremely persuasive, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, but I won't stand by while someone is tortured!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Is it preferable to spare Vanna and allow an entire planet to be destroyed?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Violence in reality is quite different from theory, is it not, madam?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: But what else can they understand, Mister Spock?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: All the little things you and I understand and expect from life, such as equality, kindness, justice.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Troglytes are not like Stratos dwellers, Mister Spock. They're a conglomerate of inferior species. The abstract concepts of an intellectual society are beyond their comprehension.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The abstract concepts of loyalty and leadership seem clear to Vanna.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: A few Troglytes are brought here as retainers. Vanna was one of them, as are the sentinels. They've received more training than the others.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But obviously no more consideration.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I fail to see the purpose of this continued criticism.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The only way you'll use that device again is on one of us.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: An imposing display of primitive gallantry, gentlemen. You realise, of course, that the sentinels could remove you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course, but Starfleet command won't take kindly to having either rays or physical force used against one of its command personnel, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Why are you so concerned with this Disrupter's well-being?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beyond plain humanitarianism, my orders are to get that zenite.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Then stop interfering, and I'll get it for you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You won't get it through torture.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: We will get it for you, and in our own way. Remove the prisoner to confinement quarters. You will return to your ship at once or I shall contact your Starfleet command myself and report your interference with this planet's government.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, we're ready to beam up.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk and Spock are beamed away

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Context: to sentinel
Text: If Captain Kirk appears again, kill him.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, star date 5819.0. More than eight hours have passed since the consignment of zenite disappeared and we have still found no trace of it. We've received word from Merak Two that the plague is spreading rapidly. Delivery of the zenite is imperative within twelve hours or all life on the planet will be annihilated.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Uhura, advise Starfleet command that the zenite has not been delivered. In my opinion, Plasus' method of accomplishing delivery will not succeed. If the zenite is not delivered shortly, I shall have to violate Plasus' order of non-interference and win the confidence of the Troglyte leader with the use of reason.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That may not be easy, Jim. Medical analysis indicates the Troglytes are mentally inferior.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's impossible, Bones. The Troglytes have accepted personal sacrifice, a common cause. Mentally inferior beings aren't capable of that.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look, I've checked my findings thoroughly. Their intellect ratings are almost twenty percent below average.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: But they're all the same species. Those who live on Stratos and those who live below all originated on the planet. Their physical and mental evolution must be similar. That is basic biological law.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's true, Spock, but obviously the ancestors of those who live on Stratos removed themselves from the environment of the mines. Therefore they avoided the effects of certain natural growths.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Natural growths? What kind?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well. I had this zenite sample sent up from the surface. Now unsealed, it would have had detrimental effects on everybody here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Incredible. Zenite is shipped all over the galaxy wherever there is danger of plant bacteria. No side effects have ever been reported.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There are none after it's refined. But in its raw state, it emits a odourless, invisible gas that retards the intellectual functioning of the mind and heightens the emotional. Therefore, it releases a violent reaction.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And the mines are full of that gas.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's right. And the Troglytes are constantly exposed to it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones, the Disrupters, Vanna. It seems impossible. They've outwitted a highly organised, scientific culture for months.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: As part of the staff of Stratos, Vanna was removed from exposure for a long period. It is likely that without such exposure, the effect slowly wears off.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: That's right, Spock. The other Disrupters were probably removed from exposure too.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does the brain return to normal?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: According to findings, it should.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you neutralise the gas?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, but a filter mask should remove the exposure.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Find one. Meet us in the transporter room.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are talking to Plasus on a wall monitor

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This mask automatically eliminates all substance injurious to humanoid life, chemical as well as bacterial. We have used these filter masks frequently on

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Do you really expect me to believe that that mask can achieve intellectual equality for the Troglytes?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There's every indication that the effect of the gas is temporary, even after repeated exposure.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: How can a mere filter accomplish what centuries of evolution have failed to do?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy has analysed the zenite thoroughly. We've checked his findings through the computer and they're absolutely valid.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And do your computers explain how my ancestors, who also dwelt in caverns, evolved sufficiently to erect Stratos while the Troglytes did not?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Unequal evolution did not begin until after your ancestors removed themselves from constant exposure to the gas, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Preposterous.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's no time to argue about the findings now. I simply propose to tell Vanna all about them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I doubt whether even Vanna will believe such nonsense!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This nonsense might mean a great deal to the Troglytes. I would like to offer them a supply of these filter masks in exchange for the zenite consignment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I'm sorry, Captain. Such an offer could only cause more unrest among them. I cannot allow it until our scientists have checked the findings.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But that could take days.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you afraid the filter masks will work? Is that why you don't want the Troglytes to try them?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: You are here to complete an emergency mission, not conduct tests, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am here to get that zenite. If these will help me get them, I'll use them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And I forbid it. Your Federation orders do not entitle you to defy local governments. This communication has ended.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My diplomacy is somewhat inadequate.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's pretty hard to overcome prejudice.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doesn't give us much choice, does it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nor much time. We have ten hours and forty minutes to deliver that consignment to Merak Two.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam me down to Vanna's confinement quarters.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You mean you're going back to Stratos against government orders?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If Vanna doesn't have something definite to gain for her people, she'll die rather than turn over that zenite consignment. This is the only thing that might convince her.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, if you are apprehended deliberately violating the High Advisor's orders, he will be within his rights to have you executed, if he chooses.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you're about to suggest that you contact Vanna, the answer is negative, Spock. That goes for you too, Bones.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Allow me to point out that a first officer is more expendable than either a doctor or a captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Officially, yes. But this mission is strictly unofficial. Nobody's to have any part in it, any responsibility for it, but myself. That's an order, Spock. You have the conn. Stand by till I contact you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: It's a fair size, with a bed and table, and horizontal bars across the doorway

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vanna, I've brought you a gift. There's a dangerous gas in the mines that affects the development of the Troglytes exposed to it for a period of time. This mask will prevent any further damage.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Gas from zenite?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: It's hard to believe something which is neither seen nor felt can do so much harm.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's true. But an idea can't be seen or felt. That's what's kept the Troglytes in the mines all these centuries, a mistaken idea.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Would all the Troglytes wear these masks?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. I'll see to it that the Federation engineers construct them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Suppose Plasus does not agree?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Plasus is not the whole government.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: That is true, but the city council will not listen to Troglytes.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As soon as the zenite is delivered to Merak Two, I'll come back. I'll request permission to mediate for the Troglytes. Vanna, you must trust me. I give you my word.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Centuries ago, Stratos was built by leaders that gave their word that all inhabitants would live there. The Troglytes are still waiting.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The zenite can be delivered in a few hours. You won't have long to wait now.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Hours can be centuries, just as words can be lies.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Vanna, you must trust me. If you don't, millions of people will die. A whole planet. This zenite is all that can save them. This filter mask is all that can save the Troglytes. Trust me. Please.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Very well, Captain. I will trust you. The consignment lies deep in the mines in a place known only to Troglytes. I cannot direct you. I must take you there. You asked for my trust, Captain. Are you unwilling to give yours?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: They hear footsteps

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: It's the sentinel with my refreshment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: The sentinel enters, puts down the tray and picks up the mask. Kirk stuns him with his phaser.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Wait. We'll need a transport pass to leave the city.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Vanna leads Kirk though tunnels, then uses a tool to hit the rock three times. Other Troglytes appear.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Midro.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: Vanna.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Anka.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Anka
Text: You have returned.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: And I've brought with me a hostage. Seize him!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Context: wearing the mask
Text: We had a bargain. Why did you break it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Did you really think I would trust you, Captain? I'm not such a fool.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I trusted you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: You thought you would trick me with your talk of your filter and your unseen gas. I don't believe you any more than Plasus does.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then you are a fool. These masks will free you, just as I said.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Our weapons are our freedom. And you've just furnished me with two very valuable ones. Yourself and this. (phaser)

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Holding me won't help you. My men'll still come for that zenite consignment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Without your communicator, you will be hard to locate.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They'll still come.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Perhaps. In the meantime, a taste of our existence, Captain. Dig as the Troglytes do. As the Troglytes do.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Without that mask, I haven't

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: With your bare hands, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, supplemental, stardate 5819.3. First Officer Spock reporting. Captain Kirk beamed down to Stratos to attempt to win the confidence of the rebel Troglytes. Unless he has made his escape from Stratos to the mines, his life is in danger from the High Advisor. The captain has not informed us of his progress. For our part, we must maintain silence. We can be of no help to him without jeopardising his life.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: You dig well, Captain. The unseen gas doesn't seem to be harming you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It takes a while for its effects to be noticed.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Nevertheless, you won't be needing this. Anka, deposit this on the transport platform so Plasus will know we have something more valuable to bargain with than our mortaes and thongs.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Anka
Text: You are clever, Vanna. Very clever.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Anka leaves

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Searchers will be coming soon, Midro. Go to the other mines and tell the Troglytes to post watchers.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: What of him?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I will see that he doesn't escape.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: If we kill him, there will be no need to see.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: A dead hostage is of no value, Midro.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: Only the Troglytes will know.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I brought him here and I will say what is to be done.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: You are not the only Disrupter. I, too, can say.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Can you do nothing but argue? The searchers will be here soon.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Midro
Text: When Anka returns, we will all say.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Midro leaves

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is that what Disrupters are bargaining for, the right to kill everyone?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Midro is a child.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The masks can change that.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Return to the digging, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How long do you plan on keeping me here, providing Midro doesn't kill me, of course?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Until we have help in the mines and our homes are in the clouds.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's quite a while. Longer than I expected.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk jumps Vanna, gets the phaser and uses it to cause a rockfall in the tunnel

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: We're sealed in!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Completely.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: But soon the atmosphere will go. We'll die.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Die from something that can't be seen? You astound me, Vanna. Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here. We've been trying to make contact, Captain. Is anything wrong?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Nothing. Are you locked in on me?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Locked in and ready to beam up consignment.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Circumstances dictate a slight variation, Spock.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standing by for instructions.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hold on these co-ordinates. Locate the High Advisor and beam him to these co-ordinates immediately. Without advance communication. Repeat, without advance communication. Have you got that, Spock?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Instructions clear. I shall carry them out immediately. Spock out.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: You would seal Plasus here also? For what purpose?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I am preparing a demonstration on the effects of unbelieved gas.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Beam the High Advisor down without warning, did he say?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: That's not an exact quote, Mister Scott. However, it does express the thought.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'd like to see the Advisor's face.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: You will have that opportunity.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: The captain did say immediately, did he not?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Now that is an exact quote, Mister Scott, and I suggest you handle the transporter yourself. This could be very delicate as a problem in transporting for us and in diplomacy for the captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Droxine is gazing out from the balcony

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Something's upsetting you, Droxine.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: No, Father.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: What is it? Tell me.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: No, really. I'm not upset. I was just standing here looking into space and wondering whether or not he would return.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: He will never return. I've seen to that.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: But the zenite is so important to him. He must have it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: It will be delivered. If we have to kill every Troglyte, it will be delivered.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: By that time, it may be too late. Perhaps he does have a method

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: He knows nothing except how to destroy our power and our society. I forbid you ever to speak of Captain Kirk, or even to think of him.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Transporter room to Mister Spock.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: I've locked into the co-ordinates of the Cloud City Council Gallery. Ready to transport the High Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll have to delay.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's wrong?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Picking up two life-forms in the gallery.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: They are inseparably close to one another. We cannot transport one

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Without the other.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Did you say the word immediately was an exact quote of the captain's order?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Precisely, Mister Scott.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Well, are we going to do anything about it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Until the High Advisor is alone or can be isolated, the captain will have to wait. Unless you have an alternative?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'll give it further thought.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: No, I wasn't thinking of Captain Kirk. It's the one with those exquisitely shaped ears. His name is Spock. He's the one I was thinking about. Did you know that he has the most incredibly sensitive hearing? Why, I almost believe that if I stood here and called out to him, he would hear my invitation to come and visit with us for a little while longer.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Oh, he's no better than his friend.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Shall we try?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: a sentinel enters

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: What is it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Sentinel
Text: The Disrupter Vanna has disappeared. Her guard was found half unconscious. He'd been attacked by Captain Kirk.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Where is Captain Kirk?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Sentinel
Text: He did not know, sir. He did not regain his senses until I came to his aid.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: This is the kind of reason they use to persuade us.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: They are desperate.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I will hear no more defence of them.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: I'm sure Mister Spock would not behave so.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Leave here at once. Go to your music.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Father, are we so sure of our methods that we never question what we do?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to transporter room.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Lock in on Council Gallery co-ordinates.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Locked in, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Energise.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Energising.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: How are you doing, Mister Scott?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Fine, Mister Spock. The High Advisor's materialising on the platform.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Beam him down to Captain Kirk immediately.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: Energising, sir. He's on his way to the captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Good work, Mister Scott.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Scott
Text: The Advisor looked mighty angry. I hope he doesn't give the captain too much trouble.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: The captain will employ his usual diplomatic balm.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Abduction of a planet official is a serious crime. You will pay for this, I promise you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Not until you're convinced of the effects of the zenite gas, Mister Advisor.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: What effects? I've been here nearly an hour of your Earth time. You and Vanna even longer. I see no changes in any of us!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps you need closer exposure. Fill that container.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Are you suggesting that I dig zenite?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I insist.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: You will indeed pay for this.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You too, Vanna. You too! Dig! Kirk here. What is it?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Contact check, Captain. It has been over an hour since your last communication.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your orders are to stand by. Now, carry them out! Kirk out.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Standing by, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: However, let me remind you, we have only five hours left to

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk closes his communicator

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is very unlike the captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can the zenite be affecting him?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: I grow faint. The oxygen is going.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: She's right. Kirk, transport us out of here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll leave when the gas has effect.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: It will never take effect. Transport us out of here!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Dig!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Imbecile! We'll die!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I said dig!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I am High Advisor of all the planet. I will take no more orders!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One more step and I'll kill you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: The gas! Captain, you were right. It's taking effect! Captain, you were right!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Are you as brave with mortae as you are with a phaser?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Both will kill.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Kirk throws his phaser away, and Plasus attacks him with two mortae. Kirk quickly disarms him, and they wrestle instead. Vanna notices the communicator has fallen off Kirk's belt, and picks it up

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Enterprise! Enterprise, help! Enterprise!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Enterprise, Spock here.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: They'll kill each other. Help us.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Help us! Enterprise!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Enterprise!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Spock activates the transporter. Kirk and Plasus have their hands around each others throats when they materialise. Spock hauls Kirk away from Plasus

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, the zenite gas has affected you. Captain! The zenite gas!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The zenite gas.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Look out, Jim!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Plasus attacks, and Kirk knocks him out

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, it seems my little demonstration was quite a success.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: I don't like filters, or even masks. I like the word protector much better, don't you?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is less technical, therefore less accurate, but perhaps more generally descriptive of the function.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: It appears you have what you came for after all.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: The captain will have his zenite, just as I agreed.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: Agreed? There's no such word in the Troglyte vocabulary.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: The captain will have his zenite.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: No thanks to any agreement by you. It had to be obtained by force.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Because it is the only way we can obtain what is due us.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: How about your education? Was that by force?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: It served your purpose at the time.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: You could have had those filters for all the good it will do you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They will be very effective. sir. They've been severely tested, and the Troglytes will no longer suffer from retardation and emotional difficulties.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: They will all be like her. ungrateful, vindictive.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Yes. Our demands have just begun. Here is the zenite, Captain, just as I promised.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Context: Sentinels pile the containers on the balcony

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Vanna.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Stratos is so pleasant and so beautiful. I think I'm afraid to leave it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is great beauty in the knowledge that lies below, and only one way to really experience it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: I shall go to the mines. I no longer wish to be limited to the clouds. Is your planet like this one?

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: No. No, Vulcan is quite different.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Droxine
Text: Someday I should like to visit it.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps some form of mediation can be helpful in your difficulties. The Federation Bureau of Industrialisation may be of aid to you.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: I will tolerate absolutely no interference! You will not set foot here as long as I rule!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Believe me, sir, I have neither the time nor the desire to return here. Only answering your charges against me will force me back.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Plasus
Text: And I shall press them. You are guilty of abduction, Captain!

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're guilty of attacking a starship commander and plotting against his life.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Vanna
Text: Captain, perhaps both incidents are best forgotten.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Vanna. They never happened. Mister Advisor? (Plasus nods) Mister Spock, let's get that zenite delivered. I believe we only have three hours left.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Spock
Text: Two hours, fifty-nine minutes to be exact, Captain.

Title: The Cloud Minders
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott beam us up.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: A small craft, which looks like a Tholian dart with small nacelles, is being pursued by the Enterprise

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is definitely the stolen space cruiser, Captain, the Aurora. I read six aboard.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Hailing frequencies. Aurora, this is the USS Enterprise, Captain James T. Kirk commanding. Acknowledge. Aurora, this is the Enterprise. Do you read me?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Palmer
Text: They are receiving us, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: I read no evidence of malfunction.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Repeat. Federation orders to detain you for

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They're veering off, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Change course. Pursue and overtake.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by tractor beams.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Standing by, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: If it continues on course, it will enter Romulan space.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Engage.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Tractor beam engaged.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bring them in.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: They've not cut power, sir. They're struggling to escape.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Their engines are seriously overheating, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aurora, cut power. You are overtaxing your ship.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Power approaching critical. They cannot continue.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Emergency power to tractor beams. Bridge to Transporter room. Scotty, are you ready to transport?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Power beyond critical. Explosion is imminent.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The little ship glows red

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are we within transportation range?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Not yet, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Aurora personnel, stand by to be transported aboard. Energise.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The little ship makes a big bang

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are they aboard? Scotty, are they aboard?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain. They are, and a nice lot too.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Say hello to the 'space hippies'

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5832.3. The son of the Catullan ambassador is one of six we have beamed aboard from the stolen cruiser Aurora. We have been ordered to handle him with extreme delicacy, because the treaty negotiations now in progress between the Federation and Catualla are in a crucial phase.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, take them to the briefing room.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: We are not in the mood, Herbert.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Irina?

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The hippies are seated on the floor of the transporter room

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Man
Text: Tell Herbert it's no go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: No go. No go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's going on?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: They refuse, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: I don't know. They're sitting on the floor, the lot of them. You can hear for yourself. Shall I send for security?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I'll be right down. Mister Spock.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: No go, no go, no go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: No go, no go, no go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which one of you is Tongo Rad?

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: A purple haired lad with shaggy eyebrows stands up

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You can thank your father's influence for the fact you're not under arrest. In addition to piracy, you've left yourself open to charges of violating flight regulations, entering hostile space and endangering the lives of others as well as your own.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: I'm bleeding.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In addition you've caused an interstellar incident which may have destroyed everything that's been negotiated between your planet and the Federation.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: You've got a hard lip, Herbert.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you have an explanation, I am prepared to hear it.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Rad sits down again

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, take them to Sickbay for a medical check. There may have been radiation from the explosion.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, with your permission

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By all means.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Spock steps forward and makes a triangular sign with his hands

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: One.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Context: An older male with alien ears. Obviously the leader
Text: We are One.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: One is the beginning.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: A red-headed youth
Text: Are you One, Herbert?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not Herbert.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: He is not Herbert. We reach.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: If you will state your purpose and your objectives, perhaps we can arrive at a mutual understanding.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: If you understand One, you know our purpose.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: I would prefer that you state it.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We turn our backs on confusion and seek the beginning.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: What is your destination?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: The planet Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That planet it is a myth.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: And we protest against being harassed, pursued, attacked, seized and transported here against our wishes.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Right, brother.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We do not recognise Federation regulations nor the existence of hostilities. We recognise no authority save that within ourselves.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, whether you recognise authority or not, I am it on this ship. I am under orders to transport you back to Starbase peaceably. From there you'll be ferried to your various planets. Because of my orders, you are not prisoners, but my guests. I expect you to behave as such.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Oh, Herbert, you are stiff!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, you seem to understand these people. You will deal with them.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We respectfully request that you take us to Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And after they are finished in Sickbay, see to it that they're escorted back to their proper quarters and given whatever care they need.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We respectfully request that you take us to Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have orders to the contrary. This is not a passenger ship.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Herbert, Herbert, Herbert.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: Herbert, Herbert, Herbert. Herbert, Herbert, Herbert.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Palmer, notify Starbase we have the six aboard who stole the space cruiser Aurora. Regrettably, the space cruiser itself was destroyed.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Personal note to the Catullan ambassador. His son is safe.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, what is it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Sir, I believe I know one of them. At least, I think I recognise her voice. Her name is Irina Galliulin. We were in Starfleet Academy together.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: One of those was in the Academy?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes, sir. She dropped out. She

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do you wish to see her? Permission to leave your post.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Spock enters

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are they in the Sickbay?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Chekov leaves

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock, do they really believe that Eden exists?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Many myths are based on truth, Captain, and they are not unintelligent. Their leader, Doctor Sevrin, is a man

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Sevrin is their leader?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. A brilliant research engineer in the fields of acoustics, communications and electronics on Tiburon. He was dismissed from his post when he started this movement. Tong Rad inherits his father's extraordinary abilities in the field of space studies.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well. But they've rejected all that and all that this technology provides. And they seek the primitive.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: There are many who are uncomfortable with what we have created. It is almost a biological rebellion. A profound revulsion against the planned communities, the programming, the sterilised, artfully balanced atmospheres. They hunger for an Eden where spring comes.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All do. The cave is deep in our memory.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, that is true, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But we don't steal space cruisers and act like irresponsible children. KIRK: What makes you so sympathetic toward them?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not sympathy so much as curiosity, Captain. A wish to understand. They regard themselves as aliens in their own worlds, a condition with which I am somewhat familiar.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock. What does Herbert mean?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is somewhat uncomplimentary, Captain. Herbert was a minor official notorious for his rigid and limited patterns of thought.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, I shall try to be less rigid in my thinking.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The teenagers are having an impromptu concert

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: playing a guitar without a sound box) Looking for the good land, Going astray. Don't cry, don't cry. Oh, I can't have honey, And I can't have cream. Gonna live, not die. Gonna live, not die. (Rad plays bongos
Text: Stand in the middle of it all one day. I'll look at it shining all around me and say, I'm here, I'm here, In the good land. In the new land. I'm here.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Excuse me. Is Irina Galliulin with you?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: She's getting her physical. Gonna crack my knuckles and jump for joy. I got a clean bill of health from Doctor McCoy. You know Irina?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: Say, tell me, why do you wear all those clothes? How do you breathe?

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Chapel and two med-techs enter

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chapel
Context: to Sevrin
Text: You're next.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The techs carry Sevrin into the next room. Chapel leaves and Irina enters

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Irina.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Pavel Andreievich. I had thought we might encounter each other.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You knew I was on the Enterprise?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: I had heard.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Irina, why? Come.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: How could you do this to yourself? You were a scientist. And now, look at you.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Look at yourself, Pavel.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Why did you do it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Why did you?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I am proud of what I am. I believe in what I do. Can you say that?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Yes. Oh, we should not tear at each other so, Pavel. We should meet again in joy. Today when I first knew it was your ship that followed us, I thought of you and wondered what I would find. And I remembered so much. In spite of that uniform, I still see the same Pavel I used to know.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Are you happy in what you do?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Then I accept what you do.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You even talk like them. Why did you go away?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: It was you who went.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I came back to look for you. I looked. Where did you go?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: I stayed in the city, with friends.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You never felt as I did. Never.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: I did.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You don't have it in you to feel so much. Even when we were close, you weren't with me. You were off thinking of something else. Why did you stay away?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Because you disapproved of me, Just as you do now. Oh, Pavel, you have always been like this. So correct. And inside, the struggle not to be. Give in to yourself. You will be happier. You'll see.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Go to your friends.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Irina leaves, and there is a commotion in the corridor.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: Free Doctor Sevrin! Free Doctor Sevrin! We want to see him right now!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: We want to see him now!

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Chekov joins the security guards and Chapel trying to keep the kids out of Sickbay

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: Herbert! Herbert! Herbert! Herbert!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chapel
Text: I thought all the animals were kept in cages.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's going on, Bones?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Trouble. Your friend here didn't want a checkup. Turns out there's a reason.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I refuse to accept your findings.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You don't have the choice.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: They're the product of prejudice, not science.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know what this man was planning on doing on a primitive planet, but assuming one did exist, I can tell you what would have happened had he settled there.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Untrue!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: There wouldn't have been enough primitives left to bury their dead.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Fantasy. Fantasy.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wish it were. There's a nasty little bug evolved in the last few years, Jim. Our aseptic, sterilised civilisations produced it. Synthococcus novae. It's deadly. We can immunise against it, but haven't learned to lick all the problems yet.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Does he have it? What about the others?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All the others are clear. He doesn't have it. He's a carrier. Remember your ancient history? Typhoid Mary? He's immune, as she was, but he carries the disease and spreads it to others.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is the crew in danger?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't know. They all had full spectrum immunisations before boarding. Now my guess is that his friends have had their shots too. But a regular programme of shots is necessary. I'll have to check everyone on the ship. There could be some skips. In the meantime, he should be placed in total isolation.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: This is outrageous. You're not isolating me, you're imprisoning me. You invent a crime, find me guilty and sentence me!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Would you like to run the test, Doctor? You knew you were a carrier before you came aboard, didn't you?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: No!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Then why did you fight the examination?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: It was an infringement on my rights.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Put him in isolation.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The two med-techs haul Sevrin away

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Be ready for the objections, Jim. They are a vocal lot.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I'm ready. Kirk to Security. I want a guard maintained on Doctor Sevrin until further notice. Bones, how long before we know whether the crew has been endangered by this infection?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It'll show in twenty four hours. It's a virulent strain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Sulu is being chatted up by a brunette

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Woman
Text: You don't belong with them! You know what we want. You want it too. Come, join us.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: How do you know what I want?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Woman
Text: You're young. Think young, brother!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: You make it tempting.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu. Mister Sulu, explain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No explanation, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Sevrin will be released when we think he is medically safe.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: singing
Text: Stiff man putting my mind in jail. And the judge bang the gavel and say no bail. Gonna lick his hand and wag my tail.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: Herbert! Herbert!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering to Bridge.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Scotty, what is it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain, I just had to give one of those barefooted what do you call 'ems the boot out of here. She came in bold as brass, tried to incite my crew to disaffect.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Scotty. Mister Spock, I don't seem to be able to communicate with these people. Do you think you can persuade them to behave?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall make an attempt, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock. If it weren't for that ambassador's son, they'd all be in the brig.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5832.5. The arrogance of Doctor Sevrin and his followers is creating an intolerable situation aboard the Enterprise. If it continues, I'll be forced to use controls which might not agree with Starfleet's suggestion that they be handled with extreme tolerance.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I have no influence over what they do.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: They respect you. They will listen to your reasoning. For their sake, you must stop them. Doctor Sevrin, I'm in a position to help you and your group. I can use the resources of the Enterprise to determine whether or not Eden actually exists and to plot its exact location. I can present a case to Federation to allow you and your group to colonise that planet. Neither you nor your people are at present charged with a crime. However, incitement to disaffection is criminal. The Federation will never allow the colonisation of a planet by criminals. If they persist, they will be so charged and forever barred from Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: As I have been barred.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you knew you were a carrier.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Of course I knew. You've researched my life. You've read the orders restricting me to travel only in areas of advanced technology because of what my body carries.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: What I fail to understand is why you disobey those orders.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Because this is poison to me. This stuff you breathe, this stuff you live in, the shields of artificial atmosphere that we have layered about every planet. The programs in those computers that run your ship and your lives for you, they bred what my body carries. That's what your science have done to me. You've infected me. Only the primitives can cleanse me. I cannot purge myself until I am among them. Only their way of living is right. I must go to them.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your very presence will destroy the people you seek. Surely you know that.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I shall go to them and be One with them. And together we shall build a world such as this galaxy has never seen. A world. A life. A life. So now you're going to try to persuade me that your technologies will find a cure for me, and then I'll be free to go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: And for that reason I should persuade my friends to behave so that they too will be allowed.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Doctor.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: All right, you send them in. I'll talk to them.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor Sevrin is insane. I've not consulted Doctor McCoy, but I have no doubt of it.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll have Bones check him out. Spock, I'm sorry. You had great respect for him. But it does explain some of what they've done.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: His condition does not affect my interest in the movement. There is no insanity in what they seek. I made a promise which I should like to keep. With your permission, I must locate Eden. I shall work in my quarters. May I have the assistance of Mister Chekov in auxiliary control?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certainly. Mister Chekov, assist Mister Spock. Bridge to Sickbay.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: McCoy here.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'd like to talk to you.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5832.6. I have asked Doctor McCoy to check Starfleet medical records to verify Mister Spock's suspicion that Doctor Sevrin is insane. In spite of Doctor Sevrin's antipathy to us, he has promised Mister Spock that he will order his disciples to conform to our rules and regulations.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come in.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Am I crossing you?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: No.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: I was just thinking, I (sees the lyre) Hey, brother, do you play? Is it Vulcan? Can I try it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Spock gestures his permission and the young man strums a chord

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Oh ho, that's now. That's real now. I reach that, brother. I really do. Give.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: He hands the lyre to Spock who plays it briefly

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Hey, how about a session, you and us? It would sound. That's what I came for. I wanted to ask, you know, great white captain upstairs, but he don't reach us. But would he shake on a session? I mean, we want to co-operate, like you ask, so I'm asking.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I understand you correctly, I believe the answer might be yes.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: I'll spread the word.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Am I allowed in?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Yes.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: I have been looking for you, Pavel. What room is this?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Auxiliary control.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: What's it for?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Should the main control room breakdown or suffer damage, we can navigate the ship from here. What do you want?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: To apologise. I should not have teased you. It was cruel.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: It does not matter.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Oh, but it does. It is against everything I believe in.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Let us not discuss your beliefs.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: And I do not like having you angry with me, or disapproving.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Then why do you do such things?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: What are you working on?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I am assisting Mister Spock in locating your Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Oh, now you are teasing me.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I am not. These tapes contain star charts, and we project the orbits of the various planets here. By mathematical process, we determine whether or not they are affected by other bodies not yet charted.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Do you know all these things?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: What I do not know I find out from the computer banks. If, if I knew nothing at all, I could navigate the ship simply by studying what is stored in there. They contain the sum of all human knowledge. They solve our problems of navigation. Of control. Of life support.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: They tell you what to do, and you do what they tell you.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No. We use our own judgment also.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: I could never obey a computer.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: You could never listen to anyone. You always had to be different.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Not different. What I wanted to be. There is nothing wrong in doing what you want.

Title: The Way To Eden
