Context: Chekov gives in, and kisses her

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not receiving, Mister Chekov. Spock to Chekov. Repeat, I am not receiving.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I am sorry, Mister Spock. I was momentarily delayed.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: His name is Sulu, specialist in weapons and navigation. His hobby is botany.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Can?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: Can. I reach botany. It's my favorite of studies. What's yours?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Vulcan. Spock is practically One now.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Everything can be handled from auxiliary control. The computers contain all the information we need. We can do it.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: It starts to chime.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: When will it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Soon. Like he said now, we should all go out and swing as many as possible over.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: Can you suggest any special ways to swing them?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Just be friendly. You know how to be friendly. Then they'll be friendly.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Sounds are being laid down in a session and piped through the ship

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: singing
Text: I'm talkin ''bout you, I'm talkin ''bout me. Long time back when the galaxy was new. Man found out what he had to do. Found he had to eat and he found he had to drink. And a long time later he found he had to think. Uh huh. Yes, think. I'm standing here wondering.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: All
Text: What?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: If a man tells another man out of my way. He piles up trouble for himself all day. But all kinds of trouble come to an end. When a man tells another man be my friend, uh huh. My friend. Well, what's it going to be?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Girl
Context: singing
Text: There's a mile wide emptiness between you and me.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Spock arrives with his lyre

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Can't reach across it, hardly even see.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Girl
Text: Someone ought to take a step one way or other.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: with chorus
Text: Let's say goodbye, or let's say brother. Brother. Brother. Hey, out there. Hey, out there. Hey, out there. Hey, out there. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. Let's get together and have some fun. I don't know how to do it but it's got to be done.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Then Spock plays, accompanied by a girl playing what looks like a wire-spoked wheel

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: In the Brig, Rad climbs up a ladder and uses pressure points to knock out the guard. Then he releases Sevrin from his cell

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Many of the crew are moving to the beat

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: At least we know where they are and what they're doing. I don't know why a young mind has to be an undisciplined one. They're troublemakers.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I used to get into a little trouble when I was that age, Scotty. Didn't you?

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Rad takes out the man on duty in Auxiliary control, then he and Sevrin sit down and start changing things

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, I get no response from controls. We're going off course.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's shorted. No, it's channeled over somewhere. To auxiliary control.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to auxiliary control. Bridge to auxiliary control.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, it seems as though someone else is running the ship.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: That's right, someone else is running this ship.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: All his followers are there now

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I am. All functions, life support as well. You cannot interfere, as I have frozen the doors to the control room.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I do not intend to hand over the helm to you until and unless we reach Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: If I am in any way prevented from reaching that destination, I shall destroy this ship and all aboard.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can he do it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: He has the capability, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: He's got everything channelled over.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Start a trace-back of all circuits.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: See if you can bypass him.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Do that, and I shall retaliate.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I shall not warn you again.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain, we're now leaving the Neutral Zone. Bearing into Romulan space!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any patrols?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There will be soon. Doctor Sevrin. You are violating Romulan space and endangering the peace of the galaxy.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The Romulans will view this as a military intrusion and attack. Bring the ship about now. If you bring her about

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And return to Starbase, no charges will be leveled.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Like you said, Brother Sevrin.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you do not, you will never reach Eden. You and this ship will be destroyed.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: He's got jelly in the belly. Real scared.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Adam.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rad.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are being led by a man who is insane.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are being used by him.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you tell them.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Adam, there is a file on Doctor Sevrin in our computer banks. In it you'll find a report attesting to the fact

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: That he is a carrier of a bacillus strain known as Synthococcus novae.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: sarcastic
Text: Ain't that just awful.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: You'll also find a report from the same hospital, giving a full psychological profile on him and projecting these actions of his.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Yay, brother.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Adam. You know I reach you. I believe in what you seek. But there is a tragic difference between what you want and what he wants.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: You're making me cry.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: There it is. They've established Eden, Brother Sevrin.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Pavel said they would. Our original course must have been somewhat in error.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: When will we get there?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: At this speed, three hours.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: They'll try to persuade us to change course presently and then they'll attack.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: How do you plan to stop them? By cutting off their life support?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I have another weapon. Take control, Brother Rad.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Sevrin takes the cover off a wall access point

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: What are you doing?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Making an adjustment on their circuits.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Context: singing
Text: Headin' out to Eden. Yea, brother. Headin' out to Eden. No more trouble in my body or my mind. Gonna live like a king on whatever I find, Eat all the fruit and throw away the rind. Yea, brother. Yea.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: We are within sensor range of Eden and continuing to approach.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whatever they're going to do, they're going to do now. We have no choice. Mister Spock, Mister Scott.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: When will you use that?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: At the proper time. Let me know when we're in orbit.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: Approaching right on the dot, just as they plotted it, Brother Sevrin.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: What will that do to them? What is it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Well, I'm using sound against them, beyond the ultrasonic. It will stun them and allow us time to leave. We'll go in one of their shuttlecraft.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Sound pitched that high doesn't stun, it destroys. I remember when we read in the text that it

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: I've gone beyond those texts, Irina. It's correct for you to be concerned, but be assured also.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Rad
Text: We are in orbit over Eden, Brother Sevrin. It does destroy.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We cannot allow them to come after us. It will not reach us in here. I can control it all. I have adjusted it so that it will suspend its effects after a few moments and allow us time to escape. Then, after we've gone, it will automatically reactivate. Rejoice, brethren. Soon we shall step together into Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: A flame appears in the wall behind them

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Scott is trying to cut into the room with a phaser. Sevrin turns on his sonic weapon and Spock is instantly stricken with pain

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock! It's all right, Spock. It stopped.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, Captain, it hasn't stopped. It has gone beyond

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Now it affects Kirk. Scott is already unconscious

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, they're using

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: All over the ship, people fall to the floor

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Adam
Text: Steppin' into Eden. Yea, brother. Steppin' into Eden. Yea, brother. No more trouble in my body or my mind. Gonna live like a king on whatever find. Eat all the fruit and throw away the rind. Yea, brother.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: Now we may leave.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Scott, Kirk and Spock are waking up

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Context: in pain
Text: Captain, go. I. You must destroy the

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Ultrasonics. The panel.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Kirk staggers into the room and turns off the sound

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Engineering. Bridge? Hangar deck? Kirk to Transporter Room. Kirk to Bridge. Do you read me? Come in.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Sulu here, Captain. What happened to us? I heard a whistle, and then

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Never mind. Do we have control of the ship?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: No, sir. Control is in auxiliary.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can we break out of orbit if we have to?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I think so, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Hangar Deck to Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Crewman
Text: Sir, one of the shuttlecrafts has been taken. We were all knocked out.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by. Do you read any Romulans?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Negative, Captain. However I am picking up the shuttlecraft.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: It has landed. Except for those aboard the craft, I read no life at all, either humanoid nor animal.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Auxiliary control to Doctor McCoy. Bones, are you all right?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, Jim.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by, transporter room. Full medical gear.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge to Captain Kirk. Do you wish to open communication, sir?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No, they tried to destroy us. Let them think they succeeded. I want the co-ordinates zeroed in so that when we beam down, we won't be visible to them. Scotty, you have the conn. If any Romulans appear, try to make them understand. I do not want to provoke combat. Mister Spock. Mister Chekov, join us in the transporter room.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Looking remarkable like Miramanee's planet, right down to the lake. Or maybe the Pleasure Planet?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: The legends were true, Captain. Fantastically beautiful planet.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Eden.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is this what they believed they'd find? Then I can understand. Spread out. Approach with caution. (into communicator) Doctor Sevrin.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Chekov screams

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What is it?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The flower, sir. I touched it. It's like fire.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: His palm is covered in blisters

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's burned. All this plant life is full of acid. Even the grass, Jim.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Will our clothing protect us?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It should for a while.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Our young minstrel is spread out on the ground, a half-eaten fruit beside him

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Poison. The fruit is deadly.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: His name was Adam.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's the shuttlecraft.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The door opens. The hippies have blisters on their feet and can't walk. Kirk picks up Irina and carries her

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Here, we'll help you.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: The youngsters come out, and finally Sevrin

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor Sevrin. Bones!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He should be beamed aboard, Jim. He needs more than I can do for him here.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Spock to Enterprise.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Enterprise here.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Stand by to beam aboard injured parties. Medical team to the transporter room.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: No, we're not leaving.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can help you aboard the ship.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We're not leaving Eden, none of us.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Be sensible, Doctor.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Sevrin
Text: We're not leaving.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Sevrin runs off on his blistered feet and climbs a fruit tree

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come back here, you fool!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sevrin, don't! You'll kill yourself!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't bite into that!

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stop!

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: But man takes a bite of the forbidden fruit, and loses Eden forever

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: It was so beautiful.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Palmer
Text: I have Starbase now, Captain.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alert them that we have the four and we're ready to beam them down. And mark the incident closed.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Palmer
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bridge to Transporter. Scotty, are they there?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Scott
Text: Three of them, sir. Expecting a fourth any minute.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by. Mister Chekov, do you wish to attend?

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Captain, I wish first to apologise for my conduct during this time. I did not maintain myself under proper discipline. I endangered the ship and its personnel by my conduct. I respectfully submit myself for disciplinary action.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Chekov. You did what you had to do. As did we all. Even your friends. You may go.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Irina enters

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: I was coming to say goodbye.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: And I was coming to say goodbye to you. (a kiss) Be incorrect, occasionally.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Chekov
Text: And you be correct.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Occasionally.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Spock
Text: Miss Galliulin. It is my sincere wish that you do not give up your search for Eden. I have no doubt but that you will find it, or make it yourselves.

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Irina
Text: Thank you.

Title: The Way To Eden
Context: Irina leaves

Title: The Way To Eden
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We reach, Mister Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5843.7. The Enterprise is in the grip of a raging epidemic. Three crewmen have died and twenty three others have been struck down by Rigelian fever. In order to combat the illness, Doctor McCoy needs large quantities of ryetalyn, which is the only known antidote for the fever. Our sensors have picked up sufficient quantities of pure ryetalyn on a small planet in the Omega system. We are beaming down to secure this urgently needed material.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Compared to the lurid red, purple and vivid blue of the planet from space, the ground is pretty normal

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, there's a large deposit bearing two seven three, four kilometres away. I've got four hours to process that stuff, otherwise the epidemic will be irreversible. Everybody on board the Enterprise will

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strange. Readings indicate a life form in the vicinity, apparently human. Yet ship's sensors indicated this planet was uninhabited.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's get that ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: A strange device comes travelling through the air towards them. A bit like Nomad, but much smaller and with more round bits. It fires an energy beam at the landing party's feet. They try to fire their phasers.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Inoperative.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The device fires again, and closes in.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Do not kill.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The device backs away and a silver-haired man in sort of doublet and hose approaches

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm Captain James Kirk

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I know who you are. I have monitored your ship since it entered this system.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then if you know who we are, you know why we're here, Mister?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Flint. You will leave my planet.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Did you say your planet, sir?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: My retreat from the unpleasantness of life on Earth, and the company of people.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Flint, I have a sick crew up there. We can't possibly reach another planet in time. You can't refuse us the ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You're trespassing, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We're in need! We'll pay for it, work for it, trade for it.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You have nothing I want.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you have the ryetalyn that we need! If necessary, we'll take it.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: If you do not leave voluntarily, I have the power to force you to leave or kill you where you stand.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott, lock phasers onto our co-ordinates.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain, all phasers locked on.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Flint, if anything happens to us, four deaths and then my crew comes down and takes that ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: An interesting test of power. Your enormous forces against mine. Who would win?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Mister Flint, unless you are certain, I would suggest you refrain from a most useless experiment.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We need only a few hours.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Have you ever seen a victim of Rigelian fever? They die in one day. The effects are like bubonic plague.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Constantinople, summer 1334. It marched through the streets, the sewers. It left the city by ox cart, by sea, to kill half of Europe. The rats, rustling and squealing in the night as they, too, died. The rats.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you a student of history, sir?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I am. The Enterprise, a plague ship. You have two hours, at the end of which time you will leave.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: With all due gratitude.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: M4 will gather the ryetalyn which you need. (the device leaves) Permit me to offer you more comfortable surroundings.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: A comfortable room, with 18th century furniture, woven rugs, paintings on the wall

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Come in, gentlemen.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Our ship's sensors did not reveal your presence here, Mister Flint.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: My planet is surrounded by screens which create the impression of lifelessness. A protection against the curious, the uninvited.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then you live here alone.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Except for M4, which serves as butler, housekeeper, gardener and guardian.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A most impressive home, Mister Flint.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, a Shakespeare first folio. A Gutenberg Bible.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: A young woman sits in a high-backed carved chair, watching a monitor image of Kirk

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Creation lithographs by Taranullus of Centauri Seven. That's one of the rarest book collections in the galaxy, spanning centuries.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Be comfortable, gentlemen. Help yourselves to brandy.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do we trust him?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem logical to do so for the moment.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I'll need two hours to process that ryetalyn into antitoxin.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If that ryetalyn isn't here in one hour, we'll go prospecting, right over Mister Flint if necessary.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is the most splendid private collection of art I've ever seen, and the most unique. The majority are the works of Leonardo da Vinci, Renaissance period, some of the works of Reginald Pollack, 20th century, and even a sten from Marcus Two.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: At last I have seen other humans.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Other men.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: One is not human.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: The Vulcan.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Oh, so that is a Vulcan. I would like to discuss sub-dimensional physics with him. You've taught me all you know in the area and you say Vulcans know more.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Even he is not your intellectual equal, nor mine.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Let me meet them.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: They are selfish, brutal, a part of the human community which I rejected and from which I've shielded you.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Soon they will be gone. Let me meet them.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Rayna. (nearly kisses her) Have you been lonely?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: What is loneliness?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: It is thirst. It is a flower dying in the desert.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Flint, don't take this opportunity away from me. It's so exciting.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Exciting? You have never made a demand of me before.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I'm sorry.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Do not be sorry. It might be interesting.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Saurian brandy, one hundred years old. Jim?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Please.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Mister Spock, I know you won't have one. Heaven forbid those mathematically perfect brain waves be corrupted by this all too human vice.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Doctor. I will have a brandy.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do you think the two of us can handle a drunk Vulcan? Once alcohol hits that green blood

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: If I appear distracted, it is because of what I have seen. I am close to experiencing an unaccustomed emotion.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'll drink to that. What emotion?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Envy. None of these da Vinci paintings has ever been catalogued or reproduced. They are unknown works, all apparently authentic to the last brush stroke and use of materials. As undiscovered da Vinci's, they would be priceless.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Would be? You mean you think they're fakes?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most strange. A man of Flint's obvious wealth and impeccable taste scarcely needs to hang fakes. Yet my tricorder analysis indicates that the canvas and pigments used are of contemporary origin.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well, this could be what it seems to be, or it could be a cover, a setup, or even an illusion.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that could explain the paintings. Similar to the real thing.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, at your earliest opportunity, take a full tricorder reading of our host. See if he's human. Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, run a full computer check on Mister Flint and on this planet, Holberg Nine One Seven G. Stand by with your results. I'll contact.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. Let's enjoy this brandy. It tastes real.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: M4 glides in with a bag of purple crystals and puts it on the table. It leaves

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Easy. Bones?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Ryetalyn, ready to be processed into antitoxin.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam up to the ship and start processing.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: That will not be necessary, Captain. M4 can prepare the ryetalyn for inoculation more quickly in my laboratory than you could aboard your ship.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I would like to supervise that, of course.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: And when you are satisfied as to procedures, I hope you will do me the honour of being my guests at dinner.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Flint. I don't think we have the time.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I regret my earlier inhospitality. Let me make amends.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Rayna enters, and that thud you hear is Kirk's jaw hitting the floor

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Gentlemen, may I present Rayna.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I thought you lived alone.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I meant there are no others besides my family. Doctor McCoy. Mister Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Mister Spock, I do hope we can find a moment to discuss field density and its relationship to gravity phenomena.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed. I would appreciate such a talk. It is an interest of mine.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Captain Kirk.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rayna.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Her parents were killed in an accident while in my employ. Before dying, they placed their infant, Rayna Kapec, in my custody. I have raised and educated her.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: With most impressive results, sir. What else interests you besides gravity phenomena, Rayna?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Everything. Less than that is betrayal of the intellect.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The totality of the universe? All knowledge?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Rayna possesses the equivalent of seventeen university degrees in the sciences and arts. She is aware that the intellect is not all. But its cultivation must come first or the individual makes errors, wastes time in unprofitable pursuits.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: At her age, I rather enjoyed errors with no noticeable damage, but I must admit you're the farthest thing from a bookworm I've ever seen.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Flint is my teacher. You are the only other men I've ever seen.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The misfortune of men everywhere, and our privilege.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: If you would accompany my robot to the laboratory, Doctor, you can rest assured that the ryetalyn is being processed.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: McCoy and M4 leave

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Your pleasure, gentlemen. Chess, billiards, conversation?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why not all three?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: M4 leads McCoy into a lab, then disappears through a door. McCoy examines the large coloured jars on a table whilst M4 works behind an opaque window

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Rayna sends the cue ball around all four cushions to hit both reds. Billiards

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you teach her that?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: We play often.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: May I show you, Captain?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You said something about savagery, Mister Flint. When was the last time you visited Earth?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You would tell me that it is no longer cruel. But it is, Captain. Look at your starship, bristling with weapons. Its mission to colonise, exploit, destroy, if necessary, to advance Federation causes.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Rayna guides Kirk's shot, but he misses anyway

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Our missions are peaceful, our weapons defensive. If we were barbarians, we would not have asked for ryetalyn. Indeed, your greeting, not ours, lacked a certain benevolence.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: The result of pressures which are not your concern.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, well, those pressures are everywhere in everyone, urging him to what you call savagery. The private hells, the inner needs and mysteries, the beast of instinct. As human beings, that is the way it is. To be human is to be complex. You can't avoid a little ugliness from within and from without.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: While Rayna is very close to Kirk, Spock is at a gold carved grand piano

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Why don't you play the waltz, Mister Spock? To be human is also to seek pleasure, to laugh, to dance. Rayna is a most accomplished dancer.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: May I have the pleasure?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: So the couple do an old-fashioned waltz as Spock plays

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: In the lab, M4 brings three vials to McCoy for analysis

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Kirk and Rayna are now literally cheek to cheek. Flint is watching her carefully

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: McCoy enters

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Is something wrong?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, there's something wrong. The ryetalyn is no good. It contains irillium, nearly one part per thousand.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Irillium will render the antitoxin inert and useless.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Most unfortunate that it was not detected. I shall go with M4 to gather more ryetalyn and screen it myself. You're welcome to join me, Doctor.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Flint leaves

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time factor, Bones? Epidemic?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Nearly two and a half hours. I guess we've got time to get in under the wire. I've never seen anything like the speed of that robot. It'd take us twice as long to process that stuff.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But would we have made the error?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what if all the ryetalyn on this planet contains irillium?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Go with Flint. Keep an eye on procedures.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Like a hawk.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: McCoy leaves

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Something else which is rather extraordinary. This waltz I just played is by Johannes Brahms.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Later, Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, it is written in manuscript. In original manuscript, in Brahms' own hand, which I recognise. It is totally unknown, definitely the work of Brahms, and yet unknown.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I think I will go to the laboratory. There may be a way of reversing the irillium's effect and saving the existing antitoxin. Stay here. Let me know when Flint and McCoy return.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5843.75. Have I committed a grave error in accepting Flint's word that he would deliver the antidote to us? The precious time I have let pass may result in disaster for the Enterprise and her crew.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Kirk is having a look around when Rayna enters and goes to a closed door

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You left us. The room became lonely.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: It is a thirst, a flower dying in the desert.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What? What's in there?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I do not know. Flint told me never to enter. He denies me nothing else.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why are you here?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I do not know. I come here when I am troubled, when I would search myself.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Are you troubled now?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Yes.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: By what? Are you happy here with Flint?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: He is the greatest, kindest, wisest man in the galaxy.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then why are you afraid? (he embraces her) Don't be afraid.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Kirk kisses Rayna. M4 enters and Rayna is scared. Kirk pushes her away

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Stop command. Stop.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: M4 ignores her and pursues Kirk around the room. Spock vapourises it with his phaser as it starts to fire at Kirk

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fortunately, the robot did not detect my presence and deactivate my phaser.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: M4 was programmed to defend this household and its members. No doubt I should have altered its instructions to allow for unauthorised but predictable actions on your part. It thought you were attacking Rayna. A misinterpretation.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If it were around right now, it would correct

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: M4 enters

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Too useful a device to be without, really. I created another. It will now go to the laboratory and join Doctor McCoy.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: M4 leaves

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Be thankful that you did not attack me, Captain. I might have accepted battle, and I have twice your physical strength.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: In your own words, it would be an interesting test of power.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: How childish he is, Rayna. Would you call him brave or a fool?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I'm glad he did not die.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Of course! Death, when unnecessary, is a tragic thing. Doctor McCoy's in the laboratory with the new ryetalyn. He's satisfied as to its quality. May I suggest that you wait here patiently, safely. You have seen that my defence systems operate automatically and not always in accordance with my wishes. Come, Rayna. Rayna! Come.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Rayna reluctantly tears herself away from Kirk, and they both leave

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't like the way he orders her around.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Since we are dependent on Mister Flint for the ryetalyn, Captain, may I respectfully suggest that you pay less attention to the young lady if you should encounter her again. Our host's interests do not appear to be confined to art and science.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He loves her?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Strongly indicated.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Jealousy. Yes, that would explain the attack, but he seemed to want us together. The billiard game. He suggested we dance.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: It does appear to defy the male logic as I understand it.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Report on the Rigelian fever.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Nearly everybody aboard has got it, Captain. We're working a skeleton crew and waiting for the ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Just a little while longer, Scotty. Report on the computer search.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Uhura
Text: There is no report on Mister Flint. He doesn't seem to have any past.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Uhura
Text: The planet was purchased thirty years ago by a Mister Brack, a wealthy financier and recluse.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Run a computer check on Rayna Kapec. Status, legal ward after the death of her parents.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out, Mister Scott.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have still a greater mystery, Captain. I was able to run a tricorder scan on Mister Flint. He is human, but there are certain biophysical peculiarities. Some body function readings are disproportionate. For one thing, extreme age is indicated on the order of six thousand years.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you confirm that, Mister Spock?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: I shall programme the readings through Doctor McCoy's medical computer when we return to the ship.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Time factor.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: We must commence ryetalyn injections within two hours and eighteen minutes or the epidemic will prove fatal to us all.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's keeping the processing this time?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: The delay may be deliberate.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: As though he's keeping us here for some reason.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Most interesting. Our host appears to wish us to linger, yet he is apprehensive. It is logical to assume that we are being monitored and that he is aware of our every move.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Flint turns off the screen

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: You sent the robot to kill him.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: It came to protect you.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: My mind could not have summoned it. I was not frightened.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: It was defective, then. I would have destroyed it myself. Have I lied to you?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Never.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Believe what I say. I would not want Captain Kirk dead. What did you feel?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: You will let them have the ryetalyn?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Yes. Go to them, if you wish. Say your farewells.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mister Scott, sir. There's no record of a Rayna Kapec in Federation legal banks.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No award of custody?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Scott
Text: No background at all in any computer banks. Like Flint.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk out. Like Flint. People without a past. What hold does he have over her?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I would suggest that our immediate concern is the ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find McCoy.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: Captain?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll meet you in the lab.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Spock leaves

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I've come to say goodbye.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't want to say goodbye.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Flint watches on the monitor as Kirk kisses Rayna, and she starts to respond

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: A last tender encounter, Captain Kirk, to end your usefulness.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I tell you, Spock, I was waiting for the robot to finish the processing, and the next thing I knew it was gone and so was the ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting. Obviously, Mister Flint is not yet ready for us to depart.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I think we'd better tell Jim.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: The captain wanted us to wait here.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Come with me. I offer you happiness.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I've known security here.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Childhood must end. You love me, not Flint.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Rayna dashes out of the room

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Kirk enters

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Flint lied. The ryetalyn isn't here.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Picking up tricorder readings, Captain. Apparently the ryetalyn is behind this door.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why is Flint playing tricks on us? Apparently we're supposed to go in and get it, if we can. Well, let's not disappoint the chess master. Phasers on full.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The door opens by itself

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, I shall get the ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why you?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: There may be dangers within.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's find out.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Let me go alone, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why? Get to the point, Spock, if there is one.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll all go.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: they go down a short corridor into another laboratory

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The vials of ryetalyn are on a table.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The ryetalyn.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: And over by the far wall is a covered figure with the label - Rayna 16. Kirk takes a look at it. It is a bald version of Rayna. They look further and see others. Rayna 14, Rayna 15

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5843.8. We have accomplished our mission and have the ryetalyn ready to combat the epidemic aboard the Enterprise. But we have also discovered our benefactor's secret. He has created the perfect woman. Her only flaw, she's not human.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Physically human but not human. These are earlier versions of Rayna, Jim. She's an android.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Created here by my hand. Here, the centuries of loneliness were to end.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your collection of Leonardo da Vinci masterpieces, Mister Flint, they appear to have been recently painted on contemporary canvas with contemporary materials. And on your piano, a waltz by Johannes Brahms, an unknown work in manuscript, written in modern ink. Yet absolutely authentic, as are your paintings.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I am Brahms.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: And da Vinci?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Yes.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: How many other names shall we call you?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Solomon, Alexander, Lazarus, Methuselah, Merlin, Abramson. A hundred other names you do not know.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were born?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: In that region of earth later called Mesopotamia, in the year 3834 BC, as the millennia are reckoned. I was Akharin, a soldier, a bully and a fool. I fell in battle, pierced to the heart and did not die.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Instant tissue regeneration coupled with some perfect form of biological renewal. You learned that you were immortal and

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: And to conceal it. To live some portion of a life, to pretend to age and then move on before my nature was suspected.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your wealth and your intellect are the product of centuries of acquisition. You knew the greatest minds in history.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Galileo, Socrates, Moses. I have married a hundred times, Captain. Selected, loved, cherished. Caressed a smoothness, inhaled a brief fragrance. Then age, death, the taste of dust. Do you understand?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: You wanted a perfect, ultimate woman, as brilliant, as immortal as yourself. Your mate for all time.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Designed by my heart. I could not love her more.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, you knew?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: I had hoped I was wrong.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You cannot love an android, Captain. I love her. She is my handiwork, my property. She is what I desire.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK:: You brought me here to learn this? Does she know?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: She will never know.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let's go.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You will stay.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: We have discovered what he is, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: If you leave, the curious would follow, the foolish, the meddlers, the officials, the seekers. My privacy was my own. Its invasion be on your head.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: We can remain silent.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: The disaster of intervention, Spock. I've known it. I will not risk it.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: We see Flint press a button, and the Enterprise disappear from its orbit

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Clear out of the area. Inform Starfleet Command. Enterprise? Scotty?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: They cannot answer, Captain.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: A model Enterprise appears on a table. Kirk peers in through the viewscreen to see everyone stationary

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My crew.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: The test of power. You had no chance. It is time for you to join your crew.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You'd wipe out four hundred lives? Why?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I have seen a hundred billion fall. I know death better than any man. I have tossed enemies into his grasp. And I know mercy. Your crew is not dead, but suspended.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Worse than dead! Restore them. Restore my ship!

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: In time. A thousand, two thousand years. You will know the future, Captain Kirk.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You have been such men. You've known and created such beauty. You've watched your race evolve from cruelty and barbarism throughout your enormous life, and yet now you would do this to us?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: The flowers of my past. I hold the nettles of the present. I am Flint now, with my needs.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What needs?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Tonight I have seen something wondrous, something I've waited for, laboured for. Nothing must endanger it. At last, Rayna's emotions have stirred to life. Now they will turn to me in this solitude which I preserve.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: No.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Rayna.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: You must not do this to them.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I must.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: What will you feel for him after we are gone?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: All emotions are in play, Mister Flint. You harm us, she hates you.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Give me back my ship. Your secret is safe with us.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The model Enterprise disappears, and appears back in orbit

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's why you delayed the processing of the ryetalyn. You realised what was happening. You kept us together, Rayna and me, because you knew I could bring her emotions alive. And now you're just going to take over.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: I shall take what is mine when she comes to me. We are mated, Captain, alike, immortal. You must forget your feelings in this matter, which is quite impossible for you.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Impossible? Impossible. From the beginning, you used me. I can't love her, but I do love her. And she loves me.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: No!

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: They tussle

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, your primitive impulses will not alter the circumstances.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stay out of this. We're fighting over a woman.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, you're not, for she is not.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: Flint thumps Kirk, then repeatedly throws him across the room

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I cannot be the cause of this. I will not be the cause of this. Please stop. Stop! I choose where I want to go.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: The men stop fighting in astonishment

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: what I want to do. I choose. I choose.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Rayna!

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: No. Do not order me. No one can order me!

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: She's human. Down to the last blood cell, she's human. Down to the last thought, hope, aspiration, emotion, she's human. The human spirit is free. You have no power of ownership. She's free to do as she wishes.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Gentlemen, I urge you to stop. There is a danger.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: No man beats me.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't want to beat you. This is no test of power. Rayna belongs to herself and she claims the human right of choice to be as she wills, to do as she wills, to think as she wills.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: That's what I've worked for.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Rayna, come with me.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: Stay.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Rayna
Text: I was not human. Now I love. I love.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: She collapses. McCoy checks for a pulse

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Flint
Text: You can't die.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: She loved you, Captain. And you, too, Mister Flint, as a mentor, even as a father. There was not enough time for her to adjust to the awful power and contradictions of her new-found emotions. She could not bear to hurt either of you. The joys of love made her human, and the agonies of love destroyed her.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: The epidemic is reduced and no longer a threat. The Enterprise is on course five one three mark seven, as you ordered.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Kirk
Text: A very old and lonely man. And a young and lonely man. We put on a pretty poor show, didn't we? If only I could forget.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: He rests his head on his arms, on the desk. McCoy enters

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. Oh, thank heaven, sleeping at last.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Your report, Doctor.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, those tricorder readings on Mister Flint are finally correlated: He's dying. You see, Flint, in leaving Earth with all of its complex fields within which he was formed, sacrificed immortality. He'll live the remainder of a normal life span, then die.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: On that day, I shall mourn. Does he know?

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I told him myself. He intends to devote the remainder of his years and great abilities to the improvement of the human condition. And who knows what he might come up with.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, I guess that's all. I can tell Jim later or you can. Considering his opponent's longevity, truly an eternal triangle. You wouldn't understand that, would you, Spock? You see, I feel sorrier for you than I do for him because you'll never know the things that love can drive a man to. The ecstasies, the miseries, the broken rules, the desperate chances, the glorious failures, the glorious victories. All of these things you'll never know simply because the word love isn't written into your book. Goodnight, Spock.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Goodnight, Doctor.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I do wish he could forget her.

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Context: McCoy leaves. Spock goes over to Kirk and initiates a mind meld

Title: Requiem For Methuselah
Speaker: Spock
Text: Forget.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: All observation stations, take final readings. This'll be our last orbit.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, any answers?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I still read a suggestion of carbon cycle life forms on the planet surface, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which is scientifically impossible under conditions there.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed. Mister Sulu, switch to the planet area I have under observation.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: I'm reading it now, Mister Spock. It seems to indicate artificial power being generated in factor seven quantities.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Which would indicate a considerable civilisation there.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's all this poppycock about life forms on this planet, Spock? The surface is molten lava. The atmosphere is poisonous.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Our readings could be false, Captain, perhaps caused by some natural phenomena.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well I think Starfleet should forget about those old space legends. There's no intelligent life here.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant, anything from the planet?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I've repeatedly tried on every hailing frequency, sir. There's no response on any channel.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Transmit to Starfleet our sensor readings and log entries on the planet. Surface conditions make it impossible for us to beam down and investigate further. We are therefore going on to our next assignment.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Completing final orbit, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepare to warp us out.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: The red light on the navigation console flashes, and the lights dim

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Alert status.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: We're being scanned, Captain. A deep probe, incredibly swift.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: The lights come back up, and the planet disappears from the viewscreen

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: On the screen is the image of a man sitting in a large leather chair, and wearing a stove-pipe hat

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Captain Kirk, I believe. A pleasure to make your acquaintance, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Uhura

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: No need to check your voice telegraph device. Do I gather that you recognise me?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I recognise what you appear to be.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: And appearances can be most deceiving, but not in this case, James Kirk. I am Abraham Lincoln.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: I have been described in many ways, Mister Spock, but never with that word.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I was requesting your analysis, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: They did scan us and our vessel, Captain, and doubtless obtained sufficient information to present this illusion.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Illusion? Captain, will you permit me to come aboard your vessel? No doubt you have devices which can check my reality.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'd be honoured to have you aboard, Mister President.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Do you still measure time in minutes?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can convert to it, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Then you should be directly over my position in. There. Exactly twelve and one half minutes. Until then, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: And the orange planet is back in view

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Context: signing a PADD
Text: Thank you, Mister Mulney.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Small change occurring there, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Magnification four, helm.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: An area of approximately one thousand square kilometres. It measures completely Earth-like.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Perfect oxygen-nitrogen atmosphere.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: He called it to the second, sir. We'll be over it in exactly twelve minutes now.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Security, send a detachment to the transporter room immediately, phaser side arms, and be prepared to give presidential honours.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, do you really believe he's Abraham Lincoln?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's obvious he believes it. Doctor McCoy, Mister Spock, full dress uniforms.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Scott is in kilt and plaid, the three security guards look smart

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Full dress? Presidential honours? What is this nonsense, Mister Dickerson?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Dickerson
Text: I understand President Lincoln's coming aboard, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Ha! You're daft, man.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Dickerson
Text: All I know is what the captain tells me, and he says he'll have the hide of the first man that so much as smiles.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: McCoy enters

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I'd have expected sanity from the ship's surgeon, at least. President Lincoln, indeed. No doubt to be followed by Louis of France and Robert the Bruce.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Kirk and Spock enter

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If so, we'll execute appropriate honours to each, Mister Scott.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, I don't for a moment believe that President Lincoln is actually coming aboard, but we're dealing with an unknown and apparently highly advanced life-form. Until we know, when in Rome, we'll do as the Romans do.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: Bridge to Transporter room. One minute to overhead position.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Locked on to something. Does that appear human to you, Mister Spock?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Fascinating. For a moment, it appeared almost mineral. Like living rock with heavy fore claws. It's settling down now to completely human readings.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: We can beam it aboard anytime now, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, take tricorder readings and see if it is human. Appropriate ruffles and flourishes, Mister Spock. Security, stand ready.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Dickerson
Text: Phaser team, set ready for a heavy stun.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Band honours ready, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Energise.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: A tall, lean figure in a black frock coat is beamed aboard to drum beat and a bosun's whistle

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The USS Enterprise is honoured to have you aboard, Mister President.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Strange. Where are the musicians?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's taped music, sir. A starship on active duty never carries an honour detachment.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Taped music, you say. Well, perhaps Mister Spock will be good enough to explain that to me later. A most interesting way to come aboard, Captain. What was the device used?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An energy-matter scrambler, sir. The molecules in your body are converted into energy, then beamed into this chamber and reconverted back into their original pattern.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Well, since I'm obviously here, and quite whole, whatever you mean apparently works very well indeed. Gentlemen, if those are weapons, please lower them. At my age, I'm afraid I'm not very dangerous.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Human, Jim.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: All too human, Doctor McCoy. Happy to make your acquaintance.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister President, may I present my officers. Commander Spock, second in command, Engineering Officer Scott and Security Officer Dickerson.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Mister Spock, Mister Scott, Mister Dickerson. Gentlemen, I hope to talk to each of you. But meanwhile, your captain is consumed with questions and I shall do my utmost to answer them. And I trust your duties will permit time to answer some of mine. At your service, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Lieutenant Dickerson, you and your men may return to quarters. Mister President.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: A most interesting vessel.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Kirk, Lincoln, Spock and security leave

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Just what was it you locked onto before you beamed him aboard?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: You heard Mister Spock yourself. Mineral he called it, like living rock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And that became Lincoln?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I couldn't tell. It may have been another figure down there standing by. What do you make of it?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I'm not quite sure.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5906.4. Who or what has been beamed aboard our vessel? An alien who has changed himself into this form? An illusion? I cannot conceive it possible that Abraham Lincoln could have actually been reincarnated. And yet his kindness, his gentle wisdom, his humour, everything about him is so right.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, if I recall, your Union Army observation balloons were tendered six hundred or so feet high. We're six hundred and forty three miles above the surface of this planet.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: You can measure great distances that closely?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: We do, sir. Six hundred forty three miles, two thousand twenty one feet, two point zero four inches at this moment, using your old-style measurements.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Bless me.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Excuse me, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Lieutenant.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: What a charming negress. Oh, forgive me, my dear. I know in my time some used that term as a description of property.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: But why should I object to that term, sir? You see, in our century we've learned not to fear words.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: May I present our communications officer, Lieutenant Uhura.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: The foolishness of my century had me apologising where no offense was given.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We've each learned to be delighted with what we are. The Vulcans learned that centuries before we did.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is basic to the Vulcan philosophy, sir. The combination of a number of things to make existence worthwhile.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Yes. Philosophy of Nome, meaning all. How did I know that? Just as I seem to know that on the planet surface you will meet one of the greatest living Vulcans in all the long history of your planet. My mind cannot recall his name, but I know he will be there. What is it that powers your vessel, Captain? May I see your engine room?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Certainly. Our engineering officer

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Has been waiting in the briefing room for you, sir, for over two hours.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Oh, dear. If you'll forgive me, our communications officer

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: I would be delighted to have her as guide.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Forgive me again. We'll rejoin you shortly.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where the devil are they?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Why, they're probably looking up a plate of haggis in the galley. They've been everywhere else.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Kirk and Spock enter

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Sorry to have been delayed, gentlemen.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, I would be the last to advise you on your command image.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I doubt that, Bones, but continue.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Do I have to lay it out for you? Practically the entire crew has seen you treat this impostor like the real thing when he can't possibly be the real article.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Lincoln died three centuries ago on a planet hundreds of light years away.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: More that direction, Engineer.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're the science officer. Why aren't you, well, doing whatever a science officer does at a time like this?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am, Doctor. I am observing the alien.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: At last! At least somebody agrees with us he's an alien.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, of course he's an alien.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: MCCOY And he's potentially dangerous.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Mad. Loony as an Arcturian dogbird.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, as you know, Mister Spock and I have been invited to beam down to the planet surface with him. Any comments on that?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, a big one. Suddenly, miraculously, we see a small spot of Earth-type environment down there. Now is it really there, or do we just think we see it down there?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: You might beam down into a sea of molten lava.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But why would he want to kill only two of us?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would be illogical. With such abilities, they could as easily trick us into destroying the entire vessel.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you implying, Mister Spock, that it's probably safe to beam down there?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, I'm not, Doctor. There's no doubt they want us down there for some hidden purpose. Otherwise, they would have revealed some logical reason for all of this.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why Lincoln, Spock? Any speculation on that?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Speculation is unnecessary, Captain. The answer is clear. President Lincoln has always been a very personal hero to you. What better way to titillate your curiosity than to make him come alive for you.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But not only to me, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed. I, too, experienced his charm. It is a magnificent work of duplication.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But he holds a special involvement to you, Jim. I think it's interesting, in as much as you're the one who's going to make the decision whether to beam down or not.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Don't do it, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The very reason for the existence of our starships is contact with other life. Although the method is beyond our comprehension, we have been offered contact. Therefore, I shall beam down. Mister Spock, as for you

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, since I was included in the invitation to make contact, I must beam down with you.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You're both out of your heads!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And you're on the edge of insubordination.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Would I be on the edge of insubordination to remind the captain that this smells of something happening to him that I might not be able to patch together again?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Gentlemen, your concern is noted and appreciated. Mister Spock, standard dress, tricorders and phasers. We will guide President Lincoln to the transporter room. We'll beam down immediately.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Standing by, Mister Scott.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Transporter room to bridge. Standing by.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: We are now locked in synchronous orbit, Mister Scott. Sensors continue to show the area as completely Earth-like in all respects.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If they're wrong and they do beam into a pool of lava

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Then they're dead men. I couldna pull them back in time.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: All right, Mister Scott, energise.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Lincoln, Kirk and Spock are beamed away, but -

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Scotty.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Sandy ground, big rocks, orange sky

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Our phasers and tricorders did not beam down with us.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise? Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise, come in.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Undamaged, yet something is preventing them from functioning.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Come in, landing party. Report. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Can you read us?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: If they're all right, they should've reported in.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your explanation, sir?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Well, I have none. To me this seems quite as it should be.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Why were our weapons taken? Why can't we communicate with our ship?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Please, believe me. I know nothing other than what I have already told you.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The game is over. We've treated you with courtesy. We've gone along with what and who you think you are.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Despite the seeming contradictions, all is as it appears to be. I am Abraham Lincoln.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Just as I am whom I appear to be.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Surak.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Who?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: The greatest of all who ever lived on our planet, Captain. The father of all we became.
