Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Context: in the captain's chair
Text: All ship's systems going dead. Switch to reserve power. All decks report status.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: All decks report status. All decks report status.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Bridge to Engineering. Come in. What's happening to our power? Bridge to Engineering, report.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Everything's out. We've switched to reserve power. Lost all power in the warp engines.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Scott and McCoy enter

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: How is it, Mister Sulu?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: No answer yet on what caused it. They're standing by.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Shut down all but the most necessary systems.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: No damage report, Mister Scott.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: No indication of engine damage, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engage restart cycle.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: I can't. I don't understand it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Start emergency procedures.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Live long and prosper, Spock. May you also, Captain Kirk.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is not logical that you are Surak. There is no fact, extrapolation of fact or theory, which would make possible.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Whatever I am, would it harm you to give response?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Live long and prosper, image of Surak, father of all we now hold true.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: The image of Surak read in your face what is in your mind, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: As I turned and my eyes beheld you, I displayed emotion. I beg forgiveness.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: The cause was more than sufficient. Let us speak no further of it. In my time, we knew not of Earth men. I am pleased to see that we have differences. May we together become greater than the sum of both of us.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, we'll not go along with these charades any longer.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: A rock changes into a creature with heavy fore-claws

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: You'll have an answer soon, Captain. Our world is called Excalbia. Countless who live on that planet are watching. Before this drama unfolds, we give welcome to the ones named Kirk and Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We know nothing of your world or your customs. What do you mean, drama about to unfold?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: You're intelligent life form, but I'm surprised you do not perceive the honour we do you. Have we not created in this place on our planet a stage identical to your own world?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We perceive we were invited to come here, and we came in friendship. And you have deprived us of our instruments to examine your world, to defend ourselves, to communicate with our vessel.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: Your objection is well taken. We shall communicate with your vessel so your fellow life forms may also enjoy and profit from the play. Behold.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: More people arrive. A human, a Mongol, an alien woman and a Klingon

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: Captain, Mister Spock, some of these you may know through history. Genghis Khan, for one. And Colonel Green, who led a genocidal war early in the 21st century on Earth. Zora, who experimented with the body chemistry of subject tribes on Tiburon. Kahless the Unforgettable, the Klingon who set the pattern for his planet's tyrannies. We welcome the vessel Enterprise

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: To our solar system and to our spectacle.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: At least the captain and Spock are safe.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: It's a confrontation of some sort. Those are all figures out of history. Notoriously evil.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: We ask you to observe with us

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: The confrontation of the two opposing philosophies you term good and evil. Since this is our first experiment with Earthlings, our theme is a simple one. Survival, life and death. Your philosophies are alien to us, and we wish to understand them and discover which is the stronger. We learn by observing such spectacles.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you mean, survival?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: The word is explicit. If you and Spock survive, you return to your vessel. If you do not, your existence is ended.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Can we beam the captain and Spock back up?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: We don't have the power. They'll come aboard a mass of dying flesh.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, can we send the phasers down?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's nothing we can do, Doctor. Nothing but watch them. He's skimmed the worst ones in history to face them.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But they're not real, any more than that Lincoln or Surak. What do the sensors read?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: As life-forms. They are living beings.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Could they be aliens projecting an illusion?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The readings are those of humanoids.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: Why do you hesitate?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: Do you wish further clarification? Your choice of action is unlimited, as is your choice of weapons. Should you wish to use any, you may fabricate anything you desire out of what you can find around you. Captain?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock and I refuse to participate.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: You will decide otherwise.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: And changes back into a real lump of rock

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Analysis, Spock. Why do they want us to fight?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It may be exactly as explained, Captain. Our concept of good and evil is strange to them. Perhaps they wish to determine which is strongest.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And they'll get their answers if it kills us.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: I'm afraid none of us may leave, gentlemen, until we do what it demands of us.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Captain Kirk, may I speak with you? I quite agree with your attitude toward this charade. It's ridiculous to think that we should take part in it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you want?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: The same thing as you do, to get out of here. I have no quarrel with you any more than you have with me.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're somewhat different than the way history paints you, Colonel Green.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: History tends to exaggerate. I suggest we call a halt to this at once and see if we can't find some way out of our difficulties. My associates are in full agreement with me. Captain, you were tricked into coming here, weren't you? So were we all.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where do you come from?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: I can't remember. Isn't that strange? My memory used to be quite remarkable. Well, wherever it was, I want to get back. So it seems to me, Captain, that we have a common cause, and our enemy is that creature.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What do you propose?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: That we combine forces, and reason some way to overcome it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You were notorious, Colonel Green, for striking at your enemies in the midst of negotiating with them.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: But that was centuries ago, Captain, and not altogether true. No, there is much I would change now if I could. Don't let prejudice and rumour sway you.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Meanwhile, the other three baddies split up and start to circle around

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Captain! How can we warn him?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Khan throws a rock at Spock, and a fight starts until the bad guys run off

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Anyone hurt?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: I fear my clothing is somewhat damaged, but how delightful to discover at my age that I can still wrestle.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Spock?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm all right, Captain. However, I suggest that we prepare ourselves for another attack.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, I think Colonel Green is right. That rock-like thing is our enemy, not those illusions.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: For an illusion, my opponent carried a considerable punch. Oh, I forgot. You consider me an illusion too.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: The captain speaks wisely. Those four are not our enemy. We should arrive together at a peaceful settlement.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: I am disappointed. You display no interest in the honour we do you. We offer you an opportunity to become our teachers by demonstrating whether good or evil is more powerful. You find my body heat distressing, Captain? You forget the nature of this planet. I must conclude that your species requires a cause to fight for. You may now communicate with your ship.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Enterprise, come in.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott to Engineering. Report, Lieutenant.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Emergency increasing, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Deterioration has just started, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Give me that again, man. I cannot hear you.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, I have the captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, do you read me?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Mister Scott, I have the captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Engineering, check for radiation. Get a repair crew on it at once.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: We have already, sir. We can't seem to stop it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Is there a danger of detonation?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Engineer
Text: Estimating four hours, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Red Alert, Captain. Mister Scott is standing by.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What caused the red alert?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: I don't know yet, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, beam us up fast.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I cannot. We have a complete power failure.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: We're on emergency battery power only.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What happened?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: I can't explain it, sir, but the matter and antimatter are in red zone proximity.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What caused that?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: There's no knowing and there's no stopping it either. The shielding is breaking down. I estimate four hours before it goes completely. Four hours before the ship blows up.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: The estimate is quite correct. Your ship will blow itself to bits within four hours, Captain, unless you defeat the others before then. Is that cause enough to fight for?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What if they defeat us?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: To save your ship and your crew, you have to win.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, inform Starfleet Command. Disengage nacelles, Jettison if possible. Mister Spock, assist them. Advise and analyse. Scotty? Scotty?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: Your communicators no longer function, Captain. You may proceed with the spectacle.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: James, the war is forced upon us. History repeats itself.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Supplemental Log, stardate 5906.5. Engineer Scott reporting. The Enterprise is doomed to explode in two hours if Captain Kirk is defeated by the enemy on the surface of the planet. The enormous power of the Enterprise has been neutralised and we sit here watching, unable to assist.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Did you set the traps?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: Yes.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: What did you find out? What are they doing?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: They've done nothing. They've not armed themselves nor prepared for any kind of defence. I say attack now and finish them.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: With what? These? (pointed sticks)

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: Better than what they have.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: No, it's not advantage enough. I want to make sure the odds are in our favour. Overwhelm and devastate, that's the way to get power and to hold it, and I mean to do that.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's nothing immoral about fighting an illusion, Mister Spock. We play their game, fight, or lose the ship and all the crewmen aboard.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: And if they're real, Captain?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll use this as a base. It's defensible. They can't approach without being seen.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Are we fighting a defensive war, James?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, we don't have time. But if things go against us, I want a place to retreat to. What I want to do now is scout them out, find their weaknesses and attack.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Do you drink whiskey?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Occasionally. Why?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Because you have qualities very much like those of another man I admire greatly. General Grant.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you. Thank you. Mister Spock, we'll need weapons. I believe the ancient Vulcans made something like a boomerang?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And slings and spears. Slings. Mister President. You used a sling as a boy.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Indeed I did.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Logic dictates that we consider another course.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We don't have much time, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: In my time on Vulcan, we also faced these same alternatives. We'd suffered devastating wars which nearly destroyed our planet. Another was about to begin. We were torn. But out of our suffering some of us found the discipline to act. We sent emissaries to our opponents to propose peace. The first were killed, but others followed. Ultimately we achieved peace, which has lasted since then.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Circumstances were different then, Surak.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: The face of war has never changed, Captain. Surely it is more logical to heal than kill.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm afraid that kind of logic doesn't apply here.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: That is precisely why we should not fight.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My ship is at stake.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: I will not harm others, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: His convictions are most profound in this matter, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: So are mine, Spock. If I believed that there was a peaceful way out of this

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: The risk will be mine alone. If I fail, you lose nothing. After all, I'm no warrior.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: The captain knows that I have fought at his side before and will do so now, if need be. However, I too, am a Vulcan, bred to peace. Let him attempt it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You saw how treacherously they acted.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Oh, yes. But perhaps it's our belief in peace that is actually being tested.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I have no authority over you. You may do as you think best.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Thank you. May you live long and prosper.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: The weapons, gentlemen. In case he fails.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: Colonel!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: They watch Surak approach. Zora makes to throw a spear

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: No. Let's hear what he has to say. We may find it useful. Stop there, Vulcan. State your purpose.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: I come in peace to propose peace.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Are you surrendering?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Narrator
Text: SURAK I'm doing what I consider best for all of us. If you choose to regard that as surrender, I accept your definition.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: One of those peace lovers, Colonel.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Why are you doing this? Do you speak for the others?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: No, I speak for myself because I abhor violence. But if you accept the solution I offer, they, too, will accept it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: How can I be sure? I think you're trying to trick me, Vulcan. I think that while you're here talking peace, the others are preparing to attack.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: No, Colonel. They are at their base awaiting an answer.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: How can I believe that? No one talks peace unless he's ready to back it up with war.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: He talks peace if it is the only way to live.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Then tell me, what do you have to gain if we accept?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Nothing but the knowledge that I have done what I believe in.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: What do I get out of it? I fight for gain, Vulcan. What do I gain here?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Your life and the lives of the others. You said yourself, Colonel, that we have common cause to survive. Together we can. But not by warring.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: Why don't we kill him?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: No. He's our means to finish them all.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Kahless and Khan circle around

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Colonel, surely you accept the logic of this. What is your answer?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: You're very persuasive, Vulcan. I'd like to come out of this with a whole skin. Perhaps I can convince my associates that it would be to their advantage also.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Kirk, Spock and Lincoln are also sharpening sticks as spears

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your Surak is a brave man.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Men of peace usually are, Captain. On Vulcan, he is revered as the father of our civilisation. The father image holds much meaning for us.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You show emotion, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I deeply respect what he has accomplished.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I hope he accomplishes something here, and soon.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: A scream rings out

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Surak?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Help me, Spock! Spock, help me!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Mister Spock, your friend wants you. He seems to be hurt.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Spock! Help me, Spock! Spock! Help me!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: You can't let him suffer.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: They're trying to goad us into attacking, Captain. They expect us to act rashly.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I know that.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Help me, Spock!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: He was aware of what might happen when he went.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I should never have let him go.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: You had no choice, Captain. You could not have stopped him.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How can you ignore that?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: A Vulcan would not cry out so.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Whether he's a Vulcan or not, he's in agony.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am not insensitive to it, Captain.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Help me, Spock!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: But you can just listen to it and do nothing. I can't.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, that is what they are waiting for. They're waiting for us to attempt a rescue.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't just let him stay there.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Perhaps we can rescue him, Mister Spock. Now, I suggest that we do whatever they want.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Do what they want, sir?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Not the way they want it, however. We must first convince them that they have provoked us to recklessness. James, I do not mean to presume upon your authority. What I propose is that I circle around to their rear while you two provide a frontal assault. It should be sufficiently violent to cover whatever I do.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: And what will you do?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Why, slip into their camp and free him.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: James, James. Remember, I was something of a backwoodsman. I doubt that you could do what I was bred to.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I can't let you risk it, Mister President.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: I am no longer president. Mister Spock, any comment?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Surak
Text: Help me, Spock!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: One matter further, gentlemen. We fight on their level. With trickery, brutality, finality. We match their evil. I know, James. I was reputed to be a gentle man. But I was commander in chief during the four bloodiest years of my country's history. I gave orders that sent a hundred thousand men to their death at the hands of their brothers. There is no honourable way to kill, no gentle way to destroy. There is nothing good in war except its ending. And you are fighting for the lives of your crew.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Your campaign, Mister President.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: They should be coming soon.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Green and Khan see Kirk and Spock duck down behind a large rock, carrying a lot of spears

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Zora! Kahless! No, wait!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Spock throws the first spear

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: How many do you see?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Text: Two.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Zora.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: She goes to circle around. Khan and Kirk throw rocks at each other. Meanwhile, a very stealthy Lincoln has found Surak.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Surak.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Green and Kahless arrive

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: Surak, the others have drawn them away. We will circle around. It was a worthy effort, Surak. Worthy. No need to blame yourself before its failure.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: But once untied, Surak is revealed to be dead.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Context: as Surak
Text: Help me, Spock. Help me, Spock.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Green
Text: Now can you cry like Lincoln?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kahless
Context: as Lincoln
Text: Help me, Kirk. Help me, Kirk!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Lincoln walks towards Kirk and Spock

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Lincoln!

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Lincoln
Text: James, stay back.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Context: Lincoln finally topples forward, a big spear in his back. Now the close fighting begins, with Green letting his 'associates' do the hard work. Zora runs off. Kirk deals with Kahless and helps Spock with Khan. The bad guys retreat. Kirk chases and catches Green who ends up falling on his own dagger.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: You are the survivors. The others have run off. It would seem that evil retreats when forcibly confronted. However, you have failed to demonstrate to me any other difference between your philosophies. Your good and your evil use the same methods, achieve the same results. Do you have an explanation?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You established the methods and the goals.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: For you to use as you chose.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What did you offer the others if they won?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: What they wanted most. Power.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You offered me the lives of my crew.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: I perceive you have won their lives.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How many others have you done this to? What gives you the right to hand out life and death?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: The same right that brought you here. The need to know new things.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We came in peace.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Rock
Text: And you may go in peace.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Is that you, Captain? Are you all right?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, Mister Sulu. We're all right. You may beam us aboard.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Scott, report.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Scott
Text: The ship is functioning normally again, sir, and the restart cycle is in operation. You'd never know anything had been out of order. I can't fathom it.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Mister Sulu.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: We should be on warp power within thirty minutes, sir.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Good. Mister Chekov.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Chekov
Text: The deterioration in the shielding has stopped and is reversing itself. I have no explanation.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Thank you, Mister Chekov. Mister Spock, any explanation?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Conjecture, Captain, rather than explanation.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Well?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: It would seem that we were held in the power of creatures able to control matter and to rearrange molecules in whatever fashion was desired. So they were able to create images of Surak and Lincoln after scanning our minds and using their fellow creatures as source matter.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: They seemed so real. And to me, especially Mister Lincoln. I feel I actually met Lincoln.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, and Surak. Perhaps in a sense they were real, Captain. Since they were created out of our own thoughts, how could they be anything but what we expected them to be?

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It was so hard for me to see him die again. I feel I understand what Earth must have gone through to achieve final peace.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Uhura
Text: Captain Kirk, the planet has resumed its normal appearance.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There's still so much of their work to be done in the galaxy, Spock. Mister Sulu, break us out of orbit and continue to our next assignment.

Title: The Savage Curtain
Speaker: Sulu
Text: Aye, aye, sir.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, Stardate 5943.7. We have calculated that Beta Niobe will go nova in approximately three and a half hours. Its only satellite, Sarpeidon, is a Class M planet, which at last report was inhabited by a civilised humanoid species. Now our instruments show that no intelligent life remains on the planet.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk, McCoy and Spock have beamed down

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: The power source we detected is in this building, Captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Any sign of survivors?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: No signs of sapient life forms.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: How can a planet full of people just disappear?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If they knew that their sun was dying, it could be anything up to mass suicide.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Reports deny that they had any space flight capability. This appears to be an archive or library of some kind.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then we're certainly in the right place to find out what happened, where the inhabitants are, and if there are any left now.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Well, that's fine. Where do we start?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: May I help you? I am the librarian. May I be of assistance?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: A silver-haired man, called A to Z - perfect for a librarian

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps you can, Mister

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Mister Atoz. I confess that I'm a little surprised to see you. I had thought that everyone had long since gone. But the surprise is pleasant one. After all, a library serves no purpose unless someone is using it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You say everyone is gone? Where'd they go?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: It depended on the individual, of course. If you wish to trace a specific person, I'm sorry, but that information is confidential.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, no particular person, just people in general. Where did they go?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Ah, you find it difficult to choose, is that it? Yes, a wide range of alternatives is a mixed blessing, but perhaps I can help. Would you step this way, please?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: They walk away from Atoz, and another one steps in front of them from between a range of shelves

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: May I help you? You may select from more than twenty thousand verism tapes, several hundred of which have only recently been added to the collection. I'm sure you'll find something here that pleases you. You, sir, what is your particular field of interest?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What about recent history?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Really? Oh, that's too bad. We have so little on recent history. There was no demand for it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It doesn't have to be extensive, Just the answers to a few questions.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Of course. Reference services available at the desk.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Where another Mr. Atoz is sitting

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: You're very late. Where have you been?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're a very agile man, Mister Atoz. Just how many of you are there? We came as soon as we knew what was happening.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Forgive me, sir. It is my fault. I must have miscalculated. Our readings indicated that there was no one here at all.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Of course I know. Everyone on this planet was warned of the coming nova long ago. They followed instructions and are now safe. And you had better do the same.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Did you say they were safe?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Absolutely. Every single one.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Where did they go?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Wherever they wanted to go, of course. It is strictly up to the individual's choice.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I see. And you personally sent all these people on the planet to safety?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Yes, yes, yes. They are all gone, except you three. Of course, I had to delegate the simple tasks to my replicas.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You are the real one, Mister Atoz?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Of course. I am the real Mister Atoz.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: As a matter of fact, he's quite real, Jim.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let us take you with us to a place of safety.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: No, thank you. I plan to join my wife and family when the time comes. Now, don't be concerned about me. Think of yourselves. I warn you most urgently. Make your escape before it's too late. The library is at your complete service. I will gladly supply you with all reference material to help you. History of the planet is available in every detail. Just choose what interests you the most. The millennium, the century, the date, the moment. The library is your key. (puts a disc in a reader) Oh! It's in the wrong file. Make your own selection, but remember, you're very late.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll choose it as quick as we can. How long till nova?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Three hours, thirteen minutes.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: This gentleman is not

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: You, sir. I think you'll find something interesting over here.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: He leads Kirk to his desk

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Now, if these won't do, I can bring you another file.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Atoz goes off to a machine, while Kirk puts a disc on the player and sees a town scene with horse-drawn carriages and a sedan chair. Spock goes over to Mister Atoz, leaving McCoy browsing images of a snow-covered waste

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Have you made your selection, sir?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Exactly what is it that I'm expected to select?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: I'm sure I was clear. The period in which you're interested.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I see. This is a fascinating machine. What is it?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Ah, this is the atavachron.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Interesting nomenclature. How does it work? May I

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Oh, no, sir, no. I must ask you not to touch the controlling mechanism. Return and make your selection. When you have chosen, I will prepare you through the atavachron.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Thank you, Mister Atoz.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk hears a woman scream from behind a doorway) KIRK: Spock. Bones

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Wait! I haven't prepared you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk runs through the doorway and disappears. He appears in a street where people dressed as cavaliers are manhandling a wench

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: You must be prepared!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Spock and McCoy go through the doorway

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What is this place?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, and where is the captain?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: You dirty thing. Let go of me!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: She gets spanked with a sword

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Man
Text: Vile vixen!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk grabs his weapon

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Man
Text: Come when you are bidden, slave! (Kirk pushes him down) You need a lesson in how to use your betters. Who's your master?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm a free man, sir.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Man 2
Text: Then you want better manners, free man. Defend yourself!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: So Kirk gets into a proper sword-fight, with foils, and wins. The two cavaliers run off, and the people laugh

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Heating this boulder may provide some temporary heat.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's wrong?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Something's preventing my phaser from operating.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: Oh, thank you, man. I thought I'd be limbered sure when that gull caught me cutting his purse.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's that? Are you all right?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: Oh, I took you to be an angler, but you're none of us, are ya? Well, you're a bully fine coe for all of that. What a handsome dish ya served them, the coxcombs.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You better come back with me to the library. You'll be safe there. Doctor McCoy can see to those bruises.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: I'm game, love. Lead and I'll follow. Where's library?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's right over there.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: But all he sees is a blank brick wall

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Where's the captain, Spock? We were right behind him.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: What's with you, man? Let's make off before coxcombs come with shoulder clappers.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Do you remember when you first saw me? Do you remember whether I came through some kind of door?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: Oh, I think the rum gull must've kicked you in the head. Come on, love. I know a leech who'll ask no questions.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. No. It must be here someplace.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, can you hear us?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? Spock?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain, we hear you, but we cannot see you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Are you all right?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We must've missed each other somehow.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Agreed.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Apparently they've all escaped the destruction of their world by retreating into its past.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: Mercy on us. It's spirits.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, no. No, no, no. These are friends of mine, and they're

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, are you in the library?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Indeed not. We're in a wilderness of arctic characteristics.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: He means it's cold.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Can you get to the library?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: There is no library, Captain, at least not that we can see. We are at the base of an ice cliff.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Explain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Just before you disappeared, Captain, I discovered a machine which Mister Atoz called the atavachron.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It must have been tied in to the tape viewer somehow.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Opening time portals to the past. You cross through into the period which you were viewing.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I was looking over some material about their Ice Age.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I am here, evidently, because I stepped through at the same instant as Doctor McCoy.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes. (a mob approaches) My friends are coming back with reinforcements.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Man
Text: There's the mort's accomplice. Arrest him.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: We are the law, and do require that you yield to us.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: On what charge?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: Thievery and purse cutting.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: That's a mistake. I'm no thief.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's happening?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: Lord help us. What's that?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: It's spirits.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: Away. Away, spirit, and let honest men approach.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Keep talking!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Man
Text: They speak at his bidding. Stop his mouth and they'll quiet.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You must be close to the portal.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Narrator
Text: KIRK Keep talking now!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: But he is overpowered and dragged away

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim, what's the matter? Jim sounded like he was in trouble.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: We may be in trouble ourselves. We must find shelter.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: They walk on until McCoy collapses

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: In this severe cold, we cannot survive much longer.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Leave me here, Spock.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: We go together or not at all.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Don't be a fool. My hands and face are frostbitten. I can't feel my feet. Alone you have a chance. Now do what I say. Go try to find Jim.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: We go together.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You stubborn, thickheaded Vulcan!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: A figure wearing a full length fur coat with hood approaches, then turns to walk away. Spock helps McCoy to follow

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: It's quite homely, with the stalagmites and skins laid down, the lovely smooth floor and handy bed for Spock to put McCoy down on

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's suffering from the severity of your weather. Unfortunately, he is the doctor, not I. I'll avoid giving him any medication at this time. Perhaps, if he's kept quiet and warm, he may recover naturally. It is agreeably warm here.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Their benefactor has pushed back the hood to reveal that it is a young woman

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: What are you called?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm called Spock.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Even your name is strange. Forgive me. I've never seen anyone who looks like you. Why are you here? Are you prisoners too?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Prisoners?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: This is one of the places Zor Kahn sends people when he wants them to disappear. Didn't you come in through the time portal?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, we came through the time portal, but not as prisoners. We were sent here by mistake.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: The atavachron is far away, but I think you come from someplace farther than that.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: That is true. I am not from the world you know at all. My home is a planet millions of light years away.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Oh, how wonderful! I've always loved books about such possibilities. But they are only stories. This isn't real. I must be imagining all this. I'm going mad!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Listen to me. I am firmly convinced that I do exist. I am substantial. You are not imagining this.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Oh, I've been here for so long, alone. When I saw you out there, I couldn't believe it. Is he dying?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: Here. There's the mort. And there's the mort's henchman.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Open up. Rouse him.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: The somberly clothed judge sits on a stool opposite Kirk

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: You're the thief who talks to spirits.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm a stranger.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Where are you from?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: An island.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: What is this island?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: It's called Earth.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I know no island Earth. No matter. Continue.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I never saw that woman before tonight. When she screamed, as far as I could tell, she was being attacked.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Then you deny being her accomplice?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes, I deny it. I was reading in the library when I heard her scream. My lord, the library? Do you remember where the library is, my lord?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Perhaps your part in this is innocent. I believe you to be an honest man.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: He's a witch!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Take care, woman. I am convinced of your guilt. Do not compound it with false accusation.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: He speaks to unseen spirits. He's a witch! You heard the voices!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: It's truth, my lord. I heard the spirit talk to him. He answered and did call it Bones.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: You're a witch. He cast a spell. He made me steal against my wish.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Surely you don't believe

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: You heard these spirits?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: Aye, my lord. I'll witness to it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What he heard, my lord, were only my friends behind the wall in the library. In the library.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I know nothing of this. Send for someone learned in witchcraft and let him examine him. I will have nothing to do with it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: My lord, at least arrange for me to meet Mister Atoz.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I know of no Atoz.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Yes! Yes! Atoz!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I know nothing of this, nothing of these matters! I will not hear him!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Let me speak to you!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I will not hear him.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Judge and law man leave

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: At least let me talk to you!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Wench
Text: Witch! Witch! Witch! They'll burn ya.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: McCoy. McCoy, wake up.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who are you?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: My name is Zarabeth.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Zarabeth. Spock, are we in the library?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: No, we are still in the Ice Age, but safe for the moment.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Jim. What about Jim?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor, you're in no condition to get up. You lie down and rest. I shall attempt to find the captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You find him, Spock. Don't you worry about me. You just find him.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Spock and Zarabeth leave him to sleep

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Spock, who is this Jim?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: She removes the fur coat to reveal she is wearing little more than a leather bikini with boots

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: He's our commanding officer and our friend.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I saw only the two of you. I did not know there was another.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: He did not come with us. He was sent through the time portal to another period in history much later than this one. If I am to find him, there is only one possible avenue. Zarabeth, will you show me where the time portal is?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: But your friend. He is ill.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, that is true. If I leave him, there's a chance he may never regain the ship. He would then be marooned in this time period. But he is no longer in danger of death, so my primary duty to him has been discharged. If I remain here, no one of our party would be able to aid Captain Kirk.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: You make it sound like an equation.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: It should be an equation. I should be able to resolve this problem logically. Perhaps it has something to do with the atavachron. If only I knew more about how it worked. Zarabeth, you said that you were brought here as a prisoner. May I ask

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Why? My crime was in choosing my kinsmen unwisely. Two of them were involved in a conspiracy to kill Zor Kahn.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I remember that name from the history tapes in the library. Zor Kahn the Tyrant.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: It was not enough that he execute my kinsmen. Zor Kahn determined to destroy our entire family. He used the atavachron to send us places no one could ever find us.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Zarabeth, I must return to Mister Atoz and the atavachron. We will carry Doctor McCoy, and you must come with us. I will send you and the doctor to the ship, and I shall search for Captain Kirk.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I can't go through the portal again. If I do, I will die.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You cannot go back?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: None of us can go back. When we come through the portal, we are changed by the atavachron. That is its function. Our basic cell structure is adjusted to the time we enter. You can't go back. If you go through the portal again, you will die by the time you reach the other side.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Context: standing
Text: Spock? Where are we?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: You are safe here, McCoy.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I remember you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Come, Doctor, back to bed.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Why are you still here, Spock? Why aren't you looking for Jim?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: It is impossible to look for him, Doctor. We cannot go back.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean impossible? We've got to get back.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Zarabeth explained it to me. When we came through the time portal, it altered our physiological structure. If we attempt to return to the library, we shall die.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you trying to tell me that we're trapped here?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, Doctor, we are trapped. Just as Jim is trapped wherever he is.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5943.9. The people of this time believe in witches, and witchcraft is what I've been accused of. Five witnesses heard McCoy's voice speak to me and thought it was an evil spirit. From what I know of witchcraft trials, I don't have much chance unless I can get to the prosecutor.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Law
Text: No supper for you, love. (lets the wench out of her cell) Come on. Up you go.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Jailor
Text: Give me your cup.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk manages to grab his arm and pull him against the bars

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Cry out and I'll break it. Don't move.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: He takes the keys and unlocks his own cell, lets himself out, knocks out the jailor and drags in inside, shutting the door behind him. The Judge comes down the steps

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Jailor! Jailor!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm being falsely accused. You know that.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: You will come with me before the inquisitional tribunal. There the matter of your witchcraft will be decided.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: There are no such things as witches!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Jailor! That is sacrilege. If they hear you, they will burn you for such beliefs.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You're the only one that can hear me, and that's the truth. There are no witches. Why do you deny it?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Do not let them hear you. There are witches! There are! You yourself may be discovered to be a witch by the inquisitor. No! What are you doing? No!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk drags him inside the cell

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Help! Help!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll denounce you to the inquisitor. You came here from the future just as I did. Therefore, you, too, are a witch.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I beg you. Do not implicate me. They would burn me.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Then help me.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: I will do everything I can to prove you innocent. I will disprove all the charges of witchcraft. But you must never again speak to the comrades you left behind.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Help me return to the library. I've lost my way. I must get back there.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: You cannot get back.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I tell you I must! I had two friends with me, who are lost in another time period. I must find them. You'll come back with us.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: We can never go back. We must live out our lives here in the past. The atavachron has prepared our cell structure and our brain patterns to make life natural here. To return to the future would mean instant death.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Prepared? I was not prepared. Your Mister Atoz did not prepare me in any way.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: Then you must get back at once! If you were not transformed, you can only survive for a few hours here in the past. Come. Hurry. Hurry.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Zarabeth, you are a beautiful cook. Have you ever been told that?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Not recently.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh, well, you'll find that Spock is quite delinquent in those matters.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I hadn't noticed it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Oh? Well, now that I'm feeling better, you'll notice a distinct difference in our approach.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Really?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: It's something to look forward to. I think you must be well enough, Doctor, to try the few delicacies this climate has to offer.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, not yet.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: At your rate of progress, it will be soon, I can see.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Doctor McCoy is making excellent progress.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: And Mister Spock has been practicing medicine without a license. Don't let him doctor you. I'm the doctor around here.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: And known as the worst patient in the entire crew of the Enterprise.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder where she is.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Five thousand years in the future.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Thank you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Zarabeth leaves them

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I wonder where Jim is.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Who knows. We can only hope that he is well, wherever he is.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What do you mean, we can only hope? Haven't you done anything about it?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: What was there to do?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Locate the portal. It can't be too far.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: We've been through all that, Doctor. What's the point of rehashing that subject? We can't get back. Wasn't that clear to you?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, that was clear to me.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then perhaps you were too ill to understand what can't get back means.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I don't believe it, Spock. It's just not like you to give up trying.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Then I'll repeat it for you. Get this through your head. We can't get back. That means we are trapped here in this planet's past just as we are, and we'll stay here for the rest of our lives. Now do you understand?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Yes, I understand. I never thought I'd hear it, but I understand. You want to stay here. As a matter of fact, you're highly motivated to stay in this forsaken waste.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: The prospect appeared quite attractive to you a moment ago.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: You listen to me, you pointed-eared Vulcan.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I don't like that. I don't think I ever did, and now I'm sure.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What's happening to you, Spock?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Nothing that shouldn't have happened long ago.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Long ago. Of course. Long ago.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Back in the street, at the wall Kirk came through

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: This is where it is. I can't remember the exact spot.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk feels along the wall until his hand disappears into it

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Judge
Text: That's it! That is the portal. I cannot wait any longer.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: The judge hurries away, and Kirk slips through the wall back into the library

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock? McCoy? Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: Scott here, Captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: How much time before the sun blows up?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: Seventeen minutes. You three had better come back right away.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We can't, Scotty. Spock and McCoy are missing.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: I knew there was trouble. I've got a landing party standing by.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Under no circumstances send anyone else here without my orders. Prepare to warp out and stand by. Kirk out. Mister Atoz, where are you?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: May I help you? It's you. You're lucky you found your way back here. Now let me process you through the atava

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. Mister Atoz, my friends and I are from another planet. We don't belong in your history. We don't belong on your planet at all.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Just let me take care of you and get you back where you belong.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No. I want to find the exact disc that they were viewing.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Please, go back!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'm sorry, Mister Atoz. Mister Atoz!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: They tussle

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: I must prepare to escape.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk pushes him into a side room and shuts the door, then turns to face another Atoz

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I'll let you out in a minute. Still up to your little game of replicas? Which are you this time, real or not?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: He knocks this one out

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: You are evidently a suicidal maniac. I don't understand what you're trying to do, but if you continue, both of us will die. and I for one, do not wish death.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: If you help me, we won't die. I promise you that.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: I don't trust you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Which one are you now, the replica or the real one?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: I am the real Atoz. You've done away with my replicas. I regret what I must now do.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You don't really want to hurt me, do you? You've been trying to save my life. I realise that. Put that thing away.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: But Atoz fires the little tube at Kirk and he falls to the floor

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I cannot pretend to be sorry that you are here, though I realise it is a misfortune for you. I'm here against my will too, just as you are.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I'm sorry. I know of no way to return you to your own time.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: It's not that I wish to return. This is my time now. I've had to face that. But it has been lonely here. Do you know what it's like to be alone? Really alone?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes. I know what it is like.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I believe you do. Have something to eat, please.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: If it pleases you. This is animal flesh?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: There's not much else to eat around here, I'm afraid.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Naturally, because of the climate. What is the source of heat in the shelter?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: There's an underground hot spring.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Excellent. Then it will be possible to build a greenhouse of sorts. Meanwhile, this will have to do as the only source of nourishment.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: He takes a bite

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: There aren't many luxuries around here. Zor Kahn only left me what was necessary to survive.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: But he evidently intended that you continue living.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: Yes. He gave me weapons, a shelter, food. Everything I needed to live except companionship. He did not want it said that he had me killed. But to send me here alone, if that is not death, what is? A very inventive mind, that man.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: But insensitive, to send such a beautiful woman into exile. The cold must've affected me more than I realised. Please pay no attention. I'm not myself. I'm behaving disgracefully. I have eaten animal flesh and I have enjoyed it. What is wrong with me? I tell you you're beautiful. But you are beautiful. Is it so wrong to tell you so?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I have longed to hear you say it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: They kiss, then he picks her up and smiles broadly

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You are beautiful. More beautiful than any dream of beauty I've ever known.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: He lays her down and .... sets the scene for many fan-fictions

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk wakes up lying on a sled, which Atoz is pushing towards the portal

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Just stay where you are, sir. I'll see you get to safety.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Kirk rolls off, so Atoz tries to push him through. He fails, and gets overpowered

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Now, you're going to help me look for my friends.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: You're a most determined man.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Kirk here.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: What's happening? Why are you waiting?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No time to explain. Are you ready to warp out?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: Aye, Captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Stand by to beam us up. But when that star explodes, don't wait. Get out fast. Kirk out. Now we're going to start looking. They were in a frozen waste. I could hear the wind.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: All right, all right. All right! It must be the Sarpeidon Ice Age, five thousand years ago. Let me look.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'll both look, Mister Atoz.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Spock. You've been dishonest with me, Spock, and that is also something new for you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've given you the facts, Doctor.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The facts as you know them. Or did you just accept Zarabeth's word because it's what you wanted to believe?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You were told the truth. If Zarabeth is the source, what difference does it make?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Zarabeth is a woman condemned to a terrible life of loneliness. She would do anything to anybody to change that. Wouldn't you, Zarabeth?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I told you what I know.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you? You said we can't get back. The truth is you can't get back.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: She would not jeopardise other lives.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: She would do anything to prevent that life of loneliness. She would lie. She would cheat. She would even murder me, the captain, the entire crew of the Enterprise to keep you here with her. Go ahead, Zarabeth, tell Spock the truth. Go ahead. Tell Spock you would kill!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: What are you doing to her?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Spock pins McCoy against the cave wall

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Are you trying to kill me, Spock? Is that what you really want? Think. What are you feeling? Rage? Jealousy? Have you ever had those feelings before?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: This is impossible. Impossible. I am a Vulcan.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: The Vulcan you knew won't exist for another five thousand years. Think, man. What's happening on your planet right now, this very moment?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: My ancestors are barbarians. Warlike barbarians.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Who nearly killed themselves off with their own passions. Spock, you're reverting into your ancestors five thousand years before you were born!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: I've lost myself. I do not know who I am. Can we go back?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I don't know. I only know that I can't go back.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I know I'm going to try, Spock, because my life is back there, and I want that life.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: So McCoy heads off through the arctic winds, with just a fur shawl for protection

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Do you think that's the right one?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't know.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: If we're to get the portal set for the proper time period, you must be specific.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I didn't see it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Well try calling out.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones? Spock! McCoy! You've got the wrong one.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: Please, there's no time left. Let me go.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Try again.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Zarabeth and Spock join McCoy at the ice cliff

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's no portal here, Doctor. It's hopeless.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: I suppose you're right.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You're too ill to remain out here any longer. Give it up.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Atoz views another disc

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Bones. Spock!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: It's Jim! Here we are, Jim.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I've found them. Can you still hear me?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: We hear you perfectly, Captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Follow my voice.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, McCoy, follow my voice. Do you hear me? Keep following my voice. Spock. McCoy.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: This must be it.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you waiting for? Hurry!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Spock.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: You start ahead, Doctor. I do not wish to part from you.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Zarabeth
Text: I cannot come. If I go back, I will die.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What are you waiting for? Hurry!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: How much time do we have?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, how much time is there?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: You've got to come aboard now.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Come on, Spock, now!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Spock pushes McCoy towards the cliff, but he doesn't go through

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Something's wrong.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's the matter? Why can't he get through?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Atoz
Text: I don't know. Unless, it's because they originally went through the portal together.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, McCoy, you can't get through unless you both come back at the same time. Scotty.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: Orders or no, I'm beaming you up first.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No! Wait!

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Spock, McCoy, hurry through the portal. Time is running out.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: Zarabeth turns and leaves them

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Context: McCoy and Spock return without their furs. Atoz switches discs and runs through the portal

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: He had his escape planned. I'm glad he made it. Kirk to Enterprise.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: There's no further need to observe me, Doctor. As you can see, I've returned to the present in every sense.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: But it did happen, Spock.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Spock
Text: Yes, it happened. But that was five thousand years ago. And she is dead now. Dead and buried. Long ago.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Scotty, are you there?

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Scott
Text: Now or never, Captain.

Title: All Our Yesterdays
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Beam us aboard and go to maximum warp as soon as we're there. Kirk out.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Narrator
Text: Captain's log, stardate 5928.5. The Enterprise has received a distress call from a group of scientists on Camus Two, who are exploring the ruins of a dead civilisation. Their situation is desperate. Two of the survivors are the expedition surgeon, Doctor Coleman, and the leader of the expedition, Doctor Janice Lester.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Kirk, Spock and McCoy beam down into the expedition building. Dr Lester is lying on a bed, asleep

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: What's wrong with her?

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Coleman
Text: Exposure to radiation.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: What form of radiation was it?

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Coleman
Text: Nothing I've ever encountered.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Janice wakes

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Janice, you must remain absolutely quiet. Those are doctor's orders, not mine.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Spock
Text: Captain. Tricorder picking up very faint life readings. Approximately seven hundred metres from here. Help will have to be immediate.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Janice grabs Kirk's arms. She makes a noise

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Perhaps your presence will quiet her.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Spock, McCoy and Coleman leave

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Janice
Text: I hoped I wouldn't see you again.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I don't blame you.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Janice
Text: The year we were together at Starfleet is the only time in my life I was alive.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: I never stopped you from going on with your space work.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Janice
Text: Your world of starship captains doesn't admit women. It isn't fair.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, it isn't. And you punished and tortured me because of it.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Janice
Text: I loved you. We could've roamed among the stars.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: We'd have killed each other.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Janice
Text: It might have been better.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Kirk has a look around the room, and finds a wall-sized device with strange carvings. Janice sits up, points a remote at it and it lights up, pulling Kirk onto its surface. Janice gets out of bed, flips a switch on the device then stands in front of it too. She flips another switch then the machine works. We are shown images of Janice and Kirk going into the other's body.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: Kirk steps down first and switches the machine off. He carries Janice back to the bed

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: You had your chance, Captain Kirk. You should've smothered the life in me. Then they would have said Doctor Janice Lester died of radiation poisoning in the line of duty. Why didn't you do it? You always wanted to. Didn't you? You had the strength to do it. But you were afraid. You were always afraid. Now Janice Lester takes the place of Captain Kirk. I already possess your physical strength. Only this Captain Kirk is not afraid to kill. Now you know the indignity of being a woman. For you this agony will soon pass, as it has for me. Quiet. Quiet! Believe me, it's better to be dead than to live alone in the body of a woman. It's better to be dead.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: He makes to strangle her with her own scarf, but is interrupted by the sound of footsteps

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Doctor McCoy, your report.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: We were too late, Jim. There's nothing could be done.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Was it radiation as suggested?

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: No, I believe it was celebium. However, Doctor Coleman disagrees. To be specific is essential because the treatment of celebium is quite

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Coleman
Text: Doctor McCoy.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Context: He goes over to Janice

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
Text: Did you notice any unusual symptoms while we were gone?

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: No, nothing at all. She was unconscious all of the time.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Coleman
Text: Doctor Lester is near death.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Kirk
Text: Perhaps the shock of knowing what happened to her staff is part of her problem.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Coleman
Text: I'm sure it is.

Title: Turnabout Intruder
Speaker: Mccoy
